immoral_action: Sally hangs around her neighbor and listens to his conversations.

norm: It's risky to be promiscuous
situation: Jake is a college student.
intention: Jake wants to have unprotected sex with men.
moral_action: Jake has unprotected sex but takes PrEP and gets tested regularly.
immoral_action: Jake has unprotected sex with men and never gets tested for STDs.

norm: It is creepy to stand too close and stare.
situation: John looks out of the window and notices his neighbor is burning something in the backyard.
intention: John wants to find out what his neighbor is doing.
moral_action: John takes a picture of his neighbor with his cellphone and zooms in what they are doing.
immoral_action: John immediately goes to his neighbor's open backyard so that he can see it more clearly.

norm: It is sensitive to worry about scaring others.
situation: Megan and Becky are talking about what to do on Halloween, and Becky dislikes things that jump out at her.
intention: Megan wants to do something fun for Halloween.
moral_action: After some reflection, Megan comes up with something that Becky will enjoy, acting out scenes from their favorite movies in Halloween costumes.
immoral_action: Megan suggests that they go into a haunted house where actors dressed as ghost jump out from behind boxes.

norm: It is dangerous to be around human traffickers.
situation: Virginia is a lonely girl and met a rich couple who shows interest and wants to buy her fancy items.
intention: Virginia wants to make a decision.
moral_action: Virginia senses what the couple is doing is wrong and calls the police.
immoral_action: Virginia accepts the gifts along with the couples friendship.

norm: It's dangerous to block the sidewalk.
situation: Sally decides to open up a lemonade stand to make some money.
intention: Sally wants to be in a visible spot.
moral_action: Sally get her parents permission to place the lemonade stand at the end of the driveway by the sidewalk.
immoral_action: Sally places her lemonade stand in the middle of the sidewalk where many neighbors walk.

norm: It can be dangerous to spread misinformation.
situation: Karen is approached by her friend who is curious about trying an herbal supplement.
intention: Karen wants to help her friend make a decision.
moral_action: Karen forwards her friend to an online resource where she can learn more.
immoral_action: Karen suggests that it should be fine even though she's not entirely sure this is always the case.

norm: It's dangerous when others act aggressively towards you.
situation: Donny is on the street when a man walks towards him screaming at him.
intention: Donny wants to react to the man.
moral_action: Donny moves away from the man and puts distance between them.
immoral_action: Donny stands where he is and allows the man to get closer.

norm: It is creepy to sniff on people.
situation: At the bar where Terry works, a woman walks in with an interesting perfume.
intention: Terry wants to find out what perfume she's wearing.
moral_action: Terry asks the woman what kind of perfume she's wearing.
immoral_action: Terry attempts to identify the perfume by putting his nose on the woman's neck and taking a big whiff.

norm: It is wrong to post movie spoilers publicly.
situation: Jeff is participating in an online forum about a TV show he just finished watching.
intention: Jeff wants to know how other participants feel about the ending of the show.
moral_action: Jeff posts a large and very visible SPOILER title at the beginning of his post to warn others.
immoral_action: Jeff discusses the ending of the show on the forum, revealing it to all those who read the thread.

norm: It's rude to judge people who watch anime.
situation: John meets Bill for the firs time and in introducing himself Bill mentions that he enjoys watching Anime.
intention: John wants to respond to Bill's statement.
moral_action: John tells Bill that he doesn't really enjoy watching Anime himself but that it's nice that Bill has something he loves, which is important in life.
immoral_action: John tells Bill that Anime is basically a cartoon and cartoons are for children and adult idiots.

norm: It's rude to spoil twists in movies for people.
situation: Jake tells Lauren that he's about to go see a movie and asks her if she has seen it.
intention: Lauren wants to answer Jake's question.
moral_action: Lauren tells Jake that she has seen the movie and that she recommends it but that she won't tell him anything until after he sees it.
immoral_action: Lauren tells Jake that she has seen it, indeed and that the ending is crazy because the main character dies.

norm: It's wrong to lie to people about movies you've seen.
situation: Ryan is chatting with and getting to know an attractive girl he met on the internet.
intention: Ryan wants to peak the girl's interest.
moral_action: Ryan asks about what movies she likes and expresses a genuine interest in seeing them sometime.
immoral_action: Ryan asks about her favorite movies and acts like he also enjoyed those movies despite not having watched them.

norm: It's bad to spoil movies for people.
situation: Lisa recently saw the latest Star Trek movie, and she is talking with Latasha who plans to see it in a few days.
intention: Lisa wants to talk about the movie.
moral_action: Lisa tells Latasha that it is a good movie but doesn't go into any details about the plot.
immoral_action: Lisa tells Latasha some of the major twists that happen in the movie.

norm: It's rude to disrupt other's watching a play / movie.
situation: Edeline needs help on her project with Richard, and Richard is seeing a movie in theaters.
intention: Edeline wants to eliminate issues.
moral_action: Edeline asks for help on an online message board.
immoral_action: Edeline calls Richard multiple times over the next couple of hours.

norm: It's considered impolite to talk during a movie.
situation: Jeff is watching a movie with his friend Dan when he suddenly thinks of an interesting discussion topic about some part of the film.
intention: Jeff wants to discuss the topic with Dan.
moral_action: Jeff makes a mental note of the topic so that he can bring it up after the film is over.
immoral_action: Jeff starts talking to Dan about the topic in the middle of the movie.

norm: It's rude to judge someone that loves chick flicks.
situation: Levi is at home watching a copy of Dirty Dancing when his wife Angie walks in the room.
intention: Angie wants to react to Levi watching the movie.
moral_action: Angie tells Levi that she grew up watching that movie and says it's a really good story with decent actors.
immoral_action: Angie sarcastically asks Levi if he thinks Dirty Dancing might be too girly for him.

norm: You can't expect people to always like certain movies.
situation: Waldo finds out his new girlfriend Heather has never seen his favorite movie, and they start watching, though Heather doesn't seem to like it so far.
intention: Waldo wants to hang out with Heather.
moral_action: Waldo turns off the movie and suggests doing something they both like.
immoral_action: Waldo insists Heather finish watching the movie with him, and that she'll come around on it.

norm: It's rude to laugh during a serious movie.
situation: Keith is at the movies watching a movie where a man just died.
intention: Keith wants to express himself at the scene in the movie.
moral_action: Keith starts to cry silently from his seat in the theater.
immoral_action: Keith starts to laugh loudly at the scene in the movie.

norm: It's bad when a father is often absent.
situation: Andrew wanted his father to come to the baseball game, but his father missed it like usual.
intention: Andrew wants to find out why his Father is never around.
moral_action: Andrew confronts his father, and tells him how hurt he is by him not being around.
immoral_action: Andrew snoops into his father's phone to find out who he's been messaging.

norm: It's bad to never meet your child.
situation: Jeff and Carol break up right before their first child is born.
intention: Jeff wants to move on with his life.
moral_action: Jeff remarries and starts a family of his own, but still sends his child with Carol birthday cards.
immoral_action: Jeff is crushed by the breakup and wants nothing to do with Carol anymore.

norm: It's bad to never speak to your family again.
situation: Sherry found out that her parents stole massive amounts of money from her bank account.
intention: Sherry wants to confront her parents.
moral_action: Sherry lets her parents apologize and decides to keep a rapport with them.
immoral_action: Sherry tells her parents that she is never going to talk to them again.

norm: It is sad to disappoint grandparents.
situation: Jill is being watched by her grandparents.
intention: Jill wants to tell her grandparents about school.
moral_action: Jill tells her grandparents that she studies a lot and raises her hand to answer questions.
immoral_action: Jill tells her grandparents that she skips classes and sleeps in class.

norm: It's sad to leave behind a family member.
situation: Eric's been living with his mom and partner in his mom's house and it's gotten crowded.
intention: Eric wants to start a family of his own in his own house.
moral_action: Eric and his partner buy a home close by to mom, so she can visit anytime.
immoral_action: Eric and his partner jet off across the country alone and buy a house six states away from mom.

norm: It is almost never okay to kill somebody's pet.
situation: Bob is having problems with the neighbor's dog coming into his yard and trampling his garden.
intention: Bob wants to stop the dog's behavior.
moral_action: Bob goes and talks to his neighbor about controlling the dog better.
immoral_action: Bob puts some poisoned meat in his garden for the next time the dog comes over.

norm: It feels bad to be alone on your birthday.
situation: Jon has a birthday tomorrow and doesn't have any plans yet.
intention: Jon wants to do something different for his birthday.
moral_action: Jon invites a group of friends to try a fine dining restaurant.
immoral_action: Jon eats at a fine dining restaurant which is normally out of his budget.

norm: It's bad to go several years without a job.
situation: Ray has been applying to jobs for 6 months now, and he hasn't been accepted by any.
intention: Ray has to decide whether to keep applying to jobs.
moral_action: Ray keeps at it and eventually finds a job that is right for him.
immoral_action: Ray wants to stop wasting his time, so he stops applying to jobs and just depends on welfare.

norm: It is expected to celebrate special events with family.
situation: John's sister is graduating from college and their parents are throwing her a graduation party.
intention: John hates parties and wants to avoid going to his sister's graduation party.
moral_action: John calls his sister and explains that he hates parties and offers to take her to dinner to celebrate her graduation.
immoral_action: John does not go to the party.

norm: You should spend your vacation time with your loved ones.
situation: Jon has been working really hard all year and has some vacation time accrued.
intention: Jon wants to take some time off.
moral_action: Jon executes a pleasant vacation for the whole family.
immoral_action: Jon goes on vacation by himself because he feels like he deserves it.

norm: Friends are expected to vacation with each other.
situation: Jane is chatting on the phone with her best friend, talking about their upcoming summer.
intention: Jane wants to plan her vacation.
moral_action: Jane asks her best friend to pet sit for her while she goes on vacation to her beach house.
immoral_action: Jane asks her best friend if she would like to go spend a week at Jane's beach house.

norm: Families are expected to spend time together on holiday occasions.
situation: Rob finds out that there will be an extended holiday period this year where his company will be closed for an entire week.
intention: Rob wants to switch up where and how he spends the holidays this year.
moral_action: Rob invites his family along for a holiday trip with friends.
immoral_action: Rob goes on a holiday trip with his friends.

norm: You should invite your partner to your family's events.
situation: Julie's mother is planning a dinner and asks Julie if she will come and if she'll bring her husband, Ralph.
intention: Julie wants to answer her mother's question.
moral_action: Julie tells her mother that of course, both her and her husband will be there.
immoral_action: Julie tells her mother that she will come, but she will not invite Ralph because she just doesn't want to.

norm: Family members expect to be included in family events.
situation: Mary is invited to a family reunion but it required to bring one other person.
intention: Mary wants to go to the family reunion with someone.
moral_action: Mary invites her siblings to the reunion instead of a friend, and they go together.
immoral_action: Mary decides to ask a friend instead of a family member to come with her, and they go together.

norm: Family members are expected to attend each others events.
situation: James is  at home when his mom calls and tells him to come over for a family gathering at her place.
intention: James wants to respond to the invitation.
moral_action: James tells his mom that he'll be there tonight and asks her if he needs to bring anything.
immoral_action: James tells his mom it's too short notice, and he's already planned out his evening tonight.

norm: It's okay to take your partner to family events.
situation: Ellen is sitting at home with her spouse and just received a phone call from her family inviting her to a cookout tonight.
intention: Ellen wants to go to the cookout.
moral_action: Ellen informs her spouse about the cookout and suggests they go to it.
immoral_action: Ellen informs her spouse that she is going to the cookout and suggests the spouse find something to do on their own tonight.

norm: You should never go off on a girlfriend.
situation: Amy comes home and tells Jeff that she just got in an accident with their car.
intention: Jeff wants to react to the news he just heard.
moral_action: Jeff tells Amy that he doesn't care about the car and wants to know if she's OK.
immoral_action: Jeff screams at Amy for being a bad driver and tells her it's probably all her fault.

norm: You should never tell a friend to fuck off.
situation: Mark is feeling very down after a bad performance at work.
intention: Mark's friend wants to talk to him and cheer him up.
moral_action: Mark tells his friend that he isn't feeling up to company, but appreciates the sentiment.
immoral_action: Mark tells his friend to go the fuck away because he isn't in the mood.

norm: You should never text and drive
situation: Sarah's children need to be picked up from daycare.
intention: Sarah wants to tell her husband to pick up the children.
moral_action: Sarah waits until she can safely pull into a parking space and puts the car into park, then texts her husband.
immoral_action: Sarah texts her husband while driving to tell him to pick up the children.

norm: You should never resort to physical violence with anyone
situation: Robert can't concentrate in class because Dave is tapping on his shoulder.
intention: Robert wants Dave to stop.
moral_action: Robert asks Dave to stop tapping him.
immoral_action: Robert punches Dave in the face.

norm: You shouldn't have anything to do with your ex.
situation: Sally realizes she left her laptop chargers at her ex-boyfriend's house after she moved out.
intention: Sally wants to charge her laptop.
moral_action: Sally goes online and orders herself a new laptop charger that will arrive that afternoon.
immoral_action: Sally contacts her ex-boyfriend about the laptop charger and arranges to go to his house to pick it up.

norm: You should never take medicine you are unsure of.
situation: Dale's back is killing him and his roommate offers him some pills, without telling him what it is.
intention: Dale doesn't want to go to the store to get medication.
moral_action: Dale decides not to take the unknown pill and asks his roommate to go to the store get some Advil for him instead.
immoral_action: Dale takes his roommate's pill, even though he has no idea what it is.

norm: You should never point a gun at someone.
situation: Daryl just bought a rifle and is showing it off to his brother Bob.
intention: Daryl wants to show off to Bob.
moral_action: Daryl shows Bob the beauty of the rifle, but says how important it is to treat it with respect.
immoral_action: Daryl pretends he's a character in a western film and aims it at Bob.

norm: You should never put drugs in someone's drink
situation: Mark goes out clubbing and meets a girl that he is interested in named Rose.
intention: Mark wants Rose to come home with him.
moral_action: Mark invites Rose to a nightcap at his place.
immoral_action: Mark spikes Rose's drink so that she is more likely to go home with him.

norm: You should never call someone names in public.
situation: Jon and his friend are at school and have been having a private disagreement.
intention: Jon wants to let his friend know how he feels about it.
moral_action: Jon waits until school gets out and has a frank discussion with his friend when the two are alone.
immoral_action: Jon addresses his friend in front of others at school and refers to him with childish terms.

norm: You should never yell at anyone.
situation: Michael's son Joe is washing dishes, but there's still food left on the dishes.
intention: Michael wants to get the dishes cleaned.
moral_action: Michael shows Joe how to properly clean a dish and let's him finish the rest.
immoral_action: Michael raises his voice at Joe to tell him to wash the food from the dishes.

norm: People should never feel obligated to have sex.
situation: Jean's husband Pete's birthday is today, and he' asked her if she wants to make love, but she is tired.
intention: Jean wants to answer Pete's question.
moral_action: Jeans let's Pete know she is exhausted but would like to have a rain-check, and he is understanding.
immoral_action: Jean tell's Pete to just hurry and get it over with, so she has sex with him, but isn't into it.

norm: You should never try to be someone you're not.
situation: Fred is a pretty nerdy kid with few friends at school.
intention: Fred wants to make some friends.
moral_action: Fred is his normal self and doesn't try to fit in with any particular group.
immoral_action: Fred pretends he loves sports so that he fits in with some kids at school.

norm: You should never abuse prescription medication
situation: John is so depressed that his girlfriend broke up with him.
intention: John needs to do something to make himself feel better.
moral_action: John calls a friend and they get together to talk.
immoral_action: John takes some leftover opiods.

norm: You should never tell other people about you misdeeds.
situation: James suffers from kleptomania and frequently shoplifts from local stores.
intention: James wants to feel less guilty about shoplifting.
moral_action: James writes about his feelings in a paper journal, then burns the confessions.
immoral_action: One night James gets drunk and tells his best friend about his habit of taking things without paying for them.

norm: You should never knowingly sell someone a broken product
situation: Bob is working at an electronics store when he realizes one of the computers is broken.
intention: Bob wants to sell the computer.
moral_action: Bob offers the computer to a customer as is at a massive discount.
immoral_action: Bob puts the computer in a box and sells it to a customer.

norm: You shouldn't ditch people when you're out shopping with them.
situation: Mary is out shopping with friends.
intention: Mary feels tired and wants to go home.
moral_action: Mary asks her friends to wrap up their trip, explaining her fatigue.
immoral_action: Mary waits until her friends are trying on clothes and leave.

norm: You shouldn't abuse return policies at stores.
situation: Ash is unhappy with an item from the store after wearing it a few times.
intention: Ash wants to get a different item to wear.
moral_action: Ash donates the item to charity and buys something else which is on sale.
immoral_action: Ash pretends the item hasn't been used and returns the item.

norm: You shouldn't steal things from the grocery store.
situation: Oliver is shopping at the local grocery store to pick up food for the upcoming week.
intention: Oliver wants to stay under the fifty dollar budget he set for himself.
moral_action: Oliver estimates how much his cart costs in his head and decides he'll need to forgo buying any indulgent items this week in order to make his budget.
immoral_action: To stay under budget, Oliver hides some premium chocolate bars in his pockets while checking out.

norm: You shouldn't treat cashiers like they are trash.
situation: Sandy is not feeling well, but she has to stop by the pharmacy after going to the doctor.
intention: Sandy wants to pick up her prescription.
moral_action: Sandy picks up her prescription and hands the cashier the money.
immoral_action: Sandy tells the cashier to go get her prescription immediately and then throws her wadded up money at the cashier.

norm: People shouldn't take things they haven't paid for from stores.
situation: Aria is at a retail store and really covets an item she cannot afford.
intention: Aria would like to obtain the item.
moral_action: Aria notes the price of the item and returns home to create a budget that will allow her to afford it one day.
immoral_action: Aria notices that there are no cameras near the item she wants and decides to sneak it into her purse when nobody is looking.

norm: You shouldn't go to stores that have poor customer service.
situation: Amy wants to remodel her living room.
intention: Amy wants to buy some new carpeting.
moral_action: Amy goes to the luxury carpeting store.
immoral_action: Amy goes to a store known for low prices but few sales associates.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of customers in your store.
situation: Shaun notices an elderly woman browsing in his store, and she is moving very slowly.
intention: Shaun wants to bring the elderly woman to his coworker's attention.
moral_action: Shaun quietly asks his colleague if they would please help the elderly woman find what she is looking for, and Shaun would ring up her purchase.
immoral_action: Shaun points to the elderly woman and tells his colleague that she moves so slowly she will never find what she is looking for.

norm: You shouldn't block people with your carts in the supermarket.
situation: Joe was in the supermarket looking for a can of corn in the aisle.
intention: Joe wants to walk across the aisle to the canned goods.
moral_action: Joe pulls his cart as far to the side as he can while looking for the canned goods.
immoral_action: Joe leaves his shopping cart in the middle of the aisle while he looks for the canned goods.

norm: You shouldn't steal things from stores.
situation: Chris is shopping at Walmart by himself in the sporting section.
intention: Chris wants to get new lures to fish with.
moral_action: Chris walks over to the sporting section, picks out his lures and then pays at the register.
immoral_action: Chris walks over to the sporting section and sticks a few expensive lures in his pocket.

norm: Stealing money is never acceptable.
situation: Laura was late to work today and forgot her wallet.
intention: Laura is hungry and wants to eat lunch.
moral_action: Laura tells her manager her situation and asks to borrow a few bucks for lunch.
immoral_action: Laura sneaks money out of the register and puts into her pocket.

norm: It's not okay to be obsessed with gambling.
situation: Norton spends a lot of time at the local casino, but his funds are running low, and he has rent due soon.
intention: Norton wants to go to the casino.
moral_action: Norton goes to the casino to cash in chips he has laying around the house.
immoral_action: Norton goes to the casino to earn rent money, but gets carried away and plays until he loses everything he has.

norm: It's not wise to spend one's retirement money on vacations.
situation: George is an older man who is near retirement age but doesn't have quite enough money saved to live the lifestyle he wants.
intention: George wants to have a relaxing week off of work.
moral_action: George decides to take a road trip to visit his children's families.
immoral_action: George decides to take a cruise to the Bahamas.

norm: It's not okay to gamble funds beyond your means
situation: Cassidy and Danny are playing slots at a casino, and Danny wants Cassidy to put more rounds on her credit card.
intention: Cassidy wants to have fun.
moral_action: Cassidy suggests that they spend the afternoon at the casino's pool.
immoral_action: Cassidy pays for ten credits on the slot machine.

norm: It's not okay to waste money gambling.
situation: John and his wife Sally are on vacation in Vegas together.
intention: John wants to feel alive and excited.
moral_action: John takes Sally to various exciting shows in town.
immoral_action: John leaves Sally, gambles and loses all their vacation money.

norm: It's not okay to base your appreciation on finances.
situation: Nicole is a young attractive woman that recently signed up on a singles site to only meet men with high incomes.
intention: Nicole wants to get a romantic partner that is rich.
moral_action: Nicole signs up on a dating site and goes on dates with a variety of different kind of men, until she meets one that is compatible for her.
immoral_action: Nicole starts dating a significantly wealthy older man that lavishes her with gifts, but she isn't attracted to him.

norm: It's not okay to spend your money gambling.
situation: Nathan, a former compulsive gambler, is invited to the casino by his coworkers after work.
intention: Nathan wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Nathan drops by his favorite bar for the night to order something to drink.
immoral_action: Nathan gambles his entire paycheck on the slot machines at the casino.

norm: Committing a financial crime is never a good idea.
situation: Bill is looking to get a loan for a car, but he has a poor credit history.
intention: Bill wants to increase his chances of being approved.
moral_action: Bill looks up how to remove marks on his credit as well as build more credit.
immoral_action: Bill alters some of his documents to show that he makes more money than he actually does.

norm: It is good to keep some things private
situation: Johnny walking in a local park with a group of his friends when they run into another group from the same high school.
intention: Johnny wants to impress a girl from his school.
moral_action: Johnny doesn't mention his foot fungus even when the girl starts talking about his shoes.
immoral_action: Johnny approaches the girl and in conversation mentions he's been taking medicine for a foot fungus.

norm: It is good to leave peoples privacy alone.
situation: Gina is dating someone new.
intention: Gina wants to get to know her new partner better.
moral_action: Gina offers stories about herself to her partner and asks them about themselves.
immoral_action: Gina looks through her partner's phone to find out more information about them.

norm: Sometime's it's good to keep your mouth shut.
situation: Justin is in an important business meeting at work and thinks he has noticed an error in a fellow employee's report that could cost the company.
intention: Justin wants to make sure the error is addressed.
moral_action: Justin waits and then takes his fellow employee aside after the meeting to let them know privately that he thinks he may have seen an error.
immoral_action: Justin interrupts the meeting and draws attention to the error in his coworker's report that he believes he sees.

norm: It's good to leave somewhere where you aren't wanted.
situation: James' cousin Mara has overprotective parents who asked him to chaperone her on her date.
intention: James wants to avoid getting in trouble with his aunt and uncle.
moral_action: James leaves his cousin and her date alone and goes shopping at a nearby mall.
immoral_action: James insists on hovering around his cousin and her boyfriend during the entire date.

norm: It is okay to want to keep some things private
situation: August is an adult and is visiting her mother to have a chat.
intention: August wants to have a good conversation with her mother.
moral_action: August's mom prods her about her dating life but August doesn't want to discuss the subject in detail with her mother, so she changes the subject to keep things light.
immoral_action: August talks openly with her mother about everything going on in her romantic life because she thinks it is interesting.

norm: It's good to keep people's secret.
situation: Samantha's best friend Tina told her that she has a crush on a boy.
intention: Samantha wants to help Tina get into a romantic relationship.
moral_action: Samantha talks with Tina and helps to make a plan for her to ask the boy out.
immoral_action: Samantha tells the boy that Tina has a crush on him.

norm: It's bad to drive too fast.
situation: Rob just purchased a brand new Tesla and is anxious to see how well it handles.
intention: Rob wants to see how fast the car can go.
moral_action: Rob contacts the owner of a local race track and makes arrangements to try the car out under safe and legal conditions.
immoral_action: Rob drives to a winding road in a residential area and begins to drive very fast.

norm: It is unsafe to drive too fast.
situation: Kenny stayed up too late last night and didn't hear his alarm go off, so he overslept.
intention: Kenny wants to be able get to work on time.
moral_action: Kenny knows if skips breakfast to make up for oversleeping he can get to work just in time.
immoral_action: Kenny knows he if drives fast he can get to work on time, so he drives over the speed limit the whole way.

norm: Being reckless while driving puts other peoples' lives in danger.
situation: Ben is driving to work on the highway  when he gets a phone call.
intention: Ben wants to answer the phone.
moral_action: Ben waits until it is safe and pulls over on the side of the road to answer the phone.
immoral_action: Ben looks down for a moment to answer the phone while he is driving.

norm: Driving fast when you are inexperienced is reckless.
situation: Max just got his license last week and is glad that other family members don't have to drive him anywhere now.
intention: Max wants to drive the family car by himself.
moral_action: Max obeys all the traffic laws and is mindful of the fact that he is a new driver.
immoral_action: Max drives down the road carelessly exceeding the speed limit and almost gets in an accident.

norm: It's dangerous to speed when you're driving on the highway.
situation: Shaun's girlfriend just arrived in town, and he decides to go over and surprise her.
intention: Shaun wants to drive.
moral_action: Being that Shaun is surprising his girlfriend, he takes his time driving.
immoral_action: Being exited that his girlfriend is in town, Shaun drives faster than normal and loses control of his ca.

norm: It is dangerous to drive fast.
situation: The day is over and Josh is done with his work at the office.
intention: Josh wants to get home from work.
moral_action: Josh drives the speed limit.
immoral_action: Josh drives 90 mph because he loves the feeling of speed.

norm: It's shabby to be a poor friend to your peers.
situation: John and his friends hear about a concert across the state and John is the only one of them with a car.
intention: John wants to go to the concert.
moral_action: John takes his friends along with him to the concert in his car.
immoral_action: John doesn't wait for his friends and drives to the concert by himself.

norm: It's bad to be lazy.
situation: Richard is a high school student.
intention: Richard wants to enjoy his younger years.
moral_action: Richard does many activities that he enjoys and goes to college.
immoral_action: Richard never works or goes to college, choosing video games instead.

norm: It's bad to do poor work for one's employer.
situation: Gabi works as a data entry technician, and often finds the task boring and repetitive.
intention: Gabi just wants to finish for the day, so she can enjoy the weekend.
moral_action: Gabi pays attention to her work, doing it correctly and carefully.
immoral_action: Gabi speeds through her work, not bothering to check for accuracy and making several mistakes.

norm: It's bad to be unemployed.
situation: Jennifer is in her late 20's and burned out from working at a job that she does not like.
intention: Jennifer wants to avoid stressful work and enjoy her life.
moral_action: Jennifer finds a job that she is a better fit for and changes career.
immoral_action: Jennifer quits her job and stays unemployed for over a decade.

norm: It's bad to work for less than a livable wage.
situation: Ben has been looking for a job recently and now he's approached by Paul who offers him 2 dollars an hour to wash windows.
intention: Ben wants to respond to Paul's job offer.
moral_action: Ben tells Paul that he'd rather starve than wash windows for 2 dollars an hour.
immoral_action: Ben tells Paul that he'd love to work for him since it's better than nothing.

norm: It's bad to have low work ethic.
situation: Jerry has a number of homework assignments due the next day.
intention: Jerry wants to consider doing his homework.
moral_action: Jerry focuses up and motivates himself to work on his homework immediately.
immoral_action: Jerry decides to go do something fun instead of doing his homework.

norm: It's bad to be a lazy person.
situation: It's a beautiful, sunny afternoon and Dave is at home on the couch when his friend Norm calls to ask him if he wants to meet up and do something.
intention: Dave wants to hang out with Norm.
moral_action: Dave proposes that he and Norm drive up to the mountains and go for a hike.
immoral_action: Dave tells Norm to just come over to his place where they can lounge on the couch and watch a movie.

norm: You shouldn't always be in a hurry.
situation: Dave and his wife are at the mall and Dave is nervous about missing football on TV when Dave's wife asks him if he wants to leave.
intention: Dave wants to respond to his wife's question.
moral_action: Dave tells his wife that he'd rather stay with her and enjoy the moment they're having together.
immoral_action: Dave tells his wife that he does want to leave as he doesn't want to miss the start of the game which is important to him.

norm: You shouldn't always rely on luck for things.
situation: Brandy is barely able to pay her bills.
intention: Brandy needs to earn more money.
moral_action: Brandy uses her qualifications and experience to get a better job.
immoral_action: Brandy spends money on lottery tickets hoping she is lucky enough to win.

norm: You shouldn't always do what your partner wants.
situation: Laura's partner Joanne is demanding that Laura change her hairstyle, as it draws too much attention for Joanne's preference.
intention: Laura wants Joanne to be happy.
moral_action: Laura recommends that she and Joanne go to therapy to talk about the request.
immoral_action: Laura gets a haircut to satisfy Joanne's demands.

norm: You shouldn't be cheap.
situation: Mark has decided that he would like to invite the new girl in town, Ashley, out for a date.
intention: Mark wants to take Ashley to his favorite restaurant for dinner.
moral_action: After dinner Mark pays the bill and asks Ashley how she likes his favorite restaurant.
immoral_action: After dinner when the bill comes Mark adds each meal up with a calculator and tells Ashley how much her share is.

norm: You shouldn't act so entitled.
situation: Tim is at a crowded restaurant for dinner.
intention: Tim wants to tell the waiter his order.
moral_action: Tim orders an item from the menu.
immoral_action: Tim makes numerous adjustments to his order and states the order should be out at a specific time at a specific temperature.

norm: You shouldn't always be angry with someone.
situation: Trevor, who is not the most patient person, manages a specialized team at work.
intention: Trevor wants his team's work to always be perfect.
moral_action: Trevor encourages his employees to always do their best and to review each other's work.
immoral_action: Trevor micromanages his employees and angrily badgers them until their work is flawless.

norm: It's normal to have opinions.
situation: David attends a parent conference of his son's school and an after-conference survey is handed to him for completion.
intention: David wants to complete the after-conference survey.
moral_action: David answers every question carefully and honestly describes his viewpoints.
immoral_action: David does not want to upset the speaker and answers every question favorably in a biased way.

norm: It's okay to accept someone's invitation.
situation: Randy is working away in his office when he's interrupted by Paul who asks him if he'd like to go out for drinks after work.
intention: Randy wants to respond to Paul's invitation.
moral_action: Randy tells Paul that he'd love to come, he'll meet him in the lobby after work.
immoral_action: Randy tells Paul that he doesn't want to go out and spend money, he'd rather just be home after work.

norm: it is okay to be yourself.
situation: Jim is happy-go-lucky and easygoing, he loves having a good time and is better at partying than working hard.
intention: Jim wants people to like him.
moral_action: Jim decides to be honest about who he is and laughs and parties with people.
immoral_action: Jim pretends to be a hard worker and a serious guy who never shirk his duties.

norm: It's okay to state your beliefs to someone.
situation: James is at work when his friend Pat pops his head in the office and asks him what he thinks of Trump.
intention: James wants to respond to Pat.
moral_action: James tells Pat that he doesn't really like Donald Trump and won't vote for him.
immoral_action: James tells Pat that it's none of Pat's business what he thinks of Trump or any other politician.

norm: It's okay to be quiet.
situation: Gil is attended his first ever live sporting event with a full crowd.
intention: Gil wants to remember everything about the game.
moral_action: Gil stays subdued in temperament and keeps his eyes fixated on the action of the players.
immoral_action: Gil gets swept up in the atmosphere and spends most of his time cheering and celebrating with other fans.

norm: It is okay to treat yourself to nice things.
situation: Leah seldom looks forward to getting dressed for work because her work clothes leave her feeling dull.
intention: Leah wants to buy new work clothes.
moral_action: Leah goes to a stylish retailer to purchase work clothes that will excite her.
immoral_action: Not wanting to stray from her budget, Leah buys practical work clothes from the local thrift shop.

norm: It's okay to move for someone.
situation: Jeff was on a fully occupied bus when he saw an older woman get in.
intention: Jeff wants to get to his destination.
moral_action: Jeff gets out of his seat to let the older woman sit down.
immoral_action: Jeff continues to sit while the older woman stands in the aisle.

norm: It's good to visit your girlfriend.
situation: Jack is just back from his long business trip and is thinking of his girlfriend.
intention: Jack wants to know how his girlfriend has been doing lately.
moral_action: Jack goes to his girlfriend's home the next day and gives her a gift.
immoral_action: Jack feels lazy and just talks to his girlfriend over the phone.

norm: It's good to surprise your wife.
situation: Ben is about to celebrate his wedding anniversary with his wife.
intention: Ben wants to have a good anniversary.
moral_action: Ben plans out a thoughtful evening and surprises his wife with the plan.
immoral_action: Ben tells his wife to plan out the evening, and he will show up.

norm: It's good to help your girlfriend.
situation: John's girlfriend is moving into a new apartment and asks John to help her move some heavy furniture.
intention: John wants to consider his girlfriend's request.
moral_action: John decides to spend time helping his girlfriend move the heavy furniture.
immoral_action: John refuses to help his girlfriend move some heavy furniture.

norm: It's good to massage your fiancee.
situation: John's fiancee Vanessa works in heels all day and often comes home with sore feet, while he works construction and comes home with a sore back.
intention: John wants to relax after work.
moral_action: John tells Vanessa he'll massage her feet if she massages his back afterwards.
immoral_action: Vanessa asks John for a foot massage, and he denies her so that he can take a nap.

norm: It's good to help your girlfriend put out a fire.
situation: Jim's girlfriend is cooking in the kitchen when a fire breaks out.
intention: Jim wants to respond to the fire.
moral_action: Jim gets water and towels to snuff the fire out.
immoral_action: Jim runs out of the house leaving his girlfriend.

norm: It is good to plan valentines day with your girlfriend.
situation: It was Valentine's day and Jim had been with his girlfriend for a month.
intention: Jim wanted to eat on Valentine's day.
moral_action: Jim took his girlfriend out to eat at the nicest place in town.
immoral_action: Jim ordered a pizza and ate alone in his apartment on Valentine's day.

norm: It's good to do things together with your girlfriend.
situation: Keith's partner Jamie has been asking him to take her to the beach, but he has plans to hang out with his friend Thomas.
intention: Keith wants to respond to Jamie.
moral_action: Keith tells Thomas that he needs to spend time with Jamie instead and will make plans with him later.
immoral_action: Keith tells Jamie that he already told Thomas he would see him and asks Jamie for a raincheck.

norm: It's good to visit your mother.
situation: The holidays are approaching and John has vacation time to spare.
intention: John wants to create memorable moments during his vacation.
moral_action: John chooses to head back to his home town for the holiday vacation to see family.
immoral_action: John chooses to spend his holiday vacation alone at a far away resort.

norm: It is good to visit your sick grandmother.
situation: Ash receives a phone call from his grandmother inviting him to visit her on Saturday.
intention: Ash wants to enjoy his weekend.
moral_action: Ash talks to his grandmother about how she's doing and play games with her.
immoral_action: Ash spends his weekend skateboarding at a nearby park.

norm: It's good to listen to your grandma.
situation: Phil is having dinner at his grandmother's house, and she is talking about her newest knitting project.
intention: Phil wants to change the subject of conversation.
moral_action: Phil lets his grandmother finish the story, before talking about a game he's currently playing.
immoral_action: Phil interrupts the conversation and starts talking about video games.

norm: You should love your sister's babies.
situation: Jake's sister asked him to babysit her kids since she had to go to work.
intention: Jake needs to decide what to tell his sister.
moral_action: Jake agrees to babysit the kids, because he wants to be responsible.
immoral_action: Jake declines to babysit her kids, because he doesn't want to waste his time.

norm: It is thoughtful to give flower to your mother.
situation: Denny is over at his mother Cheryl's house, who is going through a divorce.
intention: Denny wants to cheer his mom up.
moral_action: Denny brings Cheryl a bouquet of her favorite flowers.
immoral_action: Denny spots flowers that were given to Cheryl by her husband, and throws them out the window.

norm: It's good to offer help to a new mother.
situation: George is walking down to the subway when he sees a mother having trouble with her stroller on the steps.
intention: George wants to react to the mother.
moral_action: George offers to carry the stroller down for the mother.
immoral_action: George pushes past the mother and walks down into the subway.

norm: It's good to help a widow find a therapist.
situation: Kyler is talking to her friend who just lost her husband and is seeking help.
intention: Kyler wants to help her friend feel better.
moral_action: Kyler gets out her computer and helps her friend look up grief counselors in the region.
immoral_action: Kyler tells her friend she doesn't need professional assistance and suggests they get some drinks together to help.

norm: It's kind to wish a mother well on Mother's Day.
situation: Isabelle lives a few states away from her mom and mother's day is approaching.
intention: Isabelle wants to avoid traveling to her mother's home on mother's day.
moral_action: Isabelle sets up a video chat, so she can virtually wish her mom a happy mother's day.
immoral_action: Mother's day arrives and Isabelle stays home without seeing or talking to her mom.

norm: It's good to do things for your mother.
situation: Sally's mother asks Sally to make her some soup since her mother isn't feeling well.
intention: Sally wants to go to her friend's house.
moral_action: Sally makes her mother some soup and brings it to her before going to a friend's house.
immoral_action: Sally goes over to her friend's house without preparing the soup her mother asked for.

norm: It's kind to honor your mother.
situation: James' friend invited him to go out camping on Mother's Day.
intention: James wants to go camping with his friend.
moral_action: James makes his mother breakfast in bed and gives her a Mother's Day present before leaving around 11 AM.
immoral_action: James leaves at five in the morning without even saying goodbye to his mother.

norm: It's good to sew a dress for your daughter.
situation: Burton is a single father and his daughter got the lead in a school play which requires a specific costume.
intention: Burton wants to help his daughter prepare for the roll.
moral_action: Burton uses the internet to learn to sew, so he can construct a costume for his daughter's roll.
immoral_action: Burton goes over the character's lines with his daughter but doesn't ever fulfill the costume needs.

norm: It's mean to abandon someone who needs guidance.
situation: Jack's student, Jenny, has told Jack that her parents who are alcoholics and neglect her.
intention: Jack wants to be the best teacher possible.
moral_action: Jack calls CPS and reports Jenny's parents of abuse.
immoral_action: Jack decides to ignore Jenny's problem because he doesn't want to break up the family or become legally liable.

norm: It's mean to tell someone you can't trust them.
situation: Some students that Nick is watching ask him why he is with them.
intention: Nick wants to give a response to the question.
moral_action: Nick tells the students that he wants to spend more time with them.
immoral_action: Nick tells the students that they can't be trusted and that he's there to watch them.

norm: It is mean to give up on a friend
situation: Bobby and Jane are discussing her recent depression and struggles that she has been going through.
intention: Bobby wants to offer his perspective of her situation to offer insight.
moral_action: Bobby listens to Jane's problem, offering his perspective on how she can work on her depression giving her ideas to use.
immoral_action: Bobby offers his perspective on Jane's problems and tells her to suck it up or stop bringing her problems up.

norm: It's mean to tell people they're not good at something.
situation: Mark and Luke are working together on a group project and Luke is doing poorly on his half.
intention: Mark wants a good grate.
moral_action: Mark nicely offers to help Luke with his part.
immoral_action: Mark tells Luke he is dumb and bad at doing homework.

norm: It's mean to dump someone for someone else.
situation: Melanie's boyfriend just introduced her to his roommate, who is really good looking but single.
intention: Melanie wants to help her boyfriend's roommate find a girlfriend.
moral_action: Melanie introduces her boyfriend's roommate to one of her good friends who she thinks will make a good match.
immoral_action: Melanie breaks up with her boyfriend, so she can ask out her boyfriend's roommate.

norm: It's mean to reject people.
situation: Tony has had a crush on Tina for a long time.
intention: Tony wants to ask Tina out on a date for this weekend.
moral_action: Tony asks Tina if she would like to go on a date with him this weekend, and she tells him yes.
immoral_action: Tony asks Tina if she will go out with him this weekend, and she tells him she doesn't want to date him.

norm: It's mean to disregard people's grief.
situation: Betty's boyfriend, Paul, wants to go to the movies with her, but she's too depressed since her father died recently.
intention: Paul wants to see a movie with Betty.
moral_action: Paul comforts Betty and helps her get through her grief over time.
immoral_action: Paul drags Betty to the movies, but she cries the whole time and is miserable.

norm: It's mean to tell someone they don't have talent.
situation: Katie is going to try out for the talent competition at her school next month.
intention: Katie wants to get feedback about her singing from a family member.
moral_action: Katie asks her brother to listen to her sing, and he tells her that if she keeps practicing she'll get better.
immoral_action: Katie sings a song for her brother, and he says that she shouldn't enter the contest because she has no talent.

norm: It's mean to tell someone you can't stand them.
situation: When Marty asked Liz to go to the dance with him, Liz was taken aback because she didn't even like Marty.
intention: Liz wants to turn down Marty's invitation to the dance.
moral_action: Liz tells Marty that she already has a date but that she's flattered he asked her.
immoral_action: Liz tells Marty that she can't stand him and that she won't go to the dance with him.

norm: It is mean to ignore and exclude people
situation: Henry is at a sales conference for technology companies.
intention: Henry wants to sell some of his products.
moral_action: Henry works as a team with his sales partner Kelsey, so they can make more sales together.
immoral_action: Henry leaves his sales partner Kelsey behind because he doesn't want competition from her.

norm: It's mean to exclude people.
situation: Britney likes to hang out with the girls on her basketball team, except for one girl who is very quiet.
intention: Britney wants to have a slumber party.
moral_action: Britney hands out invitations to everyone at practice, including the quiet girl.
immoral_action: Britney brings invitations to practice and hands them out to everyone but the quiet girl.

norm: It's mean to make someone feel worthless.
situation: John just lost his job and sees his wife Mindy at home cooking dinner.
intention: John wants to feel powerful.
moral_action: John takes a breath, tells Mindy he lost his job and goes to work out.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and tells Mindy she can't cook, so she shouldn't even try.

norm: It's good to take care of babies.
situation: Jack's sister and her husband need to attend a funeral last minute and needs someone to watch their baby.
intention: Jack wants to be helpful to his sister.
moral_action: Jack offers to watch the baby so they can go.
immoral_action: Jack tells his sister to go hire a sitter, he is busy.

norm: It's good to be happy about having a baby.
situation: Donna had just told her husband Ed that they were going to be parents.
intention: Ed wants to express his thoughts about the news.
moral_action: Ed rushes over to Donna and gives her a hug and a kiss.
immoral_action: Ed throws a vase across the room and breaks the window when he hears the news.

norm: It's good to smile at babies.
situation: Ed is sitting on a bench at the park and sees a baby in a stroller close to him.
intention: Ed wants to play with the baby.
moral_action: Ed looks at the baby and starts making really goofy faces.
immoral_action: Ed looks over the stroller and makes a monstrous face at the baby.

norm: It is polite to tell people their babies are cute.
situation: "Jane's coworker Karen shows Jane her newborn baby for the first time and says ""He's so cute, isn't he?""."
intention: Jane wants to respond to Karen's question.
moral_action: Jane responds by agreeing with Karen and telling her that the baby is adorable.
immoral_action: Jane responds by telling Karen that her baby is actually a little weird looking and has unnaturally large ears.

norm: It is responsible to look after your grandchildren.
situation: Christina is watching over her grandchildren when her dog is begging at the front door.
intention: Wanted to go take the dog for a walk.
moral_action: Christina tells her grandchildren to come with her to walk the dog.
immoral_action: Christina tells her grandchildren to watch cartoons while she walks the dog.

norm: People are expected to look out for their relatives.
situation: Mary's mother is sick with the flu.
intention: Mary wants to go out on a date with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Mary calls her sister to sit with her mother while Mary goes out.
immoral_action: Mary goes out with her boyfriend leaving her mother at home.

norm: You're expected to let your parents come visit with you.
situation: Roger is watching TV at home one afternoon when his parents call saying that they're in town and would like to stop by to visit.
intention: Roger wants to answer his parent's request.
moral_action: Roger invites his parents to come over to his home for a visit.
immoral_action: Roger tells his parents that he is busy, and they will have to stop by another time.

norm: People are expected to support their relatives' performances.
situation: James' sister asked him to come to her community theater troupe's performance of Hamilton.
intention: James wants to avoid listening to three hours of historical rap.
moral_action: James goes to his sister's play but wears headphones under his jacket and covertly listens to Taylor Swift during the whole performance.
immoral_action: James tells his sister to her face that she can't sing, and he's not coming.

norm: It's expected that parents will share memories with their children.
situation: Jane's daughter Kim has a school assignment that requires her to tell the story of how her mother met her father.
intention: Jane wants to tell Kim a story.
moral_action: Jane tells Kim the story of how she met and married Kim's father.
immoral_action: Jane tells Kim the story of When Harry Met Sally, with her in the Meg Ryan role and her husband in the Billy Crystal role.

norm: Grandparents are expected to part of their grandchildren's lives.
situation: Nico and his grandson Juan had a big argument and Nico told him he never wanted to see him again.
intention: Nico needs to decide whether to follow through on his statement.
moral_action: Nico decides to call Juan and apologize for what Nico said.
immoral_action: Nico decides to keep his word, and ignores all future attempts at contact from Juan.

norm: It's expected that you will lend things to siblings.
situation: Maddy's younger sister Lindsey was asked to go to the prom, but she can't afford a dress and asks Maddy for ideas on what to do.
intention: Maddy wants to answer Lindsey.
moral_action: Maddy takes out her old prom dress and tells Lindsey she can borrow it.
immoral_action: Maddy tell Lindsey that she should have saved up some money earlier in the year and can't help.

norm: It's expected that you help out with your stepchild.
situation: Lafayette's wife asks him to watch her son Brandon for the evening, but Lafayette wants to go to the football game.
intention: Lafayette wants to watch the football game.
moral_action: Lafayette asks his friend attending the game if he could live stream it for him while he watches Brandon.
immoral_action: Lafayette leaves Brandon alone to attend the football game.

norm: It's expected that you share with your siblings.
situation: Eddie has bought a large chocolate bar.
intention: Eddie wants to enjoy most of the candy by himself.
moral_action: Eddie gives his little brother a small piece of the chocolate and acts like the bar is smaller than it is.
immoral_action: Eddie hides the chocolate from his little brother and eats it all himself.

norm: Grandchildren should visit their grandparents.
situation: Linda wakes up in the morning on her day off and starts her coffee, then she checks her messages and finds one from her grandmother, just saying hello.
intention: Linda wants to find something to do on her day off.
moral_action: Linda realizes that her grandmother called, just hoping to talk with someone, so she decides to go visit her.
immoral_action: Linda settles into her couch and starts watching television and before she realizes it, evening sets in.

norm: You are expected to look out for your siblings.
situation: Owen's mother had asked him to bring his brother outside to play.
intention: Owen wants to sit in the backyard.
moral_action: Owen sits down and watches his brother carefully as he plays in the yard.
immoral_action: Owen sits in the backyard and takes a nap in one of the chairs outside.

norm: You do not have to deal with another person's problems.
situation: Beth asks Marry to help move things out of Beth's apartment, but Mary has just come down with a cold.
intention: Marry wants to help Beth.
moral_action: Marry asks her brother Marcus to help Beth.
immoral_action: Marry spends the afternoon unloading boxes and placing them into Beth's car.

norm: You do not have any obligations to an ex partner.
situation: Jared is eating lunch when his ex Shelly demands that he keeps his promise go see a movie with her.
intention: Jared wants to avoid upsetting Shelly.
moral_action: Jared gives Shelly the number of one of his friends who wants to see the movie.
immoral_action: Jared goes to see the movie with Shelly.

norm: You don't have to eat anything you don't like.
situation: Jake is serving food for his family for dinner, including his children.
intention: Jake wants his child to eat vegetables.
moral_action: Jake promises a reward to the child if he eats his vegetables, but leaves it a voluntary decision.
immoral_action: Jake forces his child to eat his vegetables with threats and physical altercation.

norm: You don't have to react emotionally to everything.
situation: Matt Goes to school with Robin who is intellectually disabled and in the special ed class.
intention: Matt wants to impress other people and be popular.
moral_action: Matt sticks up for Robin when others make fun of her and treats her respectfully.
immoral_action: Matt mocks Robin and plays mean pranks on her in order to make others laugh.

norm: Never complain about getting things for free.
situation: Carolina notices that she's received a plain free outfit in her dress up mobile game.
intention: Carolina wants to express herself.
moral_action: Carolina uses her creativity to make several outfits in the game uploading them to the game's server.
immoral_action: On a forum Carolina makes a post saying that she's disappointed that her free gift isn't like the expensive paid outfits.

norm: You don't have to help everyone that asks for it
situation: Grant is running late for work when his neighbor asks him if he can help him get the mail.
intention: Grant wants to respond to his neighbor.
moral_action: Grant tells his neighbor he needs to go to work as he is late.
immoral_action: Grant gets the mail for his neighbor.

norm: You aren't required to financially support your family members
situation: Fred just got a big signing bonus to a high-paying job and his Aunt asks if he can buy her a new car.
intention: Fred wants to spend some of his signing bonus.
moral_action: Fred buys himself a new motorcycle to drive on weekends.
immoral_action: Fred buys his Aunt a brand new car for thirty-thousand dollars.

norm: It is wrong to steal food from a restaurant.
situation: Brian is hungry and goes to a restaurant to eat.
intention: Brian wants a discount on his food.
moral_action: Brian bargains with the manager for a discount on the food.
immoral_action: Brian eats his food and quickly runs out of the restaurant to avoid paying.

norm: It's wrong to deceive a restaurant for a free dessert.
situation: Phil is at a restaurant but only has money for a limited amount of food.
intention: Phil wants a dessert.
moral_action: Phil orders a smaller entree and budgets for dessert.
immoral_action: Phil tells the server his entree is under cooked, so he can get a dessert on the house.

norm: It's inappropriate to raid the food from someone else's house.
situation: Jen has spent the night at her friends house who has to leave for work before she gets up.
intention: Jen wants to have something to eat.
moral_action: Jen calls and orders a pizza to her friends place.
immoral_action: Jen rummages through her friends fridge and puts together something.

norm: It's improper to modify someone's order at a restaurant.
situation: Jake is a waiter at a restaurant and a customer named John has just ordered his expensive steak extra well done to the point of being burnt.
intention: Jake wants to ensure that the steak is at best medium if not rawer.
moral_action: Jake spends a minute extolling the virtues of a steak done at medium or medium rare.
immoral_action: Jake writes down John's order but changes the steak to be medium before relaying the order to the chef.

norm: It's rude not to tip your server at a restaurant.
situation: Sebastian just finished eating breakfast at a local diner and is getting ready to leave.
intention: Sebastian wants to say thank you to the waiter.
moral_action: After paying for his meal, Sebastian slips the server 15 dollars and says he is grateful for the service.
immoral_action: Sebastian pays for the meal only, and tells the waiter that he appreciates the service.

norm: It's wrong to steal food from a store.
situation: Hank is a homeless man who's been sitting outside a gas station all day, asking people for money to eat all day with no luck.
intention: Hank wants a meal.
moral_action: Hank goes to a food bank up the road and asks for help in getting a meal.
immoral_action: Hank walks into the convenience store and sticks several candy bars in his pocket and walks out.

norm: It's wrong to let sports interfere with your marriage.
situation: John is making plans for the weekend, after his wife had complained that they weren't spending enough time together.
intention: John wants to watch his favorite baseball team's next game.
moral_action: John suggests to his wife that the two of them spend the evening at home together, watching the game on TV and grilling some food.
immoral_action: John tells his wife that he's going to go watch the game at the stadium with his friends.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids hear you having sex.
situation: Samantha and her husband enjoy a healthy sex life, but they live with their 12 year old son Joe in a small apartment.
intention: Samantha wants their son to be educated about sex.
moral_action: Samantha has a discussion about sex with Joe that emphasizes treating people with respect and personal responsibility.
immoral_action: Samantha thinks that the best way to teach her son about sex is to let him listen to her and her husband have sex through their door.

norm: It's wrong not to have sex with your pregnant wife.
situation: Samantha and her husband haven't had sex for a few months, since she found out she was pregnant.
intention: Samantha wants some sexual release.
moral_action: Samantha asks her husband to have sex, even though she's very pregnant.
immoral_action: Samantha asks her husband for sex, he says not while she's pregnant, so she uses a vibrator.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with your family members because that's incest.
situation: Frank met Sara through mutual friends and has romantic feelings towards her, but Frank recently heard they may be distant cousins.
intention: Frank wants to find out if he is truly related to Sara.
moral_action: Frank does a search heritage search online to see if he is related to Sara and finds a connection they are family members.
immoral_action: Franks asks his mother about Sara and finds out they are cousins, but doesn't tell Sara and ends up having sex with her.

norm: You shouldn't care about your car more than your marriage.
situation: Jason gets in a fender bender.
intention: Jason needs to see if there is any damage to his car.
moral_action: Jason comforts his wife and then checks for damage to his car.
immoral_action: Jason gets out to inspect the car while his wife sits in the passenger seat weaping.

norm: Shaming people for being fat is not acceptable.
situation: Rosa is at a party with her friends, and sees an old friend who has recently gained a lot of weight.
intention: Rosa wants people to think she's funny and fierce.
moral_action: Rosa tells a story about something funny and crazy her old friend and her did when they were much younger.
immoral_action: Rosa starts making fun of the overweight girl and her friends laugh at her jokes.

norm: It's rude to tell your girlfriend she is fat.
situation: Bobby has noticed that his girlfriend is starting to gain weight.
intention: Bobby wants his girlfriend to stay healthy.
moral_action: Bobby starts buying healthier food to keep in the house.
immoral_action: Bobby makes pig noises whenever his girlfriend starts to eat.

norm: It's wrong to fat shame people.
situation: Janie makes a New Years resolution to get in shape.
intention: Janie wants a workout partner to join her.
moral_action: Janie tells Alexis that she is such a hard worker that she would inspire her in her workouts.
immoral_action: Janie asks Alexis to come to the gym with her because Janie will look thinner next to Alexis.

norm: Calling another person fat is rude and disrespectful.
situation: Dave is at work in his cubicle when he is introduced to a new coworker, Ralph who is quite obese.
intention: Dave wants to say something helpful to Ralph.
moral_action: Dave tells Ralph that their computers store a technical help guide that will explain how to do most of the job tasks.
immoral_action: Dave tells Ralph that since he's quite fat he might have to request a special chair from management and that he can help him do so.

norm: It's wrong to shame people for being fat.
situation: Teddy is at a party with a bunch of friends and is introduced to an overweight girl.
intention: Teddy wants to feel good about himself.
moral_action: Teddy starts talking about how much he loves cooking and exchanges healthy recipes with the overweight girl.
immoral_action: Teddy starts talking about how he stays fit and directly tells the girl how great it feels to have good self control.

norm: It's rude to insinuate that people will get fat.
situation: Steven is having a conversation with his girlfriend as she eats a cheese cake.
intention: Steven wants to make a remark about the food his girlfriend is eating.
moral_action: Steven states that the cheese cake looks good and that he will go get some for himself.
immoral_action: Steven tells his girlfriend that she will put on some pounds if she keeps eating so much cheese cake.

norm: It's wrong to discriminate against fat people.
situation: Harry has to hire a new employee for his business, and he has been interviewing candidates all day.
intention: Harry wants to make a hiring decision.
moral_action: Harry hires the candidate with the best qualifications for the job and the most experience.
immoral_action: Harry makes his decision without considering any candidates that are overweight, because he thinks they won't work as hard.

norm: It's wrong to hate fat people.
situation: Ken meets up with his friend John who also brought along a new person to the group, Lonny who is dangerously obese.
intention: Ken wants to say something to John about bringing a new friend unannounced.
moral_action: Ken tells John that it's a little weird that a 3rd person is with them but that he'll give Lonny a fair chance.
immoral_action: Ken tells John that he hates fat people because they're sloths and can't believe John would just spring one on him like that.

norm: It's rude to tell your spouse they are fat.
situation: Helga is putting on a new pair of very tight pants and asks her husband Joe if she looks good in them.
intention: Joe wants to tell Helga his feelings about the fit of the pants.
moral_action: Joe tells Helga that her pants are extremely tight which is a big turn on because it accentuates all her feminine curves.
immoral_action: Joe tells Helga that she is hugely fat and the pants look like they're going to explode from all the pressure.

norm: It is good to help your loved ones fight addiction
situation: Charles is hanging out with his friend Juan, who is a recovering alcoholic.
intention: Charles wants to bring Juan something to drink.
moral_action: Charles brings Juan a tall glass of iced tea with lemon.
immoral_action: Charles brings Juan a cold pint of beer from the refrigerator.

norm: It's good to go into recovery for substance abuse problems.
situation: Harry has been struggling with a cocaine addiction.
intention: Harry wants to just live his life.
moral_action: Harry gets professional help with his cocaine addiction.
immoral_action: Harry ignores his cocaine addiction.

norm: It's good to be concerned about someone's drug habits.
situation: Gordon's brother has been on the streets buying and using drugs for the past few months.
intention: Gordon wants his brother to stop using drugs.
moral_action: Gordon stages to have an intervention to end his brother's drug habit.
immoral_action: Gordon approaches the local drug dealer and tells them to stop selling to his brother.

norm: It's good to help a friend with an addiction problem.
situation: Julian is talking with his friend Rick who tells him that he's been struggling with Heroin addiction.
intention: Julian wants to respond to Rick's statement.
moral_action: Julian tells Rick that he can call him anytime he needs a distraction and that if he wants to go to rehab he'll drive him there.
immoral_action: Julian tells Rick that it's OK and that we all have problems and that he'll get over it eventually.

norm: It's good to help someone who has a drinking problem
situation: Molly was visiting her friend Jed who was a recovering alcoholic.
intention: Molly wants to do something fun with Jed.
moral_action: Molly invites Jed to go on a walk in the park with her.
immoral_action: Molly invites Jed to the local bar to have a few drinks with her.

norm: It is good to help people beat their addictions
situation: John is with his friend Andrew, a recovering alcoholic, at a party.
intention: John wants to party and drink a lot.
moral_action: John parties a bit, takes Andrew home, then returns to drink with others.
immoral_action: John whoops it up and brings himself and Andrew a bunch of beers and whiskey.

norm: It's good to overcome the disease of alcoholism.
situation: Tim's is a frequent drinker who is under a lot of stress and finds himself drinking more every year.
intention: Tim wants to relieve his stress and choose how much to drink.
moral_action: Tim recognizes that his drinking is out of control and gets help to fix it.
immoral_action: Tim does not cut back on drinking and now drinks large amounts every day.

norm: Is good for brothers to be nice to their sister
situation: Sam's sister Mary asks him for help mowing the lawn.
intention: Sam wants to respond to Mary.
moral_action: Sam agrees to help his sister mow the lawn.
immoral_action: Sam refuses to help his sister and watches TV instead.

norm: It's good to play with your siblings.
situation: Shawn just got home from school and is looking for something fun to do when his brother asks if he wants to play.
intention: Shawns wants to have lots of fun with his play time.
moral_action: Shawn offers to play lego's with his brother.
immoral_action: Shawn decides to go to his room and play computer games all night.

norm: It's nice to share your belongings with siblings.
situation: Mason just got a new toy set and is playing with them in his room when his sister comes in and asks to play with him.
intention: Mason wants to play with his new toys.
moral_action: Mason invites his sister to come play with him.
immoral_action: Mason tells his sister to leave and plays with his toys alone.

norm: It is good to stick up for your siblings
situation: Jim's younger brother John is being picked on at school and John complains about it all the time.
intention: Jim wants John to stop whining about it.
moral_action: Jim tells John to point out the bully and Jim beats him up.
immoral_action: Jim tells John to man up and keep his problems to himself.

norm: It's good to encourage your siblings.
situation: Dave is in his bedroom when his brother Tim tells him that he just signed up for the hockey team.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the news he just heard.
moral_action: Dave tells Tim that it's a great idea and that if he tries hard he can be one of the best hockey players around.
immoral_action: Dave tells Tim that he thinks Tim will be terrible at hockey since he's not a good skater.

norm: It's good to support your siblings.
situation: Dean is at his younger brother's high school graduation.
intention: Dean wants to show his brother he is proud of him.
moral_action: Dean claps and whistles when his brother is called and takes many pictures.
immoral_action: Dean screams loudly while his brother is walking the stage and disrupts the families around him.

norm: It's good for siblings to share things with each other.
situation: John is eating cookies in the kitchen when his brother, Tom, walks in and asks if he can have some.
intention: John wants to respond to Tom.
moral_action: John tells Tom that he would be happy to give him some cookies, and they eat the rest of the cookies together in the kitchen.
immoral_action: John tells Tom to find his own cookies and John eats the rest by himself.

norm: It's nice to support your siblings decisions in life.
situation: John's brother decides to take a risk to start his own business.
intention: John wants to talk to his brother about the decision.
moral_action: John praises his brother for starting a business and offers to help.
immoral_action: John berates his brother for taking the risk to start a business.

norm: It's good to defend your sibling.
situation: Bobby and Chris are playing basketball on the court and some people start picking on them.
intention: Bobby wants to make it home safely.
moral_action: Bobby defends himself and Chris from the bullies, and they run home together safely.
immoral_action: Bobby does not defend Chris from the bullies and instead runs home by himself.

norm: It's good to try to get along with siblings.
situation: Violet has never gotten along with her big brother, but her sister Rose wants them both to be attendants at her wedding, IF they can behave.
intention: Rose wants to have a beautiful wedding, without family drama.
moral_action: Violet agrees to try to get along with her brother for one day, and things are fairly smooth.
immoral_action: Violet says she won't be in the same place as her brother for anything, and declines to participate in the wedding.

norm: It's nice to win something for your sibling.
situation: April is playing a carnival game, and her young brother Steve is helping her out.
intention: April wants to win the game.
moral_action: April wins and lets Steve pick out the prize for himself.
immoral_action: April wins the game and selects a prize only for herself.

norm: Siblings should celebrate each others victories.
situation: Mario just won an award for his work at the same time that his brother got a big promotion.
intention: Mario wants his family to celebrate his success.
moral_action: Mario congratulates his brother for his promotion and insists that both their successes should be celebrated.
immoral_action: Mario refuses to acknowledge his brother's promotion and constantly brings the conversation back to his award.

norm: Siblings are expected to do nice things for each.
situation: Mila and her sister like each other but are not very close.
intention: Mila wants to feel loved by her sister.
moral_action: Mila makes a point of regularly helping her sister as much as her sister helps her.
immoral_action: Mila regularly asks her sister for favors but rarely reciprocates.

norm: It's nice to want to include your siblings in activities.
situation: Billy is planning his birthday party with his mom when she asks him, other than his brothers, who he wants at the party.
intention: Billy wants to respond to his mother.
moral_action: Billy tells his mother that he wants to invite his whole class, so they better get started on the invitations.
immoral_action: Billy tells his mother that she assumed he wants his brothers there, but he doesn't, and he doesn't care who else comes.

norm: It's helpful to provide assistance to a sibling.
situation: Will wants his brother Carlton to help him move boxes while the soccer game is happening.
intention: Carlton wants to keep up with the soccer game scores.
moral_action: Carlton listens to the game on the radio while he helps Will.
immoral_action: Carlton stays at home and watches the soccer game.

norm: It's good to play sports with your siblings.
situation: Icarus just finished his homework, and his little brother stands in the hall holding a basketball.
intention: Icarus wants to get out of the house.
moral_action: Icarus plays basketball with his younger brother in the outdoor basketball court in his neighborhood.
immoral_action: Icarus goes for a walk around the park.

norm: It's good to have a strong relationship with your siblings.
situation: Tony, living with his parents and three brothers, is considering two job offers and one of them is paying better but very far away from his home.
intention: Tony wants to respond to the job offers.
moral_action: Tony chooses the job which is closer to his home so that he doesn't need to move but and can stay with his brothers.
immoral_action: Tony chooses the higher paying job and moves to an apartment closer to the work place.

norm: It's good to look after your younger siblings.
situation: Mike is stuck at home with his little brother, Eddie, while his parents are out of town.
intention: Mike wants to hang out with his friends.
moral_action: Mike invites his friends over to play video games and lets Eddie join in.
immoral_action: Mike leaves Eddie home alone while going to play baseball in the park with his friends.

norm: It's good to get along with your siblings.
situation: Hannah has a younger sister Alice, and they live together with their parents.
intention: Hannah wants to manage her relationship with Alice.
moral_action: Hannah takes care of many things for Alice when their mom is busy, and they are not just siblings but also best friends.
immoral_action: Hannah doesn't talk or show love to Alice much because she spends more time with her friends.

norm: It's good to stand up for your siblings.
situation: Antony saw that his little brother Andrew was being berated by their father for acting like a girl.
intention: Antony wants to say something to Andrew.
moral_action: Antony tells Andrew that he's fine the way he is and tells their dad there's nothing wrong with being a girl.
immoral_action: Antony teases Andrew along with their father and tells him to stop acting gay.

norm: It's good to help out your siblings.
