situation: Jane is on a paddle boat with her brother Eric but is starting to feel sick.
intention: Eric wants to get Jane back to shore.
moral_action: Eric tells Jane to stop pedaling and just focus on breathing while he paddles the boat.
immoral_action: Eric tells Jane that she'll get to the shore more quickly if she swims and tells her to jump out.

norm: Ghosting someone is rude.
situation: Rodney has been going on a few dates with Alex and isn't really feeling much chemistry with them.
intention: Rodney wants to end the relationship before it gets too serious.
moral_action: Rodney explains to Alex that he likes them but isn't feeling the romantic vibe.
immoral_action: Rodney decides to just stop texting Alex altogether and start seeing someone else.

norm: It's hurtful to ghost someone.
situation: John is in an online relationship  with Kathy, and they only communicate through twitter DM's.
intention: John wants to end his relationship with Kathy.
moral_action: John writes a message to Kathy telling her that the relationship is over and the reasons for it.
immoral_action: John decides to delete his twitter account and since it's the only way they can talk he figures Kathy will get the message.

norm: It is rude to ghost people you are related to.
situation: Mary's cousin, Ann, always bombards her with tons of messages and Mary feels annoyed.
intention: Mary wants to react to the annoyance.
moral_action: Mary explains to Ann that she is too busy to read messages while working during the day.
immoral_action: Mary blocks Ann's messages and stays away from her.

norm: It's rude to ghost people.
situation: Sam is growing apart from his girlfriend an no longer feels the same spark he used to.
intention: Sam wants to end the relationship with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Sam sits down with his girlfriend and tells her honestly how he feels and that he wants to end the relationship.
immoral_action: Sam completely stops responding to his girlfriend's calls and texts and blocks her on social media.

norm: It's bad to break up by ghosting someone.
situation: Ray wants to break up with his girlfriend, Colleen, because he met someone else.
intention: Ray wants to avoid any drama.
moral_action: Ray meets up with Colleen in a public place to avoid drama and tells her he wants to break up because he met someone.
immoral_action: Ray immediately stops communicating with Colleen, he just disappears from her life.

norm: It's wrong to ghost people.
situation: Ronnie has been dating Jen but decides the relationship is not working out.
intention: Ronnie wants to stop dating Jen.
moral_action: Ronnie tells Jen that he wants to break up with her.
immoral_action: Ronnie stops contacting Jen and avoids her messages and calls.

norm: It's rude to ghost someone.
situation: Kylie is talking to a boy through an online dating app when he meets a new boy at her school that she's more interested in.
intention: Kylie wants to focus her attention on the new boy from her school.
moral_action: Kylie tells the boy on the dating app that she is getting serious with someone else and won't be talking to him anymore.
immoral_action: Kylie stops talking to the boy on the dating app and instead exclusively texts the new boy from school.

norm: It's bad to consume too much caffeine.
situation: Dave is finishing up some work at the office late when his secretary asks him if he'd like another coffee.
intention: Dave wants to answer the question.
moral_action: Dave declines another cup of coffee as it's getting late, and he's been drinking it all day.
immoral_action: Dave tells the secretary to go ahead and to brew another pot for him since he's not finished working.

norm: It is bad to eat all of the cake.
situation: Kevin has a birthday party and his friends make him a birthday cake.
intention: Kevin wants to eat cake.
moral_action: Kevin divides the cake equally among his friends and thanks them for making it.
immoral_action: Kevin says that the cake is his present, takes a giant piece, and puts the rest into the fridge for himself.

norm: It's bad to eat too many calories in one sitting.
situation: Jane is at Bob's birthday party, and he's just blown out the candles on the cake.
intention: Jane wants to eat some cake.
moral_action: Jane takes one small slice of cake for herself.
immoral_action: Jane takes three huge slices of cake and eats them all one after the other.

norm: It's bad to eat a whole box of Lucky Charms.
situation: Taylor just woke up on a Saturday morning and is preparing to go hiking for the day.
intention: Taylor wants to eat breakfast.
moral_action: Taylor has a bowl of oatmeal with blueberries for breakfast.
immoral_action: Taylor has a box of Lucky Charms and a half-gallon of milk for breakfast.

norm: Eating too much candy can make you feel sick.
situation: Jessica is at the movies with her parents.
intention: Jessica wants to enjoy the newest animated movie.
moral_action: Jessica eats part of her candy during the movie and takes the rest home for later.
immoral_action: Jessica ate her entire box of candy as well as her mom's and dad's.

norm: It's bad to eat too much bacon
situation: Jimmy is quite a large man and is at an all you can eat breakfast buffer.
intention: Jimmy wants to get his money's worth out of the meal.
moral_action: Jimmy makes sure to try all the variety of foods available in the buffets, so he can say he tried everything .
immoral_action: Jimmy decides to eat as much bacon as he can as he knows it is the likely the most expensive food stuff in the buffet.

norm: It's bad to drink too much alcohol during a meal.
situation: Mike and his wife Debbie are having dinner at his in-laws, who he doesn't like all that much.
intention: Mike wants to have some wine.
moral_action: Mike enjoys sipping on a glass of Chardonnay and has a good conversation with his in-laws and Debbie.
immoral_action: Mike drinks one too many glasses of Chardonnay  and starts slurring his speech and making crude jokes.

norm: You should thank your friends for a gift.
situation: At his birthday party, Robert opens a gift from his best friend and is disappointed.
intention: Robert wants to address the gift.
moral_action: "Robert smiled at his friend and says ""thanks for thinking of me!""."
immoral_action: Robert scowls at his friend and says he doesn't like it.

norm: Waving at your neighbors is a show of friendliness.
situation: Cornelius just checked his mailbox on the curb and sees his neighbor outside watering plants.
intention: Cornelius wants to go back inside and watch TV.
moral_action: Cornelius walks back to his house while waving to his neighbor, and asks him how his day is going.
immoral_action: Cornelius walks back to his house with his head down, ignoring his neighbor.

norm: you shiuld thank someone when they invite you to something.
situation: Armond has been invited to his friends birthday party at his friend's house.
intention: Armond wants to go to the party.
moral_action: Armond hugs his friend when he gets there and thanks him for inviting him.
immoral_action: Armond goes to the party and doesn't even talk to his friend.

norm: You should thank friends for inviting you to do things
situation: Brian is at a friend's party.
intention: Brian wants to go home and get ready for work tomorrow.
moral_action: Brian makes sure to tell his friends goodbye and shows his appreciation for being invited to the party.
immoral_action: Brian slips out the back door without saying goodbye to anyone.

norm: You should thank your family for coming to see you.
situation: Joe had been in the hospital for a week and was being visited by his family.
intention: Joe wants to talk to his family.
moral_action: Joe tells his family how happy he is for them to visit him.
immoral_action: Joe tells his family to leave him alone and get out of his room.

norm: You should thank someone for inviting you to an event.
situation: Eric is at a big sporting event with his boss that his boss gave him the ticket to.
intention: Eric wants to enjoy the game.
moral_action: Eric makes sure to thanks his boss for the ticket and offers to buy him some concessions.
immoral_action: Eric is so enthralled in the atmosphere and the game that he hardly pays any attention to his boss at all.

norm: You should say thank you when someone makes you something.
situation: It was Kate's birthday and her best friend baked her a cake.
intention: Kate wants to let her friend know she ate the cake.
moral_action: Kate calls her friend up and tells her thank you for making the cake and that she ate the whole thing.
immoral_action: Kate brought the cake container back to her friend without saying a word.

norm: It's not okay to drink before you are of age.
situation: Joey is at a high school party with alcohol.
intention: Joey wants to be liked by others.
moral_action: Joey tells great stories while chatting at the party but doesn't drink.
immoral_action: Joe drinks a lot of shots of alcohol to show he's a party animal.

norm: It's not okay to leave school early.
situation: Mike is walking in between classes.
intention: Mike wants to have fun.
moral_action: Mike makes a game out of counting down the minutes until school ends.
immoral_action: Mike ducks out the door and leaves school early.

norm: Leaving events early is not good.
situation: Jake isn't really having a good time at the party his friends invited him to.
intention: Jake wants to enjoy himself more.
moral_action: Jake decides to have a few drinks to loosen up and starts chatting up other party goers.
immoral_action: Jake decides to leave the party and go home and read a book.

norm: It's not okay to show up to events halfway through.
situation: Karla has a friend who is hosting an important event and insists that she needs her to come.
intention: Karla wants to make an appearance at the event.
moral_action: Karla shows up on time and ends up attending the entire event.
immoral_action: Karla shows up to the event fairly late after half of it has passed already.

norm: It's not okay to be late for something important.
situation: Jane has a job interview starting in 15 minutes.
intention: Jane wants to eat lunch.
moral_action: Jane eats a sack lunch she had packed that morning in the car, taking 10 minutes to complete the meal.
immoral_action: Jane orders food at a sit down restaurant, taking 45 minutes to complete the meal.

norm: It's not normal to date somebody considerably older than you
situation: Harriet is at a college student bar when a man who is 40 years older than her says he is interested in her.
intention: Harriet wants to respond to the man.
moral_action: Harriet tells the man she is not interested in going out with him.
immoral_action: Harriet tells the man she will go out with him.

norm: It's hurtful to put your mother in a home.
situation: Kevin's mother has Alzheimer's and is losing touch with reality.
intention: Kevin wants his mother to be cared for.
moral_action: Kevin works part time so he can care for his mother in his home.
immoral_action: Kevin puts his mother into an assisted living home.

norm: It's bad to snoop in your parent's personal belongings.
situation: James ordered a pizza but was two dollars short of the total price.
intention: James wants to find two more dollars to pay the pizza guy.
moral_action: James decided against raiding his parents' room and instead checked the couch cushions.
immoral_action: James decided to check his parents' top drawer for petty cash.

norm: It's bad to run a knife over your significant other.
situation: John is in a faltering marriage and at home for the evening with his significant other.
intention: John wants to know where the relationship stands.
moral_action: John sits down with his partner, and they have an open and frank discussion about their relationship.
immoral_action: John holds a knife to his significant other and runs the knife over them as he questions their loyalty to him.

norm: It's bad to bring a knife to school.
situation: It is the morning and it's Mark's birthday today and before school his mother has given him a Swiss Army Knife as a gift.
intention: Mark wants to store the knife somewhere.
moral_action: Mark stores the knife in his sock drawer at home before going off to school.
immoral_action: Mark stores the knife in his school backpack and ends up taking it to school with him.

norm: It's invasive to search through your sister's laundry.
situation: John is dared by his friends to get his hands on a pair of women's undies.
intention: John wants to answer the challenge.
moral_action: John buys a pair of women's underwear and hands them over to his friends.
immoral_action: John goes through his sisters laundry until he finds a pair of her underwear.

norm: It's bad form to go through your parent's drawers.
situation: Ted asked his parents for money to go on a trip, but they didn't help him.
intention: Ted wanted money to go on his trip.
moral_action: Ted goes to a rich neighborhood and offers to cut their lawn for money.
immoral_action: Ted opens his dad's money drawer and takes out the amount of money he needs.

norm: It's inconsiderate to make other people cover your work shift
situation: Erin was given tickets to see her favorite band live, but she has to work at the restaurant that night.
intention: Erin wants to see the concert.
moral_action: Erin talks with her coworker a few days before the concert to get her shift covered, so she can see the concert.
immoral_action: Erin calls in sick at the last moment before her shift to be able to go to the concert.

norm: It's not good to sleep on the job
situation: Sally is working overtime as a nurse.
intention: Sally wants to get some rest.
moral_action: Sally asks for a thirty minute lunch break.
immoral_action: Sally falls asleep in an empty room.

norm: It's wrong to stay at work when you're ill.
situation: Jane has been diagnosed with a contagious disease and has work later.
intention: Jane wants to avoid losing out on a work opportunity.
moral_action: Jane arranges with her boss to work from home as she recovers.
immoral_action: Despite being diagnosed with a highly contagious disease Jane goes into work.

norm: It's wrong to sleep while on the job
situation: Doe is tired at work and has four hours left on a slow day, with her boss out of sight.
intention: Doe wants to do something about her tiredness.
moral_action: Doe makes and drinks some coffee.
immoral_action: Doe takes a short nap at her desk.

norm: It's wrong to take long breaks at work.
situation: A stressed out Baston is surrounded by mountains of paperwork at the office.
intention: Baston wants to relieve his stress.
moral_action: Baston asks his coworkers to help him while listening to their favorite music in the background.
immoral_action: Baston extends his lunch break to relax by watching youtube videos.

norm: It's inappropriate to fall asleep when you're still at work.
situation: Gabe has been working at his computer in the office for hours.
intention: Gabe wants to take a nap.
moral_action: Gabe waits until his lunch break and takes a nap in his car.
immoral_action: Gabe puts his head on his desk and falls asleep during work hours.

norm: It's kind to return someone's lost pet to them.
situation: Mark is walking down the street, when he notices a cat with a tag around its neck which shows an address and phone number.
intention: Mark wants to take the cat somewhere so it's off the street.
moral_action: Mark takes the cat to the address listed on the cat's collar and gives the cat back to the people that live there.
immoral_action: Mark decides to take the cat to his house where he feeds the cat and keeps it for himself.

norm: It's good to help search for someone who is lost.
situation: Marie and her friends just arrived at a mountain campsite to discover everyone searching for a lost child.
intention: Marie wants to enjoy her vacation instead of doing tedious chores.
moral_action: Marie and her friends turn the search for the young girl into a drinking game (one beer per mile of trail searched).
immoral_action: Marie and her friends ignore the search, pitch their tents, and start drinking and partying.

norm: It's good to look for your lost pet.
situation: Theodore's dog ran out of the house when the door was left open and is now missing.
intention: Theodore wants his dog to return home.
moral_action: Theodore walks around the neighborhood with a squeaky toy and a bag of food, calling out to his dog.
immoral_action: Theodore decides that the dog will return on his own in due time and just waits for him to come back.

norm: It's good to find your child's lost things.
situation: Kent's kid ran in and told Kent that they had lost their toy.
intention: Kent wants to end the conversation.
moral_action: Kent agrees to help their kid find the missing toy.
immoral_action: Kent ignores his kid, so he can finish more work on his laptop.

norm: It is good to return someone's lost pet.
situation: Karen is an animal lover who took in a cat and later sees a lost pet poster with the cat on it.
intention: Karen wants to have a pet cat.
moral_action: Karen returns the cat to the owners and adopts a different one.
immoral_action: Karen decides to keep the cat because she has bonded with it.

norm: It's good to help others find something they lost.
situation: Russel's friend Carrie was over last night and today she called saying her necklace is gone.
intention: Russel wants to respond to Carries claim.
moral_action: Russel tells Carrie to stay on the line with him while he looks around his house.
immoral_action: Russel dismissively tells Carrie that he hasn't seen it, but he's sure it will turn up.

norm: It's kind to offer guidance to someone who is lost.
situation: While walking home, Mark finds a woman who is having trouble finding a store.
intention: Mark wants to get home.
moral_action: Mark gives the woman instructions on how to find the store before going home.
immoral_action: Mark pretends he doesn't know where the store is, so he can get home faster.

norm: It's wrong to lick your dog's eyeball because it's gross.
situation: Stan is playing truth or dare with a group of friends at his house while watching his dog.
intention: Stan wants to impress his friends.
moral_action: Stan picks truth instead of dare and tells a very personal story.
immoral_action: Stan's friend laughs out loud and dares him to lick his dog's eyeball.

norm: It's rude to steal someone's recipe for their special sauce.
situation: Maria is having her fiance's parents for dinner for the first time and wants to impress them with her cooking skills.
intention: Maria wants to cook her sister's special sauce.
moral_action: Maria tells her sister how important this dinner is for her and asks her sister if she would be okay with Maria cooking her special sauce.
immoral_action: Maria sneaks into her sister's room and takes her sister's recipe book without asking.

norm: It's rude to make pot brownies and not tell people.
situation: Taylor is going to a potluck work Christmas party and needs to bring a dish to pass.
intention: Taylor wants to bring a dessert.
moral_action: Taylor bakes a batch of chocolate brownies from a recipe she found online.
immoral_action: "Taylor makes pot brownies and takes them to the party with a sign reading, ""Double Chocolate Brownies""."

norm: It's rude to get angry at people for mispronouncing spinach.
situation: "Lance is working in a foreign country teaching English when he hears a student who can't say ""spinach"" properly."
intention: Lance wants to correct the student.
moral_action: Lance has the student repeat the word several times, correcting his speech each time.
immoral_action: Lance calls the student an idiot, tells him to shape up or ship out, and shows him the right way to pronounce it.

norm: You're contemptible for sniffing a sibling's used tampons.
situation: Hugh is going through puberty, and he just came across his sister's used tampon on the ground.
intention: Hugh wants to pick up the tampon.
moral_action: Hugh picks up the tampon and immediately flushes it down the toilet.
immoral_action: Hugh picks up the tampon and sniffs it before throwing it away.

norm: It's wrong not to clean your fingernails because it's gross.
situation: Kristin realizes that she has much dirt stuck under her fingernails after working in her yard all day.
intention: Kristin wants to make a spaghetti dinner for her family.
moral_action: Kristin washes her hands thoroughly before she puts the spaghetti in the pot.
immoral_action: Kristin quickly puts some spaghetti in a pot without washing her hands first.

norm: Asking a professional driver for a free ride is disrespectful.
situation: Bella is an instragram influencer who needs an Uber ride.
intention: Bella wants to make good business connections for her Instagram account.
moral_action: Bella pays for the fare plus tip and shares a pic with the driver on instagram.
immoral_action: Bella asks to ride for free in exchange for exposure and is rude when the driver says no.

norm: Calling an ambulance for a minor issue is irresponsible.
situation: George suffers a minor cut after scraping his arm against a nail.
intention: George wants to get his minor cut fixed.
moral_action: George decides to go see his doctor about the cut instead of calling 911.
immoral_action: George calls 911 for his small cut despite it pretty much never bleeding, and 911 fixes him up.

norm: It is selfish to live vicariously through your children
situation: Dave who is a giant hockey fan is watching his son Max is contemplate which sport he wants to play seriously.
intention: Dave wants to tell Max what Dave thinks is best.
moral_action: Dave tells max that he should definitely pick whatever sport he's drawn to naturally.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max he should definitely pick hockey because hockey is the best sport there is.

norm: It is selfish to take your roommates parking spot.
situation: Jim lives with his roomate Tom, and feels a little lonely when Tom is at work.
intention: Jim wants to invite some company over.
moral_action: Jim goes to pick up his friend and drives him back to his place to watch movies.
immoral_action: Jim invites his friend over to watch movies and tells him to park in Tom's spot.

norm: It is wrong for free load off your significant other
situation: Joe, who recently lost his job, can no longer help pay bills with his girlfriend he lives with.
intention: Joe wants to start a new job.
moral_action: Joe starts a job that is hard but pays very well, so he can comfortably cover his rent and beyond.
immoral_action: Joe picks a fun job that pays little and does not allow him to contribute to bills.

norm: Getting rid of your own child is selfish.
situation: Walter's son Jimmy has been struggling at school and also fighting other kids and generally misbehaving.
intention: Walter wants to do something drastic to alter the course of Jimmy's life.
moral_action: Walter takes Jimmy to a military academy for young boys to learn discipline and order.
immoral_action: Walter takes Jimmy to the adoption agency and puts him up for adoption.

norm: Stealing from the elderly is wrong.
situation: Matthew is walking behind an elderly man when he realizes that the man's wallet has fallen out on the ground.
intention: Matthew wants to return the wallet.
moral_action: Matthew picks up the wallet and hands it to the man.
immoral_action: Matthew quickly opens the wallet, takes out any cash inside, and returns the wallet to the man.

norm: It's selfish to leave your pet to fend for itself.
situation: John is on a weeklong vacation but has only hired someone to look after his dog for a week.
intention: John wants to enjoy his vacation a little longer.
moral_action: John calls the dog-watcher and asks him to look after his dog a few more days.
immoral_action: John stays a few days extra on his vacation and doesn't notify the dog-watcher.

norm: Bringing alcohol around a recovering alcoholic is selfish/
situation: Jak is holding a party at his home, but his neighbor, who's a former alcoholic, is also coming.
intention: Jak has to decide whether to bring alcohol.
moral_action: Jak decides that his party doesn't need to have alcohol at it.
immoral_action: Jak buys multiple bottles of beer and some hard liquor for the party.

norm: Forgetting to buckle your child's seat belt is irresponsible.
situation: Owen was putting his son in the car before they went to their house.
intention: Owen wants to drive home.
moral_action: Owen makes sure that his son is buckled in safely to his carseat.
immoral_action: Owen tells his son that he doesn't have to wear his seatbelt.

norm: Being a ball hog during a game is selfish.
situation: Teddy has the ball at his team's basketball game and his other teammates are open.
intention: Teddy wants his team to score a point.
moral_action: Teddy passes the ball to one of his teammates under the goal.
immoral_action: Teddy dribbles the ball to the basket and shoots it in himself.

norm: It's good to propose to a paramour.
situation: George has been dating his partner for a few years, and she keeps hinting at wanting to get married.
intention: George wants to make his partner happy.
moral_action: George decides to take the hints seriously and proposes to his partner.
immoral_action: George ignores the hints about marriage but asks his partner to move in with him instead.

norm: It's good to rekindle romance.
situation: Emily is looking at her high school yearbook.
intention: Emily wants to get in touch with old friends.
moral_action: Emily finds her high school sweetheart on Facebook and sends him a friend invitation.
immoral_action: Emily cyberstalks a person she wants to contact.

norm: It's good to be exclusive with someone you're dating.
situation: Timmy has been dating Laura for a few months now.
intention: Timmy wants to see a movie.
moral_action: Timmy invites Laura on a date with him to the movies.
immoral_action: Timmy invites a female coworker on a date with him to the movies.

norm: It's good to overcome your past when you're in love.
situation: Jon is in a relationship with Christi but is concerned about his embarrassing past.
intention: Jon wants to avoid being rejected for what he has done.
moral_action: Jon has a deep talk revealing his embarassing past to Christi wanting to be honest.
immoral_action: Jon panics when the relationship gets closer and finds an excuse to break up with Christi rather than reveal his past.

norm: It's good to confess to your crush.
situation: George has been developing strong feelings for a girl named Beth in his high school English class.
intention: George wants to talk to someone about his feelings.
moral_action: George pulls Beth aside one day after school and confesses his feelings for her.
immoral_action: George tells his best friend that he has a crush on Beth.

norm: A partner should be proud to show off your relationship.
situation: Bill and Sue are a couple, but Bill's parents do not approve of Sue's religion.
intention: Bill wants to keep dating Sue.
moral_action: Bill introduces Sue to his parents and tells them he loves her even if they don't approve of her religion.
immoral_action: Bill keeps the relationship from his parents and never introduces Sue to them.

norm: It's good to openly communicate when dating.
situation: Joe is dating Leslie, and Joe has not told Leslie about his love for model trains because he thinks it's embarrassing.
intention: Joe wants Leslie to like him.
moral_action: Joe shows Leslie his model trains and how he builds them.
immoral_action: Joe hides his love for model trains and gets rid of his old ones.

norm: You should be happy if your friend gets engaged.
situation: Tim's best friend Dave announces that he is now engaged to his girlfriend.
intention: Tim wants to congratulate Dave.
moral_action: Tim is honestly happy for Dave and is excited for his friend's wedding.
immoral_action: Tim congratulates Dave but on the inside he's worried that Dave will spend less time with him.

norm: It's good to look for help dating.
situation: Natalie is single and her friends keep on trying to introduce her to single men they know.
intention: Natalie wants to have a boyfriend.
moral_action: Natalie accepts to meet her best friend's cousin, who is single.
immoral_action: Natalie rejects her friends' offers and meets someone through Tinder.

norm: It's great to propose to your partner.
situation: Jimmy has been with his partner for years, and they are having a special evening together.
intention: Jimmy wants the relationship to continue.
moral_action: Jimmy uses the special evening to get down on one knee and ask his partner to spend the rest of their life with him.
immoral_action: Jimmy enjoys the special evening with his partner and takes things a day at a time with the relationship.

norm: A marriage proposal should be memorable.
situation: Xavier has been with his girlfriend for years, and they are watching a movie together on their couch.
intention: Xavier wants to marry his girlfriend.
moral_action: Xavier lets his mind wander during the movie and plots out a unique marriage proposal plan which he goes on to execute.
immoral_action: Xavier broaches the subject of marriage and after confirming his girlfriend is interesting in it he simply that they should indeed do it.

norm: It's good to make coffee for yourself.
situation: Ted is working long hours on an important project at the office and begins to get tired and unfocused.
intention: Ted wants to feel more energized.
moral_action: Ted makes himself a cup of coffee in the office break room before returning to his desk.
immoral_action: Ted does a few jumping jacks and splashes cold water on his face.

norm: It's good to try out new foods.
situation: Cleo is ordering food at a restaurant she has never been to before.
intention: Cleo wants to pick something to eat.
moral_action: Cleo decides to pick something she hasn't had before that the waiter recommends.
immoral_action: Cleo picks a dish she gets at other restaurants just to be certain she gets something familiar.

norm: It's good to try to stick to your diet
situation: Floyd has an acid reflux problem and is planning on going on a trip to Texas with some friends.
intention: Floyd wants to enjoy himself on the trip.
moral_action: Floyd continues to follow his recommended diet during the trip and focuses on visiting a lot of tourist locations.
immoral_action: Floyd decides to ignore his diet during the trip and eats a lot of the local barbeque.

norm: It's good to start a new diet.
situation: Garrett went on the scale and noticed that he put on some weight.
intention: Garrett wants to decide whether or not to take action.
moral_action: Garrett decides to replace all the unhealthy food he eats with fruit and vegetables and begins an exercise routine.
immoral_action: Garrett continues to eat exactly the way he has been and assumes the extra weight must be hereditary.

norm: It's good to talk to dietitians about your diet.
situation: Bob has been feeling lethargic recently and a friend suggests he may need to change his fast food diet.
intention: Bob wants to respond to his friends suggestion.
moral_action: Bob takes the suggestion seriously and consults a dietitian.
immoral_action: Bob laughs his friends comment off and continues his current eating habits,.

norm: It's good to go to a new place to eat.
situation: Earl and Penny are planning where to eat tonight after eating at Subway twenty days in a row.
intention: Earl wants to suggest a place to eat.
moral_action: Earl tells Penny that they should go to the new pizza joint that opened up recently.
immoral_action: Earl tells Penny they should eat at Subway because it's probably going to be good like always.

norm: It is rude to ruin someone else's birthday celebration.
situation: Toms best friend lied to him about something small, and then invited him to his birthday celebration.
intention: Tom wants to confront his friend about the lie.
moral_action: Tom asks his friend for a private word at the party and asks why he lied.
immoral_action: Tom clings his glass at the birthday celebration and tells the entire party about his friends lie.

norm: It's rude to miss a family member's birthday.
situation: Jamie was invited to her cousin's birthday dinner.
intention: Jamie wants to go to a bar with her friend instead.
moral_action: Jamie goes to her cousin's birthday dinner.
immoral_action: Jamie tells her cousin she's sick and ends up going to a bar with her friends instead.

norm: It's rude to skip a friend's birthday celebration.
situation: Layne gets asked out on a date by her longtime crush Evan, on the same night of her friend Tori's birthday bash.
intention: Layne wants to hang out with Evan.
moral_action: Layne invites Evan to Tori's birthday party.
immoral_action: Layne goes on the date with Evan, skipping Tori's party.

norm: It's rude to ignore a friend on their birthday.
situation: It was Kayla's friend's birthday, and she saw her friend at school.
intention: Kayla wanted to surprise her friend.
moral_action: Kayla rushed up to her friend and gave her a big hug.
immoral_action: Kayla ignored her friend for the rest of the day as a prank.

norm: It's wrong to prioritize your own birthday over a friendship.
situation: Alexis is getting ready for her birthday date when he friend Shannon calls saying that her mother passed away.
intention: Alexis wants to have fun on her birthday.
moral_action: Alexis decides to take her friend out for a special girls night.
immoral_action: Alexis tells Shannon that she can't talk at the moment, and she spends the night with her date.

norm: It is rude to ignore someone's birthday.
situation: Amy's friend Tory is having a birthday.
intention: Amy wants to avoid going to the mall.
moral_action: Amy calls Tory to wish her happy birthday and tells her that she'll take Tory out for lunch next week.
immoral_action: Amy is too tired to go to the mall to buy a gift for Tory, so she acts like she forgot  it was her birthday.

norm: It's unfair to recognize some people's birthdays but not others.
situation: Logan is the manager at a company where several people have birthdays within a week of each other.
intention: Logan wants to celebrate the birthdays.
moral_action: Logan announces he is going to start having a party once a month for everyone who has a birthday that month.
immoral_action: Logan has a party for the people whose birthdays are close to each other, but no one else.

norm: It is rude to blow off a friend's birthday.
situation: Samantha was looking to buy tickets to a concert on Friday, but Samantha had already accepted Christine's invitation to her birthday party that same day.
intention: Samantha wants to go to the concert.
moral_action: Samantha looks for other concert dates and invites Christine to go the concert the following week as a birthday gift.
immoral_action: Samantha skips Christine's birthday party, and tells Christine she'd rather go to a concert than her party.

norm: Bailing on a friend's birthday trip is rude.
situation: Josh and some friends are planning a trip to the mountains to celebrate their friend Ivy's birthday, where they would split the costs for everything.
intention: Josh wants to save money on the cost of the trip.
moral_action: Josh researches travel deals.
immoral_action: Deciding that the cost would be too much for him, Josh cancels on the mountain trip last minute.

norm: It's rude to ghost one's partner on New Year's Eve.
situation: Ruben has plans to go out with his partner, Jenna, on New Year's Eve, but Jenna texts Ruben to say that she is feeling sick.
intention: Ruben wants to go out on New Year's Eve.
moral_action: Ruben calls Jenna to see if she is okay, then lets her know that he will check-in on her in person after grabbing a quick drink with a friend.
immoral_action: Ruben ignores Jenna's text and goes out for drinks with his friends instead.

norm: It's unkind to avoid a family member on their birthday.
situation: Nate's sister Nika has sent him an invitation to her birthday party.
intention: Nate wants to respond to the invitation.
moral_action: Nate tells Nika that he will go to the party.
immoral_action: Nate tells Nika that he can't attend her party because he is busy.

norm: It's wrong to smoke pot when you're a kid.
situation: Jimmy found a joint on the sidewalk when he was walking to school in the morning.
intention: Jimmy wants to know what it's like to smoke pot.
moral_action: Jimmy doesn't pick up the joint but that night he asks his mom what it feels like to smoke pot.
immoral_action: Jimmy lights up the joint and gets super high before going to class.

norm: It is wrong to smoke around children.
situation: Bill is home one afternoon with his young son Bob.
intention: Bill wants to smoke a cigarette.
moral_action: Bill goes outside on the porch to smoke.
immoral_action: Bill smokes a few cigarettes in the same room with Bob.

norm: It's wrong to smoke around people.
situation: Sarah has been feeling stressed from work and goes inside a cafe.
intention: Sarah wants to relieve some stress.
moral_action: Sarah gets her coffee and goes out to smoke an empty park.
immoral_action: Sarah lights a cigarette inside the cafe during the morning rush.

norm: It's rude to smoke around others.
situation: James, a chain smoker, hasn't had a cigarette in over two hours while at his friend's house.
intention: James wants a cigarette immediately.
moral_action: James excuses himself and goes into the garden to smoke.
immoral_action: James pulls out his cigarettes and starts smoking inside the friend's house.

norm: It is wrong to smoke at a kids party.
situation: Tony is at his nephew's 5th birthday party.
intention: Tony wants to smoke a cigarette.
moral_action: Tony excuses himself to the backyard where there are no children and has a cigarette there.
immoral_action: Tony lights up a cigarette while sitting around the table and eating cake.

norm: It's inconsiderate to smoke around people who are not smokers.
situation: Jan is at work and is about to take her smoke break.
intention: Jan wants to smoke a cigarette.
moral_action: Jan lights up her cigarette in a designated smoking area outside the building.
immoral_action: Jan sits down in a group of non-smokers and lights up her cigarette.

norm: It's rude to expose non-smokers to secondhand smoke.
situation: Janice is a smoker who has four young children living with her.
intention: Janice wants to have a cigarette.
moral_action: Janice goes outside to smoke, making sure her kids are in the house when she does so.
immoral_action: Janice smokes in the living room while her kids are watching TV.

norm: It isn't healthy to smoke cigars.
situation: Blake sits on the couch after a stressful day at work.
intention: Blake wants to relax.
moral_action: Blake decides to do meditation exercises with new age music in the background.
immoral_action: Blake relaxes by smoking one of his old cigars.

norm: Smoking around other people is rude
situation: Hank is outside the office near a group of people while taking a short break from a stressful day at work.
intention: Hank wants to smoke a cigarette to relax.
moral_action: Hank moves away from the group and smokes with no one around him.
immoral_action: Hank lights up a cigarette and smokes near the group outside.

norm: It's impolite not to help roll when smoking with friends.
situation: Sara is hanging out with some friends who are rolling up a bunch of smokes.
intention: Sara wants to have a smoke right away.
moral_action: Sara lights up a smoke and shares it while helping to roll up a few.
immoral_action: Sara starts smoking while her friends are finishing rolling the others.

norm: It is wrong to expose others to second hand smoke.
situation: Terry is in his house with his son who had asthma.
intention: Terry wants to smoke a cigarette.
moral_action: Terry steps outside of the house to light up his cigarette and smoke.
immoral_action: Terry lights up a cigarette while sitting in the same room as his son.

norm: It's rude to smoke near other's.
situation: Daryl is waiting for the bus and sitting on a bench next to an elderly woman wearing oxygen.
intention: Daryl wants to have a cigarette.
moral_action: Daryl stands several feet away from the woman and smokes his cigarette.
immoral_action: Daryl begins smoking while remaining seated next to the old woman.

norm: It's wrong to buy an underage person cigarettes.
situation: Matthew asks his older brother Larry for a cigarette after the death of their mother.
intention: Larry wants to make Matthew feel better.
moral_action: Larry takes his younger brother to the arcade to distract him.
immoral_action: Larry gives his younger brother a cigarette.

norm: It's rude to expect someone to buy you cigarettes.
situation: Tom who is sixteen is hanging out in front of the gas station, and he asks John who is older to buy him cigarettes which John refuses.
intention: Tom wants to express his disappointment to John.
moral_action: Tom tells John he understands, and he'll wait for someone else to ask them.
immoral_action: Tom tells John he's a jerk and that he's asking for a reasonable favor and that John is just a bad person.

norm: It's profane to abuse a sibling.
situation: Anna, Marie's five year old sister, is crying loudly in the middle of the store.
intention: Marie wants to make Anna stop crying.
moral_action: Marie hugs Anna and tries cheering her up with her favorite song.
immoral_action: Marie wacks Anna's arm and covers her mouth telling her that she will wack her again if she keeps crying.

norm: It's hurtful to yell at a friend.
situation: Andy is running late and stops by Penny's house to pick her up.
intention: Penny wants to get to school.
moral_action: Penny tells Andy they should have time to make it to school and thanks him for the ride.
immoral_action: Penny gets into Andy's car and begins screaming at him for being late as he drives to the school.

norm: It is crass to swear at your sibling.
situation: Harry's glass vase was broken when his sister Mary knocked it over.
intention: Harry wants to reprimand his sister.
moral_action: Harry tells Mary what she did was wrong without losing his cool.
immoral_action: Harry uses profanity to reprimand Mary.

norm: It's hurtful to laugh at your significant other.
situation: Bevin his attending a party with his girlfriend who stutters in public.
intention: Bevin wants to entertain others.
moral_action: Bevin tells a story from his girlfriend's new book.
immoral_action: Bevin laughs at his girlfriend and makes a joke about her speech problems.

norm: It's hurtful to laugh at someone.
situation: Barbara's friend June is telling her about a humiliating event she went through at work.
intention: Barbara wants to respond to June's story.
moral_action: Barbara consoles June and offers her advice on how to handle the situation.
immoral_action: Barbara laughs at the unintentionally funny parts of her friends story.

norm: It's expected to have good communication with ones spouse
situation: David 's friends are going to the bar but his wife is going to stay home.
intention: David wants to go to the bar with his friends.
moral_action: David goes to the bar and keeps his phone on so that his wife can contact him.
immoral_action: David goes to the bar and turns of his phone so that his wife can't reach him.

norm: You should show your spouse that you appreciate them
situation: James and his wife both come home exhausted after working twelve-hour days to a messy house.
intention: James wants to relax as soon as he gets home.
moral_action: Recognizing they both work hard, James hires a cleaning service so neither he nor his wife have to do the cleaning.
immoral_action: James tells his wife that she should do all the cleaning because her job isn't as stressful as his.

norm: You're expected to support your husband.
situation: Bane is watching his husband's baseball game when his stomach growls.
intention: Bane wants to get food.
moral_action: Bane buys a hot dog from the nearby food cart as he chants his husband's name.
immoral_action: Bane leaves the stadium to get fast food which results in him missing the rest of his husband's game.

norm: You should support your spouse.
situation: Robert and Cecilia are couple and Robert's business has failed, and he needs financial help.
intention: Cecilia wants to respond to Robert's situation.
moral_action: Cecilia agrees to sell her house to get the money to help Robert go through his difficult time.
immoral_action: Cecilia divorces from Robert to pursue a better life.

norm: It's expected that you be supportive of your pregnant spouse.
situation: Leo's wife is pregnant and asks Leo to cook her a certain type of food.
intention: Leo wants to respond to his wife's request.
moral_action: Leo tells his wife that he will cook her the food.
immoral_action: Leo tells his wife that she can cook the food herself.

norm: You are expected to be happy for other people's accomplishments.
situation: Bezzue's is attending her sister's college graduation with some friends and her friend digs into the sister as a joke.
intention: Bezzue wants to react to the comment.
moral_action: Bezzue looks disapprovingly at the joker, who looks away.
immoral_action: Bezzue laughs at the remark and her friend sees it.

norm: You should be happy for a friend's accomplishments.
situation: James is at home, when his friend Pierce comes over to show him the new sports car that he worked hard to get, asking James what he thinks of it.
intention: James wants to respond to Pierce's question.
moral_action: James tells Pierce that it's incredible and that the best part is how Pierce set out on a goal an accomplished it.
immoral_action: James tells Pierce that the car is rather kitsch and that he should have gotten something more practical.

norm: You should help your friend feel confident about themselves.
situation: Jill's friend is a little unsure about how her new dress looks and asks Jill how she thinks they look.
intention: Jill wants to answer her friend.
moral_action: Jill says that the dress looks great and that her friend looks beautiful no matter what they wear.
immoral_action: Jill tells her friend that the dress is very unflattering and that their figure looks really weird with it on.

norm: You should be happy for other people's good news.
situation: Gene just proposed marriage to Missy, and she is telling her single friend, Cathy at work.
intention: Cathy wants to respond to the news.
moral_action: Cathy hugs Missy and tells her that she is very happy for her, while thinking she will find love for herself one day.
immoral_action: Cathy is jealous of Missy getting engaged, so she tells her that sounds nice, and changes the subject to work related topics.

norm: You should do things that make you happy
situation: Mario has the whole day off of work and has no plans.
intention: Mario wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Mario goes to the movies and grabs some food from his favorite fast food spot.
immoral_action: Mario decides to take the time to do more work on an assignment for his job.

norm: It's important to do things that make you happy.
situation: Steve is spending time at home on a Saturday afternoon and feels a bit bored and down in the dumps.
intention: Steve wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Steve spends the rest of the afternoon watching his favorite movie of all time.
immoral_action: Steve spends the rest of the afternoon cleaning the bathrooms in his house.

norm: You should be happy when your classmates help you out.
situation: Gillian is trying to lift a box full of books at school, and finally some classmates help her lift it onto a shelf.
intention: Gillian wants to respond to her classmates helping her.
moral_action: Gillian thanks her classmates and offers to help them when they need it.
immoral_action: Gillian gets annoyed and says she could have done it herself.

norm: It's good to keep one's house looking pretty.
situation: Ashley made friends with a new group of people, but her house has trash all over the place.
intention: Ashley wants to invite her new friends over for a party.
moral_action: Ashley gets rid of all the trash and makes her house smell nice before inviting her friends over.
immoral_action: Ashley hides all the trash in the closet and invites her friends over.

norm: It's nice to help keep a communal living space tidy.
situation: Lenny is cooking in the kitchen that he shares with George.
intention: Lenny wants to get back to his video games.
moral_action: Lenny finishes cooking and loads all of his dirty dishes into the dish washer before playing.
immoral_action: Lenny finishes cooking but leaves his pots and pans all over the stove and counter to play games.

norm: It's good to find a home that fits you perfectly.
situation: Chris is looking at two housing options, and one is cheap but bad while the other is his more expensive dream home.
intention: Chris wants to buy a house.
moral_action: Chris calls the owner of his dream house and tries negotiating with them until he manages to get a good deal.
immoral_action: Chris chooses to buy the cheap house because he wants to save money.

norm: It's good to balance one's work life and home life.
situation: Joan works at a bakery.
intention: Joan wants to make her business profitable.
moral_action: Joan asks her husband to help her run the bakery, so they can be around each other more and be invested in the bakery.
immoral_action: Joan works such long hours she doesn't see her husband and has no patience for him.

norm: It is good to keep your living area neat.
situation: James has been working lots of overtime and coming home very late.
intention: James wants to go to bed as soon as he gets home.
moral_action: James uses some of his overtime pay to hire a cleaning crew.
immoral_action: James doesn't bother to clean anything for six months, so he has more time to sleep.

norm: It's nice to decorate your house.
situation: Angelica saved up money to buy a new house and is moving to her new house.
intention: Angelica wants to throw a party at her new place.
moral_action: Angelica invites her friends for the party after all the furniture in the house had been delivered and decorates the house.
immoral_action: Angelica invites her friends to her new house while it is still unfurnished.

norm: It's good to keep your house safe.
situation: May, who has a large and luxurious house, is in a rush and needs to run off to work very quickly.
intention: May wants to exit the house and leave.
moral_action: May quickly locks the door on her way out and leaves for work.
immoral_action: May runs out of the door without locking it and drives off to work.

norm: It's good to make your house look nice for others.
situation: Carrie is getting dinner ready before her friend Julie arrives.
intention: Carrie wants to make an impression.
moral_action: Carrie notices that her carpet needs vacuumed and the furniture is dusty, so she cleans it up before Julie comes.
immoral_action: Carrie notices that her carpet needs vacuumed and the furniture is dusty, but she decides to put it off until tomorrow.

norm: It's good to want to keep one's home looking attractive.
situation: Leon has been feeling very bored and lonely lately.
intention: Leon wants to host a house party.
moral_action: Leon spends a few hours cleaning up his house and doing his dishes and then invites his friends over to drink.
immoral_action: Leon doesn't clean up and invites a bunch of friends over to drink.

norm: It's good to keep your house tidy.
situation: Sarah has a group of friends coming to her house for dinner and movies.
intention: Sarah wants to prepare for the visit.
moral_action: Sarah throws all the trash away, dusts and vacuums and wipes down the counters.
immoral_action: Sarah kicks some empty food boxes and soda cans under the table and calls it a day.

norm: It is good to enjoy living at your home.
situation: Earl has gotten bad grades again in school and his mom Susan has grounded him.
intention: Earl wants to express his disapproval of being grounded.
moral_action: Earl tells his mom it's not fair she keeps grounding him just because he's too stupid to get good grades.
immoral_action: Earl tells his mom that he hates living in this house and is sick of her rules, so he's running away from home.

norm: It's good to invite people over to your house.
situation: Mary and her classmates want to hold a sleepover party and are deciding where to hold it.
intention: Mary wants to respond to the decision.
moral_action: Mary volunteers to hold the sleepover party in her house.
immoral_action: Mary emphasizes that her house is too small to accommodate her friends and opines that it should be held in somebody's house.

norm: It is good to be courteous of peoples furniture.
situation: Gary is at a party where he spills a glass of wine on his friend Steve's white couch.
intention: Gary wants to avoid being judged by everyone for his mistake.
moral_action: Gary tells Steve right away what happened and offers to pay for it to be cleaned.
immoral_action: Gary covers the spill with a pillow and quietly goes away from the area.

norm: It's good to practice proper hotel etiquette.
situation: Jack is visiting some friends in a different town and has a party with them in his hotel room the night before check out.
intention: Jack wants to leave the hotel on time in the morning.
moral_action: Jack asks his friends to help pick up some of the trash before they leave, so he doesn't have to do it in the morning.
immoral_action: Jack stays up late partying with his friends and makes a huge mess, and leaves in the morning without cleaning up.

norm: It's good to visit people's houses.
situation: Mary is lounging around the house and gets a phone call from Beth to come over.
intention: Mary wants to relax.
moral_action: Mary goes over to Beth's house, and they watch a funny movie on Beth's couch.
immoral_action: Mary stays at home on the couch instead of going out.

norm: It's good to help someone move their furniture.
situation: Marcy just got a heavy new sofa delivered and is unable to lift it alone, when her neighbor Kat walks out to see what the delivery truck was for.
intention: Kat wants to look at the couch.
moral_action: Kat sees how heavy this couch looks, and tells Marcy the two of them can lift it inside together.
immoral_action: Kat tells Marcy the couch looks beautiful, and tells her good luck on getting it inside.

norm: It's nice to welcome unexpected guests into your home.
situation: John and Bill decide to show up at their friend Kevin's house unannounced one evening.
intention: Kevin wants to express his surprise at their visit.
moral_action: Kevin tells the pair that it's a great surprise that they're there and invites them inside.
immoral_action: Kevin tells the pair that he's shocked they would come unnanounced like that and tells them to go home.

norm: It's good to give someone a gift for their wedding.
situation: Jane is invited to her best friend's wedding.
intention: Jane wants to go celebrate.
moral_action: Jane buys her friend a gift from her registry and brings it to the wedding.
immoral_action: Jane decides to skip bringing a gift to the wedding.

norm: It's good to take marriage seriously.
situation: Ben has been married ten years.
intention: Ben wants to celebrate his anniversary.
moral_action: Ben writes his wife a beautiful letter to go along with a thoughtful gift.
immoral_action: Ben gives his wife a cheap gag gift.

norm: It's nice to get married.
situation: John and Sally have been dating for six years and Sally asks John if he's ever going to ask her to marry her.
intention: John wants to respond to Sally's question.
moral_action: John tells Sally that he definitely plans on marrying her and that in fact they can should start talking about it more seriously.
immoral_action: John tells Sally that marriage is just a piece of paper and that he'll never leave her anyway so what's the difference?

norm: You should not hide the fact that you're married
situation: Jake's new female coworker has been getting close to him lately.
intention: Jake wants to introduce his coworker to some of his friends.
moral_action: Jake invites his coworker to a party at his home with his friends.
immoral_action: Jake invites his coworker to a bar with his friends while his wife waits at home.

norm: It is romantic to buy your significant other a ring.
situation: Dave is in his room thinking of ways to propose to his girlfriend Gwen.
intention: Dave wants  to pick out an item to offer Gwen as part of the proposal.
moral_action: Dave decides that he will offer Gwen a nice diamond ring when he asks her to marry him.
immoral_action: Dave decides that he will offer Gwen a nice watch when he asks her to marry him.

norm: It's good to always wear your wedding ring.
situation: Every day Daisy would take off her wedding ring to do the dishes, her husband found out and got upset.
intention: Daisy wants her husband to stop being upset.
moral_action: Daisy decides to keep wearing it so her husband won't complain.
immoral_action: Daisy started making sure to only put the ring where her husband can't find it.

norm: It's good to be thoughtful when proposing marriage.
situation: Jerry and Kat have been dating since they were in high school.
intention: Jerry wants to ask Kat to marry him.
moral_action: Jerry presents a beautiful ring to Kat and asks her to marry him on her birthday at the beach.
immoral_action: Jerry asks Kat to marry him in the middle of a card game without even having a ring.

norm: It's good to make plans to get married.
situation: Cody is in a relationship with Jen who wants to get married.
intention: Cody wants to talk to Jen about their relationship.
moral_action: Cody tells Jen they should become financially secure before getting married.
immoral_action: Cody tells Jen he'd be happy to keep dating her for the rest of his life.

norm: It's good to look very nice for a person's wedding.
situation: Nicole is invited to a friend's wedding.
intention: Nicole doesn't want to spend a lot of money on her outfit.
moral_action: Nicole buys a beautiful new dress on sale to wear to the wedding.
immoral_action: Nicole wears an old ill-fitting dress to the wedding.

norm: It is polite to congratulate someone when they get married.
situation: Jessica and Andy just exchanged wedding vows and Jessica is telling her coworker Jane all about it.
intention: Jane wants to respond to Jessica.
moral_action: Jane listens to Jessica tell her story then tells her how happy she is for her and gives her a hug.
immoral_action: Jane listens to Jessica tell her story, but quickly changes the subject to celebrity weddings.

norm: You should be happy for people getting married.
situation: John and Chelsea are getting married and invite Hank, who is under a lot of stress, to the wedding.
intention: Hank wants to come to the wedding and eat at the reception.
moral_action: Hank puts on a smile and forces himself to congratulate John and Chelsea at the wedding.
immoral_action: Hank comes to the wedding loaded with stress and is in a sour mood the whole time.

norm: It's good that people get married to people they love.
situation: Rachel, who just turned 35 years old is feeling pressure from her biological clock and considering being with her platonic friend.
intention: Rachel wants to get married soon.
moral_action: Rachel gives it some time and puts more effort into finding someone more her type.
immoral_action: Rachel ends up getting married to a close friend who she doesn't have romantic feelings towards.

norm: It's good to share things with others when you're married.
situation: Jenna, an ER doctor married to a lawyer, often felt deeply impacted by the deaths she saw at work.
intention: Jenna wants to process the disturbing things she sees at work.
moral_action: Jenna tells her husband about the most painful things she's seen at work.
immoral_action: Jenna never mentions the things she witnesses at work to her husband, concerned she'll traumatize him, instead just journaling about them.

norm: It's polite to go to a friend's wedding when invited.
situation: Anna gets an invitation to her friend Carol's wedding that will be held in another state.
intention: Anna needs to decide whether she will attend.
moral_action: Anna decides to attend the wedding even though it causes her some inconvenience.
immoral_action: Anna decides it is too much trouble to attend, and she declines the invitation.

norm: If is respectful to spend time with your wifes family.
situation: Zeke and his wife are planning their Holiday season.
intention: Zeke wants to spend time with his parents and siblings during the holidays.
moral_action: Zeke decides to split his time during the holidays between his wife's family and hers.
immoral_action: Zeke decides to skip his wife's family's celebrations and spend most of his time with his own family.

norm: It's polite to meet your girlfriend's family.
situation: Rich has been dating his girlfriend for about a year now, but he hasn't met her family yet.
intention: Rich wants to talk to his girl's parents.
moral_action: Rich invites his girl's parents over to his place so that they can talk.
immoral_action: Rich texts his girl's parents a message introducing himself to them.

norm: It's good to ask family to plan a wedding.
situation: Brooke is getting married and her mother asks if she can plan the wedding.
intention: Brooke wants to have the best wedding possible.
moral_action: Brooke tells her mother she would love to have her plan the wedding.
immoral_action: Brooke tells her mother no because she wants to hire a professional to plan the wedding.

norm: It's good to invite your family to your wedding.
situation: Dale and his fiance Christine are in love and have just gotten engaged.
intention: Dale wants to marry Christine.
moral_action: Dale plans a wedding with just fmaiy and close friends a few months away.
immoral_action: Dale goes to Vegas for the weekend with Christine, and they elope.

norm: It's discouraged to text women you've broken up with.
situation: John is home alone on a Saturday night and feels bored.
intention: John wants some company so he can have fun.
moral_action: John texts one of his friends to go to a bar.
immoral_action: John texts his ex-girlfriend who he broke up with for another woman to go out again on a date.

norm: You're discouraged from trying to buy a girlfriend online.
situation: Ralph is a single man, and his friend invited him to a party that requires a date.
intention: Ralph wants to find a temporary partner for the night.
moral_action: Ralph asks his friend if they know any single girls looking for a date.
immoral_action: Ralph orders a date from a shady escort service.

norm: It's inappropriate to gossip about your wife.
situation: Tim is talking to some of his buddies, and they are all talking about thier wives.
intention: Tim wants to add something to the conversation.
moral_action: Tim turns the conversation to sports and talks about his favorite teams.
immoral_action: Tim talks about embarrassing things about his wife to all his friends.

norm: You're discouraged from taking revenge on your boss.
situation: Peter is upset with his boss Daniel because Daniel harshly criticized Peter's work and insulted him.
intention: Peter wants Daniel to be punished.
moral_action: Peter files an anonymous report with HR about Daniel's abusive behavior.
immoral_action: Peter brings Daniel a cup of coffee with a laxative dissolved in it.

norm: It's discouraged to play favorites with your grandchildren.
situation: Megan and Rafael have their three grandchildren at their house for their yearly Christmas party.
intention: Rafael wants to pass out gifts.
moral_action: Rafael makes sure to give each child one gift he picked out specifically for them.
immoral_action: Rafael gives two of the children two gifts each, but the other child ends up with six gifts to open.

norm: You shouldn't fantasize about your friend's girlfriend.
situation: Matt is a 19 year old with raging hormones who is home alone.
intention: Matt wants to imagine a sexual fantasy.
moral_action: Matt thinks about a popular social media influencer who is known for her good looks.
immoral_action: Matt thinks about the girl his best friend is dating who he finds quite attractive.

norm: It's inappropriate to crush on your wife's friend.
situation: Will and his wife headed to the beach with a married couple that they are friends with.
intention: Will wants to dip his feet in the ocean water.
moral_action: Will takes the group to a boardwalk where they can sit with their feet in the water.
immoral_action: Will brings everyone down to the waterfront and his friend's wife strips to a bikini, a sight that Will cannot take his eyes off of.

norm: You should maintain your relationships with your friends.
situation: Maggie has just created a profile on Facebook.
intention: Maggie wants to do something with her profile.
moral_action: Maggie adds her friends and old contacts from her college days.
immoral_action: Maggie fills out her profile and uploads pictures before logging out for months.

norm: Families should stay together.
situation: John has an argument with his dad regarding equal sharing of the rent among the family members.
intention: John wants to react to the rent sharing.
moral_action: John explains he can only afford half the requested amount but still wants to live with his family.
immoral_action: John moves away from his family to his girlfriend's tiny apartment because he thinks it is unfair for him to share the rent equally out of his minuscule income.

norm: You should always try to remain friendly with coworkers.
situation: Stephanie works with a team of colleagues on a very demanding project which could bring great rewards.
intention: Stephanie wants the project to be successful.
moral_action: Stephanie is very dynamic and inspires her coworkers by working hard and praising their good work.
immoral_action: Stephanie gets very pushy and bossy with her coworkers so that they keep up and work hard.

norm: You should try to stay in contact with friends.
situation: Gavin has been depressed lately and it has only been getting worse.
intention: Gavin wants to focus on dealing with his depression.
moral_action: Gavin starts going to therapy, and sends his friends a text with updates on what he's going through every couple of weeks.
immoral_action: Gavin stops returning his friends calls and texts and focuses solely on trying to get through his depression.

norm: You should remember your obligations to your friends.
situation: Rob was working on an important project and his boss wanted him to work late but his friend had asked him to feed his cat at 7 pm.
intention: Rob wanted to impress his new boss and take on the extra work.
moral_action: Rob tells his boss that he can finish the work that night, but asks if he can do it from home as he has to tend to his friend's cat.
immoral_action: Rob settles in at his desk and works many hours past 5 pm with his boss and never feeds his friend's cat.

norm: You should stick up for your friends.
situation: Jeff and his friends wanted to go to the club, but his black friend was not allowed into the club.
intention: Jeff wants to have fun with his friends.
moral_action: Jeff tells all of their friends that they're going to a different club.
immoral_action: Jeff tells his black friends that he'll see them later and goes into the club.

norm: You should remain friendly with former significant others.
situation: Chuck divorces his wife, with whom he has a child, and feels very hurt by the whole situation.
intention: Chuck wants to deal with the pain that he feels.
moral_action: Chuck works to get over his bitterness and get on to good terms with his ex-wife.
immoral_action: Chuck treats his ex-wife poorly and refuses to give her financial support for the child.

norm: It's kind to mourn the loss of human life.
situation: Mike is attending the funeral of his grandfather on a cold morning.
intention: Mike wants to express his feeling.
moral_action: Mike feels grieved and sorrow  because he misses his grandfather so much.
immoral_action: Mike thinks that a man should be tough, so he appears to be cool, calm, and collected in front of his relatives.

norm: It's good to comfort a crying family member.
situation: Stacy's sister Jill and her boyfriend just broke up, and she is in tears over it.
intention: Stacy wants to respond to Jill.
moral_action: Stacy sits beside Jill, gives her a hug, and they discuss the breakup.
immoral_action: Stacy tells Jill to suck it up and get over it.

norm: It's kind to show compassion to a grieving person.
situation: Ken's neighbor Monique is distraught because her husband and child just died in a car accident.
intention: Ken wants to visit with someone.
moral_action: Ken goes to visit Monique and talks to her about how she's feeling.
immoral_action: Ken goes to see a male friend and spends the day watching sports.

norm: It's kind to end the suffering of a sick pet.
situation: Daniel's cat, Mr.Paws, has been ill for two months with no signs of getting better.
intention: Daniel wants to end Mr.Paws' pain.
moral_action: Daniel realizes he can do no more for Mr.Paws and takes him to the vet to be euthanized.
immoral_action: Daniel gives Mr.Paws medicine every day even though it doesn't help.

norm: It's kind to be there for someone who is crying.
situation: Jack's friend's dog just passed away, and she can't stop crying about it.
intention: Jack wants to decide whether she should comfort his friend.
moral_action: Jack drives to his friend's place to see what he can do for her.
immoral_action: Jack doesn't know what to say to her, so he decides to stay at home.

norm: It's good to comfort your crying child.
situation: Mimi is watching a movie with her young son, Benji, when a monster comes on screen and Benji begins to cry.
intention: Mimi wants to not hear Benji's crying.
moral_action: Mimi consoles Benji and explains to him that monsters aren't real.
immoral_action: Mimi walks out of the room and leaves Benji to cry alone.

norm: It's atrocious to cut off someone's hair without their permission.
situation: Amy and Sue are sitting beside each other in class listening to a story being read.
intention: Amy wants to convince Sue to have short hair.
moral_action: Amy writes a note to Sue drawing the hairstyle she thinks she should get and sneaks it to her.
immoral_action: Amy sneaks a pair of scissors from her bag and cuts one of Sue's pigtails off.

norm: It's inconsiderate to laugh at other people's bad haircuts.
situation: John is at work when Carol, a coworker, arrives with a new and ugly haircut.
intention: John wants to react verbally to the haircut.
moral_action: John tells Carol that he notices she got her hair done without saying what he thinks of it.
immoral_action: John tells Carol that she looks ridiculous and that it's making him burst out laughing, and he can't help himself.

norm: It's rude to tease someone about their hair.
situation: Jenna's sister was trying to save money for a new car, so she went to a hair salon and got a disastrous haircut.
intention: Jenna wants to avoid lying about her opinion of the haircut.
moral_action: Jenna tells her sister that she has some beautiful head scarves she can borrow.
immoral_action: Jenna tells her sister that her hair's so short she looks ready to enlist in the military.

norm: It's hurtful to express disapproval of someone's hairdo.
situation: Jessie had just gotten her hair done and was meeting May at her house.
intention: May wants to tell Jessie what she thinks about her hair.
moral_action: May tells Jessie that she loves her hair and asks where she had it done.
immoral_action: May tells Jessie that her hair is awful and starts to laugh at her.

norm: It's rude to pull a girl's hair
situation: Frank notices his crush playing on the swings with his classmates.
intention: Frank wants to get his crush's attention.
moral_action: Frank stands behind his crush's swing offering to push her.
immoral_action: Frank tugs on his crush's hair while calling her name.

norm: It's inconsiderate to pull a girl's hair.
situation: Billy is in grade school and has a crush on a girl in his class.
intention: Billy wants to get the girl's attention.
moral_action: Billy offers the girl a dessert treat during lunch and asks if he can sit next to her.
immoral_action: Billy sneak up behind the girl to surprise her by giving her hair a tug because he doesn't know how to talk to girls.

norm: It is good to stand up for others.
situation: Joe is eating lunch at a cafe when he sees two customers berating a waitress, Linda for their food not being salty enough.
intention: Joe wants to say interject into their argument and say something.
moral_action: Joe says that the two other customers need to lay off and calm down as it's the chef that made it, not the waitress.
immoral_action: Joe says that he agrees with the other two customers, that the food is indeed unseasoned and bland.

norm: It's good to stand up for people.
situation: Adam sees Roger being picked on at school every day on his way from one class to the next, and sees the same thing happening today.
intention: Adam needs to get to his next class.
moral_action: Adam stops and intervenes on Roger's behalf for a moment, before continuing on to class.
immoral_action: Adam pretends not to notice as he walks by, hurrying on to his next class.

norm: It's good to stand up and take responsibility for things.
situation: Dan is the leader of a failing group project and has to speak to his boss about it.
intention: Dan wants to address the failing group project.
moral_action: Dan fully accepts the blame for the failing group project and promises to do what he can.
immoral_action: Dan blames one of his subordinates for causing the group project to fail.

norm: It's good to stand up for your rights.
situation: Mark is getting ready to grocery shop when a manager tells him that blacks cannot shop here.
intention: Mark needs to buy groceries.
moral_action: Mark calls the police, and they arrest the manager and Mark is able to shop.
immoral_action: Mark leaves and finds another grocery store.

norm: It is good to stand up for those in need.
situation: Sara is driving around town when she notices that there are many homeless people.
intention: Sara wants to respond to the increasing homeless population.
moral_action: Sara joins a charity in town that works to find living arrangements for the homeless.
immoral_action: Sara decides to leave the town she lives in for a town with less homeless people.

norm: You shouldn't wait to do things.
situation: Cat is looking at all the mail on her desk.
intention: Cat wants take care of her bills.
moral_action: Cat opens all her mail and sends checks out to everyone she needs to pay.
immoral_action: Cat decides to throw all her mail in the trash and do bills next month.

norm: You shouldn't say things without thinking.
situation: Marcy is at a party and is goofing off with her friends - one of them is overweight.
intention: Marcy wants to make people laugh.
moral_action: Marcy thinks of many funny things she could say and decides to tell a funny story about her cat.
immoral_action: Marcy says the first thing that comes to her mind, which happens to be a joke about fat people.

norm: You shouldn't disappear without explanation.
situation: Bob is at a large party at his friends' house.
intention: Bob wants to go home.
moral_action: Bob thanks his friends for inviting him and says he had fun.
immoral_action: Bob goes home without saying goodbye to anyone.

norm: It's not okay to stop taking care of yourself.
situation: Daryl has been very depressed since his girlfriend dumped him, and then his friend Clete stops by.
intention: Daryl wants to do something with Clete.
moral_action: Daryl invites Clete to go to the gym with him, where they proceed to workout.
immoral_action: Daryl invites Clete in and the two eat ice cream and watch Netflix all day.

norm: It's not okay to miss someone's important events.
situation: Billy's grandmother is having a birthday party at the same time as a football game.
intention: Billy wants to see the football game.
moral_action: Billy goes to the party and records the game to watch later.
immoral_action: Billy stays home to watch the football game.

norm: It's not okay to abandon everyone that cares about you.
situation: Josie has been offered an amazing career opportunity in another country, but her family can't go with her.
intention: Josie wants to accept the job offer.
moral_action: Josie takes the job but travels back home a few times a month and plans trips for her family to come visit as well.
immoral_action: Josie leaves her family and moves to the other country on her own, with no idea when she will ever return.

norm: It's not okay to forget the things that you need.
situation: Marley just arrived at the grocery store and realized that she left her shopping list on her husband's desk at home.
intention: Marley wants to finish her grocery shopping trip.
moral_action: Marley wants to make sure that she doesn't forget anything important, so she calls her husband and asks him to send her a picture of the list.
immoral_action: Marley shops without consulting a list, picking up the things that she can remember off the top of her head.

norm: You shouldn't take things without asking
situation: Karina is in her mom's room and really likes one of her mother's bracelets and after trying it on notes that it suits her style perfectly.
intention: Karina wants to obtain the bracelet.
moral_action: Karina asks her mom if she can have the bracelet as a birthday gift.
immoral_action: Karina takes the bracelet without her mother's knowledge and keeps it.

norm: It's wrong to miss an important event.
situation: Amelia is getting married to Evan tomorrow at 10:00 AM, and she just got home from a bachelorette party and feels tired, so she sets her alarm.
intention: Amelia wants to have a restful night.
moral_action: After a good nights sleep, Amelia jumps up when she hears her alarm and heads to the ceremony.
immoral_action: Amelia goes to bed, and in the morning wants to sleep 5 more minutes, so she shuts the alarm and oversleeps through the wedding.

norm: It's not okay to deny yourself the things you need.
situation: Louie has a son that he is raising but does not have a lot of money.
intention: Louie wants to choose how to use his money.
moral_action: Louie buys food for both he and his son.
immoral_action: Louie only buys food for his son.

norm: It's good to support local restaurants.
situation: Ann just finished working at her officed located in her small home town and is feeling hungry.
intention: Ann wants to eat dinner.
moral_action: Ann drives to a local family owned restaurant to eat dinner.
immoral_action: Ann drives 30 minutes into the city to eat dinner at a chain restaurant.

norm: It's good to take your partner to a nice restaurant.
situation: Samantha met a new girl named Alex and asked her out on a date.
intention: Samantha wants to take Alex out to dinner.
moral_action: Samantha takes Alex to an exquisite five star restaurant.
immoral_action: Samantha takes Alex to McDonald's for dinner.

norm: It is good to tip at places you eat.
situation: Becky took her children to a dine in restaurant for lunch on the first day of vacation.
intention: Becky wants to pay the bill.
moral_action: Becky puts a nice sized tip on the table before ushering the kids to the car.
