intention: Ralph wants let his daughter play in the water.
moral_action: Ralph puts water wings on his daughter and goes into the lake with her.
immoral_action: Ralph sits by his cousins on a lawn chair and tells his daughter to go swimming with the other kids.

norm: Parents and children should be loyal to one another.
situation: Yolanda is at a summer camp with her parents and a canoe race is about to begin.
intention: Yolanda wants to join a team to compete in the race.
moral_action: Yolanda joins her parents' team and helps them win the race.
immoral_action: Instead of joining her parents' team, Yolanda decides to join her friend's family's team in the race.

norm: It important to stay alive for your children.
situation: Gale is an ill parent with cancer, and she's in great pain.
intention: Gale wants her pain to go away.
moral_action: Gale asks the doctor to be put on stronger pain medications.
immoral_action: Gale gets into a car wreck without wearing a seat belt killing herself.

norm: It's responsible to keep children safe.
situation: Kent was watching his kids playing in the backyard of his house and looking for saftey measures.
intention: Kent wants to add security to his back yard.
moral_action: Kent installs cameras around his yard to look for intruders.
immoral_action: Kent installs an electric fence around his yard to keep intruders out.

norm: It is important to make children feel safe.
situation: Helen is still working on her project which needs to be finished before end of the day, but she needs to pick up her daughter Kitty from school.
intention: Helen wants to finish her project on time.
moral_action: Helen asks her husband to pick up Kitty instead.
immoral_action: Helen decides to let Kitty wait at school so that she can finish her project before leaving the office.

norm: It is important to give your children privacy.
situation: Marlene has a teen daughter named Jessie who doesn't talk to her much.
intention: Marlene wants to know what is going on in her daughter's life.
moral_action: Marlene starts a conversation with Jessie over dinner.
immoral_action: Marlene sneaks into Jessie's room and reads her diary.

norm: It's good to give work as hard as you can.
situation: Greg works on Amazon's Mechanical Turk on the side to help his retirement account.
intention: Greg wants to save money.
moral_action: Greg works for four hours a day, six days a week, and earns $300 a week to put into his retirement account.
immoral_action: Greg works for an hour a day, two days a week, and earns around $40 a week to put into his retirement account.

norm: It's good to offer to help someone moving heavy boxes.
situation: Jon's friend called him to help him move heavy boxes to his new apartment.
intention: Jon wants to order a pizza.
moral_action: Jon says he will help his friend if they can get pizza to eat after.
immoral_action: Jon tells his friend he is too busy and goes out to eat pizza.

norm: It's good to help people carry heavy things
situation: Carter is walking down the street when he sees a man carrying a heavy box into a building.
intention: Carter wants to help the man.
moral_action: Carter grabs the other side of the box and helps him move it into the building.
immoral_action: Carter pushes the man forward to help him make the delivery faster.

norm: It's good to be a hard worker.
situation: Josh just got a job at a local business and showed up for his first day of work.
intention: Josh wants to make an impression on his boss.
moral_action: Josh does his best to complete his tasks quickly and efficiently.
immoral_action: Josh works at a leisurely pace throughout the day, taking frequent breaks and checking his phone constantly.

norm: Working hard is a good way to spend time.
situation: Tim has just learned that he has an extended weekend two extra days off.
intention: Tim wants to find something to do with the extra time.
moral_action: Tim spends the extended weekend working on a side project.
immoral_action: Tim decides to spend his days off playing video games.

norm: It's good to work hard.
situation: Petr just graduated from college and has started his first job in a field that matches his degree.
intention: Petr wants to make good use of his college degree.
moral_action: Petr knows his degree got his foot in the door but being a good employee will get him further still.
immoral_action: Petr takes for granted that his degree will open doors for him at his new job and doesn't push himself in his role.

norm: It is good to work together to accomplish something hard.
situation: Sharon is building a house.
intention: She wants to begin roofing.
moral_action: Sharon calls her friends and schedules a day where she can have the most help.
immoral_action: Sharon asks friends for help but no one is available for a few days, she impatiently decides to work on the roof herself.

norm: It's nice to put in hard work.
situation: Ted has moved into a new house which has a large backyard.
intention: Ted wants to do something with his backyard.
moral_action: Ted digs out the yard and puts in many plants and grass.
immoral_action: Ted does a simple scattering of small stones over his yard.

norm: It's bad to wait until the last minute to leave.
situation: John is at home getting ready for a job interview.
intention: John wants to get a job.
moral_action: John leaves an hour early for the job interview and gets there in time despite traffic.
immoral_action: John does not leave his house until 15 minutes before the interview because it is only a 10-minute drive away.

norm: It's bad to procrastinate on assignments until the last minute.
situation: Julia has a paper due the same week as a major upcoming party she's planning.
intention: Julia wants to enjoy the party without worrying about the paper.
moral_action: Julia works hard on her paper early on, so she can spend the rest of her week planning her fun party.
immoral_action: Julia decides not to do her paper, so she can prepare for her party.

norm: It's bad to cancel plans last minute.
situation: Jim is supposed to pick up Matt on his way to a concert that they're both going to.
intention: Jim needs to grab some food on the way to the show.
moral_action: Jim decides to get snacks at the venue, and him and Matt go to the concert together.
immoral_action: Jim decides to hit up a convenience store on the way to the show and skips picking up Matt to save time.

norm: It is negligent to arrive almost 45 minutes late.
situation: Sam has a dentist appointment scheduled for 9 AM today.
intention: Sam wants to go to his dentist appointment to have his teeth cleaned.
moral_action: Sam arrives right on time for his dental appointment.
immoral_action: Sam arrives 45 minutes late for his dental appointment.

norm: It's wrong to put things off until the last minute.
situation: Tim had a big exam next week that will determine if he will pass the class.
intention: Tim wants to study for the exam.
moral_action: Tim does plenty of studying the week before the exam in order to be ready.
immoral_action: Tim only studies for the exam an hour before the class starts.

norm: It's bad to flake out at the last moment.
situation: Cody has a birthday party he RSVP'd for, but a concert by a band he loves is on the same day.
intention: Cody wants to go to the concert.
moral_action: Cody informs the birthday hosts before hand that he cannot make it and apologizes.
immoral_action: Cody tells the birthday hosts he cannot come the day of the party.

norm: It's bad form to change plans at the last minute.
situation: Harry is on the phone with Phil who wants to know if he's ready to go to their planned night out.
intention: Harry wants to answer Phil's question.
moral_action: Harry tells Phil that he is indeed ready to go, and he can come pick him up.
immoral_action: Harry tells Phil that he actually doesn't really feel like going anymore, and he's going to stay in.

norm: It's bad to cancel on friends at the last minute.
situation: Kenny has been invited to go on vacation with a friend in a few days but just found out he has an important meeting he must attend instead.
intention: Kenny wants to let his friend know he cannot make it.
moral_action: Kenny immediately tells his friend about the meeting to give his friend as much notice as he had.
immoral_action: Kenny spends the next few days planning for the meeting before letting his friend know about it on the day it is happening.

norm: It is inconsiderate cancel a reservation at the last minute.
situation: Darryl made a reservation at a restaurant, with an elaborate plan in place to propose to his girlfriend, but he and his girlfriend are now in a fight.
intention: Darryl has to decide whether to cancel the reservation or not.
moral_action: Darryl called the restaurant as soon as he suspected that he may not be able to execute his plan, and that the reservation may not be necessary.
immoral_action: Darryl waits, but it doesn't work out, so he cancels the reservation and the plan on the day he was supposed to carry it out.

norm: It's bad to quit last minute and leave people hanging.
situation: George promised to help pull Fred's truck out of the ditch today, but then he won baseball tickets.
intention: George wants to go to the baseball game.
moral_action: "George tells Fred, ""How about we pull your truck out a few hours sooner, and we both go to the game?""."
immoral_action: George goes to the baseball game instead, leaving Fred literally ditched.

norm: It's bad to chicken out at the last minute.
situation: Amanda is supposed to go to her doctor's appointment to get the results of a test.
intention: Amanda wants to decide if she will enter the building.
moral_action: Amanda heads right in to see her doctor and find out the results.
immoral_action: Amanda runs away at the last minute because she's afraid of the possible news.

norm: It is rude to argue with someone about their religion.
situation: Jeff's new roommate is a Muslim and when the roommate gets up very early to pray, he wakes up Jeff.
intention: Jeff wants to sleep later in the mornings.
moral_action: Jeff sits down with his roommate and asks him if can do his morning prayer in the living room, far from the bedrooms.
immoral_action: Jeff yells at his roommate when he gets home, saying his stupid chants for his stupid religion are waking him up every morning.

norm: It is rude to use your phone in church.
situation: Jay is attending mass.
intention: Jay wants to talk with his friend.
moral_action: Jay leaves the church service and goes to his friend's house.
immoral_action: Jay takes out his cell phone and calls his friend.

norm: It's rude to push your religious beliefs on others.
situation: John, who is a passionate atheist, is at dinner with a large group of his friends.
intention: John wants to make conversation.
moral_action: John has an open discussion with his friends about the meaning of faith and it's purpose in people's lives.
immoral_action: John goes on and on about how religious people are nutjobs and atheists are much smarter than them.

norm: It's bad to mock religious figures.
situation: Nicky is in Rome at the Vatican when he sees a procession of cardinals walk past in their red hats and robes.
intention: Nicky wants to react to the cardinal's outfits.
moral_action: Nicky laughs and says that the cardinals look amazing and that he's awed by the bright red outfits.
immoral_action: Nicky points at the cardinals and laughs yelling about how they look ridiculous with their ancient outfits.

norm: It is bad to be disruptive during church.
situation: John is attending church with his family when his phone starts to vibrate.
intention: John wants to respond to the call.
moral_action: John declines the call and texts the caller that he will call back after the service.
immoral_action: John answers the call and holds a hushed conversation with the caller.

norm: Is inconsiderate to disturb other churchgoers
situation: Sally is at church, but she is expecting an important business call.
intention: Sally wants to make sure she doesn't miss the call.
moral_action: Sally puts her phone on vibrate only and keeps it on her lap, so she can feel it.
immoral_action: Sally keeps her ringtone on, so she can hear the call.

norm: It's bad to be prejudiced against a religious group.
situation: Francis is a self professed atheist and has just found out a classmate is Mormon during a class discussion about religion.
intention: Francis wants to explain that he is a Atheist.
moral_action: Francis explains why he is an atheist to his Mormon classmate while emphasizing how it is great that people are all different.
immoral_action: Francis makes broad brush stroke comments about Mormon's while explaining how he thinks atheism is superior to it in every way.

norm: It is rude to disrupt a religious ceremony.
situation: Nina's friend, Robin, is attending evening church services with her family when Nina gets some exciting news.
intention: Nina wants to speak with Robin.
moral_action: Nina stands outside the church and waits for Robin to come out after the service.
immoral_action: In her excitement Nina runs into the church and walks through the room looking for Robin.

norm: You should share with your friends.
situation: Harry was at the bar with his friends when he realized he was hungry and decided to order a large appetizer.
intention: Harry wants to eat.
moral_action: When the waiter delivers the appetizer, Harry leaves it in the center of the table and encourages his friends to have some.
immoral_action: When the waiter delivers the appetizer, Harry pulls it toward himself and eats it all without offering his friends any.

norm: You should try to help your friends whenever you can.
situation: Sally is leaving work a bit early to do some shopping on her way home when she sees her friend is having trouble getting his work finished.
intention: Sally wants to get some essentials she needs for her home.
moral_action: Sally offers to help her friend as she can order her groceries online and pick them up a bit later.
immoral_action: Sally walks past her friend and figures he will find a way to get his work done.

norm: You should try to be supportive of your friends.
situation: Ken's friend wants to be an actor even though he is terrible at acting.
intention: Ken wants what is best for his friend.
moral_action: Ken encourages his friend to go to a theater class and helps him run lines.
immoral_action: Ken insult's his friend's acting and tells him to give up on his unrealistic dreams.

norm: People should be supportive of their friends.
situation: Jamie is having brunch with her best friend who is upset.
intention: Jamie wants to go to the beach later with a group of friends.
moral_action: Jamie takes her friend to the beach with her.
immoral_action: Jamie sees her friend needs some cheering up but head to the beach without her.

norm: You should include your friends.
situation: Julie is organizing a birthday party for herself, and she has had a clash with her friend Jane recently.
intention: Julie wants to invite her friends to the party.
moral_action: Julie sends a message to Jane to apologize for the clash and asks Jane if she will join her birthday party.
immoral_action: Julie decides not to invite Jane to her birthday.

norm: You should share things with your partner.
situation: Mark is eating in the cafeteria and his friend forgot his lunch and is upset.
intention: Mark wants to help his friend eat lunch.
moral_action: Mark decides to share his food with his friend, by splitting his meal.
immoral_action: Mark asks other if they have food they can give his friend to eat.

norm: Friends should include each other.
situation: John and his friend Ted find out about a new action movie coming out that they both think looks exciting.
intention: John wants to go see the movie.
moral_action: John invites Ted to go see the movie together the following Saturday.
immoral_action: John goes to see the movie by himself the following Saturday.

norm: You should be supportive of your friends.
situation: Dali is invited to her best friend's basketball game, but she promised her boss she would do something after work.
intention: Dali wants to please her boss.
moral_action: Dali enlists her other coworkers, and they complete the task with enough time for Dali to see the game.
immoral_action: Dali completes the task for her boss.

norm: You are expected to help out friends in need
situation: Sarah is watching TV when she gets a text from her friend Keisha asking to come pick her up as she's run out of gas on the highway.
intention: Sarah wants to respond to Keisha's request for help.
moral_action: Sarah texts Keisha to stay put and drives to her with a gas canister of fuel.
immoral_action: Sarah texts Keisha back and tells her to walk to the nearest gas station to buy some fuel.

norm: You should help your friends.
situation: Mary's friend John is moving to a new house and has asked for help.
intention: Mary wants to go to a party on John's moving date.
moral_action: Mary offers to come over and help John pack prior to the move so that she can attend the party later.
immoral_action: Mary goes to the party and ignores John's calls during the week of the move.

norm: You should take an interest in your friends.
situation: Rachel receives an email from an old friend, about her recent marriage and the fact that they are expecting their first child.
intention: Rachel has to decide whether to respond to her old friend or not.
moral_action: Rachel responds with a congratulatory email and asks her old friend if there is anything she could do to help her prepare for the baby.
immoral_action: Rachel decides that she doesn't have time to rekindle an old friendship and deletes the message, without responding.

norm: You should confide in your friends.
situation: Hina is going through a rough patch with her partner and her friend asks her how the couple is doing.
intention: Hina wants to talk about her relationship issues.
moral_action: Hina tells her friend what is going on and asks for advice.
immoral_action: Hina says everything is going well and talks with her family about the issues later.

norm: You should be willing to help your friends.
situation: Sam is hanging out with his friend at his house after school and his friend has explained he doesn't understand a lesson from school.
intention: Sam wants to do something with his friend.
moral_action: Sam offers to explain the lesson to his friend in a way that he will possibly understand.
immoral_action: Sam doesn't want to do schoolwork with his friend, so he suggest they play video games and forget schoolwork.

norm: Friends should be understanding.
situation: Todd is talking with his friend Ben right after Ben experiences a crushing defeat in a tournament that he tried very hard to win.
intention: Todd wants to talk about the tournament.
moral_action: Todd consoles Ben about the tournament loss and tells Ben that he did a great job in a tough tournament.
immoral_action: Todd laughs at Ben's major tournament loss and makes fun of him.

norm: Friends should make time for each other.
situation: Ed's friend is having a difficult time and asks Ed if they can meet so that Ed can give them some advise.
intention: Ed wants to respond to his friend's request to meet.
moral_action: Ed says that although he's really busy he'll adjust his schedule and meet with his friend.
immoral_action: Ed says that he's just to busy to meet with his friend because he has a lot of work to do.

norm: One should support their friends when they have an issues.
situation: Larissa's friend Megan calls her crying because she was just dumped, but Larissa is busy with an important project at work.
intention: Larissa wants to respond to Megan's call.
moral_action: Larissa answers the call and tells Megan that she is too busy with work to talk, but that she can come over later that night with wine and snacks.
immoral_action: Larissa ignores Megan's call and texts her to say that she is too busy to talk, and that Megan shouldn't bother her at work.

norm: You should try to help your friends.
situation: Dan's friend says they really need Dan's help to study for their English exam.
intention: Dan wants to respond to his friend.
moral_action: Dan says he'll try to help his friend study for the test as best as he can.
immoral_action: Dan says he won't help his friend with their exam because they're probably not going to pass the class regardless.

norm: You should give friends space when they need it.
situation: Adrian's friend Steve is going through a rough time in his relationship with his girlfriend and looks gloomy and depressed.
intention: Adrian wants Steve to feel better.
moral_action: Adrian asks Steve how he's doing and offers to chat if he wants to, then leaves him alone.
immoral_action: Adrian sits with Steve and asks him what is wrong, continuing to ask him when he evades Adrian's questions.

norm: You should support your friends in their pursuits.
situation: Jamie's friend Faye has taken up painting and shows her a painting she has worked on that looks pretty bad.
intention: Jamie wants to give feedback on the painting.
moral_action: Jamie says that she likes Faye's effort and feels she can improve the painting with practice.
immoral_action: Jamie says based on what she sees, Faye should give up painting.

norm: It is ambitious to look for a good job.
situation: Sam has recently graduated from college with a degree in engineering and needs to find a way to make rent.
intention: Sam wants to find a job that he enjoys.
moral_action: Sam decides to pursue engineering jobs that pay well.
immoral_action: Sam thinks it would be fun to work at his favorite fast-food joint, so he can get free food.

norm: Education is an important part of life.
situation: Robert graduates high school and is trying to decide what to do next in life.
intention: Robert wants to decide on his future.
moral_action: Robert chooses to become a mechanical engineer and goes to college.
immoral_action: Robert chooses to become a car mechanic and goes straight to work.

norm: It is important to interact with your co-workers.
situation: Ron is working on a large project with his co-workers, and the team is having a meeting.
intention: Ron wants to go to the meeting.
moral_action: Ron goes to the meeting and tries to help come up with some solutions to problems.
immoral_action: Ron goes to the meeting and stares off into space, thinking his own thoughts.

norm: It's important to respect your boss.
situation: Sam's boss Darcy tells him that he unfortunately has to work overtime to help finish some files this weekend.
intention: Sam wants to respond to Darcy's order to come in on the weekend.
moral_action: Sam tells Darcy that he doesn't love the idea, but he's always there if his team needs him, so he'll be there.
immoral_action: Sam tells Darcy that he's not a slave nor does he take orders from idiots and tells him he won't be coming.

norm: It's advisable to hire a professional for important jobs.
situation: Rob needs to do some home repairs for safety and has been quoted too high of a price.
intention: Rob wants to save money on the repairs.
moral_action: Rob finds a coupon code for a licensed professional whom he hires.
immoral_action: Rob hires an unlicensed laborer to perform the repairs for much less.

norm: Communication is important in a relationship.
situation: Ned and Kati have been fighting a lot lately, and Ned is worried about the relationship.
intention: Ned wants to figure out what's going on.
moral_action: Ned asks Kati what's been happening, why they can't seem to be happy anymore.
immoral_action: Ned screams at Kati one day asking her what's wrong with her.

norm: It is important to get along with your coworkers.
situation: Paul is part of a tight-knit team at work that has just added a new member, Brenda, whose personality and interests are very different from the rest of the team.
intention: Paul wants to maintain a good working environment.
moral_action: Paul gets to know Brenda better and finds ways to include her with the rest of the group.
immoral_action: Paul begins excluding Brenda from social settings because she doesn't fit in with the group and makes things awkward.

norm: It's important to maintain professional relationships at work
situation: William is upset about missing out on a promotion.
intention: He wants to share his feelings with a superior.
moral_action: William collects himself and arranges a meeting to discuss the issue with his boss.
immoral_action: William goes to his bosses office in a rage and starts yelling angrily about not being promoted.

norm: It's important to stand up for what you believe in.
situation: Marry is browsing Twitter when she spots an anti mask tweet from Todd.
intention: Marry wants to reply to the tweet.
moral_action: Marry drops links to articles by scientists talking about the benefits of wearing masks.
immoral_action: Marry insults the poster's intelligence.

norm: It's important to ask for things you need
situation: Harry's electric bill is due in a week, but he doesn't have enough money to cover it.
intention: Harry wants to seek assistance with paying his bill on time.
moral_action: Harry rings up his parents and asks if he can borrow money to pay his electric bill.
immoral_action: Harry takes money from his parents bank accounts without consulting them about it to pay his electric bill.

norm: It's important to get good grades.
situation: Timothy is a college student on an academic scholarship that has strict requirements regarding GPA.
intention: Timothy doesn't want to pay his own college tuition.
moral_action: Timothy studies hard and  maintains the minimum GPA required for the scholarship.
immoral_action: Timothy asks his father to pay his tuition after failing one of his classes and losing the scholarship.

norm: It's important to develop your talents.
situation: Johnny is the best Junior high football quarterback that his town has ever seen.
intention: Johnny wants to be a star quarterback in high school.
moral_action: Johnny practices hard every day all year round.
immoral_action: Johnny says that he never needs to practice because he knows that is he the most talented quarterback in his school.

norm: It is important to maintain a good credit score.
situation: Robert sees that his girlfriend's birthday is coming up, but he is nearly broke and can't afford the expensive necklace she wants.
intention: Robert wants to buy his girlfriend a necklace for her birthday.
moral_action: Robert takes extra shifts at work in order to earn the extra money he needs to buy the necklace for his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Robert maxes out his credit card to buy the expensive necklace his girlfriend wants.

norm: It is important to follow established rules.
situation: Jim and his partner Blake are building a house when Blake suggests they cut a corner on something that would violate the building code.
intention: Jim wants to respond to the suggestion.
moral_action: Jim insists that they follow the established rules even though it may take a little more time and money.
immoral_action: Jim agrees that they should take the rule-breaking measure in order to cut down on their costs.

norm: It's important to keep learning
situation: Martin was getting confused on the new machines at his workplace.
intention: Martin wants to work on the machines.
moral_action: Martin takes classes to learn how to use the machine properly.
immoral_action: Martin continues working on the machines even though he is unfamiliar with them.

norm: It is important to make reasonable goals for yourself.
situation: Kayla is a high school student who is currently on summer vacation.
intention: Kayla wants to spend time relaxing and recharging over her break.
moral_action: Kayla aims to read a certain number of books over the summer and rewards each met goal with video game time.
immoral_action: Kayla spends her summer doing nothing but napping and playing video games.

norm: It is important to find something you are good at.
situation: Sam runs low on money and can't buy groceries for the week.
intention: Sam wants to find a job.
moral_action: Sam looks hard for a job where he will build some new skills and become good at something he might enjoy doing.
immoral_action: Sam goes out looking for work and takes the first job he finds, working in a hot, underpaid restaurant.

norm: It is important to respect diversity.
situation: Nick works in HR for a software company and has qualified job candidates from many different ethnicities who want work.
intention: Nick wants to select someone to hire.
moral_action: Nick chooses someone from a minority background to hire.
immoral_action: Nick prioritizes white people and picks a white person to hire.

norm: It's important to accommodate the needs of everyone.
situation: Bob is an architect and is designing a building when his manager Rick asks him where he intends to put the wheelchair ramps.
intention: Bob wants to respond to Rick's question.
moral_action: Bob tells Rick that the wheelchair ramps will fan out in both directions from each entrance symmetrically.
immoral_action: Bob tells Rick that he won't put in any wheelchair ramps since they're ugly and will ruin his beautiful design.

norm: It's important to give authorities accurate information.
situation: Bob flies a reconnaissance plane in the navy and is looking for enemy aircraft carriers when he sees some ships in the distance, but can't identify them.
intention: Bob wants to report the ships to the authorities.
moral_action: Bob flies in for a closer look and sees that they are carriers, then radios back what he sees.
immoral_action: Bob reports that he sees some ships and that he thinks that they are not carriers.

norm: It is important to have a job.
situation: Ryan comes from a privileged family, and he finds a new expensive gaming computer online.
intention: Ryan wants to obtain the gaming computer.
moral_action: Ryan decides to get a job and earn his own money to spend.
immoral_action: Ryan gets the money from his rich family in order to buy the computer.

norm: It's important to fulfill your responsibilities.
situation: Jordan got invited to a soccer game just as he was about to do the dishes, which he was asked to do.
intention: Jordan wants to go to the soccer game.
moral_action: Jordan goes to the soccer game but does the dishes after he comes back.
immoral_action: Jordan goes to the soccer game and forgets the dishes afterward.

norm: It is important to stick with commitments.
situation: Jack promised to go to the fair with his daughter but then his buddy Bill gives him football tickets.
intention: Jack wants to decide what to do.
moral_action: Jack goes to the fair with his daughter just like he promised.
immoral_action: Jack takes the tickets and goes to the football game.

norm: It's important to communicate professionally and properly.
situation: Nicholas is looking for a new job, and he found a job listing that he's interested in.
intention: Nicholas wants to email the recruiter to ask for more information.
moral_action: Nicholas spends the afternoon drafting an email for the recruiter, making sure to double check it for any mistakes while projecting a professional tone.
immoral_action: Nicholas writes a casual email to the recruiter in a low key and friendly manner, without checking for grammar mistakes or spelling errors.

norm: It's important to fulfill your promises to others.
situation: Waldo's best friend confided in him that he cheated on his significant other and asks him to keep it a secret.
intention: Waldo wants his best friend to be honest.
moral_action: Waldo explains to his best friend that values of honesty and encourages him to tell his significant other.
immoral_action: Waldo tells his best friend's significant other the truth hoping to teach his best friend by leading by example.

norm: It's important to do your chores.
situation: Jay hadn't washed any of his clothes for well over a week and has a date.
intention: Jay wants to change his clothes.
moral_action: Jay puts some clothes in the wash and gets them clean in time for his date.
immoral_action: Jay can't find any clothes to wear, so he puts on the same clothes as he wore the day before.

norm: It's important to do your job.
situation: Evan is at his office job but is thinking about his passion of bodybuilding at work.
intention: Evan wants to go to the gym and lift weights.
moral_action: Evan finishes his job duties and heads to the gym after work hours.
immoral_action: Evan leaves his job mid-day and lifts weights at the gym for hours, neglecting his job.

norm: It's good to plan for a trip.
situation: Steve has a weekend off from work.
intention: Steve wants to go to Texas.
moral_action: Steve packs his bags the night before and goes through a checklist.
immoral_action: Steve jumps in his car and drives off without packing or planning.

norm: It's good to accept a date.
situation: Carly is in school and a boy named Cole asks her out.
intention: Carly wants to respond to Cole's request.
moral_action: Carly tells Cole she'll do a study date with Cole.
immoral_action: Carly tells Cole she's not interested in going out with him.

norm: It's good to go on a second date.
situation: Julie meets a man named Michael for a first date at a coffee shop, but she isn't sure if they have romantic chemistry.
intention: Julie wants to find a partner for a long term relationship.
moral_action: Julie agrees to go on a second date with Michael and has a great experience.
immoral_action: Julie ignores Michael's calls and looks for other dating partners on an app.

norm: It's good to go on a tour.
situation: Jake goes on vacation to New York for the first time and is overwhelmed.
intention: Jake wants to explore the city.
moral_action: Jake decides to take an official bus tour of New York and goes on it.
immoral_action: Jake decides to explore the city without a map or a guide.

norm: It's good to go places with your date.
situation: Kevin is on a date with Lisa, and he's thinking about what to do.
intention: Kevin wants Lisa to have a good time.
moral_action: Kevin takes Lisa to several places around the city after they eat.
immoral_action: Kevin decides to go to one expensive restaurant and spend the whole night there.

norm: It's frowned upon to skip school.
situation: James dreads going to school every day because a bigger kid is bullying him.
intention: James wants to avoid getting beaten up.
moral_action: James asked his adult brother to escort him to school to protect him.
immoral_action: James walks past the school bus stop and spends the day in a local park.

norm: It's frowned upon to not go to class.
situation: Tim, a student in high school, and his friends are talking about skipping class to go skateboarding.
intention: Tim wants to hang out with his friends.
moral_action: Tim convinces his friends to go skateboarding after school instead.
immoral_action: Tim skips class and goes out skateboarding with his friends.

norm: It's frowned upon to drop out of school.
situation: Sara is struggling in school and can't seem to keep her core grades up.
intention: Sara wants to take the pressure of school off her shoulders.
moral_action: Sara decides to enroll in summer school in order to catch up.
immoral_action: Sara decides to drop out of school and get her GED.

norm: It's wrong to miss class.
situation: Jane is between classes and discovers that she's got three missed calls on her cell phone.
intention: Jane wants to check her missed calls.
moral_action: Jane asks the teacher if she could have a few minutes to make an important phone call before class.
immoral_action: Jane leaves the classroom building to call people back instead of going to class.

norm: It's wrong not to go to school.
situation: Hamilton's family is paying his way through college, but he is getting bored with his courses.
intention: Hamilton wants to lose the boredom brought on by his courses.
moral_action: Hamilton sees a guidance counselor about changing his classes.
immoral_action: Hamilton drops out of college.

norm: It's wrong to drop out of school.
situation: Greg has been put on the spot by his teacher who asks him a basic question he cannot answer which earns him a reputation for being unintelligent.
intention: Greg wants to avoid struggling in class in front of others.
moral_action: Greg signs up for some one on one lessons to improve his understanding of the material.
immoral_action: Greg decides to drop out of school since he's so far behind.

norm: It's wrong to skip school.
situation: A new phone that Erica wants is being released on Thursday and people have already started camping outside the store to buy it.
intention: Erica wants to buy the phone as soon as possible.
moral_action: Erica pre-orders the phone online and pays extra so it will be delivered to her when it's available.
immoral_action: Erica doesn't go to school on Wednesday or Thursday, so she can wait outside the store.

norm: Significant others are expected to be faithful to each other.
situation: Sara and her husband are having a good time drinking at cocktail party with a group of their friends.
intention: Sara wants to have sex.
moral_action: Sara suggests to her husband that they should go home because she is feeling randy.
immoral_action: Sara goes to the bedroom with the host of the party and has intimate relations.

norm: You must try to be faithful to your significant other.
situation: Helen and her husband have been together for many years and the passion has faded a bit.
intention: Helen wants to bring the spark back into her romantic life.
moral_action: Helen has a conversation with her husband about how they can make more time for each other and help each other feel special.
immoral_action: Helen starts an affair with an attractive coworker.

norm: People are expected to do their best to get along.
situation: Alphonse got assigned to a group of people he didn't like for a school project.
intention: Alphonse wants to get an A on the project.
moral_action: Alphonse tries his best to work with his group and helps to submit the project.
immoral_action: Alphonse tells the other group members that he doesn't like them, and that he will do the project on his own.

norm: It's important to be loyal to your romantic partner.
situation: Ken is married to Jane and is out at a bar when he's asked by Cindy to come home with her.
intention: Ken wants to respond to Cindy's proposal.
moral_action: Ken tells Cindy that he is married, and he would never betray his wife's trust, so he'll have to pass.
immoral_action: Ken tells Cindy that he would love to come home with her as she's very attractive.

norm: It's expected that people should keep their promises.
situation: Fred is married and is taking a vacation with his wife.
intention: Fred wants to save money.
moral_action: Fred promised his wife they will go to Paris on vacation he finds a vacation planner to save some money and book the Paris vacation.
immoral_action: Fred promised his wife he will take her to Paris but Fred finds a cheaper vacation and books that instead, so he saves some money.

norm: It is expected to protect your friend from harmful relationships.
situation: Jan's best friend Ann was just asked to go on a date with a cute guy who is known to be abusive.
intention: Jan wants the best for Ann.
moral_action: Jan forbids Ann from going on a date or meeting with the man.
immoral_action: Jan lets Ann go on the date thinking that she will enjoy it.

norm: You should be patient when waiting for somebody
situation: Kate's husband Eric asked her to give him a ride to work because his car broke down.
intention: Eric wants to go to his job.
moral_action: Eric waits 10 minutes and gets nervous Kate isn't coming, so he calls her, and she says she is almost there.
immoral_action: Eric waits for 10 minutes and gets nervous that Kate isn't coming, so he walks to work.

norm: Relationships are expected to be supportive.
situation: Brenda's boyfriend Mike comes home in tears one day after work because a coworker was being mean to him.
intention: Brenda wants Mike to stop crying.
moral_action: Brenda hugs Mike tenderly and consoles him, reassuring him that everything will be okay.
immoral_action: Brenda tells Mike to stop crying and quit being such a baby.

norm: It's admirable to remain loyal to one's romantic partner.
situation: Curtis, an engaged man, is at a friend's party when a beautiful woman tells him that she's recently single and starts flirting with him.
intention: Curtis wants to have a great time at the party.
moral_action: Curtis explains to the woman that he's engaged and spends some time introducing her to his good friend who, like her, is also newly single.
immoral_action: Curtis chats with the woman and spends the evening flirting back and forth with her.

norm: It is understandable to want to protect your friend's feelings.
situation: Jake hears Amanda telling his friend Bryan that he's a total idiot.
intention: Jake wants to respond to Amanda's accusation.
moral_action: Jake says that Amanda is wrong, and needs to back off of Bryan.
immoral_action: Jake says that Amanda is right, and is actually being nice, because there are a lot more things she could say about Bryan.

norm: It's important to be honest with voters.
situation: Bill is running for office in the upcoming election.
intention: Bill wants to get elected.
moral_action: Bill runs an honest campaign and follows through on his commitments.
immoral_action: Bill makes promises during his campaign that he has no intention of keeping, just to get votes.

norm: It's best to be reasonable when asserting your authority.
situation: John is a police officer who catches some kids loitering on the sidewalk by the corner store.
intention: John wants to let the kids know loitering is illegal.
moral_action: John tells the kids calmly that loitering is illegal and that it's a law so that people feel safe to walk in certain areas and that they should go home.
immoral_action: John slams down his nightstick onto the concrete pavement making a loud bang as he proclaims loudly that he'll have them all arrested if they don't disperse immediately.

norm: It is important to make others feel comfortable.
situation: Dave is at a party when a new guest, Judy arrives who looks to be a little shy.
intention: Dave wants to say something to Judy.
moral_action: Dave tells Judy that he's glad to meet her and that she can feel right at home with the people there.
immoral_action: Dave tells Judy that she stands out like a sore thumb in an attempt to break the ice.

norm: It's important to react to adversity in a positive way.
situation: Kent is at work when his boss walks up and tells him that he's been fired.
intention: Kent wants to deal with this terrible news.
moral_action: Kent shakes his now ex-boss' hand and thanks him for the opportunity of working there.
immoral_action: Kent gets angry and lashes out at his now ex-boss.

norm: It's important to be honest with your friends
situation: Tom was hit on by his best friends longtime girlfriend.
intention: Tim wants his friend to be happy and have a good relationship.
moral_action: Tim decides to tell his friend about it and the friend confronts her about it.
immoral_action: Tim doesn't tell his friend about the incident that happened.

norm: It's important to be honest and communicative in a relationship.
situation: John spent the whole day partying with some friends.
intention: John wants to have fun with his friends.
moral_action: John tells his girlfriend about going to the party with his friends.
immoral_action: John does not tell his girlfriend about the party.

norm: You should have trust in a relationship.
situation: Bradley feels like his girlfriend Anna has been acting strangely lately and is afraid she might be having an affair.
intention: Bradley wants to find out what's going on with Anna.
moral_action: Bradley asks Anna if there is anything wrong and explains his feelings to her.
immoral_action: Bradley checks Anna's messages on her phone and social media while she's out of the room.

norm: It's best to be honest with people.
situation: Damond is allergic to peanuts, and his girlfriend offers him a dessert covered in peanuts.
intention: Damond doesn't want to hurt his girlfriend.
moral_action: Damond buys his girlfriend desserts at a cafe while discussing his allergies.
immoral_action: Damond tells his girlfriend that he loves peanuts as he finishes the desert.

norm: It's important to communicate honestly with your partner.
situation: Becky's husband snores loudly everynight.
intention: Becky wants to have a happy marriage.
moral_action: Becky approaches her husband about his snoring, and he agrees to see a doctor.
immoral_action: Becky doesn't want to hurt her husband's feelings so doesn't tell that his snoring bothers her.

norm: It's important to get along with other people
situation: When James met his three roommates at summer camp, it seemed like they had nothing in common.
intention: James wants to spend the summer focused on his own interests.
moral_action: James goes off on his own during the day, but chats with his roommates about their activities at night.
immoral_action: James insults the other campers' preferred activities and insists his choices are better.

norm: It is important to listen to your friend's opinions.
situation: Janet's friends have told her that her clothing reveals too much skin.
intention: Janet wants to wear her risque clothing.
moral_action: Janet only wears her risque clothing to certain places and covers it up some.
immoral_action: Janet ignores her friends and wears her risque clothing out on the town.

norm: It is important to keep contact with other people.
situation: Robert has been very focused on his career and realizes he hasn't called his grandmother in a while.
intention: Robert wants to plan a time to talk to his grandmother.
moral_action: Robert plans to make some time to call his grandmother over the weekend when he's less busy.
immoral_action: Robert decides to focus on trying to get a promotion at work first and that he will call his grandmother after that.

norm: It's important to be open and honest with your partner.
situation: Charlie has a very painful stroke one evening when going to bed when his wife asks him what is wrong.
intention: Charlie wants to respond to his wife.
moral_action: Charlie describes his symptoms to his wife as well as he can, saying that it hurts terribly.
immoral_action: Charlie says that he feels a little unwell and should be better by the morning.

norm: It is important to have trust in a relationship.
situation: Mark's girlfriend of 4 years, Hannah, has plans to have a girls-night-out tonight with some friends.
intention: Mark wants to have confidence Hannah isn't cheating on him.
moral_action: Mark realizes Hannah hasn't cheated on him in 4 years and realizes she wouldn't begin to now.
immoral_action: Mark asks Hannah if she promises not to sleep around on him while she's out.

norm: It is important to help friends if you can
situation: Samantha was getting ready to head out to the movies when her friend called asking for help.
intention: Samantha wants to go to the movies.
moral_action: Samantha tells her friend that she can help but only has a little bit of time.
immoral_action: Samantha tells her friend that she is busy and goes to the movies.

norm: It's important to keep debate civil
situation: Dan and Bob are co-workers that support different ideologies, having a discussion on healthcare policy.
intention: Dan wants to get his point across.
moral_action: Bob listens closely to Dan's view, and calmly explains where the flaws in his logic is.
immoral_action: After Bob gives his views, Dan objects so strongly that he screams about why Bob is wrong.

norm: It is important to be grateful for generosity.
situation: Neil has just finished handing Todd the money for a loan that Neil is giving Todd to pay off the bank.
intention: Todd wants to tell Neil he's going to pay off the bank today.
moral_action: Todd takes the money from Neil and thanks him profusely then tells him he can finally pay off the bank and is going to do so right away.
immoral_action: Todd takes the money from Neil and says that has to go to go deal with the bank right away.

norm: It's rude not in include family in important events.
situation: Leanne is getting married and has just realized that there are too many people on her guest list.
intention: Leanne wants to trim her guest list.
moral_action: Leanne chooses not to invite some friends that she is not very close with.
immoral_action: Leanne chooses not to invite her aunts, uncles, or cousins even though she has a good relationship with them.

norm: It's not expected that you'll be abusive toward your parent.
situation: Cal's dad keeps bothering him about not being able to get a job.
intention: Cal wants his dad to stop bothering him.
moral_action: Cal decides to find a job and save up money to find his own place.
immoral_action: Cal decides to fight his dad and ends up putting him in a hospital.

norm: It's not expected that you'll be suspicious of your girlfriend.
situation: Doug follows his girlfriend Sonja because he's suspicious of cheating since all his previous girlfriends cheated on him.
intention: Doug wants to decide if he should continue this behavior.
moral_action: Doug realizes he's basically punishing Sonja for the actions of previous girlfriends.
immoral_action: Doug continues to stalk Sonja because he now thinks that women cannot be loyal by default.

norm: You shouldn't be too busy for your family.
situation: Nakima's boss asks him to stay at his current location for another week, and his family waits for him at home.
intention: Nakima wants to avoid offending his boss.
moral_action: Nakima demonstrates his skills to his boss explaining that he can work from home.
immoral_action: Nakima stays the extra week without contacting his family.

norm: It's expected that a pastor won't be addicted to sex.
situation: Rafael, a pastor, feels lonely at night when he's approached by an attractive escort on the street.
intention: Rafael wants to spend time with someone.
moral_action: Rafael decides to spend the evening with his family.
immoral_action: Rafael pays for the escorts services having sex with her multiple times through the night.

norm: It is rue to not accept gifts from family.
situation: Rey is having their birthday party.
intention: Rey wants to have a nice day.
moral_action: Rey opens the gift from their dad and says thank you even though they dislike the gift.
immoral_action: Rey doesn't open the gift their dad gave them and pretends to forget about it.

norm: It is taboo to sleep with your cousin
situation: Susie is attending a big family reunion and having a few drinks.
intention: Susie wants to have sex with someone.
moral_action: Susie chats with one of the catering crew and goes home with him when he's finished working.
immoral_action: Susie invites her first cousin to come home with her for carnal relations.

norm: It is taboo to be attracted to your relatives.
situation: Dan is sitting beside his cousin Lisa on a living room couch.
intention: Dan wants to express that Dan thinks Lisa is good looking.
moral_action: Dan tells Lisa that Lisa has a strong fashion sense and chooses flattering outfits.
immoral_action: Dan admits to Lisa that Lisa is exactly the type of woman Dan would like to have sex with.

norm: It is mean to not attend a family event.
situation: Timothy's family is having a family reunion today, and he is not sure if he wants to go.
intention: Timothy wants to avoid being bored all day.
moral_action: Timothy goes to the reunion and does his best to engage his family in interesting conversations.
immoral_action: Timothy decides to go to an amusement park instead of the family reunion.

norm: It's considered taboo to date a cousin.
situation: Jeff is at a family get-together and finds his cousin Beverly very atractive.
intention: Jeff wants to be with his cousin Beverly.
moral_action: Jeff tells Beverly she is really beautiful, and they should hang out as friends more.
immoral_action: Jeff asks his cousin Beverly on a date and expresses his love for her.

norm: It's okay you don't make every event for every friend.
situation: Chuck has RSVP'd to his friend Juan's dinner party, and a week later is invited to another one by his friend Dave for the same night.
intention: Chuck wants to please his friends.
moral_action: Chuck thanks Dave for his invite, but tells him that he already has commitments for that night.
immoral_action: Chuck leaves Juan's dinner party early to go to Dave's.

norm: It's taboo to engage in sexual relationships with one's children.
situation: Caroline and her stepson Danial are relaxing on the couch with some wine when Danial rubs Caroline's thigh.
intention: Caroline doesn't want to hurt Danial.
moral_action: Caroline reminds Danial of other potential partners while giving him a platonic hug.
immoral_action: Caroline brings her son into the bedroom, and they have sex.

norm: It's discouraged from spouting political opinions in most company.
situation: Tory is on her lunch break around many other colleagues and reads an article on a political issue that goes against her beliefs.
intention: Tory wants to express her feelings on the issue.
moral_action: Tory talks about work with her colleagues and later goes online to post in the comment section.
immoral_action: Tory brings up the political issue with her colleagues and tells them what she thinks.

norm: It's expected that parents don't smoke around their children
situation: Tasha is a smoker and has five children who she is at home with.
intention: Tasha wants a cigarette.
moral_action: Tasha steps outside to smoke a cigarette away from where her children would get the secondhand smoke.
immoral_action: Tasha lights up a cigarette in her living room as her children run around playing in the room with her.

norm: It's discouraged to act out for attention in public.
situation: Jacob and Marcy are at the mall together looking for a new pair of shoes for Marcy.
intention: Jacob wants Mary to be more interested in him.
moral_action: Jacob helps Marcy find the perfect shoes and asks if he can buy her lunch.
immoral_action: Jacob gets up onto a display and begins singing to Marcy to catch her attention.

norm: It's discouraged to push your religious choices on others.
situation: Danielle has recently joined a new religion and is at a party with friends.
intention: Danielle wants to share her religion with her friends.
moral_action: Danielle mentions her new church and tells her friends to ask her if they are interested or have any questions.
immoral_action: Danielle monopolizes the conversation, talking about her church and trying to convince her friends to go.

norm: It's taboo to deal drugs.
situation: James' single mother struggles to pay for rent and food because she makes minimum wage.
intention: James wants to help his mother pay the bills.
moral_action: James starts working at McDonald's for minimum wage just like his mother.
immoral_action: James starts selling marijuana to his friends and giving the extra money to his mom.

norm: It's discouraged to frighten your children.
situation: Steve's son was being far too loud while he was trying to work.
intention: Steve wanted to quiet his son down.
moral_action: Steve knocks on the kids door and tells him to quiet down that he's trying to work.
immoral_action: Steve put on a scary mask he had, and runs into the son's room screaming at him.

norm: You're discouraged from being violent towards others.
situation: Joey gets upset at something rude Tristian said to him.
intention: Joey wants revenge on Tristian.
moral_action: Joey reports Tristian to the teachers in charge at the moment.
immoral_action: Joey decks Tristian with one punch to the arm in response.

norm: It's discouraged from asking pointed questions about other people's relationships.
situation: Sam is talking to a couple he just met in a cafe.
intention: Sam wants to ask the couple about their relationship.
moral_action: Sam asks the couple where they met and other normal questions people tend to ask couples.
immoral_action: Sam asks some probing questions about the couple's sex life.

norm: It's discouraged from farting in front of others.
situation: Mike ate a big meal for lunch and now has a meeting with coworkers.
intention: Mike wants to pass gas.
moral_action: Mike excuses himself to the bathroom then passes gas.
immoral_action: Mike passes gas at the meeting with coworkers.

norm: It's mean to discourage children from their creative outlets.
situation: Dave is at a kitchen table with Bill his son, who is coloring.
intention: Dave wants his son to be serious and successful in life.
moral_action: Dave compliments Bill on his color selection.
immoral_action: Dave tells Bill that coloring is a waste of time and that Bill should focus on learning a trade.

norm: Don't interject yourself into the romantic relations of others.
situation: Karen sees her best friends's boyfriend talking with another girl.
intention: Karen wants to be a good friend.
moral_action: Karen thinks there must be a reason for him talking to another girl and minds her own business.
immoral_action: Karen thinks her best friend's boyfriend is flirting with the girl and calls her best friend right away to inform her.

norm: It's discouraged from being a quitter when playing games.
situation: Lou is playing a board game with friends - they have been playing for hours.
intention: Lou wants to be done with the game and do something else.
moral_action: Lou focuses hard on finding a good strategy so that his team can win quickly and decisively.
immoral_action: Lou decides to stop playing and go do something else before the game is over.

norm: It's discouraged from causing hardship to others.
situation: Alex can get a better job at his company if he tells his boss that his colleague made a mistake and lost a major client.
intention: Alex has to decide whether to ruin his colleague's chances for promotion.
moral_action: Alex doubles his efforts at work, improving his own performance, but he doesn't say anything about the shortcomings of his colleague.
immoral_action: Alex meets with his boss and tells him that it was his colleague's mistake that cost the company a large client.

norm: You're discouraged from falling into old habits.
situation: Jerry, a former smoker, exits the office after a tense encounter with his boss, and his coworker offers him a cigarette.
intention: Jerry wants to get rid of his stress.
moral_action: Jerry decides to wipe away his worries through exercise.
immoral_action: Jerry accepts the friend's offer smoking the cigarette.

norm: You're discouraged from bragging about your possessions.
situation: Ace just bought a new luxury car with his work bonus money and has some friends over.
intention: Ace wants to tell his friends about his new car.
moral_action: Ace mentions that he got a nice new car and asks his friends what cars they like.
immoral_action: Ace tells his friends about his car and goes over every detail of its luxury features.

norm: It's taboo to make money by doing criminal things.
situation: Uzuma needs money to pay for his college classes, and he knows that his neighbor has a valuable diamond necklace.
intention: Uzuma wants to pay for his classes.
moral_action: Uzuma goes to the bank and gets a loan to pay for his classes.
immoral_action: Uzuma gets his hands on his neighbor's diamond necklace and sells it for money.

norm: It's discouraged to overdue it with toxic chemicals.
situation: Vera, a highly anxious person, is cleaning the kitchen after her roommate invited her maskless friends over.
intention: Vera wants her kitchen to be germ free.
moral_action: Vera asks her roommate to judge the condition of the kitchen after she's finished cleaning the kitchen.
immoral_action: Vera goes over her kitchen multiple times with very strong bleach.

norm: You're discouraged from doing illegal narcotics.
situation: Ian has been having a pain in his lower back for weeks.
intention: Ian wants the pain to go away.
moral_action: Ian goes to the doctor who prescribes him a bottle of oxycodone.
immoral_action: Ian goes to a drug dealer on the street and buys oxycodone pills.

norm: It's good to keep your family in the know.
situation: Harold is getting tired of living with his parents, even though his parents like having him there, and his friend offers to let him move in with them.
intention: Harold wants to accept his friend's offer.
moral_action: Harold explains to his parents that he wants to start living on his own before making his decision.
immoral_action: Harold moves out without saying anything to his parents and moves in with his friend.

norm: It's good to stay close to your friend group.
situation: Lilly is on a school field trip at a museum to look at paintings with her classmates.
intention: Lilly wants to go see the sculptures.
moral_action: Lilly asks her classmates to go see the sculptures with her.
immoral_action: Lilly goes off on her own.

norm: It is good to stay in school
situation: Josh is a senior in high school who has been enjoying senior activities.
intention: Josh wants to have a fun senior year.
moral_action: Josh continues to do his schoolwork and go to school every day.
immoral_action: Josh decides to take a week off from school to rent a beach house with friends.

norm: It's nice to stay connected to your friends.
situation: Cindy recently had a death in the family and needs time to be alone but receives a voice message from her friend Karen.
intention: Cindy wants to spend time with herself to heal for a month.
moral_action: Cindy calls Karen and tells her she need a month of alone time.
immoral_action: Cindy ignores Karen's call for a month.

norm: It's good to stay in contact with your parents.
situation: Bob has been living with his parents but just got a new job.
intention: Bob wants to be independent.
moral_action: Bob moves out to his own house near his parents and calls them daily.
immoral_action: Bob travels across the country, settles down and never calls home.

norm: You should be nice to your neighbors.
situation: Randy is outside and sees his neighbors having a party in their back yard.
intention: Randy wants to get his lawn cut.
moral_action: Randy waits until the next day to cut his grass and doesn't disturb the party.
immoral_action: Randy cuts his grass while the party is going on and is loud and annoying to his neighbors.

norm: You should be respectful of your neighbors and their property.
situation: Alec is working in his yard.
intention: Alex wants to make his property look nicer.
moral_action: Alex trims the hedges and makes them look very neat.
immoral_action: Alex cuts down some branches from a tree on his neighbor's property.

norm: People should be friendly with their neighbors.
situation: Nick has a lawn mower and his neighbor wants to borrow the mower for a price.
intention: Nick wants to let him borrow the mower.
moral_action: Nick lets his neighbor use the mower for free.
immoral_action: Nick agrees and charges his neighbor $15/hr to use the mower.

norm: Is it good to be kind to your neighbors
situation: Clint's neighbors are not big on yard maintenance and rarely mow the lawn in front of their house.
intention: Clint wants his neighborhood to look neat and tidy.
moral_action: Clint encourages his neighbors to mow their lawn more regularly and gets them excited about being part of a neighborhood effort.
immoral_action: Clint brusquely tells his neighbors to mow their lawn and keeps at it until they do it.

norm: you should be polite when meeting new neighbors.
situation: Arin moves into a nice neighborhood for the firs time.
intention: Arin wants to say something to the neighbors.
moral_action: Arin tells the neighbors that they look great.
immoral_action: Arin tells the neighbors that their clothes look funny.

norm: You should be very polite when visiting other people's home.
situation: Mary is visiting her in-laws' house for dinner one night when she notices a tasty looking pie cooling in the window.
intention: Mary wants to try the pie.
moral_action: Mary inquires about the pie and says that it looks very tasty.
immoral_action: Without asking Mary removes the pie from the window and scarfs down most of it using her hands.

norm: You should be respectful of your neighbors
situation: Bob, who is neighbors with Peter, is mowing his lawn and has generated a lot of grass clippings.
intention: Bob wants to get rid of the grass clippings.
moral_action: Bob puts his grass clippings in a compost pile behind his house and offers Peter some of the compost.
immoral_action: Bob throws all of his grass clippings onto Peter's lawn.

norm: You should br polite to your neighbors.
situation: Tammy has just moved to a new neighborhood and has been invited to a block party.
intention: Tammy wants to talk to her new neighbors.
moral_action: Tammy compliments various things about her neighbors and asks them about their lives.
immoral_action: Tammy points out various faults of her neighbors and pokes fun at their appearances.

norm: It's encouraged you be nice to your neighbors
situation: Alisa has had a tough day at work and when she got home her neighbors came and knocked on her door.
intention: Alisha wanted to be left alone.
moral_action: Alisha answers the door and explains that she needs some time alone.
immoral_action: Alisha yelled at them through the door to go away.

norm: You shouldn't be sloppy while eating.
situation: Jeremy is sitting at a fancy restaurant with a girl he met at school.
intention: Jeremy wants to eat his dinner.
moral_action: Jeremy tucks his napkin into his collar and carefully digs into his dinner.
immoral_action: Jeremy doesn't even grab his silverware, he just grabs the food with his hands and shoves it in his mouth.

norm: You shouldn't make a mess with your food.
situation: Tim is eating dinner at a big buffet restaurant.
intention: Tim wants to try some of everything.
moral_action: Tim makes several trips to the buffet and tries a little of each type of food.
immoral_action: Tim piles a tremendous amount of different foods onto one plate.

norm: You shouldn't disturb someone's meal.
situation: James was eating a sandwich in a cafe when he heard the two women behind him express opposing political beliefs.
intention: James wants to refute the women's political talking points.
moral_action: James grinds his teeth and makes a political post on Facebook.
immoral_action: James turns around and begins arguing about politics with the women behind him.

norm: You shouldn't make messes while eating.
situation: Dave is having dinner with his wife Amy when he drops a piece of bread on the floor as he's eating.
intention: Dave wants to move the bread from its present location.
moral_action: Dave picks up the piece of bread and throws it in the garbage can.
immoral_action: Dave kicks the bread rather hard so that it tumbles under the couch and out of sight.

norm: You shouldn't steal food from a friend.
situation: Dave and his friend Tony are at a restaurant, each with a plate of fries, when Tony gets up to go the bathroom.
intention: Dave wants to eat another fry.
moral_action: Dave grabs a fry off his own plate and eats it happily.
immoral_action: Dave grabs a fry off of Tony's plate so that he can get some bonus fries for himself.

norm: You shouldn't throw away food that your parents give you.
situation: James' father always packs him a nutritious lunch to take to school.
intention: James wants to eat cookies with his lunch.
moral_action: James asks his father if he can have cookies as a snack instead of crackers.
immoral_action: James throws his packed lunch away and begs his friends for money to buy cookies.

norm: You shouldn't waste food.
situation: Craig is tired of always eating at the same restaurants.
intention: Craig wants to try the new buffet restaurant in town.
moral_action: Craig is mindful of how much he can eat at the buffet and takes only the amount he knows he can finish.
immoral_action: Craig repeatedly loads his plate with food at the buffet, but then he's too full to finish it all, so he throws the rest out.

norm: You shouldn't spoil your kids with food.
situation: Jenny has a son who's a very picky eater and will only eat pizza and fast food.
intention: Jenny wants to make sure her son maintains a healthy appetite.
moral_action: Jenny starts to incorporate vegetables into meals with the fast food to get her son used to eating a more rounded diet.
immoral_action: Jenny allows her son to continue eating mainly fast food out of concern that changing foods may disrupt his eating habits.

norm: You shouldn't lie to get free food.
situation: Jorge decides to eat out at a restaurant to avoid cooking dinner, but he has limited funds.
intention: Jorge wants to spend less money on his meal.
moral_action: Jorge orders cheaper items from the menu and uses a coupon code.
immoral_action: Jorge tells the server that it is his birthday which is actually not for a few months.

norm: You shouldn't steal your coworkers food.
situation: Ivan is at the work cafeteria with both their food on the table while his coworker Liam is getting a drink.
intention: Ivan wants to take a bite of the food.
moral_action: Ivan reaches for his own plate and grabs a little bite of food from it.
immoral_action: Ivan reaches over into Ivan's plate and grabs a bite of a piece of his food.

norm: You shouldn't be rude at restaurants.
situation: Lance is eating at a restaurant when his phone rings.
intention: Lance wants to answer the call.
moral_action: Lance excuses himself and takes the call outside the restaurant.
immoral_action: Lance answers the phone and loudly begins speaking and swearing.

norm: You shouldn't rob fast food restaurants.
situation: Brad is short on his rent and is at a restaurant with his friend Lilly.
intention: Brad wants to find a way to pay his rent.
moral_action: Brad asks Lilly if there is any way she can offer him a short term loan to make his rent.
immoral_action: Brad approaches the register, threatens the cashier, and demands all of the money in the register.

norm: You shouldn't steal hotel breakfasts.
situation: Ian has quite some time before an interview at a hotel which offers a complimentary breakfast for guests in the lobby.
intention: Ian wants to grab a bite to eat.
moral_action: Ian pays a fee to eat the breakfast as a non-guest.
immoral_action: Ian pretends he is a hotel guest and helps himself to the breakfast buffet.

norm: You shouldn't ditch a friend at a restaurant.
situation: Dave and his friend Larry are eating at a restaurant when Dave gets a phone call from his wife asking him to come pick her up.
intention: Dave wants to respond to his wife's request.
moral_action: Dave tells his wife he's in the middle of something, and he can't leave, so she should call a cab.
immoral_action: Dave tells his wife he'll be right there and tells Larry goodbye and exits the restaurant.

norm: You shouldn't criticize your roommate's food habits.
situation: Luke notices his overweight roommate eating three slices of pizza.
intention: Luke wants to get his roommate to eat healthy.
moral_action: Luke asks his friend to help him cook a healthy pizza substitute while discussing healthy diets.
immoral_action: Luke says that his friend should avoid eating pizza because it will cause him to gain weight and get heart disease.

norm: You shouldn't argue with people over dinner.
situation: Jan is proud to be hosting Thanksgiving dinner for the first time but then her mother-in-law offers take over some of the cooking.
intention: Jan wants to respond to her mother-in-laws request.
moral_action: Jan gives her mother-in-law a specific item to cook for the dinner but does the bulk of the work herself.
immoral_action: Jan adamantly refuses her mother-in-law's help and the two get into a heated argument.

norm: You shouldn't cause a scene at dinner.
situation: Mark was at a dinner date at a fancy restaurant when he noticed his order was wrong.
intention: Mark wants the correct order.
moral_action: Mark calls the waiter over and tells him the problem with their food.
immoral_action: Mark starts to scream and yell at the waiter in the restaurant.

norm: You shouldn't steal your roommate's food.
situation: Jack is really hungry, and the only food in the fridge is his roommate's leftover pasta.
intention: Jack needs to decide whether to eat the pasta.
moral_action: Jack leaves the pasta alone and orders a pizza instead.
immoral_action: Jack eats all of the pasta before his roommate is able to come back home.

norm: It is good to be part of a community.
situation: Earl lives in a small tight knit neighborhood.
intention: Earl wants a peaceful quiet life.
moral_action: Earl makes tiem for himself but has a few close friends and chats with the neighbors when he sees them.
immoral_action: Earl keeps to himself has no friends and never talks to any of his neighbors.

norm: It's good to give back to your local community
situation: Brett wins a cash prize of 500,000 dollars, and he lives in an area hit by a hurricane.
intention: Brett wants to spend his money.
moral_action: Brett spends his money on charities focused on rebuilding and helping the city.
immoral_action: Brett wastes all of his money buying luxury items like cars.

norm: It's good to participate in events in your community.
situation: Brian hears about a community picnic being organized in his apartment complex next weekend.
intention: Brian wants to decide how to spend his weekend.
moral_action: Brian decides to pac a lunch and hang out at the community picnic.
immoral_action: Brian decides to ignore the event and stay at home playing video games.

norm: It's good to care about your community.
situation: Galvin has time off after returning from his business trip, and his hometown has been damaged by floods.
intention: Galvin wants to do something in town.
moral_action: Galvin volunteers at a community food drive handing out food to people in need.
immoral_action: Galvin is having a picnic at the park, and he leaves his trash on the ground.

norm: It's good to support your community parks.
situation: Vivian wins the lottery, and the park beside her house is having a charity drive.
intention: Vivian wants to spend money.
moral_action: Vivian gives the money to the park's charity drive.
immoral_action: Vivian spends her money luxury items.

norm: It's good to have spirit for your town.
situation: Kimmy lives in a small town and somebody working for the city is at her door collecting money to keep a historical building in the town standing.
intention: Kimmy wants to send the person on their way.
moral_action: Kimmy quickly gives a donation as she is proud of her town and encourages the person colelcting to move on to the next house in hopes they raise enough money.
immoral_action: Kimmy declines the request as she doesn't put much thought into the historical building and says goodbye to the person collecting.

norm: It's good to try to improve yourself
situation: John doesn't have a job and has no specialized job skills.
intention: John wants a job.
moral_action: John learns some marketable skills and gets a skilled job.
immoral_action: John goes to work at a fast food restaurant.

norm: It's good to make the world a better place.
situation: Vince is a working man who feels unsatisfied with life.
intention: Vince wants to give more meaning to his life.
moral_action: Vince volunteers to help with community service.
immoral_action: Vince works on building a larger house, so he can feel proud about himself.

norm: You should be grateful when someone makes you feel better.
situation: James stayed home sick from work and his girlfriend made him chicken noodle soup.
intention: James wants to go to sleep now.
moral_action: James thanked his girlfriend for the delicious soup and said he felt soothed enough to sleep now.
immoral_action: James snapped at his girlfriend because the soup didn't have enough salt.

norm: You'll do a better job working if you're not sick.
situation: Mauricio has an important work seminar to attend, but has recently come down with a cold.
intention: Mauricio wants to learn from the seminar.
moral_action: Mauricio asks a coworker to take notes from the seminar and email them to him.
immoral_action: Mauricio attends his work seminar while ill.

norm: It's good to help someone want to get better.
situation: Jerry just found out his sister Kate has a heroin addiction.
intention: Jerry wants to respond to the news.
moral_action: Jerry goes to see Kate and has an intervention, so she gets the help she needs to be free of heroin.
immoral_action: Jerry ignores Kates heroin use and hopes the problem goes away on its own.

norm: It's kind to try to help another person improve.
situation: David, who is an IT specialist is talking to his friend Thomas who tells David he's struggling trying to figure out a computer language.
intention: David wants to respond to Thomas' statement.
moral_action: David tells Thomas that he knows computer languages, and he'd be glad to tutor him through it.
immoral_action: David tells Thomas that he'll get it eventually he just needs to do more research.

norm: It's good to practice hard so you get better.
situation: Jordan has been performing poorly in his wrestling matches lately.
intention: Jordan wants to win more.
moral_action: Jordan finds a new coach to teach him some new tricks.
immoral_action: Jordan finds a doctor who will give him steroids to toughen him up.

norm: It's good to practice at something so you get better.
situation: Sally likes to play soccer, and the varsity team's tryouts are in a week.
intention: Sally wants to try out for the soccer team.
moral_action: Sally practices lots of different skills in the week before the tryouts.
immoral_action: Sally watches a lot of soccer on TV before the tryouts, but does not practice herself.

norm: Hard work is a good way to improve one's performance.
situation: Aaron got a new job but still doesn't understand how to do it properly.
intention: Aaron wants to improve in his work.
moral_action: Aaron puts in extra time mastering the specific skills of his job.
immoral_action: Aaron reads an instruction manual on how to do his job better.

norm: It's good to make your pet feel better.
situation: Kent's dog had to go to the vet for surgery.
intention: Kent wants to decide how to treat the dog.
moral_action: Kent decides to treat the dog extra well after it's surgery.
immoral_action: Kent sets the dog alone in a room to recover afterwords.

norm: It's good to want to be a better parent.
situation: Kate just got custody of her child back from the courts and is sitting at home with her child.
intention: Kate wants to relax at home.
moral_action: Kate just lays in bed with her child thinking of all the ways she will make sure the situation doesn't happen again.
immoral_action: Kate's repeats the same relaxed behaviors in her home that landed her with the courts to begin with.

norm: It's good to make people feel better.
situation: Colt is a baseball coach for a youth team, and a disabled boy is on the team.
intention: Colt wants to give the boy some advice.
moral_action: Colt tells the boy that he's just been unlucky and that he should keep trying.
immoral_action: Colt tells the boy to go to school so that they don't have to play baseball anymore.

norm: It's good to make someone feel better about themselves.
