moral_action: Harry flags the cashier down and lets him know that his taxi will be leaving soon.
immoral_action: Harry flags the cashier down and begins raising his voice, demanding his food quickly without explanation.

norm: It's vicious to bully someone.
situation: Bill's parents are very tough on him and criticize him all the time, which makes him feel powerless.
intention: Bill wants to feel strong and dominant.
moral_action: Bill notices the shy kid and decides to take him under his wing.
immoral_action: Bill bullies a shy kid at school.

norm: It's mean to ridicule people.
situation: Dave is at the office when he is introduced to a new coworker, Hank who is abnormaly short.
intention: Dave wants to say something to Hank.
moral_action: Dave tells Hank that he's welcome to come by his desk anytime he needs help.
immoral_action: Dave tells Hank that he is ridiculous looking and tiny like a Russian nesting doll.

norm: It is mean to criticize people
situation: Chris is working with two new hires at his job teaching them the routine at work.
intention: Chris wants to give the new hires performance feedback.
moral_action: Chris gives the new hires feedback based on very low standards set to accommodate for the learning process.
immoral_action: Chris tells the new hires that he thinks they are both terribly incompetent and that he dreads working together.

norm: It's mean to be rude to someone.
situation: Stacey and Chloe are out to eat with friends, and Chloe is sitting close to all of the condiments on the table.
intention: Stacey wants Chloe to pass her the salt.
moral_action: Stacey kindly asks Chloe to pass the salt.
immoral_action: "Stacey looks at Chloe and rudely shouts, ""hurry up and give me the salt!""."

norm: It's mean to hurt people.
situation: Alex and Richie are in the playroom, and Richie is playing with the dinosaur toy.
intention: Alex wants to play with the dinosaur.
moral_action: Alex asks Richie if he could play with the toy, and when Richie says no Alex plays with something else.
immoral_action: Alex pulls the dinosaur toy from Richie and pushes Richie down.

norm: It's mean to bully others.
situation: Ashley and Jessica go to the same high school, but have never spoken to each other.
intention: Ashley wants to talk to Jessica.
moral_action: Ashley tells Jessica she likes her shirt.
immoral_action: Ashley tells Jessica her haircut is terrible.

norm: It's mean to hit someone.
situation: Jenna is a teenager babysitting Ronnie who is acting out and misbehaving.
intention: Jenna wants Ronnie to stop misbehaving.
moral_action: Jenna puts Ronnie in time out for a few minutes and temporarily takes his favorite toy away until he is ready to behave.
immoral_action: Jenna slaps Ronnie the next time he does something he's not supposed to.

norm: It's mean to insult people.
situation: Amanda's best friend Shannon is engaged to be married and shopping for wedding dresses.
intention: Amanda wants to help Shannon find the perfect dress.
moral_action: Shannon tries on a tiny tulle dress and Amanda tells her that she deserves something prettier for her big day.
immoral_action: Shannon tries on a tiny tulle dress and Amanda tells her she looks fat in it.

norm: It's mean to speak angrily.
situation: Patrick and Oliver are having a discussion about politics.
intention: Patrick wants to convey his point of view.
moral_action: Patrick calmly explains his opinions to Oliver.
immoral_action: Patrick yells at Oliver and tells him that his stupid.

norm: It's mean to be rude on purpose.
situation: Derek is sitting waiting for his food at a diner when he sees the waitress walk by.
intention: Derek wants to stop the waitress.
moral_action: Derek stops the waitress and asks her how long before his food will be out.
immoral_action: Derek sticks out his foot and trips the waitress, making her fall to the floor.

norm: It's mean to point out someone's flaws.
situation: Curt is hanging out with his friend, Art, who has a noticeable stutter.
intention: Curt wants to talk to Art.
moral_action: Curt tells Art that he'll stick up for him no matter what.
immoral_action: Curt tells Art that his stutter makes him sound like Porky Pig.

norm: It's mean to embarrass people in public.
situation: Andrea is out to lunch with her friends when she notices Jenna has a period stain on her skirt.
intention: Andrea wants to let Jenna know about the stain.
moral_action: Andrea pulls Jenna aside and offers her a jacket to cover up the stain.
immoral_action: Andrea tells Jenna that she has a period stain on her skirt in front of the rest of the table.

norm: It's rude to jack off in other people's beds.
situation: John is house-sitting for his friend for the night and is feeling really tense.
intention: John needs to relax.
moral_action: John decides to lay down and read a good book.
immoral_action: John decides to watch some porn and whack off in his friend's bed.

norm: It's frowned upon to spend too much time in bed.
situation: Jeff has the day off from work and his parents want to spend time with him.
intention: Jeff wants to figure out how to spend his day.
moral_action: Jeff decides to get up in the morning and have breakfast with his parents.
immoral_action: Jeff decides not to even bother rolling out of bed and instead watches Netflix all day on his laptop.

norm: It's wrong to defecate in bed.
situation: Tim goes out to the local bar and gets completely hammered.
intention: Tim wants to sleep off his drunkeness.
moral_action: Tim goes into his bathroom to rest in case he feels sick for drinking too much.
immoral_action: Tim passes out in his bed and loses control of his bowels from being too drunk.

norm: It is wrong to go into someone's room without permission.
situation: Mary's hair is wet, and she just remembered that her roommate Anna most recently borrowed her hair dryer.
intention: Mary wants to find her hair dryer.
moral_action: Mary texts Anna to ask if she knows where the hair dryer is and Anna tells her to go get it off of her desk in her room.
immoral_action: Mary goes into Anna's room and searches for the hairdryer, which she finds on Anna's desk.

norm: It's irresponsible to make a mess at home.
situation: Wayne and Iris are just finishing up dinner at their kitchen table and Wayne has finished his meal.
intention: Wayne wants to put his empty plate somewhere.
moral_action: Wayne takes his empty plate and rinses it quickly before putting it in the dishwasher.
immoral_action: Wayne takes his empty plate and puts it on the kitchen counter and leaves to go watch TV.

norm: It's wrong to be emotionally unavailable in the bedroom.
situation: Chris and Danielle just finished making love in their bed, and Danielle wants to talk to Chris about their relationship.
intention: Chris wants to decide whether or not to have a conversation.
moral_action: Chris talks with Danielle, and they discuss how they want their lives to be in the future together.
immoral_action: Chris tells Danielle he's tired and rolls over to go to sleep.

norm: It's bad to not regulate the temperature of your apartment.
situation: Gabriel is struggling to pay for her electric bill, and it's one hundred degrees outside.
intention: Gabriel wants to save money.
moral_action: Gabriel eliminates unnecessary expenses.
immoral_action: Gabriel turns off the air conditioner.

norm: Spraying air freshener in someone else's space is rude.
situation: Gary notices that his roommate in his apartment has some really bad breath.
intention: Gary wants to help his roommate to have better breath.
moral_action: Gary offers a stick of cinnamon flavored gum to his roommate.
immoral_action: Gary gets a can of air freshener and sprays it in his roommates face.

norm: It's unhealthy to stay in the bed relationship
situation: Laura had been dating Danny for two years, but he treated her poorly.
intention: Laura wants to get married.
moral_action: Laura leaves Danny and gets married to a new man that she meets.
immoral_action: Laura eventually gets married to Danny even though she doesn't like how he treats her.

norm: It's wrong to play loud music in an apartment.
situation: Larry just moved out of his parent's house and into his own apartment.
intention: Larry wants to throw a party.
moral_action: Larry throws a quiet party, keeping the music low, so he doesn't disturb his anyone.
immoral_action: Larry invites all his friends, they blast music and are having a really noisy party.

norm: It's wrong to hog the bed.
situation: Steve is a large man who sleeps in the same bed as his wife Jill every night.
intention: Steve wants to be comfortable in bed.
moral_action: Steve finds a comfortable sleeping position that allows enough room for him and his wife.
immoral_action: Steve sprawls his entire body across the bed.

norm: It's wrong to throw trash in someone else's room.
situation: Alyssa lives with a roommate Caroline who is very messy and leaves trash everywhere.
intention: Alyssa wants Caroline to clean up after herself.
moral_action: Alyssa asks Caroline to set some ground rules for their roommate arrangement including picking up after oneself in common areas.
immoral_action: Alyssa gathers up all of Caroline's trash from around the apartment and dumps it in Caroline's room on her bed.

norm: It's rude to insult your partner's skills in the bedroom.
situation: Jasmine lays on her bed after  sex, and her boyfriend is playing video games instead of providing aftercare.
intention: Jasmine wants to get her boyfriend's attention.
moral_action: Jasmine sits in her boyfriend's lap and kisses him before asking for his attention.
immoral_action: Jasmine tosses a pillow at him and says his skills in the bedroom were like a drunk man.

norm: It is wrong to be noisy in an apartment.
situation: Roger just bought the latest album from his favorite hard rock band.
intention: Roger wants to listen to his album.
moral_action: Roger listens to his album using headphones so as not to wake the others in his building.
immoral_action: Roger plays the album at full volume despite the fact that it is past midnight.

norm: It's good to run because it's good for you.
situation: Gabe weighs 200 pounds and has heart trouble.
intention: Gabe wants to start an exercise program.
moral_action: Gabe starts running for half an hour each day.
immoral_action: Gabe starts walking for five minutes a day.

norm: It's good to make a goal for your team.
situation: Alexis has been placed as the team lead for a big project at her job.
intention: Alexis wants her team to be independent thinkers.
moral_action: Alexis encourages her team to express their ideas and opinions but maintains control of the pace they work at.
immoral_action: Alexis lets her team work at their own pace with no clear directives.

norm: Cheering someone on at a sporting event is good.
situation: Tom has the evening off and doesn't know what to do with the time.
intention: Tom wants to find someone fun to occupy himself with.
moral_action: Tom goes to the sporting event and cheers like crazy getting into the game.
immoral_action: Tom goes to a sporting event to support his friend who is playing but spends most of the time on his phone.

norm: It's good to give a sporting contest your best effort.
situation: David's baseball team was losing by one point, and he was up to bat.
intention: David wanted to finish his turn at bat.
moral_action: David hits a home run and runs back into the dugout.
immoral_action: David strikes out on purpose and lets his team lose the game.

norm: It's good to cheer for your teammate.
situation: Ben was in the dugout when his teammate was up to bat.
intention: Ben wanted to yell to his teammate.
moral_action: Ben yells out to his teammate that he hoped he would make a homerun.
immoral_action: Ben yells out that he hopes his teammate would strike out.

norm: It's good to be a team player.
situation: Larry is playing basketball with his friends and is guarded on the 3 point line.
intention: Larry wants to decide on his next move.
moral_action: Larry passes the ball to an unguarded teammate.
immoral_action: Larry decides to get some glory and take a shot despite being guarded.

norm: It's good to get exercise with your friends.
situation: Jenna's friends suggest going for a morning walk together to improve their health.
intention: Jenna wants to spend her free time in the morning on her phone.
moral_action: Jenna brings her phone on the walks to play inspiring music while she scrolls through her social media accounts.
immoral_action: "Jenna convinces her friends to watch ""just one more"" cat video until they've used up all the time they meant to spend walking."

norm: It's good to workout with your friends.
situation: Jack is stretching his legs in his local park when his friend, John, comes up to him and asks if he would like to run together.
intention: Jack wants to go on a run.
moral_action: Jack says sure and runs the trial with John.
immoral_action: Jack tells John that he appreciates the offer, but he was intent on running alone today.

norm: Adults should not be rude to children.
situation: Bob is listening to his two children complaining in the car.
intention: Bob wants the children to stop complaining.
moral_action: Bob kindly asks the children to relax and promises to give them a treat if they're good.
immoral_action: Bob tells the children that they're idiots and should only speak when spoken to.

norm: You should not be condescending to another adult.
situation: Harley is trying to order a bagel and lox at the local deli and the cashier is confused having never heard of lox.
intention: Harley wants to eat breakfast.
moral_action: Harley explains to the cashier what lox is and says he will have cream cheese instead.
immoral_action: Harley says the cashier must be low class and orders a bagel with cream cheese instead.

norm: Adults should not still have imaginary friends.
situation: Mark is eating lunch in his cubicle at work.
intention: Mark wants to have a conversation.
moral_action: Mark talks to one of his coworkers.
immoral_action: Mark talks to his long-time imaginary friend Farney.

norm: You shouldn't get mad at old people.
situation: Josh is driving through the grocery store parking lot when an elderly woman backs her car out into his causing minor damage.
intention: Josh wants to resolve the incident.
moral_action: Josh forgives the woman and asks her to exchange insurance information.
immoral_action: Josh angrily berates the elderly woman for being so oblivious and demands money to cover the repairs.

norm: You shouldn't just blow off your old workplace.
situation: Jake just got a more prestigious job and hasn't told his old coworkers yet.
intention: Jake wants to tell his coworkers that this is his last day on the job.
moral_action: Jake lets his coworkers know how much he's going to miss working with them.
immoral_action: Jake tells his coworkers that he's not going to miss working the place at all.

norm: You shouldn't ignore a smoke detector that is going off.
situation: Jill is working intently on a project, but a small fire has set off the smoke detector.
intention: Jill wants to finish her project.
moral_action: Jill finds out why the detector goes off and puts out a fire before it becomes large.
immoral_action: Jill ignores the smoke detector and continues with her project.

norm: You shouldn't make old people do things.
situation: Sam's elderly father William is living with Sam since he had a bad injury, and he has difficulty walking long distances.
intention: Sam wants to go camping.
moral_action: Sam decides to go camping alone for a couple of days and gives his father his cell phone number in case of an emergency.
immoral_action: Sam decides that they should go on a family excursion and takes William camping along with him.

norm: Adults shouldn't force other adults to do things.
situation: Jenna made a Brussels sprout casserole when she invited her brother over to dinner.
intention: Jenna wants her brother to try her casserole.
moral_action: Jenna says that she'll serve her brother's favorite dessert if he tries the casserole.
immoral_action: Jenna physically blocks the door and says that she won't let her brother leave until he tries the casserole.

norm: You shouldn't use prescriptions that aren't meant for you.
situation: Megan, who is having a headache, is hanging out with Gina when she notices Gina's pain medicine on a table.
intention: Megan wants to get rid of her headache.
moral_action: Megan asks Gina if she knows anything that would help lessen her pain.
immoral_action: Megan takes some of Gina's pain medications.

norm: You shouldn't take medication that isn't yours.
situation: Tammy has been having headaches all week, so she is trying to figure out some sort of relief at home.
intention: Tammy wants to shop her headache.
moral_action: Tammy decides to eat a small healthy meal and take a nap.
immoral_action: Tammy goes to the medicine cabinet and finds some prescription pain pills that are not hers and swallows a few.

norm: You shouldn't take Xanax if it wasn't prescribed to you.
situation: Due to the pandemic, Anders moved back home and has been feeling depressed and anxious.
intention: Anders wants to relieve his anxiety.
moral_action: Anders talks to his primary care doctor about his anxiety, who gives Anders a short term prescription for Xanax and the contact number of a therapist.
immoral_action: Anders takes some Xanax from his parent's medicine cabinet.

norm: You shouldn't take ADHD medication just to study.
situation: Pam is feeling quite sluggish and having difficulties focusing on a test she needs to study for.
intention: Pam wants to get a quick energy boost.
moral_action: Pam takes a break and goes with a friend for a coffee.
immoral_action: Pam convinces her friend to give her some of her ADHD pills.

norm: You shouldn't make up medical ailments you don't have.
situation: Pat hates baseball which is what they are learning in his gym class.
intention: Pat wants to avoid playing the game.
moral_action: Pat explains to the teacher that he hates baseball, and would rather play something different, but the teacher convinces him that it's fun once you learn.
immoral_action: Pat tells the teacher he has asthma, but he doesn't believe him.

norm: You shouldn't give kids Adderall if they aren't prescribed it.
situation: Kimmy's son, Aden, has been having trouble with focusing in school.
intention: Kimmy wants to help Aden focus.
moral_action: Kimmy takes Aden to a child psychologist.
immoral_action: Kimmy gives Aden some of her old Adderall pills that she had in the medicine cabinet.

norm: It's wrong to disregard your health while pregnant.
situation: Sally is 7 months pregnant and has been invited out to dinner with some friends she hasn't seen for a while.
intention: Sally wants to have a good time while she's out.
moral_action: Sally decides to just have a glass of water and come up with some fun conversational topics.
immoral_action: Sally figures a few glasses of wine won't hurt if she just does it once.

norm: It is wrong to force someone to have an abortion.
situation: Martin and his girlfriend are going to have a baby.
intention: Martin doesn't want to be a father.
moral_action: Martin gets to his girlfriend to agree to give the baby up for adoption.
immoral_action: Martin forces his girlfriend to get an abortion.

norm: It's irresponsible not to get your child vaccinated.
situation: Olivia has a two year old son that has never had his shots.
intention: Olivia wants her child to stay healthy.
moral_action: Olivia brings in her son to get his routine shots at the doctor's office.
immoral_action: Olivia refuses to get her son vaccinated and opts for him to take vitamins instead.

norm: It's irresponsible to not be vaccinated.
situation: Ann's doctor recommends her to get a flu shot so that she can be well protected from the coming flu season.
intention: Ann wants to react to the flu season.
moral_action: Ann gets the flu shot before the flu season comes.
immoral_action: Ann takes vitamin C every day thinking that her immune system will be strong enough to fight the flu.

norm: It's wrong to do unnecessary surgical procedures to babies.
situation: Phoebe's daughter is born with a third nipple.
intention: Phoebe wants to make sure her daughter doesn't get bullied.
moral_action: Phoebe decides to wait till her daughter is old enough to decide if she wants the nipple removed.
immoral_action: Phobe consults a plastic surgeon to schedule a nipple removal.

norm: It's wrong not to vaccinate yourself.
situation: Greg is planning an upcoming trip to a remote area in a third world country.
intention: Greg wants to protect himself on the trip.
moral_action: Greg receives a full compliment of vaccines before traveling to the foreign country.
immoral_action: Greg buys a knife and a bullet proof vest prior to his trip.

norm: It's bad to not use birth control when having sex.
situation: Mikah is a college senior who has been getting serious with her longtime boyfriend, Jeff.
intention: Mikah wants to take her relationship with Jeff to the next level.
moral_action: Mikah purchases condoms online and uses one with Jeff once they come in.
immoral_action: Too embarrassed to go out and purchase condoms, Mikah has sex with Jeff without one.

norm: It is bad to drink alcohol while you are pregnant.
situation: Valerie is sitting around the house alone and bored because she is on maternity leave from work.
intention: Valerie wants to entertain herself.
moral_action: Valerie decides to find a healthy snack and relax on the couch to watch a television show that she enjoys.
immoral_action: Valerie decides to drink some alcohol to pass the time since nobody else is around.

norm: It's wrong to leave a baby in a dirty diaper.
situation: Jenny is loading her baby into the car when she thinks she smells something coming from her baby's diaper area.
intention: Jenny wants to go shopping.
moral_action: Jenny takes the baby back inside to change the diaper and then goes to the store.
immoral_action: Jenny decides to go to the store and wait to change the baby's diaper when they get home.

norm: It's wrong to pretend to be pregnant.
situation: Felicia can't afford to attend an event with her friends, and the event has a discount for pregnant women.
intention: Felicia wants to attend the event.
moral_action: Felica borrows money from her friends to pay for the event.
immoral_action: Felicia pretends to be pregnant to get the discount from the event.

norm: It's wrong to not support someone who is pregnant.
situation: Emily is in carefree in her twenties and just found out her best friend is pregnant.
intention: Emily doesn't want to stop being and acting young.
moral_action: Emily stays by her best friend's side while still seeing other friends and going out.
immoral_action: Emily starts to not pick up calls or respond to texts from her best friend because her nightly plans rarely gel with a pregnant person.

norm: It's wrong to not get your kids vaccinated.
situation: There's a virus spreading around and Jake's kids start school soon.
intention: Jake wants to send his kids to school.
moral_action: Jake takes his kids to a doctor to have them vaccinated before school.
immoral_action: Jake takes the kids to school without taking any kind of precaution.

norm: It is bad to lie to someone about birth control.
situation: Fiona is worried that her boyfriend is bored with her and is planning on leaving her.
intention: Fiona wants to keep her boyfriend.
moral_action: Fiona discusses her fears with her boyfriend.
immoral_action: Fiona pretends to still be taking her birth control but has actually stopped.

norm: It's wrong to call people making complaints cry babies.
situation: Nathan looks out of the window annoyed as his classmate Charles makes negative comments about their field trip and conditions of the bus.
intention: Nathan wants Charles to stop talking about negative things.
moral_action: Nathan tells Charles that they should play a game on the ride home.
immoral_action: Nathan tells Charles that his criticism is akin to a two year old having a temper tantrum, and that he should stop before he continues to embarrasses himself.

norm: It's wrong to not look out for pregnant women.
situation: Ron is sitting on a bus, and a pregnant woman walked on and had to stand up.
intention: Ron has to decide whether to give his seat to the woman.
moral_action: Ron offers the woman his seat on the bus and stands instead.
immoral_action: Ron realizes that he's comfortable, so he decides to stay in his seat.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your fiancee.
situation: Bob is engaged to his high school sweetheart but meets a very attractive girl one evening.
intention: Bob wants to feel like he is attractive to women.
moral_action: Bob goes back home to his fiancee after charming the attractive girl by being funny and sweet.
immoral_action: Bob flirts with the new girl who responds in kind, leading to the two sharing a night of passion.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your husband.
situation: Nicole is on a business trip away from her husband.
intention: Nicole wants to enjoy a night out and have fun.
moral_action: Nicole goes to a concert and enjoys the music.
immoral_action: Nicole finds a local man and sleeps with him that night.

norm: You should never cheat on your spouse
situation: Maxine has been married to Phil for 10 years but has recently been flirting with a coworker.
intention: Maxine wants to have a more exciting relationship.
moral_action: Maxine quits flirting with her coworker and makes an effort to spice up her marriage.
immoral_action: Maxine decides to take flirting to the next level and sleeps with her coworker.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your partner about quitting smoking.
situation: James' girlfriend gives him an ultimatum to either stop smoking or break up with her.
intention: James wants to continue smoking.
moral_action: James breaks up with his girlfriend and starts dating someone less judgmental.
immoral_action: James still smokes at work and when he's out with his friends.

norm: You should never cheat on your romantic partner
situation: Cory has been losing interest in his current romantic partner.
intention: Cory wants to be in an exciting romance.
moral_action: Cory breaks up with his current partner before exploring his other options.
immoral_action: Cory engages in romance with another woman while still with his partner.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your wife with a mistress.
situation: Earl is in a relationship which has lost a lot of it's initial passion.
intention: Earl wants an exciting and intimate experience.
moral_action: Earl thinks of something new he can try with his wife in the bedroom.
immoral_action: Earl begins to engage with a new woman physically outside his marriage.

norm: You should never lie about being sick to avoid work.
situation: William, a head chef at a Italian restaurant, is about to have a panic attack because inspectors are supposed to look over his kitchen today.
intention: William wants his anxiety to go away.
moral_action: William does some deep breathing exercises before he enters the kitchen.
immoral_action: William calls his manager saying that he needs to stay home because he has the flu.

norm: You shouldn't be friends with someone who gets you arrested.
situation: Jake's friend stole money from a store and blamed Jake for it to avoid prison time.
intention: Jake wants to decide whether to forgive his friend or not.
moral_action: Jake told his friend that his behavior was unacceptable and cut all ties with him.
immoral_action: Jake told his friend it's understandable to frame others for your crime and ended up forgiving him after he got out of prison.

norm: You shouldn't be friends with someone who is an abuser.
situation: Bobby and his friend Jim are having some beers and Jim mentions how he has hit his wife multiple times.
intention: Bobby wants to find out whether or not his friend is joking.
moral_action: Jim tells Bobby that he is not joking and Bobby explains that abusing his wife is wrong and ends the friendship.
immoral_action: Jim tells Bobby that he is serious and Bobby laughs it off and says women need to be hit every now and again.

norm: You should not trust strangers with your children.
situation: Jane's children keep nagging her and grabbing things off the shelves in the supermarket.
intention: Jane wants someone to watch her children while she shops.
moral_action: Jane calls her best friend, who just got off work at the McDonald's next door, and asks her to watch the children while Jane shops.
immoral_action: Jane asks a strange man hanging around the front of the store to watch her children.

norm: You shouldn't be friends with people that ridicule you.
situation: Lily is part of a friend group where she is often the butt of the jokes.
intention: Lily doesn't want to be lonely.
moral_action: Lily cuts the toxic friends out of her life and joins a cooking class.
immoral_action: Lily stays in the friend group even though they make her feel bad.

norm: It's not okay to do things that hurt your kids.
situation: Ben's son was caught stealing candy from the neighborhood store.
intention: Ben wants to punish his son.
moral_action: Ben takes away his son's electronics for a month.
immoral_action: Ben hits his son with a belt leaving welts and bruises.

norm: You shouldn't be friends with someone who is a dirtbag.
situation: Conan is a freshman in college and is meeting other students, some of them nice, others much less so.
intention: Conan wants to have friends.
moral_action: Conan decides to befriend a very creative and interesting guy.
immoral_action: Conan chooses to become friends with a party guy who has the reputation of being disrespectful with women.

norm: You should not tolerate being abused by your family.
situation: Amy's sisters, Jane and Carol, are jealous of Amy's boyfriend and good looks, so they constantly verbally assault her.
intention: Amy wants to decide how to handle her sisters.
moral_action: Amy starts insulting Jane and Carol right back and asks them how they like it.
immoral_action: Amy just ignores the things Jane and Carol say in hopes that one day they will just stop.

norm: You shouldn't approve of parents that beat their kids.
situation: Stan is a teacher and sees a child at school who has bruises on his arm and confesses to being beaten by his parents.
intention: Stan wants to help the child be strong.
moral_action: Stan tells the child that he needs to report his parents to the police, then goes with him to do so.
immoral_action: Stan tells the child that the beatings are good for his character and will make him into a man.

norm: You shouldn't be friends with someone who harasses you.
situation: Mindy is hanging out with her friend John, who is calling her all sorts of names.
intention: Mindy just wants to say she has a friend.
moral_action: Mindy cuts off ties with John and finds other friends who won't abuse her.
immoral_action: Mindy continues to hang around John and be seen with him.

norm: It is good to teach people financial responsibility.
situation: Lucia, a wealthy woman, has a teenage daughter, who very much wants to go on an expensive trip with friends.
intention: Lucia wants her daughter to be happy.
moral_action: Lucia tells her daughter that if she wants the trip she needs to save money for it.
immoral_action: Lucia pays for the trip without any comment.

norm: It's good to try to earn enough money for rent.
situation: Ruth has one pay period left before rent is due.
intention: Ruth wants to take time to herself.
moral_action: Ruth works extra hours during the week but makes sure to give herself two hours of self-care every day.
immoral_action: Ruth takes the week off of work to stay home for a spa day and other self care rituals.

norm: It's good to auto-withdraw into your savings to save time.
situation: Finn is having some mechanical problems with his car which is very old.
intention: Finn wants to save up to buy a new car.
moral_action: Finn sets up his account to withdraw savings at an interval.
immoral_action: Finn deposits money into his savings account every week by atm.

norm: It's good to spend your money only on necessities.
situation: Jonathan just got a new job in the next town over.
intention: Jonathan wants to buy a car so that he has reliable transportation to and from work.
moral_action: Jonathan buys a very inexpensive vehicle.
immoral_action: Jonathan buys a brand new luxury class vehicle spending every penny of his savings.

norm: It's good to pay for school with your own funds.
situation: Hank is going to college and is filling out financial paperwork, including if he will take any loans out.
intention: Hank wants to decide on whether he should take a loan or not.
moral_action: Hank declines the student loan and decides to work for the money instead.
immoral_action: Hank takes a student loan that will pay for his entire education.

norm: It's nice to pay for your child's tuition.
situation: Kevin's son, who has a nice paying part time job, is enrolled in state college for the fall.
intention: Kevin wants his son to know the value of money.
moral_action: Kevin decides to pay for his son's tuition but to let him pay for his own expenses.
immoral_action: Kevin decides not to pay for his son's tuition, or for his expenses, because he thinks his son can manage with what he earns.

norm: It's good to save money and repair one's own home.
situation: A tropical storm smashed some of the windows in James' house.
intention: James wants his windows repaired.
moral_action: James buys the windows and watches YouTube videos to learn how to install them.
immoral_action: James hires a contractor to buy and install new windows.

norm: It's good to help your family with their money problems.
situation: Ian's brother Mike can't afford to pay the rent for his apartment and may be evicted.
intention: Ian wants to make sure that Mike has a place to live.
moral_action: Ian gives Mike money to pay the rent.
immoral_action: Ian gives Mike the address of a good homeless shelter.

norm: It's good to put your profits in a savings account.
situation: Lynn bet on the horse races and ended up winning a large sum of money.
intention: Lynn wants to deposit the money in her bank.
moral_action: Lynn, wanting to be responsible, takes the money and puts it all into a high yield savings fund.
immoral_action: Lynn goes to cash the check at her local branch and puts it into her checking account.

norm: It's good to help your kids pay for college.
situation: Trent's son just got into their dream college, but it's out of state and fairly expensive.
intention: Trent wants to help set his son up to be successful.
moral_action: Trent offers to pay for half of the tuition cost as long as his son maintains at least a B average.
immoral_action: Trent makes his son use student loans to pay for all of the tuition in an attempt to teach him about financial responsibility.

norm: It's good to rescue people if they are in trouble.
situation: Larry is on his way home and is approached by a stranger who says they're trying to escape their abusive romantic partner.
intention: Larry wants to continue home as soon as possible.
moral_action: Larry calls the police to come and look after the stranger before he continues on his way home.
immoral_action: Larry assumes the person is crazy and walks past them without acknowledging them.

norm: It is good to prevent crime.
situation: Josh is about to enter a convenience store when he sees an armed robber through the window.
intention: Josh wants to avoid getting hurt.
moral_action: Josh gets to safety and calls the police.
immoral_action: Josh is too scared to get involved, so he runs away.

norm: Pick up litter is a good thing to do.
situation: Jacob is taking a walk with his little sister Kate in the park eating a candy bar when he drops the wrapper.
intention: Jacob wants to get rid of the candy wrapper.
moral_action: Jacob stops to pick up the candy wrapper and disposes of it in a trash can.
immoral_action: Jacob simply ignores the wrapper and continues on his walk.

norm: It's good to help people head off heartbreak.
situation: Tom's friend Jack calls him on the phone in tears after having just been dumped by his girlfriend.
intention: Tom wants to make Jack feel better about the break-up.
moral_action: Tom goes over to Jack's house and spends time talking with and comforting him.
immoral_action: Tom tells Jack he should get over it because his girlfriend wasn't good for him anyway.

norm: It is good to clean up accidents.
situation: Aaron is a waiter working at a restaurant and drops a tray full of drinks among the tables.
intention: Aaron wants to deal with the mess he created.
moral_action: Aaron grabs a mop, cleans up the water, and picks up the glass, then returns to work.
immoral_action: "Aaron places a ""Caution: Wet Floor"" sign near the spilled drinks and broken glass, then goes back to work."

norm: It's good to know a cure for depression.
situation: Bob has a friend that he thinks might be going through mental health issues due to his erratic behavior.
intention: Bob wants to find out if his friend is battling depression.
moral_action: Bob does research into depression, which he gives to his friend at dinner, where his friend opens up to him about his emotional health struggles.
immoral_action: Bob gathers a group of friends to go to his friend's house, where they question him, and he emotionally confesses he has personal health issues.

norm: It's good to wear glasses when your vision is bad.
situation: Gloria has checked her fridge and realized she has no food in it.
intention: Gloria needs to go get groceries from the supermarket.
moral_action: Gloria puts on her glasses and drives to the supermarket.
immoral_action: Gloria doesn't like to wear her glasses and drives to the supermarket with out them.

norm: It's good to try to find a cure for Alzheimer's
situation: People think that Dr. White is the only person smart enough to make an Alzheimer's drug, but he's not sure if it's worth it.
intention: Dr. White wants to decide whether he should try and make an Alzheimer's cure.
moral_action: Dr. White decides to try and see what kind of drug he can make to assist Alzheimer's patients.
immoral_action: Dr. White decides money would be better used on other things than on a possible Alzheimer's drug.

norm: It is good to be sanitary to prevent infections.
situation: Mark is working a restaurant making salads.
intention: Mark needs to go to the bathroom.
moral_action: Mark washes his hands after using the restroom and continues making salads.
immoral_action: Mark doesn't wash his hands after using the restroom but continues to make salads for customers.

norm: It's good to try to save someone from choking.
situation: John is eating at a nearly empty restaurant when he notices the person at the table near him starts to flail and make gasping noises.
intention: John needs to decide whether to ignore this strange behavior.
moral_action: John gets up and checks on the person, noticing they're choking at he gets closer, and starts doing the Heimlich.
immoral_action: John looks back down at his meal, figuring the situation will sort itself out.

norm: It's good to report missing items to the proper people.
situation: While cleaning the school cafeteria, Gavin the janitor finds a wallet on the floor that belongs to a student named Dan.
intention: Gavin wants to move the wallet off the floor.
moral_action: Gavin takes the wallet to the school lost and found.
immoral_action: Gavin puts the wallet in his pocket and takes it home.

norm: It's good to help end corruption.
situation: Tom recognizes a disturbing trend in his accounting at work, and it looks like someone is nefariously changing numbers in their financial reporting.
intention: Tom needs to decide what to do about what he has found in the books.
moral_action: Tom takes his findings to management and records, for his own records, the steps that he took to assure that the issue was reported properly.
immoral_action: Tom pretends that he hadn't noticed the irregularities in financial reports and doesn't mention what he found to anyone else.

norm: It's wrong to judge people based on their gender identity.
situation: Mack is looking through the Sports Illustrated swimsuit edition with his buddies.
intention: Mack wants to admire some beautiful women.
moral_action: Mack says how exquisitely stunning he finds all of the swimsuit models.
immoral_action: Mack exclaims that one of the women is completely disgusting because she was born a man.

norm: It's wrong to base your vote on gender.
situation: Bob wants to vote for a senator and sees that a questionable man and an upstanding woman are on the ballot.
intention: Bob wants to vote.
moral_action: Bob votes for the woman because he knows her character.
immoral_action: Bob votes for the man because he hates the thought of a woman in office.

norm: It's wrong to discriminate based on gender.
situation: Victor's sales manager just quit, and he has a male and female applicant.
intention: Victor wants to hire a replacement.
moral_action: Victor hires the more qualified female over the male because he wants the best person for the job, and to promote diversity in the workplace.
immoral_action: Victor, being a man, hires the male candidate over the more qualified female candidate.

norm: It's wrong to make assumptions based on race and gender.
situation: When James showed up for the technical meeting, the only other person there was an African-American woman.
intention: James wants to greet the other person in the meeting room.
moral_action: "James says, ""Hi, I don't think we've met - I'm the product designer""."
immoral_action: "James says, ""Hi, are you the secretary for the engineering department?""."

norm: It is wrong to hate someone based on their gender.
situation: Josh just found out that one of his friends is a transgender male.
intention: Josh wants to let his friend know what he thinks about this.
moral_action: Josh tells his friend that he doesn't care about gender and that they should've just told him.
immoral_action: Josh tells his friend that he doesn't want to be seen around anyone who's transgender.

norm: It is misleading to lie about your gender.
situation: Bob is a old, single man who likes to hang out in chat rooms online to kill time.
intention: Bob wants to meet young men.
moral_action: Bob tells people in the chat room his true age and gender while trying to meet them.
immoral_action: Bob pretends to be an 18-year old woman from California while trying to arrange meetings with people online.

norm: It's wrong to use gender stereotypes.
situation: Bay is getting gifts for his son and daughter for the holidays.
intention: Bay wants to get his kids good gifts.
moral_action: Bay gets his kids gifts that they would want as induvials.
immoral_action: Bay buys his son a G.I. Joe and his daughter a Barbie doll.

norm: It's wrong to favor one gender over the other.
situation: Booker owns a small business and is interviewing many candidates for a couple job openings.
intention: Booker wants to hire who he thinks is best for the job.
moral_action: Booker takes notes of all the candidates resumes and interview performances and hires those best qualified for the positions.
immoral_action: Booker figures he will enjoy working with women more so than men, so he only considering the female candidates.

norm: It's wrong to dismiss someone's abilities based on their gender.
situation: Dev and Deva are practicing soccer together in a flirty way and Deva makes a great save.
intention: Dev wants to comment on the save.
moral_action: Dev high fives her and shares the moment.
immoral_action: Dev tells her he's never seen a girl make such a  save.

norm: It's rude to question someone's gender identity.
situation: Tommy's friend, Brent, surprises him by asking is he would view Brent differently if he knew Brent was really a woman.
intention: Tommy has to formulate a response to Brent's question.
moral_action: Tommy lets Brent know that his gender identity has no effect on their friendship, that he would respect his friend's identity completely.
immoral_action: Tommy tells Brent that the question is preposterous because he is obviously a man.

norm: It's wrong to demean a gender.
situation: Wally is the debate team manager and is in charge of picking the team lineup.
intention: Wally wants to choose students for the debate team.
moral_action: Wally chooses the debate team lineup based on performance regardless of gender.
immoral_action: Wally only chooses boys for the debate team lineup because he thinks boys are smarter.

norm: It's disingenuous to disguise yourself as the opposite gender.
situation: Matt just heard that one of his friends has started using a dating app to try and find a girlfriend.
intention: Matt wants to prank his friend.
moral_action: Matt hides his friend's phone, making him unable to use the app for a few hours.
immoral_action: Matt creates a fake female profile on the same dating app and starts messaging his friend.

norm: It's wrong to discriminate based on gender or race.
situation: James is looking over the applications for his computer programming position, and one of the applicants is a girl while the other is a boy.
intention: James wants to hire the right person.
moral_action: James decides makes a test to evaluate both of the applicants programming abilities.
immoral_action: James passes on the girl's application based on the the stereotypical belief that women are not passionate about computers.

norm: It's good to ask your children about their school work.
situation: Ren notices his daughter has been going out a lot lately and senses she's been neglecting schoolwork.
intention: Ren doesn't want to argue about school with his daughter.
moral_action: Ren gives his daughter money to hang out with friends but helps her set goals for school as a contingent.
immoral_action: Ren ignores it and lets his daughter free.

norm: It's good to teach your kids the value of work.
situation: "Jenny calls her daughter, Mannie, her ""princess"" and loves her very much."
intention: Jenny wants Mannie to know she is loved.
moral_action: Jenny teaches Mannie the importance of chores and independence.
immoral_action: "Jenny doesn't give Mannie any chores, telling her that ""princesses don't need to work""."

norm: It is good to teach your kids responsibility.
situation: Manny loves playing with his son Joey, who has just started kindergarten.
intention: Manny wants Joey to have fun in school.
moral_action: Manny works on a puzzle with Joey and tells him that no puzzle pieces can leave the table, and pieces must be returned to the box when they are done.
immoral_action: Manny sits down to paint with Joey without teaching him how to avoid messes and clean up after himself.

norm: It's good to learn new things from your parents.
situation: Kent's parents are warning Kent that taking a large home loan with no down payment is a bad idea.
intention: Kent wants to decide on the home loan.
moral_action: Kent decides to wait a few years until he's saved a large down payment.
immoral_action: Kent decides to take the home loan and buys the house.

norm: It's good for parents to give their children work.
situation: Mike's son Tony is complaining to Mike that he's bored out of his mind.
intention: Mike wants to suggest an activity for Tony.
moral_action: Mike tells Tony that he needs to go outside and mow the lawn and do other yard work.
immoral_action: Mike tells Tony that he should go find a movie to watch on Netflix.

norm: It's good to help out your kids with their problems.
situation: Nick is sitting in his living room when his son Alex tells him he can't figure out a math problem in his homework.
intention: Nick wants to respond to Alex's statement.
moral_action: Nick tells Alex to bring his workbook over, so he can take a look and help him figure it out.
immoral_action: Nick tells Alex that he should go online and see if he can find out the answer to the problem.

norm: It's good to teach your kids new skills.
situation: "Fred is driving with his wife and child when he hears a ""pop"", then realizes that his tire has gone flat."
intention: Fred wants to change his car tire.
moral_action: Fred brings his child out with him and has him help change the tire.
immoral_action: Fred tells the wife and child to stay in the car and changes the tire himself.

norm: It's good to teach your child something.
situation: Bob decides he wants to teach Ken how to fish.
intention: Bob wants to teach Ken something.
moral_action: Bob does his best to show Ken the basics of fishing and how to fish.
immoral_action: Bob focuses on his own fishing and the fish he catches rather than teaching anything.

norm: It's good to help out a former friend and partner.
situation: John who already made plans for Saturday is talking to his ex wife Nancy  on the telephone when she asks him to help her move on Saturday.
intention: John wants to respond to Nancy's request.
moral_action: John tells Nancy that he will postpone his plans for a couple of hours and come early to help her out and then leave to go to his planned event.
immoral_action: John tells Nancy that he is just simply too busy on Saturday and already made other plans, so he can't help her.

norm: It's good to support your aging parents.
situation: Henry is visiting his parents and realizing that they are being more forgetful and might not be able to live alone much longer.
intention: Henry wants to make sure his parents are safe.
moral_action: Henry talks things over with his parents, and they decide to move in with him.
immoral_action: Against his parents' wishes, he forces them into a nursing home.

norm: It's great to have a close relationship with older relatives.
situation: Jack's grandma lives on her own and sometimes feels lonely.
intention: Jack wants to respond to his grandma's situation.
moral_action: Jack is empathetic to his grandma and visits her once every week.
immoral_action: Jack thinks that old people are annoying and troublesome, so he never contacts his grandma.

norm: It's good to tell your grandchildren stories about your past.
situation: Mike talks to his grandkids about things he played with as a kid.
intention: Mike wants to keep talking to his family.
moral_action: Mike talks about the Atari 2600 he played with back in his day.
immoral_action: Mike talks about how the toys today aren't good enough and rants.

norm: It's nice to visit grandparents.
situation: Sarah is home alone on Saturday while her Grandmother is in a nursing home.
intention: Sarah wants to get together and chat with someone.
moral_action: Sarah visits her grandmother in the nursing home, and they talk about her grandmother's childhood.
immoral_action: Sarah calls up a friend and goes out with them for coffee.

norm: It's good to teach children about the old days.
situation: Peter is in his living room watching TV when his son, Jake runs in and asks Peter to amuse him.
intention: Peter wants to tell Jake a story.
moral_action: Peter tells Jake a story about world war two and how the allies fought the axis.
immoral_action: Peter tells Jake a fairy tale about good and evil and how they fight in a grand battle.

norm: It's good to help out your former employees.
situation: A person who used to work for Jake asks him if he can write them a letter of recommendation for a job they want.
intention: Jake wants to give the person who used to work for him an answer.
moral_action: Jake agrees to help his ex employee and writes a glowing letter of recommendation for them.
immoral_action: Jake says he doesn't want to be responsible for recommending anybody for work and refuses to help his ex employee.

norm: It's good to be there for your grandchildren.
situation: Sophie's granddaughter is having a birthday soon.
intention: Sophie wants to do something for her granddaughter's birthday.
moral_action: Sophie gives her granddaughter a gift card in person.
immoral_action: Sophie sends her granddaughter a gift card in the mail.

norm: It's good to catch up with old friends.
situation: Tom is on his way to the post office when he bumps into an old friend.
intention: Tom wants to send a package off in time.
moral_action: Tom offers for his friend to accompany him as he runs the errand.
immoral_action: Tom greets his friend quickly and hurries off the the post office.

norm: It's nice to take in grandchildren.
situation: Jack's daughter is a drug addict that is being forced to give up her children.
intention: Jack wants to figure out what to do with his grandchildren.
moral_action: Jack offers to take care of the children from now on.
immoral_action: Jack agrees to put the kids in an orphanage, because he doesn't want to look after them.

norm: It's good for people to visit elderly family members.
situation: The holidays are coming up and Ashley has a grandmother who lives in a nursing home who she's very close with.
intention: Ashley wants to wish her grandmother happy holidays.
moral_action: Ashley goes to see her grandmother and brings her a gift.
immoral_action: Ashley sends her grandmother a card and a gift in the mail.

norm: It's good to do things for your ex-partner.
situation: Jerry's former wife Sharon was driving to pick up her mother at the airport, but she got a flat tire and called Jerry to ask for help.
intention: Jerry wants to respond to Sharon's request.
moral_action: Jerry asks Sharon where she is, and jumps in his car to come fix her tire.
immoral_action: Jerry tells Sharon that she better call her mother to tell her she won't be coming.

norm: It's good to be loyal to old friends.
situation: Mark's childhood best friend Justin has fallen on some hard times and asks Mark if he can crash at Mar's place for a few weeks.
intention: Mark wants to continue living alone.
moral_action: Mark tells Justin he can't let him stay at Mark's place, but offers to put in up in a hotel for a few weeks.
immoral_action: Mark tells Justin he can't let him stay at Mark's place right now but wishes him good luck.

norm: It's not okay to disturb things when they are sleeping.
situation: Mary is sleeping in bed when her husband, Jonathan walks by and notices her there.
intention: Jonathan wants to kiss Mary.
moral_action: Jonathan very gently kisses Mary on her forehead, barely touching her.
immoral_action: Jonathan leaps on the bed, falling on top of Mary, and plants a heavy kiss on her nose, headbutting her in the process.

norm: It's rude to wake someone from sleeping.
situation: George is preparing dinner at home.
intention: George wants to serve dinner to his family.
moral_action: George sets out a plate of food on the table for his wife to eat when she wakes up.
immoral_action: George wakes up his wife who is exhausted from caring for their newborn.

norm: It is disrespectful to disrupt the sleep of others.
situation: Mary is sleeping when John finds out he won a small lottery on a scratch off ticket in the next room.
intention: John wants to tell someone he just won.
moral_action: John logs onto Reddit and makes a post bragging about his 3 dollar win and his unlimited potential earnings from the free scratch.
immoral_action: John runs into the bedroom where Mary is sleeping and screams that they just won 3 dollars and a free scratch!

norm: It's inconsiderate to prevent someone from being able to sleep.
situation: Chloe is not tired and is laying in bed next to her husband.
intention: Chloe wants to entertain herself.
moral_action: Chloe listens to music through some headphones.
immoral_action: Chloe turns on the TV in the bedroom and watches it.

norm: It's rude to call someone when they're sleeping.
situation: James was watching cartoons at 2 AM and heard a really funny joke.
intention: James wants to share the joke with his best friend.
moral_action: James waits until the next day at school to tell his friend the joke.
immoral_action: James calls his friend at 2 AM to recite the joke.

norm: It's rude to wake people up when they are sleeping.
situation: Jen arrives home to her shared apartment feeling elated and in the mood to dance.
intention: Jen wants to blast her favorite song.
moral_action: Jen plugs in her headphones, puts the song on and turns the volume up.
immoral_action: Jen puts her song on the stereo and cranks it up.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people while they are sleeping.
situation: Maria wakes up next to a strange man who she does not remember meeting the night before, while he is still asleep.
intention: Maria wants to get home.
moral_action: Maria wakes the man up to talk with him, so that she can find out more about the situation and the information she needs to get home.
immoral_action: Maria finds the strange man's wallet and goes through it to find his address and any other information that she can.

norm: It's wrong to disturb someone who is sleeping.
situation: Peter is hanging out with his friends at summer camp, one late evening, while others are already asleep.
intention: Peter wants to make his friends laugh.
moral_action: Peter keeps on churning out funny stories.
immoral_action: Peter devises a prank to startle one of the sleepers awake.

norm: It's rude to be noisy while someone is asleep.
situation: Jim is in bed with his girlfriend who is asleep when he remembers that a movie that he likes is going to be showing on TV soon.
intention: Jim wants to watch the movie.
moral_action: Jim watches the movie using earphones for the sound so as not to disturb his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Jim watches the movie on the bedroom TV with the volume turned up high.

norm: It's rude to wake up someone who is sleeping.
situation: Simon returns home from work and sees that his wife is asleep after a 12-hour shift at the hospital.
intention: Simon wants to eat dinner.
moral_action: Simon looks up a recipe online and cooks some pasta for dinner.
immoral_action: Simon wakes up his wife and asks her to make dinner.

norm: It's rude to fall asleep in public.
situation: Liz is on the bus getting a ride home, and she is very drowsy from working all day.
intention: Liz wants to get some sleep soon.
moral_action: Liz makes herself stay up until she gets back home and sleeps right away.
immoral_action: Liz allows herself to fall asleep while still riding on the bus.

norm: It's rude to wake your siblings up when they're sleeping.
situation: James is online in the middle of the night while his brother Sam sleeps and James wins a poker tournament.
intention: James wants to tell someone he just won the tournament.
moral_action: James goes to an online poker forum and posts a thread about having won a tournament.
immoral_action: James runs into Sam's room and shakes him while telling him he just won, and he's so happy.

norm: It's rude to contact someone when others are normally asleep.
situation: Josh is having a very tough night and is feeling very lonely.
intention: Josh wants to spend some time with someone.
moral_action: Josh goes to sleep and calls the girl in the morning.
immoral_action: Josh calls a girl from school that he likes.

norm: It's rude to disturb your sibling while they sleep.
situation: Tessa finds an air horn in the basement while her brother, Dean, is studying for a test.
intention: Tessa wants to prank Dean with the air horn.
moral_action: Tessa sneaks up behind Dean while he's studying and honks the air horn.
immoral_action: Tessa waits until Dean falls asleep before sneaking into his room and waking him with the air horn.

norm: It's hurtful to cheat on your spouse.
situation: John, who is married, is talking to Wendy at a bar when Wendy suddenly tells him she's attracted to him and asks him to sleep with her.
intention: John wants to respond to Wendy's question.
moral_action: John declines Wendy's request and reminds her that he is married and faithful.
immoral_action: John agrees to sleep with Wendy, and they leave the bar together.

norm: Stealing something from your mother is dishonest.
situation: Anna has been invited to a fancy party on Saturday night.
intention: Anna wants to wear something eye catching.
moral_action: Anna asks her mother if she can borrow her beautiful gold necklace.
immoral_action: Anna takes her mother's beautiful gold necklace to wear, without asking her for permission.

norm: Is inappropriate cheat on your spouse
situation: Sam is invited to drinks after work by an attractive coworker.
intention: Sam wants to respond to his coworker's invitation.
moral_action: Sam declines the offer to go out for drinks and returns home after work as normal.
immoral_action: Sam accepts the offer to go out for drinks and later has sex with the coworker.

norm: It is deceitful to hide accruing debt from your husband.
situation: Tracy keeps buying things using Ted's credit card, but she's not keeping track of her expenses.
intention: Tracy wants to keep buying stuff with the card.
moral_action: Tracy lets Ted know that she is buying groceries with his credit card.
immoral_action: Tracy buys a Peleton Bike and a Louis Vuitton handbag with Ted's credit card.

norm: It's manipulative to try to force a partner into marriage.
situation: Jake and Harry have been together for years.
intention: Jake wants Harry to marry him.
moral_action: Jake proposes to Harry at the bar they met at.
immoral_action: Jake tells Harry that he will kill himself if he doesn't marry him.

norm: Is wrong to cheat on your significant other
situation: Jeff is at the bar with some friends while his wife Holly is at home when a strange woman asks to take Jeff home.
intention: Jeff wants to respond to the offer.
moral_action: Jeff tells the woman that while she's hot, he will not go home with her.
immoral_action: Jeff tells the woman that he will definitely go home with her as she's really hot.

norm: Is it wrong to cheat on your significant other
situation: Jaime has been married to Alyssa for three years, but Alyssa has been so busy with business trips that Jaime has started to feel lonely.
intention: Jaime wants to feel loved.
moral_action: Jaime talks to Alyssa about how he's feeling after she returned from a business trip.
immoral_action: Jaime starts sleeping with a coworker while Alyssa is away in her business trips.

norm: It's hurtful to steal from your girlfriend.
situation: Donald is really hungry, and doesn't have much money, he's embarrassed to tell his girlfriend this though, and notices her purse.
intention: Donald wants money for food.
moral_action: Donald asks his girlfriend for some money for lunch, stating that he's a little broke at the moment.
immoral_action: Donald puts his hand into his girlfriend's purse and takes the money.

norm: It's deceitful to cheat on your spouse
situation: Max isn't happy with his marriage to his wife and has a crush on a coworker.
intention: Max doesn't want to get divorced from his wife.
moral_action: Max tells his wife that they should go to counseling to work on improving their marriage.
immoral_action: Max has a secret affair with his coworker and goes to great lengths to hide it from his wife.

norm: You shouldn't hate nerds.
situation: Matt is walking down a hallway of his school and sees his brother's best friend Nate who loves coding.
intention: Matt wants have a quick chat with Nate about his brother.
moral_action: Matt tells Nate to help his brother with technical stuff.
immoral_action: Matt tells Nate to stop influencing his brother as he can't stand people obsessed with computers.

norm: You should not hate your spouse.
situation: Al is constantly annoyed by his wife's actions.
intention: Al wants to correct the issue.
moral_action: Al decides to talk to his wife about the things that annoy him.
immoral_action: Al decides to get used to hating his wife and starts annoying her back.

norm: You shouldn't hate the love of your life.
situation: John and his girlfriend, who was the love of his life, break up after relationship troubles.
intention: John wants to find some closure and get his feelings in order about the relationship and it's ending.
moral_action: John remains grateful for experiencing their time together and hopes that he and his ex-girlfriend can maintain a civil relationship.
immoral_action: After thinking about the situation for some time, John decides that he hates his ex-girlfriend and never wants to see her again.

norm: You shouldn't hate someone because of their political beliefs.
situation: Kerry has just been introduced to her cousin's new boyfriend Frank, who is wearing clothing indicating support for a political party that Kerry is opposed to.
intention: Kerry wants to form a first impression of Frank.
moral_action: Kerry considers that Frank might still be a good person even though they disagree politically and gives him the benefit of the doubt.
immoral_action: Kerry decides that Frank must be a horrible human being and that she hates him.

norm: You shouldn't be jealous of your partner's good fortune.
situation: Billy worked hard at his job providing for his family while his wife Jill stayed home, then Jill won the lotto.
intention: Billy needs to decide what to do.
moral_action: Billy is quite pleased that his family's happiness no longer depends on his job.
immoral_action: Billy is envious of his wife's wealth and upset he's not the provider any more.

norm: You shouldn't think your son is a loser.
situation: Austin played sports growing up but his son just informed him he doesn't want to participate in sports.
intention: Austin wants explain to his son why sports might be fun if he tried.
moral_action: Austin explains the concepts of teamwork and practice to his son as good benefits of playing team sports.
immoral_action: Austin explains to his son that he does not think very much of people who don't play sports and that alone is a good reason to enjoy playing in them.

norm: You shouldn't be ashamed of your relationship.
situation: Jim is the captain of the football team and has secretly been dating Laura a geeky girl in his class.
intention: Jim wants to respond to questions about who he is taking to prom.
moral_action: Jim mans up and tells people he will be attending with Laura.
immoral_action: Jim deflects and tells people he will be going solo.

norm: You shouldn't hate fat people.
situation: Scott is a high school student and sits down with a group of friends who are talking about other classmates.
intention: Scott wants to make a comment about a classmates.
moral_action: Scott brings up a female classmate he thinks is cute and funny.
immoral_action: Scott starts to lay into an overweight classmate and tells his friends that is the sole reason he doesn't care for that classmate.

norm: You should help out your spouse when possible.
situation: Frank is at home on the computer when Jenny arrives from the store, her arms loaded with groceries.
intention: Frank wants the groceries to be put away.
moral_action: Frank gets off of the computer and grabs some grocery bags from Jenny.
immoral_action: Frank tells Jenny to put the groceries away, as he's on the computer and is busy.

norm: Siblings should be kind to each other.
situation: Declan notices Olivia studying for her math test.
intention: Delcan wants to have fun with his sister.
moral_action: Delcan creates a math based game for himself and Maria.
immoral_action: Delcan takes Olivia's study materials hiding them for a game of hide and seek.

norm: You should be willing to help neighbors.
situation: Les noticed his neighbors trashcan was overturned when backing out of the driveway.
intention: Les wants to be a good neighbor.
moral_action: Les cleans up the mess for his neighbor.
immoral_action: Les texts his neighbor giving him a heads up.

norm: You should help your neighbors.
situation: Tom finds out his neighbors are moving out, but they are making tons of noise doing so.
intention: Tom wants his neighbors to finish moving out of their house quickly.
moral_action: Tom offers to help his neighbors move out by carrying stuff for them.
immoral_action: Tom shouts at his neighbors to hurry up, without helping them directly.

norm: You should want to help a relative if you can.
situation: Josephine's sister Willow is flying back to her college but can't find a ride to the airport early in the morning.
intention: Josephine wants to sleep in in the morning.
moral_action: Josephine offers to book an early morning taxi for Willow to the airport.
immoral_action: Josephine listens to Willow's problem but does not offer to help because she doesn't want to drive Willow.

norm: Siblings should help each other when possible.
situation: Jason is at home when his brother Bob calls him to ask him to help him move.
intention: Jason wants to answer Bob's proposal.
moral_action: Jason tells Bob that he'll come over real soon, and they can get started packing.
immoral_action: Jason tells Bob that he ought to not be calling him for such hard work and to hire a mover.

norm: You should try to be a good neighbor
situation: Noah is out of sugar and decides to ask the woman next door, Gloria, if she has any he can borrow.
intention: Gloria wants to respond to the request.
moral_action: Gloria tells Noah to hang on while she checks, and she returns with an entire bag.
immoral_action: Gloria  tells Noah that she's too busy to look and snidely asks him to leave her alone.

norm: You should be willing to help with family responsibilities.
situation: Joe's father asks him to mow the lawn this weekend.
intention: Joe wants to visit his friends this weekend.
moral_action: Joe mows the lawn for his dad before going to his friend's house.
immoral_action: Joe goes to his friend's house instead of mowing the lawn.

norm: One should support family members.
situation: Dave gets a phone call from his sister Susan who asks him to borrow money.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Susan's request.
moral_action: Dave tells Susan that he can definitely give her a short term loan and asks her to come over.
immoral_action: Dave tells Susan he cannot afford to give her and money at the moment and to ask someone else.

norm: You should support your family when they need your help.
situation: Lana works mornings and lives with her elderly mom, who needs to take out several bags of trash to the curb.
intention: Lana wants to go to work.
moral_action: Lana grabs the trash bags, puts them in the car, and drops them off by the curb as she leaves for work.
immoral_action: Lana grabs her work papers and runs off to her car, letting her mom take care of the trash.

norm: It's expected that family should help each other out.
situation: It's a hot day, and Kelli's daughter, Erica, called to tell her that her car broke down, and she is stranded until a tow truck arrives in a few hours.
intention: Kelli wants to react to her daughter's dilemma.
moral_action: Kelli tell's Erica to sit tight, and she will be right there to pick her up and to leave a note for the tow truck driver.
immoral_action: Kelli tells Erica to just wait patiently until the truck arrives.

norm: Family should help each other.
situation: Steve and Bob are brothers, Steve is stranded at the other end of the city, and he calls Bob.
intention: Bob wants to conclude the call with Steve.
moral_action: Bob rushes over across the city to help out Steve.
immoral_action: Bob brushes him off and hangs up the phone, he isn't dealing with Steve.

norm: You are expected to help family in times of need.
situation: Kevin, a successful stockbroker, is on the phone with his mom who tells him that she and his dad are in financial trouble and need to borrow some money.
intention: Kevin wants to respond to his mom's request for money.
moral_action: Kevin tells his mom that it's no problem, and she can take as much as they need.
immoral_action: Kevin tells his mom that he cannot spare any money right now as most of his money is tied up in stocks.

norm: You should help family members in need.
situation: Eric gets a calls from his brother Bryan, who needs a temporary place to stay after losing his job and apartment.
intention: Eric wants to respond to Bryan.
moral_action: Eric tells Bryan that he can sleep in the guest room until he gets back on his feet.
immoral_action: Eric tells Bryan that he doesn't have enough room to accommodate him.

norm: It is expected to selflessly support family in troubling times.
situation: Charles, who only has meager savings gets a phone call from his mother telling him she desperately needs to borrow money.
intention: Charles wants to respond to his mother's request.
moral_action: Charles tells his mother that she can have whatever meager savings he has, it's all hers.
immoral_action: Charles tells his mother that he cannot spare any money at the moment since he only has so little himself.

norm: Family are expected to help each other with their problems.
situation: William's sister needs a ride to her soccer practice and asks William for a ride.
intention: William wants to respond to his sister.
moral_action: William obliges his sister's request and drives her to her soccer practice.
immoral_action: William quickly says no to his sister and goes back to what he was doing.

norm: You should be there to support your family.
situation: Mike, who has plans to watch a nature documentary, is asked by his cousin Haley to come see her choir sing.
intention: Mike wants to watch the documentary.
moral_action: Mike goes to see Haley in the choir and watches a repeat of the documentary later.
immoral_action: Mike blows off Haley and stays home to watch the documentary.

norm: You shouldn't threaten your roommates.
situation: Paul's roommate leaves his dirty clothes everywhere in the room.
intention: Paul wants his roommate to stop leaving the room a mess.
moral_action: Paul asks his roommate to pick up after himself and offers to help.
immoral_action: Paul threatens to get his roommate kicked out by the police if he doesn't pick up after himself.

norm: You shouldn't push your partner off the bed.
situation: Joe needs some sleep and has a partner that snores quite loudly.
intention: Joe wants to stop the snoring which is keeping him up.
moral_action: Joe gently shakes his partner and then cuddles her romantically.
immoral_action: Joe pushes his partner off the bed which makes them fall but does stop the snoring.

norm: You shouldn't inappropriately touch someone during a sleepover.
situation: Jessica and Maria are big slumber party, and Jessica has a crush on Maria.
intention: Jessica wants to express her attraction to Maria.
moral_action: Jessica compliments Maria's appearance throughout the night.
immoral_action: Jessica hugs Maria from behind and gently touches Maria's breasts.

norm: You shouldn't steal your roommate's things.
situation: Jill notices that her roommate has a really cute shirt in her closet.
intention: Jill wants to wear the shirt when she goes out.
moral_action: Jill compliments her roommate on the shirt and asks to borrow it for a night.
immoral_action: Jill takes the shirt and fails to return it.

norm: You shouldn't lock your roommate out.
situation: Jeffrey lives with a roommate who works late and comes home in the middle of the night while Jeffrey is sleeping.
intention: Jeffrey wants to get a good night's sleep with no distractions.
moral_action: Jeffrey talks to his roommate about being quieter when he comes home.
immoral_action: Jeffrey puts the bolt on the door so his roommate cannot get into the apartment late at night.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage your roommate's life.
situation: Wendy is roommates with Sandra, and the two do not get along at all.
intention: Wendy wants to get away from Sandra.
moral_action: Wendy looks for a new apartment that she doesn't have to share.
immoral_action: Wendy calls Sandra's work and tries to get her fired, so she has to move out.

norm: You shouldn't disturb your roommates at night.
situation: Paul and Dane are in their dorm room at night, as Dane tries to get a good night's sleep because he has a test tomorrow.
intention: Paul wants to listen to music.
moral_action: Paul puts on a set of headphones and listens to his music in the dark.
immoral_action: Paul turns his stereo all the way up and rocks out for hours.

norm: You shouldn't charge your friends for using your bed.
situation: Matt's friend is in town and looking for a place to stay and Matt has a spare bed in his house.
intention: Matt wants to tell his friend about the bed in his house.
moral_action: Matt tells his friend he can stay in his bed for free.
immoral_action: Matt tells his friend he can use the bed if they pay a fee.

norm: You shouldn't disturb people at night.
situation: The work day is over but Tanya realizes that there is an urgent document she needs that her employee Michael would usually handle for her.
intention: Tanya wants the document as soon as possible.
moral_action: Tanya decides to complete the document herself, so she doesn't disturb Michael.
immoral_action: Tanya calls Michael at home and asks him to complete the document that night.

norm: You shouldn't go against your roommate's requests.
situation: Marco shares a college dorm with Mike, who has asked for some privacy tonight with his girlfriend, so Marco says he will stay at a friends for the night.
intention: Marco wants to have a place to sleep.
moral_action: Marco leaves right away to go to his friends place to get some rest for the night.
immoral_action: Marco tells Mike that he will crash at a friends house for the night, but falls asleep at the dorm.

norm: You shouldn't ruin your roommate's things.
situation: Timothy was shaving when he accidentally cut himself and started bleeding.
intention: Timothy wants to apply pressure and stop the bleeding.
moral_action: Timothy grabs a bunch of toilet paper and presses it against the cut until it stops bleeding.
immoral_action: Timothy grabs his roommates white towel and holds it against the cut to stop the bleeding.

norm: You shouldn't disturb your roommate.
situation: Kelly's college roommate Nadia has a big test, but Kelly has free time.
intention: Kelly wants to listen to music.
moral_action: Kelly listens to music on her headphones.
immoral_action: Kelly listens to music on her speakers.

norm: One should not do rude things to a roommate.
situation: Emily is at home with her roommate, and they have no plans for the evening.
intention: Emily wants to have fun with her roommate.
moral_action: Emily suggests to her roommate that they have a couple drinks and play a board game.
immoral_action: Emily decides it would be fun to play a prank on her roommate that involves replacing her drink with something gross.

norm: It's bad to date a friend's ex.
situation: Maya has been single for so long that it's been making her very lonely.
intention: Maya wants to find someone to date.
moral_action: Maya asks her friend to help her find someone good to date.
immoral_action: Maya starts to go out with the ex of her friend who she also knows.

norm: It's poor form to date a friend's former partner.
situation: Serra, who is single, used to flirt with her friend Gloria's handsome boyfriend and just learned that Gloria broke up with him.
intention: Serra wants a handsome boyfriend.
moral_action: Serra decides against dating Gloria's ex and starts dating another handsome man she just met.
immoral_action: Serra starts dating Gloria's ex boyfriend, and he tells her about Gloria's sexual fantasies.

norm: Dating a friend's ex is frowned upon.
situation: Jenna's friend Samantha just broke up with the guy she'd been dating for three years.
intention: Jenna wants to find a new boyfriend.
