moral_action: Jenna creates an account on OkCupid to find a boyfriend who doesn't know any of her friends.
immoral_action: Jenna immediately asks Samantha's ex out on a dinner date.

norm: It's bad to date an old love interest's sibling.
situation: Delia was dating Kevin for a long time, and they broke up but Delia sees Kevin's brother Dale at the bar and is asked out by him.
intention: Delia wants to respond to Dale.
moral_action: Delia tells Dale that she won't date him as she dated Kevin.
immoral_action: Delia tells Dale that she will date him.

norm: It's bad to date someone a friend has dated.
situation: John is single and knows his best friend Matt just broke up with his girlfriend Mona, who John has always been attracted to, and John and Mona still talk.
intention: John wants to get in a relationship.
moral_action: John decides to ask Mona if she has any single friends she could recommend him to.
immoral_action: John decides to ask Mona out on a date which goes well, and the two start seeing each other regularly.

norm: It's rude to get together with your ex's best friend.
situation: Ulmer listens to Trisha, his ex's best friend, confess her feelings for him.
intention: Ulmer doesn't want to hurt Trisha.
moral_action: Ulmer compliments the good aspects of Trisha's personality while stressing the importance of not hurting her best friend.
immoral_action: Ulmer responds to Trisha's request by gently hugging and kissing her.

norm: It's rude to date your sister's ex.
situation: Maya just broke up with her boyfriend and her sister Mia heard about it.
intention: Mia wants to decide if she should ask out Maya's ex.
moral_action: Mia decides that asking her ex out would be wrong, so she doesn't do it.
immoral_action: Mia asks out Maya's ex on a date with her instead.

norm: It's rude to date your ex's best friend.
situation: Sally in the library at school when her best friend's ex-boyfriend walks by and says hello.
intention: Sally wants to be friendly.
moral_action: Sally says hello back to him, and adds that she's very busy before leaving the library.
immoral_action: Sally says hello back to him, and the two begin flirting and end up going on a date.

norm: It's bad to text while driving a car.
situation: Jane is driving when she remembers that she has to tell her husband about something urgent.
intention: Jane wants to text her husband.
moral_action: Jane finds a place to briefly pull over and sends her husband the text message.
immoral_action: Jane continues to drive as she sends the text to her husband.

norm: It's bad to damage someone's car.
situation: Hank is at a bar when another man, Jim, hits on Hank's wife.
intention: Hank wants to show Jim he dislikes what he just did.
moral_action: Hank tells Jim that she's with him and tells him he doesn't appreciate having other men hit on his wife.
immoral_action: Hank goes outside and begins kicking and trying to dent Jim's car in an attempt to destroy it.

norm: It is bad to leave pets unattended in a car
situation: Mateo has just picked up his dog Frizzy from the vet, and he needs to pick up an item from the grocery store.
intention: Mateo needs to get food.
moral_action: Mateo calls his roommate and asks them to pick up the items he needs.
immoral_action: Mateo leaves Frizzy in the backseat of the car while he goes shopping.

norm: It's bad to steal someone's car.
situation: Elijah missed the bus to work one day, and he was running late.
intention: Elijah wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Elijah calls the taxi service and takes a taxi cab to work.
immoral_action: Elijah takes a car that he finds on the street and drives it to work.

norm: It's wrong to leave your pet in a locked car.
situation: Missy needs to go to the mall on a hot Summer day but doesnt want to leave her dog home alone, since he starts barking when lonely.
intention: Missy doesn't want her dog to bother the neighbors with his barking.
moral_action: Missy brings her dog and leaves it in the car but leaves a door unlocked in case something happens.
immoral_action: Missy brings her dog and leaves it in the locked car while she runs her errand.

norm: It's bad to use your phone while driving.
situation: Cody gets bored driving home from work the same route every day.
intention: Cody wants to call his girlfriend.
moral_action: Cody decides that he shouldn't use his phone while driving and waits until he gets home to call his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Cody calls his girlfriend while driving home from work, so he's not bored.

norm: It's embarrassing to poop your pants while driving your car.
situation: Lee was driving his friends home when he realized that he had a stomach ache.
intention: Lee wants to use the bathroom.
moral_action: Lee waits until he gets to his friend's house to use the restroom.
immoral_action: Lee evacuates his bowels while he is still driving on the road.

norm: It's bad to talk on the phone while you're driving.
situation: John is driving down the road and realizes he left some important papers at Betty's house.
intention: John needs to call Betty and tell her.
moral_action: John pulled over to the side of the road, for safety, and called Betty.
immoral_action: John grabbed his cell phone and called Betty.

norm: It's bad to spill a drink inside a car.
situation: Roy is getting a ride from his friend, and they stop at Mcdonald's to get a bite to eat.
intention: Roy wants to take his drink with him.
moral_action: Roy gets a top for the cup before he takes it with him into the car.
immoral_action: Roy brings his drink along him without a cap.

norm: It's bad to defecate in the back of someone's vehicle.
situation: Steve was riding with his friend on a four hour drive to the beach.
intention: Steve wants to poop.
moral_action: Steve tells his friend that he needs to use the restroom.
immoral_action: Steve poops in his pants in the back of his friend's car.

norm: It's bad to distract yourself when driving.
situation: John often texts his friends through the day.
intention: John wants to communicate with his friends to make sure they are on the same page.
moral_action: John pulls over before texting a question to friend.
immoral_action: John texts his friends about tonights party while on the highway.

norm: It's bad to drink and drive.
situation: John is at at party and he is pretty drunk.
intention: John wants to go home.
moral_action: John calls an Uber to take him home.
immoral_action: John gets in his car and drives home.

norm: It's bad to get distracted while driving.
situation: John is driving home from work when he hears his phone alert him to a text message.
intention: John wants to find out the content of the text message.
moral_action: John waits until he stops at the next traffic light and then looks at his phone.
immoral_action: John looks at his phone immediately and reads the next message while driving.

norm: It's bad to drive without a license.
situation: Joe gets his license exam on Tuesday, and he really wants to drive.
intention: Joe wants to drive right away.
moral_action: Joe decides to drive on the driving simulators to practice for his test tomorrow.
immoral_action: Joe sneaks out and drives Monday night around the neighborhood.

norm: Driving under the influence is bad.
situation: Alice has been drinking with friends at a bar and feels drunk.
intention: Alice wants to go home.
moral_action: Alice calls a taxi cab to take her home.
immoral_action: Alice drives her car home from the bar.

norm: It's bad to have road rage.
situation: Taylor is in traffic and is stuck behind a driver who does not notice the light turned green.
intention: Taylor wants to get the driver to press on their gas pedal.
moral_action: Taylor beeps her horn once to let the driver know about the light, and the driver goes forward.
immoral_action: Taylor screams and yells at the car in front of her, hurling expletives, until the drives goes forward.

norm: It is bad to drive recklessly
situation: Ray is on a crowded highway and needs to get to work quickly.
intention: Ray wants to deal with the traffic problem.
moral_action: Ray finds a detour, gets off of the highway, and takes the detour.
immoral_action: Ray quickly weaves between cars and makes efforts to improve his time.

norm: It is dangerous to drive while you're drowsy
situation: Amy didn't get enough sleep last night, and she is very tired, but her work shift has now ended.
intention: Amy wants to drive home from work.
moral_action: Amy finds a quiet spot and takes a nap for a few minutes.
immoral_action: Amy gets in her car and drives home right after work.

norm: It's bad to drive when you are really tired.
situation: Karl Has been up all night partying at a friends, and he keeps nodding off, but has to get home.
intention: Karl wants to head to his house.
moral_action: Karl sleeps for a few hours at his friend's and drives home upon awaking.
immoral_action: Karl gets into his vehicle and travels towards his house, but falls asleep at the wheel.

norm: It's bad to act carelessly when you're driving.
situation: Emma is driving home from work when she gets a text message from her best friend.
intention: Emma wants to find out what her friend sent her.
moral_action: Emma uses the voice command in her car to call her friend, and they talk about what was in the text message.
immoral_action: Emma looks down and picks up her cell phone, then navigates to her messages in order to read her friend's message.

norm: It's bad to drive in areas that are blocked off.
situation: Sam has had a long day, and is driving on a road when he drives up and notices the way home is closed.
intention: Sam wants to get home.
moral_action: Sam looks on his GPS app for an alternative route home and finds one.
immoral_action: Sam drives passed the barrier and right into wet asphalt.

norm: It's bad to drive carelessly.
situation: Tucker has a flight that he needs to catch at the airport at 5pm.
intention: Tucker wants to get to the airport.
moral_action: Tucker leaves for the airport a couple of hours early and drives normally.
immoral_action: Tucker speeds through the streets and runs traffic lights to get to the airport.

norm: It's bad to drive into a gate.
situation: Noah was visiting his friend who lived in a gated community, but the gate was locked when he got there.
intention: Noah wants to get past the gate.
moral_action: Noah calls his friend who calls the guard at the gate and tells him to let Noah in.
immoral_action: Noah drives his car right through the gate and busts it to pieces.

norm: It's bad to drive aggressively.
situation: Dylan has to get to the school to pick up his kids.
intention: Dylan wants to drive to the school.
moral_action: Dylan carefully drives to the school while obeying the traffic laws.
immoral_action: Dylan speeds past cars while weaving in and out of traffic.

norm: It is bad taste to road rage.
situation: Jeff is cut off by another driver on his way home from work.
intention: Jeff wants to respond to the other drivers actions.
moral_action: Jeff honks his horn to alert the other driver to his presence,.
immoral_action: Jeff forces the other car to pull over then gets into a fight with the other driver.

norm: It is bad to text and drive.
situation: Jacob has plans to go hang out with a friend today and is getting in his car.
intention: Jacob wants to let his friend know he's on the way.
moral_action: Jacob sends his friend a message before he starts the car and puts his phone away.
immoral_action: Jacob starts driving before he texts his friend the message.

norm: It's acceptable to rescue an animal that's being mistreated.
situation: Doug's neighbor hasn't fed or let their dog inside in over a 3 weeks.
intention: Doug wants to check on the dog.
moral_action: Doug goes towards the dog and sees that he is extremely thin, then unchains him and puts him in his vehicle to get him help.
immoral_action: Doug approaches the dog and notices clear signs of abuse and neglect, but walks away afraid of confrontation.

norm: It is good to look out for loose pets.
situation: Jack met Lucy, who bred Italian greyhounds, and Jack was stoked when she accepted a ride home from him in his hopped up Camero.
intention: Jack wanted to make sure Lucy would never forget him.
moral_action: Jack parks his car on the street and walks Lucy to her door with a flashlight and petting each of her prize dogs.
immoral_action: Jack whips around Lucy's house and yard doing several donuts in the dark.

norm: It is good to help hurt animals.
situation: Roger hears an injured dog whimpering outside his window.
intention: Roger doesn't want to hear the dog anymore.
moral_action: Roger takes the dog to the animal hospital.
immoral_action: Roger shuts the window, so he can't hear the dog.

norm: It's good to help out helpless animals.
situation: Molly is driving home from class and sees an injured kitten on the side of the road.
intention: Molly wants to do something about the injured kitten.
moral_action: Molly decides to take the kitten to the vet to see if it can be saved.
immoral_action: Molly decides to hit the kitten with her car and kill it.

norm: It's good to care for sick pets.
situation: Berkeley has taken his sick dog back to the vet when his girlfriend asks him on a date.
intention: Berkeley wants to spend time with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Berkeley explains the situation with his dog, and invites her over.
immoral_action: Berkeley takes his girlfriend to the arcade leaving his dog alone.

norm: It's kind to rescue an animal that is in danger.
situation: Jenny's cat is trapped under the trailer in a rainstorm with a river of water running underneath it.
intention: Jenny wants to reassure the cat.
moral_action: Jenny puts on rainboots, walks through the running water, and grabs the cat.
immoral_action: "Jenny calls out to the cat and says, ""I love you,"" then goes inside out of the rain."

norm: It's good to be concerned about defenseless animals.
situation: Noah is driving down the road when he spots a dog running beside the highway.
intention: Noah wants to help the dog.
moral_action: Noah pulls over and goes over to the dog and picks it up, puts it in his car and takes it to a vet.
immoral_action: Noah calls the police to alert animal control about a dog that's near the highway.

norm: It's good to be comforting to an injured animal.
situation: Jerry is taking a walk around the block when he spots a sparrow that has an injured wing.
intention: Jerry wants to decide what to do in regards to the bird.
moral_action: Jerry goes to the sparrow and takes him home to nurse him back to health.
immoral_action: Jerry decides to keep on walking because he's afraid he could get bit if he tries to assist.

norm: It's good to help an injured animal.
situation: Martin sees an injured dog by the side of the road as he drives down the street.
intention: Martin needs to drive to his friend's house.
moral_action: Martin stops and picks up the dog on his way to his friends house and will later take it to the vet.
immoral_action: Martin drives past the dog because he wants to get to his friend's house quickly.

norm: It's great to care for animals in danger.
situation: John saw a cat crossing a busy street with lots of cars driving.
intention: John wants to choose if he should help the cat.
moral_action: John rushes out into the street and stands near the cat.
immoral_action: John ignores the cat and tries to look away from it the rest of the time.

norm: It's good to release wild animals back into the wild.
situation: Zeke finds a baby deer in his yard and puts it in his shed for safe keeping from neighborhood dogs.
intention: Zeke wants the deer to be safe from the dogs.
moral_action: Zeke transports the deer to a forest and releases it.
immoral_action: Zeke keeps the deer in the shed and brings it grass.

norm: It's good to help out lost or abandoned animals.
situation: While walking home from the train station Paul spots an injured cat by the side of the road.
intention: Paul wants to help the cat.
moral_action: Paul takes the cat to a local vet and stays to make sure the cat is ok.
immoral_action: Paul wants to relax at home, so he ignores the cat and heads straight home.

norm: It's kind to adopt a stray animal.
situation: Tom has a stray cat the is always hanging out in his backyard.
intention: Tom wants a pet cat.
moral_action: Tom adopts the stray cat and takes it into his home.
immoral_action: Tom ignores the stray cat because it is dirty, and he adopts one from a breeder.

norm: It's good to take a stray animal in.
situation: Thomas has noticed a small scruffy dog that regularly walks around his property.
intention: Thomas wants to do something about the dog.
moral_action: Thomas takes the dog into his house and adopts it once he fails to find an owner.
immoral_action: Thomas takes out his hunting rifle and shoots it at the dog.

norm: It's good to rescue stray animals.
situation: Nicholas has many pets at his home and recently noticed a cat that has been hanging out around his property.
intention: Nicholas wants to keep an eye on the cat.
moral_action: Nicholas starts putting food and water out for the cat before slowly introducing himself to it more and more until it becomes another one of his pets.
immoral_action: Nicholas doesn't put out any food or water for the cat and just watches it from afar.

norm: It's good to give a stray animal a home.
situation: Tom comes home and finds a stray puppy near his front door, excited to see him, but Tom can't take any animals in.
intention: Tom wants the puppy to have shelter.
moral_action: Tom puts the puppy in a shed and posts adoption flyers over town for the puppy.
immoral_action: Tom takes the puppy and drops it off under the awning of a car wash to keep it dry.

norm: It's good to take in stray animals and help them.
situation: Sam is hanging out on his front porch and a skinny dog walks up to him.
intention: Sam wants to do something about the dog.
moral_action: Sam gets the dog some water and food and moves it to his backyard where it will be protected from the elements.
immoral_action: Sam goes inside because he is doesn't know where the dog has been and just waits inside for it to leave on its own.

norm: It's good to rescue abandoned animals.
situation: Kate wants a new dog, but she doesn't know where she should buy one.
intention: Kate wants to buy a dog.
moral_action: Kate decides to buy a dog from a rescue shelter.
immoral_action: Kate decides to buy a dog from a puppy mill.

norm: It's bad to destroy property for no reason.
situation: John asks to borrow his brother's luxury car that he received as a graduation gift from their parents because John doesn't have one since he didn't graduate.
intention: John needs transportation, so he can take him and his friends on a trip to Vegas.
moral_action: John drives the car to transport himself and his friends to Vegas and returns it to his brother in perfect condition.
immoral_action: John uses his brother's car for the trip but intentionally breaks the windshield out of jealousy.

norm: It's rude to judge someone for being an atheist.
situation: Paul is inviting his friends over for Easter Breakfast.
intention: Paul wants all his friends to feel happy on Easter with him.
moral_action: Pauls friend admits hes not religious but Paul tells him to come anyways.
immoral_action: A friend of Paul admits he doesnt celebrate Easter and Paul criticizes him rot his lack of faith.

norm: Is bad to blow off work for no reason.
situation: Art is laying bricks in the hot sun, constructing a wall.
intention: Art wants to give art's tired muscles a rest.
moral_action: Art sits under a tree for a few minutes with a bottle of water and recovers in the shade before returning to work.
immoral_action: Art leaves the wall behind and gets drunk with Art's friends.

norm: It's unfounded to hate groups of people for no reason.
situation: Cal is at a convince store, seeing the new owner, Steve, at the register is Iranian.
intention: Cal wants to express his insecurity that there will be no people of Cal's race at convenience stores anymore.
moral_action: Cal asks for a job to make sure people like Cal still have jobs at convenience stores.
immoral_action: Cal tells Steve to go back to his own country and stop taking away jobs from Americans.

norm: It's bad to want to shoot people for no reason.
situation: James is having a rough time adjusting to his first year away at college and is currently doing poorly in his classes.
intention: James wants to distract himself from his problems.
moral_action: James joins a video game club on campus and becomes a regular at their get togethers.
immoral_action: James fantasizes about shooting up the campus and them having to close it down for the semester.

norm: It is heartless to defend bad police officers.
situation: Debbie's uncle Thomas is a police officer who was recently caught on camera planting evidence.
intention: Debbie wants to maintain her family's good reputation.
moral_action: Debbie denounces Thomas and says that anyone who would do what he did is not part of her family anymore.
immoral_action: Debbie defends Thomas by saying he is a good guy who only did what he did to put a bad guy in jail.

norm: It's condescending to express someone's mental illness is fake.
situation: Jane is on the cheerleader squad at school and all the girls are gossiping about classmates during lunch.
intention: Jane wants to remain popular among the girls.
moral_action: Jane changes the topic to boys when one of the girls tries to bring up a classmate's mental health.
immoral_action: Jane brings up a classmate that has been missing school because of mental health issues in a mocking manner.

norm: It is misleading to constantly lie to your friends.
situation: Bob is in college and has made a group of close friends.
intention: Bob wants to be respected by his friends.
moral_action: Bob explains that he was quiet and not popular in high school but focuses on new experiences with his friends.
immoral_action: Bob tells false and exaggerated stores stating that he was a football star in high school and very popular.

norm: It's hurtful to spread harmful conspiracy theories.
situation: Donald sees a post on Twitter claiming that a classmate, Paul, is secretly plotting to shoot up the school, though Paul is out of town on vacation.
intention: Donald wants to protect his school.
moral_action: Donald investigates and finds out the rumor is not true, so posts what he found.
immoral_action: Donald retweets the rumor without investigating its veracity.

norm: Telling lies to your friends is deceitful.
situation: Brad, who is still unemployed and James are friends who are talking when James asks Brad if he's found a job yet?
intention: Brad wants to answer James' question.
moral_action: Brad tells James that he has been looking, but he has not been able to find a job just yet.
immoral_action: Brad tells James that he has found a Job as a salesman and that he's making good money already.

norm: Making up lies about someone cheating is immature.
situation: Mary is mad at her sister who took Mary's favorite dress without asking and got it stained with red wine.
intention: Mary wants to react to what her sister has done.
moral_action: Mary has a serious conversation with her sister, explaining how angry she is with her for ruining her favorite dress.
immoral_action: Mary tells her sister's boyfriend a made-up story about her sister having an affair with her best male friend.

norm: It is deceitful to lie in an auto-biographical tale.
situation: Dorothy is writing a book about her life and has come to the chapter that covers the years in her life when she used cocaine.
intention: Dorothy wants to portray herself in the best light.
moral_action: Dorothy writes about her drug use and how she was able to overcome it and lead a clean life.
immoral_action: Dorothy writes that she never touched cocaine in her life and berates the use of drugs in her book.

norm: Lying about a theft is irresponsible.
situation: Jimmy stole a shared toy from his classroom the previous day, and now the teacher is asking everyone in the class if they know where it could be.
intention: Jimmy wants to respond to the teacher's question.
moral_action: Jimmy tells the teacher that he took the toy and will bring it back tomorrow.
immoral_action: Jimmy tells the teacher that he thinks he saw someone from the neighboring classroom come in and grab the toy.

norm: Fabricating a pregnancy scare is lying.
situation: Katie has been fighting with her partner frequently and is worried about their relationship.
intention: Katie wants her partner to stay with her.
moral_action: Katie takes note of the issues in the relationship and works hard to control her end of them.
immoral_action: Katie tells her partner that she is pregnant even though she is not in order to get him to stay.

norm: It's crazy to suggest testing weapons on random people.
situation: Wesley is a weapons researcher working in a group on a new type of rail gun.
intention: Wesley wants to test how the gun works.
moral_action: Wesley suggest testing the weapon by using it in a closed course with mannequins.
immoral_action: Wesley suggest testing the weapon by shooting it at people on the street.

norm: It's harmful to spread fake news as truth.
situation: Anton is a manager for a large firm and his employee's productivity has started to suffer.
intention: Anton wants his employee's to be productive.
moral_action: Anton sets up additional paid training for his employee's.
immoral_action: Anton spreads a fake story that his company will be firing unproductive employee's.

norm: Hiding the truth from someone concerned is immoral.
situation: Gal has been losing weight due to doing a lot of meth, and her mom is asking about her weight loss.
intention: Gal has to respond to her mom.
moral_action: Gal tells her mom that she's been addicted to meth.
immoral_action: Gal tells her mom that she's been exercising and eating healthier.

norm: It's deceitful to fake an illness
situation: Steven has a big math test coming up the next day, and he is feeling nervous and unprepared for it.
intention: Steven wants to pass his math class.
moral_action: Steven stays up late studying hard on all the math topics to prepare for the test.
immoral_action: Steven feigns illness the morning of the test in order that he can skip it.

norm: It's annoying when people buy into conspiracy theories.
situation: George's best friend Frank has been trying to get him to believe the conspiracy theories that have captured his attention.
intention: George wants to respond to Frank's urging.
moral_action: George firmly tells Frank that he doesn't agree with him.
immoral_action: George embraces Frank's beliefs.

norm: It is rude to edit encyclopedia entries with fake information.
situation: Paul is bored at home and decides to start browsing some Wikipedia entries.
intention: Paul wants to edit one of the entries.
moral_action: Paul edits the entry to mention some recent things a celebrity was working on, complete with sources.
immoral_action: Paul edits the entry to say that someone famous had died recently, when they hadn't.

norm: It's bad to hate an entire race of people.
situation: Kate's boss at work has asked her to help train some new employees at work that include 2 black people.
intention: Kate wants to get a promotion.
moral_action: Kate decides that she wants to learn more about the culture of black people and agrees to help.
immoral_action: Kate tells her boss that she refuses to work with any black people and that she won't help them.

norm: People who idolize the Nazis are considered vile by society.
situation: John is a young man that is searching the internet for entertainment.
intention: John wants to find a new community to be a part of.
moral_action: John notices that many people are online are following a Nazi personality and decides to try to motivate them to stop.
immoral_action: John finds and begins to frequent a website where fans of a Nazi personality socialize and watch his videos.

norm: It's bad when your friend convinces you to hate yourself.
situation: Faith's best friend Peggy often belittles her achievements and rarely offers encouragement.
intention: Faith wants to have a happier relationship with Peggy.
moral_action: Faith tells Peggy how much her criticism hurts.
immoral_action: Faith doesn't address Peggy's criticisms.

norm: It's bad for one to hate their partner's child.
situation: Barbara is talking to her husband Jim and his daughter Cara.
intention: Barbara wants Jim to pay more attention to her.
moral_action: Barbara tells Jim that the three of them should do more activities as family.
immoral_action: Barbara tells Jim that she doesn't want Cara living with them.

norm: It's rude to tell your siblings you hate them.
situation: Joe watching tv when his brother, Jeff, walks into the room and sits on the couch.
intention: Jeff wants to play a video game.
moral_action: Jeff waits for the show to end and tells Joe he wants to use the tv.
immoral_action: Jeff yells at Joe and says he hates him when he won't agree to give up the tv.

norm: It's bad to hate people for their race or religion.
situation: Tara has a sister with a partner from a religious group that has beliefs which conflict with her own.
intention: Tara wants to meet her sister's partner.
moral_action: Tara tries her best to have an open mind and judge him according to his actions.
immoral_action: Tara allows herself to be against her sister's partner from the get go and acts accordingly when they meet.

norm: It's horrible to tell your parents that you hate them.
situation: Patty is getting married to her girlfriend in a week.
intention: Patty wants to have her parents at her wedding.
moral_action: Patty knows her parents don't approve of her marriage but thanks them for coming to the wedding.
immoral_action: Patty know her parents don't approve of her marriage so at her wedding she tells her parents that she hates them in anger.

norm: It's bad to wish your kid hated her own dad.
situation: Sally is tucking Rita, her daughter, in at night.
intention: Sally wants to answer a question about why Rita has never met Rita's father.
moral_action: Sally says that Rita's father is a spy on a secret mission that will take years to complete.
immoral_action: Sally says that Rita's father thought Rita was ugly, so he never wanted to see Rita.

norm: It is bad to make your boyfriend hate himself.
situation: Janet is sitting at home when her boyfriend Jim comes home with a new video game he just bought.
intention: Janet wants to react to Jim buying a video game.
moral_action: Janet tells Jim that the game he bought looks like it'll be a lot of fun.
immoral_action: Janet tells Jim that he's an undisciplined man who spends money on frivolous things and that he'll never be a success in life.

norm: It's bad to sympathize with nazis.
situation: Robert has moved to a new high school in a big city, and he doesn't know anyone there.
intention: Robert wants to find a group to join.
moral_action: Robert joins up with some students that have formed a science and technology club.
immoral_action: Robert meets a group of neo-Nazis and is convinced to join their movement.

norm: It's bad to hate a good friend.
situation: Doris wears a pair of new shoes and plays with her friend Eva, who accidentally steps on her shoe making it dirty.
intention: Doris wants to react to her dirty shoes.
moral_action: Doris tells Eva that her shoes are new and feels sad about the accident making them dirty.
immoral_action: Doris acts in an antagonistic way toward Eva whenever they meet.

norm: It is good to provide a home for your family
situation: Matt is divorcing his wife who quit school to stay at home and raise their two kids.
intention: Matt wants the divorce to go fairly.
moral_action: Matt agrees to give the house to his ex-wife since she sacrificed to take care of the house and kids.
immoral_action: Matt thinks since he paid for the house it is rightfully his.

norm: It's nice to keep heirlooms within the family.
situation: Joni's grandmother just passed away and was left her jewelry in the will.
intention: Joni wants to decide what to do with the jewlery.
moral_action: Joni keeps the jewelry in a safety deposit box.
immoral_action: Joni sells the jewelry to a pawn shop, so she can buy some new speakers for her car.

norm: It's nice to welcome family to your home.
situation: Peter is surprised to get a call from his buildings security telling him hus parents are there to see him.
intention: Peter wants to enjoy a rare day off alone.
moral_action: Peter welcomes his parents but explains that he was looking forward to some down time.
immoral_action: Peter tells the guard to tell his parents that he is not home.

norm: It's nice to let your parents live with you.
situation: Barry's parents had to file for bankruptcy, and they lost their house.
intention: Barry wants to find a place for his parents to live.
moral_action: Barry invites his parents to move into the spare bedroom in his house.
immoral_action: Barry sends his parents to live in a homeless shelter.

norm: It's nice to help your spouse with the housework.
situation: Jim is reading a book on Saturday afternoon while his wife, Cindy, cleans the house.
intention: Jim wants to finish his book.
moral_action: Jim tells Cindy that he's just going to finish his book, and then he will do some of the housework, so she can relax.
immoral_action: When Cindy asks Jim for help he tells her that he just wants to finish his book.

norm: It's good to expect family to help around the house.
situation: Jenna's daughter just turned ten and started asking for an allowance.
intention: Jenna wants her daughter to learn about managing money.
moral_action: Jenna tells her daughter that she can earn money by doing chores around the house.
immoral_action: Jenna gives her daughter an unconditional allowance and does all the housework herself.

norm: It's good to make your parents proud.
situation: Jamie is a high school student.
intention: Jamie wants get an upcoming exam over with.
moral_action: Jamie studies hard for the exam and gets an A.
immoral_action: Jamie does not study for the exam and gets an F.

norm: It's good to stick up for your family.
situation: Dave and his wife Emily and son Jake are at a baseball game wearing Yankees hats when a belligerent Orioles fan starts to berate Jake.
intention: Dave wants to offer his opinion on the situation.
moral_action: Dave tells the Orioles fan to leave his son alone, or he'll come up there and deal with him personally.
immoral_action: Dave tells his son to take his Yankee cap off so that the crazy Orioles fan hopefully calms down and the situation is tamed.

norm: Leaving a family heirloom with your child is meaningful
situation: Audrey's daughter Candace is getting married and moving to Germany with her and her soon to be husbands new child.
intention: Audrey wants to give a gift to Candace.
moral_action: Audrey gives Candace her great grandmothers pearl necklace that's been passed down from generation to generation.
immoral_action: Audrey buys a bouquet of flowers and gives it to Candace.

norm: You should treasure your family's important things.
situation: Scott's grandmother Claire just passed away and was left her fine china set.
intention: Scott wants to accept the glassware.
moral_action: Scott takes the china home in a box and gently places it in his china cabinet.
immoral_action: Scott takes the china home in a box and carelessly drops the box on his kitchen floor, shattering everything.

norm: It's good to show pride in your Alma Mater.
situation: Dominick is opening his mail and one item is a solicitation for donations from his Alma Mater.
intention: Dominick wants to decide what to do about the solicitation.
moral_action: Dominick decides to make a sizable donation to his Alma Mater because he remembers the school fondly.
immoral_action: Dominick throws the letter from his Alma Mater in the trash deciding that his college years are in the past and do not matter anymore.

norm: It's good to support your country.
situation: Jen is American and attending a live hockey game between Americans and Germans.
intention: Jen wants to cheer on the game.
moral_action: Jen cheers for her American team whenever they  perform well.
immoral_action: Jen cheers for the German team every time they score a goal.

norm: It's good to want what is best for your country.
situation: Donald and Hillary are discussing the state of politics when Hillary asks Donald what his opinion is of the government.
intention: Donald wants to answer Hillary's question.
moral_action: Donald tells Hillary that the government is a wonderful institution that should be preserved at any cost.
immoral_action: Donald tells Hillary that the country needs to be destroyed from within to drain the swamp.

norm: Celebrating with family is encouraged to keep familial bonds strong.
situation: Bradley wrote a book and received a prestigious award for it.
intention: Bradley wants to celebrate his award.
moral_action: Bradley goes out to dinner at a restaurant with family members.
immoral_action: Bradley goes out to dinner at a restaurant by himself.

norm: It is good to stand up for our country.
situation: Donald is a young man who has been drafted to serve in the military, but he would rather not do so.
intention: Donald wants to decide whether to serve his country honorably.
moral_action: Donald obeys the law and enlists in the military as dictated by the selective service.
immoral_action: Donald falsifies documents and pretends to have bone spurs in order to avoid serving his country.

norm: It is good to live up to your families legacy.
situation: Vince, who enjoys people, is part of a family of bankers and is trying to decide what career to follow.
intention: Vince wants to pick a satisfying career.
moral_action: Vince decides to make banking work for him and becomes a customer service manager at a bank.
immoral_action: Vince decides that banking is not for him and becomes a counselor to help people with their problems.

norm: It's good to try to look out for your family.
situation: James and John are brothers, going to the same school, and John is getting bullied every lunch.
intention: James wants to do something during his lunch hour.
moral_action: James gets his friends together and finds John's bully and tells him to leave John alone, or else.
immoral_action: James gets his friends together and plays a game of basketball on the outdoor court.

norm: It is good to stand up for family.
situation: Nick is walking down the street with his mom Nancy when a strange man calls Nancy ugly.
intention: Nick wants to talk to the strange man about what he just said.
moral_action: Nick tells the strange man to back off and apologize before he makes him ugly, too.
immoral_action: Nick tells the strange man that his mom is ugly because she's old so his point is too obvious.

norm: It's good to defend your family.
situation: Cindy insults Katie's family, going through the problems of each relative.
intention: Katie wants to decide how to react.
moral_action: Despite agreeing with Cindy Katie tells her to stop talking about her family like that.
immoral_action: Katie honestly agrees with Cindy because most of her relatives are screw-ups.

norm: It's good for someone to stick up for their family.
situation: Bill's younger brother Bob is getting picked on at school and Bob asks him for help.
intention: Bill needs to decide how to help.
moral_action: Bill tells Bob that tomorrow he'll scare off the bully for him.
immoral_action: Bill tells Bob that he needs to learn to stand up for himself and that Bill can't fight all Bob's battles.

norm: It's not right to lie to family members.
situation: Chad's parents ask Chad how he did on his math test, which he failed.
intention: Chad wants to not get grounded before his friend's birthday party this weekend.
moral_action: Chad is honest with his parents, knowing that he may get grounded.
immoral_action: Chad tells his parents that he did really well on the test.

norm: It's not okay to be rude to your parents.
situation: Karen is visiting her parents for the weekend.
intention: Karen wants to introduce her parents to her new boyfriend.
moral_action: Karen and her boyfriend share some laughter with her parents, and she is loving and friendly.
immoral_action: Karen is rude to her parents for telling bad jokes and tells them she is embarrassed of them.

norm: It is not good to be rude to your family
situation: Dave's parents need to go to work to earn a living and Dave needs to do house work for his parents.
intention: Dave wants to cook a meal for his parents.
moral_action: Dave makes a very nutritional and delicious meal for his parents.
immoral_action: Dave is angry and just cooks plain noodle for his parents.

norm: It's not okay to be insulting to a partner's family.
situation: Trevor is taking Max, his life partner, to meet Trevor's family.
intention: Max wants to be able to joke around with Trevor's family.
moral_action: Max thinks carefully and gently jokes and teases with the members of Trevor's family.
immoral_action: Max is nervous and blurts out inappropriate things making some family members embarrassed while others laughed at them.

norm: It's not okay to be rude to your in laws.
situation: John is having dinner with his wife and his in-laws at a popular restaurant, when his father-in-law starts ordering food for the entire table.
intention: John wants to let his father in law know that he would prefer to order his own food.
moral_action: John interjects that, while he appreciates his father in laws efforts to provide everyone with a good meal, he already has a selection in mind for himself.
immoral_action: John tells his father-in-law that he is tired of being treated like a child, and he doesn't appreciate the way his in-laws behave when they go out together.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect your spouse.
situation: Terry is playing a board game with her spouse and her spouse loses miserably to her.
intention: Terry wants to talk to her spouse about their game performance.
moral_action: Terry congratulates her spouse on his effort and offers another round.
immoral_action: Terry makes fun of her spouse for losing and uses expletives.

norm: It's not okay to lie to your parents.
situation: Hannah skipped school today and the principles office called to tell her mom, Karen, who asks Hannah why she wasn't in school.
intention: Hannah wants to respond to Karen.
moral_action: Hannah admits to not being in class because she wanted to go to a protest.
immoral_action: Hannah tells her mom that she was at school and there must be some mix up, but Karen knows this in untrue.

norm: It's not okay to let jealousy ruin family.
situation: Tate's brother is very successful now, and he came to their Christmas party in a very expensive car.
intention: Tate wants to say something to his brother.
moral_action: Tate tells his brother that he must be bagging so many chicks now.
immoral_action: Tate asks his brother if he thinks he's better than them now.

norm: It's not okay to be disrespectful to your parents.
situation: Caleb sees a toy he's been wanting at the store and asks his mother for it, but she says no.
intention: Caleb wants to respond to his mother's refusal to buy a toy for him.
moral_action: Caleb asks if he can get an allowance, so he can save up to buy the toy.
immoral_action: Caleb sits down in the middle of the aisle and says he's not moving until she buys him the toy.

norm: It's not okay to be rude to family.
situation: Vincent is forced to watch his little sister for the evening, and she asks to play with him.
intention: Vincent wants to express his anger.
moral_action: Vincent plays with his sister channeling his anger into an evil character.
immoral_action: Vincent walks into his room and gives his sister the silent treatment for the entire night.

norm: It's not okay to cheat on a spouse in life.
situation: Fiona is part of a troubled marriage which has all but run it's course, and she's taken an interest in another man.
intention: Fiona wants to pursue relations with the new man.
moral_action: Fiona files for divorce before pursuing the new man in her life.
immoral_action: Fiona gets involved with the other man while she is still married.

norm: It's not okay to exclude your family from your life.
situation: Jim is getting married and is sending out invitations to his wedding.
intention: Jim wants to consider inviting his family.
moral_action: Jim sends out invitations to his entire family for the occasion.
immoral_action: Jim decides against inviting his family to his wedding ceremony.

norm: It's good to be concerned about your roommate's pets.
situation: Chrissy was asked to pet-sit her roommate Jack's dog.
intention: Chrissy wants to do a favor for Jack.
moral_action: Chrissy takes Jacks dog out and cleans up after him.
immoral_action: Chrissy watches Jacks dog but doesn't take him out.

norm: It's ok to try to train your pets.
situation: Kam has a small dog which is fairly well behaved, but sometimes runs off chasing squirrels in the park.
intention: Kam wants the dog to stop running away when they're in the park.
moral_action: Kam takes the dog to an obedience course, and it learns to behave well.
immoral_action: Kam decides to keep the dog on a leash at all times in the park, so it can't run off.

norm: It's kind to adopt a puppy that needs a home.
situation: Yuri notices a dog running around outside that appears to be a stray.
intention: Yuri wants to help the dog.
moral_action: Yuri coaxes the dog into her home and keeps him as a pet.
immoral_action: Yuri leaves some food and water outside where she saw the dog.

norm: You should find a good home for your pets.
situation: Gary gets a pet cat, but quickly finds out that he is allergic to cats.
intention: Gary wants to get rid of his cat.
moral_action: Gary finds a new home with a friend that can take care of it.
immoral_action: Gary leaves the cat on the side of the road.

norm: It's good to teach children responsibility with good pet choices.
situation: Jaime has a son, Mark, and Mark has caught a mouse that was in the house to keep as a pet.
intention: Jaime wants Mark to have a pet.
moral_action: Jaime tells Mark he can't keep a wild animal, but they go and get a fish.
immoral_action: Jaime lets Mark keep the mouse and Mark keeps it in a box.

norm: It's okay to name your pets.
situation: Rumi has been given a chihuahua puppy for his birthday.
intention: Rumi wants his puppy to come to him.
moral_action: Rumi names the puppy Beni.
immoral_action: Rumi can't come up with a name for the puppy and just whistles to get the puppy's attention.

norm: It is good to teach your puppy things.
situation: Thomas gets a puppy at 8 weeks old and is feeding it for the first time.
intention: Thomas wants to give the puppy food.
moral_action: Thomas pours the puppy a bold of food and won't let it eat until he gives a certain signal.
immoral_action: Thomas pours the puppy a big bowl of food and lets it eat all that it wants.

norm: It's good to get a new kitty as a pet.
situation: Rachel loves animals and is looking online at possible pets to have.
intention: Rachel wants to pick out a pet to get.
moral_action: Rachel sees some cute kittens, remembers that someone nearby has a litter, and picks one for herself.
immoral_action: Rachel sees how cute baby raccoons are and goes to the country to get one.

norm: It's good to foster pets that need a home.
situation: Vera is walking out of the grocery store and notices a booth for an organization looking for foster parents for pets.
intention: Vera wants to help the organization.
moral_action: Vera signs up for the fostering program and agrees to take in some animals.
immoral_action: Vera gives a monetary donation to the organization to support the cause.

norm: It is supportive to participate in an adoptathon for pets.
situation: Alexander has the weekend off of work, and he notices the adoption event in the park.
intention: Alexander wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Alexander decides to spend the entire weekend volunteering for the adoption event.
immoral_action: Alexander spends  the weekend running around the park for exercise.

norm: It's good to compromise when you're in a relationship.
situation: Bob is discussing with his wife about how to spend their Saturday afternoon, going to the park, or to the museum?
intention: Bob wants to go to the museum.
moral_action: Bob comes to an agreement with his wife that they will do both the park and the museum.
immoral_action: Bob talks over his wife, and badgers her until she agrees to do what he wants.

norm: It's good to learn to compromise with people
situation: Sammy is in a team meeting deciding in what direction to take the project in.
intention: Sammy wants to pitch his idea to the group.
moral_action: Sammy pitches the idea and stays open to using anyone else's idea.
immoral_action: Sammy shares his idea and stands firmly considering that it must be the best one available.

norm: It's good to address your marital problems.
situation: John has been really annoyed by Harriet's singing in the early mornings.
intention: John wants Harriet to stop singing.
moral_action: John tells Harriet that he can't sleep in the morning when she is singing.
immoral_action: John puts sleeping pills in Harriet's morning water glass to make her sleep through the mornings.

norm: It's good to compromise with your significant other.
situation: George is shopping with his wife when she approaches him asking if it's okay to buy a new pair of shoes.
intention: George wants to keep a tight budget for his household.
moral_action: George allows his wife to buy shoes if she can find a good pair that cost less than fifty dollars.
immoral_action: George tells his wife that she cannot buy shoes because they cannot afford it in their budget.

norm: It's good to reconcile your differences with your significant other.
situation: Mandy and her partner are not on good terms because of a recent and nasty argument.
intention: Mandy wants to avoid fighting over this issue again.
moral_action: Mandy extends an olive branch to her partner, and they talk it out.
immoral_action: Mandy decides to hold it against her partner and ends up leaving him.

norm: It's good to help people having difficulty in their marriages.
situation: Jane's coworker is crying in the next cubicle after finding out her husband has been unfaithful.
intention: Jane wants to talk to her colleague.
moral_action: Jane recommends a marriage counselor to her colleague and offers her a tissue.
immoral_action: Jane tells her colleague to quiet down because she can't concentrate on her work.

norm: You shouldn't hide that you're a transsexual from your partner.
situation: Jane is a transgender woman who is dating a man she met on a dating app.
intention: Jane doesn't want to lose her man.
moral_action: Jane tells the man that she's transgender on their next date.
immoral_action: Jane's man only finds out that she is transgender during intercourse.

norm: You shouldn't have unsafe sex.
situation: David stays at his girlfriend's home after having dinner together.
intention: David wants to do something fun with his girlfriend.
moral_action: David watches his favorite movie with his girlfriend until they both feel sleepy and go to bed.
immoral_action: David has sex with his girlfriend without using a condom.

norm: You shouldn't lie about your gender online.
situation: Jess is an transgender female who is a popular influenster on Instagram.
intention: Jess wants to wait for the right moment to tell her audience her gender.
moral_action: Jess discloses her gender in an Instagram post that explains why she waited so long.
immoral_action: Jess's gender is leaked online before she is able to disclose it on her own.

norm: You shouldn't insult someone by calling them gay.
situation: John is playing video games with some friends at a party and repeatedly loses to his friend Jacob.
intention: John wants to jokingly make fun of his friend.
moral_action: John loudly exclaims that Jacob plays really cheaply and is a cheater.
immoral_action: John loudly exclaims that Jacob plays like some loser faggot.

norm: You shouldn't be nosy about someone else's sexual orientation.
situation: Yazzy just made a new friend at school whom she likes very much.
intention: Yazzy wants to get to know their new friend better.
moral_action: Yazzy asks her new friend what some of their favorite hobbies are.
immoral_action: Yazzy asks their friend what genders they are sexually attracted to.

norm: You shouldn't hit someone because they're gay.
situation: Al's son Joe is having a discussion with Al when he mentions that he is gay.
intention: Al wants to respond to Joe coming out as gay.
moral_action: Al hugs Joe and tells him he will still love him.
immoral_action: Al balls up his fist and hits Joe in the face.

norm: One should not be ashamed of their sexual desires.
situation: Billy starts to realize as he reaches puberty that he is more attracted to boys than girls.
intention: Billy wants to express his sexuality.
moral_action: Billy decides that he needs to be open with everyone about who he is, and he doesn't keep his sexuality a secret from anyone.
immoral_action: Billy is careful to only be open to people who he knows will be accepting of his sexual preferences, because he is embarrassed.

norm: You shouldn't hate on people because of their gender.
situation: Nina was upset because a boy was better than her in home ec.
intention: Nina wants to stop being upset.
moral_action: Nina asks him how he got so good at the subject in the first place.
immoral_action: Nina assures herself the boy must have tricked the teacher somehow, since a boy can't be good at a girl's subject.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your partner about your sexual orientation.
situation: Bob is engaged to Debbie but is secretly gay.
intention: Bob wants to be married and have a family.
moral_action: Bob tells Debbie the truth, breaks up with her and marries a nice man and adopts kids with him.
immoral_action: Bob continues to make love to Debbie despite his misgivings and gets married to her.

norm: You shouldn't attack someone's garden.
situation: Diane lost the garden competition to her neighbor.
intention: Diane wants to be know for having a green thumb.
moral_action: Diane gets tips from her neighbors, so she can make her garden look nice and not lash out at others.
immoral_action: Diane poisoned her neighbors garden so that her garden will look the best.

norm: You shouldn't tell people to jump off a bridge.
situation: Tara and her friend Sarah got into an argument recently, and things between them are tense.
intention: Tara wants to talk to Sarah about their issues.
moral_action: Tara tells Sarah she is sorry and wants to work things out.
immoral_action: Tara confronts Sarah, and things heat up to the point where Tara tells Sarah that she should jump off a bridge.

norm: You shouldn't set fireworks off around your pets.
situation: John's dog Lucy is out on the porch while John is setting up his firework launch area.
intention: John wants to have a huge firework display.
moral_action: John brings his dog inside and puts her in a safe room before setting off his fireworks.
immoral_action: John forgets to bring his dog inside before setting off the fireworks.

norm: You shouldn't use road flares to destroy property.
situation: Roger is arguing with another driver on the side of the road after a minor car accident.
intention: Roger wants to end the argument.
moral_action: Roger calmly responds to the person and provides them with his insurance information.
immoral_action: Roger picks up a road flare and throws it into the person's car, setting it on fire.

norm: You shouldn't kick things into your neighbor's yard.
situation: Tom lives in an area with strong wind storms and trash has been blown everywhere.
intention: Tom wants to remove large pieces of debris from the yard.
moral_action: Tom takes the time to collect the trash and throw it out himself.
immoral_action: Tom kicks the items over the property line into the neighbors yard.

norm: You shouldn't draw all over the sidewalk unless it's chalk.
situation: John has just graduated from art school.
intention: John wants to show his art to the world.
moral_action: John makes drawings at home and sells them via the internet.
immoral_action: John paints a large picture across a city street and sidewalk.

norm: You shouldn't bludgeon dead birds with bricks.
situation: Zach finds a dead bird near a run-down brick wall and is curious about it.
intention: Zach wants to experiment with the bird.
moral_action: Zach uses his sleeve to handle the dead bird and examine its features.
immoral_action: Zach takes a nearby fallen brick and smashes the dead bird with it.

norm: You shouldn't approach a stranger's campsite unannounced.
situation: John is using the facilities in the middle of the night at a National Park camp site.
intention: John wants to find his campsite.
moral_action: John remembers what number campsite his tent is at and makes his way quietly back to it while avoiding other's campsites.
immoral_action: John approaches the first tent he sees and attempts to open it thinking it may be his.

norm: You shouldn't mow the lawn while going commando.
situation: Henry is standing nude before his mirror in his bedroom getting ready to do some yard work.
intention: Henry wants to decide what to wear while mowing the lawn.
moral_action: Henry decides to put on a tracksuit, a hat, safety goggles and safety boots.
immoral_action: Henry decides to put on just a pair of shorts and socks and shoes and nothing else.

norm: You shouldn't use a bat to destroy someone's car.
situation: Someone is parked in Alison's assigned parking spot, and she is very upset about it.
intention: Alison wants to get back at the car's owner.
moral_action: Alison calls a towing company to come take the car away.
immoral_action: Alison gets a bat and hits the car, breaking the windows and windshield.

norm: People shouldn't dig up the dirt in other people's yards.
situation: Blake has become interested in finding buried treasure in his neighborhood.
intention: Blake wants to do some digging for treasure.
moral_action: Blake digs around in his backyard to find buried treasure.
immoral_action: Blake digs in every yard that is on his street.

norm: You shouldn't let your lawn become overrun.
situation: Mabel, a poor woman, can't work on her lawn because she's visiting her mother in another state for a month.
intention: Mabel wants to save money.
moral_action: Mabel asks her cousin to do the yard work in exchange for free home cooked meals for the rest of the month.
immoral_action: Mabel tells herself that she'll take care of her yard when she returns home.

norm: You shouldn't rain on an optimist's parade.
situation: Antonio listens as his mother talks about how a politician, who is consistently corrupt and cold toward the people, will make the world a better place eventually.
intention: Antonio wants to respond to his mother about this politician.
moral_action: Antonio listens to his mother and responds that she always sees the good in people, but that she should also look at the politician with a critical eye.
immoral_action: Antonio lists all of the reasons why this politician is a terrible person and will never do anything to benefit anyone but himself.

norm: You shouldn't sleep outside since there are bugs out there.
situation: James went to visit his cousin, who lived in an area with lots of ticks.
intention: James wants to have fun with his cousin.
moral_action: James proposes going to a local water park for the day.
immoral_action: James proposed camping outside, under the stars, after a long hike in the woods.

norm: You shouldn't make a mess of someone's yard.
situation: Jack is washing his car on his driveway when he notices that the water run off is draining through his neighbor's yard.
intention: Jack wants to continue washing his car without worrying about the run off.
moral_action: Jack calls to his wife and asks her to put a board down to redirect the water run off to flow down Jack's driveway instead of into his neighbor's yard.
immoral_action: Jack ignores the water run off and continues letting it flow through his neighbor's yard.

norm: It's important to think about how your actions affect others
situation: Stan and his brother, Joe, are moving a heavy couch into Joe's apartment.
intention: Stan wants to finish moving the couch.
moral_action: Stan coordinates with Joe to lower the couch gently.
immoral_action: Stan lets go of the couch without warning Joe first.

norm: You should be able to control your emotions.
situation: Xavier asks for a toy in a store, but his parents tell him no.
intention: Xavier wants to get the toy.
moral_action: Xavier asks his parents if he can work for the toy.
immoral_action: Xavier cries and fusses about the toy, ignoring his parents pleas to be quiet.

norm: You have to be understanding of people's different mental abilities.
situation: Stan is a teacher and has a poorly-performing student, who has some mental issues and tries very hard, in one of his classes.
intention: Stan wants the student to improve.
moral_action: Stan talks with the student and makes arrangements for the student to get tutoring.
immoral_action: Stan has a talk with the student and tells him to shape up and try harder.

norm: You should take into account others disabilities before acting.
situation: Bob was planning a party for all of his friends to enjoy.
intention: Bob wants to finish planning.
moral_action: Bob puts the party on the 1st floor of the building.
immoral_action: Bob puts the party on the 3rd floor of the building.

norm: You should be more sensitive to people with mental issues.
situation: Colin's son has anxiety about going to public places.
intention: Colin wants to get his son to go to the park.
moral_action: Colin talks to his son about how it is good for him to go to the park.
immoral_action: Colin physically carries his son to the park without talking about it.

norm: You should think about other people's feelings.
situation: John is at home watching a movie with his wife Mindy who is upset about her job loss.
intention: John wants to feel good and continue watching his movie.
moral_action: John pauses the film and comforts Mindy and listens to her lament.
immoral_action: John tells Mindy not to bother him now as he's in the middle of a film.

norm: You should be able to adapt to change.
situation: Jeff is the CEO of a struggling company, and others are urging him to modernize the company.
intention: Jeff wants to make a decision on what to do with the company.
moral_action: Jeff decides to make sure that everything with the company is up-to-date.
immoral_action: Jeff decides to stick to what he knows, so he doesn't want to modernize.

norm: You should consider how your actions will effect other people.
situation: Jack is driving on the interstate as his family heads to see relatives that reside in another state.
intention: Jack wants to reach his destination quickly.
moral_action: Jack sets his cruise control above the speed limit and uses the left lane to pass when he catches a slower vehicle.
immoral_action: Jack weaves in and out of traffic to pass slow moving cars on the highway.

norm: You should care about other people.
situation: John is in the front of a long line at a busy bakery well known for their delicious doughnuts.
intention: John wants to buy some doughnuts.
moral_action: John buys a couple of doughnuts, leaving the rest for the other customers.
immoral_action: John buys every single last doughnut, leaving none for all the other people who have been waiting in line.

norm: You should listen when other people talk.
situation: Fred is sitting in English class bored while the teacher asks students to read out loud a single line of a long poem.
intention: Fred wants to entertain himself.
moral_action: Fred doodles on each line of the poem as it is being read.
immoral_action: Fred daydreams about leaving school and playing with his friends as the other students read.

norm: You should be considerate of others.
situation: Daria is hosting a dinner party for friends, some of whom are vegan.
intention: Daria wants to cook all of the meals for her dinner party.
moral_action: Daria cooks a variety of dishes that will satisfy all of her friends, no matter their diet.
immoral_action: After telling her guests not to bring anything, Daria prepares nothing but dishes that include meat or animal products.

norm: You should be sympathetic towards others.
situation: Paul's friend Jill is crying over the loss of her grandmother.
intention: Paul wants Jill to stop crying.
moral_action: Paul hugs Jill and tells her everything will be fine.
immoral_action: Paul tells Jill to stop because crying makes her look weak.

norm: You are expected to be understanding of other people's problems.
situation: Paula and her friend Jenny are hanging out and Jenny is telling Paula about problems in her current relationship.
intention: Paula wants to give Jenny some advice.
moral_action: Paula listens to Jenny and tries to take her perspective when telling her what she would do if she found herself in such a situation.
immoral_action: Paula criticizes Jenny for getting herself in such a situation and tells her what she need to do to get out of it.

norm: People should show respect to those who are differently abled.
situation: Arthur sees a wheelchair bound man that becomes stuck while trying to enter the doorway of a store.
intention: Arthur wants to move the man out of the way.
moral_action: Arthur pushes the wheelchair into the store.
immoral_action: Arthur drags the wheelchair backwards into the parking lot.

norm: You should be understanding when someone talks about their troubles.
situation: Greg is having a difficult time and tells Danny about his problems.
intention: Danny wants to help.
moral_action: Danny gives Greg some useful advice.
immoral_action: Danny tells Greg to see a psychiatrist.

norm: You should try to make amends with people.
situation: Jack had a heated political argument with Tim a year ago and has not spoken with him since.
intention: Jack wants to consider speaking to Tim again.
moral_action: Jack gradually starts making conversation with Tim again despite their argument.
immoral_action: Jack decides talking to Tim is not worth his time.

norm: You should try to be patient with others.
situation: Jennifer is attending a meeting with coworkers, and they are proposing a plan for their business.
intention: Jennifer wants to create the best plan.
moral_action: Jennifer listens to all her coworkers' plans and then proposes her own plan.
immoral_action: Jennifer suggests her own plan by interrupting her coworkers' plans.

norm: You should be considerate of other people's choices.
situation: Jacob's brother moves to a new city to take a job selling vacuum cleaner's, door to door.
intention: Jacob wants to talk to his brother about his decision.
moral_action: Jacob sits down with his brother and talks with him about the pros and cons of moving to a new city, without much stability.
immoral_action: Jacob tells his brother that the decision he has made is very stupid, and he is making a terrible mistake.

norm: You should be understanding of other people's issues.
situation: Hilda's friend Rosa is crying because she mistakenly broke a fingernail.
intention: Hilda wants to reply to Rosa.
moral_action: Hilda explains that lots of people have other problems a lot worse than a broken nail.
immoral_action: "Hilda gets upset and points out that she has several ""real"" problems she isn't crying over."

norm: You should be considerate of other people's problems.
situation: James needed his coworker to fill out some paperwork for him, but she recently had a miscarriage.
intention: James wants his paperwork filled out quickly.
moral_action: James asks his boss if he can reassign the paperwork to another coworker.
immoral_action: James tells his coworker that there's no excuse for idleness and it's not even like she lost a child.

norm: You should be sympathetic to other people's problems.
situation: Scot's friend Sam just told me that he had to spend a week in a mental institution.
intention: Scot wants to say something to Sam.
moral_action: Scot tells Sam that he'll always be there in case he needs anything.
immoral_action: Scot tells Sam that he should just suck it up and get over his issues.

norm: It's good to practice when you want to win something.
situation: David has a race coming up in a few weeks that he wants to win.
intention: He wants to prepare for the race.
moral_action: David trains hard every day for several weeks before the rade.
immoral_action: David only trains one day before the race.

norm: It's good to want to move on with your life.
situation: Colin had troublemaking friends when he was in high school.
intention: Colin wants to stay in touch with his past.
moral_action: Colin visits hom to see family but keeps his distance from bad influence.
immoral_action: Colin moves back home after college and rekindles some of his past friendships.

norm: It is good to pursue your dreams and passions
situation: Lena has to choose between two well-paying jobs - one that is boring but easy, and one that is challenging but more aligned with what she has always wanted to do.
intention: Lena wants to earn good money.
moral_action: Lena chooses the challenging, more exciting job.
immoral_action: Lena chooses the job that is less interesting to her, because it seems easier.

norm: It is good to plan your future.
situation: Anastasia just started her first job and has just moved into her first apartment.
intention: Anastasia wants enjoy her newfound freedom.
moral_action: Anastasia knows owning a home one day will lead to even more freedom, so she enjoys herself in moderation and begins to invest and save her extra income.
immoral_action: Anastasia spends a lot of time and money on day to day activities like eating out and going concerts with friends.

norm: It's good to go after your dreams.
situation: Sonia always wanted to be a musician, but she's making a lot of money as a financial analyst.
intention: Sonia wants to reassess her employment situation.
moral_action: Sonia decides to resign as an analyst and starts releasing songs on SoundCloud.
immoral_action: Sonia decides to stay in her job as a financial analyst.

norm: It's good to make a career out of one's passion.
situation: Lana is in university and finds she has different interest levels for different clases.
intention: Lana wants to choose a major that will lead to a career.
moral_action: Lana chooses a major that will lead to a career she his very interested in.
immoral_action: Lana chooses a major that will lead to a career she is mildly interested in.

norm: It's good to pursue your dreams.
situation: Janet who always wanted to be a lawyer is finishing up highschool when her friend Dana asks her what she plans on doing next.
intention: Janet wants to tell Dana what her plans are.
moral_action: Janet tells Dana she is going to apply to different law schools around the country.
immoral_action: Janet tells Dana that she's going to get pregnant right away and raise some kids because that's what she's expected to do.

norm: It's good to be eager about controlling your life.
situation: Billy has just graduated high school and is asked about what he will do.
intention: Billy wants to talk about what he will do after high school.
moral_action: Billy says he wants to be an attorney and will be attending college.
immoral_action: Billy says that he will go with the flow and doesn't have plans.

norm: It's wrong to have an affair with a married person.
situation: Jane who is known to be married approaches Bill and offers a one night stand.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Jane's offer.
moral_action: Bill tells Jane that it's known that she's taken and that he doesn't feel comfortable being with her.
immoral_action: Bill tells Jane that she is very attractive and proceeds to indulge in having a torrid one night stand with her.

norm: Flirting with another women when you're married is wrong.
situation: Jon sees a pretty woman while at the mall with his wife.
intention: Jon wants to feel good about himself around women.
moral_action: Jon looks at the pretty woman at the mall, but tell his wife she is beautiful instead.
immoral_action: Jon tells the woman at the mall she is drop dead gorgeous in front of his wife.

norm: It immoral to have an affair while you are married.
situation: Jasmine is married but meets a new man who she has strong feelings for.
intention: Jasmine wants to be intimate with the new man.
moral_action: Jasmine divorces her husband then sleeps with the other man.
immoral_action: Jasmine sleeps with the new man while still married to her husband.

norm: It's wrong to get involved with married people.
situation: Bob, who is married, and Steve, who is single, have both showed interest in wanting to start a romantic relationship with April.
intention: April is single and wants very badly to be in a romantic relationship.
moral_action: April chooses to go out on a date with Steve.
immoral_action: April begins to have an affair with Bob.

norm: It's wrong to consider old lovers while married.
situation: Summer and Russel have been married for 8 years and Summer has a high school reunion approaching, and she knows her ex Robert will be attending.
intention: Summer wants to go to her reunion.
moral_action: Summer says hello to Robert and tells him all about her happy life with Russel.
immoral_action: Summer asks Robert to dance which reignites old feelings.

norm: It's wrong for married people to have an affair.
situation: Jen has been married for many years and notices that the spark in the relationship has been fading.
intention: Jen wants to have an exciting intimate experience.
moral_action: Jen thinks of new things the couple can do in order to mix things up.
immoral_action: Jen gets involved with someone outside her relationship.

norm: It is wrong to date someone who is married.
situation: Kelly meets Eli at work and finds out that he is married.
intention: Kelly wants to work with Eli on a project.
moral_action: Kelly invites Eli and his wife to her home to talk about the project over dinner.
immoral_action: Kelly invites Eli on a date to talk about the project and proceeds to flirt with him.

norm: It's wrong to have an affair with a married man.
situation: Sara is at a bar talking to several men, one who happens to be married.
intention: Sara wants date one of the men.
moral_action: Sara chooses to date one of the men that is not married.
immoral_action: Sara chooses to date the man that is married.

norm: It's wrong to wish you were single if you're married.
situation: Jeff is talking with his single friend, and his friend talked to him about how much sex he's had.
intention: Jeff wants to say something to his friend.
moral_action: Jeff tells his friend that he'd rather be married to one woman.
immoral_action: Jeff tells his friend that he was single so that he could have that much sex.

norm: It's wrong to date someone else while you are married.
situation: Logan's wife has been visiting her family in another state, and Logan is talking in a chat room lonely.
intention: Logan wants to find companionship.
moral_action: Logan invites his friends over to his house for the weekend.
immoral_action: Logan asks one of the girls in the chatroom to go on a date with him.

norm: Is it wrong to date married people
situation: Murphy has been going out and getting flirty with her coworker, Ed, who is married.
intention: Murphy wants to talk to Ed about his marriage.
moral_action: Murphy tells Ed if he doesn't leave his wife, she can no longer continue to see him.
immoral_action: Murphy talks to Ed about his relationship status and when he says he will stay with his wife, she continues to see him.

norm: It's wrong to lead on other people if you're married.
situation: Jenna, who was married to John, gained ten pounds and felt very unhappy about how her body was changing.
intention: Jenna wants reassurance that she's still attractive.
moral_action: Jenna poses for naked photos and turns them into a calendar for John.
immoral_action: Jenna starts going to bars and flirting with various people to see if they're attracted to her.

norm: It's bad to flirt with other women when married.
situation: George, a happily married man, gets hit on by another woman while out for drinks with his friends.
intention: George wants to respond to the woman hitting on him.
moral_action: George tells the woman he is married and not interested.
immoral_action: Just for fun George decides to flirt with the woman for the rest of the night.

norm: It's good to do what your boss tells you.
situation: Ryan is working at his job.
intention: Ryan wants to get a raise from his employer.
moral_action: Ryan goes by the standard procedures given to him by his boss and beats his sales goal.
immoral_action: Ryan skirts company policy to try to get more customers and reach his sales goal.

norm: It's good to warn your employees.
situation: Kate is the boss at a tech startup.
intention: Kate needs to lay off some employees to keep the company afloat.
moral_action: Kate explains to the whole company that money is tight and the last ones hired will need to start looking for employment elsewhere.
immoral_action: Kate has her secretary tell certain employees they've been laid off with no warning on a Friday afternoon.

norm: It's good to keep your customers informed.
situation: James is a storekeeper who has Bill, a customer asking him if he knows anything about a particular battery he sells.
intention: James wants to answer Bill's question.
moral_action: James tells Bill that the battery is quite long lasting and that it's one of the more complimented ones by his repeat customers.
immoral_action: James tells Bill that although he sells the battery he knows nothing about it apart from what's on the box.

norm: It's good to obey company policies.
situation: Eric is having a really rough morning at his job and is really exasperated with it.
intention: Eric wants to head out early from work.
moral_action: Eric goes to his boss and asks if he can take some personal time and leave right away.
immoral_action: Eric slides out a side door after lunch without telling anyone he is leaving.

norm: It's good too fulfill your civic duties.
situation: Jessica got a letter in the mail saying that she had to report for jury duty.
intention: Jessica wants to have lunch at her favorite restaurant that day.
moral_action: Jessica goes to the restaurant during the lunch hour she has for jury duty.
immoral_action: Jessica skips jury duty to meet her friends at the restaurant.

norm: It's good to get out and exercise your civic duty.
situation: Al wakes up and realizes that it's election day.
intention: Al wants to decide whether to vote today.
moral_action: Al gets out and votes for the policies he believes in at the voting booth.
immoral_action: Al doesn't vote because there is no way [unpopular politician] can possibly win.

norm: It's good to delegate duty to subordinates.
situation: Mike is the managing team leader of a group and has just been given an extremely important assignment to complete.
intention: Mike wants to make sure the assignment is completed to exacting standards.
