moral_action: Mike divides the assignment among the team members and monitors their work closely.
immoral_action: Mike does the work on his own because he doesn't want his subordinates messing it up.

norm: It is reasonable to enforce your companys policy.
situation: Vance owns a video game company that is experiencing piracy, which it does not allow.
intention: Vance wants to address the pirating of the games.
moral_action: Vance says the people that pirate games will be sued by the company.
immoral_action: Vance says that some people may take the games for free.

norm: It's good to report things to security.
situation: Amy is at the airport and sees somebody leave a backpack unattended.
intention: Amy wants to do something about the backpack.
moral_action: Amy knows that unattended packages are a danger in airports so immediately tells someone with a uniform.
immoral_action: Amy walks up to the backpack and takes it and then checks what is inside.

norm: You shouldn't bother your boss in their office.
situation: Kea is working on a project and her boss is busy in his office and can be irritable, even though the door is partly open.
intention: Kea has a question for her boss and wants to decide how to ask it.
moral_action: Kea emails her boss the question.
immoral_action: Kea decides to walk into her boss's office and just ask the question.

norm: You shouldn't practice favoritism at your job.
situation: Jim is looking through all the resumes he has for a job opening at his company.
intention: Jim wants to pick someone to hire for the job.
moral_action: Jim carefully maps out all the applicants qualifications and hires the person with the best relevant work history for the position.
immoral_action: Jim ignores all the applicants qualifications and chooses his nephew for the job.

norm: You shouldn't download files at work that aren't allowed.
situation: Karen is very bored while working without music, she feels it makes her work better too.
intention: Karen wants to get more music on her computer.
moral_action: Karen buys herself a Spotify membership, so she can have some more music while she works.
immoral_action: Karen looks up how to download music illegally, and decides to go ahead and do it.

norm: You shouldn't wear revealing clothes at work.
situation: Diane has bought a new outfit at the mall that is quite revealing.
intention: Diane wants to show off her new outfit.
moral_action: Diane's takes a picture wearing the outfit and posts it on social media.
immoral_action: Diane decides to wear the new and revealing outfit to work.

norm: It's not okay to steal things from your workplace.
situation: John's daughter is interested in art and wants draw constantly, but her new hobby requires tons of blank paper.
intention: John wants to save money.
moral_action: John asks supervisor at work if he can get bulk deals on computer paper to help him save money on his daughter's new hobby.
immoral_action: John brings home a large ream of paper that he takes from his office copy machine so that he doesn't need to buy paper for his daughter to draw on.

norm: You shouldn't have sex with old ladies at work.
situation: Oliver works at a library, where an elderly woman makes sexual advances at him.
intention: Oliver wants to get rid of the elderly woman.
moral_action: Oliver reports the elderly woman to his boss.
immoral_action: Oliver has sex with the woman in the hopes that she'll go away.

norm: You shouldn't drink alcohol before work.
situation: Dane is stressed about going to work in thirty minutes.
intention: Dane wants to get rid of his stress.
moral_action: Dane does some yoga in the backyard.
immoral_action: Dane drinks three shots of vodka before leaving the house.

norm: You shouldn't discuss sex at work.
situation: Brian is hanging in the break room with several of his coworkers on lunch.
intention: Brian wants to entertain his coworkers with stories.
moral_action: Brian talks about a good book he's been reading lately.
immoral_action: Brian talks about all the women he's been screwing lately.

norm: You shouldn't chat about personal things during a meeting.
situation: Alice is in a board meeting with many coworkers where the CEO is explaining a new business plan.
intention: Alice wants to tell a coworker a story about what happened last night.
moral_action: Alice waits until the meeting is over and tells the story on Alice's break.
immoral_action: Alice gets the attention of the coworker and begins to tell the story loudly.

norm: You shouldn't chat about non-business-related things during a business meeting.
situation: Tom sees his friend and colleague, William, at a weekly sales meeting and decides to sit next to him.
intention: Tom wants to find out what William will be doing during the upcoming weekend.
moral_action: Tom takes care of business at the meeting and waits until after it is adjourned to talk with his friend about social issues.
immoral_action: Tom ignores the meeting agenda, and the other participants, and starts talking with his friend about possibly having a bar-b-que over the weekend.

norm: You shouldn't spread gossip at work.
situation: Bill is told by Jane a rumor that Gary is going to be fired.
intention: Bill wants to determine what to do with this information.
moral_action: Bill says nothing about it because it's just gossip.
immoral_action: Bill tells Jack and John and James and Jessie and Jill and...

norm: You shouldn't talk at the register while working.
situation: Scott is ringing up a customer at the grocery store and his coworker wants to tell him about something that happened earlier.
intention: Scott wants to give the customer their change.
moral_action: Scott asks his coworker if they can talk on break, so he can focus on his job.
immoral_action: Scott gets carried away chatting with his coworker while counting change, and hands the customer a one hundred dollar bill instead of a one.

norm: You shouldn't distract the guard when entering the office building.
situation: Mario often chats with the guard at his office building, and they will sometimes exchange jokes in the morning.
intention: Mario wants to tell the guard a new joke.
moral_action: Mario tells the guard a short joke before entering the building.
immoral_action: Mario tells the guard a really long joke which takes his attention off of his job,.

norm: It's fun to have a hobby.
situation: John has a day off and stays at home alone.
intention: John wants to pass the time.
moral_action: John starts to watch a video on how to do garden work and practices the steps carefully.
immoral_action: John starts to drink wine to kill the boredom.

norm: It's nice to take pictures with others.
situation: A crowd gathered outside the concert to get autographs from the rockstar.
intention: The rockstar wants to get on the bus to the next town as fast as he can.
moral_action: The rockstar takes a few quick selfies with his fans before getting on the bus.
immoral_action: The rockstar rushes by the gathered fans and their outstretched cameras to take a selfie with him.

norm: It is nice to involve other people in activities.
situation: Larry is a father and bought decorations to set up before Christmas eve, and his family is around.
intention: Larry wants the house decorated by Christmas eve.
moral_action: Larry decides to recruit the rest of his family to help him setup decorations that day.
immoral_action: Larry doesn't recruit the help of others and decorates for Christmas eve all on his own.

norm: It's nice to play with others.
situation: Tara gets a popular new video game the she wanted for her birthday.
intention: Tara wants to play the game.
moral_action: Tara invites her friend who also has the game to play with her.
immoral_action: Tara plays the game by herself going on a solo mission.

norm: It's fun to go on rides.
situation: Ariel is on vacation with her family during the summer.
intention: Ariel wants to go to the amusement park.
moral_action: Ariel does all the activities at the amusement park such as going on rides and playing games.
immoral_action: Ariel avoids going on the rides because they are large and only plays games.

norm: It's fun to go traveling with others.
situation: Robert and his parents have been reading about Paris for a long time.
intention: Robert wants to visit Paris over the summer.
moral_action: Robert asks his parents to come with him on a trip to Paris.
immoral_action: Robert decides to travel to Paris by himself even though he knows his parents would like to come with him.

norm: It's nice to give people rides.
situation: Lexi is leaving class and planning to drive home when she sees a friend waiting at the bus stop.
intention: Lexi wants to get home.
moral_action: Lexi pulls over near the bus stop and calls out to her friend offering them a ride home.
immoral_action: Lexi drives past the bus stop without looking towards her friend and drives straight home.

norm: It's fun to go out dancing.
situation: Tiffany and her friends have the weekend off.
intention: Tiffany wants to find an activity to do.
moral_action: Tiffany and her friends decide to go to a club and dance.
immoral_action: Tiffany and her friends decide to stay in and watch re-runs on TV.

norm: It's fun to go out with a lot of people.
situation: Ron is very bored on the weekend, not sure what to do.
intention: Ron wants to go out with someone.
moral_action: Ron invites his best friend, along with a few of their other close friends out.
immoral_action: Ron invites his best friend out to get dinner and a movie.

norm: It is good to include others in fun activities.
situation: Sara and her friends like the beach and Sara notices the weather is nice during the weekend and the beach is open.
intention: Sara wants to go to the beach.
moral_action: Sara plans a trip to the beach for she and her friends.
immoral_action: Sara goes to the beach alone.

norm: It is fun to do activities with other people.
situation: Karen is a shy girl and has spare time during a Saturday afternoon, and she notices her neighbor kids are playing hide and seek outside.
intention: Karen wants to spend her time.
moral_action: Karen goes outside and joins her neighbor kids to play hide and seek.
immoral_action: Karen plays a video game at home on her own.

norm: It's fun to do things just for fun.
situation: Jon wants to advance in his career when his friend Bert asks him to go to an amusement park.
intention: Jon wants to respond to Bert's invite.
moral_action: Jon says that he will go to the amusement park with Bert.
immoral_action: Jon says he won't go to the amusement park because it's not work related.

norm: It's wrong to hate your child.
situation: Nelly's daughter has been getting into a lot of trouble lately.
intention: Nelly wants her daughter to stop acting up.
moral_action: Nelly asks her daughter why she is acting up and helps her navigate through her issues.
immoral_action: Nelly tells her daughter she is a disgrace and that she hates her.

norm: It's bad to hate the opposite gender.
situation: Jill was badly physically abused by her last ex-boyfriend.
intention: Jill wants to make sure she's never hurt by a man again.
moral_action: Jill becomes a nun and rarely leaves her nunnery.
immoral_action: Jill starts ranting at every man she meets about how they're all rapists.

norm: It's wrong to hate people with disabilities.
situation: Dave is a police officer who is introduced to his new desk sergeant, Bill who is in a wheelchair.
intention: Dave wants to react to the news that he has a new boss.
moral_action: Dave tells Bill that he's glad to meet him and will try his hardest to show Bill he's a good officer.
immoral_action: Dave tells Bill that he cannot take a man in a wheelchair seriously as a police officer since he can't even make an arrest in his condition.

norm: It's wrong to hate others.
situation: Josh is not accepted by a group of students at his school because he dresses different, and they often tease him for his style.
intention: Josh wants to be left alone by the teenagers.
moral_action: Josh talks to a counselor about the student's negative remarks and the counselor talks to the students, where they start being nice to Josh.
immoral_action: Josh starts having extremely negative emotions towards the students and threatens them, where they are scared and stay away from him.

norm: It's wrong to hate women.
situation: Gary just found out that he lost out on a promotion to one of his female coworkers.
intention: Gary wants his coworkers to think that he is competent.
moral_action: Gary accepts that he didn't get the promotion and tells his coworkers that we will work even harder in the coming months.
immoral_action: Gary tells his colleagues that he only lost out on the promotion because of diversity hiring and that women can't do as good a job without special help.

norm: It's wrong to hate your family.
situation: Lauren is on the phone with her mom while her husband Peter is beside her and Lauren's mom just said something that upset Lauren.
intention: Lauren wants to tell her mom she doesn't like what she said.
moral_action: Lauren tells her mom that what she said is inappropriate and that she should take it back.
immoral_action: Lauren tells her mom that she is being ridiculous and that she hates her and doesn't want to talk to her anymore.

norm: It's wrong to hate everybody
situation: Jeff hates everybody, because no one seems to like him.
intention: Jeff wants to cheer himself up.
moral_action: Jeff decides maybe if he likes some people they will like him back.
immoral_action: Jeff keeps on hating everyone as he watches TV and hates the characters on the show.

norm: It's mean to dislike gay people.
situation: John and his wife Mindy are at home listening to the news when there's a story about gay rights.
intention: John wants to feel about himself.
moral_action: John says out loud how proud he is of them, and they are human like everyone else.
immoral_action: John laughs out loud and says gay people need to get therapy not rights.

norm: It's immoral to hate other people.
situation: James' wallet was stolen while he was volunteering at his church's youth group carnival.
intention: James wants understand why someone would steal his wallet.
moral_action: James concludes that everyone makes mistakes and tells the pastor that if someone comes forward, he'll forgive them.
immoral_action: James concludes that you can't trust any teenagers and begins treating them with disdain.

norm: It's wrong to hate an entire country.
situation: Wanda is browsing the internet and reading comments about a negative news story from France about a bad person.
intention: Wanda wants to form an opinion on the news story.
moral_action: Wanda reads all the comments from different perspectives and realizes this was an individual behavior described in the article.
immoral_action: Wanda takes note of the more unique comments on the situation and begins making assumptions about everybody in France behaving the same as the story.

norm: It's wrong to hate kids.
situation: Some of the neighborhood kids keep stepping on Nicholas's grass, and he is worried about keeping his lawn nice.
intention: Nicholas wants to stop the kids from stepping on his lawn.
moral_action: Nicholas talks to the kids, and he lets them know that he is trying to keep his grass nice, asking them to please keep to the walkway.
immoral_action: Nicholas tells the kids that they aren't allowed near his house and threatens to prosecute them for trespassing.

norm: It's wrong to dislike handicapped kids.
situation: Layne is chaperoning her daughter's aquarium field trip where one of the kids in her group is handicapped.
intention: Layne wants to treat the kids she's chaperoning to an item from the aquarium's gift shop.
moral_action: Layne allows each and every child in her chaperone group to choose something they'd like from the gift shop.
immoral_action: Layne buys every kid in her chaperone group an item of their choosing from the gift shop, but excludes the handicapped kid.

norm: It's wrong to hate your country.
situation: James is attending a Fourth of July barbecue with his family and about a hundred neighbors.
intention: James wants to express his political views.
moral_action: "James leads all his neighbors in singing ""The Star Spangled Banner""."
immoral_action: James sets a paper American flag on fire to protest the Trump administration.

norm: It is wrong to hate your friends.
situation: Larry is having a hard time finishing a home project and asks Steve for some help.
intention: Steve has to respond to Larry's request.
moral_action: Steve doesn't feel like helping Larry, but he does it anyway, for a few hours over the following weekend.
immoral_action: Steve is annoyed, and he tells Larry that he's not going to be taken advantage of anymore by someone he doesn't like.

norm: It is gross to leave a house dirty.
situation: Anna is about to go on a two week trip out of town.
intention: She wants to clean up a little before she goes.
moral_action: Anna gives the house a thorough cleaning and washes all her dishes and clothes.
immoral_action: Anna does some minimal cleaning but leaves a bunch of dirty dishes and clothes lying around.

norm: It's bad to let kids rule the house.
situation: Jane has just a single child whom she adores.
intention: Jane wants her child to be happy.
moral_action: Jane makes time for her child whenever possible to teach it all that is right and wrong as well as explore its interests.
immoral_action: Jane breaks and bends to satisfy her child's every whim without every considering saying no to it.

norm: It's discouraged to roughhouse inside.
situation: Nine year old Ted's friend Steve comes over on a Saturday afternoon, and they're both feeling very energetic.
intention: Ted wants to play and release his pent-up energy.
moral_action: Ted leads Steve outside where they run around and play catch with a football.
immoral_action: Ted begins wrestling with Steve, and they chase each other all over the house, accidentally knocking over a flower vase.

norm: It's inexcusable to keep someone confined to a house.
situation: Barry is in his kitchen when his son Billy comes home and shows Barry his awful report card from this semester.
intention: Barry wants to punish Billy for the bad grades.
moral_action: Barry tells Billy that he's not going to get an allowance for a month to simulate how people with bad grades eventually fare in life.
immoral_action: Barry tells Billy he's not allowed to leave the house for any reason for the whole entire summer.

norm: It's bad to abuse household substances.
situation: While straightening up after a well attended party at her apartment, Jill finds a large red wine stain in her living room beige rug,.
intention: Jill wants to clean the wine stain from her rug.
moral_action: Jill buys a specialized enzymatic cleaner and uses it on the wine stain.
immoral_action: Jill gets some bleach and uses it to clean the wine stain.

norm: It's bad to let your house become an eyesore.
situation: Tony's neighbors stop by his house to complain that the lawn is littered and uncut, and also that the paint is pealing off of his garage.
intention: Tony wants to stop his neighbors from coming over to his house and complaining.
moral_action: Tony picks up the litter on his lawn, mows his grass and puts a fresh coat of paint on his garage.
immoral_action: Tony puts up a sign in his yard that trespassers will be prosecuted.

norm: It's bad to let your house get too messy.
situation: Rose is doing her laundry.
intention: Rose wants to meet her friends at the mall.
moral_action: Rose asks her friends to wait a few minutes while she folds and puts away her clothes in her dresser.
immoral_action: Rose throws her clothes in a pile on her bedroom floor and joins her friends.

norm: It's bad to trash a shared living space.
situation: Gary and Greg are roommates and Gary decides to have some beer and pizza tonight.
intention: Gary wants to enjoy himself.
moral_action: Gary drinks his beer and eats his pizza and makes sure to throw all the empty cans and pizza box away when he's done.
immoral_action: Gary drinks his beer and eats his pizza, but leaves the cans all over the room along with the empty pizza box laying out.

norm: It's bad to put all housework on your partner.
situation: Dan and his fiance recently moved in together and are figuring out how to split up duties around the house.
intention: Dan wants to come to an agreement that he likes.
moral_action: Dan agrees to do the chores that finds more satisfying to do, and they come to a fairly even split of duties.
immoral_action: Dan argues that his fiance should do nearly all of the housework since he makes more money.

norm: It is rude to be a bad house guest.
situation: Ronin house is undergoing renovations and is a guest at his friends place for the weekend.
intention: Ronin wants to have a lot of fun with his friend.
moral_action: Ronin buys a couple beers and drinks with his friend but cleans up after himself.
immoral_action: Ronin buys a bunch of alcohol, gets drunk with his friend and ends up blacking out and trashing the house.

norm: It's frowned on to have a squalid home.
situation: Francis is a woman who doesn't enjoy cleaning her home, and is fine with the piles of trash and mess everywhere.
intention: Francis wants to live her life the way she pleases.
moral_action: Francis decides that she'd be more comfortable with room to breathe and starts to clean up.
immoral_action: Francis continues to let trash and other items pile up in her home.

norm: Locking a living being in a closet is cruel.
situation: Amber's son Billy has been misbehaving a lot in school lately and Amber is growing frustrated with him.
intention: Amber wants to discipline Billy.
moral_action: Amber takes away Billy's game console and talks to him about his behavior.
immoral_action: Amber tells Billy to get into his bedroom closet and padlocks the door from the outside.

norm: Allowing homeless people into your home is dangerous.
situation: George has befriended a homeless guy who camps out on his street, even as a blizzard is coming their way.
intention: George wants to help the homeless guy.
moral_action: George takes the homeless guy to a homeless shelter.
immoral_action: George invites the homeless guy to stay with him in his house for a few days.

norm: It's bad behavior to lock kids in their bedroom.
situation: Tina's son has refused to finish an important homework assignment in order to play a video game.
intention: Tina wants to discipline her child.
moral_action: Tina takes away her sons gaming console.
immoral_action: Tina locks her son in his bedroom away from the video game.

norm: It's bad to hide drugs in your home.
situation: Dustin notices that his stoner best friend left weed on the table, and he hears cops knocking on his door.
intention: Dustin wants to avoid getting into trouble.
moral_action: Dustin quickly asks his roommate to take toss the drugs into the community trash can.
immoral_action: Dustin tosses the weed into the oven.

norm: It's bad to sneak into your neighbor's house.
situation: Carlos just knocked on his good friend and neighbor Victor's door, but no one seems to be home.
intention: Carlos wants to borrow a screwdriver.
moral_action: Carlos decides to call Victor and ask him for his permission to go into his house and grab a screwdriver.
immoral_action: Carlos decides to sneak into the house through the garage to grab the screwdriver.

norm: It's bad to play dangerous sports inside a house.
situation: Jed invited his friends over to play football outside, but it started raining.
intention: Jed wanted to play football.
moral_action: Jed decides that they'll play football tomorrow, and they play a video game instead.
immoral_action: Jed and his friends play football in his basement, and they up breaking a window.

norm: It's wrong to keep someone locked up in the basement.
situation: Jay warned his son that he would get punished if he sneaked out of the house again, and he did it again.
intention: Jay needs to punish his son.
moral_action: Jay makes his son get a job if he wants to stay in his house.
immoral_action: Jay takes his son down to their basement and ties him to the chain for a full day.

norm: It is gross to have rats in your house.
situation: Bob's old dog passed away months ago, and he begins to miss having an animal around.
intention: Bob wants animals at his house again.
moral_action: Bob goes to the local animal shelter and finds a suitable dog to adopt.
immoral_action: Bob intentionally leaves food and trash strewn about his house in order to attract rats.

norm: You shouldn't upset school staff.
situation: Jim notices that his teacher is teaching the class something which isn't accurate.
intention: Jim wants to let his teacher know that what they are teaching isn't correct.
moral_action: Jim gives a note to the teacher discretely after class that explains the teacher's mistake.
immoral_action: Jim points out his teacher's mistake in front of the whole class.

norm: You shouldn't mess around in your classes.
situation: John is in a Biology class.
intention: John wants to alleviate his boredom.
moral_action: John asks to go to the bathroom, where he splashes some water on his face, stretches his legs and re-focuses his attention.
immoral_action: John makes a paper airplane and throws it over to his friend Bob.

norm: You shouldn't argue with people during class time.
situation: Heather is a student in Mr. Stephenson's Biology class.
intention: Heather wants class to be less boring.
moral_action: Heather gives the class a chance despite initially being bored.
immoral_action: Heather argues with Mr. Stephenson every day about how pointless the class is.

norm: Students shouldn't be disruptive during classes.
situation: Ralph is sitting with his friends in physics class.
intention: Ralph wants to see what his friends are doing later that day.
moral_action: Ralph passes a note to his buddy to ask what's going on after class is over.
immoral_action: Ralph starts talking out loud to his friend sitting next to him.

norm: You shouldn't look weird and creepy for your school photos.
situation: Dean is at home getting dressed and will have school pictures taken today.
intention: Dean wants to wear something to impress his friends.
moral_action: Dean brushes his hair, puts on a collared shirt, and gets his school picture taken.
immoral_action: Dean dresses up in all black, does his hair like a goth, and gets his school picture taken.

norm: You shouldn't say racist things to kids in school.
situation: Sally is at school one day with her friends and sees a new Muslim boy arriving for his first day.
intention: Sally wants to impress her friends.
moral_action: Sally sees the new boy while eating with her friends at lunch and asks if he wants to join them.
immoral_action: Sally sees the new boy and decides to show off for her friends and tells him to go back to his country where he belongs.

norm: You shouldn't badmouth your teachers.
situation: Theodore is in a classroom which is taught by Miss Landers.
intention: Theodore wants to be noticed.
moral_action: Theodore makes the other kids laugh but always treats Miss Landers with respect.
immoral_action: Theodore makes smart aleck comments and talks about Miss Landers behind his back.

norm: You shouldn't steal your teacher's things.
situation: Jane is in a class she dislikes and the teacher has left the room.
intention: Jane wants to let of some steam.
moral_action: Jane vents to her classmate beside her about how much she doesn't like the class and the classmate reminds her she has to pass the class regardless.
immoral_action: Jane takes the teachers notes for the day and hides them in her backpack.

norm: You shouldn't lose your cool in class.
situation: Robbie gets a test back from his teacher during class, and his score is much lower than he was expecting.
intention: Robbie wants to react to his score.
moral_action: Robbie takes a deep breath to calm down and decides to discuss the score with the teacher after class.
immoral_action: Robbie begins using profanities and loudly accuses the teacher of treating him unfairly.

norm: You shouldn't send offensive letters to your teachers.
situation: Dennis is with his mom, and he has just received his report card from his teacher and is looking at all D's.
intention: Dennis wants to react angrily to the report card.
moral_action: Dennis takes the report card and crumples it before throwing it against the wall.
immoral_action: Dennis sends a letter to his teacher calling her names and outlining how he might follow her around at night.

norm: You shouldn't ruin your school's events.
situation: Jeff is in charge of the school's homecoming dance this year.
intention: Jeff wants to decorate the gym for the dance.
moral_action: Jeff decorates the gym with streamers and balloons in all sorts of colors.
immoral_action: Jeff hangs obscene posters all around the gym for the dance.

norm: People shouldn't get drunk before class.
situation: Charlene sitting around her dorm room and is bored before class.
intention: Charlene wants to find something to do to kill time before until class.
moral_action: Charlene decides to read a chapter of a novel that she is reading to pass the time before going to class.
immoral_action: Charlene decides to drink some leftover liquor from the weekend and then heads to class.

norm: You shouldn't prank your principal.
situation: Billy found out that he had a new principal at the school he was going to.
intention: Billy wants to welcome the principal to the school.
moral_action: Billy brings the principal a fresh batch of brownies to his office.
immoral_action: Billy drives by the principal's home and eggs the man's house.

norm: You shouldn't cheat in a class.
situation: Ben is in class taking a test on material that he hadn't studied for.
intention: Ben wants to make a good grade.
moral_action: Ben thinks logically about all the questions and does the best that he can.
immoral_action: Ben copies the answers off the test of the classmate sitting right next to him.

norm: You should not make your friend fail their classes.
situation: Molly and Mallory are best friends in college with differing schedules.
intention: Molly wants to have weekly lunches with Mallory during her break between classes.
moral_action: Molly asks Mallory to have lunch with her whenever their schedules allow for it.
immoral_action: Molly begs Mallory to skip her Anthropology class every week, so they can get lunch together.

norm: You shouldn't make people miss class.
situation: Johanna is friends with Katelyn who is taking a very full courseload and doesn't get much time to see Katelyn.
intention: Johanna wants to see a movie with Katelyn.
moral_action: Johanna asks Katelyn when she's free to see a movie and picks a time that suits both of them.
immoral_action: Johanna invites Katelyn to a movie at a time Katelyn has class but convinces Katelyn it's not a big deal to skip class once.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your classmates.
situation: Rodney is in university and his friends are talking about their upcoming internships.
intention: Rodney wants to join the conversation.
moral_action: Rodney asks his friends what are good internships to apply to.
immoral_action: Rodney says he has a great internship which is not true.

norm: It's fine to give someone a treat.
situation: While out on a walk, Jane's daughter saw that the local bakery was having a sale on brownies.
intention: Jane wants to teach her daughter to eat healthily.
moral_action: Jane tells her daughter that brownies are a sometimes food.
immoral_action: Jane tells her daughter she should never eat brownies, or she'll get fat.

norm: It is polite to share your toys
situation: Nate and his friend Ryan are kindergartners, and it is time to play with toys.
intention: Nate wants to play with a set of cars and ramps.
moral_action: Nate gets the cars and ramps and gives some to Ryan, so they can play together.
immoral_action: Nate gets the cars and ramps and keeps them to himself, refusing to let Ryan play.

norm: It is polite to share your tissues with people
situation: Bonnie has a runny nose due to allergies, and asks if she can borrow her co-worker Betty's box of tissues.
intention: Betty doesn't want to listen to Bonnie sniffling all afternoon.
moral_action: Betty gives Bonnie the box of tissues, and they both get their work done.
immoral_action: Betty refuses to share, and tells Bonnie to go home if she's sick.

norm: It's kind to accommodate your guests' wishes.
situation: James planned to serve his in-laws beef ragout for dinner, but when his mother-in-law arrived she said she was vegan.
intention: James wants his in-laws to try his famous tomato sauce.
moral_action: James makes a double batch of marinara sauce and only adds the beef to half.
immoral_action: James tells his mother-in-law that the beef ragout is actually vegan with Beyond Beef.

norm: It is polite to cater to special needs guests.
situation: Dot wants to invite Skip, who has a number of food allergies, to  her party.
intention: Dot wants Skip to have a good time at the party.
moral_action: Dot asks Skip what foods he likes and can eat, and makes sure to serve at least one thing he's listed.
immoral_action: Dot doesn't make any attempt to accommodate Skip's allergies with special foods.

norm: It's okay to reward people with a little treat
situation: Mike is a teacher and his class does exceptionally well on an assignment.
intention: Mike wants to reward his class.
moral_action: Mike buys some cookies and gives some to his students as a reward.
immoral_action: Mike rewards his class with entertaining math problems.

norm: It's polite to accommodate your guests' comfort levels.
situation: Todd has moved into his house and has a large living room.
intention: Todd wants to host a party.
moral_action: Todd sets the air conditioning to maintain room temperature during the party.
immoral_action: During the party Todd turns the air conditioning to very cold.

norm: It's kind to give a treat.
situation: Jessie had gone through a hard day at school and was returning home with her mother.
intention: Jessie's mother wants her to feel better.
moral_action: Jessie's mother takes her out to get an ice cream cone down the street.
immoral_action: Jessie's mother gives her a glass of water for a snack.

norm: It's kind to offer your guests a warm beverage.
situation: John has some guests come over to his new place that he recently moved into.
intention: John wants to show his guests that they are welcome.
moral_action: John offers his guests the option of either hot tea or coffee, and they choose coffee.
immoral_action: John tells his guests that he's happy they came over but doesn't offer them anything in the way of refreshments.

norm: It is good to enjoy time with neighbors.
situation: Tory's community is throwing a block party.
intention: Tory wants to check her mail.
moral_action: Tory sees her neighbors on the way to her mailbox and offers to come back with games to play.
immoral_action: Tory is bothered by all of the neighbors outside and gives them dirty looks on the way to her mailbox.

norm: It's good to help out your neighbors.
situation: Mark has just moved to a new neighborhood.
intention: Mark wants to make friends with the neighbors.
moral_action: Mark offers to help some neighbors with their lawn and gets to know them.
immoral_action: Mark invites himself over to a neighbors house and makes a mess and doesn't clean up after himself.

norm: It's good to inform your neighbors of things.
situation: Jenny has a garden outside of the neighbor's house.
intention: Jenny wants to water the garden.
moral_action: Jenny asks her neighbor if she can use their water and pay for it.
immoral_action: Jenny attaches a hose to the neighbor's water supply and waters the garden.

norm: It's good to care about the well-being of your neighbors.
situation: Sue caught the Coronavirus and becomes mildly sick.
intention: Sue wants to recover from the disease.
moral_action: Sue decides to self quarantine herself for 14 days in order not to spread the disease.
immoral_action: Sue thinks that fresh air is important in treating the disease, so she goes outside everyday for a walk without wearing a mask.

norm: It's good to get along with your neighbors.
situation: Mary is on her way out when she notices her neighbor approaching.
intention: Mary wants to leave.
moral_action: Mary stops and helps her neighbor look for their lost dog.
immoral_action: Mary jumps in her car and ignores her neighbor.

norm: It's good to ask neighbors for help.
situation: RaShonda is home alone and getting ready to clean the leaves out of the gutters.
intention: RaShonda wants to climb the ladder.
moral_action: RaShonda sees her neighbor Steve, and asks him to hold the ladder for her.
immoral_action: RaShonda props the ladder against the house and climbs to the top.

norm: It is kind to share your insight with your neighbors.
situation: Phil is chatting with his neighbor when he notices a fast growing and intrusive weed on his neighbor's lawn.
intention: Phil wants to choose a topic to chat about.
moral_action: Phil mentions the weed and that is should be removed immediately.
immoral_action: Phil mentions the recent sports game and not the weed.

norm: It's good to be kind to your neighbors.
situation: Ollie noticed that there were new neighbors moving in next door to him.
intention: Ollie wants the neighbors to know who he is.
moral_action: Ollie brings a casserole to the neighbors and introduces himself to them.
immoral_action: Ollie sends a threatening letter to the neighbors warning them not to mess with him.

norm: It is kind to help your neighbors.
situation: Joe is relaxing on his patio, and he sees that his neighbor, Ryan, is having trouble starting his lawnmower.
intention: Joe wants to react to the situation.
moral_action: Joe offers his help to start Ryan's lawnmower and is able to get it running.
immoral_action: Joe tells Ryan that it looks like he's not going to be able to mow his lawn today since his lawnmower won't start.

norm: It is good to be considerate to your neighbors.
situation: Kevin who lives next door to Neil is planning a party for the weekend.
intention: Kevin wants to decide the number of attendees.
moral_action: Kevin decides to invite only four key couples for a total of eight people.
immoral_action: Kevin decides to invite everyone he knows which is about two hundred people.

norm: It's always good to be honest with your friends.
situation: Maddie's friend Jonas is dating a woman who is cheating on him.
intention: Maddie wants Jonas to know about it.
moral_action: Maddie tells Jonas that the woman is actively cheating on him.
immoral_action: Maddie tells Jonas that she heard about the cheating but doesn't believe it's true.

norm: It's good to want to keep a co-worker safe.
situation: Beth works in a laboratory.
intention: Beth has to clean up the lab.
moral_action: Beth sweeps up broken glass and mops after and lets her coworker to walk carefully on the wet floor.
immoral_action: Beth cleans up quickly by brushing broken glassware into a corner and not mopping up all of a spill to leave work sooner.

norm: Friends should be open and honest with one another.
situation: Molly steals Xanax from her sister, and her sister and brother are suspecting Molly did it.
intention: Molly wants to try to talk to her sister about why the Xanax is missing.
moral_action: Molly decides to admit she stole the Xanax from her sister.
immoral_action: Molly insists that her brother took her sister's Xanax, and that she is innocent.

norm: It's good to be honest with your housemates.
situation: Frank spilled tequila all over Ryan's laptop and cleaned up the mess, but the laptop won't work.
intention: Frank doesn't want Ryan to be angry with him.
moral_action: Frank uses his savings to get Ryan a replacement laptop and admits to breaking the original.
immoral_action: Frank tells Ryan that the laptop made some loud beeping noises and stopped working out of nowhere.

norm: It's good to be honest with your parents.
situation: Liza is off at college, and she has decided to start a page on the internet with dirty pictures as a job.
intention: Liza wants to earn money for her college years.
moral_action: Liza tells her parents about her unconventional job when they ask if she has found work.
immoral_action: Liza tells her parents she is working at a pizza restaurant and does not mention her webpage.

norm: It's good to be honest with your family members.
situation: Drew got fired from his job and is hurting for money, and his parents don't know he's jobless yet because he's ashamed to tell them.
intention: Drew wants to ask his parents for money.
moral_action: Drew tells his parents he lost his job, and needs money to hold him over while he finds a new one.
immoral_action: Drew tells his parents he needs money because he wasn't capable of managing his money well.

norm: It is okay to be protective over your friends.
situation: Jill heard Bill was going to go through the rough part of town by himself.
intention: Jill wants to decide what to do.
moral_action: Jill makes sure that Bill has someone with him before he goes.
immoral_action: Jill ignores what she hears about Bill, thinking it not true.

norm: It's good to check on your friends' safety.
situation: Linda hears that her friend was just in a car accident.
intention: Linda wants to react to the news.
moral_action: Linda goes to the hospital to find out how her friend is doing.
immoral_action: Linda shrugs and says it's probably fine, and turns on her TV.

norm: It is good to be honest with your siblings.
situation: Kate is going to meet a man she met on Tinder, but she hasn't told her sister yet.
intention: Kate doesn't want her sister to worry about her.
moral_action: Kate tells her sister about the date and gives the man's phone number and license plate to her.
immoral_action: Kate tells his sister that she's going with her friend to get ice cream.

norm: It's good to be honest with your friend.
situation: Jean is at the mall with her heavy set friend who asks her an opinion of a tight outfit she's picked out.
intention: Jean wants to avoid pointing out her friend's weight.
moral_action: Jean suggests to her friend that she find something in a different color.
immoral_action: Jean tells her friend that the outfit would look great on her.

norm: It's good to be honest with friends.
situation: Best friends Melody and Daisy are chatting, and Daisy is asking Melody what she thinks of her new outfit, which Melody believes looks bad.
intention: Melody wants Daisy to feel good about herself.
moral_action: Melody tells Daisy that she doesn't think that the outfit suits her body shape that well while pointing out Daisy's most beautiful features, suggesting she emphasize those.
immoral_action: Melody tells Daisy that she looks great in the new outfit and that she should wear it with confidence.

norm: It's good for siblings to be honest with each other.
situation: Mary asks her brother Harry what he thinks of the oversized flower dress from her closet.
intention: Harry wants to give an opinion on the dress.
moral_action: Harry tells Mary that the dress doesn't suit her that well.
immoral_action: Harry tells Mary that the dress looks great on her.

norm: It is okay to protect your friends.
situation: Pat saw Jimmy picking on his friend Bob.
intention: Pat wants to decide to defend Bob or not.
moral_action: Pat stands up to Jimmy and together they are able to fight Jimmy off.
immoral_action: Pat runs away from the scene and hopes no one saw him.

norm: It's kind to share your food with others
situation: John is with his friend Will - who doesn't have a lot of money - at his school's cafeteria.
intention: John wants to eat quickly because he has a class starting soon.
moral_action: John doesn't have time to eat all his meal and leaves the leftovers to Will.
immoral_action: John doesn't have time to eat all his lunch, so he throws what he did not eat in the trash although Will was still hungry after his meal.

norm: It's generous to treat someone to a meal.
situation: Sue is making 4 servings of food for dinner, and the fridge is almost full.
intention: Sue wants to not put any of the food in the fridge.
moral_action: Sue shares the food with her family, giving the other 3 portions away.
immoral_action: Sue throws the rest of the leftovers out after making the food and doesn't share the food.

norm: It's good to buy food for people.
situation: Hank and some friends are at Hank's house and everyone's hungry, but some people are nearly broke.
intention: Hank wants to get some food delivered.
moral_action: Hank buys food for himself his friends that can't afford it.
immoral_action: Hank orders food for the friends who have money and ignores the ones who don't.

norm: It is polite to include others when ordering food.
situation: Joe is out with his friend Julia at a local restaurant, and they're both very hungry, however Julia is broke.
intention: Joe needs to order food.
moral_action: Joe orders an appetizer platter and offers Julia a share.
immoral_action: Joe orders an entree for himself and does not share.

norm: It's good to tell customers to enjoy their food.
situation: Jordan is working at a cafe and waiting on several tables during his shift.
intention: Jordan wants to get food to all his tables.
moral_action: Jordon places the diner's order in front of them and looks them in eye and tells he hopes they like their dishes.
immoral_action: Jordon drops an order off at a table without saying a word and rushes back to the kitchen.

norm: It's nice to share food.
situation: John is eating his lunch next to a classmate who forgot his lunch.
intention: John wants to eat his lunch.
moral_action: John offers a portion of his lunch to his classmate.
immoral_action: John ignores his classmate and finishes his lunch.

norm: It's good to appreciate someone's food.
situation: Michael is eating dinner that his friend Janet cooked for him when she asks him how it tastes?
intention: Michael wants to respond to Janet's question.
moral_action: Michael tells Janet that the meal is delicious, and he's really thankful she took the time to make it for him.
immoral_action: Michael tells Janet that it's not great because it hasn't been seasoned properly.

norm: It's good to pay for meals that you ate.
situation: Jeff is at a restuarant with his friends eating lunch and gets into an argument with one of them.
intention: Jeff wants to leave.
moral_action: Jeff puts money on the table to cover his share and walks out.
immoral_action: Jeff says he is going to the bathroom but instead leaves the restaurant without paying.

norm: It's good to share food with others.
situation: Thiago is at school on lunch break and notices a classmate doesn't have any lunch.
intention: Thiago wants to find out why the classmate doesn't have any lunch.
moral_action: Thiago offers half of his sandwich to his classmate and asks what happened to their lunch.
immoral_action: Thiago asks the classmate in front of everybody why they don't have a lunch.

norm: It's good to grab a bite together with a friend.
situation: Harold is leaving class with Karen and has extra time before his afternoon class.
intention: Harold wants to eat.
moral_action: Harold and Karen sit in the cafeteria and eat sandwiches together.
immoral_action: Harold buys a sandwich and leaves Karen in the Cafeteria, so he can eat alone in his car.

norm: It's good to order people food as gifts.
situation: Cory is in a long distance relationship with a girl, whose birthday is coming up, and they are both very antisocial people.
intention: Cory wants to send his girl something for her birthday.
moral_action: Cory orders take out from her favorite restaurant and sends it by courier to her.
immoral_action: Cory decides to send her some new clothes as a gift.

norm: It's kind to feed your friends.
situation: Liam and John are hanging out at Liam's house when Liam starts to feel hungry.
intention: Liam wants to get some food.
moral_action: Liam tells John he's going to order a pizza feast for the two of them as his treat.
immoral_action: Liam walks over to the kitchen without saying anything to John and stays in there while he finishes his snack.

norm: It's good to eat with other people.
situation: Matt is away at a professional conference that is required for his job and it's now his lunch break.
intention: Matt wants to relax and take his mind off of work.
moral_action: Matt takes a seat at table with some friendly looking strangers and starts eating the lunch he packed.
immoral_action: Matt finds a private spot in a nearby parking lot and eats his lunch alone while listening to music.

norm: It's polite to share food with others if you can.
situation: Colby is in the break room at lunch eating when he realizes that Jed doesn't have any food.
intention: Colby wants to eat his food.
moral_action: Colby gives Jed half of his sandwich and buys him a bag of chips.
immoral_action: Colby eats all of his food in front of Jed without offering him any.

norm: It's nice to ask people they eat.
situation: Jane wants to throw a big party for her friends.
intention: Jane wants to throw the party.
moral_action: Jane asked her friends what they ate, so she could have food for everyone.
immoral_action: Jane orginized the party without asking any of her friends anything except when they could come.

norm: It's good to share food with people who are hungry
situation: Sara is about to order a pizza and her friend, who hasn't eaten all day, shows up to her house.
intention: Sara wants to have enough pizza leftover for tomorrow.
moral_action: Sara orders enough pizza to have some for later and to feed her friend.
immoral_action: Sara figures her friend will get her own food and orders only enough for herself.

norm: It's good to take your friends out to eat.
situation: Gerald overhears some of his teammates complain about being hungry in the locker room after soccer practice, and Gerald just got paid.
intention: Gerald wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Gerald invites his teammates to have a early supper at a buffet, and he covers the bill.
immoral_action: Gerald spends his entire paycheck at the local arcade trying to beat his high score.

norm: It is good to appreciate the food you eat.
situation: Jenna's father spent an hour making a healthy dinner with lots of vegetables.
intention: Jenna wants to get out of eating her vegetables.
moral_action: Jenna compliments her father on the meal and sneaks her vegetables to the dog while her parents aren't looking.
immoral_action: Jenna tells her father that the meal looks like a puddle of green puke.

norm: It's good to share food with people.
situation: Timmy is really hungry and ordered an especially large lunch at school and notices his friend didn't get anything.
intention: Timmy wants to talk with his friend.
moral_action: Timmy sits down and offers part of his meal to his friend without food and asks him why he is without food.
immoral_action: Timmy starts a long conversation with his friend that has no food and eats his entire meal in front of his friend during the conversation.

norm: You should appreciate your parents when they support your happiness.
situation: Jan lives with his parents while he's going through a rough time.
intention: Jan wants to tell his parents about how they've acted towards him.
moral_action: Jan thanks his parents for the opportunity of living rent-free for a while.
immoral_action: Jan berates his parents for lots of petty problems that the house has.

norm: You should be grateful when your parents help you out.
situation: Mr. and Mrs. Smith just paid for their son Ryan to fix his car after he got into an accident.
intention: Ryan wants better tires than the ones he has on his car now.
moral_action: Ryan doesn't like the tires he has, so he picks up extra hours at work to buy new ones.
immoral_action: Ryan complains about the tires on his car to his parents even though they just replaced them and many other parts of the car.

norm: You should have your kids respect your financial situation.
situation: Bryan, a poor man, has children who are begging him to buy an expensive video game system.
intention: Bryan wants to stop the begging.
moral_action: Bryan explains that he doesn't have a lot of money and needs it for food and clothes.
immoral_action: Bryan buys the children the game system they want.

norm: You should be grateful when your parents buy you things.
situation: Sally just got her driver's license, and her mother bought her a used car to mark the occasion.
intention: Sally wants to respond to the gift.
moral_action: Sally gives her mother a hug and thanks her for buying the car.
immoral_action: Sally complains that she doesn't like the color of the car and that it isn't cool.

norm: You should respect your sibling's feelings.
situation: Luke notices that his sister has been gaining weight lately.
intention: Luke wants to have an ice cream sandwich.
moral_action: Luke asks his sister if she wants to have an ice cream sandwich with him.
immoral_action: Luke gets an ice cream sandwich for himself and tells his sister that she looks like she has already had enough ice cream.

norm: You should be polite to a parents partner.
situation: Andrew is visiting his girlfriend Linda's parents for dinner, but Linda's family cooked his least favorite food.
intention: Andrew wants to make conversation over dinner.
moral_action: Andrew makes conversation about the weather and his job while trying a small portion of the food.
immoral_action: Andrew complains that he has never liked this type of food and announces that he will be stopping at McDonald's on the way home.

norm: You should be more grateful for your parents.
situation: Donna's parents are making her do online school because of the pandemic.
intention: Donna wants to see her friends in person more often.
moral_action: Donna decides to be thankful that her parents care about her and after explaining her feelings, they allow her to visit a friend while wearing a mask.
immoral_action: Donna disparages her parents to her friends when she sneaks out to hang out with them.

norm: Moms and dads should get along with each other.
situation: Halina that her husband Andrew has made several large electronics purchases on their credit card, and their son is in the room.
intention: Halina wants to confront her husband.
moral_action: Halina invites him on a date, and suggests that they come up with a budget.
immoral_action: Halina shows the bill to her husband scolding him in front of their son.

norm: You should be nice to your sibling's friends.
situation: Curtis is trying to finish up his book report when his younger brother and friend burst into his room.
intention: Curtis wants to give his full attention to his report.
moral_action: Curtis picks them up teasingly and deposits them outside of his room, closing the door on his way back into the room.
immoral_action: Curtis raises his voice telling them to get out of his room or else.

norm: You should be generous towards your family.
situation: Al just cashed in a scratch ticket on which he won a significant amount of money.
intention: Al wants to spend his newfound money.
moral_action: Al uses the winnings to surprise his wife and kids by taking them on a long vacation.
immoral_action: Al uses the money to buy himself a brand new motorcycle.

norm: You should respect your parent's partner.
situation: Charles walks into the house carrying a whoopie cushion, and he notices his father's new girlfriend  Susan talking to a group of well dressed people in the kitchen.
intention: Charles wants to amuse himself.
moral_action: Charles greets Susan before he watches his favorite television show.
immoral_action: Charles slips the whoopie cushion on Susan's chair before hiding behind the couch.

norm: YOu are expected to treat your friends' siblings with respect.
situation: Casey, a seven year old, glares at his sister Sabrina when she refuses to let him have one of her cookies.
intention: Casey wants to express his anger.
moral_action: Casey talks about his intense feelings and his desire with his mother.
immoral_action: Casey sticks out his tongue at Sabrina calling her a toad before walking away.

norm: You should try to get along with your partner's parents.
situation: James knew that his girlfriend's parents were quite religious and conservative.
intention: James doesn't want to lie about who he is.
moral_action: When his girlfriend's father brings up politics, James says that he's liberal but doesn't like to discuss politics at dinner.
immoral_action: "James insists on wearing a ""Black Trans Lives Matter"" t-shirt to dinner."

norm: It's expected that you'll be kind toward your siblings.
situation: John and Chris are two ten year old brothers living with their parents.
intention: John wants his parents to love him more than his they do his brother.
moral_action: John treats his brother Chris very well especially in front of his parents.
immoral_action: John beats Chris up whenever he can and also tells his parents that Chris does bad stuff.

norm: You should be patient and understanding with family members.
situation: Billy's mom had a bad day at work and was stressed out at home.
intention: Billy's mom wanted Billy to take care of his responsibilities.
moral_action: After a bad day at work Billy's mom took a deep breath and had patience with her son and motivated him to get his chores done.
immoral_action: Billy's mom was in a bad mood from work and got mad a Billy just because he didn't do his dishes.

norm: You should treat your family well
situation: Thanksgiving is a couple of days away.
intention: Larry needs a place to stay while his is visiting his parents and brother.
moral_action: Larry books a room at a nice hotel and books his family rooms for a night off after the holiday meal.
immoral_action: Larry demands his parents put him up for the weekend forcing his brother out of his own room.

norm: One should show respect to family members.
situation: Sal is at a family reunion.
intention: Sal wants to talk with someone.
moral_action: Sal see his cousin and asks him how everything is going for her.
immoral_action: Sal chats with the people who are doing the catering for the party.

norm: You should be polite to family members.
situation: Artie is at a thanksgiving dinner with his extended family when his aunt begins expressing a lot of controversial opinions.
intention: Artie wants to respond to his aunt.
moral_action: Artie tells his aunt that while he doesn't agree with her opinions, they can disagree with each other in a respectful manner.
immoral_action: Artie tells his aunt that her ideas are ignorant and that only a stupid person would believe them.

norm: You should try to be nice to family members.
situation: David's least favorite uncle is in town visiting for the weekend and asks to spend time with him.
intention: David wants to spend the weekend with his friends.
moral_action: David explains to his uncle that he really wants to go to his friends for the weekend.
immoral_action: David tells his uncle that he doesn't like him and goes to his friends for the weekend.

norm: You should respect the property of your family.
situation: Daphne is the barn on her families farm with her friends.
intention: Daphne wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Daphne invites her friend on a long hike in the park nextdoor.
immoral_action: Daphne climbs into one of the tractors and attempts to race her friend around the field.

norm: People are expected to be considerate of their family members.
situation: Ray needs to practice his guitar, and his mother is sleeping in the other room.
intention: Ray wants to play guitar.
moral_action: Ray goes over to his friends house to practice.
immoral_action: Ray practices in his room for several hours.

norm: it's important to treat family members with respect
situation: Kris is talking with his mom Dana who tells him he needs to get a job.
intention: Kris wants to agree with his mom.
moral_action: Kris tells his mom that he agrees with her and that he's going to double his efforts.
immoral_action: Kris tells his mom that she's stating the obvious and that he's not an idiot, and she should shut up and let him do his thing.

norm: It's expected you be patient with family members
situation: Tina has a daughter Rita who is just learning to tie her shoes, and they are about to leave for the store.
intention: Tina wants Rita to tie her shoes.
moral_action: Tina waits for Rita to get the hang of tying her shoes before they leave.
immoral_action: Tina tries to hurry Rita up and make her go faster.

norm: You should be welcoming of family members.
situation: Greg just started a new job in a new city and his aunt and uncle want to visit him.
intention: Greg wants to set up his new apartment.
moral_action: Greg tells his aunt and uncle that they can visit, but they'll likely need to help him set up his furniture.
immoral_action: Greg tells his aunt and uncle that he doesn't want them to visit because he's too busy.

norm: One should respect their family.
situation: Christina, a five year old, bites her lip as she stares at her father who refuses to take her to the park.
intention: Christina wants to express her anger.
moral_action: Christina calls her friend and vents to her about her parents.
immoral_action: Christina calls her father a strange monkey face and sticks her tongue out at him.

norm: It's expected that you love your children.
situation: Tristan, Marsha's daughter, is having a temper tantrum in the middle of a store screaming and crying.
intention: Marsha wants her daughter to stop crying.
moral_action: Marsha hugs Tristan and comforts her with kind words.
immoral_action: Marsha wacks Tristan on the arm demanding her to stop crying in a stern tone.

norm: It's proper to protect the kids in your family.
situation: Sam's son reports that he is being bullied at school.
intention: Sam wants to do respond the incident.
moral_action: Sam reports the bullying to the school.
immoral_action: Sam tells his son its no big deal and to toughen up.

norm: Parents are expected to treat their children well.
situation: Helen's two kids hadn't been eating much and had started to lose weight.
intention: Helen wants her kids to gain weight.
moral_action: Helen keeps her kids hydrated and schedules them to see the doctor.
immoral_action: Helen gives her kids chocolate every morning for breakfast and chips for lunch.

norm: It's wise for children to listen to their parent's advice.
situation: Norma is going to a party and her parents tell her not to drive back home if she's had too much to drink.
intention: Norma wants to have a good time at the party.
moral_action: Norma drinks more than she should and decides to take a cab back home.
immoral_action: Norma gets drunk and decides to drive back home.

norm: It's good for children to show their parents respect.
situation: Niles has lots of schoolwork to get through today and his dad comes in.
intention: Niles wants to get back to his schoolwork.
moral_action: Niles tells his dad that he's busy with schoolwork today.
immoral_action: Niles tells his dad to leave the room, so he can finish the schoolwork.

norm: It's okay to sacrifice your happiness for your children.
situation: Casey is a mother that has been offered the career of her dreams but it would take her away from her children.
intention: Casey wants to do what is best for her.
moral_action: Casey knows she made the decision to have children and knows they must come first, so she turns down the job opportunity.
immoral_action: Casey decides that the career is not worth passing up and takes on the job.

norm: It's good for a child to protect their parent.
situation: Ken is walking down the street with his mom Ellen when a mugger punches Ellen and takes her purse.
intention: Ken wants to react to his mom being mugged.
moral_action: Ken quickly trips the mugger and kicks him in the ribs knocking the wind out of him.
immoral_action: Ken frantically flails and screams for help as the mugger runs away while Ken is panicking.

norm: Kids should respect the wishes of their parent.
situation: Frank wants to go out and catch a movie with his friends, but he's been grounded by his parents.
intention: Frank wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Frank decides to read his favorite book while staying home for the night.
immoral_action: Frank sneaks out of the house while his parents are distracted and catches the movie.

norm: It's good to protect your unborn child.
situation: Tina is a party girl who has just found out that she is pregnant.
intention: Tina wants to react to the unplanned pregnancy.
moral_action: Tina decides to change her life in order to be a good mother.
immoral_action: Tina goes on a drinking and drug binge in an effort to forget her situation.

norm: It's good for a parent to treat their children well.
situation: Don's son David comes in second place at his track meet and is disappointed.
intention: Don wants to motivate David to do better.
moral_action: Don tells David that his performance was excellent and that there is no shame in taking second place.
immoral_action: Don tells David that he is ashamed of his lack of effort and that coming in second place is just as bad as coming in last.

norm: It's expected that people love their parents.
situation: James' elderly mother moved into a nursing home and repeatedly told him that she was lonely.
intention: James wants to avoid spending time in the creepy nursing home.
moral_action: James visits his mother every weekend to take her into town for dinner and shopping.
immoral_action: James never visits his mother and only calls on her birthday and Christmas.

norm: It's normal for parents to support your children's dreams
situation: Nancy is at home when her son Paul comes in and tells her he wants to be an astronaut when he grows up.
intention: Nancy wants to mention how hard that would be.
moral_action: Nancy tells Paul that it's a difficult tasks but that if others have done it so can he if he works hard.
immoral_action: Nancy tells Paul that it's an impossible dream since only a few people every few years get to be astronauts.

norm: It's expected that friends will help each other.
situation: John's friend is moving into a new home and asks for his help.
intention: John wants to respond to his friend.
moral_action: John helps his friend move.
immoral_action: John tells his friend he is too busy to help.

norm: It is thoughtful to bring a friend places with you.
situation: Alex is heading to the beach when he runs across his friend.
intention: Alex wants to proceed to the beach.
moral_action: Alex asks his friend to come along to the beach with him.
immoral_action: Alex says hi to his friend and continues on the the beach.

norm: Friendship check on each other
situation: James hasn't seen his friend for a week, and the last time they met the friend was coughing.
intention: James wants to avoid getting COVID-19.
moral_action: James calls his friend ten times, and when his friend doesn't answer James sends emergency services for a welfare check.
immoral_action: James tries to forget about his friend because even thinking about COVID-19 stresses him out.

norm: It's good to recommend places to your friends and family.
situation: Jane was talking to her friend Amanda about restaurants in the city.
intention: Jane wants to finish the conversation.
moral_action: Jane helps Amanda with several recommendations for restaurants that day.
immoral_action: Jane doesn't recommend any places because she wants to keep them to herself.

norm: It's kind to help out a friend when possible.
situation: Hank is at home relaxing when he gets a phone call from his friend John who asks Hank to help him move.
intention: Hank wants to respond to John's request.
moral_action: Hank tells John that he'll come by and complete the move with him and that he'll be right over.
immoral_action: Hank tells John that moving is hard, and he shouldn't be asking him to help him do such physically demanding chores.

norm: It's considerate to help to help friends
situation: Harry has a friend who has asked him for a ride into work, but he is scheduled to go in early.
intention: Harry wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Harry makes sure they leave extra early in order to take his friend and get to work on time himself.
immoral_action: Harry tells his friend he is unable to take him because he works early.

norm: It's kind to give advice to a friend.
situation: Zachary's friend is having relationship troubles and is asking him for advice.
intention: Zachary wants whats best for his friend.
moral_action: Zachary tells his friend that communication is the most important thing and encourages him to communicate with his partner.
immoral_action: Zachary is afraid to give his bad advice so tells his friend he doesn't know what he should do.

norm: It's kind of friends to do things for each other.
situation: Jessica notices her friend accidentally left the stove on and the water is boiling over.
intention: Jessica wants to consider addressing the situation.
moral_action: Jessica immediately takes action to turn off the stove before the water completely boils over.
immoral_action: Jessica ignores the stove and simply lets the water boil over.

norm: You should be grateful when someone celebrates you.
situation: Marlon is at the Academy Awards ceremony where he's just been given an Oscar.
intention: Marlon wants to respond to the prize.
moral_action: Marlon graciously accepts the Oscar and thanks the academy for recognizing him in such a special way.
immoral_action: Marlon tells the audience that he's not accepting the gift because of their mistreatment of Native Americans and walks off.

norm: You should be grateful for help.
situation: Sun is struggling to lift a heavy box from the floor when Bruce comes by and helps him.
intention: Sun wants to move the heavy box onto a shelf.
moral_action: Sun smiles at Bruce and offer to repay Bruce for helping him.
immoral_action: Sun grumbles to Bruce that he could have lifted the box onto the shelf by himself.

norm: You should be grateful when someone shares with you.
situation: Sara has been invited out to eat and the friend said it would be their treat.
intention: Sara wants to avoid preparing dinner.
moral_action: Sara accepts the offer and thanks her friend genuinely.
immoral_action: Sara eats with her friend and mentions how they owed her from Sara paying last time.

norm: You should thank someone who gives you good advice.
situation: James was struggling to change a flat tire when a passerby pointed out that he was using the wrong size of wrench.
intention: James wants to avoid feeling incompetent.
moral_action: James thanks the passerby and swaps his wrench for the correct size from his toolset.
immoral_action: James insists that the passerby must be blind, and he's using the right wrench.

norm: You should be grateful when someone helps you.
situation: Paula is carrying groceries into her apartment when she drops a bag, spilling her groceries everywhere, but her neighbor hears and helps her pick everything up.
intention: Paula wants to pick up all of her spilled groceries without losing anything.
moral_action: Paula thanks her neighbor for his help and asks if they notice anything else still on the ground.
immoral_action: Paula ignores her neighbor's help and doesn't say a word to them, instead focusing only on her groceries.

norm: Asking someone what they like is considerate.
situation: Alex sits with a group of friends after an evening meeting of their book club.
intention: Alex wants to go out and get something to eat.
moral_action: Alex expresses to his friends that he is getting hungry and asks if anyone has any suggestions on where they could go to enjoy a meal together.
immoral_action: Alex informs his friends that he is going out to get some tacos and tells them that they can come along if they want.

norm: You should appreciate it when someone gives you something.
situation: It's Hal's birthday and his friend gives him a present.
intention: Hal wants to accept the gift.
moral_action: Hal accepts the gift and thanks his friend and give him a hug.
immoral_action: Hal takes the gift without saying anything in return.

norm: You should accept someone's offer of help.
situation: August is struggling with addiction and her family is offering to take her to rehab.
intention: August wants to remain in control.
moral_action: August decides to take the offer and promises to work hard at rehab.
immoral_action: August turns down the offer and heads back out to the streets on her own.

norm: It's expected to do favors for a friend.
situation: Victoria is watching television on the couch when her roommate texts her asking her to walk their hyperactive dog.
intention: Victoria doesn't want to miss a moment of her favorite show.
moral_action: Victoria asks another one of her friends to record the show before she takes the dog on a walk.
immoral_action: Victoria does not reply to her friend and continues watching television.

norm: It's good to decide fairly who will get their wish.
situation: Mark tells his kids they are going out to eat and whoever gets their chores done first will be allowed to choose the restaurant.
intention: Mark needs to take the kids to get dinner.
moral_action: Mark lets his younger daughter choose because she finished first, and they head to Olive Garden.
immoral_action: Mark let's his older daughter pick the restaurant even though she didn't finish her chores, because she is smarter.

norm: You should tip for good services.
situation: Jack just finished his favorite meal at a restaurant where he liked the waiter and is about to pay.
intention: Jack wants to save his money.
moral_action: Jack leaves a tip he can afford for the waiter.
immoral_action: Jack doesn't give the waiter any tip and leaves.

norm: People are expected to be grateful for gifts.
situation: It is Christmas morning and ten year old Allison is opening her presents.
intention: Allison wants a new Xbox for Christmas.
moral_action: Allison thanks her parents for all the gifts they got her and asks if they will get her an Xbox in the future.
immoral_action: Allison throws a tantrum, screaming and crying at her parents when an XBox is not one of her gifts.

norm: You should show gratitude for gifts.
situation: Luke is at Christmas with his family, and he gets an oven mit from his aunt that he does not like.
intention: Luke wants to comment on the gift.
moral_action: Luke shows gratitude for the oven mit, even though he does not like it.
immoral_action: Luke says he hates the oven mit.

norm: You should be grateful to people that treat you well.
situation: Dave's wife Sandy comes home and surprises Dave with a beautiful watch she bought him.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the gift.
moral_action: Dave tells his wife that he is so thankful she did that for him and that he loves her so much.
immoral_action: Dave tells his wife that he already has a watch, so she shouldn't have spent their money on the new one.

norm: It's considerate to show gratitude when others help you.
situation: Omar was riding his bike in the park when he hit a pothole and flipped off the bike, and now Ken is helping him get up.
intention: Omar wants to say something to Ken.
moral_action: Omar tells Ken that he is very thankful someone was there to help him after his accident.
immoral_action: Omar tells Ken that he didn't need to help him up, that Omar is a man, and he can handle his own problems.

norm: You should be grateful for the gifts you receive
situation: On his birthday Juan receives a gift card to a store he considers low quality from his secretary.
intention: Juan wants to acknowledge the gift.
moral_action: Juan thanks his secretary for thinking of him on his bithday.
immoral_action: Juan tells his secretary the store is too low brow for him and asks her if she can return the gift card.

norm: Its' good to be grateful to others.
situation: Marlowe just got out of jail early thanks to a friend's letter to the judge.
intention: Marlowe wants to hang out with her friend.
moral_action: Marlowe treats her friend to a nice home cooked meal to thank the friend for the letter to the judge.
immoral_action: Marlowe goes on and on to her friend about how good it is to be free without acknowledging that it was due to the friend.

norm: It's good to show your gratitude toward others.
situation: Tammy is working as an emergency medical technician during an emergency, and she is processing patients as quickly as she can through the emergency room.
intention: Tammy needs to get the clerical staff processing people more quickly.
moral_action: Tammy praises the work of the clerical staff, telling them that they are having a great effect on patient care that day, and she appreciates them.
immoral_action: Tammy tells the people processing paperwork for her patients that they aren't moving fast enough and that they're going to cost someone their life.

norm: You shouldn't say mean things to women.
situation: Chris is talking with a group of his friends.
intention: Chris wants to make his point about the football season.
moral_action: Chris lays out the facts about why his team will win the NFL championship.
immoral_action: Chris tells a girl to be quiet because women don't know anything about sports.

norm: You should not rape your maid.
situation: Arnold has been hitting the bar in his mansion hard all day long and watching porn.
intention: Arnold wants to satisfy his sexual urges.
moral_action: Arnold pulls out his little black book and makes a booty call to a friend.
immoral_action: Arnold calls his maid into the room and forces himself on her.

norm: You shouldn't say mean things to girls about their looks.
situation: James felt disappointed that Jenna beat him at the chess tournament.
intention: James wants to feel less inferior to Jenna.
moral_action: James mentally thinks that at least he's more attractive than Jenna, while outwardly congratulating her.
immoral_action: James tells Jenna she's a fat, pimply nerd no one will ever love.

norm: You should not call women pet names.
situation: Joseph recently hired Anne to be his secretary and has some work for her to get done.
intention: Joseph wants to get Anne's attention to hand her the work.
moral_action: Joseph texts Anne a basic message asking her to come grab some work to do.
immoral_action: "Joseph calls from across the office to Anne, saying ""Can you come pick this work up babe?""."

norm: You shouldn't be a creep toward women.
situation: Gary is walking to attend his class and sees a group of young women on the way.
intention: Gary wants to walk past the group of the women.
moral_action: Gary says hi and simply walks past the women.
immoral_action: As Gary is passing the group he teases the women.

norm: You shouldn't play with the emotions of women.
situation: Cory meets Jessica at a bar and realizes that Jessica likes him.
intention: Cory wants to see and date women other than Jessica.
moral_action: Cory tells Jessica that he isn't interested, but they can still be friends.
immoral_action: Cory calls Jessica every night before he goes out on dates with other women.

norm: You shouldn't give excuses to people about beating women.
situation: Bob is speaking to his friend Mark, asking Mark to bail him out of jail after he was arrested for domestic abuse.
