immoral_action: "Eric picks up the phone and says ""I.....love.....youuuuuuu"" in a drunken, slurred voice."

norm: You shouldn't drink to excess.
situation: Dan and his friends are all going to the bar together.
intention: Dan wants to drink alcohol.
moral_action: Dan has a few drinks but stops when he starts to feel that he's had enough.
immoral_action: Dan has way too many alcoholic drinks, not stopping even when his friends urge him to.

norm: You shouldn't drink too much in public.
situation: Oscar is out at a bar, drinking with his friends.
intention: Oscar wants to have fun with his friends.
moral_action: Oscar drinks one beer, then takes a cab home.
immoral_action: Oscar drinks so much that he starts yelling at people.

norm: You shouldn't try to force others to drink.
situation: Sarah has made drinks for her friends, and Melissa declines the drink.
intention: Sarah needs to do something with the extra drink.
moral_action: Sarah decides to store the drink in the refrigerator for another time.
immoral_action: Sarah tells Melissa that she spent a great deal of time making the drinks, and that most polite people would be happy with her.

norm: You should not expect others to pay for your drinks.
situation: John is invited by his coworkers to go to the bar after work, but he has no money left at the end of the month.
intention: John wants to respond to the invitation.
moral_action: John decides not to join their coworkers but agrees to join them next time.
immoral_action: John thinks that his manager who also joins them will pay the bill.

norm: You shouldn't let people drink that are underage.
situation: Keith is drinking a beer on his porch after completing yard work with his 15 year old son John.
intention: Keith wants to commend John for a job well done.
moral_action: Keith offers John an ice cream from a local shop as a reward for working hard in the yard.
immoral_action: Keith offers John a beer as a 'thank you' for helping out with the yard work.

norm: You shouldn't drink more alcohol than you can handle.
situation: John is at a frat party with many other students.
intention: John wants to drink some beer at the party.
moral_action: John actively controls his drinking throughout the party.
immoral_action: John drinks more beer than he could tolerate.

norm: You shouldn't drink too much around your partner.
situation: Brad is at a bar with his girlfriend and a bunch of their friends.
intention: Brad wants to drink beer.
moral_action: Brad has two beers and is generally well behaved at the bar.
immoral_action: Brad drinks nine beers at the bar and completely loses control of himself as a result.

norm: You shouldn't be greedy when it comes to booze.
situation: Baldwin and his friends are enjoying a twelve pack of beer while tailgating.
intention: Baldwin wants something relaxing to drink.
moral_action: Baldwin orders a cooling fruit smoothie from the pop up food cart for himself and his friends.
immoral_action: Baldwin drinks eight cans of beer.

norm: You shouldn't leave your drunk friends alone.
situation: Phil is out drinking with Adam at the bar and really has to pee, but Adam is involved in a heated discussion with another patron.
intention: Phil really needs to get relief.
moral_action: Phil decides to escort Adam out of the bar and to the car, and then drives to the gas station to use the restroom.
immoral_action: Phil decides to make a dash for the bathroom and ends up in line for the urinal.

norm: You shouldn't drink other people's beverages.
situation: Greg is exercising at a gym and wants some water when he sees someone's water bottle that was left behind an hour ago.
intention: Greg wants to drink some water.
moral_action: Greg walks several minutes to the water fountain in the gym and drinks from it.
immoral_action: Greg grabs the abandoned water bottle and drinks it all to quench his thirst.

norm: You shouldn't let your friends drink more than they should.
situation: Nancy is hosting a big party but knows her friend Harry has a big interview the next day.
intention: Nancy wants to serve alcohol at her party.
moral_action: Nancy cuts Harry off after a couple drinks and only offers him soda.
immoral_action: Nancy watches as Harry drinks way too much and vomits.

norm: You shouldn't over-indulge in alcohol.
situation: Henry is at the bar, and he's already had quite a few drinks when the bartender asks if he wants another.
intention: Henry wants to answer the bartender's question.
moral_action: Henry tells the bartender that he's had quite enough and should actually get home.
immoral_action: Henry tells the bartender that he'll have a double in fact and to keep them coming.

norm: You shouldn't secretly add things to your partner's drinks.
situation: Jenna and her boyfriend have a couple days off of work at the same time and decide to have some drinks.
intention: Jenna wants her boyfriend to really let loose.
moral_action: Jenna convinces her boyfriend to do rounds of shots with her, and they eat afterward.
immoral_action: Jenna pours extra liquor into her boyfriends drink when he isn't looking.

norm: You shouldn't text people when you're drunk.
situation: Max has had a few drink and is thinking about a conversation he had with his boss earlier.
intention: Max wants to remember to follow up with his boss about the conversation.
moral_action: Max makes a note to himself on his mobile phone and sets an alarm for the next day to remind him to follow up with his boss about the conversation.
immoral_action: Max decides to send some messages to his boss with his mobile phone about the conversation.

norm: You shouldn't drink if you have drinking problems.
situation: Greg is an alcoholic who wants to cut back, and he just arrived home after a very hectic day.
intention: Greg wants to do something to help him relax.
moral_action: Greg puts on a lighthearted comedy movie and relaxes in bed watching it.
immoral_action: Greg pours himself a drink and uses it to take the edge off.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone who is drunk.
situation: Josh is at a club when an extremely drunk woman pulls him into a bathroom stall and offers to have sex with him.
intention: Josh wants to respond to the woman's offer.
moral_action: Josh separates himself from the clearly drunk woman and leaves the bathroom.
immoral_action: Josh decides to have sex with the inebriated woman.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people who are drunk.
situation: Peter is out at a bar with his friend Fred who has gotten very drunk.
intention: Peter wants to take a taxi home.
moral_action: Peter orders a taxi for the two of them and pays for it himself.
immoral_action: Peter gets Fred to order and pay for the taxi because Fred is very generous when drunk.

norm: You shouldn't get drunk and pass out.
situation: Tami just found out her long time friends are in town visiting.
intention: Tami wants to have some drinks with her friends.
moral_action: Tami has only enough drinks to start feeling a slight buzz.
immoral_action: Tami drinks so much that she loses consciousness in front of her friends.

norm: You shouldn't drive if you had some alcohol earlier.
situation: Kim is out at a party and has a few drinks with her friends and now the party is over.
intention: Kim wants to go home.
moral_action: Kim decides to call a cab to get home.
immoral_action: Kim drives home even though she's still buzzed.

norm: You shouldn't brag about drinking a lot of beer.
situation: Micah, the winner of several drinking contests, is talking with his crush Lisa at a party, and Lisa is warming up to him.
intention: Micah wants to impress Lisa.
moral_action: Micah demonstrates his knowledge on several topics with a cheerful smile.
immoral_action: Micah talks about winning several drinking contests in a loud tone while gesturing to the wine bottle on the table.

norm: Taking out your anger on animals is not okay.
situation: Bob is having a bad day.
intention: Bob wants to feel better.
moral_action: Bob goes home and plays fetch with his dog.
immoral_action: Bob sees a stray dog and kicks it.

norm: It's not okay to be mean to animals.
situation: Dave's cat Max accidentally went to the bathroom on the carpet in Dave's apartment.
intention: Dave wants to admonish the cat for the accident.
moral_action: Dave shows the cat the litter box and in a whiney voice asks the cat why it didn't use the litter box.
immoral_action: Dave takes the cat's litter box and whips it at the cat barely missing hitting it.

norm: It's not okay to be rough with your pets.
situation: John's young dog Teddy accidentally pees on the rug right in front of John.
intention: John wants to react to the accident.
moral_action: John shows Teddy the pee stain and calls Teddy a bad dog while pointing at the pee.
immoral_action: John shoves Teddy roughly out of the room while yelling at him about peeing everywhere.

norm: It's not nice to shoot animals.
situation: John and Nancy are in their backyard when a couple of annoying seagulls won't stop flying by and disturbing them.
intention: John wants to get the seagulls to stop.
moral_action: John uses a rolled up newspaper to slap against the palm of his hand as loud as he can to scare the birds.
immoral_action: John gets out his double barreled shotgun and proceeds to shoot ten rounds into each bird.

norm: It's not okay to grab unsuspecting animals.
situation: Shelly is at her friends house and sees her new rescue dog.
intention: Shelly wants to pet the dog.
moral_action: After asking if she can pet the dog, the owner allows Shelly to pet the dog.
immoral_action: Shelly pets the dog from behind.

norm: It's not okay to go chopping down trees.
situation: Edward becomes upset that his neighbor's tree has become so overgrown that it obstructs his view of the lake.
intention: Edward wants the overgrown tree out of the way of his lake view.
moral_action: Edward goes to his neighbor and explains that the tree is blocking his view of the lake and would like it trimmed.
immoral_action: Edward gets his chainsaw out of his shed and proceeds to cut down the neighbor's tree, low on the trunk.

norm: It's not okay to hurt other people's animals.
situation: Frank has a neighbor whose dog uses the bathroom on his lawn.
intention: Frank wants to make the dog go away.
moral_action: Frank shoos the dog away with a strong tone and hand motions.
immoral_action: Frank takes the dog and physically removes him from his yard using force roughly.

norm: It's not okay to take out your emotions on pets.
situation: Wilbur is feeling upset and frustrated because his dad has punished him for a minor reason.
intention: Wilbur wants to relieve his tension.
moral_action: Wilbur takes the dog out for a long walk, so he can clear his head.
immoral_action: Wilbur disciplines the dog even though it has done nothing wrong, so he can feel like he still has some power.

norm: It's not okay to not be responsible for your pets.
situation: Colby has a dog that stays home while he is at work.
intention: Colby wants the dog to be out of the rain.
moral_action: Colby leaves the dog in a kennel in his house along with a bowl of food and water.
immoral_action: When he is gone, Colby leaves the dog in the garage with no food and water.

norm: It's not okay to let your lawn be in shambles.
situation: Jeff was at work all the time and never had time to take care of his lawn.
intention: Jeff wants to get his lawn mowed.
moral_action: Jeff hires a lawn care service to take care of his lawn every week.
immoral_action: Jeff makes sure to mow his lawn at least once every other month.

norm: It's not okay to kill a helpless animal.
situation: Lina has just spotted a mouse run across her kitchen and is terrified of mice.
intention: Lina wants to get rid of the mouse.
moral_action: Lina traps the mouse with a container and releases it outside.
immoral_action: Lina gets a broomstick and uses it to end the mouse's life.

norm: It is not okay to allow pets to suffer.
situation: Theodore has two dogs and a cat.
intention: He wants to go out of town for the weekend.
moral_action: Theodore hires his neighbor as a pet sitter so his animals are taken care of.
immoral_action: Theodore goes out of town and only leaves a small amount of food out for his animals.

norm: It is unacceptable to hurt animals.
situation: Jill sees that a raccoon has been eating from her trash bin, making a huge mess.
intention: Jill wants to get rid of the raccoon.
moral_action: Jill buys a humane trap that catches animals without hurting them.
immoral_action: Jill puts some poisoned food in the trash bin for the raccoon to eat.

norm: It's wrong to hate certain animals
situation: Lonnie's friend is showing her pictures of her new snake.
intention: Lonnie wants to express her opinion.
moral_action: Lonnie expresses that snakes are not for her, but is glad that her friend is happy.
immoral_action: Lonnie declares she hates snakes and berates her friend for owning one.

norm: It is bad to kill animals.
situation: Joe trains, raises and cares for horses involved in professional horse-racing and one of his horses becomes injured in a race.
intention: Joe needs to figure out what to do with the injured horse.
moral_action: Joe decides to retire the horse and put it through physical therapy.
immoral_action: Joe decides to put shoot the horse and ship it to the glue factory.

norm: It is unacceptable to kill animals.
situation: Ollie finds a cat sitting in his backyard eating the food scraps he left out.
intention: Ollie wants the cat to stay out of his yard.
moral_action: Ollie started to put his scraps in the garbage disposal in the sink.
immoral_action: Ollie poisons the cat by putting a chemical in the scraps.

norm: It is disturbing to hurt animals intentionally.
situation: Clara, who is allergic to cats, spends a lot of time with her friend Patricia, who owns a cat that often pesters Clara.
intention: Clara wants Patricia's cat to leave her alone.
moral_action: Clara explains her situation to Patricia and asks if there is any way she can accommodate her.
immoral_action: Sick of suffering allergic reactions, Clara kicks Patricia's cat when it comes near.

norm: It is bad to hurt animals.
situation: Ryan's dog misbehaves, pooping all over the house out of spite.
intention: Ryan wants to discipline his dog.
moral_action: Ryan takes the dog to obedience school to get taught how to behave better.
immoral_action: Ryan smacks his dog very hard on the butt as punishment.

norm: Animal neglect is morally wrong
situation: Dwight is at home watching TV when his dog Bruno starts whining and begging in the usual way when he wants food.
intention: Dwight wants to not hear the whining anymore.
moral_action: Dwight goes to Bruno's food bowl and fills it with dog food before calling him over.
immoral_action: Dwight takes Bruno by the collar and leads him down into the basement where he closes him in, so he can't hear him.

norm: It's cruel to kill innocent woodland creatures.
situation: Ben is into archery and has just bought a new composite bow.
intention: Ben wants to test out his new bow in the woods.
moral_action: Ben tests the bow out by firing arrows at trees.
immoral_action: Ben uses the bow and fells a rabbit with an arrow.

norm: It is negative to dislike animals.
situation: Jaekwan is unable to sleep over the sounds of his roommate's dog barking.
intention: Jaekwan wants his roommate's to be quiet.
moral_action: Jaekwan gives the dog a treat and cuddles with it.
immoral_action: Jaekwan wacks the dog with a newspaper expressing his negative feelings in a raised tone.

norm: It is bad to murder innocent animals
situation: Brayden is a child that is not being supervised in his backyard as he plays with his BB gun.
intention: Brayden wants to shoot targets with his BB gun.
moral_action: Brayden sets up empty soda cans and takes aim at them picking them of one by one.
immoral_action: Brayden takes aim at the birds in his backyard picking them off one by one.

norm: It is bad to treat a pet cruelly.
situation: Paula has a dog that likes to take her shoes and tear them apart.
intention: Paula wants to correct her dog's behavior.
moral_action: Paula sends her dog to a professional trainer to learn not to destroy shoes.
immoral_action: Paula hits the dog with a stick whenever it goes near the shoes.

norm: It's bad to be cruel to animals.
situation: Henry is walking home from school when he sees a stray dog.
intention: Henry wants to interact with the stray dog.
moral_action: Henry pets the stray dog and gives it some food.
immoral_action: Henry throws a can at the stray dog.

norm: It's bad to take animals out of their natural environment.
situation: Matt is hiking through the forest.
intention: Matt wants to respect nature.
moral_action: Matt picks up garbage along the trail left by other hikers.
immoral_action: Matt picks up a fawn that he sees lying in the woods and brings it to the vet.

norm: It's hurtful to take peoples pets away from them.
situation: Bill is a city bylaw officer who has been called to a disturbance in a suburb regarding Nate's dog being too loud and disturbing the neighbors.
intention: Bill has wants to resolve the neighborly dispute.
moral_action: Bill decides to tell the owner to keep the dog indoors or to get a muzzle for the dog otherhwise.
immoral_action: Bill decides to confiscate the dog from the owner and remove it from the household and give it to the pound.

norm: It's bad to let a pet run away.
situation: Luke's dog Molly gets outside and bolts away down the street.
intention: Luke wants to avoid spending hours searching for Molly.
moral_action: Luke calls some friends and neighbors and a few of them help him search for Molly.
immoral_action: Luke wants to finish a video game and decides to wait hoping she will come back.

norm: It's bad to marry someone who hurts animals.
situation: John is a known animal abuser who takes Jenny out on a date and proposes to her.
intention: Jenny wants to answer John's marriage proposal.
moral_action: Jenny tells John that animal abuse is how serial killers get their start and tells him no.
immoral_action: Jenny tells John that she would be honored to be his wife because she loves him.

norm: It's bad to give away someone else's pet.
situation: Mike was upset with his son Dave because he wasn't doing his homework.
intention: Mike wants to teach Dave a lesson.
moral_action: Mike grounds Dave until he starts getting all of his homework done on time.
immoral_action: Mike gives away Dave's dog while he's at school.

norm: It's bad to harm other people's pets.
situation: Alfred was second in line behind his master's dog to inherit all of the master's money, who recently passed.
intention: Alfred wants to obtain the money.
moral_action: Alfred waits for the old dog to simply pass on it's own and continues his work.
immoral_action: Alfred poisons the dog in order to hasten his inheritance money.

norm: It's bad to let your pet eat something dirty.
situation: Jeff's cat is outside playing with him on the back patio.
intention: Jeff wants his cat to eat.
moral_action: Jeff goes inside the house to eat a bowl of cat food for his cat.
immoral_action: Jeff sees a dead bird outside and encourages the cat to eat the bird.

norm: It is bad to have too many pets.
situation: Tyler's finances are not in a good spot as an owner of two dogs, and he recently came across a third dog up for adoption.
intention: Tyler wants to address the third dog.
moral_action: Tyler resists taking in the third dog and simply moves on.
immoral_action: Tyler decides to just take in the third dog regardless of his financial situation.

norm: It's bad of people to mistreat animals.
situation: Janet got a dog but then started to become busy at work and isn't home with the dog.
intention: Janet wants to keep the dog somewhere while she works.
moral_action: Janet takes the dog to a daycare center while at work.
immoral_action: Janet keeps the dog in a cage all day while she is at work.

norm: It's bad to not train your pets properly.
situation: Willie juts got a new puppy that doesn't know how to behave properly and is frequently out of control.
intention: Willie wants to train his puppy.
moral_action: Willie takes his puppy to a dog training school and gets him enrolled in a comprehensive course that lasts for a few months.
immoral_action: Willie decides to train the puppy himself even though he has no prior experience with training animals or knowledge of canine behavior.

norm: It's bad to let a pet run loose without supervision.
situation: Joe just adopted a rabbit and loves it very much.
intention: Joe wants his rabbit to have fun in the yard.
moral_action: Joe puts nets up above his yard and watches his rabbit play in the yard.
immoral_action: Joe leaves his rabbit outside in his yard with free reign and leaves to go shopoping.

norm: It's bad to lose track of your pets.
situation: Vince has a dog who loves to run around town and is in a store looking to buy him a collar.
intention: Vince wants to choose the right collar for his dog.
moral_action: Vince gets a GPS monitoring collar to find his dog when he runs off on his own.
immoral_action: Vince gets one of those spiked bulldog collars, thinking that his dog will look scary and cool with it.

norm: It's bad to lose someone's pet.
situation: Leah is pet sitting her neighbor Chris's dog, Sparky, and is taking him for a walk when a cat runs past, and he takes off chasing it.
intention: Leah wants to react to Sparky breaking away from her.
moral_action: "Leah yells at Sparky to ""heel"" and he stops right on his tracks."
immoral_action: Leah panics and lets Sparky get too far away before she begins to look for him, and now it's too late.

norm: It's bad to have no food.
situation: John is at the store shopping for tonight's date with Nancy which will be over at his house, and he's doing so because he has 0 consumables at home.
intention: John wants to buy something for them to consume.
moral_action: John decides to buy wine and a chacuterie board with cheese and meats because he thinks those pair well together.
immoral_action: John decides to buy wine and beer as he figures that Nancy will enjoy drinking with him.

norm: It's bad to not think about the environment.
situation: Stuart is finishing his coffee as he walks to work one morning.
intention: Stuart wants to dispose of the empty coffee cup.
moral_action: Stuart carries the empty cup along with him until he encounters a recycling bin which he uses to dispose of the cup properly.
immoral_action: Stuart carelessly drops the empty coffee cup on the sidewalk.

norm: It's wrong not to take care of your teeth.
situation: John woke up late this morning, just rolled out of bed and needs to rush to get to work on time.
intention: John needs to cut something off his morning routine to make up for lost time.
moral_action: John skips the morning coffee in an attempt to get out the door quicker.
immoral_action: John skips brushing his teeth in an attempt to get out the door quicker.

norm: It's bad to not care about your mental health.
situation: Dani is critically depressed because she's working on a project with some toxic coworkers.
intention: Dani wants to complete the project.
moral_action: Dani takes a day off from work to give herself a break before requesting her toxic coworkers to be removed from her team.
immoral_action: Dani ignores her depression as she continues working with the same people for months.

norm: It is bad to not eat fruits and vegetables.
situation: Sasha is at a buffet and is getting ready to load up her plate with food.
intention: Sasha wants to have lunch.
moral_action: Sasha creates a balanced plate of food, going out of her way to incorporate all the nutritional categories including fruits and vegetables.
immoral_action: Sasha takes some meat, starches, cheese and dessert but avoids the fruit and salad bar.

norm: It's disappointing to hear that you can't keep a dog.
situation: Rachel finds a dog in the street and bring it home to her father Daniel.
intention: Daniel wants to get the dog out of the house.
moral_action: Daniel tells Rachel that the dog need her help to get home.
immoral_action: Daniel tells Rachel that she can't have a dog.

norm: It's bad not to carry your weight in a group.
situation: Al, Bert, and Jill are in an office, working on coding a computer program for a client.
intention: Al wants leave early to start the weekend.
moral_action: Al works competently and focused and takes no breaks for lunch or anything else to get finished.
immoral_action: Al types a lot of bad code because it is quicker to do.

norm: It's not okay to not take care of your teeth.
situation: Ash keeps coming late to work and needs to do something about it.
intention: Ash wants to change her morning routine.
moral_action: Ash spends less time trying to make her hair look the way she wants it to.
immoral_action: Ash stops brushing her teeth in order to save time.

norm: It is bad not to help a dying animal.
situation: Josh runs a cat over while driving home after work.
intention: Josh wants to react to the accident.
moral_action: Josh stops and rushes the cat to a vet.
immoral_action: Josh rushes home and washes his car to remove all traces of the accident.

norm: It's bad not to help someone who is suicidal.
situation: Gordon's girlfriend Sara just broke up with him for someone else, and he's crying to his friend Kristina about it, saying he wants to end it all.
intention: Kristina wants to respond to Gordon's troubles.
moral_action: Kristina tells Gordon not to think that way because she will be there for him.
immoral_action: Kristina tells Gordon that he should see a counselor, and then leaves.

norm: It's bad to not take care of your teeth
situation: Brad is in the bathroom getting himself ready before going to bed.
intention: Brad wants to take care of his hygeine.
moral_action: Brad brushes his teeth before washing his face and hands and then going to bed.
immoral_action: Brad washes his hands and rinses his face and then turns off the light and goes to bed.

norm: Bosses are not supposed to threaten their employees.
situation: Dave is a manager of an office and notices an employee, Rick is under performing.
intention: Dave wants to say something to Rick to motivate him to perform better.
moral_action: Dave tells Rick that he just wants to remind him that the highest performers are eligible for a bonus at year's end.
immoral_action: Dave tells Rick that if he doesn't get his act together Dave will have no choice but to fire him.

norm: Manager should not be mean to their employees
situation: Jason, a manager at a fast food restaurant, just noticed that his employee Jill made a huge mess.
intention: Jason wants to get Jill to clean up the mess.
moral_action: Jason asks Jill to clean up the mess and gives her tips to avoid getting into this situation in the future.
immoral_action: Jason yells at Jill and tells her that she's fired if she doesn't clean up the mess immediately.

norm: You shouldn't creep your coworkers out while they are working.
situation: Josh has planned a prank for his coworkers on Halloween.
intention: Josh wants to give his coworkers a fright.
moral_action: Josh plays a prank on his coworkers as they are leaving work for the night.
immoral_action: Josh plays a Halloween prank on his coworkers while they are making a presentation to a client.

norm: Employees shouldn't show disrespect to their boss.
situation: Josh is working retail and his boss is giving him a task he cannot possibly complete.
intention: Josh wants to be treated fairly.
moral_action: Josh explains to his boss why he cannot complete the task and suggests a way it could be done.
immoral_action: Josh talks back to his boss about the instructions in front of a customer.

norm: You shouldn't expect others to cover for you at work.
situation: Jon is currently at work and is about to go on his lunch break.
intention: Jon wants to take an extended lunch to take care of a personal matter.
moral_action: Jon doesn't mention anything to his coworker, so he can say he doesn't know.
immoral_action: Jon instructs his friend and coworker on a story to tell his boss if asked.

norm: You shouldn't have crushes on people at work.
situation: James just started a new job as an accountant and one of his coworkers is very attractive.
intention: James wants to feel less bored at work.
moral_action: James chats with his attractive coworker about their favorite films while they fill out spreadsheets.
immoral_action: James spends lots of time at work fantasizing about dating and having sex with his attractive coworker.

norm: People shouldn't say negative things about customers while at work.
situation: Clara places an item on the counter of guest services after a tense encounter with a customer.
intention: Clara wants to vent her frustrations.
moral_action: Clara closes her eyes ranting to herself in her own head for a moment before getting back to work.
immoral_action: Clara tells her coworker about the event mimicking the customer's voice.

norm: Employees shouldn't falsify time cards at work
situation: John works at an accounting firm.
intention: John wants to make some overtime this month.
moral_action: John works and bills 60 hours one week because he worked more than the usual 40 hours.
immoral_action: John decides to bill a 60 hour week when he only worked 40 hours this week.

norm: You should respect your partner's wishes.
situation: John is all set to go bowling with his buddies when his wife Nancy says she isn't feeling so great and wants him to stay home toight.
intention: John wants to respond to Nancy's request.
moral_action: John tells Nancy that he'll call the guys right away and tell them that something came up, and he'll stay with her.
immoral_action: John tells Nancy that he's already planned this and the guys will mock him if he skips out on it, besides he'll be back in a few hours.

norm: You should be kind to your friends.
situation: Mary's friend is getting married.
intention: Mary wants to be in the wedding.
moral_action: Mary offers to help her friend contact vendors.
immoral_action: Mary tells her friend to put her in the wedding party.

norm: People should be kind.
situation: Tim is hanging out with a group of friends who are cruelly mocking someone.
intention: Tim wants to keep having a good time with everyone.
moral_action: Tim changes the subject to something he is sure everyone is interested in.
immoral_action: Tim joins in on the mocking and eggs everyone on.

norm: People should be kind to one another.
situation: Jake has been rude to Randy all afternoon, but Randy knows Jake's mother passed away yesterday.
intention: Randy wants to interact with Jake.
moral_action: Randy gives Jake a hug and says he will always be there for him.
immoral_action: Randy makes a joke about Jake's attitude.

norm: Friends are expected to be kind to each other.
situation: Mark is with his friend Apple, and she is crying because her dog died.
intention: Mark wants to give Apple some advice.
moral_action: Mark kindly tells Apple it will get better in time and that he is here for her if she needs to talk.
immoral_action: Mark sternly tells Apple to get over it, toughen up and stop crying like a baby.

norm: You should respect your significant other's friendships.
situation: Jenna was looking forward to watching Netflix with her boyfriend when his best friend called very upset about a breakup.
intention: Jenna wants to spend time with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Jenna lets her boyfriend go comfort his friend while she takes a nap.
immoral_action: Jenna tells her boyfriend that if he goes to talk to his friend then he's abandoning her.

norm: You should respect your friend's partner.
situation: Ashton and his friend, Tim, are bowling with Tim's girlfriend, Tracy.
intention: Ashton wants to talk to Tim about Tracy.
moral_action: Ashton tells Tim that Tracy's bowling game has improved over the course of the night.
immoral_action: Ashton makes snarky comments to Tim about Tracy's bowling skills.

norm: It's expected that spouses are kind to each other.
situation: Joe is married to Lisa and has just gotten home from a long day at work to find Lisa has burned dinner.
intention: Joe wants to eat dinner.
moral_action: Joe tells Lisa it's no big deal, and they'll just order some takeout.
immoral_action: Joe calls Lisa a lousy cook and complains about the food the whole time.

norm: You should respect other people's friendships.
situation: Alan is friends with Doug who joined the basketball team and is now friends with the basketball players.
intention: Alan wants to talk to Doug about being friends with the basketball players.
moral_action: Alan will tell Doug it's cool that he made the team, and he's hanging out with all the players.
immoral_action: Alan tells Doug that being friends with the basketball players is taking away from their friendship.

norm: You should respect a friend's choices.
situation: Jed's female friends enjoys having lots of sex with multiple men.
intention: Jed wants to comment on her friend's behavior.
moral_action: Jed tells his friend that she should just make sure that she's having protected sex.
immoral_action: Jed calls her friend a name and tells her she's going to become pregnant soon.

norm: You should be respectful towards your significant other's hobbies.
situation: Kit is a music producer working on a new song, and his wife Janine wants him to come watch TV.
intention: Janine wants to get Kit's attention.
moral_action: Janine goes up to Kit and asks if when he's finished if he could watch a show with her.
immoral_action: Janine goes up to Kit's computer and pulls the plug on his computer while he was working on the song.

norm: You should respect your friends decision.
situation: Bianca has chosen a college to go to, but her close friend has chosen a different university that works better for her goals.
intention: Bianca wants to talk with her friend about her decision.
moral_action: Bianca tells her friend that she will succeed at her new school and that she hopes that her career goes well.
immoral_action: Bianca asks why her friend is leaving her and comments that she'll be all alone at her new school.

norm: You should be kind to your coworkers.
situation: George's coworker is going through a rough time in their relationship and cries at work often.
intention: George wants to respond to his coworker's feelings.
moral_action: George asks his colleague if there is anything he can do for them.
immoral_action: George tells his coworker to grow-up and get over it.

norm: You should treat your superiors with respect.
situation: Larry is invited to the work Christmas party.
intention: Larry wants to have fun.
moral_action: Larry abstains from drinking and tells his boss how much he enjoys his job.
immoral_action: Larry drinks too much and insults his boss.

norm: People should show the people around them respect.
situation: Peter is the manager of a department in a tech firm who has a reputation for being abrupt.
intention: Peter wants his subordinates to follow his lead.
moral_action: Peter curbs his abrasive manner and works to offer his staff encouragement and guidance.
immoral_action: Peter puts his staff down constantly in an attempt to get them to follow his directions without question.

norm: Children should respect their elders.
situation: John sees his mother's new car sitting in the driveway.
intention: John wants to drive over  to a friends house to visit.
moral_action: John asks his mother if he can borrow the car.
immoral_action: John takes the car without asking his mother if he can borrow it.

norm: You should respect your leaders.
situation: Jim is the head of a project group that Ken is working in and has made a new change to the rules.
intention: Ken wants to ask about the rules.
moral_action: Ken approaches Jim about the rules he has questions about and works to seek compromise.
immoral_action: Ken tells Jim that he thinks the rules are way out of line and don't make much sense.

norm: It is considerate to obey your parents.
situation: Todd is a teenager who has been told by his parents to eat less candy.
intention: Todd wants to decide on obeying his parents or not.
moral_action: Todd takes his parent's advice and actively limits the amount of candy he eats.
immoral_action: Todd decides to ignore his parent's advice and continue eating copious amounts of candy.

norm: You should be considerate of the people you live around.
situation: Jason just got home from work.
intention: Jason wants some dinner.
moral_action: Jason makes his own sandwich and eats it.
immoral_action: Jason takes the sandwich his wife just prepared for herself and eats it.

norm: People should respect each other.
situation: John has just arrived home from football practice.
intention: John wants to eat dinner.
moral_action: John eats dinner in his room so that his stench doesn't bother the rest of the family.
immoral_action: John sits down at the kitchen table to eat a sandwich, smelling up the whole room with his body odor.

norm: You should be considerate of people.
situation: Pat is listening to the radio while he works his construction job on a busy street, when his favorite song starts playing.
intention: Pat wants to turn up his favorite song.
moral_action: Pat gets closer to the radio while his favorite song is playing and turns it up very slightly.
immoral_action: Pat turns the radio up as loud as it will go and holds it up to get the maximum amount of sound out of the box.

norm: You should be respectful of people around you.
situation: Sebastian is studying at a desk in the library when his phone starts to ring.
intention: Sebastian wants to answer the phone.
moral_action: Sebastian puts the phone on silent, goes outside, and talks with his friend.
immoral_action: Sebastian picks up the phone at the desk and starts to talk with his friend.

norm: You should respect your elders wishes.
situation: Dan's dad asked Dan to pull the plug if he ever forget who Dan is, and it actually happened.
intention: Dan wants to make a decision on his dad's life.
moral_action: Dan tells the doctors to pull the plug on his dad.
immoral_action: Dan doesn't tell the doctors what his dad wanted wants his dad to stay alive.

norm: You shouldn't post racist things online.
situation: Ken is reading a story on a news website about Black Lives Matter who he thinks are taking the wrong approach.
intention: Ken wants to post a comment showing his disagreement with BLM.
moral_action: Ken writes a long narrative explaining why he thinks BLM is a good idea with a flawed approach and uses respected sources to back his claims.
immoral_action: Ken writes a long narrative full of slurs and hateful messages against black people going on to state he hates BLM and all black people in general.

norm: You shouldn't write crazy things on the Internet.
situation: Megan is scrolling through her feed on Twitter when she comes across an out home cure tweet for COVID.
intention: Megan wants to comment on the post.
moral_action: Megan shares the tweet in a discord group discussing the implications of the tweet with her friends.
immoral_action: Megan retweets the post with a comment that vitamin C tablets can cure COVID in an attempt to goof around.

norm: You shouldn't use social media vindictively
situation: Heather is on Facebook posting and interacting with her friends.
intention: Heather wants to tell her friends about her life.
moral_action: Heather post that she's feeling low after a recent break-up.
immoral_action: Heather posts about the boyfriend who just dumped her and claims that he embezzles from his work.

norm: You shouldn't decieve others on social media.
situation: Kim just added her crush from school on a new facebook account.
intention: Kim wants her crush to like her.
moral_action: Kim sends a message to her crush asking him how he is doing.
immoral_action: Kim posts fake pictures and invents another personality in order for her crush to like her.

norm: You shouldn't irritate or harass people in online games.
situation: Brendon is playing an MMO when he stumbles across his classmate Natalie.
intention: Brendon wants to interact with Natalie.
moral_action: Brendon asks Natalie to trade with him.
immoral_action: Brendon follows Natalie taking her kills, loot, and sending  her spam messages.

norm: You shouldn't downvote everything on a website.
situation: Mike was on his favorite website reading all the comments that had been posted.
intention: Mike wants to voice his opinion.
moral_action: Mike makes comments relevant to the post voicing his own personal opinion.
immoral_action: Mike starts to downvote every single comment that he reads on the site.

norm: You shouldn't stalk people on social media.
situation: Finn has an acquaintance who he has recently taken more of an interest in.
intention: Finn wants to get to know his acquaintance better.
moral_action: Finn engages in conversation to get to know the acquaintance more.
immoral_action: Finn goes through his acquaintance's social media to find out more about her.

norm: You shouldn't fight with people online over petty things.
situation: Brian is on an internet message board for games when he sees a person respond to his message with hostility.
intention: Brian wants to respond to the hostile message.
moral_action: Brian tells the person they're allowed their own opinion and leaves it at that.
immoral_action: Brian calls the the person a name and says they are wrong.

norm: You shouldn't block your partner on social media.
situation: James noticed that his girlfriend had liked a lot of pictures of her ex on Facebook.
intention: James wants his girlfriend to spend less time thinking about her ex.
moral_action: James tells his girlfriend he thinks she's still too obsessed with her ex.
immoral_action: "James blocks his girlfriend on Facebook and changes his relationship status to ""it's complicated""."

norm: You shouldn't spam the internet.
situation: Mark is running for mayor of his town.
intention: Mark wants to get more people to know who he is and that he is running.
moral_action: Mark goes door to door letting people know he is running.
immoral_action: Mark posts requests for people to vote for him to every message board he can find and sends email to an address list from his work.

norm: You shouldn't judge someone who doesn't like using the internet.
situation: Eric's with his friends and just finished helping his mom with internet issues on the phone, and she said she hates the internet.
intention: Eric wants to look smart in front of his friends.
moral_action: Eric tells his friends it was a pleasure helping his mom as he loves her.
immoral_action: Eric tells his friends he can't believe his mom doesn't know how to use the internet and laughs.

norm: It is rude to miss a special celebration.
situation: It is Luke's fathers birthday and his family is holding a large celebration at Luke's house for his father.
intention: Luke wants to stay home that day instead of going out.
moral_action: Luke joins the celebration in the main celebration areas.
immoral_action: Luke avoids the rooms in the house that contain celebration.

norm: It's rude to cancel your wedding venue on short notice.
situation: Beatrice scheduled a wedding at her chosen venue a year ago, and recently a pandemic started and a lot of people are cancelling their weddings.
intention: Beatrice wants to get married without contributing to the spread of the pandemic.
moral_action: Beatrice gets married at the venue after ensuring that everyone will wear masks and social distance.
immoral_action: Beatrice cancels her wedding venue weeks before the wedding and chooses to have a very small wedding instead.

norm: It is rude to cancel a date on short notice.
situation: Tim scheduled a date with Tina a week from now, but later figured out he is busy that day.
intention: Tim wants to formally cancel his date with Tina.
moral_action: Tim lets his date know a week ahead of time that he cannot attend the date.
immoral_action: Tim waits until three hours before the date to inform Tina he can't come.

norm: It's rude to back out of a trip last minute.
situation: Yuri promised his wife Helga they would take a road trip this weekend but his friend Bo just got into town.
intention: Yuri wants to decide what to do.
moral_action: Yuri tells Bo he already has plans with Helga and tells him they can hang out another time.
immoral_action: Yuri tells Helga that Bo just arrived and wants to take the road trip another time.

norm: It is rude to be materialistic with wedding gifts.
situation: Karen was going to be getting married, so she set up a registry at a store.
intention: Karen wanted to get nice gifts for her wedding.
moral_action: Karen included gifts at varying price points on her wedding registry.
immoral_action: On the registry, Karen only included gifts that were two hundred dollars or more.

norm: It is wrong to exclude your girlfriend on valentines day.
situation: Jim is at home with his girlfriend when he reads about a great new movie playing at the cinema.
intention: Jim wants to go see the new movie.
moral_action: Jim suggests that he and his girlfriend go to see the movie together as a Valentine's Day activity, and she says yes.
immoral_action: Jim leaves the house quietly and goes to watch the movie on his own.

norm: Is wrong to expect your guests pay for your wedding
situation: Lily was planning a large wedding, and she realized the total bill was going to be pretty high.
intention: Lily wants to find a way to help pay the bill.
moral_action: Lily decides to get a part time job waiting tables for a few months to help with costs.
immoral_action: Lily decides to charge all of her guests a $50 door charge to attend her wedding.

norm: It's wrong to dictate how people should organize their wedding.
situation: Miranda is helping her daughter Natasha plan her wedding.
intention: Miranda wants Natasha's wedding to be special.
moral_action: Miranda acts as Natasha's assistant giving her tips along the way.
immoral_action: Miranda micromanages the entire process and invites a musical act Natasha hates to perform at the reception.

norm: It's bad to spread gossip at a wedding.
situation: Janet is at her friend Mary's wedding.
intention: Janet wants to talk to the other guests at the wedding.
moral_action: Janet asks Mary's new mother-in-law about her favorite music.
immoral_action: Janet tells her Mary's new mother-in-law a rumor about Mary from college.

norm: It's rude to make outrageous demands for your wedding.
situation: Jane is getting married and wants her whole wedding to have a red and white color scheme.
intention: Jane wants to make sure her bridesmaids match the color scheme.
moral_action: Jane picks a red bolt of fabric and lets each bridesmaid design a dress out of it.
immoral_action: Jane insists that all her bridesmaids wear wigs or dye their hair in the same shade of red.

norm: It's unusual to involve your ex in a new wedding
situation: Larry is getting married to his fiancee soon and is planning the wedding with her.
intention: Larry wants to send out wedding invitations.
moral_action: Larry invites only certain friends and family who can they both agree on.
immoral_action: Larry invites his ex girlfriend who is also a friend to the wedding.

norm: It's considered inappropriate to have two different valentine's day vaentines.
situation: Paul's best friend May asks him if he will still get her a Valentine's gift now that he has a girlfriend.
intention: Paul wants to answer May's question.
moral_action: Paul lets May know that it would be inappropriate for him to give her a gift as well.
immoral_action: Paul decides to go ahead and buy May a Valentines day gift.

norm: It's rude to miss a wedding.
situation: A movie is scheduled to premiere on the same day that Hannah has to attend a wedding for her friend Jill.
intention: Hannah wants to see the movie.
moral_action: Hannah goes to the wedding and sees the movie the next day.
immoral_action: Hannah skips the wedding and goes to see the movie.

norm: It's rude to end a date early.
situation: Victor is on a first date with Sally and it's not going well.
intention: Victor wants to change the situation.
moral_action: Victor tries to get to know Sally better and then livens up their conversation with funny stories for the rest of their date.
immoral_action: Victor tells Sally that he just remembered that he has to get up early, so he has to get going.

norm: It's rude to miss your friend's graduation ceremony.
situation: Julie receives an invitation to attend a friends college graduation, but she has plans to watch a movie premiere on the same day.
intention: Julie wants to respond to the invitation.
moral_action: Julie cancels her movie plans and attends the graduation ceremony.
immoral_action: Julie declines the invitation and goes to the movie premiere instead.

norm: It's rude to infringe on someone's honeymoon.
situation: Verlin lays in bed feeling lonely on his day off of work, and his roommate Derrick is on his honeymoon with his new wife.
intention: Verlin wants to get rid of his loneliness.
moral_action: Verlin decides to hang out with his other friends for the afternoon.
immoral_action: Verlin calls his friend multiple times asking to get into a video chat with him.

norm: It's rude to not buy your child a wedding gift.
situation: Jean's daughter is getting married and has set up a wedding registry for gifts.
intention: Jean wants to save money for bills and essential items.
moral_action: Jean picks an inexpensive item off of the registry to gift.
immoral_action: Jean decides not to buy a gift but show support in other ways.

norm: It's rude to leave your fiancee at the altar.
situation: Mark has second thoughts about marrying his fiance Tiffany.
intention: Mark wants to break off the wedding.
moral_action: Before the wedding, Mark tells Tiffany that he's not ready to get married.
immoral_action: Mark doesn't show up to the wedding and leaves Tiffany a break up letter.

norm: It is not okay to ruin someone's wedding
situation: Ryan and Cassie are at their friend Amber's wedding as a couple.
intention: Ryan wants to propose to Cassie.
moral_action: As Ryan and Cassie leave the wedding, Ryan proposes to Cassie in their car.
immoral_action: During Amber's wedding vows, Ryan stands up and proposes to Cassie.

norm: It's wrong to try to interfere with a wedding.
situation: Elise is getting married in two days, and she tells her friend Miranda that she's stressed about a light figure not working right.
intention: Miranda wants support Elise.
moral_action: Miranda hugs her friend and offers her words of encouragement.
immoral_action: Miranda, to relieve Elise's stress, makes modifications to the light fixture after Elise leaves the room.

norm: It's wrong to skip out on your family member's memorial.
situation: James grandfather has passed away from a heart attack.
intention: James wants to go on a trip with his friends.
moral_action: James attends his grandfather memorial and meets his friends the next day.
immoral_action: James skips his grandfathers memorial and goes on his trip with his friends.

norm: It's wrong to not wear your wedding ring.
situation: Abe is going out to a wine bar for drinks with his coworkers after work.
intention: Abe wants to meet someone.
moral_action: Abe starts a conversation with a man at the next table.
immoral_action: Abe removes his wedding ring when he enters the wine bar.

norm: It's wrong to disturb your friend's wedding.
situation: Scott and Steve are lifetime friends and Scott is picked to be a groomsman for Steve wedding.
intention: Scott wants to have a good time at the wedding and reception.
moral_action: Scott makes a nice speech and has a great time with the party being very helpful throughout the wedding and reception.
immoral_action: Scott gets very drunk at the recption makes an awkward speech and hits on some of the bridemaids in an unwelcome way.

norm: It's wrong not to pull over for a funeral procession.
situation: Mike is going to the store when he sees a long funeral possession going down the road.
intention: Mike wants to run errands and pick up food items for dinner.
moral_action: Mike continues until the funeral line is very close, then slowly pulls to the side of the road.
immoral_action: Mike sees other drivers stop, but he is in a rush and doesn't take the time to stop.

norm: It's wrong to not invite family to your wedding.
situation: Sam and his girlfriend are getting married, but she doesn't like his family.
intention: Sam wants to have the best wedding possible.
moral_action: Sam invites his family to the wedding and makes sure that his girlfriend invites her family as well.
immoral_action: Sam decides to have a small wedding and only invite close friends.

norm: You shouldn't get pregnant before you get married.
situation: Lisa has a boyfriend with Ben and is in love with him.
intention: Lisa wants to have a baby with Ben.
moral_action: Lisa develops her relationship with Ben which leads to marriage and then a baby.
immoral_action: Lisa has a baby with Ben while they are still dating.

norm: It's wrong to not prioritize a friend's special event.
situation: Daniel invites Paul to his piano recital, which is on the same day as a major sale.
intention: Paul wants to buy something at the sale.
moral_action: Paul goes to the recital and then attends the sale when it's over.
immoral_action: Paul skips the recital to attend the sale and buy a toaster.

norm: You shouldn't tell your friend how to plan her wedding.
situation: Francine is listening to Kyla talk about her upcoming wedding.
intention: Francine wants to respond to Kyla's wedding plans.
moral_action: Francine tells Kyla that her wedding sounds like a dream come true for Kyla.
immoral_action: Francine tells Kyla that she should have a certain theme and exactly what to do.

norm: It's wrong to talk badly about someone's wedding.
situation: Bob is attending a friend's wedding and is chatting about it with the other attendees.
intention: Bob wants to comment on the wedding.
moral_action: Bob highlights all the good parts of the wedding and does not say anything about the less positive parts.
immoral_action: Bob mentions how bad the food is and severely critiques several other aspects of the wedding.

norm: You shouldn't get remarried on your child's birthday.
situation: James was getting married for the second time and the date was scheduled for his kid's birthday.
intention: James wants to choose a special day to be remarried on.
moral_action: James realizes that his son and his wife won't want to share a birthday and an anniversary.
immoral_action: James proceeds with the date as scheduled and gets married on that day.

norm: It's wrong to go on a vacation without your partner.
situation: Violet is planning a vacation for the following weekend, and she knows that her husband Harry doesn't have any obligations.
intention: Violet wants to book airplane tickets.
moral_action: Violets checks with Harry to make sure he wants to go with her and then books their airplane tickets.
immoral_action: Violet books an airplane ticket for herself but doesn't invite Harry along.

norm: It is unacceptable to exclude your parents from your wedding.
situation: Jill has been estranged from her parents for a while, and she is sending out invitations to her wedding.
intention: Jill wants to decide if she wants to invite her estranged parents to her wedding.
moral_action: Jill decides that although she has had some differences with her parents she will invite them to her wedding.
immoral_action: Jill decides not to invite her parents to her wedding as it will be too awkward after all this time.

norm: It's wrong to exclude specific family members from big events.
situation: Gary is getting married soon and has decided to start planning the wedding.
intention: Gary wants to make a guest list.
moral_action: Gary invites all of his friends and family to the wedding including his sister Mary.
immoral_action: Gary invites many friends and family members to the wedding but does not invite his sister Mary.

norm: It's wrong to exclude someone from holiday events.
situation: Debbie is having a neighborhood party for the holidays.
intention: Debbie needs to make an invite list.
moral_action: Debbie invites all her neighbors.
immoral_action: Debbie does not invite her neighbor Rachel.

norm: It's wrong to exclude family from weddings.
situation: Gary is having a wedding and is trying to decide who to invite when he realizes that the hall is too small for everyone.
intention: Gary wants to solve the invitation problem.
moral_action: Gary searches for a larger venue, finds one, and books it for his wedding, then invites everyone who is close.
immoral_action: Gary invites his close friend and some family and doesn't invite some cousins, aunts, and uncles.

norm: It's wrong to cause problems at another person's wedding.
situation: Tom's ex-girlfriend, Linda, is marrying someone else, and he has been invited to her wedding.
intention: Tom wants to let Linda know that he is hurt and angry that she is marrying someone else.
moral_action: Tom declines the wedding invitation, and he tells Linda that he has not gotten over their relationship yet, so it isn't a good idea for him.
immoral_action: Tom drinks too much at the wedding and blurts out, in the middle of the wedding party, that he hopes the marriage fails.

norm: It is wrong to not invite grandparents to a graduation.
situation: Nina is graduating from college soon, and she's preparing for the big day.
intention: Nina wants to finalize her list of invites to her graduation.
moral_action: Nina makes sure to add her grandparents to the list of those invited to her graduation so that they don't miss it.
immoral_action: Nina invites her parents, cousins and some friends but neglects to invite her grandparents.

norm: It's wrong not to have your parents at your wedding.
situation: Isabella wants to have a wedding at a big church, and her parents are out of town on the only open time slot.
intention: Isabella wants to get married.
moral_action: Isabella chooses to have a wedding at another location that works with her parent's schedule .
immoral_action: Isabella goes ahead with the wedding at the church.

norm: It's wrong to cause stress at a family function.
situation: Henry is celebrating Christmas at a large family gathering and his bother has made a disrespectful comment towards him.
intention: Henry wants to give his brother a piece of his mind.
moral_action: Henry decides to wait until after Christmas to bring up the issue to his brother.
immoral_action: Henry starts getting into it with his brother immediately at the gathering.

norm: You shouldn't do things that upset your neighbors.
situation: Corey has been working on his house and has a lot of heavy construction to get done.
intention: Corey wants to get his new driveway poured.
moral_action: Corey invites his friend to help him pour the driveway during a weekend afternoon so as not to disturb anyone's sleep.
immoral_action: Corey has his friend help him pour the concrete for the driveway late at night, even though he knows his neighbors are early birds.

norm: You shouldn't do shady things for your neighbors.
situation: Charlie is sitting on his porch having a friendly chat with his next-door day neighbor.
intention: Charlie wants to bond with his neighbor.
moral_action: Charlie invites his neighbor and his family over for a dinner party.
immoral_action: Charlie agrees to open a shell company to help his neighbor launder money for a drug cartel.

norm: You shouldn't do drugs around your neighbors.
situation: James enjoys smoking pot and has a lot of soft furnishings that absorb smells easily.
intention: James doesn't want his apartment to smell like pot.
moral_action: James switches from smoking pot to eating pot brownies and cookies.
immoral_action: James smokes pot in his apartment building's garden in front of the neighbors' kids.

norm: You shouldn't disturb your neighbors with loud music.
situation: Benny lives next to a woman and her newborn baby, and late one evening he purchases the latest album by his favorite band.
intention: Benny wants to listen to the album.
moral_action: Benny puts on a set of nice headphones to listen to the new album.
immoral_action: Benny puts the album into his stereo system and cranks up the volume really loud.

norm: Neighbors should not make enough noise to disturb each other.
situation: It is a weeknight and Andy is having some people over for a small get together.
intention: Andy wants to play music for the party.
moral_action: Andy turns on his speakers and keeps the music playing at a moderate volume.
immoral_action: Andy turns his speakers on and cranks the volume up to the max.

norm: You shouldn't play loud noise if it disturbs your neighbors.
situation: Cindy, who has elderly neighbors, loves music and just got a new set of speakers for her house.
intention: Cindy wants to play her favorite song on the speakers.
moral_action: Cindy plays the song at medium volume and shuts the windows.
immoral_action: Cindy plays the song and turns it up to test the capabilities of the speakers.

norm: You shouldn't be too loud for your neighbors.
situation: Samuel's birthday is coming up, and he is planning on having a house party.
intention: Samuel wants to invite lots of people over.
moral_action: Samuel invites a large amount of his closest friends, and asks them to be respectful with noise.
immoral_action: Samuel tells his guests to invite anyone and everyone, and the party gets out of hand.

norm: You shouldn't do illegal activities in your neighborhood.
situation: Daniel has been furloughed from his job and is having trouble making ends meet.
intention: Daniel wants to make some extra money, so he can pay his bills.
moral_action: Daniel decides to get a side hustle driving for Uber to make some extra money.
immoral_action: Daniel decides to make and sell crystal meth in order to make some money.

norm: It's wrong to make people feel bad about their appearance.
situation: John's sister asks him how her hair looks before going out on a date.
intention: John wants to respond to his sister.
moral_action: John tells his sister her hair looks great.
immoral_action: John tells his sister her hair looks ugly.

norm: It is wrong to judge people on how they look.
situation: Mary is greeted by an overweight woman as she walks to work.
intention: Mary wants to respond to the woman.
moral_action: Mary says hello and asks the woman how she is doing.
immoral_action: Mary tells the woman she should lose some weight.

norm: It's wrong to judge others solely based on their appearance.
situation: John goes to school with a fat kid named Jim who he shares gym class with, and they are forming dodgeball teams.
intention: John wants to pick his team members.
moral_action: John decides to take a risk and pick Jim before anyone else.
immoral_action: John leaves Jim to be picked last, grabbing everyone in better shape first.

norm: It is wrong to defraud somebody about your appearance.
situation: Alvin is chatting with Beth, a woman he met on a virtual dating site.
intention: Alvin wants to send Beth a picture.
moral_action: Alvin sends Beth a picture of himself even though he is worried she won't like his appearance.
immoral_action: Alvin sends Beth a picture of his younger, athletic cousin and claims it is a picture of himself.

norm: It's inappropriate to judge people's character based on their appearance.
situation: Margret is interviewing a man in used clothes named Josh for a position in her company.
intention: Margret needs to decide if she wants to hire Josh.
moral_action: Margret asks John more questions about his work experience attempting to learn more about John.
immoral_action: Margret dismisses Josh citing his attire does not fit her personal standards.

norm: It's wrong to make comments about people's appearance.
situation: Todd meets a man with a large mole on his face.
intention: Todd wants to say something to the man.
moral_action: Todd makes normal small talk with the man and asks about his interests.
immoral_action: Todd tells the man that he looks hideous and that he should have the mole removed.

norm: It is wrong to just like someone for their looks.
situation: Bert has hired a matchmaker.
intention: Bert wants to go on a date.
moral_action: Bert chooses a girl to date who has multiple things in common with him.
immoral_action: Bert chooses a pretty girl to date who does not have anything in common with him.

norm: It's wrong to brag about your looks.
situation: Sal is in the office at his desk when Carmine comes by and asks Sal what he thinks of his look today.
intention: Sal wants to respond to Carmine's question.
moral_action: Sal tells Carmine that he looks great today and that he should come to the office with that look more often.
immoral_action: Sal tells Carmine that he looks OK but definitely will never look good as Sal as he's the best looking person ever.

norm: It's wrong to hate someone based on skin color
situation: Ronald doesn't like his coworker Steve very much at all, Steve asks why.
intention: Ronald wants to answer Steve.
moral_action: Ronald answers that Steve borrowed his pen on the first day and never gave it back.
immoral_action: Ronald answers that he doesn't like Steve because of the amount of melanin in his skin.

norm: It's rude to make assumptions based on skin color.
situation: Kristen's brother recently started dating an Asian girl named Kelly.
intention: Kristen wants to get to know Kelly.
moral_action: Kristen asks Kelly where she works and what her hobbies are.
immoral_action: Kristen asks Kelly if she works for a nail salon since she is Asian.

norm: It's wrong to shame people for how their body looks.
situation: Kiki's friend, Alyssa, expresses her dissatisfaction with her weight.
intention: Kiki wants to respond to Alyssa's comments about her weight.
moral_action: Kiki tells Alyssa she's beautiful the way she is, but she'll go to the gym with her if she wants to start working out.
immoral_action: Kiki tells Alyssa she's disgusting for being fat.

norm: It's wrong to make fun of someone's makeup.
situation: Margret is a beauty influencer doing a live stream with another influencer Barbra, and Barbra insults an instagram model's makeup.
intention: Margret wants to entertain her audience.
moral_action: Margret gives constructive criticism to the model along with doing a small demonstration on how to fix the makeup.
immoral_action: Margret joins Barbra comparing the model's makeup to a clown.

norm: It's wrong to criticize a person just for their appearance.
situation: Dwayne is at work in a retail shop and is helping an overweight customer in the fitting room who has selected too small a dress.
intention: Dwayne wants the customer to try on a larger size, as she might rip the one she selected.
moral_action: Dwayne mentions to the customer that the dress she selected runs very small and says most people need a size up.
immoral_action: Dwayne asks the customer if she thinks somebody of her level of activity could truly fit into the dress she selected.

norm: It's good to offer food to your friends.
situation: John and his friends are having a movie night at John's house.
intention: John wants to get something to eat.
moral_action: John prepares a spread of snacks and shares it with his friends.
immoral_action: John grabs himself some leftovers from lunch and sits down to watch the movie while eating.

norm: It's kind to cook a meal for friends and family.
situation: Dave and a tired Wendy are in the kitchen as dinner time is approaching when their son Max tells them he's hungry.
intention: Dave wants to decide what the family will eat.
moral_action: Dave tells Max that he's going to look up some recipes online and cook a meal for the family since Wendy can't.
