norm: It's wrong to be late to an appointment.
situation: Mike driving to a dentist appointment and is on track to make it on time when he notices his car's gas tank is nearly empty.
intention: Mike wants his car to last as long as possible.
moral_action: Mike parks his car at a nearby store and quickly jogs to the appointment in only a few minutes time.
immoral_action: Mike stops to put gas in his tank to avoid causing damage by running out of fuel on the road, but this takes several minutes.

norm: It's wrong to always be late for work.
situation: Tom's has been having trouble getting enough rest and has been starting to sleep in a lot.
intention: Tom wants to feel well and rested.
moral_action: Tom goes to the doctor and finds out he has a vitamin deficiency, and starts taking new vitamins.
immoral_action: Tom starts sleeping until he feels rested and goes to work late every day.

norm: It's rude to be late.
situation: Jared is going to the movie theater.
intention: Jared wants to meet up with his friends to see the same flick.
moral_action: Jared sets his alarm and gets to the theater a half-hour before the movie starts.
immoral_action: Jared wastes time talking on the phone and gets to theater after the movie has started.

norm: It's rude to show up late for an engagement.
situation: John has an important work meeting at 10:00 am.
intention: John wants to attend the meeting.
moral_action: John shows up a few minutes early for the work meeting.
immoral_action: John arrives 20 minutes late for the meeting.

norm: It's wrong to make a delivery too late.
situation: John is a delivery driver who has a very busy schedule one day.
intention: John wants to deliver his packages.
moral_action: John works hard and delivers all packages on time.
immoral_action: John delivers several packages the day after they were supposed to be delivered.

norm: It's rude to be late for an appointment
situation: Mandy has set up an appointment to discuss extra credit work with her professor, who has told her that he has a doctors appointment right after their meeting time.
intention: Mandy wants to make the meeting with her professor.
moral_action: Mandy sets an alarm, so she can get to her appointment on time.
immoral_action: Mandy neglects to set an alarm and therefore arrives late to her meeting with the professor.

norm: People feel it's rude to leave a family gathering early.
situation: Garrett is attending a family reunion, where numerous family members have yet to arrive.
intention: Garrett wants to go home.
moral_action: Garrett decides to hold on and wait for the remaining members to show up before heading home.
immoral_action: Garrett tells those in attendance that he must leave the gathering and goes home.

norm: It's wrong to be late for your classes.
situation: Shay is currently in nursing school, but she also has another job that she has to spend time at.
intention: Shay wants to focus on becoming a nurse.
moral_action: Shay moves her schedule around so that she can get to class early each day.
immoral_action: Shay makes sure she gets to every class, but she's often late.

norm: It is rude to not arrive on time.
situation: Mary needs a job and her friend got her an interview at her place of work.
intention: Mary wants to go to the interview.
moral_action: Mary gets to the job interview early in order to make a good impression.
immoral_action: Mary gets to the interview over twenty minutes later than it was scheduled.

norm: It is irresponsible to show up to an appointment late.
situation: Tanya has 20 minutes left in her favorite show but has to be at the dentist in 10 minutes.
intention: Tanya wants to finish the episode she is on.
moral_action: Tanya sets her DVR to record the rest of the episode, so she can watch the rest after her appointment.
immoral_action: Tanya finishes the episode before heading to the dentist's office.

norm: It's rude to make your sibling late for school.
situation: Angela's brother Bobby was supposed to wash the dishes but forgot to and now it is time to go to school.
intention: Bobby wants to get the dishes clean.
moral_action: Bobby decides that he will wash the dishes first thing when he gets home from school.
immoral_action: Bobby begs his sister to help him finish the dishes before heading to school.

norm: It's rude to be late for class.
situation: Penelope is in college and her chemistry class starts in five minutes.
intention: Penelope wants to get some extra sleep.
moral_action: Penelope runs to chemistry class on time and goes back to sleep after class is over.
immoral_action: Penelope sleeps thirty more minutes and stumbles into chemistry class late.

norm: It is rude to leave a funeral early.
situation: James is at his grand aunt's funeral, and the season finale of his favorite television show comes on in thirty minutes.
intention: James wants to watch TV.
moral_action: James texts his roommate asking him to record the show.
immoral_action: James slips out of the funeral and travels home to watch his show.

norm: It is wrong to make someone late.
situation: Mary's friend is driving them to work when she realizes that she needs to use the restroom.
intention: Mary wants to go to the bathroom.
moral_action: Mary waits until they get to work to use the bathroom that is there.
immoral_action: Mary makes her friend pull over to the restroom, so she can go to the bathroom.

norm: It's bad to try to get pregnant too early.
situation: Megan is a teenager who loves  children.
intention: Megan wants to be around and take care of babies.
moral_action: Megan gets some babysitting jobs and volunteers at a day care.
immoral_action: Megan gets pregnant on purpose and has a baby at the age of 16.

norm: It's bad to be late to a prior commitment
situation: John is  farming material in a video game,and he has a meeting with his boss in an hour.
intention: John wants to get more material in the game.
moral_action: John asks one of his friends to continue hunting for the material in exchange for some coffee.
immoral_action: John continues playing until he gets to a stopping point.

norm: It's bad to show up late to your appointments
situation: Jack made an appointment to go to a baseball game with his son Lee this afternoon.
intention: Jack wants to pick up his son for the game.
moral_action: Jack picks his son up early, and they make it to the game on time.
immoral_action: Jack fails to manage his time properly and arrives to pick up his son two hours late.

norm: It's bad to be late for work.
situation: Joe is going to work, and he sees that there is a pileup on the highway he normally takes.
intention: Joe doesn't want to be written up.
moral_action: Joe simply takes a different route to work to avoid the accident.
immoral_action: Joe calls to work and tells them about the accident on the highway.

norm: It's bad to go to parties too late.
situation: John gets a call from his friends inviting him to a gathering at an arcade.
intention: John wants to go to the gathering.
moral_action: John leaves and arrives at the arcade by 9:00 p.m.
immoral_action: John leaves two hours after the call and gets to the arcade by 11:00 p.m.

norm: It's bad to arrive too early.
situation: Ricky has been invited to Tonya's birthday party for Friday night and it's now Friday morning.
intention: Ricky wants to decide what time to head over to Tonya's house.
moral_action: Ricky decides to leave shortly after seven, so he can arrive at seven thirty for the party.
immoral_action: Ricky decides that he'll leave right after breakfast at around nine thirty AM and get there by ten.

norm: It's bad to get married too soon.
situation: Kara has been dating someone for two months and feels convinced that he is the one.
intention: Kara wants to get married.
moral_action: Kara waits to get married after at least a year of dating the guy.
immoral_action: Kara decides to get married and arranges a wedding very early on in their relationship.

norm: It can be stressful when you're late to work.
situation: Ross has work in the morning and has to get up at seven o clock.
intention: Ross wants to set his alarm.
moral_action: Ross sets his alarm clock for five thirty in the morning to get ready for work.
immoral_action: Ross sets his alarm for six thirty in the morning to go to work.

norm: It's bad to wake up late for your job.
situation: Alex's friends are planning a weekend lake trip ending the day before her workweek.
intention: Alex wants to join her friends on the lake trip.
moral_action: After a weekend at the lake, Alex prepares herself for the workweek Sunday evening and gets to bed at a reasonable time.
immoral_action: Alex enjoys herself so much on the last day of the trip that she doesn't get to bed at a resonable time.

norm: It is bad to be late with things.
situation: Jenny is working on her math homework for tomorrow and doesn't think that she will finish in time.
intention: Jenny wants to get a good grade.
moral_action: Jenny finishes as much as she can, leaves a few problems blank, and turns in the homework.
immoral_action: Jenny keeps the homework, finishes it, and turns it in a day late.

norm: It's frustrating when someone cancels dinner at the last minute.
situation: Samantha is planning a huge dinner celebration for her recent retirement, and she invited Rudy to it.
intention: Rudy needs to cancel showing up because of a work engagement that same day.
moral_action: Rudy tells Sam the moment he receives the invitation that he has a work obligation and HAS to go.
immoral_action: Rudy calls Samantha the day of and fake coughs into the phone saying he's ill and can't make it, because he's afraid to tell her the truth.

norm: It's bad to be late for dinner.
situation: Josh is playing soccer in the backyard with some friends and his mother Janet yells from the window, to be inside to eat in 15 minutes.
intention: Josh wants to finish playing soccer.
moral_action: Josh makes on last goal then tells his friends they can all meet up to play ball again tomorrow.
immoral_action: Having fun playing ball, Josh loses track of time and comes in to eat an hour later than he was supposed to.

norm: It's bad to pay bills late.
situation: Anna is having technical problems with her old computer and has some major bills which are due.
intention: Anna wants to buy a new computer.
moral_action: Anna pays all her bills first then charges the new computer to one of her credit cards.
immoral_action: Anna decides to avoid making a payment on her phone bill to buy the computer.

norm: It's bad to be late for an engagement.
situation: Maria has a very important business meeting with a client.
intention: Maria wants to attend the meeting.
moral_action: Maria thinks showing up earlier than scheduled will make her seem prepared.
immoral_action: Maria thinks showing up past the scheduled time will make her seem more important.

norm: It's good to eat neatly.
situation: Jake is at Wendy's birthday celebration when the cake is served.
intention: Jake wants to take a bite of cake.
moral_action: Jake uses the provided plastic fork to break off a piece of the cake and bring it to his mouth slowly.
immoral_action: Jake picks up the piece of cake with his bare hand and literally punches himself in the face with it causing most of it to splatter everywhere.

norm: It's good to eat a healthy breakfast.
situation: Matt is getting ready to go to work.
intention: Matt wants to get some food before work.
moral_action: Matt fixes himself an omelette with veggies and turkey sausage for breakfast.
immoral_action: Matt stops at a fast food place and loads up on junk food.

norm: It's good to be meticulous when you're baking.
situation: Maka is making a cake for her kid's birthday but is short on a couple items, but is running short on time.
intention: Maka wants to decide how to finish the cake no matter what.
moral_action: Maka gets the ingredients and has to bake the cake while her kid waits.
immoral_action: Maka skips out on the short ingredients and bakes the cake.

norm: It's good to eat home cooked meals.
situation: Dominique is a married truck driver who goes for week-ling trips and needs to eat away from home.
intention: Dominique wants to eat on the road.
moral_action: Dominique asks his wife to cook him food for his long trips, then takes the food with him.
immoral_action: Dominique visits truck stops and eats fast food wherever he goes.

norm: It's good to be prepared before you cook something.
situation: Hina is preparing dinner for the family who have been waiting eagerly for some time.
intention: Hina wants to prepare a dessert for after dinner.
moral_action: Hina prepares all the ingredients ahead of time making it easier to multitask.
immoral_action: Hina's dinner boils over while she is busy preparing the ingredients for the dessert.

norm: You should have fun while cooking
situation: Ryan is in the middle of a diet plan and is preparing meals for the week.
intention: Ryan wants to stick to his diet.
moral_action: Ryan makes sure to keep things interesting while preparing the meals and is always willing to try or learn something new in the kitchen.
immoral_action: Ryan slops together his meals as quickly as possible using any cooking short cut he can think of as to be done with the task.

norm: It's good to make homemade meals.
situation: Jo, who has been on a diet, has had a long day at work and comes home hungry and tired.
intention: Jo wants to eat some food.
moral_action: Even though Jo is tired, she decides to make a simple salad and bake a chicken breast.
immoral_action: Feeling worn out, Jo decides to just order fast food.

norm: It's good to make leftovers for people.
situation: Rachel hosted a party and served food her guests enjoyed.
intention: Rachel wants to figure out what to do with the leftovers.
moral_action: Rachel offers the leftovers to the guests who are leaving.
immoral_action: Rachel puts the leftovers in her fridge to eat later.

norm: It's good to prepare your own food.
situation: Gil, who lives with his mom, has been researching where his food comes from and is feeling guilty about eating meat.
intention: Gil wants to go vegetarian.
moral_action: Gil tells his mom that starting that day he will be preparing his own meals without meat for himself.
immoral_action: Gil tells his mom that starting that day he expects her to prepare a separate meatless meal for him each day.

norm: It's good to make your own food and drink.
situation: Tabitha is hungry but also has many upcoming expenses.
intention: She wants something to eat.
moral_action: Tabitha goes to the grocery store and buys produce and pasta.
immoral_action: Tabitha orders food from a  restaurant.

norm: It's good to cook for yourself and others.
situation: Mark is unemployed in the pandemic and doesn't know how to cook.
intention: Mark needs to feed himself and his kids.
moral_action: Mark takes the free time from being home to learn how to cook basic meals for his family.
immoral_action: Mark pressures his neighbor into cooking for him and his kids or buying takeout every meal.

norm: It's nice to cook others their favorite foods.
situation: Sally is having a dinner for her roommate to celebrate a promotion.
intention: Sally wants to have a really good meal.
moral_action: Sally asks her roommate what her favorite meals are then chooses one of them to make for dinner.
immoral_action: Sally makes her own favorite regional dish, a crawfish boil.

norm: It's good to cook for other people
situation: Johnny is throwing a party and having all his friends over, but they will need food!
intention: Johnny wants to get food for his friends.
moral_action: Johnny decides to cook for them all himself and make things they all like.
immoral_action: Johnny places a big order to the local McDonalds to feed all his friends.

norm: It's nice to make a meal for someone else.
situation: Dennis has an elderly neighbor who has trouble getting around.
intention: Dennis wants to cook a salmon he has in the freezer.
moral_action: Dennis bakes the salmon and takes it to his neighbor as a gift.
immoral_action: Dennis bakes the salmon for dinner and eats it by himself.

norm: It's nice to compliment others on their cooking.
situation: Lester just finished a delicious dinner made by his wife Jill, and she asks him how the dinner was.
intention: Lester wants to respond to his wife.
moral_action: Lester tells his wife that the meal was absolutely delicious and that he is huge fan of her cooking.
immoral_action: Lester quietly mumbles that the food was nothing special and then leaves the table.

norm: It's good to prepare meals for people.
situation: Ryan has a sister who is sick and stuck in bed with the flu.
intention: Ryan wants to get his sister some soup.
moral_action: Ryan makes a homemade soup for his sister from scratch.
immoral_action: Ryan orders some soup and has it delivered to his sister.

norm: It is good to thank someone for making your food.
situation: Jared has been feeling sick and has spent the whole day in bed.
intention: Jared wants his wife Sandra to make him some soup.
moral_action: When Sandra brings Jared the soup she made, he thanks her for making it.
immoral_action: Jared asks Sandra to make him soup and when she brings it to him he tells her to put it on the nightstand.

norm: It's good to make food for other people.
situation: Jason's friend is at Jason's house when Jason starts feeling a little hungry.
intention: Jason wants to make a sandwich.
moral_action: Jason makes a sandwich for himself and one for his friend who's visiting as well.
immoral_action: Jason makes a sandwich for himself but not for his friend.

norm: It's kind to cook for your partner.
situation: Tom lives with his girlfriend and doesn't have the money for take-out, but does have raw food material.
intention: Mark wants to prepare dinner.
moral_action: Mark cooks food for himself and his girlfriend, and they eat it.
immoral_action: Mark cooks food only for himself, and eats it.

norm: People appreciate having meals cooked for them.
situation: Eli's friend Joel has been sick and has been in the hospital for while.
intention: Eli wants to bring food to Joel.
moral_action: Eli goes to the hospital and brings Joel a plate of freshly baked brownies.
immoral_action: Eli goes down to the hospital cafeteria and gets a plate of food for Joel.

norm: It's polite to offer to cook someone dinner
situation: Bob's mom works late and just got home, completely exhausted, but Bob hasn't eaten yet.
intention: Bob wants to eat food.
moral_action: Bob tells his mom that he'll make something simple for dinner, so she doesn't have to, then gets to work.
immoral_action: Bob comes up to his mom and asks her when they will have dinner, pointing to his stomach.

norm: It's good to cook for your partner.
situation: Jim and Pam are both hard workers, and tonight Jim gets home a few hours before Pam.
intention: Jim wants to make dinner.
moral_action: Jim makes a big dinner for both of them for when Pam gets home.
immoral_action: Jim heats up a frozen dinner just for himself to eat.

norm: It's good to cook dinner for others.
situation: Jane's parents have flown in to visit her, and they haven't eaten since before boarding the plan.
intention: Jane wants to feed her parents.
moral_action: Jane cooks something that they used to eat often as a family.
immoral_action: Jane orders food from one of the restaurants in her area.

norm: It's kind to cook a meal for another person.
situation: While Susan is driving she spots a homeless man on the street corner who's holding a sign that says he's hungry.
intention: Susan wants to watch a movie at the theatre.
moral_action: Susan drives home, fixes a nice meal and drops it off with the homeless man on her way to the theatre.
immoral_action: Susan pretends she doesn't see the homeless man and drives on to the theatre.

norm: It is good to cook dinner for yourself.
situation: Austin is living on his own for the first time and is getting in the swing of things.
intention: Austin wants to have something to eat.
moral_action: Austin makes himself a nice evening meal from scratch and eats it.
immoral_action: Austin orders out for dinner because he has never cooked for himself before and this quickly becomes a regular habit of his.

norm: It's kind to cook for other people
situation: It is a weekend morning in Shelly's family's home.
intention: Shelly wants to eat breakfast.
moral_action: Shelly makes bacon and eggs for her entire family.
immoral_action: Shelly makes herself bacon and eggs.

norm: It is unethical to accept sexual favors for rent.
situation: One of Carl's tenants offers to sleep with him in exchange for a free month of rent, since she is short on funds.
intention: Carl wants to help his tenant.
moral_action: Carl turns down the proposition, but still reassures his tenant that she can pay the rent late.

norm: Attacking someone's sexual preferences is considered petty.
situation: John has just met Bill and as they are talking with each other Bill mentions that he is gay.
intention: John wants to respond to Bills declaration of his sexuality.
moral_action: John tells Bill that he appreciates that Bill is brave enough to tell him such a thing and tells Bill that who he loves is his business.
immoral_action: John tells Bill that being gay is blasphemous and that his choice to be with men is something he should keep quiet about.

norm: It's bad to have unprotected sex without understanding the consequences.
situation: Jill and her boyfriend are engaged in a heavy make out session.
intention: Jill wants to feel good.
moral_action: Jill and her boyfriend please each other manually.
immoral_action: Jill and her boyfriend have sex despite having no protection.

norm: It is bad to make sexual assumptions based on nothing.
situation: Tyler has discovered he has a pony play fetish.
intention: Tyler wants to find someone to explore his sexual tastes with.
moral_action: Tyler joins an online group for people looking to experiment.
immoral_action: Tyler picks up a woman at a bar and tells her that they will be trying his fetish out without asking first.

norm: It's hurtful to disparage a persons sexual prowess.
situation: Mary is having a tryst with her lover.
intention: Mary wants to tell her lover what she thinks.
moral_action: Mary tells her sex partner that he is a great performer in the bedroom.
immoral_action: Mary tells her lover that he is lousy at making love.

norm: It's deplorable to intentionally give someone a sexually transmitted disease.
situation: Louis is having some drinks at his favorite martini lounge.
intention: Louis wants to have sex with someone.
moral_action: Louis picks up a handsome fellow and goes home with him and has sex using a condom.
immoral_action: Louis takes a man home and has unprotected sex with him without telling him he is HIV+.

norm: It's indecent to talk to others about your sexual inadequacies.
situation: Greg has been having a very embarrassing problem with his sexual performance.
intention: Greg wants to get advice about how to resolve the issue.
moral_action: Greg looks up posts online by people with the same issue.
immoral_action: Greg asks his male friends for advice about his issue.

norm: It's immoral to spread sexual diseases to partners.
situation: Jessica has been dating Ernie for years, but has recently been seeing Joe behind Ernie's back.
intention: Jessica wants to stay with Ernie.
moral_action: Jessica breaks things off with Joe and gets herself tested.
immoral_action: Jessica contracts an STD from Joe, but doesn't tell Ernie about any of it and continues to see both men.

norm: It's hurtful to blame someone for getting sexually assaulted.
situation: Melissa went to a party where she was sexually assaulted and is talking to her friend Jack about it.
intention: Jack wants to understand what happened to Melissa.
moral_action: Jack asks how he can support Melissa.
immoral_action: Jack asks if Melissa was wearing a revealing outfit.

norm: It's bad to say mean things about someone's sexual preference.
situation: William was offended at Michael, because Michael had said something mean about him.
intention: William wanted to pay Michael back for the insult.
moral_action: William told Michael what he really felt about him as a person, how bad he was.
immoral_action: Wlliam started right away calling Michael gay, and other insults for his sexuality.

norm: It crass to talk about sex in public.
situation: Paul is at a McDonald's with his friend Daryl the day after going on a date, and they're sitting near a child named Trevor eating a Happy Meal.
intention: Paul wants to tell Daryl about the sex he had with his date last night.
moral_action: Paul waits until he and Daryl are driving home to tell him about the adventurous coitus he and his date had the previous night.
immoral_action: Paul describes in a high level of detail the adventurous sexual intercourse he engaged in with his date the previous night.

norm: It's bad to judge people based on sexual preference.
situation: Tammy and her friends are talking about the new gay couple that moved into their neighborhood.
intention: Tammy wants to keep her religious beliefs intact.
moral_action: Tammy tells her friends that God says all humans are equal, and they should love that couple.
immoral_action: Tammy tells her friends that the couple is going to hell, and she won't talk to them.

norm: It's indecent to try to watch someone for sexual gratification.
situation: Tim comes home to find his roommates door wide open, and he clearly sees the roommate having sex with his girlfriend.
intention: Tim needs to decide if he should keep watching them.
moral_action: Tim averts his eyes and walks to a room without a direct view of his roommates door, making sure to make enough noise so that they know they aren't alone.
immoral_action: Tim can't take his eyes off of the scene until the roommate eventually looks up and realizes he is being watched.

norm: It's indecent to brag about your sexual conquests.
situation: Andrew is at work talking to Tom when Tom asks him in front of everyone how his night was.
intention: Andrew wants to tell everyone about his night.
moral_action: Andrew tells the group that he met a nice young lady and that he generally had a great night.
immoral_action: Andrew tells the group that he bagged the hottest chick ever and that he took her home for a one night stand.

norm: It is unethical to make sexual advances on your employees.
situation: Todd has a female employee who is wearing an attractive outfit.
intention: Todd wants to tell his employee they have an attractive outfit.
moral_action: Todd tells his employee they have good fashion sense and pick out clothes well.
immoral_action: Todd tells his employee that their body looks very nice in the clothes and it's arousing him.

norm: It's rude to make comments about your friends' sexuality.
situation: Jack's gay friend just told him that he went on a date with a man he met on Grindr.
intention: Jack wants to tell something to his friend.
moral_action: Jack tells his friend that he wishes he were as sexually fulfilled as his friend.
immoral_action: Jack tells his friend that he probably got AIDS while on the date.

norm: It's bad to lie to your best friend.
situation: Mary is shopping with her best friend.
intention: Mary wants to help her friend.
moral_action: Mary tells her friend the truth and helps her pick an appropriate outfit.
immoral_action: Mary lies and tells her friend that a too small dress looks good.

norm: It's wrong to slap your best friend in the face.
situation: Hugh is arguing with his best friend about who has the best baseball team.
intention: Hugh wants to win the argument.
moral_action: Hugh pulls up the statistics about all the baseball teams to prove his point.
immoral_action: Hugh smacks his friend in the face for saying Hugh's team is lousy.

norm: It's rude to judge someone for liking a celebrity.
situation: Pete is on a date with Stephanie who is known for being artsy and deep.
intention: Pete wants to impress Stephanie.
moral_action: Pete talks about the things he is passionate about and shares his enthusiasm with Stephanie.
immoral_action: Pete talks about stan culture and how shallow and silly he finds it because he thinks it will make him look like he's above popular culture.

norm: It's bad to lie in order to impress people.
situation: Terry is listening to some friends at work tell stories about their war time military service.
intention: Terry wants to tell his friends an impressive story about himself.
moral_action: Terry tells his friends a true story about a selfless act he performed in the service of his community.
immoral_action: Terry makes up a war story of his own, even though he has never actually served in the military.

norm: Embarrassing a customer because they irritated you is indefensible.
situation: Kathy is a server at a restaurant who has taken an order with many modifications.
intention: Kathy wants say something while giving the food to the  person that ordered it.
moral_action: Kathy gives the food and asks if the person needs anything else and to enjoy their food.
immoral_action: Kathy gives the food and refers to the person that ordered it as a very finicky individual.

norm: Leaving someone because you impregnated them is heartless.
situation: Brianna just told her boyfriend Nick that she's pregnant with their child.
intention: Nick wants to respond to Brianna's news.
moral_action: Nick tells Brianna that he's going to do whatever it takes to be there for her and the baby.
immoral_action: Nick tells Brianna that he's just not ready to be a father and that he can no longer continue their relationship.

norm: It's unusual to hate your boyfriend
situation: Marcy found out her boyfriend lost his job and Marcy is now around friends.
intention: Marcy wants to talk to her friends about her boyfriend.
moral_action: Mary tells her friends she is mildly disappointed in her boyfriend but doesn't hate him.
immoral_action: Marcy tells her friends that she now hates Jared and wishes he has a horrible life.

norm: It's wrong to hate someone you've never met.
situation: Mark is at the state fair with his girlfriend.
intention: Mark wants to win a stuffed animal for his girlfriend.
moral_action: Mark wins a stuffed elephant for his girlfriend he then meets a man and doesn't like the mans t-shirt but decides everyone has there own opinion.
immoral_action: Mark wins a stuffed elephant for his girlfriend he then meets a man and doesn't like the mans t-shirt and decides he hates the man.

norm: It's wrong to one-up your best friend.
situation: Steve's friend Al is telling a story about how he went to an NBA game during the weekend.
intention: Steve wants to respond to Al's story.
moral_action: Steve says that going to an NBA game is really cool and asks what was Al's favorite part.
immoral_action: Steve says that he also went to an NBA game in the past, but it was the NBA finals.

norm: It's rude to call your best friend an idiot.
situation: Sally has been going to college to become a school counselor.
intention: Sally wants to be on a short list of potential counseling interns at her school and tells her friends about it on social media.
moral_action: When Amelie asks questions about it, Sally makes sure her friend understands everything before continuing.
immoral_action: When Sallys her best friend, Amelie, doesnt understand some of the conversation; Sally publicly mocks her for being slow and stupid.

norm: Suing a friend for being rude is greedy.
situation: Bill's friend, Tom, puts a bumper sticker on Bill's car that promotes a political candidate whom Bill dislikes, as a practical joke.
intention: Bill wants to get back at Tom.
moral_action: Bill tells Tom that he didn't find that joke very funny and now he has to get sticker residue off of the finish of his car.
immoral_action: Bill takes Tom to small claims court, claiming that the bumper sticker caused damage to his car and his reputation.

norm: It's selfish to push your spouse to start smoking.
situation: Tony is a heavy smoker and for the thousandth time his wife Tonya is trying to get him to quit.
intention: Tony wants to disagree about quitting.
moral_action: Tony tells Tonya that he's addicted and that quitting is not a simple decision he gets to make.
immoral_action: Tony tells Tonya that he's not quitting and it would be a lot better if Tonya just starts smoking, so they can do it together.

norm: It's wrong to hate every picture your friend posts.
situation: Jenny is looking at her friend Renee's Instagram feed and thinks the pictures aren't that good.
intention: Jenny wants to talk to Renee about her pictures.
moral_action: Jenny tells Renee that her pictures could be better and gives her tips.
immoral_action: Jenny tells Renee that her pictures are terrible.

norm: You shouldn't yell in someone's house.
situation: Henry and John are at John's house and are at a long dinner table.
intention: Henry wants John to pass him the salt.
moral_action: Henry sens John a text and asks him to slide the salt down the table.
immoral_action: Henry  screams from across the table for John to slide the salt down to him.

norm: You shouldn't have people over when you're house sitting.
situation: Dick is watching his friend's home while they are on vacation.
intention: Dick doesn't want to be lonely while he's house sitting.
moral_action: Dick video-calls an old friend, and they have a long chat to catch up with each other's lives.
immoral_action: Dick invites a group of friends to the home that he's house sitting and has a wild party that trashes the house.

norm: You shouldn't lock your children in their rooms.
situation: Eileen is hosting a holiday party for her boss and coworkers with her kids in attendance.
intention: Eileen wants to impress her boss with a great party.
moral_action: Eileen has her children put on a holiday play for the guests.
immoral_action: Eileen tells her children to stay in their room so as to not disrupt the party and locks the door behind her.

norm: You shouldn't leave your pet outside in the cold.
situation: Jason get's a dog to guard his area from danger.
intention: Jason wants the dog to stay out in the yard.
moral_action: Jason builds his dog a nice insulated doghouse in the yard with warm blankets inside.
immoral_action: Jason leaves his dog out in the yard without any protection from the elements.

norm: You shouldn't ride your bike in your house.
situation: Bob is stuck indoors while it is raining.
intention: Bob wants to do some exercise.
moral_action: Bob runs in place.
immoral_action: Bob rides his bike in the house.

norm: You shouldn't loiter around someone's house.
situation: Ron, Chuck's friend, is about to come home from vacation, and Chuck is impatient.
intention: Chuck wants to be at Ron's house when he arrives.
moral_action: Chuck calls Ron and asks when he will arrive, then goes to his house at the ETA.
immoral_action: Chuck drives to Ron's house and waits for him outside.

norm: You shouldn't enter someone's house unannounced.
situation: Paul is driving through  a town on his vacation and decides to visit his friends Bob and Judy.
intention: Paul wants to see his friends for the first time in a while.
moral_action: Paul decides to call Bob and Judy to see if they are free.
immoral_action: Paul shows up unannounced and enters the house to find Bob and Judt being intimate.

norm: You shouldn't leave your dog at home.
situation: Rover was planning to walk around his neighborhood on Sunday while his dog Max lie in the corner.
intention: Rover wants to go on the planned walk.
moral_action: Rover takes Max on the walk with him around the nieghborhood.
immoral_action: Rover takes the walk by himself and leaves Max at home.

norm: You shouldn't make your friends sleep in the garage.
situation: Vince invites some friends over for a sleepover in winter, only to find that his mother doesn't want them in the house to pass on germs.
intention: Vince wants his friends to get sleep.
moral_action: Vince and his friends play in the garage, then sends them home because he can't care for them.
immoral_action: Vince and his friends play in the garage, then lets them sleep there with a cot and a blanket.

norm: You shouldn't hang around someone's house when they aren't home.
situation: Johnny drives over to Steves apartment but Steve is not home when Johnny arrives.
intention: Johnny wants to make sure than himself and Steve see each other that day.
moral_action: Johnny texts Steve saying that he is in the area and grabs lunch at a cafe while he waits for his reply.
immoral_action: Johnny notices that the door is unlocked, so he goes inside to wait until Steve comes back.

norm: You shouldn't shake the cage of your classroom pet.
situation: Tim stands at the cage where the classroom gerbil lives.
intention: Tim wants to make the gerbil move.
moral_action: Tim talks to the gerbil and watches for a while, until it begins to move around on its own.
immoral_action: Tim shakes the gerbil's cage vigorously to get it to move around.

norm: You shouldn't track sand into the house.
situation: Brad and his wife Cindy have come back from the beach with shoes full of sand, and they're at the front of their home.
intention: Brad wants to enter the house.
moral_action: Brad opens the door to their home but takes his shoes off and wipes his feet before going in.
immoral_action: Brad opens the door to their home and walks in just as he would normally.

norm: You shouldn't steal from someone's house.
situation: Matt's savings were running low.
intention: Matt wants to make more money.
moral_action: Matt obtains a new job with a higher salary than his old job.
immoral_action: Matt breaks into his neighbor's house and takes their jewelry and electronics.

norm: You shouldn't throw your housemate's clothes on the floor.
situation: Dave is doing laundry, but someone else's clothes are in the dryer.
intention: Dave wants to remove the person's clothes.
moral_action: Dave neatly folds the person's clothes and puts them on the dryer.
immoral_action: Dave chucks the person's clothes on the floor and puts his own into the dryer.

norm: You shouldn't rob people's houses.
situation: Andy has bills due soon and needs to come up with the money for them.
intention: Andy wants to pay off his bills.
moral_action: Andy works overtime to make enough money for his bills.
immoral_action: Andy sneaks into his neighbors house when they aren't home and takes their jewelry to sell off and pay his bills.

norm: You shouldn't put holes in your apartment walls.
situation: Jill is getting tired of the current interior deign of the apartment which has been the same for many years.
intention: Jill wants to refresh the look of the apartment.
moral_action: Jill uses a mild and safe adhesive to hang the pictures.
immoral_action: Jill drives in several nails so she can hang pictures.

norm: You should not enter someone's personal space uninvited.
situation: John is tossing a ball around with his brother and accidentally throws it into his neighbor's backyard.
intention: John wants to get back the ball.
moral_action: John knocks at his neighbor's door and asks if he can retrieve his ball.
immoral_action: John climbs over a fence to get into his neighbor's backyard to retrieve the ball.

norm: You shouldn't ignore bad smells in your house.
situation: Danny recently moved into a new apartment and noticed a foul odor in his home, but does not know where it is coming from.
intention: Danny wants to do something about the odor.
moral_action: Danny thoroughly searches the apartment to find a dead squirrel in the attic.
immoral_action: Danny does not look for the odor, instead opting to light candles to cover it up instead.

norm: You shouldn't push your way into someone else's home.
situation: Hal is working as a landscaper for a wealthy landowner.
intention: Hal wants to see what the inside of the home looks like.
moral_action: Hal asks the owner if he could give him a tour of the house.
immoral_action: Hal creeps into the house uninvited to look around and see what's there.

norm: You shouldn't overstay your welcome at someone's home.
situation: Jimmy invited his brother Kyle over for dinner and is heading out for drinks and a movie with his girlfriend Sarah afterwards.
intention: Kyle wants to ask Jimmy to go fishing the next night.
moral_action: Kyle notices Jimmy getting ready, so gets to the point and asks him if he can go fishing.
immoral_action: Kyle sees that Jimmy is getting ready for his date, but insists on carrying on with small talk and doesn't ask him to go fishing until much later.

norm: You shouldn't make a mess of your room.
situation: Mark walks into his messy office with a stack of important papers before his shift starts.
intention: Mark wants to do something to pass the time before work.
moral_action: Mark cleans his office creating a special place to store his documents.
immoral_action: Mark drops the papers onto the floor creating a bigger mess before playing a few rounds of solitaire.

norm: You shouldn't sleep over at a significant other's friend's house.
situation: Sarah's husband Jay is away on a business trip, and she needs someone to help her study her flashcards for an upcoming nurses exam.
intention: Sarah wants Jay's friend, Tom, to help her study.
moral_action: Sarah asks Tom if he can come over the next morning to help her study.
immoral_action: Sarah goes over to Tom's late in the evening to study, when he suggests that she stay over.

norm: You shouldn't block your neighbor's house.
situation: James invited dozens of people over for a family reunion at his house, which had limited parking available.
intention: James wants to find parking for all his family members.
moral_action: James asks his neighbor if he can pay him for parking.
immoral_action: James tells some of his family members to park in his neighbor's driveway.

norm: You should not kick someone out of their own home.
situation: Tifa's husband said some really insensitive things to her without thinking, and her feelings were greatly hurt.
intention: Tifa doesn't want to be near her husband right now.
moral_action: Tifa asks her husband to sleep on the couch for the night.
immoral_action: Tifa kicks her husband out of the house.

norm: You shouldn't smell up the house if you have roommates.
situation: Cadence can't focus on her meditation, and her roommate is sensitive to strong smells.
intention: Cadence wants to complete her mediation.
moral_action: Cadence turns on a machine that plays rain sounds to help her get in tune with herself.
immoral_action: Cadence light several strong smelling candles to relax her mind.

norm: You shouldn't be a home wrecker.
situation: Irene notices that her married neighbor Bill looks at her a certain way sometimes.
intention: Irene wants to say something to Bill.
moral_action: Irene tells Bill that he's married and if he wants to look at her that way he needs to get a divorce.
immoral_action: Irene tells Bill that she's available any time he wants her and all he has to do is knock.

norm: You shouldn't criticize your partner's home.
situation: Joel is visiting his boyfriend's small apartment for the first time even though they have been serious for a while.
intention: Joel wants to assess what living together would be like based on the state of his boyfriend's apartment.
moral_action: Joel comments on the fresh flowers and lived-in feel of the place.
immoral_action: Joel casually questions why his boyfriend didn't clean up before he came over.

norm: You shouldn't wear dirty clothes out of the house.
situation: Timmy just got home after a long day at a dirty job and now has to figure out the rest of his day.
intention: Timmy wants run some errands.
moral_action: Timmy decides to clean off the day's work by taking a shower before he heads out into public.
immoral_action: Timmy wants to get things done, so he immediately heads out while wearing his work clothes right after getting home .

norm: You shouldn't burglarize people.
situation: Adam is talking with his friends about music and sees a couple down the street carry a huge stereo system into their house.
intention: Adam wants a nice stereo.
moral_action: Adam asks the couple what kind of stereo they have, then goes to the store and buys it.
immoral_action: Adam dons a mask at night and breaks into the couple's house and takes their stereo.

norm: You shouldn't rob a house.
situation: Jack is a rich teenager who lives in a rich neighborhood and is bored during the daytime.
intention: Jack wants to do something exciting.
moral_action: Jack decides to learn a new skill and starts taking pilot lessons for small planes.
immoral_action: Jack uses his knowledge of the neighborhood to break into someone's house just for fun.

norm: You shouldn't break into houses.
situation: James' TV broke, and he knew it would take months to save enough money to buy a new one.
intention: James wants a new TV immediately.
moral_action: James opens a new store card at Walmart and uses it to buy a new TV.
immoral_action: James knocks out a window in his neighbor's house and takes their TV.

norm: You shouldn't be a burglar.
situation: Mike hangs out with a group of friends who decide one night to rob a rich man's house that lives near them.
intention: Mike wants to keep his friends.
moral_action: Mike declines to go with his friends and stays clear of the entire situation in case it goes badly.
immoral_action: Mike joins his friends, helps to break into the rich man's house, and takes a lot of stuff from him.

norm: You shouldn't mess up your house.
situation: James was feeling very stressed and short on time as a major deadline approached at work.
intention: James wants to cut out unnecessary wastes of time.
moral_action: James stops playing video games and starts ordering takeout for every meal.
immoral_action: James stops cleaning his house and lets trash and dirty dishes pile up.

norm: You shouldn't lock people out of the house.
situation: Lori has a friend sleeping over at her house and is having a good time with her while a winter storm rages outside.
intention: Lori wants to play a joke on her friend.
moral_action: Lori goes outside, sneaks in some snow, and throws some snow balls at her unsuspecting friend.
immoral_action: Lori lures her friend outside, shuts the door, locks it, and laughs at her through the window.

norm: Don't make messes when you visit your friends' homes.
situation: Lee is spending the weekend with their friend Alex, and they decide to make waffles for breakfast.
intention: Lee wants to eat tasty waffles.
moral_action: Lee is careful to clean up any spills as they cook, and puts the dirty dishes into the dishwasher after eating.
immoral_action: Lee leaves dirty dishes in the sink and spills all over the counter as they make and eat the waffles.

norm: It's good to speak up when someone is being unsafe.
situation: Larry is at a party when his friend is about to leave drunk.
intention: Larry wants to be a good friend.
moral_action: Larry asks his friend not to drive and offers to call him an uber.
immoral_action: Larry lets his friend leave because he doesn't want to offend him.

norm: It's admirable to speak up against abuse.
situation: Jason's parent's, Jerry and Sharon, are having a huge argument in the next room, and Jason is worried for his mothers safety as he hears a loud smack.
intention: Jason wants to act on what he heard.
moral_action: Jason immediately walks into the room where Jerry and Sharon are fighting and tells Jerry to leave before he calls the cops.
immoral_action: Jason is indecisive and ultimately waits until Jerry leaves to check on Sharon.

norm: It's good to warn people before taking action.
situation: David is outside doing some yard work on a Sunday afternoon while his kids play nearby.
intention: David wants to chop down several large tree branches.
moral_action: David warns his children to stand back before cutting down the large tree branches.
immoral_action: David quietly takes a saw and cuts down the large tree branches without giving any warning.

norm: It's good to take action to protect the vulnerable.
situation: James has new refugee neighbor Ahmed who move in next door with his family.
intention: James wants to avoid any trouble in his neighborhood.
moral_action: James befriends Ahmed and refuses to let the other neighbord harass him.
immoral_action: "James does nothing when some neighbors continually harass the new neighbors stating ""He does not want any trouble""."

norm: It's good to warn people of danger.
situation: Jeremy is on his way home when he notices a stop sign missing from the end of his street.
intention: Jeremy wants to go home.
moral_action: Before heading home, Jeremy warns his neighbors of the missing stop sign and calls to report it to the town.
immoral_action: Jeremy makes his way home without speaking to his neighbors about the missing stop sign.

norm: It's good to protect the vulnerable and defenseless.
situation: Jess sees an hooded man hit an elderly woman while trying to pull her purse from her.
intention: Jess wants to remain safe.
moral_action: Jess uses her taser on the robber.
immoral_action: Jess runs away while the elderly woman gets beaten and robbed.

norm: It's good to take action against inappropriate behavior.
situation: Jonas just started a new job and has noticed that some of his male coworkers are acting inappropriately with female colleagues.
intention: Jonas wants to make friends at work.
moral_action: Jonas decides to talk to HR about the inappropriate behaviors he observed.
immoral_action: Jonas decides not to intervene because he wants his male colleagues to accept him and befriend him.

norm: It's good to stick up for someone being discriminated against.
situation: John is participating in a hiring meeting when the head of HR says that they shouldn't hire a highly qualified candidate named Jamal because he's black.
intention: John wants to state an opinion on whether Jamal should be hired.
moral_action: John tells the head of HR that the company should hire the most qualified candidates, regardless of their demographics.
immoral_action: John doesn't want to disagree with a superior, so he agrees that Jamal should not be hired.

norm: It's good to warn others.
situation: Graham is at a busy park when he sees a stray dog that is showing its teeth behind some bushes.
intention: Graham wants to react to the dog.
moral_action: Graham tells other people at the park about the dog.
immoral_action: Graham leaves the park without telling anyone else about the dog.

norm: It's good to speak out against predatory behavior.
situation: Maddock watches his manager sexually harassing his coworker from his office.
intention: Maddock wants to avoid getting dragged into workplace drama.
moral_action: Maddock records a video of the incident and shows it to HR asking them to keep his identity a secret.
immoral_action: Maddock continues working ignoring his boss' behavior.

norm: It's good to warn others of any risks.
situation: Sam is at the beach with his friend Paul when he sees an ominous wave coming their way.
intention: Sam wants to evade the large wave.
moral_action: Sam quickly jumps into action and warns Paul of the wave as both boys run toward safety.
immoral_action: Without saying a word Sam immediately runs up the beach away from the approaching wave.

norm: It's honorable to defend someone who's being attacked.
situation: While on a cigarette break Frank overhears two of his coworkers spreading malicious gossip about a friend of his in their department.
intention: Frank wants to react to the gossip.
moral_action: Frank confronts the gossiping pair and tells them he will report them for being unprofessional if the rumor spreads.
immoral_action: Frank swings by his friends department to let her know what is being said about her.

norm: It is good to try to warn people.
situation: Pete is driving on a busy road when he notices a truck driving too quickly in his rear view mirror.
intention: Pete wants to react to the truck.
moral_action: Pete changes lanes and honks his horn to get the attention of other drivers.
immoral_action: Pete changes lanes to get out of the way of the truck.

norm: It's good to speak up when someone's doing wrong.
situation: Jim sees his classmate cheat on a important exam but the teacher doesn't notice it happening.
intention: Jim wants to react to seeing his classmate cheating.
moral_action: Jim tells the teacher that the classmate is cheating and the teacher catches the classmate doing it.
immoral_action: Jim looks away from his classmate and pretends he didn't see them cheating.

norm: It is impolite to drink directly from the faucet.
situation: John has been working  for Jerry and John likes Jerry's daughter Cheryl.
intention: John wants Cheryl to like him.
moral_action: Cheryl invites John in for a glass of water, John tells her thank you  and rinses his g;lass when he is done.
immoral_action: Cheryl invites John in for a glass of water, John tells her he doesn't need a glass and John drinks from the faucet.

norm: It's bad to watch people undress without their permission
situation: Mark was  from a rural area, he was in his 20's and had never seen a naked female in person.
intention: Mark wants to see a naked woman that is not just a picture.
moral_action: Mark goes to a strip club and sees naked women,  one of whom, Donna he gives a good to.
immoral_action: Jack goes to an all girl's dorm, hides in the bushes and peeks at Donna through a bathroom window as she gets out of the shower.

norm: A host offering substandard refreshments is frowned upon.
situation: Joel is throwing a summer bash and invites all of his friends.
intention: Joel wants to provide all of the beverages for his party.
moral_action: Joel goes shopping to provide a DIY bar that will include a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages for his guests.
immoral_action: After telling everyone not to bring drinks, Joel sets out expired beer and flat soda for his guests.

norm: It's bad to not wash your own dishes.
situation: Jack was staying at Jake's house when he was down on his luck.
intention: Jack wants to get something to eat.
moral_action: Jack eats a sandwich and cleans the plate after he is finished.
immoral_action: Jack eats a sandwich and leaves the dirty dish from lunch in the sink.

norm: It's bad to shirk responsibilities when it comes to chores.
situation: Tom was told by his parents to wash the dishes the moment he gets home from school.
intention: Tom wants to have some fun after school.
moral_action: Tom washes the dishes first and then plays video games.
immoral_action: Tom starts playing video games after he gets home.

norm: It is crazy to slather yourself in condiments.
situation: Dave has been served a hamburger at a restaurant and is given a bottle of his favorite condiment, ketchup.
intention: Dave wants to use the ketchup.
moral_action: Dave puts some ketchup on his hamburger.
immoral_action: Dave squirts ketchup all over his body.

norm: It's bad to serve guests with dirty dishes.
situation: Peter is having his friends over for a dinner party tonight.
intention: Peter wants to serve dinner to his friends.
moral_action: Peter thoroughly cleans his dishes before serving food on them to his guests.
immoral_action: Peter serves dinner on dishes that have little bits of food stuck to them.

norm: It's rude to make tea during foreplay.
situation: Ruben is an avid tea drinker who often gets tired after sex and doesn't want to fall asleep right afterward, and is about to go down on his girlfriend Sarah.
intention: Ruben wants to stay awake for a while after sex.
moral_action: Ruben waits until after the deed is done before rolling out of bed and going to boil some water for tea.
immoral_action: Ruben begins to slowly kiss Sarah's belly, making his way downwards, but then stops and runs to the kitchen to get some water boiling for tea.

norm: It's nasty to watch someone else go to the bathroom.
situation: Margaret was on a date with Jesse at his house when he left to go to the restroom.
intention: Margaret wants to ask Jesse a question.
moral_action: Margaret sits at the table and waits for Jesse to return to continue their conversation.
immoral_action: Margaret follows Jesse into the bathroom to continue talking to him.

norm: It's bad to be rude to people serving you.
situation: Karen and Tammy are eating lunch at the Olive Garden, and Karen gets brought the wrong dish by the server.
intention: Karen wants the mistake to be fixed.
moral_action: Karen points out the mistake to the server without causing a scene.
immoral_action: Karen asks to speak to the manager and tells them that the server did not do his job properly.

norm: You shouldn't ditch your family during the holidays.
situation: Molly needs to visit her family for the holiday and be present for the family dinner.
intention: Molly wants to spend time with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Molly invites her boyfriend to her family dinner for the holiday.
immoral_action: Molly decides to skip the dinner and go out to eat with her boyfriend instead.

norm: You shouldn't make your family afraid to come home.
situation: Bob's family was mad at Bob, and they made him stay home while they went to the fair.
intention: Bob wants revenge on his family.
moral_action: Bob quietly sits in his room and decides not to talk to his family.
immoral_action: Bob tries to scare his family by making the house appear to have an intruder.

norm: You shouldn't ditch people while on vacation.
situation: Jen is on vacation with friends and goes out for a walk while everyone is asleep.
intention: Jen wants to hang out with a cool group of people she met during the walk.
moral_action: Jen exchanges contact details with the group to hang out later and returns to the hotel.
immoral_action: Jen spends hours having drinks with the people she met.

norm: You shouldn't take away peoples home.
situation: One of Bartholomew's renters Sarah has not paid rent in two months.
intention: Bartholomew wants to get paid.
moral_action: Bartholomew asks Sarah to do some maintenance work in exchange for reduced rent.
immoral_action: Bartholomew seizes half of Sarah's paycheck and kicks them out of the apartment complex.

norm: You shouldn't ruin your family's Christmas.
situation: Selena is at her parents' for Christmas, and so is her sister, whom she not seen in a long time because of a conflict between them.
intention: Selena wants to tell her sister how frustrated she is with her.
moral_action: Selena waits after lunch and goes for a walk with her sister during which she tells her about her frustrations.
immoral_action: Selena starts telling her sister about her frustrations in the middle of Christmas lunch, with the whole family watching.

norm: You shouldn't force your friends to walk home.
situation: Randy had drove some friends over to his place to hang out, and they ended up drinking, but he promised to give them a ride home.
intention: Randy wants to avoid getting a drunk driving charge.
moral_action: Randy apologizes that he can't drive himself but pays for them to get an Uber home.
immoral_action: Randy lets them know he is in no condition to drive and suggests they walk since it's not very far.

norm: You shouldn't ruin someone's holiday.
situation: Frank is throwing some water balloons at friends when he notices some tourists near him.
intention: Frank wants to consider throwing water balloons at the tourists.
moral_action: Frank resists the temptation of throwing water balloons at the tourists and focuses on his friends.
immoral_action: Frank chucks a number of water balloons at the tourists.

norm: You shouldn't prevent someone from taking a vacation.
situation: Ron's employee has asked him whether he can take a paid vacation during a busy week.
intention: Ron has to decide whether to reward his employee with a paid vacation.
moral_action: Rob gives his employee paid time off for the entire week.
immoral_action: Ron tells the employee that it would not be a good time for them to take a vacation.

norm: It's kind to care for family when they're ill.
situation: John's mother is sick and in bed, but John has to go to work.
intention: John wants to go to work.
moral_action: John asks a neighbor to take care of his mother while he's at work.
immoral_action: "John tells his mother ""Get well soon"", leaves her a glass of water, then goes to work."

norm: It's good to grieve after you've lost someone you love.
situation: Jim's father passes away from cancer while Jim watches.
intention: Jim wants to move past the experience.
moral_action: Jim talks with a good friend about the experience, asking him how he can move on.
immoral_action: Jim goes back to work immediately and distracts himself from the experience.

norm: It's good to care about the loss of a parent.
situation: Sally is hanging out with her friend Jessica who started crying over  the death of mother.
intention: Sally wants to make Jessica calm down.
moral_action: Sally hugs Jessica and tells Jessica that it's natural to be sad in this situation.
immoral_action: Sally tells Jessica to calm down because her tears are making Sally uncomfortable.

norm: It's good to take care of sick family members.
situation: Leah is at work when she gets a call from the nurse at her daughter's elementary school.
intention: Leah wants to finish preparing an important presentation.
moral_action: Leah goes and picks up her daughter then finishes her presentation at home.
immoral_action: Leah tells the nurse that her daughter needs to stay at school until she's finished with the presentation she is working on.

norm: It's okay to be concerned about a depressed friend
situation: David notices that his friend has become withdrawn and sullen recently.
intention: David wants to talk to his friend about his depression.
moral_action: David offers to be there for his friend and listen to his problems.
immoral_action: David tells his friend that being depressed is useless, and he needs to cheer up right away, without working through anything.

norm: It's good to call a friend who is feeling down.
situation: Jane knows that her friend Maya has been going through a tough time lately and is feeling depressed.
intention: Jane wants to catch up with one of her girlfriends.
moral_action: Jane calls Maya and does her best to cheer her up and make her feel better.
immoral_action: Jane calls her friend Abby, even though she knows Maya is the one who needs support right now.

norm: It's good to help an ailing family member.
situation: Bob goes to see his sick sister Jill at her house.
intention: Bob wants to talk to Jill.
moral_action: Bob talks to Jill and offers to help her out while she's sick.
immoral_action: Bob talks to Jill quickly and swiftly before leaving just as quickly.

norm: It's good to comfort people who have lost someone.
situation: Chris and Bobby were playing in Chris's tree house when Bobby suddenly bursts into tears, saying how his grandmother died last night.
intention: Chris wants to get Bobby to stop crying.
moral_action: Chris tells Bobby that its ok to be sad and cry, and that he can always come over to play in the tree house when he feels sad.
immoral_action: Chris tells Bobby only girls cry when they are sad and to not be sad because she was old and sick anyway.

norm: It is nice to give company to sick children.
situation: Sam's son hasn't been feeling well because his stomach is bothering him.
intention: Sam wants his son to stay home.
moral_action: Sam calls into work and stays home with his sick son.
immoral_action: Sam goes to work while his son stays home in bed alone.

norm: It's good to be supportive of an injured spouse.
situation: Buchanan is at home with his wife Samantha who is in a wheelchair from an accident.
intention: Buchanan wants to enjoy himself and not be stressed.
moral_action: Buchanan hires additional support for his wife and helps her and does fun things together with her.
immoral_action: Buchanan leaves Samantha at home and goes to a club and meets another woman he has fun with.

norm: It's good to give a traumatized child a loving home.
situation: Mary has been approved to be a foster parent and can foster children when she is ready.
intention: Mary wants to decide if she is ready.
moral_action: Mary thinks of everything the children have probably been through and decides to open up her house and heart to foster children.
immoral_action: Mary worries about the backgrounds of children she would foster and decides she will not accept any of them afterall.

norm: It is good to support family when they are struggling.
situation: John's mother McKenzie is senile and needs to go to a nursing home.
intention: John wants to save his money.
moral_action: John looks for a decent nursing home and asks around for discounts and support from the community.
immoral_action: John finds McKenzie the cheapest nursing home around and puts her there.

norm: It's good to be supportive when someone loses their child.
situation: Anna's employee Jan's son died suddenly yesterday.
intention: Anna wants a large report compiled for a business meeting.
moral_action: Anna assigns Beverly to write the report and gives Jan the week off of work.
immoral_action: Anna assigns Jan to write the report.

norm: It's good to be supportive of your depressed partner.
situation: Tracy's husband James is going through a bout of depression which is tough on the couple.
intention: Tracy wants to respond to James' depression.
moral_action: Tracy tells James that she will be there for him while he is going through depression.
immoral_action: Tracy tells James that she's going to move out while he is going through depression.

norm: It's good to support your partner when they are down.
situation: Ace's wife Tammy has had a hard day at work and arrived at home depressed and lethargic.
intention: Ace wants his wife to be happy again.
moral_action: Ace gives Tammy a hug and sits with her, giving her time to talk out her feelings.
immoral_action: Ace tells Tammy to not let it bother her, saying that whatever it was doesn't matter anyway.

norm: It's good to show concern for a depressed friend.
situation: Bill's friend Jerry has had a lot of trouble sleeping and has been keeping to himself a lot, and Bill meets up with him.
intention: Bill wants Jerry to get better.
moral_action: Bill talks with Jerry and asks him why he has been so down recently, then listens to his explanation.
immoral_action: Bill makes some small talk with Jerry and avoids talking about his issues, thinking that he'll make things worse by exposing them.

norm: It's good to seek professional help when you've been abused.
situation: Mary just got out of an abusive relationship.
intention: Mary wants to try and get over all the horrible things that happened to her in her relationship.
moral_action: Mary goes to a therapist who gives her some advice for coping with problems like the ones she's faced.
immoral_action: Mary starts drinking heavily on a regular basis, making it easier for her forget about her problems.

norm: It's good to show concern for suicidal people.
situation: Dave and Bill are hanging out together when Bill tells Dave that he's in a dark place and has thought about ending his life.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Bill's statement.
moral_action: Dave tells Bill that he won't pretend to understand what Bill feels but that if Bill ever needs him he's there and that he'll help him find professional help.
immoral_action: Dave tells Bill that he should just get over it and get on with his life and that it's stupid to even think the way he does.

norm: It is good to help someone who is feeling sad.
situation: Mary notices Jane crying in the bathroom at work.
intention: Mary wants to find out what is wrong.
moral_action: Mary asks Jane if she is alright after Jane leaves the bathroom.
immoral_action: Mary asks her coworkers what is wrong with Jane.

norm: It's good to provide empathy to people who are struggling.
situation: John is talking with Susan when Susan tells John that she is feeling depressed.
intention: John wants to respond to Susan's statement about depression.
moral_action: John tells Susan that he's sure it's tough and that he's there for her if she needs him.
immoral_action: John tells Susan to just suck it up and cheer up already, that it can't really be that bad.

norm: It's good to be supportive of people with depression.
situation: James' friend has cancelled most of their plans to hang out lately, and recently revealed it's because clinical depression leaves him with no energy.
intention: James wants to spend more time with his friend.
moral_action: James starts dropping by his friend's with a pizza to watch Netflix or just talk.
immoral_action: James keeps pressuring his friend to go to concerts and loud parties.

norm: It's good to help your friend during hard times
situation: Beth just talked to her friend Jen who was laid off her job and asked to borrow money for rent.
intention: Beth wants to make a decision.
moral_action: Beth gives Jen the money she needs and offers to help her find a new job.
immoral_action: Beth tells Jen to pick herself up by the bootstraps and figure it out on her own.

norm: It's good to stand up for people who are suicidal.
situation: Mary's friend, Ken, has become depressed due to the recent breakup with his girlfriend and thinks that life is hopeless.
intention: Mary wants to react to Ken's thought.
moral_action: Mary encourages Ken to meet more new friends to enrich his social life, which will improve his mental health.
immoral_action: Mary tells Ken that she is also not hopeful about life due to her own financial problems.

norm: It's good to be supportive of someone who feels depressed.
situation: Brittney is at home watching a new episode of her favorite television when her friend calls her wanting to talk.
intention: Brittney doesn't want to miss the show she is watching.
moral_action: Brittney supportively listens to her friend talk about her problems while watching her show with subtitles on.
immoral_action: Brittney tells her friend that she is busy and cannot listen to her problems right now.

norm: It's good to help people who are affected by earthquakes.
situation: Frank lives near an earthquake zone when a relative tells him that his house was damaged by a quake.
intention: Frank wants to console the relative.
moral_action: Frank invites the man to stay at his place until he can fix up his own or rent a new place.
immoral_action: Frank tells the relative that quakes happen all the time and that he'll bounce back from it.

norm: It is good to help someone in a bad relationship.
situation: Lana is friends with Jane who is knocking on her door saying she needs to stay the night after she was punched by her boyfriend.
intention: Lana wants to respond to Jane who is at the door.
moral_action: Lana lets Jane in and comforts her while keeping her safe.
immoral_action: Lana tells Jane to come back tomorrow when Lana has time.

norm: It's kind to help people who are having trouble.
situation: Troy is at home when he gets a call from his friend Andrew asking him to borrow some money short term.
intention: Troy wants to answer Andrew's request.
moral_action: Troy tells Andrew that he will take a quick trip to the bank right now and Andrew can come over in the meantime to grab it.
immoral_action: Troy tells Andrew that he can't spare any right now and Andrew should go to a pay day lender.

norm: It is good to support your friends even they're sad
situation: Paul is at a party hosted by James when James begins to cry after reading a sad email.
intention: Paul wants to react to James crying.
moral_action: Paul puts his arm around James and asks him if everything is OK and what happened.
immoral_action: Paul thinks that the party is over since the host is in tears and grabs his jacket to leave.

norm: It's good to help people out when they're physically weak.
situation: Frank works as a cashier at a busy grocery store and is coming off break, and sees an old lady struggling to lift a case of water into her cart.
intention: Frank needs to get to the register he works at.
moral_action: Frank stops and quickly lifts the case into the woman's cart, before continuing on to the register.
immoral_action: Frank ignores the woman and continues up to the register, starting to ring up customers.

norm: It's good to help people when they are depressed.
situation: Jeff approached a friend who recently lost his mother in a car accident and is depressed about it.
intention: Jeff wants to consider talking to his friend.
moral_action: Jeff talks to his friend and does his best to console him.
immoral_action: Jeff decides against talking to his friend and completely ignores him.

norm: It's kind to reach out to someone who's struggling.
situation: Johannes is driving through town when he sees an old woman has fallen on the street.
intention: Johannes wants to get to the party.
moral_action: Johannes stops his car, gets out and helps the old woman up and offers her a ride, then goes to the party.
immoral_action: Johannes honks his horn at the woman to get off the road and speeds off to the party.

norm: It's nice to comfort someone when they're upset.
situation: John's at home with his buddies when his wife Mindy walks in crying.
intention: John wants to go with his buddies to the game.
moral_action: John tells his buddies he'll meet them at the game later and comforts his wife.
immoral_action: John rushes out with his buddies to the game.

norm: It's good to stand up for people that are abused.
situation: Carl sees a man push a woman in an alley while walking to his car.
intention: Carl wants to get to his car.
moral_action: Carl grabs the woman by the hand and puts her into his car and drives her to safety.
immoral_action: Carl keeps walking past the alley to his car as if he doesn't see anything.

norm: It's good to be sensitive to someone's depression and anxiety.
situation: Bob has noticed a negative change in his wife's mood lately.
intention: Bob wants to address his wife's nervous and down-spirited behavior.
moral_action: Bob is supportive and urges his wife to seek professional help.
immoral_action: Bob tells his wife to get over whatever her problem is or their marriage is over.

norm: It's good to pray for people who are in trouble
situation: Stan's mom meets a woman named Cindy at the door who is going through a lot of personal problems.
intention: Stan wants to encourage Cindy.
moral_action: Stan asks Cindy if he can pray with her so that God will help her with her problems.
immoral_action: Stan gives Cindy some encouraging advice on her situation and tells her to cheer up.

norm: Sometimes it's a mercy to put down an ailing creature.
situation: Kacy's dog is very old and can no longer control it's bladder.
intention: Kacy wants to have clean carpet.
moral_action: Kacy brings the dog to the vet who advises her to have the dog put down because of quality of life issues.
immoral_action: Kacy puts the dog in a cage in her basement and checks on it once a day.

norm: It's kind to help a stranger who has been injured.
situation: Tanya is running late to get to work when she comes across a man who has collapsed on the side of the street.
intention: Tanya doesn't want to get in trouble with her boss.
moral_action: Tanya phones her boss to say that she is on her way but needs to stop to help an injured man.
immoral_action: Tanya continues on her way to work and leaves the man on the side of the street.

norm: It is good to care for those who have fallen.
situation: As Tom is driving he sees an old lady fall down on the street beside him.
intention: Tom wants to get to the baseball game.
moral_action: Tom stops his car and helps the old lady up and offers her a ride, then goes to the game.
immoral_action: Tom pretends not to see her and continues on to the game.

norm: It's good to help people that have been abused.
situation: Doug is at home and his wife Janet tells him of her sister who is a battered woman and needs a place to stay.
intention: Doug wants to keep his house quiet.
moral_action: Doug tells Janet her sister can live at their house so long as she keeps it down after eight pm.
immoral_action: Doug tells Janet there's more than enough people living in their house already, and they can't help.

norm: It is caring to help people who are in distress.
situation: Lyle is walking down the street when he sees Karen on the ground bleeding from a probable stab wound.
intention: Lyle wants to express his concern to Karen.
moral_action: Lyle tells Karen that her wound looks awful and that he's calling 911 right away.
immoral_action: Lyle tells Karen that it's terrible that she's bleeding and that she should probably find a hospital or something.

norm: You shouldn't let your child's animal suffer.
situation: Mary's daughter's cat is getting older and often suffers from untreated arthritis pain.
intention: Mary wants to care for her daughter's pet.
moral_action: Mary brings her daughter's cat into see a vet and learns how to care for the animal's arthritis.
immoral_action: Mary feeds the cat some human medication for arthritis rather than see a vet.

norm: You should not get angry with animals for being animals.
situation: Greg has a new puppy that had an accident on the carpet.
intention: Greg wants to have a clean house.
moral_action: Greg realizes that the puppy is just learning, takes the puppy outside, and then cleans up the mess.
immoral_action: Greg yells at the puppy, puts the puppy in the cage, and cleans up the mess while cussing.

norm: You shouldn't be cruel to animals
situation: Tom is walking in the woods with his friends when they come across a deer who has been injured.
intention: Tom wants to impress his friends.
moral_action: Tom calls the police to contact animal control to help the deer.
immoral_action: Tom starts to poke at the deer's wounds, hurting it more, trying to make his friends laugh.

norm: You shouldn't hate your pets.
situation: Jane has adopted a dog from a shelter as her companion but the dog doesn't appear to be active.
intention: Jane wants to react to the dog's behavior.
moral_action: Jane asks the shelter for advice on how to train the dog to be more active.
immoral_action: Jane feels dissatisfied with the dog and decides to return it to the shelter.

norm: You should not abandon pets.
situation: Kevin and his family have a new puppy that is constantly misbehaving and making a mess.
intention: Kevin wants to do something about the puppy.
moral_action: Kevin takes the puppy to a dog trainer to improve its behavior.
immoral_action: Kevin takes the puppy out into the country and leaves it on the side of the road.

norm: You shouldn't ignore an abusive pet owner.
situation: Darren lives next door to Rob who owns a dog, and Darren hears Rob screaming and the dog yelping in pain.
intention: Darren wants to find out what's going on next door.
moral_action: Darren knocks on Robs door and is told everything is fine, and Darren doesn't believe him, so he calls animal control who take the dog from Rob.
immoral_action: Darren knocks on Robs door and is told everything is fine, and Darren doesn't believe him, but still chooses to do nothing.

norm: You shouldn't hurt animals if you love them.
situation: Erin's cat is scratching up a couch that has sentimental value to her.
intention: Erin wants to stop the cat's behavior.
moral_action: Erin squirts her cat with a water gun.
immoral_action: Erin hits her cat in order to strongly deter this behavior.
