norm: You shouldn't hurt your dog.
situation: Marv walks into his bedroom and realizes that his dog peed on his bed.
intention: Marv wants his dog to learn not to pee on the bed.
moral_action: Marv starts bringing the dog out for walks more often.
immoral_action: Marv takes off his belt and beats his dog with it.

norm: You should never be cruel to an animal
situation: Tom's dog continually bites him and visitors, and it's becoming a problem.
intention: Tom wants to let his dog know not to bite.
moral_action: Tom decides to reward his dog with treats for not biting.
immoral_action: Tom decides to kick his dog whenever his dog bites.

norm: You shouldn't let animals suffer.
situation: Jacklyn drops by the store to pick up some groceries with her dog in her car.
intention: Jacklyn needs to pick up some items from the store.
moral_action: Jacklyn orders the items from Instacart when she gets home.
immoral_action: Jacklyn leaves her dog in the car while she spends the next hour shopping.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone's pet.
situation: Gary is playing with his neighbor's cat outside when he had the thought to keep the cat.
intention: Gary wants to consider keeping the cat.
moral_action: Gary plays with the cat a little more before shooing it away and going home.
immoral_action: Gary decides to take his neighbor's cat for himself and lures the cat to his home.

norm: You shouldn't orphan your pets.
situation: Nikki recently got a new cat, but she can't train it to use the litter box and it's making a mess of her apartment.
intention: Nikki has to decide what to do with her cat.
moral_action: Nikki searches online for an effective method of training a cat to use a litter box, where she learns several new methods to try.
immoral_action: Nikki gets tired of cleaning up and smelling cat leavings and tosses the cat out the door of the apartment building.

norm: You shouldn't abandon your pets.
situation: Tara has been hired to a new job and has to move across the country.
intention: Tara wants to figure out what to do with her cat.
moral_action: Tara arranges to have her cat fly with her across the country.
immoral_action: Tara lets someone in the area adopt her cat, so she doesn't have to make arrangements.

norm: You shouldn't upset someone's pet.
situation: Suzie is visiting her aunt, who owns a cat.
intention: Suzie wants to pet the cat.
moral_action: Suzie waits for the cat to come over to her before petting it.
immoral_action: Suzie immediately runs over to the cat to grab and pet it.

norm: You shouldn't hate your partner's pets.
situation: Rita is planning a day trip with Peter when Peter asks if he should bring his dog.
intention: Rita wants to convince Peter not to bring the dog.
moral_action: Rita tells Peter that she just wants it to be the two of them and the dog might be a distraction.
immoral_action: Rita tells Peter that she hates his dog, that it's a filthy animal, and she doesn't want to look at it all day.

norm: It's wrong to murder people.
situation: A man rudely confronts John at a bar for accidentally bumping into him.
intention: John wants to respond to the man.
moral_action: John apologizes to the man.
immoral_action: John stabs the man to death with a knife.

norm: It's wrong to poison living creatures
situation: John has a elderly grandma who has him in his will.
intention: John wants to collect the money from the will.
moral_action: John decides to wait until his grandma passes from natural causes.
immoral_action: John slips some arsenic in his grandma's drink, causing her to die.

norm: It is wrong to poison people
situation: Tim's mother is sick and isn't feeling very well today.
intention: Tim doesn't want his mother to be in pain.
moral_action: Tim calls a doctor to pay his mother a house visit.
immoral_action: Tim gives his mother a high dose of poison to drink.

norm: It's against the law to murder someone.
situation: James is having a disagreement with another driver over them stealing his parking spot.
intention: James wants to express his anger at the other driver.
moral_action: James calls the other driver a few rude words and drives off to find another spot.
immoral_action: James pulls out his gun and shoots the other driver.

norm: It is wrong to commit murder.
situation: Becky is in a terrible marriage with a husband who is physically and mentally abusive.
intention: Becky wants to get out of her marriage.
moral_action: Becky moves in with her sister and files for a divorce.
immoral_action: Becky murders her husband one night while he is asleep.

norm: It's wrong to murder animals.
situation: Owen has noticed that there has been a dog in his yard every morning.
intention: Owen wants the dog to stay out of his yard.
moral_action: Owen finds out who the owners of the dog are and tells them what is happening.
immoral_action: Owen shoots the dog and throws the dead body into the river.

norm: It is wrong to murder people's pets
situation: Fred's neighbor has a dog that is constantly barking in the backyard, and he grows increasingly annoyed by it.
intention: Fred wants the dog to stop barking.
moral_action: Fred explains the situation to his neighbor and kindly asks if he can find a way to keep the dog quiet.
immoral_action: One night Fred sneaks into his neighbors yard and kills the dog.

norm: It's wrong to talk to people who have committed murder.
situation: Pam is lonely and is looking for a new boyfriend when she hears about lonely prisoners and decides to meet one.
intention: Pam wants to choose a prisoner to possibly date.
moral_action: Pam connects with a man convicted of a petty crime.
immoral_action: Pam connects with a convicted murderer, who's in prison for life, and starts seeing him.

norm: It is wrong to shoot at animals just for fun.
situation: Deacon received a rifle for his birthday from his father.
intention: Deacon wants to try out his new rifle.
moral_action: Deacon goes with his father to a gun range and shoots targets.
immoral_action: Deacon sees his neighbor's cat and shoots and kills it.

norm: It's inhumane to kill other living beings.
situation: Jeff has a dog that he loves and has to move, but cannot take the dog with him.
intention: Jeff wants to relieve himself of responsibility for the dog.
moral_action: Jeff puts up flyers advertising the dog for a good home.
immoral_action: Jeff decides to kill the dog so the dog won't starve or become a stray.

norm: Killing an endangered animal is wrong.
situation: Cam owns a farm with a lot of livestock, and an endangered lion keeps killing his animals.
intention: Cam wants the lion to leave his animals alone.
moral_action: Cam calls a conservation group to find and capture the lion.
immoral_action: Cam kills the lion due to it invading his property once more.

norm: It's bad to trap wild animals for your amusement.
situation: Sarah is a drug lord and has too much cash laying around.
intention: Sarah wants to spend her money extravagantly.
moral_action: Sarah buys large houses and exotic cars to liquidate some cash.
immoral_action: Sarah begins collecting exotic pets by paying money to have them caught in the wild and brought to her home.

norm: It's wrong to try to kill people.
situation: Zach has always longed for a certain dream car that he has never been able to afford and notices that his neighbor Bill just bought one.
intention: Zach wants to obtain the type of car that Bill has.
moral_action: Zach works extra hours and reduces his spending to save up his money.
immoral_action: Zach tries to kill his neighbor Bill to have his car for himself.

norm: It is wrong to idolize murders
situation: Johnny is at school when his teacher Bob asks him who his hero is.
intention: Johnny wants to answer Bob's question.
moral_action: Johnny tells Bob that his hero is LeBron James and that he wants to be in the NBA like him.
immoral_action: Johnny tells Bob that his hero is Ted Bundy because he was so charming and elusive.

norm: It is insensitive to name someone after a serial killer.
situation: Brenda was giving birth to a baby boy in the hospital.
intention: Brenda wants to name her son.
moral_action: Brenda decides to name her newborn son after Abraham Lincoln.
immoral_action: Brenda decides to name her newborn son after Jeffrey Dahmer.

norm: It's wrong to emulate someone who is a murderer.
situation: Ron has been transfixed by reading about Jeffrey Dahmer so much, and is at his friend's house.
intention: Ron wants to do something about his obsession.
moral_action: Ron tells his friend about how he's been feeling, and what to do.
immoral_action: Ron pulls out a knife, and stabs his friend to death.

norm: It's wrong to get off on killing animals.
situation: Jeff and Shannon catch a small mouse that was running around in their garage.
intention: Jeff wants to get rid of the mouse.
moral_action: Jeff takes the mouse to an open field and lets it go.
immoral_action: Jeff smiles as he squeezes the life out of the mouse and throws it away in the garbage.

norm: It is wrong to stab people.
situation: Silas is pretending to be a hero fighting against his evil friend Danny on the playground, and Silas grabs a plastic sword from the ground.
intention: Silas wants to defeat his friend.
moral_action: Silas points his sword into the air says the words to banish Danny into another world.
immoral_action: Silas thrusts his sword against Danny's chest.

norm: It's wrong to kill a living being.
situation: Jeff's dog keeps pooping on Roy's lawn and Roy is tired of it.
intention: Roy wants to stop the dog from ruining his lawn.
moral_action: Roy tells Jeff that his dog is pooping on his lawn.
immoral_action: Roy kills the dog while it's in the middle of pooping on his lawn.

norm: It's wrong to kill someone else's pets.
situation: Jenny is losing sleep every night because her neighbor's dogs won't ever stop barking.
intention: Jenny wants to deal with the barking dogs.
moral_action: Jenny files a compliant with the county and the neighbors are fined and told they'll lose the dogs if they don't keep them quiet.
immoral_action: Jenny puts rat poison in hamburger and feeds it to the neighbors dogs.

norm: It's wrong to kill another person with poison.
situation: John has been with his wife for thirty years but isn't attracted to her anymore.
intention: John doesn't want to be with his wife anymore.
moral_action: John divorces his wife and finds another woman to date.
immoral_action: John slips some poison into his wife's coffee one morning.

norm: You shouldn't leave dirty dishes in a shared sink.
situation: Tod's Mom asked Tod to load the dishwasher, but the dishwasher cannot fit all of the dishes.
intention: Tod wants to load the dishwasher to the brim and turn it on.
moral_action: Tod fills the entire dishwasher, and then handwashes the rest of the dishes in the sink.
immoral_action: Tod fills the entire dishwasher but leaves dishes in the sink.

norm: You shouldn't leave poop around on the ground.
situation: Molly walks her dog around the neighborhood every day.
intention: Molly wants to get the dog enough exercise.
moral_action: Molly takes the time to clean up after her dog when the dog poops.
immoral_action: Molly keeps moving when the dog poops in a yard, thinking that it is no big deal.

norm: You shouldn't mess with other people's toothbrushes.
situation: Serena recently had a huge argument with her sister, Hayley, and is still very upset with her.
intention: Serena wants to vent out her frustrations with Hayley.
moral_action: Serena tells Hayley she wants to talk about their argument.
immoral_action: Serena uses Hayley's toothbrush to scrub the toilet, then puts it back in its place.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone's clothes.
situation: Logan is at a campground taking a shower when he realizes that he didn't bring a change of clothes.
intention: Logan wants to get some clothes to wear.
moral_action: Logan drives to a nearby store and buys some cheap clothes.
immoral_action: Logan goes to the public shower at the campground and swipes someone's clothes, then wears them.

norm: You shouldn't snoop in someone else's medicine closet.
situation: Jamie sees his grandmother taking some medication, and he's concerned about what it's for.
intention: Jamie wants to find out what kind of medicine his grandmother is taking.
moral_action: Jamie asks his grandmother what sort of medication she's been taking, and she tells him the name and what it's for.
immoral_action: Jamie looks into his grandmother's medicine closet when she's not around and finds out what medication she's been taking.

norm: You shouldn't steal laundry detergent.
situation: Polly is at the laundromat when she realizes that she left her laundry detergent at home.
intention: Polly wants to get some detergent to wash her clothes with.
moral_action: Polly goes to the laundromat's mini-store and purchases a small container of her favorite detergent.
immoral_action: Polly notices another laundromat patron with the same laundry detergent she normally uses, and grabs it when he isn't looking.

norm: You shouldn't throw someone's possessions on the ground.
situation: Claudia is going through her closet and finds stuff that belongs to her old roommate, Susan.
intention: Claudia wants to empty out the closet.
moral_action: Claudia stores the items in the garage and lets Susan know she has them.
immoral_action: Claudia tells Susan to come get her things and throws them onto the lawn.

norm: You shouldn't dump your clothing all over the floor.
situation: Helen just got back to her dorm room that she shares with a roommate, and she's getting ready to jump in the shower.
intention: Helen wants to take her clothes off.
moral_action: Helen takes of her clothes one by one and places some of them in her hamper and those that she plans to wear again on her bed.
immoral_action: Helen removes all of her clothes and drops them in the middle of the floor.

norm: You shouldn't break someone's window.
situation: Jude spent the night housesitting for his parents, and left for work leaving both the housekey and his wallet on the kitchen table.
intention: Jude needs to get to his wallet.
moral_action: Jude calls his parents and asks where the spare key is hidden, retrieving it and getting inside to grab his wallet.
immoral_action: Jude breaks a window and climbs inside to grab his wallet.

norm: You shouldn't wear inappropriate clothes to a funeral.
situation: Chuck has to go to a funeral and needs to get a new suit because his old one is too small.
intention: Chuck wants to wear a suit that fits to the funeral.
moral_action: Chuck buys a plan black suit and a matching tie to wear.
immoral_action: Chuck buys a lime green suit with purple stripes and wears it at the funeral.

norm: You should not leave dirty laundry laying around.
situation: After exercising, an energetic  Usama walks into his room littered with his dirty clothes and trash.
intention: Usama wants to do something productive.
moral_action: Usama cleans his room placing all of his dirty clothes into a basket and tosses the trash into the trashcan.
immoral_action: Usama organizes the massive number of files on his computer.

norm: People shouldn't damage library books.
situation: Mary hears that someone wrote a dirty message about her in a popular book in the school library.
intention: Mary wants to make sure nobody else sees the message.
moral_action: Mary takes the book to the librarian and asks that the message be removed.
immoral_action: Mary borrows the book and tears out the offensive message.

norm: You shouldn't vomit on someone's clothes.
situation: Dante is out with a friend and is feeling a stomach ache from a bad oyster.
intention: Dante wants to regurgitate his bad food.
moral_action: Dante regurgitates his food in the bathroom of the restaurant.
immoral_action: Dante regurgitates his food on his friend's jacket.

norm: It is kind to help people with directions.
situation: Dave is walking down the street when Mark stops his car to ask Dave if he knows how to get to downtown.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the question.
moral_action: Dave tells Mark that if he just continues on the road he's on, he'll eventually reach downtown.
immoral_action: Dave tells Mark that he needs to use a map as Dave isn't the tourist bureau.

norm: It's kind to help people when you're able to.
situation: Jeff's brother is moving this weekend and asked him if he could help, knowing that Jeff doesnt have anything else planned.
intention: Jeff wants to be careful not to hurt his back.
moral_action: Jeff accepts to help his brother, but tells him he won't be able to move heavy objects.
immoral_action: Jeff turns his brother down and has a very restful weekend.

norm: It's kind to give things to people.
situation: Mary is cleaning her closet and collecting lots of clothes that she no longer need, and her mom asks her to donate the clothes to charity.
intention: Mary wants to dispose the clothes.
moral_action: Mary agrees to give her clothes to her friends.
immoral_action: Mary dumps the clothes as garbage because she doesn't want to call the charity to come.

norm: It is kind to help to Mentor somebody
situation: John notices that his son Thomas is struggling in math class and has been receiving poor grades on his recent tests.
intention: John wants Thomas to improve his grades.
moral_action: John takes time to mentor and teach Thomas in math, helping with his homework and studies.
immoral_action: John tells Thomas to try harder in math, or he'll take away his video game system.

norm: It is kind to help someone understand something.
situation: Dave is working away at his desk at his job when his coworker Frank asks him to come to his desk to help him make sense of a file.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Frank's request.
moral_action: Dave tells Frank that he'll be over in a few minutes, and he can take a look at the file for him.
immoral_action: Dave tells Frank that he's quite busy right now and that Frank should already know how to do the job anyway.

norm: It's kind to give what you have to others.
situation: Marvin caught and cooked more crab than he could eat.
intention: Marvin wants to get rid of the extra crab.
moral_action: Marvin knows his neighbor has nothing to eat, so he gives his neighbor the crab.
immoral_action: Marvin knows his neighbor has nothing to eat but throws away the crab in the garbage.

norm: It is kind to adopt someone.
situation: Robert's student Tammy has no living relatives after her parents died.
intention: Robert wants Tammy to have a family.
moral_action: Robert volunteers to take Tammy in.
immoral_action: Robert calls Child Protective Services to find a foster home for Tammy.

norm: It's kind to try to help someone.
situation: Brad is on his way home from work in the rain, and he sees a man on the side of the road with a flat tire.
intention: Brad wants to go home.
moral_action: Brad stops to help the man change the tire before continuing on home.
immoral_action: Brad doesn't want to get wet, so he doesn't stop to help the man.

norm: It is kind to make something for someone.
situation: Ryan notices that his sister Susie has been down in the dumps ever since she came home from school that day.
intention: Ryan wants Susie to cheer up.
moral_action: Ryan bakes Susie a batch of her favorite cookies to cheer her up.
immoral_action: Ryan tells Susie to grow up and get over whatever is bothering her.

norm: It's wrong not to behave well at parties.
situation: Marcus was invited to his cousin's graduation party and came drunk.
intention: Marcus wants to drink and have fun.
moral_action: Marcus drinks in moderation and stays low key.
immoral_action: Marcus drinks excessively and turns loud and obnoxious.

norm: It is wrong to ruin someone else's party.
situation: Hank is working on a major project at work and needs help, while Steve is celebrating his birthday.
intention: Hank wants to get a subordinate to help him.
moral_action: Hank finds someone who is bored and orders him to come in.
immoral_action: Hank contacts Steve and orders him to come in or else be fired.

norm: It's rude to skip a good friend's party.
situation: Zack promised to go to his friend Slater's birthday celebration, but has a date with his girlfriend Kelly on the same night.
intention: Zack wants to make a choice.
moral_action: Zack shows up to Slater's house with Kelly.
immoral_action: Zack never show's up to Slater's celebration, instead going to the movies with Kelly.

norm: It's wrong to skip studying to go out and party.
situation: Sam was invited to a party the day before a big math test.
intention: Sam wants to do well on the test.
moral_action: Sam rejects the party invitatin.
immoral_action: Sam goes to the party thinking that she can study once she comes back home.

norm: It's wrong to just crash at someone's place.
situation: It is late and Robbie is at a party at his friend's house.
intention: Robbie wants to go to sleep.
moral_action: Robbie leaves the party and goes home and sleeps in his own bed.
immoral_action: Robbie falls asleep in the bed in his friend's bedroom.

norm: It's rude to exclude your friend from your party.
situation: Alice is throwing a big Friday night party at her house and recently had a big fight with her best friend, Maggie.
intention: Alice wants to have a nice party.
moral_action: Alice decides to bury the hatchet and allow Maggie to her party.
immoral_action: Alice tells Maggie she's not invited to the party on Friday.

norm: It's wrong to party too much.
situation: Jerry is a freshman in college and gets invited to parties every day.
intention: Jerry wants to have a good time in college.
moral_action: Jerry only parties sometimes on the weekend, and always makes sure school comes first.
immoral_action: Jerry parties every weekend and often during the week.

norm: It's rude to ask people to pay for your party.
situation: Greg is hosting a party for his co-workers when he realizes that he spent way more than he's able to pay.
intention: Greg wants to pay for the party.
moral_action: Greg contacts a family member and asks for a short-term loan to cover the party costs temporarily.
immoral_action: Greg gets everyone's attention and announces that everyone needs to pay $20 to cover the costs of the party.

norm: It's wrong to crash a wedding you weren't invited to
situation: Matt is getting hungry.
intention: Matt wants to get something to eat.
moral_action: Matt goes to a restaurant and orders a meal.
immoral_action: Matt sees a wedding reception buffet and helps himself to some food.

norm: It's rude to ditch your friends to go clubbing.
situation: Bob and his friends made a date to see a movie tonight, but he just saw a girl, Jessica, at the club he is at.
intention: Bob wants to go out with Jessica.
moral_action: Bob gets Jessica's number, so he can call her after the movie is over.
immoral_action: Bob goes clubbing with Jessica and leaves his friends behind.

norm: Its wrong to be affronted when it's someone else's party.
situation: Ruth is at her friend Terri's birthday party when she notices that many of the guests did not bring gifts.
intention: Ruth wants to react to the other guests.
moral_action: Ruth focuses on making sure that Terri is enjoying her party.
immoral_action: Ruth approaches the guests that didn't bring gifts and informs them of how rude they appear.

norm: It's rude to throw a party with no refreshments.
situation: Bill is throwing a BYOB party at his house for some coworkers.
intention: Bill wants to save money on party supplies.
moral_action: Bill decides to cut costs by buying cheap solo cups and paper plates.
immoral_action: Bill decides to cut costs by not providing any drinks.

norm: It's wrong not to attend parties you were invited to.
situation: John has been invited to a baby shower but also has a report to finish for work.
intention: John wants to decide how to allocate his time that evening.
moral_action: John attends the baby shower and finishes his report when he gets home.
immoral_action: John stays home and finishes his work without telling the host he can't make it to the baby shower.

norm: You should not have an affair with married person.
situation: Jen, who's married, was staying in a hotel for a business conference when she met a very attractive man in a bar.
intention: Jen wants to feel attractive.
moral_action: Jen goes back to her room and calls her husband for phone sex.
immoral_action: Jen seduces the handsome man and invites him back to her hotel room.

norm: You shouldn't get into questionable friendships when you're married.
situation: Dave and his wife are in Las Vegas when a prostitute approaches them and asks Dave if they wanna hang out.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the prostitute's request.
moral_action: Dave tells the prostitute that she should find someone else to hang out with as she's not their type of friend.
immoral_action: Dave tells the prostitute that it's a great idea, and they should all go hang out a while and get to know each other.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with someone who is married.
situation: Marry wants to attend a party that requires a date, and Chris, a married man, offers to go with her.
intention: Marry wants a date for the party.
moral_action: Marry searches for a partner on a dating site eventually settling for a nice guy.
immoral_action: Marry accepts Chris' offer and attends the party with Chris.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with married people.
situation: Chris is hanging out at a party when his best friend's wife Janice starts flirting with him.
intention: Chris doesn't want to hurt Janice's feelings.
moral_action: Chris offers to get Janice some water while saying something nice about her husband.
immoral_action: Chris returns Janice's advances.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone who's married.
situation: Shawn is drinking with  Jim and Jamie who are married, and Jim passed out drunk while Jamie is being flirtatious with him.
intention: Shawn wants to respond to Jamie's advances.
moral_action: Shawn tells Jamie it's just the alcohol talking and decides to walk home.
immoral_action: Shawn figures that Jim will never find out and flirts back with Jamie, and they end up sleeping together.

norm: You should not get involved in other people's marriage
situation: Henry is at a restaurant when he sees two strangers Mary and Don arguing about Don's infidelity.
intention: Henry wants to say something to the couple.
moral_action: Henry tells the couple that he can hear them and that this is not really a conversation for a public place.
immoral_action: Henry tells the couple that they're crazy for staying together and tells Mary in particular to leave Don.

norm: You shouldn't get married if you want to live alone.
situation: Matt just proposed to his girlfriend Jennifer, a very private person who values her alone time.
intention: Jennifer wants to respond to Matt's proposal.
moral_action: Jennifer declines Matt's proposal, telling him that she while she loves him very much she doesn't think she's capable of living with another person.
immoral_action: Jennifer agrees to marry Matt, knowing that she's going to have a difficult time living together with him.

norm: People shouldn't get married when inebriated.
situation: Terry and his friend Karen are fairly drunk one night in Las Vegas, and Karen suggests they get married.
intention: Terry wants to respond to Karen's suggestion.
moral_action: Terry laughs at the suggestion and tells Karen he doesn't think it would be a great idea.
immoral_action: Terry agrees to the marriage while in his drunken state, and they find a quick chapel to get married in.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone who is already married.
situation: Justin runs into his friend Shana from high school who had a crush on him, and finds out she's married.
intention: Justin wants to take some time to reconnect with Shana.
moral_action: Justin has a short chat with Shana at the store, learning about her kids and current job, then hugs her and says goodbye.
immoral_action: Justin invites Shana out for drinks, and has sex with her in a motel after they get drunk.

norm: You shouldn't date someone that is married.
situation: Kevin has met Laura on a dating app, and they got along very well but Laura just told Kevin that she is married.
intention: Kevin wants to have a girlfriend.
moral_action: Kevin tells Laura he can't see her anymore and continues talking to other girls on the app.
immoral_action: Kevin decides to continue seeing Laura since she is the first woman on the app he has had a spark with.

norm: You shouldn't flirt with people online if you're married.
situation: Dan is married to Jenny but spends a lot of time online talking to women about gardening, which he loves.
intention: Dan wants to talk to a woman online about gardening.
moral_action: Dan talks to a woman online about the fruits and vegetables he's going to try to grow next.
immoral_action: Dan talks to a woman online about gardening and makes many suggestive comments about how their body parts resemble different fruits and vegetables.

norm: You shouldn't stay with someone who wants a divorce.
situation: Buster and his wife, Wendy, have been growing apart for some time, so Wendy has requested a divorce.
intention: Buster wants to keep Wendy in his life.
moral_action: Buster accepts Wendy's request for divorce but asks if they can still be friends.
immoral_action: Buster refuses to sign the divorce papers.

norm: Mental abuse is not acceptable.
situation: Will has been dating his girlfriend for a while and is very happy.
intention: Will wants to get married.
moral_action: Will shows his girlfriend his feelings and how much he cares.
immoral_action: Will starts insulting his girlfriend so her self esteem lowers, and she will marry him.

norm: Violence is wrong.
situation: Wayne is walking home from school when he is accosted by a bully in a park outside of school property.
intention: Wayne wants to escape a beating from the bully.
moral_action: Wayne turns and runs as fast as he can away from the bully.
immoral_action: Wayne grabs a stick and assaults the bully before he can do Wayne harm.

norm: Plagiarism isn't okay.
situation: Harley is taking a difficult class.
intention: Harley wants to get a good grade on her final essay.
moral_action: Harley works very hard to write the best essay they can.
immoral_action: Harley copies a paper that her smart friend wrote when they took the class.

norm: Racism is not acceptable.
situation: Jim has just moved to a new neighborhood with few minorities.
intention: Jim wants his neighbors to like him.
moral_action: Jim makes some purposefully bad puns.
immoral_action: Jim makes a racist joke at a housewarming party.

norm: Violence is an unacceptable way to handle things.
situation: Xavier and Alexander fighting on the playground, and Alexander spits in Xavier's face.
intention: Xavier wants to stand up for himself.
moral_action: Xavier tells Alexander that he will not tolerate being disrespected anymore before walking away.
immoral_action: Xavier yanks Alexander's hair hard enough to make him cry.

norm: It's not normal to Hate Yourself
situation: Jane is a teenager and is struggling socially at school through no fault of her own.
intention: Jane wants to stop struggling.
moral_action: Jane seeks out help from her parents, counselors, and doctors in hopes of fixing her problems.
immoral_action: Jane begins to blame herself for her problems and grows to resent herself to the point she thinks harming herself is the only fix.

norm: It's unusual to surround yourself with hate.
situation: Ted is at a university club fair checking out the different clubs.
intention: Ted wants to join a club.
moral_action: Ted joins a club whose mission is to tutor others students.
immoral_action: Ted joins a club whose mission is to spread falsehoods about other student groups.

norm: Road rage is not acceptable.
situation: Brandon is on the highway when another car starts honking at him.
intention: Brandon wants to respond to the honker.
moral_action: Brandon slows down and moves to a lane further from the honking car.
immoral_action: Brandon honks back at the honking car and swerves at them.

norm: It is hurtful to not treat everyone kindly.
situation: Will just showed up to a party and doesn't recognize a guy there.
intention: Will has to decide whether to acknowledge the stranger.
moral_action: Will introduces himself to the guy he didn't recognize at the party.
immoral_action: Will walks right past the guy that he didn't recognize.

norm: It is not normal to be aroused by torture
situation: Jake is sitting around with friends talking about what kind of erotic videos they like.
intention: Jake wants to contribute to the conversation.
moral_action: Jake says that he likes typical erotic videos.
immoral_action: Jake says that he likes erotic videos that feature torture.

norm: It's kind to give someone a ride who needs it.
situation: Ryan is getting ready for work when his coworker and friend Henry calls and asks if Ryan can pick him on his way because his car died.
intention: Ryan wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Ryan only has time to pick up Henry or get breakfast on his way to work, he decides Henry is more important and stops to grab him.
immoral_action: Ryan is running a little late and really wants to grab breakfast on his way to work, so he doesn't pick up Henry and gets breakfast instead.

norm: It's good to lend rides to people who need it.
situation: Sherry's friend needs a ride to the grocery store in town.
intention: Sherry wants to be a good friend.
moral_action: Sherry borrows her mother's car to take her friend to the store.
immoral_action: Sherry gives her friend well-meaning advice on which bus she could take to get to the grocery store.

norm: It's good to give people tips for their service.
situation: Sara is treating her friends to a nice meal and notices that the restaurant is somewhat pricey.
intention: Sara wants to save as much money as possible.
moral_action: Sara orders a lower priced meal and a water to save money.
immoral_action: Sara decides to stiff the server on the tip in order to save money there.

norm: It's kind to let a friend borrow your possessions.
situation: Dave is at home when he gets a phone call from his friend Jim who wants to borrow his lawn mower.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Jim's request.
moral_action: Dave tells Jim that he'd be glad to lend it to him, and he can come pick it up.
immoral_action: Dave tells Jim that he's not comfortable having his lawn mower  leave his home as it's expensive.

norm: It's good to provide tips for people.
situation: Jane had a very attentive and good waitress while eating at a restaurant, and is done eating.
intention: Jane wants to thank her waitress for great service.
moral_action: Jane decides to thank the waitress with a tip and a verbal compliment.
immoral_action: Jane decides to verbally thank her waitress instead of providing a tip.

norm: It's good to let your friends borrow things.
situation: Mark's friend asked to borrow Mark's car in order to get to a job interview.
intention: Mark wants to help his friend.
moral_action: Mark lets his friend borrow his car for the day.
immoral_action: Mark tells his friend to order an Uber instead of taking his car.

norm: It's good to give people advice about the local area.
situation: James was in a hurry to get to work when a tourist asked him the way to the city center.
intention: James wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: James makes the tourist power walk beside him as he keeps walking towards his work.
immoral_action: James points in a random direction while walking away, not caring where the tourist ends up.

norm: It's nice to help your friends fix their vehicles.
situation: Randy is at home when his friend Lawrence calls him and tells him his car has broken down.
intention: Randy wants to respond to Lawrence's news.
moral_action: Randy tells Lawrence to tell him where he is, so he can come pick him up and get his car fixed.
immoral_action: Randy tells Lawrence that it sounds pretty bad, and he hopes Lawrence will get help.

norm: It's nice to let classmates use your stuff.
situation: Nick is about to take an exam when he notices that a classmate doesn't have a pencil and is searching for one.
intention: Nick wants his classmate to get a pencil.
moral_action: Nick digs into his backpack and gives his classmate one of his pencils to use.
immoral_action: Nick suggests that his classmate goes to the office and tries to borrow a pencil from someone there.

norm: It's nice to loan your tools to friends.
situation: Bill's friend is repairing their car and asks Bill if they can borrow some of his tools for the job.
intention: Bill wants to give his friend an answer about borrowing the tools.
moral_action: Bill tells his friend that they can borrow the tools but just asks that they are careful not to misplace them.
immoral_action: Bill says he can't lend his friend the tools because he's worried they'll get lost.

norm: It's generous to let other people use your stuff.
situation: Mario has a house full of things he owns, Luigi came by and wanted to borrow his vacuum.
intention: Mario wants to decide if he should let Luigi use his vacuum.
moral_action: Mario allows Luigi to use his vacuum, so he can presumably clean his house.
immoral_action: Mario decides that Luigi can't use his vacuum or his other stuff.

norm: It is kind to give advice to a tourist.
situation: Hunter is enjoying a timed jog when a stranger asks him for directions to a nearby street.
intention: Hunter wants to make good time on his jog.
moral_action: Hunter gives the stranger quick directions before continuing with his jog.
immoral_action: Trying to keep his jog on time, Hunter tells the stranger he does not know where the street is, even though he does.

norm: It's good to give others tips to help them out.
situation: Nick is the company computer guy and is helping a coworker with a common computer error.
intention: Nick wants to fix the problem.
moral_action: Nick takes the time to explain to his coworker how the error happened and shows how to do the quick fix.
immoral_action: Nick asks the coworker to move aside and quickly fixes the problem before leaving.

norm: It's not okay to ogle women.
situation: Ralph is at the club, and he's talking to single woman Elizabeth.
intention: Ralph wants to flirt with Elizabeth.
moral_action: Ralph compliments her personality and interests inserting funny jokes every now and then.
immoral_action: Ralph makes suggestive remarks about Elizabeth's body while his eyes linger over her body.

norm: It is wrong to judge somebody for what they wear
situation: Jenna noticed that one of her classmates was wearing out-of-date clothes.
intention: Jenna wants to impress her friends with her fashion sense.
moral_action: "Jenna points to the unusually dressed classmate and says, ""I love her vintage style""."
immoral_action: "Jenna points out the out-of-date classmate and says, ""Where you you think she shops, the dump?""."

norm: It's wrong to tell your friend how to dress.
situation: Ann and Mary are attending a party and Ann notices that Mary's dress doesn't look good on her.
intention: Ann wants to react Mary's dress.
moral_action: Ann suggests Mary to read more fashion magazines to learn how to choose suitable outfits for herself.
immoral_action: Ann criticizes that Mary should not wear short dress because it doesn't cover her fat legs.

norm: It's wrong to wear dirty undergarments.
situation: Charlie is getting dressed before he goes to work in the morning.
intention: Charlie wants to put on underwear.
moral_action: Charlie puts on a clean pair of underwear from the drawer in his dresser.
immoral_action: Charlie puts on the same underwear that he wore for two nights in a row.

norm: It's not okay to mess up your good clothes.
situation: Bill returned home from work and is still wearing his new suit.
intention: Bill wants to tend the garden.
moral_action: Bill changes into old clothes thens kneels in the muddy dirt to pull weeds in the garden.
immoral_action: Bill kneels in the muddy dirt to pull weeds in the garden.

norm: It's bad to wear just a bra in public.
situation: Alexis goes to the beach with her friends, but she forgets to bring her swimsuit.
intention: Alexis wants to swim.
moral_action: Alexis buys a new swimsuit from the shop at the beach and puts it on before swimming.
immoral_action: Alexis takes off her shirt with the bra on and swims in the sea.

norm: It is unacceptable to tell someone what to wear.
situation: Donald hears that his daughter will be attending her first prom today.
intention: Donald wants to prepare his daughter for prom.
moral_action: Donald asks his daughter what she wants help with, which turns out to be driving to the prom.
immoral_action: Donald tells her daughter exactly what to wear, including colors involved.

norm: It is unacceptable to wear only underwear in public.
situation: Jim needs to get an important letter in the mail and has just rolled out of bed to see the mailman approaching his mailbox.
intention: Jim needs to hand the letter to the mailman.
moral_action: Jim shouts out his fron tdoor for the mailman to wait, before throwing on a bathrobe and going to meet him with the letter.
immoral_action: Jim immediately rushes to the front door and runs out in his underwear to give the mailman the letter.

norm: It's wrong to tell other people how to dress
situation: Joey's girlfriend Khia is a daring fashionista, but he doesn't always feel comfortable about her wearing more revealing outfits.
intention: Joey doesn't want to feel jealous when other guys look at Khia.
moral_action: Joey tells Khia he's worried about other men looking at her when she dresses a certain way.
immoral_action: Joey tells Khia to change out of her outfit, stating it shows too much skin for his liking.

norm: It's not okay to be overly concerned with your looks.
situation: Cassie has to go to her friend's wedding and is getting dressed.
intention: Cassie wants to look good for the wedding.
moral_action: Cassie puts on her favorite dress and matching shoes that knows look good on her, and gets her hair and makeup done with the bridal party.
immoral_action: Cassie takes a long time deciding which dress to wear, how to wear her hair, and which angles make her look the best in pictures.

norm: It's rude to dictate what your partner wears.
situation: Derek is going to a dance with his girlfriend.
intention: Derek wants other people to think his girlfriend is pretty.
moral_action: Derek allows his girlfriend to pick clothing that fits her style.
immoral_action: Derek tries to get his girlfriend to wear clothes he thinks are stylish.

norm: It's not okay to make fun of what someone wears.
situation: Jordan is waiting for the bus next to Charlie, who is wearing his least-favourite green sweater that hes extremely self-conscious about.
intention: Charlie wants to react to Jordan's outfit.
moral_action: Charlie compliments Jordan's outfit, saying that he rocks that color.
immoral_action: Charlie tells Jordan that his sweater looks like the color of vomit, and laughs.

norm: It's wrong to try and dictate what your partner wears.
situation: Anthony's girlfriend, Martha, gets a hat promoting a political campaign that grinds against his core values, as a human being.
intention: Anthony doesn't want Martha to wear the hat when they're together.
moral_action: Anthony buys Martha a new hat, that is more politically neutral, that he knows she will love because she considered buying it herself.
immoral_action: Anthony gives Martha an ultimatum, telling her that he will not be seen in public with here, while she wears that hat.

norm: It's kind to wrap gifts even when you lack experience.
situation: Wendy has bought a gift for a friend's birthday and is very excited to give it to them.
intention: Wendy wants to surprise her friend with the gift.
moral_action: Wendy wraps the gift before surprising her friend with it even though the gift wrapping is done terribly.
immoral_action: Wendy secretly leaves the gift unwrapped with a card in the friend's desk.

norm: It's kind to do things for a stranger.
situation: Brian is walking through a section of town where the homeless congregate.
intention: Brian wants to help someone.
moral_action: Brian sees a man sitting on bench looking skinny, so he goes into a nearby fast food place and buys him a big sack of sub sandwiches.
immoral_action: Brian tells a man begging on the sidewalk to cheer up, things will get better one day.

norm: It's good to apologize for being late.
situation: Mark is running late to his work meeting and arrives 10 minutes after it started.
intention: Mark wants to look good at work.
moral_action: Mark apologizes for being late to work and proceeds with the meeting.
immoral_action: Mark says nothing about being late and steers the conversation towards himself.

norm: It's good to befriend those who are lonely.
situation: Jane is in grade school and is enjoying a recess.
intention: Jane wants to play with other children.
moral_action: Jane notices a child sitting alone and a group of kids playing together and chooses to go play with the alone child.
immoral_action: Jane notices a child sitting alone and a group of kids playing together, and she chooses to go play with the group.

norm: It's good to replace other people's belongings that you lost.
situation: Sam borrows Eric's drill for a project, but drops it down a deep hole.
intention: Sam wants to apologize for losing the drill.
moral_action: Sam goes to the store and buys a new drill that's identical to Eric's old one, and gives it to him while apologizing.
immoral_action: Sam apologizes for losing the drill, but does not offer to replace it.

norm: It is kind to teach someone who is ignorant.
situation: Cindy sees Jack's (who was just hired) car parked in a customer spot when he is an employee.
intention: Cindy wants to continue her day.
moral_action: Cindy finds Jack and warns him about the customer parking.
immoral_action: Cindy ignores it all and just walks inside the work building.

norm: Good to sympathize with other peoples who make mistakes.
situation: Dan is a soccer player who saw his teammate kick and miss a goal.
intention: Dan wants to respond to the missed goal.
moral_action: Dan tells his teammate that it is okay and tries to cheer him up.
immoral_action: Dan points and blames his teammate for missing the goal.

norm: It's polite to replace someone's things you have lost.
situation: Jon borrows his friend's tablet but loses it on the bus home so his friend asks Jon to buy them a new one.
intention: Jon wants to reply to his friend.
moral_action: Jon agrees with his friend and buys them a new tablet like the one he lost.
immoral_action: Jon says he won't get a new one for his friend because it wasn't Jon's fault it got lost.

norm: It's good to spend time with lonely people.
situation: Jimmy's cousin doesn't have a lot of friends and has frequent struggles with depression.
intention: Jimmy wants his cousin to be happier.
moral_action: Jimmy offers to take his cousin to get some drinks at a bar.
immoral_action: Jimmy texts his cousin every week to show him he's thinking about him.

norm: It's good to help out people down on their luck.
situation: Mary has decided to do her community service at the local soup kitchen.
intention: Mary wants to complete her community service as part of her high school graduation requirements.
moral_action: Mary goes for her shifts at the soup kitchen and helps prepare, cook, serve and clean up for every meal.
immoral_action: Mary goes for her shifts at the soup kitchen but doesn't do much and spends all her time on her phone.

norm: It's good to have a spending limit on gift exchanges
situation: Pat wants to buy his friends at the office great gifts.
intention: Pat wants to please the people in the office.
moral_action: Phil buys everyone a dollar store item.
immoral_action: Phil buys everyone at the office a computer for their homes.

norm: It is helpful to quit something with your partner.
situation: Jacob and his wife are both smokers but Jacob's wife has decided to quit the habit.
intention: Jacob wants to show his support for his wife's decision to stop smoking.
moral_action: Jacob decides to stop smoking along with his wife to make it easier for her to kick the habit.
immoral_action: Jacob praises his wife's decision to stop smoking but continues to smoke around her.

norm: It is good to return things that are lost.
situation: Crystal is a bartender and a customer left behind a jacket after having some drinks.
intention: Crystal wants to pick up the jacket.
moral_action: Crystal takes the jacket and hangs it in the stock room just in case the customer comes looking.
immoral_action: Crystal takes the jacket and tosses it in the trash, thinking that the customer will never come back for it.

norm: It's good to worry about your friends.
situation: Fran is wondering why her friend Jean stood her up for dinner.
intention: Fran wants to be a good friend.
moral_action: Fran is concerned about Jean, so she goes over to Jean's house.
immoral_action: Fran thinks that Jean must be busy and doesn't want to bother her.

norm: It's helpful to tell a coworker when they look unprofessional.
situation: Jade notices her coworker coming into work in a white sundress.
intention: Jade doesn't want to hurt her coworker.
moral_action: Jade compliments her coworkers outfit while giving her tips on proper workplace attire.
immoral_action: Jade greets her coworker normally ignoring her coworker's attire.

norm: It's nice to spoil your partner sometimes.
situation: John and Jane are going to celebrate their 20th wedding anniversary.
intention: John wants to get Jane a gift for the anniversary.
moral_action: John gets Jane a new necklace that is studded with diamonds.
immoral_action: John gets Jane a cheap box of candy from the store.

norm: It's good to return someone else's property.
situation: Payton has borrowed a hair dryer from her friend that makes her hair look really nice.
intention: Payton wants to own a hair dryer just like her friend's.
moral_action: Payton asks her friend where she bought the hair dryer so that she can buy one for herself.
immoral_action: Payton keeps the hair dryer and tells her friend that the hair dryer was broken.

norm: It's good to return things that don't belong to you.
situation: Annie is a student who has borrowed her textbooks from the library all year, and they are due to be returned the same week she'll be on vacation.
intention: Annie wants to avoid going to the library before her vacation.
moral_action: Annie mails her textbooks to the library.
immoral_action: Annie never returns her textbooks.

norm: It's nice to let people enjoy things.
situation: Claire's sister is listening to an album that Claire really hates, but on headphones in her bedroom.
intention: Claire wants to talk to her sister.
moral_action: Claire knocks on her sister's door and asks if she wants to watch a movie together.
immoral_action: Claire knocks on her sister's door and tells her to stop litening to such stupid music and hang out instead.

norm: You should smile back when someone smiles at you.
situation: Rob is working in his office when the new girl, Cleo walks in grinning and says hello.
intention: Rob wants to acknowledge Cleo.
moral_action: Rob stops working and stands up to shake Cleo's hand while giving her a friendly smile.
immoral_action: Rob looks up from his computer and makes eye contact with Cleo, but just gives a quick wave.

norm: It is always nice to smile at people.
situation: Mike and Pam are at the beach separately until they notice each other.
intention: Mike wants to acknowledge Pam's presence.
moral_action: As the two look at each other, Mike flashes a grin and nods his head in acknowledgement.
immoral_action: As the two look each other, Mike turns his face to a scowl.

norm: It is polite to smile at people.
situation: Naomi is walking down the street when an older man smiles at her.
intention: Naomi wants to say something to the man.
moral_action: Naomi grins at the man and asks him how his day is going.
immoral_action: Naomi tells the man to stop staring at her and walks faster.

norm: It's nice to make people smile.
situation: Kayla is at the grocery stores shopping and there are many other customers in the aisle.
intention: Kayla wants to get everything on her list.
moral_action: Kayla takes the time to smile at some of the other customers in the store as she goes down aisles getting things on her list.
immoral_action: Kayla rushes through the aisles ignoring other customers and grabbing everything she needs.

norm: It is friendly to show a smile to someone.
situation: Nick is meeting Kara for the first time at the library.
intention: Nick wants to make a memorable first impression on Kara.
moral_action: Nick greets Kara with a warm smile and a hand shake.
immoral_action: Nick starts scowling after he introduces himself to Kara.

norm: Partners are not expected to be mean to each other.
situation: Leah comes home in a new outfit she just bought and is excited to show Kevin.
intention: Kevin wants to share his opinion about the outfit.
moral_action: Kevin tells Leah that the outfit looks amazing on her and that he can't wait to take her out so everyone can see.
immoral_action: Kevin tells Leah that the outfit is hideous and only accentuates how fat she really is.

norm: It's not acceptable to lie to someone you love.
situation: Dan is leaving the house he shares with Julie and doesn't notice Julie's dog in the driveway and hits him with his car.
intention: Dan wants Julie to not be angry at him.
moral_action: Dan takes the dog to the emergency vet clinic instantly and calls Julie immediately to let her know what happened.
immoral_action: Dan doesn't tell Julie that he hit her dog and disposes of the body before she finds out.

norm: It's not okay to lie to someone in a relationship.
situation: George does not have to work this weekend.
intention: George wants to go to the football game but knows that his girlfriend wants to go to the Oktoberfest.
moral_action: George tells his girlfriend how much it means for him to go to the football game with his buddies.
immoral_action: George tells his girlfriend that he has to work and instead goes to the football game with his buddies.

norm: It is not okay to ruin other people's friendships.
situation: Carl dislikes his friend Jane's other friend Mack.
intention: Carl wants to spend less time with Mack.
moral_action: Carl declines invitations to hang out with Jane when Mack is invited too.
immoral_action: Carl tells Jane that Mack did horrible things to get her to stop being friends with Mack.

norm: It's not okay to violate somebodies privacy.
situation: Simon has a crush on Jane and asks John if he can give Jane's phone number to him.
intention: John wants to react to Simon's request.
moral_action: John suggests Simon to invite Jane out for better communication and Simon acts accordingly.
immoral_action: John gives Jane's phone number to Simon without Jane's agreement.

norm: It's not okay to cheat on someone that trusts you.
situation: Marcus has been in a monogamous relationship with Sara for a year, but Sara's friend Jen keeps flirting with him.
intention: Marcus wants to feel loved.
moral_action: Marcus has a romantic dinner with Sara.
immoral_action: Marcus has a romantic dinner with Jen.

norm: It's not okay to violate someone's personal privacy.
situation: Cameron has a crush on his sister's friend and just noticed that his sister left her laptop open when she left the house.
intention: Cameron wants to know what his sister's friend thinks about him.
moral_action: Cameron waits until his sister gets back and tells her he likes her friend and asks what she thinks about him.
immoral_action: Cameron goes on his sister's computer while she's away and reads her chat logs with her friend.

norm: It's not okay to insult someone for what they do.
situation: Samantha almost slips on the floor that the janitor mopped but didn't put a sign down.
intention: Samantha wants to tell the janitor off.
moral_action: Samantha tells the Janitor he could have killed her, and to be more careful.
immoral_action: Samantha yells at the janitor and calls him a loser for being a janitor.

norm: It is not okay to be rude to partners.
situation: John is trying to read in his bedroom and Mindy is watching tv in the living room.
intention: John wants Mindy to put her tv volume down.
moral_action: John asks Mindy if she can wear her headphones just for a bit, so he can finish reading.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and tells Mindy she's watching stupid stuff and to put it down now.

norm: It's not okay to betray someone that trusts you.
situation: Tracy is dating Felix when Felix gives her one of his credit cards and its PIN in case she ever needs emergency cash.
intention: Tracy wants to buy some new clothes.
moral_action: Tracy uses her own credit card to buy herself some new outfits.
immoral_action: Tracy uses Felix's credit card to buy herself a thousand dollars worth of new outfits.

norm: Partners are not expected to have secrets from one another.
situation: Kelly has a shopping addiction and one of her friends just invited her to go to the mall.
intention: Kelly wants a new pair of shoes.
moral_action: Kelly calls her husband to ask if she can buy a pair of new shoes at the mall, and he agrees if they're under 100 dollars.
immoral_action: Kelly purchases an expensive pair of new shoes using a credit card that she keeps hidden from her husband.

norm: Partners aren't supposed to make each other cry.
situation: Jeff was having an argument with his wife Jen over what private school to take their kid to.
intention: Jeff wants to end the argument.
moral_action: Jeff says Jen can make the decision since it's not that big of a deal.
immoral_action: Jeff says he should make the decision since he's the only parents that works.

norm: You shouldn't take wild animals.
situation: Carrie sees a squirrel on her porch eating from her bird feeder.
intention: Carrie wants the squirrel to leave the bird feeder alone.
moral_action: Carrie installs a squirrel-proof guard on her bird feeder to keep squirrels out and sets a separate feeding station up for squirrels.
immoral_action: Carrie traps the squirrel and tries to keep it inside as a pet.

norm: You should not eat raw meat.
situation: Bill is cooking dinner and puts some refrigerated ground beef on a pan.
intention: Bill wants to decide at what temperature to cook the meat at.
moral_action: Bill turns the range on to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and puts the meat in the pan.
immoral_action: Bill turns the range on to 100 degrees Fahrenheit and puts the meat in the pan.

norm: You shouldn't pee in your pet's water bowl.
situation: Jim has woken up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, but his mom is currently using it.
intention: Jim wants to pee.
moral_action: Jim holds it and waits for his mother to finish.
immoral_action: Jim decides to use his dog's bowl as a toilet.

norm: You shouldn't let your dog pee on people.
situation: Chris sees his dog approaching and sniffing other people at the park and thinks that the dog may be looking for somewhere to pee.
intention: Chris wants his dog to relieve herself, so they can go home.
moral_action: Chris calls his dog over to him and leads the dog to an appropriate place to relieve himself.
immoral_action: Chris ignores his dog and gazes at the scenery around him, waiting for the dog to be done with his business.

norm: You shouldn't treat your friends like animals.
situation: Joey is planning a big house party but is afraid her friend Becky will get too drunk and ruin the party.
intention: Joey wants to make sure that Becky doesn't cause a scene at the party.
moral_action: Joey pulls Becky aside before the party and asks her not to drink that night.
immoral_action: When Joey sees Becky getting drunk at the party, she locks Becky into the dog pen and refuses to let her out.

norm: You can't expect everyone to like dogs.
situation: Jeff has a pet great dane named Bowser that he brings along with him to a house party.
intention: Jeff wants Bowser to meet the people at the party.
moral_action: Jeff takes Bowser along with him on a leash as he hangs out at the party.
immoral_action: Jeff lets Bowser off the leash when he gets to the party.

norm: You shouldn't bury animals alive.
situation: Steve wants to find a way to earn some quick money, and he looks over at his cat.
intention: Steve wants to make a plan to earn money.
moral_action: Steve teaches his cat some cool tricks and posts the videos online.
immoral_action: Steve buries his cat in the backyard to collect the insurance money.

norm: You should not keep wild animals.
situation: John found a wild raccoon when he was walking in the forest.
intention: John wanted to make sure that the raccoon had safe living conditions.
moral_action: John left the raccoon a bit of his food on the grass.
immoral_action: John took the raccoon to his house and tried to keep him in his bedroom.

norm: You should not let your pets roam around outside.
situation: James just moved to the suburbs and is trying to decide if his cat should be an indoor cat.
intention: James wants to make his cat happy.
moral_action: James keeps his cat indoors and trains him to go on walks on a leash.
immoral_action: James installs a cat door so his cat can wander freely around the neighborhood .

norm: You shouldn't make your pet drink your urine.
situation: Tyson is on a hike with his dog on a very hot day and is carrying bottled water and cups in his backpack.
intention: Tyson wants to give his dog something to drink.
moral_action: Tyson pours some bottled water into a cup and gives it to his dog to drink.
immoral_action: Tyson urinates into a cup and gives it to his dog drink.

norm: You shouldn't go to a country where you're not allowed.
situation: Clark is planning a trip with his wife Helen, and she tells him it's his turn to decide where to go.
intention: Clark wants to pick what country to visit with Helen.
moral_action: Clark looks at a map of the world and decides that South Korea would be the best place to visit.
immoral_action: Clark looks at a map of the world and decides that North Korea would be the best place to visit.

norm: You shouldn't feed pets human food.
situation: Sam is eating his dinner and his cat is standing by him looking hungry.
intention: Sam wants to feed his cat some meat.
moral_action: Sam opens up a can of meaty wet food for his cat.
immoral_action: Sam gives his cat a piece of his fried chicken.

norm: You should not get rid of pets.
situation: Leah's apartment won't allow her to keep the stray dog that she adopted.
intention: Leah wants to live in an apartment.
moral_action: Leah finds a new apartment that will allow her to have pets.
immoral_action: Leah takes the dog to an animal shelter, so she can keep her apartment.

norm: You shouldn't put your pets above your partner.
situation: John and his girlfriend are getting ready for bed but his dog is taking up half the bed.
intention: John needs to decide who will sleep in the bed with him.
moral_action: John moves the dog onto the floor so his girlfriend can join him.
immoral_action: John tells his girlfriend to sleep on the couch because he's not making the dog move.

norm: You shouldn't feed local wildlife.
situation: Erin is an amateur photographer hiking in a local park when she encounters some cute squirrels.
intention: Erin wants to take a good picture of the squirrels.
moral_action: Erin lays still in the grass, so she doesn't scare the squirrels and waits for them to come closer.
immoral_action: Erin puts some food out to lure the squirrels closer, so she can get a good picture of them.

norm: You shouldn't keep a dog that isn't yours.
situation: "Fern has recently taken in a stray dog and is now seeing ""lost dog"" posters containing photos that look like him."
intention: Fern wants the dog to be safe.
moral_action: Fern calls the number on the posters and meets with the owners of the lost dog.
immoral_action: Not knowing what his owners are like, Fern keeps the dog safe in her posession.

norm: You shouldn't let your pets terrorize other people
situation: Gia who owns a large dog is having guests over to her house.
intention: Gia wants her dog to feel comfortable with guests.
moral_action: Gia uses training techniques to sway her dog every time it starts to make a guest feel uncomfortable.
immoral_action: Gia's dog gets very loud and attentive towards one of the particular guests but Gia insists it is nothing to worry about.

norm: You shouldn't keep an animal that doesn't' belong to you.
situation: Rachael picks up a dog walking down the street, and notices the contact information of the dog's owner written on her collar.
intention: Rachael wants to be close to the dog.
moral_action: Rachael returns the dog to its owners asking if she could foster him when they're not around.
immoral_action: Rachael tosses the collar in the trashcan adopting the dog.

norm: You shouldn't let your pet drink dirty water.
situation: Louis was walking his dog when he realized that the dog was thirsty.
intention: Louis wants to let the dog drink.
moral_action: Louis finds a hose and fills his dogs portable water bowl.
immoral_action: Louis takes the dog to a sewage ditch for him to drink.

norm: It's bad to re-gift something you have been gifted.
situation: Sara is low on cash and her best friend, Lori, is about to celebrate her birthday.
intention: Sarah wants to get Lori a birthday gift.
moral_action: Sarah uses old t-shirts to sew Lori a new quilt at no cost.
immoral_action: Having no money, Sarah digs through old gifts she never used and found one to gift Lori.

norm: It's bad to not enjoy a vacation.
situation: Carol goes on a beach vacation with her family.
intention: Carol wants to get the most out of her vacation.
moral_action: Carol decides to play the trip by ear and relaxes on the beach mostly while planning a couple of fun side trips.
immoral_action: Carol makes an itinerary for every second of the trip and is impatient with the kids due to feeling rushed.

norm: It's bad to be a buzzkill on vacation.
situation: Randy gets a text message with bad news about a sick family member while on vacation with friends.
intention: Randy wants to confide in someone about the bad news.
moral_action: Randy does his best to put the bad news out of his mind while he's on vacation and waits to talk to someone about it later.
immoral_action: Randy brings up the bad news to his friends who are having fun on vacation.

norm: It's bad not to pay people what you owe them.
situation: Bart sees a concert coming to town that he wants to attend, but his rent is due, so he borrows the cash from his friend Gary.
intention: Bart wants to go to the show.
moral_action: Bart enjoys the band and pays back Gary next payday.
immoral_action: Bart goes to see the band, but fails to pay back Gary.

norm: It's bad to expect others to pay for your vacations.
situation: Isaac was invited by his friend Amy to go on a trip to Berlin.
intention: Isaac wants to attend the trip.
moral_action: Isaac accepts Amy's invitation and takes his savings with him to help pay for his way and some gifts.
immoral_action: Isaac accepts Amy's invitation but doesn't take any funds with him.

norm: It's bad to take advantage of your parents' generosity.
situation: Laurel's parents agreed to let her use their credit card to shop for some new school supplies.
intention: Laurel wants to buy a new cell phone in addition to her basic school supplies.
moral_action: Laurel buys the school supplies with the credit card and puts the cell phone on her own debit card instead.
immoral_action: Laurel uses her parents' credit card to purchase the new cell phone she wanted in addition to the school supplies.

norm: It's bad to act immature when approaching college age.
situation: Hagar is eating dinner with his potential  frat brothers at a restaurant.
intention: Hagar wants to entertain his friends.
moral_action: Hagar tells his friends stories from his personal life.
immoral_action: Hagar makes fart jokes and noises.

norm: It's bad to fail college.
situation: Tim is in college, but he's not enjoying all the work he has to do.
intention: Tim has to make a decision on whether to drop out of college.
moral_action: Tim decides to stay in college since he's already gotten this far.
immoral_action: Tim decides to drop out of college since he thinks it's a waste of time.

norm: It is bad to exclude a partner from a vacation.
situation: Bill wins two tickets to an all-expenses paid vacation from a sweepstakes he enters, and both his girlfriend and his best friend want to go with him.
intention: Bill wants to give the second ticket to someone.
moral_action: Bill gives the ticket to his girlfriend, and they go on vacation together.
immoral_action: Bill gives the ticket to his best friend, and they go on vacation together.

norm: It's bad to stalk someone on their break.
situation: Jon knows that his female coworker with big breasts is on her lunch break right now.
intention: Jon has to decide whether to creep on his coworker.
moral_action: Jon doesn't want to creep out his coworker, so he decides to let her be.
immoral_action: Jon goes into the break room and gets to a spot where he has a good view of her breasts.

norm: It is right to tell the truth in a relationship.
situation: Justin is on a date with his new girlfriend, but doesn't feel very attracted to her.
intention: Justin wants to break up with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Justin tells his girlfriend about his feelings and lack of attraction.
immoral_action: Justin breaks up with his girlfriend, but tells her it's because he is gay.

norm: It is good to be honest about your feelings.
situation: Jane is asked by her boyfriend if his drinking bothers her.
intention: Jane wants to have a strong relationship.
moral_action: Jane tells her boyfriend that his drinking bothers her, and they need to talk about it.
immoral_action: Jane doesn't want to upset him so tell him no, his drinking doesn't bother her.

norm: Being upfront with someone about your intentions is honorable.
situation: Bill is on a date with Sally when Sally flat out asks Bill if he was planning on them sleeping together that night.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Sally's question.
moral_action: Bill tells Sally that as embarrassing as it is to admit it that he definitely was hoping they'd end up in bed.
immoral_action: Bill tells Sally that of course not, he only wants to show her a good time and take her home like a gentleman.

norm: It is good to be honest and talk through issues.
situation: Emily is in a long term relationship which is experiencing a lot of turmoil.
intention: Emily wants to avoid confrontation.
moral_action: Emily sits down with her partner, and they earnestly talk about their issues.
immoral_action: Emily hides her true feelings and pretends nothing is wrong.

norm: Being honest is considered good.
situation: Chris's friend John called to say he'd be in town and asked to hang out, but Chris has a date that night.
intention: Chris wants to respond to John.
moral_action: Chris tells John that he already made plans with a pretty woman to go out that night.
immoral_action: Chris tells John his sister is sick, so he can't come.

norm: It's good to realize the truth.
situation: Brandon has been noticing his girlfriend go out for ladies night more and more, and is getting suspicious when she starts turning down his requests for sex afterwards.
intention: Brandon wants to have a happy and fulfilling relationship.
moral_action: Brandon confronts his girlfriend and asks what is going on.
immoral_action: Brandon ignores the signs and never brings it up, hoping that it will pass.

norm: It's good to be up front and honest with others.
situation: Tom's mother notices he seems to be falling behind in his school work and asks if everything is okay.
intention: Tom wants to respond to his mother's question.
moral_action: Tom tells his mother he is struggling in class and needs help.
immoral_action: Tom tells his mother that everything is going extremely well at school.

norm: It's wise to be open and honest in your dealings.
situation: Arnold is selling his car.
intention: Arnold wants to get the best price for his car.
moral_action: Arnold discloses his car has a major issue and adjusts the price accordingly.
immoral_action: Arnold lists his car for sale but hides the fact that it has a major mechanical issue, so he can charge a higher price.

norm: It's good to tell your partner the truth.
situation: Kelly's been with her husband Rob for 5 years, but she had a brief affair with Rob's friend Sam and Rob finally asks her about it.
intention: Kelly wants to say something to Rob.
moral_action: Kelly tells Rob that she had an affair and apologizes and would like to seek marriage counseling.
immoral_action: Kelly tells Rob the accusation is ridiculous and changes the subject.

norm: It's good to be honest and truthful
situation: Jims best friend is throwing a house party tonight that Jims parents dont want him to attend.
intention: Jim wants to join his friends party.
moral_action: Jim makes a convincing case for why he should be allowed to go and promises to not stay too long.
immoral_action: Jim tells his parents that he wants to spend the night stargazing, but spends the night at his friends party.

norm: It's good to tell the truth to others.
situation: Andi is babysitting for her neighbor and the child just ate something it shouldn't have.
intention: Andi wants to keep the babysitting job.
moral_action: Andi immediately calls the child's parents about what the child ate because they told her to contact them in case of an emergency.
immoral_action: Thinking about her job security, Andi conceals the incident from the child's parents and tells them everything went fine upon their return.

norm: Informing relative on the truth is always a good thing.
situation: Jay is out at a store, and sees his brother Todd's girlfriend making out with another man.
intention: Jay wants to respond to seeing his brother's girlfriend cheating.
moral_action: Jay takes a picture and shows Todd what he saw.
immoral_action: Jay keeps the information about Todd's girlfriend to himself.

norm: It's good to tell someone the truth.
situation: Greg got fired from his job today and his girlfriend notices he seems different.
intention: Greg wants to avoid talking about what really happened.
moral_action: Greg tells his girlfriend that he's had a really bad day and doesn't want to talk about it.
immoral_action: Greg pretends that there is nothing wrong when his girlfriend asks him about it.

norm: It's good to be honest when dealing with others.
situation: Dan has an older car with some mechanical problems and has been looking at new cars.
intention: Dan wants to sell the car quickly to get money for a down payment.
moral_action: Dan posts the car for sale online at a lower price because of the issues it has.
immoral_action: Dan posts an ad saying that the car is in perfect mechanical condition.

norm: It's good to let out the truth when it's important.
situation: Walt was walking down the road when he saw a robbery going on, and an officer asked him about it.
intention: Walt has to decide whether to snith.
moral_action: Walt tells the officer everything he knows about what he saw.
immoral_action: Walt told the officer that he didn't see any robbery going on.

norm: It is good to be honest with others.
situation: Jonah promised his mom, Sarah, than he would sign up for dance classes, but he doesn't really want to do it.
intention: Jonah wants to talk to Sarah.
moral_action: Jonah tells Sarah that he decided he doesn't want to be a dancer.
immoral_action: Jonah tell's Sarah that he can't wait to go, and he reluctantly takes the classes.

norm: It's immoral to trivialize another person's health.
situation: Ron is talking with James when he finds out that James has stomach problems.
intention: Ron wants to help James cope with his stomach problem.
moral_action: Ron asks if there's anything he can do to help James.
immoral_action: Ron says that James' stomach issues are likely in his head and that he shouldn't worry about them.

norm: It's wrong to abandon someone due to mental health issues.
situation: Don has a roommate Randy who is also a close friend going through a depression and acting more moody than normal.
intention: Don wants to create a more comfortable situation for himself.
moral_action: Don explains his concerns and talks things out with Randy asking what he can do to help.
immoral_action: Don moves out in the middle of the lease leaving Randy alone and paying more rent.

norm: You should not treat mental illness like it is cool.
situation: Sophie is listening to her friend Moira talk about depression that she experiences.
intention: Sophie wants to add to the conversation.
moral_action: Sophie tells Moira she has never experienced depression but wants to be able to help.
immoral_action: Sophie tells Moira that she is jealous because her depression makes her seem more mature and mysterious.

norm: It's wrong to play with someone else's mental health.
situation: Amber and Colt share an apartment where they each keep their prescriptions on the kitchen table.
intention: Amber wants to prank Colt.
moral_action: Amber hides Colt's TV remote in the morning before he wakes up.
immoral_action: Amber takes Colt's psychiatric medication and empties the bottle to all but one.

norm: It's wrong to put another's health at risk.
situation: Jenna is in charge of food purchasing for a large elementary school, and gets an offer to buy expired meat for 90% off.
intention: Jenna wants to save the school money.
moral_action: Jenna rejects the expired meat and starts serving a vegetarian meal once a week.
immoral_action: Jenna purchases the expired meat and serves it to the students.

norm: You shouldn't be cheap when it comes to your health.
situation: Kelly noticed that her leg had been hurting her for a while.
intention: Kelly wants her leg to stop hurting.
moral_action: Kelly goes to the doctor to see what was wrong with her leg.
immoral_action: Kelly puts ice on her leg for a few minutes before going back to work.

norm: It is wrong to not support people with mental illnesses.
situation: Susan's friend Mary has got into a depression due to loss of her mom recently and Mary needs help from Susan.
intention: Susan wants to react to Mary's situation.
moral_action: Susan suggests Mary to get help from a mental health doctor and spends time with her when necessary.
immoral_action: Susan finds Mary to be increasingly annoying and dependent on her, so she stays away from Mary.

norm: It's wrong to trivialize the health condition of another person.
situation: Phil's friend Colt recently caught the coronavirus.
intention: Phil wants to talk to Colt about the coronavirus.
moral_action: Phil tells Colt that he should rest and seek medical attention if he develops bad symptoms.
immoral_action: Phil tells Colt that coronavirus is just the flu and is harmless.

norm: It is not okay to shame someone's mental health issues.
situation: Gage is at a party with his bipolar friend Suzy.
intention: Gage wants to entertain people.
moral_action: Gage asks Suzy to help him perform a comedy skit for everyone.
immoral_action: Gage makes a joke about Suzy's bipolar disorder.
