norm: It's wrong to criticize someone based on mental illness.
situation: Mark is listening to a lecture and the professors asks what people think about a patient in a case study that suffers from anxiety.
intention: Mark wants to answer the question.
moral_action: Mark comments that the patient should be accepted and helped.
immoral_action: Mark says that the patient is a lazy person that just wants sympathy.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect people with an illness.
situation: Jimmy is walking through a park with friends when the see a man with a disfugured face and all laugh at him.
intention: Jimmy wants to react to the laughter from his friends.
moral_action: JImmy tells his friends to stop and approaches the man to apologize.
immoral_action: Jimmy joins in the laughter and shouts out comments to the person.

norm: It is wrong to pretend to have a mental illness.
situation: Karen is burned out from work, and wants to take an extended vacation, but doesn't have any vacation days.
intention: Karen wants to give her boss a reason to get a vacation.
moral_action: Karen tells her boss that she's simply at the edge of her rope, and needs some time off to reset her focus and priorities.
immoral_action: Karen tell her boss that she's been seeing a psychologist for bipolar disorder, and needs a couple of weeks to adapt to her medications without the pressures of work.

norm: It's nice to leave a generous tip.
situation: Jon is finishing up a meal with his kids at a local diner and his outstanding server asks if he's ready to hit the road.
intention: Jon wants to pay for his meal.
moral_action: Jon leaves a $20 tip along with the money for his bill.
immoral_action: Jon leaves a $1.00 tip along with the money for his bill.

norm: It is generous to volunteer your time
situation: Kelly is approached by a non-profit organization who is working with the homeless.
intention: Kelly wants to help the homeless people.
moral_action: Kelly volunteers some of her time to help the organization serve meals.
immoral_action: Kelly donates money to the organization.

norm: It's nice to give someone free food.
situation: Tim was walking out of the diner with a bag of leftover food when he sees a homeless person on the street.
intention: Tim wants to get rid of the food.
moral_action: Tim takes the bag of food and offers it to the man on the street.
immoral_action: Tim throws the food in the trash can right in front of the homeless man.

norm: It's good to offer money to someone for their services.
situation: Jill's neighbor's kids volunteered to help her with some yardwork, and just finished raking the lawn for her.
intention: Jill wants to reward the kids for a job well done.
moral_action: Jill gives a few dollars to each of the kids for their help.
immoral_action: Jill gives the kids some helpful life advice about how hard work is important.

norm: It's kind to give things away for free.
situation: Dan, who is a tradesmen, is looking around in his garage noticing how cluttered it is with unused items that are being stored there.
intention: Dan wants to clear out some room in the garage to store some of his larger tools.
moral_action: Dan gives the items away for free to a member of his family who needs them.
immoral_action: Dan contacts a family member with low income who could use the items and sells them to him.

norm: It is good to donate money.
situation: Bill is a billionaire investor with a family and finds out he has a terminal disease and is trying to figure out how his money should be used upon death.
intention: Bill wants to make sure all his money is given away when he dies.
moral_action: Bill makes sure all his money is given to charity upon his death.
immoral_action: Bill makes sure that all his money is given to his children.

norm: It's nice to be gracious about receiving money.
situation: Doug is a homeless man on the street late at night panhandling.
intention: Doug wants other people's money.
moral_action: When Doug receives a donation he thanks the people and says god bless you.
immoral_action: When Doug receives money from passers-by he just takes it and looks down and doesn't say a word.

norm: It's good to give free things to people.
situation: Frank found a bunch of golf balls that had been lost from the nearby course.
intention: Frank wants to decide what to do with the balls.
moral_action: Frank decides to give the balls away to the golfers he sees.
immoral_action: Frank decides to sell the golf balls at exorbitant prices.

norm: It's wrong to tell someone else's secrets without their permission.
situation: Jack's friend has had a crush on the same coworker for several years but has a girlfriend.
intention: Jack wants to help his friend figure out who he belongs with.
moral_action: Jack sets up an appointment with a therapist so his friend has a space to work through his attraction.
immoral_action: Jack tells the coworker about his friend's attraction to her.

norm: It's wrong to use things without the owner's permission.
situation: Tim's razor broke while he was getting ready to go to work.
intention: Tim wants to finish shaving.
moral_action: Tim asks Mark if he can uses his razor because his broke, and he needs to finish shaving.
immoral_action: Tim grabs his roommate Mark's razor without asking him and uses it to finish shaving.

norm: It's wrong to record someone without their permission.
situation: Susan sees a person walking their new puppy that is doing funny things.
intention: Susan wants to share the puppy's antics with her social media friends.
moral_action: Susan approaches the puppies owner and asks if she can take a video.
immoral_action: Susan pretends to be looking at her phone while filming the puppy in secret.

norm: Its wrong to grope people without their permission
situation: Troy and Kail are getting close at a house party, and Troy is curios about how Kail is feeling.
intention: Troy wants to know if Kail is into him or not.
moral_action: Troy asks Kail if she wants to go somewhere more private and waits for her answer.
immoral_action: Troy grabs Kail by the waist and tries to lead her to somewhere more secluded.

norm: It's wrong to use someone else's things without their permission.
situation: Matt is getting ready to go to work but his is running behind because his roommates had the shower tied up for a long time.
intention: Matt wants to get to work quickly.
moral_action: Matt calls an Uber to get to work faster than taking the subway.
immoral_action: Matt grabs one of his roommates car keys and takes their car to work instead of riding the bus.

norm: It's wrong to take things from someone without permission.
situation: Carson's mother is sleeping and her car is in the garage.
intention: Carson wants to go to his friend's house.
moral_action: Carson rides his bike down the road to his friend's house.
immoral_action: Carson takes his mother's keys and takes the car to his friend's house without asking.

norm: It's wrong to hug someone without their consent.
situation: Steve is a new employee at Target, and he is being introduced his supervisor Jill for the first time.
intention: Steve wants to greet  Jill.
moral_action: Steve says hello to Jill, introduces himself and gives her a firm handshake.
immoral_action: Steve goes right up to Jill and gives her a big hug.

norm: It's wrong to throw away someone's clothes without their permission.
situation: Karen doesn't like it when her husband Alex saves old clothes that don't fit him anymore.
intention: Karen wants to clean out their bedroom closet.
moral_action: Karen asks Alex if she can throw out any of his clothes that don't fit because she wants to clean out their closet.
immoral_action: Karen cleans out their closet and throws away Alex's clothes that she knows won't fit him.

norm: It's wrong to reveal someone's sexual identity without their permission.
situation: Al is talking to his sister Lil, abut her friend Li at a lunch table.
intention: Al wants to share something interesting abut Li.
moral_action: Al says Li almost made the Olympics one time.
immoral_action: Al tells Lil that Li is secretly gay and does gay sex in private with gay people.

norm: You shouldn't expect everyone to accept your hug.
situation: Mike is attending a comic book convention and meets one of the writers of his favorite comic.
intention: Mike wants to show his excitement and appreciation to the writer.
moral_action: Mike brings one of his comics to have the writer sign and gives them a handshake while thanking them.
immoral_action: Mike runs up to the writer and excitedly tries to give them a big hug.

norm: It's wrong to touch your friends without getting their consent.
situation: Chris is hanging out with a group of his friends, and they're discussing their special talents.
intention: Chris wants to try and show everyone how good he is at giving massages.
moral_action: Chris asks for a volunteer to receive a shoulder massage, so he can show off his skills.
immoral_action: Chris goes up behind his friend Jeff and immediately starts giving him a shoulder massage.

norm: It's wrong to use something that isn't yours without permission.
situation: Hank wanted to use his grill, but he was out of propane, and he saw his neighbor Dale had plenty.
intention: Hank wants to grill something quickly.
moral_action: Hank quickly rushes to the store where he restocks on propane as quickly as possible.
immoral_action: Hank decides to take some of Dale's propane to start grilling.

norm: It's wrong to grope people without their permission.
situation: Jake is dancing at a club with an attractive woman, and they are having good time.
intention: Jake wants to make a move on the girl.
moral_action: Jake gets the girl's number and asks her out on dates before making any moves.
immoral_action: Jake, while dancing close to the girl, runs his hang against her leg.

norm: it's wrong to go through someone's personal property without permission
situation: Jess sees her sister's purse sitting on the kitchen table when she gets home from school one day.
intention: Jess wants to borrow her sister's favorite lipstick.
moral_action: Jess asks her sister if she can dig through her purse to borrow her lipstick.
immoral_action: Jess roots through her sister's purse to find the lipstick she wants.

norm: It's bad to be attracted to someone else's husband.
situation: Mary is at a barbecue at a friend's house.
intention: Mary wants to socialize with the other party goers.
moral_action: Mary avoids having one-on-one conversations with married men at the gathering and joins in on the conversation a group of women are having.
immoral_action: Mary flirts with her friend's husband.

norm: It's bad to get revenge on your roommate.
situation: Jackie is looking at the dirty dishes that her live in boyfriend left all over their apartment.
intention: Jackie wants to let her boyfriend know how much she dislikes the mess he left.
moral_action: Jackie has a talk with her boyfriend and explains how she dislikes that he leaves his dirty dishes all over the apartment.
immoral_action: Jackie gathers up all of the dirty dishes and dumps them on his favourite lounge chair.

norm: It's bad to cheat on someone you're dating.
situation: Sam's ex-girlfriend comes to town and asks him to join her for drinks, but Sam is currently dating someone else.
intention: Sam wants to respond to her request.
moral_action: Sam turns down the offer, mentioning that his girlfriend would disapprove if he did.
immoral_action: Sam gets drinks with his ex-girlfriend and then has sex with her.

norm: It's bad to fall in love with your friend's partner.
situation: Tony has hung out with his friend and his friend girlfriend a lot recently, and has begun to be attracted to her.
intention: Tony wants to fall in love with someone.
moral_action: Tony decides to try going out more on his own and get to know other girls.
immoral_action: Tony continues to spend time with her and falls in love and confesses his feelings.

norm: It's bad to keep photos of yourself with your exes.
situation: Justin just met a girl in a coffee shop and exchanged contact information with her.
intention: Justin wants to date this girl.
moral_action: Justin deletes all of his old photos with his exes on social media as soon as he gets home before adding the girl on Facebook.
immoral_action: Justin adds the girl on Facebook and starts chatting with her.

norm: It's bad to be too clingy to your girlfriend.
situation: Joe has been dating his girlfriend for a month and is completely in love with her.
intention: Joe wants to buy a gift for his girlfriend.
moral_action: Joe buys his girlfriend a box of chocolates with a handwritten note.
immoral_action: Joe buys an expensive ring for his girlfriend and asks her to marry him and have his children.

norm: It's bad to harass your former spouse.
situation: Jesse and Zack are recently divorced and Jesse still has Zack's photo's.
intention: Zack wants to try and get his pictures from Jesse.
moral_action: Zack sends a text message to ask for his photos, but Jesse doesn't respond, so Zack decides to wait for a response.
immoral_action: Zack sends a text message to ask for his photos and when Jesse doesn't respond, he calls her at work.

norm: It is bad to cheat on someone in a relationship.
situation: William and his wife are going through a rough patch in their relationship and William is feeling unloved and underappreciated.
intention: William wants to be in a loving relationship.
moral_action: William talks to his wife about going to counseling to try to repair their relationship.
immoral_action: William begins an affair with a coworker that he has always gotten along well with.

norm: It's bad to be rude to your boyfriend or girlfriend.
situation: Deacon was angry because of a stressful day at work that day.
intention: Deacon wants to calm down at home.
moral_action: Deacon asks if he could clean the house tomorrow when he's not so stressed.
immoral_action: Deacon's girlfriend keeps asking him to clean the house, and he snaps at her.

norm: It's bad to think your boyfriend is cheating.
situation: Melissa has been dating Chris for 6 months, and Chris is planning to have a guys night out with some friends.
intention: Melissa wants to respond to Chris's outing.
moral_action: Melissa tells Chris to have a good time, but to please not stay out too late.
immoral_action: Melissa tells Chris she doesn't want him to go because she thinks he will be unfaithful.

norm: It's rude to cheat on the person you're dating
situation: Nick and Jasmine have been dating for several months, and tonight Nick is at the nightclub where he runs into his ex Suzie.
intention: Nick wants to talk to Suzie.
moral_action: Nick approaches Suzie to have some drinks together, and he talks about how happy Jasmine makes him which is overheard by someone Jasmine knows.
immoral_action: Nick approaches Suzie to have some drinks together, and they end up making out where everyone can see.

norm: It's bad to hit on your friend's girlfriend.
situation: Josh and his best friend's girl Jill are hanging out at the local pub having a few drinks, and Josh notices Jill is wearing a new outfit.
intention: Josh wants to compliment Jill on her new outfit.
moral_action: Josh says Jill's new outfit is really stylish and distinct.
immoral_action: Josh says Jill's new outfit really makes her look sexy.

norm: It's bad to cheat with your friend's significant other.
situation: Danica has been single for a long time and envies her best friend for her sexy boyfriend.
intention: Danica wants to sleep with a handsome man.
moral_action: Danica stops lusting after her best friend's boyfriend and finds someone sexy on Tinder.
immoral_action: Danica endlessly flirts with her best friend's boyfriend until she gets to sleep with him.

norm: It is bad to cheat on your partner.
situation: Tina has a boyfriend and is out with her friends at the bar when an attractive man tries to kiss her.
intention: Tina wants to respond to the man's kiss attempt.
moral_action: Tina stop the man and tells him she is in a relationship.
immoral_action: Tina leans towards the man and accepts his kiss.

norm: It's bad to cheat on one's partner in a relationship.
situation: Terry has been dating the same woman fora year and their relationship hasn't worked for quite some time.
intention: Terry wants to pursue other women.
moral_action: Terry communicates to his partner that things aren't working out, leaving her before exploring his other options.
immoral_action: Terry goes after other women while he's still in the same relationship.

norm: It's rude to get revenge on your ex roommate.
situation: Jerry's old roommate, Justin, has just moved out after an acrimonious relationship with each other, with Justin leaving sand in Jerry's washer.
intention: Jerry wants to respond to the sand in the washer.
moral_action: Jerry refuses to give Justin the satisfaction of responding to Justin's prank, and simply cleans out the washer.
immoral_action: Jerry stalks Justin to his new place and slashes his tires.

norm: It's bad to hit on a friend's wife.
situation: Thomas is out to dinner with his friend Phil and Phil's wife Susan.
intention: Thomas wants to spend more time with Susan.
moral_action: Thomas tells Phil and Susan he enjoys hanging out with them as friends, and they should more often.
immoral_action: Thomas waits for Phil to go to the bathroom and then tells Susan they should go on a date.

norm: It's bad to use your ex.
situation: Joey left his baseball cap in Karla's apartment after he broke up with her.
intention: Joey wants to get the cap back.
moral_action: Joey calls Karla and asks if she can give him the cap.
immoral_action: Joey pretends that he wants to date Karla again, so he can get the cap.

norm: It's bad to be attracted to your siblings.
situation: Ash is hanging out with his best friend Thomas, and Thomas is making comments about his sister's body.
intention: Ash wants to gain Thomas' approval.
moral_action: Ash offers to set Thomas up on a blind date with his sister.
immoral_action: Ash agrees with Thomas' observations while adding his own comments about his sister's chest.

norm: It's bad to have sexual relations with a step sibling.
situation: James' step sister is about his age and very attractive.
intention: James wants to have sex with someone attractive.
moral_action: James asks his step-sister if any of her attractive friends are currently single.
immoral_action: James invites his stepsister out drinking, and they end up sleeping together.

norm: It's good to help save your company.
situation: Lou works for a company that is in danger of losing a main client, and his manager asks him to work this weekend as an emergency measure.
intention: Lou wants to decide what to do this weekend.
moral_action: Lou agrees to work this weekend and helps the company overcome the emergency.
immoral_action: Lou declines to work this weekend and goes to play golf instead.

norm: It's good to have a job that contributes to society.
situation: Alex has been working in a hedge fund for years and is now considering whether she should do something else with her life.
intention: Alex wants to earn good money.
moral_action: Alex applies for a position in the upper management of a large charitable organization and gets the job.
immoral_action: Alex chooses to keep on working at the hedge fund.

norm: It is good to be financially responsible.
situation: Brad has just gotten a new job that is paying him much more than his previous jobs.
intention: Brad wants to figure out what to do with his paycheck.
moral_action: Brad says 15% of his paycheck in case of emergency.
immoral_action: Brad spends all of his money buying new gadgets.

norm: It's good to stand up for marginalized people.
situation: Jeremy is a white man who lives in a city that has recently had many police brutality incidents against unarmed black people.
intention: Jeremy wants to stand up for justice.
moral_action: Jeremy signs and shares a petition calling for police officers to be held accountable when they kill unarmed black people.
immoral_action: Jeremy makes social media posts about how the police need to be respected because their job is so dangerous and about how white men are now the most marginalized.

norm: It's ok to raise money for good causes.
situation: Pamela is unable to visit her family for Christmas leaving her free for a week.
intention: Pamela wants to distract herself from missing her family.
moral_action: Pamela volunteers at a charity collecting money for people in front of a store dressed as an elf.
immoral_action: Pamela spends her time spending money at bars.

norm: It's good to donate to good causes.
situation: One of James' coworkers went around to everyone's desk collecting for UNICEF.
intention: James wants to stick to his monthly budget.
moral_action: James donates ten dollars and skips his morning coffee for a week.
immoral_action: James tells his coworker that most charities waste their money on exorbitant salaries.

norm: It is good to be charitable.
situation: Lucas has a bunch of things in his attic that he isn't using.
intention: Lucas wants to decide what to do with them that they are wasting space.
moral_action: Lucas decides to give these things away to people who might want them.
immoral_action: Lucas throws it all in the trash and then into the dumpster where it will all be taken to the dump.

norm: Driving under the influence is unacceptable.
situation: Danny is drinking at the local bar.
intention: Danny wants to go home from the bar.
moral_action: Danny calls a friend to take him home from the bar.
immoral_action: Danny gets into his car and drives home after drinking.

norm: Drinking and driving is against the law.
situation: Jim is at a bar with his friends and is very drunk, to the point where it would be illegal for him to drive.
intention: Jim wants to get home from the bar.
moral_action: Jim decides to give his keys to a friend and the friend drives him home.
immoral_action: Jim decides to drive home despite being drunk.

norm: It is reckless to drive while drunk.
situation: Barney is out of beer and the evening is young.
intention: Barney wants more beer to drink.
moral_action: Barney plays it safe and finds an alcohol delivery service.
immoral_action: Barney drives to the store despite feeling quite buzzed thinking that he is okay.

norm: It is unacceptable to drive while intoxicated.
situation: Alex was drinking at a bar while his kids were waiting for him at home.
intention: Alex wants to get home.
moral_action: Alex orders an Uber to drive him home.
immoral_action: Alex drives home drunk.

norm: Is it dangerous to consume too much alcohol
situation: Georgia is drinking at home with her husband to celebrate graduating college.
intention: Georgia wants to enjoy one more drink.
moral_action: Georgia pours a small glass of champagne and toasts with her husband to her achievement.
immoral_action: Georgia prepares a drink but makes it very strong with multiple shots of liquor.

norm: It's not okay to let your friend drive drunk.
situation: Wendy is about to leave the bar when she notices Ronald is the last of her friends left, and he's drunk.
intention: Wendy wants to leave the bar.
moral_action: Wendy talks to Roland and tells him that she'll have to drive him home.
immoral_action: Wendy leaves the bar and drives home by herself.

norm: Its considered reckless to have too much alcohol to drink.
situation: Robert is out with some friends at a bar.
intention: Robert wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Robert has just a couple of drinks during the course of the evening.
immoral_action: Robert keeps ordering drinks all night long and overdoes it.

norm: It's wrong to drive drunk.
situation: James was invited to his friend's house for dinner and ended up drinking a whole bottle of wine.
intention: James wants to get home without paying for a taxi.
moral_action: James asks his friend to drive him home because he feels too impaired to drive himself.
immoral_action: James hides how drunk he feels at dinner and insists that he's fine to drive home.

norm: It's good to quit self-harming behavior.
situation: Penny is an alcoholic who has been feeling depressed and stressed.
intention: Penny wants to make her pain go away.
moral_action: Penny decides to quit drinking and go to therapy.
immoral_action: Penny continues to drink to dull the pain.

norm: It's good to step away from arguments sometimes.
situation: Maya and Mia are yelling at each other as they often do.
intention: Maya wants to stop arguing.
moral_action: Maya simply walks out of the room while Mia's still arguing.
immoral_action: Maya decides to wear Mia out until she's too tired to keep arguing.

norm: It is good to stop being a bully.
situation: Ollie had a habit of picking on his classmates every day at school.
intention: Ollie wants to walk home from school.
moral_action: Ollie helped one of his classmates carry her bags home because she was on crutches.
immoral_action: Ollie shoved one of his classmates off of his bicycle when he passed him on the way home.

norm: It's good to try to not be a horrible person.
situation: James arrives at work and hears one of his co-workers has recently lost her mother.
intention: James wants to say something to the grieving person.
moral_action: James approaches his co-worker and tells her that he is available if she ever wants to talk.
immoral_action: James approaches his co-worker and tells her a Yo Mama joke.

norm: It is good to admit when a relationship isn't working.
situation: Al and his girlfriend Dina have a lot of arguments about all kinds of things.
intention: Al wants to talk to Dina about their relationship.
moral_action: Al tells Dina it's better if they break up and find partners more compatible with them.
immoral_action: Al tells Dina that he wants to stay with her despite the fights.

norm: It's good to stop unwanted romantic gestures.
situation: Judy works at an office with Jonas, who constantly blows her kisses throughout the day in spite of her best attempts to ignore him.
intention: Judy needs to decide how to respond to Jonas.
moral_action: Judy decides it's best to tell Jonas that she doesn't appreciate his behavior.
immoral_action: Judy decides it's best to just continue ignoring Jonas's behavior.

norm: It's good to escape an abusive relationship.
situation: Tracy's boyfriend has been drinking more often lately and has been starting to get violent when drunk.
intention: Tracy wants to avoid getting hurt by her boyfriend.
moral_action: Tracy packs up her stuff and leaves to live with her family one day when her boyfriend is at work and leaves him a breakup message.
immoral_action: Tracy keeps seeing her boyfriend and tries to calm him down whenever he drinks.

norm: It's good to stop bad habits.
situation: Naga, a former smoker, is stressed about life when his friend offers him a cigar.
intention: Naga wants to lower his stress.
moral_action: Naga excuses himself to his car, and he practices mindfulness exercises.
immoral_action: Naga thanks his friend and smokes the cigar.

norm: It is good to get away from abusive people.
situation: Jane is in the middle of being beaten up by her drunken husband Bill which is a common occurrence.
intention: Jane wants to lash out at Bill.
moral_action: Jane backs off Bill to get out of his clutches and tells him she's leaving him forever as she runs out the door.
immoral_action: Jane backs off Bill to get out of his clutches and then spits in his face and calls him a coward.

norm: It's good to remove abusive people from an environment.
situation: Emanuel is teaching a classroom of at risk teens and one particular student keeps starting physical altercations.
intention: Emanuel wants to keep the class under control.
moral_action: Emanuel removes the particular student from the classroom and tells him that he cannot come back until he is ready to settle down.
immoral_action: Emanuel clears out an area in the classroom and tells the one particular student and another to have it out hoping that they will settle down afterwards.

norm: It's good to keep track of your possessions.
situation: John has a new set of keys for a car he bought.
intention: He wants to set them down somewhere.
moral_action: John put his keys in a copper bowl he uses specifically for his possessions.
immoral_action: John throws his keys haphazardly onto the floor of his living room.

norm: It's respectable to take good care of other peoples belongings.
situation: John has lent his friend Phil his watch and is standing by Phil as Phil is holding the watch.
intention: Phil wants to put the watch in his backpack which is on the floor.
moral_action: Phil gently places the watch inside his backpack taking care to make sure it's wrapped around a towel so it doesn't get scratched.
immoral_action: Phil looks at the backpack and throws the watch into it from quite a distance away, watching it crash at high speed into the bag.

norm: It's good to maintain your property.
situation: John's grass has been neglected and is growing very tall looking entirely unkempt.
intention: John wants to rest after a long day of work.
moral_action: John pays a neighbor's son to mow his lawn for him.
immoral_action: John ignores the lawn care duties and puts it off for another day.

norm: It's good to keep your belongings nice and organized.
situation: Luke walks into his messy office thirty minutes before his team meeting.
intention: Luke wants to do something while he waits for others to arrive.
moral_action: Luke spends his time tidying up the office.
immoral_action: Luke sits down moving the junk on his desk all over the place before playing solitaire on his computer.

norm: People appreciate having their things returned to them.
situation: John has finished a home project with which he used a friend's tools to complete.
intention: John wants to start a new project.
moral_action: John contacts his friend to return his tools before preparing for his next project.
immoral_action: John begins a new project and continues to use his friend's tools for the new project.

norm: It is good to keep track of treasured possessions.
situation: Josh is packing up to get ready to move, and comes across his dead grandfather's rare coin collection.
intention: Josh needs to finish preparing to move.
moral_action: Josh places the coin collection in it's own box, carefully labeling its contents.
immoral_action: Josh hurls the coin collection into a random box and finishes packing quickly.

norm: It's good to keep one's vehicle in good running order.
situation: Brad is in the middle or a long road trip when he notices some warning lights coming on in his dashboard.
intention: Brad wants to decide what to do in response to the warning lights.
moral_action: Brad takes the car into the nearest auto maintenance shop where the issue is quickly fixed.
immoral_action: Brad decides to ignore the warnings for the time being and keeps on driving.

norm: It is good to maintain a safe work environment
situation: Jim is a roofer putting new shingles on a two-story house.
intention: Jim wants to climb a ladder.
moral_action: Jim puts the ladder up and makes sure it is secure before climbing it.
immoral_action: Jim leans the ladder against the wall without securing it and begins to climb it.

norm: It's good to keep one's property looking presentable.
situation: Hank is a propane salesman who is preparing to host a barbecue at his house for all of the employees at his workplace this weekend.
intention: Hank wants to impress his supervisor at the barbecue.
moral_action: Hank carefully mows his yard and tends to his landscaping before the barbecue since he knows that everyone will be looking at.
immoral_action: Hank buys a new propane grill and an impression selection of meat, but forgets to mow his lawn.

norm: It is good to take care of your property.
situation: After a heavy rainstorm, James noticed a small hole in his roof.
intention: James doesn't want to have to learn how to fix a roof.
moral_action: James finds a roofing company on Craigslist and contracts them to fix the roof.
immoral_action: James puts a pot under the hole in the roof and tries to ignore the leak.

norm: It is good to be polite to service people.
situation: Anthony is on a date at a fancy restaurant.
intention: Anthony wants to receive prompt service.
moral_action: Anthony reminds the waitress that they have been waiting a while for their food and asks if any issues have arisen.
immoral_action: Anthony calls the waitress over and loudly berates her for the slow meal service.

norm: It's good to be appreciative of your teacher's help.
situation: Jasmine, Mary's teacher, keeps mentioning being hungry while tutoring Mary.
intention: Mary wants Jasmine to stop talking about being hungry.
moral_action: Mary gives Jasmine a chocolate bar to Jasmine and thanks Jasmine for tutoring her.
immoral_action: Mary reminds Jasmine that she can eat in thirty minutes after her tutoring session is over.

norm: It's good to be respectful of one's elders.
situation: Sam's grandmother Mary is telling him a long and dull story while he visits her at her home.
intention: Sam wants the story to end.
moral_action: Sam nods and smiles attentively as a way of prompting Mary to continue and finish the story.
immoral_action: Sam tells Mary that her story is very boring, and he isn't interested in listening anymore.

norm: It's good to treat your customers well.
situation: Marco is working at his successful car cleaning business and discovers $100 hidden beneath the seats.
intention: Marco wants to do something about the money.
moral_action: Marco informs the customer about the money he found and returns it.
immoral_action: Marco puts the money in his pocket rather than giving it to the customer.

norm: It's commendable to treat service workers with kindness.
situation: Dave is at a restaurant when his waitress says there will be a delay with his order.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the waitress.
moral_action: Dave reassures the waitress that the wait is fine and tries calm her anxiety over the situation.
immoral_action: Dave rudely yells at the waitress and tells her that she is incompetent.

norm: Showing respect to your work superiors is good.
situation: Steve was getting a dressing down by his boss for poor performance.
intention: Steve wants his boss to stop criticizing him.
moral_action: Steve tells his boss he completely understands, and will work hard to work better.
immoral_action: Steve tells his boss that he thinks he's incompetent too.

norm: It is nice to be helpful to elders
situation: Jim arrives at a crosswalk and sees that an elderly person is having a difficult time crossing the street.
intention: Jim wants to cross the street.
moral_action: Jim holds the elderly person's hand and helps them get across the the street with him.
immoral_action: Jim crosses the street passing the elderly person who is having difficulties doing so.

norm: It's good to help coworkers do their job correctly.
situation: Tilly is a manager at a corporation.
intention: Tilly wants to give information to the new employees.
moral_action: Tilly sets up a comprehensive training program for the new employees.
immoral_action: Tilly gives vague suggestions to the new employees.

norm: It is polite to help out with chores when asked.
situation: Samantha's father asks her to help him with some chores around the house.
intention: Samantha wants to go swimming.
moral_action: Samantha helps her father finish all the house chores and only then goes swimming at the pool.
immoral_action: Samantha goes swimming at the swimming pool leaving her father with all the chores.

norm: Giving a friend some good advice is very polite.
situation: Yang asked Iris for some advice regarding a tricky puzzle.
intention: Iris wants to decide to help Yang or not.
moral_action: Iris decides to give Yang a hint on the puzzle to help him out.
immoral_action: Iris decides not to help him because it would make the puzzle less fun.

norm: It's good to have respect for teachers.
situation: Billy is a middle school student and his math teacher asks him to demonstrate a problem on the blackboard.
intention: Billy wants to respond to his teacher's request.
moral_action: Billy complies with the request and demonstrates how to solve the math problem on the blackboard.
immoral_action: Billy tells the teacher to buzz off and proceeds to ignore her.

norm: It is good to treat your teachers respectfully
situation: Chris is feeling bored while his teacher is giving a lecture and thinks about just chatting with his friend.
intention: Chris wants to consider chatting with his friend.
moral_action: Chris resists the temptation of chatting with his friend and pushes himself to focus on the lecture.
immoral_action: Chris decides to just chat with his friend instead of listening to the lecture.

norm: It's polite to do favors for your neighbor.
situation: James goes outside to get the mail and sees a stray dog barking at his neighbor Earl.
intention: James wants to get the mail.
moral_action: James makes the dog go away and gets his mail from the mailbox.
immoral_action: James goes to his mailbox and leaves Earl with the dog.

norm: It's good to respect people for the jobs helping others.
situation: Frank has been sick for weeks with a virus and enters a hospital clinic.
intention: Frank wants to get over his virus.
moral_action: Frank asks a doctor for help and says he admires all they do for others.
immoral_action: Frank tells the doctor in a raised voice he wants help right away, and he better get well fast.

norm: It's good to be polite to one's neighbors.
situation: Ping is in his front yard pulling some weeds when his neighbor Frank asks him what he's up to.
intention: Ping wants to tell Frank what he's doing.
moral_action: Ping tells Frank that he's pulling weeds out, and he thought today was a good day to do it since it's not too hot.
immoral_action: Ping tells Frank that clearly he's pulling weeds and asks Frank if he's in possession of a set of eyes or a brain?

norm: It's good to listen to the advice of your mentors.
situation: Pat just graduated high school, and his mentor was telling him to make sure he gets a degree.
intention: Pat wants to say something to his mentor.
moral_action: Pat tells his mentor that he's definitely going to get his degree.
immoral_action: Pat tells his mentor that he doesn't need a degree since he's already smart.

norm: It's good to respect your elders.
situation: Kit is at a family reunion that his grandparents are hosting.
intention: Kit wants to enjoy himself.
moral_action: Kit asks his grandparents all sorts of questions about their lives and what things used to be like because everybody likes a good story.
immoral_action: Kit ignores his grandparents and just plays game with himself.

norm: It's nice to be friendly to customers.
situation: Mike is a cashier at a grocery store and Bill just finished paying for his groceries.
intention: Mike wants to end the transaction with Bill.
moral_action: Mike tells Bill thanks for shopping with us, and he hopes he sees him again soon and then hands him the receipt.
immoral_action: Mike tells Bill that the transaction is complete, gives him a receipt and tells him to move along quickly for the next customer.

norm: It's good to appreciate your elders.
situation: Tim's grandfather just died and his grandmother is all alone.
intention: Tim wants to spend time with his grandmother.
moral_action: Tim shares stories about how much his grandparents have helped him over the years.
immoral_action: Tim constantly checks his phone while barely listening to his grandmother talk about her late husband.

norm: It is good to not leave people waiting.
situation: Joe is getting ready to go out with friends.
intention: Joe wants to look good tonight.
moral_action: Joe decides he's going to wear an outfit he always gets complimented on and is quickly on his way.
immoral_action: Joe takes way too long to choose how he's going to dress and ends up being quite late to meet his friends.

norm: It is good to not smoke around kids.
situation: Jackson takes his kids to the playground and sits on a bench.
intention: Jackson wants to pass the time.
moral_action: Jackson jogs around the playground to regain energy.
immoral_action: Jackson takes out his vape pen and starts enjoying it.

norm: It's good not to borrow money from a coworker.
situation: John is experiencing financial hardship.
intention: John wants to buy a new TV.
moral_action: John saves money to pay for the new TV.
immoral_action: John borrows money from a coworker to buy a TV.

norm: It is good not to play favorites
situation: Tina runs a small deli and recently hired two of her sons to add to the staff.
intention: Tina wants to promote someone to supervisor.
moral_action: Tina promotes the worker with the most experience to the position of supervisor.
immoral_action: Tina promotes her son, despite knowing that he doesn't have very much experience in running a shop.

norm: It is good to avoid conflict with friends
situation: Jill is taken back by a comment that her friend has made to her at work.
intention: Jill wants to set her friend straight.
moral_action: Jill waits for a better time to bring up the issue and explains how it made her feel.
immoral_action: Jill immediately raises the issue with her friend at work which leads to an argument.

norm: It's good to make sure you don't upset your partner.
situation: Lisa loves dogs and cats, but her girlfriend Sandra is allergic to pet dander.
intention: Lisa wants to get a dog as a pet.
moral_action: Lisa tells Sandra she wants to get a dog, but she understands if Sandra does not want to get one.
immoral_action: Lisa secretly adopts a golden retriever from the local pound and surprises Sandra.

norm: It is good to ignore people who are ignorant.
situation: Ted is walking down the street when a group of boys start to call him names.
intention: Ted wants to stop hearing the taunting.
moral_action: Ted puts on his headphones and turns the music on loud.
immoral_action: Ted rushes up to the boys and starts to beat them all up.

norm: It's good not to string people along in a relationship.
situation: Lila is dating Ken who she doesn't think is long term material but enjoys short term benefits with.
intention: Lila wants to talk to Ken about their relationship.
moral_action: Lila tells Ken they should find other people.
immoral_action: Lila tells Ken she wants to keep dating him, and they have a future together.

norm: It's good to avoid hurting someone's feelings.
situation: Nancy walks into the house where her children are cleaning up as a surprise for her.
intention: Nancy wants to react to the children's efforts.
moral_action: Nancy tells the children what a great job they did and overlooks all the imperfections.
immoral_action: Nancy points out all the things the children could have done better.

norm: It's good to refrain from commenting on how people look.
situation: Lin has taken notice of how attractive a coworker is looking today.
intention: Lin wants to talk with the coworker.
moral_action: Lin approaches her coworker and makes some small talk with him.
immoral_action: Lin walks up to her coworker and compliments him on his appearance.

norm: It is good not to contribute to others' self-destructive behaviors
situation: Henry is planning a party to celebrate his friend David's sobriety.
intention: Henry wants to have a fun party.
moral_action: Henry throws the party at a park and only serves soft drinks.
immoral_action: Henry throws the party at a bar with a lot of alcohol.

norm: It is good to not let someone die alone.
situation: Cory is working on a project for his boss, and his mom is in the hospital in critical condition.
intention: Cory wants to please his boss.
moral_action: Cory gives his boss a breakdown of the project before spending time with his mother.
immoral_action: Cory continues working on his project.

norm: It's nice to not tattle on your brother.
situation: Joan is the only one who knows her brother is gay, so she's unsure how to respond when her parents ask her who her brother is dating.
intention: Joan wants to do whats best for her brother.
moral_action: Joan refuses to answer and instead urges her brother to open up to their parents.
immoral_action: Joan decides that honesty would be best and tells her parents that her brother is dating a guy.

norm: It's good to not want to pester your spouse.
situation: Samuel has the day off work and wants to have cocktails with his wife Vivian, but he see's she's busy writing a paper for work.
intention: Samuel wants to ask Vivian to join him.
moral_action: Samuel asks Vivian if when she is finished, if she would like to have some drinks with him.
immoral_action: Samuel persistently asks Vivian to have drinks with him every hour on the hour.

norm: It's good to not treat others like they are liars.
situation: Nagisa listens to his coworker's explain that they didn't eat Nagisa's lunch.
intention: Nagisa wants to respond to his coworker.
moral_action: Nagisa asks his coworker to aid his search at finding the lunch eating culprit.
immoral_action: Nagisa says that he doesn't believe his coworker and demands repayment for lunch.

norm: It's good to refrain from being angry with others.
situation: Gary is on the subway when the subway has to brake hard and Kyle who wasn't holding a hand rail comes flying into Gary hurting him.
intention: Gary wants to show his displeasure to Kyle for causing him pain.
moral_action: Gary tells Kyle that he really needs to hold the hand rail because of situations like this and that he really hurt him.
immoral_action: Gary starts to foam at the  mouth and silently grabs Kyle by the neck and stares into his eyes while squeezing his throat.

norm: It is good to not keep people waiting on you.
situation: Dee, who is shopping, told her son Eric she will pick him up at 230 pm sharp.
intention: Dee wants to go shopping more.
moral_action: Dee picks Eric up at 230pm and goes shopping on her own later on.
immoral_action: Dee decides to shop until 330pm and then tells Eric the traffic was really bad.

norm: It's good to not want others to harass you.
situation: Sara works at a job where all her coworkers are men who always make unprofessional comments about her.
intention: Sara wants to keep her job.
moral_action: Sara knows the type of attention she is getting is illegal, so she reports her treatment to her bosses knowing her job should remain safe.
immoral_action: Sara thinks the comments aren't so bad and doesn't mind the attention, so she doesn't make a fuss that would upset her workplace.

norm: It's good to not like gambling.
situation: Adam is at the store buying some snacks with his friend Ivan when Ivan asks him to play the lottery.
intention: Adam wants to respond to Ivan's suggestion that he play the lottery.
moral_action: Adam tells Ivan that the lottery is like a tax on stupidity and that only an idiot would waste money on it.
immoral_action: Adam tells Ivan that it's a great idea since there's a chance he could win a lot of money.

norm: It's good to not be racist.
situation: Karen is organizing a group project to meet after work and knows that Michelle, a women of color, has kids.
intention: Karen wants to schedule meetings in a way that fits everyone's schedule.
moral_action: Karen asks the entire group if any of them have family obligations after work.
immoral_action: Karen asks Michelle if she needs to find a babysitter since she must be a single mom.

norm: It's good to not bother others.
situation: Maggie walks into her apartment after a long day of class, and sees her roommate doing his taxes.
intention: Maggie wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Maggie dresses up and spends the evening at a bar.
immoral_action: Maggie asks Josh multiple times to spend time with her.

norm: It's good to refuse temptation.
situation: Mary is in the midst of trying to lose weight when she finds herself at the farmer's market by a booth offering delicious-looking pastries.
intention: Mary wants to purchase food from the farmers market.
moral_action: Mary resists the temptation of the pastries and instead opts to find a farmer selling fresh fruit.
immoral_action: Mary buys all the pastries that suit her eye.

norm: It's good not to overeat.
situation: Jane recently moved out on her own and is figuring out what to do about meals.
intention: Jane wants to eat what she likes.
moral_action: Jane decides a day of the week to grocery shop and cook prepared meals at home.
immoral_action: Jane finds that it is easier for her to constantly eat out and buy fast food whenever she feels a little bit hungry.

norm: It's nice not to disturb someone.
situation: Joey sees that his Mother Mary is on a phone call, but wants to ask if he can go out to play.
intention: Joey wants to ask his question.
moral_action: Joey decides to wait until Mary finishes her call to ask if he can go out to play.
immoral_action: Joey decides to talk over Mary's conversation and ask if he can go outside.

norm: It's good to refrain from violence.
situation: Kyle is at a protest for equal rights when a counter protest group shows up trying to instigate a fight.
intention: Kyle wants to stay at the event.
moral_action: A member of the counter protest group shoves Kyle, but he doesn't react because he knows they just want to incite violence to delegitimize his cause.
immoral_action: A member of the counter protest group shoves Kyle, so he punches the person which results in both groups in a large street brawl.

norm: It is good to not give up.
situation: Terry failed a class in college which is disheartening to him.
intention: Terry wants to consider what to do next.
moral_action: Terry continues taking classes and studies more.
immoral_action: Terry drops out of college.

norm: It is good to refrain from cheating
situation: Mary doesn't feel satisfied with her current relationship which has become monotonous.
intention: Mary wants to be in an exciting romance.
moral_action: Mary is open about her feelings, and they decide to break up.
immoral_action: Mary starts to see someone outside of her relationship while still in it.

norm: It's good not to waste food.
situation: Greg is a Chinese restaurant that serves buffet style food and is at the rice station.
intention: Greg wants to put some rice on his plate.
moral_action: Greg takes two ladles worth of rice and puts them on his plate.
immoral_action: Greg takes the ladle and pours six ladles worth of rice on his plate so the rice is overflowing and dropping on the ground.

norm: It's good to care about not disturbing others.
situation: Erin, who lives in an apartment with a roommate, is doing a late night gaming session and music helps her skills get into rhythm.
intention: Erin wants to do well in the game.
moral_action: Erin puts on headphones to listen to her music on and is able to play better.
immoral_action: Erin turns up some music through the speakers and her focus is improved.

norm: It's good not to cancel plans.
situation: Ally had plans with Mike to go to the movies, but she has to work late.
intention: Ally wants to stay late at work.
moral_action: Ally calls Mike to see if he can reschedule his plans with her.
immoral_action: Ally cancels her plans with Mike and stays late at her job.

norm: It is good to not ignore pain.
situation: Marco is working on an important project at work when he notices that his tooth is starting to bother him and his gums are swelling up.
intention: Marco wants to make sure he has enough time to finish his project before the workday is over.
moral_action: Marco takes a short break to call his dentist and schedules an appointment for the same evening after work.
immoral_action: Marco decides that the pain will likely subside, and he ignores it while focusing on his work.

norm: It is good to avoid conflict.
situation: Nate is a new recruit in the army and is getting insulted by some other new recruits.
intention: Nate wants to stop the insults.
moral_action: Nate walks up to the new recruits and begins joking and making friends with them.
immoral_action: Nate walks up to the new recruits and starts pushing them around, threatening them if they don't stop.

norm: It is good to not complain too much.
situation: Heather deals with chronic pain and has friends who are free-spirited and light.
intention: Heather wants to hang out with her friends.
moral_action: Heather accepts and deals with her condition without making it the only topic of discussion with her friends.
immoral_action: Heather sees her friends every week, but talks about about her pain nonstop when they are together.

norm: It's rude to answer a phone while helping a customer.
situation: There is a long line at the counter where Pedro works at the bakery.
intention: Pedro wants to sell a cake.
moral_action: Pedro puts his phone on silent and is attentive to his many customers, and checks it on his break.
immoral_action: Pedro answers his cell phone in the middle of a transaction for an expensive wedding cake without greeting the customer.

norm: It's rude to ignore someone on a business call.
situation: Cameron is on a conference call with an important client when his favorite coworker, Dan, walks into his office with donuts.
intention: Cameron wants to enjoy a donut.
moral_action: Cameron quietly thanks Dan while grabbing a donut, then enjoys it silently as he continues his conversation with the client.
immoral_action: Cameron asks the client to hold, and spends the next twenty minutes joking around with Dan over donuts.

norm: It is rude to fight at a private event.
situation: Sally is attending her work holiday party where she will see an old coworker she has been upset with for a long time.
intention: Sally wants to tell this coworker what she thinks of her.
moral_action: Sally approaches the old coworker and gives her a backhanded compliment, while staying polite.
immoral_action: Sally approaches the old coworker and grabs her by the shoulder before telling her off loudly.

norm: Not voting in an election is inexcusable and ignorant behavior.
situation: Ronald is very unhappy with the current governor of his state.
intention: Ronald wants to do something to get him out.
moral_action: Ronald decides to vote for the governor's opponent in the next election.
immoral_action: Ronald decides to tweet at the governor on twitter all day, and nothing else.

norm: It's rude to use a relative's computer without their knowledge.
situation: Kevin is at his aunt's house, which has his aunt's computer that has unsaved info on it, and has to send an important email.
intention: Kevin wants to send the important email.
moral_action: Kevin asks his aunt if he can use the computer to send an email.
immoral_action: Kevin logs on to his aunt's computer without asking, closes the open programs, and sends the email.

norm: It's rude to not help your elders struggling with technology.
situation: Alana is at her grandparents home, and they keep asking her questions about emails they've been receiving in their spam folder.
intention: Alana wants to move to a different subject.
moral_action: Alana explains what the spam folder is and the dangers of scam emails before changing the subject.
immoral_action: Alana tells her grandparents not to worry about the emails and starts talking about something different.

norm: It's frowned upon to share political views at work.
situation: Tony is sitting with his coworkers in the break room at work.
intention: Tony wants to talk to his coworkers.
moral_action: Tony starts a conversation with his coworkers about the project they are working on.
immoral_action: Tony starts a conversation with his coworkers about the politics of the nation.

norm: It's rude to pretend to be your twin at work.
situation: Gary was sick and couldn't afford to take the day off, his twin Terry gets an idea.
intention: Terry wants to resolve the money issue.
moral_action: Terry finds another way to make money to make up for the loss of one day's pay for Gary.
immoral_action: Terry goes to Gary's job and pretends to be him and works.

norm: It's rude to go on a political tirade in public.
situation: Violet is in the grocery store and thinks the prices are outrageous.
intention: Violet wants to complain about the prices.
moral_action: Violet complains about the prices to her friends quietly.
immoral_action: Violet starts ranting about late stage capitalism and how the store is exploiting them all.

norm: It's unseemly to talk about politics with patients.
situation: Dr. Carlos, a staunch liberal in regard to politics, practices family medicine and is talking with a patient that takes a conservative view.
intention: Dr. Carlos wants to maintain a conversation.
moral_action: Dr. Carlos starts talking with the patient about neutral topics such as family and work.
immoral_action: Dr. Carlos starts talking about the need for government to provide more rights and services to its people, including a basic universal income.

norm: It's nice to do something special for one's partner.
situation: Ron has a long day at work and it's late before he leaves, his wife, Sam, has been ill.
intention: Ron wants to get home as soon as possible.
moral_action: Ron heads home quickly, stopping shortly at the store for dinner and some medication for his wife.
immoral_action: Ron heads home quickly as possible and finds his wife sick in bed with nothing to eat for dinner.

norm: It's nice to celebrate anniversaries.
situation: James' wife Sandy mentions that their wedding anniversary is coming up and asks him if he's planned anything.
intention: James wants to respond to Sandy's question.
moral_action: James tells Sandy that he has planned something but that it's a surprise, and she'll have to wait.
immoral_action: James tells Sandy that since it's just another day in their ordinary life he hasn't planned anything.

norm: It's good to celebrate things with people.
situation: Lily's grandmother, who hasnt seen her sister Mary in years, has an upcoming birthday party.
intention: Lily wants to contact her grandmother's sister.
moral_action: Lily calls Mary to tell invite her to her grandmother's party.
immoral_action: After the party is over, Lily calls her grandmother's sister, Mary.

norm: It's polite to clap for others' performances.
situation: Jill's classmate is performing a dance for the class that ends with a flourish.
intention: Jill wants to react to her classmate's performance.
moral_action: Jill joins the class in a round of applause for the dancer.
immoral_action: Jill just stares at her classmate blankly as the rest of the class claps in appreciation.

norm: It's fun to look forward to special events
situation: Colleen is looking forward to going back to school.
intention: Colleen wants to mark important events on the school calendar.
moral_action: Colleen marks tests as well as school dances and sports events on the calendar.
immoral_action: Colleen only marks when big tests will take place.

norm: It's good to strive to be inclusive when throwing celebrations.
situation: As Tony develops plans for a surprise birthday party for his wife, he evaluates the guest list.
intention: Tony must decide if he wants to invite people he would like to have at the party, or people his wife would like to have there.
moral_action: Tony only considers who he believes his wife would want to see, as he populates the guest list for her party.
immoral_action: Tony decides to omit a few of his wife's cousins, who he finds annoying, from the guest list.

norm: It's good to celebrate when someone has a special event.
situation: Liam's wife has told him she just got a promotion at work.
intention: Liam wants to respond to his wife about the promotion.
moral_action: Liam says that they should go out for a fancy dinner to mark the occasion.
immoral_action: Liam says getting a promotion is nice and goes about his day.

norm: It's good to clap to encourage performers.
situation: Jones is at a concert with his friends and the band finishes a song.
intention: Jones wants to decide to clap or not.
moral_action: Jones claps for the band even though it wasn't his favorite song.
immoral_action: Jones didn't like the song, so he thinks the band is lucky he's not booing.

norm: It's good to celebrate with your friends.
situation: Blane's friend Giovanni won a million dollars on a game show, and he's throwing a party.
intention: Blane wants to decide to go to the party or not.
moral_action: Blane goes to the party to celebrate with his friend.
immoral_action: Blane is envious of Giovanni for winning the money, so he stays home.

norm: It's nice to surprise your partner.
situation: Jerry and his wife have been married for a long time and have a routine where they eat microwave dinners.
intention: Jerry wants to figure out dinner.
moral_action: Jerry takes his wife to a fancy restaurant as a surprise.
immoral_action: Jerry makes microwave dinners that they have in the fridge.

norm: It's good to want to celebrate your relationship with another.
situation: Phil's and Judy's tenth wedding anniversary is coming up in two weeks.
intention: Phil wants to plan what to do on his anninversary.
moral_action: Phil rents the honeymoon suite at a five-star hotel for his anniversary and buys a diamond necklace to give to Judy.
immoral_action: Phil buys tickets to a football game on his anniversary and invites his best friend to go with him.

norm: It's good to surprise your kids.
situation: Doug is the father of two kids and is doing some shopping before Christmas.
intention: Doug wants to buy some presents for his kids.
moral_action: Doug decides to buy expensive toys that his kids always wanted.
immoral_action: Doug buys some generic sweaters as presents for his kids.

norm: It's nice to get people a surprise.
situation: Trent is happy because he won some money in the lottery, but his wife is sad because she's struggling at work.
intention: Trent wants to spend his lottery winnings.
moral_action: Trent blindfolds his wife and takes her to a spa resort for the weekend and pays to have her pampered for two days.
immoral_action: Trent books himself a trip to Las Vegas for the weekend.

norm: It's bad to try to snoop about families' secrets.
situation: Sam is invited to a family reunion and hasn't seen most of the guests in years.
intention: Sam wants to catch up and see how everyone is doing.
moral_action: Sam goes around speaking with everyone and asks what they've been up to.
immoral_action: Sam is overly nosey during the reunion and secretly listens in on other conversations.

norm: It's bad to not invite close friends to important events.
situation: Sue is getting married and is sending out wedding invitations, keeping in mind that her two best friends Betty and Jane aren't getting along.
intention: Sue doesn't want to upset her friends and wants to have a great wedding without any drama.
moral_action: Sue doesn't take sides and invites both friends to the wedding.
immoral_action: Sue is closer friends with Jane, so she doesn't invite her friend Betty to the wedding.

norm: It's hurtful to not invite family to big events.
situation: Jeff and Jen are planning their wedding and trying to decide what kind of ceremony they'd prefer.
intention: Jeff wants to settle the matter.
moral_action: Jeff convinces Jen to have a big wedding with as many invitees as possible.
immoral_action: Jeff convinces Jen to elope with him to Vegas for a private ceremony.

norm: It's bad to keep your phone number from your employer.

norm: You shouldn't take someone else's medication without permission
