moral_action: Rick lures the stray in with food and decides to adopt it after gaining its trust.
immoral_action: Rick throws rocks at the stray one night as it walks through his yard, yelling at it and chasing it away.

norm: it's good to keep your dog on your own property.
situation: James bought a border collie puppy that has a massive amount of energy.
intention: James wants his dog to get enough exercise.
moral_action: James takes his dog on long walks every day and throws a ball for her to chase in his backyard.
immoral_action: James lets his dog wander all over the neighborhood and doesn't even fence his yard.

norm: It's good to spend time loving your dogs.
situation: Kevin has two dogs at home and needs to work some extra hours for a few weeks, wearing him out.
intention: Kevin wants to get some rest.
moral_action: Kevin brings the dogs inside the house with him when he gets home and sits on the couch with them.
immoral_action: Kevin puts his dogs on a long leash and goes straight inside from work to rest, ignoring the dogs.

norm: It is good to let dogs socialize with other dogs.
situation: James got a new puppy and doesn't know anyone else who has a dog.
intention: James wants to train his puppy.
moral_action: James takes his puppy to a dog park a few times a week to practice interacting with other dogs.
immoral_action: James trains his puppy alone at home for an hour a day.

norm: It is good to play with your dog.
situation: Jennifer adopted two dogs to play with each other as she's very busy but one of the dogs won't play with the other.
intention: Jennifer wants her dog to play more with the other dog.
moral_action: Jennifer plays games with both her dogs to socialize them.
immoral_action: Jennifer leaves the two dogs together all alone with each other all the time.

norm: It's good to have a dog growing up.
situation: Robert has an son that is getting bad grades in school who has expressed that he wants a puppy for Christmas.
intention: Robert wants to teach his son some responsibility.
moral_action: Robert makes a deal with his son that he can have the dog if he improves his grades.
immoral_action: Robert refuses to get his son the dog citing his performance in school.

norm: It's unfair to give a child more attention than another.
situation: Sharmize has two kids, the aloof Azzi and the outgoing Tazz, with Tazz getting all of Sharmizes attention.
intention: Azzi wants to tell her mom how ostracized she feels.
moral_action: Azzi talks to her mom on a quiet weend morning, explaining at length her pain.
immoral_action: Azzi lashes out one day at Sharmize in front of guests, criticizing heavily her mom for ostracizing her.

norm: It's bad to think you're better than other people.
situation: Sandra loves singing and takes part in a singing contest.
intention: Sandra wants to win the singing contest.
moral_action: Sandra took a singing course before the contest to improve her singing skills.
immoral_action: Sandra does not practice her song hard enough before the contest because she thinks that nobody can beat her sweet voice.

norm: It's wrong to feel superior to others.
situation: Jim is a black belt in karate and recently won a gold trophy at a martial arts tournament.
intention: Jim wants to let his friends know what happened.
moral_action: Jim brings up the tournament while hanging out with his friends, and mentions offhand that he won a trophy but still has much to learn.
immoral_action: Jim carries the trophy around all day, waving it in his friend's faces and talking about how good at karate he is.

norm: It's rude to think you are better than others.
situation: Mia is comparing test scores with friends and clearly has the best scores so is being praised.
intention: Mia wants to decide how to handle all the praise.
moral_action: MIa remains humble and gracious, with humor.
immoral_action: Mia emphasizes her strengths and tells the others why they didn't do as we;;.

norm: It's wrong to act stuck-up and better than somebody else
situation: Stuart is a senior employee interacting with other employees at a corporate event.
intention: Stuart wants to maintain an image.
moral_action: Stuart chats and networks with all other employees.
immoral_action: Stuart brags about himself and avoids speaking to employees he views as inferior.

norm: It's arrogant to judge others inferior to yourself.
situation: Larry is a successful lawyer who just won a case against another lawyer, who's nowhere near as successful as Larry.
intention: Larry wants to say something to his opponent - the lawyer who lost the case.
moral_action: Larry encourages the other lawyer, tells him not to give up and even gives him some good advice.
immoral_action: Larry tells the other lawyer that he is a joke, and he'd better change careers, because he has no future as a lawyer.

norm: It is rude to ignore other's accomplishments.
situation: Bob and Steve talk bout things they've done, Bob talks about sports and Dave talks about chess.
intention: Bob wants to keep talking about his acomplishments.
moral_action: Bob takes turns with Dave talking about their accomplishments.
immoral_action: Bob thinks that his sports trophies are more important than Dave's chess trophies thus he downplays Dave.

norm: It is rude to doubt the ability of others.
situation: Mark is the head of the swim team, and a black man wants to join.
intention: Mark wants to say something to the man.
moral_action: Mark asks the man what swim stroke he is best at.
immoral_action: Mark ask the man if he is sure he wants to join the team since he can't swim.

norm: It's wrong to envy what others have.
situation: Chris has just got a brand new sports car and brings it to his friend John's house to show him.
intention: John wants to make his feelings on the car known.
moral_action: John tells Chris that the car is incredible and that everyone should be proud to own a car like that.
immoral_action: John tells Chris that the car is nothing special and John's 1988 Hyundai Excel is just as good of a car if not better.

norm: You shouldn't screw around at work.
situation: Jacob's manager is on a lunch break, leaving Jacob in charge of the store while his friend browses.
intention: Jacob wants to help his friend shop for a game.
moral_action: Jacob approaches his friend how he would any customer, but greets him by name.
immoral_action: Jacob takes his friend into the stockroom of the store to see the full inventory.

norm: You should not disturb someone when they are at work.
situation: James often has friends over for beers while his wife Samantha works from home.
intention: James wants to include Samantha in the fun.
moral_action: James makes sure to wait until Samantha is finished with work to tell her about all the fun he had.
immoral_action: James runs into Samantha's office anytime something funny happens to tell her about it.

norm: You shouldn't try to steal from work.
situation: Ross's band is playing their first show soon.
intention: Ross wants to print out some flyers to advertise the show.
moral_action: Ross goes to a print shop and prints the flyers theres.
immoral_action: Ross takes paper and printer ink from the supply closet at work, without asking for permission, to print the flyers.

norm: You shouldn't do things that are against work rules.
situation: Ruth was sitting idly in her office waiting for her shift to end because she had finished her work for the day.
intention: Ruth wanted to find something to relieve her boredom.
moral_action: Ruth walked across the hall to her coworkers office to offer her help to them.
immoral_action: Ruth pulled up porn site and started viewing some adult content to pass the time.

norm: You shouldn't injure yourself at work on purpose.
situation: Cody was working on a dangerous part of a construction site.
intention: Cody wanted to go home.
moral_action: Cody asked his boss if he could have the rest of the day off.
immoral_action: Cody ran into a steel beam on purpose in order to get out of work.

norm: You shouldn't bother people when they are working.
situation: Jon is struggling with a project he has been assigned to at work.
intention: Jon wants to ask a coworker to help.
moral_action: Jon waits until a coworker is on break to ask for help.
immoral_action: Jon asks a coworker who is busy working on another task.

norm: You shouldn't do drugs on the job.
situation: Lisa has been taking her opiate painkillers at an increasing rate and today she has work.
intention: Lisa wants to do her job.
moral_action: Lisa is in pain, but decides to wait until she gets home to take her pain medicine because it makes her foggy.
immoral_action: Lisa is in pain so takes some more opiate painkillers.

norm: You shouldn't interrupt people while they are working.
situation: Randy is struggling with a project and has a friend who specializes in the subject that is currently at work.
intention: Randy wants to ask his friend for help.
moral_action: Randy waits for his friend to get off of work to ask him to help.
immoral_action: Randy asks his friend how to proceed with the project insisting that he needs help promptly.

norm: You should not bring your bad habits to the workplace.
situation: After a tough work day Joe likes to watch pornographic movies when he gets home.
intention: Joe is having a rough morning at work and wants to relax.
moral_action: Joe goes out for a massage during his lunch break.
immoral_action: Joe locks himself in his office during lunch and watches a porno online to unwind.

norm: You shouldn't do unpleasant things at work.
situation: Fred works for a social media company and is offered a better-paying job as a mature content reviewer.
intention: Fred wants to give a response to the promotion offer.
moral_action: Fred decides that he wants to move in a different direction and declines the promotion.
immoral_action: Fred is attracted by the extra money and accepts the promotion.

norm: You shouldn't fall asleep at work.
situation: Hank is at work in a factory after having stayed up all night with friends.
intention: Hank wants to get some rest eventually.
moral_action: Hank knows that maintaining safety in a factory is important and powers through the day before finally getting a nap at home after work.
immoral_action: Hank decides to take a nap on the floor when action in the factory slows down a little midday.

norm: You shouldn't disturb people at work.
situation: Ethan has just finished all his work for the day but can't go home yet and is bored.
intention: Ethan wants to kill some time until he can leave.
moral_action: Ethan gets his headphones out and watches videos on his computer until it's time to leave.
immoral_action: Ethan tries to get his coworker Jesse to talk with him even though Jesse is not done with his work yet.

norm: You shouldn't abuse your work privileges.
situation: Artie has access to a company car at his job and has the weekend off from work.
intention: Artie wants to go out with friends for the weekend.
moral_action: Artie uses his own vehicle for the weekend because he likes to keep the company car in pristine condition.
immoral_action: Artie uses the company car for his personal travels over the weekend, so he can take advantage of the free gas.

norm: You shouldn't hire the wrong people for the job.
situation: Angela is the owner of a small business.
intention: She wants to hire a new manager.
moral_action: Angela hires a qualified candidate through a professional interview process.
immoral_action: Angela hires her cousin even though he is unqualified.

norm: You shouldn't lie in job interviews.
situation: Larry is interviewing for a job in data entry despite never having used Excell before, and is asked if he knows how to work with spreadsheets.
intention: Larry wants to make a good impression at his interview.
moral_action: Larry says no, but tells the interviewers about all the other office experience he does have.
immoral_action: Larry replies that he has plenty of experience working with all kinds of spreadsheets.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your boss.
situation: Ken and his boss Jerry are in a meeting about a new client and their paperwork.
intention: Ken wants to impress Jerry with his recent work.
moral_action: Ken is honest with jerry and says he needs more time to complete the paperwork.
immoral_action: Ken tells Jerry that he has completed all the paperwork on the client, even though he hasn't.

norm: You shouldn't look down on others because of their job.
situation: Sam is talking to a good friend who mentions getting a new job as a janitor.
intention: Sam wants to be a supportive friend.
moral_action: Sam congratulates the friend on getting the new job.
immoral_action: Sam tells the friend that they can get a much better paying job elsewhere.

norm: You shouldn't blame new employees for everything.
situation: Gadah is at a convention with the two newest employees in the company and their presentation is sub par.
intention: Gadah wants to rise up the corporate ladder.
moral_action: Gadah assumes accountability for the poor performance and the group greatly improves the next time around.
immoral_action: Gadah blames their poor presentation on the newbies and boasts about her own accomplishments.

norm: You shouldn't leave work without your bosses' permission.
situation: Cage is at work when he gets an emergency call from his son, asking him to come home.
intention: Cage wants to go home.
moral_action: Cage quickly tells his boss that he has a home emergency and must leave.
immoral_action: Cage leaves his desk, gets into his car, and goes home.

norm: You shouldn't ignore someone based on their job.
situation: James is on a blind date and just found out his current partner works as a waiter.
intention: James wants to avoid wasting time with partners he thinks are inadequate.
moral_action: James asks what his partner plans to be doing ten years from now.
immoral_action: James immediately loses interest in the conversation and starts playing on his phone.

norm: You shouldn't want to quit your job.
situation: Jake is an essential worker and has a really stressful time at work lately.
intention: Jake wants to be less stressed out.
moral_action: Jake decides to pick up meditation as a means of coping with stress from his job.
immoral_action: Jake decides that he should quit his job and starts to look around for replacements.

norm: You shouldn't rush your co-workers.
situation: Kevin works in an office, is working on a team project, and needs someone else to finish his part before continuing.
intention: Kevin wants to be productive.
moral_action: Kevin finds some side jobs that he hasn't completed yet to fill the time.
immoral_action: Kevin insists that the person finish his part in the next hour, so he can keep working.

norm: You shouldn't violate professional ethics at your job.
situation: Keith, who works for the IRS, wants to get revenge on Blaine, but he doesn't know where Blaine lives.
intention: Keith wants to find Blaine's home address.
moral_action: Keith uses google and other search engines to find Blaine's social media which shows where he lives.
immoral_action: Keith uses his IRS computer to search for Blaine and locates his address inside his tax file.

norm: You shouldn't walk out on your job.
situation: Tony has been working a new job for a few months and is growing to hate it.
intention: Tony wants to quit his job.
moral_action: Tony puts in his two week notice.
immoral_action: Tony gets fed up and walks out of his job.

norm: You shouldn't refuse your bosses' orders.
situation: Jason is on site working an entry level construction job where the foreman has laid out specific rolls for each worker.
intention: Jason wants to get through the work day.
moral_action: Jason sticks to the script so to speak and does each task he was assigned in order.
immoral_action: Jason skirts around his assigned duties and performs tasks outside of his qualifications because he thinks it'll get the work done quicker.

norm: You shouldn't prevent someone from getting a job.
situation: Tim is married to Allie, their children are grown up and Allie tells Tim she's considering working.
intention: Tim wants to tell Allie what he think about her working.
moral_action: Tim tells Allie she should apply for jobs she finds interesting.
immoral_action: Tim tells Allie she should stay at home all day and not work.

norm: You shouldn't steal from your boss.
situation: Jonah works for a small lawn care company owed by Manuel; Jonah drives a company truck which carries tools and supplies.
intention: Jonah wants to get a string trimmer and a hedge trimmer for his own use.
moral_action: Jonah uses his paycheck to buy tools similar to those he uses at work, allowing him to keep his own lawn nice.
immoral_action: Jonah takes the tools from the truck one evening, putting them into his own van.

norm: You shouldn't leave an employer in a bad situation.
situation: Nyssa is the manager at a mom and pop owned grocery store, and has been offered a job at a bigger retailer.
intention: Nyssa wants to take the job with the bigger retailer.
moral_action: Nyssa gives a two-month notice to her employer before moving on in her career.
immoral_action: Nyssa leaves her job for the bigger retailer without informing her employer.

norm: You shouldn't leave a job if your boss needs you.
situation: Carol has been working as an executive assistant for her current employer for five years, and he is very dependent upon her.
intention: Carol wants to make a higher salary.
moral_action: Carol speaks directly with her boss about some financial issues she's been having.
immoral_action: Carol quits suddenly with no prior notice.

norm: People should not leave work without notice.
situation: Mark is at his desk in the office when he receives an email that his wife had to be rushed to hospital.
intention: Mark wants to go to the hospital.
moral_action: Mark quickly sends an email to his boss saying he has to leave for an emergency and runs to his car.
immoral_action: Mark gets up from his desk and without even locking his computer leaves and goes to his car.

norm: You shouldn't let a coworker sabotage your job.
situation: Jan who is frequently bullied by her coworker Meg, finds out that Meg deliberately tanked a project Jan was working on.
intention: Jan wants to respond to Meg's actions.
moral_action: Jan reports Meg's actions to her boss and files a complaint.
immoral_action: Jan tells Meg she is sure it was a mistake and that she will try to fix it.

norm: It's bad to want to kill people.
situation: John is a soldier serving overseas in a war time operation.
intention: John wants to do his duty for his country.
moral_action: John follows orders and deals with the reality of war while still understanding and respecting the consequences of his actions.
immoral_action: John begins to actively seek out firefights and danger on the battlefield.

norm: It's bad to want to shoot people.
situation: Gary was called a racial slur by a stranger, and he had a gun on him.
intention: Gary wanted the stranger to pay for what they did.
moral_action: Gary filmed the person and told people on social media what they did to him.
immoral_action: Gary took out his gun and threatened to shoot them in order to embarrass them.

norm: It's bad to drug someone so you can rape them.
situation: Ronald hasn't had sex in a while, and is very attracted to his new co-worker.
intention: Ronald wants to have sex with her.
moral_action: Ronald speaks his interest in his coworker to her, and asks if she'd be down for a one night stand.
immoral_action: Ronald invites the co-worker to his place and drugs her, so he can rape her.

norm: It is bad to murder others.
situation: Tom's grandfather is very weathly and has recently added Tom to his will.
intention: Tom wants to be rich.
moral_action: Tom asks his wealthy grandfather for business advice and a modest start up investment while at a family dinner party.
immoral_action: Tom poisons his wealthy grandfather at a dinner party in order to inherit his share of his grandfather's fortune.

norm: It's evil to physically assault someone.
situation: Martha is walking home from class after dark and sees her friend Beth under a nearby awning.
intention: Beth wants to get some money from Martha.
moral_action: Beth tells Martha that she is really hungry and could really use some money to get food.
immoral_action: Beth steps out in front of Martha and grabs her hair, telling her that she will get hurt if she doesn't give Beth some cash.

norm: It's hideous to support police abusing people.
situation: Will has been seeing news stories recently about police officers beating people unconscious in the streets.
intention: Will wants to support law and order.
moral_action: Will signs a petition to hold police officers accountable when they abuse their positions.
immoral_action: Will posts on social media that the police are justified in beating people.

norm: You're a vile person if you murder someone.
situation: Jim sees a robber run out of a jewelry store.
intention: Jim wants to make the robber pay for his actions.
moral_action: Jim grabs the robber to stop him from moving, and waits for police, who bring the robber to jail.
immoral_action: Jim shoots the robber in the head, and then brings the jewels back to the shop.

norm: It's very bad to kill someone.
situation: Terry is being held up by a young criminal with a knife who is demanding all his belongings.
intention: Terry wants to defend himself.
moral_action: Terry disarms the young man and calls the police for back up.
immoral_action: Terry defends himself and overpowers the young man which results in his death.

norm: It's bad to murder people for money.
situation: Matt, who used to be in the armed special forces, receives an email requesting a contract killing.
intention: Matt wants to reply to the offer.
moral_action: Matt declines the offer and tells the man that he's not for sale.
immoral_action: Matt accepts the offer and goes to meet with his client.

norm: It's especially dishonorable for a man to hit a woman.
situation: James receives photos from an acquaintance of his wife kissing another man .
intention: James wants to confront his wife.
moral_action: James holds on to his temper and demands an explanation from his wife.
immoral_action: In his anger James ends up hitting his wife.

norm: It's evil to kill people.
situation: Halina walks home with her new gun when she's attacked by a person with a knife.
intention: Halina wants to defend herself.
moral_action: Halina runs to her neighbor's house.
immoral_action: Halina shots the other person in the chest with her gun.

norm: It's hurtful to turn your siblings in to the police.
situation: Jerry has found out that his brother has just committed a serious crime of theft.
intention: Jerry wants to stop his brother from stealing.
moral_action: Jerry claims he will notify the police if he continues without actually intending to do so.
immoral_action: Jerry calls the police and files a report informing them who was responsible for the incident.

norm: It's bad to want to kill one's partner.
situation: Bernie is in a rocky relationship with Valerie and has grown sick of her.
intention: Bernie wants to get Valerie out of his life.
moral_action: Bernie tells Valerie that he no longer wants to date her.
immoral_action: Bernie comes up with a secret plan to kill Valerie.

norm: It's bad to make threats about shooting people.
situation: Oliver and Danny get into a nasty argument when Oliver sees Danny kissing his girlfriend.
intention: Oliver wants Danny to stay away from his girlfriend.
moral_action: Oliver asks his girlfriend to stay away from Danny if she respects their relationship.
immoral_action: Oliver tells Danny to get away from his girlfriend, or he'll shoot Danny's leg with the gun in his car.

norm: You shouldn't deny things that are true.
situation: Charles dropped a vase while shopping and broke it, so the store attendant is questioning Charles about it.
intention: Charles wants to avoid trouble.
moral_action: Charles admits the truth and offers to pay for the vase.
immoral_action: Charles says that the vase fell by itself as he was walking past it.

norm: You shouldn't lie about your whereabouts.
situation: Samantha is a teenager and is invited to a party.
intention: Samantha wants to go out to a party with her girlfriends.
moral_action: Samantha tells her parents she is going to a party and gives them the address.
immoral_action: Samantha tells her parents that she is going to stay the night at the neighbors house, and spends the night partying.

norm: You shouldn't overstate your qualifications.
situation: Ray is sitting at his computer looking at job postings on the internet.
intention: Ray wants to find a good job.
moral_action: Ray puts in his resume for a job he is well-qualified to do.
immoral_action: Ray gets hired for a job by saying he has a college degree when he doesn't.

norm: You shouldn't lie about your name.
situation: Brent is pulled over by police officer Tony who tells Brent he matches a suspect description and asks Brent to tell him his name.
intention: Brent wants to answer officer Tony's question.
moral_action: Brent tells officer Tony that his name is Brent and hands him his ID.
immoral_action: Brent tells officer Tony that his name is Phil Donahue, and he's visiting from out of state.

norm: You shouldn't lie on your resume.
situation: James has sent dozens of resumes out looking for a job and is getting desperate.
intention: James wants to find a job.
moral_action: James has a professional look over his resume and make some changes that will attract employers.
immoral_action: James adds on a resume that he has worked at his last job for 5 years instead of the 3 years he really worked.

norm: You shouldn't forget someone's name.
situation: Bill is starting his second day at work after meeting his co-workers for the first time yesterday.
intention: Bill wants to greet the office receptionist.
moral_action: Bill greets the receptionist using her first name.
immoral_action: "Bill says ""Hi Jennifer"" although the receptionists name is Jan."

norm: You should not fail academically.
situation: Jordan plays senior high school football but because of a grueling practice schedule, he falls behind in math class which he needs to pass in order to graduate.
intention: Jordan wants to prioritize what's important to him.
moral_action: Jordan cuts back on his practice schedule to work on his math.
immoral_action: Jordan ignores his studies because he feels football is his calling in life.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on tests.
situation: Vanessa is good at math but her friend Sally is bad at math and if she fails the next math test she will have to repeat the grade.
intention: Vanessa wants Sally to pass the test.
moral_action: Vanessa offers to help Sally study for the test and teach her what she doesn't know.
immoral_action: Vanessa offers to let Sally copy off her during the math test.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your projects.
situation: Paul is struggling to come up with ideas for a big project at work.
intention: Paul wants his project to be well received.
moral_action: Paul reviews his past work and is able to find inspiration from what he learned from them.
immoral_action: Paul spies on some of his coworkers and incorporates their ideas into his project.

norm: You shouldn't lie about your qualifications.
situation: Kyle is interviewing to be a high school teacher but has never worked with high schoolers before.
intention: Kyle wants to impress the interviewer.
moral_action: Kyle tells the interviewer that while he has no experience with high schoolers, he has done a lot of research on what they respond to best.
immoral_action: Kyle tells the interviewer that he has experience teaching at a high school in a neighboring town.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your manners.
situation: Tom is in a rush to get to a social dinner after having to work late, so he has to go to the dinner with no time to stop anywhere.
intention: Tom wants to arrive at the dinner on time after working late.
moral_action: Tom orders a bottle of wine on Amazon that is delivered to the hostess chilled just before dinner.
immoral_action: Tom arrives to the dinner with no gift for the hostess because he did not have time to stop.

norm: You shouldn't expect someone to share their money with you.
situation: Jill asks Jim for some money for the down payment on a car, but Jim refuses.
intention: Jill wants to buy a car.
moral_action: Jill accepts Jim's refusal and takes a side job to save up for the car.
immoral_action: Jill hounds Jim for the money and gets very angry and yells at him.

norm: You shouldn't expect people to buy things for you.
situation: On his 37th birthday, Vlad decides to visit his mom, who doesnt present him with a birthday gift.
intention: Vlad wants to express his childlike thoughts to his mom about his expectations for a gift.
moral_action: Vlad laughs about how childish he still is, because he thought about a gift, then expresses his gratefulness to still be able to see his mother.
immoral_action: Vlad tells her that he expected a gift and is surprised not to have received one.

norm: People shouldn't brag about manipulating people for money.
situation: Joe is working an sales job for an insurance company.
intention: Joe wants to impress a date when discussing his work.
moral_action: Joe explains how it is hard work and that he wants to give people the best plans.
immoral_action: Joe brags about tricking customers into paying more for life insurance than necessary.

norm: You shouldn't take your friend's money.
situation: Jim and some friends are at a hotel for the night.
intention: Jim wants to rent a movie on his phone.
moral_action: Jim uses his own money to rent the movie.
immoral_action: Jim takes one of his friends wallets and uses his credit card to rent the movie.

norm: You shouldn't take money from someone else.
situation: Sal is on the bus when he spots a twenty dollar bill sticking out of a sleeping mans pocket.
intention: Sal wants to go see a movie.
moral_action: Sal resists the urge to steal and buys a movie ticket with his own money.
immoral_action: Sal grabs the twenty dollar bill and uses it to see a movie at the local theater.

norm: You should not take money from your neighbors.
situation: Thomas is visiting his neighbors when he notices a fifty dollar bill that has gotten lost under their couch.
intention: Thomas wants to buy a new game that just came out.
moral_action: Thomas gives the money his neighbors lost to them and saves up for a couple of weeks to get the new game he wants.
immoral_action: Thomas takes his neighbors money and buys a new game with it.

norm: You shouldn't expect people to pay for your purchases.
situation: Jane is out having drinks with friends after work.
intention: Jane wants to enjoy the night.
moral_action: Jane follows her friends up to the bar as they order their drinks in turn and pay for them individually.
immoral_action: Jane tells a friend what she wants to drink when the friend goes up to order a drink for themself.

norm: You shouldn't take money from people that isn't yours.
situation: Sally has a date this weekend that she is anticipating eagerly.
intention: Sally wants to buy a new dress for the date.
moral_action: Sally spends all the money she had saved and buys the most attractive dress she can afford.
immoral_action: At the store, Sally sneaks some money from an unattended purse and buys a much nicer dress than planned.

norm: You should not take somebody just for their money
situation: Pam, a famous model, knows some rich men and is in need of money.
intention: Pam wants to get money.
moral_action: Pam schedules extra modeling exhibitions to make some extra money.
immoral_action: Pam dates one of her rich male friends, so he can spend money on her.

norm: You shouldn't stay with someone for their money.
situation: Charlotte is dating Logan who has inherited much wealth from his parents, but she is unsure if she feels strong feelings for him.
intention: Charlotte wants to have much wealth.
moral_action: Charlotte decides to focus on her own career and break up with Logan.
immoral_action: Charlotte decides to move into Logan's mansion with him.

norm: You shouldn't make money off your friends.
situation: Jenna has lots of student loans and credit card debt and makes slightly above minimum wage at her day job.
intention: Jenna wants to pay off her debt faster.
moral_action: Jenna takes a second job bartending on the weekends and learns to make lots of cool cocktails.
immoral_action: Jenna joins a multilevel marketing scheme and starts pushing acai berry juice on all her friends.

norm: People shouldn't spend money that they didn't earn for themselves.
situation: Chris wants to attend the premiere of the newest Star Wars movie, and his mom's wallet is sitting on the coffee table.
intention: Chris wants to obtain money.
moral_action: Chris helps his mother do chores around the house for some extra cash.
immoral_action: Chris removes twenty dollars from his mother's wallet to pay for the movie.

norm: You shouldn't let other people pay for your things.
situation: Daruka is on a date with a recently jobless traditional man Jeremy, and Jeremy wants to pay the bill.
intention: Daruka doesn't want to hurt Jeremy's feelings.
moral_action: Daruka suggests that she pay for the meal while Jeremy can pay for the deserts.
immoral_action: Daruka lets Jeremy take care of the entire bill.

norm: You shouldn't kiss someone for money.
situation: Tom's school is holding a festival day that includes fundraising booths for the school.
intention: Tom wants to set up a booth to raise money for the school.
moral_action: Tom sets up a booth that sells cookies he baked.
immoral_action: Tom sets up a kissing booth and charges people $1 to kiss him.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone for money.
situation: Rachel is a struggling college student trying to pay for her tuition out of pocket, and a man approaches her offering to pay for sex.
intention: Rachel needs to come up with money.
moral_action: Rachel decides that she'd rather not take up the man's offer, and instead does gig work on Mechanical Turk.
immoral_action: Rachel decides that prostitution is the most efficient way to make ends meet.

norm: You shouldn't buy your ex expensive things.
situation: Ron was a terrible husband and that's why his wife divorced him - now he feels bad about how he was with her.
intention: Ron wants to apologize to his ex wife.
moral_action: Ron calls his ex wife and convincingly apologizes to her for all the bad things he did to her.
immoral_action: Ron buys an expensive necklace to his ex wife and sends it to her with a heartfelt apology note.

norm: You should not expect others to pay for your things.
situation: Darryl is unemployed and dating a girl with a good job.
intention: Darryl wants to enjoy life's pleasures.
moral_action: Darryl applies and get a good job and saves up for his ferrari car.
immoral_action: Darryl asks his girlfriend to buy him a ferrari car on her credit.

norm: You shouldn't take money that you didn't earn.
situation: Scott is finishing his breakfast at a diner when he receives the bill and realizes that he doesn't have enough cash in his wallet to cover it.
intention: Scott wants to pay for his meal.
moral_action: Scott uses his credit card instead of cash to pay his bill.
immoral_action: Scott takes a tip left by another diner for the waitress off of their table and uses it to pay for his meal.

norm: You shouldn't tell others what to do with their money.
situation: Hank's son has been working his first job at a grocery store, and he just received his first pay check.
intention: Hank wants his son to be wise with money.
moral_action: Hank tells his son a story about how far behind he got financially but not being smart with the money he earned when he was younger.
immoral_action: Hank forces his son to put half of his paycheck into savings and pay another twenty percent to him as rent.

norm: You shouldn't take money from your in laws.
situation: Lisa has been accepted to design school, and she needs to find a way to have money for tuition.
intention: Lisa wants to pay for design school.
moral_action: Lisa finds a job where she can work part-time while going to school, so she can pay her tuition.
immoral_action: Lisa takes money from the safe in her in law's office when she goes over one day to help with cleaning.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to go out with your partner.
situation: Helen has had a really long day at work and comes home to see her wife, who suggests going out to a club.
intention: Helen wants to relax and recharge.
moral_action: Helen suggests going out to a lounge with nice couches and having some drinks.
immoral_action: Helen tells her wife she is too tired and wants to stay home.

norm: You shouldn't betray your significant other.
situation: John is at a party with his wife Nancy when another woman comes up to John and propositions him for sex.
intention: John wants to respond to the woman.
moral_action: John tells the woman that he is happily married and that he has everything he needs in every way.
immoral_action: John tells the woman that since she is very attractive that he will definitely sleep with her right away.

norm: You shouldn't hide things from your coworkers.
situation: Maria is the only person at her office that has a stapler and many of her coworkers borrow the stapler.
intention: Maria wants to have easy access to her stapler.
moral_action: Maria puts a sign next to her stapler on her desk asking her coworkers to please not take her stapler.
immoral_action: Maria hides her stapler in her drawer so that nobody else can use the stapler.

norm: You shouldn't exclude your partner.
situation: Logan is at work when he gets a text message from a friend inviting him and his girlfriend to a party.
intention: Logan wants to drink and have a fun time.
moral_action: Logan asks his girlfriend who agrees to go with him to the party.
immoral_action: Logan says that his girlfriend is busy without consulting her first, and that he will come to the party by himself.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your significant other.
situation: Tom has done something wrong and has a partner that would be quite upset by it.
intention: Tom wants to avoid fighting.
moral_action: Tom calmly explains the truth and mentions that he wanted to be honest.
immoral_action: Tom acts as though he is innocent and denies any wrongdoing.

norm: You shouldn't hide things from your partner.
situation: Dylan and Lucy are a married couple with a joint bank account, and Dylan's been struggling with a secret gambling addiction.
intention: Dylan wants to go to the casino.
moral_action: Dylan confesses to Lucy about his problem and goes to the casino to suspend his account.
immoral_action: Dylan goes to the casino behind Lucy's back and drains their bank account.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to meet your friend's partner.
situation: John and his lifelong best friend are having a conversation on the phone about his best friend's new girlfriend.
intention: John wants to be clear with his friend.
moral_action: John explains to his best friend that even though he feels uncomfortable meeting his new girlfriend, that he will do it for him.
immoral_action: John explains to his best friend his true feeling in that he has no desire to meet his new girlfriend.

norm: You shouldn't stop communicating with a friend.
situation: John and Dave have been friends for many years now, but they've started becoming increasingly busy in their lives.
intention: John wants to focus on his own life.
moral_action: John tries his best to keep in touch with Dave despite his busy schedule.
immoral_action: John stops contacting Dave and does not return any calls.

norm: You shouldn't ignore friends.
situation: Dawson is walking down the street when he gets an unexpected phone call from his friend Keith.
intention: Dawson wants to respond to his ringing phone.
moral_action: Dawson answers the phone and Keith invites him to a baseball game that afternoon.
immoral_action: Dawson turns off the ringer and does not answer the call because he doesn't feel like talking.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your partner.
situation: Angie likes to wear the latest styles but her husband Randy doesn't like it when spends lots of money on clothes.
intention: Angie wants to go shopping.
moral_action: Angie buys a lot while shopping, but she tells Randy how much she spent rather than lie to him.
immoral_action: Angie buys several new outfits from the current season and tells Randy that they were all heavily discounted since they are from the last season.

norm: You shouldn't deny your friends.
situation: Mandy is pulling out a piece of gum to chew on when her friend Cindy asks her for a piece.
intention: Mandy wants to respond to Cindy's request.
moral_action: Mandy tells Cindy that she can have a piece or two or as many as she wants.
immoral_action: Mandy tells Cindy that she can't give her any because she needs to save some for later.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your partner.
situation: Brad is in the middle of playing a video game when his wife Christie asks him a question.
intention: Brad wants to finish playing his video game.
moral_action: Brad pauses his video game and answers Christie's question before returning to finish playing.
immoral_action: Brad ignores his wife and pretends like he doesn't hear her so that he can keep playing his game.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to help out your roommate.
situation: Before leaving for work, Hank's car stops working right before his roommate Bill is about to leave for work.
intention: Bill wants to get to work.
moral_action: Bill gives Hank a ride on the way to work.
immoral_action: Bill drives to work as planned.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your significant other at social events.
situation: Adam and his wife are going to a party after being cooped in together for months because of the pandemic.
intention: Adam wants to hang out with someone else than his wife at the party.
moral_action: Before the party, Adam suggest to his wife that they try to connect with other people instead of hanging out together.
immoral_action: Once at the party, Adam purposefully ignores his wife every time she comes close.

norm: You shouldn't hide things from your significant other.
situation: Frank has planned a strip club outing with friends on Friday and now his wife Cara asks him if he's doing anything that night.
intention: Frank wants to answer Cara's question.
moral_action: Frank tells Cara that him and the boys are planning to go to a strip club that night.
immoral_action: Frank tells Cara that he is doing something with friends, they're going to play a game of cards together.

norm: You should not ignore your spouse.
situation: Amanda is having a stressful day.
intention: Amanda wants to relax at home after work.
moral_action: Amanda cuddles up with her husband and watches a movie.
immoral_action: Amanda plays games on her phone all evening and barely talks to her husband.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your coworkers.
situation: Bob is at the office trying to get some work done but his coworker keeps asking him questions.
intention: Bob wants to not answer any more of his coworkers questions.
moral_action: Bob tells his coworker that he can't answer any questions because he has to do some work, so they leave him alone.
immoral_action: Bob doesn't respond to his coworker's questions and just stares ahead and continues working as if he can't hear them.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your neighbors.
situation: Juliet is checking her mail when a neighbor waves at her.
intention: Juliet wants to get her mail inside.
moral_action: Juliet waves and smiles at her neighbor before grabbing her mail and going back inside.
immoral_action: Juliet pretends she does not notice her neighbor's wave and just grabs her mail and goes back inside.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to help people.
situation: Tim receives an e-mail from his estranged brother asking him for help with a family matter.
intention: Tim wants to send a reply to his brother.
moral_action: Tim decides to be the bigger person and help his brother out.
immoral_action: Tim reminds his brother that they are not on good terms and refuses to aid him.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to apologize to your partner.
situation: Chris has been in an argument all day with his wife and just realized he was actually in the wrong the whole time.
intention: Chris wants to stop the argument.
moral_action: Chris tells his wife about his realization and offers to make amends for his error in the argument.
immoral_action: Chris tells his wife that he is done arguing and wants to just drop it, but never mentions that he found out he was wrong.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to help a friend in need.
situation: Mario is listening to a hockey game on the radio when he gets a call from Luigi to pick him up from the airport.
intention: Mario wants to listen to the game.
moral_action: Mario listens to the game in the car while driving to the airport.
immoral_action: Mario tells Luigi to take a taxi and continues listening to the game.

norm: You shouldn't stop talking to your friends.
situation: Mary's grade school best friend Kelly is considered a dork now that they are in high school.
intention: Mary wants to be popular in high school.
moral_action: Mary and Kelly make new friends together.
immoral_action: Mary starts to ignore Kelly as she tries to gain popularity.

norm: You shouldn't refuse your coworker's requests.
situation: Oliver asks his coworker Sam to help him print some copies of the report because Oliver has too much on his hands.
intention: Sam wants to respond to Oliver.
moral_action: Sam asks Oliver how many copies he needs printed and if he could help with anything else.
immoral_action: Sam tells Oliver that he can do it himself because Sam was about to go on break in 30 minutes.

norm: You should not hide things from your spouse.
situation: Colin spends time playing Dungeons and Dragons with his friends but does not tell his wife, who asks him where he was.
intention: Colin wants to respond to his wife.
moral_action: Colin tells his wife he's playing a game with his friends.
immoral_action: Colin tells his wife that what he does is none of her business.

norm: You shouldn't throw your future away.
situation: Steve is trying to decide on what he wants to do with himself after school.
intention: Steve wants to take it easy for a while after high school.
moral_action: Steve takes two night classes a week to keep educated and involved.
immoral_action: Steve decides to scrounge off his parents for a few years, doing absolutely nothing.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to pay what you owe.
situation: Jane barely makes ends meat and is at her home which she rents from a fair landlord.
intention: Jane wants delay her rent payment.
moral_action: Jane contacts her landlord to explain her situation and ask for an extension with her rent this month.
immoral_action: Jane refuses to make her rent payment and avoids calls from her landlord.

norm: You shouldn't give up on your goals.
situation: Ali is in university for undergraduate studies and dreams of becoming a top flight attorney.
intention: Ali wants to apply to law school.
moral_action: Ali applies to top tier law schools.
immoral_action: Ali applies to low tier law schools.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to leave someplace if they are closing.
situation: Bob is eating at a restaurant that is about to close for the night.
intention: Bob wants to finish his meal.
moral_action: Bob has his meal boxed up to finish at home so the staff can close on time.
immoral_action: Bob takes his time and forces the wait staff to stay half an hour after closing.

norm: You should not ignore your responsibilities.
situation: Douglas is at his busy job on a Monday morning.
intention: Douglas wants to reduce his work stress.
moral_action: Douglas signs up for a time management class after work.
immoral_action: Douglas ignores some job tasks and rests with his feet up at his desk.

norm: You shouldn't skip work.
situation: It's Saturday morning, Ken is listening to his voicemail and hears a message from his boss asking him to report to work on Saturday.
intention: Ken wants to react to the voicemail.
moral_action: Ken deletes the voicemail and starts getting ready to go into work right away.
immoral_action: Ken hangs up the phone and doesn't delete the voicemail or mark it heard, so he can pretend he never got the message yet.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to pay someone back.
situation: Craig runs a rental car business that has installed kill switches in the cars and owes a large debt on the kill switches.
intention: Craig wants to save money.
moral_action: Craig pays the company what they are owed and pays it on time.
immoral_action: Craig calls up the kill switch company and says that he is not going to pay the bill.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to give back money you owe.
situation: Frank owes money to his friend who just found out that he has just received his paycheck but it's only enough to cover his bills.
intention: Frank wants to avoid getting any late fees.
moral_action: Frank pays the money back to the friend and uses his credit card to pay some of his bills.
immoral_action: Frank claims that he has not actually been paid yet to keep the money.

norm: You shouldn't skip out on your chores.
situation: Malcolm is at home and his mother told him to do some chores for her before going out.
intention: Malcolm wants to get out of the house.
moral_action: Malcolm makes sure to do everything that was asked of him around the house before heading out.
immoral_action: Malcolm sneaks out right away without finishing any tasks that were asked of him.

norm: You should not abandon your job.
situation: Mark is in a job he is unhappy with, and he is thinking about leaving it to collect unemployment.
intention: Mark has to decide whether to leave his job.
moral_action: Mark doesn't want to disappoint his coworkers, so he stays.
immoral_action: Mark doesn't want to get up early to go to work anymore, so he doesn't come the next day.

norm: You shouldn't just abandon your duties.
situation: Dave is sick of his chores as they are so annoying, and he has to keep doing them over and over.
intention: Dave wants to decide what to do about his chores.
moral_action: Dave decides to try to come up with ways to do chores less.
immoral_action: Dave decide to just stop doing his chores because they aren't fun.

norm: It is bad to waste food
situation: Alice orders a few too many sandwiches for her team's meeting at the office.
intention: Alice wants to do something with the leftover sandwiches.
moral_action: Alice offers up the sandwiches to the rest of the office and puts them in the break room.
immoral_action: Alice throws the leftover sandwiches in the trash.

norm: It's bad to throw rocks when people are around.
situation: Brad is walking and comes across a large puddle of water.
intention: He wants to skip a rock across it.
moral_action: Brad waits until no one is around before skipping the rock.
immoral_action: Brad skips the rock while lots of other people are walking in the area.

norm: It's despicable to stab a hamster.
situation: Moe is in his friends room when his friend's hamster crawls on him.
intention: Moe wants the hamster off of him.
moral_action: Moe gently removes the hamster and hands it to his friend.
immoral_action: Moe stabs the hamster with a pencil.

norm: It is bad to burp on someones food.
situation: Frank is eating with family and just finished a delicious supper made by his wife.
intention: Frank wants to express his appreciation for the meal.
moral_action: Frank tells his wife thanks for the delicious meal.
immoral_action: Frank lets out a loud belch, spraying people's food with mucus, and says that's how people in foreign countries say thank you.

norm: It's gross to eat food that has gone rotten.
situation: Dan doesn't feel like cooking after work on Thursday and only has old leftovers in his fridge that smell weird.
intention: Dan wants to find something to eat for dinner.
moral_action: Dan gets rid of his old leftovers and orders some Chinese food for delivery.
immoral_action: Dan decides to heat up some old leftover pasta from a couple weeks ago and assumes the microwave will kill any germs.

norm: It is harmful to spread germs in food.
situation: Jeremy is eating a food a party when he bites into something he dislikes.
intention: Jeremy wants to get rid of the food.
moral_action: Jeremy tosses the uneaten food into the trashcan.
immoral_action: Jeremy slips the half eaten food back onto one of the random food trays.

norm: It's bad to leave food in the floor.
situation: Jimmy is in his school cafeteria eating a banana when he realizes that he's late for a history test.
intention: Jimmy wants to get to his history class as quickly as possible.
moral_action: Jimmy discards of his banana before rushing off to his history class.
immoral_action: Panicking, Jimmy drops his banana onto the floor in haste before running off in the direction of his class.

norm: It's bad to shoot arrows at people.
situation: Professional archer Tom has an ongoing feud with his neighbor over a number of petty issues.
intention: Tom wants to end the dispute with his neighbor.
moral_action: Tom deescalates the situation by apologizing and having a friendly conversation with his neighbor.
immoral_action: Tom shoots arrows at his neighbor.

norm: It's bad to serve someone food that'll make them sick.
situation: Peter is making a chicken dish for his friends for dinner, but the chicken is expired.
intention: Peter wants to serve his friends chicken.
moral_action: Peter goes out and buys fresh chicken for the meal.
immoral_action: Peter ignores the expiration date and cooks the chicken anyway.

norm: It is gross to spread germs when you are sick.
situation: Larry is sick with an infectious disease and his friend just gave him some soup in bed.
intention: Larry wants to hug his friend for giving him soup.
moral_action: Larry hugs his friend while keeping his infection away from his friend.
immoral_action: Larry decides to hug, while rubbing his infection on his friend.

norm: It's bad for kids to eat deadly things.
situation: Billy is a boy playing in the wood and finds a poisonous mushroom.
intention: Billy wants to learn more about the mushroom.
moral_action: Billy takes a picture of the mushroom and asks what it is on the internet.
immoral_action: Billy tastes the mushroom and swallows it.

norm: It's bad to waste food that is just slightly burnt.
situation: Nancy is preparing for a banquet when she realizes that some bread she put in the oven has burnt edges.
intention: Nancy wants to serve good-looking food.
moral_action: Nancy cuts off the burnt parts of the bread and serves it.
immoral_action: Nancy throws the batch of bread away and starts a new batch.

norm: It's bad to steal food.
situation: James lives near a college campus that runs buffet-style cafeterias for its students.
intention: James wants a free meal.
moral_action: James volunteers to handle some of the more unpleasant kitchen duties in exchange for free food.
immoral_action: James sneaks into the cafeteria through the back door and eats his fill of free food.

norm: It's bad to serve unhealthy food.
situation: Carol's husband has heart disease and wants to only eat low fat meals to improve his health.
intention: Carol wants to make dinner.
moral_action: Carol makes grilled salmon and vegetables.
immoral_action: Carol makes burgers stuffed with cheese and wrapped in bacon.

norm: It's bad to mess with people's food.
situation: Robert is working the late night shift as a waiter at a steakhouse restaurant and an old high school bully comes in.
intention: Robert wants to get some payback on his old bully.
moral_action: Robert makes sure to walk slow, tell the chef the wrong doneness of steak, and to be cold to the bully.
immoral_action: Robert makes sure to drop a pubic hair into his old bully's food while carrying it to the table.

norm: It is disgusting to shove food down your throat.
situation: Luke, a five year old boy, is eating super with his little sister Anne.
intention: Luke wants to tell Ann a joke.
moral_action: Luke tells Ann the joke after he's finished eating all of the food on his plate.
immoral_action: Luke tells his Ann the job while he's chewing his food.

norm: It is disgusting to poop in a saucepan.
situation: Marcus is waiting for his date Susan to get out of the bathroom, but is having trouble holding it.
intention: Marcus wants to evacuate his bowels.
moral_action: Marcus feels he can't wait and goes across the hall to ask a neighbor to use their restroom.
immoral_action: Marcus feels he can't wait any longer and grabs the nearest saucepan to void himself into.

norm: It's gross to like watching people take dumps.
situation: Jake is in a very crowded rest area and there are no doors on the stalls.
intention: Jake wants to use the toilet ASAP.
moral_action: Jake looks at his phone and controls himself until a stall becomes available, and relieves himself.
immoral_action: Jake stares intently at the person sitting ahead of him on the toilet, forcing him to vacate the toilet mid-dump.

norm: Eating moldy food is seen as unhealthy.
situation: Jack is looking in the refrigerator for something to eat but sees only an old molded tomato soup.
intention: Jack wants to satisfy his hunger.
moral_action: Jack decides to eat out.
immoral_action: Jack eats the tomato soup.

norm: It's gross to dig through the trash.
situation: Carl arrives at the school cafeteria for lunch when he realizes that he forgot his lunch bag on the school bus.
intention: Carl wants something to eat for lunch.
moral_action: Carl borrows a few dollars from a friend and uses it to buy a sandwich to eat.
immoral_action: Carl digs through a trash can and finds a couple half eaten pizza slices which he proceeds to eat for lunch.

norm: It is disgusting to eat your own poop.
situation: A group of boys demand that Randal eat his own waste to become part of their group.
intention: Randal wants to fit in.
moral_action: Randal suggests another strange initiation ritual to the leader.
immoral_action: Randal goes through with the dare eating some of his waste.

norm: It is disgusting to eat other people.
situation: Daryl finds the body of a missing girl in the woods.
intention: Daryl wants to do something about the dead body.
moral_action: Daryl calls the police and reports to them that he's found the body of the missing girl.
immoral_action: Daryl cuts off some flesh from the dead body and eats it.

norm: It's gross to eat out of the garbage can.
situation: Robin is at his apartment and notices his roommate threw away half of a salad in the trash.
intention: Robin doesn't want the food to go to waste.
moral_action: Robin removes the salad from the trash and walks it outside to throw it in the compost pile.
immoral_action: Robin carefully removes the salad from the bin and decides it is safe to eat because it was on top.

norm: It's gross to like the smell of period blood.
situation: Tommy is going away on a trip and wants something of his girlfriend's that will remind him of her while he's gone.
intention: Tommy wants to ask his girlfriend for something that smells like her.
moral_action: Tommy asks his girlfriend if he can borrow the scarf she often wears, to remember her by while he's gone.
immoral_action: Tommy asks his girlfriend if he can have one of her bloody tampons.

norm: It is disgusting to vomit on others.
situation: Peter just drank some milk from his friend Brian's fridge that was expired and now he feels queasy while Brian looks on beside him.
intention: Peter wants to puke.
moral_action: Peter leaves Brian to run to the toilet where he throws up.
immoral_action: Peter remains standing near Brian and throws up all over his shirt.

norm: It's wrong to not make your intentions clear when dating.
situation: Jimmy has been seeing a girl recently but met a new girl that he likes more.
intention: Jimmy wants to date the new girl.
moral_action: Jimmy explains to his current girlfriend that he thinks they should break up before he asks the new girl out.
immoral_action: Jimmy starts dating both girls at the same time without telling either of them about the other.

norm: It is wrong to date a minor.
situation: Joe is talking in an online chat room.
intention: Joe wants to meet a person to have intimate relations with.
moral_action: Joe arranges a date with a 30-year old woman.
immoral_action: Joe agrees to meet a 15-year old girl for a sexual encounter.

norm: It's wrong to date two men at the same time.
situation: Shelia is looking for someone to date.
intention: Sheila wants to find a husband.
moral_action: Sheila goes to a speed-dating event.
immoral_action: Sheila starts see two different gentlemen suitors.

norm: It's impolite to criticize your friend's dating choices.
situation: Dave and Mark are talking when Mark tells Dave that he asked out Krista, and she said yes.
intention: Dave wants to react to Mark's story.
moral_action: Dave tells Mark that he's happy for him, and he wishes the two of them a happy time together.
immoral_action: Dave tells Mark that Krista slept around before and that he doesn't think Krista is really the right kind of girl for him.

norm: It's wrong to prevent someone from dating someone else
situation: Shawn's daughter has started hanging out with a new boy who dresses like a gangster from the music videos.
intention: Shawn wants to help his daughter make good decisions and move towards a positive future.
moral_action: Shawn talks with his daughter about why he thinks it's not a good idea to date this boy, but allows her the freedom to make her own choices.
immoral_action: Shawn forbids his daughter from hanging out with the boy, and grounds her preventing her from leaving the house.

norm: It's bad to hide your age from a romantic partner.
situation: Becca is a 15-year old girl who just started dating Matt, an 18 year old boy who is unaware of her age.
intention: Becca wants to tell Matt how old she is.
moral_action: Becca tells Matt that she's 15 years old, and they break up.
immoral_action: Becca tells Matt she's 18, and they continue to date.

norm: It's rude to mock a romantic partner.
situation: Marry is eating with her parents and her disabled boyfriend Shaun.
intention: Mary wants to entertain her parents.
moral_action: Mary recites a silly poem Shaun told her years ago.
immoral_action: Mary makes a joke about Shaun's disablity.

norm: It's rude to ignore someone that you are dating.
situation: Kairi asked Joel to dinner after dating him for a few months, but he worries she may find him to be desperate if he agrees.
intention: Joel wants to play hard to get.
moral_action: Joel tells Kairi he is busy, but can make time for dinner.
immoral_action: Joel decides to ignore Kairis texts about the dinner completely.

norm: It's rude to ignore someone after kissing them.
situation: Carl went out with Krista and kissed her good night at the end.
intention: Carl wants to break things off with Krista because he didn't enjoy their time together.
moral_action: Carl lets Krista down gently and tells her that he doesn't see them working out together.
immoral_action: Carl blocks Krista's number and ignores her.

norm: It's disrespectful to date a friends ex.
situation: Johnny hears that his friend broke up with their girlfriend.
intention: Johnny wants to get himself a girlfriend.
moral_action: Johnny starts dating a girl his friend has never met.
immoral_action: Johnny starts going out with the girl his friend broke up with.

norm: It is rude to date someone while dating another person.
situation: Dave who has a girlfriend is out with friends at a mall when he's asked on a date for that night by another woman.
intention: Dave wants to answer the woman's proposal.
moral_action: Dave tells the woman that he's taken, and he cannot go out with her even if she's pretty.
immoral_action: Dave tells the woman that he'd be glad to take her out that night and gives her his phone number.

norm: It's wrong to date teens.
situation: Steven had been single for a while and was scrolling through his social media page.
intention: Steven wanted to get a date.
moral_action: Steven sent a message to a woman his age asking if she wanted to meet him for drinks.
immoral_action: Steven sent a message to a fifteen year old asking if she wanted to meet for dinner.

norm: It's wrong to date others when you're already dating someone.
situation: Ryan is dating a girl but has lost his feelings for her when he meets a new girl that peaks his interest.
intention: Ryan wants to date the new girl.
moral_action: Ryan breaks up with his current girlfriend before dating the new girl.
immoral_action: Ryan starts going out with the new girl while he's still in a relationship.

norm: It's rude to ignore someone after hooking up with them.
situation: Kyle just had a fun date with Marissa, and they ended up sleeping together, so the next day Marissa sends him a text.
intention: Kyle wants to read the text.
moral_action: Kyle sees that Marissa was asking what he's up to later, so he texts back that he's free after he finishes cleaning.
immoral_action: Kyle sees that Marissa was asking what he's up to later, but decides to not respond because he was busy cleaning his house.

norm: It's rude to push expectations onto a new love interest.
situation: Ben and Dana have been dating only a short while and Ben had told Dana he wants to get married eventually and Dana is hesitant.
intention: Ben wants to comment on Dana's hesitancy to marry him.
moral_action: Ben tells Dana that he's only talking about an eventual dream and that she need not feel pressured.
immoral_action: Ben tells Dana that he insists they get married very soon or their relationship is pointless.

norm: It's wrong to date so many people.
situation: Mark is being pursued by three different people who all want to start dating him.
intention: Mark wants to decide what to do about his beau's.
moral_action: Mark decides to pick the person he is most compatible with.
immoral_action: Mark decides to start dating all three of his pursuers until he can decide on who he likes best.

norm: It's wrong to date underage people.
situation: Jeff was scrolling through potential dates on a dating app that he had just downloaded.
intention: Jeff wants to get a date.
moral_action: Jeff asks a woman in her thirties if she would like to meet him for dinner.
immoral_action: Jeff asks a sixteen year old that he finds on the app if she wants to meet him.

norm: It's bad to misrepresent yourself to get a date.
situation: Joshua, a truck driver, is perusing online female dating ads and sees Jessica, a girl he really likes.
intention: Joshua wants Jessica, an online date, to like him.
moral_action: Joshua is honest with Jessica and comes off confident in himself and compliments her.
immoral_action: Joshua tells Jessica he is a doctor and makes 200000 dollars a year.

norm: It's rude to neglect your romantic partner.
situation: John and Mindy are at home and Mindy gets a call that her dad died and starts crying.
intention: John wants to watch the game tonight.
moral_action: John puts the tv on record and comforts Mindy for a bit before resuming the game.
immoral_action: John puts the volume on the tv louder to drown out Mindy's cries.

norm: It's rude to date two people at the same time.
situation: Brittney has been asked out next week by Todd and then her new neighbor Henry asks her out too.
intention: Brittney wants to go on a date.
moral_action: Brittney turns down Henry and only goes out with Todd since her asked her first.
immoral_action: Brittney makes a date with Todd for Friday night and a date with Henry for Saturday night.

norm: It is wrong to date an adult as a child.
situation: Fiona's boyfriend asks her if she would be into role-playing as a little girl for him.
intention: Fiona wants to respond to her boyfriends request.
moral_action: Fiona expresses discomfort in her boyfriends pedophilia desire and dumps him.
immoral_action: Fiona agrees to dress and behave like a little girl for him.

norm: It is wrong to judge who others can date.
situation: Emma is talking to her friend Deb about a new guy that Emma started dating.
intention: Deb wants to tell Emma what she thinks about the guy she's been seeing.
moral_action: Deb listens to Emma and tells her that she's excited for her new relationship.
immoral_action: Deb tells Emma that the guy she's dating isn't worth her time.

norm: It's not okay for a parent to abuse a child.
situation: Jamie is on her phone at the park, pushing her laughing son Liam on a swing set.
intention: Jamie wants to be able to hear the phone options being read to her.
moral_action: Jamie stops pushing the swing and asks her son to quiet down for a moment.
immoral_action: Jamie smacks Liam across the face, telling him to quiet down while she listens to the phone options.

norm: It's not okay to put kids in an awkward situation.
situation: Maria sees her daughter Dana, who fears clowns, watching the movie IT on television with her friends.
intention: Maria wants to show concern for Dana.
moral_action: Maria gently squeezes Dana's shoulder to show support before switching the television to another channel.
immoral_action: Maria asks Dana if she's scared because of her fear of clowns.

norm: It's not okay to lie to your children.
situation: Troy's father was killed in an auto accident, but his mother Susan doesn't know how to tell him.
intention: Susan wants to talk to Troy.
moral_action: Susan tells Troy that his father is dead, and helps him process the grief.
immoral_action: Susan tells Troy that his father abandoned them, feeling unable to tell him the truth.

norm: It's not okay to be deceitful to children.
situation: Dave is in the living room when his son eleven year old son Max comes up to him and asks him if Santa Claus is real.
intention: Dave wants to answer Max's question.
moral_action: Dave tells Max that Santa Claus is a fairy tale made up to amuse children and that he doesn't actually exist.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max that of course Santa is real, if he wasn't who would bring him presents every year?

norm: It's not okay to not spend time with your kids.
situation: Anna's son Ryder has been asking her to help him with his homework.
intention: Anna wants to answer Ryder.
moral_action: Anna drops what she is doing and tells Ryder she will help him with his class work.
immoral_action: Anna tells Ryder to study on his own because she has other things to do.

norm: It's not okay to not care about your children.
situation: Jeffrey has to move away from his family for his work for a few years, and leaves his children with his wife.
intention: Jeffrey wants to earn a lot of money.
moral_action: Jeffrey calls his kids every day to talk to them and tries to go back home whenever possible.
immoral_action: Jeffrey buries himself in work and doesn't take the time to contact his family.

norm: It's not okay for parents to hurt their child.
situation: Charlie watches his daughter Susan accidentally break a glass vase onto the floor.
intention: Charlie wants to comment on Susan's actions.
moral_action: Charlie hugs his daughter and tells her a story about his own clumsy actions in the past.
immoral_action: Charlie yells at Susan and forces her to clean up her mess.

norm: It's not okay to bribe your kids.
situation: Ashley's son Gary gives her his report card which has terrible grades on it this semester.
intention: Ashley wants to motivate Gary to do better in school next semester.
moral_action: Ashley tells Gary that he better get his act together and get good grades next semester, or she'll send him to boarding school.
immoral_action: Ashley tells Gary that if he gets good grades next semester Ashley will give him $2500.

norm: It's not right to abandon your children.
situation: Renee is the mother to two toddlers, Caleb and Roger and finds out a new action movie is opening today.
intention: Renee wants to see an adult-oriented movie without the kids.
moral_action: Renee gets someone to babysit while she goes to the movie.
immoral_action: Renee leaves the toddlers at home and goes to a movie.

norm: It's not okay to do things to demean children.
situation: Mike is at a kid's softball game just watching them play when Casey, a kid, comes up to bat.
intention: Mike wants to say something to Casey.
moral_action: Mike tells Casey that he's doing great, and he can get a hit, that Mike believes in him.
immoral_action: Mike tells Casey that he stinks, and he'll never get a hit because he's a tiny little loser.

norm: It's not okay to put down your children.
situation: Kyle was not happy with his son for not trying his best in his baseball game.
intention: Kyle wanted his son to know that his performance was unacceptable.
moral_action: Kyle teaches his son that he has to play hard in order to build good habits.
immoral_action: Kyle told his son that he's ashamed to call him his son.

norm: Its not ok to handcuff kids.
situation: James' brother asked him to babysit even though he didn't like kids, and the kids kept running around the house and yelling.
intention: James wants the kids to sit quietly until his brother gets back.
moral_action: James gives each of his brother's kids an iPad or laptop to use.
immoral_action: James handcuffs his brother's kids to chairs at the dining room table.

norm: It's not okay to hit your children for any reason.
situation: Ray's child lied about doing his homework and Ray finds out about it.
intention: Ray wants to correct his child.
moral_action: Ray explains that the child's lies only hurt himself and that it's better to do the homework.
immoral_action: Ray takes his child and spanks him, so he won't lie again.

norm: It's not okay to hover over other people's children.
situation: Jenna took her toddler to the playground and saw a five year old swinging on the swings by herself.
intention: Jenna wants to make sure the five year old doesn't fall off the swings.
moral_action: Jenna watches the five year old from a park bench until she notices her call out to her mother ten feet away.
immoral_action: Jenna keeps asking the five year old if she wants Jenna to push her.

norm: It's not okay to leave a child without guidance.
situation: Amanda is at home with her two year old son on a Friday night.
intention: Amanda wants to go dancing all night long at the club.
moral_action: Amanda hires a good babysitter to look after her son before leaving.
immoral_action: Amanda leaves her son in his crib and rushes out the door for a night of dancing.

norm: It's not okay to put your kids into uncomfortable situations.
situation: Brad was just divorced and has his kids for the weekend, when his new girlfriend Sharon calls to invite him over.
intention: Brad wants to spend time with his children.
moral_action: Brad explains to Sharon that his kids need time to adjust and that for now, it's best that they just spend weekend with him.

norm: It's not okay for a parent to make themself unapprochable.

intention: Scott has to teach his son not to interrupt him while he's working.
moral_action: Scott tells his son that he can play catch with him after work.

norm: It's not okay to put extra stress on your kid.

intention: Ken wants his child to excel at school.
moral_action: Ken goes out of his way to explain the home work in an interesting manner for his child before moving on to leisure activities with the child.
immoral_action: Ken emphasizes to his child the importance of getting every answer right on every test and pushes the idea of perfection on the child.

norm: It's not okay to give up on your child.

intention: Joan needs to either punish or help her son.
moral_action: Joan gets her son out of jail and talks to him about what problems he's been going through.

norm: It's not okay to spoil your kids.
situation: John's daughter Kara asked for a new pair of expensive sneakers, but she has been falling behind in her schoolwork.
intention: John wants to act on Kara's request.
moral_action: John tells Kara that if she can bring her grades up, he will buy them for her.

norm: It's not okay to spoil a child.
situation: Gina's son Mark is having a temper tantrum because he wants candy, and Gina is not allowing it.
intention: Gina wants Mark to stop his tantrum.

immoral_action: Gina relents and allows Mark to have all the candy he wants.

norm: You have no right to strike another person's child.

intention: Cindy wants to respond to the slap.
moral_action: Cindy decides to take the kid back to the neighbor's house and tell the parents what the kid did.
immoral_action: Cindy decides to slap the kid back for slapping her first.

norm: It' not okay to do things that could upset children.
situation: Stan is not doing well in school because he keeps playing video games, and judy is not happy about it.
intention: Judy wants Stan to study more.
moral_action: Judy works with Stan to make sure that he gets everything that is being taught to him.
immoral_action: Judy takes away all of Stan's games and consoles until he improves his grades.

norm: It's not okay to take things from children.

intention: James wants the child to stop playing the age-inappropriate game.
moral_action: James asks the girl if her mother let her install that game, and when she says no he asks her to take him to her mother.
immoral_action: James confiscates the child's phone and orders her to take him to her mother.

norm: You shouldn't have sex in a communal shower.

intention: Mandy wants to have sex with Megan.

norm: You shouldn't film other people in the shower.

moral_action: After looking into the hole and seeing a camera, Henry calls the police.
immoral_action: After looking into the hole and seeing a camera, Henry asks the hotel owner if he can have some video footage of young girls in the shower.

norm: You shouldn't stare at someone while they use the bathroom.

intention: Rick wants to relieve himself.
moral_action: Rick goes into a bathroom stall and urinates.

norm: You should not inject a needle into your veins.

moral_action: Hank gets a volunteer and inserts a needle into him.

norm: You should not eat in the bathroom.

intention: Sally wants to eat something without taking additional break time.
moral_action: Sally gets a drinkable yogurt to have while she is working to hold her off until later.

norm: You shouldn't wear diapers if you're an adult.
situation: Jim has been reading about fetishes on the internet and comes across a diaper fetish while alone at home.
intention: Jim wants to try out how a diaper feels.
moral_action: Jack briefly puts on a diaper before taking it off and throwing it out.
immoral_action: Jack puts on a diaper and wears it for a long while, surprising his girlfriend when she gets home.

norm: You should not use urinals for things other than peeing.

intention: Rick needs to poop.
moral_action: Rick sees a restroom door open and uses the stall to defecate.

norm: You shouldn't urinate outside of a toilet.

norm: You should not pour cooking oil in someone's gas tank.

moral_action: Dave suggests writing funny messages on Tom's car windows.
immoral_action: "Dave suggests pouring some cooking oil into Tom's gas tank, then placing a funny note telling Tom about the ""fill-up""."

norm: You shouldn't allow running in the halls.

norm: You shouldn't sniff tampons.

norm: You shouldn't talk during a test.
