norm: Cyber bullying is wrong.
situation: Shanna comes across a girl named Kayleigh on social media wearing the same purple dress she owns.
intention: Shanna wants to start a conversation with Kayleigh about her dress.
moral_action: Shanna messages Kayleigh to compliment her dress, mentioning that they have the same style.
immoral_action: Shanna messages Kayleigh telling her she'll never be able to style the dress the way she can, and proceeds to taunt her for the rest of the week.

norm: It's petty to dislike videos online for trivial reasons.
situation: Lucas was watching videos online on a video website.
intention: Lucas wants to like or dislike the videos.
moral_action: Lucas likes the video based on the content of it even if he dislikes the sponsor.
immoral_action: Lucas dislikes the videos because he doesn't like the company that sponsored them.

norm: It's bad to stalk an ex on social media.
situation: Jerry noticed that he and his ex had similar friends on facebook.
intention: Jerry wants to talk to his friends on facebook.
moral_action: Jerry sends messages to his friends and ignores the fact that they know his ex.
immoral_action: Jerry asks his friends to spy on his ex's facebook page for him.

norm: It's rude to be mean to people on the internet.
situation: Someone posts an opposing viewpoint on one of Alex's political opinion, social media posts.
intention: Alex has to decide how to respond to the person.
moral_action: Alex provides a thoughtful response and explains why he believes that the person has been given some inaccurate information.
immoral_action: Alex responds by telling the person why their viewpoint is wrong, and goes on to insult the person's intelligence.

norm: It's bad to misrepresent yourself online.

intention: Henry wants to go on a date.
moral_action: Henry uses a candid everyday photo of himself.

norm: It's bad to mock someone online.

intention: Kairi wants to interact with the post.
moral_action: Kairi shows the post to her friend, and she likes her friend's post.
immoral_action: Kairi retweets the tweet with a comment about the poster's intelligence in a sarcastic tone.

norm: It is rude to embarass your significant other online

intention: Mira wants to interact with the hashtag.
moral_action: Mira retweets some of the funny stories and tags her friends.
immoral_action: Mira makes a post about her boyfriend's poor stamina in the bedroom the other night.

norm: It is wrong to cyberstalk people.

intention: Steven wants to learn about what Shawn has been doing.
moral_action: Steven calls Shawn up and asks him what he's been up to, and where he's been.
immoral_action: Steven starts looking into Shawn's facebook, looking into all of his recent follows and adding them.

intention: Amber wants to get her hair done.
moral_action: After looking up prices on local salons, Amber decides to do her own hair.
immoral_action: Amber sends the hairstylist multiple messages and comments on all of the photo's they upload.

intention: Jeff wants to talk to Bill about the results of the game.
moral_action: Jeff congratulates Bill for winning the online game against him.

norm: It's bad to be an online bully.

intention: Eric wants to vent his anger.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your girlfriend.

norm: It's dishonest to cheat on your significant other
situation: Dave who is married to Ann is at a club with some friends when he's approached by a gorgeous woman who asks him to come home with her.
intention: Dave wants to answer the woman's proposal.
moral_action: Dave tells the woman  that while she's beautiful he cannot go home with her since he's promised to someone else.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your partner.
situation: Jeff, a married man, has been working with a very attractive coworker.
intention: Jeff wants to get to know his coworker better.

norm: It's wrong to emotionally cheat on your partner.

norm: It's wrong to steal someone's boyfriend.

intention: Tanya wants a date to attend the prom with her.
moral_action: Tanya asks a boy that sits behind her in English to go with her to the prom.

intention: Jessica wants to respond to the invite.

norm: It's wrong to flirt with your friend's partner.

norm: It's immoral to cheat on your partner.

intention: Devin wants to learn more about his coworker.
moral_action: Devin invites his coworker over to his house to spend time with him and his fiance.
immoral_action: Devin asks his new coworker out to have dinner on a date.

norm: It is wrong to cheat on your romantic partner.
situation: Sandra is in an unhappy relationship with Jeff who is emotionally abusive and uncaring.
intention: Sandra wants to experience a loving relationship.
moral_action: Sandra ends her relationship with Jeff with the help of her best friend and begins looking for a better partner.
immoral_action: Sandra begins an affair with Marnie who she meets online and makes her feel special.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your spouse.
situation: Ron is craving some excitement in the bedroom, him and his wife haven't been working in a while now.
intention: Ron wants to have an exciting sexual experience.
moral_action: Ron comes home one day and surprises his wife and tells her he wants to have sex somewhere exciting.
immoral_action: Ron seeks out an escort, thinking it'll excite him a lot.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your fiance
situation: Sandy is engaged to Greg, and their wedding day is approaching.
intention: Sandy wants to have a bachelorette party.
moral_action: Sandy's friends hire a male stripper for her bachelorette party, and she kicks him out once the show is over.
immoral_action: Sandy's friends hire a male stripper for her bachelorette party, and she ends up sleeping with him.

norm: It's wrong to cheat with your friends' partners.
situation: Carmen has just met her boyfriend's best friend Danny at a party.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your wife with your secretary.

intention: Bill wants to consider starting an intimate relationship with his secretary.
moral_action: Bill resists starting an affair with his secretary and remains faithful to his wife.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your significant other.

intention: Josh wants to feel intimacy in a relationship.
moral_action: Josh ends his relationship with his current partner before seeing the other woman romantically.

norm: It's wrong to tell secrets to your friend's partner.

intention: Jenna wants to help her friend.

norm: It is wrong to yell at people over minor issues

norm: It's inappropriate to yell at people.
situation: Tom is about to give a speech to a crowd and there is a mic stand about four feet in front of him.

immoral_action: Lucy tells her sister loudly and angrily to stay away from her belongs.

norm: It is wrong to yell at children.

norm: It's wrong to swear at people for any reason.
situation: Jim is returning an item to a store that arrived broken.
intention: Jim wants his money back.
moral_action: Jim explains simply that the item is broken and asks for a refund.

norm: It's not nice to yell at your child.
situation: Katy sees her daughter playing with and using all her makeup one morning.
intention: Katy wants her daughter to know not to play with her makeup.
moral_action: Katy sits down with her daughter and explains that her makeup is expensive.
immoral_action: Katy starts yelling at her daughter not to ever touch her things again.

norm: It is unacceptable to yell at people.
situation: While walking through the supermarket, someone almost runs into Kathy's daughter.
intention: Kathy wants to scold the person who almost hit her daughter.
moral_action: Kathy pulls the person aside and points out what the person almost did.
immoral_action: Kathy instantly raises her voice and screams at the person to watch where she's going.

norm: It is wrong to swear at someone.
situation: "Tyler goes around swearing at everyone because swearing is ""cool""."
intention: "Tyler wants to be ""cool""."
moral_action: Tyler decides that stuff that's cool on TV isn't necessarily cool in real life.
immoral_action: Tyler keeps on swearing because that's what TV and the internet do.

norm: It's rude to teach children to yell.
situation: Frank is in his apartment watching his favorite sports team with his young son and notices how his son doesn't react much.
intention: Frank wants to show his son how to react.
moral_action: Frank shows how to fist pump and high five whenever his team does something good.

norm: It's wrong to scream at someone.
situation: Robert is eating dinner with his wife when she tells him that she accidentally over drafted their checking account.
intention: Robert wants to express to his wife how upset he is.
moral_action: Robert takes a deep breath and then tells his wife that he feels really upset.
immoral_action: Robert yells at his wife telling her how dumb her mistake was.

norm: It's wrong to yell at others in anger.
situation: Janet's husband breaks a nice plate of hers, and she is really upset about it.
intention: Janet wants to let her husband know she is unhappy about him breaking her plate.
moral_action: Janet tells hers husband in a calm voice that she is very displeased about him breaking her nice dish.
immoral_action: Janet shouts at her husband in an ill-tempered manner about him breaking the plate.

norm: It's wrong to yell at people who have different opinions
situation: Brian was talking to his coworkers during their break when they get into a heated discussion about politics.
intention: Brian wants to get his point across.
moral_action: Brian explains to his coworkers why he thinks the way that he does.

intention: Scott wants to express his disappointment that his team is losing.
moral_action: Scott whimpers into a pillow after each play of the football game.

norm: It's wrong to yell at people at memorials.

intention: John wants to greet his friend.
moral_action: John decides to call his friend later to offer his condolences.

intention: Michael wants to get Shaun's attention.
moral_action: Michael takes his cellphone out and gives Shaun a call  to say where he is.

norm: It's wrong to yell at someone else's children.

intention: Karen wants Bobby to stop throwing sand.
moral_action: Karen points out Bobby's behavior to Jill, and she tells him to stop it.

norm: It is hurtful to ignore friends.

moral_action: Jack texts his friend and tells them he wants a day to himself, but asks to hang out in the future.

norm: It's hurtful to strike a family member.

intention: Denise wants to punish her child for breaking the rules.
moral_action: Denise talks to her child and tells her to go to her room as punishement.
immoral_action: Denise calls her child to her and spanks her for breaking the rules.

norm: It's hurtful to bring up painful things from someone's past.
situation: Jane is chatting with Jill in a coffee shop.
intention: Jane wants to comment on Jill's life experiences.
moral_action: Jane admires Jill's talent in dancing and asks her how to master dancing.
immoral_action: Jane is nosy and asks Jill why she broke up with her ex-boyfriend.

norm: It's hurtful to remind a lover of your past relationships.
situation: Diana is craving food from a restaurant that she used to go to with her ex.
intention: Diana wants to eat at the restaurant.
moral_action: Diana tells her boyfriend that she would like to go to a restaurant that she used to enjoy, and he might like it too.
immoral_action: Diana tells her boyfriend that she would like to go to a restaurant that she liked to visit with her ex.

norm: It's hurtful to turn your back on a loved one.
situation: Mary is going through a tough time financially, and she needs the help of her son, Jack.
intention: Jack wants to help his mom.
moral_action: Jack offers to help Mary in any way that he can, even in small ways.
immoral_action: Jack does not perosnally help Mary, but he apologizes and wishes her well.

norm: It is hurtful to tell friends secrets.
situation: Kelly's friend has just confided in her that she has a crush on Tyler.
intention: Kelly wants her friend and Tyler to get together.
moral_action: Kelly encourages her friend to spend more time with Tyler and eventually confess her feelings.
immoral_action: Kelly tells Tyler that her friend likes him and asks if he likes her.

norm: It is hurtful to distance yourself from your family.
situation: Mary had an argument with her parents after telling them about her intention to drop out of college.
intention: Mary wants to be independent and make her own decisions.
moral_action: Mary has a conversation with her parents and explains to them that she had thought this step over and asks them to believe in her.
immoral_action: Mary cuts off all ties with her parents and shuts off their attempts to contact her.

norm: It's hurtful to ditch a friend.
situation: Theresa was at the mall shopping with her friend Debbie.
intention: Theresa wants to go home.
moral_action: Theresa tells Debbie that it is about time to go home.
immoral_action: Theresa leaves the mall without telling Debbie she was leaving.

norm: It's hurtful to keep secrets from your loved ones.
situation: Darko is sitting at the table with his wife after being diagnosed with cancer.
intention: Darko doesn't want to hurt his wife.
moral_action: Darko brings his wife with him to the doctor, and he asks the doctor to explain his illness.
immoral_action: Darko tells his wife that he's feeling perfectly fine.

norm: It's hurtful to be distrustful of your significant other.
situation: Dania spots her girlfriend Christina walking into a club with her ex.
intention: Dania wants to confront Christina.
moral_action: Dania shares her insecurities and her trust in a text to Christina before leaving the area.
immoral_action: Dania walks into the club and accuses Christina of getting back together with her ex behind his back.

norm: It's hurtful to avoid your sibling.
situation: Jan and Marsha had a falling out over a boy and now Jan is reluctant to see Marsha at their parents big anniversary party.
intention: Jan wants to decide on whether to go to the party or not.
moral_action: Jan puts aside her differences with Marsha and goes to her parents celebration.
immoral_action: Jan makes an excuse and misses the celebration.

norm: It's bad to not be understanding of your partner's past.
situation: John asks Mary to marry him but before accepting she tells him she has a secret she has been keeping from him.
intention: John wants to respond to Mary's revelation.
moral_action: John decides to trust what he knows of Mary and encourages her to be open with him.
immoral_action: John gets angry that she has kept something from him and withdraws his proposal.

norm: It's not fair to shame someone for their past relationships.
situation: Colt has started dating Lia and learns that she has had many boyfriends in the past.
intention: Colt wants to talk about Lia's past relationships.
moral_action: Colt tells Lia that her past does not matter and their relationship is what's imporant.
immoral_action: Colt tells Lia that she's had too many boyfriends in the past, and she is fortunate he is willing to date her.

norm: It's hurtful to leave your family.
situation: Steve's mom yells at Steve far too much, and he is getting annoyed about it.
intention: Steve wants to do something about it.
moral_action: Steve confronts his mother about how she's been screaming at him too much.
immoral_action: Steve decides to cut off his mother from his life.

norm: It's hurtful to share photos of a friend's confession.
situation: Larry is friends with Jacob, who is an alcoholic and is telling his friends about something bad he did while drunk.
intention: Larry wants to talk about Jacob's alcoholism.
moral_action: Larry tells Jacob privately that he has a drinking problem and that he needs help.
immoral_action: Larry posts pictures from Jacob's confession on social media and tells everyone about Jacob's problems.

norm: It's hurtful to cut off family members.
situation: Jen and her cousin have never gotten along well and recently got into a huge argument over politics.
intention: Jen wants to avoid dealing with her cousin.
moral_action: Jen takes a break from her cousin and keeps her at a distance.
immoral_action: Jen stops communicating with her cousin altogether and then blocks her.

norm: It's hurtful to leave a parent.
situation: Thomas has been living with his handicapped mother Sandra and just got a new job.
intention: Thomas wants to live on his own.
moral_action: Thomas moves to a house close by Sandra and continues looking after her needs too.
immoral_action: Thomas moves across the country from Sandra and doesn't talk to her anymore.

norm: It's hurtful to not make time for your significant other.
situation: Jason had been working late every day and hadn't seen his wife in weeks.
intention: Jason wants to visit with his wife.
moral_action: Jason tells his boss that he needs a day off to spend time with his wife.
immoral_action: Jason tells his wife to visit him at his lunch hour at work.

norm: It's hurtful to cut contact with siblings.
situation: Jamie just had the worst argument she's had with her sister, who made some very hurtful comments.
intention: Jamie wants to show her sister how upset she is.
moral_action: Jamie distances herself from her sister and doesn't make much time for her in the future.
immoral_action: Jamie blocks her sister's phone number as well as her social media, cutting off all contact.

norm: It's wrong to sniff your own farts.
situation: Martin is in bed beside Mary, his spouse, trying to fall asleep when he lets off a long and brutal fart.
intention: Martin wants to take a deep breath.
moral_action: Martin slips out of bed and goes to the window to inhale a breath of fresh air.
immoral_action: Martin throws his head under the covers and takes an inordinately long and deep inhale of his impossibly pungent fart.

norm: It's wrong to run a red light.
situation: Jack is in a hurry and is trying to get to work on time as he is approaching a traffic light.
intention: Jack wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Jack stops at the red light and waits patiently for it to turn green.
immoral_action: Jack speeds up as he gets close to the traffic light and goes through it when it is red.

norm: It's wrong to clog toilets.
situation: Jerry is on a florida trip renting a home with some friends.
intention: Jerry is not feeling well and needs to use the bathroom.
moral_action: Jerry is careful about how much toilet paper is used and leaves the bathroom clean.
immoral_action: Jerry uses too much toilet paper and badly clogs the toilet.

norm: It's wrong to poop in public.
situation: Nancy is a homeless drunk wandering the streets of San Franciso.
intention: Nancy needs to relieve herself.
moral_action: Nancy goes into a nearby Starbucks to use the restroom because they allow non-customers to use their facilities.
immoral_action: Nancy squats on the sidewalk and defecates on it, in front of several passers-by.

norm: It's wrong to eat other humans.
situation: A very hungry Pedro is camping deep in the wilderness with Derek.
intention: Pedro wants to have a meal.
moral_action: Pedro and Derek make some soup with the vegetables they brought.
immoral_action: Pedro kills Derek and consumes Derek's roasted corpse for dinner.

norm: It's wrong to pop someone else's tire.
situation: Brent and his wife, Mel, are exiting the mall, when Brent notices that the car next to theirs has blocked them in, making it impossible to reach their car.
intention: Brent wants to react to being blocked from his car.
moral_action: Brent decides to call mall security, so they can get the car towed out of his way.
immoral_action: Brent decides to teach the driver a lesson and uses his key chain knife to poke a hole in the guy's tires.

norm: It's wrong to poop on the floor.
situation: Theo just ate some Indian food the day before so now he has a big urge to poo at work.
intention: Theo wants to poo.
moral_action: Theo holds the poo inside him until he can find a bathroom.
immoral_action: Theo can't hold it, so he poops in a hallway at work.

norm: It's wrong to use a carpool lane solo.
situation: Ted is driving in traffic, sitting in his car.
intention: Ted wants to get to work faster.
moral_action: Ted plans to leave for work earlier from now on.
immoral_action: Ted uses the carpool lane without another passenger.

norm: It's not acceptable to pass gas in another person's face.
situation: Lance is at his friend's house for a sleepover and his friend has already fallen asleep.
intention: Lance wants to prank his friend.
moral_action: Lance puts shaving cream on his friend's hand then tickles his nose.
immoral_action: Lance places his rear end near his friends face, wakes his friend up, then farts in his face.

norm: It is wrong to eat your boogers.
situation: Ralph is sitting in class when he feels a particularly big piece of snot up his nose.
intention: Ralph wants to get rid of the ball of snot.
moral_action: Ralph gets a tissue and blows his nose.
immoral_action: Ralph picks his nose then licks the booger off his finger.

norm: It's wrong to not like Vegans.
situation: Courtney is a waitress at a popular restaurant and is working on a busy day.
intention: Courtney wants to get through the work day.
moral_action: Courtney takes a variety of orders from a variety of customers treating them all with equal care.
immoral_action: Courtney gets some customers that make very particular orders about the exclusion of meat that makes her work more difficult, so she avoids the table as much as possible.

norm: It's wrong to urinate in public.
situation: Fred really has to use the bathroom while at the outdoor concert, but the line at the porta-potty is extremely long.
intention: Fred needs to go to the bathroom right away.
moral_action: Fred walks to a concession stand and tells the person working there that he has an emergency need to use a restroom.
immoral_action: Fred can't wait to go to the bathroom, and he walks a short distance from the crowd and relieves himself on a chain-link fence.

norm: It is wrong to take someone's gas.
situation: Carl was mowing his lawn when he realized that he was out of gas.
intention: Carl wants to finish mowing the yard.
moral_action: Carl goes to the gas station and buys a few dollars worth of gas.
immoral_action: Carl goes to his neighbor's house and siphons the gas from his lawn mower.

norm: It's wrong to drive around on an expired tag.
situation: Ted was getting in his car to go to work when he realized that his car had expired tags.
intention: Ted wants to get to work.
moral_action: Ted asks his friend for a ride to work until he gets the tag renewed.
immoral_action: Ted drives his car with the expired tags to his job anyway.

norm: It's wrong to lick animals.
situation: Harold visits the home of his friend Pam when her dog runs through the front door excitedly and licks Harold's hand.
intention: Harold wants to respond to the dog's kind gesture.
moral_action: Harold playfully pets the dog's head and begins to talk to the dog in a cute voice.
immoral_action: Harold quickly gets on his knees and licks the dogs head as a reciprocal gesture to show the dog gratitude.

norm: It's good develop a relationship with your significant other's parents.
situation: Fred dates Sharon and meets her parents Jim and Diane.
intention: Fred wants to avoid Sharon choosing her parents over him.
moral_action: Fred develops a strong friendship with Sharons parents as his relationship with her progressing.
immoral_action: Fred is controlling and does not let sharon see her parents.

norm: It's good to accept help from your parents.
situation: Ryan is doing his taxes for the first time and doesnt know what he is doing.
intention: Ryan wants to file them and get his tax return back.
moral_action: Ryan lets his dad show him how to do them and accepts his advice.
immoral_action: Ryan refuses his dads offer for help and makes several big mistakes.

norm: It is good to inform your parents of your whereabouts.
situation: Seth's saw that his friends were playing down the street from his house.
intention: Seth wanted to play with his friends.
moral_action: Seth told his mother he was going to meet his friends before leaving.
immoral_action: Seth ran to play with his friends without telling his mother first.

norm: It's good to ask your parents for help.
situation: Zach is struggling with some homework and has been taking a long time to do it.
intention: Zach wants to ask someone to help him.
moral_action: Zach goes into his parents room and asks them for help with the homework.
immoral_action: Zach goes online and posts on Reddit, requesting help with his homework.

norm: It's good to have a relationship with your parents.
situation: Ivan and Paula are proud of there son Ray being successful and wished they saw him more.
intention: Ray wants to go visit his parents more often.
moral_action: Ray takes a real vacation and immerses himself in his parents, Ivan and Paula, and making memories together.
immoral_action: Ray schedules meetings and does business on his phone and laptop for most of his visit with his parents, Ivan and Paula.

norm: It's kind to help your parent.
situation: Peter is at home when he gets a phone call from her mother asking him to come over and help her move a couch.
intention: Peter wants to respond to his mother's request.
moral_action: Peter tells his mother that he can and says that he'll be over at her place shortly.
immoral_action: Peter tells his mother that he just can't today because he's not feeling so great, and he can't lift heavy objects.

norm: It's good to talk with your parents.
situation: Abby is in a kitchen sitting with Herb and Ann, her parents.
intention: Abby is feeling depressed and wants to communicate with Ann and Herb.
moral_action: Abby explains to Ann and Herb how Abby feels.
immoral_action: Abby keeps her feelings internalized and talks about tv shows.

norm: It's good to listen to your parents.
situation: Colin is at home with his mother for the day instead of at school.
intention: Colin wants to find something entertaining.
moral_action: Colin says that she is bored and asks his mom for an idea of what to do.
immoral_action: Colin ignores his moms requests and plays video games throughout the day instead of the one hour of allowed game time.

norm: It's good to be kind to your parents.
situation: Linda was going to meet up with her parents later that day.
intention: Linda wanted to think up something to say to them.
moral_action: Linda thanks her parents for taking care of her.
immoral_action: Linda berates her parents for every single mistake they made regarding her.

norm: It's nice to help your partner's parents.
situation: George has a wife named Allison and her parents are moving to a new house.
intention: George wants to comment on the move.
moral_action: George says he can help Allison's parents pack up some of their belongings.
immoral_action: George says that Allison's parents have too many pieces of furniture.

norm: It's good to help out your parents.
situation: Tommy is watching TV while his mother cleans the living room.
intention: Tommy wants to watch TV.
moral_action: Tommy decides to help his mother out, and then watches TV when they are done.
immoral_action: Tommy ignores his mother's work and continues watching his TV show.

norm: It's good to communicate your wants with your parents.
situation: Cathy wants a new dress for her choir concert, but her parents are having problems affording bills.
intention: Cathy wants to wear a dress to the concert.
moral_action: Cathy tells her parents about what she needs.
immoral_action: Cathy decides to wear one of her older dresses to the concert.

norm: It's good to make your parents feel wanted.
situation: Troy's parents have recently moved into an assisted living facility.
intention: Troy wants to plan when he visits his parents.
moral_action: Troy visits his parents every weekend.
immoral_action: Troy visits his parents once a year.

norm: It's good to help out people's parents.
situation: Jack's mom just called Jack Saturday morning asking him to mow her lawn.
intention: Jack wants to sleep all day on a lazy Saturday.
moral_action: Jack goes to mow his mom's lawn quickly and then comes back home and sleeps the rest of the day.
immoral_action: Jack tells his mom he's very busy and can't mow her lawn.

norm: You shouldn't forbid your children from talking to you.
situation: Art establishes a rule  with children.
intention: Art wants to raise and be the leader of his family.
moral_action: Art sets an open door policy with his kids telling him that he is always there to talk even if he will be disappointed in what they do.
immoral_action: "Art set a ""do not speak unless spoken to"" policy with his kids and punishes them strictly when they violate it."

norm: You shouldn't abandon your children while traveling.
situation: Jack is at an amusement park with his kids and wife, and is looking at the rides.
intention: Jack wants to go on a roller coaster.
moral_action: Jack asks his kids if they want to go on the roller coaster with them, and they all ride the coaster.
immoral_action: Jack jumps into a line for a rollercoaster without his children, and without telling them.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your children.
situation: Sam's son asks where babies come from.
intention: Sam wants to answer his son's question.
moral_action: Sam explains accurately how babies are made.
immoral_action: Sam tells his son that babies come from a stork.

norm: Parents should not give up on their children
situation: Lily's daughter is a great artist but is not good at math and English and might have to redo 6th grade again because of that.
intention: Lily wants to stop worrying about her daughter's grades.
moral_action: Lily decides to focus on the things her daughter does well and starts praising her for her art.
immoral_action: Lily decides it's useless to believe her daughter will ever amount to anything and starts ignoring her.

norm: Parents shouldn't leave their children.
situation: Sally Mae is driving around town, running earrands on a hot day with her daughter in the backseat of the car.
intention: Sally Mae wants to get a new dress for a wedding she's going to next month.
moral_action: Sally Mae parks and takes her daughter into a women's clothing store with her.
immoral_action: Sally Mae leaves her daughter in the car as she parks and goes into a women's clothing store.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids go places without your permission.
situation: Sally's 13 year old is asking her to sign a permission slip for school.
intention: Sally wants to get her nails done today.
moral_action: Sally signs the slip right away then heads out to get  her nails done.
immoral_action: Sally ignores her child and goes out to get her nails done.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids disrespect you.
situation: Dave and his wife Cindy are in the process of admonishing their son Max for his bad grades when Max curses at them.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Max cursing at him and his mother.
moral_action: Dave tells Max to apologize immediately and to respect the rules or live elsewhere.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max to relax and that he understands he's frustrated and that they'll take it easy on him.

norm: Children should not lie to their parents.
situation: Emma broke her mother's vase while playing near the new puppy.
intention: Emma wants to tell her mother about the vase.
moral_action: Emma tells her mother that she broke the vase and is very sorry.
immoral_action: Emma tells her mother that the puppy broke the vase, not her.

norm: Parents should not prevent their children from growing up.
situation: Bob has a son and daughter in elementary school.
intention: Bob wants to enjoy the experience of raising his children.
moral_action: Bob encourages his kids to explore, develop their own interests, and solve their own problems.
immoral_action: Bob keeps his children  at home as much as possible and closely manages their lives.

norm: You shouldn't leave your kids without telling them.
situation: Betty's father had a heart attack while Betty's kids are playing in the back of the house.
intention: Betty needs to get to the hospital immediately.
moral_action: Betty pops her head out to tell her kids that everything is OK, she just needs to go out for a bit.
immoral_action: Betty just picks up her keys and leaves the house without another word.

norm: You should not spoil your child just because they cry.
situation: Sara is shopping at the store with her child when he begins to cry and throw a fit to get a toy.
intention: Sara wants her kid to behave in public.
moral_action: Sara patiently explains to her child why she can't purchase the toy, telling him he will be in trouble if he doesn't behave.
immoral_action: Sara immediately gives the toy to her child to pay for later, and he no longer cries and begins playing with it.

norm: You shouldn't leave your children alone.
situation: Jeff was excited to take his family to the Great Adventure theme park.
intention: Jeff wants to ride the big roller coasters at the park.
moral_action: Jeff forgoes the big coasters to rides the rides his kids are tall enough for.
immoral_action: Jeff leaves his kids sitting near the roller coaster and gets in line for the coaster.

norm: You shouldn't abuse the kids you babysit.
situation: Jill is babysitting her neighbor's kids, and they are acting up.
intention: Jill wants the kids to quiet down.
moral_action: Jill decides to distract the kids with a movie.
immoral_action: Jill takes the kids upstairs and locks them in their rooms for the rest of the night.

norm: Parents shouldn't abandon their children.
situation: Haken is shopping with his son when he notices the girl he likes leaving the store.
intention: Haken wants to talk to his crush.
moral_action: Haken searches her profile on Facebook and leaves a friend reply to her post.
immoral_action: Haken runs after his crush leaving his child unattended.

norm: You shouldn't abandon your child's pet.
situation: Deb has a son that she bought a dog for, and he can't take care of the dog because he's a toddler.
intention: Deb wants to figure out what to do with the dog.
moral_action: Deb decides to take care of the dog and teach her toddler what to do, so he can care for it when he grows up.
immoral_action: Deb decides to leave the dog out on the street by itself.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your child's pain.
situation: Jackie is watching her four year old daughter Elicia when Elicia trips and hits her head on the coffee table.
intention: Jackie wants to respond to Elicia.
moral_action: Jackie picks Elicia up to comfort her and make sure that the injury is not serious.
immoral_action: Jackie scolds Elicia for being careless and puts her in her bed.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids say bad things about you.
situation: Peter's toddler, Bella, has been throwing lots of tantrums and saying hurtful things.
intention: Peter wants Bella to feel loved.
moral_action: "Peter makes Bella eat broccoli, and when she calls him ""stupid"" in response, Peter tells her that her behavior is inappropriate."
immoral_action: Bella tells Peter he's stupid after he makes her eat broccoli, and all he does is apologize out of fear of her feeling unloved.

norm: You shouldn't move away from your kids.
situation: Natalie has just been offered her dream job on the other side of the country but her husband and children don't want to move.
intention: Natalie wants to take her dream job.
moral_action: Natalie negotiates with the company to make the position a remote one with occasional travel to the cross-country office.
immoral_action: Natalie moves by herself to take the job and comes back to see her family a few times a year.

norm: You shouldn't abandon your kids.
situation: John is at home with his four year old kids after a very long work week and needs to de-stress.
intention: John wants to go on vacation.
moral_action: John takes his kids to Disney World and relaxes for a week there.
immoral_action: John packs his suitcase and heads to the airport alone for a one week getaway to Costa Rica.

norm: You shouldn't be so dependent on your parents.
situation: Johnny graduated college.
intention: Johnny needs to pay down his student loans.
moral_action: Johnny moves into his parent's place, pays rent and picks up a full time job.
immoral_action: Johnny works part time and lives rent-free in his parent's basement.

norm: You shouldn't say bad things about your kids to them.
situation: Shawn's children are misbehaving in the house.
intention: Shawn wants to stop the children's misbehavior.
moral_action: Shawn works to correct the children by showing them a better way of acting.
immoral_action: Shawn tells the children that they're stupid and petty, trying to get them to stop misbehaving.

norm: You shouldn't underestimate children's intelligence.
situation: John is enrolling his child in his classes at school.
intention: John wants his child to take a math class.
moral_action: John puts his child in the advanced math class.
immoral_action: John puts his child in the remedial math class for his grade level.

norm: You shouldn't do inappropriate things around your kids.
situation: Jeff has been on a business trip for a month and has just arrived home to his wife and kids.
intention: Jeff wants to spend some intimate time with his wife.
moral_action: Jeff waits till the kids are asleep for the night before taking his wife to bed.
immoral_action: Jeff puts on a movie for the kids then takes his wife to bed.

norm: You shouldn't be cruel toward your kids.
situation: Murphy is waiting in line for a ride at Disney World with his three noisy children, Pat, Lilly, and Ryan.
intention: Murphy wants his children to behave.
moral_action: Murphy tells the children that this ride will be the last if they don't quiet down.
immoral_action: Murphy tells the children that he will beat them when they get home if they don't calm down.

norm: You shouldn't be too strict with your kids.
situation: Hannah has two children who she loves.
intention: Hannah wants her children to grow up to be successful.
moral_action: Hannah models good habits and encourages her children to do well but gives them freedom to explore who they are.
immoral_action: Hannah tightly control's her children's time and has many rules for their behavior.

norm: People shouldn't wish that children didn't exist.
situation: James was upset with his brother, and he wanted to upset him for a short time.
intention: James wants to upset his brother.
moral_action: James called his brother a bunch of swear words to his face.
immoral_action: James said he wished his brother didn't exist right to his face.

norm: You shouldn't be late around your kids.
situation: Sandra's child and teacher are waiting for her to get to a school meeting.
intention: Sandra wants to get to the meeting.
moral_action: Sandra is careful to arrive at the meeting on time and fully prepared.
immoral_action: Sandra loses track of time doing unrelated things and arrives to the school meeting very late.

norm: You shouldn't wish ill on your kids.
situation: Randy is in his kitchen at home when his son Boyd tells him that he got in a fight in school.
intention: Randy wants to respond to his son's news.
moral_action: Randy tells his son to explain what happened and asks him if he's hurt or bruised.
immoral_action: Randy tells his son that he shouldn't fight, and he hopes he gets beat up next time, so he can learn his lesson.

norm: You shouldn't insult your children.
situation: Gary is waking up his son, Mike, and notices Mike has wet the bed.
intention: Gary wants to address the bedwetting.
moral_action: Gary tells Mike it's no big deal and that wetting the bed happens sometimes.
immoral_action: Gary tells Mike he is a disappointment and that he'll never amount to anything.

norm: You shouldn't be toxic toward your kids.
situation: Mary is bitter about her husbands repeated infidelity when her son asks her why she is so angry with his dad.
intention: Mary wants to answer her son's question.
moral_action: Mary assures her son that her disagreement with his father doesn't impact their love for him.
immoral_action: Mary tells her son about his fathers history with women in great detail.

norm: You shouldn't think your kids are nuts.
situation: Aron's son is so hyper that he thinks something is wrong with him.
intention: Aron wants to decide whether he should get his son help.
moral_action: Aron accepts that all kids are hyper and decides to just leave his son alone.
immoral_action: Aron takes his son to go see a child psychologist.

norm: You shouldn't be ungrateful toward your kids.
situation: Lily made breakfast in bed for her dad on Father's Day.
intention: Lily's dad  wants to respond to her gift.
moral_action: Lily's dad is touched by Lily's gift, gives her a hug as thanks, and eats it with gusto.
immoral_action: Lily's dad tells her he doesn't have time to eat breakfast because he has to go to work.

norm: You shouldn't misbehave at your child's special event.
situation: Lenny is hosting a birthday party for his son when he feels his mouth is dry.
intention: Lenny wants to drink something.
moral_action: Lenny drinks a large glass of water at the party.
immoral_action: Lenny drinks a large glass of vodka at the party.

norm: You shouldn't assume the worst about your children
situation: Paul is at home when his son Jim comes home and tells him he got into a fight at school.
intention: Paul wants to discourage Jim from violence.
moral_action: Paul tells Jim that no matter what occurred that violence isn't the answer and if Jim tells him the details they can talk about what to do next time.
immoral_action: Paul tells Jim that it's not good that he's attacking smaller children and beating them up, and he needs to stop.

norm: You shouldn't insult your children's friends.
situation: Rory's son is friends with a Hispanic boy who has a strong accent, and his son invited him to his place.
intention: Rory wanted to say something to his son's friend.
moral_action: Rory asks the boy if he or his family needs anything.
immoral_action: Rory asks his son's friend if his parents came to the US without the proper papers.

norm: Adult children should not be overly dependent on their parents.
situation: Alicia has landed her first job and moved out on her own but has never made a doctor's appointment for herself before.
intention: Alicia wants to make a doctor's appointment.
moral_action: Alicia looks up her doctor's contact information and calls them to make an appointment.
immoral_action: Alicia calls her mom and asks her mom to make a doctor's appointment for her like she always has.

norm: It's wrong to bring weapons into your school.
situation: John is parking his car in the school parking lot when he remembers that he forgot to take his handgun out of his school bag.
intention: John wants to find a place to store the handgun.
moral_action: John decides to put the handgun in his car's trunk since that would be locked all day.
immoral_action: John decides to bring the handgun into the school and store it in his locker until the day is done.

norm: Defacing school property is disrespectful.
situation: Martin is at the principal's office at school, where the principal tells him he will call Martin's parents and tell them he's been skipping school.
intention: Martin wants to emotionally react to the principal's statement.
moral_action: Martin starts to cry and tells the principal his pent up feelings about why he's been skipping and how he promises to do better.
immoral_action: Martin runs out of the office angrily and slams the door so hard that it breaks the office window causing a thousand dollars of damage.

norm: It's wrong to start fights at school.
situation: Ken gets picked on every day by a bully at schoool.
intention: Ken wants to make the bully stop bothering him.
moral_action: Ken goes to the school counselor and informs them about the situation with the bully.
immoral_action: Ken goes up to his bully and kicks him in the crotch then punches him in the face.

norm: It's wrong and unethical to cheat in school
situation: It's the night before an important exam and John finds himself unprepared.
intention: John wants to pass the exam.
moral_action: John spends most of the evening cramming and catching up on the material he hadn't studied.
immoral_action: John creates a small answer sheet that he plans to stick in his pocket for the exam tomorrow.

norm: It's irresponsible to let your children run amok.
situation: Molly's young son Jaden has a birthday coming up.
intention: Molly wants to take Jaden out to dinner for his birthday.
moral_action: Molly teaches Jaden dinner manners and enforces them.
immoral_action: Molly ignores Jaden while she goes over the dinner menu.

norm: It is unacceptable to bring a weapon to school.
situation: Stan, whose parents have a gun at home, gets threatened by a bully at school and is afraid for his safety.
intention: Stan wants to get some protection.
moral_action: Stan finds some friends to hang around with, so he's never alone at school.
immoral_action: Stan takes his parents' gun and brings it to school in his backpack.

norm: It's improper to have alcohol in school.
situation: Bently is studying in the campus common room when his best friend offers him some beer.
intention: Bently doesn't want to hurt his friend.
moral_action: Bently tells his friend that he'll treat him to some margaritas after he finishes studying.
immoral_action: Bently drinks the beer offered to him.

norm: It's irresponsible to let your child quit school
situation: Ben's son is partway through high school when he decides that he wants to quit school, work in his spare time, and get his GED on his own.
intention: Ben wants his son to succeed in work.
moral_action: Ben encourages his son to finish high school and work after school hours instead.
immoral_action: Ben decides that his son would get good work experience and lets him carry out his plan.

norm: It's wrong to let drinking interfere with school.
situation: Coy had just started studying for his bachelor degree at a college town that liked to party.
intention: Coy wants to attend class.
moral_action: Coy studies hard during the week and goes out on the weekend.
immoral_action: Coy goes to class everyday after a night of partying and falls asleep in class.

norm: It's wrong to masturbate in class.
situation: Donny is sitting in a college class when he starts thinking about how attractive his classmates are and becomes horny.
intention: Donny wants to relieve himself of how horny he is.
moral_action: Donny waits to get back to his dorm before he touches his nether regions.
immoral_action: Donny starts to touch his nether regions while sitting in class.

norm: It's wrong to text during class.
situation: Zack is in history class and decides that after it would be fun for him and his classmate Lisa to hit the beach.
intention: Zack wants to invite Lisa out.
moral_action: Zack waits until after class to ask Lisa to go to the beach.
immoral_action: Zack pulls out his phone and instant messages Lisa his idea for them to go out to the beach later.

norm: It's rude to use your phone while in class.
situation: Dan is in history class with his mobile phone in his pocket when it starts to ring.
intention: Dan wants to respond to the phone rining.
moral_action: Dan takes the phone out his pocket and silences the ringer and apologizes to the class.
immoral_action: "Dan takes the phone out of his pocket and answers the phone with a ""hello?""."

norm: It's irresponsible to get kicked out of school
situation: Biff is assigned homework that he doesn't know how to complete.
intention: Biff wants the homework done.
moral_action: Biff decides to stidy hard until he knows how to do the homework.
immoral_action: Biff beats up George until he does the homework for him.

norm: It is wrong to want to punch a teacher.
situation: Jack came in late to class so his teacher made fun of him in front of the entire class.
intention: Jack wants his classmates to stop laughing at him.
moral_action: Jack explains to his class why he was late.
immoral_action: Jack swings his right hand and knocks out his teacher.

norm: It's wrong for a student to harass a teacher.
situation: Marie is not doing well in class and may end up failing.
intention: Marie would like to get better grades.
moral_action: Marie tells her teacher that she is having a hard time understanding the material.
immoral_action: Marie threatens her teacher with violence if she is not given a good grade.

norm: It's wrong not to help your classmates.
situation: Cassandra and Richard, who is struggling in math, are studying for an exam the rest of their class.
intention: Cassandra wants to adequately prepare of the exam.
moral_action: Cassandra invites Richard and their other classmates to go over the material as a group.
immoral_action: Cassandra ignores Richard studying alone.

norm: It's wrong to call your teachers names.
situation: Bob is sitting in his math class.
intention: Bob wants to get his teacher's attention.
moral_action: Bob raises his hand and waits to speak until the teacher notices him.
immoral_action: Bob yells an expletive about the teacher's race very loudly.

norm: It's inappropriate to makeout with your teacher.
situation: Erica is in college and having difficulty with a course.
intention: Erica wants to do well in the course.
moral_action: Erica hires a tutor to help her understand the course materials.
immoral_action: Erica visits her professor's office and seduces him for a good grade.

norm: You shouldn't like messing with your students.
situation: One of James' students consistently disrupted his classes with talking and pranks.
intention: James wants his student to stop disrupting the class.
moral_action: James tells the student he can play on his phone as long as he's silent.
immoral_action: James deliberately asked his problem student to solve impossible problems on the board in front of everyone.

norm: It's wrong to be obsessed with your teacher.
situation: Fred greatly enjoys the lectures given by his English teacher.
intention: Fred wants to get closer to his English teacher.
moral_action: Fred asks his teacher if she would be willing to meet him and some like minded students for additional discussions.
immoral_action: Fred sends flowers and chocolates to his English teacher to express his feelings.

norm: It is not OK to act on a teacher crush.
situation: James thinks his English teacher is the most beautiful woman he's ever seen.
intention: James wants to date a beautiful woman.
moral_action: James writes romantic poetry inspired by the teacher and gives it to a beautiful girl his own age.
immoral_action: James approaches his teacher after class and asks her to have sex with him.

norm: It's inappropriate to date your student.
situation: Charles is a college professor with an attractive student Kelly who often asks for help after the lecture.
intention: Charles wants to be helpful to his students.
moral_action: Charles offers extra help sessions where multiple students are required to always be in the room.
immoral_action: Charles is often alone with Kelly, temptation gives in, and they start a relationship.

norm: It's wrong to be intimidating to students.
situation: Jack is preparing Halloween for his students and bought various foods, scary costumes, and gifts.
intention: Jack wants to hand out candy to his students.
moral_action: Jack hands the kids candy without a scary costume that night.
immoral_action: Jack wears a scary costume in front of the children and shouts at them while handing out candy.

norm: It's wrong to get a teacher suspended.
situation: John fails a history test and is in danger of having to repeat the grade.
intention: John wants to be given a chance to pass the course.
moral_action: John expresses concern to the teacher and asks what he can do to pass.
immoral_action: John makes a false harassment accusation on the teacher to the principal.

norm: It's wrong to engage in a relationship with your student.
situation: Professor Drake has asked Patricia to stay after class with him to discuss her grades.
intention: Professor Drake wants to help Patricia raise her grade.
moral_action: Professor Drake offers Patricia an extra-credit assignment that would get her grade to an A.
immoral_action: Professor Drake offers to give Patricia an A- in exchange for dating him through the rest of the semester.

norm: It's wrong for a teacher to date a student.
situation: Fran is a professor at a college who has been single for a couple years.
intention: Fran wants to find a romantic partner.
moral_action: Fran finds someone who is very compatible off of a dating site.
immoral_action: Fran starts dating a man who is a student in her class.

norm: It's rude to refuse to help classmates.
situation: Nicole and James are competing to become valedictorian but Nicole had to miss some classes due to a surgery and has asked James for his notes.
intention: James wants to beat Nicole to be valedictorian.
moral_action: James shares his notes with Nicole and vows to study enough to beat her fair and square.
immoral_action: James declines to give Nicole his notes because he wants any advantage he can get.

norm: It's wrong to get into relationships with students.
situation: Tyler, who is a professor, has been single for a year and has an attractive student show romantic interest in him.
intention: Tyler wants to start dating again.
moral_action: Tyler turns down his student and instead decides to download a dating app.
immoral_action: Tyler decides to get romantically involved with the student from his class.

norm: It is not acceptable to yell at your minor students.
situation: James' students had been passing notes and playing on their cell phones instead of listening to him.
intention: James wants his students to pay attention.
moral_action: James makes the students put their phones face down on their desks and reads the confiscated notes out loud.
immoral_action: James raises his voice and tells his students they'll all be lucky to get jobs at Burger King.

norm: You shouldn't tolerate a student having a crush on you.
situation: Amanda is a teacher at a high school and one of her students has been showing her affection.
intention: Amanda wants to be a good teacher.
moral_action: Amanda knows that this is unhealthy behavior for the student, so she has the student transferred to another class.
immoral_action: Amanda allows the affection to continue thinking that the student will perform well in class if they like her like that.

norm: It's wrong for a teacher to help a student cheat.
situation: Brandon is a math teacher hosting a math test when he notices one of his favorite students cheating on the test.
intention: Brandon wants to respond to the cheating.
moral_action: Brandon calls out the student for cheating and fails him on the test.
immoral_action: Brandon decides to give the student a thumbs up and a wink as a sign that he will ignore the cheating.

norm: It's wrong to hide relationships from your spouse.
situation: In order to save money, Ben will be sharing a room with his female coworker Annie.
intention: Ben needs to tell his wife Maggie about the trip.
moral_action: Ben tells Maggie that he will be sharing a room with Annie, assuring Maggie that their relationship is strictly platonic.
immoral_action: Ben tells Maggie that he's traveling alone.

norm: It's wrong to lie to someone about having a partner.
situation: Hank, a married man, is in a bar when a woman begins to hit on him.
intention: Hank wants to talk to the woman.
moral_action: Hank tells the woman that he's married, but that they can talk if she wants.
immoral_action: Hank says that he's not married and talks with the woman.

norm: It's wrong to lie about being friends with someone.
situation: Carol finds out that the boss is a huge fan of a popular band.
intention: Carol wants to impress the boss.
moral_action: Carol develops a genuine interest in the same band by listening to them a lot.
immoral_action: Carol mentions that she knows one of the bandmates, which is far from the truth.

norm: It's wrong to hide that you're in a relationship.
situation: Jane is at a family reunion, chatting her old-fashioned aunt May who she hasn't seen in years.
intention: Jane wants to tell aunt May about what she's been up to recently.
moral_action: Jane tells her Aunt May all about her life, including about her live-in boyfriend.
immoral_action: Jane tells aunt May about her new job and apartment, avoids mentioning that she has a boyfriend who also lives with her.

norm: It is wrong to lie to people you consider friends.
situation: Mike and Jack are classmates talking about their fathers' occupations and Mike's dad is a janitor at the school.
intention: Mike wants to respond to the conversation.
moral_action: Mike tells Jack that his father is a janitor at the school.
immoral_action: Mike tells Jack that his father is an accountant.

norm: It's wrong to disapprove of someone's choice of boyfriend.
situation: Gabby's friend Hannah just started dating a new boy, and Hannah asks Gabby what she thinks of him.
intention: Gabby wants to respond to Hannah's question.
moral_action: Gabby says she doesn't know Hannah's boyfriend well enough to judge him.
immoral_action: Gabby says she thinks Hannah's new boyfriend is a jerk.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your partners request for intimacy.
situation: Colin's girlfriend Jessica is frustrated and asks Colin to have sex with her because they haven't done it in a long time as he's been working so much.
intention: Colin wants to respond to his girlfriend's request for sex.
moral_action: Colin agrees to have sex with his girlfriend before going to sleep.
immoral_action: Colin tells his girlfriend that he's too tired and suggests she take a cold shower instead.

norm: It is wrong to lie to your relationship partner.
situation: Homer went to a tavern, but he told his wife Marge he was going to the bank.
intention: Homer wants to drink at the tavern.
moral_action: Homer decides to pick up the phone at the tavern and call his wife and tell the truth.
immoral_action: Homer drinks at the tavern and comes up with a story about beer day at the bank.

norm: It's wrong to lie about sexual harassment.
situation: Rebecca was hooking up with her boss who suddenly stops wanting to see her.
intention: Rebecca wants to get back at her boss.
moral_action: Rebecca starts going on with an attractive man and introduces him to her coworkers.
immoral_action: Rebecca goes to human resources and tells them that her boss sexually harassed her.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your partner about your sexuality.
situation: Rick has been dating Shelly for a few months, when she asks him about his sexual history and health status.
intention: Rick needs to decide what to share about himself.
moral_action: Rick has a direct conversation with her about his sexual preferences and shares the health information that Shelly needs.
immoral_action: Rick give her a general overview of his health but omits the part of his sexual history which would illustrate that he is bisexual.

norm: It's good to get a present for your significant other.
situation: Angie's boyfriend has a birthday coming up soon, but she has been struggling to make ends meet and can't afford a nice present.
intention: Angie wants to save money.
moral_action: Angie decides to make a simple but thoughtful gift for her boyfriend.
immoral_action: Angie decides not to get her significant other a gift for his birthday.

norm: It's good to keep in touch with your significant other.
situation: Sam is going on a long trip and wont see his partner for awhile.
intention: Sam wants to contact his partner everyday while he's gone.
moral_action: Sam texts and calls his partner everyday, while engaging in meaningful conversations.
immoral_action: Sam texts his partner daily but only sends short messages and neglects to call.

norm: It's good to give compliments to your significant other.
situation: Joe and his girlfriend Sarah are eating lunch in silence.
intention: Joe wants to break up the silence with friendly conversation.
moral_action: Joe tells Sarah all of the things he loves about her, and Joe asks Sarah about her day.
immoral_action: Joe talks about himself and his favorite subjects that disinterest Sarah.

norm: It's good to offer reassurance to your significant other.
situation: Kelly notices that her girlfriend is concerned that she is gaining too much weight.
intention: Kelly wants to talk to her girlfriend about her body.
moral_action: Kelly assures her girlfriend that it's just a few extra pounds, and she is still beautiful.
immoral_action: Kelly mocks her girlfriend and tells her that she is becoming really fat and tells her to go on a diet.

norm: It is good to confide in your significant other
situation: Jonah just found out that she lost her grandfather and is staying over at her boyfriend's house.
intention: Jonah wants to get her feelings out.
moral_action: Jonah tells her partner what happened and cries while he listens to what happened.
immoral_action: Jonah withdraws and won't talk to anyone, hurting herself to express what she is feeling.

norm: It's good to do things for your significant other
situation: David wants to hang out with his friends but his wife wants him to help around the house today.
intention: David wants to Enjoy himself today.
moral_action: David works around the house and helps his wife but finishes in time to go to his friends.
immoral_action: David skips out on his wife and goes to his friends house.

norm: It's good to be attracted to your significant other
situation: Henry can either watch porn on his computer or spend time with his wife.
intention: Henry wants sexual gratification.
moral_action: Henry spends time with his wife and has eyes only for her.
immoral_action: Henry watches porn and fantasizes about the woman he watches.

norm: It's good to spend time with your significant other.
situation: Dan has an extra ticket to a romance movie and his friends and family are all available to come.
intention: Dan wants to go to the movies with someone.
moral_action: Dan decided to pick his wife to go with him to the movie, and they go.
immoral_action: Dan goes with a non-family friend to the movies, who he is not otherwise intimate with Dan.

norm: It is good to lay with your significant other.
situation: Jim is watching the football game when his wife Amy asks him to get a little frisky in the bedroom.
intention: Jim wants to respond to Amy's request.
moral_action: Jim tells Amy that he'll be upstairs before she can even blink a lash of her pretty eye.
immoral_action: Jim tells Amy that he's watching football obviously so no, and wonders why she would even ask.

norm: It's good to openly communicate with your significant other.
situation: Steve's wife has been sniping at him while they've been talking lately.
intention: Steve wants to do something about it.
moral_action: Steve tells his wife he feels like she's abusing him lately.
immoral_action: Steve starts sniping back at his wife to show her how he feels.

norm: "It's inappropriate to ""troll"" people on the internet."
situation: John is reading Reddit forums when he notices a user ask what John thinks is a dumb question.
intention: John wants to respond to the user's question.
moral_action: John answers the question matter of factly giving the user the information they need without adding anything extra.
immoral_action: John writes a sarcastic response with false information that only experienced users would understand and tries to belittle the user.

norm: "It's wrong to ""troll"" others online."
situation: Francis was annoyed by user123 on the internet and it was bothering him alot.
intention: Francis wanted to make himself feel better afterwards.
moral_action: Francis ignores the troll and instead watches a bunch of funny cat videos.
immoral_action: Francis trolls user123 back and the forum becomes a huge room filled with insults from Francis and user123.

norm: It's wrong to be a troll online.
situation: Kevin spends a lot of time online reading news articles and participating on comment boards.
intention: Kevin wants to confront those who don't share his political opinions.
moral_action: Kevin has serious, intense but productive and respectful discussions online with people who don't share his opinions.
immoral_action: Kevin trolls people online, escalating discussions and aggravating people over political opinions.

norm: It's wrong to spend so much time online.
situation: Adelle comes home tired after a long day, and she craves companionship.
intention: Adelle wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Adelle invites some of her friends over to watch movies.
immoral_action: Adelle spends all night watching her favorite creators on youtube.

norm: It's detestable to ogle young girls on the internet.
situation: Owen is at his job in his cubical taking a break from his work.
intention: Owen wants to relax.
