intention: Marcy wants to save her grandpa's password.
moral_action: Marcy decides to install a Chrome extension that memorizes passwords for her grandpa.
immoral_action: Macy demands to know the password from her grandpa, so she can remember it herself.

norm: You shouldn't advertise your business on other people's posts online.
situation: Louis notices an online post about repairing a computer cooling fan and thinks about how he could help people with that operation.
intention: Louis wants to help people repair their computer fans.
moral_action: Louis offers the readers of the post individual assistance, through private message, if they have trouble following the instructions.
immoral_action: Louis responds to the post by offering to do the work, for the any reader, for a fee and the costs associated with shipping the computer.

norm: You shouldn't peek at someone's text messages.
situation: Chris's best friend Josh has been very evasive lately, and Chris notices even more while he's hanging out with Josh today.
intention: Chris wants to help Josh out.
moral_action: Chris asks Josh straight up what's going on, and why he is acting this way.
immoral_action: Josh goes to the bathroom and leaves his phone on the table, so Chris picks it up and looks at some text messages.

norm: You shouldn't let your parents track your phone.
situation: Stefy, a lady in high school whose parents monitor her through the phone, is thinking of ways that she can make her parents happy.
intention: Stefy wants to buy a surprise gift for her dad.
moral_action: Stefy leaves her phone at home and goes to a men's watch store to get her dad a watch.
immoral_action: Stefy goes to a men's watch store and looks up different types of watches with her phone, then buys one.

norm: You shouldn't delete things on your friend's phone.
situation: Shawna has her friend Lacy's phone and is feeling mischievous.
intention: Shawna wants to play a prank on Lacy.
moral_action: Shawna takes pictures to put into Lacy's phone.
immoral_action: Shawna erases pictures that she finds on Lacy's phone.

norm: You shouldn't search for your ex on Instagram.
situation: Veronica recently broke up with her boyfriend Archer and hasn't spoken to him since.
intention: Veronica wants to find out what Archer has been up to since their breakup.
moral_action: Veronica asks a common friend about what Archer's been up to since their breakup.
immoral_action: Veronica decides to go on Instagram and search for Archer's account, so she can check up on him.

norm: You shouldn't hate people with mental or physical disabilities.
situation: Jeff and Mary are discussing their opinions about disabled people.
intention: Jeff wants to form an opinon about the disabled.
moral_action: Jeff decides that just because disabled people are restricted in one way doesn't mean they're restricted period and vows to help them.
immoral_action: Jeff decides that since disabled people are restricted in some ways, that he thinks they should all die and doesn't want them around.

norm: You shouldn't think of transgender people as freaks.
situation: Dan is at a party when he is introduced to Lena who looks like a nice girl, when Dan is told by Lena that she's recently transitioned.
intention: Dan wants to react to Lena's admission.
moral_action: Dan tells Lena that he has learned that gender is fluid and that we are all different spectrum of woman and man.
immoral_action: Dan tells Lena that he thought she was pretty but now that he knows that Lena is a gross freak of nature he takes it back.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against people with lisps.
situation: Mary is the judge of a singing contest right now, and some of the contestants have lisps.
intention: Mary wants to pick a singing contestant as a winner.
moral_action: Mary ignores the fact that some of her contestants have lisps and lets a few contestants with lisps win.
immoral_action: Mary explains that all participants with lisps are automatically disqualified from winning.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against people with autism.
situation: John is a manager at a large company.
intention: John needs to hire a new employee.
moral_action: John hires the most qualified candidate who happens to have autism.
immoral_action: John passes over a highly qualified candidate because they have autism in favor of someone else.

norm: You shouldn't be afraid of people with disabilities.
situation: Brie moves into her new apartment with the help of a neighbor, who has a mental disability and hits on her a lot.
intention: Brie wants to decide how to interpret the neighbor.
moral_action: Brie exercises patience with the neighbor.
immoral_action: Brie decides that the neighbor is threatening and mentally unpredictable.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against people with depression.
situation: Bob is interviewing a job candidate named Tom for a customer service position who tells Bob he recently suffered from depression.
intention: Bob wants to decide whether or not to hire Tom for the position.
moral_action: Bob hires Tom because he is well qualified for the job.
immoral_action: Bob decides to hire a less qualified candidate for the job because he doesn't like that Tom has had depression.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against people with mental problems.
situation: John is a landlord reviewing the rental application of a man named Bill who has disclosed having prior mental health issues.
intention: John wants to find a new tenant for his property.
moral_action: John judges Bill to be a good potential tenant and approves him to rent the property.
immoral_action: John denies Bill's application due to his history of mental health problems and signs a lease with someone else.

norm: You shouldn't trivialize actual mental issues people have.
situation: Terry notices that his coworker is counting to five between every action he completes in his work.
intention: Terry wants to address the fact that his coworker isn't getting enough work done, due to the counting behavior.
moral_action: Terry asks his coworker if he is experiencing any special difficulties in their work, that Terry could help them work around.
immoral_action: Terry approaches his coworker and complains that they are acting completely crazy, and they need to speed up their work.

norm: You shouldn't call mentally challenged people losers.
situation: A mentally challenged man stopped Jeff on the sidewalk and wanted to have a conversation.
intention: Jeff wants to get away from the man.
moral_action: Jeff tells the man that he's late for an appointment.
immoral_action: Jeff tells the man to get away from him and calls him a loser.

norm: You shouldn't exclude people with mental disabilities.
situation: Bertha is getting married soon and her little brother suffers from depression.
intention: Wants to have the best wedding possible.
moral_action: Bertha asks her little brother to be the ring bearer for her wedding.
immoral_action: Bertha decides to not invite her little brother because she doesn't want him to keep everyone down in the dumps.

norm: You should not hurt the mentally disabled.
situation: Julie teaches a 2nd grade class that has recently admitted a new student who has an intellectual disability.
intention: Julie wants to find a way to get the new student to follow direction better.
moral_action: Julie researches how to communicate effectively with intellectually disabled people.
immoral_action: Julie resorts to smacking the child with a ruler when he makes a mistake.

norm: You shouldn't say rude things to disabled people.
situation: Chad was walking down the street when he sees a man in a wheelchair on the sidewalk in front of him.
intention: Chad wants to get ahead of the man in the wheelchair.
moral_action: Chad asks the man if he minds if he walks ahead of him.
immoral_action: Chad calls the man a crippled bastard and tells him to get out of the way.

norm: You shouldn't treat people with down syndrome differently than others.
situation: James, an art teacher, had a student with Down Syndrome in his class one year.
intention: James wants to avoid modifying his curriculum.
moral_action: James lets the student with Down Syndrome participate in all the art projects.
immoral_action: James asks the administration to remove the student with Down Syndrome from his class.

norm: You shouldn't be biased against mentally challenged people.
situation: James had to choose between two applicants for a cashier position, someone who got fired from their last few jobs or someone with Down Syndrome.
intention: James wants to hire a reliable long-term worker.
moral_action: James hires the worker with Down Syndrome and talks to them and their family about necessary accomodations.
immoral_action: James insists on not hiring the worker with Down Syndrome out of concern over possible unusual behavior.

norm: You shouldn't be ashamed of your physical disabilities.
situation: Lara, who is very physically attractive, was born with a problem in her legs that leaves her with a severe limp, which she doesn't like people to see.
intention: Lara wants to participate in a speed dating event at a local nightclub.
moral_action: Lara has fun at the dating event and finds herself walking from table to table without even thinking about it, and she meets a lot of interested, prospective dates.
immoral_action: Lara is very popular with prospective dates, but she is ashamed of her limp and avoids walking in front of them, so she doesn't get to meet as many people.

norm: It's wrong to interfere without permission in family members relationship.
situation: Mary just learned that her sister's husband is having an affair with a coworker, but her sister doesn't know about it.
intention: Mary wants to help her sister be happy.
moral_action: Mary asks her sister how her marriage is going and tells her she's always there for her.
immoral_action: Mary tells her sister that her husband is having an affair.

norm: It's wrong to betray the trust of family members.
situation: Tom is mowing the grass like he promised his mother he would do when his friend Dan asks him to go to a movie.
intention: Tom wants to go to the movie.
moral_action: Tom tells Dan he can see the movie with him tomorrow and finishes mowing the grass.
immoral_action: Tom abandons mowing the grass and goes with Dan.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your friends and family
situation: Mike didn't get offered the job he applied for and doesn't know what to tell his parents.
intention: Mike doesn't want his parents to be disappointed with him.
moral_action: Mike tells his parents that he didn't get the job but that he is going to volunteer at a homeless shelter until he does find a job.
immoral_action: Mike tells his parents that he got the job and his first day of work is Monday.

norm: It's wrong to worry your parents.
situation: Kim is going out with some friends for the night, but agreed to be home by 10 .
intention: Kim wants to have a good time with her friends.
moral_action: Kim's sets an alarm on her phone to make sure she is home in time while out with friends.
immoral_action: Kim is having so much fun she forgets all about her curfew and stays out way past 10.

norm: It's wrong to steal from a parent.
situation: James hears about a new arcade game and sees his dad's coin jar in his bedroom.
intention: James wants to play the arcade game.
moral_action: James goes to his dad and asks for money to play a game.
immoral_action: James takes quarters from the coin jar and goes to play the game.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your parents.
situation: Lucas got a disciplinary note from his teacher to give to his parents.
intention: Lucas wants to go to his friend's slumber party that night.
moral_action: Lucas gives his parents the note and explains to them how he has learned from the situation.
immoral_action: Lucas tells his parents he had a good day at school and goes to the party.

norm: It's wrong to steal money from your parents.
situation: Zoe is at home putting her makeup on in order to get ready to go to the movies with her friends.
intention: Zoe wants to buy her friends snacks at the movie theater.
moral_action: Zoe asks her money if she can borrow some money to buy snacks at the movie theater.
immoral_action: Zoe sees her mom's purse on the counter and grabs a twenty dollar bill from inside of it without asking.

norm: It's wrong to disobey your parents.
situation: Bailey's parents ask her to watch her little brother, but her friends want her to explore a haunted house with them.
intention: Bailey wants to see the haunted house.
moral_action: Bailey asks her friends to live stream their adventures in the haunted house.
immoral_action: Bailey leaves her brother at home to hang out with her friends.

norm: It's wrong to hide the truth from your parents.
situation: Jerry accidentally shattered his mom's vase and is confronted by his parents.
intention: Jerry wants to respond to his parents.
moral_action: Jerry admits he was the one who accidentally broke the vase.
immoral_action: Jerry says he did not break the vase and feigns ignorance in front of his parents.

norm: It's wrong to waste your parent's money.
situation: Elliot is a child who is playing a game on his mobile telephone which his parents pay for.
intention: Elliot wants to beat the game.
moral_action: Elliot ignores the games invasive tactics tempting him to spend his parents money on features and instead grinds away at the game until he beats it on his own accord.
immoral_action: Without asking permission to do so, Elliot chooses to purchase a feature in the game that makes his character powerful enough to complete the game with ease.

norm: It's wrong to be upset at your step-parents.
situation: Benny has a new step-mother after his mom passed away, and she wants him to help carrying groceries from the car.
intention: Benny wants to respond to the request to carry groceries.
moral_action: Benny helps his step-mother carry groceries from the car.
immoral_action: Benny tells his step-mother isn't his mom and can't tell him what to do.

norm: It's wrong to steal from your parents.
situation: Amy is looking for some money to go shopping with friends and notices her father's wallet on the table.
intention: Amy wants to consider taking money from her father's wallet.
moral_action: Amy decides against taking money out of her father's wallet and simply waits to ask him for money.
immoral_action: Amy quickly takes money from her father's wallet and goes shopping with her friends.

norm: It is wrong to worry your grandma.
situation: Danny is taking a trip through Europe and his grandmother asks him to contact her a least once a week to let her know how he is.
intention: Danny wants to travel through Europe.
moral_action: Danny travels throughout Europe contacting his grandmother at least once every week as he goes.
immoral_action: Danny travels around Europe without contacting his Grandma even one time.

norm: It's wrong to think your parents are stealing from you.
situation: Sal is missing money in his room, and he suspects that his parents might know where it is.
intention: Sal wants to ask his parents about his money.
moral_action: Sal asks his parents if anyone else happened to come in his room.
immoral_action: Sal asks his parents which one of them took his money from his room.

norm: It's wrong to be disrespectful to your parents.
situation: Gabby is in her room because her mother said she couldn't go out even though she really wants to.
intention: Gabby wants to show her mother how much she wants to go out.
moral_action: Gabby asks to have a conversation with her mother and tries to explain her motivations for going out.
immoral_action: Gabby uses language she shouldn't in reference to her mother at a level her mother can clearly hear.

norm: It is not good to disturb others with loud noise.
situation: Dan is in his apartment while cleaning his house.
intention: Dan wants to listen to music to keep him motivated.
moral_action: Dan listens to music loudly while wearing headphones.
immoral_action: Dan plays his music really loudly over his big speakers.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people.
situation: Sean plays a card game and is trading with James, who knows very little about the game.
intention: Sean wants one of James' valuable cards.
moral_action: Sean helps James realize the value and offers a rare card for the one he wants.
immoral_action: Sean offers James a trade using several common cards for the rare card.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people close to you.
situation: John is excited about a new game which is coming out but it's very expensive.
intention: John wants to get the game as soon as it comes out.
moral_action: John works extra hours at his low paying job to save up the money.
immoral_action: John asks his parents for money, saying that hes raising funds for a charity.

norm: You shouldn't spend all your time having fun.
situation: Jill has an easy work life, and she has lots of free time after work.
intention: Jill wants to spend her free time.
moral_action: Jill takes an online Spanish course during her free time and become proficient in Spanish.
immoral_action: Jill goes to bars to hang out with friends or watches movies every evening after work.

norm: It's wrong to interrupt others when they're busy.
situation: Jenna and Marie are both on the phone talking to customers, and Jenna's customer just asked a question only Marie can answer.
intention: Jenna wants to answer the customer's question.
moral_action: Jenna asks the customer for a phone number where she can call him back.
immoral_action: Jenna interrupts Marie's phone conversation to ask the customer's question.

norm: It is bad not to help others in need
situation: Charles, who is a wealthy man, passes by a homeless man on the street asking for money.
intention: Charles wants to respond to the homeless man.
moral_action: Charles buys the man dinner and takes him to a homeless shelter.
immoral_action: Charles tells the man to quit being lazy and get a job.

norm: You shouldn't control your partner.
situation: Kevin is watching TV when his wife Ann tells him that she's going to her friend Susan's house.
intention: Kevin wants to react to Ann's statement.
moral_action: Kevin tells Ann to have a great time with her friend and to drive safe.
immoral_action: Kevin tells Ann that he despises Susan and is forbidding Ann to go see her.

norm: You shouldn't like being used.
situation: Mike, who often hits up Frank for favors and never repays him asks Frank once again to drive him to the next town over.
intention: Frank wants to respond to Mike's request.
moral_action: Frank tells Mike that he's had enough and that if Mike wants a ride he can either pay him a couple hundred bucks or take a bus.
immoral_action: Frank tells Mike that it's no problem as usual and that he'd be glad to drop him off wherever he wants.

norm: You shouldn't trust strangers.
situation: Sara is returning to work after maternity leave and needs to find a nanny to take care of her infant.
intention: Sara wants to find a caretaker for her child.
moral_action: Sara interviews numerous candidates, checks their references and makes sure they have CPR training.
immoral_action: Sara puts an ad in the paper for a babysitter and hires the first one she interviews, that doesn't have experience.

norm: You should not favor some friends over others.
situation: Linda, Greeta, and Gertude are out at the mall having lunch together.
intention: Linda wants to share her cheesecake.
moral_action: Linda gives both Greeta and Gertude a taste of a cheesecake.
immoral_action: Linda lets Greeta taste her cheesecake, but when Gertude asks to taste, Linda tells her that she wants to eat the rest.

norm: You shouldn't work so much that you injure yourself.
situation: One of Dustin's cars recently broke down.
intention: Dustin wants to repair his car.
moral_action: Dustin spends a few hours every day working to fix his car.
immoral_action: Dustin spends all day, and all night working to try to fix the car.

norm: You should not control your partner's appearance.
situation: Cladwell buys his girlfriend Rachel a dress two sizes too small for a party.
intention: Cladwell wants them to look like an attractive couple.
moral_action: Cladwell takes Rachel to a high end dress store offering to buy something she likes.
immoral_action: Cladwell pressures Rachel into wearing the dress.

norm: You shouldn't do things you don't enjoy.
situation: Bob watches the same TV show every morning for 20 years.
intention: Bob wants to watch TV.
moral_action: Bob thinks about it and realizes he doesn't actually like the show anymore.
immoral_action: Bob keeps watching the show because it's part of his routine.

norm: You should not reward behavior you do not enjoy.
situation: Lance's dog has started begging at the table during dinner which Lance finds very annoying.
intention: Lance wants his dog to leave him alone when he's eating.
moral_action: Lance ignores his dog's begging and gives him food whenever he stops.
immoral_action: Lance gives his dog some food whenever it starts begging so it will stop for a bit.

norm: You should not completely control employees.
situation: Lenny's department has an evaulation coming up that Lenny needs to pass.
intention: Lenny wants his department to perform well.
moral_action: Lenny let's his workers do their job, letting them know that they can reach him for support.
immoral_action: Lenny runs around correcting every action his employees make that he doesn't like.

norm: It's wrong to approach people when they are busy.
situation: Milton arrived at his professor's office on his way to his next class but his professor was talking to another student.
intention: Milton needed to ask his professor a question.
moral_action: Milton decided to come back after his class to ask the question.
immoral_action: Milton interrupted the professor and student stating he was in a rush before asking his question.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of your friends.
situation: Charlotte sometimes has outings with her friend, David, who often pays for her meals and drinks.
intention: Charlotte wants to invite David out to dinner.
moral_action: Charlotte takes David out to dinner and pays for the meal.
immoral_action: Charlotte and David have dinner and when the bill comes, Charlotte tells David that she has no money.

norm: You shouldn't get high with your friends.
situation: Lee, whose parents are firmly against drugs, is hanging out with a group of friends who offer him a pipe filled with weed to smoke with them.
intention: Lee wants to avoid looking uncool.
moral_action: Lee refuses and cites that he would, but he has an upcoming drug test.
immoral_action: Lee accepts the pipe and takes a hit, smoking for the first time.

norm: It's wrong to get into fights with your partner.
situation: Ian and Holly disagree on where they should go for vacation.
intention: Ian wants to go to his chosen destination.
moral_action: Ian attempts to negotiate with Holly to go to his place, but do things she wants to do.
immoral_action: Ian shouts at Holly and attempts to bully her into accepting his idea.

norm: Staying silent about your problems isn't healthy
situation: John who recently lost a lot of money is visibly stressed so his friend Marty asks him if everything is OK?
intention: John wants to respond to Marty's question.
moral_action: John tells Marty that he is having financial problems and that they've been bothering him quite a lot.
immoral_action: John tells Marty that everything is fine and that Mary is probably just imagining things.

norm: During war it is not acceptable to kill civilians.
situation: Jim is flying a bomber on a bombing mission over Germany during World War 2, with the aim of releasing his payload.
intention: Jim wants to complete his mission.
moral_action: Jim releases the bombs on German military positions along the Rhine.
immoral_action: Jim releases the bombs over the crowded city of Dresden.

norm: Raping someone is not a good thing to do.
situation: John notices a new coworker at his workplace that he finds attractive.
intention: John wants to have intimate romantic relations with the woman.
moral_action: John asks his coworker out on a date after work.
immoral_action: John follows his coworker home and sexually assaults her.

norm: It's inappropriate to pick a fight in public.
situation: Vince is at a bar when he hears a terrible singer on the nearby stage.
intention: Vince wants to let the singer know that he dislikes his music.
moral_action: Vince leaves a note on the singer's personal belongings telling him that he needs to improve his performance.
immoral_action: Vince heckles the singer and calls him a girly wussy man that can't sing.

norm: It's wrong to start a fight.
situation: James' math teacher just announced that the class has to take a pop quiz.
intention: James wants to get out of taking the test.
moral_action: James raises his hand and says he feels like he's about to throw up.
immoral_action: James starts slapping the head of the student sitting next to him.

norm: It's wrong to start fights with coworkers.
situation: Spencer and Kendall are going to door to door handing out pamphlets for a new business.
intention: Spencer wants to split the pamphlets evenly.
moral_action: Spencer suggests that they split the pamphlets evenly so that they each do the same amount of work.
immoral_action: Spencer takes half of the pamphlets and throws the other half at Kendall.

norm: It's wrong to pick fights with others.
situation: Johnny has a growing and heated rivalry with another member of his middle school basketball team.
intention: Johnny wants to show up his rival.
moral_action: Johnny challenges his rival to a one-on-one game of basketball.
immoral_action: Johnny starts a fight with his rival to prove that he is superior.

norm: It's wrong to get into fights.
situation: Bill is very proud of his roots despite coming from a poor family, which other students take as a reason to pick on him.
intention: Bill wants to stand up for himself.
moral_action: Bill laughs off his bullies' taunts and ignores their calls to fight.
immoral_action: Bill gets into a fistfight with one of his bullies.

norm: It's wrong to use violence to solve your problems.
situation: Ben lives in a neighborhood with assigned parking and his neighbor's friend frequently uses his assigned spot.
intention: Ben wants to stop the neighbors friend from taking up his parking spot.
moral_action: Ben calls a tow truck and gets the car of the neighbor's friend's towed away.
immoral_action: Ben ends up getting into a physical altercation with the neighbors friend.

norm: Violence is not an acceptable way to handle issues.
situation: Robbie and his friend are competing in a game and Robbie's friend is winning.
intention: Robbie wants to prove he is a good competitor.
moral_action: Robbie continues to try his best despite the losing effort and is humble in defeat when he congratulates his friend.
immoral_action: Frustrated with the way the competition is going Robbie begins to get physical with his friend as a way to show he is still better despite losing.

norm: It is wrong to solve conflicts with your fists
situation: Christine has been made fun of by bullies at school.
intention: Christine wants to be left alone.
moral_action: Christine reports the bullies' behavior to the principal.
immoral_action: Christine punches a bully in the middle of the school yard.

norm: It's not okay to use violence to solve your problems.
situation: Nicole is high school freshman who has been dealing kids blocking her locker every day just to chat.
intention: Nicole wants the other kids to stop blocking her locker.
moral_action: Nicole excuses herself and asks the other kids not to block her locker.
immoral_action: Nicole walks up to the kids who are blocking her locker and pushes them to the ground.

norm: You should not interfere with other people's lives
situation: John sees Jake gambling at the local casino.
intention: John wants to tell someone that Jake is gambling.
moral_action: John calls his own wife and tells him that a friend is gambling, and he just wanted to tell someone.
immoral_action: John calls Jake's wife and tells her that Jake is gambling their money away.

norm: You should not brag to those less fortunate than you.
situation: Dave is in front of a corner store where a homeless man lives, scratching a lotto ticket when he wins a prize.
intention: Dave wants to tell someone he won.
moral_action: Dave runs back into the store and tells the cashier that he just won the prize.
immoral_action: Dave runs up to the homeless man showing him the ticket and yelling happily about how he won.

norm: You should not depend on others to pay for you.
situation: Bob is out at a restaurant with friends, but only has enough money for a small meal.
intention: Bob is hungry and wants to eat a big meal.
moral_action: Bob orders himself a small meal, and asks his friends if they would pay for an appetizer to split with him because he doesn't have a lot of money.
immoral_action: Bob orders a large meal and, once the bill arrives, tells his friends that he just discovered that he forgot his wallet, expecting them to pay for his meal.

norm: You shouldn't judge people based on their socio-economic situation.
situation: Laura is on enjoying her first date with Liam when he explains that he is currently homeless due to job loss.
intention: Laura wants to express her concern for Liam.
moral_action: Laura tells Liam that she wants to help him get in touch with people who can help improve his situation.
immoral_action: Laura tells Liam that his situation sounds horrible and that she's so sorry for him but that she thinks he shouldn't be focused on dating right now.

norm: You shouldn't judge other people on the way they look
situation: Dell and his friends were hanging out at the mall getting something to eat in the food court.
intention: Dell wanted to chat with his friends.
moral_action: Dell asked his friends if they were excited about the new superhero moving coming out next week.
immoral_action: Dell said a man walking by was so ugly it made him not want to finish his food.

norm: People shouldn't need to qualify their gender to others.
situation: Mary sees Jake approaching multiple single stall bathrooms and needs to go at the same time Jake is.
intention: Mary wants to know which bathroom Jake is going into.
moral_action: Mary asks which bathroom Jake is going into directly instead of asking about gender, and Jake tells her.
immoral_action: Mary asks Jake what his gender is to determine which bathroom they will enter, and Jake says which one.

norm: You shouldn't obsess on how other people live their lives
situation: Chet's gay neighbors are coming over his place to eat lunch.
intention: Chet wants to ask his neighbors a question.
moral_action: Chet asks his neighbors if they are allowed to eat meat.
immoral_action: Chet asks his neighbors why they're okay with being gay.

norm: People shouldn't feel as if they own other's social attention.
situation: Lucy is a social influencer online and is making a new video for her fans.
intention: Lucy wants to send a message to her fans.
moral_action: Lucy tells her fans that she's grateful for all of the support that they've given her.
immoral_action: Lucy tells her fans that they belong to her and are losers if they decide to follow anyone else.

norm: You shouldn't judge other people's choices
situation: Barney is sitting on his front porch when his much older neighbor, Tim shows up in his new sports car.
intention: Barney wants to comment on the sports car.
moral_action: Barney tells Tim that the sports car looks amazing and sleek.
immoral_action: Barney tells Tim that it's odd why he would buy a sports car at his age when he needs retirement money.

norm: You shouldn't have to listen to everyone's problems.
situation: Randy has had an exhausting day at work when his friend Rick calls to whine, as Rick does almost daily.
intention: Randy wants to respond to Rick's incessant whining.
moral_action: Randy tells Rick that he needs to seek professional help and to stop calling him to whine about nonsense so frequently.
immoral_action: Randy tells Rick to go on and tell him all about what is causing him an issue that day.

norm: You should not judge others by their appearance.
situation: Jane is going through her social media account looking at her messages and requests.
intention: Jane wants to accept some friend requests.
moral_action: Jane accepts people based on their overall profile and messages to her.
immoral_action: Jane accepts only the people who she finds attractive based on their profile picture.

norm: You should not judge the tastes of others.
situation: Samantha is eating dinner at her friend's house with her friend, and her friend's very ethnic parents, and they just put out a very unorthodox dish.
intention: Samantha wants to have a conversation.
moral_action: Samantha asks her friend's parents how they ended up meeting.
immoral_action: Samantha looks at the dish, and laughs and says it looks absolutely disgusting.

norm: You should not judge the lifestyle of others.
situation: Freya, a mother with two boyfriends, asks her conservative Christian coworker Abigail for advice on how to handle her unruly children.
intention: Abigail wants to give Freya advice.
moral_action: Abigail offers to loan Freya one of her mother's parenting books alongside passing along some information she learned from her other friends who are mothers.
immoral_action: Abigail tells Freya that her children are misbehaving because they have two father figures which confuses them,  and breaking up with one of her boyfriends should fix the problem.

norm: You should not judge your relationship in relation to others.
situation: Katie tries to figure out if her relationship is good or not.
intention: Katie wants to learn about relationships.
moral_action: Katie decides to judge if she herself is happy with her relationship.
immoral_action: Katie compares her relationship to all of her friends' relationships.

norm: You shouldn't judge others on their appearance.
situation: Katie tended to judge everyone she saw by how expensive thier clothes were.
intention: Katie wants to invite people to her party,.
moral_action: Katie decides to talk to the people and figure out who she wants to invite from that information.
immoral_action: Katie invited only those who wore expensive clothes all the time.

norm: You should not judge others just for how they look.
situation: Josh is riding the subway when a man wearing clothes with holes in them comes up to him and asks him for directions.
intention: Josh wants to respond to the man.
moral_action: Josh gives the man directions, and it turns out the man needs to go to the laundromat because he was doing his laundry.
immoral_action: Josh ignores the man because he assumes he's crazy and homeless.

norm: It's bad to infect someone's computers with viruses.
situation: Andrew is a computer programmer and is running low on money and talking to his friend Tom.
intention: Andrew wants to make money.
moral_action: Andrew finds someone who needs a website and offers to make it for them.
immoral_action: Andrew writes a computer virus that asks for money and sends it to Tom.

norm: It's bad to steal things from a company
situation: Jared's daughters birthday is tomorrow, and at work he notices the toy his daughter wants coming down the factory line.
intention: Jared wants to get his daughter a birthday present.
moral_action: Jared asks his boss if he can buy one of the toys for his daughter.
immoral_action: Jared takes one of the toys from the line for his daughter's birthday present.

norm: It's bad to misuse email to harm someone else.
situation: Betty is reviewing her department's Q2 sales performance numbers spreadsheet.
intention: Betty wants to improve her department's apparent performance relative to her rival, Sara's, section.
moral_action: Betty sends a personal email to each of her people give personalized suggestions and encouragement.
immoral_action: Betty crafts a fake series of emails that make it appear that Sara is sabotaging Betty's team's sales numbers and shows it to her supervisor.

norm: It's bad to steal from your roommates.
situation: Joe has a date coming up and knows that his roommate, Tim, just bought a new blazer that he intended to return.
intention: Joe wants to wear a nice outfit on his date.
moral_action: Joe asks Tim if he has anything nice to wear that he can borrow for his date.
immoral_action: Joe takes Tim's blazer without asking and spills wine on it during his date.

norm: It's bad to steal from the government.
situation: Dirk is having a hard time keeping up with his bills.
intention: Dirk wants more money to give him comfort.
moral_action: Dirk looks for a part time job at night to make more money.
immoral_action: Dirk claims more dependents than he should on his tax returns form, so that he will get back more money.

norm: It's bad to spy on your significant other.
situation: Susan and Jake have been married for more than five years, and Jake comes back home late recently due to heavy workload.
intention: Susan wants to know what causes Jack to come home late.
moral_action: Susan patiently waits for Jack to come back home and asks if he has worked overtime and feels tired.
immoral_action: Susan pretends to be a customer and goes to the shop where Jake works, checking out if Jake is still working at late evening.

norm: It is bad to call 911 and hang up.
situation: John is a young child that was just taught about emergency services at school.
intention: John wants to call 911.
moral_action: John remembers the lesson and only calls 911 later when he witnesses an actual emergency.
immoral_action: John sneaks away a cell phone and practice calling 911 and hang up when the phone begins to ring.

norm: It's bad to hide transmittable diseases from your significant other.
situation: Jose started an account on a gay dating app to meet somebody even though he is HIV positive.
intention: Jose wanted to have sex.
moral_action: Jose puts that he is HIV positive in his profile so that other men will know.
immoral_action: Jose finds a man that is wiling to have sex with him, but Jose doesn't tell him that he has HIV.

norm: It's bad to snoop on your neighbor's correspondence.
situation: Deloris and her husband Ned offered to help out their neighbor while she's away on vacation.
intention: Deloris needs to pick up their neighbor's mail every day.
moral_action: Deloris picks up all her neighbor's mail and puts it in a pile without looking at any letters.
immoral_action: When Deloris picks up her neighbor's mail she looks her letters to see who writing to her.

norm: It's bad to steal someone's wifi.
situation: Jason is out on the street and needs to access his email with his phone, so he goes into settings to connect to the internet.
intention: Jason wants to choose which method to connect to the internet with.
moral_action: Jason goes into data and turns it on and uses the mobile phone network to connect to the internet.
immoral_action: Jason goes into wi-fi and finds an unsecured connection which he uses to connect to the internet.

norm: It's bad to prank call 911.
situation: Sandy is at home alone by the phone.
intention: Sandy wants to to do something amusing.
moral_action: Sandy gets out Sandy's old sketchbook and practices a still life.
immoral_action: Sandy dials 911 and orders a pizza.

norm: It's bad to steal from your parents.
situation: James has a signature on his mom's bank account and needs some extra money for a night ot.
intention: James wants to get some money.
moral_action: James asks one of his friends to float him a loan for the night, to be repaid when he gets his paycheck.
immoral_action: James withdraws some money from his mom's bank account and goes out for the night.

norm: It's bad to steal someone's phone from them.
situation: Will finds out that Jerry has purchased the new IPhone.
intention: Will wants to have an Iphone.
moral_action: Will goes to the store and buys a new IPhone.
immoral_action: Will takes the IPhone from Jerry while he is using it.

norm: It's bad to steal something that belongs to your neighbor.

intention: Jose wants to find out what's in the package.
moral_action: Jose brings the package over to his neighbor and asks what it is.

norm: It is bad to steal from your job.
situation: Belinda works at a retail store, but has fallen behind on her bills lately.
intention: Belinda wants to get more money to pay her bills.
moral_action: Belinda does some side jobs online for extra money when she is not at work.

norm: It's bad to steal from a school.

intention: Janice wants to react to the shortage of sanitizer at home.
moral_action: Janice makes her own hand sanitizer by mixing isopropyl, aloe vera gel and lemon juice.
immoral_action: Janice takes the bottle of sanitizer from her classroom during recess and put it into her backpack.

norm: It is bad to steal from a co-worker.
situation: Jared is on his lunch break at work and realizes he forgot to bring his packed lunch today, and has no time to leave and buy food.
intention: Jared wants to eat.
moral_action: Jared asks a colleague if he can borrow a dollar to buy something from the vending machine, and the coworker says yes.

norm: It's bad to spy on your significant other online.

intention: Leah wants to know what's going on with Ben.

norm: You shouldn't force your partner to do you sexual favors.

norm: You shouldn't judge others by their amount of sexual experience.

norm: You shouldn't try to sleep with someone else's significant other.

norm: People shouldn't have sex with other people's partners.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with partners your friends are interested in.

moral_action: Sabrina takes notice of Roger's attractive brother and asks the two of them to go on a double date with Danielle.

norm: People shouldn't talk about their sexual obsessions publicly.

norm: You shouldn't sext other people when you're in a relationship.

intention: Justin wants to have an orgasm.
moral_action: Justin puts rose petals on his bed, lights some candles, and asks his wife to have sex with him when she gets home.
immoral_action: Justin sexts the girl he was flirting with at work and masturbates to the conversation.

norm: You shouldn't flirt with people when you're in a relationship.
situation: Luna, who is married, is at work where she is friends with many coworkers.
intention: Luna wants to enjoy work.
moral_action: Luna makes wise cracks with her coworkers and keeps things light throughout the work day.
immoral_action: Luna gets physically close and leads on a coworker who doesn't know she is married.

norm: You shouldn't pressure your partner to have sex with you.
situation: Bobby has been dating Amber for a few months, but they have not had sex yet.
intention: Bobby wants to talk about when they should have sex.

norm: You shouldn't spread diseases through sex.

norm: You shouldn't string people along in relationships.

norm: You shouldn't base your treatment of people on their sex.
situation: Bob runs an all male department but today a female employee has been added to his staff.
intention: Bob wants to incorporate the new employee into the department.
moral_action: Bob has a meeting to identify her strengths and weaknesses and then assigns her tasks accordingly.
immoral_action: Bob asks the female employee to take over the responsibility of making coffee and ordering meals for the department.

norm: You shouldn't watch porn if you're in a relationship.
situation: Christopher lays onto his bed in the mood, and his girlfriend Caroline is on vacation with her family.
intention: Christopher wants to get off.
moral_action: Christopher asks Caroline to give him a show through video chat.
immoral_action: Christopher watches an erotic movie of a threesome on the internet while he gets off.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone's partner.
situation: Adam is out with his friend Thomas and his wife JIll for dinner and Adam is attracted to Jill.
intention: Adam wants to spend more time with Jill.

immoral_action: Adam calls Jill later that week and sleeps with her in her house.

norm: You shouldn't pressure people to have sex.

intention: Tommy wants to talk to Julia about their relationship moving forward physically.
moral_action: Tommy tells Julia that he really likes her and is willing to wait until she is ready to have sex.
immoral_action: Tommy tells Julia that he is going to break up with her if she doesn't have sex with him this weekend.

norm: You shouldn't have sex with someone you barely know.
situation: Dirk goes on vacation to a tropical island, attends a party, and meets up with a beautiful foreign girl who wants to go home with him.
intention: Dirk wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Dirk refuses but continues to dance and party with the girl at the event.
immoral_action: Dirk brings the girl back to his hotel room and spends the night with her, then parts ways with her.

norm: You shouldn't change a friendship based on sexuality.
situation: Paul recently became aware that his friend, Scott, is homosexual and Scott has invited him to go out to the bar with him this weekend.
intention: Paul has to respond to Scott's invitation.
moral_action: Paul considers the fact that his sexuality is different from his friend's, but he realizes that it doesn't matter and goes out with Scott, as he usually does.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with someone in a serious relationship.
situation: Brenda is at the club when her married friend James asks her to come home with him and have sex.
intention: Brenda wants to respond to the offer of sex.
moral_action: Brenda tells James that there's no way she's going to let him cheat on his spouse.
immoral_action: Brenda tells James that it sounds like a good idea, and they should probably leave soon.

norm: It's unacceptable to leave a dog with an animal abuser.
situation: John is about to go on vacation.
intention: John wants to have someone watch his dog.
moral_action: John books a stay at a well known boarding kennel for his dog.
immoral_action: John leaves his dog with his friend that hates animals because it is free.

norm: It's irresponsible to leave your dog outside of a store
situation: Oliver is walking his dog on the sidewalk when he notices something in a store window.
intention: Oliver wants to look at the item.
moral_action: Oliver takes the dog home, and returns to the store later by himself.
immoral_action: Oliver ties the dog to a sign post and heads into the store.

norm: It's rude to touch people's animals without permission.
situation: As James was waiting in line, he saw that the woman ahead of him had a large dog on a leash.
intention: James, a dog lover, wants to pet the dog.
moral_action: James asks the dog's owner if he can pet it.
immoral_action: James leans forward and tries to pet the dog's head without asking its owner.

norm: It is irresponsible not to spay and neuter your pets
situation: Josh has had a cat for years but has never gotten her spayed because he doesn't want to spend the money.
intention: Josh wants to keep expenses regarding his cat low.
moral_action: Josh applies for pet insurance and takes his cat to get spayed.
immoral_action: Josh never takes his cat to get spayed.

norm: It's wrong to leave toddlers near pools.
situation: Jennifer is watching her 2 year old niece by the pool.
intention: Jennifer is thirsty and wants something to drink.
moral_action: Jennifer brings her niece inside, and they both get a glass of water.
immoral_action: Jennifer leaves her niece to get a glass of water.

norm: It's wrong to leave a pet out in bad weather.
situation: Penny's dog keeping pooping inside the house, but there's a tornado warning in her area.
intention: Penny wants to punish her dog.
moral_action: Penny makes her dog stay in their kennel for the night and potty trains them later on.
immoral_action: Penny makes her dog stay outside during the tornado warning.

norm: It's wrong to let young children near unpredictable dogs.
situation: Gail is walking with her son on the sidewalk when she sees a large dog with no leash walking towards them.
intention: Gail wants to decide what to do concerning the dog.
moral_action: Gail crosses the street with her son to avoid the dog.
immoral_action: Gail lets her son walk closely beside the dog.

norm: Refusing to help animals in need is seen as bad.
situation: Ben was driving down the road when he sees a wounded dog on the side of the road.
intention: Ben wants to get home.
moral_action: Ben stops and picks up the dog and takes it back to his house.
immoral_action: Ben drives past the dog and goes straight to his house without worrying about the dog.

norm: Letting your dog run around off a leash is irresponsible.
situation: Janet thinks it's a beautiful day outside to get some sunshine with her dog, Mr Beefy.
intention: Janet wants to spend time with Mr Beefy.
moral_action: Janet decides to go for a jog with Mr Beefy, so she keeps up pace with him on the leash.
immoral_action: Janet decides to throw a stick for Mr Beefy and lets him off his leash to go after it.

norm: It's wrong to chain a pet up in harsh weather.
situation: It's snowing outside and Jill's dog is going crazy and running around the house and it's stressing her out.
intention: Jill wants to have a calm evening.
moral_action: Jill plays with her dog and rough houses with it for about twenty minutes.
immoral_action: Jill takes her dog outside and chains it up in the snow.

norm: It's very wrong to sexually assault your pets.
situation: Nate hasn't been going outside due to the pandemic, and he hasn't had sex in forever.
intention: Nate wants to relive himself sexually.
moral_action: Nate opens up porn on his computer and masturbates to it.
immoral_action: Nate grabs his dog and puts his genitals in his dog's butt.

norm: It's rude to pepper spray people.
situation: Dave is confronted by a drunk, angry man in a bar.
intention: Dave wants to avoid a fight.
moral_action: Dave calmly speaks to the man and apologizes, even though he didn't do anything.
immoral_action: Dave pulls out pepper spray and sprays it in the man's face.

norm: It's rude to honk at cyclists.
situation: Matt is driving when he sees a cyclist riding on the shoulder.
intention: Matt wants to warn the cyclist of his approach.
moral_action: Matt flashes his lights several times at the cyclist.
immoral_action: Matt honks his horn at the cyclist to warn him.

norm: It's rude to spray someone with a hose.
situation: Lily is cleaning off her sidewalk in the summer time.
intention: Lily wants to get all the dirt off her sidewalk to make it look nice.
moral_action: Lily stops spraying when she sees a stranger walk by.
immoral_action: When a stranger walks by lily doesnt stop using the hose and sprays the stranger with water.

norm: It's rude to call for a culling of men.
situation: Portia has extreme views regarding feminism.
intention: Portia wants to share has opinion with others.
moral_action: Portia posts a message on social media that calls for equality between the sexes.
immoral_action: Portia posts a message on social media expressing her belief that the world would benefit from a culling of the male population.

norm: It's rude to point out someone's smell.
situation: Dave is on the bus beside a sweaty, smelly man who keeps looking at him and making eye contact.
intention: Dave wants to tell the man to stop looking at him.
moral_action: "Dave looks up at the smelly man and says ""Can I help you with something?""."
immoral_action: "Dave looks up at the smelly man and says ""You disgusting, smelly rat, stop looking at me""."

norm: It's rude to publicly offend someone on the radio.
situation: Larry listens to the Don and Mike radio show at work every afternoon.
intention: Larry wants to call and be on the radio show.
moral_action: Larry calls on a break and tells them he is a big fan.
immoral_action: Larry calls from work and badmouths his boss on national radio.

norm: It's rude to wipe your boogers on things.
situation: Tim is feeling congested during math class but doesn't have any tissues handy.
intention: Tim wants to clear out his nasal passages.
moral_action: Tim excuses himself to the bathroom where he uses a tissue to blow his nose.
immoral_action: Tim picks his nose and wipes his snot and boogers on the desk.

norm: It's rude to destroy someone's glasses.
situation: John is going to the movies with his mom.
intention: John wants to get a good seat in the theater.
moral_action: John sees that the couple in front of him has better seats, so he asks if he can pay to trade seats and they agree.
immoral_action: The couple in front of John gets better seats than him, so he breaks the mans glasses they are upset and leave, John takes there seats.

norm: It's rude to refer to people as pigs.
situation: Jerry made new friends at school, and they hang out during the day.
intention: Jerry wants to give nicknames to his friends.
moral_action: Jerry calls his friends nicknames based on what they're good at.
immoral_action: Jerry calls his friends pigs because they eat lunch together.

norm: It is rude to wipe your nose on your clothes.
situation: Little Reilly has a cold and his nose is running a lot.
intention: Reilly wants to wipe his nose.
moral_action: Reilly gets a tissue to blow his nose into, then throws it away.
immoral_action: Reilly wipes his nose on his shirt, getting his snot all over it.

norm: It is dumb to play with fire.
situation: John is given a new lighter by his brother.
intention: John wants to test out the lighter.
moral_action: John lights a scented candle with the lighter.
immoral_action: John sets a piece of paper on fire with the lighter.

norm: It's rude to call someone trailer trash.
situation: Ben is at the mall when he's bumped into by Zeke which causes Ben pain.
intention: Ben wants to react to the painful bump.
moral_action: "Ben yells ""ouch"" and tells Zeke to be more careful as it really hurt him when he got bumped."
immoral_action: Ben tells Zeke that he's trailer trash who doesn't belong in the city and certainly not at the mall.

norm: It's rude to call someone a thug.
situation: Sam gets into an argument with a black man on Twitter.
intention: Sam wants to goad him into doing something bad.
moral_action: Sam tells the black man he thinks he is a bad person.
immoral_action: Sam instantly goes to name calling, calling him a filthy thug.

norm: It's rude to throw a rock at someone's pet.
situation: Josh is getting annoyed at his neighbor's dog for barking so much.
intention: Josh wants the dog to stop barking.
moral_action: Josh goes and knocks on the neighbor's door and asks him to calm the dog down.
immoral_action: Josh picks up a heavy rock and throws it at the dog the next time it barks.

norm: It is rude to throw a football at someone.
situation: Joe gets into an argument with Roy during football practice.
intention: Joe wants to end the argument.
moral_action: Joe walks away from Roy while he is still talking.
immoral_action: Joe pick up a football and throws it at Roy's head.

norm: It's wrong to litter and throw garbage around
situation: Billy buys a hotdog from a stand and eats it, but what to do with the wrapper?
intention: Billy wants to decide what to do with the wrapper.
moral_action: Billy finds a trash can and throws the wrapper away inside it.
immoral_action: Billy decides do take the wrapper and threw it on the ground.

norm: It's rude to leave your dirty laundry laying around.
situation: Max walks home from the gym, and he has to be at work in thirty minutes.
intention: Max wants to be at work on time.
moral_action: Max goes into work and changes into the spare work uniform in his office.
immoral_action: Max leaves his dirty gym clothes on the floor after he changes.

norm: It's rude to tell someone to pound sand.
situation: David is driving his friend home from school, but they are arguing about something.
intention: David wants to end the argument.
moral_action: David continues a dialog with his friend while making sure he gets him to his house.
immoral_action: David pulls the car over to the side of the road a long ways from his friend's house and insists they get out and walk home.

norm: It's rude to break someone's seashells.
situation: James and his sister went looking for seashells, and she found a lot more than he did.
intention: James wants the seashells to be distributed more evenly.
moral_action: James asks his sister if she'll give him some of the shells she found.
immoral_action: James crushes some of his sister's shells between heavy rocks.

norm: Cutting people off on the street is considered rude.
situation: Late to work,Charlotte drives on the leftmost land in a crowded highway, and her gps tells her to exit right.
intention: Charlotte wants to get to work.
moral_action: Charlotte asks the navigating system to send her on another route.
immoral_action: Charlotte forces her way to the right lane, and she moves in front of someone attempting to enter the lane before her.

norm: It is rude not to pay back a debt.
situation: Jill and James are at the bank cashing their paychecks together, because James owes Jill money.
intention: James wants to go on a shopping spree after the bank trip.
moral_action: James pays Jill back and asks if she would like to go shopping with him.
immoral_action: James tells Jill that his check is worth far less money than it is in reality, and asks to pay her back next month.

norm: It's dishonest to take credit for work you didn't do.
situation: Harry is working on a project for his boss at work.
intention: Harry wants to get his work done on time.
moral_action: Harry works a lot of overtime hours to complete the project.
immoral_action: Harry copies some work that a coworker completed and uses it in his project to save time.

norm: Expecting someone to work without properly paying them is wrong.
situation: Bill is a project manager whose team is falling behind on a project with an important deadline coming up.
intention: Bill wants to get the project done over the weekend.
moral_action: Bill offers overtime for team members to work on the weekend.
immoral_action: Bill convinces his team to do volunteer work to finish the project.

norm: It's rude not to pay people for their services.
situation: Todd noticed that his car has been making a weird squeaking noise.
intention: Todd wants to take his car to the mechanic.
moral_action: Todd takes his car to the mechanic and pays him for the work but tells him he thinks the cost is high.
immoral_action: Todd has his car worked on by the mechanic but refuses to pay because he thinks the cost is too high.

norm: It's rude to not thank someone for serving you.
situation: Bill was at a restaurant and Jane served him his food, Bill thought Jane did a poor job.
intention: Bill wants to react to Jane's service.
moral_action: Despite the poor service Bill still said thank you to Jane.
immoral_action: "Bill gave no response beliving in ""if you can't say something nice...""."

norm: Not paying artists for their work is wrong.
situation: Tory has a new business that they're building from the ground up.
intention: Tory wants to get an artist for a business logo.
moral_action: Tory tells the artist they'll pay them a good rate for their work.
immoral_action: Tory tells the artist that they won't pay them, but they'll get exposure.

norm: It is rude to not tip for good service.
situation: Matt is out at a restaurant that appears to be slightly out of his budget as he looks through the menu.
intention: Matt wants to save money on his dinner.
moral_action: Matt orders an inexpensive item off the menu and leaves a modest tip.
immoral_action: Matt enjoys his food, and he does not leave a tip in order to spend less money.

norm: It's rude to not share something someone helped you get.
situation: Arnie bought Tom a vacuum for Xmas last year, and now Arnie wants to borrow that vacuum.
intention: Tom needs to decide to lend Arnie the vacuum or not.
moral_action: Tom allows Arnie to borrow the vacuum because Tom trusts Arnie with it.
immoral_action: Tom doesn't lend the vacuum to Arnie, since if Arnie accidently broke it Tom would have no way to get another.

norm: It is rude to not pay your obligations.
situation: Jack was down on his luck and John loaned him 100 bucks to pay his rent, and now Jack has recovered financially and John is asking for his money back.
intention: Jack needs to decide how to respond to John.
moral_action: Jack pays John back the 100 dollars he owed him.
immoral_action: Jack tells John he's going to have to wait because Jack's enjoying having money again.

norm: It's unethical to not pay for overtime.
situation: James is a Walmart manager who's under a lot of pressure to cut costs.
intention: James wants to cut labor costs.
moral_action: James replaces some of the cashiers with automated self checkouts.
immoral_action: James insists that workers apply for two different jobs, so they can work two thirty-hour work weeks.

norm: It's good to give people gifts.
situation: Jane was invited to Eddie's birthday party, and she decided to go.
intention: Jane wants to respond to Eddie's birthday.
moral_action: Jane brings a birthday gift to the birthday party to give to Eddie.
immoral_action: Jane brings some leftover food to the birthday party for sharing with Eddie.

norm: Showing excitement over a gift is considerate.
situation: Chris's grandma gives him a hideous knitted sweater for christmas.
intention: Chris wants to respond to his Grandma's gift.
moral_action: Chris smiles as his grandmother gives him the sweater and jumps to his feet to try it on immediately.
immoral_action: Chris accepts his grandma's gift impassively, before turning and tossing it in a trashcan.

norm: A tip is a nice way to show appreciation.
situation: Dan experienced good service at the diner he ate at.
intention: Dan wanted to thank the waitress.
moral_action: Dan gives more than 20% for the tip.
immoral_action: Dan offers his loose change as a tip to the waitress.

norm: It's good to appreciate gifts.
situation: Bob's wife gives him a gift for Christmas.
intention: Bob wants to respond to his wife's present.
moral_action: Bob thanks her for the gift and gives her a hug.
immoral_action: Bob tells her it isn't what he wanted.

norm: It's nice to give others gifts.
situation: Joe is the office manager and his employee Brian just hit his 25th anniversary with the company they work at.
intention: Joe wants to recognize Brian's achievement.
moral_action: Joe gives Brian a gold watch in celebration of Brian's milestone.
immoral_action: Joe briefly mentions Brian's anniversary at the morning meeting before moving on.

norm: It's nice to send people a gift.
situation: Milo is invited to his parents anniversary party but can't attend.
intention: Milo wants to acknowledge the event.
moral_action: Milo sends a box of chocolate with a note attached saying that he sorry he couldn't make it.
immoral_action: Milo calls his parents to say he can't make it but to have fun.

norm: Exchanging a gift is okay.
situation: Fred receives a birthday gift from his grandmother that he doesn't really like or need.
intention: Fred wants to decide what to do with the unwanted gift.
moral_action: Fred takes the gift back to the store and exchanges it for store credit.
immoral_action: Fred decides to keep the gift even though he doesn't really want it.

norm: It's good to give someone a gift as a reward.
situation: Bill returns from a week long vacation during which time his friend Greg was dog sitting for him.
intention: Bill wants to thank Greg for helping him out.
moral_action: Bill thanks Greg in person and gives him a substantial gift certificate as a reward for dog sitting.
immoral_action: Bill leaves Greg a short voicemail telling him thank you for dog sitting.

norm: It's fair to exchange favors
situation: Terri has been busy, so her friend has been taking her kids to school for her.
intention: Terri wants her children to get a good education.
moral_action: Terri decides to take her children and her friend's children on a field trip.
immoral_action: Terri decides to take her kids on a field trip without inviting her friend's children.

norm: Complimenting someone is a nice thing to do.
situation: Brian's coworker Bertha walks in to the office with a brand new hairstyle that she's visibly proud of.
intention: Brian wants to mention Bertha's new haircut.
moral_action: Brian mentions that he thinks Bertha's new hairstyle is fashionable.
immoral_action: Brian mentions that he thinks he likes Bertha's old hairstyle better.

norm: It's good to give gifts that are thoughtful.
situation: Diane's son Joshua is celebrating his birthday the following week.
intention: Diane needs to get Joshua a gift.
moral_action: Diane buys Joshua the skateboard that he was looking at in the mall last week.
immoral_action: Diane buys Joshua a birthday card from the nearby pharmacy.

norm: It is acceptable to buy someone a nice gift.
situation: John has a good friend who loves to cook and whose birthday is coming up in a few days.
intention: John wants to get something for his friend.
moral_action: John gets his friend an expensive blender that he has been wanting for a long time.
immoral_action: John gets his friend a funny card with his signature inside.

norm: It is nice to give someone a thoughtful gift.
situation: Ken finds out that his good friends birthday is coming up soon.
intention: Ken wants to wish his friend a happy birthday.
moral_action: Ken finds out what kind of clothes his friend likes and get him a shirt.
immoral_action: Ken picks up a generic birthday card and gives it to his friend.

norm: It's good to share gifts with people.
situation: Bret is a young boy that gets a toy car for his birthday that his little brother wants to play with.
intention: Bret wants to respond to his little brother.
moral_action: Bret tells his little brother they can both play with the toy car.
immoral_action: Bret tells his little brother that he doesn't get to play with the toy car.

norm: Bringing people gifts is a good gesture.
situation: Ted is invited to dinner at the house of a married couple he knows.
intention: Ted wants to go to the married couple's house for dinner.
moral_action: Ted shows up for dinner at the couple's house with a nice bottle of red wine for them.
immoral_action: Ted goes to the couple's house for dinner without bringing anything as a gift for them.

norm: It's good to show your appreciation for gifts.
situation: Veronica was recently promoted at work so her friend Joey sent her congratulatory flowers.
intention: Veronica wants to let Joey know that the flowers arrived safely.
moral_action: Veronica calls Joey and thanks her for the flowers.
immoral_action: "Veronica sends Joey a text reading ""flowers came"" and nothing else."

norm: It is kind to give someone a gift.
situation: Ellie has invited Josh over to her birthday party at her house.
intention: Josh wants to go to the party.
moral_action: Josh goes to the party and brings Ellie a board game for a gift.
immoral_action: Josh goes to the party without a gift and eats several pieces of cake.

norm: You shouldn't try to encourage your child to be violent.
situation: Paul's son has been getting bullied at school by a student in his class.
intention: Paul wants his son's bully to see consequences for his bullying.
moral_action: Paul asks the bully's parents and teacher to take action about the bullying.
immoral_action: Paul tells his son that the next time his bully bothers him he should punch the bully in the nose.

norm: You shouldn't bribe your kids.
situation: Andy is a father of two.
intention: Andy needs his kids to do their chores.
moral_action: Andy sets an example for his kids by cleaning up after himself and teaching them to set a schedule for themselves to make it easy to do.
immoral_action: Andy tells his kids he'll take them shopping at the mall if they clean their rooms.

norm: You shouldn't yell and swear around kids.
situation: Bob is watching a football game with his son Andrew in the room, and his team scored a touchdown.
intention: Bob wants to express his excitement.
moral_action: Bob jumps up and down cheering and asks Andrew for a high five.
immoral_action: "Bob screams ""[insert curse word] yeah, that's how it's done"" while jumping up and down."

norm: You shouldn't snoop around your child's things.
situation: Jack is suspicious that his son is hiding some porn magazines in his room.
intention: Jack wants to figure out what his son is hiding.
moral_action: Jack confronts his son calmly and asks him if he is hiding the magzines.
immoral_action: Jack snoops around his son's room when he is at school.

norm: You shouldn't show inappropriate movies to kids.
situation: Ray has some time off and decides to go to a movie with his children.
intention: Ray wants to choose a movie to go to.
moral_action: "Ray takes his children to see ""WALL-E""."
immoral_action: "Ray takes his children to see ""Psychopathic Clowns from Mars""."

norm: You shouldn't get off on messing around with kid's heads.
situation: Louie is very bored, at home with his child Dominick.
intention: Louie wants to entertain himself.
moral_action: Louie decides to play UNO and chat with him about what's going on in the world.
immoral_action: Louie tells his child that the secret service is coming to arrest him.

norm: You shouldn't shout at other people's kids.
situation: Margo noticed that the children from next door were riding their bikes over her flower bed.
intention: Margo wants the kids to stay off her lawn.
moral_action: Margo calls the parents of the children and asks them to talk to the children about riding their bikes on the lawn.
immoral_action: Margo goes outside and yells at the children when they are passing in front of her house.

norm: You should not yell at your children.
situation: Mary's daughter was doing the dishes when she dropped one on the floor and broke it.
intention: Mary wants her daughter to be more careful.
moral_action: Mary talks to her daughter and tells her that broken glass can be dangerous.
immoral_action: Mary starts to yell at her daughter telling her that the dishes were expensive.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids damage store merchandise.
situation: Kayla is at the store with her young son who is hyperactive and destructive.
intention: Kayla wants to distract her son with something.
moral_action: Kayla gives her son a stress ball to play with at the store.
immoral_action: Kayla gives her son a store product to keep him busy.

norm: You shouldn't turn your kids into monsters.
situation: Nate has a boy and wants to raise the boy to be tough and independent.
intention: Nate wants to decide on a training program for his boy.
moral_action: Nate gets the boy involved in physical exercise and survivalist courses to teach him how to live off of the land.
immoral_action: Nate leaves his boy out in the wilderness for days and teaches him to only serve himself, taking from others if needed.

norm: You shouldn't do drugs around your kids.
situation: Jessi is spending time with her kids and gets the urge to smoke some weed.
intention: Jessi wants to have a quick smoke.
moral_action: Jessi puts the kids to bed and steps outside to smoke.
immoral_action: Jessi rolls some weed and smokes it in front of the kids.

norm: You should not throw water on your children.
situation: James' children were playing in his backyard when they starting fighting over a toy.
intention: James wants his children to stop fighting.
moral_action: James tells his children that he's confiscating the toy for an hour.
immoral_action: James turns on the garden hose and sprays his children with it.

norm: You shouldn't scare your kids with threats of monsters.
situation: Anna's young son Milo has developed a bad habit of getting out of bed in the middle of the night and walking around the house.
intention: Anna wants Milo to stop his bad habit.
moral_action: Anna tells Milo that he should not be getting out of bed at night because he will be tired in the morning, and he might hurt himself in the dark.
immoral_action: Anna tells Milo that if he gets out of bed at night a monster will catch him and eat him.

norm: You shouldn't' argue with your kids.
situation: Kay is a mother of two kids and is trying to get them to bed.
intention: Kay wants to get her kids to listen to her.
moral_action: Kay uses a stern voice to state that the children are to go to bed immediately.
immoral_action: Kay begins to act childish towards her children, and they verbally spar loudly with each other about going to bed.

norm: You shouldn't cut a child's ball up.
situation: Willis is mowing his lawn and the local neighborhood kids kicked their ball into his yard accidentally.
intention: Willis wants to move the ball.
moral_action: Willis stops his mower and kicks the ball back to the neighborhood kids, so he can get back to mowing.
immoral_action: Willis pushes his lawnmower right over the ball sending pieces of it all over the place.

norm: You shouldn't rummage through your dad's things.
situation: Joe is writing an essay for an assignment.
intention: Joe needs paper to print his essay.
moral_action: Joe asks his father for the paper.
immoral_action: Joe searches his father's desk for paper instead of asking where the paper is.

norm: You shouldn't do other people's homework.
situation: Calvin is sitting in the school library.
intention: Calvin wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Calvin goes to the non-fiction section picks out a book to read.
immoral_action: Calvin does a friend's homework for them when they ask him for help.

norm: You shouldn't spray paint your name on public property.
situation: A corporation declared bankruptcy firing the majority of its' employees but the CEO got a multi-million dollar bonus.
intention: Mike wants to express his disgust at the situation as a former employee.
moral_action: Mike hands out fliers on the sidewalk in front of the office building decrying what the CEO did.
immoral_action: "Mike spray paints ""Mike worked here and is broke now but the CEO isn't"" all over the sidewalk in front of the office building."

norm: You shouldn't scribble on someone's personal item.
situation: Cindy is at her boss's desk talking with someone from technical support.
intention: Cindy wants to write down a phone number.
moral_action: Cindy writes the number down on her hand, so she will remember it.
immoral_action: Cindy writes the number down in her boss's date book.

norm: You shouldn't shoplift from stores.
situation: Tara is shopping at the mall when she spots a lovely pink sweater that is quite expensive.
intention: Tara wants to add a pink sweater to her wardrobe.
moral_action: Not wanting to pay the hefty price of the sweater, Tara finds a lookalike for half the price.
immoral_action: Not wanting to pay the hefty price of the sweater, Tara sneaks it into her purse.

norm: You shouldn't cut through someone's film set.
situation: Nancy is walking through a busy Hollywood studio lot, where a director is filming in the center, looking for her actor husband Tom.
intention: Nancy wants to pick a path to take to get to the other side of the lot.
moral_action: Nancy decides to exit the studio lot and go all the way around to the other gate on the other side.
immoral_action: Nancy decides to go through the middle, the fastest way, and cut through some film sets.

norm: You shouldn't rummage through other's belongings.
situation: Han was over at his friend Luke's house waiting for Luke to finish using the restroom.
intention: Han wants to do something while waiting for Luke.
moral_action: Han looks at the posters on the wall that Luke has up.
immoral_action: Han looks through Luke's things and finds a wad of $1000 bills.

norm: Delivery drivers shouldn't enter the homes of customers.
situation: Jay is a pizza delivery driver who is currently delivering an order.
intention: Jay wants to deliver the pizza on time.
moral_action: Jay arrives with the pizza and the door is open, so he stands by the door to yell in for the customer.
immoral_action: Jay arrives at the house to an open door and steps just inside the doorway to look for the customer.

norm: You shouldn't bring your pets to the cemetery.
situation: James' dog kept scratching at the door to beg for a walk.
intention: James wants to walk his dog in a pleasant environment.
moral_action: James takes his dog for a walk in a nearby wooded park.
immoral_action: James takes his dog to walk in the nearby cemetery, which has many trees and gardens.

norm: You shouldn't let people eat out of your garbage cans.
situation: Callie notices a homeless person digging a hamburger tossed out of her trashcan.
intention: Callie wants the homeless person to have food.
moral_action: Callie cooks dinner for herself and the homeless person.
immoral_action: Callie enters her apartment allowing the homeless person to continue digging through her trash.

norm: You shouldn't copy homework.
situation: Jerry was sent home with schoolwork that is due by tomorrow.
intention: Jerry wants to go out to play with his friends.

situation: Neal just got invited to go to a football tailgate by one of his friends and Neal is debating whether to invite his girlfriend.
intention: Neal wants to have fun at the tailgate.
moral_action: Neal asks his girlfriend if she wants to go to the tailgate, and she agrees to join.
immoral_action: Neal doesn't invite his girlfriend and goes to the tailgate alone.

norm: It's wrong to never give to charity.
situation: Tom is walking with his groceries out of the store when he bumps into a charity worker at a table asking for donations.
intention: Tom wants to save his money.
moral_action: Tom stops and gives what he can afford to the charity worker while saving the rest.
immoral_action: Tom pretends not to see the charity worker and walks briskly to his car.

norm: It is wrong not to help a friend.
situation: Naru has the afternoon off of work, and her best friend is moving into her apartment.
intention: Naru wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Naru helps her friend move into her apartment while listening to upbeat music.
immoral_action: Naru spends the afternoon buying clothes at various stores.

norm: It is rude not to support your loved ones passion
situation: Macy eats with her boyfriend at a restaurant while his boyfriend discusses his favorite anime in a loud tone.
intention: Macy wants to avoid causing a scene.
moral_action: Macy makes a lower your voice gesture with her hands and offers to watch an episode with him at home.
immoral_action: Macy tells her boyfriend that he's embarrassing her by talking about anime.

norm: It's wrong to never have contact with the other gender.
situation: Mike's girlfriend just broke up with him, and he is laying in bed at home, feeling devastated.
intention: Mike wants to feel in control of his life.
moral_action: Mike decides he needs to change his life and strive to be surrounded by better people, so he makes plans to move to a new city.
immoral_action: Mike vows never to speak to another women again and isolates himself from the world around him.

norm: It's wrong not to help out your partner.
situation: Stephanie and Ron, a married couple, both have the day off of work, but Stephanie has promised to help her parents clean out their attic.
intention: Ron wants to find something to do with his day.
