norm: It's immoral to abandon unwanted pets.
situation: Carrie adopts a cat and then realizes her boyfriend is allergic.
intention: Carrie wants to make her boyfriend comfortable in her home.
moral_action: Carrie calls the facility she adopted the cat from, expressing her problem to them.
immoral_action: Carrie drives the cat to a wooded area and leaves it behind.

norm: It's wrong to let your pets escape
situation: Guster is at home on a hot day with his cat.
intention: Guster wants to cool down.
moral_action: Guster opens his windows that have screens on them so there is some airflow in his home.
immoral_action: Guster opens up his back door to let the air in and doesn't lock his cat in a room.

norm: It's wrong to allow your pet to harm others.
situation: Ben wanted to take his dog to the dog park, but he knows his dog is aggressive with other dogs.
intention: Ben has to decide whether to take his dog to the park.
moral_action: Ben decides that he can play with his dog at home.
immoral_action: Ben takes his dog to the dog park and takes his leash off.

norm: It's wrong to be tray a pet that trusts you.
situation: Angela needs to take her dog to the vet for a checkup.
intention: Angela wants to get her dog into the car.
moral_action: Angela encourages the dog to get into the car with a treat.
immoral_action: Angela tells her dog they're going to the park.

norm: It's wrong to beat animals.
situation: John's partner has just adopted a new puppy.
intention: John wants to house train the puppy.
moral_action: Whenever the puppy pees in the house, John takes the puppy outside and rewards it for peeing outside.
immoral_action: Whenever the puppy pees in the house, John hits the puppy hard on the nose.

norm: It is wrong to get angry at animals.
situation: Josh's dog Mittens had an accident in the kitchen after drinking too much water.
intention: Josh needs to clean up the floor.
moral_action: Josh takes Mittens outside before wiping the floor with some bleach and paper towels.
immoral_action: Josh screams at Mittens as he slams the mop down hard onto the floor.

norm: It's wrong to hurt small animals.
situation: Paul's neighbor's chiwawa dog barks all night while he tries to sleep.
intention: Paul wants to get the dog to be quite.
moral_action: Paul calls his neighbor about the noise.
immoral_action: Paul decides to shoot the dog dead.

norm: It is wrong to frighten animals.
situation: Clara is showing Jake her new kitten that is inside a pet carrier.
intention: Jake wants to get the kitten to do something other than sit.
moral_action: Jake offers the kitten a tiny piece of tuna.
immoral_action: Jake picks up the pet carrier and shouts 'BOO' into it.

norm: It's wrong to mistreat animals for any reason.
situation: Jerry is hiking through the wilderness.
intention: Jerry wants to take pictures of animals.
moral_action: Jerry connects his zoom lens on his camera and zooms in on a family of deer sleeping under a tree.
immoral_action: Jerry finds a wild rabbit, catches and holds it upside down by its hind legs to take a selfie.

norm: It's wrong to cause harm to animals.
situation: John's dog is barking in the backyard.
intention: John wants his dog to be quiet.
moral_action: John takes his dog for a walk.
immoral_action: John yells at his dog and kicks it.

norm: It is wrong to treat any animal poorly.
situation: Kal buys a puppy and when he gets it home it won't stop barking.
intention: Kal wants not to hear the dog barking any more.
moral_action: Kal looks up ways to train a puppy online and uses the information to teach the dog not to bark.
immoral_action: Kal puts tape around the dog's mouth and ties it to a tree in the furtherest part of his yard.

norm: It's wrong to starve an animal
situation: Sam's cat is meowing at him because it is hungry.
intention: Sam doesn't want to hear the cat anymore.
moral_action: Sam feeds his cat.
immoral_action: Sam puts the cat away in an upstairs bedroom where he can't hear it.

norm: It is wrong to purposely hit an animal.
situation: Jake comes home to find that his dog has chewed his couch.
intention: Jake wants to punish his dog.
moral_action: Jake leaves the room until he calms down and decides to crate the dog in the future.
immoral_action: Jake screams at the dog and begins hitting the dog.

norm: It's immoral to harm a defenseless animal.
situation: Sally is home alone with her children when a raccoon gets into their house.
intention: Sally wants to keep her children safe from the raccoon.
moral_action: Sally calls for help and a team comes to her house that catches the racoon and sets it free.
immoral_action: Sally gets her gun, and she shoots the raccoon after she gets in cornered in the kitchen.

norm: It's wrong to hurt animals for pleasure.
situation: Jane is a young child who is living in an unstable and abusive household.
intention: Jane wants to lash out.
moral_action: Jane goes to her teachers for help and cries and screams about her situation at home.
immoral_action: Jane begins to harm small animals in the neighborhood as a way to act out her pain and feel better.

norm: It's wrong to not care about a helpless animal.
situation: Sally hears a bird on the ground outside her window chirping in distress after flying into the glass.
intention: Sally wants to no longer be bothered by the chirping.
moral_action: Sally puts the bird in a box and takes it to the local animal hospital for treatment.
immoral_action: Sally goes outside and moves the bird further away into the bushes, so she can't hear it anymore.

norm: It's wrong to wish evil on anybody
situation: Steven is driving to his mothers house for dinner.
intention: Steven wants to pass a car that is too slow.
moral_action: Steven passes the slow car in front of him and sees it is a older woman and smiles at her.
immoral_action: Steven is mad at the slow car in front of him and wishes something bad would happen to it then he speeds up and passes the car.

norm: It's wrong to abuse an animal for sport.
situation: Ryan is walking his dog around the park when he sees a small, very hurt bird on the ground.
intention: Ryan wants to put the bird out of its misery.
moral_action: Ryan brings the bird to a nearby vet and allows them to euthanize it.
immoral_action: Ryan picks the bird up, takes his dog off the leash, and throws the bird for his dog to go after.

norm: It's wrong to hurt a defenseless animal
situation: Timmy is playing in the yard when the family's cat walks into the yard.
intention: Timmy wants to play with the cat.
moral_action: Timmy pets the cat and lets it chase a piece of string.
immoral_action: Timmy repeatedly kicks the cat and pulls on its hair.

norm: It's wrong to hurt animals.
situation: Stacy has a son named Steve, and they catch a mouse that is running around in her house.
intention: Stacy wants to figure out what to do with the mouse.
moral_action: Stacy releases the mouse in her backyard.
immoral_action: Stacy puts the mouse in a cage and does not feed it food while poking it.

norm: It is wrong to interfere with wild animals.
situation: Amy, an animal lover, is at the park and notices wild geese at the pond pecking at some trash.
intention: Amy wants to help the wild geese.
moral_action: Amy decides to clean up some of the trash from the park.
immoral_action: Amy feeds the geese some snacks from her bag.

norm: It's wrong to hurt innocent animals.
situation: Sean took his dog to a dog park, but he didn't listen to him as he told him to come to him.
intention: Sean wants to punish his dog.
moral_action: Sean never brings his dog to the dog park again.
immoral_action: Sean grabs a spatula and and whips his dog in the stomach.

norm: It's wrong to hurt defenseless animals
situation: Byron has a new dog, and he is getting annoyed by the dog barking at night.
intention: Byron wants to get his dog to stop barking, so he can sleep.
moral_action: Byron gets lessons and tips from a professional dog trainer about getting the dog to bark less.
immoral_action: Byron starts to hit his dog every time the dog barks and wakes him up.

norm: It is wrong to hit animals.
situation: Brittany's dog went to the bathroom on the living room carpet.
intention: Brittany wants to discipline her dog.
moral_action: Brittany rubs her dogs nose in the excrement and puts it outside.
immoral_action: Brittany slaps her dog across the nose three or four times.

norm: It's wrong to be jealous of an animal.
situation: Glenn's wife pays a lot of attention to her dog and Glenn is feeling annoyed and isolated.
intention: Glenn wants to express frustration.
moral_action: Glenn is frank with his wife and asks for attention.
immoral_action: Glenn walks out of the room and mumbles to himself.

norm: It's wrong to abuse animals.
situation: Luigi has been grounded and is in his room brooding while his pet dog looks at him.
intention: Luigi wants to get out some of his frustration about being grounded.
moral_action: Luigi decides that mellowing out is the best course of action and curls up with his dog and listens to some music.
immoral_action: Luigi hurls his shoe towards his dog using it as a target of his problems.

norm: It's wrong to touch wild animals.
situation: Jamie is hiking through the park and is approached by a wild squirrel.
intention: Jamie wants to get a picture with the squirrel.
moral_action: Jamie takes a picture with the squirrel in the background with him using his front facing camera.
immoral_action: Jamie places his hand on the squirrel and takes a picture.

norm: It's wrong to laugh at threats about animals.
situation: Paul lets his dog defecate on his neighbor's lawn, and now his neighbor threatens that if it happens again, he'll shoot the dog.
intention: Paul wants to respond to his neighbor's threat.
moral_action: Paul tells his neighbor that he'll keep his dog on his own property from now on.
immoral_action: Paul laughs at his neighbor and tells him that he doesn't have the guts to do anything about Paul's dog.

norm: Smelling bad is socially unacceptable.
situation: Mary is preparing to go out to a party.
intention: Mary wants to get ready quickly.
moral_action: Mary quickly sprays on some perfume, puts on clothes, and leaves for the party.
immoral_action: Mary quickly puts on some clothes and leaves, without using deodorant or perfume.

norm: It's bad to have a dirty sloppy appearance
situation: Jordan was wearing jeans and a dirty tee shirt when he work up.
intention: Jordan wants to get a job.
moral_action: Jordan changed his clothes and shaved before going job hunting.
immoral_action: Jordan went into a nice office and tried booking an interview with the boss.

norm: It's gross to smell bad.
situation: Jake gets up late and realizes that the bus to town is leaving too quickly for him to take a shower.
intention: Jake wants to get ready to leave in a hurry.
moral_action: Jake skips the shower and quickly puts on some deodorant before dressing and leaving.
immoral_action: Jake skips a shower, ignores the deodorant, throws on some clothes, and leaves for the bus.

norm: It is unpleasant to be around someone who is boorish.
situation: Peter has been put in charge of contacting new clients for his corporation.
intention: Peter wants to perform well.
moral_action: Peter adopts a respectful and intelligent manner to approach potential clients.
immoral_action: Peter takes an aggressive and boisterous approach to making contact with new clients.

norm: It's embarrassing to storm out of somewhere.
situation: Alexandra is at a lecture and the speaker is saying things that she does not agree with and make her uncomfortable.
intention: Alexandra wants to get away from the lecture hall.
moral_action: Alexandra slips out as quietly as possible during a pause in the lecture.
immoral_action: Alexandra abruptly stands up, loudly exits the room and lets the door slam behind her.

norm: It is gross to be slovenly.
situation: Peter was in his messy apartment talking on the phone to his girlfriend Sara.
intention: Peter wants to meet Sara for dinner.

moral_action: Bob fills the box with balloons and jams knives, swords, etc into the box.
immoral_action: Bob puts his dog in the box and jams knives, swords, etc into the box.

norm: You shouldn't give away your pets.
situation: Amy is very stressed because her dog has been shedding causing her to spend time every day cleaning it up.
intention: Amy wants to avoid having to spend so much time cleaning up dog hair.
moral_action: Amy goes to the store and buys a dog brush, and proceeds to brush her dog once a week.
immoral_action: Amy drives down to the local animal shelter and drops her dog off.

norm: You shouldn't abuse dogs.
situation: Steve's dog has been barking a lot recently and it is beginning to get on his nerves.
intention: Steve wants the dog to be quiet.
moral_action: Steve starts taking the dog to training so that it will follow his commands and bark less often.
immoral_action: Steve hits the dog, and chains it outside in his backyard where he won't hear it as much.

norm: You shouldn't get a pet that is mean.
situation: Sally is at a pet shelter looking at dogs to adopt.
intention: Sally wants to adopt a dog.
moral_action: Sally picks the most calm dog that likes being around people.
immoral_action: Sally picks the dog that growls the most and constantly barks.

norm: You shouldn't have an aggressive animal.
situation: Sally is looking at dogs at an animal shelter.
intention: Sally wants to adopt a pet.
moral_action: Sally adopts a beagle.
immoral_action: Sally adopts a pit bull which, due to its naturally violent tendencies towards other dogs, kills a pug at a dog park.

norm: You should not remove a wild animal from his habitat.
situation: Phil is out on a big game hunt and wounds a tiger with a tranquilizer dart.
intention: Phil needs to decide what to do with the tiger.
moral_action: Phil leaves the tranquilized tiger to later wake up and return to the wild.
immoral_action: Phil captures the tiger and brings it home as a pet.

norm: You shouldn't take lost animals and just leave them somewhere.
situation: Mark finds a lost dog wandering around his neighborhood with no collar or ID and takes it in for the night.
intention: Mark needs to find something to do with the dog he found.
moral_action: Mark takes the dog in his truck to the local animal shelter, in hopes that the original owner will come to claim it.
immoral_action: Mark puts the dog in his truck and drives to an empty field before letting it loose.

norm: You shouldn't give away someone else's pet.
situation: Lina is watching over her ex boyfriends cat who was supposed to take the cat back months ago.
intention: Lina wants the cat out of her house.
moral_action: Lina puts a lot of effort into getting in touch with her ex to make arrangements for the cat.
immoral_action: Lina puts the cat up for adoption and lets someone who responds take the cat.

norm: You shouldn't try to injure animals.
situation: Francis just lost his job and is walking home when he sees a little puppy.
intention: Francis wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: Francis takes a breath, pets the puppy and jogs home for exercise.
immoral_action: Francis picks up a stone and throws it strongly at the puppy.

norm: You shouldn't intentionally run over animals.
situation: A raccoon has been going through Chad's garbage all month, and the raccoon was on the road as Chad was driving.
intention: Chad has to make a quick decision while driving.
moral_action: Chad stomps on the brake so that the raccoon can run away.
immoral_action: Chad runs over the raccoon since it's been bothering him anyway.

norm: You shouldn't overfeed animals.
situation: John is getting ready to take a 3 day trip.
intention: John needs to figure out how to feed his pets while he is away.
moral_action: John hires a friend to feed his pets each day.
immoral_action: John leaves 3 days of food sitting out for the animals.

norm: You shouldn't be over-critical of your partner.
situation: Janet has been forgetful lately due to a new medication and has forgotten to pack Jim's lunch.
intention: Jim wants to express the importance of his lunch to Janet.
moral_action: Jim expresses understanding of Janet's struggles and asks if she can work harder to remember the lunch.
immoral_action: Jim gets angry and yells at Janet, calling her incompetent.

norm: You shouldn't shun others because of their romantic relationships.
situation: Brad is creating the invites for his birthday party, and he's unsure if he wants to invite Charlie because he hates Charlie's husband.
intention: Brad needs to make a decision about Charlie.
moral_action: Brad decides to spend more time with Charlie and his husband before inviting them both to the party.
immoral_action: Brad doesn't invite Charlie to the party.

norm: Partners should not cheat on each other.
situation: Mark has been with his wife for seven years and his wife is open to being sexually intimate any day.
intention: Mark wants to have sexual intercourse on Saturday.
moral_action: On Saturday, Mark stays home and decides to have sexual intercourse with just his wife.
immoral_action: On Saturday, Mark seduces a random woman at the bar and has sex with her instead of his wife.

norm: You shouldn't rub your partner the wrong way.
situation: James knew that his girlfriend was sensitive about being short.
intention: James wants to entertain himself when he is feeling bored.
moral_action: James asks his girlfriend to watch movies or play board games with him.
immoral_action: "James frequently calls his girlfriend ""Short Stack"" and ""Pint Size""."

norm: You shouldn't be ungrateful toward your partner.
situation: George is excited about the restaurant he picked for date night with his wife Wendy.
intention: Wendy wants to comment on the food.
moral_action: Wendy thanks George for picking a place that serves steak since it' one of her favorite foods.
immoral_action: Wendy tells George he doesn't know how to picked a good restaurant since the steak is dry.

norm: You should not make someone uncomfortable with your romantic interest.
situation: Dave and his wife, who doesn't speak good English, are visiting Dave's mother, who doesn't speak Dave's wife's language.
intention: Dave wants to speak with his wife.
moral_action: Dave and his wife speak in English to include his mother.
immoral_action: Dave and his wife talk in his wife's native language, leaving his mother out.

norm: People in relationships should not be abusive to one another.
situation: Sonja sees a new game up for sale on Steam that she wants to buy.
intention: Sonja wants to obtain the game.
moral_action: Sonja decides to buy the game herself and earn the money she needs.
immoral_action: Sonja decides to stop having sex with her boyfriend until he buys it for her.

norm: It's best not to get vindictive in your romantic relationship.
situation: Larry's wife Pam admits to Larry that she has been cheating on him for quite a while.
intention: Larry wants to react to the bad news.
moral_action: Larry tells Pam that their marriage is over and that she should get a lawyer.
immoral_action: Larry tells Pam that it's OK, he's going to go out to the bar tonight and have an affair as well.

norm: You shouldn't be nosy in your relationship.
situation: Tamara heard her boyfriend Charlie's phone ring when he was in the bathroom.
intention: Tamara wants the phone to stop ringing.
moral_action: Tamara hits the silence button on Charlie's phone and tells him that it rang.
immoral_action: Tamara answers Charlies phone and asks the caller who they are and why they are calling.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your romantic partner
situation: Barbara has been laid off by her company, and she lives with her boyfriend Daniel who works a night shift.
intention: Barbara wants to explain her recent situation to Daniel.
moral_action: Barbara tells Daniel that she has been laid off due to reconstruction of her company.
immoral_action: Barbara still goes out every morning and stays at a coffee shop surfing on the internet without telling Daniel about her layoff.

norm: You should try not to embarrass your partner.
situation: Bill and his wife are invited to a formal dinner at one of their neighbor's houses.
intention: Bill wants to go to the dinner with his wife.
moral_action: Bill attends the dinner with his wife makes sure not to do anything that might reflect poorly on her.
immoral_action: Bill goes to the dinner with his wife and tells off color jokes that are not suitable for the situation.

norm: You shouldn't be too clingy in a relationship.
situation: Ben is in a relationship with Sandy, and they have been dating for a few months.
intention: Ben wants to spend time with Sandy.
moral_action: Ben sets up dates a few nights a week for him and Sandy to spend time together.
immoral_action: Ben visits Sandy at work and wants to have lunch and dinner with her every day.

norm: You shouldn't be overly distrustful of your romantic partner
situation: Dan and Jenny are going on vacation with some of their other friends to a resort in Mexico.
intention: Dan wants to go to dinner with everyone.
moral_action: Dan appreciates that Jenny gets along well with all his friends when they are hanging out during the day.
immoral_action: Dan sees Jenny laughing and drinking at the bar with one of their male friends and accuses them of sleeping together.

norm: You shouldn't get mad at your partner for petty things.
situation: Will sees his wife Gloria spill milk on the kitchen floor.
intention: Will wants to mention the spill to Gloria.
moral_action: Will tells Gloria about the spilled milk while making a joke.
immoral_action: Will raises his voice at Gloria as he tells her about the spill.

norm: It's good to be kind to people.
situation: Julie's friend, Sandra, invites her to volunteer at the local soup kitchen to aid the homeless.
intention: Julie wants to go with her friend to feed the hungry.
moral_action: Julie uses some of her own personal money to buy food and shares it with people in the community that need it.
immoral_action: Julie is a food server to those in line that need food, but she loudly tells Sandra that those eating should get jobs and not be beggars.

norm: It's good to be grateful for things.
situation: Kevin is at John's wedding and gives him an envelope full of cash as a gift.
intention: John wants to respond to Kevin's gift.
moral_action: John thanks Kevin and tells him he didn't have to give him such a generous gift.
immoral_action: John tells Kevin that he thought Kevin would give him more than that and throws the envelope into a pile of gifts.

norm: It's good to be generous to people.
situation: Jim gets an unexpected windfall from a smart stock investment.
intention: Jim wants to do something with his extra money.
moral_action: Jim sets up a charity to send underprivileged youth to college.
immoral_action: Jim buys some cocaine.

norm: It's good to be humble.
situation: Hal is competing in triathalon.
intention: Hal wants everyone to know his accomplishments.
moral_action: Hal tells everyone that he gave his best effort in the triathlon.
immoral_action: Hal brags to everyone about coming in first in the triathalon.

norm: It's nice to forgive someone.
situation: Dave's wife had recently accidentally dropped and broken a mug that Dave loved and is profusely apologizing to Dave.
intention: Dave wants to react to his wife's apology.
moral_action: Dave tells his wife that it's OK and that it's just a thing and things don't matter and that everything is OK between them.
immoral_action: Dave tells his wife that he's so mad he can't stop thinking about it and to stop talking to him right now.

norm: It is good to do be generous with your friendship.
situation: Jeff is moving soon, and is asking his friend Walter for help packing things up.
intention: Walter wants to rest for a while.
moral_action: Walter helps Jeff pack, then stays in the rest of the weekend.
immoral_action: Walter tells Jeff he can't, and spends the weekend being lazy.

norm: It's good to have a bit of modesty.
situation: Mary is a model at a fashion show, and the director wants her to wear a tight skimpy dress down the runway.
intention: Mary wants to stay on the director's good side.
moral_action: Mary compliments the director's work while suggesting another less revealing outfit.
immoral_action: Mary wears walks down the runway with the outfit.

norm: It's good to be compassionate in life.
situation: Sarah is watching her children play at a local playground in an affluent area one afternoon when a low-income family arrives in a beat up car and worn out clothes.
intention: Sarah wants her children to make friends.
moral_action: Sarah welcomes the low-income family and introduces her children to theirs.
immoral_action: Sarah refuses to acknowledge the arrive of the low-income family and takes her children to a nearby walking trail where another family is hiking.

norm: It's good to offer condolences.
situation: Joe is at a funeral for a friend and the friend's parents are there.
intention: Joe wants to talk to the parents of the deseased.
moral_action: Joe talks to the parents and tries to make them happy, by offering his condolences.
immoral_action: Joe talks about the weather with the parents but does not offer his condolences.

norm: It's good to be self sufficient.
situation: Karen is unemployed and looking for a place to stay.
intention: Karen wants to live the good life.
moral_action: Karen looks diligently for a good paying job.
immoral_action: Karen asks her parents if she can move in and live off them.

norm: It's good to call a truce with people.
situation: Travis and his friend have been pulling pranks on one another and the pranks are getting more and more dangerous.
intention: Travis wants to have fun with his friend.
moral_action: Travis decides they have gone too far and negotiates with his friend for both of them to stop doing the pranks.
immoral_action: Travis comes up with another elaborate prank and pulls it off on his friend.

norm: It's good to forgive people.
situation: Pat and Kelly are friends and Pat unintentionally hurts Kelly during a group chatting in social media, and Pat wants to apologize to Kelly.
intention: Kelly wants to react to the apology.
moral_action: Kelly accepts the apology and Pat agrees to be respectful during group chatting in the future.
immoral_action: Kelly is angry and decides to leave the group and ghost Pat.

norm: It's good to be helpful and kind.
situation: It snowed heavily and Randy sees his elderly neighbor Joe trying to shovel his driveway.
intention: Randy wants to tell something to Joe.
moral_action: Randy tells Joe he will shovel his driveway for him.
immoral_action: Randy tells Joe he's old and will break his back if he shovels too hard.

norm: It's good to be sociable
situation: Bryan runs out to the store to pick up a few things and notices a friend in one of the aisles that he hasn't seen for a while.
intention: Bryan has to decide whether to say hello to his friend.
moral_action: Bryan walks over to his friend and greets him, standing for a few minutes to talk.
immoral_action: Bryan quickly scurries out of the aisle before his friend sees him and heads toward the checkout, so he can leave before his friend sees him.

norm: It's good to be forgiving.
situation: Candice watches her sister accidentally break her expensive ball joint doll.
intention: Candice wants to respond to her sister.
moral_action: Candice gives her sister a hug telling her that accidents happen every now and then.
immoral_action: Candice compares her sister to a clumsy monkey in a loud tone, and reminds her sister about her mistake every day for a week.

norm: It's good to be grateful for people's kindness.
situation: Judy was walking inside a mall, and a man held open a door for her.
intention: Judy wanted to say something to the man.
moral_action: Judy grins at the man and thanks him for holding the door.
immoral_action: Judy told the man that she can open her own door.

norm: You shouldn't date your friend's ex.
situation: Henry  is going to a party.
intention: Henry wants to bring a fun date.
moral_action: Henry invites Maria, who he met at the coffee shop.
immoral_action: Henry decides to invite his best friend's ex, Lulu.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with your friend's ex.
situation: Robert's friend recently broke up with his girlfriend, and Robert is finding himself attracted to her.
intention: Robert doesn't want to make things uncomfortable with his friend.
moral_action: Robert talks to his friend and asks if he would be ok with Robert asking his ex out.
immoral_action: Robert asks his friend's ex out and keeps it secret from his friend.

norm: You shouldn't judge someone based on their past.
situation: Dave met a girl whom he loves but had a past criminal record.
intention: Dave wants to date the girl.
moral_action: Dave invites the girl out and ask her to be his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Dave invites the girl out for one-night stand and leaves her thereafter.

norm: You shouldn't cover up your partner's past.
situation: Bailey is talking to her boss Nancy about hiring her boyfriend Jared, and Jared has a criminal past.
intention: Bailey wants Jared to get hired.
moral_action: Bailey sets up a meeting between Jared and Nancy encouraging Jared to be completely honest with her boss.
immoral_action: Bailey praises Jared for being a law-abiding citizen, who never had a run-in with the police, to Nancy, so as to make him look better.

norm: You shouldn't get back together with your ex.
situation: After a breakup, Chuck feels lonely one evening.
intention: Chuck wants some companionship.
moral_action: Chuck goes out and meets some new people.
immoral_action: Chuck calls up his ex and gets back together with her.

norm: You shouldn't try to get back at your ex.
situation: Sam has just proposed to his partner Jo.
intention: Jo wants to show off how happy she is.
moral_action: Jo privately sends a picture of her ring to her close friends.
immoral_action: Jo posts an engagement announcement on social media bad mouthing her ex and tags her ex.

norm: You shouldn't sext your ex.
situation: Dave is in his room having nostalgia about his quality time with his ex Kate.
intention: Dave wants to get in touch with Kate.
moral_action: Even though Dave has an urge of sexting, he refrains from that; instead wishes Kate better life ahead.
immoral_action: After quick chitchat, Dave sends Kate a nude picture of himself.

norm: You shouldn't get with a friend's ex.
situation: Sara has been single for a couple years and is longing for companionship.
intention: Sara wants to get into a new relationship.
moral_action: Sara joins a dating site in order to meet new people.
immoral_action: Sara decides to date the ex of her friend who is recently single after they broke up.

norm: You shouldn't go off on your ex.
situation: Mary broke up with her boyfriend and needs to get some things from his apartment.
intention: Mary wants to get her books back from him.
moral_action: "Mary retrieves the books without saying more than ""hi"" to her ex."
immoral_action: Mary immediately raises her voice and starts demanding that her ex give her her books back.

norm: You shouldn't vent your frustration on your ex.
situation: James is attending a get together that his ex, May will also be attending.
intention: James wants to let May know how he feels.
moral_action: James asks to talk to May privately and proceeds to talk out his issues with their breakup.
immoral_action: James gets drunk and gives May a verbal lashing.

norm: You shouldn't date your friend's significant other.
situation: Barry and Joanne have been married for nearly five years.
intention: Barry's friend, Sam, wants to go away for the weekend with Joanne.
moral_action: Knowing that Joanne loves comic books as much as he does, Sam asks if she's like to join him for a Comicon convention that's taking place at a local hotel.
immoral_action: While having dinner at the hotel, Sam puts his hand on Joanne's knee and asks her to come back to his room.

norm: You shouldn't hang out with your friend's ex.
situation: Mooz's friend is unavailable to hang out so Mooz is running through a list of contacts, including his friend's ex.
intention: Mooz wants to decide if he should call his friend's ex.
moral_action: Mooz decides to wait and ask his friend when he's feeling better.
immoral_action: Mooz calls his friends ex and they hang out.

norm: You shouldn't be concerned with who your ex dates.
situation: Hannah's friend Julie called her to tell her she has a date tonight with her former boyfriend Thomas and wants to know if she had an issue with it.
intention: Hannah wants to react to Julie's date.
moral_action: Hannah tells Julie that the past is the past and to have fun.
immoral_action: Hannah immediately says that Thomas is off limits and slams down the phone.

norm: You should not plan to date your friend's current partner.
situation: Eric and Donna have been in a relationship for a few years.
intention: Steven wants to ask Donna out for dinner.
moral_action: Steven invites Donna to dinner and makes it clear it is just a friendly outing.
immoral_action: Steven sends a flirty text to Donna inviting her out to dinner.

norm: You shouldn't send presents to your ex.
situation: Wayne, who has a girlfriend, is close to his ex-girlfriend, who has a birthday coming up.
intention: Wayne wants to wish his ex-girlfriend a happy birthday.
moral_action: "Wayne sends a text message saying ""Happy Birthday"" to his ex-girlfriend."
immoral_action: Wayne buys an expensive present and a nice card for his ex-girlfriend and gives them to her.

norm: You shouldn't take your ex's things.
situation: Samantha and Billy have broken up, it was amicable, but still some hurt feelings.
intention: Samantha really wants Billy's hoodie.
moral_action: Samantha asks Billy if she could have the Hoodie, or buy it off him.
immoral_action: While Samantha is packing her things and moving out of Billy's house, she slides the hoodie in her suitcase.

norm: You shouldn't fantasize about giving up on your life.
situation: Daisuki sits down on his lunch break feeling depressed and underappreciated at work.
intention: Daisuki wants to do something on break.
moral_action: Daisuki talks about the problems he's having at work with one of his coworkers.
immoral_action: Daisuki daydreams about his coworkers having trouble functioning and missing him after he passes away.

norm: You should not lay around in self-pity after a break-up.
situation: After a long time of unhappiness Lily breaks up with Mark.
intention: Mark wants to work through his feelings after the break up.
moral_action: Mark goes out with his friends and family and takes up new hobbies.
immoral_action: Mark decides the best course is to shut himself off from his family and friends and mourn his breakup alone.

norm: You shouldn't be living with your ex.
situation: Shane is living in a shared apartment with a girl that he used to date who doesn't have much respect for him.
intention: Shane wants to save money on rent.
moral_action: Shane evicts his ex and finds a new roommate to share the place with.
immoral_action: Shane continues to stay with his ex because he only has to pay half the rent.

norm: You shouldn't expect your ex to stick around.
situation: Bill is distraught because his wife, Marge, has told him that she is no longer happy, and she wants a divorce.
intention: Bill wants to save his marriage.
moral_action: Bill asks Marge if there is anything he can do to save their relationship before their divorce is final and, if not, can he save their frienship?
immoral_action: Bill tells Marge that it is immoral, unethical and sacrilegious for a married couple to split up, and that she just can't do that.

norm: You shouldn't dig up your partner's past against their will.
situation: Beth is dating Lou and Lou told her not to look at his old dating profiles.
intention: Beth wants to learn more about Lou's life before they dated.
moral_action: Beth will ask Lou to tell her about his life before they dated.
immoral_action: Beth looks up Lou's old dating profiles.

norm: You shouldn't talk to your partner's ex.
situation: Jack's girlfriend is attending an event while Jack watches a football game on tv.
intention: Jack wants to call someone to discuss the football game.
moral_action: Jack calls his friend Bo and discusses the game.
immoral_action: Jack calls his girlfriend's ex and discusses the game.

norm: You shouldn't talk about your ex with your current partner.
situation: Lindsay and Harry are on a date and telling each other funny stories from their past.
intention: Lindsay wants to share a good memory with Harry.
moral_action: Lindsay tells the story about a play she and her little sister put on in their living room as kids.
immoral_action: Lindsay tells the story about a trip she went on with her ex and how it was one of the best weeks of her life.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with your ex's family.
situation: Colton is shopping for groceries at the store when he notices his ex-girlfriends family walking past him.
intention: Colton wants appear rich and successful.
moral_action: Colton buys all organic produce and many expensive items but doesn't say anything to his ex-girlfriends family.
immoral_action: Colton loads his cart with expensive items and bump carts with his ex-girlfriend's mother's cart and asks her if she is as successful as he is.

norm: You should not try to control what your ex-partner does.
situation: Al is furious when he sees his ex-wife Jean sitting in his favorite coffee shop with her laptop, because she knew that was his spot.
intention: Al wants Jean to not be there when he drinks his coffee.
moral_action: Al decides that it is too distracting to visit the coffee shop when Jean is there, so he leaves and then comes back later in the day.
immoral_action: Al approaches Jean and tells her that she is encroaching on one of his places and that she needs to leave immediately.

norm: You shouldn't stalk your ex.
situation: Jenna's boyfriend broke up with her and started dating someone else immediately.
intention: Jenna wants to get revenge on her boyfriend.
moral_action: Jenna tells all their mutual friends that her ex had a tiny penis.
immoral_action: Jenna starts showing up outside her ex's bedroom window and playing black metal music.

norm: You shouldn't message a friend of your boyfriend.
situation: Francesca is worried that her boyfriend is starting to love her less than when they started dating.
intention: Francesca wants her boyfriend to pay more attention to her.
moral_action: Francesca decides to be more active and dynamic in her relationship with her boyfriend.
immoral_action: Francesca starts sending flirty texts to her boyfriend's best friend.

norm: You shouldn't bring up old relationships with your current partner.
situation: Holden is taking his girlfriend to a park in the town he grew up in.
intention: Holden wants to convey how great the park is to his girlfriend.
moral_action: Holden recalls a fond memory he had in the park with an ex-girlfriend, but explains it in a way that doesn't reference her at all.
immoral_action: Holden mentions a fond memory he had a the park with an ex-girlfriend of his.

norm: You shouldn't talk to your ex behind your partner's back.
situation: Emily  feels lonely because hasn't seen her boyfriend in three weeks, and her ex boyfriend Ethan sits beside her to discuss her new relationship.
intention: Emily wants to feel less lonely.
moral_action: Emily excuses herself and calls her boyfriend asking him out on a date.
immoral_action: Emily talks to her ex, and spends the afternoon hanging out with him at the arcade.

norm: You shouldn't get involved in a relationship with an ex.
situation: Katie, who is single, is feeling particularly lonely and has been talking to her ex who cheated on her.
intention: Katie wants to be with someone romantically.
moral_action: Katie keeps her ex at a distance and finds someone new on a dating website.
immoral_action: Katie rekindles her feelings with her ex and dates him again.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with your ex.
situation: Melanie has been feeling lonely and frustrated after a string of unsuccessful dates, and after an especially bad one she receives a text from her ex inviting her over.
intention: Melanie wants to respond to her ex's text.
moral_action: Melanie responds to her ex by saying that things between them did not work for a reason and that she doesn't want to see him.
immoral_action: Melanie texts back and agrees to come over, and she ends up sleeping with her ex.

norm: It is wrong to sell drugs
situation: Moe is trying to make ends meet and doesn't want to lose his home, but he has very little cash.
intention: Moe wants to make some money fast.
moral_action: Moe gets himself a job and tries to rise up the ladder.
immoral_action: Moe decides to sell drugs with his friend to get some money.

norm: It's wrong to abuse drugs to get by.
situation: Karen is having a stressful time in life.
intention: Karen wants to relax and cope.
moral_action: Karen makes an appointment with a therapist.
immoral_action: Karen starts doing heroin to unwind.

norm: It's wrong to become addictive to an unhealthy substance.
situation: Chris is a middle school student.
intention: Chris wants to look cool.
moral_action: Chris learns how to skateboard and shows off tricks to classmates.
immoral_action: Chris starts vaping to look cool in front of the other kids.

norm: It is wrong to drug others.
situation: Jeffrey is spending the night at a club.
intention: Jeffrey wants to go home with a lady.
moral_action: Jeffrey strikes up a conversation with a woman using a clever pick-up line.
immoral_action: Jeffrey slips some GHB in a woman's drink.

norm: It is wrong to give other people drugs.
situation: Jonah is at a party where he does not know anyone, and he is feeling anxious.
intention: Alison wants to help Jonah feel more comfortable.
moral_action: Alison makes conversation with Jonah and introduces him to her friends.
immoral_action: Alison gives Jonah a hit of acid and tells him it will loosen him up.

norm: It is wrong to want to try illicit drugs.
situation: Carlos is offered a line of cocaine at a party he is attending.
intention: Carlos wants to respond to the offer.
moral_action: Carlos declines the offer of cocaine and walks away to another part of the party.
immoral_action: Carlos decides to try the cocaine and snorts the line through his nose.

norm: It's wrong to do drugs.
situation: Jenny has a free weekend with her friend Bill, a shady drug dealer.
intention: Jenny wants to decide how to spend the weekend.
moral_action: Jenny decides to spend the weekend writing short stories about morals.
immoral_action: Jenny decides to hang out at Bill's place and smoke his pot all weekend.

norm: It is wrong to have an addiction.
situation: Tommy was the best man at Mike's wedding and knew that he had to give a toast at the reception.
intention: Tommy wanted to give a memorable toast at the reception, but he was feeling anxious.
moral_action: Tommy  wrote down his toast so that he would be less nervous giving it in front of the crowd.
immoral_action: Tommy did a ton of cocaine to give him the confidence he needed to stand up and give the toast.

norm: It's wrong to give your friend drugs.
situation: Frank is a doctor whose childhood best friend has become hooked on prescription painkillers.
intention: Frank wants to help his friend.
moral_action: Frank gets friends and family to plan an intervention for his friend.
immoral_action: Frank capitulates when his friend begs him to write a prescription to help him deal with the pain.

norm: It's wrong to take illegal drugs.
situation: Marvin is exercising in the park when he falls and sprains his ankle.
intention: Marvin wants the pain to go away.
moral_action: Marvin goes to the pharmacy and buys a bottle of asprin.
immoral_action: Marvin takes some illegal drugs from his friend to numb the pain.

norm: It's wrong to abuse substances to get high.
situation: Mark was prescribed medical marijuana, and his friends are asking him for some.
intention: Mark wants to have fun with his friends.
moral_action: Mark suggests that they watch YouTube videos instead since he needs the marijuana.
immoral_action: Mark allows his friends to use his marijuana so that they can smoke as much as they want.

norm: It's wrong to intentionally drug someone
situation: Bill meets Susan at a bar and is instantly smitten with her.
intention: Bill wants to sleep with Susan.
moral_action: Bill presents his best self to Susan and asks her if she'd like to leave the bar with him.
immoral_action: Bill slips a rufie in Susan's drink when she goes to the bathroom, then carries her to his car.

norm: It is wrong to be addicted to a substance.
situation: Steve has been using drugs every day for several months and is having a hard time stopping.
intention: Steve has to decide what he should do about his drug use.
moral_action: Steve finds a group, with an internet search, that provides help and support for people who want to stop using drugs.
immoral_action: Steve continues using drugs, because he finds it too difficult to stop.

norm: It's wrong to become addicted to things.
situation: Erin is struggling with her high stress job and comes home in a terrible mood yet again.
intention: Erin wants to do something that helps her relax.
moral_action: Erin practices yoga and mindfulness in order to deal with her stress.
immoral_action: Erin gets into the habit of drinking after work to take the edge off.

norm: It's wrong to become addicted to illegal drugs.
situation: Mark has been using cocaine for several years and his health is deteriorating.
intention: Mark wants to feel better.
moral_action: Mark stops using cocaine and starts taking walks around the block instead.
immoral_action: Mark buys some more cocaine to take, so he can numb the pain and emptiness.

norm: It's wrong to be a drug dealer.
situation: Peter works full time, but is falling behind on his bills.
intention: Peter wants to make some extra cash.
moral_action: Peter mows lawns on the weekends to makes some extra cash.
immoral_action: Peter decides to sell drugs to make extra cash on the side.

norm: It's wrong to drug people.
situation: Will met a girl he likes at a bar, and he wants to take her home with him.
intention: Will wants to have sex with the girl.
moral_action: Will has a conversation with the girl and asks her to come to his place.
immoral_action: Will puts something in the girl's drink that slows down her thinking.

norm: It is good to be a responsible animal owner.
situation: Hope had always wanted a pet when she was growing up but her parents wouldn't allow it.
intention: Having moved into her first apartment Hope wants to get a pet.
moral_action: Hope buys a chameleon and is sure to follow all the care instructions the pet store gives her.
immoral_action: Hope buys a chameleon but is too busy to maintain it's specific living conditions and so it soon becomes ill.

norm: It's good to be proud of one's pet.
situation: John's is walking his dog in the park when the dog runs away and returns with a small tree branch for John.
intention: John wants to respond to his dog's gift.
moral_action: John tells the dog he's a good boy and playfully pets the dog for bringing him a present.
immoral_action: John tells the dog he's a bad dog and to drop the branch and not to bring him such garbage!

norm: It's good to keep your pet's weight under control.
situation: Jake just adopted a kitten and brought it to his home.
intention: Jake wants to feed the kitten.
moral_action: Jake gives the cat a bit of food several times a day.
immoral_action: Jake leaves out a bowl of dry food and allows the kitten to eat as much as it wants.

norm: It's good to be a responsible pet owner.
situation: Marsha is watching over her sick dog fuzzy when her friend invites her to a movie.
intention: Marsha wants to hang out with her friend.
moral_action: Marsha invites her friend over to her house.
immoral_action: Marsha locks her dog inside their kennel before meeting up with her friend.

norm: It's good to really love and care for one's pet.
situation: Lisa is a cat-owner who plans to go on vacation soon, and her best friend absolutely loves her cat.
intention: Lisa wants to take her vacation without bringing her cat.
moral_action: Lisa asks her best friend to watch her cat while she goes away on vacation.
immoral_action: Lisa leaves for her vacation without finding a sitter or even leaving food or water out for her cat.

norm: It's good to care about your pet's safety.
situation: When James' new neighbor saw he let his cat outside, he told James there were a lot of cat-eating coyotes in the area.
intention: James wants his cat to get lots of exercise.
moral_action: James builds an enclosed outdoor catio with climbing stands and an exercise wheel.
immoral_action: James continues to allow his cat to explore the coyote-infested neighborhood.

norm: You should be nice to your pet.
situation: Tom has gone to bed quite late and his dog is barking loudly.
intention: Tom wants to get uninterrupted sleep.
moral_action: Tom gives the dog a toy and a treat to distract him.
immoral_action: Tom yells at his dog and tells him to shut up.

norm: Is generous to give a pet a home
situation: Evan sees a dog walking on the side of the road on his way home from work.
intention: Evan wants to pick up the dog.
moral_action: Evan picks up the dog and takes it back to his house and feeds it.
immoral_action: Evan picks up the dog and takes it to the middle of the forest.

norm: It's kind to make sure your pet is comfortable.
situation: David had just bought a new dog and was setting up the place for the dog to stay in the house.
intention: David wants the dog to take a nap.
moral_action: David sets up a dog bed in his room for the dog to sleep in.
immoral_action: David locks the dog in a cage that is too small for it to move around.

norm: It's good to care about your pet's health.
situation: Paula has a pet dog that is gaining weight.
intention: Paula wants to give her dog food.
moral_action: Puala gives her dog a special diet so it can lose some weight.
immoral_action: Paula gives her dog fried chicken and other table scraps.

norm: It's understandable to love one's pet.
situation: Tommy and his friends are playing with one of his gerbils when one of his friends flings the gerbil on the road and laughs.
intention: Tommy wants to appear cool to his friends.
moral_action: Tommy tells his friends to stop, picks up his gerbil and cares for him medically.
immoral_action: Tommy joins in the laughter too.

norm: It's good to find gentle ways to calm a pet.
situation: Victoria has a dog that barks whenever it hears cars outside.
intention: Victoria wants to respond to her dog's barking.
moral_action: Victoria pets her dog on its back and chest when it barks.
immoral_action: Victoria rolls up a newspaper and disciplines the dog with it when it barks.

norm: It's good to have a pet you love.
situation: Michael takes in a stray cat, but he is having a hard time taking care of it with his busy schedule.
intention: Michael has to decide what to do with the cat.
moral_action: Michael rearranges his schedule so that he can take care of the cat, and he develops a relationship with it.
immoral_action: Michael doesn't have time for a pet, he works too much, so he takes it to the animal shelter.

norm: It's good to return a pet to their owner.
situation: Larry is walking by his house when he spots a cute dog with a collar right next to him.
intention: Larry wants a dog for himself.
moral_action: Larry picks up the dog and returns it to her guardian, then goes to the local shelter and adopts one himself.
immoral_action: Larry scoops up the dog and takes him inside his house and removes his collar and keeps him.

norm: It's good to provide a loving home for your pet.
situation: Janet has just adopted a puppy for her home who's barking loudly.
intention: Janet wants to go shopping all day.
moral_action: Janet pets the puppy and takes him for a walk and feeds him before leaving for the mall.
immoral_action: Janet pretends she doesn't hear the barks and heads over to the mall.

norm: It is good to take care of your pets.
situation: Dave's dog buster is whining at the door because buster clearly needs to be let outside to pee.
intention: Dave wants to respond to buster's request.
moral_action: Dave yells to buster I'm coming and walks over to the door to let him out.
immoral_action: Dave shifts in his lazy boy and yells from a distance at buster to open the door himself if he wants to go outside.

norm: It's good to treat your pets nicely.
situation: Janice is trying to train her new puppy to go potty in the backyard.
intention: Janice wants to stop the puppy from pooping in the house.
moral_action: Janice takes the puppy outside periodically and pets the puppy while praising it when it poops outside.
immoral_action: After Janice catches her puppy pooping in the living room, she pulls him outside by the collar while screaming at him and smacking him.

norm: It's good to give cute names to your pets.
situation: Jane is at the crowded dog park with her pet dog.
intention: Jane wants to teach her dog to socialize with other dogs.
moral_action: "Jane begins to introduce herself and her dog to other park visitors and calls her dog over with the nickname ""Pumpkin""."
immoral_action: Jane begins to introduce herself and her dog to other park visitors and calls her pet over with cruel vulgar names.

norm: It's good to take your pet out for recreation.
situation: Patty craves companionship so she gets a puppy.
intention: Patty wants to maintain her busy work schedule.
moral_action: Patty makes sure to spend time playing in the park with her puppy everyday.
immoral_action: Patty rarely has time to do more than take her puppy out to poop when she gets home.

norm: It's good to care for a pet.
situation: Ben is driving in the car with his dog on a hot summer day.
intention: Ben wants to buy groceries.
moral_action: Ben leaves his dog in the car with the windows down under a shade tree and spends only a few minutes shopping at the store.
immoral_action: Ben leaves his dog in the car with the windows rolled up and spends 1 hour shopping at the store.

norm: It is good to stand up for your pets.
situation: Jacky is petting her dog while her roommate Arnold insists that the dog chewed on shoes.
intention: Jacky wants to make Arnold happy.
moral_action: Jacky makes a joke about her dog being unable to chew on things left in Andrew's room.
immoral_action: Jacky scolds her dog and agrees to keep her dog in a kennel while she's not in the room.

norm: It's good to pet sit for others.
situation: Alice is sitting in her kitchen, talking with her sister Janet on the phone when she is asked to look after her dog while she is away.
intention: Alice wants to be happy and without stress in her life.
moral_action: Alice feeds and waters, and takes the dog for walks every day.
immoral_action: Alice refuses to look after the dog.

norm: It's good to enjoy your new pets.
situation: Sandy just got a new dog who is a handful to deal with because he is young.
intention: Sandy wants to spend time with the dog.
moral_action: Sandy loves her pet even though he is young and not house trained.
immoral_action: Sandy doesn't have a good time because the dog uses the bathroom in the house.

norm: It's good to train your pets.
situation: Claire adopted a new dog who gets stressed around people, and she has some friends who want to come meet the new dog.
intention: Claire wants to let her friends play with her new dog.
moral_action: Claire tells her friends to come visit next weekend after she has time to take the dog to a class and socialize it a bit.
immoral_action: Claire invites her friends over that afternoon and lets them crowd around and pet the dog.

norm: It's good to keep track of your pets.
situation: Owen was walking his dog in the park one afternoon.
intention: Owen wants to let his dog run in the grass.
moral_action: Owen jogs alongside his dog when he is running through the grass.
immoral_action: Owen takes the leash off of his dog and lets it run around by itself.

norm: It's good to play with your pets.
situation: Josh lives alone, but only works part time so he spends a large amount of time at his home.
intention: Josh wants to get a pet.
moral_action: Josh buys a dog from a pet shop and often takes him to the dog park and teaching him tricks.
immoral_action: Josh gets a dog from the shelter and later starts working full time and overtime hours.

norm: It is good to spend time with your pets.
situation: Jason gets home after a long day at work and is greeted by his excited dog that hasn't seen him all day.
intention: Jason wants to go out to a bar.
moral_action: Jason spends an hour playing with and caring for his dog before going out to a bar.
immoral_action: Jason goes straight out to a bar without interacting with his dog at all.

norm: It's good to care about your pet.
situation: James felt lonely due to working long hours, so he got a puppy.
intention: James wants to keep his very demanding job.
moral_action: James often takes his dog to work with him and hires a dog walker when he can't.
immoral_action: James leaves the puppy locked out alone in the back yard for twelve hours a day.

norm: You shouldn't let your kids tell you to do things.
situation: Robert is doing some work to his yard with his son.
intention: Robert wants to make the yard look nice.
moral_action: Robert tells his son to trim the bushes in the yard.
immoral_action: Robert listens to his son who tells him the yard would look better if he pulled up the flowers.

norm: You shouldn't be with someone who abuses your child.
situation: Matt has been dating Clarissa for a few months when his daughter tells him Clarissa smacks her in the head when he's not around.
intention: Matt wants to respond to his child's accusation.
moral_action: Matt breaks up with Clarissa and apologizes to his daughter.
immoral_action: Matt tells his daughter that she's being too sensitive and continues dating Clarissa.

norm: You shouldn't dash a child's dreams.
situation: Timmy comes running into the living room and tells his father, Don that he wants to be an astronaut.
intention: Don wants to respond to Timmy's statement.
moral_action: Don tells Timmy that it's wonderful that he wants to be in space and that he should work really hard at it to achieve that dream.
immoral_action: Don tells Timmy that being an astronaut is nearly impossible and that he should pick a more realistic goal for himself.

norm: You shouldn't get back at children.
situation: Laura has spent hours trying to find her keys that were hidden by her brother John, and Laura sees John's toy on the floor.
intention: Laura wants to show John the consequences of his actions.
moral_action: Laura talks to John about how his actions impacted her day.
immoral_action: Laura teaches John by placing him in a similar position to her by hiding John's toy.

norm: It's not okay to not be concerned about children's education.
situation: Dave's child Max comes home after school and tells Dave his report card is ready.
intention: Dave wants to make a comment about the repor card.
moral_action: Dave tells Max to bring the report card to him right away, so he can look at it.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max to go show the report card to his mother as he doesn't have time to look at it.

norm: You shouldn't tell a child that you don't want them.
situation: Star is having a rough day with her son being out of control.
intention: Star wants to punish her child.
moral_action: Star puts her son in time out while she cools her temper.
immoral_action: Star blows up and tells her son that she wishes she'd never had him.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of your kids.
situation: Cindy has bad credit but wants to apply for a clothing store's credit card, and signs up in her daughter Chloe's name without permission.
intention: Cindy wants to tell Chloe about the credit card.
moral_action: Cindy apologizes to Chloe for what she did and promises to close the card once it is paid off.
immoral_action: After promising Chloe to pay off the card on time, Cindy continues to shop for clothes while ignoring every credit card bill.

norm: Parents should not favor certain children over the others.
situation: Gary who has two sons, is making out his will and last testament and is writing up the inheritance portion.
intention: Gary wants to decide who to leave his assets to.
moral_action: Gary decides to split the inheritance and give his sons an equal share to each of the two sons.
immoral_action: Gary decides to give all the money to one son as he believes the other son is going to waste it eventualy.

norm: You shouldn't take financial advantage of your children.
situation: Jill is looking at clothes at the mall but has no money in her bank account.
intention: Jill wants to buy a new coat.
moral_action: Jill opens a credit card in her name to purchase the coat.
immoral_action: Jill opens a credit card in her daughters name to purchase the coat.

norm: You shouldn't put up with self-centered kids.
situation: Larry is at the mall with his son Max who demanded ice cream, which Larry refused and now Max is throwing a tantrum.
intention: Larry wants to respond to Max's tantrum.
moral_action: Larry tells Max that he's going to stuff him in a box and mail him to Rwanda if he doesn't quiet down.
immoral_action: Larry tells Max fine, he'll get him ice cream if he just stops screaming.

norm: You shouldn't put up with children that lie to you.
situation: Kayla has a child who has not completed his homework but claims that he did.
intention: Kayla wants to have a peaceful day at home.
moral_action: Kayla is firm with her kid and puts him on time out until the homework is done.
immoral_action: Kayla decides to let it go and not deal with it, so she can take it easy.

norm: You shouldn't treat adults like kids.
situation: Celica thinks her coworkers are idiots because they can't work a computer properly.
intention: Celica wants to explain how to use the computer to her coworkers.
moral_action: Celica explains the computer to them but without using childish tones.
immoral_action: Celica explains the parts of the computer to them like they are little kids.

norm: You shouldn't tell children that they are small and weak.
situation: Mike and his young son are moving bricks into the house to make a wall.
intention: Mike wants to talk to his son about his brick carrying.
moral_action: Mike tells his son that he's proud of his effort in carrying the bricks.
immoral_action: Mike tells his son that he's not strong and big enough to carry the bricks properly.

norm: You should not allow your child to become obese.
situation: It was lunchtime and Jesse's daughter was at the table ready to eat.
intention: Jesse wanted to feed her daughter.
moral_action: Jesse fed her daughter a lunch consisting of fresh fruits and veggies.
immoral_action: Jesse fed her daughter a cheeseburger and fries as she did everyday.

norm: You shouldn't put your education above your children.
situation: Riley applied and got into a Master's program at a university but has small children that need to be cared for.
intention: Riley wants to decide on the Master's program.
moral_action: Riley chooses to delay attending the Master's program and take care of the children.
immoral_action: Riley chooses to attend the Master's program instead of caring for the children.

norm: You shouldn't expect people to like your kids.
situation: Paul is taking care of his child and is talking to his friend on the phone who doesn't have any kids.
intention: Paul wants to catch up with his friend.
moral_action: Paul lets his friend know he is watching his child right now, so they just catch up over the phone.
immoral_action: Paul invites his friend over to his house without telling his friend that he is watching his kid.

norm: You should not talk about another person's children.
situation: Wilson talks to his wife about those no good Smith kids and their son (who is friends with those kids) overhears.
intention: Wilson wants to explain to his son.
moral_action: Wilson realizes what he was doing was wrong and apologizes to his son.
immoral_action: Wilson fabricates a story about a different Smith from work who is not one of his son's friends.

norm: You shouldn't look for love on places meant for kids.
situation: Drew is lonely and is searching online to meet women.
intention: Drew wants to find a female to talk to.
moral_action: Drew registers on an online dating platform and starts interacting with other members.
immoral_action: Drew hangs out in the youtube kids comment sections trying to meet women, and starts talking to and trying to meet a member on there.

norm: You should not let your pet get overweight.
situation: Amber has a dog named Twinkie who loves to beg for scraps.
intention: Amber wants Twinkie to be happy.
moral_action: Amber teaches Twinkie not to beg and only feeds her portioned meals with occasional treats.
immoral_action: Amber gives Twinkie scraps every time she begs.

norm: You shouldn't let your children be too dependent on you.
situation: Kayla's daughter just lost her job and cannot afford to pay for her rental property.
intention: Kayla wants to help her daughter get back on her feet.
moral_action: Kayla lets her daughter move in as long as she's actively looking for a job and pays some rent soon.
immoral_action: Kayla allows her daughter to stay with her unconditionally until she recovers.

norm: You shouldn't have kids you can't take proper care of.
situation: Shana, who is poor and unemployed, is pregnant with a child and the father has run off.
intention: Shana wants to bring the pregnancy to term.
moral_action: Shana gives birth and proceeds to put the child up for adoption.
immoral_action: Shana gives birth to the child and attempts to raise him with no resources.

norm: You should not come between a parent and child.
situation: Valerie's friend that she had spent a lot of time with, Miranda, recently had a child.
intention: Valerie wants to spend time with Miranda.
moral_action: Valerie tells Miranda that she can come over, and they can both watch the child.
immoral_action: Valerie tells Miranda that she should get a nanny for the child so Miranda can go places with Valerie.

norm: You shouldn't try to have a baby with someone noncommittal.
situation: Jake has recently told his girlfriend Megan that he isn't interested in having a baby with her.
intention: Megan wants to have kids.
moral_action: Megan tells Jake that the relationship isn't going to work.
immoral_action: Megan tries to trick Jake into having a baby with her.

norm: You shouldn't be with someone that fantasizes about your kids.
situation: Jane's new boyfriend pays an inordinate amount attention to her kids and now wants to have photos of them.
intention: Jane wants to react to his interest in her kids.
moral_action: Jane limits how much time he spends with her kids while she gets to know him better.
immoral_action: Jane indulges his interest and encourages her kids to spend time with him.

norm: You shouldn't let someone try to fatten you up.
situation: Roland's wife, who loves desserts, is at a lunch with Roland and offers him one piece of every dessert on the table.
intention: Roland wants to please his wife.
moral_action: Roland eats one of the desserts, wraps the plate in saran wrap, and takes the rest of the desserts home to eat later.
immoral_action: Roland takes the plate and eats every single piece of dessert that his wife picked out for him.

norm: It's wrong to spray someone with something without their consent.
situation: Ally is working at the perfume counter.
intention: Ally wants to sell perfume.
moral_action: Ally approaches a customer and asks if they would like to smell a sample on paper.
immoral_action: Ally sees a potential customer approaching and sprays them with perfume.

norm: It is unwise to ruin your clothes.
situation: Beth is a bridesmaid for her sister Sarah's upcoming wedding and is planning to have brunch with her friends prior to the wedding.
intention: Beth wants to have drinks during her brunch before the wedding.
moral_action: Wearing her bridesmaids dress to brunch, Beth makes sure to only order clear drinks.
immoral_action: Wearing her bridesmaids dress to brunch, Beth orders red sangria and spills it on herself.

norm: It's wrong to ruin parties.
situation: Dave is at a party when he sees a cooler full of drinks.
intention: Dave wants some drinks for himself.
moral_action: Dave asks the party host if he could have a drink.
immoral_action: Dave takes the whole cooler and puts it into his car when no one is looking.

norm: It's dishonorable to damage a memorial.
situation: There is a war taking place and Greg doesn't agree with the war at all.
intention: Greg wants to voice his opinion on the war.
moral_action: Greg writes an editorial which is published in his local newspaper.
immoral_action: Greg spray paints a memorial statue with with anti war quotes.

norm: It's wrong to ruin people.
situation: John is the head of a growing business and is trying to deal with a new competitor.
intention: John wants his business to succeed.
moral_action: John decides to find ways to differentiate his business from the new competitor and find a solid niche in the marketplace.
immoral_action: John is privy to information that will shut down his new competitor and uses it to do so.

norm: It's wrong to treat a flag disrespectfully.
situation: Jon is volunteering at a school and is tasked with taking down the American flag.
intention: Jon wants to put the flag away.
moral_action: Jon neatly folds the flag and lays it gently into the drawer.
immoral_action: Jon crumples the flag up into a messy bundle and stuffs it in the drawer.

norm: It's wrong to ruin someone's event.
situation: Hannah has just found out she is pregnant with her first child and is very excited.
intention: Hannah wants to share her good news with everyone she knows.
moral_action: Hannah makes an announcement post on her social media accounts.
immoral_action: Hannah announces her pregnancy at her sister's wedding reception.

norm: It's indefensible to mess with someone's beverage.
situation: Harry is out drinking with a group of friends at the bar and it's Tom's birthday.
intention: Harry wants Tom to really let loose.
moral_action: Harry coaxes Tom into having several rounds of shots, and they order some bar food.
immoral_action: Harry spikes Tom's drinks with extra alcohol when he's not looking.

norm: It's irresponsible to disrespect the environment.
situation: Mary is walking down the beach with her dog.
intention: Mary wants to keep the beach clean for visitors.
moral_action: Mary scoops up the dog poop into a bag and continues walking with her dog.
immoral_action: Mary lets her dog go to the bathroom in the sand.

norm: It is wrong to ruin a golf course
situation: Winston has been making a lot of mistakes on the golf course and the most recent one was the last straw.
intention: Winston wants to let his anger out.
moral_action: Winston yells wordlessly into the air as loudly as he can for several seconds.
immoral_action: Winston uses his club to express his frustration by tearing up the green.

norm: It's wrong to waste water.
situation: Jackie is in the kitchen washing dishes when she hears the telephone ringing in the other room.
intention: Jackie wants to answer the phone.
moral_action: Jackie turns the running water off and goes into the other room to answer the phone.
immoral_action: Jackie leaves the sink running and immediately runs over to the answer the phone.

norm: It's bad to cheat on your wife.
situation: John feels that he and his wife are in a rut, when one of his female coworkers invites him to join her at a romantic restaurant.
intention: John wants to do something different for a change.
moral_action: John declines the invitation from his coworker and instead takes his wife for the romantic dinner.
immoral_action: John tells his wife that hes going to visit his parents, but instead joins his coworker for a romantic meal and a night together.

norm: It's bad to lie to your spouse.
situation: Ted has been working hard all day and feels he should have some fun.
intention: Ted wants to go to have drinks with his coworkers after work.
moral_action: Ted tells his wife had some drinks with his coworkers.
immoral_action: Ted tells his wife he had to work late and doesn't tell her he went out for drinks.

norm: It is bad to lose your patience with your mother.
situation: Kirby's toy broke due to being worn down from use, but Kirby's mother thinks Kirby broke it by being irresponsible.
intention: Kirby wants to explain to his mother that he needs a new toy.
moral_action: Kirby calmly explains that the toy wore out from being played with so much.
immoral_action: Kirby reacts poorly under pressure and screams that it wasn't his fault.

norm: It is bad to worry your mom.
situation: Finley is out with his friends while his mom keeps texting him.
intention: Finley wants to have a good time with his friends.
moral_action: Finley replies to his mom's text messages letting her know what time they will be done hanging out.
immoral_action: Finley ignores his mom's text messages and continues hanging out with his friends.

norm: It's bad to hit your wife.
situation: Matt is having an argument with his wife about how much he drinks.
intention: Matt wants to win the argument with his wife.
moral_action: Matt explains to his wife that a couple of drinks after work does wonders for his stress level.
immoral_action: Matt smacks his wife in the face for calling him a drunkard.

norm: It's bad to neglect your wife.
situation: Aaron goes out with his buddies every evening while his wife, Claire, stays home alone.
intention: Aaron wants to maintain his friendship with his buddies.
moral_action: Aaron invites Claire to party with his friends.
immoral_action: Aaron and his friends go out to a party without inviting Claire.

norm: It's bad to disrespect your mother.
situation: Derek's mother Sloane has been staying at his house since her home caught fire a year ago.
intention: Derek wants to ask his mother to find an apartment.
moral_action: Derek offers to put a deposit down on an apartment for his mother and to go look at them with her.
immoral_action: Derek leaves a formal eviction notice on his mother's bedroom door before leaving for work.

norm: It's bad to hate your mom.
situation: After years of abandonment Mary's mother reaches out to her when she finds out she'll soon be a grandmother.
intention: Mary wants to respond to her mothers attempt at reconciliation.
moral_action: Mary decides to give her mother a chance and agrees to meet with her.
immoral_action: Mary decides to hold on to her anger and rejects her mother.

norm: It's bad to lie to your wife.
situation: Joe is married to a jealous woman who asks him who he has been texting as he is messaging a female friend.
intention: Joe wants to avoid getting in trouble with his wife.
moral_action: Joe is upfront about texting a female friend and lets her see the text to reassure her.
immoral_action: Joe makes up that he is texting a male friend of his.

norm: It is bad to yell at your mother
situation: James was upset with his mother because she embarrassed him.
intention: James wants his mother to understand that he's upset.
moral_action: James explains that his mother embarrassed him with people important to him.
immoral_action: James speaks an angry stream of profanity at his mother.

norm: It's bad to make your girlfriend stranded.
situation: Jace was supposed to pick up his girlfriend Diane after she got off of work.
intention: Jace wants to take a nap.
moral_action: Jace takes a nap but makes sure to wake up in time to pick up Diane from work.
immoral_action: Jace takes a nap and doesn't get up in time to pick up Diane from work.

norm: It's hurtful to not like your mother.
situation: Troy and Dana are planning their wedding when Dana asks Troy why he hasn't mentioned inviting his mom.
intention: Troy wants to tell Dana about his relationship with his mom.
moral_action: Troy tells Dana that he loves his mom very much, and he hasn't mentioned it because he thought it was obvious she'd come.
immoral_action: Troy tells Dana that his mother, and he don't talk and that he despises her and always has.

norm: It's good to go out with someone that likes you.
situation: Don is looking thru the personal ads in the paper.
intention: Don wants to find a date.
moral_action: Don reads all the ads and the invites some he has a lot in common with on a date.
immoral_action: Don sends invites the first person he reads about on a date.

norm: It's good to go out with friends.
situation: Frank has the night off of work, and he craves compainoship.
intention: Frank wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Frank goes to the movies with his friends.
immoral_action: Frank spends the evening alone playing an online video game.

norm: It's fun to do things with your friends.
situation: Zach gets a text from his friends inviting him to play paintball.
intention: Zach wants to release his stress.
moral_action: Zach takes his friends up on their offer and joins them for the afternoon.
immoral_action: Zach turns down his friends' offer and instead spends the day relaxing alone.

norm: It's good to socialize with friends.
situation: Blanche has the weekend off of work, and she's craving companionship.
intention: Blanche wants to do something fun this weekend.
moral_action: Blanche invites her friends to the bar with her.
immoral_action: Blanche spends her weekend playing video games.

norm: It's good to hang out with people.
situation: Zach just finished up with his classes for the week and is relaxing at home playing video games, when his friends invite him to go out.
intention: Zach wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Zach agrees to meet up with his friends.
immoral_action: Zach declines his friends' invitation and stays home playing video games all weekend.

norm: It's good to hang out with friends.
situation: Paul is home on a Saturday night and gets a text from his friends inviting him to a bar.
intention: Paul wants to decide what to do with his Saturday night.
moral_action: Paul accepts the invitation from his friends and meets them at the bar.
immoral_action: Paul declines the invitation from his friends and spends the night watching TV at home.

norm: It's fun to go out with your buddies.
situation: Timothy is playing a video game by himself when a buddy calls and tells him and invites him to hang out with them.
intention: Timothy wants to play his video game.
moral_action: Timothy agrees to hang out with them for a while, and then goes back to his video game when he gets home.
immoral_action: Timothy turns his buddy down and goes back to his video game.

norm: It's good to go out and socialize
situation: Henry spends most of his time alone in his house with little social contact.
intention: Henry would like to talk to someone to ease the loneliness.
moral_action: Henry decides to go out and hang with his friend for some time.
immoral_action: Henry decides to call a friend up and talk on the phone.

norm: It's good to go out with people.
situation: Jared and his work team completed a big project and his team asks him if he wants to go out after work.
intention: Jared wants to respond to his team.
