immoral_action: Grace goes on her traveling adventures and doesn't attempt to contact anyone while she's away.

norm: It is rude to disrespect your brother
situation: James, an avid reader and chess player, couldn't understand why his brother liked sports so much.
intention: James wants to feel closer to his brother.
moral_action: James goes to watch some of his brother's football games to better understand the allure.
immoral_action: "James tries to teach his brother to play chess despite his lack of interest, so he'll have ""something better to do that hit people all day."

norm: It's rude to interfere in someone's business.
situation: Lisa is at the DMV, and she overhears someone sobbing at the other end of the room.
intention: Lisa wants to know what is going on.
moral_action: Lisa minds her business and tries to listen in on why shes upset.
immoral_action: Lisa marches right up to the woman and asks her why she is crying and demands to know.

norm: It's unwise to start a relationship in the workplace.
situation: Jackie, a new coworker of Robert's asks him out for a drinks and dinner.
intention: Robert wants to have drinks with Jackie.
moral_action: Robert has drinks with Jackie but makes it clear that no relationship will come of this.
immoral_action: Robert accepts the drinks, asks her to be his girlfriend and the relationship ends within a week of it's start.

norm: It's wrong to make inappropriate jokes in the workplace.
situation: Mark is a high level sales manager who is trying to land a new client.
intention: Mark wants the client to feel comfortable with him like they were buddies out having drinks.
moral_action: Mark makes a cheesy dad joke to the client.
immoral_action: Mark makes a sexually charged joke to the client.

norm: It's rude to snitch on your friends at work.
situation: Dave who had witnessed Phil stealing from a work cash register is asked by the manager if he saw who took the money.
intention: Dave wants to answer the manger's question.
moral_action: Dave tells the manager that he has no idea who took the money since he didn't see anything.
immoral_action: Dave tells the manager that he saw Phil taking the money from the cash register.

norm: It's rude to inconvenience employees.
situation: Terry is at the store and needs help with a purchase when she sees an employee going on lunch.
intention: Terry wants to find someone to help her.
moral_action: Terry approaches the worker and asks if they can page someone else to help her.
immoral_action: Terry approaches the worker and insists they help her.

norm: It is rude to yell at a co worker.
situation: Alex's disabled co-worker keeps messing up at work.
intention: Alex wants the co-worker to work better.
moral_action: Alex explains to his co-workers what he's doing wrong at work, and how he can improve.
immoral_action: Alex yells at the co-worker to stop messing up so much.

norm: Treating a client in an unfriendly manner is unacceptable.
situation: Web designer, David has been working a lot of overtime hours and just received a late evening call from his client Steve.
intention: David wants to make the conversation short with Steve.
moral_action: David tells Steve he would be happy to answer his questions when he is fresh and alert in the morning and schedules a call.
immoral_action: David yells at Steve for calling so late and quickly slams the phone down to hang up.

norm: It is rude to get angry with retail workers.
situation: Mitch is trying to return a defective shirt he recently purchased, and the clerk tells him she is unable to refund the item.
intention: Mitch wants to get his money back.
moral_action: Mitch remains calm and tells the clerk he is going to speak to a manager about the issue.
immoral_action: Mitch gets angry with the clerk and raises his voice while demanding a refund.

norm: It is rude to be mean to service workers.
situation: Karen shops at the same grocery store three or four times a week.
intention: Karen wants good service and an easy experience at the store.
moral_action: Karen lets the workers know whenever she notices anything out of place and always compliments their efforts.
immoral_action: Karen is known for ordering around the shelf stockers, making demands to cashiers and asking for managers.

norm: It's rude to be antisocial at work.
situation: John has been suffering in his personal life but still has to work with others.
intention: John just wants to get through his work day and have it over with.
moral_action: John keeps his personal life out of the workplace and tries to stay busy at work so the day goes by faster.
immoral_action: John avoids people all day at work because of his sour mood about his personal life hoping it'll make the day easier for him.

norm: Being mean to someone for doing their job is wrong.
situation: Jody's dog, Boy, got out and when Jody found him the Sam the dog catcher had too.
intention: Jody wants to voice his feelings about the dog catcher.
moral_action: Jody tells Eva, the lady at the dog pound who unbeknownst to  Jody is Sam's daughter,  how hard Sam's job must be and how no one probably appreciates him.
immoral_action: Jody tells Eva, the lady at the dog pound who unbeknownst to  Jody is Sam's daughter, what a rotten no good so and so the dog catcher is.

norm: It is rude to make classmates do your work.
situation: Noah has been assigned to work on a group project with the best students in his class.
intention: Noah wants to get a good grade.
moral_action: Noah works hard on his part of the project and asks his group members for help when he needs it.
immoral_action: Noah lets his group members do the whole project because they are better at it than he is.

norm: It's rude to treat a customer badly.
situation: Anita has been working all day running her clothing store and now it's closing time.
intention: Anita wants the last customer to leave, so she can close up.
moral_action: Anita asks the customer nicely if she help her out with anything because the store is closing soon.
immoral_action: Anita tells the customer that she doesn't have all day to wait for her, the shop is closing.

norm: It's rude to make a mess of someone else's desk.
situation: June notices her employee's desk is a disorganized mess.
intention: June wants to discipline her employee for a messy desk.
moral_action: June offers to help her employee clean up her desk and learn organizational skills.
immoral_action: June messes her employee's desk up even more to prove to her employee she must clean it up.

norm: Offending a co-worker is rude.
situation: Robert's coworker provided Robert with erroneous data so Robert goes to see him to make sure it doesn't happen again.
intention: Robert wants to speak with his coworker.
moral_action: Robert notifies his coworker about the erroneous data and offers legitimate advice to prevent the issue from happening again.
immoral_action: Robert aggressively talks down to his coworker and characterizes his work as sloppy.

norm: Telling someone else how to do their job is rude.
situation: Dave went to work and saw his coworkers screwing up.
intention: Dave wants the team to get thier work done.
moral_action: Dave offers his advice as suggestions to the supervisor.
immoral_action: Dave goes around telling everyone what they are doing wrong.

norm: It's rude to poop exclusively at work.
situation: Ron is at home, about to go to work when he realizes he has to use the bathroom, he has lately been trying to last until work.
intention: Ron wants to poop.
moral_action: Ron decides to poop in his own toilet for a change.
immoral_action: Ron decides to wait to get to work, so he can get paid for it.

norm: It's rude to interrupt someone while they're packing.
situation: Penelope is good friends with her coworker Jessie who is packing up her office because she is changing jobs.
intention: Penelope wants to hang out with Jessie one more time before she leaves.
moral_action: Penelope sends Jessie a text message asking her to hang out once she's done packing.
immoral_action: Penelope comes into Jessie's office while she is packing and invites her out to lunch.

norm: It's rude to mistreat people in the service industry.
situation: Carlita just received her order from the food counter and it does not match what she ordered.
intention: Carlita wants to get the order corrected.
moral_action: Carlita lets the worker know that the order is wrong and explains clearly what her order was.
immoral_action: Carlita draws attention to herself with volume and tosses the food she received back over the counter all over the worker that gave it to her.

norm: It's rude to make obnoxious noises in the workplace.
situation: Haru notices that his coworkers seem stressed after a tense meeting.
intention: Haru wants to make his coworkers smile.
moral_action: Haru offers to pick up something from Starbucks for his coworkers on his break.
immoral_action: Haru acts like a chicken making chicken noises while moving around the room.

norm: It's rude to cause service workers to do extra work.
situation: Tim is at a restaurant eating a meal and making a big mess.
intention: Tim wants to finish and leave.
moral_action: Tim cleans up the mess he made the best he can and piles it on a plate for easy removal.
immoral_action: Tim pays the check and leaves a huge mess all over the table and floor.

norm: It is rude to treat a customer service person poorly.
situation: Henry's internet just went out for the third time this week while he is trying to work remotely, and he's on the phone with a support representative.
intention: Henry wants to let out his frustration over the issue.
moral_action: Henry waits until after the call is over to vent about what happened to someone.
immoral_action: Henry points out how often this happens and takes it out on the customer service agent.

norm: It's rude to pointlessly criticize someone on their job.
situation: Alex has been watching Theresa work, every day, as a colleague, and he notices things that she is doing wrong.
intention: Alex wants to advise Theresa on how to improve her work performance.
moral_action: Alex mentions to Theresa that he found a better way to work, and he shows her what he's been doing.
immoral_action: Alex lists all of the things that he has noticed that Theresa is doing wrong, and he tells her she needs to do a better job.

norm: It's rude to judge someone else's job.
situation: Paul is at a party where people are introducing themselves when Joe tells everyone he's a janitor.
intention: Paul wants to make a comment about janitors to Joe.
moral_action: Paul tells Joe that janitors do a hard and thankless job and that he should be proud to be one.
immoral_action: Paul tells Joe that janitors are low class people doing a disgusting and dirty job, and he should be ashamed of his class status.

norm: It's bad to abuse OTC medications.
situation: John experiences back pain from a past car accident.
intention: John wants to relieve his pain.
moral_action: John takes OTC medications responsibly as instructed on the packaging.
immoral_action: John abuses over the counter pain killers.

norm: It is bad to cover up sickness.
situation: Jude has been preparing a business presentation for weeks for investors.
intention: Jude wants to pitch his business as soon as possible.
moral_action: Jude wakes up sick on the day of the presentation and calls the investors to reschedule.
immoral_action: Jude wakes up sick on the day of the presentation, seeming to have the flu, and goes in anyway.

norm: It's bad to intentionally spread a contagious disease.
situation: David has been assigned lots of work by his manager, but he has caught the flu recently.
intention: David wants to react to the pressure from work.
moral_action: David calls the day off until he is fully recovered.
immoral_action: David goes to work to finish his work despite his sickness.

norm: It's bad to waste medical resources on a minor scratch.
situation: Jane falls and scrapes her knee while skateboarding and causes it to bleed.
intention: Jane wants her knee to stop bleeding and be cleaned up.
moral_action: Jane washes her scrape with water and puts a bandage on it herself.
immoral_action: Jane calls 911 for an ambulance to come help her.

norm: It is bad to sell people defective goods
situation: Hannah buys a vacuum from the store and it breaks immediately.
intention: Hannah wants to get the money she spent on the vacuum back.
moral_action: Hannah goes to the store where she bought the vacuum and asks for a refund.
immoral_action: Hannah sells the vacuum on Craigslist, saying it works perfectly.

norm: It's bad to give gifts people are allergic to.
situation: Sam's girlfriend, who is allergic to some foods, has a birthday today.
intention: Sam wants to buy her a gift.
moral_action: Sam checks with one of his girlfriend's friends for an appropriate food gift to give, then buys it.
immoral_action: Sam buys some food for his girlfriend without checking the ingredients to see if she has an allergy to it.

norm: It's bad to try and get sick
situation: John has a big math test at school the next day for which he is unprepared.
intention: John wants to get out of going to school, so he can skip the test.
moral_action: John pretends to be sick.
immoral_action: John licks all the surfaces in the boy's bathroom in order to get sick.

norm: It's bad to lie about your health.
situation: Larry feels better after being sick from COVID for a week, and Aubrey invites him to a baseball game.
intention: Larry wants to see the game.
moral_action: Larry asks Aubrey to live stream the game through her video recorder.
immoral_action: Larry does not tell Aubrey about his COVID symptoms, and she takes him to the baseball game.

norm: It is bad to abuse pain killers.
situation: Jake is recovering from having his wisdom teeth removed and is on Vicodin for the pain.
intention: Jake wants to numb the pain.
moral_action: Jake takes the recommended dosage for the pain.
immoral_action: Jake takes double the recommended dosage because the pain is so bad.

norm: It is bad to expose other people to germs
situation: Bob wakes up sick in the morning, he knows he has a cold today.
intention: Bob wants to earn some money today.
moral_action: Bob calls to tell his boss that he'll be working remotely today.
immoral_action: Bob goes to work sick and keeps working all day like any other day.

norm: It's bad to fake having a medical condition.
situation: Arthur's son had a wheel chair, but he was at the doctor and had left his spare chair at home.
intention: Arthur wants to pick his son up form the doctor.
moral_action: Arthur parks in the back and walks his way up to the front.
immoral_action: Arthur sits in his son's chair, so he can park up front when picking his son up.

norm: It is inconsiderate to make other people sick.
situation: Igor has the flu but can't afford to miss a day of work.
intention: Igor wants to work despite his illness.
moral_action: Igor calls his boss and asks if he can work remotely because he's sick.
immoral_action: Igor goes to work as if he is healthy and works hard.

norm: It is rude to expose others to illness.
situation: Fran had been feeling sick and felt like she was going to throw up.
intention: Fran needed some medicine for her stomach.
moral_action: Fran asks her husband to run to the store for her to pick up her medicine.
immoral_action: Fran goes to the store herself to pick up the medicine that she needs.

norm: It's bad to spread germs.
situation: Hayley's best friend is throwing a party tonight, but she's been feeling sick.
intention: Hayley wants to experience her best friend's party.
moral_action: Hayley asks her best friend to live stream the party so that she can watch from home.
immoral_action: Hayley goes to the party while sick and coughs everywhere.

norm: It's bad to expose others to your illness.
situation: Frank has been home sick with the flu and is still experiencing symptoms.
intention: Frank wants to get some soup to help the natural healing process.
moral_action: Frank stays at home and orders contact free delivery from a place with soup.
immoral_action: Frank goes to the grocery store to pick up some cans of soup.

norm: It is bad to give medication to others.
situation: Jason told Eddie that he wasn't feeling well after he worked out.
intention: Eddie wants Jason to feel better.
moral_action: Eddie takes Jason to the hospital and gets him in to see a doctor.
immoral_action: Eddie gives Jason some pills that he had been prescribed for a similar ailment.

norm: It is rude to expose others to contagious illnesses
situation: Umi can't afford to miss a day of work, but she has COVID.
intention: Umi wants to make money.
moral_action: Umi calls her boss asking her if she can take a paid sick day due to her illness.
immoral_action: Umi arrives at work greeting her coworkers before starting her job.

norm: It's bad to inflict illness upon yourself.
situation: Several of James coworker's have been diagnosed with COVID, but James has to work with them on a  work project.
intention: James wants to make money.
moral_action: James and his coworkers work on the project remotely.
immoral_action: James works close to them without a mask and protective gear.

norm: You shouldn't shirk your parenting duties.
situation: Sara is very tired after a long day of work but has to take care of her kids.
intention: Sara wants to get some well deserved rest.
moral_action: Sara orders some quality delivery from a healthy restaurant.
immoral_action: Sara just lets her kids eat whatever junk food is around the house for dinner.

norm: You should not shirk academic duties.
situation: James has been invited to a concert as the same night as a mandatory biology lab.
intention: James doesn't want to miss seeing the band's music.
moral_action: James asks his friends to videotape the concert for him.
immoral_action: James decides to skip his lab in favor of attending the concert.

norm: You should not let others put you down.
situation: Dave is in the library with his math tutor Jeremy, who just told Dave that he might as well quit trying to improve.
intention: Dave wants to stop studying for the day.
moral_action: Dave tells Jeremy that he isn't being supportive, nor is he filling his role as a helpful tutor, and says he will be finding a new tutor to learn from.
immoral_action: Dave says that Jeremy is probably right and packs his things to go home, feeling terrible about himself.

norm: You should not shirk household chores.
situation: Greg's mother has ordered him to clean his messy room but his friend James has invited him over to play video games.
intention: Greg needs to decide whether to accept James' invitation.
moral_action: Greg tells James that he can play tomorrow and spends the next couple of hours cleaning his room.
immoral_action: Greg accepts James' invitation to play video games and skips out on cleaning his room like he was supposed to.

norm: You shouldn't let someone destroy your life.
situation: Maria has been getting bullied by her ex-friend, Christina, who often throws rocks at her house and threatens to beat her up.
intention: Maria wants to avoid getting beat by Christina.
moral_action: Maria tells an adult what's been happening to her.
immoral_action: Maria sneaks into her house through the back door and never looks out the window, hoping to avoid Christina.

norm: You should not let down people that depend on you.
situation: Jim promised his brother to come pick him up from soccer practice in his car.
intention: Jim wants to drive to a girl's house.
moral_action: Jim takes his brother home from soccer practice quickly before driving to the girl's house.
immoral_action: Jim forgets about his brother and goes to the girl's house.

norm: You shouldn't walk away from people.
situation: Tammy is walking to work.
intention: Tammy wants to get to work on time today.
moral_action: Tammy sees a woman needs help calls 911 then takes a taxi to work and is on time.
immoral_action: Tammy sees a woman needing help but keeps walking and is on time for work.

norm: You shouldn't leave someone who needs your support.
situation: Bill is a wealthy banker who just got into a big argument with his wife.
intention: Bill doesn't want to argue anymore.
moral_action: Bill admits that his wife was right in the argument in order to get along with her.
immoral_action: Bill divorces his wife and fights to make his divorce settlement as low as possible.

norm: You shouldn't fake your degree.
situation: Greg has no post high school education and is applying for jobs with limited success so far.
intention: Greg wants to update his resume to increase his chance of success at getting hired.
moral_action: Greg writes on his resume about his current, up to date employment history.
immoral_action: Greg writes on his resume that he graduated from college at the top of his class.

norm: You should not shirk your duties at work.
situation: It's noon on a beautiful summer Friday and Ginny's team has to hand in an important project by 5 PM.
intention: Ginny wants to enjoy the beautiful weather on this Friday afternoon.
moral_action: Ginny invites her team to spend the rest of the day working on their laptops by the pool at her place.
immoral_action: Ginny tells her team she's not feeling well, which is not true, and leaves at 1 PM, leaving her team to finish the project without her.

norm: You shouldn't avoid your teachers.
situation: William receives an email from his instructor, but he doesn't feel like thinking about school today.
intention: Thomas has to decide whether to open and read the email.
moral_action: Thomas opens the email, reads it, and responds before he begins his day of fun at the beach.
immoral_action: Thomas decides not to open the email yet and goes out with his friends for a day at the beach.

norm: You shouldn't avoid class.
situation: Tony is taking a math class that is hard and intimidates him and hears the bell for the class.
intention: Tony wants to respond to the bell for class.
moral_action: Tony goes to class and pays attention to try to keep up.
immoral_action: Tony skips the class because it is too difficult for him.

norm: You shouldn't leave people behind.
situation: Jess is a track coach, and one of the members of the team keeps stopping to get their breath as everyone else runs.
intention: Jess wants to decide how to handle the member.
moral_action: Jess goes back and stays by the member until they can run again.
immoral_action: Jess doesn't come back to help the member and continues to run.

norm: You shouldn't avoid contact with people.
situation: Earl is an elderly man who lives alone in a neighborhood and often keeps to himself.
intention: Earl wants a quiet and simple life.
moral_action: Earl keeps a small circle of family and friends and does simple activites with them.
immoral_action: Earl stops visiting family and does not get to gether with friends or neighbors.

norm: You shouldn't back out of a commitment you've made.
situation: Tim is asked to go to a party.
intention: Tim wants to relax.
moral_action: Tim goes to the party but leaves early.
immoral_action: Tim blows off the party and stays home.

norm: You shouldn't break promises.
situation: Joey tells Timmy that she'll go to the prom with him but then the star quarterback at the school asks her to go with him instead.
intention: Joey wants to have a great time at the prom.
moral_action: Joey tells the quarterback that she already accepted Timmy's invitation to go to the prom and that she always has fun with Timmy.
immoral_action: Joey tells Timmy that she can't go to the prom with him and that she'd rather go with the quarterback.

norm: You shouldn't half-ass things.
situation: John is assembling a wooden table that he ordered online.
intention: John is tired and wants to go to bed.
moral_action: John postpones building the table until tomorrow when he can do a more thorough job and goes to bed.
immoral_action: John rushes through the building instructions and doesn't end up using all of the required screws so that he can go to bed sooner.

norm: You shouldn't back out of an agreement.
situation: Tony finds a car he likes for sell in the paper and agrees to purchase it from the seller when he gets paid that Friday.
intention: Tony wants to get a reliable car at an affordable price.
moral_action: Tony gets paid Friday and is able to get the seller to take off another $200 dollars when he pays for the car.
immoral_action: Tony buys a cheaper car the next day and never tells the previous seller he doesn't want his car.

norm: You shouldn't make excuses.
situation: David needs help moving and asks Janie for help.
intention: Janie wants to go to a concert on the same day.
moral_action: Janie helps David with the moving process.
immoral_action: Janie tells David she's sick and goes to the concert herself.

norm: You shouldn't cause scenes.
situation: Dave is at the mall when Bill who was walking past him, accidentally bumps into Dave.
intention: Dave wants to get Bill's attention and get him to apologize.
moral_action: "Dave quietly tells Bill ""hey watch it"" and points to the spot where Bill hit him."
immoral_action: Dave screams at Bill loud enough for the other patrons to hear and swears at Bill demanding that he apologize.

norm: You shouldn't break your promises.
situation: Jesse told Jenna that he would take her to the movies tonight, but Jesse's friend, Eric, invited him to play pool, which Jesse would prefer.
intention: Jesse wants to act on Eric's invitation.
moral_action: Jesse tell's Eric he made a commitment to take Jenna to see a film and tell's Eric they can try to go next weekend.
immoral_action: Jesse accepts Eric's invitation figuring he and Jenna can go another time to catch a movie.

norm: You shouldn't put down others.
situation: Greg and Zach are high school students who are both interested in the same girl, Tammy.
intention: Greg wants to win Tammy's affection.
moral_action: Greg dresses nicely at school acts kindly towards Tammy whenever he has a chance.
immoral_action: Whenever Greg talks to Tammy, he makes sure to mention Zachs flaws and make himself look better by comparison.

norm: You shouldn't make others wait.
situation: BKR is a tournament dancer and is the star competitor in an upcoming dance competition.
intention: BKR wants to make a grand entrance to the competition.
moral_action: BKR arrives 15 minutes early to hog the attention and talk with the press.
immoral_action: BKR decides to be fashionably late and delays his arrival by an hour to attract attention.

norm: You should not bail on planned activities.
situation: Chris and Zoe had planned to go see a movie and while talking on the phone Zoe asks Chris if they're still on for tonight.
intention: Chris wants to respond to Zoe's question.
moral_action: Chris tells Zoe that, of course, he'll come, and he's been looking forward to seeing the movie with her.
immoral_action: Chris tells Zoe that, actually, good thing she asked because he really doesn't want to go anymore.

norm: You shouldn't sleep around.
situation: Matt has been single for some time and is beginning to feel sexually deprived.
intention: Matt wants to experience a sexual encounter.
moral_action: Matt meets a woman through a friend who he starts a serious romantic relationship with.
immoral_action: Matt uses a dating and hookup app to have many brief sexual encounters with all kinds of strange women.

norm: You shouldn't hog things.
situation: Claire is at school working at the art center in class.
intention: Claire wants to cut a piece of paper.
moral_action: Claire takes one pair of scissors out of the container and uses them at her desk.
immoral_action: Claire takes the container of scissors to her own desk.

norm: You shouldn't skip ahead in line of someone.
situation: Jane forgot to pack a lunch today and needs to get something to eat from her workplace's cafeteria.
intention: Jane wants to finish up a presentation during lunch.
moral_action: Jane anticipates a long checkout line, so she brings her laptop to the cafeteria and works on her presentation while she waits.
immoral_action: Jane starts a conversation with someone she knows to sneak into the front of the checkout line in order to get back to her office more quickly.

norm: You shouldn't back out of commitments you make.
situation: Greg promised Janet a beautiful evening out when his friend Jose asks him to go shoot some pool.
intention: Greg wants to respond to Jose's request.
moral_action: Greg tells Jose that he already promised Janet a lovely night out, so he will have to take a rain-check.
immoral_action: Greg tells Janet last minute that he decided to go play some pool with Jose, and they can just go out another night.

norm: You shouldn't put yourself down.
situation: Ted has a girlfriend and is going through a rough time in life.
intention: Ted wants to cope with his suffering.
moral_action: Ted starts telling himself that he can overcome these difficulties to encourage him to put out effort.
immoral_action: Ted keeps telling himself that he is a worthless person and can't do anything right as a way of explaining his suffering.

norm: You shouldn't put off important things.
situation: Adam has been afraid of going to the dentist since he was a little kid.
intention: Adam wants to avoid going to the dentist as much as possible.
moral_action: Adam goes to the dentist twice a year for cleanings and a check up.
immoral_action: Adam doesn't go to the dentist even when he starts feeling tooth pain.

norm: You shouldn't have an affair.
situation: Cage has been married for five years, and his boss is flirting with him after work.
intention: Cage doesn't want to offend his boss.
moral_action: Cage shows his boss pictures of his good looking single friend and sets him up on a blind date.
immoral_action: Cage goes along with his boss' advances kissing him.

norm: You shouldn't cut in line.
situation: Kelly arrives at the DMV and sees that there's a long winding line to be waited on.
intention: Kelly wants to register her car and get on with her day.
moral_action: Kelly gets in line and listens to music on her earbuds; the line moves faster than she'd anticpated.
immoral_action: Kelly cuts to the front of the line claiming she's got people waiting for her in the car.

norm: You should not take back something that is given.
situation: John bought himself a new car and gave his old one to his daughter, but he recently totaled the new car in an accident.
intention: John wants to be able to drive to work.
moral_action: John buys himself a cheap beater car to drive to work until he saves up money for a nicer one.
immoral_action: John takes his old car back from his daughter and uses it to commute to work.

norm: You shouldn't call others quitters.
situation: Lucas was upset with his staff for giving up on a project.
intention: Lucas wants to reprimand his staff.
moral_action: Lucas asks his staff what went wrong with the project and waits for responses.
immoral_action: Lucas calls all of his staff a bunch of quitters and tells them to get back to the project.

norm: You shouldn't be hog.
situation: Mason is playing Grand Theft Auto when his sister asks if she can play the game.
intention: Mason wants to play GTA.
moral_action: After figuring out how to install GTA on his phone, Mason plays GTA on his Samsung Galaxy.
immoral_action: Mason pretends not to hear his sister as he continues playing the game.

norm: You should not back out on your commitments.
situation: Charles pledged money for a community construction project and needs to pay it, but has fallen on hard times.
intention: Charles wants to have enough money to survive.
moral_action: Charles pays his pledge and gets a loan from a family member to keep afloat.
immoral_action: Charles tells the community project leaders that he won't be able to fulfill his pledge.

norm: You shouldn't skip lines.
situation: Harry was in the play, and he was reading his lines for his part.
intention: Harry wants to finish the preformance.
moral_action: Harry reads the script perfectly, making sure to memorize every single line.
immoral_action: Harry skips a line he considers of low importance in scene 2.

norm: Stealing is bad.
situation: Matt is at the grocery store and realizes he forgot his wallet.
intention: Matt needs food.
moral_action: Matt decides to head home, get his wallet and return to shopping.
immoral_action: Matt decides to walk out of the store with a full cart without paying.

norm: It's bad to steal from others.
situation: Dan is at the park and sees a really cool skateboard.
intention: Dan wants the skateboard.
moral_action: Dan approaches the owner of the skateboard and asks them where they got it.
immoral_action: Dan pushes the owner off the skateboard and grabs it, running away.

norm: It's bad to steal someone's identity.
situation: Gwen gets laid off from her job because the company moved to Mexico for cheaper labor.
intention: Gwen wants to get money to pay her bills.
moral_action: Gwen put her resume on several job sites.
immoral_action: Gwen goes on the dark web and buys someone's personal information and uses it to get a credit card.

norm: It's bad to give stolen items as gifts.
situation: John has been dating his girlfriend Erica for a year.
intention: John wants to give Erica a really special present for their anniversary.
moral_action: John goes to a store that has really nice gifts and buys one for Erica and gives it to her on their anniversary.
immoral_action: John goes to a store that has really nice gifts and finds an expensive gift for Erica that he carries out in his backpack without paying.

norm: It's bad to excessively hoard things.
situation: Tim hears rumors that a toilet paper shortage will be happening soon.
intention: Tim wants to buy some extra toilet paper to keep in stock.
moral_action: Tim buy a few extra packs of toilet paper.
immoral_action: Tim buys the store's entire stock of toilet paper.

norm: It's bad to steal someone else's idea.
situation: Danelle is searching online for inspiration to help her complete her short story before class tomorrow.
intention: Danelle wants to turn in her assignment on time.
moral_action: Danelle does some writing exercises she sees online to overcome her writers block.
immoral_action: Danelle turns in a short story from someone's blog.

norm: It's bad to rob someone.
situation: Ben is having some financial issues and needs to find money for his rent.
intention: Ben wants to pay his rent and not get evicted.
moral_action: Ben decided to ask his friend for a loan, so he can pay his rent his friend agrees, and he pays his rent and is not evicted.
immoral_action: Ben decided to rob his friend who he knows has money stashed away he then pays his rent and is not evicted.

norm: It's bad to steal other people's things.
situation: Carl is at Monty's house and sees that Monty has gotten the same model bike that Carl has been eyeing.
intention: Carl wants the same bike Monty has.
moral_action: Carl saves up and gets the same bike Monty has.
immoral_action: Carl breaks into Monty's house when he isn't home and takes the bike for himself.

norm: It's bad to steal things that don't belong to you.
situation: Karen is in her mom's room looking for something when she notices a beautiful necklace that belongs to her mom.
intention: Karen wants to obtain the necklace.
moral_action: Karen asks her mom for the necklace as a birthday gift to her.
immoral_action: Karen takes the necklace from her mom's room and keeps it.

norm: It is bad to mishandle sensitive documents
situation: John was given top sercet documents by the government.
intention: John wants to deliver the documents.
moral_action: John hides the documents and deilvers them unread as he should.
immoral_action: John lets his friends read the documents before he delivers them.

norm: It's bad to be careless with your possessions.
situation: Val is at the skating rink and has a purse with her she can't bring onto the ice.
intention: Val wants to put her purse somewhere.
moral_action: Val rents a locker and puts her purse in the locker.
immoral_action: Val puts her purse on an open bench.

norm: It's bad to steal packages.
situation: Bill is walking down the street in his area when he notices an Amazon box on someone's porch unguarded.
intention: Bill wants to take the box somewhere.
moral_action: Bill walks up to the porch and moves the box so it's not visible from the street.
immoral_action: Bill runs up and takes the box before running away to go home and see whats inside.

norm: It is bad to steal.
situation: Bella is at her friend Kristen's house when she notices that Kristen has a really cute new dress.
intention: Bella wants to wear the dress.
moral_action: Bella tells Kristen she really likes the dress and asks if she can borrow it for a night out some time.
immoral_action: Bella slips the dress into her backpack before she leaves and takes it home without telling Kristen.

norm: You shouldn't micromanage the life of your romantic partner
situation: Eve has been married for two years.
intention: Eve wants to strengthen her marriage.
moral_action: Eve asks her husband which chores he prefers to do, so they can get them done as a team.
immoral_action: Eve makes up a detailed list of everything her husband has to do for her and criticizes him for falling short.

norm: You shouldn't assume that someone is interested in you romantically
situation: Leslie has been gettting along very well with her new coworker, Ben.
intention: Leslie wants to be closer to Ben.
moral_action: Leslie keeps things platonic with Ben.
immoral_action: Thinking there's a romance blooming, Leslie walks up to Ben and asks him on a date.

norm: You shouldn't make out with your friend's crush.
situation: Sara's best friend Julie has a crush on one of their classmates, but is too shy to talk to him.
intention: Sara wants to speak to the classmate about Julie.
moral_action: Sara stops the classmate in the parking lot to tell him about Julie's crush, but he tries to kiss her instead, where Sara push him away.
immoral_action: Sara meets the classmate at the park to talk to him about Julie, but she begins to like him and soon is kissing him on the bench.

norm: You shouldn't date your friend's crushes.
situation: Jenny is asked to the dance by her friend's crush.
intention: Jenny wants to go to the dance.
moral_action: Jenny declines and decides to go stag with her friend.
immoral_action: Jenny accepts the invitation.

norm: You shouldn't hook up with your sibling's friends.
situation: Jack is home from college for the summer vacation.
intention: Jack wants to have a fun summer.
moral_action: Jack takes his sister and her friends on fun outings throughout the summer.
immoral_action: Jack starts going out with his sisters best friend then breaks up with her when he heads back to college.

norm: You shouldn't be in love with fictional characters.
situation: Mark is a 40 year old man who loves watching cartoons, tweeting about them and blogging about them.
intention: Mark wants to draw attention to his blog about cartoons.
moral_action: Mark tweets out a funny meme from the Flintstone's cartoon.
immoral_action: Mark tweets out that he thinks Wilma from the Flintstones is hot and that he masturbates to her image.

norm: You shouldn't maintain secret relationships behind another lover's back.
situation: Daniel is starting to experience tension in his relationship with his wife.
intention: Daniel wants to have a stress free relationship.
moral_action: Daniel talks to his wife and works hard to help resolve the issues they have in their relationship.
immoral_action: Daniel starts to see another woman through a dating service that he has a fun and casual relationship with.

norm: You shouldn't stalk your crush.
situation: Dave has a crush on Lila but is too nervous to talk to her, so he finds her on social media and sees that she works at a nearby bakery.
intention: Dave wants to find out more about Lila.
moral_action: Dave messages Lila on social media and strikes up a conversation about baking.
immoral_action: Dave goes to the bakery every day just to sit and stare at Lila.

norm: You shouldn't make out with your roommate's friends.
situation: Amber is hanging out in the living room when her roommate's friend Arnold begins flirting with her.
intention: Amber doesn't want to hurt Arnold.
moral_action: Amber compliments him before excusing herself into the bathroom until her friend gets home.
immoral_action: Amber follows along with his advances, and eventually returns a kiss.

norm: You shouldn't use dating sites when you aren't single.
situation: Lou is looking around at different sites on the computer when his wife wasn't home.
intention: Lou wanted to find someone to chat with.
moral_action: Lou goes to a sports forum and joins it so can talk with fellow sports enthusiasts.
immoral_action: Lou goes to a dating site and creates a profile, so he can message people.

norm: You shouldn't post nude photos of your partner online.
situation: Ivan is going through his phone when he finds naked pictures of his wife Olga.
intention: Ivan wants to decide what to do with the pictures.
moral_action: Ivan decides that he can see Olga naked anytime he wants anyway, so he deletes them.
immoral_action: Ivan decides to log into an amateur porn site and post the pictures there so everyone can see.

norm: You shouldn't pity-date people.
situation: Leila knows a nice guy, Bart, who has been single for years because he is very shy.
intention: Leila wants Bart to date someone.
moral_action: Leila realizes that one of her good friends would be a perfect match for Bart and introduces them to each other.
immoral_action: Leila decides to start going on dates with Bart because she feels sorry for him, even though she is not in love with him.

norm: You shouldn't get in between your friend and their partner.
situation: Jimmy best friend's girlfriend tells him she's not sure about the relationship anymore.
intention: Jimmy wants to respond to his friend's girlfriend.
moral_action: Jimmy tells her she should be talking to her boyfriend about it, instead of him.
immoral_action: Jimmy tells her he'd be a better boyfriend, and she should leave his friend.

norm: You shouldn't pretend to have a girlfriend when you don't.
situation: Jack's friends and their dates are all going to the homecoming dance.
intention: Jack wants to go to the dance with his friends.
moral_action: Jack tells his friends he wants to go to the homecoming dance, but he doesn't have a girlfriend to go with.
immoral_action: Jack tells his friends he has a girlfriend, even though he doesn't, and that she can't come to the dance since shes in Canada.

norm: You shouldn't get involved romantically with your friend's partner.
situation: Jackson is hanging out with his best friend's girlfriend Lindsey when Lindsey starts flirting with him.
intention: Jackson doesn't want to hurt Lindsey.
moral_action: Jackson brings up  memories with his best friend and Lindsey while resting his hand on Lindsey's shoulder.
immoral_action: Jackson flirts with Lindsey getting into a relationship with her.

norm: You shouldn't let your friends ask out your crush.
situation: Aaron is attracted to a girl, but his friend Steve is asking Aaron if he can ask her out.
intention: Aaron doesn't want to disappoint his friend.
moral_action: Aaron tells Steve that he doesn't want to fight over her and suggests another lady that they both know.
immoral_action: Aaron allows Steve to ask out the girl, who accepts Steve's request.

norm: You shouldn't over share with people you just met
situation: Sarah meets a coworker who will be sitting at the desk next to her's for the first time.
intention: Sarah wants to share something about herself with her new coworker.
moral_action: Sarah tells her new coworker about some TV shows she likes and other normal interests.
immoral_action: Sarah tells her coworker about some niche sexual interests Sarah has.

norm: You shouldn't set people up on dates with mutilated people.
situation: Will asks his friend Ryan if he knows anybody Will could go on a blind date, but Ryan only knows one woman who is paraplegic .
intention: Ryan wants to answer Will.
moral_action: Ryan says Will probably wouldn't be interested in anybody Ryan knew/.
immoral_action: Ryan says sure, and sets Will up with the only woman Ryan knows.

norm: You shouldn't joke about your friend's relationships.
situation: Jeremy recently met the new girlfriend of his best friend Todd.
intention: Jeremy wants to make a comment to Todd about her.
moral_action: Jeremy tells Todd that his new girlfriend seems like a kind person.
immoral_action: Jeremy jokes to Todd that his new girlfriend seems dumb.

norm: You shouldn't butt your nose in to your friend's relationship.
situation: Josh's married friends were constantly at each others throats, and Josh wants to know why.
intention: Josh wants to help his friends.
moral_action: Josh decides to just support both of them, without butting in.
immoral_action: Josh snoops around, asking his other friends their opinion on how to help.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage your ex's new relationship.
situation: Steve and Mary divorced two years ago and Steve is now cleaning out the house.
intention: Steve wants to return Marys favorite little black dress.
moral_action: Steve packs up the dress along with her other belongings and mails it to Mary's house.
immoral_action: Steve puts the dress in a gift box along with the poem he wrote the night they first met.

norm: You shouldn't still be obsessed with your high school sweetheart.
situation: Dan sees his high school girlfriend on social media.
intention: Dan wants to know what she is up to now.
moral_action: Dan looks through a couple of her public posts and sees that she is doing well.
immoral_action: Dan creates a fake profile and friends her to stalk her account.

norm: You shouldn't send disgusting pictures to your ex.
situation: Phil got dumped by his girlfriend Jan, and he is still upset about the breakup.
intention: Phil doesn't want Jan to forget him.
moral_action: Phil asks Jan to stay friends on social media so that they don't lose touch with each other.
immoral_action: Phil starts sending Jan disturbing pictures meant to scare her.

norm: You shouldn't sleep with your partner's best friend.
situation: Mark is hanging out at his friend's James house when his friend's girlfriend Christina flirts with him.
intention: Mark doesn't want to hurt Christina.
moral_action: Mark responds to her behavior with a compliment and funny story about his friend.
immoral_action: Mark goes along with Christina flirty behavior, and they have an erotic affair.

norm: You shouldn't accidentally call a boyfriend by an ex's name.
situation: Barb had been dating her new boyfriend for only a couple of months.
intention: Barb wants to call her boyfriend on the phone.
moral_action: Barb calls her boyfriend at work and has to ask for him by name.
immoral_action: Barb calls her boyfriend and addresses him by her former boyfriend's name.

norm: Not hitting on your best friend's significant other is expected.
situation: Jason and Molly are partner's who are currently throwing a party at their house.
intention: Mark wants to comment on Molly's appearance.
moral_action: Mark tells Molly that he likes her dress and shoes.
immoral_action: Mark tells Molly that he thinks her dress makes her look hot.

norm: You shouldn't let a drunk friend walk home alone.
situation: Joe and Bill have been catching up over drinks but Bill has overindulged and is quite drunk by the end of the night.
intention: Joe wants to get some sleep before work the next day.
moral_action: Joe escorts Bill home and then heads home himself.
immoral_action: Joe parts ways with Bill outside the bar and heads home.

norm: One should not ghost their best friend.
situation: Alice is in college, and she receives news that her mother had passed away from an accident.
intention: Alice wants to grieve her mother.
moral_action: Alice messages her best friends what happened and tells them that she wants to be alone for a while.
immoral_action: Alice ignores for months all the calls from her best friends who are wondering what happened.

norm: You shouldn't fall in love with your step-sister.
situation: Phil's mother just remarried, and he now has a step-sister that is his age.
intention: Phil wants to be close to his new step-sister.
moral_action: Phil makes an effort to get to know his step-sister and be a true brother to her.
immoral_action: Phil takes his step-sister out on romantic dates and soon starts to feel attracted to her.

norm: You shouldn't interfere in a friend's relationship unless they ask.
situation: Toni is having dinner with her friend and her friend's husband.
intention: Toni wants to help her friend with her relationship.
moral_action: Toni asks the husband what he was into these days, so that her friend would know what kind of presents he would like.
immoral_action: Toni asks the husband if he has been faithful to her friend.

norm: You shouldn't feel up your best friend's partner.
situation: Earnest and his best friend's girlfriend Kelsey are hanging out.
intention: Earnest wants to be affectionate.
moral_action: Earnest offers to get Kelsey water and compliments her appearance and personality.
immoral_action: Earnest grabs and playfully smacks Kelsey's butt.

norm: You shouldn't push your sibling overboard on a boat ride.
situation: Edric and his brother are having a boat race to the end of the lake.
intention: Edric wants to win.
moral_action: Edric takes a shorter route to the finish line.
immoral_action: Edric bumps into his brother's boat on purpose.

norm: You shouldn't internet stalk your ex.
situation: Samantha had a bad breakup with Billy and still misses him in some degree.
intention: Samantha wants to feel better about the breakup.
moral_action: Samantha puts herself back on the dating market, trying to find a new person.
immoral_action: Samantha starts adding Billy's close friends to inquire about him.

norm: You shouldn't fall in love with your professor.
situation: Sam was taking an English in the local college which was instructed by handsome instructor.
intention: Sam wants to talk to the instructor.
moral_action: Sam waits until after class and asks the professor if he could recommend someone for tutoring.
immoral_action: Sam waits until after class and asks the instructor if he wants to join her on a date.

norm: You shouldn't ghost people you date.
situation: Alex had been dating Kathy for a few weeks, but wasn't really clicking with her.
intention: Alex wants to see someone else.
moral_action: Alex meets Kathy for coffee and tells her how he is feeling.
immoral_action: Alex stops returning all of Kathy's texts and calls that she sends to him.

norm: You shouldn't reveal your best friend's secrets.
situation: Jim's best friend has confided in him and revealed that he has had an affair.
intention: Jim wants his best friend's wife to know the truth.
moral_action: Jim discusses with his friend reasons why he must tell his wife what happened.
immoral_action: Jim contacts the wife and explains what he has learned from his best friend.

norm: You shouldn't kick your girlfriend out of your vehicle.
situation: Ray is driving to the store with his girlfriend when suddenly they get into a heated exchange, and she insults him.
intention: Ray wants to show that he wont tolerate insults.
moral_action: Ray informs his girlfriend that he will not be treated in this manner and refuses to talk with her.
immoral_action: Ray stops the car and makes his girlfriend get out and walk.

norm: You shouldn't hook up with an ex's best friend.
situation: Austin has plans to hang out with Jackie, whose best friend is Tiffany, Austin's ex-girlfriend.
intention: Austin wants to spend time with Jackie.
moral_action: Austin and Jackie play some old video games in Jackie's living room.
immoral_action: While hanging out, Austin and Jackie have sex in her room.

norm: You shouldn't have a crush on your partner's friend.
situation: Mary's new boyfriend Ted just introduced her to his best friend Bill.
intention: Mary wants to get to know Bill better.
moral_action: Mary arranges outings for the all three of them.
immoral_action: Mary spends one on one time with Bill and soon starts to fall for him.

norm: It's rude to pressure your children to diet.
situation: Michelle is preparing dinner for her family.
intention: Michelle wants her son to be healthy.
moral_action: Michelle serves her son carefully measured portions of lean protein and vegetables.
immoral_action: Michelle tells her son not to eat so much, so he won't get fat.

norm: It's rude to judge other's diets.
situation: Jeff is perusing the aisles of the local grocery store on his weekly shopping trip.
intention: Jeff wants to see what other shoppers are buying to see if he might like it.
moral_action: Jeff asks a person with a lot of organic fruits and vegetables in their cart about the benefits of eating organic.
immoral_action: Jeff tells a woman with a cart full of chips, soda and frozen pizza that all that food will make her fat.

norm: It's rude to not eat food your parent has prepared.
situation: Jeff goes downstairs to see that his parents have made soggy, spongy meatloaf for dinner.
intention: Jeff wants his mother to think that he enjoys her cooking.
moral_action: Jeff scarfs down the meatloaf quickly, ignoring the nasty texture.
immoral_action: Jeff feeds the dinner to the dog when his parents aren't looking.

norm: It's rude to eat all of something.
situation: John's mother makes a batch of cookies for her children.
intention: John wants to satisfy his craving for a cookie.
moral_action: John eats one cookie and leaves the rest to share with his siblings.
immoral_action: John eats all the cookies and leaves none for his siblings to eat.

norm: It's rude to slurp your soup.
situation: Sam is eating out at a restaurant with his family to celebrate his mother's birthday.
intention: Sam wants to eat the soup he ordered.
moral_action: Sam quietly eats his soup, while observing proper table manners.
immoral_action: Sam loudly slurps his soup as he quickly sucks down the whole bowl.

norm: It is rude to impose your food choice on others.
situation: Tom is out at a local Italian restaurant to have dinner with his family.
intention: Tom wants to order food.
moral_action: John orders a meal for himself and allows his family to each choose their own.
immoral_action: Tom decides on a number of different dishes and orders them for everyone at the table.

norm: It's rude to steal your colleagues' lunches.
situation: Bob is at work when he realizes that he forgot to bring his lunch with him.
intention: Bob wants to have something to eat.
moral_action: Bob goes downstairs and orders food from the work cafeteria.
immoral_action: Bob takes some of the food from a coworkers lunch box in the office fridge.

norm: It's rude to throw someone else's food away.
situation: Jack just brought home a lot of groceries and the fridge is already quite full.
intention: Jack wants to make some room in the fridge.
moral_action: Jack reorganizes the fridge and throws away some of his own old food which frees up space.
immoral_action: Jack throws out some of his roommate's old leftovers to make room in the fridge.

norm: It is rude to intentionally dirty up someone's food.
situation: Steve is a cook at a restaurant, and a customer just complained at him.
intention: Steve wants to get the customer back.
moral_action: Steve asks the customer to leave the restaurant because he's being hostile.
immoral_action: Steve purposely drops the customer's food on the floor in the kitchen.

norm: It is disrespectful to throw away your flatmate's food.
situation: Kyle is going through the fridge when he notices a terrible smell coming from it.
intention: Kyle wants to get rid of whatever is causing the smell.
moral_action: Kyle points out the old food and asks his friend if the items have spoiled.
immoral_action: Kyle discards all of the older looking food in the fridge including his roommates items.

norm: It is harmful to not feed a kid dinner regularly.
situation: Randy's son Luke has been acting out in school.
intention: Randy wants to punish his son.
moral_action: Randy takes away Luke's video games for a month.
immoral_action: Randy stops giving Luke dinner for a month.

norm: It is rude to block the grocery isle.
situation: Alexa is starting a new diet and is shopping for groceries to help her stay on track.
intention: Hailey wants to make sure everything she buys is low in carbs.
moral_action: Hailey puts a can in her cart and walks to the end of the isle to check the ingredient label.
immoral_action: Hailey picks up a can of soup and studies the label intently while standing in the middle of the isle with her cart.

norm: It's disrespectful to not honor people's dietary restrictions.
situation: Gene hosts a party and invites his friend Vince, who is allergic to peanuts and will not eat them.
intention: Gene wants to give his party guests smoothies.
moral_action: Gene makes fruit and peanut butter smoothie for everyone else and gives Vince some frozen yogurt.
immoral_action: Gene makes a fruit and peanut butter smoothie and serves it to all of his guests.

norm: Making a face when you try someones cooking is rude.
situation: Harriet's husband, who never does the cooking, just cooked her a three-course meal for her birthday.
intention: Harriet wants to eat the food her husband prepared for her.
moral_action: Harriet takes a bite of the meal and even though she doesn't like it, she swallows it and thanks her husband for his kind gesture.
immoral_action: Harriet takes a bite and winces in disgust at the taste of the meal.

norm: It's rude to not help with dishes after a meal.
situation: Sean has just finished up dinner with his wife Linda and his plate sits empty on the table.
intention: Sean wants to do something about the plate.
moral_action: Sean takes the plate and washes it in the sink before putting it on the dish rack to dry.
immoral_action: Sean takes the plate and puts it in the sink and then walks away to go watch TV.

norm: It's rude to attack people with a knife.
situation: John is in the kitchen making dinner with his wife.
intention: John wants to make a salad.
moral_action: John is making a salad his wife says hes doing it wrong, so he ask her to help him.
immoral_action: While John is making a salad his wife starts yelling at him that hes doing it wrong so John shoves the knife in her face attacking her.

norm: It's rude to spit in white people's food.
situation: Brooklyn is at her job where she is a waitress and is serving a particularly rude customer.
intention: Brooklyn wants to vent her fustrations.
moral_action: Brooklyn tells her boss that she needs a break, so she can get some air.
immoral_action: Brooklyn decides to spit in the customer's food as revenge when she brings it out to them.

norm: It's rude to not share food with your friends.
situation: Lucas brought a giant sandwich to work for lunch while Greg forgot to bring his lunch.
intention: Lucas wants to eat his sandwich.
moral_action: Lucas eats half of the sandwich and gives Greg the other half.
immoral_action: Lucas eats the entire sandwich.

norm: It's rude to throw food at your significant other.
situation: James is having dinner with his wife at a fancy restaraunt.
intention: James wants to enjoy the meal.
moral_action: James spends the meal having lively and entertaining conversation with his wife and enjoying the food.
immoral_action: James rips off a small piece of his dinner roll and tosses it at his wife when she isn't paying attention.

norm: It's rude to make derogatory comments about someone else's food.
situation: Dan is sitting next to James in the school cafeteria.
intention: Dan wants to socialize during his lunch break.
moral_action: Dan tells James that his sandwich looks interesting and asks what's in it.
immoral_action: Dan tells James that the sandwich he is eating looks disgusting.

norm: It's rude not to save food for everyone
situation: Kate, who lives at home with her parents, has been too busy with school assignments to fix up dinner.
intention: Kate wants to order a pizza.
moral_action: Kate orders an extra large pizza, enough to feed three and saves some for her parents.
immoral_action: Kate gets a medium pizza which is small enough for her to eat by herself.

norm: It's rude to spit out your food.
situation: Tommy's older mother spends an hour cooking brussel sprouts for Tommy.
intention: Tommy can't stand his brussel sprouts and doesn't want to swallow them.
moral_action: When mom isn't looking, Tommy takes the sprouts from his mouth and gives them to the dog.
immoral_action: Tommy spits out all his brussel sprouts onto his plate and verbally denigrates them.

norm: It is rude to make food that excludes certain people.
situation: Jenny is cooking dinner from some friends, and learns that Jane has a peanut allergy.
intention: Jenny wants to finish making dinner before her friends arrive.
moral_action: Jenny makes a series of dishes with nuts, using walnuts in place of peanuts in the recipe.
immoral_action: Jenny uses a special peanut sauce recipe on every dish, calling it 'A Night of Nuts'.

norm: It's rude to take someone's food without permission.
situation: Jared is on lunch break at work and realizes he forgot to bring a lunch that day.
intention: Jared wants to eat something for lunch.
moral_action: Jared picks a nearby fast food restaurant and lets his coworkers know he is going out to get some food there, so he can take orders.
immoral_action: Jared looks in the refrigerator in the break room and helps himself to some of the food being stored in there.

norm: It's rude to expect people to pay for your food.
situation: Jenny is out on a dinner date with James.
intention: Jenny needs to pay her half of the bill.
moral_action: Jenny gets out her wallet and pays for her food.
immoral_action: Jenny asks James to pay for her food since he asked her out.

norm: It's inconsiderate to take food from your kids.
situation: Lisa has just served her kids chicken nuggets and fries for their lunch.
intention: Lisa wants to eat.
moral_action: Lisa fixes herself a sandwich and a salad for her own lunch.
immoral_action: Lisa eats half of the food on her kids' plates for lunch.

norm: It is rude not to get food for your partner.
situation: Brenda's husband was at home with a broken leg while she was in town getting something to eat.
intention: Brenda wants to order her food.
moral_action: Brenda drives up to her favorite fast food place and orders food for her and her husband.
immoral_action: Brenda drives up to her favorite fast food place and orders a burger and fries for herself.

norm: It's rude to ask your classmates for their food.
situation: Bella is at school eating lunch with her friends, and she sees one of her friends with a twinkie.
intention: Bella wants to eat a twinkie.
moral_action: Bella stops at a store on the way home from school and buys a twinkie.
immoral_action: Bella asks her friend with the twinkie over and over if she can have it.

norm: It's rude to turn down food prepared for you.
situation: Chet went to his Asian girlfriend's house for dinner, and Chet was given a plate of food that smells bad.
intention: Chet has to decide what to do with the food.
moral_action: Chet decides to eat the food even though he doesn't like it.
immoral_action: Chet tells them that he'd rather not eat the food since it doesn't smell great.

norm: It's inconsiderate to steal someone else's lunch.
situation: Jenny is taking her lunch break in the break room at work and forgot her lunch, but see's her co-worker Alex has a big salad in the fridge.
intention: Jenny wants to eat.
moral_action: Jenny asks Alex if he would mind giving her some of his salad.
immoral_action: Jenny takes Alex's salad and begins eating it, then Alex walks in and catches her.

norm: It's rude to eat someone's food without their permission.
situation: Mark was visiting at his friend Larry's house when he started to get hungry.
intention: Mark wants to eat.
moral_action: Mark asks Larry if he has anything to eat at his house.
immoral_action: Mark goes into Larry's kitchen and makes himself a sandwich when Larry is out of the room.

norm: It is rude to eat too quickly.
situation: Aaron is having a romantic dinner with his girlfriend.
intention: Aaron wants to feel full and satisfied.
moral_action: Aaron savors each bite of his meal with great enjoyment.
immoral_action: Aaron scarfed all of his food down within minutes of receiving his plate.

norm: It's rude to comment on coworkers' eating habits.
situation: Jill is having lunch with her new co-worker Ruth, who she has just learned is a vegan.
intention: Jill wants to make sure Ruth is healthy.
moral_action: Jill respectfully asks about Ruth's veganism to learn more about the health aspects of the diet.
immoral_action: Jill makes derogatory remarks about Ruth's vegan diet and tries to pressure her into eating meat.

norm: It's bad to be too picky about your food order.
situation: Bill and Nancy are dining at a restaurant and have begun their meal when the waiter comes to ask how everything is.
intention: Bill wants to answer the waiter's question.
moral_action: Bill tells the waiter that everything is quite delicious and perfect.
immoral_action: Bill tells the waiter that the portion size is rather small and that the meal is unseasoned and needs more salt.

norm: It is rude to be disruptive when people are eating.
situation: Kyle who is a waiter is watching over his customers Pam and Sam who are eating their meal.
intention: Kyle wants to make sure Pam and Sam's meal is OK so far.
moral_action: Kyle walks into the field of view of Pam and Sam and does a thumbs up gesture while raising his eyebrows.
immoral_action: Kyle walks up to Pam and Sam's table and asks them while they're chewing if everything is good.

norm: It's rude to act out when eating out with friends.
situation: Lucy is having dinner with her friends has has found a hair in her food.
intention: Lucy wants compensated for her meal.
moral_action: Lucy points out the hair in her food and asks for another one.
immoral_action: Lucy goes on and on about the hair in her food to the server and becomes very animated.

norm: It's rude to tell someone that they eat too much.
situation: Adrian's sister has been putting on a lot of weight recently, and he is worried about her health.
intention: Adrian wants his sister to be at a healthy weight.
moral_action: Adrian has a conversation with his sister about how he is worried for her health.
immoral_action: Adrian tells his sister over lunch that she is becoming fat and ugly.

norm: It's bad to restrict your eating too much.
situation: Connie wants to lose fifty pounds by the end of the year.
intention: Connie wants to lose weight.
moral_action: Connie adds exercise to her modest diet.
immoral_action: Connie only eights six hundred calories a day.

norm: It's wrong to criticize people's eating habits.
situation: Sharon and Laura go to a dinner buffet with their friends and Laura keeps on eating an unusually large amount of meat.
intention: Sharon wants to react to Laura's binge eating of meat.
moral_action: Sharon explains to Laura the importance of eating more vegetable and less meat.
immoral_action: Sharon points out that Laura's binge eating of meat is not sensible.

norm: It's bad to talk someone into eating something they shouldn't.
situation: William and his classmates are on lunch break at school.
intention: William wants to entertain his classmates.
moral_action: William gathers the attention of many of his classmates and then blows bubbles in his milk and sings a song.
immoral_action: William gathers the attention of many of his classmates and then dares a particular classmate to eat his paper napkin.

norm: It's wrong to make fun of your partner's eating habits.
situation: Tony is eating hamburgers with his girlfriend when he notices she dips the hamburgers in soda.
intention: Tony wants to talk about the hamburger in soda.
moral_action: Tony asks his girlfriend why she dips her hamburger in soda.
immoral_action: Tony tells his girlfriend that it's weird for her to dip the burger in soda.

norm: It's a little gross to eat to excess.
situation: Tim took a girl he met on Tinder to an expensive Italian restaurant.
intention: Tim wants to eat pasta.
moral_action: Tim orders one plate of pasta and talks to the girl for the rest of the date.
immoral_action: Tim orders four different plates of pasta and eats everything off of them.

norm: It's rude to stare at people while they're eating.
situation: Keith is on a date with his wife Aubrey at a fancy restaurant, and they are seated beside a table of wheelchair users.
intention: Keith wants to talk to Aubrey about the wheelchairs.
moral_action: Keith references the wheelchair he's interested in talking about by the model and shows it to Aubrey on his phone.
immoral_action: Keith raises a finger and points towards one of the wheelchair users, drawing her eye directly to them.

norm: It's rude to keep tabs on someone's eating habits.
situation: Rebecca is with her friend at a restaurant and her friend ordered something unhealthy.
intention: Rebecca wants to have a conversation with her friend as they eat.
moral_action: Rebecca talks about the weather with her friend and other such day to day things.
immoral_action: Rebecca passively notes aloud that every time they go out to eat her friend picks the most unhealthy foods.

norm: It's rude to comment on someone eating alone.
situation: Karl takes his wife out to dinner and sees a guy eating by himself at the next table.
intention: Karl wants to say something to the guy.
moral_action: Karl asks the guy if he knows what's good to order from this place.
immoral_action: Karl laughs and asks the guy what he did to get stood up.

norm: It's bad to try to cheat at cards.
situation: James is playing poker with some friends after work.
intention: James wants to win enough money to buy a new pair of shoes.
moral_action: James plays a fair game of poke.
immoral_action: James hides an Ace in his sleeve and switches it with a card in his hand, giving him 4 of a kind.

norm: It's bad to cheat on someone.
situation: Trevor is in a relationship when he meets a new girl he thinks he really likes.
intention: Trevor wants to sleep with the new girl he met.
moral_action: Trevor takes the time to end his current relationship before sleeping with the new girl he met.
immoral_action: Trevor sleeps with the new girl he met behind his current partner's back.

norm: Cheating on someone is deceptive and unfair.
situation: Tom is in a relation but is finding himself more and more attracted to other women.
intention: Tom wants to have sex with a gorgeous woman he recently met.
moral_action: Tom tells his girlfriend he is attracted to another woman.
immoral_action: Tom asks the gorgeous women if she wants to hook up with him.

norm: It is evil to lie and cheat on someone.
situation: Dave and Bill played the lotto together with an equal share and Dave has find out they've won $1000.
intention: Dave wants to tell Bill what amount they won.
moral_action: Dave tells Bill they won 1000 dollars and that Bill is going to get 500 dollars share.
immoral_action: Dave tells Bill they won 400 dollars and that Bill is going to get 200 dollars share.

norm: Cheating on others is wrong.
situation: Daphne is out at a party without her boyfriend, Dan, and her friend Jake gets really flirty with her.
intention: Daphne wants to party with Jake.
moral_action: Daphne tells Jake he can hang out with her as long as he stops being flirty.
immoral_action: Daphne has a few drinks with Jake and ends up making out with him.

norm: It's bad to commit fraud.
situation: Paige recently got a job and needs a bank account, but has a bad history with the local banks.
intention: Paige wants to open a bank account for her paychecks.
moral_action: Paige pays back the money she owed her old bank, so she can reset her account.
immoral_action: Paige uses her mother's ID to open a bank account instead of her own.

norm: It's bad to obtain things by fraudulent means.
situation: Corey is shopping at the store with his wife Emily and sees a jacket he really likes, but he's short on money.
intention: Corey wants to acquire something new.
moral_action: Corey asks Emily if he can borrow the money he needs to cover the cost of the jacket.
immoral_action: Corey brings the jacket to the checkout,  writes a bad check, and brings it home.

norm: It's bad to cheat to get ahead.
situation: Jenna's boss promised her a bonus if she could complete ten house inspections in one week.
intention: Jenna wants to earn the bonus.
moral_action: Jenna works lots of overtime to thoroughly inspect all ten of the houses.
immoral_action: Jenna only glances at the last two houses but fills out the paperwork like she did a thorough inspection.

norm: It is bad to gamble irresponsibly
situation: Martha was going to the casino with some of her friends one day.
intention: Martha wanted to play poker.
moral_action: Martha brought along fifty dollars to gamble with at the casino.
immoral_action: Martha gambled away her whole paycheck at the poker table.

norm: It's bad to cheat on assignments.
situation: Emily is taking a test that she didn't prepare for.
intention: Emily wants to do well.
moral_action: Emily does her best on the test, and knows to study in the future.
immoral_action: Emily looks at the person next to her and copies their answers.

norm: It is shameful to be banned for bad behavior.
situation: Andre, an excellent dancer, is at a dance and is with a group of friends on the side.
intention: Andre wants to show off to his friends.
moral_action: Andre goes to the dancing area and begins breakdancing to the music.
immoral_action: Andre goes to the dancing area, finds a girl, and makes wild and sexually suggestive poses and movements.

norm: It is bad to cheat on someone who trust you.
situation: Jonah has been dating Martha, who he has promised to be faithful to.
intention: Jonah wants to date other people.
moral_action: Jonah tells Martha he wants to date other people.
immoral_action: Jonah dates other girls behind Martha's back.

norm: It is bad to lie about cheating.
situation: Warren has been out all night with his mistress and when he comes home late his wife, Ellen, confronts him, asking if he's been cheating on her.
intention: Warren wants to explain his whereabouts.
moral_action: Warren admits to Ellen that he has indeed been having an affair and that he thinks their marriage is no longer working out.
immoral_action: Warren tells Ellen that he was out comforting his best friend who had been having some personal problems.

norm: It's bad to cheat at games.
situation: William is hanging out at home with some of his friends, playing a card game.
intention: William wants to win the game.
moral_action: William spends time analyzing his friends' moves as well as the cards that have been played, and uses this information to make a smart decision which wins him the game.
immoral_action: William takes a quick glance at his friend's card when she isn't paying attention and uses this information to win the game.

norm: It is bad to cheat the system.
situation: Will has been on food stamps but has just been hired for a job which has enough income to disqualify him from those benefits.
intention: Will wants to keep his food costs low.
moral_action: Will cancels his food stamps benefits and starts following a strict weekly budget for food.
immoral_action: Will avoids reporting his new job to the welfare office in order to continue collecting benefits.

norm: It's bad to fall for a scam.
situation: Ulmer needs a thousand dollars to pay for his knee surgery, and he receives a suspicious message claiming that he inherited twenty thousand dollars.
intention: Ulmer wants money.
moral_action: Ulmer creates a post on social media asking for donations for his surgery.
immoral_action: Ulmer responds to the email, and he follows the instructions by making a down payment for his inheritance.

norm: It's bad to be a cheater.
situation: Mark is in a hard calculus class.
intention: Mark needs to pass the next test.
moral_action: Mark studies hard and passes.
immoral_action: Mark buys an answer key online and aces the test.

norm: It is bad to try to bait someone into cheating.
situation: John puts a huge bet on Karl's boxing opponent, and gets the chance to meet Karl before the fight.
intention: John wants say something to Karl.
moral_action: John tells Karl good luck, and wishes him the best.
immoral_action: John tells Karl that his life depends on the bet, and he needs to throw the fight.

norm: It's rude to ignore people you love.
situation: Gary's mom is always trying to call him to chat, but he ignores the calls because he is working.
intention: Gary's mom wants to have a conversation with her son.
moral_action: Gary's mom listens to Gary' schedule and starts calling at a different time.
immoral_action: Gary's mom keeps calling at inconvenient times, ignoring Gary's schedule.

norm: It's immoral to be abusive toward your spouse.
situation: Mitch has a bad day at work and comes home feeling angry.
intention: He wants to work out his anger somehow.
moral_action: Mitch releases his anger though a vigorous workout in his home gym.
immoral_action: Mitch takes his anger out on his wife and beats her up badly.

norm: It's rude to insult the people you love.
situation: Jake's wife has gotten a new haircut which he thinks looks terrible.
intention: Jake wants to tell his wife that her new haircut isn't right for her.
moral_action: Jake shows his wife a different haircut from a magazine and says that it would really suit her.
immoral_action: Jake tells his wife that she looks ugly with her new haircut.

norm: It is wrong to steal from your brother.
situation: Dave is in his brother's bedroom where his brother John keeps cash openly and Dave wants to raise money for his favorite charity.
intention: Dave wants to decide in which way he will raise money.
moral_action: Dave decides that he will call his brother and some other friends and ask them if they're willing to donate.
immoral_action: Dave decides that he will take the cash that is sitting in john's bedroom and give it to the charity.

norm: It's wrong to deceive your spouse.
situation: Joe's coworkers are all going out for a drink after work.
intention: Joe wants to go to the bar with his coworkers.
moral_action: Joe texts his wife to let her know he'll be joining his coworkers for a drink after work.
immoral_action: Joe goes out to the bar without telling his wife.

norm: It's wrong to mess up your ex.
situation: Charlie is attending a party with his ex Maria and a his boss.
intention: Charlie wants to make a statement to impress his boss.
moral_action: Charlie demonstrates his knowledge by telling his boss about his projects with Maria.
immoral_action: Charlie tells his boss a story about how he rescued Maria from an embarrassing situation with his skills.

norm: It's rude to ignore your spouse.
situation: Ted didn't sleep well last night and is really tired, but his wife keeps on telling him about something she read.
intention: Ted wants to take a nap right now.
moral_action: Ted tells his wife that he genuinely wants to hear about her story but that he's so tired he can't focus and needs a nap.
