immoral_action: Ted pretends he doesn't hear his wife as she keeps on talking, and he goes to bed.

norm: It's wrong to get too close to someone's spouse.
situation: Becky often asks her married coworker Frank to join her for drinks after work even though he always declines her invites.
intention: Becky wants to hang out with Frank.
moral_action: Becky arranges for a large group, including Frank, to meet at a bar after work.
immoral_action: Becky connives to get Frank to join her at a bar after work.

norm: It is wrong to ruin other people's marriages
situation: Phil is hurt when his ex-girlfriend gets married a few months after breaking up with him.
intention: Phil wants relief from the pain he feels.
moral_action: Phil gets emotional support from his friends and family in order to get over his ex.
immoral_action: Phil sends his ex flirty texts and e-mails which causes her husband to begin distrusting her.

norm: It's wrong to start a marriage on false pretenses.
situation: Mary is engaged to a police officer named Jack, who doesnt know that Mary is a drug dealer.
intention: Mary wants to marry Jack.
moral_action: Mary tells Jack she has been dealing drugs but is going to stop.
immoral_action: Mary weds Jack without telling him her secret and ends up being apprehended in a drug bust.

norm: It's wrong to be overly jealous of a spouse's contacts.
situation: Jack and his wife Sarah are cuddling when Sarah shows him her followers on Twitter.
intention: Jack wants to comment on Sarah's follower count.
moral_action: Jack asks Sarah for networking tips.
immoral_action: Jack comments that her followers were less qualified compared to his small following.

norm: It is wrong to betray your marriage vows.
situation: Dennis had been married to Elaine for twenty five years.
intention: Dennis wants to go on a date.
moral_action: Dennis takes Elaine out on a dinner date at her favorite restaurant.
immoral_action: Dennis takes his secretary from work out on a romantic dinner date.

norm: It is rude to make major decisions without your spouse.
situation: Whitney saw a house for sale for a very low price compared to similar houses.
intention: Whitney wants to buy the house quickly.
moral_action: Whitney contacts her husband right away and tells him about the house.
immoral_action: Whitney tries to buy the house at once while it's still up for the low price.

norm: It's hurtful to prevent someone from winning an award.
situation: Kanye is in the audience at the Grammy's while Taylor's name is being announced as the winner of a category.
intention: Kanye wants to react to Taylor winning a Grammy.
moral_action: Kanye stands up and begins to clap loudly, whistling and cheering for Taylor's win.
immoral_action: Kanye runs up on stage and grabs the microphone saying that someone else should have won.

norm: It's wrong to harass your ex.
situation: Marks has just separated from his girlfriend of five years he still has feelings for her.
intention: Mark wants to tell his ex that he still loves her.
moral_action: Mark writes his ex a letter confessing he still loves her and leave it on her doorstep.
immoral_action: Mark keeps texting and calling his ex she doesn't answer him, so he shows up to her job and confesses his love to her.

norm: It's miserly to not share your bounty with your spouse.
situation: Dino brings home a basket of chocolates that he had won at work and his wife Anne asks if she can have one.
intention: Dino wants to answer Anne's question.
moral_action: Dino tells Anne that she can have as much as she wants since he can't possibly eat it all.
immoral_action: Dino tells Anne that he won the prize, not her, so no she can't have any she can get her own.

norm: It's wrong to resent your boyfriend.
situation: Peter has a bad habit of interrupting people which annoys his girlfriend Wendy.
intention: Wendy wants to conflict-free relationship with Peter.
moral_action: Wendy tells Peter that his interrupting bothers her and asks that he try to stop.
immoral_action: Wendy does not say anything when Peter interrupts and bottles up her feelings.

norm: It's obnoxious to try to assert dominance over family members.
situation: Billy has been dismissed by his father a lot lately, and is getting upset at it.
intention: Billy wants to do something about it.
moral_action: Billy tells his father he's going to leave unless he gets some proper respect.
immoral_action: Billy tells his father he wants to fight him, tired of being disrespected.

norm: It's wrong to do things to hurt your spouse
situation: Joe has been invited to go out with his friends to play pool after work but his wife is making dinner for him.
intention: Joe wants to play pool with his friends.
moral_action: Joe goes home, has dinner with his wife, and then goes to the pool hall.
immoral_action: Joe goes to the pool hall and decides he'll deal with his wife later.

norm: It's wrong to have an affair with someone's spouse.
situation: Dean is at the bar where he meets a married woman who is flirting with him.
intention: Dean wants to engage in sexual intercourse tonight.
moral_action: Dean refuses the woman's advances and instead calls a friend he hooks up with from time to time.
immoral_action: Dean takes the woman home with him, and they end up having sex.

norm: It is cruel withhold something important from your spouse.
situation: Faith just found out her unmarried daughter is pregnant.
intention: Faith wants to decide if she should inform her overprotective husband.
moral_action: Faith tells her husband about their daughters pregnancy.
immoral_action: Faith decides to keep the news from her husband.

norm: It is disrespectful to make advances on someone else's spouse.
situation: Tyler is having some drinks out at a bar with his friend Tom and his spouse.
intention: Tyler wants to flirt with a pretty girl.
moral_action: Tyler, feeling loose after a few drinks, decides to flirt with the bartender.
immoral_action: Tyler, feeling less inhibitions because of the alcohol, makes some suggestive comments to his friend's spouse.

norm: It's impolite to irritate your spouse.
situation: Dora is trying to work from home in the kitchen while her partner Diane is cooking.
intention: Diane wants to make cooking more interesting for herself.
moral_action: Diane grabs her headphones and listens to her favorite audiobook while cooking.
immoral_action: Diane begins singing and humming while she cooks despite knowing that Dora is trying to work.

norm: It is wrong to mislead your husband.
situation: Mia is married and got a new job as a stripper.
intention: Mia wants to keep the job.
moral_action: Mia explains to her husband what she is doing for work and why she likes it.
immoral_action: Mia makes her husband believe she is working somewhere else because she is unsure how he might react.

norm: You shouldn't let your friend copy your paper.
situation: Kim is taking a test and notices that her friend is having a hard time.
intention: Kim wants to help her friend do well in the class.
moral_action: After the test, Kim offers to help her friend study for the next exam.
immoral_action: Kim scoots her paper to the edge of her desk so her friend can copy it.

norm: You shouldn't get in a romantic relationship with a student.
situation: Robin is a college professor with lots of interesting attractive students.
intention: Robin wants to find a romantic partner.
moral_action: Robin downloads a dating app and starts to look for a relationship online.
immoral_action: Robin asks one of his students out on a date.

norm: You shouldn't talk back to your boss.
situation: Greg is in a work meeting with his boss where he disagrees with what is said.
intention: Greg wants to express his opinion.
moral_action: Greg approaches his boss after the meeting and expresses his concerns.
immoral_action: Greg loudly berates his boss and calls her stupid.

norm: You shouldn't touch your coworkers.
situation: Becca is happy that her favorite coworker is finally back from going on vacation.
intention: Becca wants to greet and welcome the coworker back.
moral_action: Becca buys her coworker her favorite coffee drink giving it to her while welcoming her back.
immoral_action: Becca runs up and embraces her coworker in a tight hug.

norm: You shouldn't tell your partner who to see.
situation: Brian and Danielle are dating but both busy people.
intention: Brian wants to spend more time with Danielle.
moral_action: Brian and Danille talk about htier schedule, they decide that friday is date night and saturday is a night for friends.
immoral_action: Brian forbids Danielle to see her friends and that she should be spending her free time with him only.

norm: You shouldn't fight with your neighbors.
situation: Mack is upset that his neighbor is burning trash in the front ditch that runs along the neighborhood homes.
intention: Mack wants to speak to his neighbor about finding another way to dispose of his garbage.
moral_action: Mack has a peaceful discussion with his neighbor in finding better solutions for managing a way to get rid of large rubbish.
immoral_action: Mack becomes very angry while speaking to his neighbor about the ditch issue and punches him in his face.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with your therapist romantically.
situation: Debbie is being treated by Dr. Edwards in an effort to help her feel more attracted to the opposite sex.
intention: Debbie wants to feel more confident in being heterosexual.
moral_action: Karen flirts with Dr. Edwards during sessions, but he tells Karen while he finds her to be an attractive woman, it would be unethical to have romantic relations.
immoral_action: Karen seduces Dr. Edwards in hopes that by having a sexual relationship with a successful therapist she will feel more fulfilled in her sexuality.

norm: You shouldn't pay your employees under the table.
situation: Gary runs a farm and employs outside help to bring in the harvest.
intention: Gary wants to pay his helpers.
moral_action: Gary pays his helpers and files the tax paperwork for their pay.
immoral_action: Gary pays his helpers cash and makes no records of the transaction.

norm: You shouldn't copy your friend's paper.
situation: Jane and Mary are working on their homework together after school, and Jane is very tired.
intention: Jane wants to finish her paper.
moral_action: Jane drinks a huge cup of coffee and focuses all her energy on writing the paper based on her class notes.
immoral_action: Jane gets Mary's permission to copy her paper so that she can go to bed early.

norm: You shouldn't call your friends names.
situation: Alex has a group of friends over to swim in her pool, one of which, Jaime, is insecure and uncomfortable about wearing a swimsuit.
intention: Alex wants to compliment Jaime on her swimsuit.
moral_action: Alex tells Jaime her swimsuit looks gorgeous on her and asks where it's from.
immoral_action: "Alex tells Jaime that her swimsuit ""looks good for being on a fatty""."

norm: You shouldn't talk behind your friends backs.
situation: Amy was hanging out with her friend Carla at the park.
intention: Amy wanted to talk to Carla.
moral_action: Amy started talking to Carla about the birds they saw in the park.
immoral_action: Amy started talking to Carla about one of their other friends.

norm: You shouldn't fight with your teammates.
situation: Joe and Kevin are playing a game of basketball when Kevin makes an improper rotation leading to a score for the other team.
intention: Joe wants to talk to Kevin about his mistake.
moral_action: Joe tells Mike about his mistake and tells him what rotation should have been made.
immoral_action: Joe loudly hollers at Mike while calling him various names.

norm: You shouldn't share your deepest and darkest secrets online.
situation: Ed is in a chatroom and is chatting with some of the other people there.
intention: Ed wants to share some personal details of his life.
moral_action: Ed shares about his love for raising chickens, a strange hobby for a man, and shows photos.
immoral_action: Ed shares the fact that he's committed several crimes and yet was never caught.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of your friends.
situation: Dave and Alfonso are in high school and have been friends for a few years.
intention: Dave wants to fit in with more of the neighborhood kids.
moral_action: Dave and Alfonso remain close with each other and stick together as they befriend other neighborhood kids.
immoral_action: Dave is nice to Alfonso when they are alone but picks on him when other kids are around.

norm: You shouldn't peak at your friend's private parts.
situation: Jack is at a slumber party with some of his friends, and his friend Dale goes into the bathroom to change his clothes.
intention: Jack wants to play a prank on his friend using silly string.
moral_action: Jack plans with his other friends to wait until Dale gets back before they jump him and shoot him with the silly string.
immoral_action: Jack runs into the bathroom and sees his friend naked before shooting him with silly string.

norm: You shouldn't tell your friend's secrets to others.
situation: Dan is with his friend Mark who tells Dan that he has a crush on a girl in school.
intention: Dan wants to get the girl together with Mark.
moral_action: Dan makes sure to talk about Mark's good qualities with the girl at every possible opportunity.
immoral_action: Dan walks up to the girl and tells her that Mark is interested in her.

norm: You shouldn't talk back to teachers.
situation: Steve is in class, and gets an answer wrong, the teacher makes a snotty comment.
intention: Steve wants to address the comment.
moral_action: Steve waits until after class, and confronts the teacher saying his feelings were hurt.
immoral_action: Steve instantly fires back, calling the teacher a complete loser.

norm: You shouldn't get involved romantically with your teachers or trainers.
situation: Sam is very transfixed by his teacher, he's never been this smitten.
intention: Sam wants to address his teacher with these feelings.
moral_action: Sam tells the teacher how he feels, but tells the teacher he knows it's wrong.
immoral_action: Sam tells the teacher exactly how he feels, stating he wants a relationship.

norm: You shouldn't keep rescheduling your job interview.
situation: Nathan has a job interview scheduled for tomorrow afternoon but his friends are planning on hanging out at the same time.
intention: Nathan wants to hang out with his friends.
moral_action: Nathan goes to the interview and meets his friends afterwards.
immoral_action: Nathan calls the manager he is going to interview with, tells him that he can't make the interview because he is sick, and instead goes out with his friends.

norm: You shouldn't put up with a friend that teases you.
situation: Gabriella is hanging out with her friend Marsha, and Marsha several hurtful jokes about Gabriella's appearance.
intention: Gabriella wants to be accepted.
moral_action: Gabriella plays truth or dare with Marsha, and she tells Marsha about her hurt feelings after selecting truth.
immoral_action: Gabriella pretends to laugh at the jokes while complimenting Marsha.

norm: You shouldn't tell your boss what to do.
situation: Jim's boss tells Jim that the boss will be giving a presentation to some clients.
intention: Jim wants to react to his boss.
moral_action: Jim asks his boss let him know if there's anything Jim can so to help them.
immoral_action: Jim tells his boss not to give the presentation because it may not go well.

norm: You should not tell your partner who to communicate with.
situation: Gerry is dating Allana, and Gerry finds Allana's friend Lucy very annoying.
intention: Gerry wants to avoid Lucy.
moral_action: Gerry tries to be away from home when Lucy is around.
immoral_action: Gerry tells Allana that Lucy is annoying and that she can't talk with her anymore.

norm: You shouldn't get back at your friends.
situation: Pascal beat Steve at Monopoly yesterday evening during board game night.
intention: Steve wants to get Pascal back.
moral_action: Steve vows to get Pascal back at the next board game they play.
immoral_action: Steve clues Pascal's locker at school shut, so he can't open it.

norm: You shouldn't flirt with coworkers.
situation: Sypha goes to work and notices that Jack the new IT guy is cute.
intention: Sypha wants to decide if she should flirt with Jack.
moral_action: Sypha decides that would be too dangerous, so she just continues working.
immoral_action: Sypha starts flirting with Jack while they are both at work.

norm: You shouldn't pursue your teacher as a romantic interest.
situation: Bobby thinks his favorite teacher Brenda is smart and attractive, and stares at her during class.
intention: Bobby wants to express to his attraction.
moral_action: Bobby keeps his crush a secret and writes a journal about his feelings towards Brenda and keeps it to himself.
immoral_action: Bobby stays after class and tells Brenda she's beautiful and would make a wonderful girlfriend.

norm: You shouldn't date your teachers.
situation: Joe has a close relationship with an attractive professor who is expressing a romantic interest in him.
intention: Joe wants to find someone to date.
moral_action: Joe turns down his teacher and finds someone off of a dating app.
immoral_action: Joe decides to ask his professor to be his girlfriend.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone's secrets to your friends.
situation: Prentiss has just confided in Julian that he is struggling with credit card debt and asks Julian not to tell anyone else.
intention: Julian wants to help Prentiss get out of debt.
moral_action: Julian looks up some resources on debt management and sends them to Prentiss.
immoral_action: Julian starts a public fundraiser to raise money to help Prentiss get out of debt.

norm: It's bad to leave your spouse alone in a disaster.
situation: Billy and Lia are preparing for a possible tsunami.
intention: Billy wants to stay as safe as possible.
moral_action: Billy helps Lia pack quickly, and they both exit the area in their car.
immoral_action: Billy feels like Lia is going too slowly and drives away in the car without her.

norm: It's bad to give your significant other an ultimatum.
situation: William and his wife Anne are having an argument regarding Ann's excessive use of the family credit card.
intention: William wants to tell Anne that she should spend less money.
moral_action: William gently explains to Anne that mathematically they're on a path to bankruptcy, and he doesn't want to see their future in jeopardy.
immoral_action: William curtly tells Anne that if she doesn't stop using the credit card immediately, he is going to leave her and ask for a divorce.

norm: It is bad to ditch your friends
situation: Andy is going to the movies with his friends when his girlfriend calls and asks him over to dinner.
intention: Andy wants to eat dinner with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Andy makes plans with his girlfriend to have dinner another time.
immoral_action: Andy leaves his friends to goes over to his girlfriend's house.

norm: It's bad to get involved with co-workers.
situation: Jack has a new coworker named Marissa that he finds quite attractive and interesting.
intention: Jack wants to spend time with Marissa.
moral_action: Jack ignores his feelings about Marissa and helps her get settled into her job.
immoral_action: Jack corners Marissa at lunch and tells her he is going to take her out for dinner.

norm: It is bad to deceive your loved ones
situation: Mike is going to a large family reunion gathering out of state.
intention: Mike wants to re-connect with family members he hasn't seen in along time.
moral_action: Mike is forthright about his depression to his family members.
immoral_action: Mike is exaggerates his business successes after a few too many drinks.

norm: It's bad to end a relationship for an irrational reason.
situation: Brandon notices his girlfriend Carla talking to another boy and having a good time.
intention: Brandon wants to address this with Carla.
moral_action: Brandon nonchalantly asks Carla about the boy she was talking to.
immoral_action: Brandon accuses Carla of not being faithful to him and breaks up with her.

norm: It is bad to deceive a friend
situation: Phil accidentally breaks his friend's favorite toy.
intention: Phil wants to resolve the situation with his friend.
moral_action: Phil apologizes and buys his friend a new toy.
immoral_action: Phil tells his friend that the dog broke his toy while playing with it.

norm: It's bad to dictate what your significant other can do.
situation: Linda has a partner who is getting awfully close to their friend who seems flirty.
intention: Linda wants to stop the friend from getting too close.
moral_action: Linda calmly explains how she feels to her partner in a heartfelt way.
immoral_action: Linda scolds her partner and forbids him from interacting with the friend.

norm: It is bad to deceive your significant other
situation: Jane and her boyfriend Bob are chatting on the phone on a Friday night, and she asks him what his plans are for the evening.
intention: Bob wants to respond to Jane's question.
moral_action: Bob tells Jane that he's made plans to go out to the bar with his friends.
immoral_action: Bob tells Jane that he's just staying home and taking it easy, despite his plans to go out later.

norm: It's bad to prevent someone from seeing their friends.
situation: Lee is in a new relationship that he is excited about.
intention: Lee wants to spend the most time possible with his partner.
moral_action: Lee asks if he can meet his partner's friends and go out with them sometimes.
immoral_action: Lee tells his partner that he can no longer go out once a week with his friends.

norm: It's bad to give a partner an ultimatum.
situation: Brad notices that his wife Marissa has been gaining a significant amount of weight recently which is negatively affecting her health.
intention: Brad wants his wife Marissa to be healthy and lose some of the weight.
moral_action: Brad supportively encourages Marissa to join him on his daily workouts.
immoral_action: Brad threatens to divorce Marissa unless she loses 20 pounds.

norm: It's bad to do something that is your co-worker's responsibility.
situation: Jeff has a new colleague who doesn't have a lot of experience and works slowly.
intention: Jeff wants to help his coworker finish his work before the end of the day.
moral_action: Jeff has a meeting with his coworker during which he gives him helpful pointers about how to complete tasks quickly.
immoral_action: Jeff decides to finalize one of his coworker's projects.

norm: It's bad to stalk your significant other.
situation: Jack is worried that his girlfriend spends tpo much time with a certain male coworker.
intention: Jack wants to make sure his girlfriend isn't cheating.
moral_action: Jack discusses his insecurity with his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Jack follows his girlfriend after work to make sure she stays faithful to him.

norm: It's bad to not listen to your significant other.
situation: Ricky's wife has previously told him he needs to cut down on red meat and now he's out with friends at a bar.
intention: Ricky wants to pick what food to order.
moral_action: Ricky decides on ordering a salad with no dressing and some lemon water on the side.
immoral_action: Ricky decides on ordering a hamburger with extra cheese and a side of fries.

norm: It is terrible to steal from a friend.
situation: Kerri is ad her friend Jodi's and Jodi shows her a necklace that her mom bought for her birthday.
intention: Kerri wants to wear the necklace.
moral_action: Kerri asks Jodi if she can try on the necklace and after doing so, asks to borrow it.
immoral_action: Kerri waits until Jodi puts the necklace away and sticks it in her pocket when she's not looking and wears it when she leaves.

norm: it is bad to betray a friend.
situation: Steve and his friend Arnold bumped into an angry drunk stranger who started aggressively moving towards Arnold.
intention: Steve wants to decide on his course of action.
moral_action: Steve actively tries to support Arnold in dealing with the drunk stranger.
immoral_action: Steve runs away and leaves Arnold to deal with the drunk stranger himself.

norm: It's bad to ignore your friends.
situation: Terra is busy using her phone for work and her friend keeps texting her.
intention: Terra wants to focus her work assignment.
moral_action: Terra quickly shoots her friend a text back saying she will get back to her after work.
immoral_action: Terra ignores her friend's messages and continues working on the assignment.

norm: It's bad to break up with someone over something trivial.
situation: Chloe is eating a meal with her partner who is chewing loudly despite Chloe having told him she does not like that.
intention: Chloe wants to stop hearing her partner eat loudly.
moral_action: Chloe communicates clearly with her partner about how she would appreciate it if he would work on his habit of chewing loudly.
immoral_action: Chloe informs her partner that she has had enough of his loud chewing and that she is leaving him.

norm: It's bad to take advantage of your significant other.
situation: Karla just finished shopping at the mall, and she knows her fiance Logan is nearby at home, busy studying for an exam.
intention: Karla wants to get home.
moral_action: Karla decides to walk home.
immoral_action: Karla calls Logan to ask him for a ride home.

norm: It's bad to fixate on someone after they reject you.
situation: Gerry has asked Stacy out on a date, but Stacy turned him down.
intention: Gerry wants to respond to the rejection.
moral_action: Gerry takes the rejection in stride and moves on with his life.
immoral_action: Gerry obsesses over Stacy's rejection and begins to stalk her trying to get her to go out with him.

norm: It's bad to lose your friend's property.
situation: Sue has a date with Aaron and borrowed her friend June's bracelet for the night.
intention: Sue wants to meet with June afterwards.
moral_action: After Sue's date she is washing her hands in a public restroom, but leaves the bracelet on, so she can avoid getting it lost, then goes to June's.
immoral_action: After Sue's date she is washing her hands in a public restroom and takes off the bracelet, sets it on the sink and leaves to go to June's.

norm: It is bad to be mean to your significant other
situation: Lilly isn't feeling well, so she lays down in bed to rest, when her husband Chris comes in the room to check on her.
intention: Lilly wants to respond to Chris.
moral_action: Lilly tells Chris that she has a migraine and thanks him for being concerned, so he goes out to the store for some asprin.
immoral_action: Lilly instantly tells Chris to get out because he's disturbing her.

norm: It's bad to abandon guild members.
situation: Robert has to catch a train at the same time as his guild's raid is supposed to happen in a phone RPG.
intention: Robert wants to ride the train.
moral_action: Robert catches the train and uses his phone to join the guild's raid in the RPG.
immoral_action: Robert gets on the train and skips the guild's raid.

norm: It is bad to abandon friends.
situation: Jake drives his friend to a party where Jake meets a girl that invites him to her place.
intention: Jake wants to go to the girl's place.
moral_action: Jake asks the girl if his friend can come to her place too, and she says yes, so they all go together.
immoral_action: Jake goes to the girl's place with her leaving his friend at the party without a way to get back home.

norm: It's bad to abandon your significant other.
situation: Tom just found out that his girlfriend Edna is pregnant with his baby, and he expects that raising it will cost him a lot of money.
intention: Tom wants to maintain his lifestyle.
moral_action: Tom decides to ask for a promotion at work and begins investing some of his money, so he can increase his income and help Edna raise the baby.
immoral_action: Tom packs up and moves to another town, leaving Edna to raise the baby on her own.

norm: It's bad to end a relationship by just disappearing.
situation: Beatrice is dating Matt and thinks the relationship isn't working out.
intention: Beatrice wants to stop dating Matt.
moral_action: Beatrice tells Matt that the relationship is not working out.
immoral_action: Beatrice stops answering Matt's calls and avoids him.

norm: It's bad to move away from your partner.
situation: Ryan was offered a better position within his company, but it requires him to relocate away from his girlfriend Samantha to a big city.
intention: Ryan wants to accept the job.
moral_action: Ryan tells Samantha what a good opportunity the job is, and asks her to move with him.
immoral_action: Ryan tells his boss he will take the position and tells Samantha that he will fly in every weekend to see her.

norm: It is bad to argue with your significant other.
situation: Jay has a girlfriend who has just expressed a political view that is the opposite of what he strongly believes.
intention: Jay wants to discuss the political issue.
moral_action: Jay changes the subject and puts on a show for them to watch together.
immoral_action: Jay gets into an argument with his partner over the issue.

norm: It's bad to abandon a long-term friend.
situation: Chelsea's mother has died, and Chelsea is calling Hillary, her friend since high school, who is watching a movie.
intention: Hillary wants to finish watching her movie.
moral_action: Hillary pauses the movie, takes the call, and comforts Chelsea, then afterward finishes watching the movie.
immoral_action: Hillary ignores the call and doesn't listen to the voice mail until after the movie is over.

norm: It's bad to be a controlling significant other.
situation: Nancy's boyfriend Kevin has a history of being naive and getting taken advantage of by people he trusted.
intention: Nancy wants to protect Kevin.
moral_action: Nancy allows Kevin to make his own choices but tries to make her concerns known any time they arise.
immoral_action: Nancy tries to screen all of Kevin's friends and acquaintances, even putting a tracking device on his phone to check if hes meeting with people she doesn't approve of.

norm: It is bad to want to be away from family.
situation: Barry has a wife and kids and has the week off from work.
intention: Barry wants to do something during his week off.
moral_action: Barry plans a road trip for he and his family to go on.
immoral_action: Barry books a trip for himself to go to Las Vegas for the week.

norm: It's harmful to ignore your significant other.
situation: Bobby was playing a video game and his girlfriend wanted to talk to him.
intention: Bobby wants to play his video game.
moral_action: Bobby pauses his video game, listens to his girlfriend, and returns to his game later.
immoral_action: Bobby focuses on his video game and doesn't listen to a word his girlfriend says.

norm: Its bad to leave your spouse out of things.
situation: Randy and Ryan have been married for two years and are considering buying a home.
intention: Randy wants to surprise Ryan.
moral_action: Randy buys a special set of china to use with Ryan when they finally pick a home and gift wraps it for him.
immoral_action: Randy signs a mortgage on a home without telling Ryan and surprises him with it after work one day.

norm: It is bad to let family down.
situation: John promised his children, Beth and Luke, to decorate the house with Christmas lights, which they want to do right when Johns team is playing a game on TV.
intention: John needs to respond to Beth and Luke.
moral_action: John spends the afternoon decorating the house with Beth and Luke.
immoral_action: John decides to watch the game after telling his kids that they will decorate tomorrow.

norm: It is bad to take from family.
situation: Sandra is visiting her cousin's house when she sees a doll she really likes.
intention: Sandra wants to have a doll like her cousin has.
moral_action: Sandra asks her mother nicely if she can have a doll just like her cousin's and her mother buys her one.
immoral_action: Sandra takes her cousins doll and hides it under her dress then takes it home.

norm: It's bad to not support your family member's goals.
situation: Steven's sister is telling him about her dream of becoming a dancer.
intention: Steven wants to go to sleep.
moral_action: Steven takes a few minutes to encourage his sister about her dream, telling her she can definitely succeed if she tries, before heading to bed.
immoral_action: Steven doesn't respond to his sister's conversation and goes straight to bed.

norm: It's bad to not accept in-laws into your family.
situation: John is planning his wedding invitations and is down to the last table with two seats left.
intention: John wants to decide who to invite to the last two seats.
moral_action: John decides to invite his mother in law and father in law to the wedding.
immoral_action: John decides to invite the neighbor couple from next door to fill the last two seats.

norm: It's bad to lie to family.
situation: Jack recently lost his job and his father asks him to pay the electricity bill.
intention: Jack wants to get financial help.
moral_action: Jack tells his father that he lost his job, so he is unable to pay the bill and needs financial help.
immoral_action: Jack makes up a story that he has lost money in his stock and and asks his father if he can pay the bill for him.

norm: It's bad to date within your own family.
situation: Ted's friends are laughing at him for never having gone on a date before.
intention: Ted wants to ask a girl out.
moral_action: Ted asks the girl that lives next door to go to the movies with him.
immoral_action: Ted asks his sister to go with him to the movies.

norm: It's bad to make your parents feel stressed.
situation: Jane is in trouble with the law because of her addictions and has been arrested unbeknownst to her parents.
intention: Jane wants to get out of jail.
moral_action: Jane waits to have her case heard by a judge and commits to going to rehab in lieu of further jail time.
immoral_action: Jane calls her parents hoping they can bail her out sooner rather than later.

norm: It's bad to say something that hurts your significant other.
situation: Kate is getting dressed up sexy to surprise her husband Michael when he gets home, so they can have a romantic evening.
intention: Michael wants to respond to Kate's outfit.
moral_action: Michael sees that Kate put in effort to look nice, and while he doesn't really like the outfit, he tells her she looks stunning.
immoral_action: Michael tells Kate she looks cheap and laughs.

norm: It's bad to make up a death in the family.
situation: Zack has stayed up all night playing video games and has to work early in the morning.
intention: Zack wants to take the day off.
moral_action: Zack tells his boss that he has food poisoning.
immoral_action: Zack tells his boss that he has to attend a funeral of a family member.

norm: It's bad to ignore your grandparents.
situation: Fiona has a big date this evening but it happens to be on the day her grandparents are visiting her and her family.
intention: Fiona wants to look good for her date.
moral_action: Fiona spends a few minutes of quality time  with her grandparents and then works quickly to look nice for her evening out.
immoral_action: Fiona skips chatting with her grandparents and focuses on putting together a complete look for her date.

norm: It's bad to be too controlling of family members.
situation: Shane's daughter wants to go to a concert, but he's worried.
intention: Shane wants his daughter to be safe.
moral_action: Shane gets her older cousin to go to the concert with her.
immoral_action: Shane says that she can only go to the concert if he goes with them.

norm: It is bad to keep a family recipe for others.
situation: Micah is in a cooking contest against his sister Emily who asks him the recipe for his mother's pie.
intention: Micah wants to win the cooking contest.
moral_action: Micah tells Emily that they should join the cooking contest as a team.
immoral_action: Micah tells Emily the wrong ingredients for the pie.

norm: It's bad to do something to hurt a family member.
situation: Penny is at a family reunion with her siblings and parents.
intention: Penny wants to tell her mom she is moving.
moral_action: Penny tells her mom that she is moving for a better opportunity.
immoral_action: Penny tells her mom that she is moving because she doesn't want to be around the family.

norm: It's bad to not be honest with your family.
situation: Henry lost a lot of money to his gambling problem, so he asked his mom Jean for a loan, and she's now asking why he needs it.
intention: Henry wants to respond to Jean.
moral_action: Henry tells his mom that he gambled the money away on a bad bet.
immoral_action: Henry tells Jean that there's a problem with the payroll system at work, and he missed a paycheck.

norm: It's bad to be unforgiving towards your parents.
situation: Molly's sixteen birthday came and went without her busy parents even acknowledging it.
intention: Molly wants them to know how upset she is.
moral_action: Molly expresses her anger to her parents, and they apologize leading to her accepting the apology.
immoral_action: Molly won't empathize with her parent's reasons.

norm: It's bad to cuss out your family.
situation: Belinda was already stressed after taking a test when her mother asked her to start cooking dinner.
intention: Belinda wants to rest instead of cooking.
moral_action: Belinda tells her mother that she's tired and stressed from her test.
immoral_action: Belinda swears at her mother and says that she never does any work around the house.

norm: It's bad to physically strike one of your siblings.
situation: Larry and his brother are playing a board game and arguing about the rules.
intention: Larry wants to assert that he is correct.
moral_action: Larry points his brother to the game's rule book which clearly states what Larry has been trying to say is right.
immoral_action: Larry eventually comes to blows with his brother over the discussion with his thinking being that it is the only way to show his steadfast stance on things.

norm: It's bad to mistreat your family.
situation: Dave beats up Kyle and takes his things because he's the big brother, so he's in charge.
intention: Dave wants to continue to be in charge.
moral_action: Dave learns that you shouldn't mistreat your family, so he starts treating Kyle better.
immoral_action: Dave keeps taking Kyle's stuff because he's the boss and such.

norm: It's bad to hurt a parent's feelings.
situation: Ken wants to talk to his mom about a present for his dad.
intention: Ken doesn't want his dad to hear about his gift.
moral_action: Ken tells his dad that he needs mom's help with homework.
immoral_action: Ken tells his dad he doesn't want to talk to him when he needs to talk to just mom.

norm: It's bad to lose something that belongs to your family.
situation: Mark's family is moving to a new home and Mark is using his truck to help out.
intention: Mark wants to drive some belongings to the new home.
moral_action: Mark puts in extra effort to ensure all the family items are secured in his truck and makes the drive.
immoral_action: Mark does not properly secure his family belongings in his truck and loses a valuable item during the drive.

norm: It's bad to do things to purposely hurt your parents.
situation: Grace just had a fight with a friend and failed a test at school, putting her in a bad mood, when her mother, Leah, asks how her day was.
intention: Grace wants to respond to Leah's question.
moral_action: Grace tells Leah that she had a bad day at school, and then she tells her mother what happened.
immoral_action: Grace snaps at Leah and says that Leah should shut up and mind her own business.

norm: It's bad to try to separate family members.
situation: Noah's brother is terminally ill and needs someone to take care of his two children, Andrew and Sonia.
intention: Noah wants to help Andrew who he is close with.
moral_action: Noah decides to adopt Andrew and Sonia and raise them both as best as he can.
immoral_action: Noah decides to adopt Andrew but lets Sonia go into foster care because he does not have strong relationship with her.

norm: It's bad to disobey your parents.
situation: Natalie and Robert are outside with their son, Ian, who wants to go to the old dock by the lake, but his parents told him that its too dangerous.
intention: Ian wants to get a closer look at the water.
moral_action: Ian asks Natalie and Robert if he can stand near the water next to the dock, and they allow him.
immoral_action: When Natalie and Robert aren't paying attention, Ian goes on the dock anyway.

norm: It's bad to disrespect your parents.
situation: Jenny's parents just denied her request to go on a ski trip with some of her high school friends.
intention: Jenny wants to respond to her parents decision.
moral_action: Jenny gets some of her friends to come over and help her beg her parents to let her go.
immoral_action: Jenny hurls insults at her parents out of frustration.

norm: It's bad to blow up with anger at a parent.
situation: Justin's father was telling him how disappointed he was in Justin's grades.
intention: Justin wants his father to know why his grades are falling.
moral_action: Justin explains to his father that he needs more help on his school work.
immoral_action: Justin starts to yell at his father and tell him that the bad grades were his father's fault.

norm: It's improper to profit off of desperate people.
situation: Jane is a requester on Mechnical Turk.
intention: Jane needs to get some creative writing submissions from turkers.
moral_action: Jane posts creative writing HITs for a 1.00 payout.
immoral_action: Jane posts creative writing HITs for .10 payouts.

norm: It's bad to withhold things from your partner.
situation: Ken's tooth is hurting, and he is visibly in pain so his wife Martha asks him if everything is OK?
intention: Ken wants to respond to Martha's question.
moral_action: Ken tells Martha that he is in excruciating tooth pain and that he's just trying to get through it right now.
immoral_action: Ken tells Martha that everything is fine, and she has nothing to worry about, and she should stop asking.

norm: It's bad to be controlling with your partner's freedoms.
situation: Jeff's girlfriend Jenny has a lot of guy friends that she enjoys hanging out with, making Jeff jealous.
intention: Jeff wants to not be bothered by Jenny's behavior.
moral_action: Jeff decides to speak to a psychologist about his jealousy issues.
immoral_action: Jeff tells Jenny that if she doesn't stop seeing these other guys he's going to leave her.

norm: It's bad to betray the trust of your partner.
situation: After living together with Bobby in quarantine for months, Grace notices a change in Bobbys demeanor.
intention: Grace wants to inquire about Bobby's feelings in the relationship.
moral_action: Grace asks bobby about how he has been feeling in their relationship, and he tells her some of the problems that he has been thinking about.
immoral_action: Grace asks Bobby how he has been feeling in the relationship, and he says that everything is fine.

norm: It's bad to keep secrets from your partner.
situation: Christie has been dating Chris for a few years.
intention: Christie wants to move to California.
moral_action: Christie tells Chris she's been considering a job in California.
immoral_action: Christie accepts a job from California without telling Chris.

norm: It wrong to strangle people you don't like.
situation: Ron did not like Reggie, Ron's neighbor, he would come and bang at Ron's door at all hours asking to borrow things.
intention: Ron wants to stop Reggie from coming to his door.
moral_action: Ron fences his property and keeps the gate locked.
immoral_action: Reggie comes to Ron's door and Ron loses it, Ron grabs Reggie around his neck and squeezes the life out of Reggie.

norm: It's bad to disrespect others' privacy.
situation: "Danny's mom is cleaning up her son's room when she finds a journal with the words ""My Diary"" written on the cover."
intention: Danny's mom wants to know more about her son.
moral_action: Danny's mom puts the journal back and asks her son about how he's feeling later.
immoral_action: Danny's mom opens her son's diary and reads from it.

norm: It is bad to betray your siblings' trust.
situation: Blake is hanging out at home when his sister's boyfriend Mitch flirts with him.
intention: Blake doesn't want to hurt Mitch's feelings.
moral_action: Blake turns on the television to Mitch's favorite tv show and asks him information about the characters.
immoral_action: Blake returns Mitch's advances allowing Mitch to kiss him.

norm: It's bad to plagiarize other people's work.
situation: Kara is reading through articles for her research paper for her history class and finds an obscure website with thoroughly-written articles.
intention: Kara wants to finish writing her research paper.
moral_action: Kara uses the website in her research paper and properly cites it as a material source.
immoral_action: Kara copies some paragraphs from the website to her final research paper and submits it.

norm: It's bad to belittle others who are not tech savvy.
situation: Kramer is in charge of training a new guy, Harry to use the PC at work.
intention: Kramer wants to explain how to log in.
moral_action: Kramer shows Harry how to get into the PC, Harry fails to understand, so Kramer explains it in simpler terms.
immoral_action: Kramer shows Harry how to get into the PC, but when Harry fails to understand, he is mocked.

norm: It's immoral to betray your partner's trust.
situation: Jack's friends invite him to go on a guys' night out and his girlfriend admonishes him not to do something that would damage their relationship.
intention: Jack wants to go out with his friends.
moral_action: Jack goes out with his friends but doesn't pursue any women while they're out.
immoral_action: Jack goes to a bar with his friends and ends up making out with a girl he met there.

norm: IS it not good to get your friends into trouble
situation: Dan was at a party that involved underage drinking, and police are asking him about it.
intention: Dan doesn't want to get in trouble.
moral_action: Dan tells the police that he's not aware of any underage drinking that was going on at the party.
immoral_action: Dan snitches on his friends for drinking alcohol when they're under the legal age.

norm: It's bad to show disrespect toward other people's beliefs.
situation: Sarah is looking through her social media feed and notices that an acquaintance of hers believes in a popular conspiracy theory.
intention: She wants to respond to the person who is expressing this belief.
moral_action: Sarah responds respectfully, that she does not believe this theory, and she posts links that disprove the conspiracy.
immoral_action: Sarah responds to the post by indicating that the conspiracy theory is completely crazy, and so must be anyone who believes it to be true.

norm: It's bad to try to profit off of someone's insecurities.
situation: Lauren has just signed up with a multi-level-marketing company to sell makeup.
intention: Lauren wants to make her first sale.
moral_action: Lauren posts her products for sale on her social media pages and gives catalogs to her female family members.
immoral_action: Lauren calls up her sister in law Justine and tells her she should buy makeup from her because it will help Justice cover her acne scars.

norm: It's bad to do shady things behind your partners back.
situation: Mat decided to sell meth for extra money, and his wife is wondering where he's coming up with all this money.
intention: Mat has to make a decision on whether to tell his wife.
moral_action: Mat tells his wife that he's been selling meth in order to make more money for the family.
immoral_action: Mat tells his wife that he's been making money playing poker at the casino.

norm: It's bad to lie about your feelings to your partner.
situation: Peter is jealous that his wife Pam is spending time with a new guy friend, when Pam asks him if she can go away with the guy for the weekend.
intention: Peter wants to respond to his wife's request.
moral_action: Peter tells Pam that he isn't comfortable with his wife going away alone with another guy.
immoral_action: Peter doesn't want to admit his insecurity, so he tells his wife that he's fine with her going on the trip with the new friend.

norm: Making your friends feel unwelcome is wrong.
situation: Mark is hosting a Christmas party and invited his friends and family.
intention: Mark wants to talk to people at the party.
moral_action: Mark talks to all the guests at his party, including his friends.
immoral_action: Mark spends all his time talking to family members and doesn't speak to his friends.

norm: It's disgusting to betray your partner's trust.
situation: Cory has a girlfriend who he is losing interest in and is developing an interest in another woman.
intention: Cory wants to hang out with the other woman.
moral_action: Cory is open to his partner about how he has been feeling.
immoral_action: Cory tells his partner that he is with a male friend of his.

norm: It's bad to claim benefits that you do not deserve.
situation: Jessica is on unemployment but finally found a new job today.
intention: Jessica wants to make money.
moral_action: Jessica works as many hours as she can at her new job and is sure to report her employment changes to the state.
immoral_action: Jessica convinces her new boss to pay her under the table for a few weeks to start so that she can remain on unemployment a little longer.

norm: It's not nice to do bad things to your friends.
situation: Ken is at a party with his friend Pat, and his Pat is passed out on the couch.
intention: Ken has to decide what to do to his friend.
moral_action: Ken wakes up Pat so that no one can take advantage of him.
immoral_action: Ken grabs a sharpie and draws a penis onto Pat's face.

norm: It's hurtful to ridicule your child.
situation: Joe's son Josh is in the high school play.
intention: Joe wants to give Josh some feedback.
moral_action: Joe gives Josh some constructive criticism.
immoral_action: Joe says Josh's acting skills are awful, and he should be ashamed.

norm: It's bad to be unsupportive of your child.
situation: Mike learns that his child failed an exam.
intention: Mike wants to his child to answer for the result.
moral_action: Mike comforts his child by saying encouraging words that they can do better next time.
immoral_action: Mike blames his child for being lazy and not studying for the exam well.

norm: It's bad to overparent your kids.
situation: Nathan's daughter Lily has asked him if she can go to a friend's house after school.
intention: Nathan wants Lily to have a good life.
moral_action: Nathan allows Lily to go to her friends house after speaking to her friends parents.
immoral_action: Nathan thinks it is unsafe for Lily to go to the homes of anyone who isn't family, and does not allow her to go to her friends houses.

norm: It's cruel for parents to make fun of their children.
situation: Jason is at the park with his son when his son slips and falls and starts to cry.
intention: Jason wants his son to grow up and be tough.
moral_action: Jason makes sure that his son is alright before telling him that its best to accept the hurt as part of growing up.
immoral_action: Jason laughs at his son calling him a baby.

norm: It's bad to physically harm your children.
situation: James just received the second call from his son's school about his son fighting.
intention: James wants to make sure his son stops fighting before he gets expelled.
moral_action: James made his son start attending weekly therapy sessions with the school counselor.
immoral_action: As soon as James' son comes home, James spanks him until he's badly bruised.

norm: It's bad to let your children act immorally.
situation: Ted found out his child was bullying others in a class through communication with friends.
intention: Ted wants to confront his child about his bullying.
moral_action: Ted confronts his kid and tells him that bullying is never ok, and gives him a punishment.
immoral_action: "Ted confronts his child and tells him that his bullying is, ""hilarious"", and asks for stories."

norm: It's bad to mistreat your child.
situation: Dave is at home when he's called by his neighbor who says Dave's son Max has been stealing tools from his garage.
intention: Dave wants to reprimand his son Max.
moral_action: Dave tells his son Max that he is grounded, and he needs to return all the tools right away.
immoral_action: Dave tells his son Max to get in the basement and locks him down there for two days without food or water.

norm: It's hurtful for your kids to hate you.
situation: Dan has problems with anger management, he often gets into a rage because he feels tired or frustrated and his family life is hurt by this.
intention: Dan wants his kids to leave him alone when he gets back from work.
moral_action: Dan sits down with his kids, gently tells them that he's very tired and asks them to go play in the yard for an hour while he takes a nap.
immoral_action: Dan comes back home one evening and gets so angry at his kids for being noisy that he hits them.

norm: It is frowned on to curse in front of children.
situation: Bob is watching a sports game with his wife and children close by when his team loses the game.
intention: Bob wants to express his unhappiness with his team.
moral_action: Bob shouts at the TV but uses make up words instead of the bad words he wants to use.
immoral_action: Bob yells at the TV using bad words not appropriate for children.

norm: It's bad to teach your kids to be racist.
situation: Chris and Monica recently moved next to a black couple in a new neighborhood.
intention: Monica wants to explain skin color to her children.
moral_action: Monica explains that people are lots of different colors all over the world, and that it doesn't make them any different.
immoral_action: Monica explains that their neighbors are black because they are dirtier types of people.

norm: It's abusive to smack your children.
situation: Kim has a child who has been acting up all day and causing trouble.
intention: Kim wants to discipline her child.
moral_action: Kim takes away her child's favorite game.
immoral_action: Kim becomes fed up and slaps her child.

norm: It's bad to hound your kids too much.
situation: Rae has been studying hard for Chemistry, but her mother Susan is still disappointed in her grade performance.
intention: Susan wants Rae to get better grades.
moral_action: Susan asks Rae if she thinks a tutor could be helpful.
immoral_action: Susan takes Rae's cell phone away and tells her she can have it back when she gets better grades.

norm: It's bad for a child to raise themselves.
situation: Jessica is twelve years old and lives with her family at home.
intention: Jessica wants to be independent.
moral_action: Jessica asks to cook for her family sometimes and does more things on her own within the family.
immoral_action: Jessica moves out on the street and lives hand to mouth.

norm: It's bad parenting to raise your children to be violent.
situation: Johnny's son Jimmy has been getting picked on at school and Johnny is concerned about him.
intention: Johnny wants to give Jimmy some advice.
moral_action: Johnny tells Jimmy if someone says something mean to him, try and find some common ground to start a positive relationship.
immoral_action: Johnny tells Jimmy if someone says something mean to him, he should stick up for himself and start a fight.

norm: It's bad to be too controlling of your teenager.
situation: Melanie has a sixteen year old daughter Kelly who asks her mother if she can go to a friend's house that evening.
intention: Melanie wants to answer her daughter.
moral_action: Melanie allows her daughter to go to her friend's house but first talks to her about making responsible decisions.
immoral_action: Melanie tells her daughter that she cannot go anywhere without an adult chaperone and does not let her leave the house.

norm: It is bad to let children be the boss.
situation: Timmy hates going to school every day, but Greg doesn't want him staying at home all day.
intention: Greg wants Timmy to go to school.
moral_action: Greg doesn't listen to Timmy and makes him go to school every day.
immoral_action: Greg agrees to let Timmy go to school every other day.

norm: It's bad to spoil your kids.
situation: Donna's children, Madison and Greg, asked to get an expensive playhouse for the backyard, but haven't done their chores in weeks.
intention: Donna wants to respond to Madison and Greg.
moral_action: Donna tells Madison and Greg that since they haven't done their part around the house, they can't have their playhouse.
immoral_action: Donna decides to purchase the playhouse in hopes that if they get it, they will start to do what they're supposed to.

norm: It's bad to not feed your children.
situation: Melanie is unemployed and at home with her three kids who are hungry and malnourished.
intention: Melanie wants to save money.
moral_action: Melanie applies for food stamps and makes her kids healthy, simple meals.
immoral_action: Melanie eats only a small amount herself and doesn't give her kids any food.

norm: It's bad to abuse children.
situation: John comes home to his house exasperated after being berated by his boss in front of his colleagues and sees his kids in the kitchen.
intention: John wants to let off steam after a tough day at work.
moral_action: John takes a deep breath, scoops his kids up in his arms and takes them to the movies.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and uses bad language towards his kids.

norm: It's bad to raise your voice at your children.
situation: Robert catches his son young Mark drawing on the white walls with markers.
intention: Robert wants Mark not to draw on the walls again.
moral_action: Robert takes the markers away from Mark, tells him that drawing on the walls is wrong, and puts him in time out for a few minutes.
immoral_action: Robert yells at Mark for causing trouble and ruining the walls.

norm: It's bad to keep secrets from your children.
situation: James sees an invitation for his son in the mail for a birthday party around the same time he has a big test at school.
intention: James wants to make sure his son performs well on the test.
moral_action: James gives the invitation to his son and says he'll take him to the party as long as he studies enough for the test.
immoral_action: James hides the invitation and tries to make sure his son doesn't find out about the party.

norm: It's bad to ask children to lie for you.
situation: James was behind on his rent when his landlord came to confront him about it.
intention: James wants to avoid talking to his landlord.
moral_action: James tells his son to be quiet until his landlord walks away from their door.
immoral_action: James tells his eight-year-old son to tell the landlord that James is at work.

norm: It is bad to let children do whatever they want.
situation: Eddie is taking care of his girlfriend's kids while she works a shift.
intention: Eddie wants the kids to behave.
moral_action: Eddie makes up a fun game for the kids to play and explains the rules to them.
immoral_action: Eddie lets the kids decide what to do and what to eat in the hopes they won't act out.

norm: It is bad to abandon children.
situation: Cindy was at home with her children when her boss calls her into work.
intention: Cindy wants to work.
moral_action: Cindy drops off her children at the babysitter's when she goes to work.
immoral_action: Cindy leaves her children at home when she goes to work.

norm: It's bad to try to get away from your children.
situation: The parents have been cooped up with their children for months without a break.
intention: The parents want to live harmoniously.
moral_action: The parents resolve to do more fun things together with the children.
immoral_action: The parents drop the children off with their aunt the first chance they get.

norm: Calling a child a name is mean.
situation: John and his friend Steve are in the ice cream parlor and there is an obese child buying ice cream there.
intention: John wants to make Steve laugh.
moral_action: John tells Steve a funny joke he heard on the Fallon show last night.
immoral_action: John calls the obese child a fatty and tells him that he should be eating vegetables instead of ice cream.

norm: It is bad to beat a kid.
situation: Richard is at home alone with his teenage son Greg, and they are arguing about his grades.
intention: Richard wants Greg to understand how important it is to have good grades.
moral_action: Richard sits Greg down and shows him the kind of grades and schooling he will need in order to become a lawyer like he wants.
immoral_action: Richard punches Greg after he yells that school is stupid.

norm: It is bad to rage at kids.
situation: Jessica sees her young child break her favorite vase.
intention: Jessica wants to show her child that they did something wrong.
moral_action: Jessica punishes her child in a firm but reasonable way for her mistake.
immoral_action: Jessica screams at her child angrily and forcefully for a long time.

norm: It's bad to yell at little kids.
situation: Matt is jogging in a park when a little kid's ball rolls right into his path.
intention: Matt is angry and wants to teach the kid a lesson.
moral_action: Matt approaches the kid's mother and warns him that her child's behavior could get someone hurt.
immoral_action: Matt turns and starts angrily yelling at the kid to keep track of his stuff or else he'll hurt someone.

norm: It's bad to cut someone off who is young.
situation: Midge is driving down the highway and there are several aggressive teen drivers around.
intention: Midge wants to get away from the young drivers.
moral_action: Midge slows down in the right lane.
immoral_action: Midge speeds up to create separation.

norm: It's bad to fight in front of children.
situation: Frank is married with children and recently suspected his wife of being unfaithful.
intention: Frank wants to confront his wife.
moral_action: Frank privately confronts his wife about his suspicions and resolves the issue.
immoral_action: Frank openly argues with his wife about his suspicions while his children watch.

norm: It's bad when toddlers use offensive language.
situation: Gene is babysitting a toddler and is teaching him how to say single words.
intention: Gene wants to teach the toddler an unusual word.
moral_action: "Gene teaches the toddler to say the word, ""snarfdoodle""."
immoral_action: Gene teaches the toddler how to say a swear word.

norm: It's bad to be too critical of young children.
situation: Marcus has a son who is still learning how to do basic chores around the house.
intention: Marcus wants to give his son advice.
moral_action: Marcus points out some good things and then shows his son some things to improve.
immoral_action: Marcus makes a list of everything that his son does wrong every day, so he can see his mistakes.

norm: Attacking children in general is deemed not OK.
situation: Caleb is a preschool teacher and one of his students, Sean, is having a temper tantrum over another child having a toy he wants.
intention: Caleb wants Sean's behavior to stop.
moral_action: Caleb tells Sean that he will be able to play with the toy when the other child is finished which calms him down right away.
immoral_action: Caleb gives Sean a little slap across the face, which puts him in a state of shock.

norm: It's bad to sneak out as a child.
situation: Cindy's mother had just fussed at her for misbehaving at home.
intention: Cindy wants her mother to leave her alone.
moral_action: Cindy goes into her room and closes the door behind her.
immoral_action: Cindy sneaks out of the house and runs away from home.

norm: It is bad to pick on children
situation: John just lost his job and is at home with his kids who are watching tv.
intention: John wants to feel powerful.
moral_action: John takes a breath and goes to lift weights in his home gym.
immoral_action: John tells his kids to turn off the tv in a raised voice, and they are grounded for a week.

norm: It's bad to break a toy belonging to a child.
situation: Chad calls his son to dinner, but Chad's son is playing with an action figure.
intention: Chad wants to stop his son from playing with the action figure.
moral_action: Chad takes the action figure and puts it in a drawer for storage.
immoral_action: Chad snaps the action figure into pieces so it cannot be played with anymore.

norm: It's bad to push a small kid.
situation: Dave is at the mall window shopping when he feels a small child, Gary  leaning on him while he's staring at the shop window.
intention: Dave wants to get Gary off him.
moral_action: Dave taps Gary on the shoulder to get his attention then asks him to please get off his leg.
immoral_action: Dave shoves Gary quite hard and Gary goes flying away from Dave, landing on his butt and hurting himself.

norm: It's bad to neglect personal hygiene.
situation: Aaron is getting dressed after getting home from the gym.
intention: Aaron wants to cuddle with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Aaron makes sure to reapply deodorant and clean the sweat off of his body.
immoral_action: Aaron decides to skip showering and putting on deodorant to save time.

norm: It's bad to slash someone's tires.
situation: Sue's boyfriend breaks up with her.
intention: Sue wants to get back at him.
moral_action: Sue gets a makeover and starts going out and having fun.
immoral_action: Sue hides outside his work and slashes his tires.

norm: It's bad to litter.
situation: Lee is heading back to work after grabbing some lunch from the Wendy's drive-thru.
intention: Lee wants to get rid of his fast food wrappers.
moral_action: Lee put his fast food trash in garbage can when he returns to the office.
immoral_action: Lee tosses his burger wrapper out of his car window.

norm: It's bad to have body odor.
situation: Jason has spent most of his week home alone and hasn't taken a shower in 4 days.
intention: Jason wants to hang out with his friends today.
moral_action: Jason takes a shower and puts some effort into his appearance and goes out to meet his friends.
immoral_action: Jason decides not to shower after 4 days and goes to hang out with his friends anyway.

norm: It's bad to grab someone's head.
situation: Sam's coworker is being disruptive during a work meeting.
intention: Sam wants his coworker to quiet down and be respectful during the meeting.
moral_action: Sam asks his coworker to be quiet and pay attention.
immoral_action: Sam grabs his coworker's head and tells him to shut up and be quiet.

norm: It's bad to run with injured legs.
situation: Keith fell down the stairs and hurt his legs over the weekend.
intention: Keith wants to work out.
moral_action: Keith does sit ups and arm curls while his legs are healing.
immoral_action: Keith runs a few laps on the treadmill at the gym.

norm: It's bad to let your lawn become overrun with weeds.
situation: Rob buys a new house with a big lawn that needs regular landscaping maintenance.
intention: Rob wants to save money by not paying for landscaping maintenance.
moral_action: Rob does his best to maintain his lawn in a good condition and mows the lawn himself every Sunday.
immoral_action: Rob doesn't care for his lawn and lets it overgrow with weeds.

norm: Having stains on your clothes makes you look dirty.
situation: Frank is about to leave for an important work meeting one morning when he notices a stain on his shirt.
intention: Frank wants to get to the work meeting on time.
moral_action: Frank quickly uses a Tide pen to remove the stain before rushing to work.
immoral_action: Frank ignores the stain and hops in his car to drive to work.

norm: It is bad to bite your arm.
situation: Doug is eating some food and some of his food falls on his arm.
intention: Doug wants to eat all of his food.
moral_action: Doug picks the food up off his arm and puts it in his mouth.
immoral_action: Doug bites his arm to get the food off of it and into his mouth.

norm: It's bad to aggravate an animal.
situation: Jeff's cat is growling and hissing at Jeff's friend Murray who has come to visit.
intention: Murray wants the cat to stop hissing.
moral_action: Murray gets down on the ground and puts a hand out for the cat to sniff.
immoral_action: Murray hisses back at the cat and pretends to try and swipe at him.

norm: Littering is a bad thing
situation: Mike parked his car in the park where he ate his fast food lunch.
intention: Mike wants to get rid of his trash.
moral_action: Mike gathers his trash and walks to the trash can to throw it away.
immoral_action: Mike rolls down his window and throws his wrappers on the ground as he drives away.

norm: It is bad to spit on others.
situation: Carson was playing in the sand box at the park when another child joins him.
intention: Carson wants to play by himself.
moral_action: Carson leaves the sand box and goes to play on the swing set.
immoral_action: Carson spits at the other child who is sitting in the sand box with him.

norm: It is bad to smoke.
situation: Jerome was at work working on a project that was due the next day.
intention: Jerome wants to be less stressed.
moral_action: Jerome goes for a brisk walk during his breaks at work that night.
immoral_action: Jerome smokes a few cigarettes on his breaks at work during the night.

norm: It's bad to soil your pants.
situation: Sam is in the middle of an important math test when he feels the sudden urge to go to the bathroom.
intention: Sam wants to relieve himself.
moral_action: Sam excuses himself and goes pee in the school bathroom.
immoral_action: Sam pees his pants in the classroom.

norm: Wearing dirty clothes can make you smell bad.
situation: Louise is in a hurry to get dressed to go to a party and doesn't have time to wash her favorite dress.
intention: Louise wants to look good for the party.
moral_action: Louise chooses another lovely dress to wear to the party.
immoral_action: Louise decides to wear her favorite dress even though it's pretty dirty.

norm: It's bad to wear unprofessional clothing in some settings.
situation: James is attending an important job interview and his only suit does not feel right on him.
intention: James wants to feel comfortable at the interview.
moral_action: James goes shopping for a new suit that fits well and is comfortable.
immoral_action: James wears his favorite casual clothes that make him feel comfortable to the interview.

norm: It's bad to get your blood on other people.
situation: Cody had cut his finger and it was bleeding a little bit.
intention: Cody wants to stop the bleeding.
moral_action: Cody wipes his finger on a towel and wraps it in a bandage.
immoral_action: Cody wipes his finger all over his friend's arm and shirt.

norm: It is bad to choke others.
situation: Tom is listening to Mary shout in pain after she stubbed her toe on a door.
intention: Tad wants to stop Mary from shouting.
moral_action: Tom asks Mary to please stop with the shouting.
immoral_action: Tom chokes Mary, so she can't make any more noise.

norm: It's bad to wear smelly or dirty clothing
situation: Greg has been working on his yard and is getting hungry.
intention: Greg wants to go pick up something for dinner.
moral_action: Greg decides to take a quick shower before he runs to the restaurant to pick up his meal.
immoral_action: Greg decides to wear the clothes he has been working in and go into the restaurant to pick up his food.

norm: It is bad to run over an animal.
situation: Gina is on her way to work when she sees a cat crossing the road.
intention: Gina wants to make it to work on time.
moral_action: Gina turns onto a different street, so she doesn't have to wait for the cat to cross.
immoral_action: Not wanting to wait for the cat to cross, Gina keeps driving and runs over the cat.

norm: It's bad to throw up on another person.
situation: Emilio is riding in the back seat of the car next to his friend and ate something earlier that is not agreeing with him.
intention: Emilio wants to feel better.
moral_action: Emilio informs the driver that he cannot hold down his meal from earlier and the driver pulls over so Emilio can barf outside the car door.
immoral_action: Emilio doesn't let anybody know how his stomach feels and tries to avoid barfing until it is too late, and he barfs all over his friends.

norm: It is bad to have bad hygiene
situation: Zander hasn't showered in a few days and his friends just showed up asking him to go to the bar with them.
intention: Zander wants to go out and drink with his friends.
moral_action: Zander takes a quick five minute shower and then goes to the bar with his friends.
immoral_action: Zander heads out to the bar with his friends without showering.

norm: It's bad to drop a microphone on the ground.
situation: Joey is a comedian who is performing for a small crowd on stage at a local bar.
intention: Joey wants to put an emphasis on his final joke.
moral_action: Joey saves his best joke for last and delivers it well.
immoral_action: Joey tells the joke and afterwards he holds the microphone out and drops it on the ground.

norm: Its bad to only clean your arms.
situation: Phil has been working overtime and is often exhausted when he wakes up in the morning.
intention: Phil wants to save time in the morning, so he can sleep in a little.
moral_action: Phil skips the sit down breakfast and instead starts taking his breakfast to go.
immoral_action: Phil decides to skip showering and instead just wipes down his arms and pits.

norm: It is bad to have unhealthy living situations.
situation: Diane is looking at the mold and water damage to her home after the area had a major flood.
intention: Diane wants a place to sleep tonight.
moral_action: Diane decides there is a lot of cleaning that needs to happen at her home before it is healthy to live in, so she stays in a hotel.
immoral_action: Diane decides to stay in her home despite the recent flood.

norm: It is bad to put items in your nose.
situation: Faith's nose is blocked and blowing her nose isn't helping.
intention: Faith wants to clear her nasal passage.
moral_action: Faith buys a nasal spray and uses it on her nose.
immoral_action: Faith sticks a Q-tip up her nose to try to unblock it.

norm: It's bad to burn bridges.
situation: Neil has already given his two week notice two weeks ago and it's his last day on the job.
intention: Neil wants to say goodbye to his manager.
moral_action: Neil tells his manager bye that he wishes him well in his future and that he hopes they run into each other someday.
immoral_action: Neil tells his manager bye, that he's an awful person and that he's so glad to never work with him again.

norm: It's bad to lie to someone.
situation: Devon is asked by his teacher if he read the homework assignment last night.
intention: Devon wants to respond to his teacher.
moral_action: Devon tells his teacher he was unable to finish all the reading.
immoral_action: Devon says that he did the reading last night, neglecting to mention that he fell asleep half-way through.

norm: It is bad to lie to people.
situation: Jane is at a job interview and finds out that she doesn't have a qualification the recruiter is looking for.
intention: Jane wants to make a good impression on the recruiter.
moral_action: Jane is honest with recruiter about lacking the qualification but says she will work towards getting it if hired.
immoral_action: Jane tells the recruiter that she has the qualification although she does not.

norm: It's bad to lie others about who you really are.
situation: John is going to a job interview at the bank.
intention: John wants to make a good impression.
moral_action: John talks about his assets and accomplishments.
immoral_action: John tells entirely made-up stories about his previous experiences in banking.

norm: It's bad to tell others' secrets.
situation: Sandra knows an interesting secret about her brother, and she sees her friend.
intention: Sandra wants to tell her friend something interesting.
moral_action: Sandra tells her friend about something interesting that happened to her over the weekend instead of the secret she knows.
immoral_action: Sandra tells her friend the secret about her brother although he asked her not to tell anybody.

norm: It's bad to keep secrets from someone close to you.
situation: Dave who is young, but has had a couple of sexual partners is at his mom's house when she asks him if he's a virgin.
intention: Dave wants to respond to his mom's question.
moral_action: Dave tells his mom that he is not, but she need not worry because he used protection.
immoral_action: Dave tells his mom that he is a virgin and that she has nothing to worry about.

norm: It's bad to lie to someone close to you.
situation: Sue asks her brother John to buy her dinner when he is back home from work.
intention: John wants to respond to Sue's request.
moral_action: John tells Sue that he can buy her dinner after meeting with his friends but it might be a bit late.
immoral_action: John tells Sue that he needs to work overtime and won't be back home early.

norm: It's bad to lie about your degree.
situation: Lawrence got an a bachelor's degree in Computer Science and one of the jobs he is looking for requires a Master degree.
intention: Lawrence wants to find a job.
moral_action: Lawrence focuses on another job requiring a Bachelor's degree and gets hired.
immoral_action: Lawrence attends the job interview, tells the employer that he got a Master degree and gets hired.

norm: It's bad to ask people to lie for you.
situation: Becca has been seeing someone outside of the relationship with her romantic partner.
intention: Becca wants to have an excuse if he starts asking around.
moral_action: Becca makes up her own excuse and simply asks her friends not to say anything at all.
immoral_action: Becca asks her friends to tell her partner a made up story.

norm: It's bad to lie to your friends.
situation: James' friend wants James to help him move on the same day that his favorite Netflix series is releasing a new season.
intention: James wants to watch the new Netflix season immediately.
moral_action: James asks his friend if they can play Netflix on his TV while they pack.
immoral_action: James tells his friend he has to deal with a work emergency, then says home to watch Netflix.

norm: It's bad to lie about your true nature.
situation: Joe is not very detail orientated and is asked if he is detailed orientated during a job interview.
intention: Joe wants to respond to the interview question.
moral_action: Joe states how he would rather focus on the big picture instead of being detail orientated.
immoral_action: Joe tells the interviewer that he is absolutely a detail orientated individual.

norm: It's bad to report things that you're not sure happened.
situation: Pat works in an office and notices his co-worker's laptop is not on his desk.
intention: Pat wants to inform someone about the lap top.
moral_action: Pat asks his co-workers about the laptop.
immoral_action: Pat goes to security and tells them that the laptop is stolen.

norm: It is bad to lie about things.
situation: Jeff is in a math contest and wrote the wrong answer to a question, then realizes that he was wrong before he answers.
intention: Jeff wants to give an answer.
