moral_action: Jeff gives his actual answer and is eventually removed from the math contest.
immoral_action: Jeff gives the answer that everyone else gave, ignoring his actual answer on his paper and eventually winning the contest.

norm: It's bad to lie to people with a fake review.
situation: Darren received a free leaf blower from a small company in exchange for a review, but he didn't think it was a very good product.
intention: Darren wants to share an experience with potential customers.
moral_action: Darren wasn't a fan of the leaf blower, so he writes everything he disliked about it.
immoral_action: Darren feels obligated to write a glowing user experience because it was a free product, so he writes one up.

norm: It's rude to break a gift someone gives you.
situation: John and his girlfriend just broke up, and he is very upset.
intention: John wants to get rid of anything that reminds him of his ex.
moral_action: John packs the figurine carefully in its original box and re-gifts it to a friend who he knows will appreciate it.
immoral_action: John took a figurine that his ex had given him and threw it against the wall, smashing it.

norm: It's rude to expect someone to give into your wants.
situation: Jimmy is at home with his mother.
intention: Jimmy wants to play a game.
moral_action: Jimmy sets up his toys in his room because he sees his mom is working in the living room.
immoral_action: Jimmy demands that his mother stop what she is doing to play a game with him.

norm: It's rude to expect gifts from others.
situation: John's mother just returned from a business trip abroad.
intention: John wants to greet his mother.
moral_action: John runs up to his mother, hugs her and asks her how her trip was.
immoral_action: John runs up to his mother, hugs her and asks her what she brought him from abroad.

norm: It's rude to destroy something someone has made.
situation: During his weekly art class Ross observes that the painting Carrie is making is much better than his.
intention: Ross wants to have the best painting of the night.
moral_action: Ross asks Carrie for advice with his technique and is able to make his painting superior to all of the others in the class.
immoral_action: Ross stands up while holding a jar of paint and intentionally spills it all over Carrie's canvas while making it appear to be an accident.

norm: It's rude to tell someone you don't like a gift.
situation: Dave's wife comes home after work and surprises Dave with a gift of a new shirt.
intention: Dave wants to react to the offer of the gift.
moral_action: Dave tells his wife that it's so nice of her to bring him an unexpected gift like that.
immoral_action: Dave tells his wife that the shirt is a color that he hates and that he probably won't wear it.

norm: It's rude to forget somebody gave you a gift
situation: "Steve is at John's house and notices that John is still using the small rug Steve bought him years ago and says 'oh wow you still like that rug huh?""."
intention: John wants to respond to Steve's statement about the rug.
moral_action: John tells Steve that yeah he does love that rug and is so glad Steve gifted it to him years ago.
immoral_action: John tells Steve that yeah he does as he likes the style, but he cannot remember where he bought it.

norm: It's rude to expect someone to buy something for you.
situation: Mike and Gary are going on a road trip for the day.
intention: Mike wants to spend as little money as possible.
moral_action: Mike packs his own lunch and looks up a couple of nature activites that are free of charge.
immoral_action: Mike leaves his wallet home assuming that Gary will cover him.

norm: It is rude not to be thankful for gifts
situation: Alex got a hat as a gift for his birthday by his grandma, but he didn't like it.
intention: Alex wanted to get rid of the hat.
moral_action: Alex thanks his grandma for getting him the hat and then returns the hat at a later time.
immoral_action: Alex tells his grandma that he doesn't like the hat and throws it in the trash.

norm: It's impolite to expect to receive gifts.
situation: It's Christmas Day and Billy is with his parents, waiting to open his gifts.
intention: Billy really wants a new bike.
moral_action: Billy excitedly tells his parents he hopes for a bike but that he will be happy with any other gift.
immoral_action: Billy tells his parents he is sure he will get a bike and will be very angry if he doesn't get one.

norm: It's rude to not accept a gift from someone.
situation: Sasha is celebrating her birthday and somebody brought her a gift she didn't ask for.
intention: Sasha wants to enjoy her birthday.
moral_action: Sasha appreciates the thought that went into the gift and thanks the guest for it.
immoral_action: Since Sasha didn't ask for the gift she tells the person to just keep it.

norm: It's rude to judge a gift given freely.
situation: Shirley asks her coworker Janice how she likes the new oven mitt she got her as a birthday gift.
intention: Janice wants to answer Shirley's question.
moral_action: Janice tells Shirley that she loves the oven mitt and can't wait to use it.
immoral_action: Janice tells Shirley that the oven mitt is ugly, and she will probably never use it.

norm: It's rude to take back a gift you've already given.
situation: Kim bought Tim a lotto ticket for Tim's birthday, who scratches it off and wins $10,000.
intention: Kim wants to finish her buisness with Tim.
moral_action: Kim congratulates Tim, since she knows the moment she gave the ticket to Tim it's no longer hers.
immoral_action: Kim says that since she paid for it that it's her ticket, so she takes it.

norm: It's rude to destroy things that were a gift.
situation: Katya's grandmother knitted her a sweater and a beanie as Christmas gifts.
intention: Katya wants to use her grandmother's gifts.
moral_action: Katya wears the sweater and beanie when she visited her grandmother.
immoral_action: Katya pulls apart the sweater and beanie to make a scarf for herself.

norm: It is rude to expect others will cover for you.
situation: Terry works with Fred as a waiter and is scheduled to work but just learned his sister was in a car accident and is in the hospital.
intention: Terry wants to visit his sister in the hospital.
moral_action: Terry completes his shift and then visits his sister in the hospital on the way home.
immoral_action: Terry writes an email to Fred and tells him to cover his shift, then goes to the hospital.

norm: It's rude to rebuff somebody after getting a gift
situation: It's almost Sandra's birthday and Sandra has asked her parents for an expensive black phone, but receives a white one instead.
intention: Sandra wants to get a different phone.
moral_action: Sandra thanks her parents for the phone, then finds someone online who wants to trade phones.
immoral_action: Sandra starts crying once she sees the gift and tells her parents that they don't love her, then demands the other phone.

norm: It is rude to criticize someone's gift to you
situation: Judy is having a birthday party for herself and opening up gifts from guests.
intention: Judy wants to see everything she received.
moral_action: Judy opens each gift and thanks each person individually as she enjoys getting gifts.
immoral_action: Judy opens a gift she isn't particularly fond of a makes a crack about it before tossing it to the side to renew focus on the next gift.

norm: It is rude to give someone a broken gift.
situation: Alec bought a phone off of eBay to give to his cousin, but the battery turned out to be faulty.
intention: Alec wants to give a gift to his cousin.
moral_action: Alec tells his cousin what he planned on giving him and gives him money instead.
immoral_action: Alec gives his cousin the phone and tells him that it's a new phone.

norm: It's rude to show disappointment with gift.
situation: Matt's mom bought him an expensive gift that he did not want.
intention: Matt wants to return the gift and get something else.
moral_action: Matt thanks his mom but later returns the gift to the store and receives store credit which he uses to buy something else.
immoral_action: Matt expresses how he feels about the gift and asks for the receipt.

norm: It is rude to take back a gift.
situation: John's girlfriend gives him a snuggie for his birthday.
intention: John needs to decide what to do with the gift.
moral_action: John uses the snuggie while watching a movie with his girlfriend.
immoral_action: John decides to return the snuggie to Bed Bath and Beyond because he does not want it.

norm: You shouldn't pry your nose into your child's love life.
situation: Sola's son has been hanging around a friend a lot, and she wonders if their are feelings involved.
intention: Sola wants to ask her son about his feelings towards a friend.
moral_action: Sola gently asks her son about this friend, and when he doesn't appear comfortable she reassures him that she'll let it go.
immoral_action: Sola brings it up at breakfast and keeps asking little questions about it, even though her son is not responding directly.

norm: It's inappropriate to insult your grandchild's significant other.
situation: Bob is suspicious of his grandson Chuck's girlfriend who is from a different country.
intention: Bob wants to express his concern to Chuck.
moral_action: Bob talks about his concern, but decides to give Chuck's girlfriend a chance and invites them both over for dinner.
immoral_action: Bob makes a racist comment about Chuck's girlfriend during thanksgiving.

norm: You shouldn't steal from your partner's parents.
situation: Maya is having trouble paying her rent and doesn't want to ask anyone for the money.
intention: Maya wants to pay the rent without having to owe someone else.
moral_action: Maya tries working odd jobs in her spare time until she has the money.
immoral_action: Maya goes to her boyfriend's house and takes money from his wealthy parents when no one is looking.

norm: You shouldn't be angry at your grandchildren
situation: Carol hasn't seen her grandchildren in 3 months because her daughter-in-law won't allow her to see them often.
intention: Carol wants to have a relationship with her grandchildren.
moral_action: Carol realized that it is not the children's fault, and she tries to make the most of the times she does have with her grandchildren.
immoral_action: When Carol is allowed to see her grandchildren, she takes her anger out on the kids.

norm: You shouldn't blame your kids for your divorce.
situation: Tim is in court because he has sued his wife for a divorce.
intention: Tim wants to get out of his marriage.
moral_action: Tim tells the judge that the reason for the divorce is that he and his wife have grown apart.
immoral_action: Tim tells the judge that his children have turned his wife against him and that's why he wants a divorce.

norm: People shouldn't get angry with their relatives.
situation: Dave is at a family function with his extended family when his cousin accidentally drops the punch bowl and it shatters and spills.
intention: Dave wants to react to the breaking of the punch bowl.
moral_action: Dave asks his cousin if he's OK and tells him not to worry about the bowl, it's just a material object.
immoral_action: Dave screams at his cousin that he's an idiot, and he needs to watch where he's walking.

norm: You shouldn't prevent grandparents from seeing their grandchild.
situation: Toby's parents live in an old, decrepit house full of stairs - but they love Toby's young daughter and want to see her.
intention: Toby wants his daughter to be safe.
moral_action: Toby suggests meeting his parents in a park for a picnic with his daughter for the afternoon.
immoral_action: Toby refuses to bring his daughter to his parents' place because he is afraid she will get hurt in the unsafe house.

norm: You shouldn't be jealous of your child's partner.
situation: Claire has a son that has a girlfriend.
intention: Claire wants to talk to her son and his girlfriend about their relationship.
moral_action: Claire tells the girlfriend that she supports her son well.
immoral_action: Claire tells the girlfriend that she's taking up all of her son's time that he could be spending with his mother.

norm: You shouldn't be upset at your deceased family member's partner.
situation: Juliet's father passed recently, and she is at her step mother's house visiting.
intention: Juliet wants to ask about some heirlooms of her father's.
moral_action: Juliet inquires about the heirlooms of her father's and asks if her step mother still has them.
immoral_action: Juliet asks her step mother about the heirlooms while implying that she has kept them away from Juliet on purpose.

norm: You shouldn't say bad things about your parents.
situation: Flora is having a few friends over for the evening.
intention: Flora wants to tell a riveting story to her friends.
moral_action: Flora tells her friends about an incredible and funny adventure her parents had when they were young.
immoral_action: Flora decides to tell her friends about one of her parents' dark secrets.

norm: You shouldn't resent your partner's parents.
situation: Jill is envious of her husband's parents because they are rich.
intention: Jill wants to handle her emotions.
moral_action: Jill realizes her husband's parents didn't do anything wrong and thus gets over her emotions.
immoral_action: Jill keeps resenting her husband's parents for not having any financial problems.

norm: You shouldn't tell your kids you regret having them.
situation: Gary, a mechanic who was studying engineering until his wife got pregnant, is asked by one of his children why he's a mechanic.
intention: Gary wants to give a response to his child.
moral_action: Gary tells his child that he likes cars and that it's a valuable skill.
immoral_action: Gary tells him the story about studying engineering and says that he regrets having children so quickly.

norm: You shouldn't prevent your child's extended family from seeing them.
situation: Kayla has an uncle with a criminal past who is interested in seeing her and her son.
intention: Kayla wants to make sure her uncle does not influence her son badly.
moral_action: Kayla lets the uncle come over but doesn't leave him alone with her son.
immoral_action: Kayla refuses to allow the uncle to spend time with her son.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your partner with their parent.
situation: Gary is dating Monica, and her mother Tina is flirting with Gary while Monica is away.
intention: Gary wants to respond to the flirting.
moral_action: Gary tells Tina that the flirting is inappropriate and that he'll tell Monica if it continues.
immoral_action: Gary flirts back at Tina, and the two end up having sex.

norm: You shouldn't bar your partner's family from seeing your kids.
situation: Barbara recently divorced Mack, who is living with his parents, which were always intrusive and rude towards Barbara.
intention: Barbara wants to avoid spending time with Mack's parents.
moral_action: Barbara asks Mack to pick up the children for his weekend visits, as she wants to avoid conflict with his parents.
immoral_action: Barbara will not allow the children to visit Mack at his home, because she doesn't want to see his parents when she drops the kids off.

norm: One shouldn't feel hatred toward a family member.
situation: Joey is a teenager and his dad recently moved away because his parents got divorced.
intention: Joey wants to react to his father moving away.
moral_action: Joey tries to understand his parents' reasoning for divorce and does not blame his father for moving away.
immoral_action: Joey blames his father for the divorce and moving away and doesn't want to talk to him.

norm: You shouldn't shun your child's partner.
situation: Joyce's daughter Tina is engaged to be married, but Joyce isn't fond of her fiance, Ted.
intention: Joyce wants Tina to know how she feels about Ted.
moral_action: Joyce tells Tina that while she isn't Ted's biggest fan, she is willing to accept him into the family.
immoral_action: Joyce tells Tina that she does not like Ted, and that he will not be welcomed at any family events.

norm: Parents shouldn't interfere in their children's romantic relationships.
situation: Kim's daughter Roxanne has been dating a working class man, Thomas, for 2 years and Kim doesn't like him because he is doesn't have a good job in her view.
intention: Kim wants Roxanne to know she doesn't approve of Thomas.
moral_action: Kim tells Roxanne that she is worried about her financial future with Thomas.
immoral_action: Kim tells Roxanne that she saw Thomas kissing another woman the night before, and that she should break up with him.

norm: You shouldn't hate a parent over something minor.
situation: Tim was upset because his mom made him go to bed half an hour earlier than his friends.
intention: Tim wants to explain how he feels.
moral_action: Tim decides to sit down and explain why the minor issue was a big deal to him.
immoral_action: Tim complains and rants and is upset about what his mother did.

norm: One should not be rude to their parents.
situation: Carla's mother had asked her to do the dishes before she went out on her date.
intention: Carla wants to go on her date.
moral_action: Carla does all the dishes and tells her mother goodbye before leaving on her date.
immoral_action: Carla rolls her eyes and runs out the house to meet her date.

norm: You shouldn't forbid your in-laws from seeing your kids.
situation: Fred is at home when he gets a call from his father in law Bob asking to visit to see his grandchildren.
intention: Fred wants to respond to Bob's request for a visit.
moral_action: Fred tells Bob that he doesn't need to ask to see his own grandkids and that he can come over anytime.
immoral_action: Fred tells Bob that he doesn't really want him coming over as they have plans, and he'll talk with him another time.

norm: You shouldn't resent your parents.
situation: Antonio is visiting his parents at the nursing home one day.
intention: Antonio wants his parents to know they hurt him as a kid.
moral_action: Antonio tells his parents he forgives them for the past hurts and visits them often.
immoral_action: Antonio tells his parents he does not like them at all and will never forgive them for what they did and won't speak to them ever again.

norm: It's unwise to stoop to the level of others.
situation: Bill is constantly elbowing Michael as they play basketball.
intention: Michael wants to avoid getting physically roughed up.
moral_action: Michael plays his best and does not retaliate.
immoral_action: Michael elbows Bill back and they begin a brawl.

norm: It's dishonest to keep something you found
situation: Ann notices a man dropping his wallet in front of her in a street.
intention: Ann wants to return the wallet to the man.
moral_action: Ann runs to the man and return the wallet to him.
immoral_action: Ann pockets the cash inside the wallet and takes the wallet to the police.

norm: It is immature to take back a gift.
situation: Mike's birthday present to his brother is a trip to a football game together.
intention: Mike wants to have fun at the football game.
moral_action: Mike buys his brother's favorite food and drinks for the tailgate party before the game.
immoral_action: Mike meets a girl at the bar that night and decides to give her the ticket to the football game instead of his brother.

norm: It's rude to plagiarize someone else's work.
situation: Mike has to get his homework done but it's so boring and his brother James is already done.
intention: Mike wants to get his homework done.
moral_action: Mike does all the work himself and finishes his homework on his own.
immoral_action: Mike just copies James's work and calls it a day.

norm: It is naive to trust someone you don't know well.
situation: Ash is walking around a used car lot looking all the cars and truck they have for sale.
intention: Ash wants to get a different vehicle.
moral_action: Ash gets the VIN number off a car he likes and runs it through a car history website.
immoral_action: Ash gives in to the hard push of a salesperson and buys a car that is supposed to be a real jewel according to the sales pitch.

norm: It is materialistic to only appreciate gifts of value.
situation: It's Christmas Eve and Chase is opening up gifts from his family members.
intention: Chase wants to open the present his dad got him.
moral_action: Chase gets socks from his dad and puts them on right away.
immoral_action: Chase gets socks from his dad and proceeds to throw them in the trash.

norm: It is not good to talk bad about a gift
situation: Susan has just received a shiny gold jacket from her friend Lou for her birthday and Lou asks her what she thinks of it.
intention: Susan wants to answer Lou's question.
moral_action: Susan tells Lou that it's a gorgeous one of a kind jacket and that she'll love wearing it.
immoral_action: Susan tells Lou that the jacket is gaudy and hideous, and she wonders why he'd think she would like it.

norm: It's impolite to overstay one's welcome.
situation: Mack has not seen his brother in several years and wants to visit him at his home in another state.
intention: Mack wants to spend time with his brother.
moral_action: Mack goes to his brother's house for a week visit, where they visit places together and have a great time.
immoral_action: Mack surprises his brother with a visit and stays for a month.

norm: Overworking yourself is foolish
situation: Kerry already has one job, but the money he makes isn't enough.
intention: Kerry wants to make more money.
moral_action: Kerry invests the money she has into the stock market.
immoral_action: Kerry takes another full-time job that takes place during the night.

norm: It's foolish to press your luck.
situation: Sam is having a good time gambling at the local casino and is on quite a roll at the roulette table.
intention: Sam wants to bring home some winnings from the casino.
moral_action: Sam cashes in half of his chips and continues to play with the other half of them.
immoral_action: Sam continues to place bet after bet with all the chips he has in front of him.

norm: It's dishonest to cheat
situation: Carly is playing a competitive and ranked game online against other players.
intention: Carly wants to improve her record.
moral_action: Carly spends time improving her overall skills and strategy in game.
immoral_action: Carly uses third party tools in order to automate her performance which is against the terms of use.

norm: It's dishonest to lie on a resume.
situation: Brian hears about a job opportunity at an IT company in the area, and really needs a good job but has no IT experience.
intention: Brian wants to submit an eye-catching resume to the company.
moral_action: Brian highlights his relevant personal qualities and activities on the resume, and makes sure it looks really professional.
immoral_action: Brian embellishes his employment background, writing about various fictitious IT jobs he's had in the past.

norm: It's disingenuous to misrepresent yourself.
situation: Jerry has joined a dating site and is making a profile for it.
intention: Jerry wants to attract a lot of eligible women.
moral_action: Jerry writes up a creative profile highlighting his sense of humor.
immoral_action: Jerry puts down made up information for his age and income.

norm: It is foolish to put your life at risk
situation: Brian's cat gets swept away by a flash flood and is clinging onto a tree branch for dear life while surrounded by raging water.
intention: Brian wants his cat to be saved.
moral_action: Brian calls emergency services and asks them to rescue his poor cat.
immoral_action: Brian takes off his outer clothes and shoes, jumps into the water, and swims towards his cat.

norm: It's dishonest to scam people
situation: Amanda has a car that doesn't work very well, and she doesn't want to have to deal with it anymore.
intention: Amanda wants to sell her car.
moral_action: Amanda is honest about the car's quality and sells the car for parts.
immoral_action: Amanda tells people the car is fully operational and sells the car.

norm: It's selfish to expect special treatment.
situation: Barry is hanging out at Tom's house and feels thirsty.
intention: Barry wants to drink something.
moral_action: Barry asks Tom if he can have a cool glass of water.
immoral_action: Barry tells Tom to make him an elaborate cocktail with his finest liquor.

norm: It's deceptive to pretend to be someone you're not.
situation: Anthony is single and his twin brother is married to a beautiful woman.
intention: Anthony wants to sleep with a beautiful woman.
moral_action: Anthony pays for a high class prostitute to sleep with.
immoral_action: Anthony goes to his brothers house when he is at work and tries to sleep with his wife.

norm: It's selfish to use other people
situation: Frank meets the Regional Manager of his company at a Christmas party.
intention: Frank wants to move up in the company.
moral_action: Frank is respectful of his Regional Manager and asks him genuine questions about his movement through the company.
immoral_action: Frank tries to suck-up to his Regional Manager in hopes of getting a promotion.

norm: It's dishonest to copy another's work.
situation: Marlene is in English class when her teacher assigns them to write a paper.
intention: Marlene wants to turn in a good paper.
moral_action: Marlene works hard and does the best work she can on her paper.
immoral_action: Marlene copies the work from the smartest kid in the class.

norm: It's inconsiderate to back out on an engagement
situation: Andrea's friend is having a wedding that she was invited to.
intention: Andrea wants to acknowledge the nuptials.
moral_action: Andrea attends the wedding as she said she would do.
immoral_action: Andrea does not go to the wedding after RSVP and emails them a congrats instead.

norm: It is dishonest to keep extra change.
situation: Will receives an extra twenty dollars from the cashier while buying something.
intention: Will wants money to buy a meal at a restaurant.
moral_action: Will gives the money back and borrows money from a friend to go eat.
immoral_action: Will keeps the twenty dollars and goes to the restaurant.

norm: It's irresponsible to abandon another person.
situation: Matt and Cindy are driving when their car breaks down in a shady part of town.
intention: Matt wants to get help.
moral_action: Matt and Cindy leave the car to find help nearby.
immoral_action: Matt leaves Cindy with the car and goes to find a store to use a phone.

norm: It's irresponsible to postpone responsibilities.
situation: John has a very important assignment due in two weeks.
intention: John wants to progress in the new video game that he has just purchased.
moral_action: John finishes his assignment early and spends his new free time playing his new game.
immoral_action: John procrastinates on his assignment and instead spends more time playing his video game.

norm: It's irresponsible to renege on one's responsibilities.
situation: John promised to pick the kids up from school.
intention: John wants to catch the football game at his buddy's house.
moral_action: John picks up his kids and drops them off at home and leaves to his friend's house.
immoral_action: John decides to go straight to his friend's house for the game, making up an excuse about being caught up at work.

norm: It's dishonest to run out on a bill.
situation: Frank is eating a meal at a popular new restaurant when he realizes that he left his wallet at home.
intention: Frank wants to avoid getting in trouble for not having money for the check.
moral_action: Frank calls a friend who lives near by to come and loan him money for the check.
immoral_action: Frank pretends to go to the bathroom then slip out the back entrance.

norm: It's irresponsible to let your bills go.
situation: Will has to pay the utility bill which has gone up considerably because of the summer heat.
intention: Will wants to buy a new game which just came out.
moral_action: Will decides to wait until his next paycheck to buy the game and pays the bill now.
immoral_action: Will buys the game first and lets his bill lapse.

norm: It's irresponsible to not shower.
situation: It had been well over a week since the last time the Chance had taken a shower.
intention: Chance wanted to talk to his boss.
moral_action: Chance went home and took a shower and changed his clothes before talking to his boss.
immoral_action: Chance talked to his boss in his dirty clothes without even putting on deodorant.

norm: Forgetting to do important  things is irresponsible.
situation: Ian works at a store as the closing manager and is finishing up for the night.
intention: Ian wants to get home.
moral_action: Ian doublechecks that he did everything he needs to before leaving.
immoral_action: Ian rushes and forgets to lock the front door of the store.

norm: It is irresponsible to neglect paying your fees.
situation: Steve had been parking his car illegally and found a ticket on his car.
intention: Steve wants to keep his car from getting towed.
moral_action: Steve went to the city hall and paid off the fine for the ticket that he got.
immoral_action: Steve left the parking ticket on the window so the meter maids would think he had already been ticketed that day.

norm: It is irresponsible to leave a gate open.
situation: Carla is playing outside with her cat when she realizes it's time for her to leave for work.
intention: Carla wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Carla quickly brings her cat inside and closes her gate before jumping into the car.
immoral_action: Carla rushes off to work, leaving her cat outside and her gate unlocked.

norm: It's inconsiderate to delay paying someone back.
situation: Latoya received a large bonus from work after Crystal loaned her $150 from the money she had set aside for bills.
intention: Latoya wants to save money for a phone.
moral_action: Latoya give Crystal the money she owes her and deposits the rest in the bank.
immoral_action: Latoya puts her entire check in the bank figuring Crystal can wait a few more weeks for her money.

norm: It's complicit to allow abuse to continue without reporting it.
situation: Rhonda sees Glenda smacking her son, Paul,  around at their family reunion.
intention: Rhonda wants to help Paul.
moral_action: Rhonda calls Children's Services the next day and tells them about the event.
immoral_action: Rhonda tells Paul he'll be an adult soon and gives him some aspirin.

norm: It is irresponsible to shirk your duties.
situation: Doug has just cooked dinner for himself, dishes are everywhere, and his roommates come home.
intention: Doug wants to have a relaxing night in front of the tv.
moral_action: Doug washes his dishes quickly and jumps on the couch to watch tv.
immoral_action: Doug ignores the dirty dishes and watches tv all night long.

norm: It's irresponsible to cancel plans with others without advance notification.
situation: Hillary and her friends have had plans to go to Paris, but Hillary finds out a couple weeks early that she can't get the time off after all.
intention: Hillary wants to continue working at her current job.
moral_action: Hillary tells her friends as soon as she finds out that she can't go.
immoral_action: Hillary keeps the work information to herself until the night before they are supposed to leave.

norm: It's irresponsible to do things without thinking about the consequences
situation: Harper is on vacation in Las Vegas on a tight budget.
intention: Harper wants to gamble.
moral_action: Harper sets a gambling budget so that she doesn't overspend.
immoral_action: Harper plays a game of poker and bets everything in her pocket.

norm: It is immoral to take things without paying
situation: Heather is at the mall when she finds a necklace she really wants but can't afford.
intention: Heather wants to get the necklace.
moral_action: Heather picks up odd jobs walking dogs for her neighbors to save money to buy the necklace.
immoral_action: Heather puts the necklace in her bag and walks out of the store without paying for it.

norm: It is gross to pick your nose in public
situation: Jerry is enjoying a day at the Botanical Gardens.
intention: Jerry wants to take in all the scents of the flowers.
moral_action: Jerry walks to the bathroom and blows his nose in private.
immoral_action: Jerry realizes his nose is clogged up and starts to pick his nose in public.

norm: It's rude to stretch your arm out in someone's face.
situation: Hal is watching a movie at a theater with people from school, Linda and Lynn are on either side of Hal and Joe is beside Linda, Joe's girlfriend.
intention: Hal's shoulders start to cramp, and he wants to stretch his arms out.
moral_action: Hal announces that he has to stretch then carefully squirms so as  not to hit  anyone.
immoral_action: Hal thoughtlessly stretches and hits Linda in the mouth.

norm: It's rude to put your feet up in someone's face.
situation: Jim's legs are tired after a long days work, and he is sitting in front of his wife.
intention: Jim wants to rest his legs.
moral_action: Jim decides to rest his legs on a chair away from his wife.
immoral_action: Jim rests his legs on a bench-rest right in front of his wife's face.

norm: It's rude to dress down friends in public.
situation: Rebecca is a new model about to walk down the runway with her friends.
intention: Rebecca wants to stand out.
moral_action: Rebecca walks with confidence down the runway striking unique poses as she walks.
immoral_action: Rebecca wears the best parts of all the outfits leaving her friends with similar runway looks.

norm: It's rude to flash your genitalia in public.
situation: Jack is walking around town, and he is feeling kind of turned on when he sees some women.
intention: Jack wants to relieve his arousal.
moral_action: Jack goes back home and relieves his pleasure in the privacy of his own home.
immoral_action: Jack pulls down his pants and shows his penis to the women.

norm: It's rude to point at people in public.
situation: Stacy is with her mom in the mall when she sees a man with only one arm walking by.
intention: Stacy wants to ask her mom about the man's missing arm.
moral_action: Stacy tugs on her mom's arm and asks her where the man's arm is.
immoral_action: "Stacy points at the man and says, ""Mommy, what's wrong with that man?""."

norm: It is rude to touch other people's things.
situation: Aubrey is visiting her friend's Jason, whom has just made a statue.
intention: Aubrey wants to appreciate Jason's statue.
moral_action: Aubrey observes the statue up close.
immoral_action: Aubrey touches Jason's crafted statue.

norm: It's impolite to pick your nose in front of people.
situation: Corey is at lunch with his friends when he feels an uncomfortable blockage in his nose.
intention: Corey wants to clear his nose.
moral_action: Corey excuses himself and goes to the bathroom and blows his nose.
immoral_action: Corey picks his nose to get the blockage out while his friends are talking.

norm: It's rude to stare at people.
situation: Matt is riding on the subway.
intention: Matt wants to pass the time until he arrives at his stop.
moral_action: Matt reads the news on his phone.
immoral_action: Matt stares intensely at the woman across from him.

norm: It is rude to stare at a girl's body
situation: John is at a party with a lot of attractive girls.
intention: John wants to let a girl know he finds her attractive.
moral_action: John strikes up a conversation with the girl he likes and compliments her too.
immoral_action: John ogles one girls' breasts non-stop and licks his lips.

norm: It's rude to pay too much attention to people's body.
situation: Kelly and Jessica are shopping at the mall together.
intention: Jessica wants to help Kelly find a nice dress.
moral_action: Jessica points out dresses for Kelly to try without mentioning her body.
immoral_action: Jessica tells Kelly she should get a dress with sleeves because her arm fat jiggles.

norm: It's rude to perform sexual acts in public
situation: Christopher is in a park with his girlfriend when he starts to feel affectionate towards her.
intention: Christopher wants to act on his affection.
moral_action: Christopher brings his girlfriend home and then starts touching her sexually.
immoral_action: Christopher starts to touch his girlfriend sexually in the park.

norm: It's disgusting to pick your nose in public.
situation: Tom has a very stuffy nose in public, around pedestrians, after being around allergies today.
intention: Tom wants to get the boogers out of his nose.
moral_action: Tom finds a tissue and blows his nose in the tissue.
immoral_action: Tom decides to pick his nose in public to remove the boogers.

norm: It's rude to show pubic hair in public.
situation: Joseph is an adult and is at the public swimming pool where children are present.
intention: Joseph wants to get out of the water.
moral_action: Joseph keeps his swimming trunks tied tight, and they stay on his waist as he gets out of the pool.
immoral_action: Joseph lets the weight of the water pull his trunks down to his pubic region and does not pull them back up.

norm: It is rude to perform bodily functions in public.
situation: Tim is on a busy bus after eating a big meal and feels gas building in his stomach.
intention: Tim wants to release his gas.
moral_action: Tim gets off the bus and finds a private place to release his gas.
immoral_action: Tim releases his gas while on the bus.

norm: It is rude to pick your nose in public
situation: In the middle of a staff meeting Bob feels a big ball of snot in his nose.
intention: Bob wants to remove the booger.
moral_action: Bob gets a tissue and blows his nose.
immoral_action: Bob uses his pinky finger to remove the booger.

norm: It's wrong to leave while babysitting.
situation: John is babysitting for friends when he realizes that they are out of diapers and the baby needs changing.
intention: John needs a diaper to change the baby.
moral_action: John fashions an emergency diaper out of an old towel.
immoral_action: John runs out to the store to but diapers, leaving the baby alone.

norm: It's wrong to be emotionally dependent on a child.
situation: Jane had a hard day at work and has just arrived at home.
intention: Jane wants some validation and comfort from a person.
moral_action: Jane goes to her husband and tells him about her difficult day.
immoral_action: Jane goes to her child and tells the child how hard of a day she had.

norm: It's wrong not to stop for kids.
situation: Sam is in a hurry on the way to work.
intention: Sam wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Sam waits patiently at the stop sign for the children to cross.
immoral_action: Sam sees the stop sign on the side of the bus but attempts to pass it.

norm: It is wrong to fail to care for children
situation: Joan is working at a daycare center.
intention: Joan wants to take a break.
moral_action: Joan asks a coworker to watch the children for her while she goes on break.
immoral_action: Joan leaves the children alone to go outside and smoke a cigarette.

norm: It's wrong to control your child's life.
situation: Maggie's son Trevor wants to go over to Micah, his new friend's, house.
intention: Maggie wants to make sure her son is safe.
moral_action: Maggie gives Trevor her phone number and reminds him to call her if Trevor ever feels unsafe.
immoral_action: Maggie refuses to let Trevor visit his friend demanding that Micah comes over to her house first.

norm: It's wrong to not take raising a child seriously.
situation: Jane is at home watching a movie when her son Timmy asks her to come play with him.
intention: Jane wants to enjoy her afternoon.
moral_action: Jane agrees to play with Timmy, so they end up building a fort in the back yard, and she has a lot of fun doing so.
immoral_action: Jane tells Timmy that she's busy and that he should just go play some video games online while she finishes her movie.

norm: It's wrong to make your children take care of you
situation: Dina often neglects the housework and cooking, making her 10-year-old daughter do it all.
intention: Dina wants her daughter to learn how to make stir-fry.
moral_action: Dina gets in the kitchen with her daughter, asking her to gather the ingredients while she does the rest.
immoral_action: DIna sends her daugher off to the kitchen to make stir-fry, even though she doesn't know how to.

norm: It's wrong to keep your children secret.
situation: Keara is a single mother who has recently joined a dating site.
intention: Keara wants to appeal to a large amount of people.
moral_action: Keara writes up an interesting profile highlighting what makes her unique while mentioning her kids.
immoral_action: Keara intentionally hides the fact that she's a mother in order not to scare anyone away.

norm: It is irresponsible not to care for a child.
situation: Diana is watching her son at home because his school was experiencing a snow day.
intention: Diana wants her son to play outside.
moral_action: Diana asks her son if he wants to go outside with her to build a snowman.
immoral_action: Diana tells her son that he's being annoying and to go outside, then forgets to unlock the door for him to come inside.

norm: It's wrong to think more about yourself than your child.
situation: Alice took her children with her shopping.
intention: Alice wanted to have a long shop.
moral_action: Alice takes the kids out of the car and has them involved in the shopping.
immoral_action: Alice left her children in the hot car.

norm: It's inconsiderate to expect others to look after your children
situation: Edna is on her way home from picking up her kids at school, and she has to stop at the store that is near her parents' house.
intention: Edna wants to pick up some groceries.
moral_action: Edna stops at the store and has to take her children in with her.
immoral_action: Edna stops by her parents and tells the kids to play there for a bit while she runs to the store.

norm: It's wrong to not care for children.
situation: Beth's brother asks her to come over and watch his children for the eventing.
intention: Beth wants to free her brother up for a night out.
moral_action: Beth plays games with the kids and cooks them a nice dinner.
immoral_action: Beth locks the kids in their rooms and doesn't give them any supper.

norm: It's wrong not to watch your kids.
situation: Samantha watches her children all day, everyday while her husband works.
intention: Samantha wants a break from the monotony and to have an interesting day.
moral_action: Samantha takes the kids to an amusement park for the day.
immoral_action: Samantha leaves her oldest child in charge of the other children, and goes out to get a pedicure and manicure.

norm: It is wrong to use your child support on yourself.
situation: Katie has kids and is going to receive her child support check this week.
intention: Katie has to figure out what to buy with her check.
moral_action: Katie buys a lot of snacks and meals for her kids with the money.
immoral_action: Katie buys herself Starbucks coffee every day with the child support money.

norm: It is wrong to not love children unconditionally.
situation: Marie is disappointed to find out that her daughter has no desire to follow in her footsteps and become a doctor.
intention: Marie wants to react to her daughters choice.
moral_action: Marie works on overcoming her disappointment and focuses on supporting her daughters choices.
immoral_action: Marie's disappointment grows, and she finds herself showing affection for her daughter less as time passes.

norm: It's wrong not to support orphaned children.
situation: Kevin won a cash prize from bingo, and a representative from a charity for orphans asks him for a donation.
intention: Kevin wants to spend his money.
moral_action: Kevin donates a large portion of his money on the charity to help the orphans.
immoral_action: Kevin spends to money on his new dream car.

norm: You should not abuse your spouse
situation: Jim and his wife Jane have been cooped up together during the Corona quarantine so Jim suggests that they join a MMORPG together to pass time.
intention: Jim wants to share a fun activity with Jane.
moral_action: Jim is proud when Jane does a good job playing the game and compliments her when she beats him.
immoral_action: Jim gets frustrated when Jane beats him at the game, so he rage quits the game and throws his controller at her.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your spouse.
situation: Todd drops a glass of water in the kitchen near Margot, breaking it in the process.
intention: Margot wants to react to the plate breaking.
moral_action: Margot immediately asks Todd if he's OK and if he's cut himself.
immoral_action: "Margot screams loudly at Todd ""And why is the floor all wet, Todd?"" waving her arms frantically."

norm: You shouldn't put your spouse down
situation: Jane's husband played a football game and his team lost.
intention: Jane wants to comment about the game to her husband.
moral_action: Jane tells her husband that even though the team lost he played well.
immoral_action: Jane tells her husband that the team lost because of his incompetence.

norm: You shouldn't demand things from your spouse
situation: Sypha was upset at her husband Trevor for leaving his clothes on the floor.
intention: Sypha wants the clothes off the floor.
moral_action: Sypha asks Trevor why he left the clothes on the floor.
immoral_action: Sypha yells at Trevor and demands he pick up the clothes.

norm: You shouldn't get angry with your mother.
situation: John's mother keeps listening in on his phone conversations with a girl.
intention: John wants to let his mother know he doesn't like her invading his privacy.
moral_action: John calmly tells his mother that it's not okay for her to be eavesdropping on his conversations.
immoral_action: John loses his temper and yells at his mother to get of the phone line when he's on it.

norm: You shouldn't criticize your spouse's body.
situation: Sid's wife has been eating a lot lately and is asking Sid how she looks.
intention: Sid wants the best for his wife.
moral_action: Sid tells his wife not to worry about her looks.
immoral_action: Sid tells his wife that she's getting too fat in order to shame her.

norm: You shouldn't fight with your mother.
situation: Andrea and her mother were discussing what to watch on television.
intention: Andrea wants to watch cartoons.
moral_action: Andrea asks her mother if she can watch cartoons after she does her homework.
immoral_action: Andrea yells at her mother until she changes the channel to her cartoons.

norm: You shouldn't beat your wife.
situation: Lucas is upset when he comes home from work to find dirty dishes in the sink.
intention: Lucas wants to talk to his wife about cleaning.
moral_action: Lucas asks his wife, Mia, if there's anything he can do to help with the household chores.
immoral_action: Lucas calmly asks about the mess, but when his wife, Mia, gets defensive he starts punching her in the face.

norm: Don't throw things out that might make your mom upset.
situation: James has been cleaning the house and notices a broken old watch belonging to his mom.
intention: James wants to consider throwing out the broken old watch.
moral_action: James leaves the broken old watch alone until he gets a chance to ask him mom about it.
immoral_action: James decides to just throw out the broken old watch without a second thought.

norm: You shouldn't disrespect someone's wife.
situation: Anthony is upset at Shawn's wife because she has been rude to him lately.
intention: Anthony wants to do something about it.
moral_action: Anthony tells Shawn's wife that he doesn't want to fight with her, and that he wants to get along.
immoral_action: The next time Shawn's wife slights him, Anthony calls her a slur.

norm: You should not pressure your partner to marry you.
situation: John and Mary are on a weekend trip to a bed and breakfast in the country.
intention: John wants to get married to Mary.
moral_action: John proposes to Mary, and when she says no, he respects her decision.
immoral_action: John proposes to Mary, and when she says no, he demands she accept his proposal.

norm: You should not interfere with your spouse's friendships.
situation: Max is relaxing on the couch after work when his wife comes up and asks if it'd be okay for her to go to the mall with her friend.
intention: Max wants his family to stick to their budget.
moral_action: Max tells his wife to go but not to spend any money because they've already spent the entire budget for this month.
immoral_action: Max tells his wife that she has to stay in because they are already at the limit of their budget.

norm: You shouldn't do things behind your wife's back.
situation: Henry, who is married with two children, has a very stressful job that is eating away at his mental health.
intention: Henry wants to take a break to relax.
moral_action: Henry tells his wife he needs a break from work and that their family is going on vacation for a while.
immoral_action: Henry tells his wife he is going on a business trip for a few days, but he actually checks into a golf resort by himself.

norm: You shouldn't have a fight with your siblings.
situation: Sarah sees her brother is playing a video game at home.
intention: Sarah wants to have fun.
moral_action: Sarah suggests to her brother that they play a two-player game together.
immoral_action: Sarah takes the game away from her brother and starts fighting over who's turn it is.

norm: You shouldn't cut ties with siblings.
situation: Steve's on the phone with his brother, Jonah, who tells Steven that he's gay.
intention: Steven wants to respond to Jonah's statement.
moral_action: Steven tells Jonah that he supports him and that he'll come with him when Jonah tells their parents.
immoral_action: "Steven tells his Jonah that he disapproves of his ""lifestyle choice"" and that he doesn't want to speak to him again."

norm: You should not do things that will upset your parents.
situation: Andy promised his parents he would call if he would be late and his group of friends wants him to stay longer.
intention: Andy wants to stay with his group of friends.
moral_action: Andy calls his parents telling them he will be staying with his friends.
immoral_action: Andy stays with his friends without calling his parents to let them know he is ok.

norm: You shouldn't get mad at your family.
situation: John's son comes home from school and tells him that he's gotten a bad grade on a test.
intention: John wants to react to the bad news.
moral_action: John tells his son that these things happen and that he'll help him study those topics, so he can grasp them better.
immoral_action: John tells his son that is unnacpetable, and he did not raise a moron and that he's grounded for two weeks.

norm: You shouldn't start fights with your family.
situation: Paul's sister Mary is talking loudly while he is trying to read a book.
intention: Paul wants his sister Mary to be quiet.
moral_action: Paul asks Mary to please be quieter while he is reading.
immoral_action: Paul shoves Mary and tells her to shut up and stop bothering him.

norm: You shouldn't bust your parent's things.
situation: James wanted to go to a heavy metal concert, but his parents said he was grounded for poor grades.
intention: James wants to attend the concert.
moral_action: James agreed to his parents' faces, then snuck out his bedroom window at night.
immoral_action: James got a baseball bat, smashed the living room TV, and threatened to destroy the house if he wasn't allowed to go to concert.

norm: You shouldn't spread lies about family members.
situation: Maxine is fighting with her twin sister and very upset.
intention: Maxine wants to show her sister that she is upset.
moral_action: Maxine calls her sister and asks if they can meet up to talk.
immoral_action: Maxine spreads a rumor that her sister is pregnant for revenge.

norm: You shouldn't walk out on your family.
situation: Joe is stressed out raising a family of 4 with his wife Penelope, and heads out to the corner store to shop.
intention: Joe needs to find a way to cope with his stress.
moral_action: Joe buys a book on self-help book while at the convenience store.
immoral_action: Joe finishes his shopping and decides never go back home.

norm: You shouldn't cause family drama.
situation: Joe was at his mother's house visiting when his brother says something rude to him.
intention: Joe wants to let his brother know that he is being rude.
moral_action: Joe pulls his brother aside and asks him if he can tone it down.
immoral_action: Joe punches his brother in the jaw because of the things he said.

norm: You shouldn't take things from your parents.
situation: Sally found a beautiful bracelet in her mom's drawer while looking for something else.
intention: Sally wants to obtain the bracelet.
moral_action: Sally asks about the bracelet and requests it for her upcoming birthday.
immoral_action: Sally takes the bracelet without asking.

norm: You shouldn't seek revenge on your family.
situation: John's father has forbidden him from driving the family car because John hasn't done well in school.
intention: John wants to express his displeasure about his punishment.
moral_action: John tells his father that he thinks it isn't fair, and he's not happy with him.
immoral_action: John goes outside and slashes his father's tires and comes back inside to tell him that now they're even since he can't drive either.

norm: You shouldn't hold grudges against your family.
situation: Bill and his sister Marge haven't been on speaking terms for ten years, and today she sent him a text saying she wanted to talk.
intention: Bill wants to respond to the text.
moral_action: Bill texts her back that he would love to talk to her again, and he hopes they can put the past behind them.
immoral_action: Bill texts her back saying he has no interest in talking and to leave him alone.

norm: You shouldn't beg your parents to buy you things
situation: Remy just found out that a promising new game of a genre he likes is about to be released.
intention: Remy wants to obtain the game.
moral_action: Remy saves up his allowance in order to buy the game.
immoral_action: Remy asks his parents pleadingly to get him the game.

norm: You shouldn't sneak behind your parents' backs.
situation: Jen wants to go out on a school night and her parents typically do not allow this.
intention: Jen wants to hang out with her friend.
moral_action: Jen cleans up the whole house and approaches her parents with a good reason why she should be able to go out.
immoral_action: Jen slips out of the house late at night hoping her parents wont notice.

norm: You shouldn't force your family to do things.
situation: Margaret is looking into schools to send her son to.
intention: Margaret wants her son to go to a school that will help him be successful in the future.
moral_action: Margaret asks her son what kind of school he would like to attend.
immoral_action: Margaret applies to the school for her son and forces him to go there when she finds out hes been accepted.

norm: You shouldn't treat your family terribly.
situation: Mike is at home when his wife Lisa comes in from shopping and shows him a new dress she bought.
intention: Mike wants to react to Lisa buying a dress.
moral_action: Mike tells Lisa that he bets she looks gorgeous in it and asks her to go put it on.
immoral_action: Mike tells Lisa that she's a moron for spending their money on her stupid dress, and she should get out and return it.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your family.
situation: Mason is trying to watch the news, but his kids are running around the room being loud.
intention: Mason wants to hear the tv.
moral_action: Mason pauses the tv and takes his kids outside to burn off some energy.
immoral_action: Mason bellows at his kids telling them to go outside to be noisy.

norm: You shouldn't estrange yourself from your family.
situation: Justin's family life has been difficult because of how controlling his parents are, although he gets along well with his siblings.
intention: Justin wants his parents to stop meddling in his life.
moral_action: Justin tells his parents he will stop seeing them if they don't mind their own business and keeps hanging out with his siblings.
immoral_action: Justin decides to completely break off contacts with his family.

norm: You should not beat your sibling.
situation: Vinny is playing with his toy when his sister Jane grabs it out of his hands.
intention: Vinny wants to respond to Jane taking the toy.
moral_action: Vinny takes the toy back and explains to Jane she has to ask if she wants to play with it.
immoral_action: Vinny takes the toy back and uses it to hit Jane.

norm: You shouldn't go behind your family's back.
situation: Jonah and his family are in financial ruin and are at home discussing their options.
intention: Jonah wants find a solution to the problem.
moral_action: Jonah coordinates with the entire family, and they set out a detailed plan to cover how they can recover.
immoral_action: Jonah ignores the discussion because he figures he can solve the problem on his own and sets out to do so without telling anybody about his intentions.

norm: You shouldn't go against your parent's wishes and rules.
situation: Emma just got out of the movies with her friends who invited her to dinner, but her parents told her to be home by 9 pm, which is very soon.
intention: Emma wants to have fun with her friends.
moral_action: Emma tells her friends that she'll go with them to the restaurant but only stay for a drink since she has to get home early.
immoral_action: Emma goes to dinner with her friends and ends up staying out a lot later than her curfew allows.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of your siblings.
situation: Karl is playing chess with his younger sister Kristen.
intention: Karl wants to win the game.
moral_action: Karl concentrates on the positions and makes the better moves while playing against his sister.
immoral_action: Karl calls his little sister names, trying to distract her from the game.

norm: You shouldn't say mean things to family.
situation: Lucas was vising his family, and he saw they were treating his siblings much better than him.
intention: Lucas wants to point this out to his family.
moral_action: Lucas explains they do things for his siblings that they don't do for him.
immoral_action: Lucas speaks loudly to his family about how much better his siblings are treated than him.

norm: You shouldn't drive a wedge between families.
situation: Owen's parents are having a serious argument and are asking him for his opinion on which one of them is correct.
intention: Owen wants to help his parents resolve the issue.
moral_action: Owen looks at both sides of the story and explains the pros and cons of each argument while proposing a solution with a viable compromise.
immoral_action: Owen decides to take his father's side and tells his mother that she's wrong.

norm: You shouldn't try to be controlling of your loved ones.
situation: Bill is married to Evelyn, but Bill thinks Evelyn is saying bad things about him to her friends.
intention: Bill wants to deal with his suspicions about Evelyn.
moral_action: Bill realizes he can't control Evelyn's every move, and trusts her to respect him.
immoral_action: Bill insists that Evelyn no longer hang out with her friends.

norm: You shouldn't harass your family members.
situation: Roy and Pat are brothers who have are looking forward to watching two shows that come on at the same time.
intention: Roy wants to watch the show he's looking foward to seeing.
moral_action: Roy pays Pat $20 to let him watch the show.
immoral_action: Roy hits Pat repeatedly to get him to leave the television to him.

norm: You shouldn't get your siblings into trouble.
situation: Dusty is playing with his sister Sheena and convinces her to climb on the roof, then gets scared she might fall.
intention: Dusty wants to get Sheena off the roof.
moral_action: Dusty tells Sheena to get off the roof and helps her down.
immoral_action: Dusty yells to his mom that Sheena got on the roof.

norm: You shouldn't throw something at a family member.
situation: Timothy drops a cup of water over his sister Bella covering her with water, and Bella looks at the cup on the floor.
intention: Bella wants to vent her frustrations.
moral_action: Bella rants to her mother about the situation with her brother.
immoral_action: Bella picks up the cup and tosses it at her brother.

norm: You shouldn't send someone gory pictures.
situation: "Dave sees a tweet by another twitter user saying ""send me the 4th pic in your gallery"" which, in Daves case, happens to be a photo of a dead woman."
intention: Dave wants to choose which other pic to send.
moral_action: Dave decides to send a picture he has which contains a cat doing something cute.
immoral_action: Dave decides to send the picture of the dead woman and replies in a tweet with the picture attached.

norm: You shouldn't gift junk to people.
situation: Barb and her family do a white elephant gift exchange with the extended family every christmas.
intention: Barb wants to particpate in the white elephant game.
moral_action: Barb asks what types of gifts are popular and trendy and finds the best deals that 20 dollars can buy.
immoral_action: The players are supposed to spend 20 dollars, but Barb and her family are known for either bringing used junk or buying a gift from the dollar store.

norm: You shouldn't give people your STDs.
situation: Sam is HIV positive, and they haven't had sexual intercourse in a long time.
intention: Sam wants to have sex with someone.
moral_action: Sam finds a partner that is HIV positive.
immoral_action: Sam tells his sexual partners that he is clean and that they don't need to use protection.

norm: You shouldn't send dick pics.
situation: Joe sees the girl he likes, Cindy, and quickly tries to think of something to do.
intention: Joe wants to impress Cindy.
moral_action: Joe decides to ask Cindy out on a date to the movies.
immoral_action: Joe takes a picture of his junk and sends it to Cindy.

norm: You shouldn't force-kiss people.
situation: Steve is sitting around the campfire having a few beers with a mixed group of friends.
intention: Steve wants to find an outlet for his amorous feelings.
moral_action: Steve chats up an attractive girl and gets consent to give her a kiss.
immoral_action: Steve leans over and grabs the face of the girl next to him and lays a kiss on her unexpectedly.

norm: You shouldn't return gifts to people.
situation: Gladys is turning 50 years old next month.
intention: She wants to celebrate this milestone with her best friend by flying to Ireland.
moral_action: When they get to Ireland, Gladys is surprised to find out that her friend Gloria paid for her upgraded hotel accommodations.
immoral_action: Gladys best friend Gloria buys her airline ticket to Ireland but Gladys refuses to accept it as being too costly.

norm: You shouldn't kiss people that don't want to be kissed.
situation: Donny is a politician holding a rally where a young girl has just finished giving a speech.
intention: Donny wants to congratulate the young girl.
moral_action: Donny shakes the young girl's hand and tells her it was a great speech.
immoral_action: Donny tries to kiss the young girl, who is clearly uncomfortable by the gesture.

norm: People shouldn't lead other people on with a false kiss.
situation: Josh is listening to Christina, who has a crush on him, cry about the death of her mother.
intention: Josh wants to make Christina feel better.
moral_action: Josh tells Christina a funny joke.
immoral_action: Josh leans forward and kisses Christina.

norm: You shouldn't aggressively sell to people.
situation: Tim works as a sales person for a home delivery company.
intention: Tim wants to be a top seller.
moral_action: Tim maintains a client list that he uses to track what his customers like to buy.
immoral_action: Tim targets elderly clients and calls them repeatedly to pressure them to buy.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone they smell even if they do.
situation: Marcie is at the beach with her boyfriend, who is sweating, and his underarms have a bad aroma.
intention: Marcie doesn't want to have to smell her boyfriend's unpleasant scent.
moral_action: Marcie suggests to her boyfriend they take a swim, so they jump into the ocean and play in the water.
immoral_action: Marcie tells her boyfriend he stinks and to get away from her, so he leaves the beach.

norm: You shouldn't take back gifts that you give to people.
situation: Jack gave his friend a game but now wishes he could have it back.
intention: Jack wants to visit his friend's house.
moral_action: Jack goes to his friend's house and plays the game with them there then goes back home.
immoral_action: When Jack goes over to his friend's house he takes back the game he gave them before returning home.

norm: You shouldn't see prostitutes.
situation: Steve is divorced and feels very lonely without companionship.
intention: Steve wants to find a woman for comfort.
moral_action: Steve hunts for a potential wife and dates a nice lady.
immoral_action: Steve goes to see a prostitute for comfort, as they are always available.

norm: You shouldn't buy someone fake jewelry.
situation: Peter is shopping for an engagement ring for his girlfriend, Sue.
intention: Peter wants to give Sue an engagement ring.
moral_action: Peter gets a ring with a real diamond, even though he has to save up longer for it.
immoral_action: To save money, Peter gets a ring with a fake diamond instead of a real one.

norm: You shouldn't spread your germs in publicly used things.
situation: Jordan is at home sick this weekend.
intention: Jordan wants to go get some medicine.
moral_action: Jordan makes sure to wear a mask and gloves before he heads out to the pharmacy and only sneezes into his sleeve.
immoral_action: Jordan heads to his local pharmacy without a mask or gloves on.

norm: You shouldn't sneeze while kissing someone.
situation: Irene feels an itch in her nose when her boyfriend goes in for a kiss.
intention: Irene wants to respond to her boyfriend's kiss.
moral_action: Irene tells her boyfriend to hold on as she has a sneeze coming on.
immoral_action: Irene kisses her boyfriend despite the itch and sneezes.

norm: You shouldn't sell your body to people.
situation: Jane just got fired from her job and doesn't know how she will make ends meet.
intention: Jane wants to earn some money quickly.
moral_action: Jane takes on some temporary gig work in order to make ends meet.
immoral_action: Jane decides to sell pictures of herself on the internet for money.

norm: You shouldn't show your cleavage to strangers.
situation: Christina is making the final preparations for her first date.
intention: Christina wants to appear attractive for her date.
moral_action: Christina puts on some nice perfume paired with a professional skirt and shirt.
immoral_action: Christina dresses in a low cut dress with a small fitting push up bra.

norm: You shouldn't not hire someone just because they smell.
situation: Harry is conducting interviews for an open position at his company and the best candidate is a brilliant but unkempt and smelly young man.
intention: Harry wants all his employees to be well groomed and look professional.
moral_action: Harry convinces the young man to change his grooming practices and clean up his act, then hires him.
immoral_action: Harry chooses not to hire the unkempt young man because he smells.

norm: You shouldn't buy tacky gifts for people.
situation: It's fathers day and Kelly is shopping to buy her dad a present.
intention: Kelly wants to get her dad something interesting.
moral_action: Kelly buys her dad a functional dress shirt.
immoral_action: Kelly buys her father a tie with loud pink and green colors.

norm: You shouldn't give gifts to people that are expired.
situation: Allison bought some cheese back to share with her family when she was overseas but notices it's gone bad when she got back.
intention: Allison wants to give her relatives a souvenir from her trip.
moral_action: Allison takes some of the clothing items she bought for herself on the trip and gives them to her relatives as gifts.
immoral_action: Allison gives the cheese to her family at the next get together and hopes they don't notice it's gone bad.

norm: You shouldn't give money to people for gifts.
situation: Clara will be attending her friend Taylor's birthday party but has been struggling to find her a gift.
intention: Clara wants to find a gift quickly.
moral_action: Clara calls up her friend group and asks what they intend to gift Taylor.
immoral_action: Overwhelmed by gift shopping, Clara decides to gift Taylor with cash.

norm: You shouldn't give people nosebleeds.
situation: Nelson was annoyed by the other kids in school mocking them.
intention: Nelson wanted to make the other kids stop mocking him.
moral_action: Nelson simply decides to ignore the mocking kids completely and pay no attention at all.
immoral_action: Nelson punches the mockers in the nose and gives then nosebleeds.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone their breath smells.
situation: Basil is talking with Jim who has awful breath and keeps backing away from him so Jim asks why he keeps going backwards.
intention: Basil wants to answer Jim's question.
moral_action: Basil tells Jim it's just a force of habit, and he doesn't like to stay in one spot too long.
immoral_action: Basil tells Jim that his breath is destroying him, and he can't take it anymore, Jim needs to get some mints.

norm: It's good to listen when your friends care about something.
situation: jane's friend Jeff is hosting a charity event that he wants to talk about.
intention: Jane wants to listen to her favorite song.
moral_action: Jane decides to listen to the song when she gets home, and listens to Jeff talk.
immoral_action: Jane leaves her airpods on while Jeff is talking.

norm: It's good to get your friends' opinions about something.
situation: Casey books a trip for ten to Cancun.
intention: Casey wants to plan a vacation that she can enjoy with friends.
moral_action: Casey meets with her friends about her idea and asks where they want to do.
immoral_action: Casey books the trip on a whim without asking her friends what they think.

norm: It's good to listen when someone offers you advice.
situation: Sam is going through a break up and calls up her sister to vent.
intention: Sam wants someone to listen to her complain about her sorrows.
moral_action: Sam takes her sisters advice and removes all traces from her ex from her life.
immoral_action: Sam gets upset with her sister after hearing the advice to block her ex boyfriend.

norm: It's nice to accept advice.
situation: Taylor's child violates a rule in the house and Taylor's wife suggests he doesn't punish his child too hard.
intention: Taylor wants to discipline his child.
moral_action: Taylor gives his child a mild talking-to as a disciplinary measure.
immoral_action: Taylor ignores his wife's advice and grounds his child for 6 months.

norm: It's good to have people that listen to you.
situation: Noah's girlfriend often tries to talk to him about her issues, but he tends to ignore her.
intention: Noah wants to initiate conversations with his girlfriend more often.
moral_action: Noah apologizes to his girlfriend for being so aloof, and sits down to talk to her about her feelings.
immoral_action: Noah asks his girlfriend how her day was, but starts playing video games when she begins to talk.

norm: It's good to follow advice.
situation: Lana is bored and has free time.
intention: Lana wants to learn to ski.
moral_action: Lana signs up for ski lessons.
immoral_action: Lana refuses to take lessons and goes down a slope for advanced skiers.

norm: It is good to talk through situations with partner.
situation: Jane has been married to her partner for three years.
intention: Jane wants to move on from a disagreement she is having with her partner.
moral_action: Jane and her partner sit down and discuss their disagreement and communicate openly.
immoral_action: Jane and her partner bury and ignore the issue as if it never happened.

norm: People appreciate it when you keep them in the loop.
situation: John is meeting up with Jack in 10 minutes to work on a group project.
intention: John wants to get some food before working.
moral_action: John tells Jack then he needs to push the meeting back, so he can get some food first.
immoral_action: John decides to stop and eat some food before meeting without telling Jack and arrives an hour late.

norm: It's good to listen to someone's confessions.
situation: Dave, who is a priest is walking in the park when he is approached by Tim, a local man who asks Dave if he can tell him his sins.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Tim's request.
moral_action: Dave tells Tim that he would be glad to listen to whatever he wants to tell him and guide him if he so chooses.
immoral_action: Dave tells Tim that this is not the time or place for that conversation and to go seek a church.

norm: It's nice to listen when someone talks about their feelings.
situation: Rob is feeling slightly uncomfortable as his friend Jim opens up to him about some negative emotions he has been feeling lately.
intention: Rob wants to change the subject and move on to something else.
moral_action: Rob listens attentively and comforts Jim before suggesting that they go bowling.
immoral_action: Rob tells Jim to grow up and that he should talk to a counselor if he has problems.

norm: It's good to agree with people on things.
situation: Jake and his friend Luke are at a baseball game when Luke turns to Jake and says the game is boring, and they should leave.
intention: Jake wants to respond to Luke's statement.
moral_action: Jake tells Luke that he's right and the game is a total snoozefest, and he wants to leave as well.
immoral_action: Jake tells Luke that he's crazy because the game is not boring at all, but he can leave alone if he wants to.

norm: It's good to communicate about problems with a friend.
situation: Eric's friend Joe is totally absorbed with his girlfriend, and Eric isn't sure how to deal with it.
intention: Eric wants to stop feeling annoyed by the situation.
moral_action: Eric has a conversation with Joe about the amount of time he spends with his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Eric leaves Joe with his girlfriend and stops calling him, ignoring the pain.

norm: It's good to confess to people.
situation: Dean, a government assassin is married to Laura and is visibly stressed one day when Laura asks him what's wrong.
intention: Dean wants to answer Laura's question.
moral_action: Dean tells Laura that his real job is as an assassin and that it's been tearing him apart inside.
immoral_action: Dean tells Laura that she must be imagining things because he's perfectly fine.

norm: It's good to listen while your significant other vents.
situation: Dean is working on his bike when his girlfriend Rory comes home, complaining about a rough day at work.
intention: Dean wants to finish working on his bike.
moral_action: Dean allows Rory to vent before comforting her and asking if she'd like to help out with the bike.
immoral_action: Dean lets Rory's words go in one ear and out the other.

norm: It is good to talk with your partner.
situation: Cal comes home from work to his wife Tina.
intention: Cal wants to eat dinner with Tina.
moral_action: Cal eats dinner with Tina and asks about her day.
immoral_action: Cal eats dinner with Tina and concentrates on chewing his food.

norm: It's good to be concerned about your partner.
situation: Billy sits on the couch at home as his wife, Elizabeth, is stranded on the side of the road with car trouble.
intention: Billy wants to continue sitting on the couch at rest.
moral_action: When Elizabeth calls Billy for help, he decides to call-in a favour from a friend of his who lives close-by to the site of Elizabeths accident.
immoral_action: Elizabeth calls Billy's phone repeatedly, looking for help, but Billy does not answer her calls.

norm: It's good to communicate your concerns with your partner.
situation: Cecile is sometimes bothered by her boyfriend's messy habits.
intention: Cecile wants a cleaner apartment.
moral_action: Cecile mentions how she feels to her boyfriend.
immoral_action: Cecile never says anything to her boyfriend, and instead just cleans up after his messes.

norm: It is good to discuss issues with your friends.
situation: Sarah has been dealing with a breakup, but hasn't yet told anyone.
intention: Sarah wants to feel better.
moral_action: Sarah tells her friends about the breakup.
immoral_action: Sarah keeps the breakup a secret from her friends, and instead goes to the bar every night to deal with it alone.

norm: It's good to listen to your conscience.
situation: James is walking to dinner with his wife Lisa when he sees a strange man accosting an innocent person across the street.
intention: James wants to decide whether to intervene.
moral_action: James listens to his conscience and intervenes to defend the innocent person from the strange man.
immoral_action: James decides not to get involved and continues walking to dinner as if he didn't notice anything.

norm: It's good to tell others how you feel about them.
situation: Bill really likes a girl in his class but isn't sure how she feels about him.
intention: Billy wants to decide whether or not confess his feelings for the girl.
moral_action: Billy decides to be brave and tell the girl that he feels strongly for her.
immoral_action: Billy decides not to let the girl know about his feelings for her in case she doesn't feel the same way about him.

norm: It's good to tell people your opinions.
situation: Leigh and her friend, Donna, are out shopping for new clothes and Leigh wants to know how she looks in a red gown she just tried on.
intention: Donna wants to react to Leigh's dress.
moral_action: Donna tells Leigh that the dress doesn't really compliment her skin tone and offers to help her find something better.
immoral_action: Donna tells Leigh that it looks great, but really thinks it doesn't look very nice on her.

norm: It's good to listen when someone needs to talk.
situation: Paul's colleague begins talking about a personal matter that is bothering him.
intention: Paul needs to decide if he should redirect the conversation back to work topics, or if he should listen.
moral_action: Paul listens to his colleague and responds with moral support and hopes that things get better soon.
immoral_action: Paul ignores his colleagues comments about his personal life and continues working, only speaking about work related issues.

norm: It's good to take your friends' input into consideration.
situation: Wes asks his friends what he should get his girlfriend for her birthday.
intention: Wes wants to get something good for his girlfriend.
moral_action: Wes considers his friends' advice and gets his girlfriend a perfect gift.
immoral_action: Wes dismisses his friends' advice and gets tickets to a sports game.

norm: You shouldn't play loud music at night.
situation: Billy wants to start working out some nights.
intention: Billy wants to play some music while he works out.
moral_action: Billy puts his headphones in and blasts the music in his ear.
immoral_action: Billy puts the music up pretty loud while he is working out at night.

norm: You shouldn't yank at your clothes.
situation: Mary is feeling uncomfortable in her new dress.
