intention: Mary wants to fix her dress so that she is comfortable.
moral_action: Mary goes to a seamstress and explains her issues with the new dress.
immoral_action: Mary constantly pulls at her new dress to get it to sit the way she likes.

norm: You shouldn't cut in front of people.
situation: Nick is standing in line to pay for something when he realizes that his bus is about to leave.
intention: Nick wants to pay for the item immediately.
moral_action: Nick asks the people in front if he can check out now, so he doesn't miss the bus.
immoral_action: Nick walks up to the front of the line and checks out.

norm: You shouldn't sleep around with random people.
situation: Brian is married and is feeling adventurous tonight.
intention: Brian wants some excitement in his sex life.
moral_action: Brian asks his wife how they can make their sex life more exciting.
immoral_action: Brian uses an app to hook up with a one-night stand.

norm: You shouldn't text people late at night.
situation: After a long night of drinking with his friends, James felt the urge to text his ex.
intention: James wants to see if his ex is reconsidering their breakup.
moral_action: James writes a heartfelt text to his ex, which he saves as a draft to edit sober.
immoral_action: James sends his ex several long, drunken, rambling texts.

norm: One shouldn't operate heavy machinery when drowsy.
situation: Ralph tried his new allergy medication while he was at work and is beginning to feel tired and unusual from it.
intention: Ralph wants to get a full day of work.
moral_action: Ralph tells his supervisor he isn't feeling well, and he is given desk jobs that he can complete without any risk.
immoral_action: Ralph doesnt mention his condition to his supervisor and begins to work using the forklift.

norm: You shouldn't sleep around with people.
situation: Henry was trying to get to know everyone in his dorm and talked to everyone he could.
intention: Henry wanted to find someone to have sex with.
moral_action: Henry met a nice girl and asked her to be his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Henry talked quite a few people into having sex with him.

norm: You shouldn't be nude in public.
situation: Laura is in the shower when she sees her son leaving the house with her wallet.
intention: Laura wants to stop her son.
moral_action: Laura calls her neighbor and asks them to stop her son.
immoral_action: Laura chases after her son grabbing the wallet.

norm: You shouldn't scream in public.
situation: Tim sees his friend across a busy street with many people around.
intention: Tim wants to get his friend's attention.
moral_action: Tim waves his arm until his friend notices the movement and recognizes Tim.
immoral_action: Tim yells loudly so that his friend notices him across the street.

norm: You shouldn't undo your jeans in public.
situation: Jerry is walking around in a mall and his pants feel too tight.
intention: Jerry wants to loosen his pants in the mall.
moral_action: Jerry decides to loosen his belt without undoing his jeans.
immoral_action: Jerry decides to unbutton his pants in the mall, slightly exposing himself.

norm: You shouldn't wear clothes that are too revealing.
situation: Jen is currently shopping at the mall and trying on a bunch of clothes.
intention: Jen wants to buy new outfits for work.
moral_action: Jen decides to wear a modest and formal business outfit to work.
immoral_action: Jen shows up to work wearing an outfit that is fairly revealing.

norm: You shouldn't walk around nude in public.
situation: Fred, a nudist, likes to walk around nude in his home.
intention: Fred wants to get the paper from his front lawn.
moral_action: Fred puts on a robe before going out for the paper.
immoral_action: Fred nips out in the nude to get his paper.

norm: You shouldn't leave your clothes behind.
situation: Frank went on vacation to visit a friend in another country.
intention: Frank wants to enjoy his vacation.
moral_action: Frank plans time to round up his clothes the day before the vacation ends.
immoral_action: "Frank leaves his clothes everywhere and tells his friend to ""just keep them"" when packing up."

norm: You shouldn't grab someone's arm abruptly.
situation: Ulysses is walking down the street when he notices a pretty ladies shoes are untied, and she is in danger of tripping of her own laces.
intention: Ulysses wants to get her attention so that he can let her know about her laces being untied.
moral_action: Ulysses waves at her to get her attention, and then tells her about her laces.
immoral_action: Ulysses runs over and grabs her by the arm in order to turn her to face him.

norm: You shouldn't leave things in the street.
situation: Jak finished the soda he got in a plastic cup from McDonald's in his car.
intention: Jak wants to get rid of the plastic cup.
moral_action: Jak waits until he gets home to throw the cup in his recycle bin.
immoral_action: Jak opens his window and throws the cup out of it.

norm: You shouldn't fight others on the street.
situation: Rick is walking home from school down the street when a bully comes up and starts an argument with him.
intention: Rick wants to fight the bully.
moral_action: Rick tells the bully that he'll fight him at a boxing ring in a nearby gym.
immoral_action: Rick moves in on the bully and begins to fight him before he can make a move.

norm: You shouldn't yell in public.
situation: Frank, who went with a friend to a food festival, is lost in a crowd when he sees his friend some distance away.
intention: Frank wants to meet up with his friend.
moral_action: Frank waves his arms wildly in the air until his friend sees him, then motions for him to come over.
immoral_action: Frank shouts towards his friend and hollers that they need to meet up and figure out what to do.

norm: You shouldn't desire to be an unhealthy weight.
situation: Though Jessica is at a normal weight, she feels like she looks fat when she looks in the mirror.
intention: Jessica wants to feel pretty.
moral_action: Jessica realizes she already looks pretty and doesn't change anything.
immoral_action: Jessica stops eating and starves herself to lose some weight.

norm: It's good to help your friends move.
situation: Sam is lounging around his apartment on a Saturday morning.
intention: Sam wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Sam goes over to a friend's house to help him move to a new home.
immoral_action: Sam's friend texts him to ask him to come over and help him move, but Sam ignores the text and watches a movie on tv.

norm: It's good to invite someone to something.
situation: John and Mary are at the park when John gets a text from his other friends to come play soccer.
intention: John wants to go play soccer.
moral_action: John asks Mary if she'd like to come play soccer with him and some of his friends.
immoral_action: John tells Mary that he's been summoned to play soccer and that he has to go now.

norm: It's good to ask someone out that you like.
situation: A school dance is coming up at Jackson's school.
intention: Jackson wants to ask a pretty girl to the dance.
moral_action: Jackson thinks about all the pretty girls that are his friends and asks the one he really enjoys hanging out with.
immoral_action: Jackson asks the first random pretty girl he sees to the dance.

norm: It's good to take your friends out.
situation: Chris works in an office.
intention: Chris wants to spend time with his friends.
moral_action: Chris offers to treat his friends to a movie.
immoral_action: Chris tells his friends to meet him somewhere and doesn't mean to help pay.

norm: It's nice to have visitors.
situation: Tim visits his grandmother at the nursing home on a weekly basis, where he often notices a man who is always alone.
intention: Tim wants to know more about the lonely man.
moral_action: Tim walks up to the lonely man and asks him how his day is going.
immoral_action: Tim asks the nursing home staff about the lonely man.

norm: It's good to enjoy places in your local area.
situation: Mary has a day off and makes a plan for herself.
intention: Mary wants to visit a special place.
moral_action: Mary goes to the hiking trail near her home and hikes for two hours.
immoral_action: Mary drives 50 miles to another town and visit their museum.

norm: It's nice to host guests.
situation: Thanksgiving is coming and Sue's family is requesting to celebrate the festival at Sue's house.
intention: Sue wants to respond to the decision.
moral_action: Sue learns to cook a variety of food for the party and decorates her house.
immoral_action: Sue tells her family that her house is not comfortable enough to accommodate the guests.

norm: It's good for partners to go out together.
situation: Ben and Nora have been dating for months, but they have been too busy to schedule time together.
intention: Ben wants to have dinner.
moral_action: Ben makes reservations to Nora's favorite restaurant on her next day off.
immoral_action: Ben has dinner with his friends instead of going home to meet Nora.

norm: It's good to travel and visit the people you love.
situation: Joe and his friends are going on vacation to Miami without Joe telling his grandmother, who lives in Miami, about his trip.
intention: Joe wants to have fun with his friends in Miami.
moral_action: Joe decides to surprise his grandmother with a visit from himself and his friends.
immoral_action: Joe posts about his adventures with his friends in Miami on social media, but never visits his grandmother.

norm: It's good to invite people over.
situation: Julie has a three-day weekend she has been looking forward to after a busy month at work.
intention: Julie wants to enjoy herself during her break.
moral_action: Julie calls her best friend and asks her if she'd like to spend the weekend with her.
immoral_action: Julie decides to turn her phone off and spend the time at home by herself.

norm: It's nice to ask to visit people.
situation: Lucas was planning a big road trip over the summer, and he was driving right past where Nolan lives.
intention: Lucas wants to plan all the stops on his trip.
moral_action: Lucas asks Nolan if he'd want a visit since he'll be driving through Nolan's town on his trip.
immoral_action: Lucas doesn't say anything to Nolan about visiting him even though he'll be driving through his town.

norm: It's good to go fun places with your significant other.
situation: John and Mary being a couple have a day off.
intention: John wants to spend the day off with Mary.
moral_action: John goes to the countryside with Mary where there are beautiful views.
immoral_action: John asks Mary to help him with some home improvement work.

norm: It's nice to take people  along on your traveling plans.
situation: John is looking through a travel book with his girlfriend when he decides he wants to travel.
intention: John wants to take a trip to Paris.
moral_action: John asks his girlfriend to join him on an exciting trip to Paris, which she does.
immoral_action: John travels to Paris by himself telling his girlfriend he wants to have a personal adventure.

norm: It's good to take people places.
situation: Jones is planning on going to an amusement part.
intention: Jones wants to go to the park.
moral_action: Jones brings a few of his friends alone with him to the park.
immoral_action: Jones goes by himself even though he has extra tickets.

norm: It's good to visit people when your near their area.
situation: Kent is on a business trip and is passing through the city where his sister and her family live.
intention: Kent wants to talk with his sister.
moral_action: Kent stops by his sister's place for dinner and visits with them for a few hours.
immoral_action: Kent passes through the city and calls his sister on the phone to talk while he's driving.

norm: It's great to share your interests with those you love.
situation: James is a big fan of his video games and the type of entertainment they can bring.
intention: James wants to keep playing his video games.
moral_action: James shows the games to his family and tries to get them interested as well.
immoral_action: James hides his games from his family and keeps them away.

norm: It's good to take people nice places.
situation: Tom is on vacation, in Paris, with his spouse, and they have not yet visited unique places.
intention: Tom wants to take his spouse someone special on vacation.
moral_action: Tom takes his spouse to the Eiffel Tower, to see the nice building.
immoral_action: Tom takes his spouse to the sewers of Paris, to see the underground of the city.

norm: It's nice to visit other's.
situation: Charlie has been busy at work with no time to see anyone, but he finally has a day off.
intention: Charlie wants to do something during his day off.
moral_action: Charlie goes to see his friend and hangs out with them.
immoral_action: Charlie stays at home and plays video games all day.

norm: It's good to help people when they move.
situation: Larry has had a hard week of work and is looking forward to resting on Saturday, but his friend Bob has asked him to help him move.
intention: Larry wants to rest on Saturday.
moral_action: Larry helps Bob move in the morning and spends the rest of Saturday resting up.
immoral_action: Larry tells Bob that he can't help him move and spends all Saturday sleeping and watching TV.

norm: It's good to take people out to their favorite places.
situation: Danny's wife Jenna just turned 40, and she's expecting him to do something to celebrate the occasion.
intention: Danny wants to take Jenna out somewhere.
moral_action: Danny thinks about Jenna's favorite places and decides to take her to her favorite beach for a picnic.
immoral_action: Danny decides to take Jenna to his favorite bar to get some drinks in order to celebrate her birthday.

norm: It's good to travel with your partner.
situation: Adam is married and has many vacation days he can use to take time off of work, but his wife does not.
intention: Adam wants to go travelling.
moral_action: Adam waits for his wife to get time off approved, and they go travelling together.
immoral_action: Adam goes traveling without his wife.

norm: It's good to take your friends with you places.
situation: John had his bike stolen by a bully at school and knows where the bully lives.
intention: John wants to try to get his bike back.
moral_action: John gets four of his friends to go to the bully's house with him and demands that the bully return the bike.
immoral_action: John goes to the bully's house and demands that he return his bike.

norm: It's good to have guests over and enjoy good company.
situation: Olivia sinks down onto her couch worn out after a long day of work, and she craves companionship.
intention: Olivia wants to do something relaxing.
moral_action: Olivia invites her close friends over for some tea and bread.
immoral_action: Olivia lays down in bed reading chapters of her favorite book before taking a nap.

norm: It's wrong to not make time for your family.
situation: Jim started a new business, so he hasn't had enough time to spend with his family.
intention: Jim wants to have a successful business to help support his family.
moral_action: Jim has a healthy work-life balance and spends lots of time with his family.
immoral_action: Jim spends all of his time at work and never hangs out with his family.

norm: It's wrong not to visit your family.
situation: Perry is out driving around.
intention: Perry wants to enjoy time other people.
moral_action: Perry goes over to his parents house and spends the afternoon chatting with them.
immoral_action: Perry stops at the park and hangs out with the stoners.

norm: It's wrong not to help family who is in distress.
situation: Nikki is talking with her son.
intention: Nikki wants to see what's going on in her son's life.
moral_action: Nikki learns her son is low on funds during the conversation, and she pays his rent for him.
immoral_action: Nikki's son tells her he's struggling financially, and she encourages him to work harder.

norm: It's wrong to talk back to a parent.
situation: Mike is an angsty teen and thinks his parents just don't understand him.
intention: Mike wants to have his parents feel the pain he is going through.
moral_action: Mike decides to have a conversation about how him and his parents can understand each other more.
immoral_action: Mike tries to tell his parents how they are annoying him, but he ends up screaming in their faces.

norm: It's wrong to get off on disturbing your family members.
situation: Dave is at home with his parents and is feeling particular bored at that moment.
intention: Dave wants to do something to amuse himself.
moral_action: Dave puts on some music and begins to do a funny dance to burn off some excess energy.
immoral_action: Dave bursts into his parents room and opens his mom's closet and throws all her stuff out to get a reaction out of her.

norm: It's wrong to not support your sibling.
situation: Jeb's sibling is having a baseball match tomorrow and wants Jeb to come along.
intention: Jeb wants to let his sibling know if he can attend the game.
moral_action: Jeb tells his sibling he can go tomorrow to the game and pats his son on the back.
immoral_action: Jeb tells his sibling he can't attend the game because he is busy and doesn't come.

norm: It's wrong not to talk to your in-laws.
situation: John is walking through a local park where he runs into in-laws.
intention: John wants to get home quickly to catch an upcoming football game on television.
moral_action: John says he to the in-laws and makes small talk for a few minutes.
immoral_action: John pretends he doesn't he his in-laws and quickly changes paths to avoid them.

norm: It's wrong not to take care of your family members.
situation: Barb fell on the steps and broke her hip.
intention: Barb wants to heal outside of a nursing home.
moral_action: Barb's children allow her to heal at their house.
immoral_action: Barb's children ignore their mother's plea for help.

norm: It's wrong to want your parents to split up.
situation: Max's father is always belittling his son.
intention: Max wants his father to understand how his behavior affects him.
moral_action: Max's documents all the mean things his father says to him over the course of a day and shows him.
immoral_action: Max tells his mom she'd be better off with someone else right in front of his father.

norm: It is wrong to judge someone else's family dynamic.
situation: Dave meets Ken who tells Dave that both his parents are transgendered men.
intention: Dave wants to react to Ken's statement.
moral_action: Dave tells Ken that it's refreshing to see someone raised by a non nuclear family once in a while.
immoral_action: Dave tells Ken that he finds that quite frankly disgusting and that men shouldn't be with other men while raising a family.

norm: It's wrong to not allow your family on trips.
situation: Robert is planning a trip over the weekend and little sister asks if she can come too.
intention: Robert wants to go on his trip.
moral_action: Robert brings his sister along on his weekend trip, taking her to all the destinations.
immoral_action: Robert forbids his sister from joining him on his weekend trip and goes alone.

norm: It is wrong to always want your husband gone.
situation: Maude's husband Jim recently retired, and she's annoyed at how often he's at home now.
intention: Maude wants to be annoyed less.
moral_action: Maude tries to learn more about Jim since they aren't used to him being home.
immoral_action: Maude finds several ways to get Jim out of the house like golf and random trips with his buddies.

norm: It's wrong to fight with your family.
situation: Mary is having dinner with her family.
intention: Mary wants to tell her sister shes mad at her.
moral_action: Mary waits until after dinner then talks to her sister calmly.
immoral_action: Mary starts yelling at her sister at the dinner table.

norm: It is wrong to gossip about family members.
situation: Georgina is at a boring baby shower.
intention: Georgina wants to liven things up.
moral_action: Georgina suggests the group play a party game.
immoral_action: Georgina starts talking about an affair she suspects her cousin is having.

norm: It's wrong to push a product to your family.
situation: Dave is finished training as a salesman at a printer company and is tasked with making his first sale.
intention: Dave wants to telephone someone to pitch the printer to.
moral_action: Dave calls the first name he sees in the phone book and pitches them a printer.
immoral_action: Dave calls his mom and pitches her the printer as if she was any other regular potential customer.

norm: It's wrong to keep secrets from family members
situation: Susan just went to the hospital to get an abortion and has not told her family about it.
intention: Susan doesn't want to be rejected by her mother by telling her about the abortion.
moral_action: Susan tells her mom about the abortion and how she felt like had no other valid option.
immoral_action: Susan doesn't tell her mom about the abortion.

norm: It's wrong not to help out your parents.
situation: Joe is working on a rickety ladder while his son Tom is watching and holding his phone.
intention: Tom wants to text his friend.
moral_action: Tom holds the ladder for Joe until Joe is finished, then goes to texting his friend.
immoral_action: Tom looks down at his phone while texting his friend.

norm: It's wrong to be intimate with family.
situation: Max has a birthday today and his sister just gave him a gift that Max loves.
intention: Max wants to hug his sister for the present.
moral_action: Max hugs his sister lightly and for not too long after receiving his gift.
immoral_action: Max hugs his sister very tightly and intimately after he receives his gift.

norm: It's wrong to have a crush on family members.
situation: It's valentines day for Jake, and his family are all giving each other gifts.
intention: Jake wants to write a valentine's day letter to his sister.
moral_action: Jake writes a platonic letter to his sister simply wishing her a good day.
immoral_action: Jake writes in the letter that he has a crush on his sister and loves her.

norm: It's wrong to beat up your family.
situation: Jonah has a brother that broke his toy.
intention: Jonah wants to punish his brother regarding the toy.
moral_action: Jonah talks to his parents about the toy and how his brother broke it.
immoral_action: Jonah pushes his brother down and kicks him while mentioning the toy.

norm: It's wrong to swear at your family.
situation: Roger is at a family dinner when the discussion gets ugly and his parents start saying hurtful things to each other.
intention: Roger wants his parents to listen to what he has to say.
moral_action: Roger starts speaking forcefully and eloquently about family values and respect.
immoral_action: Rogers acts angry and curses at his parents to carry his point across.

norm: It's wrong to not obey your parents.
situation: James is not letting his son Dan play video games until he cleans up his room.
intention: Dan wants to play video games.
moral_action: Dan cleans his room and lets his dad know in order to be allowed to play video games.
immoral_action: Dan plays video games when his dad isn't paying attention and hasn't cleaned his room.

norm: it is impolite to tell your parents to go away.
situation: Jules is living with her parents while she is studying for her degree and enjoys watching tv in the living room.
intention: Jules wants to watch a violent thriller.
moral_action: Jules asks her parents if they would be okay with watching something graphic.
immoral_action: Jules doesn't want to have hear her parents complain about the bloody scenes and tells them to scram.

norm: It's wrong to take advantage of your grandparents.
situation: Larry's grandmother, who can be forgetful, gave him some money, but forgot and offered to give him some more money.
intention: Larry wants to decide whether to take the money or not.
moral_action: Larry reminds his grandmother that she already gave him money and thanks her again.
immoral_action: Larry takes the second bit of money from his grandmother and thanks her for it without mentioning the first payment.

norm: It's wrong to not look out for family members.
situation: Sarah lives currently with her grandmother who needs help.
intention: Sarah wants her own independence and to live alone.
moral_action: Sarah hires very good help for her grandmother and sees she is well looked after before moving out.
immoral_action: Sarah moves out to her own place suddenly without telling anyone and doesn't look back.

norm: It's wrong not to pay your ex child support.
situation: Jay has a child with his ex, and he's in a tough financial situation after losing his job.
intention: Jay wants to cut his costs, so he can improve his finances.
moral_action: Jay arranges to make lower payments for couple months then pay more the following months.
immoral_action: Jay skips out on paying child support for a few months.

norm: It's wrong to marry within your family.
situation: Iris is tired of being single and lonely while all of her friends are getting married.
intention: Iris wants to get married and have kids.
moral_action: Iris ventures out of her circle of friends and family and finds a nice man to marry.
immoral_action: Iris doesn't know any single men except her cousin, so she decides that they should get married.

norm: It's wrong to have sexual thoughts about one's family.
situation: At a family reunion, George is asked by his cousin Gloria how she looks in her new dress.
intention: George wants to give Gloria a compliment.
moral_action: George tells Gloria that she looks elegant in the dress.
immoral_action: George tells Gloria that she looks good enough to shag.

norm: It's wrong to make your parents do things by themselves
situation: Kelsey is a senior in high school who has outgrown her bedroom decor.
intention: Kelsey wants to ask her mom for a room makeover.
moral_action: After asking her mom to redo her room, Kelsey and her mom go shopping for new furniture.
immoral_action: After asking her mom to redo her room, Kelsey leaves her with a wishlist then goes off to have fun with her friends everyday.

norm: It's wrong to yell as a parent.
situation: Carrie catches her young daughter Beth drawing on the walls with colored pencils.
intention: Carrie wants her daughter to stop drawing on the walls.
moral_action: Carrie sits Beth at a table with a piece of paper and tells her to draw on it.
immoral_action: Carrie raises her voice at Beth and tells her to get away from the walls.

norm: It's wrong to cut contact with family members.
situation: Brad is having a big dinner with his family during Christmas vacation and is offended by something his sister Teresa says.
intention: Brad wants to let Teresa know he is displeased with her.
moral_action: Brad tells Teresa that what she said offended him and it was not appropriate.
immoral_action: Brad cuts off all contact with Teresa and refuses to return her calls and messages.

norm: It's wrong to be a burden on your partner's family.
situation: Joe, who has a girlfriend, decides to move out of his parents' house and in with his girlfriend's family.
intention: Joe wants to live in a place for cheap.
moral_action: Joe arranges a utility payment agreement with his girlfriend's parents and moves in.
immoral_action: Joe lives with his girlfriend's parents and doesn't help pay any of the house bills.

norm: It's wrong to want your family to move out.
situation: Gary's mom moved in with him and his wife and has stayed for longer than planned, and her habits are grating on him.
intention: Gary wants to stop being annoyed with his mother.
moral_action: Gary tries to compromise with his mom and get her to change her habits if she wants to continue to live with them.
immoral_action: Gary gets into a big fight with him mom and demands that she move out immediately.

norm: It's wrong to give your parents ultimatums.
situation: Charlie has siblings and is arguing with his parents about cleaning his room, which he does not want to do.
intention: Charlie wants to avoid cleaning his room.
moral_action: Charlie bribes one of his siblings to clean his room for him, in exchange for a nice toy.
immoral_action: Charlie tells his parents to let him go without cleaning or else he will trash the house.

norm: It's wrong not to want to see your grandparents.
situation: Billy's grandpa has been recently put into a nursing home, and it is visiting day today.
intention: Billy wants to do something fun today.
moral_action: Billy brings a board game over to the nursing home to play with his Grandpa.
immoral_action: Billy goes out with his friends to go see a new movie that just came out.

norm: It is wrong to be absent from marriage and family.
situation: Nate has been really bored lately, and he's thinking about going on a vacation.
intention: Nate wants to feel less bored.
moral_action: Nate take his wife and kids to go on a trip to Italy.
immoral_action: Nate goes on a vacation to Mexico by himself and has a lot of fun.

norm: It's wrong to only care about your parents.
situation: Ann is visiting her mom's nursing home and the garden outside catches a fire.
intention: Ann wants to react to the fire.
moral_action: Ann stays with the elderly people and her mom, and calm them down before the employees start to evacuate them.
immoral_action: Ann immediately takes her mom out of the nursing home to a safe place.

norm: It's wrong to be rude to your family.
situation: John is teaching his brother Harley how to type, but Harley keeps typing too fast and making typos.
intention: John wants to tell Harley to slow down.
moral_action: John encourages Harley while telling him that accuracy is more important than speed.
immoral_action: John berates Harley while telling him not to move so fast.

norm: It's wrong to wish harm on a family member.
situation: Jasmine is having an argument with her mother who is leaving to work.
intention: Jasmine wants to express her anger.
moral_action: Jasmine speaks frankly with her mother informing her how upset she is and requests that they talk things throw when her mother gets home.
immoral_action: Jasmine blurts out that she doesn't care about her own mother's safety because of the disagreement.

norm: It's wrong not to keep in touch with your grandparents.
situation: Miley has moved to a new town and received a letter from her grandparents.
intention: Miley wants to react to the letter.
moral_action: Miley writes a letter back to her grandparents.
immoral_action: Miley thinks the letter is nice but does not write a letter back.

norm: It is wrong not to share with your parents.
situation: Lenny is chatting with his mom and eating chips when his mom asks him for a chip.
intention: Lenny wants to answer his mom's request for a chip.
moral_action: Lenny hands the bag of chips to his mother and tells her to take as many as she wants.
immoral_action: Lenny tells his mom that he's starving, so she should go to the kitchen and get her own snack.

norm: It's wrong to argue with your family.
situation: Cory and his brother Pete are trying to decide what movie to see at a movie theater.
intention: Cory wants to see a movie with Pete.
moral_action: Cory suggests they each pick a movie and watch both.
immoral_action: Cory starts shouting at Pete to see a movie he wants to see.

norm: It is wrong to shun or ignore family members
situation: Patrick's Aunt Lydia made an insensitive remark at dinner that hurt Patrick's feelings.
intention: Patrick wants Lydia to know she hurt him.
moral_action: Patrick tells Lydia that her comment made him feel bad and asks her not to say similar things again out of consideration for him.
immoral_action: Patrick starts to ignore Lydia when she talks to him and doesn't respond to any of her calls or messages.

norm: It is wrong to speak ill of a partner's family.
situation: Aaron observes his brother-in-law, Anthony, stealing money out of his wallet.
intention: Aaron needs to let his wife know what happened.
moral_action: Aaron tells his wife what he saw and lets her know that he would like to support her as she decides what she wants to do about the problem.
immoral_action: Aaron tells his wife that he has never trusted Anthony and that he doesn't want him around their house anymore.

norm: It's wrong to take advantage of your parent's kindness.
situation: Tommy moved away from home to attend college in another state and, though his parents pay for his education, he struggles with finances as a young student.
intention: Tommy wants to get the money together to go on a weekend trip.
moral_action: Tommy finds a job cleaning out an abandoned house, off campus, that pays enough for him to go away for the weekend.
immoral_action: Tommy calls his parents and claims that he needs some money to pay for an extracurricular, school related activity, instead of telling them its for a personal trip.

norm: It's wrong to use your family.
situation: Leah is driving home from work when the check engine light in her car turns on.
intention: Leah wants to get a new car.
moral_action: Leah takes the car to a mechanic and begins saving money from every paycheck to put towards a new car.
immoral_action: Leah calls her dad and tells him that her car is broken, and she cannot afford a new one, and she doesn't know what to do.

norm: It is wrong to escalate conflicts with your parents
situation: Mary gets into a huge argument with her strict parents because they won't allow her to date.
intention: Mary wants to have more freedom.
moral_action: Mary asks other family members to help her plead her case.
immoral_action: Mary runs away from home with a guy she likes.

norm: It's wrong not to acknowledge your parents.
situation: Joe has been living with his parents but just got a good job.
intention: Joe wants to live on his own.
moral_action: Joe moves out on his own near to his parents and calls them every day to talk.
immoral_action: Joe moves across the country and settles down and doesn't bother to ever call his folks.

norm: It's wrong to spoil your grandchildren.
situation: Barry's grandma was taking care of Barry for the weekend.
intention: Barry's grandma wants to make sure he gets something to eat.
moral_action: Barry's grandma fixes Barry healthy meals with a few treats during his stay.
immoral_action: For dinner Barry says he wants ice cream and chips, and she lets him have it.

norm: It's wrong to destroy a family.
situation: Bill works in an office with a lot of hot young interns and his wife.
intention: Bill wants to be sexually satisfied.
moral_action: Bill has sex with his wife when they get home from work.
immoral_action: Bill invites an intern into his office and has sex with her.

norm: It's wrong to abandon someone that raised you.
situation: Joe is shopping with his mother when his friend, Tom, calls and asks him to go see a movie.
intention: Joe wants to see the movie with Tom.
moral_action: Joe tells Tom  that they will go see the movie next week.
immoral_action: Joe agrees to go to the movies and leaves his mother to shop by herself.

norm: It's wrong to lose your soul mate.
situation: Dave and his wife Linda are sitting on the couch when Linda asks Dave to clean up after himself more.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Linda's request.
moral_action: Dave realizes that his wife is precious and that he needs to do better and tells her that he'll clean up right away.
immoral_action: Dave tells Linda that he doesn't care about that and if she doesn't like it she can leave the relationship.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your parents.
situation: James always laughed at his parents when they told him he had to wear a helmet when biking.
intention: James wanted to avoid looking dorky in front of his friends.
moral_action: James insisted that his parents buy him a helmet with the logo of his favorite heavy metal band.
immoral_action: James refused to take his parents' advice and rode his bike without a helmet.

norm: It's wrong to separate a parent and their child.
situation: Bill works for child services and is investigating Mary and her parenting abilities as Mary struggles with having enough money to pay the bills.
intention: Bill wants to decide how to reprimand Mary for her latest violation.
moral_action: Bill tells Mary that he's writing her a warning on her file and that she needs to do better to find a job.
immoral_action: Bill tells Mary that he's taking her kids away as she's unfit to be a mother, and she can apply to get them back later.

norm: It's wrong for parents to abandon their children
situation: Dave is walking down the street with his daughter, when a bar owner asks him to come into his bar for a drink, but leave his underage daughter outside.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the bar owner's suggestion.
moral_action: Dave tells the bar owner that it sounds like a terrible idea and that he's an insane person for suggesting it.
immoral_action: Dave tells the bar owner that it sounds like a great idea and goes inside.

norm: It's wrong to abandon your loved ones.
situation: John and Jane are in a jungle fleeing from lions, John trips over while fleeing.
intention: Jane wants to leave the jungle alive.
moral_action: Jane turns around and tries to help John up to help him escape.
immoral_action: Jane leaves John behind and saves herself by continuing to run.

norm: It's wrong for someone to lock up their child.
situation: Rover's son Barker dropped a laptop and broke it, so Rover couldn't finish his project for work until the weekend.
intention: Rover wants to teach Barker a lesson.
moral_action: Rover takes away Barker's laptop and gives it back to him on Friday afternoon.
immoral_action: Rover locks Barker in his room with his dog Joe until Rover's work project is done.

norm: It is wrong to abandon family members.
situation: Joe took his 5 year old son to the ball game.
intention: John wants to grab a hot dog.
moral_action: John holds his son's hand to lead him to the hot dog stand.
immoral_action: John turns away from his son for a second to get a hot dog.

norm: It's wrong to cut off your kids from your life.
situation: Cindy and her adult daughter get into an argument and stop speaking to each other for a while, which hurts Cindy.
intention: Cindy wants to deal with the pain.
moral_action: Cindy tries to make up and start a positive relationship with her daughter to avoid fighting.
immoral_action: Cindy refuses to talk to her daughter any longer, so she doesn't have another fight.

norm: It's wrong to cut everyone out of your life.
situation: Doug is having a really difficult time lately with his mental health.
intention: Doug wants to feel better.
moral_action: Doug decided to call up his friend to see if he wanted to hang out and do something.
immoral_action: Doug decided to turn his phone off, hang out alone in his bedroom, and drink his sorrows away.

norm: It's wrong to abandon your children.
situation: Lisa was at the mall shopping with her young daughter.
intention: Lisa wants to go to the restroom.
moral_action: Lisa takes her daughter with her into the stall when she goes to the bathroom.
immoral_action: Lisa leaves her daughter in the toy department when she goes to the restroom.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your family.
situation: Kyle has a work project with a deadline coming up soon and his mom has been calling and texting him.
intention: Kyle wants to focus on his work.
moral_action: Kyle sends his mom a quick text back promising to get back to her when he's done.
immoral_action: Kyle turns off his phone and continues to work on his project.

norm: It's wrong for parents to break ties with their children.
situation: Suzy is having a fight with her daughter, who has been staying out late partying.
intention: Suzy wants her daughter to act morally.
moral_action: Suzy arranges an intervention for her daughter and tries to strengthen their relationship.
immoral_action: Suzy tells her daughter to leave, and then refuses to answer her calls after she's gone.

norm: It's wrong for a father to abandon his child.
situation: Walter just found out that he has a two year old son from an ex girlfriend.
intention: Walter wants to see his son.
moral_action: Walter talks to his ex-girlfriend and decides on dates when he will start visiting the child.
immoral_action: Walter sees his son and ex-girlfriend in order to sign off all his rights to the child.

norm: It's frowned upon to give your child up for adoption.
situation: Adeline lives in a poor neighborhood which has a high level of crime and is in bad condition.
intention: Adeline wants a better home for her son.
moral_action: Adeline takes night classes for a certification which gets her a higher paying job.
immoral_action: Adeline allows one of her family members, who is more well off, to adopt her son.

norm: It's wrong to give up on your children.
situation: Darrell has son named Gerald who is doing poorly in school.
intention: Darrell wants to give advice to Gerald about school.
moral_action: Darrell tells Gerald he needs to study more and work harder to achieve.
immoral_action: Darrell tells Gerald that school is a dead end for him, and he won't get better at it.

norm: It's wrong to take children from their parents.
situation: Jenna was delighted when she got pregnant but had a miscarriage late in her pregnancy.
intention: Jenna wants a baby.
moral_action: Jenna immediately starts having sex with her husband to get pregnant again.
immoral_action: Jenna walks out of the hospital with someone else's infant daughter.

norm: You shouldn't BS people.
situation: Ted is at a party and just met a woman he finds very attractive.
intention: Ted wants the woman to like him.
moral_action: Ted is attentive and funny and talks simply about the things he likes, without exaggerating.
immoral_action: Ted starts telling bogus stories to the woman about how he earns a lot of money and is famous.

norm: You shouldn't karate chop people.
situation: Kent is confronting an angry man who is threatening someone else.
intention: Kent wants to end the bad situation.
moral_action: Kent apologizes and tries to verbally diffuse the situation.
immoral_action: Kent repeatedly karate chops the angry man in the face.

norm: You shouldn't hit on teenagers.
situation: Dan is hanging out at the local park.
intention: Dan wants to find someone to date.
moral_action: Dan talks to a middle-aged female about going to the movies with him.
immoral_action: Dan asks a 15 year old girl to go to dinner with him.

norm: You shouldn't block the door.
situation: James is at the movie theater when he sees his friend Tim on his way in.
intention: James wants to chat with Tim before the movie starts.
moral_action: James asks Tim to step aside to chat for a bit.
immoral_action: James stands between  the theater's entrance doors to talk to Tim.

norm: You shouldn't smoke just to prove a point.
situation: Chris and Amy are eating lunch at school near the fieldhouse, Amy is flirting with Chris.
intention: Amy wants to impress Chris.
moral_action: Amy declines Chris's offer, saying she's never done it before and doesn't think now is the right time.
immoral_action: Chris offers Amy a puff on his joint, Amy smokes it even though she hasn't ever smoked weed before.

norm: You shouldn't punch teenagers.
situation: Mrs. Jones is teaching a class, and Chris keeps interrupting her.
intention: Mrs. Jones wants Chris to quiet down and let her teach.
moral_action: Mrs. Jones threatens Chris with a detention if he doesn't quiet down.
immoral_action: Mrs. Jones approaches Chris's desk and punches him hard in the arm.

norm: You shouldn't call people robots.
situation: Jill just received her order in the mail, and she is missing one of the items she ordered.
intention: Jill wants to speak with someone at customer service.
moral_action: Jill talks to the customer service agent and tells him he has been very helpful solving her problem.
immoral_action: As Jill is talking to the customer service agent she tells him to stop sounding like a robot reading from a script.

norm: You shouldn't demand sex.
situation: Rachel and Becky are on a date together and are snuggling in bed.
intention: Rachel wants to have sex with Becky.
moral_action: Rachel asks Becky about the type of things she likes romantically and physically and the two become intimate under consensual terms.
immoral_action: Rachel tells Becky that because she paid for the meal, Becky has to make it up to her with sex.

norm: You shouldn't throw rocks.
situation: Barry wants to practice pitching for the baseball team, but doesn't have a ball.
intention: Barry wants to improve his throw,.
moral_action: Barry ignores the stone and instead goes to a neighbor to ask to borrow a baseball.
immoral_action: Barry uses a stone as a baseball and when he throws it he pulls a muscle.

norm: You shouldn't block exits.
situation: Matt drives up to a store to buy something real quick.
intention: Matt wants to park in a good location.
moral_action: Matt parks in the closest available parking space, hops out of his car, and goes inside.
immoral_action: Matt parks directly in front of the store doors, hops out of his car, and goes inside.

norm: You shouldn't make trash mountains.
situation: Holly is outside cleaning the yard and has picked up a lot of trash.
intention: Holly wants to get rid of the trash.
moral_action: Holly takes the trash and brings it to the recycling center.
immoral_action: Holly uses the trash to make a huge mountain in her yard.

norm: You shouldn't do drugs to cope with something.
situation: Marie's husband has recently passed away, and she is struggling to cope with her grief.
intention: Mary wants to feel better emotionally.
moral_action: Marie's sister convinces her to start seeing a therapist to talk through her problems.
immoral_action: Marie begins to take her sister's depression medication to try to improve her mood.

norm: You shouldn't give people drugs.
situation: Jared is hanging out with his friend John, and John is having bad cramps.
intention: Jared wants to help his friend feel better.
moral_action: Jared makes John some green tea and a glass of water.
immoral_action: Jared gives John some of his father's prescription pain medication.

norm: You shouldn't punch people.
situation: Roger is in a bar with a few friends when a drunk man starts yelling at them because Roger accidentally stepped on his foot.
intention: Roger wants the guy to leave them alone.
moral_action: Roger calmly talks to the guy and de-escalates the situation.
immoral_action: Roger punches the guy in the face.

norm: You shouldn't catfish people.
situation: Sally has a crush on Henry, but is too shy to talk to him.
intention: Sally wants to get closer with Henry.
moral_action: Sally works out the courage to talk to Henry during class.
immoral_action: Sally makes a fake account with a totally different picture on social media and starts messaging Henry.

norm: You shouldn't shoplift.
situation: Mary is at the corner store during her lunch break.
intention: Mary wants to eat a snack.
moral_action: Mary buys a candy bar from the store.
immoral_action: Mary hides a candy bar in her purse and exits the store.

norm: You shouldn't blast your music.
situation: Tobias bought a new sound system and is hosting a house party to celebrate.
intention: Tobias wants to show off his new sound system.
moral_action: Tobias plays the music at a moderate level, so that everyone can hear but not loud enough to disturb his neighbors.
immoral_action: Tobias cranks the volume up as loud as it will go.

norm: You shouldn't abuse medication.
situation: Xavier gets his wisdom teeth removed and is prescribed a sedative to help him with the pain.
intention: Xavier wants to block out the pain.
moral_action: Xavier takes the sedatives to dull the pain and deals with the pain when it's not so bad.
immoral_action: Xavier takes more than the recommended dose of sedatives, so he feels less pain.

norm: You shouldn't commit arson.
situation: Another person was shot by the cops so James decided to go violently protest.
intention: Jamie wants to cause chaos in the city.
moral_action: Jamie spray paints on the windows of a CVS the name of the person killed by police.
immoral_action: Jamie set off fireworks inside a CVS in order to help light a fire inside it.

norm: You shouldn't jump people.
situation: "Frank lives in the city and finds out that a ""friend"" of his just stole a lot of his money."
intention: Frank wants to get justice on this friend.
moral_action: Frank reports the friend to the police and describes the theft in detail.
immoral_action: Frank gets some friends, finds the thief when he's alone, and attacks him.

norm: You shouldn't demand freebies.
situation: James is in his regular coffee shop and is planning on ordering a latte.
intention: James wants to get a cup of coffee.
moral_action: James orders and pays for a latte.
immoral_action: James repeatedly asks the barista to give him the coffee for free because he buys so much coffee from the cafe.

norm: People shouldn't do drugs.
situation: Nathan has a huge headache when he notices his father's pain medications sitting on the table.
intention: Nathan wants to feel better.
moral_action: Nathan exercises for thirty minutes before eating supper early.
immoral_action: Nathan takes two pills of his father's medication.

norm: You shouldn't abuse Adderall.
situation: Douglas is having trouble studying before his biology test when he sees his roommates Adderall bottle laying on the table.
intention: Douglas wants to do well on his test.
moral_action: Douglas drinks some coffee and does jumping jacks to wake himself up before studying.
immoral_action: Douglas uses some of his roommates Adderall to study and take the test.

norm: You shouldn't deal drugs.
situation: Trevor is struggling with his finances lately and has overdue bills.
intention: Trevor wants to make more money.
moral_action: Trevor gets a job with his local parks and recreation department doing maintenance at the parks and makes decent money.
immoral_action: Trevor invests in a large amount of drugs which divvies up and sells to people in the local community for profit.

norm: It's good to do things that encourage team work.
situation: Nick is working on a group project for  a college class.
intention: Nick wants to act for the good of the group.
moral_action: Nick works together with the team toward the best possible group outcome.
immoral_action: Nick performs much of the work assigned to the group for himself.

norm: It's good to want others to learn from your experiances.
situation: Maya invites some girl scouts who came to her door into her house.
intention: Maya wants to talk with the girl scouts for a bit.
moral_action: Maya tells stories about mistakes she's made in life and how the girls can avoid them.
immoral_action: Maya tells random stories about people she knew when she was a child.

norm: It is good to learn from others.
situation: Sarah recently struggles with her Math study and Ann is good at Math.
intention: Sarah wants to improve her grade in Math.
moral_action: Sarah asks Ann for advice on getting a better grade in Math test and follows it through.
immoral_action: Sarah stayed up and did not sleep the night before the Math test in order to study more.

norm: It's good to want to teach others things you know.
situation: John is a guitar prodigy who learned how to play guitar at a young age and is now considering tutoring for money.
intention: John needs to make some money.
moral_action: John decides to start his own tutoring business for young students.
immoral_action: John decides to get a job as a mechanic instead, keeping his talents all to himself.

norm: It is good to help others prepare for a presentation.
situation: Jonah's colleagues are in a hurry to wrap up fine-tuning their upcoming presentation and ask him for help, but he is busy on an important project of his own.
intention: Jonah wants to be recognized as an outstanding worker.
moral_action: Jonah decides to help his colleagues polish their presentation and stays late to work on his own project.
immoral_action: Jonah doesn't help his colleagues and intensely focuses on his project.

norm: It is appreciative to recognize how someone helps you.
situation: Heather is in need of a new car but doesn't have the money, though her mom often provides her with financial help.
intention: Heather wants to ask her mom if she will help her buy a new car.
moral_action: After receiving a check from her mom, Heather thanks her immensely and bakes her a cake to show her gratitude.
immoral_action: Heather cashes a check from her mom then proceeds to purchase a new car without ever thanking her.

norm: You should be appreciative when people try to help you.
situation: Trevor slips and falls and his friend puts out their hand to assist Trevor back to his feet.
intention: Trevor wants to react to his friend's gesture.
moral_action: Trevor thanks his friend for his assistance and takes their hand to get up.
immoral_action: Trevor slaps his friend's hand away and tells them to mind their own business.

norm: It is good to encourage other people not to quit.
situation: Dylan has been working out every day, but he's starting to lose motivation, and he's talking about this to his girlfriend Fiona.
intention: Fiona wants to respond to Dylan's concerns.
moral_action: Fiona tells Dylan that sometimes results take a long time to show and that the only way to see them is to persevere.
immoral_action: Fiona tells Dylan that perhaps working out is not for him and that he should look for a new pastime.

norm: It's good to help people fix things.
situation: Candice has the weekend off, and his mother asks him to look over her slow computer.
intention: Candice wants to have fun.
moral_action: Candice invites her friends over to join her  while Candice repairs his mother's computer.
immoral_action: Candice spends the weekend at the beach.

norm: It is good to help others learn.
situation: Kara is doing her homework at the park after school, and she see's a girl, Molly, she knows from school looking confused at her notebook.
intention: Kara wants to see what Molly is so flustered about.
moral_action: Kara asks Molly what the problem is, so Molly shows her a difficult math problem, and Kara shows her how to do it properly.
immoral_action: Kara asks Molly what the problem is, so Molly shows her a difficult math problem, but Kara says she doesn't really have time to help.

norm: It is good to have a list to organize yourself.
situation: Susan is preparing for a big presentation at work.
intention: Susan wants to give a good presentation.
moral_action: Susan jots down everything she needs to do for the presentation and keeps checking back on her notes as she spends the evening preparing.
immoral_action: Susan doesn't want to overthink the presentation, so she decides to relax and watch television before going to bed.

norm: It is nice to encourage others to keep trying.
situation: Sam is a guidance counselor who is meeting with a student about pursuing art as a career after losing a local art competition.
intention: Sam wants to make sure the student realistically understands their goal in life.
moral_action: Sam cautions the student towards the perils of pursuing art but tells them to not give up on their passion after one setback.
immoral_action: Sam tells the student that art is financially impractical, and they should switch focus after the loss.

norm: It is kind to repair something for someone.
situation: Hal notices his neighbor's car in the driveway is making odd engine noises.
intention: Hal wants to talk about the car.
moral_action: Hal tells his neighbor he can fix his car's noise problem.
immoral_action: Hal tells his neighbor that it's bad luck that his car is making noises.

norm: It is okay to provide others with work.
situation: Jill was listening to her friend Sarah talk about how she lost her job.
intention: Jill wants Sarah to feel better.
moral_action: Jill decides to hire Sarah to mow her lawns and wash her car.
immoral_action: Jill takes Sarah to see a movie at the huge screen Imax theater.

norm: It's good to intern for things and gain experience.
situation: Courtney is in college and it is time for summer break.
intention: Courtney wants to do something during the summer.
moral_action: Courtney applies for an internship and interns during the summer.
immoral_action: Courtney spends her time shopping at the mall during the summer.

norm: It's good to give others work advice.
situation: Craig is working on a team with a new employee who is having difficulty working through an assignment that Craig knows how to do.
intention: Craig wants to make sure he doesn't get distracted from his own work.
moral_action: Craig offers to give the new employee some pointers during his break and after he finishes his work for the day.
immoral_action: Craig does not offer to help the new employee and spends his time focusing on his own assignments.

norm: It's good to try your best to help your team.
situation: The bases were loaded, there were two outs, and Nick's team was losing by one point when he was up to bat.
intention: Nick wants the game to be over.
moral_action: Nick swings the bat hard and hits an over the fence home run.
immoral_action: Nick watches three good pitches pass by and strikes out on purpose.

norm: You should admire someone for their skills.
situation: Jamie has joined the art team for a games company and notices another artist named Lyle is very talented.
intention: Jamie wants to react to Lyle's ability.
moral_action: Jamie views Lyle as an inspiration.
immoral_action: Jamie becomes jealous of Lyle's ability.

norm: It's nice to fix things for other people.
situation: Randy got a hole in his roof and it's leaking water, so he tells his carpenter friend, Russel, about the problem and mentions how hiring a repairman is too expensive.
intention: Russel wants to react to Randy's issue.
moral_action: Russel tells Randy that he can patch up the roof for him with some extra materials he's got.
immoral_action: Russel suggests that Randy start saving up, so he can get it professionally fixed.

norm: It's good to teach others.
situation: Danny is cooking dinner for the family in the kitchen and his daughter asks if she can help.
intention: Danny wants to make dinner.
moral_action: Danny accepts her daughter's help and shows her how to hold a knife and chop up vegetables.
immoral_action: Danny tells his daughter that he'll take care of it because she doesn't know how to cook yet.

norm: It is good to be appreciative when someone helps you.
situation: Mike has just finished helping Brad move some heavy furniture, and they're taking a break.
intention: Brad wants to tell Mike they're done, and he can go.
moral_action: Brad tells Mike he really appreciates all the help Mike gave him and thanks him before saying he can go if he wants.
immoral_action: Brad tells Mike that was it and Mike should go home now since they're finished.

norm: It is wrong to purposely embarrass someone else.
situation: Jimmy was at the talent show as his competition Billy got on the stage.
intention: Jimmy wants to win the talent show.
moral_action: Jimmy uses the time to practice his own talents during Billy's show.
immoral_action: Jimmy heckles Billy during the show to try and throw him off his game.

norm: It is wrong to impede someone's academic success.
situation: James' parents often criticize him for struggling in school, and he feels envious of his sister's straight A's.
intention: James wants his parents to nag him about his grades less.
moral_action: James gets one of his teacher to recommend an assessment for learning disabilities.
immoral_action: James starts sneaking into his sister's room at night and burning her homework, distracting his parents.

norm: It is wrong to mislead others to fit in.
situation: Nancy has just joined a new reading club in her area.
intention: Nancy wants to impress her new club friends.
moral_action: Nancy comes to the book club with some articles about the author to give them some context.
immoral_action: Nancy tells her friends that she is friends with the author of the book they are reading, even though she isn't.

norm: It's wrong to try to sabotage a group's success.
situation: Black people have been getting a lot of roles in movies lately, but Juan noticed that there aren't a lot of role for Hispanics.
intention: Juan wants more roles in movies for HIspanics.
moral_action: Juan starts his own organization that helps Hispanic actors get roles.
immoral_action: Juan becomes anti-black and starts posting on social media on how black people have low IQ.

norm: It is wrong to insult someone else's skills.
situation: Joe is an art director at a games company watching an employee draw.
intention: Joe wants to comment on the drawing.
moral_action: Joe says the drawing can have some improvements and points out where to do them.
immoral_action: Joe says the drawing is not up to level and the artist is not talented.

norm: It is wrong to ruin someone else's dreams.
situation: Brad is talking to his son, Jay, who wants to be a writer.
intention: Brad wants to impart practical knowledge that will help Jay later in life.
moral_action: Brad suggests finding a balance between developing art skills, and preforming practical work.
immoral_action: Brad says that Jay isn't clever or interesting enough to be a writer, and if Jay was, would not make any money, and Jay should work in a factory.

norm: It's wrong to waste resources when you don't need to
situation: Jessica is going through her evening routine before bedtime and just put some toothpaste on her toothbrush and wet it under running water.
intention: Jessica wants to finish brushing her teeth.
moral_action: Jessica makes sure to turn the faucet off as soon as her toothbrush is wet and turns it on again to rinse the brush off once shes done brushing.
immoral_action: Jessica leaves the faucet running while she brushes her teeth.

norm: It's wrong to ruin other peoples good time.
situation: Billy is not having a particularly good time with his friend Robin while they are at another friend's house.
intention: Billy wants to do something else.
moral_action: Billy tells Robin that he is going to go out and get some food to bring back to get some fresh air.
immoral_action: Billy tells Robin that he wants to leave, that he's not having any fun at all.

norm: It is wrong to falsify experimentation evidence.
situation: Victor is a scientist who has been doing experimentation on some viruses.
intention: Victor needs to publish a paper about his findings.
moral_action: Victor is honest about his findings and warns people about the dangers of the virus.
immoral_action: Victor underplays the danger of the virus in order to make his findings sound less alarmist.

norm: It's wrong to disappoint your customers with gross negligence.
situation: Tom is managing a restaurant and is short-staffed during the busy lunch hour.
intention: Tom wants to keep up with the customers' orders.
moral_action: Tom puts on an apron and goes into the kitchen to help prepare food during the rush.
immoral_action: Tom directs one of the bus boys to go into the kitchen and help cook and serve food.

norm: It's wrong to ruin something someone else enjoys for them.
situation: Frasier just finished watching the new hit movie and is talking to a friend who hasn't seen it but wants to.
intention: Frasier wants to talk about the movie.
moral_action: Fraiser expresses to his friend how much he enjoyed the movie but avoids spoiling the plot so his friend can see it for themself.
immoral_action: Fraiser spoils all the twists and turns of the movie to his friend.

norm: It's wrong to try and ruin someone else good time.
situation: Jim's neighbor is holding a big party, and he suspects there is underage drinking going on.
intention: Jim has to decide whether to call the police.
moral_action: Jim decides to leave the kids alone and let them be.
immoral_action: Jim calls the police and alerts them there are kids drinking at a party near him.

norm: It's wrong to blame significant others for accidents that happen.
situation: Mark was driving in a car with his wife Kate when he crashed into another car.
intention: Mark wants to say something to Kate.
moral_action: Mark tells Kate that it was his fault and that he feels very bad about it.
immoral_action: Mark tells Kate that they wouldn't be in this situation if she didn't talk so much.

norm: It's wasteful to throw away a new piece of clothing.
situation: Jill got a shirt for Christmas that she doesn't like.
intention: Jill wants to get rid of the shirt.
moral_action: Jill donates the shirt to charity.
immoral_action: Jill throws the shirt in the trash.

norm: It's irresponsible to shirk work in favor of camping.
situation: Jessica is looking at a travel website.
intention: Jessica wants to go on a trip.
moral_action: Jessica takes a few days off to go camping in the local state park.
immoral_action: Jessica calls in sick to work to camping at a nearby lake resort.

norm: It's rude to use other people's wifi.
situation: Karla's home Wifi stopped working, and she is driving around looking for a signal.
intention: Karla wants to check her email.
moral_action: Karla sees a public library that is open and goes inside to use the Wifi there.
immoral_action: Karla notices an unlocked Wifi network outside of somebody's house and uses it on her laptop.

norm: It is rude to get someones password without asking them.
situation: Will is bored after a long day of work and doesn't know what to do.
intention: Will wants to watch a good movie or TV show.
moral_action: Will offers to pay for half the Netflix subscription, so they can share it.
immoral_action: Will gets on his roommate's laptop to get the saved Netflix password.

norm: It's rude to leave clean-up activities to other camp goers.
situation: Tony has been camping for a couple of nights at a campsite in the mountains, and today he is going back home.
intention: Tony wants to deal with his campsite before he goes.
moral_action: Tony thoroughly cleans up the campsite and leaves it in the same state as he found it.
immoral_action: Tony puts out the fire he made but leaves a bunch of trash lying around.

norm: Reddit is a poor place to get relationship advice from.
situation: Jim has become suspicious of his girlfriend who has been coming home later than usual.
intention: Jim wants advice for confronting her.
moral_action: Using advice from his sister, Jim expresses his concerns regarding her coming home later and later.
immoral_action: Using advice from the relationship advice subreddit, Jim accuses his girlfriend of meeting other guys behind his back.

norm: It's bad form to use handicap stalls if you're non-handicapped.
situation: Bob enters a public bathroom right before a man on crutches, and notices that the only open stall is the handicapped stall.
intention: Bob wants to go to the bathroom.
moral_action: Bob waits until a stall opens up, and he uses that one.
immoral_action: Bob decides he can't wait, and uses the handicap stall.

norm: It's rude to leave someone because their body changed.
situation: Tammy feels less attracted to her partner after they have put on a lot of weight.
intention: Tammy wants to be in a passionate relationship.
moral_action: Tammy makes going to the gym a couple's activity.
immoral_action: Tammy leaves her partner for someone who is more attractive.

norm: It's rude to judge someone who hasn't seen Blade Runner.
situation: Chris is talking with a group of his friends about different movies the they've seen.
intention: Chris wants to find out who has seen Blade Runner.
moral_action: When Chris finds out one of his friends hasn't seen Blade Runner, he invites her over to his house for a movie night.
immoral_action: When his friend says he's never seen Blade Runner, Chris makes fun of him.

norm: It is rude to desecrate a grave.
situation: James' high school bully Andy was hit by a bus and buried in a local cemetary.
intention: James wants closure on his resentment towards Andy.
moral_action: James writes a letter to Andy about all of his resentment, then burns it.
immoral_action: James knocks over Andy's tombstone and pees on his grave.

norm: It's rude to lie about which school you attended.
situation: Bob wants to come up with something interesting to say to people at parties.
intention: Bob wants to impress people.
moral_action: Bob decides to instead talk about the chess tournament he won as a kid.
immoral_action: Bob starts telling people that he went to Harvard.

norm: It's rude to delete people's numbers.
situation: Jane likes to clear out clutter on her phone from time to time.
intention: Jane wants to get rid of stuff on her phone.
moral_action: Jane isn't sure if the numbers are important, so she keeps them just in case.
immoral_action: Jane deletes a bunch of phone numbers that she doesn't recognize.

norm: It's rude to keep someone else's USB drive.
situation: Katie would just take usb drives out of computers and keep them.
intention: Katie wants to own more USB drives.
moral_action: Katie decides to stop taking random USB drives and buy her own.
immoral_action: Katie keeps taking usb drives that she finds and uses them herself.

norm: It's rude to judge someone based on their footwear.
situation: Dani is out at a restaurant and her date arrives wearing some old beat up shoes.
intention: Dani wants to be with someone who can provide for her.
moral_action: Dani decides to look past the shoes and try to enjoy the date.
immoral_action: Dani loses interest because she assumes that he doesn't have enough money.

norm: It's rude to make comments about someone's worn out shoes.
situation: Lucas is at his first day back in class and notices his friend Jessica's old sneakers.
intention: Lucas wants to talk to Jessica.
moral_action: Lucas says hi to Jessica and notices her old sneakers but declines to say anything.
immoral_action: Lucas says hi to Jessica and points out that her sneakers look terrible.

norm: It's wrong to downvote posts just because they are new.
situation: Stacy posted an awesome selfie on a subreddit but people are ignoring it in favor of newer posts.
intention: Stacy wants people to see her post on the subreddit.
moral_action: Stacy start linking her Reddit post outside of Reddit so more people see it.
immoral_action: Stacy starts downvoting newer posts so that her post is seen.

norm: It's poor taste to make a joke about beheadings.
situation: Keith is watching some Youtube videos and comes across one about the guillotine.
intention: Keith wants to leave a comment on the video.
moral_action: Keith makes a tasteful comment about how horrible the guillotine is as a method of execution.
immoral_action: Keith leaves a comment making a really off-color joke about the deaths discussed in the video.

norm: It's rude to ask someone how they got their scars.
situation: Jack was at a bar, and the bartender there has scars on her face.
intention: Jack wants to talk to the bartender.
moral_action: Jacks asks the bartender how long she's been working at that bar.
immoral_action: Jack asks the bartender how she ended up with those marks on her face.

norm: it is inconsiderate to do a poor parking job
situation: Bill drives to a meeting and sees two parking spaces near where he's going.
intention: Bill wants to park his car.
moral_action: Bill parks his car taking care to use only one parking space.
immoral_action: Bill parks his car quickly and carelessly taking up both spaces with his car.

norm: It's rude to delete other people's data.
situation: Charlie was working on his brother's computer for a class assignment.
intention: Charlie needs more space to save his work.
moral_action: Charlie gets a thumb drive to save his class project on.
immoral_action: Charlie deletes some of the files from his brother's computer.

norm: It's rude to point out that someone was adopted.
situation: Mike is at a restaurant with Leah who was adopted, and some other friends when Leah mentions she has a fear of abandonment.
intention: Mike wants to tell the group why he thinks Leah has that fear.
moral_action: Mike tells the group that it's totally understandable that Leah feels that way as it's part of the human condition, and we all feel it.
immoral_action: Mike tells the group that Leah was adopted so since her parents abandoned her she thinks others will too.

norm: It's rude to dictate what your children's surnames will be.
situation: John and Andrea are expecting their first child, which they know will be a boy from the ultrasound.
intention: John wants to name his new son after his grandfather, Bob.
moral_action: John explains that he was very close to his grandfather and appeals to Andrea to allow him name their first son Bob.
immoral_action: John insists that the name of their first son will be Bob, and he will not entertain any other ideas.

norm: People should never intentionally expose another person to a disease.
situation: Mary works in a grocery store.
intention: Mary wants to interact with customers.
moral_action: Mary wears a mask while at her register and makes small talk with her customers.
immoral_action: Mary doesn't wear a mask or gloves while talking to customers at her register.

norm: You should not disrespect the dead.
situation: Dolly is walking through a cemetery with her friends late at night.
intention: Dolly wants to have a little bit of fun in the cemetery.
moral_action: Dolly and her friends bring a ouiji board with them and sit respectfully amongst the tombstones to play.
immoral_action: Dolly and her friends kick over a bunch of headstones and run away laughing.

norm: You shouldn't wish that people die.
situation: Jill has a coworker she really hates named Julie who works at the desk next to hers.
intention: Jill wants Julie to leave her alone.
moral_action: Jill asks management to move her desk away from Julie so Jill can focus better on her work.
immoral_action: Jill tells Julie she wishes she'd just drop dead so Jill wouldn't have to listen to her anymore.

norm: You shouldn't overwork yourself to death.
situation: Jasper and Kait are lying in bed together on their mobile devices.
intention: Jasper wants to spend their time productively.
moral_action: Jasper decides to listen to foreign language study podcasts while they fall asleep.
immoral_action: Jasper continues doing tasks for work on their phone while in be, staying up for several hours.

norm: You shouldn't wish to die.
situation: Bob wishes for no traffic while going to work, he runs into none - thinking himself lucky he wishes for a raise and gets one an hour later.
intention: Bob wants to see what happens next.
moral_action: Bob decides to be careful and wishes for his sports team to win.
immoral_action: Bob when going home sees that someone crashed into his car - in anger he remarks I wish I were dead.

norm: You shouldn't try to make people sick.
situation: Louisa has been coughing and sneezing for the past few days, and she thinks she might have Covid-19.
intention: Louisa needs to go shopping at the grocery store.
moral_action: Louisa decides to quarantine herself and stays at home until she feels better.
immoral_action: Louisa doesn't wear a mask and coughs while inside the grocery store.

norm: You should not desecrate graves.
situation: Tommy is walking through a graveyard with friends and is bored.
intention: Tommy wants to have a good time, even in the graveyard.
moral_action: Tommy starts looking for strange quotes among the headstones and reads them to his friends.
immoral_action: Tommy starts kicking over flowers and wreaths and draws silly faces on the headstones.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone to kill themselves.
situation: Judy is angry at her husband Sergio over an unpaid utility bill, but she has no idea how depressed he has been.
intention: Judy wants to say something to Sergio about the bill.
moral_action: Judy tells Sergio to pay the bill and offers to pay some of it herself, in case hes short on funds.
immoral_action: Judy tells Sergio to pay the bill or, if he cant, just get it over with and end his life.

norm: You shouldn't fake medical disorders.
situation: Brianna has to give a big presentation in her English class but is nervous that she will embarrass herself in front of the class.
intention: Brianna wants to avoid giving the presentation.
moral_action: Brianna tells her teacher that she is nervous about talking to such a large group and that she cannot do it.
immoral_action: Brianna tells her teacher that she has a condition that causes her to faint when she is nervous in front of a large crowd, so she cannot do the presentation.

norm: You shouldn't do things that may harm someone else's health.
situation: Martin is looking after his little son at home while his wife is running some errands.
intention: Martin wants to smoke the cigar one of his clients gave him as a gift.
moral_action: Martin waits for his wife to return, then goes outside to smoke the cigar, because he doesn't want his son to inhale the smoke.
immoral_action: Martin smokes the cigar inside, disregarding the fact that his little son is in the room, which soon fills with thick smoke.

norm: You shouldn't joke about having an affair.
situation: Saul made some new friends and is out at the bar with them.
intention: Saul wants his new friends to think he is funny.
moral_action: Saul makes a bunch of cheesy dad jokes.
immoral_action: Saul jokes about sleeping with another women besides his wife.

norm: You shouldn't try to fool someone with dementia.
situation: Samantha's grandmother has dementia and her favorite video game was just remastered, but she can't afford to purchase it.
intention: Samantha wants to obtain a copy of the new game.
moral_action: Samantha tells her grandmother she really wants to buy a new game but is broke.
immoral_action: Samantha approached her grandmother, tells her that it's her birthday and asks for birthday money.

norm: You shouldn't feign a mental illness to get someone's attention.
situation: Jay is a musician who has been having trouble getting attention for his music.
intention: Jay wants to get his music out there.
moral_action: Jay offers to perform at concerts for an affordable price.
immoral_action: Jay writes a post on social media about making music while being bipolar.

norm: You shouldn't fake your own death.
situation: Mary is in an online relationship with Tim, and is growing bored with it.
intention: Mary wants to break up with Tim.
moral_action: Mary is honest with Tim that the relationship isn't working out and breaks up with him.
immoral_action: Mary pretends she has cancer and makes Tim think she has died.

norm: You shouldn't lay guilt trips on people.
situation: Maxwell's wife is a homemaker and Maxwell thinks she should always clean up after him when he gets home from his construction job.
intention: Maxwell wants to avoid doing chores when he gets home from work.
moral_action: Maxwell makes a deal with his wife that he won't do evening housekeeping during the work week but will do whatever she asks on the weekend.
immoral_action: Maxwell tells his wife that his job is much more difficult than hers, so he doesn't help her when he arrives home after working.

norm: You shouldn't fake mental illness.
situation: Joe, who forgot to bring his wallet to the store, sees a mentally ill man pan handling on the sidewalk.
intention: Joe wants to earn some money for the store.
