moral_action: Joe does some back flips and break dances on the sidewalk.
immoral_action: Joe panhandles while prentending that the has a personality disorder.

norm: You shouldn't be the cause of someone else's death.
situation: Nancy is driving to work when her cell phone starts ringing, while ahead is a stop sign intersection with a pedestrian crossing.
intention: Nancy wants to answer her phone.
moral_action: Nancy stops at the stop sign and answers the phone while stopped.
immoral_action: Nancy reaches out and answers her phone, taking her eyes off the road.

norm: One should not put others at risk of disease infection.
situation: Larry is sick but needs to buy himself groceries for the upcoming week.
intention: Larry wants spend as little money as possible.
moral_action: Larry takes advantage of a promotion for first time users of a grocery delivery service and gets a good deal on groceries delivered to his home.
immoral_action: Larry goes to the grocery store and cannot stop coughing as he walks down the store's aisles looking for bargains.

norm: You shouldn't think about suicide.
situation: Jeff has had a run of bad luck both at work and in his personal life, and so he has sunk into depression.
intention: Jeff wants to put an end to his pain.
moral_action: Jeff decides to see a psychologist for his depression.
immoral_action: Jeff contemplates taking his own life.

norm: You shouldn't fake illness.
situation: Charles hates crowds, and over thirty people will be attending his family reunion hosted in one building.
intention: Charles wants to relax.
moral_action: Charles requests that a patio area of sorts be placed outside, so he can be at the reunion anxiety free.
immoral_action: Charles tells his family that he can't go to the reunion because he has a cold.

norm: It is rude to talk back to a parent.
situation: Billy is at home where his dad is admonishing him for not mowing the lawn like he was supposed to.
intention: Billy wants to express displeasure to his father.
moral_action: Billy walks outside to mow the lawn but gives his father the silent treatment the rest of the day.
immoral_action: "Billy tells his father to ""shove it"" and to mow the lawn himself if he thinks it's so importanat."

norm: It is rude to disobey your family.
situation: Susan is trying to plan out her college career.
intention: Susan wants to pick a major.
moral_action: Susan knows her mother would like her to be a pre-med major and follows that path.
immoral_action: Susan knows her mother would like her to be a pre-med major and chooses to major in art instead.

norm: It's rude to leave loved ones hanging.
situation: Mary is on a phone call with her loving brother and while on the phone with him, gets another call from her insurance.
intention: Mary wants to deal with the incoming call somehow.
moral_action: Mary deals with the incoming call by telling insurance to call back later and immediately jumps back into conversation with her brother.
immoral_action: Mary deals with the new incoming call by telling her brother to wait for her to finish talking to insurance.

norm: It's disrespectful to not listen to your parents.
situation: Sarah is forbidden by her parents to go to a party.
intention: Sarah wants to have fun.
moral_action: Sarah spends the night watching a movie with her parents.
immoral_action: Sarah goes to the party and it is broken up by police.

norm: It is rude to disrespect your parents.
situation: Randal learns about a concert at midnight from a radio ad, but his parents don't want him out past 9pm by himself.
intention: Randal wants to go to the concert.
moral_action: Randal asks his parents to go with him to the concert.
immoral_action: Randal sneaks out of the house to go to the concert alone.

norm: It's rude to ignore your parents.
situation: Jacob is a teenager living with his parents and is asked to clean up his messy bedroom.
intention: Jacob needs to decide whether to obey his parents.
moral_action: Jacob decides to clean up his room before playing some video games.
immoral_action: Jacob decides to play video games all day instead of cleaning up his room.

norm: It is rude to not help your parents.
situation: Dave is at home when his father calls and asks Dave if he would mind coming over to help him clean the garage.
intention: Dave wants to answer his father's question.
moral_action: Dave tells his father that he would be glad to help him and that he'll be right over.
immoral_action: Dave tells his father that he is really busy the rest of the day, and he just can't put anything off right now, so he can't come.

norm: It is disrespectful to swear at your parents.
situation: Jim comes home past his curfew and his waiting parents tell him he's grounded for a month.
intention: Jim wants to show his displeasure about being grounded.
moral_action: Jim explain to his parents that he was late because their was a wreck on the highway.
immoral_action: Jim curses out both his parents for being so strict and for grounding him.

norm: It's considered rude and unkind to exclude family members.
situation: Jake invites his sister Maggie to hang out with his friends for the night.
intention: Jake wants to entertain his friends.
moral_action: Jake shows his friends Maggie's favorite movie.
immoral_action: Jake starts a game of Smash Brothers handing a controller to everyone but Maggie.

norm: It is disrespectful not to obey one's parents
situation: Steve is watching cartoons in the living room when his mother comes in and asks if he can take the family dog for a walk.
intention: Steve wants to answer his mother's request.
moral_action: Steve agrees and takes the dog for a nice walk around the neighborhood.
immoral_action: Steve tells his mother he's busy and to quit bothering him.

norm: It is rude to yell at your sibling.
situation: Jeff is at home watching his favorite TV show when his sister grabs the remote and changes the channel.
intention: Jeff wants to react to his sister changing the channel.
moral_action: Jeff explains how the previous show was his favorite and plainly asks his sister to change the channel back.
immoral_action: Jeff loudly demands his sister change the channel back to the show he was watching.

norm: It's rude to snap at your parents.
situation: Jason is having a discussion with is parents about his college plans, which his parents don't approve of.
intention: Jason wants to put a quick end to the discussion.
moral_action: Jason tells his parents he understands their concern and appreciates how much they care about his future, then changes the topic.
immoral_action: Jason tells his parents that the discussion is over and that he doesn't want to hear one more word from them.

norm: It's rude to make fun of a sibling.
situation: Maria asks her brother Ray how she looks in her large blue hat.
intention: Ray wants to respond.
moral_action: Ray tells Maria that the hat looks good on her.
immoral_action: Ray tells Maria that she looks funny in the hat.

norm: It is disrespectful to interfere any parents personal life.
situation: Angel is sitting with her mom over coffee at the breakfast table.
intention: Angel wants to talk about her mom's new boyfriend.
moral_action: Angel asks her mom questions about her new beau.
immoral_action: Angel tells her mom she has to choose between her boyfriend and her.

norm: It is rude to abandon your family.
situation: Ian watches his little brother get onto the teacup ride when his friends ask him invite him to the roller coaster.
intention: Ian wants to have fun.
moral_action: Ian plays a multiplayer game on his cell phone while he waits for his younger brother.
immoral_action: Ian gets onto the roller coaster with his friends.

norm: It is disrespectful to yell at your parent.
situation: Owen's father had punished him for a week, and he and Owen were having a discussion.
intention: Owen wants his father to change his mind.
moral_action: Owen talks to his father and explains why he did what he did that got him in trouble.
immoral_action: Owen begins to yell at his father and call him all sorts of names.

norm: It's disrespectful to spit in your parents' faces.
situation: Marla wants to go to a party with friends but her parents tell her she can't.
intention: Marla wants to respond to her parents.
moral_action: Marla tells her parents that she will be responsible and come home early.
immoral_action: Marla gathers up saliva and spits it at the faces of her parents.

norm: It's rude to ignore family.
situation: John is at home with his friends and his wife Mindy, who wants to go out to eat with him.
intention: John wants to play a game with his friends.
moral_action: John tells his friends he's going out to dinner but will be back to play with them soon.
immoral_action: John pretends he didn't hear Mindy and continues laughing and playing with his friends.

norm: It is rude to ignore your elders.
situation: Timmy'a grandmother asks him to get her something from the other room.
intention: Timmy wants to watch TV.
moral_action: Timmy says okay and gets his grandmother what she wanted from the other room before starting to watch TV.
immoral_action: Timmy goes to the TV and starts watching a show as if he didn't hear his grandmother's request at all.

norm: It's rude to insult your parents.
situation: Sam's father says something over dinner that Sam knows is factually incorrect.
intention: Sam wants to correct his father.
moral_action: Sam informs his father that what he said was factually incorrect and explains why.
immoral_action: Sam tells his father that he's and idiot and what he said is totally wrong.

norm: It's inconsiderate to speak negatively about someone else's parents.
situation: Ted's friend Jamal is talking to him about being raised by a single mom.
intention: Ted wants to talk to Jamal about his mom.
moral_action: Ted tells Jamal that he's lucky to have been raised by such a strong woman.
immoral_action: Ted tells Jamal that she must've slept with a lot of men in the past.

norm: It's rude to yell at your family.
situation: Igor is relaxing and taking a nap in the living room when his nephew Clark runs through screaming and waking him up.
intention: Igor wants to reprimand Clark for waking him up.
moral_action: Igor tells Clark that he's trying to nap so Clark should maybe go play outside.
immoral_action: Igor screams at Clark and tells him he's exhausted and Clark should shut up and let him rest.

norm: It's rude to exclude family members from your life.
situation: Martin is in the living room with his family as they all mull about.
intention: Martin wants to tell his family they are going on vacation.
moral_action: Martin tells the family that he bought vacation tickets for everyone in the family.
immoral_action: Martin tells the family that he bought vacation tickets for everyone in the family except Mary, the middle daughter.

norm: It's rude to expect your siblings to do your chores.
situation: Taylor and Joe are doing their weekly chores and Taylor begins to feel tired and bored.
intention: Taylor wants to find a way to get out of her chores.
moral_action: Taylor makes a deal with Joe to do his chores the following week if he does her chores today.
immoral_action: Taylor tells Joe that the rest of the list is for him and walks out of the room.

norm: It is rude to charge family for small things.
situation: Sally's sister was sick with the flu and could not cook or get to the store.
intention: Sally wants to get some dinner to her sister to be sure she gets well.
moral_action: Sally leaves the soup for sister and wishes tell her to get well.
immoral_action: Sally asks her sister for $5.75 to cover the cost of the soup.

norm: It is rude to get into someone else's family business.
situation: Dinah is married to a man with a dysfunctional family.
intention: Dinah wants to help her husband deal with his family.
moral_action: Dinah stands by her husband and gives him advice about his family when he asks her for it.
immoral_action: Dinah pretends to be her husband and sends his family members messages calling them out for their poor behavior.

norm: It's rude to ban your child's friend from seeing them.
situation: Jill has very strict controls on what type of movies her son is allowed to watch, and his friends' parents are more lenient.
intention: Jill wants to make sure her son only watches G-rated movies.
moral_action: Jill insists that her son's friends always come over to her house to play.
immoral_action: Jill disrupts every friendship her son starts to form because she doesn't trust the other parents to enforce her rules.

norm: It's rude to cut your children out of your will.
situation: Jack was about to pass away, and he wanted to change his will.
intention: Jack wants to finish changing his will.
moral_action: Jack divides his estate among his kids evenly and equally.
immoral_action: Jack left his son everything and his daughter nothing because the latter was of a different religion.

norm: It's rude to steal from your family.
situation: Bob sees the expensive jewelry lying around in his sister's room.
intention: Bob wants to exit the room.
moral_action: Bob turns around and exits the room and advises his sister to keep those in a safe.
immoral_action: Bob takes all of those watches and quickly heads to the pawn shop.

norm: It's rude to exclude a single family member from celebrations.
situation: Jessie is getting married and her mother asks her to invite a cousin she had a falling out with.
intention: Jessie wants to make a decision regarding her mothers request.
moral_action: Jessie agrees to bury the hatchet and invites her cousin.
immoral_action: Jessie refuses to invite her cousin to the wedding.

norm: It's rude not to include everyone in shared family activities.
situation: Jim is visiting his brother and sister over the holidays.
intention: Jim wants to watch a holiday movie.
moral_action: Jim puts on a movie that he knows both of his siblings will enjoy.
immoral_action: Jim puts on a movie that he knows only he and his sister will like.

norm: It's rude not let a sibling use your things.
situation: Jenny's sister asks to use Jenny's makeup because she wants to look nice for her date that evening.
intention: Jenny wants to respond to her sister's request.
moral_action: Jenny says it's okay for her sister to use Jenny's makeup and even helps her sister put it on.
immoral_action: Jenny tells her sister to get her own makeup if she wants to wear makeup.

norm: It's rude to not want to help out a neighbor.
situation: Gannon's neighbor Zelda is having a problem with mice in her house, and he has several cats.
intention: Gannon wants to decide to help her or not.
moral_action: Gannon decides to lend Zelda the cats to hunt down the mice.
immoral_action: Gannon decides Zelda can deal with her own mice.

norm: It's rude not to introduce your parents to your partner.
situation: Sean, who lives with his parents, has a new girlfriend and brings her home for a relaxing night.
intention: Sean wants to go to his part of the house.
moral_action: Sean enters the house and introduces his girlfriend to his parents, then goes to his room.
immoral_action: Sean says a quick hello to his parents and leads his girlfriend past them to go to his room.

norm: It's rude to ignore your partner's family.
situation: Steve is at his in-laws for Thanksgiving when his father-in-law says he's going to turn on the Dallas Cowboys game.
intention: Steve wants to watch the football game.
moral_action: Steve goes into the living room and watches the game with his father-in-law.
immoral_action: Steve goes out onto the porch by himself and watches the game on his phone.

norm: It's rude to turn down family members.
situation: Oscar lives in a different town than his family and his brother is calling him to let him know he is in Oscar's town while travelling.
intention: Oscar wants to hear what his brother wants.
moral_action: Oscar finds out his brother is in town and wants to see Oscar so Oscar says for him to come stop by.
immoral_action: Oscar finds out his brother is in town and wants to see Oscar but Oscar tells him he is busy.

norm: It's rude not to share with a sibling.
situation: Jane, who lives with her family, has just brought home a large order of chili fries which her sister wants to eat with her.
intention: Jane wants to eat enough to feel satiated.
moral_action: Jane gives her sister a small portion making sure to leave most of it for herself.
immoral_action: Jane refuses to give her sister any of the fries because she is hungry.

norm: It's rude not to speak to one's siblings.
situation: Katie is going to Thanksgiving dinner at her parents house and her sister will be there who she is angry with.
intention: Katie wants to avoid fighting during the holiday.
moral_action: Katie approaches her sister ahead of time and talks the issue out with her.
immoral_action: Katie does not speak to her sister the whole time she's at Thanksgiving dinner.

norm: It is rude to misbehave at a family funciton.
situation: Dewey is a child and his family is at a wedding for his aunt.
intention: Dewey wants to have fun.
moral_action: Dewey uses his imagination to pretend he is somewhere else during the ceremony and is on a grand adventure.
immoral_action: Dewey gets up and starts to dance and sing right in the middle of the ceremony part of the wedding.

norm: It's rude to your family to prioritize work over them.
situation: Blaine has been told that he must work overtime on Saturday and then his mom calls to invite him to a family reunion on Saturday.
intention: Blaine wants to respond to his mom about coming over on Saturday.
moral_action: Blaine tells his mom that he'll call in sick to work on Saturday and be there for sure.
immoral_action: Blaine tells his mom that he is being made to work overtime that day and that he can't come.

norm: You shouldn't do a U-turn if it's not allowed.
situation: Maura is driving to the mall.
intention: Maura wants to go in the first entrance.
moral_action: Maura pays attention and slows down near her destination.
immoral_action: Maura misses the entrance and makes a U-turn.

norm: You shouldn't drive while distracted.
situation: Sally is driving to her friends house.
intention: Sally wants to enjoy the ride.
moral_action: Sally puts on an audio book she'd been meaning to listen to.
immoral_action: Sally texts with her friend to pass the long ride.

norm: You shouldn't drive when locations are close enough to walk.
situation: Jim is hungry for a cheeseburger and there is a place just one block away.
intention: Jim wants to buy food from the nearby restaurant.
moral_action: Jim walks to the restaurant.
immoral_action: Jim drives his car to the nearby restaurant.

norm: You should not express your rage on the road.
situation: Jason is driving on the highway and a car cuts him off.
intention: Jason wants to let out frustration.
moral_action: Jason mutters under his breath.
immoral_action: Jason pulls up next to the car and flips it off.

norm: You should not drive irresponsibly.
situation: Homer is driving home from work on a busy highway when he encounters heavy traffic.
intention: Homer wants to get home quickly.
moral_action: Homer decides their most be a better route and exits the highway to take back roads to home.
immoral_action: Homer sees an opening and quickly swerves through three lanes of traffic to get into a faster lane.

norm: You shouldn't go out in public when you're contagious
situation: Jen has been sick at home with the flu for several days and is still having symptoms.
intention: Jen wants to get some soup in order to feel better.
moral_action: Jen orders delivery and instructs them to leave it at the door.
immoral_action: Jen goes out to the store while sick to pick up some cans of soup.

norm: You should not drive in a manner than endangers others.
situation: Jim has just been to the dentist and feels dizzy and a little disoriented because of the anesthesia he was given.
intention: Jim wants to get home as soon as possible.
moral_action: Jim realizes he is not in a good condition to drive and takes a cab home.
immoral_action: Jim gets in his car and drives home, despite his condition, which causes him to drive extremely unsafely.

norm: You shouldn't use emergency exit doors unless there's an emergency.
situation: William just finished his shopping at the mall and is at the very back of the building, far from the main exit.
intention: William wants to exit the shopping mall.
moral_action: William walks back through the entire length of the shopping mall and exits through the front doors.
immoral_action: William decides to take a shortcut and leaves through the emergency exit at the back of the building.

norm: You shouldn't run in crowded places
situation: Nate is attending a charity event, and he notices one of his good friends on his way out of the crowded hall.
intention: Nate wants to get to his friend before he leaves the event.
moral_action: Nate calls his friend and asks him to wait for him, then heads towards him, careful not to disturb the people around him.
immoral_action: Nate rushes towards his friend, moving unacceptably fast in the packed hall.

norm: You shouldn't let people drive buzzed.
situation: Henry and Peter are leaving the bar after a night of drinking and Peter is walking to his car and says goodbye to Henry.
intention: Henry wants to respond to Peter's goodbye.
moral_action: Henry tells Peter that he's not letting him drive since he drank and that there is no goodbye since they're both taking the bus together.
immoral_action: Henry tells Peter to have a great night and continues to walk towards the bus stop.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of other races.
situation: Nick and Nancy are a married couple at an old west exhibit where they see a display of Apache Indians in traditional garb.
intention: Nick wants to comment on the display.
moral_action: Nick tells Nancy that the display is so beautiful and vivid, and he feels as he was with the Apache when he looks at it.
immoral_action: Nick tells Nancy that Indians are a ridiculous people for wearing feathers and painting their faces.

norm: You shouldn't segregate events by race.
situation: Sean has to organize a convention, and he's trying to figure out how to group people together.
intention: Sean wants to make everyone happy.
moral_action: Sean puts everyone into random groups by picking names out of a hat.
immoral_action: Sean decides to separate everyone by race, because he thinks they'll all get along.

norm: You shouldn't engage in road rage with people.
situation: Bob is late to work and is stuck in traffic on his way there.
intention: Bob wants to get to work.
moral_action: Bob turns up his music, ignores traffic and starts jamming out to himself.
immoral_action: Bob gets angry and starts yelling at people in traffic through his window.

norm: You shouldn't practice road rage.
situation: Walt is driving in his car when another driver honks at him.
intention: Walt wants to respond to the honk.
moral_action: Walt signals to another lane and gets out of the way of the other driver.
immoral_action: Walt honks back many times and drives very close to the other driver to tell them to pull over.

norm: You shouldn't annoy other drivers.
situation: Jon needs to get to the rightmost lane, but there are cars in it.
intention: Jon wants to switch lanes.
moral_action: Jon slows down and waits for the cars in the right lane to drive past.
immoral_action: Jon quickly cuts off the driver on his right despite them honking.

norm: You shouldn't go somewhere if it's too crowded.
situation: The pandemic is still going on, but Pat really wants to go to a concert that's also being live streamed.
intention: Pat wants to watch the concert.
moral_action: Pat doesn't want to hurt anyone, so he stays home and watches the stream.
immoral_action: Pat wants to have fun, so he decides to go to the concert.

norm: It is irresponsible to start a riot.
situation: John is in downtown Portland taking part in a protest against recent police brutality.
intention: John wants to energize the crowd.
moral_action: John grabs the megaphone and tells the crowd that they should sing amazing grace as they march through the streets.
immoral_action: John grabs the megaphone and tells the crowd to attack the police and destroy all the symbols of capitalism around them.

norm: It's irresponsible to play so raucously that it causes damage.
situation: Hank and his friends are playing flag football outside in the field.
intention: Hank wants to get the guy with the ball.
moral_action: Hank runs behind the player and tears off the player's flags.
immoral_action: Hank charges the player with the ball and tackles him full-force.

norm: It is immoral to commit acts of violence
situation: Jim is being bullied by Sandy who is insulting him and getting in his face.
intention: Jim wants to defend himself.
moral_action: Jim brings up all of the times he had to rescue Sally at work.
immoral_action: Jim pushes Sally away from him hard enough for Sandy to fall onto the floor.

norm: It's immoral to bully or harass another person.
situation: Paul and Greg go to Junior high together.
intention: Paul wants to appear tough in front of others.
moral_action: Paul and Greg become friends and try out for football together.
immoral_action: Paul teases Greg every day.

norm: It's immoral to deceive or lie to another person.
situation: Chad is meeting with a woman he found on the Tinder dating app.
intention: Chad wants the woman to like him.
moral_action: Chad is completely honest with the woman and acts like himself.
immoral_action: Chad tells the woman that he's a doctor even though he's not one.

norm: It's foul to state ignorant opinions as fact.
situation: Barbra is browsing Facebook when she comes across a post on COVID cures.
intention: Barbra wants to interact with the post.
moral_action: Barbra shares a link to official websites with tips on masks and other useful information.
immoral_action: Barbra states a rumor that people can prevent COVID by taking vitamins.

norm: It's immoral to physically harm another person.
situation: Phil is walking on the sidewalk when Aaron who was skateboarding bumps into him and the skateboard hits Phil in the shin painfully.
intention: Phil wants to lash out at Aaron for causing him pain.
moral_action: Phil screams at Aaron that he's an idiot and that he needs to watch where he's going because he hurt him.
immoral_action: Phil grabs Aaron by the throat and begins to punch his face as hard as he can so Aaron can feel pain, too.

norm: It's immoral to cannibalize another person.
situation: Henry is lost and hungry in the middle of nowhere and his friend who was with him just died.
intention: Henry wants to eat something.
moral_action: Henry buries his friend and begins to collect edible plants, so he can eat.
immoral_action: Henry decides that the only way that he can survive is to consume the meat of his friend.

norm: Lying about achievements is detestable behavior.
situation: Hector, who is part of Ryan's friend group, has an annoying habit of one-upping people during conversations.
intention: Ryan wants to tell his friends about his most recent fishing trip.
moral_action: Ryan shows his friends pictures of the trip and ignores Hector's attempts to one-up him.
immoral_action: Ryan tells his friends about the trip and exaggerates the size and number of fish he caught to show up Hector.

norm: It's immoral to purposefully injure another person.
situation: Ian has an important race coming up, and Jake is the only one that can beat him.
intention: Ian wants to win the race.
moral_action: Ian trains as hard as he can in preparation for the race.
immoral_action: Ian sneaks up behind Jake and targets hs knee with a baseball bat.

norm: It's wrong to be a compulsive liar.
situation: Adam is with friends, and they are all sharing wild stories from their pasts.
intention: Adam wants to impress with his stories.
moral_action: Adam thinks of some times in his life that odd things have happened and shares those stories with his friends.
immoral_action: Adam pulls many a story out of thin air that are clearly to good to be true.

norm: It's immoral to sell yourself to someone.
situation: Jamal is a poor person from a West African country, and a man from France offered to buy him to work for him.
intention: Jamal has to respond to the offer.
moral_action: Jamal refuses to sell himself to the man and tells him to leave his country.
immoral_action: Jamal agrees to sell himself to the man because he needs the money.

norm: It's immoral to to be dishonest and manipulative.
situation: Tommy met Rachel on an online dating site, and she likes rich men and Tommy is poor.
intention: Tommy wants Rachel to date him.
moral_action: Tommy tells Rachel he really likes her and what he lacks in income he makes up for in other areas.
immoral_action: Tommy tells Rachel he is a doctor and has a lot of money, and they date.

norm: It is immoral to rob someone
situation: Sean sees that a kid has a new pair of shoes that he likes a lot.
intention: Sean wants the shoes.
moral_action: Sean asks the kid where he bought the pair of shoes.
immoral_action: Sean tells the kid to give him the shoes, or he will be hurt.

norm: It's unethical and immoral to steal from another person.
situation: Josh sees that his neighbor has left their door open and that there is money on a table inside their house.
intention: Josh wants to buy a game.
moral_action: Josh closes his neighbor's door and goes to buy the game he wanted with his own money.
immoral_action: Josh quickly takes the money of his neighbor's table and goes to buy a game with it.

norm: It's immoral to commit a crime against another person.
situation: James doesn't have enough money to buy gas, but he sees that John has a lot of money in his wallet.
intention: James wants to get some money from John.
moral_action: James asks John to lend him the money for gas.
immoral_action: James hits John in the face and takes money from his wallet.

norm: It's immoral to treat people like commodities.
situation: Barry owns a factory and needs to close the current facility and build a bigger facility.
intention: Barry wants to build a bigger facility.
moral_action: Barry builds a bigger facility close to the current facility.
immoral_action: Barry builds a bigger facility on the other side of the country.

norm: It's rude to wear someone else's underwear without their knowledge.
situation: Adam is getting dressed and realizes he has no underwear clean when he see his brother's.
intention: Adam wants clean underwear.
moral_action: Adam does a load of laundry and makes sure the load contains underwear.
immoral_action: Adam takes his brother's clean underwear and wears them for the day.

norm: It's rude to ruin someone else's property.
situation: Grace is playing video games at a friend's house and just lost a very close game.
intention: Grace wants to get rid of her frustration.
moral_action: Grace steps away and takes a few deep breaths to calm herself down.
immoral_action: Grace throws her friend's controller against the wall, breaking it.

norm: It's rude to share information about someone without their permission.
situation: Stacy is with her friend and has some great news about her boyfriend, but she's not sure he would want people to know about it.
intention: Stacy wants to share the news abut her boyfriend.
moral_action: Stacy calls her boyfriend to ask if it's okay to share the news, and he says it is, so she tells her friend about it.
immoral_action: Stacy tells her friend the news about her boyfriend without getting his permission.

norm: It's rude to record a friend without their permission.
situation: Sam is walking near school when he hears his friend Wayne singing.
intention: Sam wants to record Wayne.
moral_action: Sam compliments Wayne and asks if he can record him singing.
immoral_action: Sam walks up unseen, pulls out his phone, and records Wayne.

norm: It's rude to mess with other people's personal property.
situation: Lacy is in the living room with her roommates laptop on the couch.
intention: Lacy wants to lay down.
moral_action: Lacy asks her roommate if she can move the laptop.
immoral_action: Lacy throws the laptop on the floor and it's stepped on.

norm: It' rude to hide people's property from them.
situation: Sam's sister Tammy asks him where her Gameboy is.
intention: Sam wants to respond to Tammy's question.
moral_action: Sam retrieves the Gameboy from his room and hands it to her.
immoral_action: Sam tells Tammy he doesn't know where the Gameboy is, while he hides it in his room, so he can play it.

norm: It's rude to damage other people's property.
situation: Mark and Maggie have an argument which leads to a breakup.
intention: Mark wants to vent his frustrations.
moral_action: Mark writes all of his bad feelings in his journal.
immoral_action: Mark kicks the side of Maggie's car leaving a dent in the side.

norm: It is rude to disrupt someone's belongings without permission.
situation: Sally asks John to watch her bag while she runs to the bathroom.
intention: John wants to use some lip balm on his chapped lips.
moral_action: John waits for Sally to get back from the bathroom and asks if she has lip balm.
immoral_action: John goes through Sally's bag to look for lip balm.

norm: It is rude to sneak around someone else's property.
situation: Lucy has just moved into a new neighborhood.
intention: Lucy wants to get to know her next door neighbor.
moral_action: Lucy rings the neighbor's doorbell and introduces herself.
immoral_action: Lucy tries to sneak around the neighbor's house and peek into their windows to see what they're like.

norm: It's rude to destroy other people's property.
situation: Jason is taking a shortcut home though an alley when his way is blocked by a locked gated fence.
intention: Jason wants to get home.
moral_action: Jason decides to just change his path and take the long way home.
immoral_action: Jason kicks open the gate breaking the lock in the process and continues to his house.

norm: It's rude to record someone without permission.
situation: Akihito notices a model standing in front of him while he's gathering footage for an advertisement.
intention: Akihito wants to make a good advertisement.
moral_action: Akihito decides to move to another location where he films the local wildlife.
immoral_action: Akihito films the model from a distance from various angles.

norm: It's rude to sell things that belong to someone else.
situation: Linda agrees to store some of her sister's furniture and other belongings in her house.
intention: Linda wants to earn some extra money.
moral_action: Linda and her sister agree on a moderate storage fee for the trouble.
immoral_action: Linda later claims ownership over the items and proceeds to sell them as she pleases.

norm: It's rude to steal someone's underwear.
situation: Carl is at a gym to workout.
intention: Carl wants to get dressed after taking a shower.
moral_action: Carl puts on boxer shorts he stored in a locker.
immoral_action: Carl takes boxers from a pile of clothes he found and puts them on.

norm: It's rude to move others' belongings without their permission.
situation: Chris is cleaning his dorm and comes across baggages belonging to his roommate.
intention: Chris wants to consider moving the baggages.
moral_action: Chris chooses to leave his roommate's baggages alone and focuses on cleaning around it.
immoral_action: Chris decides to move his roommate's baggages into the corner of the room.

norm: It's rude to throw your partner's belongings around.
situation: Jane is cleaning the condo when she finds her husband Josh's underwear in the middle of the living room.
intention: Jane wants to move the underwear.
moral_action: Jane picks up the underwear and gives them to Josh and tells him to never leave them on the floor like that.
immoral_action: Jane picks up the underwear and tosses them out of the window onto the street below.

norm: It's rude to try to make customers leave.
situation: Rudy is the manager of a Costco, and people want to come into the store without wearing masks.
intention: Rudy wants to come up with a compromise.
moral_action: Rudy buys a bunch of masks that he can give to customers that arrive without a mask.
immoral_action: Rudy tells the customers to go home if they're not willing to put on a mask.

norm: It's rude to lie to someone about your backstory.
situation: Bill is preparing his resume for his ongoing job search.
intention: Bill wants to get a good job.
moral_action: Bill is forthright about his work experience and impresses an interviewer with his honesty at a respected company.
immoral_action: Bill purposefully writes his resume in a way that makes it seem as if he has more supervisory experience than he really has.

norm: It's rude to steal something that another person is using.
situation: George's teacher just gave the entire class a writing assignment when he realizes he left his pencils at home.
intention: George wants a writing utensil.
moral_action: George asks his neighbor if he can borrow a pencil for the day.
immoral_action: George snags a pencil off of his neighbors desk when they aren't looking.

norm: It's rude to lie to people about your name.
situation: Fabian is standing at the counter of the fast food restaurant when the cashier asks him his name.
intention: Fabian wants to give a name to the cashier that he will recognize when it is called.
moral_action: Fabian tells the cashier his name is Fabian.
immoral_action: Fabian tells the cashier that his name is Mike Rotch.

norm: It's rude to give away another person's things without permission.
situation: Toby's friend forgets a movie a Toby's house and Toby's brother sees it and asks if he can have it.
intention: Toby wants to answer his brother about whether they can have the movie.
moral_action: Toby says that he'll have to ask his friend if they still want the movie before giving it away.
immoral_action: Toby says his brother can have the movie his friend left behind and gives it to them.

norm: It's rude to sell shoddy products to people.
situation: Chris wants to sell a universal TV remote that only works with half the TVs it says it does.
intention: Chris wants to sell the remote.
moral_action: Chris decides to disassemble the remote and try to find the issue.
immoral_action: Chris puts the remote for sale but leaves all the problems with it out.

norm: It is rude to be dishonest about your contact information.
situation: Marsha is out clubbing when a guy named Jacques asks her for her number.
intention: Marsha wants to avoid giving Jacques her phone number.
moral_action: Marsha tells Jacques that she isn't comfortable with giving her phone number out to strangers.
immoral_action: Marsha gives Jacques the number to a local fast food place, telling him that it is hers.

norm: It's rude to break other people's belongings.
situation: Judy and Simon are playing tag in their parents' house.
intention: Simon wants to catch Judy.
moral_action: Judy stops before getting near the vase and Simon tags her.
immoral_action: Simon bumps into and breaks his parent's vase when he tags Judy.

norm: It's disrespectful to destroy other people's property
situation: Iris is playing Ark Survival Evolved on Max's xbox, and her house is destroyed by invaders.
intention: Iris wants to express her frustrations.
moral_action: Iris pulls out her phone making an angry tweet about the incident on Twitter.
immoral_action: Iris slams down her remote onto the table hard enough to crack it.

norm: It's rude to throw away someone else's belongings.
situation: Stacy and her family are in the process of moving, and she is going through things in the basement while her mom is at work.
intention: Stacy wants to get rid of some items.
moral_action: Stacy carefully goes through the boxes and only throws out the items that are hers.
immoral_action: Stacy tosses boxes of items at a time, not bothering to check what is inside of them.

norm: You shouldn't jail people just because they aren't feminists.
situation: Christina is the chief of police helping manage tensions between pro-life and pro-choice protesters.
intention: Christina wants to conduct an arrest.
moral_action: Christina apprehends protesters who are disturbing the peace and causing dangerous situations for others.
immoral_action: Christina can't stand the viewpoint of the pro-life protesters and falsely arrests a few of them to prove a point.

norm: You shouldn't exclude people just because they don't drink.
situation: Peter is friends with a lot of people, including some who don't like alcohol.
intention: Peter wants to celebrate his birthday at a local bar with some friends.
moral_action: Peter invites as many people as possible to the celebration.
immoral_action: Peter only invites his alcohol drinking buddies to the birthday celebration.

norm: You shouldn't honk your horn at people if you're angry.
situation: Jason is stuck behind a slow driver.
intention: Jason wants the driver to be out of his way.
moral_action: Jason passes the slow driver at the dotted yellow line.
immoral_action: Jason honks his horn at the driver.

norm: People shouldn't gross out their friends with surgical pictures.
situation: Paul is studying human anatomy with his friends.
intention: Paul wants to share what he's learning.
moral_action: Paul explains the material in his notes to his friends.
immoral_action: Paul points out the parts of the arm by showing them pictures of the arm he dissected during lab.

norm: You shouldn't go shirtless if it makes other people uncomfortable.
situation: John is at a summertime cocktail party outdoors.
intention: John is really hot and wants to cool off.
moral_action: John goes to the bar and orders a frozen margarita to sip on.
immoral_action: John takes of his shirt.

norm: You shouldn't sneeze your boogers on people.
situation: Greg is in a store waiting in line when he feels a sneeze approaching.
intention: Greg wants to sneeze.
moral_action: Greg sneezes into his elbow and tries to be quiet about it.
immoral_action: Greg sneezes on the back of the person in front of him in line, covering him in bodily fluids.

norm: You shouldn't push someone to eat something they're allergic to.
situation: Gerald is planning a birthday party for his son.
intention: Gerald wants his son to have a delicious cake.
moral_action: Gerald bakes a lemon cake which is not as good as his chocolate walnut cake.
immoral_action: Gerald bakes his famous chocolate walnut cake even though his son is allergic to walnuts.

norm: You should not pressure someone to start smoking.
situation: Jill feels insecure about being the only person in her friend group who smokes.
intention: Jill wants to feel less alone.
moral_action: Jill switches to nicotine chewing gum, and gives her friends free packs of normal gum.
immoral_action: Jill persuades two of her friends to take up smoking with her.

norm: You shouldn't disturb other people by being loud and annoying.
situation: Tommy's dad works from home, where Tommy often hangs out with his friends.
intention: Tommy wants to invite his friends over.
moral_action: Tommy's friends come over, and he suggests that they go outside to play Tag.
immoral_action: Tommy's friends come over, and they decide to play Tag, screaming throughout the house.

norm: People shouldn't gross out others by being stinky and dirty.
situation: Brandon is working out at the gym in the morning and gets really sweaty.
intention: Brandon wants to hang out with friends after exercising.
moral_action: Brandon takes a shower before going to see his friends.
immoral_action: Brandon leaves straight from the gym to see his friends, without taking a shower.

norm: You shouldn't have to deal with people smoking around you.
situation: Ace is riding on a no-smoking train when he sees someone nearby lighting a cigarette.
intention: Ace wants to avoid fighting with the man about his cigarettes.
moral_action: Ace notifies a train official about the smoking man.
immoral_action: Ace decides not to say anything and lets the man smoke.

norm: You shouldn't be noisy around people since it disturbs them.
situation: Greg works with Linus, who hates noise while he's working, and has to do a construction job in the office.
intention: Greg wants to work on the construction job.
moral_action: Greg works on the construction job after regular work hours.
immoral_action: Greg works on the construction job during regular work hours.

norm: You shouldn't have to spread sickness to people around you.
situation: Al was at work, but he hadn't been feeling very well.
intention: Al wants to finish the project he was working on.
moral_action: Al leaves and goes home to complete the work remotely while he healed.
immoral_action: Al stays at work in order to finish the project he was working on.

norm: You shouldn't peer pressure a friend into smoking.
situation: Misty is smoking a cigarette during a picnic lunch with her friend, Rita.
intention: Misty wants to share something with Rita.
moral_action: Misty offers Rita some of the potato salad she made.
immoral_action: Misty hands Rita a cigarette multiple times until she gives in and smokes it.

norm: Is wrong to think negatively about yourself
situation: Lily is at that age where she is seeing every flaw in the mirror.
intention: Lily wants to change what she thinks is wrong with her.
moral_action: Lily goes on a diet to lose weight responsibly.
immoral_action: Lily starves herself to make herself look thinner.

norm: Is wrong to alienate people
situation: Jennifer had a bad argument with Fiona recently.
intention: Jennifer wants to respond to the event.
moral_action: Jennifer discusses the problem with Fiona frankly.
immoral_action: Jennifer deletes Fiona from her contact list and refuses to answer any calls from Fiona.

norm: It's wrong to take things that don't belong to you.
situation: Marie is a 10 year old who loves collecting rings.
intention: Marie wants a new ring to add to her collection.
moral_action: Marie saves up her allowance and buys a pretty silver ring at a store in the mall.
immoral_action: Marie shoplifts a pretty ring from a store in the mall.

norm: It's wrong to bully marginalized groups.
situation: Ryan is working with Todd in a class he shares with his crush.
intention: Ryan wants to seem tough in front of his crush.
moral_action: Ryan overhears a classmate bullying Todd for being Native American and stands up to them.
immoral_action: Ryan thinks bullying will make him seem tough, so he mocks Todd for his Native heritage.

norm: Lying to people is wrong.
situation: Denny's rent is due and his roomate has been asking him all week for his portion of the rent money.
intention: Denny wants his roomate to stop asking him for rent money.
moral_action: Denny wires his roomate his portion of the rent money.
immoral_action: Denny tells his roomate that he has already paid his portion of the rent to their landlord.

norm: Bullying people is wrong.
situation: Ken is out on the school playground when he is greeted by a slightly overweight girl named Becky.
intention: Ken wants to respond to Becky.
moral_action: Ken says hello to Becky and invites her to a birthday party later that week.
immoral_action: Ken tells Becky she is fat and convinces others to join in laughing at her.

norm: Taking something that is not yours is wrong.
situation: Sue just got invited to the movies with her friends, but she has no money.
intention: Sue wants to acquire cash.
moral_action: Sue asks her brother Brent to borrow the money and offers to pay him back with interest.
immoral_action: Sue walks into her brother Brent's room and takes money from his piggy bank without asking him first.

norm: It's unfair to bully people
situation: Chad is eating lunch in the school cafeteria and sees that his classmate Billy has several delicious looking cookies on his plate.
intention: Chad wants to taste the cookies.
moral_action: Chad asks Billy if he can try one of the cookies.
immoral_action: Chad pins Billy against the table until he gives him all the cookies.

norm: It's wrong to bully other people.
situation: Alan is a student in a high school.
intention: Alan wants to raise money for a charity.
moral_action: Alan organizes a fundraiser with other students for money.
immoral_action: Alan intimidates other students for money through force.

norm: Is wrong to abuse another person
situation: Sandy enters the office a fight with her husband when she spots her subordinate placing files in the wrong place.
intention: Sandy wants to vent her frustrations .
moral_action: Sandy vents to her employee about her problems with her husband.
immoral_action: Sandy pushes the files out of her employee's hands demanding that she pink up the papers on the floor.

norm: People would be offended if you reject their customs.
situation: John is visiting a foreign country with a culture that his vastly different than his.
intention: John wants to enjoy his vacation.
moral_action: John attempts to immerse himself in the local culture and learn about their customs.
immoral_action: John shows no interest in learning local customs and goes about his business as he pleases.

norm: Hurting other people's feelings is wrong.
situation: Caleb is helping his younger brother do his homework one afternoon.
intention: Caleb wants to give his brother feedback on his progress.
moral_action: Caleb encourages his brother and tells him that he can get the answers himself.
immoral_action: Caleb tells his brother that he is stupid, and he should know all the answers by now.

norm: It's wrong judge someone based on a stereotype.
situation: Roger is a store manager, and a black person walks up to him holding a wallet he found on the floor.
intention: Roger wants to get the wallet to the rightful owner.
moral_action: Roger thanks the person for bringing the wallet and saves it for when the rightful owner returns.
immoral_action: Roger accuses the black person of stealing the wallet and calls the police.

norm: Judging people and kink shaming is wrong.
situation: Alice is meeting a friend who has a new boyfriend and is experimenting with different arousal techniques.
intention: Alice wants to talk about her friend's dating life.
moral_action: Alice asks questions about how effective the arousal techniques are.
immoral_action: Alice says what her friend is doing is against nature and forbidden by a higher power.

norm: Taking things without permission is wrong.
situation: Chloe notices Quentin's iPod while she's visiting his house.
intention: Chloe wants to use the iPod.
moral_action: Chloe asks Quentin if she can borrow the iPod for the night.
immoral_action: Chloe calmly slips the iPod into her pocket while Quentin is in the restroom.

norm: Stealing something from someone is wrong.
situation: Jim is going fishing on a hot afternoon.
intention: Jim wants to keep his drinks cold.
moral_action: Jim goes to the store and buys a cooler.
immoral_action: Jim takes a cooler he sees sitting in his neighbor's yard.

norm: Snooping on someone is wrong.
situation: Eric is feeling suspicious over one of his partner's friends who seems to be too friendly with her.
intention: Eric wants to put his mind at ease.
moral_action: Eric is open about his concerns and brings them up to his partner directly.
immoral_action: Eric goes through his partners devices to check if anything is going on.

norm: Is wrong to hurt yourself
situation: Mindy is at home being abused by John yet again.
intention: Mindy wants to feel less depressed.
moral_action: Mindy separates from her abuser John and only hangs around positive people.
immoral_action: Mindy takes a kitchen knife and stabs herself in the chest out of depression.

norm: It is wrong make someone feel unimportant.
situation: Malcolm is a child who his at his brother's recital, but he is mad at his brother.
intention: Malcolm wants to get back at his brother.
moral_action: Malcolm waits until after the recital to get back at his brother because he knows he practiced hard for it.
immoral_action: Malcolm walks out of the recital when his brother takes the stage.

norm: Taking things that don't belong to you is wrong.
situation: Gabe is walking through his neighborhood and notices a house with many items laying in the yard.
intention: Gabe wants to possess one of the items.
moral_action: Gabe rings the doorbell of the home the item is in front of and makes an offer to buy it from the homeowner.
immoral_action: Gabe casually picks up the item he likes and walks home with it hoping that nobody saw him.

norm: It is wrong to bully people.
situation: Jasmine just transferred to a new school and hasn't made any friends yet.
intention: Jasmine wants to be popular at her new school.
moral_action: Jasmine participated at the talent show telling a lot of jokes.
immoral_action: Jasmine said mean things to a girl at lunch trying to get the other kids to laugh with her.

norm: Behaviour that causes other people discomfort is considered wrong.
situation: Sandra, who speaks Spanish, is out with some friends at a restaurant, including some others that speak Spanish.
intention: Sandra wants to talk with her friends.
moral_action: Sandra talks in a language that everyone understands and involves them in conversation.
immoral_action: Sandra talks in Spanish with the friends that speak Spanish, enjoying a lively conversation.

norm: Doxxing people is wrong.
situation: Jenelle has been getting harassed by someone named Claire on social media.
intention: Jenelle wants Claire to pay for what she's done.
moral_action: Jenelle reports Claire's account for bullying.
immoral_action: Jenelle finds out where Claire lives and posts her address all over social media.

norm: Is wrong to make somebody feel self-conscious
situation: Reina and her friend Kate are going out to dance and Reina shows up wearing an expensive new dress.
intention: Kate wants to greet Reina.
moral_action: Kate looks at Reina and exclaims that she looks amazing in the new dress.
immoral_action: Kate looks at Reina and remarks on the new dress, saying that she thinks it's a bit short.

norm: It's bad to hurt a close friend.
situation: Steve saw Ron do something very embarrassing.
intention: Steve wants to make his friends laugh.
moral_action: Steve tells a funny joke he read over on Reddit to his friends.
immoral_action: Steve tells his friends about what Ron did.

norm: It is bad to make your partner worry.
situation: Jack went out to play video games with his friends and told Ann he would be back by midnight.
intention: Jack wants to hang out with friends all night.
moral_action: Jack calls Ann and lets her know he is having fun and wants to stay but didn't want her to worry.
immoral_action: Jack decides he's going to stay at his friends place and not call Ann to tell her.

norm: It is bad to hurt your friend's feelings
situation: Bill's friend Tom just got a new haircut that isn't so great, and he asks Bill how it looks.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Tom's question.
moral_action: Bill tells Tom that the haircut looks great and that he is very handsome.
immoral_action: Bill tells Tom that his new haircut is ugly and it makes him look funny.

norm: It's bad to lose control of your emotions too frequently.
situation: Sam was just dumped and tends to vent out his frustrations on a regular basis using social media.
intention: Sam wants to confide in someone about what happened.
moral_action: Sam calls a family member to discuss what happened.
immoral_action: Sam writes out a long social media post after feeling self pity.

norm: It's bad to make yourself feel sad.
situation: Chuck is bored and has time to watch a movie to relieve his boredom.
intention: Chuck wants to pick a movie and watch it.
moral_action: Chuck picks a happy movie with a happy ending and watches it.
immoral_action: Chuck feels like watching a sad movie, picks one, and watches it.

norm: It is bad to betray those you love
situation: Alana is good friends with Josh, her sister's boyfriend, who has invited her to a party.
intention: Alana wants to attend the party with Josh.
moral_action: Alana asks her sister if it'd be alright to attend the party with Josh.
immoral_action: Alana and Josh go to the party without telling her sister.

norm: It's bad to make your partner cry.
situation: John sits down to eat the dinner that his girlfriend spent several hours making from scratch.
intention: John wants to give his girlfriend his opinion of the food.
moral_action: John tells his girlfriend the food tastes wonderful and is perfectly cooked.
immoral_action: John tells his girlfriend the food is bland and overcooked.

norm: It is bad to be upset when people are happy.
situation: Mark who's foot is hurting a lot is at the office when Kim wins employee of the month and everyone starts celebrating loudly.
intention: Mark wants to respond to the loud celebration.
moral_action: Mark tells everyone that he thinks Kim is awesome and deserves the award.
immoral_action: Mark tells everyone around him to pipe down because he's in pain, and they're annoying him.

norm: It's bad to get your friend in trouble.
situation: Bobby pulls the fire alarm, and he wasn't seen but the principal thinks it was him.
intention: Bobby wants to get out of trouble.
moral_action: Bobby insists he was nowhere near the fire alarm, and he's got nothing more to say.
immoral_action: Bobby tells the principal that it was Luigi who pulled the fire alarm.

norm: It's bad to find pleasure in pain.
situation: Frank has discovered his girlfriend Lisa likes receiving pain while having sex, and she asks him to indulge her.
intention: Frank wants to respond to Lisa's request.
moral_action: Frank explains his reservations to Lisa and urges her to seek professional help for her unusual desire.
immoral_action: Frank decides to please Lisa and smacks her while they are having sex.

norm: It is bad to hurt those you love
situation: John just lost his job and comes home to his wife Mindy.
intention: John wants to feel strong.
moral_action: John goes to lift some weights and then takes Mindy out to dinner where he confides in her about his job.
immoral_action: John tells Mindy she is not smart or capable and threatens to hit her.

norm: It is bad to lose your temper over minor things
situation: Mark's football team just lost, and a fan of the opponent is bragging about it to Mark.
intention: Mark wants to say something to the fan.
moral_action: Mark tells the fan to be nice since it's not that big of a deal.
immoral_action: Mark tells the fan that he'll knock him out if he says one more thing.

norm: It's bad to abandon a depressed person.
situation: Kyle is talking with his friend Jack who tells him that he's going to kill himself tonight and Kyle should leave now.
intention: Kyle wants to express his desire to stay.
moral_action: Kyle tells Jack he's not going anywhere until Jack agrees to see a psychiatrist and get help for his mental state.
immoral_action: Kyle tells Jack he can kill himself later, and he doesn't want to leave yet since they're having a good time.

norm: It's wrong to sell your body for money.
situation: Jane is told by her landlord that her rent is due and Jane is completely broke.
intention: Jane wants to use the internet to attempt to raise funds for rent.
moral_action: Jane posts a plea online asking for donations to help her through a rough time.
immoral_action: Jane posts an ad online offering sexual favors for high sums of money.

norm: It's wrong to withhold payment to someone for services rendered.
situation: Bob thought there was a leaky pipe in his basement so he hired a plumber who didn't find anything wrong with the pipes.
intention: Bob wants to conclude his business with the plumber.
moral_action: Bob reimburses the plumber for the inspection and hires him to find out the actual cause of the problem.
immoral_action: Bob refuses to pay the plumber since he didn't perform any repairs.

norm: It's wrong to lie to people about money.
situation: Jenny is walking and thinking of some large bills when her friend Paul pulls up and offers her some spare cash.
intention: Jenny wants to respond to Paul's offer.
moral_action: Jenny says that the money will help with some bills and takes it.
immoral_action: Jenny says that she's doing just fine and has plenty of cash, not wanting to embarrass herself.

norm: It's wrong to steal money from someone.
situation: Jim is waiting in line at a coffee shop when he notices a $100 bill fall out of the pocket of the person in front of him.
intention: Jim wants to pick the money up.
moral_action: Jim picks up the money and returns it to the person in front of him.
immoral_action: Jim looks around before picking up the $100 bill and places it in his pocket.

norm: It's wrong not to want to earn money.
situation: Dave is at school watching a guidance counselor do a presentation on different career types when she asks Dave what he wants to be when he grows up.
intention: Dave wants to answer the question.
moral_action: Dave tells the guidance counselor that he wants to be a computer tech like his dad is.
immoral_action: Dave tells the guidance counselor that he wants to get married to a rich woman and that way he won't have to work.

norm: It is wrong to waste your employer's money.
situation: Alex is granted a large amount of autonomy at his job and the company will cover fairly high food costs while traveling.
intention: Alex wants to eat a quality meal and have some drinks to recharge.
moral_action: Alex spends a reasonable amount on food and drinks at a casual restaurant.
immoral_action: Alex orders very expensive food and drink at an expensive restaurant.

norm: It's irresponsible to waste other people's money.
situation: Tom is out at the park with his parents, and he sees an ice cream truck driving by.
intention: Tom wants an ice cream cone.
moral_action: Tom uses some money he has saved up from mowing laws to buy himself an ice cream cone.
immoral_action: Tom takes money from his mom's purse and buys several ice cream treats for himself.

norm: It's foolish to turn down a well-paying job.
situation: Ron has been looking for work when he suddenly gets a call for an interview to be a nursing assistant.
intention: Ron wants to talk to the interviewer.
moral_action: Ron finishes his interview and is offered the job at a rate of $30.00 an hour which he accepts.
immoral_action: Ron finishes his interview and is offered the job at a rate of $30.00 an hour, but turns it down because they only offer 2 weeks in vacation a year .

norm: It is wrong to take money that is not yours.
situation: Tanya is working at the register at a diner that is in the center of town.
intention: Tanya wants to make extra money when she is working on her shift.
moral_action: Tanya asks her boss if she can work a little later that night.
immoral_action: Tanya takes some money out of the register and puts it in her pocket.

norm: It's wrong to scam money from people.
situation: Craig is out of a job and has a computer with a good internet connection at home.
intention: Craig wants to earn money from home.
moral_action: Craig signs up for some online survey sites and does surveys.
immoral_action: Craig runs a Nigerian email scam and gathers people's account numbers, then takes their money for himself.

norm: It's wrong to take away someone's livelihood.
situation: Karen is being kicked out of a store after arguing with an employee because she was trying to redeem an expired coupon deal.
intention: Karen wants to resolve her issue with the coupon.
moral_action: Karen comes to her senses when she gets home and decides to put the issue behind her while being too embarrassed to ever go into that particular store again.
immoral_action: Karen exaggerates the behavior of the employee to the manager the next day saying that the employee was unfair and rude.

norm: It's not okay to gamble your hard worked earnings away.
situation: Jack goes to Las Vegas for the first time.
intention: Jack wants to have a fun evening.
moral_action: Jack goes to a magic show.
immoral_action: Jack goes to a casino and makes a huge bet.

norm: It's wrong to take things without paying for them.
situation: Quinn's baby daughter is out of diapers and the checkout line at the store is very long.
intention: Quinn wants to get home with the diapers as soon as possible.
moral_action: Quinn walks past the register with the diapers and gives some cash to the cashier on the way out.
immoral_action: Quinn walks past the register with the diapers and tries to go home.

norm: It's wrong to expect kids to pay for things.
situation: Rick is driving back home with his son who wants to stop to get fast food as a treat.
intention: Rick wants to teach his son responsibility.
moral_action: Rick gets his son the fast food under the condition that he gets an A on an upcoming test.
immoral_action: Rick stops to get fast food but makes his son use his allowance to buy his own food.

norm: It is wrong to take away someone's income without notice.
situation: Harold owns a store that has been losing money for a long time.
intention: Harold wants to shut down the store.
moral_action: Harold gives his employees a month's notice that he is shutting down.
immoral_action: Harold shuts down the store without telling his employees, leaving a note on the door.

norm: It's wrong to gamble your money away.
situation: Ren is on vacation with some friends, and they go to a casino together.
intention: Ren wants to find something fun to do.
moral_action: Ren tries out an exclusive restaurant which is in the casino.
immoral_action: Ren spends a lot of money playing the games at the casino.

norm: It's wrong to judge a person based on  material wealth.
situation: Reya has just registered to a dating site and has a lot of requests.
intention: Reya wants to accept some friend requests.
moral_action: Reya accepts requests that are from people with similar interests.
immoral_action: Reya accepts requests from people who list a decent income or well paying occupation.

norm: It is wrong to waste the money of others.
situation: Stacy collects money from a gofundme to pay for her surgery.
intention: Stacy wants to spend the money.
moral_action: Stacy gets the surgery, and she donates the rest to charity.
immoral_action: Stacy goes on a vacation to a resort hotel.

norm: It's wrong to expect money out of people.
situation: Bobby is unemployed and has just been introduced to a rich woman he isn't attracted to.
intention: Bobby wants to live the good life.
moral_action: Bobby doesn't lead her on and instead finds himself a lucrative career.
immoral_action: Bobby pretends to love the woman in return for monetary support.

norm: It's wrong to judge someone based on their financial well-being.
situation: Joe, who is poor and wearing old clothes, is shopping for a new shirt at a clothing store and the manager is suspicious of him.
intention: The manager wants to decide what to do about Joe.
moral_action: The manager offers to help Joe find something he likes.
immoral_action: The manager calls the police on Joe saying that he is trying to take clothing.

norm: it's rude to spend someone else's money without their consent
situation: Josephine is on a school field trip to NYC, and her mother gave her a credit card to use for emergencies only.
intention: Josephine wants to purchase souvenirs with her mother's credit card.
moral_action: Josephine calls her mom to ask if it is okay that she buys some souvenirs.
immoral_action: Josephine goes on a shopping spree with her mom's card.

norm: It's unscrupulous to mislead people who trust you with finances.
situation: Bill is gathering financial and market information to put into a prospectus.
intention: Bill wants to raise money from investors to expand his business.
moral_action: Bill accurately reflects his current financial position in his correspondence with his investors.
immoral_action: Bill pads his current revenue numbers and omits some of his liabilities in the promotional materials.

norm: Is wrong to take money from people who need it
situation: Joe runs a charity that gathers funds and materials for people.
intention: Joe wants to use the money that has been gathered.
moral_action: Joe uses the money to feed the homeless people.
immoral_action: Joe uses the money from the charity for personal expenses.

norm: It's wrong to marry someone for their money.
situation: Jake, who comes from a poor family, is dating Eve, who makes a six-figure salary.
intention: Jake wants to be rich.
moral_action: Jake gets to know Eve as a person and realizes they are not compatible.
immoral_action: Jake marries Eve and then spends all her money.

norm: It's wrong to exclude someone because they can't afford something.
situation: Blake's friend Jimmy just lost his job and Blake invites Jimmy out with some other friends to go see a movie and when Jimmy shows Jimmy says he's broke.
intention: Blake wants to enjoy the movie.
moral_action: Blake offers to pay for Jimmy's tickets, so he can enjoy the movie as well.
immoral_action: Blake tells Jimmy tough luck, and takes the rest of his friends in to buy tickets and watch the movie.

norm: It's wrong to obtain merchandise without paying for it.
situation: Joss is shopping for groceries and opens a package of cookies and starts eating as he shops.
intention: Joss wants to eat something because he's hungry.
moral_action: Joss finishes the cookies, and gives the empty wrapper to the cashier to scan as he checks out.
immoral_action: Joss finishes the cookies and throws the empty package into a trash can before checking out.

norm: It's wrong to take a game without paying for it.
situation: Lucas is in a game store and sees a bunch of games that he wants.
intention: Lucas wants to get some of the games.
moral_action: Lucas buys the games with money form his wallet.
immoral_action: Lucas decides to take the games for himself without paying.

norm: It is wrong to judge someone else's financial situation.
situation: Rosa loans $1,000 to Jill because she badl needed money, but then she sees Jill with a new hairdo.
intention: Rosa wants to mention it to Jill.
moral_action: Rosa points out the hairdo and asks how where she got it.
immoral_action: Rosa shouts at Jill for getting a hairdo when she badly needs money.

norm: It's immoral to steal money from another person.
situation: Will, who is very dexterous, is out of a job and needs to pay bills and loan payments soon.
intention: Will wants to find another source of income.
moral_action: Will decides to go into business for himself and becomes a locksmith, using his dexterous hands to open locked doors.
immoral_action: Will joins a gang of pickpockets and works the city streets, taking lots of money from rich people.

norm: It's wrong to benefit from someone else's unemployment.
situation: Jeff's employee is trying to unionize Jeff's employees, and Jeff is upset.
intention: Jeff has to decide whether to fire the employee.
moral_action: Jeff lets his employees unionize if they want to and steps out of the way.
immoral_action: Jeff lets go of the employee so that his employees don't become unionized.

norm: It is unwise to waste your money on frivolous items
situation: Grace just got her paycheck and after paying bills, has some extra cash left over that's she's undecided on how to spend.
intention: Grace wants to decide what to do with her money.
moral_action: Grace deposits the money in her savings account for a potential emergency.
immoral_action: Grace decides to buy a pair of Kanye West designed shoes she doesn't really like, but wanted to buy something.

norm: It's wrong to waste your savings.
situation: Tony has money saved up from his summer job in his bank account, and wants to reward himself.
intention: Tony wants to buy himself a gift.
moral_action: Tony buys himself a video game and keeps the rest in savings.
immoral_action: Tony spends everything he's got on liquor and party supplies to share with friends.

norm: It is wrong to marry someone just for their money.
situation: Laura has been dating Bob, a wealthy CEO, and he has just proposed, but she is not in love with him.
intention: Laura wants to answer his proposal.
moral_action: Laura tells Bob that she can't marry him because she's not in love with him.
immoral_action: Laura decides that she can live in a marriage without love as long as she has lots of money, and accepts Bob's proposal.

norm: It's wrong to brag about how much money you make.
situation: Debbie received a promotion at work with a higher salary, and she is spending time with friends.
intention: Debbie wants to talk about her promotion.
moral_action: Debbie talks about how her promotion gives her some interesting work opportunities.
immoral_action: Debbie talks about how her promotion is paying her more than all of her friends make.

norm: It's wrong to ask a friend to pay for something.
situation: Marie goes shopping at the mall with her friends.
intention: Marie wants to get some new clothing.
moral_action: Marie sees a coat she likes and pays for it with her debit card.
immoral_action: Marie finds the perfect outfit and asks her friend Ivanka to pay for it since she's rich.

norm: It's rude to expect your parents to give you money
situation: Cynthia is out at a party with her friends, some of whom are dancing on the car her father gave her.
intention: Cynthia wants to have a fun night out.
moral_action: Cynthia asks her friends to get off of the car because she doesn't have money to pay for repairs.
immoral_action: Cynthia tells her friends it's not a big deal to be on the car because her dad will pay to fix it.

norm: It's wrong to expect someone to work for free.
situation: Olivia, who runs an accounting firm, has recently hired Kelly to be a receptionist.
intention: Olivia wants her firm to thrive financially.
moral_action: Olivia decides to pay Kelly a fair wage plus bonuses for good work.
immoral_action: "Olivia decides not to pay Kelly for her first two weeks of work, referring to it as ""unpaid training"", thinking this will save her money."

norm: It's wrong not to share money with your partner.
situation: Bob makes a large sum of money investments from a side business that him and his wife Judy have started up.
intention: Bob wants to enjoy his well spent money.
moral_action: Bob takes Judy on a second honeymoon to Fiji for a two week vacation.
immoral_action: Bob buys a new car for himself and stashes away some of the profit in a secret account.

norm: It's rude to be cheap to your spouse.
situation: Alfred is a lawyer with a wife and kids.
intention: Alfred wants to look good for his job.
moral_action: John goes to the gym and gets a makeover and gets professional photos taken for his law firm.
immoral_action: Alfred gets designer suits for himself but makes his wife buy clothing for herself and the kids with a meager allowance.

norm: It's wrong to take advantage of people's kindness and money.
situation: Jack's friend, Dave, is very generous and always helps people with money need.
intention: Jack wants to borrow money from Dave.
moral_action: Jack's mother has an accident and needs money for treatment, so he asks Dave for help.
immoral_action: Jack asks Dave to lend him money for buying things that he cannot afford.

norm: It's wrong to pay someone to be your friend.
situation: Jack moves to a new town where he doesn't know anybody.
intention: Jack wants to make new friends.
moral_action: Jack takes the time to get to know some local people.
immoral_action: Jack gives somebody money to spend time with him like a friend would.

norm: It is rude to refuse an expensive gift.
situation: Charlie sees all his friends, including Dave, arrive at his birthday party with gifts.
intention: Charlie wants to have the best possible time at his party.
moral_action: Charlie realizes he's going to get a big gift from Dave, so he waits until everyone else leaves to open it.
immoral_action: Dave gives Charlie a Ferrari he won on a game show, Charlie refuses it because it might hurt the other's feelings.

norm: It is rude to demand free services from others.
situation: Karen is a customer who has multiple lines for a telecommunications company.
intention: Karen wants to make sure that she is getting the best deal.
moral_action: Karen checks for the best deals online and only calls if she needs help.
immoral_action: Karen calls in dozens of time a week escalting to manager while demanding free service and credits.

norm: It is rude to expect money from family.
situation: James has been living in a rented apartment for a long time and is tired of it but doesn't have a lot of money, even though his parents have some.
intention: James wants to buy a house.
moral_action: James realizes he should be autonomous and saves enough money by spending less.
immoral_action: James thinks his parents should help him financially and tells them so.

norm: It is rude to ask friends for free things.
situation: Delilah's friend is a graphic designer.
intention: Delilah wants their friend to design a logo for them.
moral_action: Delilah aks to hire her friend to design a logo.
immoral_action: Delilah asks her friend to design a free logo for her as a favor.

norm: It is impolite to ask friends for money.
situation: Brian is invited to go to the diner after school with his friends, but he doesn't have any money.
intention: Brian wants to get something to eat.
moral_action: Brian goes to his house to eat and meets his friends later.
immoral_action: Brian orders a burger and fries and then asks his friends to pay for the meal.

norm: It's rude to repeatedly borrow money from others.
situation: Bill is behind in his rent, for the seventh time this year, and has already asked his friends for help a lot.
intention: Bill needs to pay his rent.
moral_action: Bill asks the landlord to give him a few days of clemency.
immoral_action: Bill asks his best friend for another loan to help pay his rent.

norm: It's rude to ask others for money.
situation: Jake finds out that a new video game he's interested in is about to be released, and he comes from a disadvantaged family.
intention: Jake wants to buy the game.
moral_action: Jake saves up his own money in order to purchase the game.
immoral_action: Jake asks his parents for money to buy the game.

norm: It's rude to take advantage of a friend's generosity.
situation: James offers to buy Bob a dinner that evening and Bob is happy about it.
intention: Bob wants to enjoy the meal.
moral_action: Before the dinner, Bob warns James that he usually orders expensive meals.
immoral_action: Bob orders a $300 dollar meal that evening.

norm: It's rude to take all the credit from your partner.
situation: Zelda and her husband worked hard to get rid of the roaches in the old house.
intention: Zelda wants to talk about the acomplishment.
moral_action: Zelda talked about the ideas she came up with and the ones her husband did.
immoral_action: Zelda tells people how she came up with the ideas and took the roaches down herself.

norm: It's rude to base household chores on income.
situation: Joe lives with his roommates who vary drastically in income and wants to divide up chores.
intention: Joe wants to finish the chore schedule.
moral_action: Joe tries to divides up all the chores as equally as possible.
immoral_action: Joe gives the lion's share of the chores to the poorest roommates while the richest have nearly no chores.

norm: It's rude to flaunt wealth.
situation: John notices that his niece and nephew are wearing old, worn out clothes.
