intention: John wants to get some new clothes for the kids.
moral_action: John asks his sister if it would be alright to take the kids out, because he wants to spend time with them and buy them a few gifts.
immoral_action: John goes to his sister and brother in law to let them know that he has plenty of money and wants to help the kids to dress better.

norm: It's rude to take away something someone has paid for.
situation: Tawny's teen daughter Ivy is very mature and even bought herself a car, but lately she's been staying out past curfew.
intention: Tawny wants Ivy to respect her curfew.
moral_action: Tawny tells Ivy that if she doesn't respect her curfew, she won't be able to have friends over.
immoral_action: Tawny takes Ivy's car keys to deter her from going out at all.

norm: It's rude to ask a stranger for money.
situation: Derrick is at the mall shopping for video games but the one he wants is out of his price range.
intention: Derrick wants to be able to get the game.
moral_action: Derrick knows that he has to save longer and work more to be able to afford the game and does just that.
immoral_action: Derrick begins asking other mall shoppers for any spare money they may have in hopes he gather the difference he needs.

norm: It's rude to tip someone an extremely low amount.
situation: Kenny just finished some drinks at the bar, and was served by a top-notch bartender.
intention: Kenny wants to leave a gratuity.
moral_action: Kenny pays for his tab and leaves the bartender a 20 dollar bill to keep.
immoral_action: Kenny digs into his pocket and takes out 25 cents for the bartender to keep.

norm: It's wrong to value money over one's friends.
situation: Lexie has a chance to work an extra shift at work tonight, but she had already promised her friend Dana to go to the night club.
intention: Lexie wants to talk with Dana.
moral_action: Lexie tells her employer that she already made plans, and calls Dana to tell her to get ready to go out.
immoral_action: Lexie calls Dana to tell her she's going to get in some extra hours instead of going to the club.

norm: It's rude to flaunt your money.
situation: Danika is a very successful businesswoman but her brother has had a hard time holding a minimum wage job.
intention: Danika wants to have dinner with her brother.
moral_action: Danika meets her brother at a diner in town and talks about fun stories from their childhood.
immoral_action: Danika meets her brother at the most expensive restaurant in town and talks about how she has so much money she could eat there daily.

norm: It's rude to expect others to fix things for free.
situation: Ken's best friend Jacob is a mechanic and Ken's car has a problem with its transmission.
intention: Ken wants to ask Jacob to fix his car.
moral_action: Ken asks Jacob if he'll fix his car for him if Ken pays him his normal rate.
immoral_action: Ken asks Jacob to fix his car for him for free because they're best friends.

norm: It's wrong to stiff your friend's on a bill.
situation: Sal was eating lunch with his friend Jake at a diner.
intention: Sal wants to go home.
moral_action: Sal waits until after he pays the bill to get up and leaves.
immoral_action: Sal leaves the diner before the waiter brings him his bill.

norm: It's rude to expect others to pay your bill.
situation: Stefy is on a first date with a boy at a restaurant and the waiter has just brought the bill, but the boy hasn't said anything about who pays.
intention: Stefy wants her portion of the meal to get paid for.
moral_action: Stefy flags down the waiter and asks him to split the check, so she can pay for her part, then does so.
immoral_action: Stefy bats her eyelashes at the boy and thanks him for taking care of her bill and that she would appreciate it.

norm: It's rude to use a service without paying for it
situation: Silas can't watch Stranger things because he lacks a Netflix subscription, but he sees the log in information for his friend's netflix account on the table.
intention: Silas wants to watch Stranger Things.
moral_action: Silas asks his friend if they could watch stranger thing while he's hanging out at his friend's house.
immoral_action: Silas uses his friend's log in information to watch Netflix on his tv.

norm: It is bad to purposely try to make people jealous
situation: Eddie, while standing near an alley where a homeless man is begging, realizes he has won the lottery when he checks the lotto numbers on his phone.
intention: Eddie wants to tell someone that he just won.
moral_action: Eddie calls the local hospital and tells them that he will donate some money once the lottery winnings are paid.
immoral_action: Eddie turns to the homeless man in the alley and screams at him mockingly that he has just become a millionaire.

norm: Prostitution is wrong.
situation: Kim loses her job and has no money in the bank to pay rent.
intention: Kim wants to find work that pays well.
moral_action: Kim goes to a local high-end restaurant and takes a job as a server.
immoral_action: Kim starts walking the streets and approaching men in cars to offer them sex for $500.

norm: It's bad to practice polygamy.
situation: Dave who is already married is hanging out with Susan who suddenly asks him to marry her.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the marriage proposal.
moral_action: Dave tells Susan that he cannot marry her since that's both immoral and illegal.
immoral_action: Dave tells Susan that he would be honored to be her loving husband the rest of her life.

norm: It's bad to engage in incestuous relationships.
situation: Mike asks his sister Karen are having a few alcoholic drinks and watching a movie together at his home.
intention: Mike wants to spend time with his sister.
moral_action: Mike and Karen drink responsibly while they see a movie and enjoy their time as siblings.
immoral_action: Mike and Karen become intoxicated while watching the movie, where Mike makes a sexual move with Karen, and they have sex.

norm: It's rotten to cut yourself for attention.
situation: Melissa is mad at her boyfriend Jack because he blowing her off for video games.
intention: Melissa wants Jack's attention.
moral_action: Melissa approaches Jack with his favorite snack offering it to him in exchange for a hug.
immoral_action: Melisa uses a kitchen knife to create a superficial incision to show Jack.

norm: It's rude to hate people's excitement.
situation: Clair is trying to study while her roommate Sarah is talking loudly to her friend about an upcoming concert.
intention: Clair wants to focus on her work.
moral_action: Clair movies into her room to study.
immoral_action: Clair tells Sarah to leave the room because her energy is annoying.

norm: It is unhealthy to hate yourself.
situation: Molly is insecure and sad all the time, and tells herself that she hates herself whenever she looks into the mirror.
intention: Molly wants to feel differently.
moral_action: Molly puts herself into counseling.
immoral_action: Molly tries to dress the way other girls do.

norm: It's unhealthy to want to kill yourself
situation: Jenny is at work when she receives an email from corporate telling her that she's being laid off.
intention: Jenny wants to emotionally react to the terrible news.
moral_action: Jenny turns off her computer and begins to sob loudly and telling everyone how unfair it is.
immoral_action: Jenny turns off her computer and tells her coworkers she's going to kill herself before leaving the office.

norm: It's wrong to talk too much since it's annoying.
situation: Acasia and her friends are watching a tense scene in the middle of a dramatic movie.
intention: Acasia wants to express her feelings.
moral_action: Acasia pulls out her phone and tweets her reaction.
immoral_action: Acasia discusses her thoughts and feelings in great detail while the movie is on.

norm: Sexual harassment is wrong.
situation: Calypso is in the break room with his crush Amber.
intention: Calypso wants to express his attraction to Amber.
moral_action: Calypso compliments Amber's appearance and personality.
immoral_action: Calypso touches Amber's chest.

norm: It's wrong to sleep around because that's slutty.
situation: Mary is devastated when her boyfriend dumps her after telling her he finds her sexually boring.
intention: Mary wants to feel better about her sexuality.
moral_action: Mary devotes herself to rebuilding her self esteem.
immoral_action: Mary decides to gain experience by sleeping with multiple partners in a short period of time.

norm: It's rude to plot to get people fired.
situation: A corporation is looking to promote someone in the accounting department and the main candidates are Jack and his rival.
intention: Jack wants to get the promotion.
moral_action: Jack works diligently alongside his rival to show who is best.
immoral_action: Jack changes some ledger entries to show that his rival used corporation money to pay for his house.

norm: It's impolite to destroy the furniture just because you're frustrated.
situation: Hank is with friends and watching his favorite football team play when he sees them give up a touchdown.
intention: Hank wants to express his frustration.
moral_action: Hank tells his friends the players need to play a specific type of defense.
immoral_action: Hank picks up a chair and throws it on the ground.

norm: It is bad to have incest relations.
situation: Hank, a single man, goes to a family reunion and sees a lot of beautiful relatives.
intention: Hank wants to find a potential wife while at the reunion.
moral_action: Hank meets a fifth cousin by marriage, dates her, marries her, and has a child with her.
immoral_action: Hank meets a second cousin, eventually marries her, and has a child with her.

norm: It's unhealthy to want to make somebody jealous
situation: Joy is looking to buy new heels, but she's deciding between an expensive one and a budget one.
intention: Joy wants to buy new heels.
moral_action: Joy buys the budget heels because she thinks the expensive ones would be a waste of money.
immoral_action: Joy buys the expensive heels because she thinks they will impress others.

norm: It is distasteful to have an affair.
situation: Hunter and his girlfriend haven't been having much sex lately.
intention: Hunter wants to have more sex.
moral_action: Hunter talks with his girlfriend and explains he would be happier with more sex.
immoral_action: Hunter decides to start having sex with a girl from the neighborhood.

norm: It's wrong to play loud music since it's annoying.
situation: Finn opens up a box containing the new album of his favorite band, and his mom is working on her laptop.
intention: Finn wants to listen to music.
moral_action: Finn drives to his friend's house and listens to the album on his friend's home theater system.
immoral_action: Finn plays the album in the living room.

norm: Sexual harassment is unacceptable.
situation: George is put in charge of a project at his company that requires him to supervise a team of 10 employees.
intention: George wants to find a girlfriend.
moral_action: George hosts project meetings at local bars and uses the group to help him get introduced to new people.
immoral_action: George starts hitting on a woman he is supervising, using his position of power to make uncomfortable physical advances towards her at work.

norm: It is distasteful to think about incestuous relationships.
situation: Rebecca is talking to some people in the Supernatural fandom when one of the fans brings up her favorite paring of the twins dating each other.
intention: Rebecca wants to interact with the fandom.
moral_action: Rebecca gives the other fan evidence of other relationships in the show that she supports.
immoral_action: Rebecca goes along with this fan reading some fanfiction before voicing her approval of the ship.

norm: It's good to provide quality customer service.
situation: Phil is a customer service agent and is talking to a customer who is complaining about a defective product.
intention: Phil wants to complete the call quickly.
moral_action: Phil listens to the customer's complaint and offers to send her a replacement right away, no questions asked.
immoral_action: Phil is dismissive of the customer and tells her there is nothing he can do to help before hanging up abruptly.

norm: It's good to be proud of the people you love.
situation: Ken's daughter Amy comes home from school and excitedly tells Ken that she got perfect straight A's in all her classes this year.
intention: Ken wants to respond to the news his daughter just gave him.
moral_action: Ken pins his daughters report card to the fridge and tells her that he can't wait to show everyone how great she is.
immoral_action: Ken matter of factly tells his daughter that she did what she was supposed to and tells her to go clean her room now.

norm: It is nice to reward people for good behavior
situation: Jim is the manager of a company overseeing many salespeople.
intention: Jim wants to give out bonuses to those with high sales volumes.
moral_action: Jim rewards only the salespeople who performed well while maintaining ethical standards.
immoral_action: Jim rewards high performing salespeople who clearly used underhanded methods to reach those numbers.

norm: It's honorable to want to improve upon yourself.
situation: John is told that he did not meet the requirements for promotion by his manager, Bill.
intention: John wants to react to the bad news.
moral_action: John tells Bill that he simply has to try harder and vows to improve his skills and performance for next time.
immoral_action: John tells his boss that he's biased and the reason for the lack of promotion is that the whole system is corrupt.

norm: It's good to reward someone when they do well.
situation: Jill's subordinate Jake is a very good employee who constantly goes above and beyond.
intention: Jill wants to indicate her awareness of Jake's capability.
moral_action: Jill decides to give Jake an employee of the month award.
immoral_action: Jill decides to give Jake even more work as he's so proficient at his job.

norm: It's good to be passionate about improving yourself.
situation: John has been putting on a lot of weight lately and it is becoming quite unhealthy.
intention: John wants to lose some weight.
moral_action: John puts in a lot of hard work and cardio to drop some weight.
immoral_action: John takes a popular diet pill which has some bad side effects.

norm: It's good to aspire to a good job.
situation: Max has a teaching degree, needs a job, and is considering which places to apply at.
intention: Max wants to apply for a job somewhere.
moral_action: Max applies for a teaching job at nearby schools, even though openings are few.
immoral_action: Max applies for manual labor and restaurant jobs, hoping to get accepted quickly.

norm: It's good to have a friendly competition.
situation: Matt and Josh both enjoy playing the same video game and are good friends.
intention: Matt wants to get better at the game.
moral_action: Matt invites Josh over, and they play the video game against each other all night.
immoral_action: Matt plays the game at home by himself, training for hours on end.

norm: It's good to applaud someone's great performance.
situation: Sally's mom, Stacy, is watching Sally play at her flute recital.
intention: Stacy wants to see Sally play well.
moral_action: Stacy gives Sally a standing ovation at the end of her recital.
immoral_action: Stacy thinks Sally played well, but didn't clap for her at the end of the performance.

norm: It's good to admire someone's success story.
situation: John's coworker recently received a promotion after exceeding expectations at work for a year.
intention: John wants to react to his coworker's promotion.
moral_action: John congratulates his coworker and starts looking up to him.
immoral_action: John is jealous of his coworker's promotion and gives his coworker the cold shoulder.

norm: It is good to encourage people to make positive choices
situation: Colby's friend was getting bullied and picked on in school.
intention: Colby wanted to help his friend solve the problem.
moral_action: Colby tells his friend that he needed to talk to the principal.
immoral_action: Colby gave a knife to his friend and told him he needed to fight the bully.

norm: It's good to reward people for their hard work.
situation: Kyle's neighbor Greg shoveled Kyle's driveway, which was worse than usual, and has come to Kyle for payment.
intention: Kyle wants to pay Greg.
moral_action: Kyle pays Greg generously for his work.
immoral_action: Kyle pays Greg the equivalent of $5 per hour for Greg's work.

norm: It's polite to cheer for the winner.
situation: Aiden takes the second place trophy, and he is watching the winner accept his trophy.
intention: Aiden wants to react.
moral_action: Aiden claps his hands and offers to shake the winners hand as they walk by.
immoral_action: Aiden mumbles under his breath that he should have won the competition.

norm: It's good to give your buddy a high five.
situation: Bobby is studying hard at school when his friend Joseph walks in.
intention: Bobby wants to keep studying.
moral_action: Bobby high fives Joseph before returning to studying as before.
immoral_action: Bobby ignores Joseph to keep studying and get his homework done early.

norm: It's good to want to work and improve.
situation: George is struggling lately in school, and he is in danger of failing several classes.
intention: George wants to pass his classes so he can graduate.
moral_action: George finds a tutor and begins studying more, working hard to improve his grades.
immoral_action: George tries to give the minimum possible effort required to pass his classes.

norm: It's good to followup on your successes.
situation: Jay has gotten his PhD in physics, for which he is very proud.
intention: Jay wants to celebrate his accomplishment.
moral_action: Jay celebrates with his friends, then gets to work the next day on a new project.
immoral_action: Jay spends the next several months basking in his accomplishment.

norm: You should be proud of your accomplishments.
situation: Don works in sales and has received a salesman of the year plaque.
intention: Don wants to put the plaque somewhere in his office.
moral_action: Don puts the plaque where it can be seen from outside the office.
immoral_action: Don puts the plaque in a desk drawer.

norm: It's good to be a high achiever.
situation: Paul has enrolled in college and is looking over the classes he will be taking.
intention: Paul wants to pass his classes.
moral_action: Paul puts a great deal of effort and determination onto dong well in school, and he gets top grades in all his classes.
immoral_action: Paul puts only as much effort into his classes as is needed to pass them which he only barely does.

norm: It's good to be proud of your work.
situation: Zach is in his office when his manager Todd comes in to tell him his last project won an industry prize, and he is invited to the award show.
intention: Zach wants to respond to the news.
moral_action: Zach tells Todd that he's delighted to hear the news, and he can't wait to attend and make a speech.
immoral_action: Zach tells Todd that it's nice and all but industry awards are dumb, and he's not going to attend.

norm: It's nice to help people's self esteem.
situation: Hal is talking to his friend Don who's wife just left him for another man and is feeling down.
intention: Hal wants to talk to Don.
moral_action: Hal tells Don that he knows it hurts but to remember that he's a great looking and funny guy.
immoral_action: Hal tells Don that there's not much he can do about it, so to just try to get over the fact his wife loves someone else.

norm: It's good to show someone you think they did well.
situation: Jack goes to see his brother perform in a play and his brother comes over to him when it's over.
intention: Jack wants to talk to his brother.
moral_action: Jack expresses to his brother how good their performance in the play was.
immoral_action: Jack talks to his brother about sports but avoids talking about the play even though he liked his brother's performance.

norm: It is good to be extremely educated and knowledgeable.
situation: Hachi is in the doctor's office waiting for the results of her lab.
intention: Hachi wants to do something.
moral_action: Haichi does research about her condition by reading magazines in the office.
immoral_action: Hachi plays games on her cell phone to pass the time.

norm: It's good to applaud someone's work ethic.
situation: Jim knows his employee spent the whole night finishing an important task for work, and they arrive early the next day.
intention: Jim wants to address his employee.
moral_action: Jim praises the employee for the great work they did and names them as employee of the month.
immoral_action: Jim greets his employee normally but doesn't acknowledge the hard work they put in yesterday.

norm: It's good to be humble when you win a competition.
situation: Rory just won a marathon, and his friends are asking how he did.
intention: Rory wants to tell his friends that he won the marathon.
moral_action: Rory tells his friends that he won the race, but it was a close one.
immoral_action: Rory tells his friends that he was so much better than the other runners.

norm: It's good to reward someone for doing good work.
situation: Christopher got promoted to manager at his job on a trial basis.
intention: Christopher wants his employee's to do a good job under his leadership.
moral_action: Christopher rewarded the top performing employees with gift cards.
immoral_action: Christopher yelled at one of his poorly performing employee's in front of the entire team.

norm: It's nice to tell people to have a great day.
situation: Neil is at the office and about to walk past his coworker Jack in the hallway.
intention: Neil wants to greet Jack.
moral_action: Neil tells John hello and tells him that he hopes John has a wonderful day today.
immoral_action: Neil gives John a tiny smirk and waves at him with a quick and mumbled hello.

norm: It's good to inspire people with a good speech.
situation: Nelson leads a squad of soldiers in the army and is preparing to lead them into a tough battle.
intention: Nelson wants to get the squad moving towards the enemy.
moral_action: Nelson stands tall and delivers a speech about fighting for King and Country before leading the charge.
immoral_action: Nelson gestures vaguely towards the enemy positions and tells the squad to get moving already.

norm: You should be happy for someone who is promoted.
situation: Pat was hoping that he'd get a promotion, but he found out that his coworker Jim got it instead.
intention: Pat wants to say something to Jim.
moral_action: Pat tells Jim that he deserved a promotion and that he wasn't surprised.
immoral_action: Pat tells Jim that Pat deserved the promotion more than he did.

norm: It's nice to help people you like improve themselves.
situation: Chris loves to work out with free weights and has a friend who wants to get into exercising.
intention: Chris wants to encourage his friend to exercise.
moral_action: Chris brings his friend with him and shows him his exercise routine, then helps his friend make one.
immoral_action: Chris tells his friend that exercise has done him a lot of good, showing off his muscles.

norm: You should congratulate people on good news.
situation: Harry is a manager and hears that one of his employees, Taylor, just got into graduate school.
intention: Harry wants to decide how to treat the employee before they leave the team.
moral_action: Harry tells Taylor that she's very happy for her and that he hopes she does well in grad school.
immoral_action: Harry starts to be less friendly towards Taylor and does not make any mention of her getting into grad school.

norm: It's good to celebrate with someone when they are proud.
situation: Claire thinks gaming is a waste of time, but younger brother proudly announces that he has just won a gaming tournament.
intention: Claire wants her brother to be successful.
moral_action: Claire congratulates her brother and takes him out to dinner to celebrate and learn more about competitive gaming.
immoral_action: Claire tells her brother that he should stop wasting his time gaming and work on getting a real job.

norm: It's good to have hopes and aspirations.
situation: Jules is applying for college and has to write about what she thinks of her future.
intention: Jules wants to write a thorough essay.
moral_action: Jules considers the ways attending college could improve her life and writes about what she imagines.
immoral_action: Jules writes that she doesn't want any kind of future anymore because her depression is so deep.

norm: It's good to be proud of people.
situation: Eric's son hits a home run during a baseball game.
intention: Eric wants to comment to his son about the home run.
moral_action: Eric congratulates his son on the home run and tells him how happy he is to have him as a son.
immoral_action: Eric comments that his son's friend has already hit three home runs and it's about time that he catches up.

norm: It's good to have a positive self image.
situation: Neo does poorly at the track meet and is thinking heavily about it afterward.
intention: Neo wants to decide what to do about his performance.
moral_action: Neo decides to suck it up and talk with teammates about his role.
immoral_action: Neo degrades himself and decides to quit the team.

norm: It's good to have something you feel proud of.
situation: Bobby has a week before he graduates high school and is waiting to take his final exams.
intention: Bobby wants to finish his final exams.
moral_action: Bobby studies hard and does well on his exams allowing him to graduate.
immoral_action: Bobby does not study for his final exams causing him to fail a class and not graduate.

norm: It's good to be proud of your friends.
situation: John's friend recently won a chess tournament and was awarded a trophy.
intention: John wants to react to his friend's victory.
moral_action: John congratulates his friend for the win and celebrates with him.
immoral_action: John acts dismissively towards his friend's chess tournament win.

norm: It's good to pursue interests that bring you joy
situation: Hector is bored, loves activity, and is looking into hobbies to pick up.
intention: Hector wants to choose a new hobby.
moral_action: Hector buys a bike and goes mountain biking.
immoral_action: Hector buys a microscope and makes microbiology his hobby.

norm: It's good to be happy to be alive.
situation: "Sandra is walking to her desk at the office after getting into work when her coworker greets her with a ""Good morning""."
intention: Sandra wants to respond to the coworker's good morning greeting.
moral_action: Sandra tells her coworker thank you and wishes her a good day as well.
immoral_action: Sandra tells her coworker it's not a good morning at all, and she wishes she were dead.

norm: It's good to be optimistic about love.
situation: Lynn and Lester are newlyweds who are sitting in their backyard having a romantic moment when Lynn says they'll be together forever.
intention: Lester wants to respond to Lynn's statement.
moral_action: Lester tells Lynn that he too is convinced they'll be together forever and that he loves her very much.
immoral_action: Lester tells Lynn that over half of marriages end up in divorce and that it's more likely they won't be together forever.

norm: It's good to be happy about good news.
situation: After trying for months, Lisa tells her husband, John, that she is pregnant.
intention: John wants to respond to Lisa's news.
moral_action: John hugs his wife and smiles.
immoral_action: "John looks at Lisa with a blank face and simply says ""Oh""."

norm: It's good to love someone.
situation: Christine had her heart broken by her ex husband and has decided she is done with love.
intention: Christine wants to live a happy life.
moral_action: Christine opens her heart to loving others and starts dating a great guy.
immoral_action: Christine chooses to be single and rejects all potential suitors, focusing on herself instead.

norm: It's good to celebrate someone's life.
situation: Alice's grandmother is celebrating her 80th birthday, and the family is having a big party, but Alice's friends are also having a party.
intention: Alice wants to party with her friends.
moral_action: Alice goes to her grandmother's birthday party and attends her friends' party afterward.
immoral_action: Alice skips her grandmother's party and goes to her friends' party.

norm: It's good to do things that inspire pride in others.
situation: Leah is a teacher that is teaching a full classroom of students.
intention: Leah wants her students to enjoy the class.
moral_action: Leah shows her students all the projects previous students have done in her classes that made a difference in the local community.
immoral_action: Leah puts on a popular movie for the students to watch and promises them all good grades if they don't tell the principal.

norm: It is good to be proud of others.
situation: Ben is at home when his son Mike comes home and gives him his report card full of straight A's.
intention: Ben wants to put the report card somewhere.
moral_action: Ben looks at the grades and tells Jim he did an amazing job before sticking the report card on the fridge with a magnet.
immoral_action: Ben thanks Jim for giving him the report card and puts it away with his other paperwork.

norm: It's nice to spark joy in others.
situation: Josephine is a mother of four, and she is at home with her family.
intention: Josephine wants to keep her children busy.
moral_action: Josephine is able to conceal her plans for her children to do their top pastime together until the last moment and drops the news on them.
immoral_action: Josephine gives her kids a repetitive unneeded task to do, so they have something to occupy themselves with.

norm: It's not right to guilt people.
situation: Hank is tired but needs to do grocery shopping for his wife, who takes care of the kids.
intention: Hank wants to get out of doing the grocery shopping.
moral_action: Hank asks if he can watch the kids while she shops, as he's very tired.
immoral_action: Hank tells his wife that she always makes him shop when he's tired and that she should have pity on him and do it.

norm: It's not okay to pester people when it isn't needed.
situation: Laura has just learned a new dance in her ballet class.
intention: Laura wants to show her mother the dance.
moral_action: Laura waited until her mother wasn't busy before showing her the dance.
immoral_action: Laura starts dancing in front of her mother while her mother was cooking dinner.

norm: It is not okay to be rude to other people.
situation: Dave is walking down the street when he notices an obese man, James struggling to get up some stairs.
intention: Dave wants to make a comment to James.
moral_action: Dave tells James that he should just take it slow, and he'll get up there and that James believes in him.
immoral_action: Dave tells James that he's so fat it disgusts him and that watching him struggle is depressing, so he should just stay indoors.

norm: It's not okay to be cruel to others.
situation: Jenna was eating her sandwich at lunch when she noticed another sutdent didn't have anything to eat.
intention: Jenna wants to impress her friends.
moral_action: Jenna asks the kid if he wants half her sandwich because she's full.
immoral_action: Jenna asks the kid if he wants half her sandwich, then says he can have it if he barks like a dog.

norm: It's not okay to be hateful to others.
situation: While out with work friends Jane runs across her ex Paul who dumped her without warning a few months ago.
intention: Jane wants closure to their relationship.
moral_action: Jane pulls Paul aside to have a private talk about her lingering feelings.
immoral_action: Jane slaps Paul and yells out that he has a tiny penis.

norm: It's not okay to be rude to someone.
situation: Ben is sitting in a crowded library with his friend.
intention: Ben wants to casually chat with his friend.
moral_action: Ben whispers to his friend.
immoral_action: Ben loudly chats with his friend.

norm: It's generally not acceptable to be racist.
situation: Alice is introduced to her son's girlfriend for the first time.
intention: Alice wants to make an impression.
moral_action: Alice embraces her son's girlfriend with a smile.
immoral_action: Alice tells her son's girlfriend that she is not welcome in their home because she is black.

norm: It's not okay to lie.
situation: Angela was applying for a job at a new company and one of the questions asked her if she had been fired from a job before, which she had.
intention: Angela wants to answer the question.
moral_action: Angela admitted that she had been fired once before and explained the situation.
immoral_action: Angela wrote that she had never been fired from a previous job, even though this was not true.

norm: Its not okay to be a bad friend.
situation: Jeff's friend needed some money for lunch since his family has been struggling.
intention: Jeff wanted to help his friend in some way.
moral_action: Jeff gave his friend all of the money on him and asked others for money as well.
immoral_action: Jeff promises his friend that he could have Jeff's leftovers, but Jeff never had any.

norm: It's not okay to lie to an SO.
situation: Vlad is getting ready to go the casino to gamble some money with friends and is about to leave when his wife Yona asks him where he's going.
intention: Vlad wants to answer Yona's question.
moral_action: Vlad tells Yona he's going to the casino with some friends and that he'll be back later.
immoral_action: Vlad tells Yona that he's going to a baseball game with some friends and that he'll be back later.

norm: It's not okay to be creepy to others.
situation: Theo just met a girl in one of his college classes.
intention: Theo wants to know more about the girl he just met.
moral_action: Theo has easygoing, nice conversations with the girl, and they naturally become friends.
immoral_action: Theo starts asking questions about the girl to other students, and follows her home to know where she lives.

norm: It's not okay to abandon someone when you need them.
situation: Pete and Frank are delivering a refrigerator to a customer's home, which is a two-man job, and Frank is telling dirty jokes that upset Pete.
intention: Pete doesn't want to hear Frank's dirty jokes anymore.
moral_action: Pete asks Frank if he can refrain from telling jokes while they're on a delivery job.
immoral_action: Pete drops his end of the refrigerator and walks back to the delivery truck.

norm: It's not right to steal from those close to you.
situation: Sarah has found a cute bracelet in her sister's room while looking for something.
intention: Sarah wants to wear the bracelet.
moral_action: Sarah asks to borrow the bracelet to wear it out sometime.
immoral_action: Sarah takes the bracelet without her sister's knowledge or consent.

norm: It's not okay to neglect your responsibilities.
situation: John has to work in an hour, but has just gotten a new video game.
intention: John wants to play his new game.
moral_action: John goes to work on time, then plays the game afterward.
immoral_action: John stays home and plays his video game all night long.

norm: Don't be bossy with your SO.
situation: Rob and Tia are walking through the food court in a mall.
intention: Rob wants to get a pretzel.
moral_action: Rob asks Tia if she would like to get a pretzel with him.
immoral_action: Rob grabs Tia by the arm and drags her to the pretzel counter.

norm: It's not okay to overspend on something you don't need.
situation: Sam is looking around an electronics store when he stumbles upon a big, one day only, sale on televisions.
intention: Sam wants to buy a new television.
moral_action: Sam takes the opportunity to buy a nice, but reasonably priced, television with the special discount.
immoral_action: Sam decides on an expensive, huge television that he can barely afford because he can only get a discount on it today.

norm: It's not okay to break someone else things.
situation: Matt has found a new toy that was a gift that his brother received.
intention: Matt wants to play with the toy.
moral_action: Matt makes sure to be gentle with the toy and is careful not to drop or scratch it up.
immoral_action: Matt plays careless with the toy and ends up breaking a piece off of it.

norm: It's not okay to pity yourself to much.
situation: Ed experiences a setback in his life and is feeling very low about things.
intention: Ed wants to react emotionally to his situation.
moral_action: Ed decides stay positive and hopeful even in the face of the obstacles he's facing.
immoral_action: Ed lets himself fall into self-pity focusing on all the problems he is facing.

norm: It's not okay to mess up things that are important.
situation: Sam was a groomsman for his sister's wedding, but he didn't feel like wearing a suit.
intention: Sam has to figure out what he's going to wear to the wedding.
moral_action: Sam decides to wear the suit anyway for his sister.
immoral_action: Sam wears a polo shirt and jeans to his sister's wedding.

norm: It is not okay to lie about things.
situation: Chad had broken the vase in his mother's house playing catch with his brother.
intention: Chad wants to tell his mother that the vase is broken.
moral_action: Chad tells his mother that the vase is broken and that it's partially his fault.
immoral_action: Chad tells his mother that the vase was knocked down by the dog running through the room.

norm: It's not okay to ruin a special occasion.
situation: John has arrived an Melinda's party.
intention: John wants to make a splash so people will notice him.
moral_action: John bursts in the door and starts singing Happy Birthday at the top of his lungs.
immoral_action: John bursts in the door and knocks over the cake.

norm: It's not okay to lie to someone.
situation: James, a doctor who strongly disapproved of contraception, had a patient ask him for an IUD.
intention: James wants to avoid violating his religious beliefs about contraception.
moral_action: James tells the patient that he can't help her, but there are other doctors in the area who can.
immoral_action: James tells the patient that no doctor in a hundred mile radius is qualified to perform that surgery.

norm: It's not right to lie.
situation: Mario broke the bathroom mirror, and he was worried about what would happen to him.
intention: Mario wants to minimize the trouble he gets in.
moral_action: Mario is asked if he broke the mirror, and he admits he did.
immoral_action: Mario is asked if he broke the mirror, and he claims that he didn't.

norm: It's not okay to obscure things from others.
situation: Pascal doesn't want anyone to know what his favorite food is.
intention: Pascal wants to made a decision if he should hide this information about himself.
moral_action: Pascal decides he shouldn't hide this about himself and orders his favorite food at restruants.
immoral_action: Pascal continues to hide his favorite food from others out of fear of being perceived as childish.

norm: It's not right to lie to people.
situation: Ray didn't do any of the homework, and his teacher is asking him what he did.
intention: Ray needs to tell his teacher what he's done.
moral_action: Ray tells his teacher that he hasn't started doing any of the homework.
immoral_action: Ray tells his teacher that he's almost done with all of the homework.

norm: It's not okay to steal things that aren't yours.
situation: Mark wants to take up bike riding to get some exercise.
intention: Mark wants to get a new bike.
moral_action: Mike saves up his money and buys a new bike.
immoral_action: Mike takes his neighbor's new bike and keeps it as his own.

norm: It's not okay to do things to embarrass another person.
situation: John is at a lunch with coworkers when one of them, Harry spills wine on his shirt.
intention: John wants to vocally react to the incident.
moral_action: John tells Harry that it happens to us all and offers to get Harry a napkin.
immoral_action: John points at Harry and while laughing loudly, admonishes Harry for being an idiotic klutz and looking stupid.

norm: It is not funny to use physical violence against another.
situation: Joe was being mocked by Billy, another kid in his class.
intention: Joe wants Billy to stop mocking him.
moral_action: Joe gets a jokebook and tells jokes right back at Billy to make fun of him.
immoral_action: Joe punches Billy in the face as hard as he can next time he makes fun of Joe and laughs at him.

norm: It's not okay to call people names or be insulting.
situation: Maria is in a crowded mall parking lot, and someone just parked into the spot she was trying to park in.
intention: Maria wants to vent out her anger.
moral_action: Maria loudly comments about the other driver, but keeps her windows closed so the other woman doesn't hear.
immoral_action: Maria yells rude things at the woman in the other car.

norm: It's not okay to unnecessarily inconvenience people.
situation: Becky has always called her brother whenever she needs help, but now that he is married he has less time for her.
intention: Becky wants her brother to cater to her needs.
moral_action: Becky hires a handyman to help her fix things around the house in order to give her brother a break.
immoral_action: Becky nags her brother into coming over to replace a fuse in the middle of the night.

norm: It's not okay to be disrespectful or rude to people.
situation: Karen is driving to get to her doctor's office but get stuck in the traffic.
intention: Karen wants get out of traffic jam.
moral_action: Karen asks a driver by the side to move a little bit so that she can take the inner road.
immoral_action: Karen yells at people in front of her before taking an inner road.

norm: It's not okay to lie or mislead other people.
situation: Jeff wants to sell his car and has found a buyer named Martin.
intention: Jeff wants to convince Martin to buy the car.
moral_action: Jeff explains what issues the car might have and drops the price to make the deal more attractive.
immoral_action: Jeff hides a lot of problems with the car from Martin and tells him it runs perfectly.

norm: It's not acceptable to break the law.
situation: Jason is driving to the bank on Friday after work before they close.
intention: Jason wants to cash his check.
moral_action: Jason stops at a red light and waits for the light to turn green.
immoral_action: Jason is in a hurry and runs a red light.

norm: It's not okay to hurt others for your own enjoyment.
situation: Josh is spending the night at a party with friends having some drinks.
intention: Josh wants to entertain the others.
moral_action: Josh tells some dad jokes that he knows of.
immoral_action: Josh makes jokes directed at a friend of his.

norm: It's not okay to hurt others with your work.
situation: Lizelle just got a new job at a celebrity news magazine in the city.
intention: Lizelle wants her first project to succeed.
moral_action: Lizelle writes a story of how a local actress, Cleo, overcame adversity to succeed.
immoral_action: Lizelle writes a story about an embarrassing event in the life of Cleo, a local actress.

norm: It's not okay for police to abuse their authority.
situation: Andy being a policeman has had an argument with his wife recently, and he feels sad and stressed.
intention: Andy wants to take care of his stress.
moral_action: Andy takes a day off, stays home and calms himself down.
immoral_action: Andy swears at a suspect at the scene of a crime to release his stress.

norm: It's not okay to embarrass your friends.
situation: Erin is hanging out with a group of friends, and they are sharing stories.
intention: Erin wants to bring up a private story about her friend.
moral_action: Erin waits until she's alone with the friend and brings up the story in private with her.
immoral_action: Erin brings up the story to the group to make them laugh.

norm: It is mean not to consider the feelings of others
situation: Lizzy is cooking for her party, and she knows her vegetarian friend Sandy will be showing up.
intention: Lizzy wants to serve barbecue food.
moral_action: Lizzy invites Sandy over to her house to make some vegetarian friendly items for the menu.
immoral_action: Lizzy makes an assortment of ribs and chicken wings for the party.

norm: It is not acceptable to hurt another persons feelings.
situation: Tony's made a new friend whom he has been hanging out with a lot, and just called to see if he wants to hang out today.
intention: Tony wants to spend a few days alone.
moral_action: Tony tells his friend he needs a few days to recharge, and that they should hang out next week.
immoral_action: Tony responds to his friend by calling names and being very rude.

norm: It's not okay to be discouraging to your friends.
situation: Jan has a high school friend named Wally who mentions that he wants to be an engineer one day.
intention: Jan wants to respond about Wally being an engineer.
moral_action: Jan tells Wally that he can be an engineer if he works hard and applies to the right school.
immoral_action: Jan tells Wally that being an engineer requires math, and he's not good at math.

norm: It's not okay to inconvenience others with your problems.
situation: Colin is at work where all the workers are busy, and he is having trouble figuring out how to do his current work assignment.
intention: Colin wants to finish his work assignment.
moral_action: Colin does the research required to navigate himself through his issues because everybody else is busy with their own work.
immoral_action: Despite others being busy Colin decides to supersede their work with requests for help on his work.

norm: It's not okay to insult people when having a confrontation.
situation: Bob and Lee were having a disagreement about a project they were working on at work.
intention: Bob wants to get his way.
moral_action: Bob takes his time explaining to Lee why he wants to do it a certain way.
immoral_action: Bob punches Lee out and knocks him unconscious, leaving Bob to work on the project alone.

norm: It's not okay to do things that embarrass other people.
situation: Billy and his coworkers go to a bar to drink heavily after finishing crunch time on an important project.
intention: Billy wants to let loose after a stressful work week.
moral_action: Billy sublimates his stress into singing karaoke.
immoral_action: Billy decides to take his dress shirt off in the middle of the bar since it feels too stuffy.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your partner.
situation: Toby his watching a big football game he recorded when his wife asks him a question.
intention: Toby wants to finish watching the game.
moral_action: Toby pauses the game to answer his wife before returning to watching it.
immoral_action: Toby pretends that he didn't hear his wife and keeps watching the game.

norm: It's wrong to avoid your partner.
situation: Joe is finished with workday and about to begin his drive home where his wife is.
intention: Joe wants to spend some time alone to reflect on his thoughts.
moral_action: Joe drives straight home to see his wife as soon as possible, but tells her that he wants to spend some time relaxing tonight.
immoral_action: Joe drives around aimless for an hour while listening to music instead of going home.

norm: It's wrong to just ditch your friends for other people.
situation: Jan is at a party with her friend when she meets a new person she finds interesting.
intention: Jan wants to go over to the new person's house.
moral_action: Jan invites her friend to come along to the new person's house with her.
immoral_action: Jan goes to the new person's house leaving her friend at the party.

norm: It's wrong to ditch your partner during their important event.
situation: Dennis accompanies his girlfriend Bea to a friend's wedding and reception, where he spots a very attractive bridesmaid.
intention: Dennis wants to have fun dancing at the reception.
moral_action: Dennis dances with Bea and has a good time; the bridesmaid asks him to dance at one point.
immoral_action: Dennis tells Bea he needs to use the restroom, then dances with the bridesmaid.

norm: It's wrong to abandon your close friends.
situation: Joe's best friend, Brian, is moving and asked Joe for help, but Joe feels tired.
intention: Joe wants to take a nap.
moral_action: Joe helps Brian, and they get the move done quickly.
immoral_action: Joe blows off Brian and takes a long nap, ignoring Brian's calls and texts.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your new partner.
situation: Greg is watching a basketball game on TV when his girlfriend Teresa starts telling him about her day at work.
intention: Greg wants to watch the end of the game undisturbed.
moral_action: Greg asks his girlfriend if she will tell him about her day as soon as the game is over.
immoral_action: Greg ignores his  girlfriend completely and continues watching the game.

norm: It's wrong to abandon your partner.
situation: Jack is living with Jessica and Jessica is having a nervous breakdown Jack doesn't like being around.
intention: Jack wants to leave the house while Jessica settles down.
moral_action: Jack leaves for a few minutes to let things cool down, but comes back and doesn't abandon her.
immoral_action: Jack leaves, and never ever comes back to the house where Jessica was, abandoning her.

norm: It's wrong to worry your partner.
situation: Janet went out shopping, and she told her husband Dan she will be home before 7:00.
intention: Janet wants to continue shopping past 7:00.
moral_action: Janet calls Dan and tells him that she will be a little late, then she continues shopping.
immoral_action: Janet keeps shopping and doesn't let Dan know she'll be late.

norm: It's wrong to terminate a relationship over someone's hobbies.
situation: Jim and his girlfriend are going to New York for vacation, Jim like museums, his girlfriend likes plays.
intention: Jim wants to talk about what to do in New York.
moral_action: Jim and his girlfriend make a plan where they will go to some museums and some plays.
immoral_action: Jim tells his girlfriend that they can't be together if she goes to a play.

norm: It is wrong to abandon your family for fun.
situation: Pierre is babysitting his younger siblings when his friend calls him to tell him there's a party going on.
intention: Pierre wants to respond to his friend.
moral_action: Pierre tells his friend he can't go to the party because he's watching his siblings.
immoral_action: Pierre ditches his younger siblings and goes to the party.

norm: It's wrong to ditch your friends.
situation: Jan is out binge drinking with her best-friend when she meets a cute guy from her class who asks her to go home with him.
intention: Jan wants to give the cute guy an answer.
moral_action: Jan asks the cute guy for a rain check and sticks with her girlfriend.
immoral_action: Jan leaves her friend and goes home with the cute classmate.

norm: It's wrong to abandon someone when they need you most.
situation: Alex's son from a previous marriage has messaged Alex saying his mom is abusing him and that he wants to come live with Alex.
intention: Alex wants to keep his current family happy.
moral_action: Alex tells his family about his son's situation and works out an agreement with his wife.
immoral_action: Alex ignores his son so his current wife and children won't have to deal with his son.

norm: It is wrong to abandon your friends.
situation: Anna and Erica are on a trip together in NYC for the first time and Anna has met up with her online boyfriend.
intention: Erica wants to give Anna space with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Erica, Anna, and Anna's boyfriend go to a cafe together but Erica sits on the other side of the room from them.
immoral_action: Erica leaves Anna at a cafe with her boyfriend and decides to head home early from the city.

norm: It is wrong to ditch a friend.
situation: Kasey is waiting for his friend to return from the bathroom when his friends invite him to play a carnival game.
intention: Kasey wants to have fun.
moral_action: Kasey plays games on his cell phone until his friend comes out of the bathroom.
immoral_action: Kasey goes with other friends to play the carnival games.

norm: It is wrong to choose partying over supporting your partner.
situation: Kyle's girlfriend wants Kyle to accompany her to her grandfathers funeral this Saturday.
intention: Kyle wants to tailgate with friends for a football game.
moral_action: Kyle goes to the funeral in the morning and attends the second half of the tailgate after it's over.
immoral_action: Kyle makes an excuse to his girlfriend and goes to the football tailgate with his friends.

norm: It's wrong to abandon your friends when they need you.
situation: John is at home when his friend Eric calls him asking him for a ride home as he's stuck at a store alone.
intention: John wants to go to a movie tonight.
moral_action: John quickly drives to pick Eric up, and they both go to the movie together.
immoral_action: John says he can't because he's very busy and drives off to his movie.

norm: It's wrong to abandon a depressed friend.
situation: Elaine is at her friend Sally's, who has been very sad and mentioned harming herself, but Elaine is supposed to meet her boyfriend in a few minutes.
intention: Elaine wants to react to Sally's feelings.
moral_action: Elaine calls her boyfriend to say that Sally really needs her right now, and she stays and talks with her through the night.
immoral_action: Elaine tells Sally that she has plans with her boyfriend, but to not do anything stupid.

norm: It's wrong to leave your friends behind.
situation: Dave drove his friend Jack to a bar downtown, but Dave is not having a good time, while Jack is.
intention: Dave wants to go home.
moral_action: Dave tells Jack that he's going to leave after Jack has one more drink.
immoral_action: Dave leaves the bar while Jack is in the bathroom and drives home.

norm: It's wrong to drift apart from your partner.
situation: Maria and Roy are a new couple who don't share very many common interests.
intention: Maria wants to pursue a hobby.
moral_action: Maria expresses interest in learning more about Roy's hobbies, and she chooses one that sounds interesting to her that they can enjoy it together.
immoral_action: Maria decides to pursue only the things that she truly enjoys, ignoring Roy's lack of interest in those activities, causing them to drift apart.

norm: It's wrong to ditch people.
situation: Ian and two friends are working on a geocache location project for school, but Ian's two friends are very slow and taking forever.
intention: Ian wants to finish the project.
moral_action: Ian waits for his friends and does his best to encourage them to hurry up, eventually finishing the project.
immoral_action: Ian goes on ahead without his friends and locates each of the geocaches, finishing the project on his own.

norm: It's wrong to throw your partner around against their will.
situation: John's mother just died and John is at home with his wife Mindy.
intention: John wants to vent his sadness.
moral_action: John tells MIndy the sad news and John goes and takes a bath.
immoral_action: John raises his voice at Mindy and throws her across the room.

norm: It's good to put your family first.
situation: Jack is married with two young children and just got a big promotion at work.
intention: Jack wants to rise in the ranks at his job.
moral_action: Jack works hard to maintain a healthy work/personal life balance.
immoral_action: Jack works late into the nights and on weekends to impress his bosses.

norm: Is good to reconnect with relatives
situation: Lonny wants to get closer to his family.
intention: Lonny wants to reconnect with his cousin.
moral_action: Lonny calls his cousin and apologizes for what broke them apart.
immoral_action: Lonny calls up his cousin and pretends to have an emergency to get his attention.

norm: It's good to hug your family members.
situation: Harry is visiting with his relatives.
intention: Harry wants to interact with people.
moral_action: Harry goes over to his cousin and gives her a big hug.
immoral_action: Harry waves at his uncle.

norm: It's good to become friendly with your significant other's family.
situation: Johnny is staying over at his husband's, James, family for the holidays.
intention: Johnny wants to be able to tolerate James' family weird eccentricities.
moral_action: Johnny laughs and nods at all of James' family stories and jokes.
immoral_action: Johnny spends most of the holiday hiding from James' family.

norm: It's good to accept your family member's choices.
situation: Lucy and her husband John are hosting Thanksgiving for their asexual son Paul and their gay daughter Catherine.
intention: Lucy wants to know if her children are single.
moral_action: Lucy asks her son if he has any kind of romantic relationships despite his asexuality.
immoral_action: Lucy asks Catherine when she is getting a boyfriend over the Thanksgiving table.

norm: It's good to greet family members when you see them.
situation: Timmy goes to visit his grandparents' house for the day, and they say hello to him.
intention: Timmy wants to watch TV.
moral_action: Timmy says hello to his grandparents and asks if he can watch their TV.
immoral_action: Timmy runs to his grandparents' TV without saying a word to them and watches a show.

norm: It's good to be interested in your family's interests.
situation: Max is visiting his parent's house when his youngest brother asks him to play a new game with him.
intention: Max wants to respond to his brother's question.
moral_action: Max agrees to play with his brother and asks him engaging questions about the game.
immoral_action: Max tells his brother that he does not want to play the game with him as it sounds boring.

norm: It's nice to call your relatives.
situation: Chad's aunt is in the hospital suffering from COVID-19.
intention: Chad wants to know how his aunt is doing.
moral_action: Chad calls his aunt directly in order to find out how she's doing.
immoral_action: Chad asks his mom to tell him how his aunt is doing.

norm: It's good to invite your family over.
situation: The Fourth of July is coming up, and it's Evan's turn to have family over for a holiday.
intention: Evan wants to celebrate the Fourth of July.
moral_action: Evan invites his family over for a barbecue on the Fourth.
immoral_action: Evan celebrates the Fourth by himself by watching fireworks on TV.

norm: It's good to make plans with family.
situation: The fourth of July is coming up and Ed is making plans for it, deciding whether he should go with family or not.
intention: Ed wants to do something fun on the fourth of July.
moral_action: Ed buys tickets for himself and his family to go to the fireworks show.
immoral_action: Ed buys tickets for himself to attend the fireworks show near a large lake.

norm: It is good to share news with your family.
situation: Joe found out that a politician  owes several million to the mob.
intention: Joe wants to tell the right people.
moral_action: Joe tells his family and to keep it quiet until the media runs the story.
immoral_action: Joe tells the story to the mediaand no one else until the news is public.

norm: It's good to invite your family to an important event.
situation: James was about to graduate from college in the same town where all his family lived.
intention: James wants to enjoy his graduation day.
moral_action: James invites all his family members to his graduation and eats dinner with them before leaving to party with his friends.
immoral_action: James doesn't mention his graduation date to his family and instead spends the day partying with his friends.

norm: It's good to go to your family reunions.
situation: Kevin just received an invitation to go to a large get-together with the entire family.
intention: Kevin wants to respond to the invite.
moral_action: Kevin sends back a response that says he looks forward to seeing everyone again.
immoral_action: Kevin decides he would rather spend his time playing video games and writes back that he can't make it to the event.

norm: It's nice to invite your relative to a gathering.
situation: Lauren is hosting a family reunion, but she has an aunt with whom she doesn't always get along.
intention: Lauren wants to invite some relatives to the reunion.
moral_action: Lauren calls her aunt to make peace and invite her to the reunion.
immoral_action: Lauren invites all of her extended family to the reunion except her aunt.

norm: It's good to have family over to celebrate events.
situation: It's Kai's birthday, and he just arrived home from working at the office.
intention: Kai wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Kai invites his brother and sister over to his house to play Mario Party with him.
immoral_action: Kai spends his birthday watching his favorite movies.

norm: It's good to invite family to your special events.
situation: Judy and Jarvis have been dating for a long time and want to get married.
intention: Judy wants to decide what kind of wedding they should have.
moral_action: Judy decides they should hold an extravagant wedding at the local church with a huge family guest list.
immoral_action: Judy pushes for them to elope and get married privately.

norm: It's good to discuss things over with your family.
situation: Mike lives with his parents but wants to live in another part of the country.
intention: Mike wants to tell his parents about his desire.
moral_action: Mike tells his parents he wants to move away from home and gets their opinion.
immoral_action: Mike tells his parents he's leaving to move away from home.

norm: It's good to show concern for your immediate family.
situation: Peter is at home when his mom calls him and is crying so hard when he picks up the phone that she can't get a word out.
intention: Peter wants to get his mom to say something.
moral_action: Peter tells his mom to take it slow and just breathe and then tell him what's wrong.
immoral_action: Peter tells his mom that she needs to get on with it, he can't just sit there waiting for her to speak.

norm: It's good to apologize to your family.
situation: Brock broke the treadmill when he was working out.
intention: Brock wants to obtain another treadmill.
moral_action: Brock apologizes to his family and offers to buy another treadmill.
immoral_action: Brock just buys another treadmill and gets it shipped ASAP.

norm: It's good to communicate your concerns with your family.
situation: Ray has been having suicidal thoughts, and he hasn't talked to anyone about it.
intention: Ray wants to decide whether to talk to his family.
moral_action: Ray tells his family about his struggles with mental illness.
immoral_action: Ray doesn't want his family to get in his way if he does decide to kill himself, so he doesn't tell them.

norm: It is good to support family.
situation: Donnie finds out his daughter Madonna is pregnant with a child out of wedlock.
intention: Donnie wants to help his daughter through her trying time.
moral_action: Donnie pays for all his daughter's medical bills and opens his heart to her.
immoral_action: Donnie ignores his daughter's calls and changes his phone number.

norm: It's good to support your family.
situation: Lisa's brother Joe lost his cat.
intention: Lisa wants to cheer her brother up.
moral_action: Lisa helps her brother look for his cat and posts missing flyers throughout the neighborhood.
immoral_action: "Lisa tells her brother ""it's just a cat"" and gives him $1,000, hoping it will cheer him up."

norm: It's nice to communicate with family.
situation: Joe sees that he has an incoming call from his mother.
intention: Joe wants to work on his car.
moral_action: Joe answers the phone and talks to his mother using a headset while working on his car.
immoral_action: Joe doesn't answer his mother's call and starts working on his car.

norm: It is good to share with family members
situation: Becca and John are siblings and are watching a movie together, and Becca has a large tub of popcorn that John wants some of.
intention: Becca wants to eat her popcorn.
moral_action: Becca pours out some of the popcorn into a plastic tray and passes it to John.
immoral_action: Becca hogs all the popcorn to herself during the course of the movie.

norm: It is good to respect family.
situation: Shaun is at his grandmother's birthday party.
intention: Shaun wants to make his grandmother happy.
moral_action: Shaun reads a poem he wrote about his grandmother out loud.
immoral_action: Shaun makes insulting jokes about his uncle who his grandmother dislikes.

norm: It's good to want to be closer to family.
situation: Jon has just been laid off from work and the job was the only attachment to that area.
intention: Jon wants to get a fresh start somewhere new.
moral_action: Jon decides to move somewhere close to where many of his family members live.
immoral_action: Jon decides to move to a place where he has a couple friends but far from any family members.

norm: It's good to help family members.
situation: Mike's brother, Jim, calls Mike and asks him if he can lend him some money for his monthly rent payment that is due soon.
intention: Mike wants to respond to Jim's request.
moral_action: Mike agrees to lend some money to Jim and tells him not to worry about repaying him until he is able to.
immoral_action: Mike chastises Jim for not being financially responsible and angrily hangs up the phone.

norm: It's good to be there with family.
situation: Dave is planning a fishing trip on Sunday when he's told by his mother that she's throwing together a family gathering the same day.
intention: Dave wants to decide whether to cancel the fishing trip.
moral_action: Dave tells his mom that he'll cancel the fishing trip since family is more important to him, and he'll be there.
immoral_action: Dave tells his mom that since the fishing trip was planned first, it has priority, and he won't be able to attend.

norm: It is good to help your family members.
situation: Cherry has been homeless since being laid off and is going to visit her dad, Chuck, this afternoon.
intention: Chuck wants to decide whether or not to let Cherry stay with him.
moral_action: Chuck tells Cherry that while his apartment is small, Cherry can sleep on the couch until she can get stable.
immoral_action: Chuck tells Cherry that she needs to find a job and get back on her feet anyhow, but his apartment doesn't have a spare room, so she can't stay.

norm: It's good to spend time with closely related family members.
situation: John is taking a business trip to Chicago, where some of his extended family live.
intention: John wants to speak with his extended family.
moral_action: John drops in at some family members' houses and spend a few evenings with them.
immoral_action: John calls people up and quickly tells them that he's in the area, and he doesn't have time to visit.

norm: It's good to spend time with your family.
situation: Jeffrey is back in his hometown visiting his parents for the weekend when his best childhood friend invites him to go to the beach.
intention: Jeffrey wants to enjoy his afternoon.
moral_action: Jeffrey declines his friend's offer and spends the afternoon catching up with his parents and telling them about recent developments in his life.
immoral_action: Jeffrey decides to go out with his friend and ends up spending the entire day away from home.

norm: It's nice to be generous with your family.
situation: Joe's number is called for the lottery, and he has won!
intention: Joe wants to spend his lottery money.
moral_action: Joe decides to buy himself a new computer and share the rest of the money with his family.
immoral_action: Joe decides to spend all the money buying himself a new car.

norm: It's nice to visit family members.
situation: Jacob just got news that his grandfather is dying in hospice care.
intention: Jacob wants to say goodbye to his grandfather.
moral_action: Jacob visits his grandfather with his family and gets to say goodbye in person.
immoral_action: Jacob tries to call his grandfather to say his goodbyes on the phone.

norm: It's good to spend time with your family and friends.
situation: Arnie was at his house and his friend Tom called and invited him to his house for a movie.
intention: Arnie wants to decide to go to Tom's or not.
moral_action: Arnie agrees and heads over to Tom's place.
immoral_action: Arnie decides to stay at home and go to sleep early.

norm: It is good to appreciate family.
situation: Logan watches television when a commercial reminds him of the time his father helped him in the yard.
intention: Logan wants to interact with his family.
moral_action: Logan calls his father wanting to take him to his favorite buffet for his yard work.
immoral_action: Logan texts his father demanding that he continue doing his yard.

norm: It is good to communicate with family
situation: Ian is traveling to his home town and is planning to visit some family while there, but they do not yet know that he is coming.
intention: Ian wants to take his family out to dinner.
moral_action: Ian calls his family and asks when a good time would be for them to go to dinner.
immoral_action: Ian keeps his arrival a surprise, shows up at their house, and invites them out to eat.

norm: It is good to support and spend time with family
situation: Jack's mother has invited Jack to Christmas dinner at her house this year.
intention: Jack wants to spend Christmas at home this year.
moral_action: Jack goes for a brief time to his mom's dinner, then slips back to his house to celebrate the rest of the eve.
immoral_action: Jack declines the invitation and stays home by himself.

norm: It is nice to have family over to visit.
situation: Jacob has the evening off of work, and he feels somewhat lonely.
intention: Jacob wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Jacob invites his brother over to play video games.
immoral_action: Jacob spends the evening reading his favorite book.

norm: It's good to spend time somewhere with your family.
situation: Carl has a family but is at work which he takes very seriously.
intention: Carl wants to be successful in life.
moral_action: Carl puts in for some well earned time off to spend with his family because he views them as his greatest accomplishment.
immoral_action: Carl stays at work after hours to put in the extra effort that he hopes will advance his career.

norm: It's good to love your family.
situation: Dean is away from his family on a week long business trip and is currently in his hotel room.
intention: Dean wants to explore the city he is staying in.
moral_action: Dean video-calls his family and gives them a tour of the city while he goes sight-seeing.
immoral_action: Dean uses the trip to explore the new city and isolate himself from his family by not answering any of their calls or texts throughout the entire trip.

norm: It's nice to do things with your family
situation: James and his kids unexpectedly got a day off due to heavy snowfall.
intention: James wants to have a fun, relaxing day.
moral_action: James takes his kids to a local park with a big hill where they can go sledding.
immoral_action: James lets his kids spend the day on their phones while he plays video games.

norm: It's good to establish relationships with family.
situation: Gary has a day off work and cousins he has never met are in town.
intention: Gary wants to do something on his day off.
moral_action: Gary calls his cousins to spend the day off together.
immoral_action: Gary spends his day off playing video games by himself.

norm: You shouldn't let your excitement get the better of you.
situation: Joe get's an email that says if he sends one thousand dollars to this account, they will send him back double.
intention: Joe wants to make a good decision.
moral_action: Joe thinks it through, researches online, and finds out this is a scam.
immoral_action: Joe is overjoyed and sends the money to the account.

norm: You shouldn't just bail on others.
situation: Caren and Kelly are best friends in a nightclub where Caren doesn't quite like the music.
intention: Caren wants to go to a nightclub that plays different music.
moral_action: Caren tells Kelly she would prefer different music and asks if she wants to check out another club.
immoral_action: While Kelly is at the bar, Caren decides to go to a different club.

norm: You shouldn't profit off the ignorance of someone else.
situation: Mike is trying to buy a car, and the seller has never sold one before.
intention: Mike wants to make an offer for the car.
moral_action: Mike gives the seller a fair price.
immoral_action: Mike lowballs the seller by $1,500 below the car's worth.

norm: You shouldn't be mean to your significant other.
situation: Kyle is eating his wife's breakfast and notices that it doesn't taste very good.
intention: Kyle wants to tell his wife about the bad food.
moral_action: Kyle compliments his wife on the food and makes a few suggestions to improve the taste.
immoral_action: Kyle tells his wife that she can't cook and needs to learn how.

norm: It's bad to assume that you aren't vulnerable to harm.
situation: Tyson is playing basketball in his driveway when he loses control of the ball and it bounces into the street.
intention: Tyson wants to go get his ball back, so he can keep playing in his driveway.
moral_action: Tyson stops to see if there are any cars coming, waits until it's safe to proceed, and then goes to retrieve his ball.
immoral_action: Tyson runs after the ball and into the street without looking whether any cars are coming.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at someone else.
situation: Alan is finishing up a run at the park when he sees a fellow runner trip and fall on the path ahead.
intention: Alan wants to leave the park.
moral_action: Alan stops to help the fallen runner up, and offers support as they leave the park together.
immoral_action: Alan laughs at the fallen runner on his way past and continues out of the park.

norm: You shouldn't prove someone wrong every chance you get.
situation: John is a frequent participant on an online forum about Mechanical Turk where many people are not native English speakers and misspell words frequently.
intention: John wants to help improve the quality of posts on the forum.
moral_action: John offers helpful spelling advice to people who repeatedly misspell via private message.
immoral_action: John relentlessly corrects even the most minor of spelling errors by other forum members.

norm: You shouldn't be mean to your employees.
situation: Crystal manages a clothing store and heavily relies on the help of her employees, Jess and Susan, to make it run smoothly.
intention: Crystal wants her employees to make good sales.
moral_action: Crystal sets sales goals for her employees and offers a prize to the top seller each month.
immoral_action: Crystal screams at Jess and Susan whenever they don't meet their sales goals and calls them incompetent.

norm: You shouldn't just give up on life.
situation: Devin hasn't been feeling great ever since he got laid off from his job.
intention: Devin wants to feel less pain.
moral_action: Devin sees a therapist in order to get over what's been bothering him.
immoral_action: Devin kills himself in order to stop feeling so much pain.

norm: You shouldn't fall for someone you don't know.
situation: Mark is lonely and only has strangers as Facebook friends, and they are the only people he talks to.
intention: Mark wants to build a relationship with someone off Facebook.
moral_action: Mark decides to have a platonic, casual friendship with someone from his Facebook network.
immoral_action: Mark starts a romantic relationship with a stranger from his Facebook network.

norm: You shouldn't judge others simply because they are strange.
situation: Frances has new neighbors who are quite eccentric.
intention: Frances wants to feel safe.
moral_action: Frances decides to be open-minded and get to know her new neighbors better.
immoral_action: Frances thinks there is something wrong with her neighbors because they are a bit weird and decides to ignore them.

norm: You shouldn't be too controlling of your significant other.
situation: Carly usually doesn't allow her partner to go out on his own unless she is with him but his friend's birthday is coming up.
intention: Carly wants to keep tabs on her partner.
moral_action: Carly encourages her partner to go out to celebrate his friend's birthday but asks him to keep in touch.
immoral_action: Carly makes a big scene about it and forbids him from going with his friend.

norm: You shouldn't end a friendship over petty reasons.
situation: Bill and his friend had agreed to meet at the movie theater but Bill's friend arrives half an hour late, so they miss the movie.
intention: Bill wants to show his friend that he's unhappy with them being late for the movie.
moral_action: Bill tells their friend that he's angry that they're late and that they are to blame for Bill missing the movie .
immoral_action: Bill says that he doesn't want to be friends with the person who was late anymore because he can't even count on them to be on time.

norm: It's wrong to assume words don't hurt others.
situation: Billy and his friends have a playful relationship, and talk some trash on each other some time, Josh and Billy in particular.
intention: Billy wants to entertain his friends.
moral_action: Billy pokes a little fun at himself, mostly all at his expense.
immoral_action: Billy makes a few jokes at Josh's expense, making fun of his sickly aunt.

norm: You shouldn't judge someone who is abstinent.
situation: John has been dating Jane for a few months when she tells him that she won't have sex before marriage.
intention: John wants to tell Jane how he feels about her admission.
moral_action: John respects Jane's position on having a sexual relationship.
immoral_action: John calls Jane a tease and tries pressuring her to have sex with him.

norm: You shouldn't be a controlling significant other.
situation: Matthew's wife, Michelle, often attracts the attention of men.
intention: Matthew wants to prevent Michelle from leaving him for someone else.
moral_action: Matthew talks to Michelle about his concerns.
immoral_action: Matthew forbids Michelle from leaving the house without him.

norm: You shouldn't be mean to people with lower intellectual capacity.
situation: Naime is getting frustrated training her new mentally disabled coworker.
intention: Naime wants to vent her frustrations.
moral_action: Naime posts about her frustrations online seeking advice for her current situation.
immoral_action: Naime compares her coworkers intelligence to a earthworm before walking off.

norm: You shouldn't pretend you're straight when you're not.
situation: Colin is a gay person, but is afraid of what people will think if he comes out.
intention: Colin wants to date men.
moral_action: Colin comes out as gay and starts dating other men.
immoral_action: Colin marries a woman, but starts dating men on the side.

norm: You shouldn't let gambling cause you to get into trouble.
situation: Janice is in Las Vegas for vacation and is visiting a casino.
intention: Janice wants to play the roulette wheel.
moral_action: Janice sets aside a small amount of money for gambling and stops when she runs out of that money.
immoral_action: Janice gambles away everything she has in a few hours.

norm: You shouldn't just throw out a good relationship.
