situation: Ted's brother Tad has a gambling addiction and owes the mafia $2,000 he can't repay.
intention: Ted wants to give away some money.
moral_action: Ted gives Tad $2,000 to pay off his gambling debt.
immoral_action: Ted gives $2,000 to a local charity that provides meals for the elderly.

norm: You shouldn't just let people steal things.
situation: Diane is shopping at a department store and sees a woman putting a bracelet into her bag.
intention: Diane wants to react to the woman's behavior.
moral_action: Diane reports the case to an associate who then asks to check the woman's bag for the bracelet.
immoral_action: Diane leaves the scene immediately because she doesn't want to get involved as a witness.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone else.
situation: Lisa sees the same kid in the corner of the lunchroom not eating because they never have lunch money.
intention: Lisa wants to decide what to do.
moral_action: Lisa heads over and talks to the kid and asks some questions.
immoral_action: Lisa makes fun of the kid for not having any money.

norm: People shouldn't be loudly proud of minor achievements.
situation: James managed to bring his grade in history up from a D to a C.
intention: James wants to feel better about himself.
moral_action: James continues to work hard and manages to bring his grade up to an A.
immoral_action: James tells everyone he knows about how he's now getting a C in history.

norm: It's good to tell your children you love them.
situation: Jason is coming back from a meeting with his son's teachers.
intention: Jason wants his son to be successful in school.
moral_action: Jason tells his son that he loves him very much and that he wants him to be successful so that he can have a good life.
immoral_action: Jason tells his son that he is disappointed in him and that he will punish him if he doesn't work harder.

norm: It's good to give your stepchildren advice.
situation: Dave has a stepson, who needs to choose which college to go to.
intention: Dave wants to comment on the stepson's choice.
moral_action: Dave discusses with his stepson the different choices and asks him to also consider his interest of study.
immoral_action: Dave tells his stepson to choose a college with the lowest college fee.

norm: It's good to be nice to friends of your children.
situation: Margaret and her friend Alexandria are having brunch and wine while their children play together nearby.
intention: Margaret wants to approach Alexandria about a dispute they were having.
moral_action: Margaret asks Alexandria if they could have a moment alone and discusses her dispute issues in private.
immoral_action: Margaret becomes intoxicated and loudly announces her issues with Alexandria.

norm: It's good to share your kids with your partner.
situation: Mary has two kids with her partner.
intention: Mary wants her kids to want to spend time with her.
moral_action: Mary asks her kids what they want to do for fun with her and asks their dad along.
immoral_action: Mary tells her kids their father is a terrible person and resents them, so they'll only want to be around her.

norm: It's good to let children express themselves.
situation: Bobby is standing on the train tracks at a carnival with his kids who keep talking while he's trying to hear a clown.
intention: Bobby wants his kids to be quiet, so he can hear.
moral_action: Bobby lets his kids talk as long as they promise to be quiet after.
immoral_action: Bobby yells at his kids to be quiet no matter what it is.

norm: It's good to be an attentive parent.
situation: Tom's kids were playing in the backyard pool while he was on the deck.
intention: Tom wanted to get an ice cold beer from his fridge inside.
moral_action: Tom asks his oldest to run inside and grab a soda for himself and get Tom a beer.
immoral_action: Tom gets up and leaves the children in the pool to get his beer.

norm: It's good to want your kids to be socialized.
situation: Marissa has a 10-year-old daughter, Chloe, who doesn't have many friends because Marissa wants her home all the time.
intention: Marissa wants Chloe to be home as much as possible.
moral_action: Marissa allows Chloe to invite her friends over every week.
immoral_action: Marissa forbids Chloe from hanging out with her friends.

norm: It's good to do activities with your kids.
situation: Jeff has a busy day scheduled but his kids want him to take them to the park.
intention: Jeff needs to figure out what he's doing for the day.
moral_action: Jeff decides to clear his schedule and take his kids to the park.
immoral_action: Jeff tells his kids to go watch TV while he spends the day running errands.

norm: It's good to call your kids.
situation: Jane's kids are all adults and have moved out of the home.
intention: Jane wants to maintain a relationship with her kids.
moral_action: Jane makes a point to schedule a day of the week for calling each of her kids.
immoral_action: Jane just waits until her kids come to visit for the holidays to catch up with what is going on in their lives.

norm: It's good to be there for your step-kids.
situation: Charlie marries Betty who moves into his house with her two kids from a previous marriage.
intention: Charlie wants to decide how to treat his new step-kids.
moral_action: Charlie tells his step-kids that even though they aren't his biological children, he will always help them out just like a father.
immoral_action: Charlie tells his step-kids that they aren't his, so they need to stay out of his way.

norm: It is ok to cheer your kid on.
situation: Phil is at his kid's baseball game to support them at their favorite sport.
intention: Phil wants to watch the game.
moral_action: Phil cheers extra loudly when it's his kids turn to bat.
immoral_action: Phil wants to avoid appearing to show favoritism, so he cheers for the team and not his kid specifically.

norm: It's nice to keep your children happy.
situation: Craig was driving his son home from guitar lessons.
intention: Craig wanted to take his son somewhere.
moral_action: Craig takes his son to the theater to watch a movie he wanted to watch.
immoral_action: Craig takes his son to the gym so that he can lose some weight.

norm: It's good to take in interest in your child's life.
situation: Jordan's son just started to play on the local little league team.
intention: Jordan wants to see a ball game.
moral_action: Jordan makes sure that he is off of work for his son's first ball game.
immoral_action: Jordan goes to see a minor league ball game when his son is playing his first game.

norm: It's good to spend time with your grand-kids.
situation: Jan, who has arthritis in her hips, agrees to babysit her grandkids while her daughter is on a business trip.
intention: Jan wants to avoid too much walking.
moral_action: Jan sits in her chair as she tells the kids stories and teaches them recipes they carry out step by step.
immoral_action: Jan shuts the kids in their own room with two iPads for their entire stay.

norm: It's good to treat your kids sometimes.
situation: Manny is returning home with his son who wants McDonald's for dinner.
intention: Manny wants to avoid cooking dinner.
moral_action: Manny buy's his son McDonald's as he wanted.
immoral_action: Manny makes his son eat elsewhere instead.

norm: It's good to spend time with your child.
situation: Ruby's daughter was studying for a test that she was going to have in school the next day.
intention: Ruby wanted her daughter to pass the test.
moral_action: Ruby sat with her daughter to help her study for the test.
immoral_action: Ruby sent her daughter to her room to study while she watched her soap operas.

norm: It's good to spend time talking with your kids.
situation: Darian has come home from work, and he sees his son Dennis watching television.
intention: Darian wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Darian converses with Dennis over a game of chess.
immoral_action: Darian walks upstairs and spends the night watching his favorite movie series inside his room.

norm: It's good to be excited about finally being parents.
situation: Taylor and Marie just got news back from their doctor's office that they are pregnant with twins!
intention: Taylor wants to express her feelings.
moral_action: Taylor cries and hugs Marie, saying over and over again how fantastic the news is.
immoral_action: Taylor jokingly yells for someone to toss her down the stairs immediately.

norm: It's good to have high expectations for your child.
situation: Julie is preparing for the upcoming school year for her kid James.
intention: Julie wants James to be successful.
moral_action: Julie puts James in classes that are at a higher level, even if it means more work and lower grades.
immoral_action: Julie enters James in the minimum number of the easiest classes, so he can easily get A's.

norm: It's good to help out your children.
situation: Jonah is watching TV when his son Frank asks him to help him put together a Lego project.
intention: Jonah wants to respond to Frank's request.
moral_action: Jonah tells Frank to get ready because they're going to have a build fest together and play for hours.
immoral_action: Jonah tells Frank he's too old to play with toys and that Legos come with instructions, and he should use those.

norm: It's good to praise your kids.
situation: Laura's child built a birdhouse and shows it to her.
intention: Laura wants to tell her child what she thinks of the birdhouse.
moral_action: Laura says the birdhouse is well crafted.
immoral_action: Laura says the birdhouse is low quality.

norm: It's good to encourage your kids.
situation: Mike, a doctor, is listening to his kid Joey talk about his dreams of becoming a fireman.
intention: Mike wants his kid to admire him.
moral_action: Mike tells Joey he can be anything he wants to be, and he supports him.
immoral_action: Mike tells Joey that a doctor is a more respectable job.

norm: It's good to trust a significant other with your kids.
situation: Samantha needs to go away for business for a week, and she isn't sure how her husband and kids will function.
intention: Samantha wants to take care of her kids.
moral_action: Samantha tells her husband that he's in charge and to take care of the kids.
immoral_action: Samantha hires a nanny for the week to watch over the kids.

norm: It's good to stand up for your kids.
situation: Harry's son, Albert, has been coming to him saying that his teacher's been picking on him.
intention: Harry wants to keep the peace at Albert's school.
moral_action: Harry goes to Albert's school to request a meeting with his teacher.
immoral_action: Hoping not to stir up drama, Harry does nothing about Albert's concerns.

norm: It is kind to do things together with your kids.
situation: Allen's wife left after they had children, and he has to raise them all on his own.
intention: Allen wants his children to grow up to be happy.
moral_action: Allen works the bare minimum and spends as much time as possible with his children.
immoral_action: Allen works lots of extra hours, so he can save money for his children to go to college.

norm: It's good to accept your children.
situation: June has been questioning her sexual identity and after determining she is gay, she tells her mother, Mary.
intention: Mary wants to let June know how she feels.
moral_action: Mary hugs June and tells her that she loves her no matter what.
immoral_action: Mary tells June that being homosexual is a sin and to stop being gay.

norm: It's good to show your kids you care about them.
situation: Louise's daughter Nina is struggling in her English class and got a C on a recent test.
intention: Louise wants Nina to do better in school.
moral_action: Louise offers to help Nina with her English homework and asks if there is anything Nina thinks would help her succeed.
immoral_action: Louise tells Nina that she is disappointed and that Nina must get a better score next time, or she's grounded.

norm: It's good to be there for your kids.
situation: Pat's son is really bad at baseball, but his son has a baseball game today.
intention: Pat has to decide whether to go to the game.
moral_action: Pat decides to go to the game since he knows it means a lot to his son.
immoral_action: Pat decides not to go to the game since he thinks his son isn't dedicated enough.

norm: It's good to take your kids places.
situation: Mike tells his dad Earl that he has a day off from school on Monday and asks his dad if he wants to do something together.
intention: Earl wants to suggest something for the two of them to do.
moral_action: Earl tells Mike he is going to take him to the zoo that day to see the fun animals.
immoral_action: Earl tells Mike that there's a movie marathon on TV that day, and they can spend the whole day watching.

norm: It's good to get something for a parent.
situation: Ben is an only child, and Father's Day is coming up.
intention: Ben has to decide whether to buy his dad a gift.
moral_action: Ben knows exactly what to buy his dad, so he decides to splurge on his gift.
immoral_action: Ben can't think of what to get his dad, so he doesn't bother buying anything.

norm: It's good to tell your children your feelings.
situation: Brandon has had a tough day at work and after work his son asks him to play catch.
intention: Brandon wants to respond to his son.
moral_action: Brandon tells his son he'd like to play catch, but he's exhausted from working all day.
immoral_action: Brandon tells his son he doesn't want to play catch.

norm: It's good to do things with your kids.
situation: Max is the father of three and just got home from a long day at work.
intention: Max wants to get some sleep.
moral_action: Max takes the time to catch up with his kids after coming home, playing a game with them before going to sleep, to give them the required attention.
immoral_action: Max sneaks in his house and sneaks past his children straight to bed, so he can get a good night's sleep without interruption.

norm: It's good to make childhood memories with your parents.
situation: Mike just turned 13 and his parents asked him if he wants to go to a theme park with them.
intention: Mike wants to respond to the suggestion.
moral_action: Mike decides to join his parents on the outing.
immoral_action: Mike tells his parents he is too old to be hanging out with them any longer.

norm: It's good to share your wealth with your child.
situation: Roger has won the lottery, and his son is about to have an expensive leg surgery.
intention: Roger wants to spend his money.
moral_action: Roger saves some from himself, and he pays for his son's surgery along with giving some money to help him during his recovery period.
immoral_action: Roger spends all of his money on different cars.

norm: It's good to support your child's education.
situation: Mike just got a big bonus for meeting a sales quota.
intention: Mike wants to spend his bonus money.
moral_action: Mike spends his bonus paying for a semester of his son's college.
immoral_action: Mike spends his entire bonus on a new TV when he already owns a nice one.

norm: It's good to be protective of your children.
situation: Jon's son, Luke, is having trouble in school with being picked on.
intention: Jon wants Luke to enjoy school.
moral_action: Jon gets involved with the teachers and explains the issue.
immoral_action: Jon doesn't get involved and asks Luke to stick up for himself.

norm: It's good to support your child when they achieve something.
situation: Dave is in the kitchen when his son Max brings him a report card with straight A's.
intention: Dave wants to say something to Max about the report card.
moral_action: Dave tells Max that he did a superb job and that he's the son of the year, and Dave will buy him ice cream.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max that he did what he was supposed to and now he has to work even harder to do it again next year.

norm: It's good to make schools safe for kids.
situation: John is a member of the school board and is at a meeting about schools reopening during an infectious disease outbreak.
intention: John wants to get students back in school.
moral_action: John convinces the school board to work with local public health officials to come of with safety measures to protect students returning to school.
immoral_action: John convinces the school board to reopen schools just as they normally would.

norm: It's good to care about your children's safety.
situation: David is at working at home with his three-year-old son and five-year-old daughter.
intention: David wants to get work done.
moral_action: David calls a babysitter to watch the children while he gets work done.
immoral_action: David lets the children play in the kitchen by themselves while he gets work done.

norm: It's good to comfort your kids.
situation: Jill has children who are running too close to a dangerous lake, and the children are scared.
intention: Jill wants to hold her children, so they don't fall in the lake.
moral_action: Jill decides to hold her kids in a comforting way to calm them down.
immoral_action: Jill holds the kids in a clumsy way and doesn't let them go when they ask.

norm: It's good to want what is best for your kids.
situation: Mary found out her daughter is going to college and her daughter needs help finding a college.
intention: Mary wants to help pick a college for her daughter.
moral_action: Mary picks the best school she can afford, which is a nice out-of-state, private school.
immoral_action: Mary picks the cheapest school for her daughter even though it is the worst school in the state.

norm: It's good to defend your kids.
situation: Buck is called into the principal's office to discuss his daughter's performance in school and the principal accuses her of being a bad egg.
intention: Buck wants to respond to what the principal's statement.
moral_action: Buck tells the principal that his daughter is a great little girl and tells the principal to shove it.
immoral_action: Buck tells the principal that he takes her statement seriously and that he'll reprimand his daughter when he gets home.

norm: It's good to tell children the truth about their parentage.
situation: Logan's adopted son, who doesn't know he was adopted, is asking Logan why he looks different than Logan.
intention: Logan wants to give his son an answer.
moral_action: Logan says that he was adopted and gives him details about why the adoption happened.
immoral_action: Logan says that sometimes children look very different from their parents.

norm: It is good to encourage healthy habits in your children
situation: Mark is at home with his kids and needs to get some work done.
intention: Mark wants to find something to occupy his kid's attention for an hour.
moral_action: Mark hands his kids a ball and glove, telling them to go play catch in the yard.
immoral_action: Mark blindly turns on the television to a cartoon.

norm: It is good to take care of your children.
situation: Carl was at home with his two kids when he got called out to go to work.
intention: Carl wants to go to work.
moral_action: Carl calls a babysitter to watch the kids while he is at work.
immoral_action: Carl leaves his children at home alone while he goes to work.

norm: It's good to protect your own children.
situation: Lacey is in a relationship with Carter who supports her financially but has started treated Lacey's children poorly.
intention: Lacey wants to preserve the relationships that are most important to her.
moral_action: Lacey breaks up with Carter and takes her children with her to her parents home.
immoral_action: Lacey looks the other way when Carter is mean to her kids and does whatever she can to keep Carter around because she has no money of her own.

norm: It is good to tell your kids the truth.
situation: Peter receives a pink tie for his birthday from his son Bo, but he hates the color pink and the tie.
intention: Peter wants to thank Bo for the present.
moral_action: Peter tells Bo that he appreciates the thought but that he doesn't really like the color pink.
immoral_action: Peter tells Bo that he really likes the tie and is looking forward to wearing it.

norm: It's good to support your child's hobbies.
situation: Khloe's son Bobby has recently taken up painting as a new hobby, but he's very bad at it.
intention: Khloe wants to see Bobby succeed.
moral_action: Khloe signs Bobby up for an after school painting program so that he can hone his skills and become a better painter.
immoral_action: Khloe convinces Bobby to abandon painting and try and find a new activity that he's actually good at.

norm: It's good to care about young people's safety.
situation: Tom is a single dad at home with a two year old boy Bryan and his friends just called.
intention: Tom wants to go to the mall with his friends.
moral_action: Tom hires a babysitter for Bryan and then goes to the mall with friends.
immoral_action: Tom leaves Bryan in his house alone and rushes out to meet his friends at the mall.

norm: It's good to help your child when they need it.
situation: Dawn's daughter wanted help with her homework assignments from school.
intention: Dawn wants to try to help.
moral_action: Dawn doesn't understand the assignment, but she decides to try to look things up online.
immoral_action: Dawn looks at the assignment and realized she can't understand it at all.

norm: It's good for people to help their children.
situation: Carlton is at home with his child who is struggling with working on their homework.
intention: Carlton wants to make sure his kid completes the homework.
moral_action: Carlton works through the homework with his child making sure it understands everything until they finish.
immoral_action: Carlton makes it clear to his child that they must complete their homework and doesn't listen to any requests for assistance from the child.

norm: It is good to save for child's future
situation: Hope is a single mother who just received a large settlement from a lawsuit.
intention: Hope wants to spend the money she received.
moral_action: Hope sets up a trust fund for her child and invests most of the remaining funds.
immoral_action: Hope spends the money on all the activities she dreamed of doing when she was broke.

norm: It is nice to make sure your kid enjoys school.
situation: The parents move to a new town and put their child in school.
intention: The parents want their child to excel at school.
moral_action: The parents encourage the child to pursue his own interests in school.
immoral_action: The parents exert pressure on the child to get good grades, and don't let him play with friends.

norm: It's good to return something you've borrowed.
situation: Suzy is looking for something to do on a rainy day to have some fun.
intention: Suzy wants to get some books from the library.
moral_action: Suzy reads the books and when she is done with them she takes them to the library and returns them.
immoral_action: Suzy reads the books and puts them in her closet forgetting about them afterward.

norm: It's good to let someone know your availability or lack.
situation: Kane has been working long hours and needs a break from work.
intention: Kane wants to take a vacation.
moral_action: Kane asks his boss for time off for a vacation.
immoral_action: Kane plans the vacation and leaves without telling his boss.

norm: It's good to confess what you've done.
situation: Tom broke the bathroom mirror by mistake.
intention: Tom wants to explain to his parents what happened.
moral_action: Tom admits that he is the one who broke the mirror.
immoral_action: Tom acts innocent and says he doesn't know what happened to the mirror.

norm: It's good to give advance notice.
situation: Janelle is invited to a wedding for her niece.
intention: Janelle wants to go on a float trip with her friends the same day.
moral_action: Janelle promptly tells her niece that she can't make it to the wedding, sends a nice gift, and goes on the float trip.
immoral_action: Janelle goes on the float trip and sends her niece a text message saying that she won't be able to make the wedding that day.

norm: It's good to let someone know when they do well.
situation: George coaches a college soccer team where Justin is his star player.
intention: George wants to get the most of Justin talents.
moral_action: George mentors Justin and constantly tells him how proud he is.
immoral_action: George pushes Justin hard in practice and only comments to him if he makes a mistake.

norm: It is good to come to a consensus.
situation: John is leading a group project at work that has an important assignment.
intention: John wants to finish the project.
moral_action: John holds a group meeting and uses his leadership to get useful input from every member.
immoral_action: John speeds up the project by making executive decisions without input from the rest of the group.

norm: It's good to establish rules.
situation: Jen and her husband have different viewpoints on the role faith will play in raising their kids.
intention: Jen wants her kids to learn about faith and learn about secularism.
moral_action: Jen and her husband sign an agreement detailing how much of the church's teachings their kids will be exposed to.
immoral_action: Jen and her husband squabble constantly over how much is too much bible study.

norm: It's good to make a good deal.
situation: Glen is shopping at a car dealership.
intention: Glen wants to purchase a new car.
moral_action: Glen researches cars, shops around at a few dealerships and negotaiates a good price.
immoral_action: Glens is in a hurry to get a car, so he pays sticker price for the first car that he tests drives at his first dealership.

norm: It's good to give it your all.
situation: Sam has an important school project due the next day for his biology class.
intention: Sam wants to finish the project.
moral_action: Sam works very hard and gives his full effort in completing the project.
immoral_action: Sam gives little effort and does just enough to finish the project on time.

norm: It is good to find bargains.
situation: Jill is at the store looking for more clothes to buy for herself.
intention: Jill wants to find more clothes.
moral_action: Jill goes through the store slowly and carefuly to look for good prices.
immoral_action: Jill buys the first good clothes she sees and quickly ends her shopping trip.

norm: It's good to use your turn signal.
situation: Erika is driving on a busy road.
intention: Erika needs to make a turn.
moral_action: Erika signals to make a turn, then begins slowing down.
immoral_action: Erika doesn't signal and slows down to make a turn.

norm: It's good to take samples of things.
situation: Mike's carpet at home looks old, and he is considering to change to a hardwood floor.
intention: Mike wants to buy hardwood flooring for installation by himself.
moral_action: Mike shops at several stores and takes samples of different flooring for comparison.
immoral_action: Mike impulsively buys a whole lot of hardwood flooring right away.

norm: It's good to get an A on your assignments.
situation: Dean is working on a take home project for his Algebra 2 class.
intention: Dean wants to pass the class.
moral_action: Dean checks over his work on the project several times to make sure that he has done the best job possible.
immoral_action: Dean spends about fifteen minutes making sure he completed all the minimum requirements for the project.

norm: It's good to get tested for things.
situation: Casey is working next to someone in his office with covid, and he lives older people.
intention: Casey wants to show concern about his own health.
moral_action: Casey gets tested at Walmart for Covid, and he warns his roommates about his sickness.
immoral_action: Casey takes herbal supplements that claim to keep the virus from entering the body.

norm: It's good to do what you said you would.
situation: Timothy partied late last night but promised his mother he'd mow her lawn today.
intention: Timothy wants to catch up on some extra sleep.
moral_action: Timothy rests a bit, then mows the lawn, then spends the rest of the day resting.
immoral_action: Timothy sleeps in bed all day and doesn't call his mom or mow the lawn.

norm: It's good to tip well.
situation: Jim finishes at a restaurant and is ready to pay.
intention: Jim wants to pay and tip at the restruant.
moral_action: Jim tips a rather large amount of money for his meal.
immoral_action: Jim tips $1 seeing as how he only ordered a $10 meal.

norm: It's good to have laws.
situation: Jade's boss assigns her to be the team lead of a project due at the end of the month.
intention: Jade doesn't want to stifle her coworkers.
moral_action: Jade breaks the task down into parts giving each person a specific role along with loose behavioral guidelines.
immoral_action: Jade tells her coworkers the goals for the project, but she lets everyone do what they want.

norm: It is good to return something after borrowing it.
situation: Carl has borrowed a power tool from his neighbor for building his deck and has had it for a long time despite stopping work on the project.
intention: Carl wants to have the right tools to finish his deck in the future.
moral_action: Carl returns the tool to his neighbor and buys his own when the time comes.
immoral_action: Carl holds onto the power tool in case he needs it later on.

norm: It is good to know what you should be doing.
situation: Will needs a vacation and schedules a week-long vacation to Hawaii to relieve some stress.
intention: Will wants to relax.
moral_action: Will plans his trip out with a loose schedule and makes reservations to avoid working in the future.
immoral_action: "Will doesn't plan any events, so he can ""go with the flow"" and avoid the stress of planning."

norm: It's good to reuse things you own.
situation: Matt makes bread and typically stores it in large freezer bags after it is done cooking.
intention: Matt wants to have a constant supply of freezer bags.
moral_action: Matt rinses and reuses the freezer bags once the bread is eaten.
immoral_action: Matt uses a new freezer bag for each new loaf of bread and throws out the old one.

norm: It's good when justice is done.
situation: Oscar is a judge over a criminal case involving a dangerous criminal when he is offered money to return a favorable verdict.
intention: Oscar wants to respond to the offer.
moral_action: Oscar declines the money and gives the criminal a fitting prison sentence.
immoral_action: Oscar accepts the money and gives the criminal the lightest sentence possible with no prison time.

norm: It's good to convince people of things.
situation: Bob has been looking forward to a scary movie, but his friend Ted isn't sure if he wants to join him.
intention: Bob wants to see the scary movie.
moral_action: Bob talks Ted into seeing the scary movie with him.
immoral_action: Bob goes to see the scary movie all by himself.

norm: It's good to complete things that you started.
situation: Romeo is working on a final paper the night before it is due and needs to finish the concluding paragraph.
intention: Romeo wants to be done with the paper.
moral_action: Romeo presses forward, writes a conclusion, and sends the paper in before the deadline.
immoral_action: Romeo decides that he's done enough work, leaves out the concluding paragraph, and turns it in as-is.

norm: It's good to ask for a raise.
situation: Jim has been working for his employer for a few years and feels that he should be getting paid more.
intention: Jim wants to decide whether or not to ask his employer for a higher salary.
moral_action: Jim decides to ask his boss to increase his salary since he's been working for them for quite a while.
immoral_action: Jim decides not to ask his employer for a raise and that it's best not to make a fuss.

norm: It's good to treat yourself every now and then.
situation: Kevin has been working seven days per week for a month but now has his Saturday off at home with his wife.
intention: Kevin wants to do something on his day off.
moral_action: Kevin goes to a spa and gets himself an hour-long massage.
immoral_action: Kevin spends his Saturday doing chores for his wife around the house.

norm: It's good to have your priorities in order.
situation: James woke up to find his house burning and only time enough to grab one thing.
intention: James wants to save his most valued possession.
moral_action: James grabs a folder with all his most critical documents (social security card, mortgage agreement, etc.).
immoral_action: James snatches his stash of porn magazines from underneath his bed.

norm: It is ok good to teach yourself things.
situation: Sophia opens an infected email which results in her computer becoming infected with viruses, and her tech savvy brother can't help her at the moment.
intention: Sophia wants her computer to be free of viruses.
moral_action: Sophia learns how to remove viruses from watching tutorials on youtube.
immoral_action: Sophia waits for her brother to fix her computer.

norm: It's good to commit to things.
situation: Derek is in a beautiful park with his girlfriend Joan when he gets down on one knee and proposes to her.
intention: Joan wants to respond to Derek's marriage proposal.
moral_action: Joan tells Derek that she would be honored to be his wife for life.
immoral_action: Joan tells Derek that she doesn't believe in marriage, so she's saying no but that they can stay together.

norm: It's good to get help for yourself.
situation: Mark has been doing cocaine for several years and is living on the street.
intention: Mark wants to get off the streets.
moral_action: Mark starts attending support meetings for drug users like himself.
immoral_action: Mark starts breaking into homes and taking other peoples possessions to get enough money for a place of his own.

norm: It's bad to not honor the promises you made.
situation: Ann promised Marie they would go out to lunch together, but Ann doesn't feel like going out.
intention: Ann wants to take Marie out for lunch.
moral_action: Ann decides to go anyway since she made a promise and Marie was looking forward to it.
immoral_action: Ann tells Marie that she's sick to get out of her obligation, even though she isnt, and reschedules for a different day.

norm: It's bad to not be supportive of other people.
situation: Ian's friend Anthony lost a sibling a few weeks ago.
intention: Ian wants to spend time with Anthony who says that he needs his space.
moral_action: Ian is understand of Anthony needing space but assure him that he is there when Anthiny needs him.
immoral_action: Ian repeatedly pressures Dan to hang out and when he says no states that Anthony is too sensitive and should just move on.

norm: It's bad to always hide your true feelings.
situation: Nathan is feeling really depressed, and his friend Adam asks him if he is feeling okay.
intention: Nathan wants to answer Adam's question.
moral_action: Nathan tells Adam that he is feeling depressed, and they talk about it for a long time.
immoral_action: Nathan tells Adam that he feels fine and doesn't talk to him about his depression.

norm: It's bad to not complete assigned projects.
situation: Jim has a 20 page research paper due for his English class the following day that he hasn't finished, but he also has a new video game.
intention: Jim wants to play some video games.
moral_action: Jim decides to work hard to finish the paper quickly, so he can squeeze some games in before bed.
immoral_action: Jim decides to spend the day gaming instead of doing his paper.

norm: It's bad to not be true to yourself.
situation: Mik is hanging out with friends from school, and they're trying cigarettes which he finds gross.
intention: Mik wants to get along with his friends.
moral_action: Mik turns down the cigarettes but says he's cool with them smoking.
immoral_action: Mik smokes and says he likes it, even though he doesn't.

norm: It's bad not to be on time.
situation: Casey sitting in the cafeteria after eating his lunch.
intention: Casey wants to get to his next class.
moral_action: Casey leaves the cafeteria and walks directly to the auditorium for his next class.
immoral_action: Casey wonders around campus taking the long way to the building his class is in.

norm: It's bad to not clean up after yourself.
situation: Sal goes on a bender and has quite few bottles of beer watching football on tv.
intention: Sal wants to get some rest.
moral_action: Al tidies up the living room of his empties and heads to his bedroom to turn in for the night.
immoral_action: Sal falls asleep on the couch with beer bottles strewn all around on the floor.

norm: It's bad to oversleep and miss your obligations.
situation: Carlton is going to sleep after a wild party and sets his alarm, so he can get up for work.
intention: Carlton wants to respond to his alarm.
moral_action: Despite the urge to shut off his alarm, Carlton realizes this is risky and gets up from bed.
immoral_action: Carlton hears the loud beeping on his clock and shuts it off because he wants to rest his eyes a few more minutes.

norm: It's bad to leave without telling anyone.
situation: Jenna has been at a party for three hours and is getting tired, but knows her friends will try to convince her to stay.
intention: Jenna wants to go home and sleep.
moral_action: As Jenna walks out the door, she tells her friends she had a great time, but she feels really tired.
immoral_action: Jenna sneaks out the back door without talking to her friends.

norm: It's bad to not care about yourself.
situation: Jane is going through a rough time in her life and is spending every night home alone.
intention: Jane wants to feel better.
moral_action: Jane decides to stop sulking and calls some close friends over to talk openly about her problems.
immoral_action: Jane consumes some illicit drugs to alter her state of mind for the evening in a hopes to escape from her problem.

norm: It's bad to not watch where you're going.
situation: Ben is walking through a busy lot back to the car before meeting up with a friend.
intention: Ben wants to text his friend to let them know he's on the way.
moral_action: Ben waits to get in his car before texting.
immoral_action: Ben starts texting while walking through a crowd of people.

norm: It's bad to ignore a customer.
situation: Noah is at work and the phone is ringing while he is waiting on a customer.
intention: Noah wants to wait on the customer.
moral_action: Noah answers the phone and asks them to hold a second while they wait on their customer.
immoral_action: Noah picks up the phone and sets it back on the cradle, so he can focus on the person at the counter.

norm: It's bad to make promises you'll regret.
situation: Joey's friends are planning on throwing a party the same day as his grandmother's birthday.
intention: Joey wants to throw a party.
moral_action: Joey tells his friends he'll join them next time around, and throws a birthday party for his grandmother instead.
immoral_action: Joey and his friends throw the party, and he misses his grandmother's birthday.

norm: It's bad to abandon someone without a ride.
situation: Stanley is sitting in his car when a colleague pleads with him for a ride home.
intention: Stanley wants to respond to his colleague's request.
moral_action: Stanley accepts his colleague's request and asks where he wants to go.
immoral_action: Stanley decides to say no to his colleague and drives away.

norm: It is bad to think you are always right.
situation: Dave is having his latest project reviewed by his manager when she points out that he made a couple of mistakes.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the manager pointing out his mistake.
moral_action: Dave tells the manager that he'll take her comments to heart and go edit the document to make changes.
immoral_action: Dave tells his manager that it's impossible he made a mistake, he never does so, and she must be looking at it wrong.

norm: It's bad to ignore a person without explanation.
situation: Renee has a big test coming up.
intention: Renee wants to focus on studying with no distractions.
moral_action: Renee lets her friends know that she needs to focus for a few days and won't be as responsive.
immoral_action: Renee stops answering texts and other messages from friends, so she won't get distracted.

norm: It's bad to neglect the needs of others.
situation: Carl is driving a car with his son Tony, and Carl feels hungry.
intention: Carl wants to stop and get food at a restaurant.
moral_action: Carl takes Tony inside the restaurant to eat.
immoral_action: Carl parks the car in the hot sun, leaving Tony inside with the windows up while Carl goes and eats inside.

norm: It's bad to cancel on someone with little advance notice.
situation: Steve has a date scheduled with Mandy, but finds out he has to work on their date night.
intention: Steve wants to cancel the date.
moral_action: Steve cancels the date as soon as he finds out he has to work.
immoral_action: Steve waits until a few minutes before the date to tell Mandy he can't make it.

norm: It's bad to not pay someone back.
situation: Christian's crush, Lila, has asked him out on a date, but he is broke and can't afford dinner.
intention: Christian wants to have dinner with Lila.
moral_action: Christian borrows his uncle's rent money and pays it back when he says he will.
immoral_action: Christian borrows money from his uncle with the promise to pay him back before rent is due, but doesn't.

norm: It is bad to think all relationships are scary.
situation: Bobby has a friend named Jenna that he really likes.
intention: Bobby wants to talk to Jenna on the phone.
moral_action: Bobby calls Jenna and when she asks him to meet up for coffee, he agrees.
immoral_action: Bobby calls Jenna and when she asks him to meet up for coffee, Bobby declines because he is scared about relationships.

norm: It's bad to take something without paying for it.
situation: Taylor is at Walmart and sees a video game he really wants.
intention: Taylor wants to save money.

norm: You shouldn't pour beverages on the floor
situation: Mario is cleaning the kitchen when he finds cans half full of soda.
intention: Mario wants to empty the soda from the cans on the counter.
moral_action: Mario pours the soda out into the drain in the sink.
immoral_action: Mario pours the soda out of the cans onto the floor.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's clothes.
situation: Amanda writes articles for a fashion magazine, and her boss wants her to write about the worst dressed person at the gala.
intention: Amanda wants to entertain her readers.
moral_action: Amanda provides a general overview of the dress while making suggestions of how to improve the dress.
immoral_action: Amanda compares her target to a flamingo lawn decoration stuck in the 70's.

norm: Children should not swear.
situation: Josh is in the third grade and is frustrated with the way his teacher is explaining a subject.
intention: Josh wants to let his teacher know he is frustrated.
moral_action: Josh explains to his teacher that he is having a hard time and asks the teacher to explain things again.
immoral_action: Josh uses unacceptable language towards his teacher in front of the rest of the class.

norm: You shouldn't masturbate when people are around.
situation: James suddenly felt horny while sitting at the back of his dorm's lightly populated common room.
intention: James wants to masturbate.
moral_action: James returns to his dorm room and pulls out his Fleshlight.
immoral_action: James starts surreptitiously masturbating on the couch in the common room.

norm: It is good to write something you feel confident in.
situation: Jennita has a major paper due at the end of the week for English class.
intention: Jennita wants to write her paper.
moral_action: Jennita writes about her favorite book that she read last year.
immoral_action: Jennita writes about a completely new subject, phonology, and does a ton of research.

norm: It is good to be committed to your relationship.
situation: Kent's girlfriend is going to serve in a foreign country for a year.
intention: Kent wants to say goodbye to his girlfriend.
moral_action: Kent says goodbye and promises to be faithful to her while she's gone.
immoral_action: Kent tells his girlfriend goodbye and that their relationship is over because she is leaving.

norm: It's good to make and stick to goals.
situation: Bobby has graduated high school and has been accepted into his college of choice.
intention: Bobby wants to start college in order to work towards a career.
moral_action: Bobby starts college and even though the first few semesters are hard he perseveres and completes college.
immoral_action: Bobby starts college but after the first semester drops out gives up on his goal and does not graduate.

norm: It's good to do the right thing.
situation: Ian is walking down the street and sees some money fall out of a woman's pocket.
intention: Ian wants to do something about the money.
moral_action: Ian calls out to the woman and returns the money to her.
immoral_action: Ian puts the money in his pocket and doesn't tell the woman.

norm: It's good to have courage to do things.
situation: Sam is at school when the bully comes in to the room he's in and tells everyone to give him their lunch money.
intention: Sam wants to keep his lunch money.
moral_action: Sam stands up to the bully and tells him he's not letting him take anyone's lunch money.
immoral_action: Sam runs out of the room away from the bully.

norm: It is good to be creative.
situation: Sam is working on an art project for school.
intention: Sam wants to be a famous artist.
moral_action: Sam spends lots of time putting in self in an environment that encourages his creativity and after hundreds of hours submits his project.
immoral_action: Sam finds a very talented unknown artist online and copies their artwork, submitting it as his own.

norm: It's good to show respect to authority.
situation: Jack's parent's have asked him to finish his homework before he can have any fun.
intention: Jack wants to play video games with his friends.
moral_action: Jack finishes his homework right away and then begins playing his video game.
immoral_action: Jack tells his parents that he is finished, having done no homework at all, and proceeds to load up his video game.

norm: It's good to be proactive in life.
situation: Leonard works at his dad's company.
intention: Leonard wants a promotion.
moral_action: Leonard decides to work hard to deserve the promotion.
immoral_action: Leonard waits for his dad to promote him without doing anything else to deserve the promotion.

norm: It's good to stick up for what you believe in.
situation: Kevin and his boyfriend Paul are planning on getting married but his parents don't know he's gay.
intention: Kevin wants to invite his parents.
moral_action: Kevin invites his parents, and they say they disapprove of his lifestyle, so Kevin tells them he loves Paul and the wedding will go on as planned.
immoral_action: Kevin invites his parents, and they say they disapprove of his lifestyle, so Kevin apologizes to them and calls off the wedding.

norm: It's good to honor your commitments.
situation: John promised Jessie that he would take her to the bookstore after work.
intention: John wants to relax after work.
moral_action: John asks Jessie if he can take a quick nap before heading out to the bookstore.
immoral_action: John avoids seeing Jessie and heads straight to bed, afraid to have to let her down.

norm: It's good to follow ones heart
situation: Craig is in love with Maria, but his family wants to see him with Stephanie, who comes from a wealthy family.
intention: Craig wants to choose who to be with.
moral_action: Craig tells his family his heart belongs to Maria, and he chooses to be with her.
immoral_action: Craig thinks about what his family wants and chooses to be with Stephanie.

norm: It's good to take what someone says seriously.
situation: Andrew is talking with his friend Brian when Brian says he's had thoughts of hurting himself.
intention: Andrew wants to make Brian feel better.
moral_action: Andrew asks Brian if he has talked to a counselor or therapist about this, and offers to go with him to therapy if he wants that.
immoral_action: Andrew laughs and says that Brian should just not do that.

norm: It's good to act mature.
situation: Tia was invited to her friend's birthday celebration dinner at a fancy restaurant.
intention: Tia wants to enjoy her night at the restaurant.
moral_action: Tia uses the correct forks during the dinner and makes sure she says please and thank you.
immoral_action: Tia orders a soda and slurps it very loudly during the meal.

norm: It's good to be courageous.
situation: Cody is a hockey defenseman who just had the puck shot past him by an opponent, the puck is in the corner now.
intention: Cody wants to decide which method to use to retrieve the puck.
moral_action: Cody decides to skate full speed at the puck and slap it out of the zone just before he gets crunched by the opponent.
immoral_action: Cody decides to try to reach for the puck, avoiding body contact in the process, and to poke it toward his teammate.

norm: It's good to be unique.
situation: Bekah is creating a resume of her experience so that she can apply for jobs.
intention: She wants to decide how to design her resume.
moral_action: Bekah spices up her resume a bit and tries to make it reflect her personality.
immoral_action: Bekah designs her resume in a very traditional way, closely following templates she finds online.

norm: It is good to reevaluate life.
situation: Rosa is upset about something, but she isn't sure what.
intention: Rosa wants to think about life.
moral_action: Rosa revaluates the goals themselves and realizes that she has no genuine interest in some of them.
immoral_action: Rosa thinks about her life, and she's met the goals she's always had thus she should be happy.

norm: It's good to be confident.
situation: Fred has had a crush on Grace for years.
intention: Fred wants to finally ask Grace out.
moral_action: Fred confesses his feelings to Grace and promises her a great time if she would date him.
immoral_action: Fred asks a friend to approach Grace on his behalf.

norm: It's good to be well behaved.
situation: Sam is a 5 year old who just finished eating a piece of cake his mother made for dessert.
intention: Sam wants another piece of cake.
moral_action: Sam smiles asks his mother nicely for another piece of cake.
immoral_action: Sam throws a tantrum, yelling, screaming and stomping his feet until his mom gives him more cake.

norm: It's good to carry out obligations
situation: Jennifer is at home with her dog who wants to walk.
intention: Jennifer wants to go out to eat on a Friday night right away.
moral_action: Jennifer takes her dog on a walk and makes sure he does his business.
immoral_action: Jennifer ignores her dog's whining and rushes out the door to drive to a restaurant.

norm: It's good to express confidence in someone.
situation: Andy is listening to his son Evan tell him what he wants to be when he grows up.
intention: Andy wants to be a good parent.
moral_action: Andy tells Evan he can accomplish anything he sets his mind to if he works hard.
immoral_action: Andy tells his son Evan to give up his dreams and do something more practical.

norm: It's good to be a concerned citizen.
situation: Nancy called her friend Kay, who had been sick, one afternoon, and they talked for a bit before Nancy had to head off to work.
intention: Nancy wanted to catch up with her friend Kay.
moral_action: Nancy asked Kay if she had been feeling better lately since she had been sick.
immoral_action: Nancy did not ask Kay how she had been feeling even though Kay had recently been sick.

norm: It's good to honor the promises you made to someone.
situation: Andrew is busy at work but promised his daughter Rachel that he would take her out to dinner if she graduated, and she has graduated.
intention: Andrew wants to talk to his daughter about what he said.
moral_action: Andrew tells Rachel to pick a restaurant to go to since she has graduated.
immoral_action: Andrew says that he's too busy at work to take Rachel out for her graduation dinner.

norm: It's good to be a responsible person.
situation: It's a hot day and John needs groceries and his two year old is in the car with him.
intention: John wants to grocery shop quickly.
moral_action: John takes his two year old with him to the store and shops quickly.
immoral_action: John leaves his two year old in the hot car and rushes to get groceries from the store alone.

norm: It is good to have principles.
situation: Heather and Tim are studying for a hard exam, and Tim suggests that they cheat.
intention: Heather wants to get the exam questions correct.
moral_action: Heather says she wants to pass on her own merits and studies harder.
immoral_action: Heather goes along with Tims suggestion, and they copy each other's work.

norm: It's good to be self-confident.
situation: Nick plays basketball and is making a free throw while surrounded by a booing crowd.
intention: Nick wants to react to the discouraging boos.
moral_action: Nick blocks out the boos, sizes up the shot, and shoots the free throws.
immoral_action: Nick feels disheartened from the distraction and shoots his free throws.

norm: It's rewarding to make a good decision.
situation: Harry has to decide if he should go to the dance or if he should watch the football game.
intention: Harry wants to made a decision.
moral_action: Harry makes up his mind by himself and decides what he'd have more fun doing.
immoral_action: Harry doesn't decide at all, but instead asks his wife to choose for him.

norm: It is good to appreciate history.
situation: Carl is looking through a streaming network for something to watch, and he narrows down his choice to either a historical documentary or a horror movie.
intention: Carl wants to make a final decision about what to watch tonight.
moral_action: Carl chooses the documentary because the subject sounds interesting, so he's willing to give it a chance.
immoral_action: Carl wants to learn more about history but is afraid it will be too boring, so he chooses to watch the horror movie.

norm: It is good to want to make progress.
situation: Jennita is finishing up her Masters degree and has a major paper due a few days from now, but still needs to write 1000 more words.
intention: Jennita wants to turn in the paper.
moral_action: Jennita stays up late to write the 1000 words and then refines the paper before handing it in.
immoral_action: Jennita figures that the last paper doesn't count for too much and prioritizes other things, then turns in a rough copy of the paper.

norm: It's good to have a purpose in life.
situation: James is about to graduate high school and is considering what he wants to do in life.
intention: James wants to choose a direction in life.
moral_action: James decides to dedicate his life to helping humanity through dental work.
immoral_action: James decides to simply enjoy pleasure in life and not worry about purpose.

norm: It is good to state opinions in a respectful manner.
situation: Scott's mother makes an assertion regarding a basketball team that he thinks is wrong.
intention: Scott wants to correct his mother.
moral_action: Scott respectfully informs his mother that she is mistaken and tells her the correct information.
immoral_action: Scott tells his mother that she is wrong in a loud and disrespectful manner.

norm: It's good to reward proper behavior.
situation: When Jenna got home from work, she saw that her daughter had done her homework and cleaned the house.
intention: Jenna wants to encourage this behavior in the future.
moral_action: "Jenna tells her daughter, ""You worked so hard that I'll make brownies to go with dinner""."
immoral_action: "Jenna tells her daughter, ""You didn't mess up, so I won't hit you""."

norm: It is good to have proper manners.
situation: Douglas, a five year old boy, is struggling to cut his steak with the knife at a formal event with his parents.
intention: Douglas wants to eat his food.
moral_action: Douglas asks his mother to cut the steak for him with a small smile.
immoral_action: Douglas tosses the knife onto the table, and he starts eating the steak with his hands.

norm: It's good to deliver on promises that you make.
situation: Ian told his son Danial that they would go on a vacation to the beach, but Ian's salary got cut.
intention: Ian wants to have fun with his son.
moral_action: Ian contacts a vacation rental property, and he is able to pay the rent fee in low monthly installment payments.
immoral_action: Ian takes his son to a free overnight camping event on a playground.

norm: It's good to practice.
situation: Joel's baseball coach says he should be better at hitting, but he hates practicing.
intention: Joel has to decide whether to practice hitting.
moral_action: Joel wants to get paid more, so he decides to practice more.
immoral_action: Joel decides that he's good enough at hitting and never practices.

norm: It is good to uphold laws and regulations
situation: Jim is driving towards the airport.
intention: Jim wants to make it to his flight on time.
moral_action: Jim drives within the speed limit and reaches the airport quickly.
immoral_action: Jim drives above the speed limit in an attempt to get to the airport faster.

norm: It's good to keep trying at something.
situation: Matt wants to learn how to bake a cake, but his first attempt has been a failure.
intention: Matt wants to bake another cake.
moral_action: Matt switches recipes after failing to mix the ingredients.
immoral_action: Matt attempts making the cake, but he quits halfway through when the ingredients wouldn't mix together.

norm: It is good to be smart with your moeny.
situation: Brent, who has a car loan, got a stimulus check from the government.
intention: Brent wants to spend the money.
moral_action: Brent puts the money towards the car loan.
immoral_action: Brent spends the money on a wild party with his friends.

norm: It's good to be punctual.
situation: Ryan has an interview with Cassandra at noon and is getting ready in his house.
intention: Ryan wants to look his best for the interview.
moral_action: Ryan leaves the house promptly, making sure that he gets to the venue a few minutes early to freshen up before he meets Cassandra.
immoral_action: Ryan takes too long fixing his hair to make sure that it looks perfect before heading to his interview and is 15 minutes late.

norm: It's good to want to look the best you can.
situation: Jane and her friend were invited to a fancy dinner party with lots of important people.
intention: Jane wants to put on clothing for the dinner.
moral_action: Jane decided to wear a very good looking ball gown to the dinner.
immoral_action: Jane decided to wear a tattered tank-top and a mini-skirt to the fancy dinner.

norm: It is good to post things that are not nasty.
situation: Tammy posts often on Facebook.
intention: Tammy wants to make posts that are noticed by many.
moral_action: Tammy  shares uplifiting posts and interesting highlights of her day.
immoral_action: Tammy often makes controversial political statements and verbally attacks people with her posts.

norm: It's good to put safety first.
situation: Sam slept in and is in danger of being late to work.
intention: Sam wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Sam puts his seat belt on and drives to work at the speed limit.
immoral_action: Sam rushes to work in his car speeding and doesn't take the time to put his seatbelt on.

norm: It is good to take care of your resposibilites.
situation: Dave has only one thousand dollars left for this month and knows he hasn't paid his child support yet which is 1000 dollars.
intention: Dave wants to decide how to spend his last 1000.
moral_action: Dave decides that he should pay the child support that is due for this month.
immoral_action: Dave decides that he should buy himself a new couch since the old one is starting to deterorate.

norm: It's good to make the best out of a situation.
situation: Pat got laid off from his job after his employer was losing too much money.
intention: Pat wants to find another job.
moral_action: Pat makes money from home by selling paintings that he makes.
immoral_action: Pat applies to only one job and plays video games all day.

norm: It is good to keep an ID on you.
situation: Amman is at the front of the line at the entrance of a nightclub but can't find his ID.
intention: Amman wants to get into the club.
moral_action: Amman accepts responsibility and fetches his wallet.
immoral_action: Amman tells the bouncer that his ID is in the car and that he's not waiting in line again.

norm: It is good to take responisibility.
situation: Josh has broken his mother's vase on accident and knows she will be upset.
intention: Josh wants to tell his mother about the vase.
moral_action: Josh tells his mother that he will work to pay for the vase that he broke.
immoral_action: Josh tells his mother that his brother was the one who broke the vase.

norm: It's good to show patience.
situation: Larry is teaching his son Troy math but Troy is having a really hard time grasping it.
intention: Larry wants to comment on Troy's slowness.
moral_action: "Larry tells Troy ""it's ok, just take it one line at a time, and we'll get through this""."
immoral_action: "Larry screams at Troy ""can't you just get it already? Jesus!"" and slams his hand on the table."

norm: It's good to want to have keep sakes.
situation: Jared is moving to a new house.
intention: Jared wants to clean out his drawers.
moral_action: Jared packs up trinkets he's been keeping for a long time to bring to his new house.
immoral_action: Jared throws away trinkets he's been keeping for a long time.

norm: It's nice to stay persistent.
situation: Ashley has gained weight after a long vacation with her family.
intention: Ashley wants to lose weight.
moral_action: Ashley joins a health club and insists on doing workout everyday even though it is tough.
immoral_action: Ashley takes diet pills which she thinks is easy and effortless.

norm: It's good to be patient for your ride.
situation: Joe was waiting on a ride from his friend to get to school.
intention: Joe wants to get to school early.
moral_action: Joe asks his mother if she can bring him to school instead.
immoral_action: Joe calls his friend and tells him that he need to hurry up.

norm: It's good to were protective items when you need to.
situation: Tom is in a virus pandemic and people are advocating wearing masks.
intention: Tom wants to feel free and good.
moral_action: Tom buys a comfortable mask and wears it when he goes out where he wants to.
immoral_action: Tom ignores the people and never wears a mask outside.

norm: It's good to take care of life's responsibilities.
situation: Anna, a lego collector, has been laid off from her job and is depending on her savings to pay her mortgage.
intention: Anna wants to add new limited edition lego set for her collection.
moral_action: Anna buys the set from a reseller at a mark up after she finds a new job and saves up for the set.
immoral_action: Anna uses some of her savings to buy the limited edition set when it comes out.

norm: It's good to stay ahead of emergency situations.
situation: Katie hears that everyone is buying toilet paper up because of the impending coronavirus quarantine.
intention: Katie wants to decide whether to stock up on toiler paper or not.
moral_action: Katie buys a couple packs of toilet paper, enough to tide her over for at least a month.
immoral_action: Katie only buys a few rolls of toiler paper, assuming the rumors about low supply are overblown.

norm: It's good to act more responsibly.
situation: Milton has had one too many drinks with his friends and is ready to call it a night.
intention: Milton wants to go home.
moral_action: Milton uses a ride share service to get a ride home.
immoral_action: Milton gets in his car and attempts to drive home.

norm: It's good to put things where they will be protected
situation: James bought a set of garden tools such as shovels and cutters for his backyard.
intention: James wants to put the garden tools somewhere when he's not using them.
moral_action: James puts his garden tools in the garage when not in use.
immoral_action: James puts his garden tools out on the open grass when not in use.

norm: It's good to uphold the rules
situation: Andy is playing Tennis with Carl and the score has been very close in the game.
intention: Andy wants to win the game.
moral_action: Andy doesn't accept any points that are questionable and continues to play until both he and Carl agree that the game has been won within the rules.
immoral_action: Andy scores on his opponent but the ball appears to have hit the ground just outside the line and is out of bounds, but Andy insists on recording the point.

norm: It's good to be patient when waiting for things.
situation: Sara had gone to a busy diner and had been waiting over a half hour for her food.
intention: Sara wants to eat.
moral_action: Sara asks the waiter if she can have a few crackers while she waits.
immoral_action: Sara walks into the back and into the kitchen and makes herself a sandwich.

norm: It's good to defend yourself as necessary.
situation: Bonnie is at school and a classmate keeps physically bullying her.
intention: Bonnie wants the abuse to stop.
moral_action: Bonnie decides to take a stand against the classmate and gets into an altercation making promises to do it again.
immoral_action: Bonnie decides that if she ignores it that it could stop, so she just hangs her head down when she is bullied.

norm: It is good to follow the rules.
situation: Trevor is in an MMA fight where elbow strikes are not allowed.
intention: Trevor wants to hit his opponent.
moral_action: Trevor hits his opponent with a punch.
immoral_action: Trevor hits his opponent with an elbow strike.

norm: Friends shouldn't get angry with each other.
situation: Bill and Matt are talking on the phone when Matt tells Bill that he won't be able to make it to Bill's concert tomorrow.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Matt's statement.
moral_action: Bill tells Matt that it's OK if he doesn't come as he's sure there's a good reason, and that there'll be other concerts.
immoral_action: Bill tells Matt that the fact he even contemplated not coming is enough to end their friendship and angrily slams down the phone.

norm: You shouldn't say hurtful things to your friends.
situation: Greg is a high school student.
intention: Greg wants to be more popular in school.
moral_action: Greg joins a sports team the popular kids are on and spends time with them.
immoral_action: Greg makes fun of the nerdy friends he has to fit in with the cooler kids.

norm: You shouldn't be a jerk to your friends.
situation: Amy is holding a dinner party and convinces her childhood friend, Jenny, to cater for the event.
intention: Amy wants to make sure everything in the party goes right.
moral_action: Amy tells Jenny what she wants and lets Jenny do her thing.
immoral_action: Amy spends the whole night ordering Jenny around.

norm: You shouldn't upset your friend's partner.
situation: Frank's girlfriend Rosy asks Kyle if her jeans make her look fat.
intention: Kyle wants to be honest with Rosy.
moral_action: Kyle tells Rosy the jeans really hug her curves.
immoral_action: Kyle tells Rosy that the the jeans do make her look fat.

norm: You shouldn't be rude toward employees.
situation: Dave who is a manager of an office sees that Phil, an employee is doing a bad job.
intention: Dave wants to say something to Phil about his work habits.
moral_action: Dave tells Phil that he notices Phil is having a hard time at work and offers to give Phil a coaching session.
immoral_action: Dave tells Phil that he is a moron and that his work habits are awful and that if he doesn't pick it up he's gone.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to your coworkers.
situation: Tom is at lunch with some of his coworkers, and he has a headache.
intention: Tom wants some peace and quiet and wants to be alone.
moral_action: Tom excuses himself and says he is not feeling well and goes to relax in his car.
immoral_action: Tom tells his coworkers to get out of the break room and leave him alone, he needs quiet.

norm: You shouldn't say rude things to your friends.
situation: David's laptop was damaged by his friend who dropped it by accident.
intention: David wants his friend to answer for the damage.
moral_action: David asks his friend to cover the costs of the necessary repairs.
immoral_action: David confronts and curses at his friend.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to your neighbors.
situation: Joe notices that his neighbor just had his house painted an unusual color.
intention: Joe wants to tell his neighbor what he thinks of the color.
moral_action: Joe tells his neighbor that he thinks the color of his house is very unique.
immoral_action: Joe tells his neighbor that the color is horrible and it makes his house look gross now.

norm: You shouldn't be bitter and jealous toward your friends.
situation: Edward's friend just landed an amazing job while Edward has been struggling for a while.
intention: Edward wants to help himself feel better.
moral_action: Edward congratulates his friend and takes some time to do activites that relax and center him.
immoral_action: Edward puts down his friend's achievement and makes snide comments.

norm: You should not be rude to co workers.
situation: Alice was working on a project with her coworkers.
intention: Alice wanted to give her opinion on the project.
moral_action: Alice congratulates her coworkers for their contributions.
immoral_action: Alice tells her coworkers that their contributions are terrible.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to your significant others.
situation: Jack is taking Sally out on a date for their anniversary.
intention: Jack wants Sally to agree to look for a job.
moral_action: Jack calmly talks with Sally about her looking for a job she agrees to look for one.
immoral_action: Jack starts to talk rude to Sally about her not having a job, so she agrees to get one.

norm: You shouldn't be upset at your friends.
situation: Mark is playing basketball with his friends, and they are down several points.
intention: Mark wants to coach his friends.
moral_action: Mark develops a plan that utilizes his friends' skills.
immoral_action: Mark tells his friends that they're doing everything wrong, and they are unskilled players.

norm: You shouldn't hurt your friend's feelings.
situation: David invites his friend Sheila to dinner and shows her his artwork.
intention: Sheila wants to critique David's artwork.
moral_action: Sheila points out some parts of David's artwork that she thinks could use improvement and also points out the good points in his art.
immoral_action: Sheila tells David that his artwork is blase and mediocre and that he shouldn't quit his day job.

norm: You shouldn't distrust your friends.
situation: Tina's friend tells her that she has some serious concerns about Tina's new boyfriend.
intention: Tina wants to respond to her friend's comments about her new boyfriend.
moral_action: Tina thanks her friend for her genuine concern and promises to be cautious and keep in mind what her friend has told her.
immoral_action: Tina tells her friend that she is just jealous of Tina for having a boyfriend and rudely dismisses all her friend's concerns.

norm: You shouldn't hate your coworkers.
situation: Jim works in an office as as manager to employees, and Bob is his boss.
intention: Jim wants to give a report about his employees to Bob.
moral_action: Jim tells Bob his employees are doing well, but could be more hard working, and he doesn't hate them.
immoral_action: Jim tells Bob he hates his employees and doesn't want to be around them.

norm: You shouldn't freak out on your dates.
situation: Lisa is startled when her blind date turns out to be a top executive from her firm.
intention: Lisa wants to react to the surprising revelation.
moral_action: Lisa laughs iff the coincidence and suggests they have a pleasant evening together.
immoral_action: Lisa gets flustered and is unable to hold a coherent conversation with her date.

norm: You shouldn't call your friends bad words.
situation: Tim is playing his game together with his friend when his friend damages the game by mistake.
intention: Tim wants to show his friend that he's unhappy that they broke the game.
moral_action: Tim tells his friend that he's really upset they damaged the game and that they can't play it any more.
immoral_action: Tim yells at his friend calling him some by some very bad words.

norm: You shouldn't be cold toward coworkers.
situation: Ted has a job at a factory and his co-workers ask him if he wants to hang out after work.
intention: Ted wants to respond to his co-worker's request.
moral_action: Ted tells his co-workers he'd love to hang out after work.
immoral_action: Ted tells his co-workers that he's not into hanging out.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your friends when they are over.
situation: Hiroki is playing a trading card game with his friends when his mom in the other room asks him to help with some chores.
intention: Hiroki wants to help his mom.
moral_action: Hiroki asks his friends to help him with the chores real quick.
immoral_action: Hiroki leaves his friends in the room and goes to help his mom with the chores.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on your partner with your friend.
situation: Elisa has a boyfriend and is meeting an old friend named Jim for dinner who is hitting on her.
intention: Elisa wants to respond to Jim's flirtations.
moral_action: Elisa tells Jim that they're friends, but she's already in a relationship.
immoral_action: Elisa tells Jim that they can have a side relationship without her boyfriend knowing.

norm: You shouldn't break your classmate's hearts.
situation: Jinyoung is eating lunch when a girl he doesn't love confesses her feelings to him.
intention: Jinyoung wants to respond to the girl.
moral_action: Jinyoung compliments her and offers to set her up with one of his attractive friends.
immoral_action: Jinyoung rejects the girl with blunt words in front of everyone.

norm: You shouldn't be a jerk to your neighbors.
situation: "Doro is walking to his mailbox and very tired, as his neighbor gives him a ""Hello""."
intention: Doro wants to avoid a long conversation.
moral_action: Doro waves back and says he'll connect with the neighbor later on, after he gets some sleep.
immoral_action: Doro waves off the neighbor as he darts indoors.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your friends and slip away from them.
situation: Randy just recently started dating Theresa, a young woman that he finds very attractive and interesting.
intention: Randy wants to spend more time getting to know Theresa.
moral_action: Randy invites Theresa to join him when he's hanging out with his group of friends.
immoral_action: Randy slowly spends more and more time with Theresa instead of with his friends who rarely ever get to see him anymore.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to family friends.
situation: Ken is at the wedding of two family friends, watching other people make toasts.
intention: Ken wants to give a toast.
moral_action: Ken stands up and tells stories about the bride and groom as children.
immoral_action: Ken stands up and tells the bride and groom that they're perfect for each other because they're both overweight.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to your family.
situation: Derrick is on an important business call while working from home and his family is in the background making a lot of noise.
intention: Derrick wants to be able to hear the person he's talking to clearly.
moral_action: Derrick covers the receiver of his phone and quietly asks his family to tone down the noise for a bit.
immoral_action: Derrick covers the receiver of his phone for a moment and shouts at his family to shut up.

norm: You shouldn't feel embarrassed about your friends.
situation: Dave is a star basketball player in high school and sees that his nonathletic friend Neal is trying out for the team.
intention: Dave wants to react to Neal trying out for the basketball team.
moral_action: Dave gives tips to Neal to help him out with try outs.
immoral_action: Dave distances himself from Neal because Neal isn't a good player.

norm: You shouldn't hurt your best friend.
situation: Richard loses to his best friend Eric in a game of chess and is upset.
intention: Richard wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: Richard takes a breath and congratulates him and asks to do another activity he may beat him in.
immoral_action: Richard tells Eric he doesn't want to be his friend anymore in a raised voice.

norm: You shouldn't keep things you aren't supposed to have.
situation: Kara is jogging at her local park when she finds a watch in the grass.
intention: Kara wants a new watch.
moral_action: Kara leaves the watch at the park and orders herself a similar one online.
immoral_action: Kara decides to keep the watch that she finds at the park for herself.

norm: You shouldn't expect rides from people.
situation: Chris is headed to a basketball game.
intention: Chris wants to get there on time but doesn't have a car.
moral_action: Chris asks a friend if they'll give him a ride since they're headed to the game too.
immoral_action: Chris pressures his dad into driving him out of his way to the game, making his dad late to work.

norm: You shouldn't expect someone to work when they're not scheduled.
situation: Jaime manages a small retail store where she is in charge of making the schedule for her employees, Beth, Crystal, and Sarah.
intention: Jaime wants Sarah to work a shift with Beth and Crystal on Thursday.
moral_action: Jaime adds all of her employees to Thusday's schedule and tells them of it beforehand.
immoral_action: Jaime puts only Beth and Crystal on for Thursday's schedule, and reprimands Sarah when she doesnt show up.

norm: You shouldn't do things that you aren't allowed to do.
situation: Jason's boss is going to be out of town for two week so, there will be no supervisor present in the office.
intention: Jason wants to show how responsible he is by doing all of his assigned work while his boss is away.
moral_action: Jason shows up on time for work each day and tries to go above and beyond on each of his tasks.
immoral_action: Jason does his work but also spends a great deal of time on social media sites, which is forbidden in his office.

norm: You shouldn't make a commitment that you aren't sure about.
situation: Mary's birthday is coming and a birthday party will be held at her home.
intention: Jill, Mary's sister, wants to make the party more fun.
moral_action: Jill has practiced a song for a while and sings it in front of the guests at the party.
immoral_action: Jill promises to make a birthday cake for Mary even though it is her first time making cake.

norm: You shouldn't go back on your word.
situation: Mark has agreed to help George paint his house on the weekend.
intention: Mark wants to have a fun weekend.
moral_action: Mark asks other friends to join him and George for a house painting party.
immoral_action: Mark cancels his plans with George and goes to the shore for the weekend.

norm: You shouldn't emphasize things in the past.
situation: Sarah's kids asked for an entertaining story to pass the time.
intention: Sarah wants to tell a fun story.
moral_action: Sarah makes up a story, drawing from a bunch of fantasy books she's read for inspiration.
