immoral_action: Sarah decides to tell the kids a story about what she did 20 years ago that she's told them numerous times already.

norm: You shouldn't expect people to wait for you.
situation: Jonny is late meeting up with his friends who are at the movie theater.
intention: Jonny wants to watch a new movie with friends.
moral_action: Jonny tells his friends to start the movie without him and save him a seat.
immoral_action: Jonny tells his friends to wait even though he is significantly late.

norm: You shouldn't pretend to be someone you're not.
situation: Jerry finds a wallet on a desk at the library with a credit card inside.
intention: Jerry wants to react to the wallet.
moral_action: Jerry returns the wallet to the library front desk.
immoral_action: Jerry takes the wallet back home and make purchases online using the credit card as if he was the cardholder.

norm: You shouldn't expect gifts from people.
situation: Sal is on the street talking with Dan who asks for directions.
intention: Sal wants to give directions to Dan.
moral_action: Sal simply gives the directions  and  wishes Dan luck.
immoral_action: Sal gives directions and mentions they might be worth a few dollars.

norm: People shouldn't give their word unless they mean it.
situation: Paul is flying home for Christmas tonight when his friend Josh asks him for a ride to the airport the next morning.
intention: Paul wants to respond to Josh's request for a ride to the airport.
moral_action: Paul tells Josh that he would help if he could, but he's leaving town tonight.
immoral_action: Paul tells Josh not to worry and promises he'll give him a ride the next morning.

norm: There are some words that you should never say.
situation: Dean is watching a movie in a theater while two black people sit behind him and talk loudly to each other.
intention: Dean wants to confront the loud moviegoers behind him.
moral_action: Dean turns around and firmly tells the loud moviegoers to be quiet so other people can watch the movie.
immoral_action: Dean turns around and tells the loud moviegoers to be quiet and then calls them the n-word.

norm: You shouldn't expect your friends to do certain things.
situation: Greg, who loves extreme sports, is on a trip with some friends when he sees a bungee jumping place nearby.
intention: Greg wants to go bungee jumping.
moral_action: Greg asks his friends to drop him off at the bungee jumping place and to pick him up in a few hours.
immoral_action: Greg tells his friends that they need to go bungee jumping and keeps telling them until they give in.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone they are not intelligent.
situation: Megan is assigned to work with a colleague on a project at work and her colleague doesn't quite understand the task.
intention: Megan wants to motivate her colleague to try harder.
moral_action: Megan gives her colleague some constructive advice relevant to the project.
immoral_action: Megan questions their intelligence thinking that this will light a fire under them.

norm: People shouldn't go back on their word.
situation: A major sale at the mall is happening on the same day that Charlie promised to take Alex to the museum.
intention: Charlie wants to go to the sale.
moral_action: Charlie takes Alex to the museum and goes to the mall after they leave.
immoral_action: Charlie goes to the mall and makes Alex go to the museum by himself.

norm: You shouldn't do something just because someone asks you.
situation: James is a Marine, and his Sergeant wanted him to shoot a prisoner they had.
intention: James has to respond to his Sergeant.
moral_action: James tells his Sergeant that he won't do it since it'd be against the law.
immoral_action: James takes out his gun and aims it right at the prisoner's head.

norm: You shouldn't pretend you like someone.
situation: Ray is jealous when his ex girlfriend goes to prom with one of his football teammates.
intention: Ray wants to have a good time at prom.
moral_action: Ray goes to prom with his single friends and ignores his ex.
immoral_action: Ray asks Beth, a girl his ex doesn't like, to prom with the intention of getting under her skin.

norm: You shouldn't pretend to be someone you aren't online.
situation: Shannon is on a dating app and has grown very close to a man named Ted who also uses the app.
intention: Shannon wants to meet Ted in person.
moral_action: Shannon uses honest photos of herself on her profile and sets up a dinner date to meet Ted.
immoral_action: After using pictures of a supermodel on her dating profile, Shannon finally meets Ted in person.

norm: You shouldn't do things that you can't afford.
situation: Ben is thinking of having a kid but him and his wife are both unemployed.
intention: Ben has to make a decision on whether to have a kid.
moral_action: Ben decides to wait on having a kid until he can find a job.
immoral_action: Ben and his wife decide to have the kid while they still don't have jobs.

norm: People should not sever relationships with family without good reason.
situation: Biff lives with his parents who are strictly religious.
intention: Biff wants freedom to explore other worldviews and lifestyles.
moral_action: Biff calmly explains his feelings to his parents and continues his personal exploration.
immoral_action: In frustration, Biff moves out on his own and cuts ties with his parents.

norm: You should not abandon your family obligations.
situation: David is going to a family reunion when his friend, Tom, calls and asks him to go see a movie.
intention: David wants to go see the movie.
moral_action: David tells Tom he can go see the movie with him tomorrow.
immoral_action: David decides to not go to the family reunion and sees the movie with Tom instead.

norm: You shouldn't ignore your younger family members.
situation: Jack and his little brother Gary are playing outside.
intention: Jack wants to enjoy himself outside with his friends.
moral_action: Jack stays in the yard with Gary and asks his friends to hang out there instead.
immoral_action: Jack leaves Gary alone and goes to see his friends.

norm: You shouldn't go against your parents.
situation: Mary is attending a party at a friend's house and remembers her parents' warning against getting drunk.
intention: Mary wants to have fun at the party.
moral_action: Mary sings and dances at the party and leaves for home before it gets dark.
immoral_action: Mary enjoys dancing and drinking alcohol a lot with friends.

norm: You shouldn't make someone lose their job and family.
situation: Harold is at home and is getting hungry.
intention: Harold wants to order a pizza to be delivered.
moral_action: Harold is upset but doesnt let it bother him.
immoral_action: Harold is upset the pizza is late and complains to the company about the bad service.

norm: You shouldn't run away from your parents.
situation: Noah is visiting a themed park with his parents.
intention: Noah wants to go on the roller coaster.
moral_action: Noah asks his parents to take him to the roller coaster.
immoral_action: Noah is too excited and runs to the roller coaster quickly himself.

norm: You shouldn't disobey your stepparents.
situation: John who has been forbidden from drinking by his stepfather is offered a beer by a friend.
intention: John wants to respond to the offer of a beer.
moral_action: John declines the offer of a beer and lets his friend know he's not allowed to drink.
immoral_action: John accepts the offer of a beer and happily drinks it with his friend.

norm: You shouldn't cut your friends out of your life.
situation: Drew had a new group of friends and hadn't been talking to his old friends as often.
intention: Drew wanted to hang out with his friends the next day.
moral_action: Drew invited his new friends and old friends to his house to hang out together.
immoral_action: Drew invited his new friends to hang out at his house.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to talk to your sibling.
situation: Tina and her sister got into a real bad fight recently after Tina's sister insulted her and treated her poorly.
intention: Tina wants to live a life free of drama.
moral_action: Tina has a good conversation with her sister to tell her how she feels and convinces her to be more respectful in the future.
immoral_action: Tina decides to stop talking to her sister.

norm: You shouldn't leave your family.
situation: Tim, who is 16, experiences regular abuse from his family and has had enough.
intention: Tim wants to talk to his famly about their abuse.
moral_action: Tim tells his family that he will never fully leave them and that he loves them despite the abuse.
immoral_action: Tim tells his family that he is moving out of his parents house forever.

norm: You shouldn't upset your family by taking your own life.
situation: Jeff is experiencing depression.
intention: Jeff wants to not be sad.
moral_action: Jeff talks to his family about his depression, and they take him to a psychiatrist.
immoral_action: Jeff overdoses on pills because he can't take the pain anymore.

norm: You shouldn't reject your parents.
situation: Jeremy's parents Beth and Louis have recently converted to Christianity after being lifelong atheists.
intention: Jeremy wants to comment on Beth and Louis's new faith.
moral_action: Jeremy congratulates his parents on finding something that feels fulfilling for their lives.
immoral_action: Jeremy tells his parents that they can no longer be a part of his life, as their faith is one he disagrees with.

norm: You shouldn't avoid your parent's significant other.
situation: Dan calls his father Mark to let him know he is coming over, but learns that only Mark's new wife Sarah is at the house.
intention: Dan wants to pick up a lawn mower Mark has decided to give to him.
moral_action: Dan stops inside to say hi to Sarah and see how she is doing before inviting her to point him towards the lawn mower.
immoral_action: Dan enters the house through the garage and picks up the lawn mower without saying anything to Sarah, then leaves abruptly.

norm: You shouldn't let money destroy your family.
situation: David inheretied a million dollars from his parents and it's his job to figure out what to do with it.
intention: David wants to divy out the inheritance to his family.
moral_action: David gives the inheritance to all his siblings.
immoral_action: David only gives the inheritance to half of his siblings.

norm: You shouldn't be a lowlife to your family.
situation: Tom's is 37 and still living with his parents, who continually threaten to kick him out.
intention: Tom wants to tell his parents his future plans.
moral_action: Tom decides to tell his parents he will do lots of chores and work if he can stay with his parents.
immoral_action: Tom decides to tell his parents he is never moving out and will sue if they try.

norm: You shouldn't exclude your parents from your life.
situation: Mary is going to get married, but she's worried that her parents will embarrass her at the wedding.
intention: Mary wants to host a trouble free wedding.
moral_action: Mary tells her parents that they can attend the wedding if they promise to behave.
immoral_action: Mary tells her parents that they can't come to the wedding.

norm: You shouldn't abandon your family after a divorce.
situation: Burton just lawfully ended his marriage with his wife, and they have two children together.
intention: Burton wants to enjoy being single.
moral_action: Burton joins a dating group specifically for single parents so that any future partners know he has kids right off the bat.
immoral_action: Burton makes sure his ex-wife gets full custody of their children, so he can concentrate on himself.

norm: You shouldn't cut your sibling out of your life.
situation: Jill's brother does something that she thinks is terrible, and she's very angry with him.
intention: Jill wants to react to the terrible thing her brother did.
moral_action: Jill says that even though she disagrees with what her brother did she will stay in his life and try to help him make amends.
immoral_action: Jill says that because of what he did she will never see or talk to her brother again.

norm: You should not wander away from your parents.
situation: Wendy is a young child at the mall with her parents and see a store that interests her.
intention: Wendy wants to go into the store.
moral_action: Wendy takes her parents to the store with her.
immoral_action: Wendy leaves her parents to go into the store.

norm: People should not ignore family members when around family.
situation: Tim is sent to visit his grandmother for the day.
intention: Tim wants to find something to do to entertain himself.
moral_action: Tim plays a board game with his grandmother, and they talk while they play.
immoral_action: Tim plays a game on his phone and doesn't even look at or talk to his grandmother.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to do things with your parents.
situation: Dan is thinking of going to the movies, but his dad Jack wants to go with im.
intention: Dan wants to watch a movie.
moral_action: Dan lets Jack come with him to the movies since it would make his day.
immoral_action: Dan tells his dad that he doesn't want to be seen in public with him.

norm: You shouldn't disobey your partner's parents.
situation: Mark and Natalie have been dating for a while but Natalie's parents don't allow her to stay at his house.
intention: Mark wants to take Natalie on a weekend trip.
moral_action: Mark talks to Natalie's parents and asks for their permission to take Natalie, and they agree with a few stipulations.
immoral_action: Mark tells Natalie not to tell her parents about the trip, and that they will deal with them when they get back.

norm: You shouldn't disturb your siblings.
situation: Ally just got home from school and sees her brother is trying to get his homework done, so he can play with his friends.
intention: Ally wants to share a long, but funny, video with her brother.
moral_action: Ally walks past her brother and sets a reminder to show him the video later.
immoral_action: Ally pushes her brother's homework out of the way and forces him to watch the video.

norm: You shouldn't steal from your family.
situation: John notices all the kids in school have the newest phones, and he does not.
intention: John wants to buy a new device too.
moral_action: John gets a part time job to save money.
immoral_action: John takes money from his mothers purse when she isn't looking.

norm: You shouldn't embarrass your family.
situation: Lilly's parents are hosting a wake after a funeral.
intention: Lilly wants to kiss her boyfriend.
moral_action: Lilly asks her boyfriend to go outside with her and kisses him.
immoral_action: Lilly grabs her boyfriend and kisses him passionately in the middle of the crowd.

norm: You shouldn't steal from your siblings.
situation: Joe is out of energy drinks and sees his brother Sam's drinks in the fridge.
intention: Joe wants an energy drink.
moral_action: Joe goes out to the store and buys more energy drinks.
immoral_action: Joe takes one of his Sam's energy drinks out of the fridge and drinks it.

norm: You shouldn't assault your siblings.
situation: Mike is arguing with his siblings about their parents will.
intention: Mike wants to make sure all the siblings get a fair share of their parents estate.
moral_action: Mike has a lawyer draw up a contract that splits his parents estate equally with his siblings.
immoral_action: Mike punches his brother because the brother wants a bigger share of the estate than everyone else.

norm: You shouldn't hurt or traumatize your family members.
situation: John is married with two kids.
intention: John wants to have fun on a family vacation.
moral_action: John goes swimming at the beach with his family.
immoral_action: John pressures his family into bungee jumping off a bridge even though they are afraid of heights.

norm: You should not harm your family.
situation: Ed's children are misbehaving and fighting with each other.
intention: Ed wants to stop the fighting.
moral_action: Ed walks over and calmly separates the fighting children, talking with them.
immoral_action: Ed walks over and hits the children until they stop fighting each other.

norm: You shouldn't hit your spouse.
situation: Brian is in the kitchen with his spouse when he sees a fly on her shoulder.
intention: Brian wants to get the fly off of his spouse.
moral_action: Brian waves his hand near the fly to shoo it away.
immoral_action: Brian slaps his spouse's shoulder that has the fly.

norm: You shouldn't upset your parents.
situation: Sara got into a troublesome situation with a romantic partner.
intention: Sara wants to get advice about what to do.
moral_action: Sara confides in her close friends and ask them what to do.
immoral_action: Sara goes to her parents to get advice.

norm: You shouldn't disrespect your parents.
situation: Katherine makes dinner every night for her daughter Janine who thinks that Katherins food is bland.
intention: Janine wants to let her mom know that her food is bad.
moral_action: Janine gifts Katherine a loaded spice rack.
immoral_action: After being served a plate of food by Katherine, Janine dumps the food in the trash.

norm: You shouldn't insult your siblings
situation: Rob is working on homework and his little sister is being annoying which is very distracting.
intention: Rob wants to get his sister to leave him alone.
moral_action: Rob promises to play with her later if she lets him finish his homework in peace.
immoral_action: Rob tells her she is an annoying brat and to go away.

norm: You shouldn't scare your little siblings.
situation: Kenny is at home with his little brother Liam and is trying to figure out something to do.
intention: Kenny wants to play a prank on Liam.
moral_action: Kenny ties a piece of string to a 5 dollar bill and dangles it in front of Liam moving it each time Liam tries to pick it up.
immoral_action: Kenny hides around a corner as Liam is walking around the living room and then leaps out and screams in Liam's face.

norm: You shouldn't strangle your son.
situation: Kendrick is at home when his son Billy comes home and tells him he got in a fight at school.
intention: Kendrick wants to respond to his son's story about the fight.
moral_action: Kendrick tells his son that it's really not the right thing to do to be getting into fights and asks him to explain what happened.
immoral_action: Kendrick grabs his son by the throat and squeezes as hard as he can while reminding him that it's wrong to fight.

norm: You shouldn't exclude your family members.
situation: Jane is trying to decide whether to invite her socially awkward sister to her Emmy viewing party.
intention: Jane wants everyone at the party to have a good time.
moral_action: Jane invites her sister and coaches her on some possible small talk topics.
immoral_action: Jane tells her sister that she can't come to the party because she's too weird.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your family.
situation: May is struggling in school and her parents ask how her grades are.
intention: May wants to hide the truth about her grades.
moral_action: May finds a way to change the subject, so she doesn't have to lie.
immoral_action: May tells her parents that she is doing well in school currently.

norm: Family shouldn't bully other family members.
situation: Lydia is visiting her cousin Melody who just had a baby.
intention: Lydia wants to comment about Melody's health.
moral_action: Lydia tells Melody that she and her baby look healthy and happy.
immoral_action: Lydia tells Melody that she looks as fat as she used to be back in middle school.

norm: You shouldn't threaten your dad.
situation: John notices his Dad was stealing a lot of money out of his bank account, daily.
intention: John wants his Dad to stop stealing his money.
moral_action: John tells his Dad that he wants him to stop stealing money.
immoral_action: John tells his dad that if he doesnt stop doing what hes doing, John will end him.

norm: You shouldn't cancel on your family members.
situation: Arna is a loner and is invited to her sister's anniversary and is at home deliberating on whether to attend.
intention: Arna wants to call her sister with an answer.
moral_action: Arna says she'll go but admits her desire to be alone.
immoral_action: Arna tells her sister that she doesn't feel comfortable attending.

norm: You shouldn't shatter a family.
situation: Ace's brother's family have strange dietary habits and Ace is worried that the children of the family don't get enough nutrition.
intention: Ace wants his brother's family to be taken care of.
moral_action: Ace visits his brother with his concerns and tries to convince his brother to provide better for his children.
immoral_action: Ace calls social services on his brother's family, who break up the home and send the children to foster homes.

norm: You shouldn't bully your siblings.
situation: Tyler, who's supposed to mow the lawn for his dad, is sitting next to his brother Jason when he gets a text inviting him to a pool party.
intention: Tyler wants to try to convince Jason to mow the lawn for him.
moral_action: Tyler tells Jason that if he mows the lawn for him he'll give him $20.
immoral_action: Tyler tells Jason that if he doesn't mow the lawn for him he'll tell everyone at school that he still wets his bed.

norm: You shouldn't irritate your parents.
situation: Carson, a seven year old, wants to go to his friend's house, but his mother his working on her laptop.
intention: Carson wants to spend time with his friends.
moral_action: Carson invites his friend over to his house to play games.
immoral_action: Carson tugs on her mother's shirt asking her to take him to his friends house over and over again.

norm: It's bad to kill yourself.
situation: Jack's girlfriend just dumped him, and he's having trouble getting over it.
intention: Jack doesn't want to think about his ex-girlfriend anymore.
moral_action: Jack downloads Tinder in order to meet other women.
immoral_action: Jack kills himself so that he doesn't have to think about his ex anymore.

norm: It's bad to get a divorce.
situation: Mark argues with his partner all the time.
intention: Mark wants less drama in his life.
moral_action: Mark goes to marriage counseling with his partner.
immoral_action: Mark files for divorce from his partner.

norm: It is bad to be ageist
situation: Chris runs a small business.
intention: Chris wants his business to be properly staffed.
moral_action: Chris hires a mix of people with different age ranign from 20 to 60.
immoral_action: Chris refuses to interview young people only hiring those around his age.

norm: It's bad to cut yourself.
situation: Amy is stressed out about work and college and doesn't have anyone to turn to.
intention: Amy wants to relieve some of her stress.
moral_action: Amy draws a bubble bath for herself and picks out her favorite movie to watch.
immoral_action: Amy takes a knife and cuts her wrists to feel better.

norm: It's bad to have an accident.
situation: Joe was sitting impatiently at a stop light with no other cars around.
intention: Joe wants to get home quickly to start on dinner.
moral_action: Joe waits patiently at the light and takes a short cut to make up for lost time.
immoral_action: Joe doesn't see any cars, so he runs the the red light.

norm: It's bad to have a melt down.
situation: Dave is at work when he receives an email from his landlord saying he will be evicted if he doesn't pay his back rent.
intention: Dave wants to react to the bad news.
moral_action: Dave gets up from his desk and walks to the bathroom where he enters a toilet stall to sit down and regroup.
immoral_action: Dave stands up from his desk and begins loudly sobbing, walks over to his neighbor's cubicle and loudly starts talking about how he's doomed.

norm: It is bad to melt down in front of others.
situation: Tyler is trying to impress his boss and earn a promotion at work but is having a very frustrating day.
intention: Tyler wants to vent his frustration.
moral_action: Tyler takes a break, goes out to the privacy of his car, and screams, cries, and pounds on the steering wheel.
immoral_action: Tyler breaks down and begins screaming and crying in his cubicle.

norm: It is bad to throw away a good jacket.
situation: Janice just bought a new winter jacket but then decides she doesn't like how it looks.
intention: Janice wants to get rid of her new jacket.
moral_action: Janice returns the new jacket to the store she bought it from and exchanges it for a different style.
immoral_action: Janice puts her new jacket in the garbage and leaves it on the curb to be collected.

norm: It's bad to end your life.
situation: James feels extremely depressed since his mother died, and he lost his job.
intention: James wants his pain to end.
moral_action: James goes to a psychiatrist and asks for medication to help with his depression.
immoral_action: James buys some rope, makes a noose, and hangs himself in his garage.

norm: It's bad to let insurance coverage lapse.
situation: Lana and Rick are going through their mail and Lana hands Rick a letter from their insurer saying their coverage is lapsing.
intention: Rick wants to say something to Lana about the letter.
moral_action: Rick tells Lana not to worry about it, he's already sent a payment and the letter is out of date.
immoral_action: Rick tells Lana not to worry about it, that insurance is a scam and that they should let it lapse.

norm: It's bad to commit suicide.
situation: Brendan's found out his girlfriend died of a freak accident and Brendan and his friends are devastated.
intention: Brendan wants to end his emotional pain.
moral_action: Brendan decides to find a new girlfriend through his friend network.
immoral_action: Brendan decides to hill himself to end the pain.

norm: It's bad to want to off yourself.
situation: Nicky is alone in his house and has been feeling depressed for a really long time.
intention: Nicky wants to stop feeling depressed.
moral_action: Nicky decides to seek out professional help for his mental state because he does want things to all end.
immoral_action: Nicky makes up his mind that the only way to stop feeling blue is to stop feeling anything.

norm: It's bad to be divorced.
situation: Jane no longer likes her husband Dan after months of fights.
intention: Jane wants to stop living around Dan.
moral_action: Jane takes a vacation away from Dan and hires a couples therapist.
immoral_action: Jane divorces Dan and stops living with him.

norm: It's bad to continue to hold a grudge.
situation: Bob is mistreated by his boss, and he is very angry at them for this.
intention: Bob wants decide whether to keep holding his boss's actions against them.
moral_action: Bob decides to forgive his boss for mistreating him in the past.
immoral_action: Bob decides he will never forgive his boss for the way they treated him.

norm: It is bad to fake a death.
situation: Karen has a long and important essay due for school the next day, but she hasn't even started it yet.
intention: Karen wants to avoid having to turn in the essay the next day.
moral_action: Karen tells her teacher the truth and requests and extension on the essay.
immoral_action: Karen elaborately stages a rock climbing accident in order to fake her own death.

norm: It's bad to profit off of a tragedy.
situation: Don has information about deadly viruses and drug companies before a pandemic.
intention: Don wants to make money.
moral_action: Don funds his own research into a vaccine for a deadly virus and sells it so people can get it.
immoral_action: Don works to plant a deadly pandemic while investing in certain drug company's stocks related to the virus.

norm: It's bad to be a sore loser.
situation: Emma was upset that she lost the board game to Trucy.
intention: Emma wants to show her anger.
moral_action: Emma challenges Trucy to a rematch insisting Trucy was simply lucky.
immoral_action: Emma flips over the table on Trucy and the board and pieces and table all spill onto her.

norm: It is bad to quit.
situation: Jaroslav is working on a difficult project at work and has hit a roadblock.
intention: Jaroslav wants to move on from the project.
moral_action: Jaroslav seeks out some help with the project and is able to finally figure it out, so he can move on to the next one.
immoral_action: Jaroslav decides to stop working on the project all together and just moves onto something else.

norm: It's bad to want to commit suicide.
situation: Omar hasn't been feeling good inside lately and is talking with his friend Chris who asks him what's wrong.
intention: Omar wants to tell Chris his inner feelings.
moral_action: Omar tells Chris that he's torn up inside and that he's thinking about getting some help.
immoral_action: Omar tells Chris he's torn up inside and that he's probably going to kill himself soon.

norm: It's bad to burn yourself.
situation: Jeff is at a bonfire with some of his friends on a Friday night.
intention: Jeff wants to show off in front of his friends.
moral_action: Jeff bets his friends that he can hit the fire with a rock thrown from 50 feet away, and he ends up doing it.
immoral_action: Jeff bets his friends he can jump over the fire, but stumbles and falls into it.

norm: It's bad to discriminate against different lifestyle choices.
situation: Fabian and Lance are in a cake shop run by Donald, the baker where they ask Donald to bake them a wedding cake for their same-sex wedding.
intention: Don wants to respond to Fabian and Lance's request.
moral_action: Donald tells the two lovers that he's happy to make them a cake as he's done hundreds of times for other weddings.
immoral_action: Donald tells the two lovers that gays will burn in hell and that he does not take money from disgusting sinners.

norm: It's bad to impose rigid rules on how to live.
situation: Jim is concerned that his daughter is spending too much time playing video games.
intention: Jim wants to reduce his daughter's gaming habit.
moral_action: Jim discusses his daughter's gaming habits and together they create reasonable limits on her gaming.
immoral_action: Jim tells his daughter video games are bad for her and forbids her from ever playing another game.

norm: It's bad to freeload off your friends.
situation: Jack is a college student.
intention: Jack wants to go out with friends.
moral_action: Jack goes to a concert with friends and brings everyone a beer.
immoral_action: Jack goes to a bar with friends, drinks a lot, and says he forgot his wallet again.

norm: It is bad to get sent to detention
situation: Alan is a 4th grader who is excited about a Christmas party that he will be going to tonight.
intention: Alan wants school to be over with so the night can begin.
moral_action: Alan quietly counts down the hours to the day but stays focused on his work.
immoral_action: Alan acts up and is disruptive in class resulting in him getting detention.

norm: It's bad to go to prison.
situation: Thomas works as an account and has many wealthy clients.
intention: Thomas needs to pay off some gambling debts.
moral_action: Thomas gets a loan to pay off his gambling debt and joins gamblers anonymous.
immoral_action: Thomas decides to embezzle funds from his clients in order to pay off his debt.

norm: It's bad to create unpleasant living conditions for your roommates.
situation: Jeff just rented an expensive mansion with two roommates.
intention: Jeff wanted to save money.
moral_action: Jeff unplugs electronics whenever he isn't using them anymore.
immoral_action: Jeff doesn't flush the toilet in order to save money on their water bill.

norm: It is bad to be in a gang.
situation: Pete has nothing to do after school when his parents aren't home from work.
intention: Pete wants friends to hang out with.
moral_action: Pete joins the robotics club at school and meets other boys his age.
immoral_action: Pete joins a gang of young hoodlums that hang around his house.

norm: It's bad to be living in a country illegally.
situation: Pablo moved to the United States in order to work and provide a better life for his family.
intention: Pablo wants to stay in the United States.
moral_action: Pablo applies for a work visa in order to work in the United States.
immoral_action: Pablo continues working hard and getting paid under the table as an illegal immigrant.

norm: It's bad to give people predatory advice.
situation: Daiki's best friend Hoshi asks him how to approach his crush online.
intention: Daiki wants to be helpful.
moral_action: Daiki arranges a meeting between Hoshi and his crush in an online chat room.
immoral_action: Daiki tells Hoshi that he should send messages about her personal posts multiple times to start a conversation.

norm: It's bad to let an addiction take over your life.
situation: Joey is a recovering addict who used to use heroine and alcohol.
intention: Joey wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Joey goes to a baseball game with a few of his friends.
immoral_action: Joey calls his dealer and gets him to deliver some heroin to him.

norm: It's bad to involve your friends in your drama.
situation: Jack decides to break up with Jill after finding out she cheated on him.
intention: Jack wants the support of their circle of friends.
moral_action: Jack leans on his friends for emotional support but doesn't begrudge them for remaining friendly with Jill.
immoral_action: Jack badmouths Jill to all of their mutual friends and asks them to turn away from her.

norm: It's bad to annoy someone by following them around everywhere.
situation: Yvonne brings her son Mark to a work party where other people also bring their kids.
intention: Mark wants to spend time with his mom.
moral_action: Mark plays with the other kids for a little while, and then goes to find his mom.
immoral_action: Mark follows his mom around all night.

norm: It's bad to stay with someone who abuses you.
situation: Christine is hiding in her room after her boyfriend punches her in the face.
intention: Christine wants to be loved.
moral_action: Christine reaches out to her friends for affection, and with their support she breaks up with her boyfriend.
immoral_action: Christine stays in the relationship thinking that her boyfriend's behavior will improve.

norm: It's bad to mooch off of your friends.
situation: Jane is invited on weekend trip by her well-to-do friend from school.
intention: Jane wants to go on the trip with her friend.
moral_action: Jane goes on the trip with her friend and insists of paying for most of her own expenses.
immoral_action: Jane goes on the trip with her rich friend then asks them to pay for all her expenses during the trip, which her friend does.

norm: It is bad to support people's addictions
situation: Michael's best friend disappeared years ago, but recently showed up at his door asking for money to get heroin.
intention: Michael wants to help his friend.
moral_action: Michael refuses to give him the money but instead forces his friend to stay with him and detox.
immoral_action: Michael gives his friend $300 to help him get more heroin.

norm: It's bad to live a life of debauchery.
situation: Peter moves to Thailand to work and live.
intention: Peter wants to enjoy Thailand.
moral_action: Peter takes a different tour of Thailand every weekend to learn the culture.
immoral_action: Peter goes to bars drinking and picking up prostitutes every night.

norm: It's bad to show off in front of your peers.
situation: Mark is playing basketball against a less skilled player and his friends are watching.
intention: Mark wants to win the game decisively.
moral_action: Mark focuses on the game and outscores his opponent by a large margin.
immoral_action: Mark does a bunch of flashy tricks on his way to victory demonstrated the skill gap between them.

norm: It's bad to gossip about your friends.
situation: Madeline is best friends with Heather, but Heather doesn't get along with Madeline's cheer group.
intention: Madeline wants her cheer group to accept her.
moral_action: Madeline overhears her cheer group mentioning Heather, and tells them if they care for her as a teammate, they will stop gossiping about her best friend.
immoral_action: Madeline overhears her cheer group talking about Heather and joins in.

norm: It's bad to flake out on your group.
situation: Pat is part of a basketball team that has a game coming up and Pat is still in bed.
intention: Pat wants to decide what to do with his day.
moral_action: Pat gets out of bed and goes to the game.
immoral_action: Pat stays in bed and decides not to go to the game.

norm: It is bad to stay with someone who is cheating.
situation: After having forgiven his infidelity once before Paula has just discovered that her husband is cheating again.
intention: Paula wants to respond to her current situation.
moral_action: Paula gives her husband an ultimatum, either he stays faithful or their marriage ends.
immoral_action: Scared of losing her husband Paula decides to ignore the infidelity and stay with her husband.

norm: It's bad to create unpleasant living conditions for your partner.
situation: Thomas has just moved in with his girlfriend Gina but Thomas hates doing housework.
intention: Thomas wants to avoid doing housework.
moral_action: Thomas hires a housekeeper to take care of most of the chores, so he and Gina can focus on other things.
immoral_action: Thomas does not do any of the housework and lets Gina take care of everything since she has higher standards of cleanliness.

norm: It's bad to commit crimes and wind up in prison.
situation: Jeremy is dissatisfied with how the government operates in his town.
intention: Jeremy wants to express his frustration with government.
moral_action: Jeremy protests against the government by holding a sign at a rally.
immoral_action: Jeremy throws a Molotov cocktail at city hall.

norm: It's wrong to sell stolen property.
situation: John finds a bike that he suspects is stolen.
intention: John wants to decide what to do with the bike.
moral_action: John reports it to police and turns the bike over to them.
immoral_action: John sells the bike to a pawn shop for $100.

norm: It is wrong to blackmail someone.
situation: Jane finds out that her best friend Mary's husband is having affair with his secretary.
intention: Jane wants to help her friend Mary.
moral_action: Jane declines any monetary gift from Mary's husband instead urges him calmly to quit his affairs.
immoral_action: Jane confronts Mary's husband to cut off his relationship with his secretary and also asks for money to not tell Mary.

norm: It's wrong to get people arrested.
situation: Arnold hears his neighbor blasting music at night while he is trying to sleep.
intention: Arnold wants the music to stop.
moral_action: Arnold knocks on his neighbor's door and asks him to keep it down.
immoral_action: Arnold calls in a domestic disturbance to the police, making up a charge.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your SO
situation: Billy works long hours and hardly ever sees his wife anymore.
intention: Billy wants to fulfill his sexual and romantic desires.
moral_action: Billy realizes that change is needed, gets marital counseling and changes his job, so he can work from home more.
immoral_action: Billy grows close with a female co worker, and they have an ongoing affair.

norm: It's wrong to trade people counterfeit items.
situation: Steve needs some extra money to pay some bills.
intention: Steve wants to sell some things to a pawn shop.
moral_action: Steve sells some of his personal items that he doesn't use much anymore.
immoral_action: Steve sells a counterfeit watch, trying to make some more money.

norm: It's wrong to sell things that don't belong to you.
situation: Sue and her housemates are having a yard sale together.
intention: Sue wants to make a lot of money.
moral_action: Sue puts out a lot of her unwanted items and works hard to sell them all.
immoral_action: Sue sells a book that belongs to one of her housemates.

norm: It is wrong to commit infidelity.
situation: Jerry and his wife have been married a long time, and he is bored.
intention: Jerry wants to feel young and excited again.
moral_action: Jerry shares his feelings with his wife, and they decide to try new activities together.
immoral_action: Jerry meets a woman online and sets up a hotel room for them to have an affair.

norm: It's wrong to sell items under false pretense.
situation: Jerry works as a car salesman and James has come in to buy a car.
intention: Jerry wants to sell James a car.
moral_action: Jerry sells James a car that he looking for at a reasonable price.
immoral_action: Jerry sells James a bad car with a very inflated price to make a profit, claiming that it is great.

norm: It's wrong to overcharge people.
situation: Kerry is working on the register at the local grocery store.
intention: Kerry wants to make enough money to save up for a new car.
moral_action: Kerry asks her manager if she can have extra hours every week.
immoral_action: Kerry rings up some of her customers' items several times and pockets the difference in cost.

norm: It's wrong to sell something that isn't yours.
situation: Deborah and Emily are cleaning out their closets and Emily finds a lot of valuable old records.
intention: Deborah wants to earn some money.
moral_action: Deborah asks Emily if she wants to sell her records to make money.
immoral_action: Deborah takes Emily's records and sells them online.

norm: It's wrong to be ungrateful for a gift.
situation: Billy's mom buys him a new bike for his birthday that isn't the color he wanted, and she asks how he likes it.
intention: Billy wants to answer his mother's question.
moral_action: Billy tells his mother that he loves the bike and can't wait to ride it.
immoral_action: Billy tells his mother he doesn't like it all that much and it isn't the color he wanted.

norm: It's wrong to protect someone who did something illegal.
situation: Stan and James are at an internet cafe when James lies to the cashier about his playing time.
intention: Stan wants to interject in the conversation.
moral_action: Stan tells James to fess up and pay the man what he deserves.
immoral_action: Stan says that he's confident that James is telling the truth and supports James story.

norm: It's wrong to enter a country illegally.
situation: Wayne is taking a road trip thru his native Canada on his week-long vacation from his job on the farm.
intention: Wayne wants to visit the United States.
moral_action: Wayne drives to a border checkpoint and crosses over into the US.
immoral_action: Wayne takes a back road into the US because he has no passport.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on people.
situation: Jack is married, but a girl he has always had a crush on want to come over to his place.
intention: Jack wants to invite the girl over.
moral_action: Jack invites the girl over to meet his wife and eat lunch together.
immoral_action: Jack invites the girl over when his wife isn't home, and they have sex.

norm: It's wrong to misuse charitable donations.
situation: Dahlia, the owner of a charity, can't afford to pay her rent.
intention: Dahlia wants to settle her debts.
moral_action: Dahlia works out a payment plan with her manager that she can afford.
immoral_action: Dahlia pays her rent from the extra money in her charity.

norm: It's wrong to do things that are illegal.
situation: Wesley is very bored one night, and is trying to figure out something to do.
intention: Wesley wants to go out and have fun.
moral_action: Wesley goes for a late night bike ride through the town.
immoral_action: Wesley goes to the abandoned warehouse and throws some rocks at it.

norm: It is wrong to impregnate somebody without consent.
situation: Grant is married to his wife Joan, and they use condoms for birth control.
intention: Grant wants to have a baby.
moral_action: Grant explains to Joan his desire to have a baby.
immoral_action: Grant pokes holes in the condoms, so he can get Joan pregnant.

norm: It's wrong to support someone's cheating lifestyle.
situation: Jerry's friend Johnathan calls him up and asks him if he can bring his mistress over to Jerry's place since Johnathan's wife is at home.
intention: Jerry needs to decide how to answer.
moral_action: Jerry refuses to accommodate Johnathan, and tells him to find someplace else.
immoral_action: Jerry agrees to let Johnathan bring the mistress over, and the two borrow his guest bedroom.

norm: It's wrong to hook up with cheating people.
situation: Libby is newly single and is interested in two men - Kurt, who has a history of being unfaithful to his girlfriends and Dave, who has been kind to his exes.
intention: Libby wants to date.
moral_action: Libby is more attracted to Kurt, but opts to fate Dave who treats her like gold.
immoral_action: Libby is more attracted to Kurt, and begins dating him, only to find out a week later that he's also sleeping with her best friend.

norm: It's wrong to misuse your discounts.
situation: Milo works at a retail store and his friends want them to use his employee discount for them.
intention: Milo wants to respond to his friends' requests.
moral_action: Milo tells his friends that he can't use the discount for their purchases.
immoral_action: Milo lets his friends use his discount on all the thinks they buy.

norm: It is wrong to sell something that is stolen.
situation: Mike is in possession of a watch that he knows is stolen.
intention: Mike wants to get rid of the watch.
moral_action: Mike brings the watch to the police station to turn it in.
immoral_action: Mike brings the watch to the pawn shop and tries to sell it.

norm: It's wrong for people to cheat on their SO
situation: Will got into a huge fight with his partner, and she insulted him which he considers the last straw.
intention: Will wants to get with someone who respects him more.
moral_action: Will confronts his partner on her attitude and then decides to end things with her before moving on.
immoral_action: Will gets involved with another woman before leaving his partner.

norm: It is wrong to commit statutory rape.
situation: Tony, who is eighteen, is dating a sixteen-year-old named Lisa, and they have been getting more serious about each other lately.
intention: Tony wants to express his deep love for Lisa.
moral_action: Tony writes a poem for Lisa to express his deep love to her, and he asks her to commit to a long term relationship with him.
immoral_action: Tony initiates sexual contact with Lisa for the first time.

norm: It's wrong to commit crimes.
situation: Molly recently lost her job and is worried about her ability to meet her financial obligations.
intention: Molly wants to acquire more money to pay her monthly bills.
moral_action: Molly works hard to find a new job as quickly as possible.
immoral_action: Molly uses a firearm to hold up a convenience store and demands cash from the register.

norm: It's wrong to commit perjury.
situation: Fiona is called to testify at a trial as a witness.
intention: Fiona wants to testify at the trial.
moral_action: Fiona tells the truth while she is on the stand.
immoral_action: Fiona does not tell the truth while she is on the stand.

norm: It's wrong to scam people.
situation: Neal has a job selling vacuums door to door and is currently working.
intention: Neal wants to sell lots of vacuums.
moral_action: Neal is open and honest with everybody he tries to sell to and gives them the best deal he is allowed to.
immoral_action: Neal makes up tales to gain sympathy from prospective buyers and uses every other trick in the book including charging higher prices.

norm: It's wrong to take a bribe.
situation: Michael is a senator in Congress who has fallen on hard times.
intention: Michael wants some extra cash.
moral_action: Michael looks for a second job to earn more money.
immoral_action: Michael meets with a special interest who pays him for his vote.

norm: It's wrong to impregnate a minor.
situation: Harry meets Sally at a dance club and takes her home with him in spite of the fact she's 17, and he's 18.
intention: Harry wants to get laid.
moral_action: Harry decides to use protection while having sex with Sally.
immoral_action: Harry decides not to use protection while having sex with Sally.

norm: It's wrong to not be supportive of a friend's relationship.
situation: Mary's friend spends more time with her new boyfriend than with Mary.
intention: Mary wants to spend time with her friend.
moral_action: Mary waits and schedules a time to hang out with her friend when she is not busy.
immoral_action: Mary spreads gossip that her friend's boyfriend loves another girl.

norm: It's wrong to treat a sibling's friend badly.
situation: John is at home while he is day off and his sister, Mary, is playing with her friend in their home.
intention: John wants to watch his favorite movie.
moral_action: John goes to his bedroom and watches the movie in a laptop.
immoral_action: John asks Mary's friend to leave their home so that he can enjoy his movie quietly.

norm: It's wrong to interfere in a sibling's relationship.
situation: Jenny is worried that her sister's boyfriend won't be able to provide financially for her.
intention: Jenny wants to make sure her sister is happy.
moral_action: Jenny talks to her sister about her concerns, and offers to help find a better paying job.
immoral_action: Jenny confronts her sister's boyfriend and demands he get a better job to earn more money.

norm: It's wrong to insult the people who care about you.
situation: Mike's wife Jen walks up to him in the living room and asks Mike what he thinks of her new hairstye.
intention: Mike wants to respond to Jen.
moral_action: Mike tells Jen that her hair looks as gorgeous as it ever has and that she should come kiss him.
immoral_action: Mike tells Jen that her hair is awful and that it makes her look like a weird boy.

norm: It is wrong to antagonize your sibling.
situation: Sam and her sister are watching a movie when her sister falls asleep snoring.
intention: Sam wants to watch the movie in peace.
moral_action: Sam gently wakes up her sister and tells her to go to bed.
immoral_action: Sam throws cold water on her sister to wake her up.

norm: It's wrong to be rude to siblings spouses.
situation: Leah is at a family dinner with her parents, her siblings, and their spouses.
intention: Leah wants to avoid discussing why she's still single.
moral_action: Leah acknowledges and deflects the questions she receives about her dating life, while remaining civil.
immoral_action: Leah refuses to answer a question from her sister's spouse regarding a date Leah recently went on with a mutual friend.

norm: It's wrong to be disrespectful to your best friend.
situation: Bill's friend Ted asks how his new outfit looks before going out on a first date.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Ted's question.
moral_action: Bill tells Ted that he looks handsome and his date will love him.
immoral_action: Bill tells his friend that the outfit looks terrible and his date won't find him attractive.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your significant other.
situation: Bobby and Grace have been working from home since quarantine started, and Grace made it a habit to tell Bobby that she loves him every other hour.
intention: Bobby wants to get his work done.
moral_action: Bobby takes a moment to embrace Grace and tell her that he loves her too before returning to work.
immoral_action: "Bobby replies to Grace by saying ""thanks"" without looking away from his screen."

norm: It's wrong to breach a very close friends trust.
situation: Samantha tells Christina that she has a huge crush on the quarterback.
intention: Christina wants to fit in with the popular girls.
moral_action: Christina keeps Samantha's secret even though it would make her more popular.
immoral_action: Christina tells all the popular girls that Samantha likes the quarterback.

norm: It's wrong not to protect one's sibling from harm.
situation: Alice and her sister Kate are at an intersection about to cross when Alice sees a car start through the crosswalk toward Kate.
intention: Alice wants to start walking across the road.
moral_action: Alice holds Kate back until the car is through the crosswalk.
immoral_action: Alice assumes the car will stop and starts walking behind Kate, but the car hits Kate.

norm: It's wrong to not show empathy to friends misfortune.
situation: Travis has just found out that his friend Larry has lost his job.
intention: Travis wants to tell Larry he knows that he isn't working anymore.
moral_action: Travis tells Larry a couple of places that are currently hiring.
immoral_action: Travis tells Larry that he needs to go out and get a job to pay his bills and stop being lazy.

norm: It's wrong to lie to someone you love.
situation: Cody had told his wife that he would be home right after work.
intention: Cody wants to have a beer.
moral_action: Cody comes straight home after work and has a beer with his dinner.
immoral_action: Cody tells his wife that he is working late and goes to the bar to have a beer.

norm: It's wrong to be too controlling of your significant other.
situation: Ron and his wife were really looking forward to the big dance.
intention: Ron wanted to show his wife a good time.
moral_action: Ron and his wife went to the dance, and they talked to many different people.
immoral_action: Ron would not let his wife talk to any of the other male attendees, especially the good-looking ones.

norm: It is wrong to hurt your significant other
situation: George's and his wife get into a heated argument, and she says some very mean things about his appearance.
intention: George wants to express his anger.
moral_action: George yells at her and storms out of the house.
immoral_action: George pushes his wife away from him and storms out of the house.

norm: It is wrong to get upset with your significant other.
situation: Nancy comes home and tells her husband Omar that she dented the family car.
intention: Omar wants to respond to Nancy's news.
moral_action: Omar tells Nancy that it's OK as long as she didn't get hurt, it's just a car.
immoral_action: Omar tells Nancy that she's irresponsible for damaging the car which will cost a lot of money to fix and that he's furious with her.

norm: It's wrong to disregard a friend's feelings.
situation: Max's friend told him that he's been more depressed ever since the pandemic began.
intention: Max wants to give his friend advice.
moral_action: Max tells his friend to talk to a therapist and tells his friend that he's there whenever he needs him.
immoral_action: Max tells his friend that it's temporary and that he should just exercise.

norm: It's wrong to throw something at your sibling.
situation: Cory is currently trying to watch TV but his sister is annoying him.
intention: Cory wants to get his sister to leave him alone.
moral_action: Cory warns his sister that if she doesn't go away he will tell their parents.
immoral_action: Cory takes the remote and throws it at his sister to get her to stop.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your significant other.
situation: Joe is dating a jealous person, and he has been hanging out with a female friend all day.
intention: Joe wants to avoid fighting with his partner.
moral_action: Joe tells his partner he was hanging out with a friend and omits information about her gender.
immoral_action: Joe makes up a story about what he has been doing all day.

norm: It's wrong to treat a loved one poorly.
situation: John is at home with his wife Mindy who is upset and crying.
intention: John wants to watch the game on tv.
moral_action: John puts the game on record and comforts his wife.
immoral_action: John ignores his wife and puts the tv volume louder to drown out her crying.

norm: It's wrong to abandon a friend that needs help.
situation: Sam is hanging out with his friend Amanda and notices she has new cut scars on her arms.
intention: Sam wants to help Amanda.
moral_action: Sam asks Amanda about the cuts and even though she gets mad he sticks by her and keeps checking on her.
immoral_action: Sam asks Amanda about the cuts and Amanda tell him to mind his own business and leave her alone, to which he complies and avoids her thinking she needs space.

norm: It's wrong to lose things that are important to people.
situation: Nancy is helping her Aunt Sally clean out her home office because it has become quite a mess of papers.
intention: Nancy wants to get all of the papers cleared out in her Aunt's home office.
moral_action: Nancy is careful to have her Aunt Sally look through the oldest papers to be sure nothing important is thrown out.
immoral_action: Nancy places all papers that are over five years old into the trash without paying attention to things that may be sentimental to her Aunt.

norm: It's wrong to break the trust of a good friend.
situation: Tommy told Steve a really funny secret that he didn't want him to tell the rest of his friends.
intention: Steve wants to make his friends laugh.
moral_action: Steve tells a funny joke he read on the internet the previous night.
immoral_action: Steve tells Tommy's secret to his friends, prompting a lot of laughter from them.

norm: It's wrong to call your siblings bad names.
situation: John is with his friends and younger brother Chris at a house party.
intention: John wants his friends to like him more than his brother.
moral_action: John is more social than his brother is with his friends, and he even compliments his brother.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and tells his friends that Chris is a bunch of bad names.

norm: It is wrong to deceive your loved ones
situation: Mary tells her kids that if they go to the doctor, she'll take them out for ice cream afterwards.
intention: Mary wants to get her kids to the doctor.
moral_action: Mary takes the kids to a local ice cream shop after the trip to the doctor.
immoral_action: Mary takes the kids straight home after visiting the doctor's office.

norm: It's wrong to betray your best friend.
situation: Kevin's best friend Steve confides in him that he's secretly gay and afraid to come out.
intention: Kevin wants to respond to the news that Steve is gay.
moral_action: Kevin tells Steve he'll be there in any way possible, and asks what sort of support he wants.
immoral_action: Kevin gets on Facebook and makes a post telling everyone that Steve is gay.

norm: It is wrong to abuse your loved ones
situation: John sees his son Andrew take a cookie from the jar before dinner.
intention: John wants his kids to listen to him.
moral_action: John reminds Andrew if he eats cookies now he will be too full for dinner.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and comes at Andrew with a belt swinging at him.

norm: It's wrong to hide things from your significant other.
situation: Margo wants to meet-up with Barb, an old friend from college whom her husband dislikes.
intention: Margot wants to have a quiet lunch with Barb and catch up.
moral_action: Margot tells her husband she is having lunch with Barb, and he can just deal with it.
immoral_action: Margot tells her husband she is having lunch with a different person.

norm: It's wrong to make a friend cry.
situation: Tracy has been listening to her friend Fiona complain about her deadbeat boyfriend.
intention: Tracy wants to tell Fiona what she thinks about the relationship.
moral_action: Tracy tells Fiona that she can do better and that she deserves to be with a wonderful partner.
immoral_action: Tracy tells Fiona she is a loser because she keeps dating losers.

norm: It's wrong to do something that will hurt a sibling
situation: Jane sees her brother Mark eat the last cookie.
intention: Jane wants to teach Mark a lesson.
moral_action: Jane explains to Mark why this was rude.
immoral_action: Jane punches Mark.

norm: It is wrong to criticize a partner's friend.
situation: Will recently started sating Wilma, and she introduced him to her annoying friend Wendy at dinner, and Wilma asks Will what he thought of Wendy when they get home.
intention: Will wants to answer Wendy's question.
moral_action: Will lies and tells Wilma he likes Wendy, but says there's such a thing as too much of a good thing.
immoral_action: Will tells Wilma that he found Wendy kind of annoying and doesn't want to hang out with Wendy in the future.

norm: It's wrong to abuse people you consider friends.
situation: Perry is on the basketball team with his friend James and James gets the ball stolen from him.
intention: Perry wants to react to the steal.
moral_action: Perry tells James to watch out for one of the players on the opposite team.
immoral_action: Perry tells James that he has butter fingers and should get off the court.

norm: It's wrong to neglect the needs of someone you love.
situation: Sam's family is struggling after he got laid off from his job.
intention: Sam wants to determine what he should spend less money on.
moral_action: Sam spends less money on entertainment such as cable TV.
immoral_action: Sam decided to spend less money on food for his children.

norm: It is nice to thank someone who praises you.
situation: Jack and his boss are in a meeting and Jack's boss thanks Jack for a job well done.
intention: Jack wants to not appear awkward in front of his boss.
moral_action: Jack thanks his boss for the praise before continuing on with the meeting.
immoral_action: Jack says nothing about the praise and continues with the meeting.

norm: It's good to compliment content creators.
situation: Sasha is a fan of Jasmine's work, especially of her most recent painting.
intention: Sasha wants to share Jasmine's work with her followers.
moral_action: Sasha retweets the art from Jasmine's profile with added links to Jasmine's other works.
immoral_action: Sasha posts Jasmine's work without a link to Jasmine's profile or credit.

norm: It is polite to greet someone happily.
situation: Rod stops at the same bodega every morning on his way to work for a bagel.
intention: Rod wants to greet the bodega worker.
moral_action: "Rod enthusiastically says ""good morning"" with a big smile as he pays for his bagel."
immoral_action: Rod nods at the worker without saying a word and leaves with his bagel.

norm: It's nice to give handouts.
situation: A beggar asks Robert for change as he is walking to work.
intention: Robert wants to respond to the man's request.
moral_action: Robert gives the man a couple dollars from his wallet.
immoral_action: Robert ignores the man and keeps walking.

norm: It's good to tell people thank you.
situation: John is visiting his grandparents who are hosting him for the weekend.
intention: John wants to ask his grandparents for some financial help.
moral_action: John helps his grandparents around the house the entire weekend and thanks them for being such gracious hosts before broaching the subject of his financial problems.
immoral_action: john reminds his grandparents of the last time they helped him out and demands more of the same.

norm: It's good to thank someone when you need to.
situation: Jessie is broken down on the side of the road when a car offers to help.
intention: Jessie wants to have her car fixed.
moral_action: Jessie thanks the kind stranger for fixing her car and offers to pay them.
immoral_action: Jessie immediately hops in her car after the stranger fixes it and drives off.

norm: It's nice to let someone know you care.
situation: Frank has been dating Carol for a year but his work schedule makes it hard for them to spend time together lately.
intention: Frank wants to be successful at his job.
moral_action: Frank works hard to maintain a healthy work/love balance and showers Carol with affection as often as possible.
immoral_action: Frank is so focused on his work that he begins to neglect Carol and fails to express his love for her.

norm: It's nice to give people's comments likes.
situation: Tom sees a Facebook comment his friend made that congratulates him on a sports win.
intention: Tom wants to interact with his friend's Facebook comment.
moral_action: "Tom gives the comment a ""like"" emoji because he finds it a nice comment."
immoral_action: "Tom gives the comment a, ""sad face"", emoji as a prank."

norm: It's nice to return kind gestures.
situation: Jim is moving residences and asks his friend Bob for help moving which he is happy to provide.
intention: Jim wants to thank Bob for his help moving.
moral_action: Jim repays Bob by buying him a 12 pack of his favorite beer.
immoral_action: A few days later Jim sends Bob a short text message to tell him thank you.

norm: It's good to be inclusive.
situation: Jerry and his classmates are discussing an upcoming party when he notices that the new kid is listening to their conversation.
intention: Jerry wants to speak with the new kid.
moral_action: Jerry invites the new kid to the party.
immoral_action: Jerry tells the new kid to mind his own business and forget that he knows anything about the party.

norm: It's good to show your appreciation.
situation: Lance got his first paycheck from a job his sister recommended him for.
intention: Lance wants to use his first paycheck.
moral_action: Lance uses the paycheck to take his sister out for dinner.
immoral_action: Lance uses the paycheck to buy himself a lot of food.

norm: It's good to say thanks.
situation: Laura has been waiting for 20 minutes for her drink at a busy restaurant and the server finally brings it.
intention: Laura wants to respond to the service.
moral_action: Laura thanks the server for bringing the drink.
immoral_action: "Laura rolls her eyes and says ""it's about time""."

norm: It is kind to give people compliments.
situation: Jack found out his daughter just gave a difficult performance of a song at a recital.
intention: Jack wants to give feedback on his daughters performance.
moral_action: Jack tells his daughter it was very impressive of her to perform an impressive piece.
immoral_action: Jack tells his daughter he thinks she extended herself too much and need to stop practicing.

norm: It's nice to compliment people.
situation: Joe is taking his break and notices a coworker in the break room who has a new hairstyle.
intention: Joe wants to make small talk with the coworker.
moral_action: Joe tells the coworker that he likes the way she did her hair.
immoral_action: Joe asks the coworker about her day and about work topics.

norm: It's kind to give people compliments about themselves.
situation: Aaron is attending a formal work event with his partner who is dressed up nicely for the occasion.
intention: Aaron wants to make a good impression on the people attending.
moral_action: Aaron tells his partner how good she looks in front of the other attendees.
immoral_action: Aaron focuses on mingling with other work related attendees at the event.

norm: It's kind to welcome people.
situation: Melanie is moving soon and will be selling her current house.
intention: Melanie wants to host an open house party.
moral_action: Melanie sets up her open house event and greets every guest with a plate of sweets.
immoral_action: Melanie sets up her open house event, but does not acknowledge or greet any of her guests at the door.

norm: It's nice to compliment others.
situation: Gene's wife Angela just got back from the hair salon with a new hairstyle, but he doesn't really like it.
intention: Gene wants to react to Angela's hair.
moral_action: Gene tells Angela that he thinks she looks as pretty as ever, but likes her hair the other way too.
immoral_action: Gene tells Angela that the style she got doesn't compliment her bone structure.

norm: It is kind to share.
situation: Miles finds a lost toy in the park, and he picks it up and plays with it.
intention: Miles wants to play with the toy.
moral_action: Miles plays with the toy, and he shows it off to other kids and lets them play too.
immoral_action: Miles doesn't let other kids see it because he's afraid they will be the one who lost it.

norm: It's nice to make someone feel welcome.
situation: Allison is at work and an investor is visiting the company office today.
intention: Allison wants to meet the investor.
moral_action: Allison introduces herself to the investor and offers to show them around the office.
immoral_action: Allison introduces herself to the investor and then decides that the person isn't interesting, so she walks away abruptly.

norm: It is good to say how you are feeling.
situation: Ines is at home feeling queasy when her friends call to invite her out for drinks.
intention: Ines wants to see her friends.
moral_action: Ines tells her friends that she doesn't feel good but would love to video chat.
immoral_action: Ines goes out with her friends without telling them how she's been feeling.

norm: It's nice to care about the enviorment.
situation: Frank is walking to work in the morning while he finishes drinking a coffee he picked up from a local shop.
intention: Frank wants to dispose of his coffee cup.
moral_action: Frank holds onto the empty cup until he arrives at work where he can throw it into the recycling.
immoral_action: Frank doesn't see any trash bins, so he tosses the empty coffee cup into the street.

norm: It's not okay to put poison into the environment.
situation: The CEO of the paint company was working in her office.
intention: The CEO of the paint company wanted to increase the value of her company's stock.
moral_action: The CEO decides on proper disposal of waste and is written up for her decision in Forbes magazine which raises the value of  the company's stock.
immoral_action: The CEO decides to save money by disposing of the company's waste improperly which increases the value of the company's stock.

norm: It's not politically correct to use ethnic slurs.
situation: James is standing in line at a fast food restaurant when a black man cuts in front of him.
intention: James wants to confront the black man who cut in front of him.
moral_action: James tells the black man who cut in front of him to go to the back of the line, since that would be fair to everyone.
immoral_action: James tells the black man who cut in front of him to go to the back of the line, then calls him a racist name.

norm: It's not okay to use addictive drugs.
situation: Jamie had previously been prescribed a strong narcotic after getting into a bad car accident.
intention: Jamie wants the narcotic out of his house for good.
moral_action: Jamie brings his pills to an appropriate location to be dropped off and disposed of.
immoral_action: Jamie decides to take the remainder of his pills even though he does not need them.

norm: It's not okay to force your religion on other people.
situation: Xavier is a Christian and was invited to his friend Sam's bar-mitzvah.
intention: Xavier wants to discuss his church with Sam and the party guests.
moral_action: Xavier discusses how he loves going to church and is glad to have met people who also love their faith.
immoral_action: Xavier tells Sam and his friends that, according to his pastor, the only way to get into heaven is through Jesus, and those who don't accept him are sinners.

norm: It's not okay to beg strangers for treats.
situation: Ben, who is five years old and hungry, is waiting for his mother to get out of an appointment, when he notices a woman eating crackers next to him.
intention: Ben wants to get food.
moral_action: After his mother gets out of her appointment, Bill tells his mother that he's hungry.
immoral_action: Ben asks the woman next to him to give him some of her crackers multiple times.

norm: It's not okay to abuse drugs for what ever reason.
situation: Jane's doctor prescribes Jane some Valium to use sparingly in times of stress.
intention: Jane wants to take some Valium to relax around her child.
moral_action: Jane decides to take the recommended dose of Valium and does not abuse the drug around her children.
immoral_action: Jane decides to take triple the dose of Valium recommended to her to deal with her children.

norm: It's not okay to take advantage of tourists.
situation: Hector drives a taxi in Costa Rica and sees a foreign family come into the bus station.
intention: Hector wants to make some money off of the foreign family.
moral_action: Hector offers to drive the tourists and gives them a group rate.
immoral_action: Hector offers to drive the tourists for a price, neglecting to tell them that the price is only per person and not for the group.

norm: It's not okay to use technology to scam people.
situation: Due to an unexpected medical expense, James is going to be $200 short for his rent this month.
intention: James wants to make enough money to pay his rent.
moral_action: James starts driving for Uber on the weekends to make ends meet.
immoral_action: James buys a list of 10,000 email addresses and emails them all pretending to be a Nigerian prince.

norm: It's not okay to make racist comments or jokes
situation: James is trying to come up with a dark comedy routine for a party.
intention: James wants to make people laugh.
moral_action: James calls his friends and spends the evening coming up with fresh material.
immoral_action: James makes his jokes based on racial stereotypes.

norm: It's not okay to defend pedophiles.
situation: Frank is talking with Jimmy when Jimmy confides in Frank that he's a pedophile, and he abuses some children.
intention: Frank wants to respond to Jimmy's statement.
moral_action: Frank tells Jimmy that it's abhorrent that he's doing these things and that he needs to get help right away.
immoral_action: Frank tells Jimmy that we all have desires and that Jimmy's desires are normal like anyone elses.

norm: It's not okay to be racist.
situation: Karen is working at the bakery she owns when a line starts to form.
intention: Karen wants to shorten the line.
moral_action: Karen puts out samples for all of her patrons, regardless of race, to enjoy in line, before hopping on the register so the line moves quicker.
immoral_action: Karen tells her patrons that all people of color must wait outside.

norm: It's not good to be racist towards anyone.
situation: Martin works in a grocery store and notices a black customer opening different bottles of ketchup and pouring them on the floor.
intention: Martin wants to tell the black customer to stop opening ketchup bottles.
moral_action: Martin tells the customer that opening food products is not permitted in the store unless the customer pays for them.
immoral_action: Martin tells the customer that only uncivilized blacks would open and pour out ketchup bottles in a grocery store.

norm: It's not okay to live a delinquent lifestyle.
situation: James just graduated from high school and is trying to decide what to do for the next five years.
intention: James wants a low-stress, enjoyable lifestyle.
moral_action: James decides to work part-time in fast food while attending classes at the local university.
immoral_action: James decides to move into an abandoned building with his friends and support himself by taking things from unattended houses.

norm: It's not okay to abuse drugs.
situation: Matt had a very difficult childhood and is haunted by it.
intention: Matt wants to feel less pain from his traumatic childhood.
moral_action: Matt starts seeing a psychotherapist weekly.
immoral_action: Matt starts to use heroin as a way to alleviate his moral pain.

norm: It's not socially acceptable to use discriminatory slurs.
situation: John is at home with wife and kids listening to the news about the black lives matter movement.
intention: John wants to feel good about himself.
moral_action: John states out loud that black people matter just as much as white people do.
immoral_action: John says out loud that these 'n-words' oughtta go back to Africa.

norm: It's not okay to deceive people about who you are.
situation: Chad recently was laid off from his old job.
intention: Chad wants to find a good new job.
moral_action: Chad states what his skills are without exaggerating.
immoral_action: Chad says his coding skills are better than they actually are in order to get hired.

norm: It's not okay to try and induce someone into cheating.
situation: Jason is talking with his friend Ralph who tells Jason he's in dire need of money.
intention: Jason wants to give Ralph a money making idea.
moral_action: Jason tells Ralph he should sign up for Amazon Mechanical Turk and make some quick money.
immoral_action: Jason tells Ralph he should set up a poker game with a stacked deck to win some quick money.

norm: It's not okay to do things you know are illegal.
situation: Han was shipping cargo from a city where it's cheap to another where it's expensive.
intention: Han wants to make money.
moral_action: Han keeps shipping the legal cargo that earns the biggest profits.
immoral_action: Han realizes that he can make way more money by shipping illegal cargo.

norm: It's not okay to use racial slurs.
situation: Paul is at a party when he sees his Mexican friend in the room.
intention: Paul wants his friend to notice him.
moral_action: Paul walks over to his friend and starts to yell his name.
immoral_action: Paul calls out to a Mexican slur to get his friend's attention.

norm: It's not okay to be voyeuristic of other peoples abuse.
situation: Horatio lives in a high-rise apartment complex where he often sees someone living across the street beating his wife, and witnesses it again today.
intention: Horatio has to decide whether to interfere.
moral_action: Horatio decides enough is enough and calls the authorities to put an end to the cycle of violence.
immoral_action: Horatio settles in to watch the daily altercation, figuring he shouldn't interfere because it's not his problem.

norm: It's wrong not to pay something you owe.
situation: Charles receives a call from his cousin Pat, who asks Charles to pay back some money that Pat loaned him.
intention: Charles wants to respond to Pat.
moral_action: Charles tells Pat he will transfer the money to him immediately.
immoral_action: Charles tells Pat to get over it and stop bothering him about the money.

norm: It is wrong to take credit for someone else's work.
situation: Tanya has been procrastinating on getting her science prject done.
intention: Tanya wants to avoid failing her science project.
moral_action: Tanya asks her teacher for help on her science project.
immoral_action: Tanya finds her classmates completed science project on the ground and turns it in as her own.

norm: It's wrong not to give advance notice of plans.
situation: John is sitting at home when he realizes he hasn't seen his friend Tony for a while.
intention: John wants to schedule a time to see Tony.
moral_action: John calls Tony and asks when a good time would be then after they agree writes it down in his planner.
immoral_action: John decides that 10 minutes from now is a good time and goes straight over to Tony's house.

norm: It's wrong to dismiss everything people suggest
situation: Josh is in charge of picking the foods out for his companies annual summer party.
intention: Josh wants to pick out food.
moral_action: Josh passes out a small survey to gauge what foods people want at the party, and he uses the results to pick up food.
immoral_action: Josh chooses all of the food without getting approval of others and pushing away their requests.

norm: It's wrong to take more than your share.
situation: Jan's family are forced to stay inside, and toilet paper is running out in stores.
intention: Jan wants to buy some toilet paper at the grocery store.
moral_action: Jan only buys one pack of toilet paper.
immoral_action: Jan buys up all of the toilet paper at the toilet store.

norm: Its not okay to demand more than your fair share.
