situation: Bill wants to open a lemonade stand and tells Jack about it, the next day Jack has opened a stand himself.
intention: Bill wants to be paid for his idea.
moral_action: Bill goes up to Jack and asks for some money for his idea.
immoral_action: Bill storms up to Jacks stand and demands all of the money from the stand.

norm: It's wrong not to get recognized for something you created.
situation: Tim wrote a new software program at work that is going to generate a lot of revenue for his company.
intention: Tim wants his company to be successful.
moral_action: Tim and his boss present Tim's idea to the management team at his company.
immoral_action: Tim lets his boss take credit for the program thinking that the program will be more likely to be approved that way.

norm: It is wrong not to pay for a service.
situation: Joe was going to the barber shop when he realized he forgot his wallet.
intention: Joe wanted to get his hair cut.
moral_action: Joe turned around and got his wallet before going back to the barber shop.
immoral_action: When it came time to pay, Joe dashed out the door.

norm: It is wrong to go somewhere without being invited.
situation: Susan's friend Marissa is getting married soon but Susan still hasn't received an invitation.
intention: Susan wants to attend Marissa's wedding.
moral_action: Susan drops subtle hints to Marissa about her desire to attend the wedding.
immoral_action: Susan shows up to the wedding unannounced without having been invited.

norm: It's wrong to think you know everything.
situation: Amber is at the doctor's office with what has been diagnosed as a broken leg.
intention: Amber wants to take an active part in her wellness.
moral_action: Amber follows the doctor's advice despite questioning it, does more research, and combines alternative and conventional medicine to heal.
immoral_action: Amber tells the doctor that she thinks it might not be broken and that she would like to try and use essential oils on it first.

norm: It's frowned upon to take more than you need.
situation: Bob is at a buffet restaurant and heads over to the buffet area.
intention: Bob wants to get bring food back to his table.
moral_action: Bob takes only as much food as he will eat to his table.
immoral_action: Bob piles up a huge amount of food and takes it all back to his table but only eats a small portion of what he took.

norm: It's wrong not to be able to pay the bill.
situation: Ray hadn't paid his electric bill in more that a month and a half.
intention: Ray wants to pay for his electric bill on the online service.
moral_action: Ray pays the bill online as soon as he can get to a computer.
immoral_action: Ray waits another two weeks before logging on to pay the electric bill.

norm: It's wrong not to give everybody an equal chance
situation: Lauren is the coach of her college's soccer team and is choosing players for the new season.
intention: Lauren wants her team to be good.
moral_action: Lauren decides to take a chance by welcoming newcomers on her team.
immoral_action: Lauren decides to choose only the players who have proven themselves previously, ignoring newcomers.

norm: It's wrong to take credit for the work of others.
situation: Kevin is working on a project at work when he sees that someone has already created a solution that is free online.
intention: Kevin wants to use the free solution.
moral_action: Kevin takes the solution and uses it, then tells his boss where he found it from.
immoral_action: Kevin implements the free solution and tells his boss that it was all his idea.

norm: It's wrong to judge a situation without giving it time.
situation: Phil has reservations about his daughters relationship with her new boyfriend.
intention: Phil wants to react to his daughters new relationship.
moral_action: Phil is supportive and freely offers his advice when needed.
immoral_action: Phil advises his daughter to break up with her boyfriend as he feels it will end badly.

norm: It is wrong to take credit for someone else.
situation: Brad didn't help with his group's project, but they are making their presentation in class today.
intention: Brad wants to get a good grade.
moral_action: Brad sticks to the background during the presentation and lets the rest of the group do the work like he has been the whole time.
immoral_action: Brad takes over in the middle of the presentation to try to make it look like he did all the work.

norm: It is wrong to feel entitled to someone else's time.
situation: Claire is a manager and has an important project for her and the team at work to finish before a soon-coming deadline.
intention: Claire wants to finish the project.
moral_action: Claire talks with other departments if they can spare some extra team members to meet the coming deadline.
immoral_action: "Claire declares ""mandatory overtime"" for all of her employees and says that they must report for work."

norm: It's wrong not to return a lost item.
situation: Greg is walking down the street when he finds a wallet on the ground that belongs to Jim.
intention: Greg wants to get the wallet off the street.
moral_action: Greg takes the wallet and looks to find Jim's name before looking his phone number up, so he can notify Jim he found it.
immoral_action: Greg picks up the wallet and throws it in the garbage to get it off the road and prevent someone from taking it.

norm: It's not okay to lose something valuable of someone else's.
situation: Sara was invited to a football tailgate but doesn't have any of the teams apparel, so she borrows a sweatshirt from her sister.
intention: Sara wants to have fun at the tailgate.
moral_action: Sara takes off the sweatshirt and ties it around her waste, so she doesn't lose it.
immoral_action: Sara takes off the sweatshirt, but she can't remember where she put it because she had too much to drink.

norm: It's wrong not to pay back your debts.
situation: Blair is sitting at home when his phone rings, and he sees it's the debt collection agency on the call display.
intention: Blair wants to get the phone to stop ringing.
moral_action: Blair answers his phone and talks to the collection agent about making a payment arrangement.
immoral_action: Blair looks at his phone and hits a button that silences the ringer before throwing the phone on the couch.

norm: It's wrong to destroy someone else's property.
situation: Jane is mad at Jessica for not returning her headphones like she asked.
intention: Jane wants to express her anger towards Jessica.
moral_action: Jane tells Jessica how she feels about her headphones not being returned.
immoral_action: Jane grabs Jessica's CD player and smashes it on the ground out of anger.

norm: It's wrong to destroy someone's items.
situation: Tony is a movie star who is on a date with Jenny, when Frank the paparazzi appears out of nowhere and takes Ton'ys picture.
intention: Tony wants to express to Frank his displeasure at Frank taking a picture.
moral_action: Tony tells Frank that he is just trying to have a quiet evening with his girlfriend and would appriciate some privacy.
immoral_action: Tony walks up to Frank aggressively and grabs the camera out of his hand before smashing it to pieces on the ground.

norm: It's wrong to steal from others.
situation: Billy is eating cookies with Suzy, and Billy has finished eating the last cookie on his plate.
intention: Billy wants to continue eating cookies.
moral_action: Billy asks Suzy if there's more cookies in the kitchen.
immoral_action: Billy eats the cookies off of Suzy's plate.

norm: It is wrong to vandalize other peoples property.
situation: Richard and his neighbor don't get along very well.
intention: Richard wants the neighbor to move his ugly RV from in front of his house.
moral_action: Richard calmly talks with his neighbor about moving the RV and offers to help him.
immoral_action: Richard takes a knife to the RV's tires in anger.

norm: It's wrong to destroy or alter public property.
situation: Tabitha goes to a protest with her rebellious friends.
intention: Tabitha wants her friends to think of her as a leader.
moral_action: Tabitha takes the lead during the protest, shouting clever slogans and encouraging the crowd.
immoral_action: Tabitha ends up throwing paint on a statue of George Washington during the protest.

norm: It's wrong to steal things from people.
situation: Tony got fired from his job and is behind on rent.
intention: Tony wants to be able to pay his rent, so he doesn't end up homeless.
moral_action: Tony asks his neighbor for help with his rent.
immoral_action: Tony breaks into his neighbors house because he knows they have cash hidden under their bed.

norm: It's wrong to mess with other people's property.
situation: Tina is looking for a new dress to wear on her upcoming date.
intention: Tina wants to impress her date by looking beautiful in a pretty dress.
moral_action: Tina goes to the dress shop and buys herself a new dress.
immoral_action: Tina looks into her sisters closet and takes a dress to wear to her date.

norm: It's wrong to steal other people's stuff.
situation: Lee is in the locker room at the tennis club and notices that someone has two tennis rackets in their open locker.
intention: Lee needs a tennis racket, so he can play that afternoon.
moral_action: Lee finds the owner of the locker and asks permission to borrow the racket, which is granted.
immoral_action: Making no effort to find the owner, Lee takes a tennis racket from the open locker and uses it on the court.

norm: It's wrong to steal someone else's packages.
situation: Mark notices the mailman placing his neighbor's playstation 4 package on their doorstep.
intention: Mark wants a playstation 4.
moral_action: Mark does extra chores and odd jobs around the neighborhood earning enough cash to buy his own playstation 4.
immoral_action: Mark takes his neighbor's package into his home to claim the playstation 4.

norm: It's wrong to steal someone else's intellectual property.
situation: Ella is starting a new brand to sell her creations.
intention: Ella wants an attractive logo that she can use to market.
moral_action: Ella hires a designer to make a logo for her.
immoral_action: Ella copies an artist's drawing from their website and edits it slightly to use as a logo.

norm: It's wrong to steal things from other people.

immoral_action: Nathan tucks the video game into his jacket right before he leaves his friend's house and takes it home without asking.

norm: It's wrong to damage the property of others.

intention: Julian wants to acquire the ring.
moral_action: Julian goes to the shop the next day and buys the ring.

norm: It is wrong to vandalize property.

norm: It's wrong to mistreat other peoples property.

norm: It is wrong to steal the property of others.

norm: It is wrong to break into another person's property.

norm: It's wrong to throw away someone else's property.

norm: It's wrong to take other people's property.

norm: It's wrong to steal something that isn't yours.

norm: It's wrong to damage another person's property.

intention: James wants to express his disapproval of Trump.

norm: It's inappropriate to steal things.

moral_action: Jake hides a new phone inside of Sam's car in a very hard-to-reach place and calls it repeatedly.

norm: It's wrong for a person to steal.

norm: It's wrong to steal things that don't belong to you.

intention: Sherman wants to keep the time in his room.

norm: It's wrong to steal things from another person.

intention: Lindsey wants her aunt's necklace.

norm: It's wrong to commit vandalism.
situation: Jim has been dating Diane for 2 years.

norm: It's wrong to trespass on other people's property.
situation: Josh was playing baseball with his friends when the ball went into his neighbor's back yard.
intention: Josh wants the ball back.
moral_action: Josh knocks on his neighbor's door and asks him if he can get his ball.
immoral_action: Josh climbs over the fence and sneaks into his neighbor's yard to get the ball.

norm: It's wrong to trespass on private property.
situation: Tom rode his bike to work because he did not own a car.
intention: Tom wants to find shortcuts to get to work faster.
moral_action: Tom found a great shortcut by taking a small back road.
immoral_action: Tom realized if he rode across a farmer's property he could cut his ride short by 5 minutes.

norm: It's rude to tell someone they aren't normal.
situation: James is at a party when he's introduced to Frank who has a septum piercing through his nose.
intention: James wants to react to the septum piercing on Frank.
moral_action: James tells Frank that his piercing is unique and interesting, and he likes it.
immoral_action: James tells Frank that he's a weirdo and that having a septum piercing makes him look tribal and weird.

norm: It's wrong to get tired of being nice.
situation: James is the most friendly person at his job and often helps his coworkers.
intention: James feels he is b show more appreciation for helping them eing taken for granted and wants people to.
moral_action: When a coworker asks James for help,  James agrees without hesitating.
immoral_action: When a coworker asks James for help, he berates them and refuses.

norm: It's rude to pretend you're something you aren't.

intention: Christen wants to see her friend.
moral_action: Christen is almost mistaken for a doctor due to her coat but goes through security and explains that she is a visitor.
immoral_action: Christen is allowed to skip security when someone mistakes her for a doctor due to her coat.

norm: It's wrong to try to be someone you are not.
situation: Jill ran the wrong way and scored a safety against her own team, thus she dreads going to school the next day.
intention: Jill wants to avoid embarrassment for her mistake.
moral_action: Jill decides to practice in the gym all day to avoid the cafeteria and the playground.
immoral_action: Jill pretends to be another student in her class to avoid embarrassment.

norm: It's wrong to lose your cool around others.

immoral_action: James shouts profanities at the students, to try to get them to run faster.

norm: It's bad to pretend to be a different person.
situation: Tara is excited about Halloween with her friend, which  they will be celebrating tonight.
intention: Tara wants to dress up for Halloween.
moral_action: Tara decides to dress up in a unique way during Halloween.
immoral_action: Tara decides to dress as her friend to imitate her.

norm: It's insensitive to ignore someone's feelings.

moral_action: Kevin tells Anne that he's sorry to hear about her day and that if she wants they can do something to take her mind off it.
immoral_action: "Kevin tells Anne ""oh that's great.. hey our team is winning honey, they're gonna make the playoffs!""."

norm: It's not okay to be ashamed of what you like.

intention: Ingrid wants to be liked.
moral_action: Ingrid brushes off the taunts and continues doing what she likes.
immoral_action: Ingrid stops listening to goth music and stops dressing in the clothes.

norm: It's not okay to think of yourself as dumb.

intention: James wants to react to the accident he just had.
moral_action: James yelps in pain then says that he's gotta be more careful and goes to get ice.
immoral_action: James yelps in pain then goes on muttering about how stupid he is and how he always does this.

norm: It's wrong to pretend to be somebody else
situation: Greg, an accountant, is hitting on a woman in a bar, and she asks him what he does for a living.
intention: Greg wants to get the girl's number.
moral_action: Greg tells the woman everything about himself and is completely open.
immoral_action: Greg tells the woman that he's the CEO of his own business.

norm: It is phony to pretend to be something you aren't.
situation: Louis is a child who has been in commercials and has moved to a new town and school and is getting to know the other students.
intention: Louis wants to impress the other students.
moral_action: Louis tells the other children he is a child actor that has been in commercials.
immoral_action: Louis tells the other children he is a child actor that has been in big movies, which is false.

norm: It's bad to pretend to be someone that you're not.
situation: Brad is at a job fair and talking to Phil who is a recruiter when Phil asks Brad his name.
intention: Brad wants to tell Phil a name.
moral_action: Brad tells Phil that his name is Brad and that he's pleased to meet him.

norm: It's wrong to fake liking someone.

intention: Vanessa wants the promotion.

norm: It's insensitive to not consider the feelings of others.

intention: Bob wants to launch the fireworks.
moral_action: Bob's neighbors complain about the dangers and Bob listens to them.
immoral_action: Bob's neighbors complain that it's going to make a lot of noise and be dangerous, Bob ignores them.

norm: It's not okay to hate others for who they are.

intention: James wants to be a kind person.
moral_action: James talks to the LGBT people he meets and reads some of the books they recommend.

norm: It's rude to tell someone their condition isn't real.

intention: Frank wants to talk to Sally about her condition.
moral_action: Frank listens to Sally and asks questions about where her fear comes from.
immoral_action: Frank tells Sally that fears aren't real, and she should just get over it.

norm: It's wrong to fake how you feel.

intention: Joe wants to avoid arguing on the way home.
moral_action: Joe insists that they will talk about things when later after arriving home.

norm: It's not good to pretend you're someone you're not.

norm: It's wrong to lie to the people in your life.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your friends.

norm: You should not trespass on someone else's property.

norm: You shouldn't leave a mess for others to clean up.

norm: You shouldn't steal money.

intention: John wants to count the money in the drawer.
moral_action: John quickly counts the money before carefully placing it back in the register.
immoral_action: John counts all of the bills and then takes a large portion, stuffing it into his pocket.

norm: You shouldn't steal things from your friends.
situation: It's the first of the month and Steffie needs to pay her part of the rent, but she's low on cash.

moral_action: Steffie takes her TV to the pawn shop and gets a loan on it.
immoral_action: Steffie goes in her friend Brad's wallet and takes $200 without telling him.

norm: You shouldn't destroy someone's property.

moral_action: Fred shouts through the door if his neighbors need any helpl.
immoral_action: Fred kicks down his neighbor's door, ready to help with any trouble.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against vegans.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against people from other countries.

moral_action: Carl interviews Lois, a man from India with amazing qualifications and gives him the job.
immoral_action: Carl interviews a man, Lois from India who is more than qualified, but Carl turns him down and instead hires a white American with less experience.

norm: You shouldn't waste a policemen's time.

moral_action: Jill approaches the man and asked if he moved into the neighborhood recently.

norm: You shouldn't destroy public property.
situation: Frank is among a group of demonstrators demanding social justice.

norm: You shouldn't steal things from people.

intention: Gina wants a stick of lipstick.
moral_action: Gina takes the lipstick to the cashier and pays for it.
immoral_action: Gina places the lipstick in her pocket and leaves the store without paying.

norm: You shouldn't make people waste time.

intention: Gary wants to talk to his friends.
moral_action: Gary as well as his friends show up on time, and they talk pleasantly.

norm: You shouldn't steal your friend's things.

intention: Jack wants to get a new phone.

immoral_action: Jack decides to pocket Hoffner's phone while Hoffner is in the bathroom, so that he can upgrade from his old phone.

norm: You shouldn't steal things that don't belong to you.

intention: Ash wants to wear the top when she goes out.
moral_action: Ash offers to trade a top that her sister likes for this one.
immoral_action: Ash takes the top without asking and keeps it in her closet.

norm: You shouldn't give expensive items to someone you don't know.

intention: Will wants his jewelry someone to watch over his jewelry while he is away.
moral_action: Will gives the jewelry to his brother who he has known all his life.
immoral_action: Will gives the jewelry to a neighbor he has only met once.

norm: You shouldn't destroy things that belong to other people

intention: Chris wants to open the stapler.
moral_action: Chris asks his coworker about opening the stapler, and they manage to get it open properly.
immoral_action: Chris uses all his strength and breaks open the stapler.

norm: You shouldn't waste money on unnecessary things

intention: Josh wants to make a financial decision.
moral_action: Josh decides to put the money in an emergency savings.
immoral_action: Josh decides to buy himself some baseball cards, that he didn't really need, but got a good deal.

norm: You shouldn't mess up someone's things.

moral_action: Sam decides to leave the baseball cards alone and instead hides the rubber snake in Philips sleeping bag that weekend.
immoral_action: Sam goes through all his brothers baseball card albums and dumps them all over the house.

norm: You shouldn't throw out things that can be recycled.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against who you rent out to.

moral_action: Jeremy goes through and approves the applicants with the highest ratings to stay at his place.

norm: You shouldn't require someone else to pay for your things.

intention: Jerry wants to obtain a new guitar.
moral_action: Jerry buys the guitar buy charging it on his credit card.
immoral_action: Jerry makes his spouse pay for his guitar citing that he needs it for work.

norm: You shouldn't violate people's boundaries by going through their stuff
situation: Derrick neeeds to staple some reports together, but he's out of staples at his cubicle and notices his cubicle neighbor Davin leave for lunch.
intention: Derrick needs more staples.
moral_action: Derrick considers looking in Davin's cubicle but goes to the supply closet to grab more staples instead.
immoral_action: Derrick goes to Davin's cubicle and rummages around until he finds some staples.

norm: You shouldn't steal other people's content.
situation: Mika needs to submit her essay before the due date in six hours, and she has writer's block.
intention: Mika doesn't want her work to be late.
moral_action: Mika does some writing exercises she finds online to get rid of her writers block.
immoral_action: Mika copies someone's essay from a blog.

norm: You shouldn't steal from servers.
situation: Brandon gets a bill from a restaurant waiter and notes that the waiter's pen is of high quality.
intention: Brandon wants the same pen that the waiter uses.
moral_action: Brandon signs the bill and asks the waiter where he got his pen from.
immoral_action: Brandon signs the bill, takes the pen, and replaces it with a different pen.

norm: You shouldn't talk trash about people's things.
situation: Samantha has noticed that her neighbor, Jolene, has a brand new car in her driveway.
intention: Samantha wants to have a conversation with Jolene about her car.
moral_action: Samantha asks Jolene how she feels about her new car.
immoral_action: Samantha tells Jolene that her car is low class.

norm: You shouldn't lose belongings that don't belong to you.
situation: Karen is at May's house, and they decide to go dancing, but she didn't bring the right evening attire.
intention: Karen wants to borrow some jewelry from May.
moral_action: Karen asks May if she can wear a necklace and May lets her pick out the one Karen likes the most to use.
immoral_action: Karen loses May's earrings she borrowed at a man's house that she met the night they went dancing, but he said they aren't there.

norm: You shouldn't steal money from others.
situation: Basil is in desperate need of a loan and is at the bank asking for one when he is turned down.
intention: Basil wants to find a way to acquire the money he needs.
moral_action: Basil goes to a pay day lender who will give him the loan but at higher rates.
immoral_action: Basil reaches over into the teller's till and pulls out a wad of cash before running away.

norm: You should not waste other people's time.
situation: Harmony is browsing the displays at a busy jewelry store without planning to buy anything, when a sales clerk approaches her and asks her if she needs help.
intention: Harmony wants to respond to the sales clerk.
moral_action: Harmony explains that she's currently just browsing and doesn't require assistance.
immoral_action: Harmony asks the sales clerk a bunch of questions about the jewelry and requests to try some of it on even though there's no chance of her purchasing it.

norm: You shouldn't break people's things.
situation: Tina is playing with her friend Nancy's toy, but Tina and Nancy have started fighting.
intention: Tina wants to express her anger.
moral_action: Tina yells at Nancy some, but does not get violent.
immoral_action: Tina throws Nancy's toy on the ground, breaking it in two.

norm: You shouldn't plagiarize other people's work.
situation: Candy has been assigned a paper in her English class at school.
intention: Candy wants to finish writing the paper.
moral_action: Candy researches the topic and writes the paper in her own words.
immoral_action: Candy copies her work almost word for word from something that she find online.

norm: People should not ruin other people's belongings.
situation: Carlos is a field worker in Central America and has a very dull machete when his friend offers him a sharpener.
intention: Carlos wants to sharpen his machete.
moral_action: Carlos uses the sharpener to put a fairly sharp edge on the machete, then gives it back.
immoral_action: Carlos spends the entire night sharpening the machete to a razor-fine edge and wears out the sharpener.

norm: You shouldn't push homeless people.
situation: Vernon is walking to work and a homeless person is in his way.
intention: Vernon wants to get to work.
moral_action: Vernon simply walks around the person, stepping onto the street to pass them.
immoral_action: Vernon pushes them over, so he can keep walking on the sidewalk to work.

norm: You shouldn't destroy someone else's property.
situation: Ash is watching tv at Jacob's house, and the TV remote is having problems working which annoys Ash.
intention: Ash wants to express his anger.
moral_action: Ash releases his emotions by writing a critical review of the product on Amazon.
immoral_action: Ash tosses raises his voice and tosses the remote against the coffee table breaking it.

norm: You shouldn't discriminate against immigrants.
situation: James needed a new accountant right away and most of the applicants he could find were on green cards.
intention: James wants to hire someone who'll fit in well with the team.
moral_action: James hires the candidate with the best resume regardless of nationality.
immoral_action: James refuses to hire anyone but a native-born American for the job opening.

norm: It is good show appreciation.
situation: The art teacher is seeing a new piece by her student.
intention: The art teacher wants to draw out the best from her students.
moral_action: The art teacher smiles and praises the new work of the student.
immoral_action: The art teacher frowns and offers criticism rather than encouragement.

norm: It's good to give encouragement to someone close to you.
situation: Evan asked Jerry for some words of advice about his upcoming project.
intention: Jerry wants to give his honest opinion to Evan.
moral_action: Jerry sits down and gives Evan constructive critisism.
immoral_action: Jerry yells at Evan to get his own ideas and tells him he sucks.

norm: It is good to reconnect with people.
situation: Gabby has lost touch with an old friend and has been feeling lonely.
intention: Gabby wants to have meaningful relationships.
moral_action: Gabby's friend reaches out, and Gabby makes time to have a video chat to catch up.
immoral_action: Gabby's friend tries to reaches out several times, but Gabby always prioritizes hanging out with other friends.

norm: It's nice to offer support.
situation: Bobby is listening to his friend Jack talk about his recent financial troubles and thoughts of suicide.
intention: Bobby wants to offer his perspective and give advice relative to the situation.
moral_action: Bobby helps Jack to better his perspective and to help Jack understand that the problems are temporary and that he will be OK.
immoral_action: Bobby tells Jack that the way he sees it, the problems are his fault, and he needs to work to make his life better.

norm: It is good to support your team.
situation: John is attending a baseball game which his team is playing, and he is frustrated because they are losing badly.
intention: John wants to enjoy his evening.
moral_action: John passionately cheers for his team throughout the game and continuously tries to boost their morale.
immoral_action: John decides to give up on the rest of the game and leave before it's over, going to catch a movie he'd been wanting to watch instead.

norm: It's good to communicate.
situation: Jane is at a restaurant with her friends, and they have been there for fifteen minutes.
intention: Jane wants to order some food.
moral_action: Jane confidently and clearly articles her order in a moderate voice to the waiter.
immoral_action: Jane quietly tells a friend what she wants to order when the waiter asks her what she wants.

norm: It's good to make use of public resources.
situation: Bob is poor and is having trouble paying bills.
intention: Bob wants to buy food.
moral_action: Bob uses his food stamps to buy good quality food.
immoral_action: Bob buys nothing but ramen noodles because they're cheap, ignoring his food stamps.

norm: It's good to get good at things you enjoy.
situation: Travis, an avid music lover, is thinking about learning a new skill to impress his upcoming date Sarah.
intention: Travis wants to impress his date.
moral_action: Travis practices guitar for a couple of hours.
immoral_action: Travis  buys something generic from the store to impress his girlfriend.

norm: It's good to show your appreciation to people.
situation: It's Sandra's birthday, and she gets a new toy from her father.
intention: Sandra wants to play with her new toy.
moral_action: Sandra thanks her father for the present then enjoys playing with her new toy.
immoral_action: Sandra runs of to her room to play with her new toy without thanking her father for the birthday gift.

norm: It's good to help someone with a project.
situation: Ray is sitting in his office at work.
intention: Ray wants to do something with his spare time.
moral_action: Ray joins a coworker that needs assistance on a project they're working on.
immoral_action: Ray looks at gambling websites on his work computer.

norm: It's good to greet others on public transportation.
situation: Pat is traveling across town to get to the mall.
intention: Pat wants to have an enjoyable ride on the bus on the way there.
moral_action: Pat sits down and greets the person after they say hi.
immoral_action: Pat sits down and the person sitting next to him says hello and Pat ignores him.

norm: It's good to help someone.
situation: On her way to take an exam for her college class, Meredith sees Jude slip and fall on the ice.
intention: Meredith wants to take her exam.
moral_action: Meredith stops to help Jude, seeing that it looks like he might be hurt, and waits until assistance arrives.
immoral_action: Meredith passes Jude without saying anything or checking to see if any assistance is needed.

norm: It's good to help people out and enjoy it.
situation: Josh committed a crime and has been ordered by the judge to perform community service, and decides to work at a homeless shelter's soup kitchen.
intention: Josh needs to serve people food.
moral_action: Josh serves out Soup with energy and enthusiasm, and gives a kind word to every recipient.
immoral_action: Josh does the bare minimum and hates every minute of it.

norm: It's good to be dedicated.
situation: Phil sees his friend Jane building an awesome treehouse in her yard.
intention: Phil wants to build an awesome treehouse in his yard.
moral_action: Phil gets to work on the treehouse right away and just keeps building with all of his spare time.
immoral_action: Phil gathers the materials and starts building, but then keeps putting it off.

norm: It's good to know someone's interests.
situation: Henry is Lydia's Secret Santa, so he is at the mall looking for a gift.
intention: Henry wants to buy a gift.
moral_action: Henry knows that Lydia is an avid camper, so he buys her a new headlamp.
immoral_action: Henry knows nothing about Lydia, so he just buys her a game that he wanted.

norm: It is good to engage with people.
situation: Josh comes home tired from work, and he feels the need for companionship.
intention: Josh wants to do something relaxing.
moral_action: Josh invites his friends over to his house for a movie night.
immoral_action: Josh spends the evening playing solitaire on the computer.

norm: It's good to honest with people you care about.
situation: Cliff has been drinking heavily and has developed an alcohol problem, but when his wife, Cathy, asks him why he's been at the bar so much lately, he hesitates.
intention: Cliff wants to talk to Cathy.
moral_action: Cliff tells Cathy the truth about drinking so much and explains he's been stressed lately.
immoral_action: Cliff, being ashamed of his alcohol problem tells Cathy he's been watching the band play at the bar.

norm: It's good to make newcomers feel welcome.
situation: Stan is holding a party and someone he's never met before came to it.
intention: Stan wants to make the situation less awkward.
moral_action: Stan starts up a conversation with the stranger and introduces them to others.
immoral_action: Stan asks the stranger what they're doing in his house and tells them to go home.

norm: It is good to be a good host.
situation: After a very stressful week at work, Jane is throwing a party at her house for her friends.
intention: Jane wants to speak to the guests.
moral_action: Jane talks to the guests about casual topics to keep the mood light.
immoral_action: Jane speaks to the guests but keeps remarking about how stressed out she is.

norm: It's good to support things you love.
situation: Carla loves to listen to the free band concerts in the park on Friday nights.
intention: Carla wants to enjoy the Friday concerts.
moral_action: Carla always drops a couple of dollars in the donation boxes.
immoral_action: Carla consistently walks past the donation boxes without contributing anything.

norm: It is good to talk about experiences.
situation: Caleb is in the break room at work making coffee when a new employee walks in and asks Caleb for advice.
intention: Caleb wants to get back to his office.
moral_action: Caleb tells the new employee to send him an email about it, and he'll respond soon.
immoral_action: Caleb tells the new employee that he can't talk right now because he has to get back to working.

norm: It's good to take heed of signs from people.
situation: Brad and Amy are about to have sex, but Amy seems uncomfortable.
intention: Brad wants to decide whether to keep having sex.
moral_action: Brad asks Amy if she wants to have sex and stops when she says no.
immoral_action: Brad continues to have sex with Amy even though Amy doesn't seem to enjoy it.

norm: It's good to volunteer for things.
situation: Pat is in a meeting with his manager Beth, and she asks him if he is interested in running a new company project.
intention: Pat wants to answer Beth.
moral_action: Pat tells Beth that he would like to volunteer to run the project.
immoral_action: Pat tells Beth that he doesn't think he would have time for the project.

norm: It's nice to do a favor for people.
situation: Trevor is out of food, and he's too busy to go to the store, so he asks Lee.
intention: Lee wants to decide to help Trevor or not.
moral_action: Lee agrees to help out Trevor, and he goes to the store for him and brings him the groceries.
immoral_action: Lee doesn't help Trevor and goes back to watching football.

norm: It's good to lend a hand to people.
situation: Bill's coworker was assigned more projects than he could handle and desperately asks Bill for help.
intention: Bill wants to respond to his coworker's request.
moral_action: Bill agrees and takes time out of his schedule to reduce his coworker's workload.
immoral_action: Bill flatly denies his coworker and goes away to do his own work.

norm: It's good to pay attention to your host.
situation: Leah is in a circle talking to a few people at a party when her friend who is hosting the party walks up.
intention: Leah wants to get the attention of a boy at the party.
moral_action: Leah asks the boy she's interested in how he knows the host, sparking a three-way conversation that includes the boy she's interested in.
immoral_action: Leah ignores the friend that just walked up and instead tries to start a side conversation with the boy she's interested in.

norm: It's good to give someone information when they seek it.
situation: While driving Vanessa sees a person on the side of the road wave her down.
intention: Vanessa wants to get to the mall before it closes.
moral_action: Vanessa drives slowly and answers the person's question before speeding up to go to the mall.
immoral_action: Vanessa pretends not to see the person and speeds off to the mall.

norm: It is good to stick up for people.
situation: Leslie hears a group of her friends making fun of a childhood friend that she doesn't talk to anymore, but still cares for.
intention: Leslie has to decide whether to join the conversation and what she wants to say.
moral_action: Leslie speaks up and tells the group that she has known the person they're talking about for a long time, and she feels offended by their conversation.
immoral_action: Leslie doesn't want to sacrifice her place in the social order of her friends, so she ignores the conversation she hears.

norm: It's good to share knowledge.
situation: Colby is at work when he sees that Mike is struggling with some machinery.
intention: Colby wants the machine to work correctly.
moral_action: Colby shows Mike how to work with the machine correctly.
immoral_action: Colby tells Mike to get lost, and he does the work on the machine himself.

norm: It's good to find someone you are interested in.
situation: Todd has been dating for quite a while and hasn't found anyone yet who he really likes, but he's met a few women who are nice.
intention: Todd wants to find a long term relationship with someone.
moral_action: Todd decides to wait until he meets someone he finds truly interesting and could love deeply before he commits to a relationship.
immoral_action: Todd decides to settle for someone who he doesn't really care for deeply, but she is a good person.

norm: It's good to be informed about current events.
situation: Kelly lives in a city with a lot of road construction.
intention: She has to drive her friend Carol to the airport next week.
moral_action: Kelly prepares to drive her friend by reading the local paper for updates on closures.
immoral_action: Kelly knows about the construction so doesn't look into closures but just leaves a few minutes early.

norm: It is good to observe traditions
situation: Tanis was the black sheep of the family growing up but is visiting home for the holidays.
intention: Tanis wants to enjoy the holidays.
moral_action: Tanis participates in all the family actvities that she used to skip out on when she was younger.
immoral_action: When the family is getting ready to do what they do every year for the holidays, Tanis sneaks out to go to the bar in the next town over.

norm: It's good to give things back to people.
situation: Ryan lives in a neighborhood which just got a lot of snow and realizes he still has his neighbor's snow shovel.
intention: Ryan wants to clear the snow off his driveway.
moral_action: Ryan returns the snow shovel to his neighbor and goes to pick up his own.
immoral_action: Ryan holds onto the snow shovel and uses it to take care of the driveway.

norm: It's good to accept help from people.
situation: Jon is looking to start a new business and comes from a very supportive, financially stable family.
intention: Jon wants to find funding for his new business.
moral_action: Jon gets the start up capital that he needs from his family.
immoral_action: Jon decides to slowly save up the money himself which is a long and difficult process.

norm: It is good to accept people for who they are.
situation: Jan's brother is a hardcore sports fan, and Jan is not a sports fan.
intention: Jan has to decide whether to get his brother to read more books.
moral_action: Jan doesn't think that her brother would read the books, so he decides to leave him alone.
immoral_action: Jan buys his brother a bunch of books and makes him read them.

norm: It is good to express thanks when people help you
situation: Anthony is in the process of moving and plans to do so every day for the next week.
intention: Anthony wants to enlist the help of his friends.
moral_action: Anthony's friends help him move heavy furniture for two days straight, and he thanks them by taking them out to dinner.
immoral_action: Anthony has his friends help him move heavy furniture for two days straight without thanking them.

norm: It is good to share your experiences.
situation: Joanna, who just got back from a long trip, is having dinner with her boyfriend Thomas, who's asking her about how her trip was.
intention: Joanna wants to answer Thomas' question.
moral_action: Joanna describes her trip in detail to Thomas, telling him all about what she did and where she went.
immoral_action: Joanna tells Thomas that the trip was fine and then quickly changes the conversation to another subject.

norm: It's good to spend time with people you care about
situation: Sophie is a college student that still lives at home with her family.
intention: Sophie wants to grow as a person in her college years.
moral_action: Sophie makes sure to stay close with her family despite being in college because they have always been there for her.
immoral_action: Sophie thinks that socializing is what she needs to do and goes out every night trying her best to not be home if she doesn't have to be.

norm: It is good to have activities.
situation: Sean has a day off and the weather is beautiful.
intention: Sean wants to decide if he should plan something.
moral_action: Sean decides to get some exercise.
immoral_action: Sean doesn't plan anything and relaxes all day.

norm: It is good to end in good terms with people.
situation: Jake is not enjoying his relationship with his girlfriend as much as he used to.
intention: Jake wants to break up with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Jake tells his girlfriend that they have to break up because she deserves more.
immoral_action: Jake tells his girlfriend that he wasted so much time with her.

norm: It is good to care for people you like.
situation: James is relaxing at home when his wife Mary runs in with a bleeding finger from cutting herself while making dinner.
intention: James wants to help Mary.
moral_action: James tells Mary to hang on and runs to go get some band aids and gauze from the bathroom cabinet.
immoral_action: James tells Mary that the band aids are in the bathroom cabinet, and she should go get one.

norm: It's good to want to show someone you appreciate them.
situation: Ann finally got a good paying job, and she knows her mom is responsible for her being in this position.
intention: Ann wants to decide whether to buy her mom something.
moral_action: Ann buys her mom a new electric car so that it lasts a long time.
immoral_action: Ann wants to save her money, so she decides not to buy any gifts.

norm: It's obnoxious to constantly prattle on about yourself.
situation: Jennifer is going out on a first date.
intention: Jennifer wants to connect romantically.
moral_action: Jennifer asks her date questions about himself while talking a moderate amount about herself.
immoral_action: Jennifer talks non-stop about herself throughout the date.

norm: It is rude to not tip in certain situations.
situation: Sarah is eating dinner at a local Italian restaurant before going to a movie.
intention: Sarah wants to pay the bill so she can leave.
moral_action: Sarah leaves an extra ten dollars with her payment.
immoral_action: Sarah pays the bill with exact change and leaves no tip.

norm: It's rude to cut in front of others in line.
situation: Claire is at the front of the prison commissary line and Amber is at the end of the line.
intention: Amber doesn't want to wait in the line for very long.
moral_action: Amber walks up to Claire and explains that her need is an emergency.
immoral_action: Amber walks towards the front of the line and stands in front of Claire.

norm: It is rude to sit in another persons seat.
situation: Brenda is on a plane.
intention: Brenda wants to have a window seat.
moral_action: Brenda asks someone if in a window seat if they would be willing to trade.
immoral_action: Brenda sits down in a window seat even though it is not her assigned seat.

norm: It's rude to down vote people's posts.
situation: Tim is on Reddit and stumbles upon a post that is extremely disagreeable.
intention: Tim wants to express his opinion and disagreement to the poster.
moral_action: Tim doesn't rate the post but provides a comprehensive counter argument in response.
immoral_action: Tim down votes the post and responds with namecalling.

norm: It is rude to upset someone on a special day.
situation: Claire is attending the wedding of her friend Martha, and the guests are all sitting around eating.
intention: Claire wants to make an impromptu speech.
moral_action: Claire stands up and tells a sweet story about a time Martha really came through for her.
immoral_action: Claire stands up and tells an inappropriate story involving Martha and a previous boyfriend.

norm: It's often inappropriate to swear.
situation: Wally was in class giving a presentation in front of his teacher.
intention: Wally wanted to make a point.
moral_action: Wally explained his project to all his classmates and his teacher.
immoral_action: Wally used a series of swear words to accent the point in his presentation.

norm: It is rude to take up too much room.
situation: Claudia is on the train to visit her parents and starts to feel very tired from the long journey.
intention: Claudia wants to sleep during her train trip.
moral_action: Claudia sits in a window seat, rests her head against the window with her coat as a pillow and falls asleep.
immoral_action: Claudia lies down, taking up three seats.

norm: It is rude gossip about other people.
situation: Sally meets with her friend, and she knows something embarrassing about one of their coworkers.
intention: Sally wants to talk about something interesting with her friend.
moral_action: Sally tells her friend about something interesting Sally did over the weekend but doesn't tell them what happened to their coworker.
immoral_action: Sally tells her friend about the embarrassing thing that happened to their coworker, and they laugh about it.

norm: It is rude to be overly sensitive about minor issues
situation: Martin is having dinner in a restaurant and the steak is slightly overcooked.
intention: Martin wants inform the waiter of the problem.
moral_action: Martin gently informs the waiter that is steak is overdone but that he'll eat it anyway.
immoral_action: Martin yells at the waiter.

norm: It is hurtful to joke around too much with people.
situation: Penelope likes to joke around with her friends, but sees her friend Rita is having a bad day.
intention: Penelope wants to make a joke.
moral_action: Penelope decides to joke around with someone else in the group who is in a better mood.
immoral_action: Penelope makes a joke about Rita's hair that would normally not be taken seriously by Rita.

norm: It's rude to hog all of the lefteovers.
situation: Patrick is browsing through the fridge when he notices the pizza he and his roommate ordered the night before.
intention: Patrick wants to get himself something to eat.
moral_action: Patrick takes a couple slices of pizza and leaves the rest for his roommate.
immoral_action: Patrick takes all the rest of the pizza and puts it in the oven to reheat it for his lunch.

norm: It's rude to complain too often.
situation: Jonathan is trying to return an item he bought online, but the customer service team is having trouble processing his request and asked Jonathan to wait a few days.
intention: Jonathan wants to complete his return.
moral_action: Jonathan waits to be contacted the service team and sends a reminder when a few days pass without contact.
immoral_action: Jonathan sends multiple emails a day to the website's customer service complaining about how long the process is taking and asking for updates.

norm: It's rude to skip in line.
situation: It's lunchtime and Kelly is near a popular cafe but she's running late for class too.
intention: Kelly wants to grab lunch and get to class.
moral_action: Kelly places an online order with the cafe through her phone, so she doesn't have to wait in line.
immoral_action: Kelly goes straight to the front of the ordering line because she wants to get her food as quickly as possible.

norm: It's rude to take up more than one seat.
situation: Ralph and his girlfriend Eliza get on a bus and look for a place to sit down.
intention: Ralph wants to sit on the bus.
moral_action: Ralph sits down in one empty seat and lets Eliza sit in the other.
immoral_action: Ralph sits down in the only two empty seats on the bus.

norm: It's rude to crowd in line.
situation: Jimmy wants goes to the opening night of a movie and see the line for tickets is long.
intention: Jimmy wants to get on the line for tickets.
moral_action: Jimmy gets on the line and stays an arms length from the people in front of him.
immoral_action: Jimmy gets on the line and walks into the people in front of him.

norm: It's not nice to cheat.
situation: Marcus has an important math test today.
intention: Marcus wants to make an A.
moral_action: Marcus takes the test to the best of his abilities and makes an A.
immoral_action: Marcus decides to look at other students answers when he thinks that nobody is paying attention to him.

norm: It's not good to make people feel uncomfortable
situation: Kim just bought a new house and is hosting a house warming party.
intention: Kim wants to get to know her new neighbors.
moral_action: Kim gets to know everyone and makes them feel welcome in her home.
immoral_action: Kim is rude and avoids talking to a neighbor who she never met.

norm: Gossiping about people is not acceptable.
situation: Shauna is attending her sister Cheryl's wedding reception.
intention: Shauna wants to critique her Cheryl's party gown.
moral_action: Shauna tells Cheryl she doesn't like her dress directly.
immoral_action: Shauna tells some of the guests that she hates Cheryl's dress.

norm: It is not good to lie to people.
situation: Cam is going to to a party in a shady area and his parents want to know where he' going.
intention: Cam wants to give his parents a response.
moral_action: Cam tells his parents where he's going.
immoral_action: Cam tells his parents that he's going to McDonald's.

norm: It's not good to write nonsense
situation: "Kabia was writing for this very task on Mturk and saw the norm ""It's not good to write nonsense""."
intention: Kabia wants to complete the task.
moral_action: Kabia works hard on coming up with a better narrative.
immoral_action: "Kabia literally writes the word ""nonsense"" into the action that violates the norm field."

norm: It's not polite to grab another person's private areas.
situation: Chris is attracted to a female coworker and has to work overtime with her to finish an assignment.
intention: Chris wants to make his attraction clear to his coworker.
moral_action: Chris tells his coworker that he likes her but is happy to stay friends if she doesn't feel the same way.
immoral_action: Chris tells his coworker that she is very pretty and pats her on the behind.

norm: It's not good to go looking for trouble
situation: Peter has just gotten off of work, but he doesn't want to go home yet.
intention: Peter wants to find something fun to do.
moral_action: Peter goes to the bowling alley and meets some of his friends.
immoral_action: Peter parks in an alley and buys drugs from a local drug dealer.

norm: It's not nice to threaten people.
situation: Karen is a customer who is discussing an issue with Jack who owns the local sporting goods store.
intention: Karen wants to refund or exchange a sports jersey.
moral_action: Karen explains to Jack why the jersey is not a good buy for her and asks what options are available.
immoral_action: Karen raise her voice at Jack and threatens to do harm to him if she is not refunded.

norm: It's not good to brag.
situation: Jim and his friends were playing basketball, and Jim beat all of them in 1v1 games.
intention: Jim wants to celebrate his victory.
moral_action: Jim treats everyone to a drink on him the next time they hang out.
immoral_action: Jim lords his wins over his friends for the next week.

norm: It's not nice to cause problems in public places.
situation: Laura is at the mall and sees a few garbage cans overflowing with garbage.
intention: Laura wants to attract the attention of authorities to the problem of garbage at the mall.
moral_action: Laura quietly goes to a security guard at the mall and asks him to contact his boss about the garbage issue.
immoral_action: Laura goes to a security guard at the mall and loudly takes him to task about the garbage cans.

norm: It's not good to put others lives at risk.
situation: Tyler is going to the grocery store where there is a mask requirement policy, but he has lost his mask.
intention: Tyler wants to buy something for dinner.
moral_action: Tyler fashions a t-shirt into a makeshift mask and wears it while he shops.
immoral_action: Tyler goes to the store without a mask on and picks up ingredients for dinner.

norm: It's not nice to be rude to people.
situation: Jane is waiting in line in a busy grocery store while a slow customer ahead of her pays in small change.
intention: Jane wants to get through the line as soon as possible.
moral_action: Jane waits patiently for her turn.
immoral_action: Jane complains loudly about how long the other customer is taking to finish.

norm: It's not good to force someone to do things.
situation: Ruth's son, Jack,  has social anxiety disorder, and they go to McDonald's to buy a meal.
intention: Ruth wants to buy a meal.
moral_action: Ruth shows Jack how to talk to a stranger and order a meal by interacting with the cashier.
immoral_action: Ruth asks Jack to talk to and order a meal from the cashier.

norm: It's not polite to eavesdrop on people.
situation: Jenny has finished her work and has to wait for her coworker, Ellen, to get off the phone, so they can leave together.
intention: Jenny wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Jenny sits in her office and plans the next day's work while she waits for Ellen.
immoral_action: Jenny stands next to her Ellen's office door and listens in on her phone call.

norm: It's not good to lie.
situation: Frasier who is 31 is interviewing for a contest with contest director Roz when she asks him how old he is.
intention: Frasier wants to state his age.
moral_action: Frasier tells Ros that he just recently turned thirty one years old.
immoral_action: Frasier assumes he'll have a better chance of winning the contest if he's older, so he says he's 40.

norm: It's not nice to put yourself down
situation: Ken was writing an essay on his computer, but the power went out, and it wasn't saved.
intention: Ken wants to talk to himself.
moral_action: Ken reminds himself that it was just a mistake and that he couldn't predict the power going out.
immoral_action: Ken tells himself that this is what he deserves and that he doesn't deserve a good grade.

norm: IT is not good to steal from anyone.
situation: Holly is having problems paying rent, and she notices her grandmother's diamond ring lying on the table.
intention: Holly needs money.
moral_action: Holly makes custom masks and puts them onto her online store.
immoral_action: Holly takes her mothers ring and sells it to a thrift shop for cash.

norm: It's not good to be a snitch.
situation: Robert witnesses a kid stealing candy from Walmart while he is waiting in line to pay.
intention: Robert wants to teach the boy that it's wrong to steal.
moral_action: Robert walks up to the boy and tells him that it is wrong to steal, making him promise not to steal in the future.
immoral_action: Robert walks up to the boy, asks where his parent is and then tells his mom what the boy did.

norm: It's wrong to bite a child.
situation: Jon's 3 year old son is biting him on the hand.
intention: Jon wants the child to stop biting him.
moral_action: Jon puts his 3 year old son in timeout for biting.
immoral_action: Jon bites his 3 year old son back to teach him a lesson.

norm: It's wrong to leave kids with out your help.
situation: Adrienne is babysitting and is tired.
intention: Adrienne wants some alone time.
moral_action: Adrienne gathers the kids to watch a movie together to relax.
immoral_action: Adrienne leaves the kids alone in a room and goes to watch TV.

norm: Is wrong to make children feel unwelcome
situation: Mary Beth is giving a birthday party for her daughter.
intention: Mary Beth wants to make the day memorable.
moral_action: Mary Beth negotiates a bigger boat with the rental agent to accommodate everyone.
immoral_action: She tells some of the children that there's not enough room for everyone on the sailboat, so they have to wait at the harbor.

norm: It is wrong to punch children.
situation: Bobby's son John knocks over their big screen TV and breaks it.
intention: Bobby wants to punish his kid and teach a lesson.
moral_action: Bobby holds his anger in and sends his son to his room telling him to be more careful around electronics.
immoral_action: Bobby allows his anger to take hold of him, and he punches his son in the arm as punishment.

norm: Nudity in front of children is wrong.
situation: Sandy is babysitting when the young girl vomits on her, with the fluid seeping through her shirt and onto her bra.
intention: Sandy needs to change her shirt quickly.
moral_action: Sandy went into the bathroom to wash off her shirt and bra.
immoral_action: Sandy takes her shirt and bra off in front of the girl.

norm: It's wrong to strike a little kid.
situation: Grant is coaching a youth baseball team, and they are performing poorly at practice.
intention: Grant wants to motivate his team to play better.
moral_action: Grant comes up with an encouraging speech for his players and offers them a reward if they can meet a goal.
immoral_action: Grant smacks one of the kids on the head, insinuating that he will do it to others if they don't pick up their play.

norm: It's wrong to steal a kid's toy.
situation: Kyle is at the park and is looking at a friend's baby playing with a toy.
intention: Kyle wants to play around with the baby.
moral_action: Kyle makes funny faces at the baby.
immoral_action: Kyle takes the baby's toy as a joke.

norm: It is unacceptable to neglect or abuse children.
situation: Peter has a young son named Kyle who is misbehaving.
intention: Peter wants to correct the behavior.
moral_action: Peter calmly reiterates the house rules with Kyle and puts him in a time out.
immoral_action: Peter beats Kyle very severely causing his face and body to be covered in bruises.

norm: It is wrong to abuse your children.
situation: Mary's kids are being really loud, and she has a headache.
intention: Mary wants peace and quiet.
moral_action: Mary takes some Tylenol and asks nicely that the kids be quiet.
immoral_action: Mary hits her kids to get them to be quiet and threatens them.

norm: It's wrong to kidnap and torture a child.
situation: Jeremy is driving home when he sees a young child walking down the road by himself.
intention: Jeremy wants to pick the child up.
moral_action: Jeremy picks the child up and brings him to the local authorities to help get him home safe.
immoral_action: Jeremy picks the child up under the guise of giving him a ride, then rapes and slowly kills him.

norm: It's rude to assume that children aren't smart.
situation: Jasper is babysitting for his sister's two kids while she works.
intention: Jasper wants to play a game with the kids.
moral_action: Jasper asks the kids what games they would like to play.
immoral_action: Jasper insists that the 10 and 11 year old kids play Candy Land or Duck Duck Goose.

norm: It's wrong for an adult to abuse a child.
situation: Chloe, Ninas 12-year-old daughter, wants to go to a friend's house even though she has homework to do.
intention: Nina wants Chloe to do her homework.
moral_action: Nina tells Chloe that she can leave as long as she gets her homework done first.
immoral_action: Nina gives Chloe a slap and tells her she'll hit her again if she doesn't get her homework done.

norm: It is wrong to hit children.
situation: Janice has a headache and her kids are making a racket at home.
intention: Janice wants some peace and quiet.
moral_action: Janice asks nicely for the kids to keep it down, so she can rest.
immoral_action: Janice hits and threatens her kids to make them be quiet.

norm: It's wrong to brainwash impressionable children.
situation: Aaron and his son are discussing current events and political issues.
intention: Aaron wants to help his son become more informed.
moral_action: Aaron asks his son questions to provoke his critical thinking skills but refrains from speaking about his own opinion.
immoral_action: Aaron talks for over an hour on why his son should believe what he believes and why those who disagree are wrong.

norm: It's wrong to pressure children
situation: Dave is explaining to his son, Max what it means to be in a sports team.
intention: Dave wants to iterate to Max that it's important to play on a team.
moral_action: Dave tells Max that team sports build teamwork skills and coping skills as well as keep you healthy.
immoral_action: Dave tells Max that he's weak and useless if he's not on a team and that he'll think less of him if he refuses to sign up.

norm: It is wrong to stifle children's freedom of expression
situation: Mrs. Jones is teaching a pre-school art class how to paint trees with fingerpaint.
intention: Mrs. Jones wants the children to be proud of their drawings.
moral_action: Mrs. Jones demonstrates how to make a tree and lets the children pick colors that they love.
immoral_action: Mrs. Jones gives each child one color of paint at a time and makes them follow her step by step.

norm: It's wrong to push a baby.
situation: Suzie has a baby sister, Kate, who is playing with one of Suzie's toys.
intention: Suzie wants to get her toy back from Kate.
moral_action: Suzie waits until Kate is done playing, then retrieves the toy.
immoral_action: Suzie pushes Kate over so that she drops the toy, then takes it.

norm: It's wrong to hurt an innocent child.
situation: Amelia is caring for her crying infant son after a long shift at work.
intention: Amelia wants to be able to sleep.
moral_action: Amelia rocks her son in her arms until he falls asleep, then tucks him in before getting some sleep.
immoral_action: Amelia gives her son a high dose of her own medication to make him go to sleep so that she can rest.

norm: Expecting a child to behave unsupervised is foolish.
situation: Gina paints a wall and listens for an expected delivery while her young son, Tim, plays nearby.
intention: Gina wants to get her package.
moral_action: Gina hears the delivery man and returns with her package, she sees spilt paint everywhere and starts to clean up the mess while reassuring Tim.
immoral_action: Gina hears the delivery man and returns with her package, she sees spilt paint everywhere and beats Tim.

norm: It's rude to crush children's imaginations.
situation: Maggie's son is often writing wild stories in his spare time and his grades have dropped because of his avid imagination.
intention: Maggie wants her son to get better grades.
moral_action: Maggie supports her sons writing but tells him it's important to do better at school, which helps him get his grades higher.
immoral_action: Maggie demands that her son stop writing stories and get his grades higher, or he will be punished, which leads to her son getting better marks.

norm: It's wrong to be a brat.
situation: Sally's mother was talking to a friend that she saw when they were at the mall.
intention: Sally wants to ask her mother if she could go to the toy store.
moral_action: Sally waits until her mother's friend leaves and then asks her mother if they can go to the toy store.
immoral_action: Sally interrupts her mother several times during their conversation to ask about the toy store.

norm: It is insensitive to have preference toward biological children.
situation: Tina and her partner have reached the stage where they are ready to settle down.
intention: Tina wants to raise children.
moral_action: Tina convinces herself that there are many children who need to be adopted into good homes.
immoral_action: Tina considers some kids in foster care but prefers to give birth to her own.

norm: It is wrong to be a batterer.
situation: Karl's wife spent all their food money for the month.
intention: Karl wants to confront his wife.
moral_action: Karl tells his wife he has to sell of her possessions for food money.
immoral_action: Karl physically accosts his wife.

norm: It's wrong to neglect children.
situation: Luigi tries to think of what he needs to do today after work.
intention: Luigi wants to plan his day.
moral_action: Luigi remembers he needs to pick up his kids from school.
immoral_action: Luigi forgets that it's his day to pick up the kids, and he goes straight home.

norm: It's wrong to think your kid is possessed.
situation: Barry and Leah are discussing their son's latest problems at school when Leah asks Barry why he thinks the child is so unruly.
intention: Barry wants to answer Leah's question.
moral_action: Barry tells Leah that maybe they're feeding the kid too much sugar and need to alter his diet.
immoral_action: Barry tells Leah that it's quite obvious that the kid is possessed by demons and that he needs an exorcism.

norm: It's wrong to injure a small child
situation: Sam is trying to get his son to eat his vegetables, but he is throwing a temper tantrum.
intention: Sam wants his son to eat vegetables.
moral_action: Sam figures out a way to combine vegetables with food his son likes.
immoral_action: Sam hits his son with a belt for not eating his vegetables.

norm: It's wrong to pick on a fellow kid.
situation: Tommy is playing in the school yard and notices another child, Tim, struggling to climb up the jungle gym.
intention: Tommy wants to say something to Tim about his struggle.
moral_action: Tommy walks over to Tim and offers support, telling him that he just needs to trust himself and keep climbing, that he can do it if he believes he can.
immoral_action: Tommy yells at Tim, calling him weak and making fun of his struggle to climb the jungle gym.

norm: It is wrong to harm children
situation: Travis is having pizza with his nephew Brutus and notices Brutus reaching for the last piece.
intention: Travis wants more food.
moral_action: Travis asks Brutus if he minds splitting the pizza and cuts it in half with a knife.
immoral_action: Travis lunges for the slice knocking Brutus off his chair in the process.

norm: It's wrong to be mean to a child.
situation: Ken is at the grocery store with his son Liam who asks Ken to buy ice cream.
intention: Ken wants to respond to Liam's request.
moral_action: Ken tells Liam that he can't be eating too much sugar, so they'll have to get it next time.
immoral_action: Ken tells Liam that he's a gluttonous little monster who sucks money out of him like a vacuum, and he should shut it.

norm: It's wrong to get back at small children.
situation: Evelin is babysitting her friend's six year old daughter, Alissa, and Alissa throws a tantrum when Evelin refuses to buy her ice cream.
intention: Evelin wants to respond to Alissa's actions.
moral_action: Evelin explains to Alissa that her mom has a tasty dinner planned for her in an hour, and she can have ice cream afterwards.
immoral_action: Evelin stops at the ice cream stand and buys an ice cream cone for herself and buys nothing for Alissa.

norm: It's wrong to leave a small child unsupervised.
situation: Billy is cooking and just now realized that he doesn't have any flour that he needs for dinner, he is currently watching his two year old son.
intention: Billy needs to go to the supermarket.
moral_action: Billy knocks on his neighbor's door and asks him to watch his kid for five minutes while he runs to the supermarket.
immoral_action: Billy tells his son he'll be right back and runs out to the supermarket.

norm: It's wrong to refuse to report child abuse.
situation: Sam is a teacher and a student comes to him, telling Sam that he is being abused and that he doesn't know what to do.
intention: Sam wants to avoid making the situation worse.
moral_action: Sam contacts his supervisor and reports the abuse that the student told him about.
immoral_action: Sam gives the student some general advice about what to do and lets the issue drop.

norm: It is wrong to resent a child.
situation: Johnson owns his house and a neighborhood kid Frankie has been playing and making loud noise on his front lawn.
intention: Johnson wants to keep his front lawn quiet.
moral_action: Johnson asks Frankie if he can play a bit quieter because he has to sleep.
immoral_action: Johnson tells Frankie never to play on his lawn again or be seen at all.

norm: It's wrong to be abusive towards children
situation: Ted sees that his son has started to make bad grades on his report card.
intention: Ted wants his son to make better grades.
moral_action: Ted encourages his son by taking him to a movie every time he does well on a test.
immoral_action: Ted beats his son every time that he makes a bad grade on a test.

norm: It's wrong to act like a child.
situation: Doug makes a business proposal at work that is turned down by his boss.
intention: Doug wants to respond to the rejection of his proposal.
moral_action: Doug restructures his proposal based on the feedback from his boss.
immoral_action: Doug throws objects around his office then lays on the floor and cries.

norm: It is wrong to perform pranks on unsuspecting people.
situation: Jon has thought of a creative prank inspired by a youtube video he watched.
intention: Jon wants to use the prank on someone.
moral_action: Jon invites Jenny to pull the prank on their friend Tim who is always engaging in this kind of behavior.
immoral_action: Jon pranks his friend Jenny, who would never expect such a thing.

norm: It's wrong to pressure others to have children.
situation: Alice wants grandchildren, and she notices her daughter reading through a book on parenting.
intention: Alice wants to be around children.
moral_action: Alice makes a post on facebook asking for a babysitting job.
immoral_action: Alice calls her daughter every day asking her when she plans on becoming a mother.

norm: It's especially wrong to hurt children.
situation: Gary's son Larry tells him that he broke Gary's expensive guitar because he was kicking a ball indoors which he was told not to do.
intention: Gary wants to punish Larry.
moral_action: Gary tells Larry that he was told not to kick a ball around inside and will be grounded for a month for this.
immoral_action: Gary slaps Larry across the face and shoves him to the ground as he yells obscenities at him.

norm: It is wrong to steal another person's child.
situation: Kelly is barren and is researching her options.
intention: Kelly wants a child to raise and love.
moral_action: Kelly goes through all the requirements to be able to adopt an orphan child and provide it love and a home.
immoral_action: Kelly decides the cheapest and fastest option is to find an unattended child in public to grab and take home.

norm: It is negligent to put children in danger.
situation: John is watching the neighbor's kids that are playing outside while their parents work.
intention: John needs to answer his phone.
moral_action: John answers the phone and tells the caller he'll have to get back to them because he is busy.
immoral_action: John goes inside to take the call.

norm: It's wrong for children to bully each other.
situation: Jamie is playing with his friends in a park when a smaller boy comes and sits next to him, his friends laugh about Jamie making friends with a smaller child.
intention: Jamie wants to get his friends to stop laughing at him.
moral_action: Jamie tells his friends it's not funny, and he can be friends with whoever he wants.
immoral_action: Jamie pushes the little boy off of the log they are sitting on and tells him that he doesn't want him around.

norm: It's wrong to say bad things about your kids.
situation: Stephanie's daughter has decided not to go to college, but become a tattoo artist instead.
intention: Stephanie wants to talk to her child about her career decision.
moral_action: Stephanie approaches Samantha and speaks to her about taking her time and carefully weighing her options.
immoral_action: Stephanie has a conversation with her daughter, Samantha, but gets angry and tells her daughter she is going to be a loser if she doesn't go to college.

norm: It's wrong for kids to lie to their parents.
situation: Lara is invited to a party with older kids.
intention: Lara wants to go to the party.
moral_action: Lara asks to go to the party and promises to be responsible.
immoral_action: Lara tells her parents she is studying but goes to the party instead.

norm: It is wrong to support people that molest children.
situation: Mary is a citizen of her state.
intention: Mary wants to vote for a candidate for governor.
moral_action: Mary votes for a man who isn't her favorite but doesn't have a criminal record.
immoral_action: Mary votes for a man convicted of molesting children.

norm: Its wrong to subject you children to violence early on
situation: Jack has the day off and is spending it with his young son Ryan.
intention: Jack wants to see a movie at the theater.
moral_action: Jack buys tickets to the G-rated movie Finding Nemo.
immoral_action: Jack buys tickets to the R-rated movie Rambo.

norm: It's wrong for children to show disrespect to their parents.
situation: Molly is being corrected by her mother for staying out too late.
intention: Molly wants to explain why she was out so late.
moral_action: Molly calmly tells her mother that her car had a flat tire.
immoral_action: Molly yells at her mother and storms off in front of her friends.

norm: It's wrong to get rid of your child's toys.
situation: John is doing some spring cleaning around the house.
intention: John wants to get rid of unnecessary items.
moral_action: John removes some old clutter from the basement.
immoral_action: John throws away most of his child's toys.

norm: It's immoral to abandon your children.
situation: Mary, a single mother, has recently gotten into a serious relationship with a wealthy man.
intention: Mary wants to get married.
moral_action: Mary makes sure her boyfriend and her kids get to know each other in comfortable setting.
immoral_action: Mary leaves her kids with her parents in order to be free to pursue her relationship.

norm: It is wrong to say bad things around children.
situation: Tony is in the kitchen with his wife and young children one morning.
intention: Tony wants to tell his wife something bad that children should not hear.
moral_action: Tony takes his wife to another room and tells her what he wanted to say in private.
immoral_action: Tony blurts out what he wanted to say to his wife in front of his children.

norm: It's wrong to beat your kids.
situation: Martin is at the store with his crying five year old son Jackson.
intention: Martin wants to calm down his son.
moral_action: Martin hugs his son offering to buy him a cool toy.
immoral_action: Martin wacks his son's arm and threatens to do more if he doesn't stop crying.

norm: It's wrong to let your child be a bully.
situation: Bob sees his son pick on and bully a classmate.
intention: Bob wants to talk to his son about his behavior.
moral_action: Bob admonishes his son that he must not bully people and to be more kind.
immoral_action: Bob tells his son that it's okay to pick on his classmate because it will make his classmate tougher.

norm: It is wrong to make out with your children.
situation: Jasmine is reading a book when her drunk son starts flirting with her.
intention: Jasmine doesn't want to hurt her son.
moral_action: Jasmine recites lines from her son's favorite comedian and tells him to sleep.
immoral_action: Jasmine returns her son's flirty behavior kissing him.

norm: It's wrong to drug your children without their knowledge.
situation: Tammy put her son to bed an hour ago, but he is still awake making noises.
intention: Tammy wants her son to fall asleep.
moral_action: Tammy goes in to her sons room and reads him a couple of bedtime stories.
immoral_action: Tammy serves her son a glass of juice with sleeping medication in it.

norm: It's wrong to play favorites with your kids.
situation: Jill was upset because her presents were never as good as her brother Jack's.
intention: Jill wants to talk to her parents about it.
moral_action: Her parents point out that most of Jill's things were bought new but Jack's were mostly used.
immoral_action: Her parents admit to it and point out that Jack didn't turn out well, so they wanted to raise her differently.

norm: It's wrong to deceive your children.
situation: Julie's son needs to visit the dentist, but he hates going to the dentist.
intention: Julie wants to drive her son to the dentist.
moral_action: Julie tells her son that he must go to the dentist even though he doesn't want to, and they drive there.
immoral_action: Julie tells her son that they are driving to get ice-cream but actually takes him to the dentist's office.

norm: It's wrong for parents to abuse their children.
situation: Mary's child steals a hairbrush from Mary and Mary gets upset.
intention: Mary wants to discipline her child for stealing.
moral_action: Mary decides to tell her daughter to go to her room, without abusing her.
immoral_action: Mary decides to beat her child hard with the stolen hairbrush.

norm: It's wrong for parents to mistreat their kids.
situation: Hank was upset with his son Bobby for his report card.
intention: Hank wants Bobby to learn something.
moral_action: Hank decides to get Bobby a tutor for school and make him study.
immoral_action: Hank locks Bobby in his room until his grades improve.

norm: It's wrong to mistreat your children.
situation: Joanne is picking up her screaming son from school.
intention: Joanne wants to make her son stop screaming.
moral_action: Joanne hugs her son offering to pick up some ice cream on the way home.
immoral_action: Joanne smacks him hard on the wrist with a ruler in the car.

norm: It's wrong to spoil your kids.
