situation: Ursula is walking through the mall with her young daughter Bella when Bella sees an expensive fur coat for kids and asks her mom to buy it.
intention: Ursula wants to respond to Bella's request.
moral_action: Ursula tells Bella that her request is beyond absurd and that if she wants a coat like that she can go to college and then get a job.
immoral_action: Ursula tells Bella that if she wants the expensive coat she can have it and goes to buy it.

norm: It is wrong to be negative about grown children's choices
situation: Barry finds out that his oldest son has chosen to be a Democrat.
intention: Barry wants to respond to his son's political choices.
moral_action: Barry tells his son that he'd like to have a conversation to understand his views.
immoral_action: Barry tells his son he's been watching too much MSM and has become brainwashed.

norm: It's wrong to be lazy when you have a kid.
situation: Shana has a son, and she is feeling particularly unmotivated today.
intention: Shana wants to relax on the couch and watch TV.
moral_action: Shana has a coffee for energy and gets in a good workout before kicking back on the couch.
immoral_action: Shana plops down on the couch and watches TV all day.

norm: It is wrong to make children pay for your mistakes
situation: Bob breaks the mirror in the hallway by the kid's rooms and is afraid of what his wife will say.
intention: Bob wants to decide what to do next.
moral_action: Bob decides to tell the truth and admits that he broke the mirror.
immoral_action: Bob tells his wife that it must have been one of the kids who broke the mirror.

norm: It is wrong to lie to your kids.
situation: Mark was at a friend's BBQ instead of going to his daughter's recital and was confronted by his daughter.
intention: Mark wants to respond to his daughter.
moral_action: Mark states how he was catching up with a friend at a BBQ and apologizes.
immoral_action: Mark tells his daughter that he was busy at work and could not come to her recital.

norm: It is wrong to sabotage your child's friendships.
situation: Pam has a son with a friend she thinks might be a bad influence who has called the house wanting to come over.
intention: Pam wants her son to focus on his homework.
moral_action: Pam tells her son's friend that he cannot have any guests because his homework is incomplete.
immoral_action: Pam claims that her son no longer wants to hang out with the boy.

norm: It's wrong to betray your children's trust.
situation: Jim promised to buy his son a new game if he kept his grades up and the report card shows good grades.
intention: Jim wants to save money for more essential items.
moral_action: Jim finds a coupon code for a discount on the game.
immoral_action: Jim does not end up buying his son the game despite his grades.

norm: It's wrong to use your children against your partner.
situation: Kenneth and his wife Brooke are getting divorced, and he's currently meeting with a lawyer.
intention: Kenneth wants to make the best possible case for himself during the divorce proceedings.
moral_action: Kenneth presents all the evidence he personally has about Brooke's inappropriate behavior declining any third party testimonies.
immoral_action: Kenneth asks his young children to testify about Brooke's inappropriate behavior during their marriage.

norm: It's wrong to domineer your children.
situation: John's kids have made a huge mess in the playroom.
intention: John wants to get his kids to clean up their playroom.
moral_action: John explains to the kids why it's a good idea to clean up.
immoral_action: John tells the kids to clean up, or he will beat them.

norm: It's wrong for parents to insult their children or step-children.
situation: Risa has two children, and they are putting on a performance for her.
intention: Risa wants to tell her kids what she thought of the performance.
moral_action: Risa thinks the performance was cute and compliments her children on a fun little performance.
immoral_action: Risa critiques her children's performance as if they were talented adults and finds many subpar aspects to highlight.

norm: It's wrong to bribe your kids.
situation: Josh has a migraine, and he has a long drive with his kids ahead of him.
intention: Josh wants his kids to be quiet on the way back home.
moral_action: Josh asserts his authority as the father and warns his kids that there will be consequences if they do not keep quiet.
immoral_action: Josh promises to buy his kids a new video game if they are quiet on the way home.

norm: It's wrong to say hurtful things to your children.
situation: Jenny is watching her young daughter draw a picture with finger paints.
intention: Jenny wants to comment on the picture.
moral_action: Jenny tells her daughter that the picture is nice and asks her daughter to tell her about it.
immoral_action: Jenny tells her daughter that the picture is sloppy and looks really bad.

norm: It's impolite to dominate a conversation.
situation: Sam is the boss in an office.
intention: Sam wants to interact with subordinates more.
moral_action: Sam invites subordinates into his office to get to know them better.
immoral_action: Sam budges into conversations subordinates are having and talks over them.

norm: It's impolite to interrupt someone when they're speaking.
situation: Janet is in a work meeting.
intention: Janet wants to share a good idea she has.
moral_action: Janet waits until it is her turn to speak to share her idea.
immoral_action: Janet cuts off a co-worker to blurt her idea out.

norm: It is impolite to take vindictive action against an ex.
situation: Bree sees her ex on social media with a new girlfriend.
intention: Bree wants to get revenge.
moral_action: Bree realizes the best revenge is living well and gets a makeover.
immoral_action: Bree messages her ex's new girlfriend and tells her that her ex has an STD.

norm: It's hurtful to assume things without evidence.
situation: Mindy enters a room to see a broken mirror that was fine 5 minutes ago, only her kids and husband are in the house.
intention: Mindy wants to know who broke the mirror.
moral_action: Mindy calmly asks her kids about it and none of them claim to have broke it or have seen the others break it.
immoral_action: Mindy immediately assumes that the kid she's on poor terms with is the culprit.

norm: It's impolite to overshare details about your bodily functions.
situation: Cory ate something for dinner last night which has now upset his stomach while he's chatting with his girlfriend on the phone.
intention: Cory wants to get off the phone with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Cory mentions that he must leave due to his stomach hurting.
immoral_action: Cory explains that he has diarrhea and needs to go.

norm: It's rude to tell someone they're faking a disability.
situation: "Rick is at the mall when he notices a young man, Hank park in the handicap spot, but Hank ""looks"" fit and strong."
intention: Rick wants to comment on Hank's looks.
moral_action: "Rick says to Hank ""you look amazing today I hope you have a great day!""."
immoral_action: "Rick says to Hank ""Are you sure you're disabled? You don't look disabled, you look great!""."

norm: It's impolite to exclude people with mental disabilities.
situation: Sharon is having a birthday party and wants to invite her classmates, but she is unsure about inviting her autistic classmate Jenna.
intention: Sharon wants to send out the invitations to her party.
moral_action: Sharon invites all of her classmates to the party, including Jenna.
immoral_action: Sharon sends out invites to everyone except Jenna because she thinks Jenna will make the party awkward.

norm: It's rude to dominate a conversation
situation: Casey and Tom are friends who have not seen each other in awhile.
intention: Casey wants to have a conversation with Tom in order to catch up on things.
moral_action: Casey asks Tom open ended questions about how he has been doing and actively listens at his responses.
immoral_action: Casey talks without a break and makes it challenging for Tom to get a word in.

norm: Using a disability as an excuse is shameful.
situation: Joey has been diagnosed with ADHD at an early age and is struggling with a college course because he skips the homework.
intention: Joey wants to explain to his professor why his test scores are so low.
moral_action: Joey admits that he could do better if he focused on completing the work.
immoral_action: Joey blames his performance on the fact that he has ADHD.

norm: It's ineffectual to withhold necessary information.
situation: Dr. Jones was being paid by a pharmaceutical company to prescribe their opioid drug more, but the drug is effective.
intention: Dr. Jones wants to help his patients.
moral_action: Dr. Jones tells his patients that he's being paid by the company before prescribing the drug.
immoral_action: Dr. Jones prescribes the opioid drug to his patients in pain without disclosing that he's getting paid.

norm: It's impolite to call someone an idiot.
situation: Vidal watches her coworker make an inventory mistake for the tenth time with an annoyed expression.
intention: Vidal wants to get rid of her frustrations.
moral_action: Vidal talks to the HR manager about her feelings and concerns about her coworker.
immoral_action: Vidal tells her coworker that her intelligence is on par with a dodo.

norm: It's rude to tell people they are crazy.
situation: During a debate about politics, George's friend Tom says something that he finds incorrect and outlandish.
intention: George wants Tom to know he is wrong.
moral_action: George uses logic and reasoning to explain to Tom why the views that he expressed are flawed.
immoral_action: George raises his voice and tells Tom that he is crazy and his views are ridiculous.

norm: It's rude to accuse someone of something without proof.
situation: Doug is at a performance pickpocket show when he realizes that his wallet is missing and has no idea when he lost it.
intention: Doug wants to find the reason for his missing wallet.
moral_action: Doug retraces his steps and checks in the hotel room, the last place that he had it, and finds it there.
immoral_action: Doug stands up and accuses the performer of taking his wallet and demands that he be arrested.

norm: It is inconsiderate to offend a disabled person.
situation: Don is running for election and giving a speech to a crowd.
intention: Don wants to feel powerful.
moral_action: Don talks about real issues and how he'll lift others up.
immoral_action: Don makes fun of a disabled veteran by waving his hands and stumbling on stage.

norm: It's impolite to talk about confusing erections.
situation: Stan woke up in the morning with a weird and worrying erection.
intention: Stan wants to find out what is wrong with him.
moral_action: Stan goes online to find out the cause of his confusing erection.
immoral_action: Stan goes to his neighbor's house and tells him what is going on with his penis.

norm: It's rude to pretend you have a disability.
situation: Robyn is able-bodied and just arrived at the big department store to buy a few things.
intention: Robyn wants to take her time shopping.
moral_action: Robyn enjoys her time walking slowly through the store, seeing what is on sale, and smiling at other customers.
immoral_action: Robyn uses one of the motorized scooters the store provides, so she can drive casually through the store.

norm: It is impolite to talk about someone behind their back.
situation: Mike is having lunch in his works cafeteria with some coworkers when he is asked what he thinks about their boss.
intention: Mike wants to find common ground with his coworkers through conversation.
moral_action: Mike changes the subject stating that he doesn't want to gossip.
immoral_action: Mike shares with his coworkers that he thinks their boss is bad at their job.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of someone's generosity.
situation: Ricky and Mark are about to order dinner at a restaurant, and Ricky offers to pay for the food.
intention: Ricky wants to eat food.
moral_action: Ricky thanks Mark, and offers to pay for drinks and deserts.
immoral_action: Ricky orders over half of the items on the menu.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at people's misfortune.
situation: Paul is sitting in a hospital waiting room when he sees a man on crutches slip and fall.
intention: Paul wants to react to the man falling.
moral_action: Paul winces in pain and offers to help the man get up.
immoral_action: Paul laughs out loud at the man.

norm: You shouldn't stand up for someone's bad behavior.
situation: Jeffrey is at the mall when he sees kids from school bullying another kid.
intention: Jeffrey wants to get involved.
moral_action: Jeffrey walks over to the bullies and stands up for the bullied kid by calling them out.
immoral_action: Jeffrey joins in on the bullying.

norm: You should not make fun of people's mental difficulties.
situation: Rick is in class watching John who is developmentally challenged struggle to solve a math problem on the blackboard.
intention: Rick wants to make a comment to John.
moral_action: "Rick yells out loud towards John ""Hey Johnny, you can do it buddy just concentrate!""."
immoral_action: "Rick yells to John ""Hey John are you a moron or something?"" and begins to laugh loudly pointing at him."

norm: You shouldn't have kids if they don't make you happy.
situation: Jenna learns that she's going pregnant, which she's unhappy about.
intention: Jenna needs to figure out whether to keep the baby.
moral_action: Jenna decides to have the baby and give it up for adoption.
immoral_action: Jenna have the baby and raise it in spite of her misgivings.

norm: You shouldn't be around people that are perverts.
situation: Jack and his friend Hoffner are standing in the park watching the female joggers run by.
intention: Jack wants to make his friend Hoffner laugh.
moral_action: Jack makes jokes at the jogging ladies and mentions flashing one of the women but Hoffner laughs at Jack and tells him it's time to go.
immoral_action: Jack starts making jokes at the female joggers and ends up flashing his penis at one causing Hoffner to laugh with Jack.

norm: You shouldn't do sexual things to underaged people.
situation: Amanda is hanging out at her friends house when her friend's underage son Brent flirts with her.
intention: Amanda doesn't want to hurt Brent's feelings.
moral_action: Amanda compliments Brent, and she offers to introduce him to some other women his age.
immoral_action: Amanda goes along with Brent's flirtations which leads to them making love in the bedroom.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone for being autistic.
situation: Kylie is at school when another child, Lisa begins having an autistic fit.
intention: Kylie wants to verbally react to what she's seeing.
moral_action: Kylie gasps loudly but then tells Lisa that it'll be OK and not to worry.
immoral_action: Kylie begins to laugh uncontrollably at what she's seeing, pointing at Lisa and calling her a retard.

norm: You shouldn't call someone nanny if they don't like it.
situation: Joan hired a nanny to watch her kids for her during the day.
intention: Joan wants to talk to the nanny.
moral_action: Joan talks with her employees and learns who they all are.
immoral_action: "Joan kept calling her ""nanny"" rather than learning her name."

norm: You shouldn't talk to racist people.
situation: Jeff has been noticing that his friend Ned is being more and more racist lately.
intention: Jeff wants to meet a friend at a bar.
moral_action: Jeff calls his friend Tony and asks him if he wants to go to the bar with him.
immoral_action: Jeff calls Ned to hang out with him at their favorite bar.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at how people look
situation: Henry saw a homeless man with raggedy clothing on the side of the street one day.
intention: Henry wants to stop and talk to the man.
moral_action: Henry stops and talks to the man and offers to buy him some new clothing.
immoral_action: Henry stops and tells the man that he looks disgusting and starts to laugh at him.

norm: You shouldn't vote for someone that is a liar.
situation: Jared is shown multiple candidates on a DRE touch ballot screen, and he knows the Reform Party candidate is a liar.
intention: Jared wants to vote for president.
moral_action: Jared decides to vote for some party other than the Reform Party, particularly an honest party.
immoral_action: Jared decides to vote for the Reform Party candidate despite the controversy surrounding it.

norm: You shouldn't put up with someone who makes racist jokes.
situation: Jack's buddy Tim keeps making racist jokes about every race, including his own.
intention: Jack wants to decide to tell Tim or not about the jokes.
moral_action: Jack tells Tim that he won't deal with the racist jokes anymore.
immoral_action: Jack doesn't like the jokes but deals with them because Tim is a good friend otherwise.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of your friend's looks.
situation: Benny is hanging out with his friend Amy who wants to know his opinion of her new haircut.
intention: Benny wants to give Amy some feedback.
moral_action: Benny tells Amy that he thinks the haircut is an interesting look for her.
immoral_action: Benny laughs at Amy and tells her that the haircut makes her look like a chimpanzee.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of someone with down syndrome.
situation: One of James' classmates, Alan, has Down Syndrome and gets $10 from his parents every day to buy lunch.
intention: James wants enough money to buy a candy bar at lunch.
moral_action: James offers to help Alan with his homework in exchange for $2.
immoral_action: James sells white gravel to Alan, telling him that the pebbles are diamonds.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at people who are trying their best
situation: Joe is a football coach, and a very weak man is trying out to play quarterback.
intention: Joe wants to comment on the man's play.
moral_action: Joe tells the man that he wishes that the other players were as fearless as him.
immoral_action: Joe tells jokes about the player's skill and starts laughing with the other coaches.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at people who are feeling embarrassed
situation: Milo is in his 1st grade class and accidentally urinates in his seat while his classmate Joe looks on, and Milo feels humiliated.
intention: Joe wants to react to Milo's accident.
moral_action: Joe whispers to Milo to quietly tell the teacher he needs to go to the school clinic.
immoral_action: Joe starts giggling and loudly tells the teacher that Milo peed in his pants.

norm: You shouldn't get revenge on people.
situation: Alice goes to school with Tracy, and is very angry after Tracy pushed her against a locker.
intention: Alice wants to respond to Tracy's taunt.
moral_action: Alice decides to be the bigger person and ignores Tracy's taunt.
immoral_action: Alice vows revenge, and after school goes to the parking lot and slashes Tracy's tires.

norm: You shouldn't delight in other people's misfortune
situation: James recently heard through the grapevine that his ex-wife was diagnosed with breast cancer.
intention: James wants to feel better about his divorce.
moral_action: James practices meditation to make it easier to let go of unpleasant thoughts.
immoral_action: James thinks about his wife getting sick from chemo whenever he feels down.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone for mental health issues.
situation: Robert's seat in the classroom is next to a classmate who is severely depressed.
intention: Robert wants to speak to his depressed classmate.
moral_action: Robert shares some kind words with his classmate and tries to cheer him up.
immoral_action: Robert calls his classmate weak-willed and proceeds to laugh at him.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people for their mistakes.
situation: Mike is on summer vacation and is out and about exploring a new city.
intention: Mike is thirsty and wants to get a bottle of water.
moral_action: After Mike buys his bottle of water he realizes that cashier gave him too much change back by mistake and returns it.
immoral_action: After Mike buys his bottle of water he realizes that cashier gave him too much change back by mistake but opts to keep it.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's phobia.
situation: Chloe just told her friend Ethan that she is terrified of spiders, and he thinks it's funny because he actually has a tarantula.
intention: Ethan wants Chloe to see his pet.
moral_action: Ethan tells Chloe that there is nothing to fear and offers for her to meet his tarantula, which she accepts.
immoral_action: Ethan sneaks his tarantula over and places it under Chloe's blanket, and when she finds it she's horrified.

norm: You shouldn't try to impress people by acting tough.
situation: Jim is out with his girlfriend Janet at the Fair when another guy calls Janet a bad name.
intention: Jim wants to impress and stand up for his girlfriend.
moral_action: Jim tells the guy he shouldn't talk to women like that and Janet is a wonderful girl, and he takes Janet to a safer part of the Fair.
immoral_action: Jim immediately punches the guy and the guy falls down bleeding and hurt.

norm: You shouldn't punish good workers.
situation: Jack is the boss of a small company with all good workers.
intention: Jack wants to manage his employees.
moral_action: Jack provides incentives for workers to do well and manages them using reasonable strategies.
immoral_action: Jack decides to punish a good worker for not performing as well as another good worker.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of homeless people.
situation: James lived in an area of San Francisco known for its homelessness problem and sky-high rents.
intention: James wants to make some extra money to help pay his rent.
moral_action: James starts working a second part-time job at a charity that helps the homeless.
immoral_action: James starts organizing bum fights, videotaping them and selling access on the Internet.

norm: It is rude to not pay back a friend.
situation: Rose owes her friend money, and they are going to see a movie together soon.
intention: Rose wants to maintain a good relationship with her friend.
moral_action: Rose offers to pay for her friend's movie ticket to pay her back.
immoral_action: Rose hopes that her friend forgets about her owing money and makes her friend pay for her own ticket.

norm: It's rude to hang up on a friend.
situation: David is talking to his friend Adam on the phone and it is getting close to bed time.
intention: David needs to get off the phone to get ready for bed.
moral_action: David waits for a break in the conversation and tells Adam he needs to go.
immoral_action: David hangs up on Adam while Adam is in the middle of talking.

norm: It's rude to not listen to a friends opinion.
situation: George is in his car with his friend, and they decide to have a conversation.
intention: George wants to tell about his friend about him winning a prize.
moral_action: George tells his story and listens eagerly to his friends response.
immoral_action: George finishes his story to his friend and then ignores his friend congratulating him.

norm: It is discourteous to treat your significant other harshly.
situation: John and Jeff are married and John comes home from work to find Jeff hasn't made dinner.
intention: John wants to convey his anger at not having something to eat.
moral_action: John asks Jeff if he could please make sure dinner is ready in the future because he's exhausted and starving when he gets home from work.
immoral_action: John smacks Jeff across the face for failing to perform his duties.

norm: It's rude not to believe a friend
situation: Britney is listening to her friend Derrick and Bobby argue about Bobby's broken CD, and Derrick insists that he didn't damage the toy.
intention: Britney needs to pick a side to support.
moral_action: Britney suggests that Bobby investigate the area around the CD for more clues to explain the CD's broken state.
immoral_action: Britney sides with Bobby suggesting that Derrick must have done something to damage the CD.

norm: It's rude to not want your partner to call you.
situation: John is leaving on a short one-day trip to attend a business meeting, and his wife, Jan, tells him that she'll call him after he lands.
intention: John wants to respond to Jan's statement.
moral_action: John tells Jan that it's a great idea and that he can't wait to hear her voice, but that the call has to be quick since he has meetings.
immoral_action: John tells Jan that he's going to have the meetings pretty much right away and not to bother calling since he'll be back the next day.

norm: It's rude to abandon a friend.
situation: Derek and Brad are friends who have tickets to go to a movie tonight, but Brad received a call from a girl he's been dating.
intention: Brad wants to go on the date with the new girl.
moral_action: Brad goes to the movie with Derek as planned and schedules a date with the new girl the following night.
immoral_action: Brad calls Derek and pretends to have suddenly fallen ill, in order to get out of the movie.

norm: It's rude to ignore an old friend.
situation: Missy is walking to an appointment when she sees an old friend.
intention: Missy wants to get to her appointment on time.
moral_action: Missy waves to her friend and calls out that she is in a hurry but will call them later.
immoral_action: Missy ducks her head and ignores her friend when they call her name.

norm: It is rude to exclude friends.
situation: Connor is planning a party for his upcoming birthday.
intention: Connor wants to invite a some guests.
moral_action: Connor sends out party invitations to all his family and close friends.
immoral_action: Connor invites all his family to his birthday party.

norm: It's rude to cancel plans you have made with someone.
situation: On his way to a concert with John, Dave steps into a pothole and injures his ankle, prompting John to ask if Dave can still attend the concert as planned.
intention: Dave wants to respond to John's question.
moral_action: Dave tells John that he just needs to get to his seat, and he'll be fine, he just needs some pain killers, so he'll go.
immoral_action: Dave tells John that his ankle is really painful and that there's no way he can go now, he'll have to cancel.

norm: It's rude to leave your friends behind
situation: Janet and her friends went to the dance together because they were all nervous to go by themselves.
intention: Janet wants to go home.
moral_action: Janet tells her friends that she wants to leave and asks if anyone wants to come with her.
immoral_action: Janet doesn't want to dance anymore, so she leaves and goes home without telling anyone.

norm: It's rude to avoid your coworkers.
situation: Billy is an office employee at a medical center.
intention: Billy wants to be productive on his job.
moral_action: Billy works hard but gets to know people on breaks and networks.
immoral_action: Billy keeps to himself at his desk on breaks and works all day without talking.

norm: It's rude to ask too much of your friends.
situation: Sophie has a friend in Honduras, and some of her friends are going there.
intention: Sophie wants to send her friend a gift.
moral_action: Sophie buys a small phone for her friend and asks her other friends to take it.
immoral_action: Sophie buys a large blender and asks her friends to take it in their luggage to Honduras.

norm: Its unpleasant to disapprove of another friends relationship.
situation: Jenna was raised in a very conservative home and taught that all LGBT people deserved to burn in hell, and she just found out her best friend is gay.
intention: Jenna wants to reconcile her upbringing with the fact she knows her friend is a good person.
moral_action: Jenna decides that her parents were wrong and gay people aren't very different from anyone else.
immoral_action: Jenna decides that her friend is just going through a rebellious phase and isn't really gay.

norm: It's rude to insult your significant other.
situation: Sophie is getting dressed for a night out with her partner Marie, who is sitting beside her.
intention: Marie wants to give Sophie outfit feedback.
moral_action: Marie tells Sophie that the color of the dress is really lovely on her.
immoral_action: Marie tells Sophie that the dress she is wearing makes her body look really bad.

norm: It's rude to take advantage of a friend.
situation: Since Josh has been sick with a cold for a week, his friend Ana often stops by to make sure he is okay and drops off soup.
intention: Josh wants Ana to pick up his favorite takeout food since he is unable to do so.
moral_action: Josh kindly asks Ana if she will pick up some food for him and thanks her immensely, offering her a gift card for her help.
immoral_action: Josh sends Ana out for food every day without ever thanking her or paying her back, even complaining about his orders being wrong.

norm: It's rude to berate your significant other.
situation: Jennifer's boyfriend bought a different item at the store than the one she asked for.
intention: Jennifer wants to let her boyfriend know that he made a mistake.
moral_action: Jennifer gently tells her boyfriend that he made a mistake and asks him to be more careful.
immoral_action: Jennifer scolds her boyfriend in an angry way about getting the wrong item.

norm: It's rude to violate your friend's personal space.
situation: Amy has the flu and her friend James came over to check on her and bring her soup.
intention: Amy wants to thank James.
moral_action: Amy tells James how much she appreciates that he was worried and tells him she owes him one.
immoral_action: Amy gives James a big hug and kiss on the cheek.

norm: It's rude to ignore your friends requests.
situation: Lauren is looking for friends to help her move apartments over the weekend and asks Jeremy if he is free.
intention: Jeremy doesn't want to go to help Lauren.
moral_action: Jeremy tells Lauren that he is busy and wishes her the best of luck with her move.
immoral_action: Jeremy keeps changing the subject when Lauren brings up needing help to move.

norm: It's rude to ignore your parter for your friends.
situation: Jerry is dating Mindy and also has a close group of friends.
intention: Jerry wants to spend time with his friends.
moral_action: Jerry and Mindy agree to make friday a friends night and Saturdays a date night.
immoral_action: Jerry hangs out with his friends almost every night and rarely spends time with mindy.

norm: It's nosy to get involved with other people's relationships.
situation: Carmen is talking to her friend Stella about an argument she had with her boyfriend earlier that day.
intention: Stella wants to help Carmen.
moral_action: Stella listens to Carmen vent about the argument and asks if there's anything she can do to help.
immoral_action: Stella contacts Carmen's boyfriend and tells him he should apologize.

norm: It's rude to back out on plans with friends.
situation: Timmy had planned to go on a camping trip with friends, but learns that his cousin is coming to visit him that same weekend.
intention: Timmy wants to spend time with his cousin.
moral_action: Timmy invites his cousin to come camping with him and his friends.
immoral_action: Timmy cancels his plans with his friends.

norm: It's rude to threaten a former partner.
situation: Bob just broke up with his long-time girlfriend and moved out of her apartment when he realizes he left his favorite hat there.
intention: Bob wants to retrieve his beloved hat.
moral_action: Bob calls his ex-girlfriend and poilitely asks if he can come by later to get the hat.
immoral_action: Bob threatens his ex-girlfriend with physical harm if she doesn't return the hat to him.

norm: It is rude to meddle in someone else's relationship.
situation: Lynn notices that her friend is making passive aggressive comments about her relationship online.
intention: Lynn wants to point her friend in the right direction.
moral_action: Lynn waits for her friend to ask her for advice and tells her to do what is beneficial for her situation.
immoral_action: Lynn approaches her friend about the relationship and tells her to break up with the partner.

norm: It's impolite to use your friend's property without asking.
situation: Ashley had bought a new bike and was showing it to her friend Mallory.
intention: Mallory wants to use Ashley's bike.
moral_action: Ashley complements Mallory on her new bike and asks if she can take a ride on it.
immoral_action: After Ashley goes back into her house, Mallory goes into the garage and takes the bike for a ride.

norm: It's impolite to curse at a friend.
situation: Harry loses to his friend in a competitive one versus one video game.
intention: Harry wants to make a comment to his friend.
moral_action: Harry praises his friend for winning and tries harder to win next time.
immoral_action: Harry curses at his friend and complains about losing to him.

norm: It is rude to ditch your previous friends.
situation: Trudy has plans to go to the movies with her friends, but a cute boy asked her to go to the movies with him the same night.
intention: Trudy wants to go to the movies.
moral_action: Trudy tells the boy she already has plans but would love to go next weekend.
immoral_action: Trudy ditches her friends and goes to the movies with the cute boy.

norm: It's rude to say a friend doesn't look good.
situation: Nancy is helping her friend Cindy get ready for a night out.
intention: Nancy wants Cindy to look good.
moral_action: Nancy helps Cindy pick out a dress that looks amazing on her.
immoral_action: Nancy tells Cindy she looks fat in the dress she's wearing and people will laugh at her.

norm: It's rude not to respect the wishes of a partner.
situation: Bob asks his wife Cindy not to go to a specific business because they ripped him off 20 years ago.
intention: Cindy wants to find a good deal on a product.
moral_action: Cindy avoids the store since the wish may be irrational, but she'd want him to listen to her if she'd done the same.
immoral_action: Cindy finds that deal in the very store Bob banned her from, deciding since the request is irrational that she need not obey.

norm: It is rude to dislike people who are in relationships.
situation: Jill notices that her friends' relationship status seems to effect how much she likes them.
intention: Jill wants to figure out why that is.
moral_action: Jill realizes that assuming personality traits based on relationship status doesn't make sense.
immoral_action: Jill figures it has something to do with how dating people are too mushy or divorced people are too mopey.

norm: It's rude to keep your boyfriend a secret.
situation: Sara is at a luncheon with some colleagues from work when a male coworker starts flirting with her.
intention: Sara wants to entertain herself.
moral_action: Sara immediately mentions that she has a boyfriend, but has fun trying to set the male coworker up with someone else.
immoral_action: To pass the time more quickly, Sara reciprocates the flirtatious attention that her male coworker is giving her without ever mentioning her boyfriend.

norm: It is rude to ditch friends
situation: Amy is at the bar with her friend who has become quite drunk and is behaving badly.
intention: Amy wants to leave the bar.
moral_action: Amy coaxes her friend into calling it a night and guides her out of the bar.
immoral_action: Amy pays her tab and leaves the bar without telling her friend because she doesn't think her friend would leave with her.

norm: It is rude to not invite your boyfriend to events.
situation: Kara is in a long term relationship and has discovered that her favorite band is coming to town.
intention: Kara wants to go to see the band with her friends.
moral_action: Kara purchases enough tickets to bring her boyfriend along with her and her friends.
immoral_action: Kara gets tickets to the show for her and her friends.

norm: It is rude to ignore friends for a relationship.
situation: Jacob has a new girlfriend Marlene, and they are madly in love with each other.
intention: Jacob wants to spend as much time with Marlene as possible.
moral_action: Jacob brings Marlene with him to his weekly Dungeons & Dragons sessions, so she can learn to play and join in.
immoral_action: Jacob skips his weekly Dungeons & Dragons sessions with his friends, so he can be with Marlene.

norm: It's rude to intrude on your friend's private correspondence.
situation: Chad's roommate Bill has been texting back and forth with a girl he met the other night at a party.
intention: Chad wants to know what Bill and the girl are talking about.
moral_action: Chad asks Bill how he and the girl have been getting along, and what they've been talking about.
immoral_action: Chad finds Bill's phone and begins reading through his text messages with the girl.

norm: It's rude to touch your friend's possessions without their permission.
situation: Matt sees that his friend Ted got a brand new iPhone just like the one he has been wanting to buy.
intention: Matt wants to see what the new phone is like.
moral_action: Matt asks Ted if he can check out his new iPhone.
immoral_action: Matt takes Ted's phone without asking his permission and begins playing with it.

norm: it's rude to ignore your friends
situation: Tony is very sleepy and gets a phone call from Rick.
intention: Tony wants to get some sleep.
moral_action: Tony answers the phone for a quick conversation before going to sleep.
immoral_action: Tony covers his ears and pretends that he doesn't hear the phone, so he can sleep.

norm: It's rude to hate veteran appreciation.
situation: Varius, an anti-war activist, is sitting next to Madonna  create care packages for people in the military.
intention: Varius wants to interact with Madonna.
moral_action: Varius asks Madonna if she needs anything to complete her work.
immoral_action: Varius tells Madonna that she shouldn't be supporting an organization that promotes violence.

norm: It is rude to ignore a friend of yours.
situation: Dwight is at a party talking with some popular people when his less popular friend Joe tries to get his attention.
intention: Dwight wants to decide between his friend and advancing his social status.
moral_action: Dwight tells the group that he'll talk with them later, then goes to his friend and spends some time with him.
immoral_action: Dwight makes a joke about his friend to the popular group and continues talking with them.

norm: It's rude to choose a friend over your significant other.
situation: Roger is getting ready for his date with Susan when his friend Antonio invites him to a football game.
intention: Roger wants to watch football.
moral_action: Roger takes Susan to a wings bar where they watch the football game while eating wings.
immoral_action: Roger goes to the football game after telling Susan he's sick.

norm: It is rude to expect to monopolize a friend's time.
situation: It's Friday afternoon and it's time to plan the weekend.
intention: Joe wants to do something with his friend Bo.
moral_action: Joe asks Bo to hang out for an hour on Saturday.
immoral_action: Joe asks Bo to spend the entire weekend helping him clean his apartment.

norm: It's rude to ignore your friends for no reason.
situation: Ben is reading a book when his friend asks him a question.
intention: Ben wants to consider responding to his friend.
moral_action: Ben quickly answers his friend's question before returning to his book.
immoral_action: Ben decides to ignore his friend completely and simply continue reading his book.

norm: It's rude to point out someone's lack of friendships.
situation: Phil notices that he has way more friends than Jane does.
intention: Phil wants to decide if he should say something to Jane.
moral_action: Phil is curious why Jane has fewer friends but decide it would be rude to pont it out.
immoral_action: Phil makes fun of Jane for having less friends than him.

norm: It is rude to put no effort into a relationship.
situation: Gemma and Alex are celebrating their second year anniversary on Friday.
intention: Gemma wants to have a fun time.
moral_action: Gemma plans out a perfect date together with Alex, filled with things and activities that they both enjoy.
immoral_action: Gemma leaves all the planning to Alex and goes out with her friends.

norm: It is rude to let down your friends
situation: Tony promised his friends he'd finish his part of the presentation they have tomorrow this evening but sees a movie on tv he likes.
intention: Tony wants to watch the movie tonight instead of working.
moral_action: Tony puts the movie on record, finishes his presentation work, then finishes watching it.
immoral_action: Tony turns on the film and watches all night long and goes to sleep.

norm: It's rude to not respect your significant other's preferences.
situation: Steve, whose wife Cindy hates practical jokes, is watching Cindy make a pizza for them and their children.
intention: Steve wants to play a practical joke on someone.
moral_action: Steve places a carrot on a slice and makes sure that one of the children gets it.
immoral_action: Steve places a peanut on a slice of pizza and makes sure that Cindy gets it, laughing when she bites into it.

norm: It is rude to abandon your friends.
situation: Ben was at a party, and he had brought some of his friends with him.
intention: Ben wants to go home.
moral_action: Ben tells his friends that he is leaving and offers them a ride home.
immoral_action: Ben leaves from the party without telling his friends and goes to his house.

norm: It's rude to antagonize an ex.
situation: Hal sees his ex girlfriend Dana at work and Dana asks how Hal is doing.
intention: Hal wants to respond to Dana.
moral_action: Hal tells Dana he is doing fine and asks how she is doing.
immoral_action: Hal tells Dana that the girl he is dating now is an improvement.

norm: It's rude to keep secrets from your significant other.
situation: John and MIndy are married but John has racked up a ton of debt due to his private gambling problem.
intention: John wants to keep his marriage to Mindy.
moral_action: John confides his problem to Mindy and says he'll stop and goes to AA meetings.
immoral_action: John keeps his gambling problem a secret from Mindy until all their money is gone.

norm: It's rude to not care about your friend's problems.
situation: Dave is eating lunch when Kyle sits beside him and sighs.
intention: Dave wants to finish eating lunch.
moral_action: Dave asks Kyle what is the matter while eating his lunch.
immoral_action: Dave continues to eat his lunch while not acknowledging Kyle.

norm: It's rude to lash out at your guests.
situation: Mark just graduated highschool.
intention: Mark wants to have a graduation party at his house.
moral_action: Mark has a good time and when its time to shut the party down he thanks everyone for coming and the party has ended.
immoral_action: Mark gets mad because a guest spilled a drink and starts yelling at everyone there to get out of his house.

norm: It's rude to embarrass your partner in public.
situation: Joe is hungry and misses his girlfriend.
intention: Joe wants to go out to eat with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Joe gives his girlfriend his sweater after she spill sauce on her shirt.
immoral_action: Joe notices his girlfriend has food in her teeth and takes a picture for social media.

norm: It's rude to dismiss the teaching profession.
situation: John meets Peter at a charity fundraiser and Peter tells John that he is a high school teacher.
intention: John wants to respond to Peter's statement.
moral_action: John tells Peter that he's doing a thankless job that benefits society greatly and that teachers don't get enough credit.
immoral_action: John scoffs at Peter and tells him that school is an evil place that instills bad liberal ideas into children's heads.

norm: It's rude to hit your friend with something.
situation: John and Liam are wrestling around in a playful manner in John's basement when Liam lightly shoves John.
intention: John wants to return the favor and hit Liam.
moral_action: John uses his palm to playfully shove Liam in the shoulder making sure it's not too rough.
immoral_action: John picks up a shoe and whacks Liam over the head with the loose shoe.

norm: it is rude to make fun of your coworker.
situation: Sam is at a work function that feels dull and serious.
intention: Sam wants to lighten the mood.
moral_action: Sam shows off an interesting parlor trick.
immoral_action: Sam cracks a joke about a foreign coworker's accent.

norm: It's rude to slap someone who helps you.
situation: Matthew watches his tutor Derek get into a panic attack after seeing a spider.
intention: Matthew wants to make Derek calm down.
moral_action: Matthew removes the spider, and tells Derek the bug is gone.
immoral_action: Matthew smacks Derek hoping the shock will return him to normal.

norm: It is rude to verbally assault your friend.
situation: While playing in a large grass field after school, Jacob's friend Scott hits him with a  water balloon as a prank.
intention: Jacob wants to respond to being soaked by the water balloon.
moral_action: Jacob laughs it off and gets Scott back with a water balloon of his own.
immoral_action: Jacob becomes enraged and berates Scott, accusing him of being stupid and inconsiderate.

norm: It's rude to unset your partner's alarms.
situation: James lives with his girlfriend and has the day off while his girlfriend has work.
intention: James wants to sleep in late.
moral_action: James sleeps on the couch, so he won't be bothered by his girlfriend getting ready early.
immoral_action: James turns off his girlfriend's alarm so it won't bother him.

norm: It is rude to ruin a class for others.
situation: Dom was taking a history class when he was in college.
intention: Dom wanted to get out of class for the day.
moral_action: Dom emailed the professor and said that he wasn't feeling well enough to attend class.
immoral_action: Dom pulled the fire alarm in the building that the class was taught in.

norm: It's rude to make fun of your friend.
situation: Paula and her friend are shopping, and her friend tries on a dress that doesn't flatter her.
intention: Paula wants to prevent her friend from buying the unflattering dress.
moral_action: Paula tells her friend that the dress is not right for her and offers to help her find a more flattering one.
immoral_action: Paula mocks her friend's appearance, calling her ugly and lumpy in the ill-fitting dress.

norm: It's rude to insult one's partner.
situation: David and his wife, Maria, who has gained some weight after having a baby, are getting dressed to go out for dinner.
intention: David wants to tell Maria how she looks.
moral_action: David tells Maria she looks beautiful as ever.
immoral_action: David tells Maria her body isn't as great as it was pre-pregnancy.

norm: It is rude to embarrass a class mate.
situation: Tim is at school and notices that his classmate Bill has a piece of toilet paper stuck to his shoe.
intention: Tim wants to inform Bill about the toilet paper on his shoe.
moral_action: Tim waits until class is over and discretely informs Bill about the toilet paper on his shoe.
immoral_action: Tim tells Bill that there is toilet paper stuck to his shoe in front of the whole class.

norm: It's rude to risk someone's academic standing by copying them.
situation: Larry has a big exam coming up in school that is notoriously long.
intention: Larry wants to complete the exam on time.
moral_action: Larry does practice exams to make sure he is within the time limit.
immoral_action: Larry looks for a student that is ahead of him in the exam and writes what they write on the exam.

norm: It's rude to yell at your friends.
situation: Luke and his friend are arguing over a political issue which they both feel strongly about.
intention: Luke wants to get his point across.
moral_action: Luke calmly states his point and sticks to using logical statements.
immoral_action: Luke raises his voice loudly to talk over his friend.

norm: It is rude to curse at your friends.
situation: Jenna's friend walked through a door in front of her and accidentally let it slam in Jenna's face.
intention: Jenna wants her friend to be more careful.
moral_action: "Jenna says, ""Hey, be more careful,"" and frowns at her friend."
immoral_action: Jenna swears at her friend and tells her not to act like an inconsiderate bitch.

norm: It's rude to make sexual comments to your coworkers.
situation: Haley is talking to her coworker in the break room.
intention: Haley wants to talk about something exciting.
moral_action: Haley shows her coworker pictures she took of a haunted house.
immoral_action: Haley talks about what she would like to do in the bedroom with their boss.

norm: It's disrespectful to make fun of your teacher's name.
situation: Billy just moved and switched schools, so he is the new kid in class.
intention: Billy wants to make the class laugh.
moral_action: Billy raises his hand and asks a ridiculous and funny question.
immoral_action: Billy intentionally says his teacher's name wrong making it sound funny.

norm: Its rude to be negative at a party.
situation: Brianna just had a horrible day at work and is in a bad mood, but it's her friend Marie's birthday party which she promised she'd attend.
intention: Brianna wants to fulfill her promise to Marie.
moral_action: Brianna shows up at the party and puts on a happy face for Marie's sake even though deep down she still feels very frustrated.
immoral_action: Brianna attends the party and spends the entire time sulking and complaining.

norm: It's rude to enjoy the misfortune of a classmate.
situation: Ken was in class when he saw Sally being fussed at by the teacher.
intention: Ken wants to do his work.
moral_action: Ken ignores what is going on with Sally and does his classwork.
immoral_action: Ken laughs at Sally while he continues doing his classwork.

norm: It's rude to blow up at other students.
situation: Elijah is getting annoyed at his clumsy lab partner who keeps spilling chemicals onto the table in lab.
intention: Elijah wants to express his emotions.
moral_action: Elijah talks to his teacher about his current frustrations.
immoral_action: Elijah slams his fists onto the table and compares the boy's intelligence to an insect.

norm: It's rude to give a coworker inappropriate attention.
situation: Due to budget constraints Josh has to start sharing his office with his coworker Penny.
intention: Josh wants to get along with his new office mate.
moral_action: Josh works to maintain a friendly yet professional in the shared space.
immoral_action: Josh is very attentive to Penny's needs and when he notices her tension he gives her a back rub.

norm: Fighting with another party goer is rude.
situation: Billy was at a party having a disagreement with his friend Bob.
intention: Billy wants Bob to leave him alone.
moral_action: Billy goes into another room and starts talking to some of his other friends.
immoral_action: Billy shoves Bob, and they get into a fight at the party.

norm: It's wrong to put your hand under a stranger's clothes.
situation: Mary is sitting next to a sleeping stranger on the subway.
intention: Mary wants to see the stranger's tattoo that's hidden by clothing.
moral_action: Mary asks to see the tattoo when the stranger awakes.
immoral_action: Mary lifts the stranger's skirt to see the tattoo.

norm: It's wrong to step on other people's feet.
situation: Jim is at a local cinema and has entered his theater after the movie has already started and it is dark.
intention: Jim wants to make his way to his seat.
moral_action: Jim slowly and carefully makes his way through the darkened theater.
immoral_action: Jim blunders his way down the row of seats without watching where he is stepping.

norm: It's wrong to dispose of other people's belongings.
situation: John who had borrowed Phil's pen and is walking down the street, wearing a backpack when he notices the pen in his pocket.
intention: John wants to remove the pen from his pocket and put it somewhere else.
moral_action: John puts the pen in his backpack, so he can eventually return it back to his friend later when he gets home.
immoral_action: John takes the pen and tosses is in the garbage because he's afraid it'll leak in his pocket.

norm: It's inconsiderate to tag along with a couple
situation: Lee and Jane are going to the movies for a romantic evening, but Jane's little brother Danny wants to go too.
intention: Danny wants to see a film.
moral_action: Danny wants too see a film, but sees that Jane and Lee want to be alone, so he rents a movie at home.
immoral_action: Danny invites himself to go with Lee and Jane.

norm: It's wrong to leave trash or belongings in nature
situation: Josh is out camping with his friends, and he just finished drinking a beer.
intention: Josh wants to get rid of the beer can.
moral_action: Josh walks to the other side of the camp ground to throw his trash away in the trashcan.
immoral_action: Josh places the beer can in the woods outside of the campground.

norm: It's inconsiderate to just disappear on people
situation: Beth sees a restroom while walking through the mall with Janet.
intention: Beth wants to wash her hands.
moral_action: Beth asks Janet to wait for her while she goes into the restroom.
immoral_action: Beth slips into the restroom while Janet is looking at a mall map.

norm: It is wrong to mutilate someone's body.
situation: After a major explosion in a warehouse, James volunteered to pick through the rubble and found the dead body of his childhood bully.
intention: James wants to feel some catharsis about the childhood bullying.
moral_action: James calls the fire fighters over to retrieve the corpse and tells them that the deceased used to bully him.
immoral_action: James films himself repeatedly teabagging the corpse of his childhood bully.

norm: It's wrong to relieve yourself in public.
situation: Alex had been drinking cans of soda all throughout the day.
intention: Alex wanted to urinate.
moral_action: Alex went to the port o potty in the middle of the public park.
immoral_action: Alex pulled his pants down and urinated in the bushes at the public park.

norm: It's wrong to grab people.
situation: Auston is at a party when he notices a guest, Bill, who is engrossed in a conversation, has a large wasp crawling on his shoulder.
intention: Auston wants to get Bill's attention, so he can warn him of the wasp.
moral_action: "Auston leans in and loudly says ""excuse me sir"" in the direction of Bill."
immoral_action: Auston reaches towards Bill and grab's Bill's upper arm and yanks it to get him to stop talking.

norm: It's wrong to park somewhere you are not allowed.
situation: John drives to the mall for some last minute Christmas shopping when he realizes that the parking lot is very full.
intention: John wants to find a place to park.
moral_action: John drives slowly around the parking lot until a spot opens up and takes it.
immoral_action: John parks his car on the sidewalk in front of the mall.

norm: It's inappropriate to punch a lot of people.
situation: Sam gets into a heated argument with a group of men at a bar after he accidentally bumps into one of them.
intention: Sam wants to resolve the dispute.
moral_action: Sam defuses the situation with words and offers to buy the men a round of drinks.
immoral_action: Sam starts a fight, kicking and punching the men with his fists.

norm: It's wrong to boast about one's possessions.
situation: Ellie just got a PS5 and some awesome games for it.
intention: Ellie wants to talk to her friends about it.
moral_action: Ellie talks about the PS5 including everything she hates about it.
immoral_action: Ellie brags to all her friends about how awesome her PS5 is.

norm: It's wrong to sneak into places.
situation: Once he got home after attending a party at the house of one of his coworkers, Bob realizes he had forgotten his favorite cap there.
intention: Bob wants to get his favorite cap back.
moral_action: Bob waits until the next day and calls his coworker in advance before stopping by her place to get his cap.
immoral_action: Bob returns to his coworker's place and since the lights are off decides to enter the house through the back door and find his cap.

norm: It's wrong to use someone's body.
situation: Jake has been doing construction for hours with coworkers, and his arm is very tired.
intention: Jake wants to rest his arm on something.
moral_action: Jake decides to rest his arm on a table away from his coworkers.
immoral_action: Jake rests his arm on a coworker without asking the coworker.

norm: It's wrong to snoop through other people's things.
situation: Sandra's daughter is getting to the age that she may be starting to have an interest in dating and romance.
intention: Sandra wants to find out if her daughter is dating anybody.
moral_action: Sandra brings up the topic of dating with her daughter and gently asks if she is seeing anyone and her daughter says she is.
immoral_action: Sandra reads her daughter's diary when they aren't looking and reads that her daughter has started to date someone.

norm: It is wrong to draw on photographs.
situation: Thomas' grandmother was showing him her old wedding photograph's and talking about missing his departed grandfather.
intention: Thomas wants to make a gift for his grandmother.
moral_action: Thomas redraws his grandmother's wedding photograph and writes her a lovely letter.
immoral_action: Thomas gets the black and white photograph of his grandmother and colors it with his pencils.

norm: It is unacceptable to touch other people's belongings.
situation: Faye sees a fluffy sweater on Frances' desk.
intention: Faye wants to hold the sweater.
moral_action: Faye asks Frances if she can hold the sweater.
immoral_action: Faye grabs the sweater while no one is looking.

norm: It's inappropriate to show children gore
situation: Carolyn is stuck watching her brother on Halloween.
intention: Carolyn wants to do something scary.
moral_action: Carolyn turns off the lights and reads her brother some scary stories from the internet.
immoral_action: Carolyn decides to watches all of the Halloween movies.

norm: It's wrong to sneak around behind somebody's back
situation: James loved playing paintball, but his wife told him she thought it was too dangerous.
intention: James wants to play paintball.
moral_action: James compromises with his wife by buying extra padded body armor.
immoral_action: James tells his wife he's going to spend Saturday hiking, but actually goes to the paintball range.

norm: It's wrong to put your hands on another person.
situation: Amanda was upset that a stranger cut in line in front of her.
intention: Amanda wants to decide how to confront the stranger.
moral_action: "Amanda tells the stranger, ""Hey, back of the line, buddy!""."
immoral_action: Amanda grabs the stranger and pushes him out of the line.

norm: It's wrong to have a taste for human flesh.
situation: Jeffrey is at home thinking about dinner with a friend he just met next to him.
intention: Jeffrey wants to try something he's never eaten before.
moral_action: Jeffrey does a google search for exotic foods and picks a recipe to try.
immoral_action: Jeffrey drugs his friend, dismembers him and cooks him to taste.

norm: It's wrong to defecate in other people's belongings.
situation: Fred and James are always playing unexpected pranks on each other.
intention: Fred wants to prank James in way that he's never done before.
moral_action: Fred gives James a spring snake disguised as a can of chips.
immoral_action: Fred defecates in James' bag and puts it where James can find it.

norm: It's wrong to stare at people.
situation: John is a single man who likes to people-watch when he is out in public.
intention: John wants to do some shopping.
moral_action: John does his shopping and minds his own business.
immoral_action: John sees a woman shopping alone and stares at her for a while.

norm: It's wrong to forge signatures.
situation: There is a class trip coming up and Ted is worried that his mother won't sign his permission slip because of his poor grades.
intention: Ted wants to go on the trip.
moral_action: Ted works hard in class to bring his grades up and then asks his mother to sign his permission slip for the trip.
immoral_action: Ted signs his mother's name on the permission slip for the trip to make sure that he can go.

norm: It's wrong to exclude people from public areas
situation: Dean is a police officer whose patrol is around the public park.
intention: Dean wants to keep the park clean.
moral_action: Dean tells park visitors that the park is open, but they have to clean up after themselves.
immoral_action: Dean tells park visitors that the park is closed and can't be used.

norm: It's inappropriate to fart in public
situation: Fiona, who is at the mall with her friend, has eaten a bean burrito for lunch and it has made her very gassy.
intention: Fiona wants to let out some gas.
moral_action: Fiona uses the restroom and lets her gas out in the stall that she is in.
immoral_action: Fiona passes gas while she is walking through the mall with her friend.

norm: It is wrong to leave kids by themselves outside.
situation: Benny is a parent of three children, and they are playing in the pool in the backyard.
intention: Benny wants to get out of the pool.
moral_action: Benny gets out of the pool and sits nearby it to keep a close eye on his three children still inside the pool.
immoral_action: Benny gets out of the pool and goes inside to shower while letting his three children remain in the pool.

norm: It's wrong to stand people up.
situation: Lance has agreed to have dinner with his friend, Liz, but is having second thoughts about it.
intention: Lance wants to skip dinner with Liz.
moral_action: Lance tells Liz that he can't make their scheduled dinner.
immoral_action: On the night of their dinner, Lance stays home without informing Liz of his plans.

norm: It's wrong to push through crowds of people.
situation: Olivia is at the grocery store with her items when she realizes the lines are really long at the registers.
intention: Olivia wants to check out.
moral_action: Olivia waits for twenty minutes to get to the beginning of the line.
immoral_action: Olivia pushes past all the people in the lines with her shopping cart  in order to get ahead in the line.

norm: It's wrong to call someone out in public.
situation: Portia just found out that her boyfriend has been in touch with his ex.
intention: Portia wants to confront her boyfriend.
moral_action: Portia waits until her boyfriend gets home before bringing up her problems with his actions.
immoral_action: Portia goes to her boyfriends workplace and asks him about the situation in front of his coworkers.

norm: It's wrong to throw something valuable.
situation: Erin has worn her current diamond ring for three years but spots another one in a jewelry store she likes.
intention: Erin wants a new diamond ring.
moral_action: Erin buys the new ring and wears it alongside her old ring as well.
immoral_action: Erin throws her old ring in the trash and buys the new one from the store.

norm: It's wrong to openly carry weapons in public.
situation: Zeke is at the big box store where he has just purchased a huge revolver.
intention: Zeke wants to take the revolver out of the store.
moral_action: Zeke puts the revolver in his backpack before going out of the store into the parking lot.
immoral_action: Zeke keeps the revolver in his hand as he exits the store into the parking lot.

norm: It's inconsiderate to ignore social norms when in public.
situation: Pola is in a crowded line at the airport and feels a bit bubbly.
intention: Pola wants to somehow get out a burp or two.
moral_action: Pola covers her mouth and lets them out slowly.
immoral_action: Pola lets them come naturally.

norm: It is wrong to tamper with people's possessions
situation: Omar was playing video games when his game controller broke.
intention: Omar wants to get a new game controller.
moral_action: Omar asks his roommate if he can borrow the money to get a new controller.
immoral_action: Omar opens his roommates safe to get the money to buy the controller.

norm: Its wrong to pull out in front of people.
situation: Clarissa trying to pull out of a parking lot onto a busy street.
intention: Clarissa wants to drive to her home.
moral_action: Clarissa waits patiently for the nearest light on the main road to change, so she can find a gap to pull out into.
immoral_action: Clarissa pulls her car out into the busy road without regard for how close traffic is.

norm: It's wrong to be distracted when you're out in public.
situation: Frank is using a paper map to guide his family around an amusement park.
intention: Frank wants to not get lost.
moral_action: Frank divides his attention between the map and keeping track of his family.
immoral_action: Frank focuses his full attention on reading the map.

norm: It's wrong not to care about hygiene.
situation: Lucy loves acting.
intention: Lucy wants to snag a spot in a play in a local park.
moral_action: Lucy showers the morning of her audition.
immoral_action: Lucy doesn't shower or bathe for four days leading up to her tryout.

norm: it's wrong to judge a person by their past mistakes.
situation: Connor is the boss at a tech company.
intention: Connor needs to hire a new tech support person.
moral_action: Gerald gives the candidate a chance since he did his time and is fully qualified.
immoral_action: Connor interviews a man who went to jail for possessing weed and refuses to hire him despite being a perfect candidate.

norm: It's wrong to leave the scene of an accident
situation: Azure hits another car while driving on the road.
intention: Azure wants to get help for the accident.
moral_action: Azure pulls out her phone and calls the non-emergency police number.
immoral_action: Azure drives to a nearby gas station to ask the attendant for help.

norm: It's wrong not to help out people in need.
situation: Tom is running late but has a friend who urgently needs a ride.
intention: Tom wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Tom pays for an Uber ride for his friend.
immoral_action: Tom ignores his friend and hurries off to work.

norm: It's wrong not to clean up after yourself.
situation: Patrice is in the kitchen finishing up cooking dinner for herself and her children.
intention: Patrice wants to sit down to eat dinner.
moral_action: Patrice sets dinner on the table, wipes the kitchen down, and enjoys her dinner.
immoral_action: Patrice puts the food on the table, eats dinner with her family, and forgets to wipe the kitchen counters down after cooking.

norm: It's rude not to clean up after yourself.
situation: John is playing with his toys and his grandma's house.
intention: John wants to have fun playing games all day.
moral_action: John finishes one game and puts all his toys back where they belong before going outside for a new game.
immoral_action: John doesn't clean up his toys from one game indoors before starting to play another game in the backyard.

norm: It's socially unacceptable not to maintain basic personal hygiene.
situation: Jackson has a date this evening with a girl he has a big crush on.
intention: Jackson wants to get ready for his date.
moral_action: Jackson takes a shower, puts on deodorant, and puts on clean clothes before going to pick up his date.
immoral_action: Jackson puts on his sweaty workout clothes and goes to pick up his date.

norm: It's wrong to hold someone's past against them.
situation: Jill has recently lost a treasured necklace and is a long-time friend of Sally, who stole a lot as a teen, but has since reformed.
intention: Jill wants to find out what happened to her necklace.
moral_action: Jill realizes that Sally is not a thief anymore and asks Sally if she could help find the necklace.
immoral_action: Knowing Sandy's past, Jill immediately suspects that Sandy took the necklace.

norm: It is wrong to glorify injuries.
situation: Ray is called into the room by his dad when he is suspended from school for fighting a bully.
intention: Ray's dad wants to talk to him about fighting.
moral_action: Ray's dad explains to him that violence is never the answer, and he should report bullying to his teachers.
immoral_action: Ray's dad tell him that he did the right by busting the bully's nose.

norm: It's wrong to avoid doing chores.
situation: Jim knows his mother wants his help doing chores around the house today.
intention: Jim wants to go to his friend's house.
moral_action: Jim spends a few hours doing house chores before gong to his friend's house.
immoral_action: Jim goes to his friend's house leaving his mother to do all the chores without him.

norm: It's wrong to judge someone who was injured.
situation: Martha is ice skating with her daughter when she sees another skater twist their ankle and fall several feet in front of her.
intention: Martha wants to keep her daughter safe.
moral_action: Martha stops with her daughter to help the fallen skater, who has injured their ankle, return to the sidelines of the rink.
immoral_action: Martha holds her daughter close and tells the skater on the ground that they need to stay off the ice since they are a hazard to others.

norm: It's wrong to keep matters of physical health from children.
situation: Betty is a mother of three who has just been diagnosed with an aggressive cancer.
intention: Betty wants to avoid making her children sad.
moral_action: Betty tells the kids right after her diagonsis and asks for their support.
immoral_action: Betty withholds the fact that she has cancer until just before her death.

norm: It's wrong not to care when someone is being abused.
situation: Jerry has been seeing his mom abuse his dad, and is not happy about it.
intention: Jerry wants to talk to his dad about the abuse he witnesses.
moral_action: Jerry tells his dad he cares a lot about what is happening, and he wants to help stop it.
immoral_action: Jerry tells his dad he doesn't care his dad is being abused but that it needs to stop regardless.

norm: It's wrong not to apologize to people.
situation: Edward accidentally breaks a neighbor's window while playing baseball with his little brother, and the neighbor starts shouting at them.
intention: Edward wants to explain what happened to their neighbor.
moral_action: Edward says sorry to the neighbor for breaking his window, and he tells the neighbor that it was an accident.
immoral_action: Edward tells the neighbor that it was all his little brother's fault.

norm: It is wrong to discount someone's grief.
situation: Jenny's friend is crying because their cat that they had for many years dies.
intention: Jenny wants to react to friend crying.
moral_action: Jenny says she knows how hard it can be to lose something you really care about and tells her friend that she's there for them.
immoral_action: Jenny says that her friend should just get over it because it was just a cat so it's not a big deal.

norm: It's wrong not to help someone who is hurt.
situation: Jerry is driving to work one day when he sees a terrible car accident happen in front of him, with the car from the accident erupting in flames.
intention: Jerry needs to get to work.
moral_action: Jerry pulls over and quickly dials 911 before helping the victim away from the burning car.
immoral_action: Jerry swerves around the wreck and continues driving, figuring someone else will take care of it.

norm: It's wrong to judge another person based on their heritage.
situation: Rob's classmate, Greg, grew up in a wealthy family, and Rob doesn't know how to feel about this.
intention: Rob wants to say something to Greg.
moral_action: Rob tells Greg that he understands that it's hard for him to live up to his parents' expectations.
immoral_action: Rob tells Greg that he doesn't have the work ethic needed to succeed.

norm: It's wrong to not take care of your health.
situation: Devin hadn't been feeling well and had started to miss days at work.
intention: Devin wants to feel better.
moral_action: Devin goes to the doctor to see what is wrong with him.
immoral_action: Devin takes a nap the first thing in the morning when he gets to work.

norm: It's wrong not to feel empathy toward people.
situation: Chuck's girlfriend got into a fight with her mom and is crying about it over the phone.
intention: Chuck wants her girlfriend to stop crying.
moral_action: Chuck tells his girlfriend that he knows how she feels and is sorry that she's hurting.
immoral_action: Chuck tells his girlfriend to get over it and not worry about her feelings so much.

norm: It's wrong not to console people that you care about.
situation: Max comes home from work to see his wife, Robin, crying on the couch.
intention: Max wants to let Robin cry out her feelings.
moral_action: Max gives Robin a hug and tells her it is okay to cry.
immoral_action: Max walks right past Robin and goes upstairs without saying a word.

norm: It's wrong not to do your chores.
situation: Jackie has been busy all week and has laundry lying all over her room.
intention: Jackie wants to consider doing her laundry.
moral_action: Jackie pushes herself to collect and finally do her laundry.
immoral_action: Jackie decides to forget about her laundry and go do something more enjoyable.

norm: It's wrong not to help injured animals.
situation: Bert was driving down the road when he sees a dog with a broken leg on the side of the road.
intention: Bert wants to get home.
moral_action: Bert stops and takes the dog to his house to care for it.
immoral_action: Bert drives past the injured dog and pays no mind to it on the way to his house.

norm: It's bad to get into fights unless you're defending yourself.
situation: Adam is having bad day when Tom accidentally runs into him.
intention: Adam wants to release his anger.
moral_action: Adam goes home and punches his pillow repeatedly.
immoral_action: Adam shoves Tom and verbally berates him while threatening to shove him again.

norm: It's bad to yell at other people.
situation: Nicole and her husband Mike are having a disagreement.
intention: Nicole wants to win the disagreement.
moral_action: Nicole calmly explains the reasons why she thinks she is right.
immoral_action: Nicole shouts at Mike, hoping to intimidate him by raising her voice.

norm: It is bad to take out your anger on things.
situation: Jack and his wife are discussing their finances while at home.
intention: Jack wants to know where his wife spent $400.
moral_action: Jack calmly waits while his wife looks through their bank account to see where the charge came from.
immoral_action: Jack punches a wall to try to scare his wife into telling him where the money went quickly.

norm: It's bad to pick a fight with someone.
situation: Tom is with his friends in a bar when a drunk stranger starts yelling at him and pushing him around.
intention: Tom wants the guy to leave him alone.
moral_action: Tom keeps his cool and calms the guy down by talking to him.
immoral_action: Tom pushes the guy back and punches him in the face.

norm: It's bad to throw tantrums.
situation: Prince has a birthday party and doesn't get the present that he really wanted.
intention: Prince wants to get the desired gift.
moral_action: Prince offers to trade some of his presents for the gift that he wanted.
immoral_action: Prince throws himself on the floor and shouts that he wants the desired gift.

norm: It's bad to yell at your partner.
situation: Oliver comes home from work to find his house is a mess.
intention: Oliver wants to always have a clean house.
moral_action: Oliver understands his wife must have had a lot to do and offers to help clean the house.
immoral_action: Oliver raises his voice at his wife about the messy house and sits down to have a beer while she cleans the house.

norm: It is bad to have hissy fits.
situation: Sarah showed up to a big high school party wearing the same red dress as another girl.
intention: Sarah wants her friends to think she's cool and fun to be around.
moral_action: Sarah goes out of her way to be nice to the other girl all night.
immoral_action: Sarah throws her beer in the other girl's face and calls her a copycat c-word.

norm: It's bad to yell at anyone.
situation: Sally is grocery shopping on her way to pick up her kids at the babysitter.
intention: Sally wants to get to the babysitter's house on time.
moral_action: Sally is kind to the cashier and helps her bag the groceries.
immoral_action: Sally raises her voice at the cashier and insists the cashier move faster.

norm: It's bad to yell at someone.
situation: Joy is walking down a crowded sidewalk on her way home from work.
intention: Joy wants to get to her place quickly.
moral_action: Joy jumps on an electric scooter for rent and rides it to her apartment building.
immoral_action: Joy screams at a slow-walking elderly person in front of her to hurry the hell up.

norm: It's bad to physically assault people.
situation: Owen is hitting on Jake's girlfriend and making her uncomfortable.
intention: Jake wants Owen to leave his girlfriend alone.
moral_action: Jake tells Owen to back off and takes his girlfriend away from him.
immoral_action: Jake punches Owen in the face.

norm: It's bad to take your anger out with your fists.
situation: Justin is out clubbing with friends when he notices a guy screaming at his girlfriend.
intention: Justin wants to confront the guy.
moral_action: Justin goes over to the guy and tells him to knock it off, or he'll call security.
immoral_action: Justin goes over to the guy and punches him in the face.

norm: It's bad to scream at others.
situation: Adam and his boyfriend Ethan are having an argument about their relationship.
intention: Adam wants to tell Ethan how he feels.
moral_action: Adam sits down with Ethan so that he can calmly explain his point of view about their issues.
immoral_action: Adam repeatedly screams and shouts at Ethan about their relationship problems.

norm: It is bad to emotionally abuse people
situation: John who is miserable and lacks coping abilities is at home with his wife.
intention: John wants to stop feeling miserable.
moral_action: John has enough of not understanding on how to deal with things and communicates clearly to his wife.
immoral_action: John takes out his frustrations on his wife by calling her names and mocking her appearance because in his backwards thinking it'll make him feel better.

norm: It's bad to get into fights with people.
situation: Roy is online reading a post from a friend who supports the opposite political party.
intention: Roy wants to present a statement to defend his own party.
moral_action: Roy makes a logical statement and when the contention rises he suggests they agree to disagree.
immoral_action: Roy presents his case and then proceeds to fight with his friend over the topic.

norm: It's bad to get enraged at people.
situation: Cole is driving on the freeway when another driver cuts him off.
intention: Cole wants to respond to the situation.
moral_action: Cole moves away from the vehicle that cut him off and ignores them.
immoral_action: Cole drives up to the side of the driver that cut him off and honks his horn while making gestures with his hands.

norm: It's bad to have anger issues.
situation: Mitch is the boss of a company, and lately his employees have been slacking off.
intention: Mitch wants his employees to work harder.
moral_action: Mitch explains that he needs them to work harder and asks for advice on how to get them to be more efficient.
