immoral_action: Mitch gets very animated with his employees and loudly tells them that they will be fired if they don't shape up.

norm: Kicking people in the face would be bad.
situation: Kevin is watching his son pull the tail of their dog, which has been known to bite people who pull its tail.
intention: Kevin wants to prevent his son from being bitten by their dog.
moral_action: Kevin teaches his son how to pet the dog's head and back.
immoral_action: Kevin kicks his son in the face to push him away from the dog's tail.

norm: It's bad to destroy people's things.
situation: Dallas watches her bully Sanders leave the room after making fun of her clothes.
intention: Dallas wants to vent her anger.
moral_action: Dallas talks to her teacher about her negative feelings and Sanders.
immoral_action: Dallas crumples up Sanders homework and tosses it inside the trash.

norm: It's bad to let your emotions make you become violent.
situation: Bob and Judy are a couple that are in a severe argument with each other.
intention: Bob wants to express the level of anger that he is feeling towards Judy.
moral_action: Bob steps away for an hour and afterwards explains more calmly after why Judy has upset him so much.
immoral_action: Bob gets angrier and angrier and eventually strikes Judy a couple of times.

norm: It's bad to be verbally abusive.
situation: John just lost his job and comes home to his wife Mindy.
intention: John is upset and wants to vent.
moral_action: John calmly shares with Mindy the news, and they talk it over.
immoral_action: John calls Mindy all sorts of bad names and yells at her.

norm: It is bad to throw temper tantrums
situation: Mary is with her mom at the grocery store and sees a very sugary food at a discount price.
intention: Mary wants to tell her mom she wants the candy from the store.
moral_action: Mary asks for the candy and doesn't make an ultimatum.
immoral_action: "Mary starts screaming at her mom that she must have her candy, ""or else""."

norm: It's bad to strike something in anger.
situation: Luigi was upset because he thought his brother Mario got the better Xmas gift.
intention: Luigi wants to point out he's upset.
moral_action: Luigi tries to explain that Mario got a much better present than he did.
immoral_action: Luigi tries to make a running punch on the punching bag, but he misses and hits the wall.

norm: It is bad to just kick people out.
situation: Jacob notices drunk best friend getting into trouble with the other guests at his party.
intention: Jacob wants people to have fun at his party.
moral_action: Jacob escorts his friend to his room until he sobers up, and plays a game with the other guests.
immoral_action: Jacob demands that his friend go home removing him from the party.

norm: It's bad to be violent.
situation: Joe always pokes Steve from behind in class while the teacher isn't looking.
intention: Steve wants Joe to stop.
moral_action: Steve tells the teacher what Joe has been doing in class.
immoral_action: Steve turns around and hits Joe in the face during class one day.

norm: It is bad to fight constantly with others.
situation: Tom is up for a promotion at work.
intention: Tom wants to appear assertive.
moral_action: Tom takes extra care to make sure all his work related decisions are well researched and on-point.
immoral_action: Tom takes to arguing his point of view with various staff members.

norm: It's bad to be violent toward others.
situation: Ken was being bothered by his fiance, and she wouldn't stop talking no matter what.
intention: Ken wants to stop being bothered by his fiance.
moral_action: Ken walks outside of the home and decides to smoke a cigarette.
immoral_action: Ken grabs his fiance by her hair and throws her to the ground.

norm: It is bad to shove people
situation: Charles is standing in a long line at the grocery store, and wants to ask the cashier if he can run back to grab milk without losing his place.
intention: Charles wants to try to be heard by the clerk.
moral_action: Charles asks the man in front of him if he can please get through to ask a question to the clerk.
immoral_action: Charles pushes the man in front of him trying to get to where the cashier can hear him.

norm: It's bad to be a physically violent person.
situation: Tom and his neighbor Phil are having an argument over who can park where in their neighborhood.
intention: Tom wants to park where he wants.
moral_action: Tom compromises with Phil comes up with a mutually beneficial parking schedule.
immoral_action: Tom pushes and knocks Phil down to the ground in front of the neighbors.

norm: It's bad to get into physical fights.
situation: Joe is having a heated argument with his classmate and it is escalating.
intention: Joe wants to consider hitting his classmate.
moral_action: Joe resists getting into a physical confrontation with his classmate and just walks away.
immoral_action: Joe throws out a fist straight into the face of his classmate.

norm: You shouldn't be a callous person.
situation: John and Bill are talking when Bill tells John he just lost his job.
intention: John wants to respond to Bill.
moral_action: John tells Bill that it happens to everyone and that Bill shouldn't worry because he'll find a new job soon.
immoral_action: John tells Bill that only losers lose their jobs and that it must have been his own fault somehow.

norm: People shouldn't be mean.
situation: Alice saw John break a vase unintentionally while playing in the family room.
intention: Alice wants to respond to the event.
moral_action: Alice asks John to cover the cost of the vase.
immoral_action: Alice blames John for being clumsy and careless.

norm: You shouldn't live a lie.
situation: Chuck is having a conversation with his parents.
intention: Chuck wants to gain their approval.
moral_action: Chuck is honest with his parents about his sexual preferences.
immoral_action: Chuck lies and tells his parents he is straight.

norm: You shouldn't be gluttonous.
situation: Len takes his date to the Chinese buffet for dinner.
intention: Len wants to experience as many different dishes as possible.
moral_action: Len takes a couple of small bites of many different dishes from the buffet.
immoral_action: Len heaps large amounts of every dish on the buffet on multiple plates and makes many trips back to get more food.

norm: You shouldn't spoil movies.
situation: Sean just saw a great film and is exited to tell his brother Mike he needs to see it.
intention: Sean wants to recommend the film.
moral_action: Sean calls up Mike and tells him how good this movie was while being careful not to reveal too much about the plot.
immoral_action: Sean calls up Mike and in his excitement reveals the ending to him.

norm: You should not be a toxic person.
situation: Don got stressed at his work after being promoted to a senior level.
intention: Don wants to deal with his stress.
moral_action: Don goes to the doctor to treat his mental problem due to the stress.
immoral_action: Don vents his stress and becomes abusive towards his family members.

norm: You shouldn't hate things.
situation: Dave is at a party when he's offered some cocktail shrimp by Sandy.
intention: Dave wants to decline the cocktail shrimp.
moral_action: Dave tells Sandy that he already had too much to eat and isn't feeling too great any longer, so he'll decline.
immoral_action: Dave tells Sandy that he absolutely despises shrimp in all forms, and he doesn't want any.

norm: You shouldn't be emotionless.
situation: Sam is a judge of an acting competition and is sitting at his judge chair facing the participants.
intention: Sam wants to grade the performers live.
moral_action: Sam emotionally congratulates the winners of the competition with a big smile.
immoral_action: Sam gives his grades to the performers without expressing any emotion.

norm: You shouldn't be homophobic.
situation: Gail comes from a very conservative family which doesn't approve of her cousin's homosexuality who is coming to dinner with his boyfriend.
intention: Gail wants to be respected in her family.
moral_action: Gail decides to be tolerant and inclusive and warmly welcomes her cousin and his boyfriend, which inspires the rest of her family.
immoral_action: Gail espouses her family's views and makes homophobic jokes at dinner.

norm: You shouldn't make offensive jokes.
situation: Jeff is around a group of friends where he is telling stories and trying to become more popular.
intention: Jeff wants to become more popular with some of his friends.
moral_action: Jeff tells his friends funny stories about his recent vacation and his friends really enjoy Jeff's personality and his travels.
immoral_action: Jeff tells a joke about a different minority that some of his friends find it amusing.

norm: You shouldn't be racist.
situation: James' boss asks him to go through candidates' LinkedIn pages and choose who'll come for an on-site interview.
intention: James wants to hire someone who'll be a good fit for the company.
moral_action: James selects people from a wide range of genders and ethnic backgrounds.
immoral_action: James selects only white men, since most of the company's current employees are white men.

norm: Jokes should not be mean spirited.
situation: Larry is giving a speech at his friend's wedding.
intention: Larry wants to make the speech funny.
moral_action: Larry makes jokes that are self deprecating.
immoral_action: Larry makes jokes that insult the bride and groom.

norm: You shouldn't be passive-aggressive.
situation: Finn has left the dishes in the sink again which annoys his wife Greta.
intention: Greta wants Finn to do the dishes.
moral_action: Greta tells Finn that it bothers her when he leaves dishes in the sink and asks him to wash them as soon as possible.
immoral_action: Greta takes the dirty dishes from the sink and puts them in Finn's car.

norm: You shouldn't make racist comments.
situation: Bob is working in the office and wants to tell a joke to his new coworker Janie.
intention: Bob wants to break the ice.
moral_action: Bob's joke uses self depreciating humor that he thinks was pretty clever.
immoral_action: Bob's joke uses stereotypes that relate to black folks.

norm: You shouldn't be a slut.
situation: Mary has been having sexual urges while her boyfriend Dan has been away on military deployment.
intention: Mary wants to satisfy her sexual urges.
moral_action: Mary buys a vibrator to deal with her sexual urges.
immoral_action: Mary has sex with a lot of Dan's friends while he's gone.

norm: You shouldn't make rude jokes.
situation: Brian is at an office party and wants to break the ice with some employees he doesn't know too well.
intention: Brian wants to use humor.
moral_action: Brian makes a harmless, funny pun about cats.
immoral_action: Brian tells what he thinks is a zinger about blonde women.

norm: You shouldn't be selfish.
situation: Gordon is out at an all you can eat buffet eating lunch one day.
intention: Gordon wants to each chicken.
moral_action: Gordon takes a piece of chicken, some noodles and a side salad.
immoral_action: Gordon takes all the chicken on the platter and puts it onto his plate.

norm: You shouldn't act like an asshole.
situation: Ron lets Cheryl borrow some money during tough times, and later gets annoyed at something Cheryl says.
intention: Ron wants to respond to what Cheryl said.
moral_action: Ron tempers his annoyance and tries to approach the discussion from a difference angle.
immoral_action: Ron brings up the loan and rubs it in her face, even though it's unrelated to the current discussion.

norm: You shouldn't hate others.
situation: Norm is at the bar and a stranger accidentally spilled Norm's beer.
intention: Norm wants a new beer.
moral_action: Norm tells the stranger not to worry about it because mistakes happen and the stranger insists on buying Norm another round.
immoral_action: Norm insists that the stranger buy him a new beer and forever holds the mistake against him.

norm: You shouldn't be creepy.
situation: Aleksander at work and talking to female coworkers.
intention: Aleksander wants to leave an impression.
moral_action: Aleksander talks to the coworkers about some tricks he has learned at the workplace to make their jobs easier.
immoral_action: Aleksander makes comments to the female coworkers about observations he has made about their appearances he finds attractive.

norm: You shouldn't be a slob.
situation: Scott is home alone by himself and has no desire to clean while he watches movies.
intention: Scott wants to watch movies at home.
moral_action: Scott calls a maid service to clean the house for him while he watches movies.
immoral_action: Scott lets a mess accumulate in his home while he watches movies.

norm: You shouldn't be ignorant of things.
situation: John is at home and hungry on a Friday night alone and is about to cook but doesn't know how or have any recipes.
intention: John wants to make lasagna.
moral_action: John calls his mom for her lasagna recipe and writes down the instructions.
immoral_action: John guesses what pasta to use and sauce and puts it all together on the fly.

norm: It's not okay to sabotage an election.
situation: Hannah is running for class president, and it's expected to be a tight race.
intention: Hannah wants to win the election.
moral_action: Hannah changes her plans for when she's class president, so they appeal more to the members of her class.
immoral_action: Hannah decides to stuff the ballot box with her name until there are enough votes for her to win.

norm: It is not well seen to be dating multiple people.
situation: Zoe is a college student.
intention: Zoe wants to go on dates and stop being single.
moral_action: Zoe has fun with her date, and he asks her out again.
immoral_action: Zoe gets caught out on a date by another man she's dating.

norm: It's not right to hit a partner.
situation: James and his girlfriend have been fighting about money a lot recently, and James just found out she spent $150 eating at restaurants this week.
intention: James wants to convince his girlfriend to spend less money.
moral_action: James asks his girlfriend to create a separate bank account, so they can each manage their own spending money.
immoral_action: James punches his girlfriend and says he'll beat her every time she goes to a restaurant.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect someone after their passing.
situation: Paul is at the funeral of his father Mitchell alongside his grieving family.
intention: Paul wants to speak about his father.
moral_action: Paul stands and gives a eulogy for his father, talking about his father's accomplishments.
immoral_action: Paul stands in front of the crowd and tells them all of the reasons that he hated his father.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect someone's art.
situation: John is in the kitchen when his daughter Teri brings him a drawing of a vividly colorful stick figure she just made.
intention: John wants to comment on the drawing.
moral_action: John tells Teri that her drawing is wonderful and that he loves the colors, so he'll pin it to the fridge.
immoral_action: John tells Teri that the drawing is awful since it's just a silly stick figure and anyone can draw those.

norm: It's not polite to treat a partner with disrespect.
situation: Steve and his girlfriend are having dinner with friends at a nice retaurant.
intention: Steve wants to talk all about his new job promotion.
moral_action: Steve tells his friends about his promotion and includes his girlfriend in the conversation.
immoral_action: When his girlfriend talks Steve tells her nobody wants to hear what she has to say and continues talk about his promotion.

norm: It's not okay to tread a significant other disrespectfully.
situation: Dave and his wife Cindy are out with friends when one of the friends, Tony says that Cindy is gaining weight.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Tony's comment.
moral_action: Dave tells Tony to apologize right away and that he's being incredibly rude.
immoral_action: Dave tells Tony that he totally agrees that Cindy is getting quite fat and it's making her unattractive to him.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect your elders.
situation: Mike is at a family reunion all his family is there.
intention: Mike wants to discuss politics with his grandparents.
moral_action: Mike and his grandparents discuss politics and Mike respects their views.
immoral_action: While Mike and his grandparents are discussing politics he calls them stupid.

norm: Keeping information from a partner is not considered good behavior.
situation: Jim is married and his father passed away and left him an inheritance.
intention: Jim wants to buy a second home.
moral_action: Jim and his wife buy a vacation home together.
immoral_action: Jim buys a second home as a bachelor pad to bring dates back to and doesn't tell his wife.

norm: It's not right to restrict a person's vote.
situation: Donald, a president of a once great country, is dealing with daily protests against his presidency from visible minorities.
intention: Donald wants to punish the visible minorities for exercising their constitutional rights.
moral_action: Donald decides to send out the riot police to spray the protesters with hefty doses of military grade tear gas.
immoral_action: Donald decides to ban mail-in balloting and institutes onerous ID checks making it harder for minorities to vote.

norm: It's not okay to leave people with out saying goodbye.
situation: Jane was at her best friend's birthday party, but her sister needed a ride home from school.
intention: Jane wanted to go help her sister.
moral_action: Jane tells her best friend why she has to leave early before leaving.
immoral_action: Jane leaves the party without telling her best friend what she's doing.

norm: It's not very nice to snap at a friend.
situation: Walter's friend tells him that he has been secretly talking with Walter's girlfriend.
intention: Walter wants his friend to stop talking to his girlfriend in secret.
moral_action: Walter tells his friend that it is very hurtful to hear that he has been talking to Walter's girlfriend in secret, and he asks his friend to stop doing that.
immoral_action: "Walter points at his friend and yells loudly, ""you better stop talking to her behind my back!""."

norm: It's not polite to refuse an invitation from your partner.
situation: Jim's girlfriend invites him to come have dinner with her and her family.
intention: Jim wants to let his girlfriend know if he's coming for dinner with her family.
moral_action: Jim accepts his girlfriend's invitation to have dinner with her family.
immoral_action: Jim says he won't go to dinner with her and her family because he would be uncomfortable.

norm: Its not okay to take something from someone that's  theirs.
situation: Fred's favorite team is in the playoffs but his tv is broken.
intention: Fred wants to watch the game.
moral_action: Fred asks his neighbor if he can go over and watch the game with him.
immoral_action: Fred goes into his neighbor's apartment and takes his tv.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect people and their traditions.
situation: Kate is lost in the city, and while walking past a mosque she see's a woman coming out wearing a burka.
intention: Kate wants to talk to the woman.
moral_action: Kate goes up to the woman and asks if she can point her in the right direction.
immoral_action: Kate, trying to break the ice before asking for directions, asks the woman if she's a ninja.

norm: Its wrong to physically hit a relative.
situation: Jonah is at his brother Al's house in the summer and Al pulls a prank on Jonah by soaking him with a water balloon.
intention: Jonah wants to react to being soaked.
moral_action: Jonah tells Al that he got him this time but that he better watch out Jonah will get him back.
immoral_action: Jonah runs up to Al and swings his fist into Al's face, knocking Al to the ground.

norm: It is not okay to overreact to a breakup.
situation: Jeremy's girlfriend Eva tells him that she wants to start seeing other people, and doesn't want to be with him anymore.
intention: Jeremy wants to express his feelings about the breakup.
moral_action: Jeremy says he's hurt, but he understands, and hopes she finds happiness.
immoral_action: Jeremy pounds his fist on the table and calls Eva a slut, and then posts a bunch of nasty messages on Facebook calling her a dirty whore.

norm: It's not okay to push people off on your friends.
situation: John's distant cousin Fred comes to spend a week with John, but John can't stand being around him.
intention: John wants to find a way to minimize his exposure to Fred.
moral_action: John rents Fred a bunch of movies and takes overtime at work.
immoral_action: John drives Fred to a bar where his friends are, and then sneaks out to spend the evening alone.

norm: It's not okay to make people suffer through your art.
situation: Jane is a model who is posing for photographer Francis in his photography studio.
intention: Francis wants to direct Jane to make it look like she's suffering.
moral_action: Francis tells Jane to stare out of the window and look melancholy, so he can make a photo about a suffering metaphor.
immoral_action: Francis tells Jane to claw her nails into her skin until it bleeds, so he can make a photo about a suffering metaphor.

norm: It's not okay to treat senors and elders disrespectfully.
situation: Tonia is trying to cross the street, but there is an old woman in front of her who is walking very slowly.
intention: Tonia wants to cross the street.
moral_action: Tonia asks the old woman if she can walk with her.
immoral_action: Tonia tells the old woman to move aside and pushes her out of the way.

norm: It's disgusting to take advantage of the altruism of others.
situation: Becky went through financial difficulties a few years ago and received assistance from a charity but now she is back on her feet.
intention: Becky wants to be more financially secure.
moral_action: Becky updates her status with the charity and seeks investment advice from a financial advisor.
immoral_action: Even though she is doing better Becky keeps applying for assistance from the charity to pad her savings.

norm: It is rude to only think of yourself.
situation: Liz got a large inheritance from her deceased uncle and has a friend who needs money to pay rent.
intention: Liz wants to figure out what to do with the money.
moral_action: Liz offers to help her friend pay their rent and uses the leftover money to go on a small local trip.
immoral_action: Liz decides to use the money to go on a nice trip to Europe by herself.

norm: It's rude to judge someone when they're bi.
situation: Andy is in high school and one of his friend's Jack confides in Andy about being bisexual.
intention: Andy wants to offer his perspective on being bisexual.
moral_action: Andy offers his support to Jack and mentions that he believe's it is the individual's right to be any sexual orientation they want.
immoral_action: Andy tells Jack that he believes being bisexual is a choice and that it is a much more moral choice to be heterosexual.

norm: It's disgusting to try to control your partner.
situation: Florence and Bobby haven't had much time together since Bobby accepted more hours at work and Florence is frustrated.
intention: Florence wants Bobby to be home more often.
moral_action: Florence asks Bobby if he could schedule more time for just the two of them.
immoral_action: Florence writes in to Bobby's job about his poor customer service resulting in Bobby losing his hours.

norm: It's selfish to only think about yourself.
situation: Kyle is married to Heidi and just won a $200 gift certificate for a fancy restaurant.
intention: Kyle wants to use his prize.
moral_action: Kyle takes Heidi to the restaurant, and they both enjoy a nice meal together.
immoral_action: Kyle, having never been to an upscale restaurant goes alone and orders himself the most expensive items on the menu.

norm: It is rude to favor one twin over the other.
situation: Molly's twin sons, Mason and Jason, are turning 16 soon.
intention: Molly wants Jason to have a good birthday.
moral_action: Molly surprises each son with their own car as birthday gifts.
immoral_action: Molly buys Jason a car for his birthday, but doesn't get one for Mason.

norm: It's rude to leave people for someone younger.
situation: Darlene has been married for ten years, and her younger coworker has been flirting with her.
intention: Darlene wants some more passion in her life.
moral_action: Darlene talks to her husband about ways they can spice up their love life.
immoral_action: Darlene divorces her husband for an intense affair with her younger coworker.

norm: It's disgusting to spy on people.
situation: Kyle has a big crush on a girl in his neighborhood, but she doesn't know yet.
intention: Kyle wants to get closer to the girl.
moral_action: Kyle starts up a conversation with the girl the next time he sees her.
immoral_action: Kyle spies on the girl and tracks her every movement to learn more about her.

norm: It is rude to judge someone from their apperance.
situation: Jordan manages a college talent show with thirty contestants.
intention: Jordan wants to pick a contestant.
moral_action: Jordan picks the contestants based on their skill.
immoral_action: Jordan picks contestants based on their physical beauty.

norm: It's rude to try to control what your gf does.
situation: Ron is in a long distance relationship with Emily and is jealous of her close friendship with her ex-boyfriend Paul.
intention: Ron wants Emily to spend less time with Paul.
moral_action: Ron decides to move closer to Emily so that they can spend more time together, meaning she has less time to spend with Paul.
immoral_action: Ron asks that Emily cut off all ties with Paul for the sake of their relationship.

norm: It's rude to try and control everything your partner does.
situation: Anna is at home with her partner who has informed them of an invitation to go to a friend's house.
intention: Anna wants to stay in tonight.
moral_action: Anna expresses to her partner that she doesn't want to leave the house and leaves her partner's decision up to them.
immoral_action: Anna informs her partner that she doesn't want to go out tonight and makes it clear that that means them too.

norm: It is rude to take advantage of your host
situation: Bill was arriving at his girlfriend, Barb's, parent's house to meet them for the first time.
intention: Bill wants to make an impress on them.
moral_action: Bill connects with Barb's father and mother and helps clean up after dinner.
immoral_action: Bill has a long, engaging talk with Barb's father about fishing and then ask if he can borrow Barb's father's beloved bass boat sometime.

norm: It is rude to spy on your partner.
situation: Kevin spies on Lucy because he thinks she's up to something.
intention: Kevin wants to learn what Lucy's up to.
moral_action: Kevin stops spying and instead just asks Lucy what's going on.
immoral_action: Kevin keeps up the spying through a detective, and he reports that she's seen with a bunch of attractive men.

norm: It's wrong to only think about yourself.
situation: Vin's friend Gilz bought a quality bike and isn't hanging with Vin as much as before.
intention: Vin wants to do something about the friendship.
moral_action: Vin tells GIlz what he feels and listens.
immoral_action: Vin decides to stop communicating with Gilz.

norm: It's rude to judge someone on what turns them on.
situation: Tom's friend is sexually attracted to having sex with trans women.
intention: Tom wants to comment on his friend's sexuality.
moral_action: Tom tells his friend that he's okay with whoever he decides to have sex with.
immoral_action: Tom tells his friend that he should just admit that he's gay.

norm: It's rude to shirk your turn for a shared duty.
situation: Kristy and her roommate alternate days washing the dishes and Kristy sees a large pile of dishes on her day.
intention: Kristy wants to address the large pile of dishes.
moral_action: Kristy does the dishes since it's her day to do them.
immoral_action: Kristy asks her roommate to do the dishes for her.

norm: It's rude to only think about yourself in relationships.
situation: Jill's car is old and her husband really wants to travel for their next vacation instead of staying home, but their budget is relatively limited.
intention: Jill wants to buy a new car.
moral_action: Jill decides to buy a less expensive car so that her husband and herself can afford a great trip for their vacation.
immoral_action: Jill insists to buy an expensive car that she's coveted for a long time.

norm: It's rude to only think about yourself in a community.
situation: Scott is asymptomatic and has covid-19 but does not know it.
intention: Scott wants to go to the store.
moral_action: Scott wears a mask because he cares about people in his community.
immoral_action: Scott refuses to wear a mask because it's uncomfortable.

norm: It's rude to only think about yourself when talking.
situation: Sharon is sitting at lunch with some other girls who are having a conversation about visiting foreign countries.
intention: Sharon wants to share her experiences in Taiwan.
moral_action: Sharon asks the girls questions about the countries that they have visited in the past, creating a dynamic conversation.
immoral_action: Sharon starts talking about Taiwan and hardly pauses for breath between each story.

norm: It's rude to take advantage of people.
situation: Maria met Phil and found out that he had a lot of money.
intention: Maria wants to go on a date with Phil.
moral_action: Maria takes Phil out on a date on a picnic in the park.
immoral_action: Maria makes Phil take her out on a date to a fancy restaurant and ignores him the whole time.

norm: It's rude to tell your partner what to do.
situation: Mark and Marissa are dating and Marissa is employed but also just a different job offer in another state.
intention: Mark wants to help his girlfriend Marissa.
moral_action: Mark asks what Marissa wants to do and tells her he'll be her sounding board if she needs him.
immoral_action: Mark raises his voice and tells Marissa she must take the new job over her old one.

norm: It is wrong to control other people's behavior.
situation: Sal's girlfriend spent a lot of time on the phone with her friends.
intention: Sal wanted his girlfriend to spend more time with him.
moral_action: Sal decided to plan dates for him and his girlfriend in advance to see if he could pry her from the phone.
immoral_action: Sal trying told his girlfriend she had to stop talking to her friends.

norm: People shouldn't appropriate the culture of others.
situation: Liz is running for congress and is trying to get the support of the Native american community.
intention: Liz wants to get as many people to vote for her as possible.
moral_action: Liz listens to the leaders in the Native American community and asks what policies would best help them.
immoral_action: Liz pretends to be half Native American at her rallies, to better appeal to Native voters.

norm: It is wrong to break a vow to someone.
situation: Chris feels that Becky's disability is too much for him to handle, but vowed to stay with her in sickness and in health.
intention: Chris wants to feel less burdened by Becky and her illness.
moral_action: Chris asks Becky if she knows of resources to help spouses of disabled people care for themselves and their loved one better.
immoral_action: Chris leaves Becky, explaining that he can't take care of her anymore and is at his breaking point.

norm: It is wrong to live outside your means.
situation: Sam gets a new job in the big city.
intention: Sam wants to reward himself for his achievment.
moral_action: Sam buys himself a nice steak dinner to celebrate.
immoral_action: Sam spends his money lavishly on cars and an expensive apartment.

norm: It's wrong to depend so much on others.
situation: Jim lost his license because of a DWI, and he has to ask his sister to drive him to work every day.
intention: Mike wants to keep his job.
moral_action: Mike buys a bicycle and is able to get to work on his own without relying on his sister.
immoral_action: Mike insists his sister skip her accounting class to drive him to work one day.

norm: It is wrong to control what another person does.
situation: Dave's wife Amy tells Dave that she is about to go out and do some shopping with her friends.
intention: Dave wants to remind Amy they're on a budget.
moral_action: Dave tells Amy that she should have fun but gently reminds her that the family isn't in a great financial place right now.
immoral_action: Dave tells Amy that she absolutely cannot go shopping since they can't afford it due to their budget, and she is to stay home.

norm: It's wrong to take on responsibilities you can't handle.
situation: Gavin just started a new job.
intention: Gavin wants to prove himself to his boss.
moral_action: Gavin works hard on the first project his boss assigns him.
immoral_action: Gavin volunteers for a project he is not qualified for.

norm: It is wrong to keep someone from something they want.
situation: Tammy overhears Jimmy, who Tammy has a crush on, saying that he likes Tina, who is Tammys best friend.
intention: Tammy wants to talk to Jimmy.
moral_action: Tammy tells Tina that Jimmy likes her.
immoral_action: Feeling jealous, Tammy tells Jimmy that Tina doesn't like him.

norm: It is wrong to threaten to leave someone.
situation: Sara has a partner with a drinking problem and it is taking a toll on the relationship.
intention: Sara wants to discourage the drinking.
moral_action: Sara expresses her concerns over the health issues related to alcoholism.
immoral_action: Sara gives her partner an ultimatum and says she will leave him if he doesn't quit.

norm: It's dishonest not to honor your verbal commitments.
situation: James, the CEO of an up and coming tech firm, has had a verbal contract with a programmer for years.
intention: James wants to hire a more talented programmer.
moral_action: James offers his old programmer a generous severance package and hires the new guy.
immoral_action: James fires his old programmer without severance and hires a new guy.

norm: It's wrong to not explain yourself.
situation: Bill is very moody at work and short with everyone including his boss.
intention: Bill wants to be left alone and have some space.
moral_action: Bill meets with the boos before work explaining that he suddenly lost a pet last night.
immoral_action: Bill shouts and everyone to leave alone and says that things are none of their business.

norm: It is wrong to insist on having your way.
situation: John is in a company meeting for product designs.
intention: John wants to support his favorite design.
moral_action: John makes a case for his favorite design and comes to an amicable decision with his coworkers.
immoral_action: John adamantly argues for a design he likes and will not back down.

norm: It is wrong to ditch obligations.
situation: Juan was sitting at home relaxing when he remembered that he was supposed to take his friend Lonnie to the airport.
intention: Juan wants to decide what to do next.
moral_action: Juan goes and picks up Lonnie like he promised he would.
immoral_action: Juan isn't in the mood to leave home, so he texts Lonnie that he won't be able to drive him.

norm: It's wrong to live beyond the means you have.
situation: Tom is a barista looking for a new car.
intention: Tom wants to impress women as he drives in the park.
moral_action: Tom buys a small car with low payments.
immoral_action: Tom goes heavily in debt to buy a new Corvette.

norm: It is hypocritical to not practice what you preach.
situation: Nate often posts outspoken opinions about family values and morality on facebook.
intention: Nate wants to live his life as he sees fit.
moral_action: Nate stays married for 50 years and lives by example while giving advice to those who ask.
immoral_action: Nate, in reality, is on his third marriage and is known for his poor treatment of women.

norm: Not being accepting of different lifestyle choices is wrong.
situation: Tucker's daughter Anna is getting married to her partner Louise.
intention: Tucker wants to react to the news.
moral_action: Tucker tells Anna that he is happy that she found someone she loves.
immoral_action: Tucker tells Anna he will never approve of her marriage because he was raised to believe two people of the same gender should not be married.

norm: It's wrong to make promises that you can't keep
situation: Tyler just met a new girl and has a big crush on her.
intention: Tyler wants to impress the girl and go out with her.
moral_action: After talking to the girl, Tyler promises to give her a call the next day if she will give him her number.
immoral_action: Tyler tells the girl that he has a boat, which he doesnt, and promises to take her fishing on it.

norm: It's wrong to not repay others.
situation: Steve didn't have enough money to make ends meet, so he asked to borrow some from his friend Tom.
intention: Steve wants to budget for his necessities, so he doesn't come up short again.
moral_action: Steve budgets his money carefully, including what he owes Tom, and pays him back.
immoral_action: Steve makes out a budget, but he forgets about the money he owes Tom and doesn't pay him back.

norm: It's wrong to not consider the feelings of others.
situation: Barry is selecting movies for the movie marathon, and his friend Kasey is triggered by violence.
intention: Barry wants to chose a wide selection of movies.
moral_action: Barry invites Kasey to help select the movies for the marathon.
immoral_action: Barry adds one of the later saw movies into the marathon.

norm: It's wrong not to care about others.
situation: Dennis is planning to propose to his longtime girlfriend Tricia.
intention: Dennis wants the proposal to be special.
moral_action: Dennis proposes to Tricia privately during a moonlight picnic he planned.
immoral_action: Dennis proposes to Tricia at his sister's wedding reception.

norm: It's wrong to not care about yourself in life.
situation: Ryan is shopping at the grocery store.
intention: Ryan wants to get something for dinner.
moral_action: Ryan takes time to make good choices of vegetables and chicken for dinner.
immoral_action: Ryan just grabs potato chips and ice cream for dinner.

norm: It's wrong to postpone keeping yourself or others safe.
situation: Bob keeps putting off buying the new security system because it will take work to install it.
intention: Bob wants to prioritize tasks at work.
moral_action: Bob finally puts the new system in this month and people are happy it's finally there.
immoral_action: Bob puts the system off this month as well, surprising no one.

norm: It's not okay to betray your vows in life.
situation: Jimmy is at the bar with some friends while his wife is at home when an attractive woman asks Jimmy to come home with her.
intention: Jimmy wants to answer the woman's proposal.
moral_action: Jimmy tells the woman that he is a married man who is faithful, so he'll have to decline.
immoral_action: Jimmy tells the woman that he will definitely go home with her, and they can leave right now.

norm: It's wrong to be materialistic in life.
situation: Tory makes a lot of money and is listening to Jane talk about how her kids are her pride.
intention: Tory wants to respond to Jane.
moral_action: Tory says that it's great that Jane values her family and that's inspirational.
immoral_action: Tory says that kids are okay but buying new things is the height of life.

norm: It's wrong to refuse to do your job.
situation: Henry is at the dump where he works when his boss Bill tells him to move some particularly foul garbage to another location.
intention: Henry wants to respond to Bill's request.
moral_action: Henry tells Bill that he'll get right on it and asks him where he wants the pile moved.
immoral_action: Henry tells Bill that the job is disgusting, and he's not doing it and Bill should ask a more junior employee.

norm: It's wrong not to be fair to others.
situation: Lisa collects money from all of her friends to buy concert tickets to an upcoming show, but one friend gives her too much money.
intention: Lisa needs to decide whether to refund the excess money that her friend gave her.
moral_action: Lisa refunds the extra money to her friend, when she gives her the ticket to the show.
immoral_action: Lisa pockets the extra money that her friend had given her, never mentioning that she hadn't spent it on the ticket.

norm: It's wrong to not take someone at their word.
situation: After arguing about his continued friendship with an ex, Frank promises his wife Jan that he will cut off contact with his ex.
intention: Jan wants to make sure Frank will keep his word.
moral_action: Jan makes it clear how hurtful the situation was to her and her hope that he won't put her through that again.
immoral_action: Jan insists on monitoring Franks phone and email for a few months to make sure he cuts off all contact.

norm: It's wrong not to side with your own country.
situation: Aldrich is a government employee with access to secret documents, and he's approached by Yuri who offers to buy access to the documents.
intention: Aldrich wants to respond to Yuri.
moral_action: Aldrich tells Yuri that he cannot sell secrets to the enemy for any sum of money and will report Yuri.
immoral_action: Aldrich tells Yuri to leave a bag of money under the bridge in the park, and he'll leave the documents there.

norm: It's wrong to not take the considerations of others seriously.
situation: James was told by Mike that the volcano was probably going to go off soon.
intention: James wants to decide whether to listen to Mike.
moral_action: James decides to take precautions just incase Mike is right.
immoral_action: James decides that since Mike is not a volcanologist that he won't listen to him.

norm: It's wrong to break one's word.
situation: Karen promised his son that she would take him to a Cubs game if he did his homework.
intention: Karen wants to reward his son if he listens to her.
moral_action: Karen surprises her son with multiple tickets to a Cubs game so that he can bring his friends.
immoral_action: Karen brings her son to a minor league baseball game.

norm: It's wrong to not respect traditions.
situation: Sam's found out his Dad is having a birthday today and the whole family usually gets a cake for birthdays.
intention: Sam wants to celebrate his Dads birthday.
moral_action: Sam celebrates his Dad's birthday that night with a cake, and the family sings a song.
immoral_action: Sam celebrates his Dads birthday that night, although without a cake.

norm: It's cowardly to not stick up for yourself.
situation: Jamie is listening to his best friend Alexander make nasty jokes about him at a party.
intention: Jamie wants to make friends.
moral_action: Jamie tells Alexander to stop making jokes about him with his own witty wordplay.
immoral_action: Jamie gets away from his friend to talk to another group of people.

norm: It's wrong to give into peer pressure.
situation: Aaron, who is 12 years old and is on the track team, is outside his house when one of the older neighborhood kids offers him a cigarette.
intention: Aaron wants to appear mature.
moral_action: Aaron tells him no and that it would hurt his performance in track and field.
immoral_action: Aaron takes the cigarette and smokes it, listening to the older kid's instructions.

norm: It's wrong not to listen to people.
situation: Jessica's friend is telling her about what they did over the weekend but Jessica isn't all that interested.
intention: Jessica wants to do something while her friend tells her about their weekend.
moral_action: Jessica listens to her friend's story and makes some appropriate comments about it.
immoral_action: Jessica mentally blocks out her friend speaking and starts thinking about her own plans for that evening.

norm: It's wrong to refuse to leave somewhere you don't belong.
situation: Charles wanders onto private property and is asked to leave by the owner of the property.
intention: Charles wants to respond to the owner.
moral_action: Charles apologizes to the owner and quickly vacates the private property.
immoral_action: Charles plants his foot and refuses to budge an inch.

norm: It's wrong to not tip someone.
situation: Tom is eating out at a restaurant and the kitchen has overcooked his food.
intention: Tom wants to show that he is unhappy with his meal.
moral_action: Tom points out the problem with his food but tips the server on his way out and later leaves a negative yelp review.
immoral_action: Tom complains about the meal and proceeds to leave no gratuity.

norm: It's wrong to not share what you own with others
situation: Lana is playing her Nintendo Switch when her classmate Steven asks to play.
intention: Lana wants to continue playing games.
moral_action: Lana hands Steven the other side of the remote, and they attempt to complete the one player game together.
immoral_action: Lana declines Steven's request moving to another corner of the room to play her game.

norm: It's wrong to not help others when they need it.
situation: Matt is the manager of a grocery store, and one of his cashiers is asking for a raise because they're struggling.
intention: Matt has to decide whether the cashier should get a raise.
moral_action: Matt decides that the cashier should get a raise and offers them a living wage.
immoral_action: Matt chooses not to give his cashier a raise because he doesn't think they work hard enough.

norm: It's wrong to conform due to societal pressure.
situation: Erica, who plays the tuba, transfers to a new high school, where she knows that being thin is what makes people popular.
intention: Erica wants to make friends.
moral_action: Erica joins the school band and meets other students who share her love of music.
immoral_action: Erica stops eating, so she'll lose weight and get noticed by popular students.

norm: It's wrong to burden other's with something that's your responsibility.
situation: Robert is playing video games with his cousin Sam and notices his garbage can is full.
intention: Robert wants to get rid of the garbage.
moral_action: Robert takes the garbage out and hurries back to play with Sam.
immoral_action: Robert tells Sam to take out the garbage for him.

norm: It's wrong to not respect people close to you.
situation: Andy's dad works at UPS, and he is giving Andy some career advice.
intention: Andy wants to respond to his dad's advice.
moral_action: Andy tells his dad that he'll keep his advice in mind.
immoral_action: Andy tells his dad not to give him any advice since he works at UPS.

norm: It's wrong to not accept others as they are.
situation: Mina's son is very introverted, so he's not very popular in school.
intention: Mina wants to say something to her son.
moral_action: Mina tells his son that he should do whatever that makes him comfortable.
immoral_action: Mina tells her son that he needs to start talking more.

norm: It's wrong to not take responsibility for your own actions.
situation: Danny crashed his car into Doug's when pulling into his driveway.
intention: Danny wants to decide how to deal with the damage.
moral_action: Danny tells Doug right away that he hit Doug's car.
immoral_action: Danny pulls his car back and when Doug notices the damage Danny simply insists it wasn't him.

norm: It's wrong not to give things back.
situation: Lisa finds a dollar on the ground and sees a little girl looking for it.
intention: Lisa wants to tell the little girl that she found her dollar.
moral_action: Lisa walks up to the little girl, shows her the dollar and gives it back to her.
immoral_action: Lisa walks up to the little girl, shows her the dollar and tells her that finders are keepers before walking away.

norm: It's wrong to not try and improve yourself.
situation: Tim and Jamie just had a child, and Jamie wants Ted to lose some weight.
intention: Ted has to decide whether to start going to the gym.
moral_action: Ted wants to be able to see his child grow up, so he starts going to the gym.
immoral_action: Ted realizes that having to go to the gym would not make him happier.

norm: It is wrong not to have morals.
situation: Ken has a lot of plastic bottles in his house that are taking up space.
intention: Ken wants to dispose of the plastic bottles.
moral_action: Ken takes the plastic bottles to a recycling center.
immoral_action: Ken dumps the plastic bottles in a river in town.

norm: It's bad to judge other people based on their sins.
situation: Mark and Bill are talking when Mark admits that he has killed someone in the past.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Mark's admission.
moral_action: Bill tells Mark that we all make mistakes and that he's sure there was a reason why Mark acted the way he did but that it's all over now.
immoral_action: Bill tells Mark that he is a horrible human being for taking someone's life and hopes he never sees Mark again.

norm: It's bad to think mass killers are good.
situation: Jed thoroughly researched a recent mass shooter at LSU on Reddit.
intention: Jed wants people to learn more about mass killers.
moral_action: Jed lists the warning signs that the mass shooter showed in a Reddit post.
immoral_action: Jed creates a subreddit in order to honor the LSU mass shooter.

norm: It's bad to blame others for your problems.
situation: Ariel is thinking about the failures she has made in life.
intention: Ariel wants to feel better about her failures.
moral_action: Ariel accepts the challenge of self-improvement and determines to do better.
immoral_action: Ariel blames her parents' poor child raising skills for her failures.

norm: It's harmful to recruit cult members.
situation: Jack, while high on many different drugs, believed that he saw God, who took the form of a talking walrus.
intention: Jack wants to share his spiritual experience with others.
moral_action: Jack begins attending substance use support groups, so he doesn't end up having crazy hallucinations again.
immoral_action: Jack begins attending grief support groups, so he can find people who are vulnerable to his message about the afterlife.

norm: It's bad to blame all your problems on other people.
situation: Ash is having a terrible string of luck lately and everything seems to be going wrong.
intention: Ash wants to let off some steam and vent.
moral_action: Ash has a nice get together with friends and family.
immoral_action: Ash blames their friends and family for never helping them.

norm: It's bad to try to seek revenge on people.
situation: Jorge and Mark got into an argument when Jorge accidentally rear ended Mark.
intention: Mark wanted to make Jorge know how mad he was.
moral_action: Mark sends a badly worded letter to Jorge to vent his frustrations.
immoral_action: Mark crashes his car into Jorge's on purpose to show him what its like.

norm: It's bad to seek revenge on someone.
situation: An opponent pushes John down hard during a soccer match.
intention: John wants to show up the player who pushed him.
moral_action: John scores the winning goal to achieve victory for his team.
immoral_action: John punches the opposing player in the mouth.

norm: It is bad to bully and steal from people.
situation: Buddy notices a really cool pencil his classmate is holding.
intention: Buddy wants to have a pencil like this one.
moral_action: Buddy tells the classmate how much he likes the pencil and asks where to get one.
immoral_action: Buddy tells his classmate to give him the pencil right now or else.

norm: It's bad to use illicit substances to find happiness.
situation: Larry just finished a rough day at work and walks out to find a parking ticket on his car.
intention: Larry wants to escape from his daily problems.
moral_action: Larry calls his mother on his drive home to vent about his day, and she reminds him of all the good things in his life.
immoral_action: Larry drives home and does drugs in his basement to detach himself from reality.

norm: It's bad to want to be a cult leader.
situation: Mark has lots of experience with managing wealth and has capital to use for a new venture.
intention: Mark wants to set up a wealth management business.
moral_action: Mark decides to run his business without emotional blackmail or cult-like practices.
immoral_action: Mark decides to make it so customers of his business must forfeit all their money under emotional blackmail.

norm: It's bad to support a serial killer's ideas.
situation: Jeffrey is explaining to Ted why he loves eating people and keeping them in his Milwaukee fridge.
intention: Ted wants to interject in Jeffrey's story to tell him how feels about it.
moral_action: Ted tells Jeffrey that it's abhorrent that he harms other living beings and to boot that he eats them after.
immoral_action: Ted tells Jeffrey that it's genius to keep the bodies in a fridge to snack on later and that he should have thought of that.

norm: It's bad to envy evil people.
situation: Teddy is talking with a coworker during lunch break.
intention: Teddy wants to talk about a nefarious politician.
moral_action: Teddy brings up the politician and listens to his coworker.
immoral_action: Teddy says he believes in the politician and voices some heavy opinions.

norm: It's bad to beat yourself up for a mistake.
situation: Amanda made a mistake in a report at work and it created some problems for her team.
intention: Amanda wants to make sure her team knows she is sorry about the mistake.
moral_action: Amanda apologizes to her coworkers and tells them everything will be alright and that she will take care of everything.
immoral_action: Amanda repeatedly apologizes to her team for the mistake, telling them she is not good enough, and an idiot.

norm: It is bad to hurt the planet for personal gain.
situation: Dana is a CEO of a large industrial company at a board meeting and is told one of the plants is losing money.
intention: Dana needs to find a way to cut costs at the plant.
moral_action: Dana tells the board that they will have to temporarily lay off a percentage of the staff.
immoral_action: Dana tells the board that she's ordering the plant to cease the costly waste disposal method and to dump waste in the nearby river.

norm: It's bad to body shame other people.
situation: Lisa was really excited because her high school was putting on a fashion show to raise money for the new gymnasium.
intention: Lisa wanted to be a model for the fashion show.
moral_action: Lisa was invited to model because they wanted to make sure they included everyone who was interested in the show.
immoral_action: Lisa was told by the other kids that she was too fat to be a model, and she would ruin the show.

norm: It's bad to pretend to be inhabited by evil spirits.
situation: Cameron is hanging out with his highly religious friend Andrew on Halloween.
intention: Cameron wants to scare Andrew.
moral_action: Cameron takes Andrew to a haunted house and jumps at him at the end to scare him.
immoral_action: Cameron makes a creepy expression and tells Andrew that he has been possessed by the ghost of a murderer.

norm: It's bad to highly value drinking.
situation: Elysse is having a busy season at work.
intention: Elysse wants to find a way to relax every night.
moral_action: Elysse takes a warm bath every night after work.
immoral_action: Elysse drinks a bottle of wine every night after work.

norm: It is bad to fight bullying with bullying.
situation: Kelsey has learned that her younger sister Deena has been bullying other kids at her school.
intention: Kelsey wants to teach Deena that being a bully is wrong.
moral_action: Kelsey tells their parents what Deena has been doing.
immoral_action: Kelsey figures out what Deena has being doing to the other kids and starts doing the same to Deena at home.

norm: It's bad to work for a business that commits crimes.
situation: Rory is unemployed and has been approached by a friend who is part of a criminal organization with a job offer.
intention: Rory wants to earn a high salary.
moral_action: Rory decides to study and get a degree in order to get a high paying job.
immoral_action: Rory decides to take a job with his friend despite knowing what the company does.

norm: It's bad to play the blame game with people.
situation: Linda works in a lab with others and often is careless with tests.
intention: Linda wants to avoid getting in trouble for bad job performance.
moral_action: Linda owns her mistakes and works on improving them.
immoral_action: Linda accuses others of making the mistakes and tries to other depaartments.

norm: It's bad to guilt people into things.
situation: Casey's son Derek wants to go play with his friends, but Casey has some family time planned.
intention: Casey wants Derek to stay home this evening.
moral_action: Casey tells Derek that she has a fun time planned and that Derek will enjoy it very much.
immoral_action: Casey tells Derek that he doesn't care about her and would rather run off with his friends like an ungrateful son.

norm: It's bad to like people who exhibit criminal tendencies.
situation: Felicia realizes she's falling for Phil, an excon biker in a motorcycle gang who she's dating and her parents urge her to break it off.
intention: Felicia needs to decide whether to listen to her parents.
moral_action: Felicia decides it's best to end things with Phil as he doesn't seem like good relationship material.
immoral_action: Felicia decides to continue dating Phil in spite of her parent's wishes.

norm: It's bad to try to punish your friends.
situation: Sal is annoyed with his friend but his friend is inviting Sal over.
intention: Sal needs to choose how to respond.
moral_action: Sal accepts and says that he needs to clear something up with his friend.
immoral_action: Sal tells his friend that he's not in the mood.

norm: Promoting violence against a certain race is wrong.
situation: Jim was in a bar, and a stranger he met was trying to have him join a white supremacist organization.
intention: Jim wants to respond to the offer.
moral_action: Jim tells the stranger to get away from him and calls him despicable.
immoral_action: Jim hates people of color, so he decides to join the organization.

norm: It's bad to be cruel to homeless people.
situation: Dudley sees a crowded street filled with people blocking the way.
intention: Dudley wants to get through.
moral_action: Dudley tries to ask people to move out of his way and many of them ignore him.
immoral_action: Dudley pushes over the homeless person since they matter much less than the others.

norm: It's bad to prematurely judge others due to stereotyping.
situation: Erica is a bookworm whose friends have invited her to a party at a football player's house on a school night.
intention: Erica wants to talk her friends out of going to the party.
moral_action: Erica tells her friends she's sure the football player is a great guy, but they shouldn't go out on school nights.
immoral_action: "Erica tells her friends they shouldn't want to hang out with a ""dumb jock""."

norm: It's bad to beat someone up for being different.
situation: There is a new foreign exchange student at Kevin's school, and he doesn't speak much English.
intention: Kevin needs to show the student where classes are.
moral_action: Kevin shows the student around and tries to help him understand English better.
immoral_action: Kevin is showing the new student around and, frustrated by his lack of English skills, smacks him in the mouth.

norm: It's not okay to not appreciate a gift.
situation: Mike gets a gift of a cheese basket from an uncle on Christmas.
intention: Mike wants to get a different gift.
moral_action: Mike thanks his uncle but explains that he cannot have cheese due to dietary restrictions.
immoral_action: Mike makes a rude comment, sighs and quickly throws the gift aside.

norm: It's not okay to be unhygeinic.
situation: Juan works in a crowded office and has a long lunch break every day.
intention: Juan wants to go jogging during his lunch breaks.
moral_action: Juan runs during his lunch break, goes to the bathroom to freshen up, and puts on clean clothes.
immoral_action: Juan runs during his lunch break and returns to his desk sweaty and stinky.

norm: It's not okay to have a double standard about things.
situation: Philip runs a small stock trading company that has an even number of male and female traders.
intention: Philip wants his company to succeed.
moral_action: Philip assess his traders individually and sends his strongest traders the best accounts regardless of sex.
immoral_action: Philip believes that men are more aggressive than women, so he sends male employees the larger accounts.

norm: It's not okay to throw away things you can use.
situation: Jonah's wardrobe is stuffed after he purchased a lot of new clothes.
intention: Jonah wants to declutter his wardrobe.
moral_action: Jonah donates his old clothes to a charity.
immoral_action: Jonah puts all his old in the garbage.

norm: It's not okay to make light of a disability.
situation: Timothy's and his brother whom is handicapped and can't walk are playing at the park.
intention: Timothy wants to have a friendly competition with his brother.
moral_action: Timothy finds a table and challenges his brother to an arm wrestling contest.
immoral_action: Timothy challenges his brother to a race around the park.

norm: It's not okay to lead someone on.
situation: John finds out that Mary has a crush on him.
intention: John wants to get Mary to stop flirting with him.
moral_action: John directly informs Mary that he isn't interested in a relationship.
immoral_action: John acts ambiguous around Mary, hoping she'll get the message.

norm: It's not okay to not finish what you start.
situation: Jim is exhausted from working on a labor intensive project all day.
intention: Jim wants to go to bed to rest his body.
moral_action: Jim chooses to get some rest and start again fresh in the morning.
immoral_action: Jim decides to quit on the project due to how much labor it requires and turns in for the night.

norm: It's not okay to over estimate your abilities.
situation: Anthony just got hired at a large factory and his first day is today.
intention: Anthony has to move a pallet of goods to a different location in the factory.
moral_action: Anthony asks a coworker if they can help him move the pallet and instruct him on how to use the forklift.
immoral_action: Anthony see's an unused fork lift and although he has no formal training, he is confident he can use it just fine.

norm: It's not okay to break a promise
situation: Keith promised his roommate that he would help clean up the apartment.
intention: Keith wants to go to see a movie.
moral_action: Keith helps his roommate with the cleaning then goes to a late showing at the cinema.
immoral_action: Keith goes to see an early showing at the cinema leaving his roommate to do all the cleaning.

norm: It's not okay to over indulge.
situation: Aaron is trying to lose weight but tonight he doesn't have time to cook, and he decides to order delivery.
intention: Aaron wants to eat dinner.
moral_action: Aaron orders a small veggie pizza and eats a portion of it, then puts the rest of the food away for the next day.
immoral_action: Aaron orders an extra large supreme pizza and eats the entire thing by himself in one sitting.

norm: It's not okay to be demanding.
situation: Ichiro wants to go to the park, but his mother is busy working on her computer.
intention: Ichiro wants to have fun.
moral_action: Ichiro invites his friend over to play his favorite park games in his backyard.
immoral_action: Ichiro asks in mother to take him to the park every five minutes.

norm: It's not okay to put someone one the spot.
situation: Randy is having lunch with coworkers and witnesses one of them lying to another.
intention: Randy wants to find out why his coworker lied to the the other one.
moral_action: Randy waits to ask his coworker about it later in private.
immoral_action: Randy calls out his coworker in front of all the others.

norm: It is not okay to brag
situation: Jan's friend is talking to her about the new purse she bought, but Jan's purse is much more expensive.
intention: Jan wants to compare her friend's purse to hers.
moral_action: Jan tells her friend that she likes her purse more than her own.
immoral_action: Jan tells her friend that her purse is so much nicer than Jan's.

norm: It's not okay to use the word retarded anymore.
situation: Rich came to his friend Ron's house and noticed that his friend has a brother with cerebral palsy.
intention: Rich wanted to make a comment on Ron's brother.
moral_action: Rich tells his brother that he should've told him that he had a brother.
immoral_action: Rich tells Ron that he didn't know that he had a retarded brother.

norm: It's not okay to let your studies go.
situation: Adam is tired of studying so hard for his college classes and needs a break.
intention: Adam wants to take some time to relax.
moral_action: Adam takes a few hours out of each day to relax after studying.
immoral_action: Adam stops studying entirely and spends his all of his time relaxing.

norm: It is rude to disturb the people around you.
situation: John is at the school library trying to study for finals surrounded by other students.
intention: John wants to ask a fellow student who's not present a question about study materials.
moral_action: John steps outside the library to make his phone call to the other student.
immoral_action: John calls his fellow student from the library and has a long animated discussion with him.

norm: It is rude to intentionally block an entrance.
situation: James is demonstrating his passionate opposition to abortion by protesting outside a women's health clinic.
intention: James wants to stop women from getting abortions.
moral_action: James stands beside the doorway and calls the woman walking past him babykillers.
immoral_action: James physically blocks the entrance to the clinic and pushes the patients away if they come too close.

norm: Its is rude to interrupt anyone private time
situation: Charlene's niece starts crying while she is babysitting.
intention: Charlene wants to find a way to calm her niece down.
moral_action: Charlene soothes her niece as she looks up ways to calm her down.
immoral_action: Charlene calls her brother to ask what to do and interrupts his date night with his wife.

norm: It's rude to wake people up.
situation: Emily lives with family and arrives home quite late but is very excited after receiving some good news.
intention: Emily wants to listen to her favorite song to keep the good vibe going.
moral_action: Emily listens to her music using a pair of headphones.
immoral_action: Emily cranks up the stereo and puts on her favorite song.

norm: It is rude to keep someone out of a room.
situation: Sally is playing a video game in her room when her sister knocks on the door.
intention: Sally wants to keep playing her game.
moral_action: Sally let's her sister in her room and goes back to playing her video game.
immoral_action: Sally locks her door and goes back to playing her video game.

norm: It is rude to ignore people at an event.
situation: Lance got into an argument with his friend Brock before the party.
intention: Lance wants to enjoy the party.
moral_action: Lance talks to Brock at the party to try and get over the argument.
immoral_action: Lance ignores Brock so that he can enjoy the event without him.

norm: It is rude to not invite people to an event.
situation: Jo is throwing a Christmas party at the office for her employees.
intention: Jo wants to send out invitations.
moral_action: Jo invites everyone who works with her thinking the more the merrier.
immoral_action: Jo only invites to her favorite workers thinking they deserve a reward.

norm: It is rude to invade someone's privacy.
situation: Larry notices his brother is studying hard in his room but there is a package for his brother downstairs.
intention: Larry wants to speak to his brother about the package.
moral_action: Larry waits for his brother to finished studying, after which Larry informs his brother of the package.
immoral_action: Larry barges into his brothers room while his brother is studying, to inform him of the package.

norm: It's rude to disturb the peace in an open area
situation: Paula is taking her kids for a walk through a park near a retirement home where a bunch of old people are resting in hammocks setup in the parks trees.
intention: Paula wants to keep her children away from the out folks.
moral_action: Paula runs and grabs her children and whispers to them that they need to stay on the walking path.
immoral_action: Paula yells loudly at her children to stay on the walking path.

norm: It is rude to exclude someone from a game.
situation: Jose was picking a team to play a pick-up basketball game, and one guy was left out of the teams.
intention: Jose has to decide what to tell the last guy.
moral_action: Jose tells the guy that he can be a substitute for his team.
immoral_action: Jose tells the guy to get lost, because he's not good enough.

norm: It is rude to disrupt other people at an event.
situation: Anthony takes some fireworks with him to the outdoor concert.
intention: Anthony wants to set off the fireworks.
moral_action: Anthony moves away from the crowd, and up a small hill, to light his fireworks.
immoral_action: Anthony starts lighting the fireworks in the middle of a crowd of people.

norm: It's rude to disturb people in a public setting.
situation: Carol is eating at a restaurant when she notices her district's political representative whose policies she disagrees with sitting nearby, so she walks over to his table.
intention: Caroline wants to express her displeasure at the representative.
moral_action: Caroline asks for the representative's contact info and then later that evening sends him an email stating her problems with his policies.
immoral_action: Caroline  raises her voice at him and begins asking him questions about his policies and motives.

norm: It is rude to exclude people from events.
situation: Uzuri is sending out invites for her birthday party, and she's worried that her gossiping coworker Samantha will cause drama.
intention: Uzuri wants to create a fun atmosphere.
moral_action: Uzuri calls Samantha expressing her concerns and makes Samantha promise not to cause trouble at the party.
immoral_action: Uzuri invites all of her coworkers except Samantha to the part.

norm: It is rude to not attend a meeting.
situation: Harold has a meeting scheduled with his boss at eight o clock.
intention: Harold wants to go to work in the morning.
moral_action: Harold makes sure to get to work early enough to go to the meeting.
immoral_action: Harold gets to work at nine o clock in the morning and disregards the meeting even took place.

norm: It is rude to touch someone uninvited.
situation: Clint is at the bar when he notices a girl he finds attractive.
intention: Clint wants to let the girl know he's interested in her.
moral_action: Clint talks to the girl and compliments her.
immoral_action: Clint puts his arm around the girl's shoulders.

norm: It's rude to wake people up in a surprising way.
situation: Sharon is still in bed resting, but she is supposed to get up to take her kids to school, and her husband, James is in the kitchen making coffee.
intention: James wants Sharon to get out of bed.
moral_action: James walks into the room with coffee for the aroma to wake Sharon.
immoral_action: James walks in the room where Sharon is and screams for her to get up.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on people you love.
situation: Jeff is at a bar without his wife, when a beautiful woman starts flirting with him and invites him back to her place.
intention: Jeff wants to spend intimate time with a woman.
moral_action: Jeff is flattered but turns her down and returns home to be with his wife.
immoral_action: Jeff leaves the bar with the woman and spend the night at her apartment.

norm: You shouldn't pester someone constantly about doing something for you.
situation: Harry always feels proud when his home and property look their best.
intention: Harry wants his lawn to look freshly mowed when his family visits on the weekend.
moral_action: Harry tells his neighbor Charlie when he happens to see him, how he appreciates him mowing his lawn before his family comes.
immoral_action: Harry calls his neighbor Charlie every day reminding him that he said he would mow his lawn before the weekend.

norm: People shouldn't interfere with someone's love life.
situation: Mary's friend Heather is fighting with her boyfriend Bob and thinking of breaking up with him.
intention: Mary wants to be a supportive friend to Heather.
moral_action: Mary's stays out of it but tells Heather that she is there to talk if needed.
immoral_action: Mary encourages Heather to break up with Bob and starts bashing Bob to others.

norm: You shouldn't try to sabotage someone's life.
situation: Rev and Rae broke up a month ago and Rev is still very angry about it.
intention: Rev wants to find a release for his anger.
moral_action: Rev starts to work out more and see a psych.
immoral_action: Rev posts something embarassing on Rae's social media account, getting revenge.

norm: Brothers shouldn't hurt each other.
situation: Dan and his brother are playing touch football in their backyard.
intention: Dan wants to get a touchdown.
moral_action: Dan runs really fast and wide of his brother with the football.
immoral_action: Dan runs at his brother and knocks him to the ground violently, breaking his wrist.

norm: You shouldn't tell lies to get ahead in life.
situation: Jim is preparing to submit his application to a high paying position which is expected to get hundreds of applications.
intention: Jim wants to stand out from the rest of the applicants.
moral_action: Jim is honest on his resume but spends extra time preparing for the interview.
immoral_action: Jim adds fictitious experience to his resume, to make it seem like he is the perfect fit.

norm: You shouldn't let the damage of property ruin a friendship.
situation: Carly threw a ball to her friend, Sammy, and accidentally broke her lamp.
intention: Sammy wants Carly to pay for the broken lamp.
moral_action: Sammy accepts the money from Carly and tells her not to feel bad about the lamp.
immoral_action: Sammy accepts the money from Carly but tells her that she doesn't want to be friends anymore.

norm: You shouldn't ruin other people's relationships.
situation: Dave is at the bar when he witnesses his friend Tony talking to a woman that's not Tony's wife.
intention: Dave wants to tell someone what he just saw.
moral_action: Dave calls his own wife and tells her that he's seeing his friend Tony talk to a strange woman.
immoral_action: Dave calls Tony's wife and tells her that he saw Tony with another strange woman.

norm: You shouldn't lose contact with someone you love.
situation: John and his girlfriend has a long distance relationship.
intention: John wants to manage his communications with his girlfriend.
moral_action: John maintains steady contact with his girlfriend until they meet again in person.
immoral_action: John starts to call his girlfriend less and misses the calls from his girlfriend.

norm: You shouldn't break someone's heart over and over again.
situation: James isn't especially happy in his current relationship, but doubts his ability to find another partner.
intention: James wants a more satisfying relationship.
moral_action: James breaks up with his girlfriend permanently and endures some loneliness while trying to find a new one.
immoral_action: James constantly breaks up with his girlfriend then makes up a few weeks later.

norm: Siblings shouldn't intentionally hurt each other.
situation: Jeff was playing outside in the backyard with his little brother Jack.
intention: Jeff wanted Jack to leave him alone.
moral_action: Jeff told his brother he was going play at a friend's house.
immoral_action: Jeff punched Jack and told him to stay away from him.

norm: You shouldn't say something hurtful to your spouse.
situation: Millie thinks her husband is not involved enough in house chores and finds it frustrating.
intention: Millie wants to vent out her frustration.
moral_action: Millie tells her husband that she is tired of doing almost everything around the house and asks if he could help her with it.
immoral_action: Millie tells her husband how frustrated she is and tells him she thinks he is selfish and unhelpful.

norm: You shouldn't do things that may damage someone else's relationship.
situation: Dan and Troy are hanging out, and they have a history of pulling pranks on each other.
intention: Dan wants to prank Troy.
moral_action: Dan pretends that he's having the beginning stages of a heart attack and begs for help.
immoral_action: Dan calls Troy's wife and tells her that he just saw Troy with another woman.

norm: You shouldn't try to sabotage someone's relationship.
situation: Jane is upset at her friend Mary for not inviting her to a ski trip and notices Mary's boyfriend eating dinner alone at a restaurant.
intention: Jane wants to consider spreading a harmful rumor involving Mary's boyfriend.
moral_action: Jane decides to not spread any rumors at all and just forget about the ski trip.
immoral_action: Jane spreads a rumor about Mary's boyfriend eating dinner with another girl.

norm: You shouldn't expect a significant other to change for you.
situation: Anna is bothered by her partner's smoking, and he was a smoker since before they started dating.
intention: Anna wants to convince her partner to stop smoking.
moral_action: Anna expresses her concern about the health consequences but lets her partner decide what to do.
immoral_action: Anna starts to bring the subject of quitting regularly to her partner.

norm: You shouldn't say things to hurt your significant other
situation: Jenelle's boyfriend Kieffer spent two hours cooking dinner for her, but Jenelle finds the dish under-seasoned.
intention: Jenelle wants to make conversation during the dinner.
moral_action: Jenelle discusses the weather and her day, and eats the dinner after adding some salt.
immoral_action: Jenelle tells Kieffer that the dinner does not taste good, and she is going to go out to pick up food from McDonald's.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage someone's marriage.
situation: Jared's friend's wife, who has a sister of similar age, is very attractive and Jared is attracted to her.
intention: Jared wants to have a woman for himself.
moral_action: Jared asks his friend's wife if he can be introduced to her sister as someone to possibly date.
immoral_action: Jared works to undermine his friend's marriage by talking with one or the other and spreading gossip.

norm: You should not go against your significant others wishes
situation: Dave and his wife are looking at cars at a dealership, and she wants him to buy a red car she sees there.
intention: Dave wants to come back to the dealership later and buy a car.
moral_action: Dave goes back to the dealership and buys the red car his wife liked.
immoral_action: Dave returns to the dealership and buys a blue car that he prefers over the red one his wife liked.

norm: It is wrong to withhold information from a partner.
situation: Jeff is in a relationship with Tiarah, and they're at the mall shopping.
intention: Jeff needs to give Tiarah feedback on a dress she's considering, which she looks ridiculous in.
