moral_action: Will asks the manager to take on some extra shifts and earn more money.
immoral_action: Will begs the health guests for extra money, saying that he is poor.

norm: It's unhealthy to accept abuse from somebody else
situation: Tom has been in a long term emotionally abusive relationship with someone.
intention: Tom wants to avoid confrontation.
moral_action: Tom stands his ground and dumps his partner giving them no room to even confront him by cutting them off completely.
immoral_action: Tom pretends everything is okay in order to avoid fighting.

norm: It's wrong to judge a person by looks.
situation: Karen is interviewing potential nannies for her child.
intention: Karen wants the best nanny for her child.
moral_action: Karen carefully looks over each application and references to help her pick, ignoring individual appearance.
immoral_action: Karen immediately cuts short an interview with a tattooed nanny despite her impressive references.

norm: It's wrong to mock people.
situation: Jim is sitting in the quad between classes chatting with some classmates.
intention: Jim wants to entertain his classmates.
moral_action: Jim tells a funny joke that he learned the other day.
immoral_action: Jim walks behind a disabled person imitating their limp.

norm: It's wrong to brag about your things.
situation: James and Nick are talking about who has the better collection of video games.
intention: James wants to win the argument.
moral_action: James talks about his rarest game, Nintendo world Championships.
immoral_action: James brags about the big house he can store all of his games in while Nick has to jam all his into a walk-in closet.

norm: It's wrong to use things that aren't yours.
situation: Sam is very tired and hungry upon arriving home after a long day of work.
intention: Sam wants to avoid using too much energy making dinner.
moral_action: Sam orders a pizza as an easy fix.
immoral_action: Sam uses his roommate's leftovers with a couple other ingredients to make a quick and easy meal.

norm: It's wrong to take someone else's ideas as your own.
situation: Jeff's friend John tells Jeff about a great new technology idea John had that could make tons of money.
intention: Jeff wants to make money.
moral_action: Jeff decides to fun John's idea in exchange for a share in John's profits.
immoral_action: Jeff decides to copy John's idea and get it to market before John does.

norm: It is wrong to be with multiple partners.
situation: John is on a dating website when he receives date requests from five women.
intention: John doesn't want to hurt anyone.
moral_action: John chooses one of the women to date, and he sets the other women up with his attractive single friends.
immoral_action: John dates all of the women at the same time.

norm: It's wrong to judge yourself by the standards of others.
situation: Amanda notices the valedictorian last year had a huge resume and got into all the top colleges.
intention: Amanda wants to get into a top college.
moral_action: Amanda puts her actual activities on her resume.
immoral_action: Amanda puts activities on her college resume that are likely to look good to colleges, even if she didnt do them.

norm: It's wrong to look at someone's private comments.
situation: Josiah buys a cell phone from his friend Beth, who forgot to delete her text messages before giving it.
intention: Josiah wants to send a text message.
moral_action: Josiah enters the texting app, sees the messages, deletes them to clear space, and sends his own message.
immoral_action: Josiah enters the texting app, sees the messages, sends his message, and reads through the undeleted ones.

norm: It's repugnant to abuse someone else.
situation: James has a headache after a stressful day at work and his baby keeps crying.
intention: James wants peace and quiet.
moral_action: James pays his neighbor to watch the baby while James goes for a walk.
immoral_action: James locks his baby in a closet in the far opposite corner of the house.

norm: It's wrong to take things from people that aren't yours.
situation: Giselle's mom only buys regular wooden pencils for her to bring to school, and she sees her schoolmates with fancy mechanical pencils.
intention: Giselle wants a mechanical pencil.
moral_action: Giselle brings her allowance with her to the store and buys a mechanical pencil.
immoral_action: Giselle picks a mechanical pencil out of someone else's art box when they are not looking.

norm: It's wrong to hit others.
situation: Bob's son Biff punched a classmate in the nose at recess.
intention: Bob wants to impress on Biff that hitting his classmates is unacceptable.
moral_action: Biff calmly explains that violence is unacceptable and that he is disappointed in Biff's behavior.
immoral_action: Bob spanks Biff and threatens to do so again if Biff ever raises a hand to a classmate.

norm: It's wrong to assume things about others.
situation: Bill notices that a friend who once struggled with substance abuse is looking extremely run down and behaving strangely.
intention: Bill wants to be there to help his friend.
moral_action: Bill approaches his friend sincerely and asks what has been going on.
immoral_action: Bill assumes his friend is getting back into drugs and offers up some advice.

norm: It's wrong to put others down.
situation: Dave is relaxing in the living room when his wife Cindy comes in wearing a new dress and asks him how he likes it.
intention: Dave wants to answer Cindy's question.
moral_action: Dave tells Cindy that she looks gorgeous and the dress fits her style perfectly.
immoral_action: Dave tells Cindy that since she's old and no longer can look good in anything so the dress doesn't really matter.

norm: It's wrong to force your opinions on other people.
situation: Elsa, a socialist, listens to her capitalist father make a joke about the economy during lunch.
intention: Elsa wants to comment on the joke.
moral_action: Elsa asks her father to explain his joke.
immoral_action: Elsa spends the next thirty minutes pointing out the issues with the joke and talking about socialism.

norm: It's wrong to throw things at others.
situation: Josh is holding onto a textbook in his hands during an intense argument with his boyfriend.
intention: Josh wants to defend himself.
moral_action: Josh asserts his opinions to his angry boyfriend by talking about his feelings, and asks Josh to let him in.
immoral_action: Josh tosses his textbook at his boyfriend as he slowly backs away.

norm: It's wrong to encourage people to target others.
situation: Laura is giving a speech about the importance of protecting the environment.
intention: Laura wants to inspire her listeners to take action.
moral_action: Laura tells her listeners ways they can make changes in their life that can help the environment.
immoral_action: Laura tells her listeners that peaceful action is no longer viable and to take arms against those who would harm the planet.

norm: It's wrong not doing your fair share in a group.
situation: Lara is scheduled to work on a group project on Saturday with two of her classmates.
intention: Lara wants to go out and party on Friday night.
moral_action: Lara goes to a party on Friday but leaves early so that she won't be tired at the group meeting on Saturday.
immoral_action: Lara goes out and parties on Friday where she drinks heavily, causing her to be hungover and not contribute much at the group meeting.

norm: It is wrong to use others.
situation: Kelly's boyfriend needs to borrow some money from her for rent.
intention: Sally wants to help her boyfriend.
moral_action: Sally does work for her neighbor in exchange for money.
immoral_action: Sally is nice to her neighbor that she doesn't like to get money from them.

norm: It's wrong to try to change people.
situation: Kelly has a new boyfriend, Greg, who is an amateur stand-up comic, and she is coming to see his act tonight.
intention: Kelly wants to react to Greg's comedy.
moral_action: Kelly sees that Greg uses real life experiences and understands that people relate better to him because of it.
immoral_action: Kelly hears a lot of personal stories in Greg's act, and she tells him that he shouldn't use real life experiences.

norm: It's wrong to use other people
situation: Lara is at a networking event with others in her field.
intention: Lara wants to make connections for a job.
moral_action: Lara asks her friend Francine to come to the event with her, so they can both network.
immoral_action: Lara drops her friend Francine's name as a business contact, even though they never worked together.

norm: It's wrong to judge people based on superficial factors.
situation: Candace is moving into her new college dorm and meeting her new roomate.
intention: Candace wants to be around the best people at school.
moral_action: Candace asks Janine about her background and finds out she is the first from her family to go to college.
immoral_action: Candace won't hang out with her roommate Janine because Janine wears very plain clothes.

norm: It's wrong to look down on others.
situation: Susan is going to go out to a fancy party with Emily, but Emily is wearing jeans and a tshirt.
intention: Susan wants to attract positive attention.
moral_action: Susan lends Emily a nice dress to wear.
immoral_action: Susan tells Emily she won't be seen in public with her dressed like that.

norm: It's wrong to rip up something that someone else made
situation: John and his coworker Pete are both tasked with submitting a marketing plan to their boss but only one will be chosen.
intention: John wants his marketing plan to be chosen.
moral_action: John stays up late working hard on his marketing proposal to ensure it is high quality.
immoral_action: John finds Pete's submission and tears it into tiny pieces so that his boss will not get it.

norm: It's wrong to peep on others.
situation: Hugh is dating Susan, and he is in her apartment while she is changing her clothes for their date.
intention: Hugh wants to see Susan naked.
moral_action: Hugh waits in the other room, then charms her on their date.
immoral_action: Hugh peeks in on Susan as she is getting undressed.

norm: It's wrong to take something that belongs to someone else.
situation: Stacey always brings lunch to work, but today she forgot her lunch.
intention: Stacey wants to wants to get something to eat.
moral_action: Stacey decides to go to the cafeteria to see if she can get something for lunch.
immoral_action: Stacey looks in the fridge in the break room and takes a coworker's sandwich to eat.

norm: It's wrong to force yourself onto others.
situation: Kamala is lonely, and has lately been talking as acquaintances with the cute boy in class.
intention: Kamala wants to be the boy's friend.
moral_action: Kamala begins slowly ramping up the conversations to more intimate things.
immoral_action: Kamala gets the boys number, and then calls him every few hours to chat.

norm: It's wrong to dirty up other people's things.
situation: Steven's car is at the mechanic's getting fixed, so his friend Rocco has lent him one of his cars to drive around for the week.
intention: Steven wants to go fishing.
moral_action: After a day of fishing, Steven changes into clean clothes and puts his fish in a secure cooler before getting into Rocco's car to drive home.
immoral_action: Steven spends a day fishing before returning to Rocco's car in muddy boots and spilling a bucket of fish all over the back seat.

norm: It's wrong to do things just to get attention.
situation: Bob is upset that his sister gets all the attention even though she always breaks the rules.
intention: Bob wants attention for himself.
moral_action: Bob decides to continue to be good and be happy with attention from teachers and friends.
immoral_action: Bob decides that breaking the rules gets his sister attention, so he'll break rules too.

norm: It's wrong to expose yourself to unwanting eyes
situation: Don lives in a busy suburban neighborhood where many kids play outside all day.
intention: Don wants to relax comfortably in his house on the weekend.
moral_action: Don finds comfortable tshirts and shorts to wear when he is home.
immoral_action: Don walks through his house nude without checking his windows through the day.

norm: It's wrong to shove people.
situation: Mary is hurrying down the street to an urgent appointment but a man is walking slowly taking up the way in front of her.
intention: Mary wants to get the man to move out of her way.
moral_action: Mary asks the man in front of her to let her pass by him.
immoral_action: Mary pushes the man in front of her aside and continues rushing down the street.

norm: It's wrong to gossip about others.
situation: Habiki is having a conversation with her crush when her sister Misa texts her details about her personal life.
intention: Habiki wants to entertain her crush.
moral_action: Habiki tells her crush theories about their favorite show.
immoral_action: Habiki tells her crush about her sister's personal life.

norm: It's wrong to lash out at people.
situation: Scott's feelings are hurt when his friend George insults his new haircut.
intention: Scott wants to let George know how he feels.
moral_action: Without raising his voice, Scott lets George know how his words were hurtful to him.
immoral_action: Scott raises his voice to a high level and tells George what he thinks of his words in an aggressive way.

norm: It is wrong to tell people how to feel.
situation: Georgia is talking to her friend when her friend tells her that she was sexually assaulted.
intention: Georgia wants to help her friend get over the bad experience.
moral_action: George tells her friend she understands how she feels and is there for her.
immoral_action: Georgia tells her friend that she should be grateful for the attention.

norm: It's wrong to take other people's things.
situation: Don needs a red pen and sees one on his co-worker's desk.
intention: Don wants the red pen.
moral_action: Don asks his co-worker if he can borrow the red pen.
immoral_action: Don takes the red pen without permission from his co-worker.

norm: It's wrong to do things behind people's backs.
situation: Kinsley and Tom are a married couple and Tom doesn't like Kinsley's new friend Tiffany, who he thinks is a bad influence on Kinsley.
intention: Kinsley wants to go out to lunch with Tiffany.
moral_action: Kinsley tells Tom that she's going to go out to lunch with Tiffany and that he's welcome to join them.
immoral_action: Kinsley goes out to lunch with Tiffany without telling Tom, something that she knows he will disapprove of.

norm: It's wrong to pick on other people
situation: Kyle, who is paralyzed in a wheelchair is at his first day of high school, and Jason see's him wheeling up.
intention: Jason wants to say something to Kyle.
moral_action: Jason introduces himself to Kyle and offers to show him around the campus.
immoral_action: Jason approaches Kyle and sarcastically says, you can hide, but you can't run.

norm: It's wrong to give away something that isn't yours.
situation: Oakley needs to make his student loan payment, and someone wants to pay him forty dollars for his roomate's favorite figure.
intention: Oakley wants to get money.
moral_action: Oakley sells some of his old things at a thrift store for cash.
immoral_action: Oakley sells his roomate's figure to get cash.

norm: It is wrong to troll others.
situation: John enjoys participating in the comments section of youtube videos and sees an opinion of a video posted that he does not agree with.
intention: John wants to respond to the opinion.
moral_action: John replies to the comment, laying out a well-reasoned case for why John has a different opinion.
immoral_action: John replies to the comment, calling the other poster a big dumb idiot and telling them their opinion sucks.

norm: It's wrong to throw out other people's stuff.
situation: Lisa lives in an apartment with her roommate Beverly.
intention: Lisa wants to clean the apartment.
moral_action: Lisa gathers the personal papers Beverly has left in the living room and puts them in Beverly's room.
immoral_action: Lisa gathers the personal papers Beverly has left in the living room and puts them in the dumpster.

norm: It's wrong to con someone.
situation: Ashley, who quit an MLM, wants to sell her remaining stock of essential oils, and she notices Sandy complaining about hair loss.
intention: Ashley wants to get rid of her products.
moral_action: Ashley uses the oils to create custom soap bars, and gives samples to her friends and family.
immoral_action: Ashley tells her friend that her product cures hair loss, and sells him the product at a marked up price.

norm: It's wrong to try to take someone's belonging from them.
situation: Sally was sitting on a bench waiting for the bus when she sees a woman forget her purse when she gets up to board the bus.
intention: Sally wants to return the purse.
moral_action: Sally picks up the purse and hurries to bring it to the woman before she leaves.
immoral_action: Sally picks up the purse and takes the money from it before returning it to the woman.

norm: It's wrong to judge entire groups
situation: Dennis is at work when his boss introduces him to a new black coworker James.
intention: Dennis wants to tell something useful about the workplace to James.
moral_action: Dennis tells James that they have a cafeteria downstairs with good food and a gym with a lot of amenities for employee use.
immoral_action: Dennis tells James that they have a cafeteria downstairs that has fried chicken and  that there's a basketball court in the gym.

norm: It's rude to look down on others.
situation: Gina is a teacher in a school that has mixed income students.
intention: Gina wants to give personal attention to the students.
moral_action: Gina gives personal attention all of the students.
immoral_action: Gina gives personal attention to the wealthier students.

norm: It's wrong to harass people.
situation: Charlie's friend had borrowed money from him but still hadn't paid him back.
intention: Charlie wants to get his money back.
moral_action: Charlie reminds his friend about the money that he is owed.
immoral_action: Charlie calls his friend at least five times a day asking for the money.

norm: It's wrong to keep things that are not your's.
situation: Toby had a study session with Neal and Neal left his only jacket at Toby's place.
intention: Toby wants to decide what to do with the jacket.
moral_action: Toby decides to give the jacket back to Neal.
immoral_action: Toby decides to keep the jacket and not give it back to Neal.

norm: It's wrong to get back at others.
situation: Carla is at a restaurant when she sees her boyfriend at dinner with another woman.
intention: Carla wants to express her anger.
moral_action: Carla confronts her boyfriend and the woman and breaks up with him.
immoral_action: Carla goes outside and finds her boyfriend's car and keys the door.

norm: It's wrong to prioritize fictional characters over people.
situation: Lisa gets an urgent text from her sister while she is watching a much anticipated episode of her favorite soap opera.
intention: Lisa wants to watch her show.
moral_action: Lisa sets her dvr to record the show to watch later and gets in touch with her sister.
immoral_action: Lisa texts her sister that she is at a doctors appointment and will get back to her when she's done.

norm: It's wrong to try to get even with people
situation: During class Bobby knocks off Shane's books from his desk and laughs.
intention: Shane wants to make Bobby aware that what he did was not okay.
moral_action: Shane walks up to Bobby and tells that his mom would not approve of what he did.
immoral_action: "Shane throws Bobby's books out the classroom window while saying ""reap what you sow"" to him."

norm: It is wrong to listen to other people's conversations.
situation: Martha has a daughter Kayla who is dating a new boy.
intention: Martha wants to know more about their relationship.
moral_action: Martha asks Kayla about her boyfriend that evening at dinner.
immoral_action: Martha listens in at the door while Kayla is talking to her boyfriend on the phone.

norm: Revealing too much information about someone is not appropriate.
situation: Helen is talking with her sister, who is very distraught about a psychological issue.
intention: Helen wants to make her sister feel better.
moral_action: Helen tells her sister about something else who solved a similar issue and whose ordeal was public.
immoral_action: Helen tells her sister others are worse off than her and tells her about a more serious issue one of her friends told her about in confidence.

norm: It's inappropriate to talk about controversial topics in polite company.
situation: Bob is at a party talking with some new acquaintances.
intention: Bob wants to keep the conversation going with an interesting topic.
moral_action: Bob says that he took a trip to a national park recently and really enjoyed the view.
immoral_action: Bob says that face masks during the coronavirus pandemic are not very helpful.

norm: It's wrong to send someone too many messages.
situation: Darcy is on vacation and misses her boyfriend.
intention: Darcy wants to reconnect with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Darcy sends her boyfriend a thoughtful message letting him know she misses him.
immoral_action: Darcy sends her boyfriend fifteen messages an hour and gets impatient.

norm: It's wrong to go through other peoples personal things.
situation: Joe lost his wedding ring at Jill's house, and he's panicking about trying to find it.
intention: Joe wants to find the ring.
moral_action: Joe asks Jill to look for the ring for him because he doesn't want to go through her things.
immoral_action: Joe looks through all of Jill's belongings by himself including rifling though drawers.

norm: It's wrong to judge people for their personal decisions.
situation: Mary and Kim went to college together but right before graduation Kim quits to get married.
intention: Mary wants to see her friend succeed.
moral_action: Mary expresses her concerns for Kim's future but ultimately stands by her friends decision.
immoral_action: Mary is unsupportive and vocally criticizes Kim's decision.

norm: It's impolite not to respect people's privacy.
situation: Marie is supposed to work on a project with the new employee Sandra, and Sandra leaves the window of her Facebook open on her computer.
intention: Marie wants to know more about Sandra.
moral_action: Marie asks Sandra questions about herself while they work and invites her to hang out at a more relaxed location.
immoral_action: Marie searches on Sandra's Facebook reading her messages along with other things on her page.

norm: It's wrong to not respect others privacy.
situation: Jim has noticed that his sister Naomi has been acting strange lately.
intention: Jim wants to know what's going on with Naomi.
moral_action: Jim sits down with Naomi and asks her to share what has been going on.
immoral_action: Jim sneaks into Naomi's room when she is out and reads her diary.

norm: It's wrong to talk about personal body functions with others.
situation: Anthony and Rebecca are at the gym together and there's an offensive odor in the air around them.
intention: Anthony wants to lighten the mood about the smell.
moral_action: Anthony laughs and mentions a funny story about a sewer line that broke near his house.
immoral_action: "Anthony sniffs the air and says ""I'm sure it can't be mine, they're a little frutier"" to try and make Rebecca laugh."

norm: It is wrong to keep important information from people
situation: Agatha agreed to let Nancy use her phone number as a message phone because Nancy's children were in protective services and Nancy was trying to get them back.
intention: Agatha doesn't want to take messages for Nancy anymore.
moral_action: Agatha tells Nancy she just can't do it anymore and Nancy finds another friend to take phone messages.
immoral_action: Agatha erases any messages she gets for Nancy without reading them or telling Nancy.

norm: It's wrong to send texts to the wrong people.
situation: Daniel is reading a saucy sexual text from his girlfriend when he gets another incoming text from his mom.
intention: Daniel wants to reply to an outstanding text.
moral_action: Daniel replies to his mom's text without exiting the conversation with her.
immoral_action: Daniel replies to the saucy text but does not exit the conversation with his mom and sends it to her.

norm: It's rude to read other people's messages.
situation: James' sister left her laptop logged in to Facebook while she went to the bathroom.
intention: James wants to know who his sister is dating.
moral_action: When James' sister gets back, he keeps nagging her until she eventually tells him who she's dating just to get rid of him.
immoral_action: James scrolls through his sister's Facebook messages and comes across graphic sexual descriptions.

norm: It's unseemly to interrogate others about private matters.
situation: Jim and Pam are coworkers in an office, and are talking about their lives.
intention: Jim wants to ask Pam about her interests.
moral_action: Jim asks innocuous questions like what movies she likes.
immoral_action: Jim asks very private questions about Pam's former boyfriends and private health.

norm: Hiding important information about yourself is unacceptable.
situation: A few days before leaving on a road trip with her boyfriend, Daisy is diagnosed with Covid-19, but she doesn't have any serious symptoms.
intention: Daisy wants to go on the road trip with her boyfriend.
moral_action: Daisy tells her boyfriend about the diagnosis and asks him to postpone the road trip until she tests negative.
immoral_action: Daisy decides not to tell her boyfriend about the diagnosis and goes on a road trip with him as planned.

norm: It's wrong to be overly protective of your things.
situation: Bryan owns an extremely rare and expensive trading card.
intention: Bryan wants to keep that trading card safe.
moral_action: Bryan simply locks the card in a safe with a solid combination.
immoral_action: Bryan has a super security system installed that goes off every time a speck of dust enters the room the card is in.

norm: It's wrong to start confrontations with people you live near.
situation: Bob's neighbor's dog pooped in Bob's yard and Bob had to clean it himself.
intention: Bob wants to send a message to his neighbor.
moral_action: Bob knocks on his neighbor's door and asks about the dog poo.
immoral_action: Bob hides his neighbor's lawn gnome in revenge for the poo.

norm: It's rude to eavesdrop on other's conversations.
situation: John and Mindy are having a heated discussion in the house they share with Eric.
intention: Eric wants to know what John and Mindy are talking about.
moral_action: Eric enters their room and sits where they can see him and then listens to them talk.
immoral_action: Eric puts his ear to his door and opens it a bit to hear what they're saying.

norm: It is unacceptable to control someone's personal life.
situation: Vince's son Jordan has just introduced his girlfriend Daisy to the family and Vince does not approve of her.
intention: Vince wants Jordan to be happy.
moral_action: Vince tells Jordan he is happy for him and that he will support Jordan in whatever he chooses.
immoral_action: Vince tells Jordan he should break up with Daisy so Vince can set him up with a girl he thinks would be perfect for Jordan.

norm: It's wrong to force someone to talk to you
situation: Brad is at a bar and talking to a woman who says she has to get home as it's late.
intention: Brad wants to continue talking to the woman.
moral_action: Brad asks the woman for her number, so he can call her.
immoral_action: Brad corners the woman and prevents her from leaving, so he can keep talking to her.

norm: It is inconsiderate to force your views on others.
situation: Terri is a person with very strong political views, and is at a Super Bowl party with a bunch of people.
intention: Terri wants to express her political views.
moral_action: Terri mentions something about kneeling players, but otherwise keeps the conversation about football.
immoral_action: Terri won't stop talking politics and ultimately gets into an argument with someone of a different political view.

norm: It's wrong to tell other people secrets
situation: Steve told his close friend Bill a very big and embarrassing secret about himself, and Bill remembers it while hanging out with some friends.
intention: Bill wants to amuse some friends.
moral_action: Bill decides to pull out his phone and show them a funny cat video.
immoral_action: Bill tells the group of people Steve's secret spur of the moment.

norm: It is wrong to expect favors from strangers.
situation: Janice, a homeless woman on the street, is talking with a passerby.
intention: Janice wants five dollars.
moral_action: Janice leaves the street and walks into an employment agency.
immoral_action: Janice tells the stranger if he doesn't give her five dollars she will kill herself.

norm: It's inappropriate to brag about yourself too much to others.
situation: Kenny is on the high school baseball team and hit three home runs during the game.
intention: Kenny wants to tell his friends about his performance.
moral_action: Kenny tells his friends about his home runs once, when he sees them after the game.
immoral_action: Kenny tells his friends about his home runs every day of the week.

norm: It's wrong to reveal sensitive information to people.
situation: Sam runs a tell-all website and has just received a large amount of secret government documents from a mysterious informant.
intention: Sam wants to figure out what to do with the documents.
moral_action: Sam decides that the documents are too sensitive and deletes them so no one can see them.
immoral_action: Sam releases the documents publicly so that all the world can see what the government is doing wrong.

norm: It's wrong to interrupt someone's conversation.
situation: Jason is in the hotel lobby waiting in line behind other guests to speak to the receptionist who is talking to another customer.
intention: Jason wants to ask the receptionist a question about the hotel restaurants.
moral_action: Jason waits in line for his turn and then asks then receptionist his question.
immoral_action: Jason shouts his question toward the receptionist from his spot in line.

norm: It's wrong to read other people's messages.
situation: Sam and Tina are sitting together for lunch when Tina gets a text, reads it, and smiles.
intention: Sam wants to know what made Tina smile.
moral_action: Sam asks Tina why she is smiling.
immoral_action: Sam reaches over and grabs Tina's phone and reads the text she received.

norm: You shouldn't use a service you haven't paid for.
situation: Kayla gets a movie subscription password and username from her friend and has enjoyed using it illicitly.
intention: Kayla knows her luck may run out and wants to decide whether to get her own membership or push or luck.
moral_action: Kayla sets up her own account.
immoral_action: Kayla continues using the subscription illegally.

norm: You shouldn't accept trades from customers for items.
situation: Jimmy is talking to a customer who wants to buy a microwave but doesn't have enough money.
intention: Jimmy wants to clsoe the sale.
moral_action: Jimmy offers the customers a payment plan that works for them, and they agree to buy the microwave.
immoral_action: Jimmy offers to let the customer have the microwave if they give him a video game he has been wanting.

norm: You should not feel entitled to people buying you things.
situation: Jasmine is out shopping with Laura who owes Jasmine money, and Jasmine sees necklace loves out of her price range.
intention: Jasmine wants to buy the necklace.
moral_action: Jasmine sells one of the bracelets on her wrist to a random shopper.
immoral_action: Jasmine tells Laura that she should give her cash because Laura owes her money.

norm: You shouldn't feel entitled to use people's stuff.
situation: Marie's sister told Marie to never touch her laptop because she needs it for school.
intention: Marie wants to watch YouTube.
moral_action: Marie begs her mom to borrow her tablet, so she can watch videos.
immoral_action: Marie borrows her sister's laptop and accidentally clicks on a popup that downloads a virus.

norm: You shouldn't pay for someone's soul.
situation: Logan is going for a walk with his girlfriend when she mentions that she'd do anything for a cupcake right now.
intention: Logan wants to make his girlfriend laugh.
moral_action: Logan tells his girlfriend that he'll buy her a cupcake if she promises to never sell her soul.
immoral_action: Logan tells his girlfriend that he will buy her soul for the price of a cupcake.

norm: You shouldn't hire someone that isn't eligible for a position.
situation: Kyle runs his own business, and he knows his friend's son is looking for a job.
intention: Kyle wants to hire someone to fill a position in the office.
moral_action: Kyle hires the most experienced applicant that he happened to interview.
immoral_action: Kyle meets with his friend's son and hires him even though he has no work experience.

norm: You should not act entitled to career opportunities.
situation: Patricia and two of her colleagues are discussing the new job posting.
intention: Patricia wants to be considered for the managerial role.
moral_action: Patricia acts very professional at the interview and also puts in a good word for her colleagues.
immoral_action: Patricia loudly exclaims at her interview that she is the best candidate and should get the position because she's been there the longest.

norm: You shouldn't take your own life.
situation: Zach is very depressed and doesn't know how to escape his problems in life.
intention: Zach wants to escape his pain.
moral_action: Zach decides to get professional help from a psychiatrist.
immoral_action: Zach decides to end the pain and jumps off of a bridge.

norm: You should not claim someone else's work as your own.
situation: Jim has an important project coming up for an English class and has decided to write a paper for his.
intention: Jim wants to complete his essay.
moral_action: Jim writes his essay and includes information from multiple sources, making sure to reference them.
immoral_action: Jim writes his essay and adds information directly copied and pasted from multiple sources and leaves it at that.

norm: You shouldn't expect free stuff
situation: Damien walks into a bakery where he notices a basket of fresh scones being put out onto the counter.
intention: Damien wants to try a scone.
moral_action: Damien asks the baker if it'd be possible to sample a scone.
immoral_action: Expecting them to be free, Damien takes a scone from the counter then walks away.

norm: Work shouldn't be treated like a social event.
situation: Brad's is at work and sees his colleague and friend Josh in the office for the first time since he got back from vacation.
intention: Brad wants to know how Josh's vacation was.
moral_action: Brad waits until their lunch break and then asks Josh about his vacation.
immoral_action: Brad asks Josh about his recent vacation and spends 20 minutes chatting with him about it in the middle of the office.

norm: Relationships shouldn't be treated like competitions.
situation: Jenna's best friend's boyfriend just proposed and bought her a huge engagement ring.
intention: Jenna wants to feel secure about her own relationship.
moral_action: Jenna invites her boyfriend on a romantic getaway where they can be alone for a week.
immoral_action: Jenna starts pressuring her boyfriend to propose and buy her a bigger ring than her friend.

norm: You shouldn't base a relationship on looks
situation: Jamie has a crush on Angel who is beautiful but mean, and he knows that Michelle being an average but nice girl loves him.
intention: Jamie wants to get a girlfriend.
moral_action: Jamie admiring Michelle's niceness asks her to be his girlfriend and forgets about Angel.
immoral_action: Jamie being fascinated by Angel's charm asks her to be his girlfriend and Angel agrees.

norm: You should not expect to get things for free.
situation: Karen goes to the clothing store but the line to checkout is too long.
intention: Karen wants a shirt.
moral_action: Karen waits patiently in line until she is waited on at the register.
immoral_action: Karen demands to get the shirt for free because the line was too long.

norm: You should not spend money you know is not real.
situation: Carla loves clothes and accessories but doesn't have too much money.
intention: Carla really wants a new Gucci purse.
moral_action: Carla waits for a few weeks until she has the money, then buys the purse.
immoral_action: Carla decides to buy the purse on credit even though she knows it's money she doesn't have.

norm: You should not borrow something you cannot return.
situation: Nico is currently an unemployed gamer who has stumbled across a new gaming accessory online.
intention: Nico wants to obtain the gaming accessory.
moral_action: Nico takes on odd jobs and saves up money to buy the game with his own money.
immoral_action: Nico borrows money from his friend to pay for the accessory.

norm: You shouldn't live your life pleasing people.
situation: Jeff is exhausted after working an extra shift when his friend asks him to come and help move furniture.
intention: Jeff wants to respond to his friends request.
moral_action: Jeff explains how tired he is and offers to help another day.
immoral_action: Jeff doesn't want to disappoint his friend, so he agress to help with the furniture move.

norm: You should not make money the bases of a relationship
situation: Anthony is single and looking for a relationship through dating websites.
intention: Anthony wants to get a girlfriend.
moral_action: Anthony tries to find women that he genuinely finds interesting on the dating websites to contact.
immoral_action: Anthony only picks women to contact on the dating websites who clearly have a lot of money.

norm: You shouldn't give handouts to people who don't deserve it.
situation: Cara's brother plays video games all day and asked her for some money to help him buy a new TV.
intention: Cara has to decide whether to give her brother money.
moral_action: Cara tells his brother to get a job in order to buy a new TV.
immoral_action: Cara gives his brother the money that he wanted, so he can buy a TV.

norm: You shouldn't expect help or services for free.
situation: Jess is planning a celebration for her 10th anniversary, so she approaches her event coordinator friend.
intention: Jess wants her friend to help plan her party.
moral_action: Jess pffoers her friend a fair rate if she will take on the party planning job.
immoral_action: Jess asks her friend if she can use her event planning business for free.

norm: You shouldn't try to return an item that you damaged.
situation: Mackenzie tears a hole in her new sweater when she plays with her dog.
intention: Mackenzie wants to get rid of her sweater.
moral_action: After cutting off the damaged parts, Mackenzie transforms her sweater into a small hat.
immoral_action: Mackenzie tells the people at the store that the sweater is a flawed birthday gift.

norm: You shouldn't listen to what people say about someone.
situation: Frank is at a get together when he hears people saying bad things about a politician named Jack.
intention: Frank wants to find out more about Jack.
moral_action: Frank looks up Jack and his political history through documents.
immoral_action: Frank asks the people he is with questions about Jack.

norm: You shouldn't take someone's life.
situation: Robert just found out that his daughter was raped by her ex boyfriend.
intention: Robert wants justice for his daughter.
moral_action: Robert calls the police on his daughters ex boyfriend.
immoral_action: Robert tracks down her ex boyfriend and takes his life.

norm: A relationship should not be about money.
situation: Shelly has just started a new relationship with Nelson who makes less money than her.
intention: Shelly wants their relationship to be a two way street.
moral_action: Shelly insists that she and Nelson sit down for a conversation about their expectations within the relationship.
immoral_action: Shelly insists that the cost of everything is split 50-50 between her and Nelson.

norm: You shouldn't take credit for someone else's work
situation: Devon and his team have been complimented by their boss on doing a good job on their team project.
intention: Devon wants to respond to his boss.
moral_action: Devon says that everyone in the team did their part in making the project.
immoral_action: Devon says that he did most of the work and deserves the credit.

norm: You should not let your appearance control your life.
situation: Nick is obese, so he hates going outside, but he has to go see a doctor for an issue.
intention: Nick has to decide whether to go to the doctor.
moral_action: Nick decides that he cares more about his issue than his weight, so he goes to see his doctor.
immoral_action: Nick doesn't want people looking at him, so he decides to stay at home.

norm: You should not feel entitled to touch other people's belongings.
situation: Cody is at his friends house, and he sees that he has an expensive collectible.
intention: Cody wants to get a closer look at the collectible.
moral_action: Cody asks his friend to show him the collectible and asks a lot of questions.
immoral_action: Cody walks over and picks the collectible up getting his fingerprints all over it and risking dropping it.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of people.
situation: John is on a date at a restaurant with his new girlfriend Mary, who is feeling down.
intention: John wants to cheer Mary up.
moral_action: John gives Mary some heartfelt advice about what he did when he was facing a similar problem.
immoral_action: When John and Mary's waiter is just out of earshot, John imitates his speech impediment in a funny manner.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of the way someone talks.
situation: Kara meets a new girl at her school named Sandy, who is from Australia.
intention: Kara wants to speak to Sandy.
moral_action: Kara tells Sandy she is excited to meet someone from another country and wants to learn more about her.
immoral_action: Kara laughs at Sandy and tells her that her accent is really weird.

norm: You should not try to control your partner.
situation: Dave and his wife Sally are at home when Sally gets a phone call and tells Dave she's going to go see her friend Sue.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Sally leaving.
moral_action: Dave tells Sally to drive carefully and to say hi to Sue when she gets there.
immoral_action: Dave tells Sally that he doesn't like Sue, and he forbids her from going since he thinks Sue is a bad influence.

norm: You shouldn't be fascinated by someone's disability.
situation: Frank sits next to his new coworker Bob who sits in a wheelchair.
intention: Frank wants to know more about Bob.
moral_action: Frank offers to show him around the office during Bob has an open conversation about both of their families.
immoral_action: Frank asks questions personal questions about Bob's wheelchair and how he performs simple tasks over and over again.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's tastes.
situation: Larry is listening to music that Tim thought he would like, through earphones.
intention: Larry wants to tell Tim that he doesn't like his music.
moral_action: Larry tells Tim he does not like the music, but respects his taste.
immoral_action: Larry calls the band Tim is listening to a swear word, and proceeds to make fun of it.

norm: You should not make someone give you physical affection.
situation: Sharon is at a party when she sees her friend Beth who typically dislikes physical affection.
intention: Sharon wants to interact with Beth.
moral_action: Sharon brings over a snack from one of the tables to Beth and asks Beth about her day.
immoral_action: Sharon walks up to Beth and insists that Beth give her a greeting hug in front of a small group.

norm: You shouldn't use someone as an excuse.
situation: Rob, who was going to be a programmer but dropped out of school, is asked by his child Eric why he never finished school.
intention: Rob wants to justify his dropping out of school.
moral_action: Rob says that he dropped out because he didn't like programming that much.
immoral_action: Rob says that he dropped out because Eric was born, and he no longer had time.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's dream.
situation: Will has announced that he intends to drop out of college to become a full-time streamer.
intention: Paul wants to convince Will that this is not a good idea.
moral_action: Paul calmy explains the reasons he thinks Will should stay in school for the time being.
immoral_action: Paul calls Will stupid and makes fun of his plan.

norm: You should not call someone something they do not want.
situation: Jim comes up with a funny nickname for his friend but his friend doesn't like it.
intention: Jim wants to have a nickname for his friend.
moral_action: Jim suggests a new nickname for his friend which his friend is happier with.
immoral_action: Jim keeps calling his friend by the nickname his friend doesn't like.

norm: You should not help people to cheat.
situation: Frances's son is not too good at math and has an important math test in a few days.
intention: Frances wants her son to succeed on the math test.
moral_action: Frances helps her son study hard for the test.
immoral_action: Frances suggests that her son should try to copy the answers from the smarter kids.

norm: You should not use things designated for the handicapped.
situation: Greg is shopping for groceries and in a hurry to finish because of a hectic schedule.
intention: Greg wants to make the trip as quick as possible.
moral_action: Greg shops for less items than planned and finds an express lane to cash out on.
immoral_action: Greg sees that the parking lot is crowded but notices a handicap spot open and parks there.

norm: You shouldn't hum things that are suggestive.
situation: Charles is sitting with his girlfriend on a crowded bus.
intention: Charles wants to entertain his girlfriend.
moral_action: Charles tells his girlfriend a funny story about his day.
immoral_action: Charles quietly sings his girlfriend's favorite song about bedroom activities.

norm: You should not make light of a tragic event.
situation: Lola's friend's grandmother had just died after she got into a car crash.
intention: Lola wants to send her friend a message on social media.
moral_action: Lola sends her friend a message with a heart saying that she is sorry.
immoral_action: Lola sends her friend a meme of a car going up in flames.

norm: You should not expect something for helping someone.
situation: Kyle has spent the day helping his friend move to a new house.
intention: Kyle wants to make some extra money.
moral_action: Kyle helps for free not expecting payment and schedules some extra work shifts.
immoral_action: Kyle asks how much his friend will give him for the labor.

norm: You shouldn't listen to other people's conversations.
situation: Charlene is in the pantry and her coworkers Nancy and Grace are there chatting about their family affairs.
intention: Charlene wants to react to her situation.
moral_action: Charlene joins the chatting and shifts the topic by inviting both Nancy and Grace to lunch.
immoral_action: Charlene stays in the pantry as if she is still making her coffee in order to hear more about the family affairs of both Nancy and Grace.

norm: You shouldn't take up spaces meant for disabled people.
situation: Chuck is running late for work and is having trouble finding a parking spot.
intention: Chuck wants to get into the office.
moral_action: Chuck sees a handicapped space but decides against it, then notices someone pulling out, so he quickly pulls into the space.
immoral_action: Chuck sees a handicapped space and takes it, so he can get to his job.

norm: People shouldn't take advantage of disabled people.
situation: Ken is a small business owner who is hiring, and he has received an application from a disabled man.
intention: Ken wants to figure out how much he should pay the man for the job.
moral_action: Ken offers the man a living wage of $15, because he did well in the interview.
immoral_action: Ken offers the man a wage that's below the minimum wage.

norm: You shouldn't toy with other people's emotions
situation: Barb is happy if a little bored in her marriage when a coworker starts flirting with her.
intention: Barb wants to deal with the situation with her coworker.
moral_action: Barb sets clear boundaries with her coworker and focuses on bringing excitement back into her marriage.
immoral_action: Barb decides to alleviate her boredom by stringing her coworker along.

norm: You shouldn't try to play with other peoples' heads.
situation: Mindy goes to see her friend Homer and his family.
intention: Mindy wants to see them all.
moral_action: Homer introduces his family and Mindy says hello to each of them in turn.
immoral_action: Homer introduces his family and Mindy pets them all on the head as they are introduced.

norm: You should not give people unsolicited advice
situation: Jenny is riding the train when she overhears two women discussing a problem they are having.
intention: Jenny wants to keep herself occupied during the train ride.
moral_action: Jenny minds her own business and pulls out her phone to read an e-book.
immoral_action: Jenny inserts herself in the pairs conversation and offers possible solutions.

norm: You should not make fun of disabilities.
situation: Don is running for election and making a speech about the disabled.
intention: Don wants people to laugh and vote for him.
moral_action: Don tells kind, compassionate jokes at his rally.
immoral_action: Don mimics a disabled veteran, waving his hands and pretending to fall.

norm: You should not make fun of people for their interests
situation: Bruce is attending a freshman mixer just before the beginning of fall semester.
intention: Bruce wants to make friends and increase his social status a bit if he can.
moral_action: Ed stands up for Harold saying he admires anyone with a mind for mathematics.
immoral_action: Bruce joins in with a group of frat boys giving Harold the math nerd a hard time about his major.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's face.
situation: James is having lunch in the break room at work when he notices a new employee with a cleft lip walking in.
intention: James wants to introduce himself to the new employee.
moral_action: James walks over to greet the new employee and starts up a conversation without acknowledging his facial features.
immoral_action: James walks over to greet the new employee, then begins mocking his cleft lip.

norm: You shouldn't try to take advantage of people.
situation: Sean is at a trading event for a popular card game and sees a person who has just started playing the game.
intention: Sean wants to trade cards with the new player.
moral_action: Sean looks at what the person has, makes some suggestions, and offers to trade some of his cards that would help the new player.
immoral_action: Sean picks out the person's best cards, says that they're not very good, and offers him a trade for some less-valuable cards.

norm: You shouldn't take advantage of people with memory problems
situation: Warren's friend Jack paid him back after borrowing money, but forgot and tried to pay him back again a week later.
intention: Warren wants to respond to Jack's offer of money.
moral_action: Warren lets Jack know that he'd already paid him back last week.
immoral_action: Warren takes Jack's money and keeps quiet about how he'd already been paid back.

norm: You shouldn't try to get back at people.
situation: Max was mad at Steve for breaking one of his toys.
intention: Max wants Steve to know how he feels.
moral_action: Max talks to Steve and tells him why he is so upset.
immoral_action: Max breaks one of Steve's toys in retaliation for what Steve did.

norm: You shouldn't get in the way of people's dreams.
situation: Tammy is talking with her ten year old Bryan, and he tells her his dream is to be an astronaut.
intention: Tammy wants her son to be successful.
moral_action: Tammy tells Bryan if he works hard he can do whatever he wants.
immoral_action: Tammy tells Bryan that's not realistic, and he should be a doctor.

norm: You shouldn't make fun of someone's likes.
situation: Susan loves painting ceramic frogs, but her husband David finds it to be a very boring hobby.
intention: David wants Susan to pick a hobby that he would enjoy doing with her.
moral_action: David asks Susan if she would be willing to try something new, with him, that they could do in their spare time together.
immoral_action: David tells Susan directly that he finds her choice of hobbies to be beneath her and ridiculous, that it's boring, and he wants her to find something else to do.

norm: You shouldn't find self-harm attractive.
situation: Priscilla is very depressed after losing her mother to cancer and feels numb.
intention: Priscilla wants to feel something.
moral_action: Priscilla calls a therapist and goes for therapy once a week.
immoral_action: Priscilla takes a razor blade and cuts her arms until she bleeds.

norm: You shouldn't slap people.
situation: Betty runs into her sister at a party, when her sister had already said she was ill.
intention: Betty wants them to know that she is upset.
moral_action: Betty sits her sister down and talk out their problems.
immoral_action: Betty smacks her sister and tells her that she is betrayed .

norm: You shouldn't prey upon people.
situation: Oscar is poor and needs some money for food.
intention: Oscar wants to get money.
moral_action: Oscar gets a job and works hard for money.
immoral_action: Oscar hides in an alley and assaults weak people who pass through, taking their money.

norm: You should not throw objects at others.
situation: Jack and Jill work together in the same office a few feet apart.
intention: Jack wants to get Jill's attention.
moral_action: Jack stands up and walks over to Jill, clearing his throat.
immoral_action: Jack throws a paper airplane at Jill to get her to notice him.

norm: You shouldn't hit people.
situation: Nick's girlfriend accidentally lost his expensive sunglasses.
intention: Nick wants to let his girlfriend know he is upset.
moral_action: Nick explains to his girlfriend that those sunglasses cost him a lot of money.
immoral_action: Nick punches his girlfriend for losing his sunglasses.

norm: You shouldn't murder people.
situation: John is walking his dog when a careless man on a bicycle runs into his dog at full speed hurting the dog badly.
intention: James wants to seek revenge on the careless man.
moral_action: John tells the man to stay there while he calls the police and a vet for his dog.
immoral_action: John gets into such a rage that he pounds the man into the ground, beating him until the man dies.

norm: You shouldn't squeal on people.
situation: Tom notices his wife underpaid her restaurant bill yesterday, but the waitress didn't notice.
intention: Tom wants to let someone know about the underpaid bill.
moral_action: Tom forgives his wife and only tells his wife about the underpaid bill instead of the restaurant.
immoral_action: Tom calls the restaurant on the phone letting them know that his wife underpaid.

norm: You shouldn't kick someone in the nuts.
situation: Ace is playing football and is approaching the player on the other team with the ball.
intention: Ace wants to take down the player.
moral_action: Ace dives at the player and tackles him.
immoral_action: Ace runs up to the player and kicks the person in the nuts.

norm: You shouldn't punch someone in the stomach.
situation: Tony is at the bar when someone bumps into him causing him to spill a drink.
intention: Tony wants to confront the person, and not be seen as a coward.
moral_action: "Tony turns and faces the individual, and says, ""Hey, you caused me to spill my drink""."
immoral_action: Tony immediately turns to the person, punching them in the stomach.

norm: You shouldn't tease people with disabilities.
situation: Kaiden is in the line with his mother at the grocery store.
intention: Kaiden wants to do an impression.
moral_action: Kaden acts like his favorite YouTube influencer and is spot on.
immoral_action: Kaden mocks the one armed worker by putting his arm inside his shirt and laughing loudly.

norm: You shouldn't slap people with things.
situation: Mark is reading the newspaper while Maria screams and cries at a television show.
intention: Mark wants to make Maria stop crying.
moral_action: Mark hugs Maria and offers some interesting behind the scenes facts about the show.
immoral_action: Mark wacks Maria with his newspaper to disrupt her thoughts.

norm: You should not kick others.
situation: Monty is standing in line at the store but the person in front of him isn't moving up.
intention: Monty wants the person in front of him to move up.
moral_action: Monty taps the person in front of him on the shoulder to let him know the line is moving.
immoral_action: Monty kicks the person in front of him to make him start walking.

norm: You shouldn't fart around others.
situation: After a chili lunch with coworkers Fred finds himself in a crowded elevator.
intention: Fred wants to pass gas.
moral_action: Fred steps off the elevator on the first floor and passe gas in an empty area.
immoral_action: Fred passes gas in the elevator hoping nobody realizes it was him.

norm: You shouldn't yell at someone with mental problems.
situation: Sam has been waiting for an important delivery from his boss and is angry when the company mail person delivers it late.
intention: Sam wants to vent his frustration at the mentally handicapped mail person.
moral_action: Sam curbs his temper but reports the late mail to the mail department.
immoral_action: Sam screams at the mail person.

norm: You shouldn't steal bicycles.
situation: Walter is walking to work one day and sees a bicycle on the street.
intention: Walter wants to make sure he makes it to work on time.
moral_action: Walter starts walking at a faster pace in order to make it to work on time.
immoral_action: Walter takes the bicycle and rides it the rest of the way to work.

norm: You shouldn't ghost people close to you.
situation: Tally and Meaghan are best friends, but Tally feels that they've been growing apart.
intention: Tally wants to part ways with Meaghan.
moral_action: Tally explains to Meaghan that they are different now and would be better going their separate ways.
immoral_action: Tally suddenly stops responding to Meaghans's calls and texts without any explanation.

norm: You shouldn't shoot people.
situation: Paul has a gun and finds a man trying to break into his car.
intention: Paul wants to stop the robber.
moral_action: Paul points the gun at the robber and tells him to get on the ground.
immoral_action: Paul shoots the robber with the gun.

norm: You shouldn't skateboard somewhere dangerous.
situation: Tony has the day off and decides to ride his skateboard around the neighborhood instead of sitting at home.
intention: Tony wants to go out.
moral_action: Tony decides to play it safe and rides his board on the sidewalk.
immoral_action: Tony sees some concrete stairs and decides to try to ride down the railing on his board.

norm: You shouldn't verbally abuse people.
situation: Evan is frustrated at his coworker Abby for not understanding how to operate equipment properly.
intention: Evan wants to teach Abby.
moral_action: Evan shows Abby some tutorial videos before asking her to shadow him for the rest of the day.
immoral_action: Evan puts Abby down and treats her like a child as he explains the controls.

norm: You shouldn't cut your arm.
situation: Doug just learned that his best friend died in a plane crash and is devastated.
intention: Doug wants to feel something, anything but numb.
moral_action: Doug calls a therapist hotline to talk about his sadness/numbness.
immoral_action: Doug takes a knife and cuts his arms up.

norm: You shouldn't threaten someone with a knife.
situation: Colin is out of work and his bills are piling up.
intention: Colin wants to get some money.
moral_action: Colin walks up to people on the street and asks if they need some odd jobs done for money.
immoral_action: Colin holds a knife to someone and says he wants their wallet.

norm: You shouldn't fake a broken bone.
situation: Debbie hurt her arm a few days past and it feels better, but she's tired and wants some time off from work.
intention: Debbie wants to go home and sleep.
moral_action: Debbie goes to her boss and tells her that she would like to take a sick day because she did not get enough rest.
immoral_action: Debbie tells her boss she fell in the bathroom and thinks she broke her arm, so Debbie's boss tells her to go.

norm: You shouldn't kick people off their bike.
situation: Timmy's friend is riding their new bike which Timmy would like to try riding.
intention: Timmy wants to get his friend off of their bike so that he can ride it.
moral_action: Timmy asks his friend if they can get off the bike and give him a turn riding it, and they agree.
immoral_action: Timmy pushes his friend off their bike with a forceful push of his foot and starts riding it.

norm: You shouldn't sexually harass people.
situation: Matt thinks Brooke is attractive and wants to hook up with her.
intention: Matt wants to ask Brooke out.
moral_action: Matt asks Brooke if she would like to go dancing with him.
immoral_action: Matt touches Brooke on the butt while he asks her out.

norm: You shouldn't fracture someone else's finger.
situation: Sean is an MMA fighter, and his opponent keeps sticking their finger in his mouth.
intention: Sean wants his opponent to stop bothering him with his finger.
moral_action: Sean tells the referee what his opponent's been doing, and the referee warns his opponent.
immoral_action: Sean bites down on his opponent's finger the next time he puts it in his mouth.

norm: People should not physically assault each other.
situation: Scott is on the playground at recess when a classmate Jimmy approaches him and forcefully takes the ball he's playing with from him.
intention: Scott wants to get the ball back.
moral_action: Scott tells Jimmy that he was using the ball and asks if he will give it back to him.
immoral_action: Scott strikes Jimmy with his fists and pushes him to the ground before taking the ball back.

norm: You shouldn't use violence against others.
situation: Phil is at a bar with his wife, Marie, who keeps getting hit on by another patron.
intention: Phil wants the patron to stop hitting on his wife.
moral_action: Phil gets up and leaves the bar with his wife and takes her to a dance club.
immoral_action: Phil picks up a chair and breaks it over the back of the head of the patron, rendering him unconscious.

norm: You shouldn't body-shame someone.
situation: Lili and her friend Jane wanted to lose weight together but only Lili succeeded, now they're at a party.
intention: Lili wants to make sure that people around her admire her for her weight loss.
moral_action: Lili tells people how she managed to lose weight but doesn't mention anything about Jane trying to do so too.
immoral_action: Lili explains that she worked very hard to lose weight and points to Jane as proof that losing weight is not something that all can achieve.

norm: You shouldn't sneak up on people.
situation: Martin just got home from work.
intention: Martin wants to talk to Rachel.
moral_action: Martin calls out to Rachel, and she turns and see him.
immoral_action: Martin comes up behind Rachel and scares her.

norm: You shouldn't hit people with mental or physical disabilities.
situation: Steve is shopping in a crowded aisle of the store when a man in a wheelchair tells him to get out of the way in a nasty tone.
intention: Steve wants to respond to the man in the wheelchair.
moral_action: Steve doesn't appreciate the mans, tone, but let's it slide because of the mans disability.
immoral_action: Steve, not liking the way he was spoken to, punches the man in the jaw.

norm: You shouldn't put curses on people.
situation: Ed, a believer in voodoo practices, wants to get back at his friend Andrew for pulling a prank on him.
intention: Ed wants to get revenge on Andrew.
moral_action: Ed pulls a harmless prank on Andrew with a bucket of cold water.
immoral_action: Ed gives Andrew a curse by using a voodoo doll.

norm: You shouldn't knock into others.
situation: Jackie is on a crowded street and is late for school.
intention: Jackie wants to get to school quickly.
moral_action: Jackie says excuse me to the people in front of him.
immoral_action: Jackie pushes the other people on the street with his body to get past them.

norm: You shouldn't try to run over people.
situation: James is driving when Keith who was riding a bike cuts him off.
intention: James wants to react angrily to Keith's cut off.
moral_action: James speeds up his car to catch up to Keith and then flips him the finger before driving off.
immoral_action: James speeds up his car and slams into the back of Keith's' bike knocking him down and running him over.

norm: You shouldn't try to hit people.
situation: Lars is at the baseball game with his son Kirk and Dave is being really loud jeering behind them and being generally obnoxious.
intention: Lars wants to get Dave to quiet down.
moral_action: Lars turns around and tells Dave that he's with a child and Dave really needs to tone it down.
immoral_action: Lars stands up, turns around and takes a few punches at Dave, landing some on Dave's face and head.

norm: You shouldn't shoot people in the face.
situation: Bella is getting ready to play paintball with a group of friends.
intention: Bella wants to shoot her friends with paintballs.
moral_action: Bella waits for the game to begin and takes cover while carefully aiming her shots at her friends.
immoral_action: Bella opens fire on her friends hitting them all over with paintballs before the game begins and before people have their protective face masks on.

norm: You shouldn't surprise people while they are walking.
situation: John's grandfather likes to go on walks everyday and is hard of hearing.
intention: John wants to get his grandfather's attention.
moral_action: John runs up behind his grandparents and clears his throat several times.
immoral_action: John runs up behind his grandfather and shouts for his attention.

norm: You shouldn't invade your friend's personal space.
situation: Dave and John are hanging out together at John's house.
intention: Dave wants to find out if John has a secret crush he hasn't told anyone about.
moral_action: Dave simply asks John if there are any girls that John is crushing on.
immoral_action: Dave sneaks off into John's room and rummages through his things in an attempt to find John's diary.

norm: You shouldn't demand things from your friends.
situation: Carla is having issues with her car and is unable to drive it.
intention: She wants to ask her friend April to give her a ride to work.
moral_action: Carla explains her situation and asks April nicely for a ride.
immoral_action: Carla demands that April drive her to work and says that it is her duty as a friend.

norm: You shouldn't let yourself be taken advantage of by coworkers.
situation: Roxanne's teammates want to go out to happy hour and asked Roxanne if she can finish up their work for the day.
intention: Roxanne wants to make sure all the work gets done by the deadline.
moral_action: Roxanne tells her coworkers that if she does all the work, her coworkers won't know what's going on and won't be prepared to present their project.
immoral_action: Roxanne agrees to take over her coworkers' work for the rest of the day.

norm: You should not deceive your coworkers.
situation: Clark is scheduled to work on the same night he made a date with Lois.
intention: Clark wants Jimmy to cover his shift.
moral_action: Clark tells his boss the truth and asks if he can switch with Jimmy.
immoral_action: Clark asks Jimmy to switch shifts with him because his grandmother is in the hospital.

norm: You shouldn't stalk your significant other.
situation: Larry is feeling lonely.
intention: Larry wants to spend time with his partner.
moral_action: Larry texts his partner to ask to spend time together after work.
immoral_action: Larry follows his partner when they leave work to see where they are going.

norm: You shouldn't get your friends fired.
situation: John is having dinner at a restaurant where his friend Mary is a waitress.
intention: John wants to have some dessert.
moral_action: John orders a dessert.
immoral_action: John pesters Mary to bring him a free dessert, which she reluctantly does.

norm: You shouldn't snoop around your partner's things.
situation: Mary and John are out on a date but Mary's phone keeps vibrating.
intention: John wants to know who is calling Mary.
moral_action: John tells Mary it is ok if she needs to take the call as it won't be a big interruption on their date.
immoral_action: When Mary goes to the restroom John goes through her phone to see who is calling her.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your significant other
situation: Laura and Jack and arguing about finances.
intention: Laura wants Jack to listen to her.
moral_action: Laura listens to Jack then tells her side of the money situation.
immoral_action: Laura screams at Jack that she is right about money.

norm: You shouldn't put up with resentful friends.
situation: Penny is excited to be getting married but her best-friend and matron of honor Robin has been very negative about her plans.
intention: Penny wants to have the perfect wedding.
moral_action: Penny puts her foot down early on and tells Robin to either shape up or leave her wedding party.
immoral_action: Penny puts up with Robin's snide comments because she doesn't want to rock the boat.

norm: You shouldn't get your coworkers in trouble.
situation: John is at work and sees his coworker Tom taking a few sheets of office paper and putting them in his bag to take home for personal use.
intention: John wants to do correct Tom's behavior.
moral_action: John informs Tom that taking office paper for personal use is against company policy, and he could get in trouble.
immoral_action: John tattles on Tom to their boss to get him in trouble for taking the paper.

norm: You shouldn't spread rumors about your friends.
situation: Elaine's friend Susie just told her she heard her other friend Karen was cheating on her boyfriend, but isn't sure it's true.
intention: Elaine wants to decide whether or not to tell the rest of her classmates at school tomorrow.
moral_action: Elaine calls Karen to ask if it's true she cheated on her boyfriend.
immoral_action: When Elaine is in class the next day she tells the other people in her class.

norm: You shouldn't gossip about your friends.
situation: Darcy has just learned that her friend Romy is pregnant, and then Darcy's boyfriend calls.
intention: Darcy wants to talk to her boyfriend.
moral_action: Darcy tells her boyfriend about how she and Romy met and became friends.
immoral_action: Darcy tells her boyfriend that Romy is pregnant and criticizes her for being irresponsible.

norm: You shouldn't spill water on your friend's things.
situation: Jessica leaves the kitchen with a glass of water after an argument with her roommate.
intention: Jessica wants to vent her frusterations.
moral_action: Jessica rants about her feelings to another one of her friends.
immoral_action: Jessica pours the water onto roommates computer.

norm: You shouldn't question your boss.
situation: Bruce is hard at work but his boss keeps telling him to use a much more complex method.
intention: Bruce wants to get his work done.
moral_action: Bruce listens to his boss and does things the new way.
immoral_action: Bruce keeps doing things the way he already understands.

norm: You shouldn't give your employee discount to strangers.
situation: Jane is working retail at a big box store and has to deal with lots of customers of varying degrees of politeness all day.
intention: Jane wants customers she interacts with to be satisfied.
moral_action: Jane is dealing with a particularly rude customer and follows protocol by deferring them to her manager.
immoral_action: Jane is dealing with an irate customer who is making unfounded complaints so Jane appeases them by offering her employee discount to their purchase.

norm: You shouldn't expect your coworkers to pick up your slack.
situation: Lisa works at an accounting firm.
intention: Lisa wants to work on a consulting business on the side.
moral_action: Lisa schedules firm work during the week days and consulting work on the week ends.
immoral_action: Lisa neglects her firm work leaving it to junior associates to complete while she focuses on consulting work.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your employees.
situation: Joe is the CEO of a company and has to deal with a major mistake from one of his employees.
intention: Joe wants to address his employee's mistake.
moral_action: Joe shows understanding and calmly explains the mistake to the employee.
immoral_action: Joe yells at the employee responsible for the mistake in front of the other employees.

norm: You shouldn't spy on your significant other
situation: Gary hears his girlfriend whispering in the next room, he suspects that she is talking on her phone.
intention: Gary wants to find out who his girlfriend was talking to in the next room.
moral_action: Gary expresses his concern that his girlfriend was speaking so softly on the phone and asks her if everything is alright in their relationship.
immoral_action: Gary waits until his girlfriend is asleep and looks through her phone history.

norm: You shouldn't put up with a disrespectful neighbor.
situation: Albert's neighbor is loud and obnoxious, and is always using power tools really late at night.
intention: Albert wants to deal with the noise.
moral_action: Albert confronts his neighbor and tells him he needs to knock off the noise at such late hours.
immoral_action: Albert avoids confrontation with his neighbor and tries to drown out the noise with a fan.

norm: You shouldn't lie in front of your friends.
situation: Fred is with his friends at a party and the group are talking about cars.
intention: Fred wants to his friends to think he is handy.
moral_action: Fred tells his friends that he is planning to do a few DIY maintenance tasks on his car soon.
immoral_action: Fred tells his friends that he re-did the brakes on his car last week when he actually knows nothing about car brake systems.

norm: You shouldn't blow up at your friends.
situation: Sara is a journalist under immense pressure because she has a deadline to finish her story, and her friend Jamie comes up to ask her to go for coffee.
intention: Sara wants to respond to Jamie.
moral_action: Sara turns around and tells Jamie that this story has a strict deadline and will make plans with her as soon as she's finished.
immoral_action: "Sara turns around and snaps, ""can't you see I'm busy""."

norm: You shouldn't get your coworker fired.
situation: Brenda has been called into her manager's office to discuss a problem that occurred between her and a coworker.
intention: Brenda wants to make herself look good.
moral_action: Brenda impresses the manager by accepting responsibility for the situation and suggesting ways to improve.
immoral_action: Brenda says that the coworker was responsible for the incident and gets the coworker fired.

norm: You shouldn't roofie your friends.
situation: James is attracted to his friend Laura, but she turned him down when he asked her out.
intention: James wants to hook up with Laura.
moral_action: James waits until Laura is bored and horny late one night, and they have sex.
immoral_action: James throws a party at his house, slips Rohypnol into Laura's drink, and has sex with her while she's passed out.

norm: You shouldn't get into fights with your coworkers.
situation: Jordan and Steve were in a heated discussion at their place of work.
intention: Jordan wants to stop hearing Steve talk.
moral_action: Jordan walks away from Steve and locks himself in his office.
immoral_action: Jordan punches Steve in work while they are standing in the break room at work.

norm: You shouldn't expose someone in front of all their friends.
situation: Henry's friend Kyle revealed that he believed he might be gay, but he was scared to tell others about it.
intention: Henry wants to help Kyle open up to their other friends.
moral_action: Henry encourages Kyle that he should trust their friends will accept him and that he should open up to them about it.
immoral_action: Henry decided to take the lead and tell all of his friends that Kyle may be gay.

norm: You shouldn't demand money from your partner.
situation: Thomas notices that his fianc makes quite a bit more money than he does, and he feels resentful that the household bills are split evenly.
intention: Thomas wants his fianc to accept more of the responsibility for paying that household bills.
moral_action: Thomas talks with her and explains that he would like to save more money, and asks if she could help by paying a larger share of the bills.
immoral_action: Thomas insists that she immediately begin contributing more toward the monthly expenses.

norm: You shouldn't hit your friend's pets.
situation: Billy is going on a business trip and asks Sam to watch his new dog, that has a tendency to jump on people.
intention: Sam wants the dog to stop jumping on him.
moral_action: "Sam trains the dog to stop jumping on people by saying ""No!"" loudly every time it jumps and giving it treats for listening."
immoral_action: Sam smacks the dog every time it tries to jump on him.

norm: You shouldn't beat up your friends.
situation: Joshua is playing baseball with his friends when his friends call him out even though he wasn't.
intention: Joshua wants to debate the call.
moral_action: Joshua explains to the other kids why he thinks that he was safe.
immoral_action: Joshua starts beating up the other kids that had called him out.

norm: You shouldn't stick your nose into someone else's business.
situation: Lucy was in the waiting room as Jessie while Jessie was on the phone.
intention: Lucy wants to sit down.
moral_action: Lucy sits across the room from Jessie, so she can carry on her conversation in private.
immoral_action: Lucy sits right by Jessie and interjects comments as Jessie tries to have a conversation.

norm: You shouldn't blow off your friends.
situation: Vanessa sits in her car after a fourteen hour shift when her friends ask her if she's still up for going to the bar.
intention: Vanessa wants to relax.
moral_action: Vanessa invites her friends over to her house a quiet evening.
immoral_action: Vanessa does not answer her friends, and she drives home taking a long nap on her bed.

norm: You should not make accusations against friends
situation: Will's leather jacket has gone missing at school, and he thinks that Mike might have it.
intention: Will wants to see if Mike has the jacket.
moral_action: Will asks Mike if he has seen the jacket anywhere.
immoral_action: Will accuses Mike of taking the jacket and goes through his belongings to find it.

norm: You shouldn't put up with disrespectful behavior from a classmate.
