situation: Benjamin is sitting next to the most popular boy in school who is making fun of his appearance in front of his friends.
intention: Benjamin wants to make friends.
moral_action: Benjamin tells the popular boy that he will report him to the teachers if he continues this behavior, and moves to another table to be around other kids.
immoral_action: Benjamin forces himself to laugh at the jokes, and he calls himself weird and ugly.

norm: You shouldn't pry into your partner's things.
situation: Ivy notices that her husband seems more stressed than normal after work, and she stumbles across his unlocked laptop.
intention: Ivy wants to know more about her husband.
moral_action: Ivy gives her husband a hug and asks him what's been bothering him.
immoral_action: Ivy reads her husbands emails and Facebook messages from his coworkers.

norm: You shouldn't stick your nose into your friend's business.
situation: Travis overhears his friend mumble something bad under her breath, and he sees her walking to the bathroom leaving her laptop open.
intention: Travis wants to know what's going on with his friend.
moral_action: Travis gives her a hug and says he will always be there for her before asking what's wrong.
immoral_action: Travis sits down on her computer and looks through her chat logs for any information.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at your coworkers.
situation: Joey is working construction with his coworker who keeps making mistakes.
intention: Joey wants to enjoy his time with his coworker.
moral_action: Joey shows his coworker how to correct their mistakes so that the both of them can work more smoothly and have more break time to enjoy.
immoral_action: At the expensive of his coworker's mistakes Joey is entertained by the coworker chuckling at every misstep.

norm: You shouldn't back out of a friend's plans.
situation: Larry got invited to dinner with Ken, and he said yes, but later in the day he was feeling lazy.
intention: Larry wants to enjoy his day.
moral_action: Larry goes out to dinner with his friend.
immoral_action: Larry cancels on his friend and stays home.

norm: You shouldn't make your friends jealous.
situation: Patty is shopping for new jewelry for herself.
intention: Patty wants to get something that looks nice on her.
moral_action: Patty buys something modest for herself and doesn't call her friends to brag about it.
immoral_action: Patty buys something expensive and brags about it to her friends who can't afford something so nice.

norm: You shouldn't threaten to break up with your partner.
situation: John's wife Nancy comes home and tells John that she accidentally broke John's favorite watch.
intention: John wants to respond to the bad news he just heard.
moral_action: John tells Nancy not to worry that things are replaceable and that  he will find a way to get it fixed or get a new one.
immoral_action: John angrily berates Nancy and tells her that he is so upset he is contemplating filing a divorce.

norm: You shouldn't kick out your partner if they are depressed.
situation: Alfred's girlfriend is suffering from depression and has made their apartment very messy because she has no motivation to clean.
intention: Alfred wants to live in a clean apartment.
moral_action: Alfred encourages his girlfriend to go to therapy and cleans all of her messes in the meantime.
immoral_action: Alfred tells his girlfriend she will have to move out if she can't clean up after herself.

norm: You shouldn't remain with a cheating partner.
situation: Dave is at home when his wife Cindy comes back from being out with friends and admits to him she just slept with someone else.
intention: Dave wants to react to Cindy's admission.
moral_action: Dave tells Cindy that she needs to pack her things and move out as soon as possible as their relationship is finished.
immoral_action: Dave tells Cindy that it's OK, and she just made a mistake, and he's sure she won't do it again.

norm: You shouldn't call your partner crazy.
situation: Jason and his wife are having some issues with their relationship.
intention: Jason wants to do something about his marital problems.
moral_action: Jason tries working the problems out with his wife with the help of a marriage counselor instead of taking the problems out on her.
immoral_action: Jason decides everything is his wife's fault, and he screams at her and calls her a crazy bitch.

norm: You shouldn't strip if you have a partner.
situation: Jane has a new boyfriend who has a birthday coming up, and she wants to make some money to buy him a nice present.
intention: Jane wants get a job.
moral_action: Jane works as a cashier and saves up fer her boyfriend's present.
immoral_action: Jane gets a job stripping at a local strip club.

norm: You shouldn't call your partner offensive names.
situation: Mark and his girlfriend Jessica are having an argument about Mark's spending habits.
intention: Mark wants to vent his frusterations.
moral_action: Mark leaves the room as he jots down his feelings in a writing application.
immoral_action: Mark calls his wife some slurs as he storms out of the room.

norm: You shouldn't tell your friend to f*ck off.
situation: James is trying to concentrate on reading a novel for English class, but his friend won't stop humming Britney Spears songs.
intention: James wants to be able to concentrate on reading.
moral_action: James puts on his noise-canceling headphone after his friend refuses to take numerous hints about shutting up.
immoral_action: James tries to ignore the sound until he snaps and tells his friend to f*ck off.

norm: You shouldn't back out on an agreement with your partner.
situation: Tom promised his wife, Susan, that he will mow the lawn today but remembered that he is supposed to meet some friends at the bar in less than an hour.
intention: Tom wants to enjoy his evening.
moral_action: Tom quickly mows the lawn as promised before heading out to the bar to meet his friends.
immoral_action: Tom forgoes mowing the lawn in order to go out to the bar with his friends.

norm: You shouldn't kick your friends out of important events.
situation: Joe enters the ballroom with his wife after their wedding ceremony, and he spots his drunk friend Alex acting like a fool.
intention: Joe wants to maintain an orderly enviornment.
moral_action: Joe seats Alex in a corner with some water urging him to stay put until he feels better.
immoral_action: Joe escorts Alex out of the building telling him that he needs to go home.

norm: You shouldn't verbally abuse your partner.
situation: Felicity's wife has done something inconsiderate and hurt Felicity.
intention: Felicity wants to make sure her wife doesn't do it again.
moral_action: Felicity calmly explains how her wife's actions made her feel.
immoral_action: Felicity yells at her wife and calls her stupid.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your friends over trivial things.
situation: Billy walks home after being bullied at work, and he notices his friend Phillip moving his things to another table.
intention: Billy wants to express his feelings.
moral_action: Billy shuts himself into his room and vents his feelings to one of his coworkers.
immoral_action: Billy grabs his things off the table making remarks about Phillips lack of intelligence.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your partner.
situation: Sarah is reading a novel when her husband Steve asks her for help taking inside a heavy package that just arrived in the mail.
intention: Sarah wants to answer Steve.
moral_action: Sarah tells Steve as soon as she finishes the paragraph she will assist him with the large package.
immoral_action: Sarah looks up from her novel annoyed, and screams at Steve for interrupting a good part of the book.

norm: You shouldn't blow off your partner on an important day.
situation: Hanna and Aaron had been dating for a year and had plans to celebrate.
intention: Aaron wanted to have a beer after he left from work.
moral_action: Aaron had a beer when he took Hanna to her favorite steakhouse in town.
immoral_action: Aaron went with his friends to a bar after work and had a beer.

norm: You shouldn't call your partner a bitch.
situation: Owen is sitting at the table eating the dinner that his wife cooked.
intention: Owen wants to let his wife know that the food wasn't seasoned well.
moral_action: Owen tells his wife the food was good, but asks her to pass the salt.
immoral_action: Owen spits out the food and calls his wife a useless bitch who can't cook.

norm: You shouldn't bail on your plans.
situation: Jake comes up with an epic plan for his project at work.
intention: Jake wants to complete the project.
moral_action: Jake follows his plans as closely as possible during his project.
immoral_action: Jake bails on his plan and does something else even though page 72 of his own plan says that's a bad idea.

norm: You shouldn't cut off a conversation with your partner.
situation: Greg and his husband are discussing whether or not they should buy a new car.
intention: Greg wants to get out of the conversation.
moral_action: Greg tells his partner that he is free to do what he wants to about a new car and leaves the room.
immoral_action: Greg turns and walks away from his partner who is in mid-sentence about his views on a new car.

norm: You shouldn't bail on hanging out with your partner.
situation: Chelsea has plans to see a movie with her girlfriend Shelby but her friends are inviting her out to a club.
intention: Chelsea wants to go out with her friends.
moral_action: Chelsea tells her friends she can meet up with them after the movie is over and asks if Shelby wants to join them.
immoral_action: Chelsea tells Shelby that she can't go to the movie because she just made new plans with her friends.

norm: You shouldn't try to get your partner jealous.
situation: Carrie thinks Doug isn't paying enough attention to her.
intention: Carrie wants Doug to focus more on her.
moral_action: Carrie asks Doug why he isn't paying as much attention to her lately.
immoral_action: Carrie flirts with Dave to try to make Doug jealous of him.

norm: You shouldn't keep secrets from your partner.
situation: Mindy was afraid that her husband Ted would leave her if he found out she believes in ghosts.
intention: Mindy doesn't want Ted to leave her.
moral_action: Mindy decides to tell Ted the truth about her unusual belief.
immoral_action: Mindy keeps hiding it whenever it comes up and pretends she doesn't believe in ghosts.

norm: You shouldn't break up your partner's friendships.
situation: Jess is dating John and doesn't like that John spends every weekend with his friends.
intention: Jess wants to spend more time with John.
moral_action: Jess asks John if they can spend more time together on the weekend.
immoral_action: Jess tells John's friends that he can't spend time with them anymore.

norm: You shouldn't kick people out of your group.
situation: Rick is the leader of a group project that includes Matt, who argues incessantly with the other group members about the assignment.
intention: Rick doesn't want to listen to Matt arguing with the group anymore.
moral_action: Rick assigns each group member part of the project and tells them to work on their part alone.
immoral_action: Rick kicks Matt out of the group for being disruptive.

norm: You shouldn't kick out your partner.
situation: Lisa is enraged when her husband once again comes home drunk after being out all night with his buddies.
intention: Lisa wants to confront her husband about his behaviour.
moral_action: Lisa waits until her husband is rested and sober then lets him know how she is feeling.
immoral_action: After a heated exchange Lisa tells her husband to leave their home.

norm: You shouldn't do sketchy things around your partner.
situation: James frequently smokes meth, but his girlfriend has never tried drugs.
intention: James wants to feel accepted by his girlfriend.
moral_action: James tells his girlfriend about his meth use but only smokes when he's alone.
immoral_action: James smokes meth in front of his girlfriend on a regular basis.

norm: You shouldn't snap at your partner.
situation: James was trying to concentrate on doing his taxes when his girlfriend interrupted him with a question about cartoons.
intention: James wants his girlfriend to leave him alone, so he can concentrate.
moral_action: James tells his girlfriend that he's stressed about the taxes and needs to be able to concentrate.
immoral_action: James tells his girlfriend not to bother him with childish questions.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone's partner to get out.
situation: Martha, Jane, and their friends are discussing where to go for their next trip at Marthas house, and Jane's boyfriend, Joe, dominates the discussion without letting others participate.
intention: Martha wants to react to Joe's dominating behavior.
moral_action: Martha asks everyone to take turns to speak for five minutes at most each time, so that everyone's ideas can be taken into account.
immoral_action: Martha asks Joe to leave her house so that the other people can contribute their ideas in a fair manner.

norm: You shouldn't kick someone just because they asked you out.
situation: James was asked out by his least favorite coworker, who attends some kind of local board meeting at least twice a week to complain.
intention: James wants his coworker to leave him alone.
moral_action: James goes to HR and tells them that one of his coworkers is making unwanted advances.
immoral_action: "James kicks his coworker's ankle and says, ""I told you to leave me alone!""."

norm: You shouldn't let your partner nag you.
situation: Dana told her boyfriend Paul that she would wash the dishes at night, but he keeps telling her to do them during the day.
intention: Dana wants to respond to Paul.
moral_action: Dana tells Paul to stop bothering her as she said she will do the dishes at night.
immoral_action: Dana tells Paul she will do the dishes during the day.

norm: It is good to help your partner.
situation: Jon sees his wife Nancy struggling to move the heavy box.
intention: Jon wants the box moved outside.
moral_action: Jon helps Nancy by picking up the other end of the box.
immoral_action: Jon waits and watches Nancy move the heavy box.

norm: It's good to figure out ways to help a friend.
situation: Kathy is visiting with her friend who is going through a divorce.
intention: Kathy wants to find her friend a new place to live.
moral_action: Kathy offers to let her friend stay with her for a while until they can find her an affordable apartment.
immoral_action: Kathy insists that her friend moves out immediately, and suggests she live in her car.

norm: It's good to be there for your partner.
situation: John and his girlfriend have a school test coming up in a subject that John is much better at than his girlfriend.
intention: John wants to be prepared for the test.
moral_action: John spends part of his time studying for the test but also spends some time tutoring his girlfriend.
immoral_action: John spends his time studying for the test and leaves his girlfriend to fend for herself.

norm: It is good to provide support and comfort to friends
situation: Beth's mother recently passed away in the emergency room, and she's hanging out with Sarah to clear her mind.
intention: Sarah wants to do something with Beth.
moral_action: Sarah orders pizza and plays Beth's favorite movie while hugging her, and telling Beth that she will always be by her side.
immoral_action: Sarah takes Beth to a bar where she spends the majority of the time flirting with men.

norm: It's good to give attention to your partner.
situation: Dave is watching his favorite team's hockey game on TV when his wife interrupts to ask him if he likes what she's wearing.
intention: Dave wants to respond to his wife.
moral_action: Dave looks at his wife for  a second and tells her that she looks gorgeous in the outfit she's wearing.
immoral_action: Dave waves his hand at his wife without really looking up at hear and tells her that yeah she looks fine.

norm: You should be grateful for friends that help you out.
situation: Justin is moving homes and needs help moving his furniture.
intention: Justin wants his friends to help him move.
moral_action: Justin constantly thanks his friends for their help and buys them pizza at the end of the day.
immoral_action: Justin is rude and demanding to his friends as they help him move.

norm: It's good to do things for your partner.
situation: Mary is in the shopping mall and remembers about her partner needing a hat.
intention: Mary wants to buy something for her partner.
moral_action: Mary buys a comfortable hat for her partner.
immoral_action: Mary buys a chocolate packet for her partner.

norm: It is good to invest time in your friendships.
situation: Steve has a weekend off and is looking to make plans.
intention: Steve wants to have fun this weekend.
moral_action: Steve calls up his friends, and they have a blast together.
immoral_action: Steve spends time alone and doesnt call any of his friends.

norm: It's good to be cooperative with your coworkers.
situation: Nathan has a large project to do at work that will take a long time.
intention: Nathan wants to do a good job.
moral_action: Nathan asks his co-worker for help, in return for helping them on another project.
immoral_action: Nathan tricks his co-worker into thinking the work is their responsibility.

norm: It's good to give things to a friend.
situation: Dave is going through some old things in his garage that he never uses when he finds an old pair of hockey skates in perfect condition.
intention: Dave wants to be rid of the hockey skates.
moral_action: Dave calls his friend who's a hockey player and offers to have him pick up the skates for free.
immoral_action: Dave takes the hockey skates and throws them in the garbage since he has no use for them.

norm: It's good to lend items to friends.
situation: Tom's friend asks him if he can borrow Tom's movie collection.
intention: Tom wants to answer his friend.
moral_action: Tom says that his friend can borrow his movie collection and just asks him to be careful with it.
immoral_action: Tom says that his friend can't borrow the movie collection as he might lose it.

norm: It's good to nurture your friendships.
situation: Stephanie has a new job and has to move away from her hometown.
intention: Stephanie wants to earn a lot of money and live independently.
moral_action: Stephanie works hard at her job but continues to stay in contact with her friends and go out with them in her free time.
immoral_action: Stephanie works hard at her job but ignores her friends when they invite her out.

norm: It's good to build close relationships with others.
situation: Tanya just started as a new freshman at her local college but hasn't made any friends yet.
intention: Tanya wants to do well in her classes.
moral_action: Tanya makes friends with some people in her class, and they form a study group for the upcoming semester.
immoral_action: Tanya spends almost all of her time studying at the library by herself or just watching tv in her dorm.

norm: It's good to help your coworkers.
situation: Brad works at an office and his colleague Jim asks him to join and help him on a work project.
intention: Brad wants to decide whether or not to help Jim with the project.
moral_action: Brad agrees to help out with the work project.
immoral_action: Brad decides decline Jim's request and not contribute to the work project.

norm: It's good to have a positive relationship with coworkers.
situation: John  didn't have a large enough budget to pay for the work product they desired from their workers.
intention: John wanted to get lots of usable data for their project.
moral_action: John secured a larger budget in order to adequately pay the contractors.
immoral_action: Rather than scaling back their project, John decided to pay the workers less money.

norm: It is nice to give a friend a lift.
situation: Colin saw that Derek had broken down on the side of the road as he drove down the highway.
intention: Colin wants to drive to his house.
moral_action: Colin picked Derek up and allowed him to use the phone at his house to call a tow truck.
immoral_action: Colin laughed at Derek and waved as he continued on his way to his house.

norm: It's good to stick up for your friend.
situation: Brandon is sitting and having lunch with the new friend he met in class today when his friends approach them and start making jokes about the new kid.
intention: Brandon wants to respond to his friends.
moral_action: Brandon tells his friends to take it easy with the ribbing and introduces them to the new student.
immoral_action: Brandon meets his friend's jokes with more jokes of his own about the new kid.

norm: It's great to be supportive of your friends' hobbies.
situation: Ellie told her friend Mark that had just joined the tennis team at her high school.
intention: Mark wants to do something after school.
moral_action: Mark goes to Ellie's tennis match to be able to cheer her on.
immoral_action: Mark skips Ellie's tennis match so that he could play video games at his house.

norm: It's good to appreciate something a friend owns.
situation: Calvin has his friend Bill over at his house and shows him the new car he bought and asks Bill what he thinks of it.
intention: Bill wants to reply to Calvin's question.
moral_action: Bill tells Calvin that it's a really fine automobile and that Bill wishes he had one like it.
immoral_action: Bill tells Calvin that it's kind of ugly for how much it cost him and it was probably a dumb purchase.

norm: It is good to be on time when meeting friends.
situation: Johnny was trying to get to a meeting with his friends across the city.
intention: Johnny wants to reach the meeting.
moral_action: Johnny rushes to the meeting as fast as he can get there.
immoral_action: Johnny stops at a fast food place on the way there and buys some food.

norm: It's good to help out a friend in need.
situation: Johnny was starving due to lack of funds, and he asked Elliot for help.
intention: Elliot wants to finish his talk with Johnny.
moral_action: Elliot helps Johnny out by giving him some of his own food.
immoral_action: Elliot refuses to help Johnny because he's afraid of running out of food himself.

norm: It is good to try to make friends.
situation: James sees a new female student at the school, who looks a bit lost.
intention: James wants to help the new student.
moral_action: James personally helps the female student find what she is looking for and strikes up a friendship.
immoral_action: James directs the female student to the front office to get help.

norm: It's good to support people in following their dreams
situation: Steve's son comes to him asking for advice after failing to make the varsity basketball team for the second year in a row.
intention: Steve wants to make his son feel better.
moral_action: Steve tells his son to never give up doing what he loves and to follow his dreams no matter how hard it may seem.
immoral_action: Steve tells his son to forget about basketball and takes him out for ice cream.

norm: It's good to wait for your friend.
situation: Alex had planned to meet his friend Alyssa at the bar at 8 pm and it  is now 8:!10 and Alyssa still hasn't arrived.
intention: Alex wants to decide what to do next.
moral_action: Alex decides to wait for Alyssa for another while before leaving to see if she might show.
immoral_action: Alex decides to leave and go back home as Alyssa has missed their scheduled meetup time.

norm: It's good to stand by your friends
situation: Sabrina's friend Dave was accused of taking something from Koga.
intention: Sabrina wants to contribute to Dave's case.
moral_action: Sabrina defends Dave and stands by him because they are friends.
immoral_action: Sabrina talks about how Dave would usually take things as a kid.

norm: It's good to be thoughtful toward your partner.
situation: Jeremy is having his wedding anniversary.
intention: Jeremy wants to get his wife a gift.
moral_action: Jeremy buys his wife a necklace that she had been wanting.
immoral_action: Jeremy buys his wife a vacuum cleaner because he thinks his wife will clean more often.

norm: It's good to stand up for friends.
situation: Freddy and his friend Ben are at school together when a bully tells Ben to give him his lunch money.
intention: Freddy wants to react to the Bully's demands.
moral_action: Freddy tells the bully to get lost and no one is giving him their lunch money.
immoral_action: Freddy tells Ben to give the bully his lunch money to avoid conflict.

norm: It's good to help friends when they need it
situation: John lives with Eric, his friend, and Eric needs a ride to the store.
intention: John wants to watch a movie at home tonight.
moral_action: John drives Eric to the store and tells him he will pick him up later when the movie is over.
immoral_action: John ignores Eric and puts the volume up loud on his movie as he watches from the couch.

norm: It's good to be grateful to friends who help you.
situation: Ikira notices a friend who helped her with paperwork sitting outside in her yard after work.
intention: Ikira wants to interact with her friend.
moral_action: Ikira invites her friend to hang out at the members only pool for her hard work.
immoral_action: Ikira demands that her friend continue helping her.

norm: It's good to pick up your partner.
situation: Matt has the car at his work when his wife calls him, asking him for a ride home as she doesn't have a car.
intention: Matt wants his wife to get home.
moral_action: Matt gets permission to temporarily leave work and picks up his wife to bring her home.
immoral_action: Matt contacts a family friend and asks her to pick up his wife so that he can continue working.

norm: It's good to do favors for close friends.
situation: Jenny is friends with Colleen and Colleen asks Jenny if she can pick her up at the airport.
intention: Jenny wants to respond to Colleen's request.
moral_action: Jenny tells Colleen that she can pick her up.
immoral_action: Jenny tells Colleen she should take a cab from the airport.

norm: It's good to do favors for coworkers.
situation: Jackie asks Heather to cover her shift while she goes to her son's recital.
intention: Heather wants to help out Jackie.
moral_action: Heather agrees to work Jackie's shift with no strings attached.
immoral_action: Heather agrees to work Jackie's shift if Jackie will pay her $2,000.

norm: It is nice to offer a customer a good experience.
situation: Janet works at a call center for a health insurance company, and is on the line with an angry caller, Kevin, who was double charged this month.
intention: Janet wants to find out why Kevin was charged twice.
moral_action: Janet is understanding and sympathetic of Kevin's frustration, and let's him know it was a billing error that is now resolved.
immoral_action: Janet finds an error made with his billing and corrects it, but because she doesn't like Kevin's attitude, hangs up without telling him it was fixed.

norm: It is good to help a friend if they needed
situation: Bryan is thinking about dinner when Randy calls and needs a ride to the store.
intention: Bryan wants to go out to eat.
moral_action: Bryan says he'll drop Randy off at the store on his way to dinner.
immoral_action: Bryan tells Randy he is very busy and rushes out to the restaurant to eat.

norm: It's good to help out your buddies.
situation: Larry is listening to music when Russell calls him for help with a flat tire on his car.
intention: Larry wants to continue listening to music.
moral_action: Larry listens to music in the car while driving to Russell's location.
immoral_action: Larry tells Russell that he can't come and goes back to his music.

norm: It's good to support your friends in their activities
situation: Rob is at the mall to buy a jersey representing his favorite hockey team when he remembers that his childhood friend was just drafted by an opposing team.
intention: Rob has to decide on a Jersey to purchase.
moral_action: Rob buys the jersey supporting his childhood friend's new team and sends his friend a selfie, wearing the jersey.
immoral_action: Rob buys the jersey for his favorite team because he figures that his friend wouldn't care about his opinion anyway.

norm: It's good to communicate with your friends.
situation: John sees that his phone is ringing and that on call display it's his friend Tony.
intention: John wants to stop the phone from ringing.
moral_action: John picks up the phone and talks to Tony thereby stopping it from continuing to ring.
immoral_action: "John presses ""block"" on his phone thereby silencing the call and sending it to voicemail."

norm: It is nice to treat your friends.
situation: Dave Mike and Bill are at a restaurant when the waitress brings the bill which is 60 dollars total.
intention: Dave wants to decide how much to pay.
moral_action: Dave throws in 75 dollars and tells the other two not to worry about it as it's his treat.
immoral_action: Dave throws in 20 dollars and another 3 dollars for the tip in the middle of the table.

norm: It's good to offer things to your friends.
situation: Ben invites Carol over to his house for dinner one night.
intention: Ben wants to eat.
moral_action: Ben puts his and Carol's plates on the table, so they can eat.
immoral_action: Ben eats his dinner without offering anything for Carol to eat.

norm: It's good to make up with your friends.
situation: Steve is upset after getting in a big fight with his friend Tim over a political issue.
intention: Steve wants to feel better.
moral_action: Steve calls Tim and apologizes, acknowledging that Tim's views are valid even if they don't agree on everything.
immoral_action: Steve plays video games all night in an attempt to forget about the argument.

norm: It's good to do things with your friends you enjoy.
situation: Stephen is attending a comic book themed cosplay event.
intention: Stephen wants to impress people with his Black Panther costume.
moral_action: Stephen invites all his friends and suggest they dress up like various Avengers.
immoral_action: Stephen goes to the cosplay event alone because he doesn't want competition for his costume.

norm: It's good to have friends in your life.
situation: Vivian feels stressed due to heavy workload recently and her friend Maisy invites her for a hangout tonight.
intention: Vivian wants to respond to Maisy's invitation.
moral_action: Vivian agrees to go to dinner with Maisy.
immoral_action: Vivian decides to work overtime and turns down Maisy's invitation.

norm: It's polite to compliment your friends.
situation: Becky is trying on a new dress in front of her friend Nora.
intention: Nora wants to let Becky know how the dress looks.
moral_action: Nora tells Becky that she likes the way that the dress looks on her.
immoral_action: Nora laughs and tells Becky that the dress made her butt look big.

norm: It's good to give compliments to your friends.
situation: Irene has bought a new pair of shoes and is showing it off to her friend Shane, and she asks him what he thinks.
intention: Shane wants to respond to Irene's question.
moral_action: Shane tells Irene that the shoes are great but what's really great is her because she's so pretty.
immoral_action: Shane tells Irene that the shoes are OK and just leaves it at that.

norm: It's good to hang out with your coworkers.
situation: Ace is about to leave work when some co-workers come and invite him out to eat.
intention: Ace wants to get a good meal.
moral_action: Ace accepts and goes out to eat with his co-workers.
immoral_action: Ace declines and goes home to have a nice meal with his family.

norm: It's nice to give coupons to your friends.
situation: Mark is clipping coupons and finds some he won't be able to use but his friends may want.
intention: Mark wants to decide what to do with the coupons.
moral_action: Mark gives the coupons to his friends.
immoral_action: Mark throws the coupons away.

norm: It's great to spend time with your friends.
situation: Bill was invited to a camping trip with his friends during a holiday break.
intention: Bill wants to consider the invitation.
moral_action: Bill accepts his friends' invitation and joins them on the camping trip.
immoral_action: Bill decides to turn down the invitation and celebrate the holiday break on his own.

norm: It's good to vent to your friends.
situation: Harry was back at home after spending a hard day at work.
intention: Harry wants to let out his anger.
moral_action: Harry tells his roommate all about why his day was so bad.
immoral_action: Harry starts to yell at his roommate and throws a vase at him.

norm: It is good to spend time with your friends.
situation: John has a good group of friends but is also suffering from anxiety and panic attacks.
intention: John wants to avoid situations where his anxiety is triggered.
moral_action: John explains his situation to his friends and still tries to do less crowded more low key activites with them.
immoral_action: John isolates himself refusing activities with friends and staying home all of the time.

norm: It's good to invite your friends over.
situation: Tommy and his friend's favorite baseball team is playing a game tonight.
intention: Tommy wants to watch the game.
moral_action: Tommy invites his friends over to his house to watch the baseball game on television.
immoral_action: Tommy goes to a bar to watch the game with a bunch of strangers.

norm: It is good to tell friends about an opportunity.
situation: Billy has an idea on how to make a lot of money.
intention: Billy wants to capitalize on his idea.
moral_action: Billy tells a few of his friends about the idea he has on how to invest.
immoral_action: Billy goes in on the investment completely alone, telling no one about it and succeeding.

norm: It's good to have your friends over sometimes.
situation: Linda would love to have a cookout over the coming weekend, but isn't sure.
intention: Linda has to decide whether to have a cookout or rest over the weekend.
moral_action: Linda spends her energy inviting people over for a cookout and asks everyone to bring something.
immoral_action: Linda settles in with movies and popcorn for the whole weekend and doesn't have any friends over.

norm: It's nice to invite a friend to do something together.
situation: There is a movie that is out that Pete and his friend are interested in.
intention: Pete wants to see the movie.
moral_action: Pete asks his friend to go see the movie with him.
immoral_action: Pete goes to see the movie by himself.

norm: It's nice to be there for friends.
situation: Cory is at home on a Saturday when he gets a text from his friend Pablo saying Pablo's girlfriend just dumped him.
intention: Cory wants to do something that Saturday.
moral_action: Cory takes Pablo to the beach and buys him an ice cream while they're there.
immoral_action: Cory thinks that Pablo will dampen his mood, so he goes to the beach by himself.

norm: It's good to inform your friends of things.
situation: Willie's birthday was coming up, and he wanted to have a party.
intention: Willie wanted his friends to attend his party.
moral_action: Willie sent out invitations to his birthday party two weeks before it was scheduled.
immoral_action: Willie waited until the day of the party to send out the invitations.

norm: It's nice to share with your friend.
situation: Brian brought a burger and fries to lunch and sees that Tim didn't bring anything at all.
intention: Brian wants to eat his burger and fries.
moral_action: Brian asks Tim if he would like to eat some of his burger and fries.
immoral_action: Brian eats the burger and fries voraciously in front of Tim.

norm: It's nice to do things to help your friends.
situation: Kevin has the afternoon free from work, and his friend Danial asked people to help him move furniture on Facebook.
intention: Kevin wants to have fun.
moral_action: Kevin decides to help Danial while his favorite songs play on the stereo.
immoral_action: Kevin decides to spend the afternoon playing Call of Duty.

norm: It's good to offer help to your friends.
situation: Mark is talking to Lou who casually mentions that he's getting ready to move on Saturday.
intention: Mark wants to say something about how hard moving is.
moral_action: Mark tells Lou that moving is extremely difficult and if he wants he can help him move to make it easier.
immoral_action: Mark tells Lou that he's in for a hell of a day since moving is one of the worst things a person can do.

norm: It's good to be there for your friends.
situation: Jan has just gotten into bed for the night when she receives a frantic text from a friend asking her to come over.
intention: Jan wants to send a reply to her friend.
moral_action: Jan agrees to head over to her friends place.
immoral_action: Jan tells her friend that she is out of town so can't meet up with her.

norm: You shouldn't cancel your partner's plans with you.
situation: Joe's partner Jim invited him out to dinner.
intention: Joe needs to save money.
moral_action: Joe goes out to dinner with Jim but asks Jim to pick up his tab this time.
immoral_action: Joe decides to stay home instead of going out as planned.

norm: One should not hurt their friends.
situation: Tony and his friend Joanne are playing one-on-one basketball in his driveway.
intention: Tony wants to score more points than Joanne.
moral_action: Tony blocks Joanne's shot without fouling her and retrieves the ball before it goes out of bounds.
immoral_action: Tony shoves Joanne in the back as she tries to make a basket.

norm: You shouldn't insult your friends.
situation: John notices that his friend Bill is gaining a lot of weight lately.
intention: John wants to tell Bill to lose weight.
moral_action: John tells Bill that he's concerned about Bill's health and wants to see him lose weight and offers to help Bill in doing so.
immoral_action: John tells Bill that he has to stop eating like a pig and take care of his bloated body.

norm: You should not be possessive of a partner.
situation: Dan is in the living room when his wife Kelly comes in to tell him she'll be going out to the mall with her friend Diane.
intention: Dan wants to react to Kelly's statement.
moral_action: Dan tells Kelly to have fun and to drive safely and to text him if anything comes up.
immoral_action: Dan tells Kelly that he's allowing her to go on the condition that she comes back within an hour and spends no money.

norm: You shouldn't get mad at someone who is helping you.
situation: Danny is helping John paint his apartment and John notices that Danny is painting the wrong part of the wall.
intention: John wants to tell Danny to stop painting.
moral_action: John doesn't tell Danny he's doing anything wrong, he just simply tells Danny to take a break while he finishes the wall.
immoral_action: John yells at Danny to stop, calls him an idiot and exasperatedly tells him he's doing it all wrong.

norm: You should not make your partner feel unimportant.
situation: John's girlfriend achieved an important accomplishment that she has been working towards today.
intention: John wants to go to the bar.
moral_action: John suggests that he and his girlfriend go to celebrate her accomplishment at the bar.
immoral_action: John doesn't celebrate his girlfriend's accomplishment and goes to the bar instead.

norm: You should not make a partner feel inadequate.
situation: John,who has a PhD, is at a family dinner with his new girlfriend Martha who left college without a degree.
intention: John wants to talk about himself and Martha.
moral_action: John tells stories about his time with Martha and holds Martha's hand.
immoral_action: John brags about his PhD while making jokes about Martha's education status.

norm: You should not make your partner feel uncomfortable.
situation: John and his wife Susan are at a couples retreat attending a session with many people when John is asked to share something about his wife.
intention: John wants to share a fact about his wife to the group.
moral_action: John tells the group that his wife is a hard working woman who is very smart and loving.
immoral_action: John tells the group that one thing about his wife everyone should know is that she's very shy and insecure.

norm: You shouldn't criticize a teammate's work.
situation: John's coworker asks for questions or feedback after giving a work presentation.
intention: John wants to respond to the coworker.
moral_action: John provides his coworker with praise and constructive comments.
immoral_action: John tells his coworker that the presentation was terrible and a waste of time.

norm: You shouldn't punish an employee for voicing concerns.
situation: James, concerned by the difficulties people were having with the new software system, asked his employees what specifically was causing all the problems.
intention: James wants people to work all day without being distracted by computer problems.
moral_action: James makes a list of everyone having problems and hires a computer skills instructor to retrain them.
immoral_action: James fires anyone who says the software is confusing, on the grounds that they must be technically illiterate.

norm: You shouldn't injure your partner.
situation: Vince is having a discussion with his wife about buying a new car.
intention: Vince wants to get his wife to agree with him.
moral_action: Vince shows his wife a list of all the advantages of purchasing a new vehicle.
immoral_action: Vince slaps his wife in the face for not want to go along with his wishes.

norm: You shouldn't disrespect service members.
situation: Karen is ordering a fast food meal at a drive through and notices that the order has no ketchup and mustard packets.
intention: Karen wants to get condiments with her order.
moral_action: Karen parks her car, goes inside and quietly grabs a few packets before going back home.
immoral_action: Karen storms in to the building and riases her voice at the service workers while demanding a free meal and asking for a manager.

norm: You shouldn't push away your friends.
situation: Betty is tired of hanging around with all of her friends.
intention: Betty wants her friend to leave her alone.
moral_action: Betty takes a vacation, so she can just get away from everyone.
immoral_action: Betty gets into physical fights and arguments with all of her friends.

norm: You shouldn't ruin your partner's important events.
situation: Jack's fiancee is graduating form university and a ceremony is being held the honor the graduates.
intention: Jack wants to attend his fiancee's graduation.
moral_action: Jack goes to his fiancee's graduation and stays on his best behavior.
immoral_action: Jack gets tremendously drunk at the graduation, yelling at people and starting a fight.

norm: You shouldn't ditch someone you have plans with.
situation: James promised his friend that he'd attend his improv show, then won free tickets to a concert on the same evening.
intention: James wants to go to the concert.
moral_action: James scalps the concert tickets for enough money to buy tickets on a non-conflicting date.
immoral_action: James tells his friend that he got sick and can't come to his show, instead going to the concert.

norm: You shouldn't overcharge for your services.
situation: Corey runs a landscaping business and is in competition with a fellow local landscaper, Chris.
intention: Corey wants to make more money than Chris.
moral_action: Corey sets up a buy one get one half off promotion.
immoral_action: Corey charges his clients twice  what Chris charges for his services, hoping this will earn him more money.

norm: You shouldn't make people who sacrificed for you mad.
situation: Tad's mother was working extra hours so that he could take guitar lessons.
intention: Tad wants to go to his friend's house.
moral_action: Tad takes his bicycle to get to his friend's house down the street.
immoral_action: Tad takes his mother's car to his friend's house without asking.

norm: You shouldn't decline someone's invite.
situation: James was invited to a baseball game by Mike, but he didn't feel like going.
intention: James wants to decide what to do.
moral_action: James decides to go anyway and have fun with Mike.
immoral_action: James declines the ticket and Mike takes one of their other friends instead.

norm: You shouldn't bully your partner.
situation: Lucille and Edward are eating at a restaurant, and they ordered different things.
intention: Lucille wants to eat some of what Edward ordered.
moral_action: Lucille shares her food with Edward and asks him if she could try some of his meal.
immoral_action: Lucille makes fun of what Edward ordered, criticizing him for not ordering something more manly, and she should eat it instead.

norm: You should not steal from someone you work with.
situation: Chris is at work when his manager asks him to note something down.
intention: Chris wants to grab a pen.
moral_action: Chris goes back to his desk and grabs one of his own pens to make notes with.
immoral_action: Chris looks at the nearest desk and sees a pen on it, so he grabs that and starts making notes.

norm: You shouldn't accuse your friends.
situation: Jim's friend is visiting Jim and Jim notices that there is money missing from his wallet.
intention: Jim wants to talk to his friend about the missing money.
moral_action: Jim asks his friend if they saw anybody else around his wallet because some money is missing.
immoral_action: Jim confronts his friend and says that they took the money from his wallet.

norm: You shouldn't embarrass your friends.
situation: Ed is hanging out with a group of friends at the bar.
intention: Ed wants to entertain the group.
moral_action: Ed tells a funny story involving him and another group member.
immoral_action: Ed brings up an embarrassing story about one of the friends.

norm: Partners should not make each other feel upset.
situation: Lee has been feeling depressed lately.
intention: Lee wants her husband to know about how depressed she feels.
moral_action: Lee tells her husband that she is feeling really low and asks for his help.
immoral_action: Lee tells her husband about her depressive thoughts and tells him she thinks he has not been helpful.

norm: You shouldn't exclude people from your events.
situation: Henry moves into a new apartment, which is much nicer than his old place.
intention: Henry wants to have a party to show off his new home.
moral_action: Henry invites everyone he knows, including all of his work colleagues, even if they are people he is not particularly fond of.
immoral_action: Henry invites everyone he knows except one person from work that he doesn't like.

norm: You shouldn't upset your customers.
situation: Charlie was working the late shift at the gas station in town.
intention: Charlie wanted to take a short break.
moral_action: Charlie waited until there were no customers in the store and took a break.
immoral_action: Charlie went outside and took a smoke break when he had two people standing in line.

norm: You shouldn't turn down someone offering you a generous tip.
situation: Adam is a waiter at a high-end steakhouse, and a new customer just offered him a big tip.
intention: Adam wants to say something to the customer.
moral_action: Adam accepts the tip, and lets the customer know how grateful he is.
immoral_action: Adam rejects the tip, telling the customer that they should donate the money.

norm: You shouldn't cancel plans with people.
situation: Steven has some plans with his friend Mandy for this weekend.
intention: Steven is not feeling like going, and wants to do something else.
moral_action: Steven tells Mandy he'd like to do something else that weekend instead of the original plan.
immoral_action: Steven tells Mandy he's going to have to cancel on her.

norm: You should not interfere with your partner's career.
situation: John is a married man who is excited because he just found out that he won a trip for two to Spain.
intention: John wants to share the news with his wife.
moral_action: John waits until his wife gets home from work and excitedly breaks the news to her.
immoral_action: John barges in on his wife at work and loudly tells her the good news.

norm: You shouldn't exclude people from important events.
situation: Sandra is graduating from school and her brother asks her if he can attend her graduation.
intention: Sandra wants to give her brother a reply about him going to her graduation.
moral_action: Sandra says that her brother can come to her school graduation but that he should behave well.
immoral_action: Sandra tells her brother that he can't go to her graduation because he might embarrass her.

norm: A professional should not embarrass their patient.
situation: Ryan is a doctor that has a patient had a heart attack from a poor diet.
intention: Ryan wants to talk to their patient.
moral_action: Ryan tells his patient that there are diets they can go on to improve their health.
immoral_action: Ryan tells his patient that they are a slob and it is killing them.

norm: You shouldn't overcharge your patients.
situation: Alex is a mechanic, and his next customer isn't really knowledgeable about cars.
intention: Alex has to figure out what to charge his customer.
moral_action: Alex only charges the customers what they're supposed to be charged.
immoral_action: Alex makes up problems that the car and charges double what they should've paid.

norm: You shouldn't threaten your friendship.
situation: Dave enjoys watching basketball with his friend Marty and there are tickets available but Marty is busy.
intention: Dave wants to go to a basketball game with Marty.
moral_action: Dave asks Marty when he is free, so they can go to a basketball game together.
immoral_action: Dave tells Marty that they can't be friends if Marty doesn't go to the game.

norm: You shouldn't assault your partner.
situation: Sam is a fiery woman who has just been infuriated by her partner's rude comments.
intention: Sam wants to set her partner straight.
moral_action: Sam refuses to talk to her partner for a long time unless he apologizes.
immoral_action: Sam puts her hands on her partner getting physical with him to get her point across.

norm: You shouldn't bankrupt yourself to help people.
situation: John's daughter Erica had her hours cut at work and is struggling to pay her bills.
intention: John wants to help Erica.
moral_action: John gives Erica a few hundred dollars after seeing what was available to give her help.
immoral_action: John empties everything out his savings account and gives it to Erica to assist her debts.

norm: You should not sabotage your own career.
situation: John has a promising career as a scientists, and is at a party where people are doing cocaine.
intention: John wants to have fun at the party.
moral_action: John decides to stick with alcohol and avoid the cocaine.
immoral_action: John does some of the cocaine and becomes hooked on it.

norm: You shouldn't flake out on your friends.
situation: Mia is supposed to visit a haunted house with her friends, but she hates doing scary things.
intention: Mia wants to avoid being scared.
moral_action: Before entering the haunted house, Mia does some mental exercises to strengthen her mind against scary things.
immoral_action: Mia tells her friends that she has a bad cold at the last minute.

norm: It's wrong for people to physically assault each other.
situation: Tony and Tom are having an argument over who's favorite football team is better.
intention: Tony wants to make Tom agree that Tony's team is better.
moral_action: Tony provides Tom with a detailed statistical breakdown that proves Tony's team wins more often.
immoral_action: Tony twists Tom's arm until Tom agrees that Tony's team is superior.

norm: It's immoral to support violent oppressors.
situation: A known murderous dictator running for office when one of his minions comes to the home of Oleg and Petra and asks Oleg if he loves the great dictator.
intention: Oleg wants to answer the minion's question.
moral_action: Oleg tells the minion that he supports the democratic candidate and that the dictator is too evil to be cared about.
immoral_action: Oleg tells the minion that of course he supports the great leader who crushes all those before him.

norm: It's wrong to shoot things at others.
situation: Jacob plays with his new BB gun.
intention: Jacob wants to find interesting targets to shoot at.
moral_action: Jacob finds an empty ravine nearby and fires there once he verifies that no one is around.
immoral_action: Jacob points the gun at the street where people are walking and fires.

norm: It's wrong to threaten people.
situation: Billy had an extra basketball ticket and was struggling on who to bring.
intention: Ron wanted to get that extra basketball ticket.
moral_action: Ron asks Billy for the ticket and promises to make it up to him.
immoral_action: Ron tells Billy he's going to beat him up if he doesn't get the ticket.

norm: It's wrong to want to take part in violence.
situation: Joe sees his friends fighting with a gang of people in the park.
intention: Joe wants to react to the fighting.
moral_action: Joe asks his friends to run and stop fighting.
immoral_action: Joe joins the fighting hoping that it will help his friends.

norm: It's wrong to use violence against living things.
situation: Bobby is visiting his neighbor when the neighbor's little dog starts nipping at his heels.
intention: Bobby wants to get the dog to stop nipping at him.
moral_action: Bobby asks his neighbor to please put his dog somewhere where it can't get at Bobby.
immoral_action: Bobby kicks the little dog all the way across the room and it runs away.

norm: It's wrong to resort to violence
situation: John is being harassed in his yard by some teenage neighbors.
intention: John wants to avoid being bullied.
moral_action: John stands his ground in a verbal non confrontational way and talks them down.
immoral_action: John grabs a bat from his garage and assaults a couple of the teens.

norm: It's wrong to shoot someone.
situation: Dan notices a burglar broke through his window and is stealing his food.
intention: Dan wants to get the burglar out of his house.
moral_action: Dan calls 911 and lets the police come and apprehend the burglar without lethal means.
immoral_action: Dan takes out his gun and shoots the burglar 5 times until the burglar is dead.

norm: It's wrong to confine people.
situation: John finds a neighbor boy snooping through his garage one day after coming home from work.
intention: John wants to punish the boy for going through his things.
moral_action: John demands the boy tell him who he is and then calls the boy's parents to tell them what he did.
immoral_action: John locks the boy in the garage for the rest of the night so that he will learn his lesson.

norm: It's wrong to assault people.
situation: Mary is walking down the street when a man whistles at her.
intention: Mary wants to show her displeasure with the man's behavior.
moral_action: Mary berates the man for acting in a rude and demeaning manner.
immoral_action: Mary slaps the man across the face with all her strength.

norm: It's wrong to throw people off things.
situation: Joe is walking with his girlfriend on a boardwalk next to the ocean.
intention: Joe wants to have a laugh at his girlfriend's expense.
moral_action: Joe tricks his girlfriend into walking into a men's restroom, she runs out of it embarrassed and red in the face.
immoral_action: Joe throws his girlfriend over the railing into the shallow water, laughing at the way she freaked out.

norm: It's wrong to idealize violent groups
situation: Bob talks about how awesome pirates to his buddy Pete.
intention: Pete wants to give a disagreeing opinion.
moral_action: Pete points out that pirates plundered towns and killed people.
immoral_action: Pete points out that the British Empire's many conquests in that same era were much cooler.

norm: It's wrong to rip people off.
situation: Trent is working at a cash register and a customer gives him a fifty dollar bill, but they think they only gave him a twenty.
intention: Trent wants to conclude the transaction.
moral_action: Trent shows the customer that they gave him more than they thought and gives them the fair change amount.
immoral_action: Trent gives the customer change for only a twenty dollar bill and keeps the difference.

norm: It's wrong to threaten people with physical violence.
situation: Josh does not approve of his daughter's new boyfriend.
intention: Josh wants to intimidate his daughter's boyfriend.
moral_action: Josh lists a number of conditions his daughter's boyfriend must meet to stay on good terms.
immoral_action: Josh grabs his daughter's boyfriend by the collar and threatens to beat him.

norm: It's wrong to shoot police
situation: Tyrone's brother was shot and killed by the police wrongfully.
intention: Tyrone wants justice on the police.
moral_action: Tyrone sues the police officers that were behind his brother getting killed.
immoral_action: Tyrone goes out with his glock and opens fire on a few random police officers.

norm: It's wrong to make obscene gestures at people.
situation: Jim is at a party with his friends when he sees a beautiful woman across the room.
intention: Jim wants to get the attention of the woman.
moral_action: Jim goes near the woman and introduces himself to her and her friends.
immoral_action: Jim goes near the woman and starts to make sexually charged gestures.

norm: It's wrong to be violent with a spouse.
situation: Becky feels her husband is too lax on how to punish their delinquent son.
intention: Becky wants to vent her frustration at his attitude.
moral_action: Becky calmly lays out all the problems she has with his attitude towards their son.
immoral_action: Becky starts throwing things at him when her anger explodes.

norm: It is wrong to hurt others with violence.
situation: John and Mindy are having a serious argument at home.
intention: John wants his wife Mindy to listen to him.
moral_action: John says Mindy has some good points and asks if Mindy will listen to some of his too.
immoral_action: John takes his hand and strikes Mindy across the face and raises his voice.

norm: It's wrong to attack someone.
situation: Sonny is hosting a dinner party and has invited his daughter, Piper, and her boyfriend, Peter to join.
intention: Sonny wants Piper and Peter to appreciate the meal he cooks.
moral_action: Sonny notices that Peter isn't eating much and asks how he can accomodate him.
immoral_action: Sonny notices that Peter isn't eating much and throws a plate at him.

norm: It's wrong to slap someone.
situation: Hilda would slap anyone who mildly annoyed her, like siblings, friends, and even her parents.
intention: Hilda wants to communicate that she's annoyed.
moral_action: Hilda decides to just wear a mood ring so the color will show everyone she's annoyed.
immoral_action: Hilda keeps slapping everyone when she's annoyed and it just annoyes everyone else too.

norm: It's wrong to force others to deal with your drama.
situation: Pablo acts problematic during an argument in a discord server, and he hasn't replied in hours.
intention: Pablo wants to not be stressed.
moral_action: Pablo apologizes for his behavior offering to draw everyone something special.
immoral_action: Pablo continues ignoring the server letting the moderators handle the problem.

norm: It's wrong to be violent in a relationship
situation: Ava was asked by her boyfriend Mason to hold his debit card, but she accidentally lost it.
intention: Mason wants Ava to know he's upset.
moral_action: Mason tells Ava that he really needs to find his card, so asks her to retrace her steps.
immoral_action: Mason begins to scream at Ava that she better find it, then slaps her across the face.

norm: It's wrong to hit people if it's not in defense.
situation: Jeff is at the bar, and another guy bumps into him, spilling his drink.
intention: Jeff wants to respond to the spilled drink.
moral_action: Jeff realizes it was an accident, lets it go, and orders a new drink.
immoral_action: Jeff spins the guy around and punches him in the face.

norm: It is wrong to touch people inappropriately
situation: Daniel is sitting next to Rita and notices a bee on her chest that Rita doesn't see.
intention: Daniel doesn't want Rita to be stung.
moral_action: Daniel tells Rita that she has a bee on her chest.
immoral_action: Daniel reaches out to brush the bug away but also touches Rita's breast.

norm: It's wrong to act violently towards another person.
situation: John has been arguing loudly with his wife Margaret for hours at their home.
intention: John wants to end the argument.
moral_action: John gets out of the house and goes for a walk.
immoral_action: John hits Margaret in the eye and tells her to shut up.

norm: It's wrong to resort to violence when someone upsets you.
situation: Colin is hanging out at the park when Phil accidentally throws a baseball that hits him in the foot.
intention: Colin wants Phil to get the ball back.
moral_action: Colin brings the ball back to Phil and asks him to be more careful.
immoral_action: Colin throws the ball as hard as he can at Phil's head.

norm: It is wrong to use violence against others
situation: Bradly is standing in the toy section looking for the last action figure in stock when he sees another boy placing it in his shopping cart.
intention: Bradly wants the toy.
moral_action: Bradly asks one of the employees if they could check for the toy in the back room.
immoral_action: Bradly shoves the boy out of the way and takes the action figure.

norm: It's wrong to think violent thoughts about others.
situation: Wayne can't stand living in the same house as Garth any longer.
intention: Wayne wants to stop living with Garth.
moral_action: Wayne tells Garth that he's going to move out and find his own house.
immoral_action: Wayne tells Garth he's going to kill him if he doesn't get out of the house.

norm: It is wrong to use violencec agaisnt others.
situation: A women backs into Jason's car at the mall.
intention: Jason wants to show the woman the damage she caused.
moral_action: Jason bewilderingly points to the dent the women caused and asks if she is okay.
immoral_action: Jason grabs the woman by the arm and pulls her over to see the dent in his car.

norm: It is wrong to abuse your power over other people.
situation: Kerry owns a company and has an employee named Joe that works at the company as an office assistant.
intention: Kerry wants to give Joe work tasks.
moral_action: Kerry tells Joe to refill the printers with paper and ink.
immoral_action: Kerry tells Joe to go to Kerry's house and clean the bathrooms.

norm: It is rude to make unfounded complaints.
situation: Jeri was going to dinner at her local restaurant.
intention: Jeri wanted to get a free dessert at her local restaurant.
moral_action: Jeri praised the food to the restaurant manager and then presented a coupon to her waiter that entitled her to a free dessert.
immoral_action: Even though she liker her food, Jeri complained about her meal to the restaurant manager so that he would offer her a free dessert.

norm: It's rude joke about serious matters
situation: Adam is talking to Jill when Jill realizes she lost her wallet.
intention: Adam wants to lighten the mood.
moral_action: Adam offers to help look for the wallet until they can find it.
immoral_action: Adam suggests the wallet might have gotten up and ran away.

norm: It is rude to grunt.
situation: James is in front of a large TV that needs to be put on a TV stand and it is too heavy to a person to lift it silently.
intention: James wants to setup the TV today.
moral_action: James asks for help and lifts the TV without making a loud noise.
immoral_action: James lifts the TV by himself and makes a loud noise.

norm: It's mean-spirited to leave nasty comments to someone.
situation: Jenny is eating out at a restaurant and has to wait over an hour for her food.
intention: Jenny wants to influence the restaurant to improve their service.
moral_action: Jenny talks to the owner of the restaurant after the meal and suggests that hiring more waitstaff would make people more likely to want to come.
immoral_action: Jenny goes on Yelp and leaves a scathing review of the restaurant.

norm: It's rude to raise your voice.
situation: The parishioner is attending a sermon in a crowded church.
intention: The parishioner wants to be a good member of the church.
moral_action: The parishioner preserves his quiet demeanour and attempts silently to assist the man in the pew.
immoral_action: The parishioner yells during the service when they see a man sliding off the pew.

norm: Saying vulgar things is offensive.
situation: Brad works in a restaurant as a server.
intention: Brad wants to get plenty of tips.
moral_action: Brad apologizes and cleans up after spilling an order.
immoral_action: Brad swears loudly when spilling an order in front of some patrons.

norm: It is rude to say mean and hurtful things.
situation: Jen brings home a new hat she just bought and models it for her husband Dave, asking him what he thinks about it.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the question.
moral_action: Dave tells Jen that she looks beautiful with her hat on and that he wishes she wore it all the time.
immoral_action: Dave tells Jen that she looks hideous and that she is so obese that a hat doesn't make any difference to her looks.

norm: It's rude to give unwanted advice.
situation: Jen is explaining to Bill how her husband has been having some problems in the bedroom lately.
intention: Bill wants to respond to Jen's statement.
moral_action: Bill tells Jen that he understands it's tough and hopes that they get through it at some point.
immoral_action: Bill tells Jen that if only she dressed more provocatively that her husband might perform better in that area.

norm: It's rude to lie.
situation: Billy has a planned get together with his estranged father, but his friends want to see him too.
intention: Billy wants to cancel, and hang out with friends instead.
moral_action: Billy tells his father he still wants to get together, but does want to see his friends today.
immoral_action: Billy tells his father he's not feeling up to getting together.

norm: It's rude to gossip.
situation: Sam is hanging out in the park with her friends.
intention: Sam wants to chat with her friends.
moral_action: Sam asks everyone how they are doing lately.
immoral_action: Sam tells her friends a secret she know about one of their other friends.

norm: It's rude to be vulgar.
situation: Mick is talking with his friends in the locker room.
intention: Mick wants to tell his friends about a romantic encounter.
moral_action: Mick tells his friends what an enjoyable evening he had with his female companion with flowery prose.
immoral_action: Mick describes his sexual escapades using street language.

norm: It is rude to stare.
situation: Sue is eating lunch with a friend in a coffee shop and is sitting across from her.
intention: Sue wants to know what brand jacket her friend is wearing.
moral_action: Sue asks her friend what brand her jacket is, without staring at it for too long.
immoral_action: Sue stares at her jacket for half an hour to gauge what exact brand it is.

norm: It's considered obnoxious to drop names.
situation: Sarah is at the bar with some of her coworkers for happy hour after work one evening.
intention: Sarah wants to impress one of her male coworkers.
moral_action: Sarah initiates a conversation with her male coworker and mentions that she used to work as a sports reporter and got to hear lots of interesting stories about athletes.
immoral_action: Sarah initiates a conversation with her male coworker and mentions that she knows Aaron Rodgers.

norm: Crude jokes are impolite in public.
situation: Bob is at a social function where he doesn't know many people.
intention: Bob wants to break the ice and make friends.
moral_action: Bob joins a group of people talking and tells a funny joke about dogs.
immoral_action: Bob joins a group of people talking and tells a joke based on a racial stereotype.

norm: It's rude to give ultimatums.
situation: Rin is bothered by the cigarette smoke scent which is from her partner smoking.
intention: Rin wants to convince her partner to quit.
moral_action: Rin approaches her partner with a gentle stance highlighting the health implications.
immoral_action: Rin makes her partner choose to either be with her and quit or she will leave him.

norm: It is rude to be impatient.
situation: Simon is waiting for his pizza at a shop, and the pizza is taking a long time because it's busy.
intention: Simon wants his pizza.
moral_action: Simon, knowing it's busy, patiently waits for his pizza to be ready and thanks the workers.
immoral_action: Simon yells and berates the employees until his pizza comes out.

norm: It's rude to be inattentive.
situation: Karen is watching her sister's children for the weekend and is with them out in the front yard.
intention: Karen wants to tan while on the front lawn.
moral_action: Karen puts on a tank top and shorts to get sun while she plays with her children outside.
immoral_action: Karen puts on dark sunglasses and focuses on getting the best tan she can instead of watching the children play.

norm: It's rude to make demands.
situation: Ana's boyfriend often cooks her breakfast as a kind gesture, and she is feeling hungry.
intention: Ana wants her boyfriend to make her breakfast.
moral_action: Ana asks her boyfriend if he'll cook breakfast, promising to cook dinner in exchange.
immoral_action: Ana tells her boyfriend to get in the kitchen, so he can start making pancakes.

norm: Regifting is rude.
situation: Josh's best friend Tyler's birthday was coming up soon.
intention: Josh needed to give him a gift.
moral_action: Josh looks up on Pinterest how to make a fancy home made gift and makes one.
immoral_action: Josh gives Tyler a gift card that he previously received on his last birthday, but couldn't remember who gave it to him.

norm: It's rude to make insulting comments.
situation: Jane walks into Kyle's office and asks him what he thinks of her new shoes.
intention: Kyle wants to answer Jane's question.
moral_action: Kyle tells Jane that the shoes look great on her and really go together with her outfit.
immoral_action: Kyle tells Jane that her feet are so fat that they are literally overflowing over her shoe, and he can't see it.

norm: It's inconsiderate and rude to yell
situation: Christian has just checked in a hotel after a long and exhausting day of travel, and he is very dissatisfied with his hotel room.
intention: Christian wants to switch rooms and get a better hotel room.
moral_action: Christian goes to the front desk and explains the issues he has with his room, respectfully demanding to switch rooms.
immoral_action: Christian goes to the front desk and yells at the receptionist, venting his frustration on her and demanding to be moved to a better room.

norm: It's rude to pry.
situation: John is at the mall food court where he's eating, and he can overhear the two nearby women complaining about their husbands.
intention: John wants to say something about the women's conversation.
moral_action: John tells the women that he can hear everything they're saying and that they should probably whisper if they're going to talk about personal things.
immoral_action: John tells the women that intimacy is very important in a relationship and asks them if their sex lives are up to standard.

norm: Snooping is rude.
situation: June is concerned because her boyfriend Steve has been acting secretive lately.
intention: June wants to find out if Steve has been hiding anything from her.
moral_action: June confronts Steve with her concerns and asks for an explanation of his behavior.
immoral_action: June goes through Steve's phone and computer to find out what he has been up to.

norm: It's impolite to make rude comments.
situation: Tom is at an art exhibition.
intention: Tom wants to discuss the art.
moral_action: Tom turns to the person next to him and asks what they think the painting means.
immoral_action: Tom turns to the person next to him and says that the art is ugly.

norm: Shouting is rude.
situation: Marianne is eating at a restaurant with her husband Frank and her food was served undercooked.
intention: Marianne wants to let the server know.
moral_action: Marianne waits until the server comes close to their table and lets her know the food isn't cooked all the way.
immoral_action: Marianne yells across the restaurant to tell the server there is a problem with her food.

norm: Name calling is rude.
situation: Mike is dating Grace, and he is stressed out with his new job.
intention: Mike wants to be able to perform better at his job role.
moral_action: Mike feels supported by Grace while he becomes better qualified in his work responsibilities and always has sweet endearments he calls her.
immoral_action: Mike calls Grace ugly name while he is training at his new work role and continues taking out his frustrations on her after training.

norm: It is rude to withhold information.
situation: Phil is at the police station and the police are questioning him about a robbery.
intention: Phil wants to answer the questions.
moral_action: Phil answers truthfully and tries to cooperate with the police.
immoral_action: Phil omits important details about the robbery so as to not incriminate himself.

norm: Arguing is impolite.
situation: Amber and Chris are having dinner at her parents non-smoking house, and Chris just lit up a cigarette at the table.
intention: Amber wants to confront Chris.
moral_action: Amber calmly tells Chris that her parents don't smoke, and asks him to please put out his cigarette.
immoral_action: Amber begins to yell at Chris, accusing him of knowingly breaking the non-smoking rule, so he yells back.

norm: It's rude to act conceited
situation: Tyler acts like he is better than everyone else at his school.
intention: Tyler wants to show off.
moral_action: Tyler decides to pratice his skills, so he's better able to show them off.
immoral_action: Tyler shows how good he is at bike riding by showing off his expensive bike.

norm: It's rude to yell.
situation: Four year old Brian has just returned from his first day of school with lots to tell; his mother unfortunately has a headache.
intention: Brian wants to share his day with his mother.
moral_action: Brian starts talking rapidly, but keeps his voice at an appropriate level for indoor conversation, telling his mother everything about his day.
immoral_action: Brian starts talking very loudly and rapidly, trying to tell his mother everything at once.

norm: It's rude be nosy.
situation: Rose wants to listen to her favorite group's new album on a good sound system, but her roommate is studying.
intention: Rose wants enjoy her favorite group's new album.
moral_action: Rose lays down in her bed and listens to the album with her high quality headphones.
immoral_action: Rose plays the CD on their home theater system in the living room.

norm: It's expected that you won't make a scene in public.
situation: Mark is walking through a crowded mall when someone bumps into him.
intention: Mark wants to scold the person who bumped him.
moral_action: Mark quietly tells the person to watch where they're going and then storms off.
immoral_action: Mark starts screaming and berating the older man while onlookers start recording on their phones.

norm: You should not treat others like they are disposable.
situation: John is shopping at the local supermarket.
intention: John has a particularly heavy bag he needs an employee to help with getting into his car.
moral_action: John tips the employee a dollar for the help.
immoral_action: The employee helps John, who then tells him to get lost.

norm: You shouldn't take someone's seat.
situation: Jack gets into the waiting room at the DMV and it is very busy.
intention: Jack wants to sit down but it looks like most seats are taken.
moral_action: Jack stays standing and waits until a seat frees up.
immoral_action: Jack sits down in a seat next to a child with a backpack in front of it.

norm: You shouldn't tell on others.
situation: Jack sees his coworker take supplies from the workplace which is not allowed.
intention: Jack wants his coworker to return the supplies to the workplace.
moral_action: Jack talks to the coworker privately and tells them that they should return the items.
immoral_action: Jack tells the supervisor that the coworker has taken things from the workplace.

norm: You shouldn't grab a chair that belongs to someone else.
situation: John is walking into his biology class.
intention: John wants to find a seat for the class.
moral_action: John finds an empty seat near the front of the class.
immoral_action: John takes a seat away from a smaller, weaker student.

norm: You shouldn't flaunt things in front of others.
situation: Sue just bought a fancy new dress and spent quite a bit of money on it.
intention: Sue wants to show off the new dress.
moral_action: Sue wears the dress to a formal event and posts pictures online.
immoral_action: Sue wears the dress around her friends who are not as well off as her.

norm: You should not copy someone else's work.
situation: Claire and Colt are taking an exam in a classroom together and are within eyesight of each other's desks.
intention: Colt wants to do well on his exam.
moral_action: Colt uses study strategies he has learned to recall the information he needs most on his test.
immoral_action: Colt looks over at Claire's exam paper a few times during the test to get the correct answers.

norm: You shouldn't talk over someone.
situation: James was talking to his friend Pat outside about awesome video games as the weather starts to change.
intention: James wants to keep talking to Pat.
moral_action: James lets Pat say what's on his mind and Pat says they should go inside before the storm.
immoral_action: Pat keeps trying to say someting but James talks over him, no one was going to convince him Action 52 wasn't bad.

norm: You shouldn't use people.
situation: Julie got her license suspended and now she is not allowed to drive.
intention: Julie needs to find a way to work.
moral_action: Julie tells Pat that she needs a ride to work, would be very grateful for the help and offers to pay for gas.
immoral_action: Julie asks her coworker Pat for a ride to work every day but doesn't offer to pay for gas or even thank her.

norm: You should not copy others.
situation: David is taking an exam in his calculus class that he didn't study for.
intention: David wants to pass the exam.
moral_action: David takes the exam to the best of his ability and leaves comments to his teacher on the items he doesn't understand.
immoral_action: David copies exam answers from the student sitting next to him.

norm: You shouldn't tell on people.
situation: Holly is at her desk in the office when she notices her coworker Jason sneak into his desk late just before the manager comes in.
intention: Holly wants to say something to the manager.
moral_action: Holly  greets the manager and wishes him a good morning with a big smile.
immoral_action: Holly tells the manager that she just saw Jason walking in late right before the manager arrived.

norm: You shouldn't compare someone to an animal.
situation: James is frustrated that his kids don't pick up their toys because he just stepped on a lego.
intention: James wants to encourage his children to clean up after themselves.
