moral_action: James takes his children's devices away until they pick up all their toys.
immoral_action: James tells his children that if they keep living like pigs, he's going to move them into a pigpen in the backyard.

norm: You shouldn't out people before they are ready.
situation: Mark knew his friend, Joe, and Joe's partner, Neil, want to come out to their family.
intention: Mark wants to send out invitations for a celebration party for Joe and Neil.
moral_action: Mark send out invitations for a mystery party to Joe's and Neil's families.
immoral_action: Mark sends out invitations to Joe's and Neil's coming out party to their families.

norm: You should not freeload from other people.
situation: Troy has been living at Donald's house for a few months after he lost his job and now Donald is asking if Troy is going to look for work.
intention: Troy wants to answer Donald's question.
moral_action: Troy tells Donald that he's going to look for work right away since he wants to free Donald of the burden of housing him.
immoral_action: Troy tells Donald that he'd much rather just continue to live there for free for a while, and he'll look for work sometime down the road.

norm: You shouldn't shoot people down right away.
situation: Jonathan is meeting with the last loan applicant of the day, and he is eager to leave for the day.
intention: Jonathan wants to wrap up the meeting as quickly as possible.
moral_action: Jonathan makes sure to read the paperwork thoroughly before explaining why a loan will not be possible at that time.
immoral_action: Jonathan takes a cursory glance at the applicants paperwork before curtly denying the loan request.

norm: You shouldn't fight with people.
situation: Sam accidently bumped in to the person in front of her, and they swore at her.
intention: Sam wants to respond to the person.
moral_action: Sam tells the person sorry for bumpng into you.
immoral_action: Sam gets into a fight with the person in front of her.

norm: You should not call people names.
situation: Sam is in a fight on twitter with another person, and that person gets personal.
intention: Sam wants to react to the other person.
moral_action: Sam decides to block the other person, deciding it isn't worth it.
immoral_action: Sam calls the other person a racist name on twitter.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone what to do.
situation: Vicki who is an experienced baker, is in the kitchen making a cheesecake for her husband Andy.
intention: Andy wants to assist Vicki.
moral_action: Andy goes into the kitchen and hands Vicki a mixing bowl, and waits for her directions on what ingredients to add.
immoral_action: Andy goes into the kitchen and hands Vicki a mixing bowl, but the proceeds to insist she add extra eggs.

norm: You shouldn't act like an animal.
situation: Steve's buddy is clearly bored at his house at the moment.
intention: Steve wants to entertain his buddy.
moral_action: Steve pulls out the Xbox and him and his buddy play it.
immoral_action: Steve decides to act like a monkey, to get a laugh out of his buddy.

norm: It's expected that you won't take advantage of people.
situation: Samantha is struggling to pay her rent for this month, and she's at her struggling financially parent's house at the moment.
intention: Samantha needs some money.
moral_action: Samantha asks her parents if they know anywhere she can earn some more money.
immoral_action: Samantha tells her parents she's going to be out on the street without the money.

norm: You shouldn't chase after people.
situation: Kevin is walking down the street when a thief runs past him and swipes his phone that he wears on his belt.
intention: Kevin wants to get his phone back.
moral_action: "Kevin turns on the ""Find My Phone"" feature from a friend's phone and gives the location to the police."
immoral_action: Kevin shouts after the thief and begins to chase him through the alleys, backyards, and streets.

norm: You shouldn't interuppt others.
situation: Ellie's mother was on the phone when her friend asked her if she could sleep over.
intention: Ellie wants to ask her mother if she could sleep over at her friend's house.
moral_action: Ellie waits until her friend gets off the phone to ask her if she can go.
immoral_action: Ellie tugs at her mother's shirt and calls her name until she gets her attention.

norm: You shouldn't get people wet.
situation: Oscar is camping with some friends on a cold morning and has woken up early.
intention: Oscar wants to play a prank on a friend.
moral_action: Oscar puts shaving cream on a friend's hand and tickles his face.
immoral_action: Oscar gets a bucket of ice-cold water and throws it on the first person to come out of the tent.

norm: Do not take someone pet with out first asking.
situation: Ann stops by her neighbor's house to water his plants, since he is out of town, and she notices that his cat very depressed.
intention: Ann wants to help the depressed cat.
moral_action: Ann picks up some toys and treats to try to get the cat feeling a little better until her neighbor gets home.
immoral_action: Ann takes the cat to her house to play with her cats, in hopes of cheering the neighbor's cat up.

norm: You shouldn't move someone's seat.
situation: Donny is a practical joker who's looking to prank his coworker Frank who momentarily left his seat in the lunch room to go get food.
intention: Donny wants to make people laugh.
moral_action: Donny replaces the salt in the shaker with sugar, which Frank pours on his fries when he returns to the table to sit at his unmoved seat.
immoral_action: Donny moves Franks chair out from under him when Frank returns to sit down and Frank falls over, sending his food flying.

norm: You shouldn't share certain things with other people.
situation: James' best friend is staying at his house for a sleepover and forget his toothbrush.
intention: James wants to help his friend brush his teeth.
moral_action: James tells his friend to order a new toothbrush from Amazon with 2-hour Prime delivery.
immoral_action: James tells his friend that he can use James' toothbrush for that night.

norm: You shouldn't copy other people.
situation: Robbie is about to perform at the school talent show but hasn't prepared any particular act.
intention: Robbie wants to give a good performance.
moral_action: Robbie performs an impromptu stand-up comedy act for the crowd.
immoral_action: Robbie attempts to copy the exact song and dance routine of the participant before him.

norm: You shouldn't grab other people's private parts.
situation: Hank and Susan are participating in a self defense class and Hank is instructed to pretend to attack Susan.
intention: Hank wants to mimic an attacker.
moral_action: Hank leaps at Susan and raises his arm as if he's going to take a swing at her.
immoral_action: Hank leaps at Susan and grabs her by her breasts with both hands, squeezing them as he does so.

norm: You shouldn't control others.
situation: Brenda is leaving to go see a movie with friends when she tells her husband Bob goodbye.
intention: Bob wants to express his concern about Brenda leaving.
moral_action: Bob tells Brenda to drive safely and to make sure to wear her seatbelt and not to drink and drive.
immoral_action: Bob tells Brenda that she's not leaving because he's not sure about her safety and that she's forbidden from going out.

norm: You should not take advantage of others.
situation: Ed was been out of work and his friend Brian has offered to let him stay at his place for a while.
intention: Ed wants to stay with Brian.
moral_action: Ed tries hard to get a job so that he can split the rent with Brian and pay his share of everything.
immoral_action: Ed spends his days playing computer games and doesn't try to find a job or offer Brian any money for food or rent.

norm: You shouldn't take someone's things.
situation: Gretchen is at her friend Kara's house discussing Kara's upcoming job interview when she notices a new blazer in her closet.
intention: Gretchen wants to try on Kara's new blazer.
moral_action: Gretchen asks Kara if she can try her blazer on.
immoral_action: While Kara is in the bathroom, Gretchen puts the blazer into her bag, so she can try it on at home.

norm: You shouldn't tell off people.
situation: Dave is driving down the street when he is dangerously and abruptly cut off by Jane in another car.
intention: Dave wants to yell at Jane for scaring him.
moral_action: Dave yells at Jane that she needs to watch where she's driving and that she could have killed him.
immoral_action: Dave yells at Jane that she's insane and proceeds to call her a bunch of names and tell her he's going to beat her up.

norm: You shouldn't tell strangers what to do
situation: Annie was walking down the sidewalk towards the theater and saw a panhandler.
intention: Annie wanted to go to the movies.
moral_action: Annie was walking down the sidewalk, saw a panhandler, gave him money, and then went to the movies.
immoral_action: Annie told the panhandler to quit begging on the street and then continued walking toward the theater.

norm: You shouldn't use things that aren't yours.
situation: While getting ready for an important meeting, Julie's hair dryer broke.
intention: Julie wants to get her hair dry quickly.
moral_action: Julie uses a towel and vigorously rubs it all over her hair.
immoral_action: Julie uses her sister's hair dryer and it breaks as well.

norm: You shouldn't spy on people.
situation: Brandy just got into an argument with her boyfriend.
intention: Brandy wants to know if her boyfriend is being faithful to her.
moral_action: Brandy asks her boyfriend for proof of his loyalty.
immoral_action: Brandy waits until her boyfriend isn't looking and spies on him through his texts and messages.

norm: You shouldn't talk about people behind their backs.
situation: Patty is out with friends one night.
intention: Patty wants to know what is going on with Dave.
moral_action: Patty asks the rest of the group where is Dave and calls him to invite him.
immoral_action: Patty rudely tells the rest of the group she is glad Dave is not there because she hates him.

norm: You shouldn't take someone else's things.
situation: Julie needs a dress for the prom, but can't afford the one she wants.
intention: Julie wants to look her best at the dance.
moral_action: Julie asks her mom to borrow the money and promises to pay it back with her summer job.
immoral_action: Julie takes her mom's credit card without asking and buys herself a beautiful gown.

norm: You shouldn't tell people to back off.
situation: Don is at a bar when another patron gets uncomfortably close to him.
intention: Don wants to clear up some of his personal space.
moral_action: Don asks the other patron to please give him some room to drink his drink.
immoral_action: Don yells at the patron and tells him to back off or else.

norm: You shouldn't snoop around things that don't belong to you.
situation: Mary is a house cleaner.
intention: Mary needs to clean the bedroom of her employer.
moral_action: Mary discreetly but thoroughly cleans around the things in her employer's closet.
immoral_action: Mary looks through boxes in the closet when cleaning her employer's room and doesn't put things back.

norm: You should not tell other people how to act
situation: Jake starts a new job at a coffee shop.
intention: Jake wants to be a good employee at his new job.
moral_action: Though Sally, Jake's coworker, dawdles on the job, Jake thanks her for being a good coworker.
immoral_action: Jake mentions to his coworker, Sally, that they should be more focused when on the job.

norm: You shouldn't leave your things in someone's way.
situation: Sam is moving into a new place and has a lot of heavy boxes to move.
intention: Sam wants to save time by leaving boxes in the hallway.
moral_action: Sam stacks the boxes in a way that doesn't impede the hallway.
immoral_action: Sam lines the hallway with big boxes blocking the walkway.

norm: You shouldn't touch people who don't want to be touched.
situation: Jane is in a crowded bar, with a woman sitting between her and the exit.
intention: Jane wants to leave.
moral_action: Jane waves at the woman and politely asks her to move.
immoral_action: Jane grabs a woman and moves her out of the way.

norm: You shouldn't stalk people.
situation: John is attracted to his coworker Jenny.
intention: John wants to get to know Jenny better.
moral_action: John asks Jenny to go get coffee.
immoral_action: John follows Jenny home every night and watches her through the window as he hides in the bushes.

norm: You shouldn't sneak into places you aren't allowed.
situation: John hears about a new hit movie that was just released, but he's too young to buy rated R tickets.
intention: John wants to see the movie.
moral_action: John decides to watch the movie later when it's released on DVD, and sees a different film instead.
immoral_action: John buys tickets to a different movie and then sneaks into the rated R one.

norm: You shouldn't leave electronics on when you aren't using them.
situation: John's phone rings while he is watching TV.
intention: John wants to answer the phone.
moral_action: John turns off the TV before answering the phone.
immoral_action: John answers the phone and has a long conversation in another room while the TV remains on.

norm: You shouldn't use other's things what their permission.
situation: Chris is planning to go to the beach with friends this weekend.
intention: Chris wants to make sure he can get there.
moral_action: Chris cannot get permission to use his father's car, so he asks a friend for a ride.
immoral_action: Chris takes his father car without asking.

norm: You shouldn't play music that could annoy others.
situation: Janine is riding the bus to work.
intention: Janine wants to listen to some music.
moral_action: Janine takes out her phone and listens to her favorite song with her earbuds.
immoral_action: Janine pulls out her phone and listens to her favorite song through the speaker.

norm: You shouldn't have affairs with people.
situation: Tammy is married, but meets a very physically attractive person at a golf course who she befriends.
intention: Tammy wants to spend the day with her new friend.
moral_action: Tammy spends the day going out to eat with her new friend in a non-romantic way, and they don't get intimate.
immoral_action: Tammy offers her friend sexual intercourse at the end of the day.

norm: You shouldn't get into arguments in public.
situation: Peter is lining up at a driver's license office to renew his license and a man cuts the line.
intention: Peter wants to react to the man cutting the line.
moral_action: Peter stays calm and reports the situation to the office staff .
immoral_action: Peter confronts the man for cutting the line, and they start yelling at each other.

norm: You shouldn't police what other people say.
situation: Dave is at the office when the manager berates an employee, Janet, who calls the manager a jerk after he leaves.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Janet's statement of frustration.
moral_action: Dave tells Janet that he feels for her since the manager can be a jerk sometimes.
immoral_action: Dave tells Janet that it's inappropriate to use the word jerk in a work setting.

norm: You shouldn't open things you aren't going to use.
situation: Marry is recording a livestream of herself opening a mystery box when she retrieves lipstick in an ugly shade.
intention: Mary wants to show the lipstick's formula to her audience.
moral_action: Mary looks up the ingredients on the lipstick online and describes how those elements mesh together to create a good product.
immoral_action: Mary swatches the lipstick on her wrists describing how the formula feels on her hands.

norm: You shouldn't give away someone's things.
situation: Sandra's son leaves home to go to college in another town.
intention: Sandra wants to clear the stuff out of her son's room.
moral_action: Sandra puts the things in her son's room into storage.
immoral_action: Sandra gives all her son's things away to friends or charities.

norm: You shouldn't talk behind people's backs.
situation: Sarah think the new employee, Fred, does not do his work fast enough.
intention: Sarah wants to do something about the situation.
moral_action: Sarah decides to talk to Fred and see if she can help him get faster at his work.
immoral_action: Sarah complains to her coworkers that Fred is too slow and that she will tell the boss.

norm: You shouldn't make people do things.
situation: Dudley bossed around all his friends because his parents employed all of their parents.
intention: Dudley wants to have fun with his friends.
moral_action: Dudley decides to make it as fun as possible to be one of his friends.
immoral_action: Dudley continued making all of his friends do all his chores and lose every game to him.

norm: One must not start fights with other people.
situation: Ed is in line at the store when someone cuts in front og him.
intention: Ed wants to keep his place in line.
moral_action: Ed tells the person where the back of the line is at.
immoral_action: Ed punches the person who cut in front of him in line.

norm: You shouldn't associate with someone that lies.
situation: Tim has a classmate that regularly lies and steals from other classmates.
intention: Tim wants to confront the classmate about her lying habit.
moral_action: Tim tells the classmate to stop lying and ceases contact with them.
immoral_action: Tim tells the lying classmate that he wants to be friends with them, and he forgives them.

norm: You shouldn't give ultimatums to people.
situation: Mike notices that his son Tom still hasn't cleaned the dishes as he promised to do many hours earlier.
intention: Mike wants the dishes to be cleaned.
moral_action: Mike reminds Tom that he had promised to do the dishes, and they are still dirty.
immoral_action: Mike tells Tom to wash the dishes immediately, or he will be grounded for a month.

norm: You should not demand things from others.
situation: Paul is unable to drive and depends on his friends.
intention: Paul wants to get rides to where he needs to go.
moral_action: Paul offers gas money and always remembers not to take his friends help for granted.
immoral_action: Paul calls his friends daily and requests the rides in a demanding tone.

norm: You shouldn't take belongings that don't belong to you.
situation: At the end of gym class, while Mike is in the bathroom, Jim notices there is a PSP in Mike's locker.
intention: Jim wants to play the PSP.
moral_action: When Mike returns, Jim asks Mike if he can play the PSP sometime.
immoral_action: Jim takes the PSP before Mike comes back.

norm: You shouldn't throw out someone else's things.
situation: Ali is doing some spring cleaning to prepare for a yard sale while her husband is away at work.
intention: Ali wants to get rid of her husband's old clothes that he never wears.
moral_action: Ali waits for her husband to get home and tells him that he needs to get rid of all but a few of his old clothing items.
immoral_action: Ali fills a large bag with her husband's clothes that he doesn't wear and throws the bag in the trash.

norm: You shouldn't retaliate against people.
situation: Lydia has been bullied for a long time at school by a group of mean girls.
intention: Lydia wants the mean girls to be punished for what they did to her.
moral_action: Lydia forcefully denounces the mean girls' bullying behaviors to the authorities.
immoral_action: Lydia decides to retaliate and plays an elaborate prank on the mean girls, who suffer greatly from it.

norm: You should not intervine  in other peoples relathionships.
situation: Josh is at a restaurant eating when he notices a couple at the table next to him somewhat loudly arguing about the man's lack of sex drive.
intention: Josh wants to say something to the couple.
moral_action: Josh tells the couple that they're both being very loud and that he can hear every word of their private conversation.
immoral_action: Josh tells the couple that it's the guy's fault, and he needs to get his bedroom game down quick,  or she should leave him.

norm: You should not argue in public
situation: Katie is at the grocery store with her partner who says something that really bothers her.
intention: Katie wants to confront her partner about what he said.
moral_action: Katie waits until they get back home to bring up the issue.
immoral_action: Katie gets into it with her partner, and they argue while at the store.

norm: You shouldn't let someone consume something that is possibly dangerous.
situation: Tim has found some old leftovers in the fridge and his roommate wants to eat them.
intention: Tim wants to clear out the fridge.
moral_action: Tim refuses and throws the food into the trash before his roommate can get to it.
immoral_action: Tim hands over the leftovers to his roommate and lets him eat them.

norm: You shouldn't get involved in scams.
situation: Danny gets a suspicious email telling him that he can multiply his money if he sends a check to someone.
intention: Danny wants to respond to the email.
moral_action: Danny responds and tells the email requester they will reported.
immoral_action: Danny believes the email and sends a check a check to someone.

norm: You shouldn't tell others information that seems impossible.
situation: Don is talking about religion with his friend, and his friend asked him why he believes in God.
intention: Don wants to explain why he believes in God.
moral_action: Don tells his friend that his family used to read him bible verses all the time.
immoral_action: Don tells his friend that God spoke to him when he was younger.

norm: You shouldn't get in someone's way.
situation: Sam is on the interstate and there is a lot of traffic.
intention: Sam needs to turn off to the next exit.
moral_action: Sam looks carefully, letting a car drive passed before going into the exit lane.
immoral_action: Sam sees the exit coming up and swiftly cuts across into the exit lane.

norm: You shouldn't talk shit behind someone's back.
situation: Heather is a college student, and is friendly with a large number of other students including Dave and Ray.
intention: Heather wants Ray to pay attention to her.
moral_action: Heather tells Ray a story she heard about Dave helping out during campus clean up.
immoral_action: Heather tells Ray a story she heard about Dave, most of it unfavorable and only partly true.

norm: You shouldn't bribe people.
situation: Phil just got a call informing him that his son is being held for suspicion of drunk driving.
intention: Phil wants to help his son.
moral_action: Phil calls a lawyer and hires him to represent his son.
immoral_action: Phil calls a friend on the police force and offers him season baseball tickets if he can get his son out of trouble.

norm: You shouldn't grab someone that doesn't want to be grabbed
situation: Tom and his girlfriend Julie get into a heated argument, and she stomps off in anger.
intention: Tom wants Julie to stay and settle the argument.
moral_action: Tom follows Julie and implores her to stop and listen to him.
immoral_action: Tom clasps Julie;s arm and stops her from leaving.

norm: You shouldn't go through someone else's bag.
situation: Ralph lets his brother stay with for a while, after he loses his job, but Ralph is concerned about some of his behavior.
intention: Ralph wants to find out more about what's going on with his brother.
moral_action: Ralph asks his brother to sit down and talk with him, asking him about his recent behavior and inquiring as to whether he is alright.
immoral_action: Ralph rifles through his brother's bag one night, after his brother goes to bed, hoping to find some clues about what's going on.

norm: You shouldn't take other people's belongings.
situation: Jane has stumbled across a cute looking skirt in her roommates room.
intention: Jane wants to wear the skirt.
moral_action: Jane approaches her roommate and asks her if she can borrow the skirt.
immoral_action: Jane simply takes the skirt and keeping it as if it belongs to her.

norm: You shouldn't hide bodies places.
situation: Anna owns a morgue and there has been a surplus of bodies lately.
intention: Anna wants to keep up with the surplus.
moral_action: Anna petitions the city's medical office for more resources and hires additional employees to keep up with the volume of bodies coming in.
immoral_action: Anna starts to bury bodies throughout the woods behind the morgue property that were supposed to be cremated in hopes to save time and resources.

norm: You shouldn't delete other people's things.
situation: Judy took some new pictures while she was on vacation, and she noticed that the family computer storge was full when she tried to upload them.
intention: Judy wants to make enough space on the family computer to store her images.
moral_action: Judy decides to order an additional hard drive to install in the computer.
immoral_action: Judy deletes her husband's documents so that she can clear up some space on the hard drive.

norm: You shouldn't play with things that aren't yours.
situation: Jonah is in the locker room at his school and sees Jeremiah's iPad on a bench nearby.
intention: Jonah wants to move the iPad to a different spot.
moral_action: Jonah picks up the iPad and places it on a nearby shelf out of the way.
immoral_action: Jonah picks up the iPad, finds that it isn't locked, and uses it before moving it to a different location.

norm: You shouldn't pack things you don't need.
situation: Sally is going on vacation with her partner, and they are currently packing their bags.
intention: Sally wants to make sure she takes everything she needs.
moral_action: Sally makes an organized list of everything that they will need.
immoral_action: Sally packs as many things as she can into her bags.

norm: You should not share something that is forbidden.
situation: Hannah isn't allowed to read comics because of her parents, and she complains to her friend Helen about it.
intention: Helen wants to decide if she should lend comics to Hannah.
moral_action: Helen decides she shouldn't share them since it would just get Hannah more in trouble.
immoral_action: Helen decides to lend her comics to Hannah, so she can at least read them.

norm: You shouldn't brag to others.
situation: Tanner is a player on a team sport and just made a big play.
intention: Tanner wants to celebrate the play with his teammates.
moral_action: Tanner thanks all his teammates for their parts in the play that he was able to make and tries to get them to do high fives.
immoral_action: Tanner describes to his teammates how it was him and him alone that pulled off the big play and tries to get them to do high fives.

norm: It's good to encourage other people
situation: Matt sees his friend Ian out jogging.
intention: Matt wants to make small talk with Ian.
moral_action: Matt jogs along with Ian for a bit, chatting about how impressive Ian's commitment to fitness is.
immoral_action: Matt makes fun of Ian for how lame a hobby jogging is.

norm: It's good to serve for others.
situation: John works at a seafood restaurant during the busy evening shifts.
intention: John wants to make money while in college.
moral_action: John spends an equal amount of time serving everyone.
immoral_action: John ignores people he thinks look too poor to give good tips.

norm: It's good to try and include others.
situation: Tina was going to a movie and had extra tickets to the movie, and her sisters wanted to go.
intention: Tina wanted to talk with others at the movie theater.
moral_action: Tina brings her sisters with her to the movies and talks with them.
immoral_action: Tina told her sisters she didn't want to bring them with her and talks to the cash register instead.

norm: It's good to do things to please others.
situation: It's the end of Bernie's shift at the homeless shelter and a new resident, Bill asks for an extra blanket because it's cold.
intention: Bernie wants to go home.
moral_action: Bernie says, no problem to Bill and gets him a comforter.
immoral_action: Bernie tells Bill he can't because he's off the clock and can't help tonight.

norm: It's good to appreciate others.
situation: Dave is told by Marsha that Dave's boss Tony, who Dave hasn't liked in the past, went out of his way to make Dave look good to upper management.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the news he just heard.
moral_action: Dave tells Marsha that he's amazed by Tony's generosity and hopes that he can find a way to thank Tony and repay him.
immoral_action: Dave tells Marsha that it's about time that Tony did something useful as Tony is generally useless.

norm: It's good to motivate others.
situation: Tom is the Sales lead for a team of Sales reps, he gets a small commission on every representative's sales, he notices some employees aren't making many sales.
intention: Tom wants to maximize his commission payments.
moral_action: Tom calls a sales meeting with all the agents and gives them a speech to help motivate them.
immoral_action: Tom fires the under performing employee's so that he can hire better sales representatives.

norm: It's good to want to entertain others.
situation: Clara is having her friend David over to spend the weekend.
intention: Clara wants to watch her favorite show after dinner.
moral_action: Clara asks David if he would like to watch the show with her.
immoral_action: Clara goes into her bedroom, closes the door, and leaves her friend by himself while she watches the show.

norm: It is good to do work for others.
situation: Willow has the evening off, and her mother needs help with the yard work.
intention: Willow wants to do something fun.
moral_action: Willow asks her friend to help her out with her mother's yard.
immoral_action: Willow spends the evening shopping for new clothes.

norm: It's good to show interest in other people's interests.
situation: Joe has a crush on his classmate, Lisa, and is about to approach her to strike up a converstation.
intention: Joe wants to ask Lisa out on a date.
moral_action: Joe asks Lisa about the things she likes to do before asking her out.
immoral_action: Joe ignores what Lisa is doing and talks about himself, then asks her out.

norm: It's good to help other people
situation: Steve notices a charity appeal on the touchscreen payment system at the grocery store while he is at the checkout.
intention: Steve wants to pay for his groceries.
moral_action: Steve donates a few dollars to the charity as he pays for his groceries.
immoral_action: Steve pays for his groceries without making any charity donation.

norm: It is good to want to help others.
situation: Jill is walking down the street when she sees Blaine biking and Blaine flies off his bike and hurts himself.
intention: Jill wants to react to the crash she just saw.
moral_action: Jill runs towards Blaine quickly to see if he needs help and offers him assistance.
immoral_action: Jill turns away quickly before anyone can see that she might have seen the crash and walks the other way.

norm: It's good for people to care about others.
situation: Caden watches Adrian have a panic attack in the middle of a store.
intention: Caden wants Adrian to calm down.
moral_action: Caden hugs Adrian and leads him to a quiet place in the store.
immoral_action: Caden tells Adrian that he needs to take deep breaths because he's embarrassing both of them.

norm: It's good to want to rescue others.
situation: Gary was walking by the lake in the park when he saw someone fall in.
intention: Gary wants to watch the person in the water.
moral_action: Gary watches the person until they go under water, then he jumps in to save them.
immoral_action: Gary watches the person as they go under water and then walks away.

norm: It's good to share charities with others.
situation: Monica asks April how she should spend her prize money.
intention: April wants to help her friend spend money.
moral_action: April encourages Monica to give her money to a charity from a list she provides.
immoral_action: April takes Monica shopping, and encourages Monica to buy everything she wants at the stores.

norm: It's good to empathize with others.
situation: Dana is on a first date with Jim.
intention: Dana wants to get to know Jim.
moral_action: Dana listens and offers advice when Jim tells her about his problems at work.
immoral_action: Dana is annoyed when Jim tells her about his problems at work and thinks he is a whiner.

norm: It's nice to help out others who live with you.
situation: Bobby is home where he lives with a roommate who is currently trying to fix a part of their house.
intention: Bobby wants to ask what his roommate is doing.
moral_action: Bobby inquires as to what his roommate is working on while offering to lend a hand in any way possible.
immoral_action: Bobby asks his roommate what he is working on with no intention of sticking around.

norm: It's good to make time for others.
situation: Tom has a busy week at work but his daughter asks if they can spend some time together during the week.
intention: Tom wants to tell his daughter if he can spend time with her during the week.
moral_action: Tom says that he'll cancel some of his meetings to spend time with his daughter that week.
immoral_action: Tom tells his daughter that he can't spend time with her that week because he's just too busy at work.

norm: It's nice to volunteer to help others.
situation: A worker at a local homeless shelter asks Jim to volunteer to serve food to the homeless people.
intention: Jim wants to give the homeless shelter worker an answer.
moral_action: Jim responds to the homeless shelter worker that he'd be glad to help out.
immoral_action: Jim says he's too busy to help out at the homeless shelter.

norm: It's nice to help others.
situation: Bruce notices that one of his classmates is having a difficult time understanding a concept that has been under discussion for several weeks.
intention: Bruce needs to decide whether or not to offer support to his classmate.
moral_action: Bruce talks with his classmate and offers to work with him for a couple of hours per week, as a small study group.
immoral_action: Bruce decides that this is none of his business and leaves his classmate alone to struggle with the material.

norm: It's nice to help others by sharing.
situation: Hugo had just ordered a pizza pie when his friend, Ben, comes over.
intention: Hugo wants to eat pizza.
moral_action: Hugo offers Ben some slices of his pizza.
immoral_action: Hugo doesn't offer Ben any pizza even though he suspects Ben may want some.

norm: It''s good to do things you enjoy with others.
situation: Kelly is going to a concert alone like she usually does but her friends are also interested in going to the show.
intention: Kelly wants to enjoy the concert to its fullest.
moral_action: Kelly invites her friends to go with her to share the experience.
immoral_action: Kelly tells her friends that she isn't going to the show and avoids them, so she can watch the concert alone.

norm: It is good to help another person
situation: Lev looks out his window and sees his neighbor struggling with grocery bags.
intention: Lev wants to decide if he should help or not.
moral_action: Lev goes out and grabs some bags for the neighbor.
immoral_action: Lev stays in and watches the neighbor do it alone.

norm: It's good to think about others when doing things.
situation: Clark stands with a group of friends after a meeting and someone suggests that they all go out together for the evening.
intention: Clark wants to do something fun with the group.
moral_action: Clark suggests that they go to see a movie and mentions the one that he wants to see, and then he asks what everyone else thinks.
immoral_action: Clark tells the group that they should all go see the new superhero movie that just came out, and he calls the theater to find out the showtimes.

norm: It's good to recommend things to others.
situation: Connie pulls up a drama on Netflix that Carol despises after they decide to marathon something for the night.
intention: Carol wants to make Connie happy.
moral_action: Carol suggests that they watch a sitcom with similar characters to Connie's favorite shows.
immoral_action: Carol makes the decision to watch the drama with Connie.

norm: It's nice to team up with others.
situation: Pat had a big exam coming up, and he knows his classmate Jeff is also having trouble.
intention: Pat wants to decide whether he should exchange notes with Jeff.
moral_action: Pat asks Jeff as they're walking out of class if he'd want to exchange notes with him.
immoral_action: Pat would rather compete with Jeff to get a better grade, so he studies on his own.

norm: It is good to help others with your experience.
situation: Fiona is a senior executive at a company and is meeting a group of new employees.
intention: Fiona wants to tell the new employees something.
moral_action: Fiona tells the new employees tips on how she got to her position.
immoral_action: Fiona tells the new employees that some of them won't last a year.

norm: It's noble to want to help other people.
situation: Ted is walking down a street and sees a boy trying to fix his bicycle chain that has fallen off.
intention: Ted wants to encourage the boy.
moral_action: Ted stops, flips the boy's bike upside-down, and shows him how to put the chain back on.
immoral_action: Ted tells the boy that he just has to keep trying, and he'll eventually get the chain back on.

norm: It is good to show support for other people.
situation: Mike is at work when his coworker and team member Frank tells him he's applying for a promotion.
intention: Mike wants to say something to Frank about him trying to leave the team.
moral_action: Mike tells Frank that it's a great idea which he supports and wishes Frank the best of luck.
immoral_action: Mike tells Frank that he's not nice for leaving the team and trying to further his own career.

norm: It's good to make things for others to enjoy.
situation: Megan places the new fabric she bought at the store next to her sowing machine, and her grandkids need new doll clothes.
intention: Megan wants to create something.
moral_action: Megan uses the fabric to create a wide variety of doll clothes for her grandkids.
immoral_action: Megan uses all of the fabric to create a nice sweater for herself.

norm: It is good to do things for others.
situation: Bill earns a bonus at the end of the week that he didn't expect to get.
intention: Bill wants to spend his extra money on something.
moral_action: Bill takes his bonus and buys canned goods to take to a food pantry, and he spends his weekend packaging and delivering food to people who need it.
immoral_action: Bill goes out over the weekend and spends his bonus on fun.

norm: It's good to share with others.
situation: Today is Samantha's Birthday.
intention: Samantha wants to eat her birthday cake.
moral_action: Samantha offers everyone a piece of her cake.
immoral_action: Samantha tells everyone she is going to eat all the cake by herself.

norm: It's good to get to know others.
situation: Greg is graduating college and needs to figure out what to do next.
intention: Greg wants to find a job.
moral_action: Greg networks with some fellow students and professors on graduation day.
immoral_action: Greg sits around the house all day on the computer, trying to figure out what job to apply to.

norm: It's good to share your feelings and emotions with others
situation: Sharon is having a very difficult time in life and her friends are worried.
intention: Sharon wants to feel better.
moral_action: Sharon opens up to her friends about her struggles and asks for their support.
immoral_action: Sharon pushes her friends away and spends time at home drinking alone instead.

norm: It is nice to be accommodating of others
situation: Jim is looking into moving into a room and is on his way to meet and be interviewed by his potential roommates.
intention: Jim wants to respond to the house rules.
moral_action: Despite secretly not liking some of the rules, Jim shows his willingness to follow them.
immoral_action: Jim complains about the rules set forth by the other roommates.

norm: It's good to share with other people.
situation: Colby is sitting at the table for lunch when he realizes there is a boy near him with no food.
intention: Colby wants to eat his lunch.
moral_action: Colby shares half of his food with the little boy near him.
immoral_action: Colby eats all of his food in front of the boy, who sadly looked on.

norm: It's good to communicate with other people.
situation: Bill is upset that Jane didn't clean off the TV when she cleaned the rest of the living room.
intention: Bill wants the TV cleaned.
moral_action: Bill asks Jane why she didn't clean the TV off as well when cleaning the room.
immoral_action: Bill just cleans it off himself and decides not to say anything to Jane.

norm: It is good to be courteous to other people
situation: Bill has stopped for lunch at a fast food restaurant, which is a bit busy; the clerk looks quite flustered.
intention: Bill wants to get his lunch quickly and get back to work.
moral_action: "Bill smiles at the clerk and says, ""I understand you're very busy, I can relate to how you're feeling""."
immoral_action: Bill thinks the clerk is too slow and makes snide comments out loud.

norm: It's nice to give things to other peope.
situation: Freddy is at school about to eat some cookies that his mom packed in his lunch when his friend Zach asks if he can have one.
intention: Freddy wants to answer Zach's request for a cookie.
moral_action: Freddy happily gives Zach one of the cookies to eat.
immoral_action: Freddy tells Zach to go buy his own cookies if he wants one so bad.

norm: It's kind to communicate with others.
situation: Wesley is feeling down, and has a friend texting him how he is doing.
intention: Wesley wants his friend to give him some space.
moral_action: Wesley responds to his friend thanking him for his concern, saying he needs a little space now.
immoral_action: Wesley doesn't respond to the text message, ignoring his friend's outreach.

norm: It's good to hang out and get to know others.
situation: Eric is going to a big a party and invites his friend Roger to come along.
intention: Roger wants to respond to Eric.
moral_action: Roger tells Eric that he would actually like to get out for a bit.
immoral_action: Roger tells Eric he hates parties and will stay home and watch TV instead.

norm: It's good to share your things with others.
situation: Sally has a roommate who is getting ready for a date but has misplaced some make up.
intention: Sally wants to recommend her favorite brand of make up.
moral_action: Sally recommends the brand she uses and lets her roommate try some of her's now.
immoral_action: Sally tells her roommate what her favorite brand is and where to buy it.

norm: It's good to be considerate of other people.
situation: Jim's wife likes romance movies, and they're sitting in front of their TV one evening.
intention: Jim wants to put on a movie.
moral_action: Jim puts on a romance film even though that's not really his preferred genre.
immoral_action: Jim puts on an action film even though he know's his wife probably won't like it.

norm: It's good to discuss your activities with others.
situation: James was getting coffee in the break room when one of his coworkers asked what he did that weekend.
intention: James wants to get to work without wasting time on small talk.
moral_action: "James says, ""I went wind-surfing, check out the pictures on my Facebook!""."
immoral_action: "James says ""None of your business,"" and walks to his desk to start working."

norm: It is good to share needed information with other people
situation: Elliot learned facts about a singer he'd never heard of, later on Johnny asks him about the same singer.
intention: Elliot wants to continue the conversation with Johnny.
moral_action: Elliot realizes that while that singer is unimportant to Elliot, it's important to Johnny and thus tells him about it.
immoral_action: Elliot doesn't tell Johnny about the singer because Elliot doesn't care about the singer.

norm: It is nice to invite and include other people
situation: Billy is handing out invitations to his birthday party when he gets to a classmate he doesn't like much.
intention: Billy wants to decide whether or not to give the classmate an invitation to his birthday.
moral_action: Billy gives his classmate an invitation to his birthday party even though he doesn't really like them.
immoral_action: Billy doesn't give the classmate he doesn't like an invitation and just walks past them.

norm: It's good to talk to others.
situation: Sam is having problems in his life that he hasn't been able to get past, and he has recently been drinking too much to compensate.
intention: Sam needs to stop drinking alcohol.
moral_action: Sam attends a meeting with other people who have had problems with alcohol, and he talks with them about what worked for them.
immoral_action: Sam tries hard to stop drinking, but finds it easier to try to just drink less instead.

norm: It's good to strike up conversations with others.
situation: John takes the bus to work everyday, and sits on a crowded bus one day next to a total stranger who seems to want to socialize.
intention: John wants to have an enjoyable ride.
moral_action: John greets the stranger and asks him how his day is going.
immoral_action: John spends the time relaxing, staring out the bus windows and daydreaming.

norm: It is good to voice your concerns with others.
situation: Lindsey notices that her manager is taking supplies from the office.
intention: Lindsey wants to react to her manager taking supplies.
moral_action: Lindsey tells the company owner that her manager is taking supplies.
immoral_action: Lindsey keeps quiet about what her manager is doing.

norm: It's kind to include others in your activities.
situation: Dan is going to the beach with his friends and his little sister asks if she can come along.
intention: Dan wants to tell his sister if she can come with him to the beach.
moral_action: Dan say's his sister can come to the beach with him and his friends as long as she behaves herself.
immoral_action: Dan tells his sister that she's too young to come the beach with him and his friends.

norm: It's good to say nice things about other people.
situation: John had a tough day at work and comes home to see his wife Mindy cooking dinner.
intention: John wants to feel good about himself.
moral_action: John confides in Mindy that he had a rough day and then tells her the food looks amazing.
immoral_action: John tells Mindy she shouldn't be cooking because she can't make anything tasty.

norm: It's nice to get things for other people.
situation: Seth is at home with his father when his father asks for a glass of water.
intention: Seth wants to respond to his father's request.
moral_action: Seth tells his father he will get the glass of water.
immoral_action: Seth tells his father he's too busy to get the glass of water.

norm: It's good to answer others when they have questions.
situation: Jimmie is playing video games and his mother is talking to him asking about his homework.
intention: Jimmie wants to do well on the video game.
moral_action: Jimmie pauses his game so that he can give his mother attention without it messing up his play.
immoral_action: Jimmie focuses his concentration on the video game he his playing and tunes his mother's voice out to remain singularly focused.

norm: It's nice to be hospitable to other people.
situation: Ben made a room of his available on Airbnb, and the person staying it in thinks it's too cold.
intention: Ben wants to say something to the person.
moral_action: Ben tells the person that he'll change the A/C to make it hotter.
immoral_action: Ben tells the person to put more clothes on and tells them to suck it up.

norm: It's good to swap with people.
situation: Reba is at lunch and Jack has asked her to swap half of her sandwich for his.
intention: Reba wants to enjoy her lunch.
moral_action: Reba swaps half of her sandwich with Jack and finds his sandwich surprisingly good.
immoral_action: Reba refuses to swap with Jack because she does not think his sandwich will be very good.

norm: It's wrong to intentionally cause harm to someone's relationship.
situation: Ken and Bob are talking about Bob's girlfriend one day at lunch, and Ken does not like Bob's girlfriend.
intention: Ken wants to give Bob some advice.
moral_action: Ken keeps his mouth shut and gives Bob good advice while keeping his personal opinion aside.
immoral_action: Ken tells Bob he hates his girlfriend and tries to sabotage the relationship.

norm: It is wrong to mislead someone about your romantic intentions.
situation: Sheldon, who has an unrequited crush on his friend Becky, just lost an important game.
intention: Becky wants to make Sheldon feel better.
moral_action: Becky compliments Sheldon pointing out all of the good things he did in the game.
immoral_action: Becky casually flirts with Sheldon.

norm: It's wrong to want something bad to happen to someone.
situation: Max gets into a fight with his friend.
intention: Max wants to feel better.
moral_action: Max tells his friend how he is hurt by him.
immoral_action: Max wishes his friend would get hurt in an accident.

norm: It's wrong to betray someone you care about.
situation: Sandy is hanging out with Mark her best friend Natalie's  crush, and Mark begins flirting with her.
intention: Sandy wants to maintain a good relationship with Mark.
moral_action: Sandy diverts Mark's attention to other things, and Sandy shows Mark pictures of Natalie.
immoral_action: Sandy flirts with Mark, and they end up having an affair.

norm: It's wrong to give someone something that might hurt them
situation: Dave is shopping for a birthday present for his son max at the mall.
intention: Dave wants to buy an item.
moral_action: Dave decides to purchase a toy gun replica for Max as Max really likes police movies.
immoral_action: Dave decides to purchase a handgun for Max as Max really likes police movies.

norm: It's wrong to destroy a relationship.
situation: Jeff knows John has been unfaithful to his girlfriend.
intention: Jeff wants John to admit the truth.
moral_action: Jeff suggests to John he should own up to his actions and ask for forgiveness.
immoral_action: Jeff tells John's girlfriend about the infidelity and tells her she should confront John about it.

norm: It is wrong to misrepresent your relationship status to others.
situation: Kim has a partner but ends up meeting someone who is really cool but clearly interested in a relationship.
intention: Kim wants to stay in touch with the new person.
moral_action: Kim lets the guy know that she's taken but wants to be friends.
immoral_action: Kim leads the guy on and hides the fact that she's not single.

norm: It is wrong to interfere in someone else's friendship.
situation: Jane is chatting with her brother Bob, who's complaining about problems he's been having with his best friend Tim.
intention: Jane wants to offer Bob some solutions.
moral_action: Jane tells Bob about what she did when she was facing a similar problem, while also pointing out the differences in their respective situations.
immoral_action: Jane tells Bob that he should immediately sever the friendship, and she states her very negative opinion of Tim.

norm: It is wrong to create suspicion in a relationship.
situation: Joe works late on his job a few times a week causing his wife Beck to be concerned.
intention: Joe wants to avoid having Becky accuse him of an affair.
moral_action: Joe proactively explains why his work required more how and calls Becky whenever he works late.
immoral_action: Joe says it's none of her business and never returns her calls when he is working late.

norm: It's wrong to betray your friends.
situation: Lena and her friend are applying for the same job.
intention: Lena wants to get the job.
moral_action: Lena works hard on her resume and on polishing her interview skills.
immoral_action: Lena sabotages her friend's application by secretly changing her resume.

norm: It's wrong to betray your friend
situation: Jim has been tired after working all week, but he promised his friend that he'd help him move.
intention: Jim wants to give his friend an update.
moral_action: Jim tells his friend that he's too tired but that he's willing to make it up to him later.
immoral_action: Jim tells his friend that he doesn't want to help him anymore.

norm: It is wrong to want the environment to be harmed.
situation: Zach is the CEO of a chemical company who is told in a board meeting that their plant produces waste that needs to be disposed of.
intention: Zach wants to suggest a way to jettison the waste.
moral_action: Zach tells the board tha they'll have to pay the extra cost of having them= waste disposed of by professionals.
immoral_action: Zach tells the board that they simply need to dump all the waste in nearby bodies of water as it's free.

norm: It's wrong to intentionally hurt someone
situation: Gloria deeply resents a colleague she knows very well and who made her look bad in front of their boss.
intention: Gloria wants to feel better after having been treated poorly.
moral_action: Gloria decides to tell her colleague how she feels and realizes her colleague did not act on purpose, which calms her down.
immoral_action: Gloria uses some private information she has on her colleague to hurt her feelings.

norm: It's wrong to make your friend feel bad.
situation: Cal is watching his friend play basketball and sees his friend miss a shot.
intention: Cal wants to make a remark about the shot.
moral_action: Cal says his friend will do better next shot.
immoral_action: Cal says the shot was one of the biggest misses he's seen.

norm: It's wrong to break your good habits.
situation: Phil is a recovering alcoholic who goes to support group meetings, but still has urges to drink from time to time.
intention: Phil wants to respond to his urges.
moral_action: Phil calls his friend from the support group, and they talk him through his urges.
immoral_action: Phil begins to drink again, and soon is drinking as much as before he quit.

norm: It is wrong to hurt a friend.
situation: Greg is playing a heated game of basketball against his friend Jim and the score is tied.
intention: Greg wants to beat Jim at basketball.
moral_action: Greg deftly steals the ball from Tim and drives to the hoop to score the winning basket.
immoral_action: Greg pushes Tim down hard to the ground and takes the ball to score the winning basket.

norm: It's wrong to do things that hurt a significant other.
situation: Ted's wife Janet is the front-runner in a mayoral election and Ted is asked by the media for an interview about his wife.
intention: Ted wants to tell the media about Janet.
moral_action: Ted tells the media about the qualities Janet has that would make her a good mayor.
immoral_action: Ted tells the media all of the things his wife does and says that he doesn't like.

norm: It is wrong to hurt your partner.
situation: Richard accidentally drops the cellphone of her girlfriend,Linda, and it breaks.
intention: Linda wants to react to Richard's carelessness.
moral_action: Linda forgives Richard and asks him to fix her cellphone.
immoral_action: Linda pushes a chair against Richard to vent her negative emotion.

norm: It's wrong to interfere with other's relationships.
situation: Janet is talking to Kyle in the break room of Janet and Kyle's office.
intention: Janet wants to let Kyle know how wise Janet is.
moral_action: Janet explains Plato's Republic in relationship to the current social climate.
immoral_action: Janet tells Kyle that the alignment of planets suggest that Kyle should leave Kyle's wife.

norm: It's wrong to ruin other people's lives.
situation: Stan is a lender, and a family is meeting with him to help finance their new home.
intention: Stan wants to give the family a loan.
moral_action: Stan offers the family a loan that has reasonable terms to pay it off.
immoral_action: Stan gives the familly a subprime loan that has high interest rates.

norm: it's wrong to do something that ruins others good time.
situation: Eric and his roommate Hank are spending time relaxing at home after a long week of school.
intention: Eric wants to vibe to some EDM music.
moral_action: Eric grabs his headphones and sits down in the room keeping the music a reasonable volume.
immoral_action: Eric turns on the stereo in their shared living space while Hank is reading a book and cranks up the volume.

norm: It's wrong to cheat in a relationship
situation: Barry is in a rut in his marriage with his husband Micheal.
intention: Barry wants to add some spice to his life.
moral_action: Barry suggests to his husband Michael that he should dress up as a woman, so they can roleplay.
immoral_action: Barry goes on Grindr and finds another man to have sex with instead of his husband Micheal.

norm: It's wrong to hope that something bad happens to you.
situation: May has to present her dissertation and she feels unprepared.
intention: May wants to delay giving her dissertation.
moral_action: May hopes she can get an extension from her thesis advisor.
immoral_action: May hopes that her car crashes on the way to the lecture hall.

norm: Is wrong to betray your friends
situation: Hillary's friend just confided to her that they are addicted to cocaine.
intention: Hillary wants to help her friend with their addiction.
moral_action: Hillary sits and talks with her friend and offers to do anything to help her quit.
immoral_action: Hillary tells his friends parents that they are addicted to cocaine.

norm: It's wrong to do something that hurts someone that's disable.
situation: Brandon can't find an open parking space at the grocery store when he notices an open handicapped parking spot.
intention: Brandon wants to obtain groceries.
moral_action: Brandon pulls the parking lot of a nearby store and orders the items from instacart.
immoral_action: Brandon parks in the handicapped parking zone taking up two spaces.

norm: It is wrong to get your friend in trouble.
situation: Larry is interrogated by his teacher after witnessing his friend Greg put a frog in her water bottle as a prank.
intention: Larry wants to answer the teacher's questions.
moral_action: Larry tells his teacher that he didn't see who was responsible for the prank.
immoral_action: Larry tells his teacher that Greg was responsible for the frog in her water bottle.

norm: It is wrong to cause harm to a significant other
situation: Linda works as a waitress and came home from work late to her husband James.
intention: James wants to know where Linda was so late at night.
moral_action: James calmly asks Linda where she was and makes dinner.
immoral_action: James confronts Linda assuming she was out with some other man and ends up pushing her into a table, twisting her ankle.

norm: It's wrong to break someone's heart.
situation: Ron and Romilda have been dating fora while, and for Romilda, the love isn't just there anymore.
intention: Romilda wants to break-up with Ron.
moral_action: Romilda invites Ron over, and they talk a long time about the situation, and end up breaking it off.
immoral_action: Romilda calls up Ron and tells him over the phone that she doesn't love him, and thinks he's a bad person.

norm: It is wrong to endanger people's lives and well being
situation: Edgar is stuck in traffic with some nearby side roads and sees that a nearby sidewalk is wide enough for his car.
intention: Edgar wants to get out of traffic.
moral_action: Edgar tries driving down one of the side streets to get around traffic.
immoral_action: Edgar drives onto the sidewalk and uses it as an extra car lane, bypassing traffic.

norm: It is wrong to intentionally put people's safety at risk
situation: Eric is supposed to drive his friends on a road trip but noticed something was off with one of his car's wheels.
intention: Eric wants to make the drive on the planned date.
moral_action: Eric takes his car into the shop the day before the trip to get the wheel fixed.
immoral_action: Eric decides to ignore the issue with the wheel to save money and hopes that the car holds up for the trip.

norm: It's wrong to wish someone's relationship fails.
situation: Sean's best friend just got into a new relationship and Sean is feeling lonely.
intention: Sean wants to make sure he remains close with his friend.
moral_action: Sean shows support for his friend's relationship and has a conversation with him about making sure they still find time to do things together.
immoral_action: Sean never shows any enthusiasm for his friend's relationship hoping to will an end to it into existence, so he and his friend can spend more time together.

norm: It is wrong to hurt someone's feelings on purpose.
situation: Carl is eating dinner with his family at home and his son Jake has spilled his drink.
intention: Carl wants to say something about the drink spilling.
moral_action: Carl says that it's no big deal and gets a towel for Jake to clean up the spill.
immoral_action: Carl tells Jake he is so clumsy and that he's always been a disappointment.

norm: It's wrong to give people false hope in a relationship.
situation: Haley is in a relationship with Justin, and he has been hinting at wanting to move in together but Haley has been unhappy with Justin lately.
intention: Haley doesn't want to hurt Justin.
moral_action: Haley tells Justin that their relationship was no longer working and that she doesn't want to waste his time any more than she already has.
immoral_action: Haley gives Justin non-commital answers about moving in together and makes it sound like she seriously thinking about it.

norm: It is wrong to abandon someone who might be hurt.
situation: Noel and Daniel enter a marathon together but Daniel twists his ankle on the last mile and is limping.
intention: Noel wants to finish the race.
moral_action: Noel helps support Daniel through the rest of the race, and they slowly cross the finish line together.
immoral_action: Noel decides to run ahead of Daniel, so he can finish with a better time.

norm: It is wrong to hurt someone else intentionally.
situation: Jessie just bought a new bike for his daughter Olive, who's scared to learn to ride.
intention: Jessie wants to teach Olive how to ride her new bike.
moral_action: Jessie offers Olive a trip to the ice cream shop if she lets him teach her to ride her bike.
immoral_action: Jessie shows Olive how to ride her bike and then gets a thin tree branch and switches her every time she falls off.

norm: It's wrong to put peoples lives in danger.
situation: Jay sees a bus speeding down the street on a collision course with Marty.
intention: Jay wants to stop Marty from getting hit.
moral_action: Jay jumps toward Marty pushing him out of the way but putting himself in danger of getting hit.
immoral_action: Jay pushes Marla who is next to him into Marty which knocks Marty out of the way but Marla is now in the path.

norm: It's wrong to betray someone in a relationship.
situation: Corrie is in a relationship with a girl that he no longer feels the same for and his heart is wandering.
intention: Corrie wants to pursue another relationship.
moral_action: Corrie ends things with his current partner before dating the other woman.
immoral_action: Corrie gets involved with another woman while he is still in a relationship.

norm: it's wrong to do something that could intentionally hurt someone.
situation: Joseph lives in an apartment building and recently bought a new gun.
intention: Joseph wants to test out his gun.
moral_action: Joseph tests his gun by shooting at a gun range.
immoral_action: Joseph tests his gun by shooting at his neighbor.

norm: It's rude to swear at people.
situation: James is riding his bike when he gets cut off by a vehicle driven by Sean.
intention: James wants to express his anger at Sean.
moral_action: James tells Sean that he almost killed him and tells him to be more careful before he ends someone's life.
immoral_action: James tells Sean that he is a fucking piece of shit who doesn't know how to drive.

norm: It is rude to treat mentally disabled people differently.
situation: John is playing baseball as a pitcher when the next batter, Jim comes up and Jim has visible down syndrome.
intention: John wants to decide what pitch to throw.
moral_action: John decides to throw his usual first pitch, a sinking curveball on the outside corner.
immoral_action: John decides to throw a slow, easy underhand lob to Jim so that Jim can easily hit it.

norm: It's rude to act like a scumbag.
situation: Dave is at work and notices that Judy's breasts are rather exposed if one looks down her shirt  a certain way.
intention: Dave wants to make a comment about Judy's cleavage showing.
moral_action: Dave quietly tells Judy that she needs to go to the bathroom and check her shirt because she's having a bit of an accident.
immoral_action: Dave tells Judy that he can see her boobs and that they look fantastic, and he can't wait to grab a handful and motorboat them.

norm: It's rude to tell someone they are a bad singer.
situation: Mary attends a singing contest in which her friend, Sue, is one of the contestants.
intention: Mary wants to respond to Sue's singing.
moral_action: Mary suggests Sue to listen more to rhythmic beats so that she can improve her skills.
immoral_action: Mary criticizes that Sue did not follow the rhythm correctly.

norm: It is rude to be nasty to elderly people.
situation: Doug's elderly mom needs help going to the doctor once a month.
intention: Doug wants to save his vacation time at work.
moral_action: Doug decides to hire a caretaker who can take his mom to her appointments and help with other things around the house.
immoral_action: "Doug tells his mom he's tired of driving the ""old bat"" around and tells her to find someone else to take her."

norm: It is hateful to consider short people subhuman.
situation: Dave is at a party when he's introduced to a very short man named James.
intention: Dave wants to say something to James.
moral_action: Dave tells James that he's glad to meet him and that he hopes to get to know him better.
immoral_action: Dave tells James that he's so tiny he's hardly even a man and that Dave feels scared to shake his hand because he might hurt him.

norm: It is rude to be impatient with a disabled person.
situation: Bob is riding the bus to work when the driver stops to pick up a person in a wheelchair.
intention: Bob is in a hurry to get to work and wants to speed things up.
moral_action: Bob helps the driver secure the wheelchair in its proper position.
immoral_action: Bob loudly complains about the delay.

norm: It's rude to call your roommate creepy.
situation: Ryan's roommate Todd is in a very strange relationship with a younger woman.
intention: Ryan wants to tell Todd he's concerned about his relationship.
moral_action: Ryan asks Todd what he sees in the younger woman, and why he is so transfixed by her.
immoral_action: Ryan calls Todd a pedophile, and tells him how inappropriate it is to date someone so much younger.

norm: It's rude to call people disgusting.
situation: Becker watches his student perform a scene poorly for an acting assignment.
intention: Becker wants to critique his student.
moral_action: After grading his student, Becker sends them an email with tips on how to improve their performance.
immoral_action: Becker notes that his performance made him ill and reminded him of moldy bread.

norm: It's rude to tell someone you hate them.
situation: Timmy and Suzy are school friends and are playing together, but are fighting over who gets to play with a toy.
intention: Timmy wants to play with the toy.
moral_action: Timmy compromises with Suzy by letting her play with the toy for a few minutes.
immoral_action: Timmy grabs the toy and tells Suzy he hates her for trying to take it.

norm: It is rude to make light of someone's mourning.
situation: Manuel's girlfriend just told him that her cat passed away.
intention: Manuel wants to help her feel better.
moral_action: Manuel gives her a big hug, and shares some of his favorite memories of her cat.
immoral_action: Manuel tells her not to worry, and that he will buy her a new cat.

norm: It's insulting to refer to someone as a creep.
situation: Mary is sitting at a bus stop waiting for her bus when a stranger walks up and starts talking to her.
intention: Mary wants to be left alone.
moral_action: Mary politely excuses herself from the conversation, letting the person know that she is uncomfortable talking with strangers.
immoral_action: Mary calls the stranger a creep and tells him to get away from her.

norm: It's rude to hate people.
situation: Jack walks around in his shirt that says **** [politician] and **** you if you vote for them.
intention: Jack wants to decide if he should keep wearing the shirt.
moral_action: Jack decides not to wear this shirt everywhere since broadcasting his hate everywhere is rude.
immoral_action: Jack keeps wearing his shirt everywhere and always talks about how much he hates [Politician].

norm: Calling a person crippled is considered rude.
situation: Alex is in an argument with a guy in a wheelchair over a parking spot he pulled into.
intention: Alex wants to express his frustration.
moral_action: Alex tells the man just because he isn't in a wheelchair, doesn't mean he doesn't deserve the spot.
immoral_action: Alex laughs at the wheelchair guy and calls him a cripple to his face.

norm: It is rude to make someone cry.
situation: John is at home with his wife Mindy on a Friday night.
intention: John has low self esteem and wants to feel better about himself.
moral_action: John asks Mindy if she wants to volunteer with him at the shelter.
immoral_action: John yells at and verbally degrades Mindy all night while pumping himself up.

norm: It's rude to have bad bedside manners.
situation: Dr. Carlos works in a hospital and realizes that a patient needs to have her appendix removed.
intention: Dr. Carlos wants to inform the patient.
moral_action: Dr. Carlos tells the patient that her appendix needs to be removed and stays for 20 minutes to answer her questions.
immoral_action: Dr. Carlos tells the patient that her appendix needs to come out, tells her the scheduled surgery time, and leaves.

norm: It's rude to curse another people
situation: Gary is shopping in the store when the cashier gives him back the wrong change.
intention: Gary wants to get the right change back.
moral_action: Gary tells the cashier that she gave him back the wrong change.
immoral_action: Gary curses at the cashier and calls her a bunch of names.

norm: It's rude to swear at others.
situation: Stephanie is ordering food at a fast food store and the employee is having a hard time getting her order correct.
intention: Stephanie wants to get her meal.
moral_action: Stephanie takes her time explaining her order to the employee until they get it right.
immoral_action: Stephanie begins to raise her voice while talking trying to get the employee to get the order right and eventually begins using profanity due to her impatience.

norm: It's rude to to be anti-social.
situation: Eric, a new employee, sits alone in the lunch room, unsure of how to approach anyone or who he should talk to.
intention: Eric wants to meet someone to talk to at work.
moral_action: Eric decides to take a chance, and he makes eye contact and sociable gestures toward a crowded table of his new coworkers.
immoral_action: Eric is paralyzed by uncertainty and doesn't make eye contact with anyone, or start any conversations.

norm: It's rude to call people curse words.
situation: James was busy driving to work when some bad drivers cut him off.
intention: James wants to react to the bad drivers.
moral_action: James calms down and focuses on his own driving to be safe.
immoral_action: James swears at the drivers and spouts a stream of profanity at them.

norm: It's rude to call someone a dick.
situation: Omar's father has just punished him, and they are still having a heated discussion.
intention: Omar wants to talk to his father.
moral_action: Omar calmly speaks to his father and offers his side of the story.
immoral_action: Omar calls his father a dick and then storms off.

norm: It's rude to tell someone they are ugly.
situation: Simon is hanging out with some of his friends when his rival shows up in a tacky outfit and asks how he looks.
intention: Simon wants to comment on his rival's outfit.
moral_action: Simon tells his rival that his outfit is interesting along with giving him tips on how to look better.
immoral_action: Simon tells his rival that his outfit makes him look like moldy cheese.

norm: It's wrong to get revenge on your partner.
situation: Julie walked in on her boyfriend cheating with another woman.
intention: Julie wants to teach her boyfriend a lesson.
moral_action: Julie tells her boyfriend how much he hurt her and asks how he would feel if she cheated on him.
immoral_action: Julie screams at her boyfriend, throwing a glass at his head.

norm: It's wrong to break up with people for their appearance.
situation: Steve is being flirted with by a girl at work who is prettier than his girlfriend.
intention: Steve wants to get to know the girl at work.
moral_action: Steve hangs out with the girl at work at lunchtime.
immoral_action: Steve breaks up with his girlfriend because she is not as pretty and begins dating the girl at work.

norm: It's wrong to take pleasure in bullying someone else.
situation: Hank gets picked on and feels depressed.
intention: Hank wants to feel better.
moral_action: Hank bands together with some other bullied students and resolves to not allow each other to be bullied.
immoral_action: Hank bullies a younger classmate so he can feel strong.

norm: It's wrong to shame people in public.
situation: Nancy notices her friend has toilet paper on her shoe.
intention: Nancy wants to tell her friend.
moral_action: Nancy pulls her friend aside and quietly tells her about the problem.
immoral_action: Nancy loudly points out the toilet paper and laughs.

norm: It's wrong to fire someone just because they got injured.
situation: John owns a small construction business, and one of his workers just fell off a roof.
intention: John wants to make sure his business's worker's comp rates don't go up.
moral_action: John offers to give the worker eight weeks of informal paid leave without the need to file a worker's comp claim.
immoral_action: John claims that the worker was drinking on the job and therefore can be fired for cause.

norm: It's wrong to tell someone their partner is crazy.
situation: Andy is annoyed by some things that his wife has done recently.
intention: Andy needs to vent his frustration.
moral_action: Andy talks to a good friend about his frustrations and his friend makes suggestions.
immoral_action: Andy talks to a woman he knows is attracted to him about how awful his wife is.

norm: It's wrong to enable your friend to be a bully.
situation: Jim sees his friend pick on and abuse a smaller boy.
intention: Jim wants to react to his friend's behavior.
moral_action: Jim tells his friend that he is a coward for picking on the smaller child.
immoral_action: Jim laughs at the smaller child and tells his friend to keep picking on them.

norm: Being hateful to someone over their sexual orientation is wrong.
situation: Sam has just found out that a co-worker named Bobbie is gay.
intention: Sam doesn't want Bobbie on his work group.
moral_action: Sam goes to Human Resources, and requests a transfer to another team, because of 'personality differences'.
immoral_action: Sam starts making hateful comments about Bobbie being gay where everyone can hear.

norm: It's wrong to be unfaithful to your partner.
situation: James is a married man, and having a night out drinking with friends.
intention: James wants to have a good time.
moral_action: James ignores the attractive lady and plays a game of pool with his friends.
immoral_action: James sees a pretty woman and starts flirting.

norm: It's wrong to take pleasure in hurting others.
situation: Jake is playing against his biggest rival in football and gets in position for a tackle.
intention: Jake wants to stop the play and get possession to his team.
moral_action: Jake tackles his foe hard and checks on him when he notices the rival seeming hurt.
immoral_action: Jake spears his rival to the ground and celebrates when his opponent struggles to get up.

norm: being unfaithful to a partner is morally wrong.
situation: Matt and Natalie are dating and Natalie is going to be away on a work trip for a week.
intention: Matt wants to avoid feeling lonely.
moral_action: Matt calls a friend and invites him over to play video games.
immoral_action: Matt calls his ex-girlfriend and invites her over to his house for an intimate evening.

norm: It's wrong to fire someone because they are special needs.
situation: John is a manager at a department store and one of his employees is special needs.
intention: John wants to be an effective manager.
moral_action: John knows that helping the community is important and makes sure the employee with special needs is doing tasks that are both helpful and within their capabilities.
immoral_action: John feels the special needs of his employee slow down work flow and make customers uncomfortable, so he makes up a reason to fire them.

norm: It's wrong to try to get revenge
situation: Morgan is told by a witness that it was Jim who attacked his wife last week.
intention: Morgan wants to act on the new information about Jim.
moral_action: Morgan looks up Jim's address and calls the police to report where he lives.
immoral_action: Morgan looks up Jim's address and finds him and then proceeds to beat him up as payback.

norm: It's wrong to be bigoted against a group of people.
situation: Jane was raised around only people like her but just moved to a diverse area.
intention: Jane wants to make new friends.
moral_action: Jane focuses on what people are like on the inside rather than the outside when it comes to meeting new friends.
immoral_action: Jane only looks to people who are the same background as her and look the same for prospective new friends.

norm: It is wrong to be disrespectful to soldiers.
situation: Peter was attending a Fourth of July parade and sees soldiers walking in the street.
intention: Peter wants to let the soldiers know how he feels about their service.
moral_action: Peter approaches the soldiers and thanks them for their service to the country.
immoral_action: Peter yells at the soldiers and calls them names such as killers.

norm: It's wrong to be unfaithful to someone you love
situation: Brad and Jennifer are married, and one of Brad's old girlfriends calls him up.
intention: Brad wants to communicate with his old girlfriend.
moral_action: Brad talks to his old girlfriend on the phone and tells Jennifer about it later.
immoral_action: Brad meets up with his old girlfriend, and they sleep together.

norm: Bailing on someone who needs your support is wrong.
situation: Robert is helping his friend Nathan through some difficult emotional times and is starting to feel burnt out.
intention: Robert wants to have time to recharge.
moral_action: Robert tells Nathan he needs some time to himself, so he can continue to be a supportive friends.
immoral_action: Robert blocks Nathan's number for a few days, so he doesn't have to deal with Nathan.
