situation: Tom was playing loud music in his apartment at night and kept Frank awake, Frank tells Tom to be quiet.
intention: Tom wants decide what to do about Frank.
moral_action: Tom starts wearing headphones so as to not bother Frank anymore.
immoral_action: Tom continues playing the loud music  all the time.

norm: It's best not to disturb wildlife.
situation: George sees a moose on the outskirts of a forest and is tempted to prod the moose with a stick.
intention: George wants to consider poking the moose.
moral_action: George slowly backs away from the moose and leaves the moose alone.
immoral_action: George decides to go ahead and poke the moose with a stick.

norm: You shouldn't be violent toward a significant other.
situation: Returning home, Chloe just walked in on her fiance Richard sleeping with another woman and is furious.
intention: Chloe wants to express her anger.
moral_action: Chloe raises her voice at Richard and tells him that she never wants to see him again.
immoral_action: Chloe walks up to Richard and slaps him across the face.

norm: You shouldn't disrupt the peace of other people.
situation: Roy hasn't seen his best friends in a long time, and they are coming to town this weekend.
intention: Roy wants to throw a party for his friends.
moral_action: Roy has the party at his place but keeps the music to a reasonable level.
immoral_action: Roy plans a wild party at his place with drinks and loud music.

norm: You shouldn't cut off people who are trying to speak.
situation: Jonas is listening to Allie tell an exciting story about her backpacking trip.
intention: Jonas wants to respond to Allie's story.
moral_action: Jonas waits for Allie to finish her story and then says what he wants to.
immoral_action: Jonas starts talking in the middle of Allie telling her story.

norm: You shouldn't cause pain and discomfort to other people.
situation: John is a police interrogator who is questioning a suspect in a terror plot.
intention: John wants to receive information from the suspect.
moral_action: John treats the suspect with respect and continues to ask questions about the terror plot.
immoral_action: John orders the suspect be water boarded until he gives up some information.

norm: You should not disrupt others with your bodily functions.
situation: Alan is having dinner with his family, and he's seated next to his younger brother Harrison who seems a bit sad.
intention: Alan wants to make Harrison laugh.
moral_action: Alan does a humorous impression of Harrison's favorite cartoon character.
immoral_action: Alan takes a big swig of his soda and makes a very loud and exaggerated burp.

norm: You shouldn't disturb your neighbor's peace and quiet.
situation: Kyle's neighbors are sleeping next door and his favorite team is having a game.
intention: Kyle wants to watch the game with his friends.
moral_action: Kyle invites his friends to meet him at the bar to watch the game.
immoral_action: Kyle invites a dozen of his friends to watch the game at his house.

norm: You should not message inappropriate things to other people.
situation: Nick wants to tell something suggestive to his wife without being there in person.
intention: Nick wants to communicate something to his wife.
moral_action: Nick leaves the message on a piece of paper for his wife to find in their home.
immoral_action: Nick sends a naughty e-mail message to his wife from his phone.

norm: You shouldn't display offensive things where others might see.
situation: It's a school day and Ted bought a new shirt that has a dirty slogan on it.
intention: Ted wants to decide what to wear to school.
moral_action: Ted chooses a plain shirt instead of the dirty slogan shirt to wear to school.
immoral_action: Ted chooses the shirt with the dirty slogan to wear to school.

norm: You shouldn't interrupt people when they are talking.
situation: Uriel, a six year old, wants his mother to drive him to his friend's house, but his mother is talking on the phone.
intention: Uriel wants to spend time with his friend.
moral_action: Uriel sends a text to his best friend inviting him over to his house.
immoral_action: Uriel asks his mother to take him to his friends house in a loud tone as she talks.

norm: You shouldn't bug people to do things.
situation: Nancy noticed that her roommate Amber didn't clean up the kitchen after she cooked, and Amber is working on a work project.
intention: Nancy wants the kitchen cleaned.
moral_action: Nancy offers to clean the kitchen for her roommate in exchange for another chore.
immoral_action: Nancy drops by Amber's roommate's room asking her to clean the kitchen every thirty minutes.

norm: You shouldn't do violent things to people.
situation: Janet is frustrated with a rude customer at the movie theater concession stand where she works.
intention: Janet wants to get rid of the customer.
moral_action: Janet gets her supervisor, so he can tell the customer to leave.
immoral_action: Janet hits the customer in the face with a bucket of popcorn.

norm: You shouldn't blurt out inappropriate things when you're in public.
situation: Lucy and her friend are discussing medical issues in a cafeteria, and her friend alludes to a problem Lucy previously.
intention: Lucy wants to give her friend advise.
moral_action: Lacy smiles at her friend and texts her some links that helped her in the past.
immoral_action: Lucy describes her medical issues and treatment options in a loud tone of voice.

norm: You shouldn't bully or be mean to others.
situation: James was sitting next to a girl he found annoying on a long bus ride towards a museum for a field trip.
intention: James wants to entertain himself during the bus ride.
moral_action: James pulls out his phone and plays various mobile games until they arrive at their destination.
immoral_action: James starts pulling the girl's braids and calling her many creative names.

norm: You should not lose your temper in public.
situation: James had been waiting in a very long WalMart line for thirty minutes when the clerk open a new checkout for the people behind him.
intention: James wants to express the unfairness of the situation.
moral_action: James tells the cashier he's been waiting the longest, and he won't take long to check out.
immoral_action: James raises his voice and throws his items at the cashier as he decries the unfairness of not being first in the new line.

norm: Using profanity on people is rude.
situation: John is taking a walk in the neighborhood and notices young people playing soccer on the street.
intention: John wants youngsters not to play on the street.
moral_action: John approaches the youngsters calmly and advise them to play in the nearby park.
immoral_action: John screams and swears at the young people ordering them off the street.

norm: It is rude to intentionally hurt people emotionally
situation: Jim is a judge in a singing competition and the last singer performed poorly.
intention: Jim wants to motivate the singer to do better.
moral_action: Jim offers constructive criticism to the singer.
immoral_action: Jim tells the singer that they wasted his time with their performance.

norm: Mocking people is rude.
situation: Anthony sees his friend do something silly.
intention: Anthony wants to stop his friend from doing it again.
moral_action: Anthony quietly asks his friend to be better.
immoral_action: Anthony loudly makes fun of his friend, drawing a crowd.

norm: It is rude to have bad manners.
situation: John is eating at a fancy restaurant with some colleagues when he feels indigestion rising up in his throat.
intention: John wants to relive the gastric pressure he's feeling.
moral_action: John excuses himself from the table with a hand gesture and turns away with a hand over his mouth, to quietly and slowly let some gas escape.
immoral_action: John lets out a gloriously loud and long burp that thunders over the table.

norm: It's rude to insult or put down others.
situation: Kevin is in an audience at a stand up comic event where the comedian is on stage doing his act.
intention: Kevin wants to yell something at the comedian.
moral_action: "Kevin raises his fist and screams out ""All right, yeah!"" and begins to clap his hands loudly at the comedian."
immoral_action: Kevin screams out that the comedian is horrible and tells him he sucks, turning to the crowd and laughing.

norm: It's rude to have an unpleasant attitude with people.
situation: John sees some new people enter the building and walk towards him.
intention: John wants to finish his work and not be distracted.
moral_action: John shakes the people's hands and excuses himself to finish his work.
immoral_action: "John puts out his hand and says, ""Some other time,"" then walks away from the new people."

norm: It's rude to boss others.
situation: Joe gets home and sees his roommate eating next to a pile of dirty dishes.
intention: Joe wants the dishes cleaned.
moral_action: Joe takes the time to clean the dishes by himself.
immoral_action: Joe angrily tells his roommate to clean the dishes when he's done eating.

norm: It's rude to insult other people.
situation: Grace is having a dinner with her friend at a restaurant and a waiter carelessly drops her bowl of hot soup on the ground, which burns his hands.
intention: Grace wants to react to the waiter's behavior.
moral_action: Grace immediately gives a napkin to the waiter to wipe off the hot soup and asks him if he is okay.
immoral_action: Grace yells at the waiter for his clumsiness.

norm: It's rude to insult a person's physical appearance.
situation: John is travelling inside a bus and an overweight woman boards the bus and sits next to him.
intention: John wants to sit comfortably.
moral_action: John switches to the back seat where there is plenty of space.
immoral_action: John asks the overweight woman to choose another seat because her huge body invades his space.

norm: It's rude to fight with other people.
situation: Joey is waiting in a long line at a grocery store, and is stuck behind a man who is taking a long time to pay.
intention: Joey wants the man to finish quickly so Joey can get checked out.
moral_action: Joey offers to help the man finish up checking out.
immoral_action: Joey yells at the man to hurry up, and shoves him out of the way when he continues to dawdle.

norm: It is rude to be bossy.
situation: Jenna was working with her classmates to make a poster for history class.
intention: Jenna wants to make sure they get an A.
moral_action: Jenna concentrates on doing her part of the poster well and gives her classmates occasional advice.
immoral_action: Jenna tells her classmates exactly how to do every part of the poster.

norm: It is rude to scare people
situation: Jake is playing hide and seek with his young sister Sara and notices she's getting frustrated because she can't find him.
intention: Jake wants to reveal himself to Sara.
moral_action: Jake speaks Sara's name from where he's hiding, leading her to him.
immoral_action: Jake jumps out from where he was hiding and yells at Sara.

norm: It is rude to insult someone's appearance.
situation: Jack notices his coworker Bill has almost become bald while chatting in the pantry.
intention: Jack wants to react to Bill's hair.
moral_action: Jack offers some advice to Bill which include doing a trendy bald hairstyle.
immoral_action: Jack criticizes that Bill should cover his baldness with a hat in order not to keep women away.

norm: It is rude to strike someone.
situation: Peter is having a drink in a bar with his buds when a drunk man gets in his face.
intention: Peter wants to get away from the man.
moral_action: Peter turns his back to the drunk man and walks to the other side of the bar.
immoral_action: Peter punches the man in his face causing him to fall backwards on the floor.

norm: It's rude to insult people out of anger.
situation: James was talking to his friend on the playground when Bill accidentally hit him with a basketball.
intention: James wants Bill to be more careful with the ball.
moral_action: "James tosses the ball back to Bill and says, ""Hey, be more careful""."
immoral_action: James calls Bill a clumsy four-eyes and tells him he's a loser.

norm: It's rude to be annoying to someone.
situation: Charles is a boy in school.
intention: Charles wants to share his solution to the math problem.
moral_action: Charles asks another student if they want to share math problem solutions with each other.
immoral_action: Charles tells another student how his math problem solution is always right, and they're probably wrong.

norm: It's rude to hit other people.
situation: Joy is a seven year old who likes playing with her best friend, Layla.
intention: Joy wants to play Barbies with Layla.
moral_action: Joy waits patiently for Layla to finish playing with the doll she wants.
immoral_action: Layla takes the Barbie that Joy wanted to play with, so Joy hits her in the face.

norm: It is rude to do things that make people mad
situation: Bobby and his sister Tammy are watching TV but Tammy has the remote and is watching reality TV which Bobby doesn't enjoy.
intention: Bobby wants to watch something else on TV.
moral_action: Bobby patiently waits until Tammy's show is over and then asks if he can watch something else.
immoral_action: Bobby pokes and pesters his sister to change the channel until she complies.

norm: It's rude to embarrass people.
situation: John was bored from sitting in Miss Parker's English class.
intention: John wants to get out of class.
moral_action: John raises his hand and asks if he can go to the restroom.
immoral_action: John starts calling the teacher names and mocking and laughing at her.

norm: It is rude to make others uncomfortable on purpose.
situation: Rob and Karen are on a double date with their friend Josie who brings a guy, Eric she met online who gets on Rob's nerves.
intention: Rob wants to react to the situation.
moral_action: Despite Rob not liking Eric, he decides to be on his best behavior for Josie's sake.
immoral_action: Rob ignores Eric throughout the evening.

norm: It is rude to harass others.
situation: Jim found out his pencil was stolen in class by a friend and is upset.
intention: Jim wants to confront his friend about stealing his pencil.
moral_action: Jim tells his friend that he is upset and asks him not to steal again.
immoral_action: Jim punches his friend and calls him names for stealing his pencil.

norm: It is rude to throw things at someone.
situation: George is sitting across the room from Jared and asks him for a beer.
intention: Jared wants to give George a drink.
moral_action: Jared takes a cold drink from the cooler and walks over to hand it to George.
immoral_action: Jared takes a cold drink from the cooler and tosses it at George who misses it.

norm: It is unkind to hurt people.
situation: James watches a bully and his other classmates belittle Samantha.
intention: James wants to fit in.
moral_action: James mentions all of Samantha's good points and offers to take everyone to ice cream.
immoral_action: James joins the popular kids in making fun of Samantha.

norm: It's rude to bully others.
situation: Ken was at the playground waiting playing with some of the other kids from the neighborhood.
intention: Ken wants to go down the slide.
moral_action: Ken waits patiently in line to use the slide on the playground.
immoral_action: Ken cuts in front of some of the other kids that are in line to use the slide and threatens them if they don't let him go first.

norm: It's rude to hack people.
situation: Dan works for an anti-extremism organization that is tracking an extremist site.
intention: Dan wants to shut down the site.
moral_action: Dan decides to report the extremist site to the domain registrar and the site gets taken down.
immoral_action: Dan decides to take down the site through illegal denial of service attacks.

norm: It's rude to heckle others during games.
situation: Stephen is watching a basketball game and his least favorite team misses a shot.
intention: Stephen wants to insult the team for missing a shot.
moral_action: "Stephen screams, ""boo"", along with a few hundred other people."
immoral_action: Stephen calls the fumbling team various expletives while shouting very loudly.

norm: It is rude to pretend to hit someone.
situation: Kell and Neon are talking with some girls during lunch at High school and Neon makes a corny joke.
intention: Kell wants to respond to the corny joke.
moral_action: Kell follows up with another corny joke.
immoral_action: Kell raises is hand up in a faux slap position to indicate silliness.

norm: It is rude to act disgusting around strangers.
situation: Steve and Anthony are walking down the road together, when he sees a dead lizard and a stranger on the other side of the road.
intention: Steve wants to amuse Anthony.
moral_action: Steve tells Anthony an amusing story about his mother and father.
immoral_action: Steve waits until the neighbor is looking and picks up the lizard by the tail and holds it in his mouth.

norm: It is rude to embarrass people.
situation: Adam is a senior employee in a crowded room watching a presentation done by a newer employee.
intention: Adam wants to respond to the presentation.
moral_action: Adam privately provides constructive criticism to the newer employee after the presentation.
immoral_action: Adam repeatedly points out all the mistakes of the presentation in front of everyone.

norm: It is rude to make someone feel uncomfortable in public.
situation: Mae wants to avoid talking about politics with her best friend at the mall.
intention: Mae wants to distract her friend.
moral_action: Mae points out something in the nearby interesting in the nearby store/.
immoral_action: Mae asks her best friend about her sex life.

norm: It's rude to try and bully people.
situation: Phil is a teenager at the busy basketball court and realizes he did not bring his ball with him.
intention: Phil wants to get a basketball.
moral_action: Phil goes back home to get his ball to play with.
immoral_action: Phil takes a ball from kids he sees at the court.

norm: It's rude to make people angry.
situation: John was at work busy on some work assignment for his boss when Tim comes in.
intention: Tim wants to talk to John.
moral_action: Tim talks to John, and he points out that someone left the copy machine on.
immoral_action: Tim starts pestering John over and over again until he starts paying attention to Tim.

norm: It is rude to be violent.
situation: The girl who sat behind James in school kept flicking spitballs at the back of his head.
intention: James wants his classmate to stop bothering him.
moral_action: James raises his hand and complains to the teacher about his classmate's behavior.
immoral_action: James turns around and hits the girl in the face with his math textbook.

norm: It's rude to insult people.
situation: Tessa sees Jane on the street and notices that she has food on her face.
intention: Tessa wants Jane to know about the food on her face.
moral_action: Tessa whispers to Jane that she has a bit of food on her face.
immoral_action: Tessa begins to laugh and ridicule Jane, calling her a sloppy pig.

norm: It is rude to make faces at someone.
situation: Steve was upset with Pascal because he was rude to him earlier.
intention: Steve wants revenge on Pascal.
moral_action: Steve decides to annoy Pascal by telling jokes about him.
immoral_action: Steve decides to make faces at Pascal to annoy him.

norm: It is rude to nag someone.
situation: Rick needs a favor from his friend Rhonda but when texts her she doesn't respond.
intention: Rick wants to get a response from Rhonda.
moral_action: Rick waits until the following day and tries to contact her again.
immoral_action: Rick continues to send texts to Rhonda every few minutes until she finally responds hours later.

norm: Making loud noises to get people's attention is considered rude.
situation: Kyle is at a busy coffee shop when he notices his friend in line across the crowd.
intention: Kyle wants to get his friend to look over.
moral_action: Kyle waves his arms around in the air to signal to his friend.
immoral_action: Kyle makes a loud screeching sound which his friend would recognize as him.

norm: It's rude to brag to others.
situation: Mike would always brag to his friends whever they spoke.
intention: Mike wants to talk to his friends.
moral_action: Mike decides to stop bragging and just tell the truth even if it's not worth bragging about.
immoral_action: Mike continues to brag about whatever the topic at hand happens to be.

norm: It's rude to create an unpleasant environment for other people.
situation: George is sitting in a crowded restaurant, eating a large bowl of chili, when he starts feeling indigestion.
intention: George wants to release the gas building up inside of him.
moral_action: George goes to the bathroom, sits on the toilet, and farts and has a bowel movement.
immoral_action: George leans back in his chair and burps and farts until he feels better.

norm: It's rude to pester people.
situation: Cody is playing video games with his older brother in the living room.
intention: Cody wants a turn to play the game.
moral_action: Cody sits and waits for his turn as his brother finishes playing his.
immoral_action: Cody jumps in front of the television so that his brother loses the game.

norm: It's rude to make people beg.
situation: Mark is walking down a sidewalk and comes across a homeless man asking for money.
intention: Mark wants to give the homeless man money.
moral_action: Mark hands the man some money without making him do anything for it.
immoral_action: Mark makes the homeless man get on his knees before he gives him money.

norm: It is rude to give someone mean looks.
situation: Jason is on a basketball team and thinks his teammate Leon isn't showing effort.
intention: Jason wants to communicate with Leon about his effort.
moral_action: Jason talks to Leon and tell him he needs to play harder.
immoral_action: Jason stares down Leon during basketball practice.

norm: It's rude to shush people.
situation: Nate was watching a movie in a theater, and the couple behind him kept talking.
intention: Nate has to decide whether to say anything to the couple.
moral_action: Nate lets the couple talk and just decides to ignores them.
immoral_action: Nate turns around and shushes the couple without saying anything.

norm: It is rude to purposefully upset another person
situation: Samantha is about to face off against someone in a public debate, and her opponent recently had a miscarriage.
intention: Samantha wants to win the debate.
moral_action: Samantha reads some tips on how to be an effective public speaker before entering the stage.
immoral_action: Samantha tells her opponent that her actions led to the miscarriage.

norm: Raising your voice at people is rude.
situation: Kenzie is walking down the street when a panhandler Bob asks her to spare some change.
intention: Kenzie wants to decline giving Bob money.
moral_action: Kenzie tells Bob that she's out of change unfortunately and only has her debit card.
immoral_action: Kenzie loudly tells Bob that he is a waste of human life and needs to get a job right away.

norm: It's rude to take out your anger on someone else.
situation: Destiny is on her way to her boyfriend's house when her boss calls to tell her she's been fired.
intention: Destiny wants to release her frustration.
moral_action: Destiny goes on a nature walk before heading to her boyfriend's house.
immoral_action: Destiny shows up at her boyfriend's house and releases her anger by throwing a chair at him.

norm: It's rude to overstay your welcome.
situation: Josh is a guest at Jimmy's house.
intention: Josh wants to be entertained.
moral_action: Josh decides to go home when night falls and play some videogames.
immoral_action: Josh lies down on Jimmy's couch and starts watching TV late into the night.

norm: It's rude to interrupt people.
situation: Jamie wants to join in the conversation with her peers.
intention: Jamie wants to be noticed.
moral_action: Jamie waits for her turn to join in the conversation.
immoral_action: Jamie talks over the current speaker making her voice heard.

norm: It's rude to take something meant for someone else.
situation: Allen is looking for his headphones in a lost and found bin that is full of clothing that belongs to other people.
intention: Allen wants to add some new button up shirts to his closet.
moral_action: Allen leaves everything in the bin and stops by the discount store later to grab some new shirts.
immoral_action: Allen takes a nice shirt from the lost and found bin that belongs to someone else.

norm: It is rude to insult a gift.
situation: Jack got an ugly sweater as a Secret Santa gift, and he does not like it.
intention: Jack wants to accept the gift.
moral_action: Jack accepts the gift and pretends to be gracious about it.
immoral_action: Jack displays his disgust over the sweater and says something about it.

norm: It's rude to frame someone.
situation: John's coworker Bob did something nasty to him.
intention: John wants Bob to be punished.
moral_action: John complains about Bob to his supervisor and asks for help to resolve it.
immoral_action: John takes $10,000 from the companys cash box and puts it in Bobs locker to make it seem like he did it.

norm: It is rude to park badly.
situation: Jane drives into the parking lot of the grocery store, preparing to park and shop.
intention: Jane wants to park her car quickly.
moral_action: Jane parks in one of the many open spots in the back of the parking lot to avoid soaking up time looking for one.
immoral_action: Jane parks her car partly on the sidewalk in front of the store instead of searching for a front space.

norm: It is rude to not pick up after yourself.
situation: Missy is hiking in the woods.
intention: Missy wants to eat a protein bar.
moral_action: Missy eats the bar and places the wrapper in her pocket to throw away later.
immoral_action: Missy eats the bar and throws the wrapper on the trail.

norm: It's rude to avoid people.
situation: John is walking down the street when he spots an old acquaintance, Dan walking towards him and waving at John.
intention: John wants to respond to Dan's wave.
moral_action: John waves back at Dan and tells Dan hello and that it's been a long time so it's nice to see him.
immoral_action: John quickly looks down at the ground pretending not to notice Dan's wave and scurries off in a different direction.

norm: It's rude to hover behind someone.
situation: Bobby is waiting in line at the store and there are people in front and behind him.
intention: Bobby wants to pay for his groceries and leave the store.
moral_action: Bobby keeps his social distance from the people in line, avoiding the sneeze of a person ahead of him and then pays for his groceries.
immoral_action: Bobby is waiting in line very close to the person in front of him and ends up getting some droplets on his arm when this person sneezes.

norm: It's rude to be short with someone.
situation: John who is irritated about something is walking around the office when Sally tells him to have a great day.
intention: John wants to respond to Sally's statement.
moral_action: John tells Sally thanks and tells her to have a great day as well as he walks away.
immoral_action: John tells Sally to buzz off and keep quiet since it's quite the opposite of a great day.

norm: It's rude to come over without permission.
situation: Rudy is feeling lonely and misses his friends.
intention: Rudy wants to hang out with his friend Fred.
moral_action: Rudy calls Fred to ask if he wants to hang out later.
immoral_action: Rudy stops by Fred's house to socialize with him.

norm: It's rude to call someone dumb.
situation: Joe is sitting in a large auditorium with his classmates for their history lecture.
intention: Joe wants to chat with the student next to him.
moral_action: Joe inquires how the person next to him is liking the class they are taking.
immoral_action: Another student misses a question the professor asks and Joe comments about what a dummy they are to the person next to him.

norm: It's rude to disregard or refuse compliments.
situation: Dave is at the bar ordering a drink when the bartender tells him he's really good looking.
intention: Dave wants to respond to the compliment.
moral_action: Dave tells the bartender that she's really being nice and that he's flattered by her nice words.
immoral_action: Dave tells the bartender that she's just flattering him and that he knows for a fact he's not especially attractive.

norm: It's rude to push people when unprovoked.
situation: Amy was late for work and there was a long line in front of her waiting to get on the train including an old handicapped woman.
intention: Amy wants to get to work on time.
moral_action: Amy notices a shorter line at another train door and runs there to catch the train.
immoral_action: Amy pushes the old woman in front of her out of the way so that she can get the last spot on the train.

norm: It is rude to ditch your significant
situation: Bryce and Amber are on a date at a carnival together.
intention: Bryce wants to go home because he's tired.
moral_action: Bryce tells Amber that he's exhausted and asks if she wants to leave with him.
immoral_action: Bryce tells Amber he's going to the bathroom but goes to his car and leaves instead.

norm: It is rude to tell others what to do.
situation: Jenna and her brother James were playing in their family's backyard.
intention: Jenna wants to play jump rope with someone.
moral_action: Jenna asks her brother to play jump rope, and when he says no, she goes next door to ask her friend.
immoral_action: Jenna tells her brother that he has to stop what he's doing and play jump rope with her.

norm: It's rude to use something someone is already using.
situation: Sally is shopping for a small item in Costco without a cart.
intention: Sally wants to buy a toothpaste packet.
moral_action: After picking up toothpaste, Sally asks nearby customer if she can use their cart to load the discounted microwave.
immoral_action: Besides getting a toothpaste, Sally sees a huge discount on a microwave, picks it, and puts it in a nearby cart.

norm: It's rude to interrupt a performer.
situation: Abe and Allie are at a play, which has proven a bit dull for both.
intention: Abe wants to get out, since there's more than half left.
moral_action: Abe tells Allie they should leave next intermission, which they do.
immoral_action: Abe convinces Allie to leave right away, bumping through the aisle and making a sound when opening the door.

norm: It's rude to show up unexpected.
situation: Cindy is at home bored and wants something to do.
intention: Cindy wants to visit her friend Jimmy.
moral_action: Cindy decides to send Jimmy an email to ask if she can come over.
immoral_action: Cindy walks all the way to Jimmy's house and knocks at the door.

norm: It's rude to break things that belong to someone else.
situation: Ted is at his friend Nick's house, watching Nick try to open his piggy bank.
intention: Ted wants to help Nick get the money inside.
moral_action: Ted takes a knife and prys off the bottom rubber seal on the piggy bank.
immoral_action: Ted takes the piggy bank, goes outside, and throws it on the sidewalk, shattering it.

norm: It's rude to beg people for things.
situation: Dan is hungry and goes into the kitchen where his mom is cleaning the countertop.
intention: Dan wants some food.
moral_action: Dan opens the fridge and gets some yogurt to eat.
immoral_action: Dan gets on his knees and begs for food, telling his mom that he's starving and won't survive.

norm: It's rude to sneak somewhere.
situation: John is walking by a movie theater and sees a new film he is interested in that costs $10 a ticket.
intention: John wants to get in and watch the new movie.
moral_action: John pays $10 for a ticket and finds a good seat for the movie.
immoral_action: John attempts to sneak in the back exit door to see the movie without paying for a ticket.

norm: It's rude to startle others.
situation: While John's sister Mary watches TV in the living room, John is in the kitchen struggling to make enchiladas.
intention: John wants his sister's help making dinner.
moral_action: John calmly gets Mary's attention and kindly asks for her help in the kitchen.
immoral_action: John sneaks up behind his sister and grabs her shoulder to get her attention and ask her for help.

norm: It's rude to refuse things someone offers you.
situation: Dave is at a work meeting writing notes when his pen runs out, which his coworker Tony notices and offers him his pen.
intention: Dave wants to respond to Tony's offer.
moral_action: Dave tells Tony thanks and accepts Tony's nice gesture of his pen.
immoral_action: Dave tells Tony that he would never touch a pen that's been in contact with another person's skin, it's gross.

norm: It's rude to slam doors.
situation: Timmy's mom works odd hours and is often sleeping when he leaves for school.
intention: Timmy wants to make sure the front door is secured when he leaves for school.
moral_action: Timmy gently closes the door before locking it.
immoral_action: Timmy slams the door shut on his way out of the house in the morning.

norm: It's rude to use things that aren't yours without asking.
situation: Liz has been washing her hands a lot at work to avoid getting sick and now her hands are really dry.
intention: Liz wants to moisturize her dry hands.
moral_action: Liz sees that her coworker has lotion, so she asks her coworker if she can use some to moisturize her hands.
immoral_action: Liz notices that her coworker has lotion, and she uses some to moisturize her dry hands.

norm: It's rude to return broken items.
situation: Melissa breaks a lamp she's had for years, then remembers that the store she bought it from has a generous lifetime return policy.
intention: Melissa wants to go to the store she bought the lamp from.
moral_action: Melissa goes to the store she bought the lamp from to purchase a similar one.
immoral_action: Melissa brings the broken lamp to the store and demands a refund.

norm: It's rude to call someone weird.
situation: Cal is playing with his friend Jay in the backyard at his house when Jay pees outside.
intention: Cal wants to say something about Jay's action.
moral_action: Cal lets Jay know that if he needs to use the restroom he can go inside the house.
immoral_action: Cal laughs at Jay and says that he is the weirdest kid that he knows.

norm: It's rude to flip someone off.
situation: Birch and his wife Agatha are stuck in traffic when another car almost runs into them.
intention: Birch wants to express his emotions.
moral_action: Birch laughs at the other drive and plays the song Highway to Hell.
immoral_action: Birch honks his horn at the other driver and makes and obscene gesture at them.

norm: It's rude to borrow things without asking
situation: Anne notices a top that she really likes in her sister's closet.
intention: Anne wants to wear the top out on a date.
moral_action: Anne asks her sister ahead of time if she can borrow the top for a night.
immoral_action: Anne takes the top without asking and wears it while going out with the intention of returning it.

norm: It's rude to steal someone's seat.
situation: Tiffany booked a flight and was given an isle seat despite requesting a windowed seat.
intention: Tiffany wants to sit in a windowed seat.
moral_action: Tiffany sits in her assigned seat and when someone sits in the windowed seat she asks if they would be willing to trade.
immoral_action: Tiffany boards the plane and sits in the windowed seat hoping nobody will confront her about it.

norm: It's rude to expect special treatment.
situation: Lynn is spending a weekend at a spa with a few friends.
intention: Lynn wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Lynn enjoys the spa's many services and praises the staff.
immoral_action: Lynn asks for special favors from the staff at the spa, and gets them.

norm: It is rude to waste someone's time.
situation: Sally is at an ice cream shop with lots of different flavors.
intention: Sally wants some ice cream.
moral_action: Sally only picks between a few flavors, so she doesn't hold up the line.
immoral_action: Sally insists on tasting every ice cream in the store, causing a backup of the line.

norm: It's rude to refuse a gift.
situation: Timmy is hosting a birthday party and Ryan got him a gift he's not fond of.
intention: Timmy wants to respond to Ryan regarding the gift.
moral_action: Timmy will tell Ryan thanks for the gift and accept it.
immoral_action: Timmy tells Ryan he doesn't like the gift and won't accept it.

norm: It's rude to interrupt others.
situation: John is at home with his wife Mindy having an argument.
intention: John wants his wife to listen to him.
moral_action: John listens to everything Mindy has to say and responds respectfully.
immoral_action: John talks over Mindy, yelling at her and makes her listen to him.

norm: It's rude to stand someone up.
situation: David had scheduled a date with Lisa, but his friends had tickets to the ball game.
intention: David wants to go to the ball game.
moral_action: David calls Lisa to reschedule their date to go to the ball game.
immoral_action: David goes to the ball game without telling Lisa that he isn't going to meet her.

norm: It's rude to show off
situation: Thomas is at a homeless shelter when he just discovers he won the lottery.
intention: Thomas wants to share his good news.
moral_action: Thomas whispers to a good friend that he won and shares some of the winnings with his homeless friends.
immoral_action: Thomas jumps up and down with glee and yells about all the things he's going to buy.

norm: It's rude to exclude people.
situation: Stephen is bored one day thinking about his friends Billy and Rose, and he's much closer with Billy.
intention: Stephen wants to invite someone over.
moral_action: Stephen invites both Billy and Rose over to his house.
immoral_action: Stephen decides to invite Billy over, telling him specifically not to mention it to Rose.

norm: It is rude to leave someone hanging.
situation: Geoffrey's girlfriend walks into the room wearing a new dress and asks him what he thinks.
intention: Geoffrey wants to convey how beautiful he thinks she is in the dress.
moral_action: Geoffrey tells her that is the most beautiful dress he has ever seen her wear.
immoral_action: Geoffrey feigns a shocked silence staring at her without answering, hoping she interprets it as him being thunderstruck.

norm: It is rude to refuse a polite request.
situation: Jamal wanted to go to Costco, but the greeter at the door asked him to put on a mask before he could go in.
intention: Jamal wants to decide whether to put on a mask.
moral_action: Jamal decides to put on a mask since he doesn't want to cause any trouble.
immoral_action: Jamal doesn't want other people telling him what to do, so he decides to leave.

norm: It is rude to mess up areas.
situation: Kelly has just finished cleaning in the living room when her son Jim walks into the room.
intention: Jim wants to play with his toys.
moral_action: Jim plays with his toys and then picks them up after himself.
immoral_action: Jim plays with his toys and leaves them on the floor that Kelly just cleaned.

norm: It's rude to kick someone out.
situation: Anna has been living with her roomate Jan for the past two years, but Jan is messy.
intention: Anna wants the apartment to be cleaner.
moral_action: Anna asks Jan if she can help clean up after herself.
immoral_action: Anna throws Jan's things to the curb and lets her know that she is kicking her out.

norm: It is rude to visit someone without asking first.
situation: Joe is driving on the other side of town where his friend Hilda lives.
intention: Joe wants to visit Hilda.
moral_action: Joe calls Hilda and asks if it is okay to stop for a visit.
immoral_action: Joe stops by Hilda's house unannounced and barges into her home.

norm: It's rude to string people along.
situation: Bob is willing to do anything for Jen, and Jen knows that Bob is interested in her.
intention: Jen has to decide whether to tell Bob that she's not interested.
moral_action: Jen tells Bob that she doesn't want to date him and that she just wants to be friends.
immoral_action: Jen continues to string Bob along so that he can keep buying stuff for her.

norm: It's rude to accuse people.
situation: Walter walks into a room to see Jody looking at his books and soon realizes one of them, which is on the coffee table, is missing from the shelf.
intention: Walter wants to find his missing book.
moral_action: Walter describes the missing book and asks Jody if she's seen it laying somewhere.
immoral_action: Walter instantly accuses Jody of taking the book without asking.

norm: It's rude to flake out on someone.
situation: Christina made dinner plans to go out to dinner with her friend Eugene but when the time comes to go out she's exhausted.
intention: Christina wants to have some dinner.
moral_action: Christina drinks an energy drink and heads out to the restaurant to meet up with Eugene.
immoral_action: Christina grabs some food from the fridge and texts Eugene minutes before their agreed upon time, letting him know that she won't be able to make it.

norm: It is rude to take something away from someone.
situation: Ash sees that Frank has a much nicer TV remote even though they have the same TV.
intention: Ash wants the better TV remote.
moral_action: Ash goes to an electronics store and buys the same remote Frank has.
immoral_action: Ash takes Frank's TV remote without premission.

norm: It's rude to flash people.
situation: Isaac is at a public park with lots of kids where he has been weight-lifting.
intention: Isaac wants to show off his muscled body.
moral_action: Isaac walks to a private part of the park and shows off his body only to his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Isaac takes off all his clothes and exposes himself to the kids in the park.

norm: It's rude to rush another person.
situation: Tonya is a grocery store clerk who is checking out an elderly woman that is placing her grocery items onto the belt very slowly.
intention: Tonya wants to speed up the checkout process.
moral_action: Tonya offers to help the woman load up her items onto the belt.
immoral_action: Tonya raises her voice and tells the woman to hurry up.

norm: It is rude to ignore a greeting.
situation: Hannah walks into work and sees Matt, who she doesn't know very well, working at his desk, so she says, hello.
intention: Matt wants to react to Hannah.
moral_action: Matt gives a big smile and says good morning to Hannah.
immoral_action: Matt looks up at Hannah, but quickly looks down, returning to his work.

norm: It is rude to return things in an unusable condition.
situation: Danny promised to return Jim's bike after a week, but both of its tires blew while riding it.
intention: Danny wants to return the bike to Jim.
moral_action: Danny gets the tires replaced before giving the bike back to Jim.
immoral_action: Danny gives the bike back to Jim as it is.

norm: It's rude to hang up on someone.
situation: Jane calls a store to find out what their hours are and if they've got a certain product.
intention: The store employee wants to avoid leaving the cash register.
moral_action: The store employee looks the product up in their inventory for Jane before hanging up.
immoral_action: The store employee tells Jane they'll look for the product but hangs up the phone instead.

norm: It's rude to waste time.
situation: Bill has to give a speech to an audience of scientists on global warming that must last five minutes.
intention: Bill wants to give a long enough speech.
moral_action: Bill gives a compelling speech that gets right to the point.
immoral_action: Bill spends most of the five minutes of his speech talking slowly about irrelevant topics.

norm: It's rude to decline a genuine gift.
situation: Abigail's grandmother, Helen, just brought her a new doll, but she already has the same exact one.
intention: Abigail wants to respond to the present.
moral_action: Abigail tells Helen that she loves it, and doesn't mention she already owned this one.
immoral_action: Abigail tells Helen, no thank you, citing she already has this one.

norm: It is rude to leave abruptly.
situation: Megan is at a dinner party at her friend Adrian's house and is starting to feel very tired.
intention: Megan wants to go home and go to bed.
moral_action: Megan finds Adrian and lets him know that she had fun but needs to leave because she is tired.
immoral_action: Megan says she is going to the bathroom but actually slips out and goes home without saying goodbye to anyone.

norm: It is rude to take someone else's place without permission.
situation: Tom left his seat at the game a while ago and hasn't returned, Lucas looks at the seat.
intention: Lucas wants to sit in the seat.
moral_action: Lucas asks the other people if the seat is vacant, they reply that thier friend Tom left.
immoral_action: Lucas just walks up to the seat and sits down in it.

norm: It's rude to flake out on plans.
situation: Sammy had planned to stop by her friend's house after work but learns about an opportunity to do a project after hours which would look good at her job.
intention: Sammy wants to improve her chances to get a promotion.
moral_action: Sammy stops by her friend's house and stays for a short time before going to work on the project.
immoral_action: Sammy lets her friend know she can't make it and takes the opportunity right away.

norm: It's rude to just leave somewhere.
situation: Henry is working in the middle of a shift at the office and things are really hectic.
intention: Henry wants make things a little less hectic.
moral_action: Henry focuses on the little steps he can take to complete the bigger tasks and tackles them one at a time.
immoral_action: Henry stops the work he is doing and makes his way to the door without letting anybody know.

norm: It's rude to take back an invitation.
situation: Jane has invited Ted to a dinner party but realizes that there aren't enough seats to accommodate all her guests.
intention: Jane wants to make sure all her guests have a seat at her dinner party.
moral_action: Jane sets up an extension to her dining table so that all the guests, including Ted, have enough room.
immoral_action: Jane rescinds her invitation to Ted so that the rest of the guest have a seat at the table.

norm: It's rude to test others.
situation: Sasha and her boyfriend have been seeing each other for 6 months.
intention: Sasha wants to know if she can trust her boyfriend.
moral_action: Sasha takes her time to really get to know him and lets trust develop.
immoral_action: Sasha has one of her friends hit on her boyfriend to see what he does.

norm: It's wrong to criticize those who do not want it.
situation: Ryan and Dylan are playing basketball when Dylan misses a throw.
intention: Ryan wants to mention the throw to Dylan.
moral_action: Ryan tells Dylan that he doesn't think he could have made that shot either.
immoral_action: Ryan tells Dylan to keep his eye on the ball.

norm: It's wrong to make fun of other people's suffering
situation: Josh works downtown.
intention: Josh wants to grab lunch with a friend.
moral_action: Josh brings a homeless man a sandwich after having lunch.
immoral_action: Josh tells a homeless man to get a job and stop begging.

norm: It's wrong to say things to make others feel hopeless.
situation: Billy is talking with a friend who keeps on complaining about his life.
intention: Billy is irritated by his friend and wants him to stop bothering him with his whining.
moral_action: Billy convinces his friend to try a new way of coping, which involves thinking only about the positive things.
immoral_action: Billy tells his friend there is no point in them talking about this anymore because his friend's situation is never going to improve.

norm: It's wrong to not take someone's misfortune seriously.
situation: John sees a homeless man on the side of the road as John is walking down the sidewalk.
intention: John wants to give the man some advice.
moral_action: John suggests the local man get cleaned up at the nearest shelter and tells him about job opportunities in the area.
immoral_action: John tells the homeless man to stop being lazy and get a job.

norm: It's wrong to cause other people to be stressed out.
situation: Stephen is helping Chris study for a big test they both have tomorrow.
intention: Stephen wants Chris to take the test seriously.
moral_action: Stephen mentions how important the test is to their overall grade and offers to study through the week together.
immoral_action: Stephen begins questioning Chris's ability to do well on the test, telling him if he won't study enough he might as well quit.

norm: It's wrong to brag about doing bad things.
situation: John just started a new school and is having lunch with a group of new friends.
intention: John wants to impress his new friends.
moral_action: John tells his friends about the new game he just bought and invites them over after school.
immoral_action: John brags about how he steals money from his parents to buy weed.

norm: it's wrong to blame your faults on other people.
situation: Tom recently lost his job and worries that his stressed out family will blame him for it.
intention: Tom wants to explain why he lost his job to his family.
moral_action: Tom tells his family that, despite the mental health of his family, his job loss was his own fault.
immoral_action: Tom tells his family that the emotional problems of other family members caused him to lose his job.

norm: It's wrong to take advantage of people's insecurities.
situation: James is on a date with a woman who has body image issues related to obesity and low self-esteem.
intention: James wants to try to seduce his date.
moral_action: James tries to compliment his date instead of insulting her to win her over.
immoral_action: James tries to 'neg' his date by insulting her weight in an effort to seduce her.

norm: It's wrong to trust the wrong people.
situation: Victor wants to buy a copy of a game that the publisher doesn't sell anymore.
intention: Victor wants to buy the game.
moral_action: Victor sees the game on a trusted website for $300 and buys it there.
immoral_action: Victor sees the game on a shady website for $11 and buys it there.

norm: It's wrong to judge people for things they can't control.
situation: Dan is in a classroom with Bill who has tourettes which results in involuntary verbal tics.
intention: Dan wants to react to Bill's verbal tics.
moral_action: Dan reads aboit tourettes and asks Bill questions about what it is like to have it.
immoral_action: Dan mocks Bill for the tics and shames him for it in front of others in order to impress them.

norm: It is wrong to think of other people as wretched.
situation: Dave and Karen are back home after attending a party when Karen asks Dave what he thought of Rick, who they met that night.
intention: Dave wants to give an opinion of Rick to Karen.
moral_action: Dave tells Karen that so far Rick seems like a normal guy and that he looks to be a potential friend.
immoral_action: Dave tells Karen that Rick gave him a scumbag vibe and that he already has strong feelings of dislike for him because he thinks he's no good.

norm: It is wrong to manipulate people to get sympathy.
situation: Henry had lost his job and didn't have much money in his account.
intention: Henry wanted to get money to pay his car and house notes.
moral_action: Henry started looking for jobs as soon as he was fired.
immoral_action: Henry told everyone that he was dying and needed money for medical bills.

norm: It's wrong to take your frustration out on other people.
situation: Josh walks out of the room after fighting with his wife, and he sees his son accidentally spill something onto the floor.
intention: Josh wants to vent his frusterations.
moral_action: Josh cleans up his son's mess, and he then talks about his angry feelings with his friend.
immoral_action: Josh yells at his son and forces him to clean up the mess.

norm: It's wrong to let other people take blame for you.
situation: Jack broke the microwave in the break room while he was reheating his rotisserie chicken.
intention: Jack doesn't want to get into trouble.
moral_action: Jack tells his boss that he broke the microwave right after he does it.
immoral_action: Jack leaves the microwave broken without telling anyone that he broke it.

norm: It's wrong to blame your problems on other people.
situation: Joe recently developed a problem with alcohol that he's having trouble getting over.
intention: Joe wants to get over his alcholism.
moral_action: Joe decides to stop buying alcohol and has his wife keep his credit cards until the problem is fixed.
immoral_action: Joe blames his wife for the problem and shames her into helping him.

norm: It's wrong to continuously do things that make you depressed.
situation: Elena, who loves to binge watch shows even though it makes her feel lousy, has a free weekend.
intention: Elena wants to do something enjoyable for the weekend.
moral_action: Elena goes out with friends and stays active as much as possible.
immoral_action: Elena finds several highly acclaimed shows and watches all of the episodes back-to-back.

norm: It's wrong to take advantage of people who are depressed.
situation: Elisa's friend Alice has a depression and Elisa needs help in cleaning her house because she is busy with her work lately.
intention: Elisa wants to get help for cleaning her house.
moral_action: Elisa hires a maid to clean her house and asks Alice to supervise the maid.
immoral_action: Elisa asks Alice to spend time cleaning her house because it can alleviate her depression.

norm: It's wrong to support bad behavior.
situation: Desiree is friends with Lana, who has been saying mean things to other kids at their school.
intention: Desiree wants Lana to know she's on her side.
moral_action: Desiree tells Lana that she's better than how she's been acting, and suggests being kinder.
immoral_action: Desiree witnesses Lana making fun of another girls outfit, and laughs along.

norm: It's wrong to get off on other peoples pain.
situation: Michael was at his computer watching videos on an adult website.
intention: Michael wants to find something exciting to watch.
moral_action: Michael finds a video of a person being hurt and quickly turns it off, because he does not want to support or entertain the suffering of another person.
immoral_action: Michael finds a video of someone being hurt and finds it exciting, so he watches the whole video.

norm: It's wrong to wallow in your own self pity.
situation: Jan made a big mistake at work is having trouble getting over it.
intention: Jan never wants to make the same mistake again.
moral_action: Jan doesn't think about the mistake anymore and is confident that it won't happen again.
immoral_action: Jan constantly thinks about what she did and intentionally makes herself feel bad.

norm: It's callous to be dismissive of other people's suffering.
situation: Jane suffers from a disease and talks about it at the doctor's office.
intention: Jane wants to talk to the other patients.
moral_action: Jane waits and listens to the other patients' problems as well.
immoral_action: Jane talks about her suffering, but she can't be bothered to listen to OTHERS suffering.

norm: It's wrong to enjoy people's misery.
situation: Joe is looking at his phone on a bus.
intention: Joe wants to see something interesting on his phone.
moral_action: Joe watches a fictional program about teens who attack homeless people for thrills.
immoral_action: Joe looks at a site with videos of homeless people being attacked by teens.

norm: It's wrong to be honest if it will hurt feelings.
situation: Jason's girlfriend just got a new haircut and is asking Jason how it looks.
intention: Jason wants to give her his opinion of her haircut.
moral_action: Jason tells his girlfriend that she can make any haircut look good.
immoral_action: Jason tells his girlfriend that she looks like a man now.

norm: It's wrong to do unhealthy things if you're stressed out.
situation: Harry has been working a lot and is under a lot of pressure.
intention: Harry wants to deal with the stress in his life.
moral_action: Harry works out by running a few miles a day after work.
immoral_action: Harry eats a lot of junk food and ice cream to comfort him self.

norm: It's wrong to not believe in someone's pain.
situation: Henry is talking with Janet when Janet doubles over and tells him her stomach is hurting out of nowhere.
intention: Henry wants to address Janet's statement about being in pain.
moral_action: Henry tells Janet he can go get her some pepto bismol from the store nearby if she wants.
immoral_action: Henry tells Janet she's being ridiculous and to stop being so dramatic, it can't possibly be that bad.

norm: It's wrong not to own up to your mistakes.
situation: Don is a business owner who has had COVID run through his business because he refuses to let his employees distance or wear masks.
intention: Don wants his employees to continue work.
moral_action: Done says that he made a mistake and has his employees wear masks when possible and stay home if they feel sick.
immoral_action: Don doubles down and tells his employees they will be let go if they stay home from work sick.

norm: It's wrong to be so low-key about things.
situation: Guy is at home with his wife and just found out from her that she is pregnant which he has wanted.
intention: Guy wants confirm the news is true.
moral_action: Guy lets out hollers and hugs his wife tightly asking over and over if she is serious.
immoral_action: Guy doesn't react emotionally outward despite being glad and just asks to see the pregnancy test.

norm: It's wrong to make excuses for bad behavior.
situation: Ernie cleans out his garage and piles trash in his backyard, which he sets on fire causing a terrible smell throughout his neighborhood, and his neighbors come to his door.
intention: Eric needs to talk to his neighbors about the smelly trash fire.
moral_action: Eric admits to creating an environmental nuisance and apologizes to his neighbors, promising to never do that again.
immoral_action: Eric explains that he only meant to burn the wood, and that the tires, plastic and carpets were burned by mistake.

norm: It's wrong to take joy in the suffering of others.
situation: Jen has a huge rivalry with Alice and sees that Alice has fallen in a mud puddle.
intention: Jen wants to respond to Alice's fall.
moral_action: Jen reaches out to help Alice up and asks if she is alright.
immoral_action: Jen points and laughs and claps at seeing Alice fall in the mud.

norm: It's wrong to break something because you are upset.
situation: Tom and his friends are competing as a team in an online battleground game.
intention: Tom wants to win the tournament.
moral_action: Tom throws his stress ball across the room because he thinks the team they just lost to was cheating.
immoral_action: Tom throws his keyboard across the room because he thinks the team they just lost to was not playing fair.

norm: It's wrong to treat someone who cares about you horribly.
situation: John just lost his job and gets home to be with his wife Mindy who  asks him how he is.
intention: John wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: John takes a breath, tells her the news and asks if she'd like to walk with him a bit.
immoral_action: John raises his voice at Mindy and tells her she can't do anything right.

norm: It's wrong to say things to make someone feel inferior.
situation: Clyde is a teacher who is working with a student that has trouble with a particular subject.
intention: Clyde wants the student to not worry about his performance.
moral_action: Clyde tells the student that he will understand it with time and practice.
immoral_action: "Clyde tells the student that not everyone can do it and not to feel bad if he doesn't have the ""knack"" for it."

norm: It's wrong to enjoy anothers pain.
situation: Luke's rival James got struck by a car and ended up in the hospital.
intention: Luke wants to decide how to react to James's accident.
moral_action: Luke sends James a get well card in the hospital because it's the right thing to do.
immoral_action: Luke buys everyone around him a drink when he hears what happened to James.

norm: It's wrong to irritate others.
situation: John is new to school and does not know anyone.
intention: John wants to be noticed by others.
moral_action: John introduces himself to classmates at lunch and talks to them about common interests.
immoral_action: John plays pranks on his classmates all day in class.

norm: It's wrong to make fun of others.
situation: Alex is creating a label to show Max's status as another moderator.
intention: Alex wants to create a unique label.
moral_action: Alex asks Matt for ideas on the label name.
immoral_action: Alex uses Matt's embarrassing childhood nickname as the label.

norm: It's wrong to body shame people.
situation: Tyler and Mykel took off their shirts to go for a swim in a public park, prompting Tyler to compare his body with Mykels.
intention: Tyler wants to feel more confident about his physique.
moral_action: Tyler laughs and tells Mykel that they're both in decent shape and have nothing to be ashamed of.
immoral_action: Tyler makes fun of how scrawny Mykel is compared with him.

norm: It is wrong to make jokes that might offend others
situation: Chris is a  high school student.
intention: Chris wants to make his classmates laugh.
moral_action: Chris makes fart sound with his armpit while there's a lull in class.
immoral_action: Chris makes fun of another student's acne and says they'll never get dates.

norm: It's wrong to beat up people.
situation: Tom has found out that his neighbor has stolen electronics from Tom's house.
intention: Tom wants his neighbor to pay for his crime.
moral_action: Tom refrains from getting into an altercation and instead reports his neighbor to the authorities.
immoral_action: Tom physically assaults his neighbor in retaliation for the robbery.

norm: It's wrong to do disturbing things to others.
situation: John and Dave are two friends who are walking down the street together after school.
intention: John wants to surprise Dave with something outrageous.
moral_action: John runs out in front of Dave and rips his own shorts off exposing himself to the world and screaming funny words.
immoral_action: without warning, John grabs Dave's shorts and pulls them down together with his underwear exposing Dave's naked body to the world.

norm: It's wrong to be rude or toxic towards other people.
situation: Cathy is about to leave work when a colleague approaches her.
intention: Cathy wants to get home.
moral_action: Cathy apologizes to her colleague and asks if they can catch up tomorrow.
immoral_action: Cathy ignores her colleague and brushes past towards the door.

norm: It's wrong to make people dislike each other.
situation: Max is jealous of the friendship that has developed between his girlfriedn and his younger brother.
intention: Max wants his girlfriend to focus on him.
moral_action: Max sits down and shares his insecurities with his girlfriend and his brother.
immoral_action: Max drops subtle hints that lead to his girlfriend and his brother to distrust each other.

norm: It's wrong to make other people feel bad.
situation: Kevin is at a party with friends.
intention: Kevin wants to entertain his friends.
moral_action: Kevin tells a story about one of his own embarrassing moments.
immoral_action: Kevin tells a story about a friend's most embarrassing moment without their consent.

norm: It's wrong to incite bad emotions in people.
situation: Dave is a theater director who is coaching an actress, Tanya, who is a single mom, through a death scene.
intention: Dave wants to explain to Tanya how to act more sad.
moral_action: Dave tells Tonya that she needs to use facial expressions more to really sell the fact that she's sad.
immoral_action: Dave tells Tonya that to truly act out the part she needs to image her child is dead, so she feels properly sad.

norm: It is wrong to annoy others.
situation: Kelly is working on her assignment in class at school.
intention: Kelly wants the teacher to help her.
moral_action: Kelly raises her hand and waits for the teacher to meet her at her desk.
immoral_action: Kelly yells out the teacher's first name to get her attention.

norm: It's wrong to curse at people in front of others.
situation: Bob is coaching a little league baseball team and the short-stop just dropped a fly ball allowing a runner to score.
intention: Bob wants to motivate the player to do better.
moral_action: Bob talks calmly to the player and gives her advice on how to improve her feilding.
immoral_action: Bob curses at the player about the fielding error.

norm: It's wrong to treat people rudely.
situation: Sammy is a mechanic and is fixing a friends car when his wife June approaches due to her getting a flat tire.
intention: Sammy wants to find out what June wants.
moral_action: Sammy turns around and calmly asks what he can do for June.
immoral_action: "Sammy turns around and snaps, ""what do you want from me now""."

norm: It's wrong to be rude and ignore people.
situation: Ian and John are co-workers, and they are working together on a project.
intention: John wants to do a good job on the project.
moral_action: John works with Ian on the project, and they both contribute to it equally.
immoral_action: John ignores all of Ian's suggestions and does the project on his own.

norm: It is unacceptable to call other people rude names.
situation: Craig is in line at the movie theater concession stand waiting to get some popcorn.
intention: Craig wants to hurry up and get into the theatre before the movie starts.
moral_action: Craig asks the person in front of him if he can switch places because his movie is about to start.
immoral_action: Craig steps up to make his order but a woman cuts in front of him, so he calls her a rude name.

norm: It's wrong to wish ill on others.
situation: Rina's friend is in the final interviewing stages of a prestigious new job and is competing against another woman for the position.
intention: Rina wants her friend to get the job.
moral_action: Rina gives her friend a good character reference.
immoral_action: Rina prays every night that the other woman messes up her interview.

norm: It's wrong to want to torture people.
situation: Benjamin is preparing a workout routine for overweight and inactive individuals.
intention: Benjamin wants his students to get in shape.
moral_action: Benjamin spends time with each of his students working out exercising plans to help them achieve their goals.
immoral_action: Benjamin creates a high intensity workout, and pushes his students way past their limits.

norm: It's wrong to make rude comments about another person.
situation: Jack is on a date with Judith at a restaurant, and they are being served by a waiter with a lisp.
intention: Jack wants to make Judith laugh.
moral_action: Jack tells Judith a funny anecdote of that time he got lost in the mall as a kid.
immoral_action: After the waiter takes their order, Jack imitates how the waiter talks while talking to Judith.

norm: Is wrong to fight over silly things
situation: Todd is really irritated at his friend Paul after he heard Paul talked behind his back.
intention: Todd wants to get to the bottom of why Paul talked bad about him.
moral_action: Todd asks Paul why he did that, and says he wants to fix things.
immoral_action: Todd walks up to Paul and shoves him while screaming at him.

norm: It's wrong to make people angry.
situation: Sam is having a tense debate with his friend Mike about abortion, and they have opposing views.
intention: Sam wants to end the argument.
moral_action: Sam tells Mike that he understands and appreciates his viewpoint even though they don't agree on this particular issue.
immoral_action: Sam tells Mike that he's an idiot and his position is ridiculous.

norm: It's wrong to start fights over trivial matters.
situation: Gabe is talking to his friend who made a point which he feels certain is incorrect.
intention: Gabe wants to feel validated that he is correct.
moral_action: Gabe emphasizes that it doesn't really matter but sends his friend a link proving him right.
immoral_action: Gabe gets into a fight with his friend and proves his point to her.

norm: It is unacceptable to make fun of other people.
situation: Marge is at work when she see's a coworker she likes trip and fall.
intention: Marge wants to use this opportunity to communicate with her coworker.
moral_action: Marge rushes over to her coworker and offers to help them.
immoral_action: Marge points and laughs and calls her coworker a klutz.

norm: It's wrong to ask things that make people uncomfortable
situation: Larry has taken an interest in a new friend of his and thinks the feeling might be mutual.
intention: Larry wants to make a move on the girl.
moral_action: Larry spends time getting to know her better before he flirts with her.
immoral_action: Larry starts to ask his friend questions that are very personal in nature.

norm: It's wrong to badmouth people behind their back.
situation: Jared sits down in the break room after a tense exchange with his coworker Morgan.
intention: Jared wants to vent his frustrations.
moral_action: Jared writes down his feelings in his mood journal on his phone.
immoral_action: Jared discusses Morgan's flaws in great detail with another coworker.

norm: It's wrong to tell a joke that hurts someone.
situation: James felt jealous of Don because Don got the lead role in the community play while James was just an extra.
intention: James wants to feel better about not getting a speaking role.
moral_action: James complains to anyone who will listen that he deserves a speaking roles.
immoral_action: James begins making jokes about Don's height, weight, and vocal mannerisms.

norm: It's wrong to say something just to irritate other people
situation: John and Mindy are at home together and Mindy has on a new hat she likes.
intention: John wants to laugh and have a good time.
moral_action: John tells Mindy her hat looks great and makes her look like a supermodel and laughs.
immoral_action: John tells Mindy her hat makes her look like a ugly man and laughs.

norm: It is wrong to play jokes on others.
situation: Jack is bored in school and is thinking about placing a tack on his classmate's chair as a prank.
intention: Jack wants to consider playing a prank on his classmate.
moral_action: Jack resists playing a prank on his classmate and just find other ways to amuse himself.
immoral_action: Jack puts a tack on his classmate's chair and watches in amusement.

norm: It's wrong to get angry over petty things.
situation: Kel is at a birthday party where they are handing out slices of cake to everybody, and he notices his piece of cake is smaller than the rest.
intention: Kel wants to enjoy his cake.
moral_action: Kel savors each bite of the piece of the cake he got, and he complements the person who made it.
immoral_action: Kel decides his enjoyment of the cake is dependent on him receiving a piece as big as the others and makes a big scene about the size of his piece.

norm: It's wrong to call people out over petty things.
situation: Tom and Dan run an unprofitable store and are having a meeting about what needs to change.
intention: Tom wants to tell Dan something he wants Dan to do differently at the store.
moral_action: Tom tells Dan that Dan needs to analyze sales data to determine which products are making money and which aren't.
immoral_action: Tom tells Dan that he should press the buttons on the cash register less firmly to make less noise.

norm: It's wrong to use curse words towards another person.
situation: Alan is a hockey coach and notices his player is slow at getting to the puck.
intention: Alan wants to motivate his player.
moral_action: Alan tells his player positive words to try to motivate him.
immoral_action: Alan calls his player an expletive to try to motivate him.

norm: It's wrong to do hurtful things towards others.
situation: Holly gets in an argument with her classmate, Allison.
intention: Holly wants to win the argument.
moral_action: Holly counters Allison's argument with a valid point and evidence to back it up.
immoral_action: Holly personally attacks Allison when she can't think of a counterpoint in the argument to shut her down.

norm: It is wrong to verbally abuse people.
situation: Chris and Tom are talking about sports when Tom says that Jim Kelly was the best quarterback of all time.
intention: Chris wants to tell Tom that he's incorrect.
moral_action: Chris tells Tom that judging by the stats that there were better QB's throughout history.
immoral_action: Chris tells Tom that he's an idiot for thinking that and that it's not even close to the correct opinion.

norm: It's frowned upon to say unkind things about people.
situation: Kent does not like his country's leader at all, so he complains about him.
intention: Kent wants to discuss with his friends.
moral_action: Kent decides that he should save his rants on the leader for when it's appropriate to do so.
immoral_action: Kent rants about the leader and how stupid and such he must be.

norm: It is wrong to be rude to people.
situation: Alan is dining at a busy restaurant.
intention: He wants to get the check.
moral_action: Alan waits patiently until he sees his server and tells the server he is in a rush.
immoral_action: Alan is mad at how long he has been waiting and finds a manager to scream at.

norm: It's not right to bully another person.
situation: Paul is bigger than all the kids at his school.
intention: Paul wants to get noticed this year at school.
moral_action: Paul decides to use his size to help smaller kids without being intimidating.
immoral_action: Paul uses his size to intimate kids, and they all become aware of him and fear him.

norm: It's not okay to make people feel out of place.
situation: Chris is hanging out with his best friend Chad and Chad's new girlfriend Anna.
intention: Chris wants to entertain Chad and Anna.
moral_action: Chris suggests that Chad and Anna join Chris in a three person board game.
immoral_action: Chris makes inside jokes that only Chris and Chad understand.

norm: It's not okay to stalk people.
situation: Frank's girlfriend recently broke up with him, but he still has strong feelings for her.
intention: Frank wants to feel better about the breakup.
moral_action: Frank joins some clubs and meets a lot of new people to help him forget about his ex.
immoral_action: Frank follows his ex girlfriend around and tries to sabotage her attempts to find a new boyfriend.

norm: It's not okay to boss people around.
situation: Sara's partner wants to hang out with a female colleague after work.
intention: Sara wants to express how she feels uncomfortable by the idea.
moral_action: Sara calm explains her feelings and wonders if she can tag along.
immoral_action: Sara yells at her partner and forbids him to go.

norm: It's not acceptable to be violent towards others.
situation: Jakes sees a fight.
intention: Jake wants to help.
moral_action: Jake approaches the fighters and defuses the situation.
immoral_action: Jake runs into the middle of the fight and starts punching.

norm: It's not okay to give people false directions.
situation: Joe is walking down the street and is asked by a couple in a car where a certain restaurant is.
intention: Joe wants to get on with his day.
moral_action: Joe gives good directions, and the couple thanks them and drive off.
immoral_action: Joe gives vague directions that do not get the couple to the restaurant.

norm: It's not okay to not take care of your things.
situation: Jeff's car is broken in his driveway and needs expensive repairs that he cannot afford.
intention: Jeff wants to clear his driveway.
moral_action: Jeff asks his friend for a loan in order to get the car fixed up.
immoral_action: Jeff puts the car in neutral and pushes it onto his lawn and leaves it there.

norm: It's not okay to stress yourself about things unnecessarily.
situation: Wilma hears about the COVID-19 pandemic and how people are dying.
intention: Wilma wants to prepare for the pandemic.
moral_action: Wilma buys a mask and keep some cash and food on hand for emergencies.
immoral_action: Wilma stockpiles six months worth of food and berates anyone approaching within 30 feet of her house.

norm: It's not okay to of caused yourself harm.
situation: Laura is suffering emotional abuse at home from her mother.
intention: Laura wants to make the mental pain go away.
moral_action: Laura sees a school counselor and talks with her about her problems.
immoral_action: Laura cuts herself to distract her mind from the emotional suffering.

norm: It's not okay to not work things with your SO.
situation: Jeff and his wife have a big fight the evening before a special trip that they planned.
intention: Jeff wants to go on the trip.
moral_action: Jeff pleads with his wife to go on the trip with him, apologizing for his mistake.
immoral_action: Jeff decides to go on the trip without his wife to avoid conflict.

norm: Being obsessed with something shows a lack of control.
situation: Roger just got a new video game and invites his girlfriend, Sandy over.
intention: Roger wants to enjoy his new game.
moral_action: Roger plays his game and takes breaks to visit with Sandy.
immoral_action: Roger gets so involved with the game that he ignores Sandy.

norm: It's not okay to be obsessed with competition.
situation: Adam is an avid Pokemon Go player.
intention: Adam wants to be the best Pokemon Go player in his town.
moral_action: Adam starts a town group chat and gets to know other players so that they can work cooperatively.
immoral_action: Adam insists on taking over all of the gyms in town at all costs and will stoop to any level to get them.

norm: It's not okay to make others do things for you.
situation: Jay has a recently purchased a boxed shed in his backyard.
intention: Jay wants to have a shed assembled.
moral_action: Jay and John work together to get the shed built in no time.
immoral_action: Jay asks his friend, John, to help build the shed, but instead lets John do most of the work.

norm: Hurting someone with your words is not okay.
situation: Stu is hanging out with friends when he feels hurt by a friend's comment.
intention: Stu wants to let his friend know he is hurt.
moral_action: Stu pulls his friend aside and explains his hurt feelings.
immoral_action: Stu loudly yells at his friend calling him stupid and ugly.

norm: It's not okay to be overly prideful of things.
situation: Jane helped her soccer team win big an hour ago, and runs into her mom.
intention: Jane wanted to explain her victory to her Mom.
moral_action: Jane simply tells her Mom that she helped win a soccer game.
immoral_action: Jane tells her Mom that she is the best soccer player in the world and deserves presents for it.

norm: It's not okay to let someone else bring you down.
situation: Randy is in high school with his friends.
intention: Randy wants to go to college.
moral_action: Randy ignores his friends and goes to college.
immoral_action: Randy listens to his friends when they tell him that he is not smart enough for college.

norm: It's not okay to use something bad to get attention.
