situation: John is a teenager in high school going through changes and feeling left out.
intention: John wants to feel cared about.
moral_action: John visits the school's counselor and explains all of the problems he has a been feeling.
immoral_action: John begins to act out at school by getting in fights and talking back to teachers in front of his classmates.

norm: It's not okay to provoke someone's anger.
situation: James often makes fun of his high-school science teacher, who is also his next-door neighbor.
intention: James wants to make his classmates laugh at his teacher's expense.
moral_action: James decides to play an innocent prank on his science teacher by putting chalk inside the eraser.
immoral_action: James tells his class about embarassing things he has seen while looking through his teacher's windows from his home next door.

norm: It's not okay to put yourself into a bad situation.
situation: It's the end of the month and John does not have quite enough money to pay his rent.
intention: John wants to get the money he needs for rent.
moral_action: John works a few extra hours at work in order to make the money he needs.
immoral_action: John takes out a risky high-interest payday loan in order to get the money he needs.

norm: It's not right to not share with others.
situation: Jenna is baking a batch of cookies and her brother just asked for one when they're done.
intention: Jenna wants to make sure she gets plenty of cookies.
moral_action: Jenna doubles the size of the cookie batch she's making.
immoral_action: Jenna hoards all the cookies for herself and tells her brother to go away.

norm: It's not okay to cause people undo stress.
situation: Marnie is shopping for fancy new clothes at a classy boutique.
intention: Marnie wants to look really fabulous at a friends wedding.
moral_action: Marnie asks the staff for assistance and also follows their instruction for putting away clothes she doesn't want.
immoral_action: Marnie tries on multiple outfits and tosses them all over the floor before deciding what to buy.

norm: It is not okay to point out people's awkwardness.
situation: Briana is sitting with Wayne, who is very shy, and trying to talk with him.
intention: Briana wants to pull Wayne out of his shell.
moral_action: Briana asks Wayne about his hobbies, then questions him about ones that he likes.
immoral_action: Briana tells Wayne that he's really bad at talking and that he needs to do better.

norm: It's not okay to hold a grudge against people.
situation: Sally and her boyfriend broke up but Sally was really good friends with her boyfriend's frail mother.
intention: Sally wanted to visit her ex-boyfriend's mother to stay in touch.
moral_action: Sally visits her ex-boyfriend's mother, and she does not try to talk about her ex at all.
immoral_action: Sally visits her ex-boyfriend's mother, and she talks about how mad she is at her ex-boyfriend.

norm: It's not okay to be unprofessional.
situation: Ben is meeting a new client in the office this morning.
intention: Ben wants to talk to the man about the work that he wants done.
moral_action: Ben meets the customer wearing a business suit and a tie.
immoral_action: Ben greets the man wearing a tank top and boxing shorts.

norm: It's not acceptable behavior to yell in other people's faces.
situation: Matt asks his sister Jenny a question, but she doesn't hear him because she is listening to music on her headphones.
intention: Matt wants to get Jenny's attention.
moral_action: Matt calmly taps Jenny on the shoulder to get her attention.
immoral_action: Matt walks over to Jenny and yells loudly right in her face so that she hears him.

norm: It's not okay to act in a vindictive manner
situation: George is at work and is told that his manager Tony has given him an awful performance review.
intention: George wants to react to the negative review.
moral_action: George goes to Tony's office and tells him that he's not happy with the performance rating and wants to appeal for an impartial review.
immoral_action: George runs outside into the parking lot and locates Tony's car and proceed to scratch it with his keys.

norm: It's not okay to make someone feel insignificant.
situation: Hector is giving one of his underperforming employees a performance review.
intention: Hector wants to let his employee know that they need to do a better job.
moral_action: Hector gently points out where the employee is failing and gives them advice on how to improve.
immoral_action: Hector insults his employee during the review and belittles their role.

norm: It's not okay to spit on another person.
situation: James was bumped into at a party by a person that is not watching where they are going.
intention: James wants to get the attention of the person that bumped into him.
moral_action: James taps the shoulder of the person that bump into him and asks a question.
immoral_action: James spits on the person that bumped into him.

norm: It's not okay to be to obsessive about people.
situation: Leila met a cute guy at a party a few weeks ago and has been on dates a few times with him since then.
intention: Leila wants the cute guy to think she is someone special.
moral_action: Leila sends a few interesting links to the cute guy along with original and thoughtful texts.
immoral_action: Leila can't stop thinking of the cute guy and starts texting him dozens of times a day.

norm: It's not okay to be obsessed with doing childish things.
situation: Before going to the grocery store, Bill goes to the toy store to look for action figures to add to his toy collection.
intention: Bill wants to buy some new action figures.
moral_action: Bill only buys two action figures at the toy store.
immoral_action: Bill spends his entire paycheck at the toy store.

norm: It is not okay to bully anyone.
situation: Jenna has just found out that her younger brother is being bullied by another kid at their school.
intention: Jenna wants the bully to get what they deserve.
moral_action: Jenna tells her parents what has been happening, so they can intervene.
immoral_action: Jenna re-enacts what her brother's bully has been doing to her brother to the bully.

norm: It's not okay to take something that isn't yours.
situation: When Frank arrives to collect his take-out order from a restaurant, he spots several bags of food sitting out for pick-up but is told that the cooks forgot his order.
intention: Frank wants to get home as quickly as possible.
moral_action: Frank cancels his order and buys a to-go meal at a gas station on the way home.
immoral_action: Frank grabs the bag for another person's order and leaves the restaurant without saying a word to any of the workers.

norm: It's not okay to set someone up to hurt them.
situation: Josh and his friends like to prank each other, and Josh has not pranked Jerry in a while.
intention: Josh wants to prank Jerry.
moral_action: Josh sets up an innocuous prank that startles Jerry, but doesn't emotionally devastate him.
immoral_action: Josh sets up a prank that makes Jerry think his parents have died in a car accident.

norm: It's not okay to risk a friendship.
situation: Tammy has been single for a while, and she realizes she can't stop thinking about the crush she has on a friend's ex-boyfried.
intention: Tammy wants to pursue a relationship with her friend's ex-boyfriend.
moral_action: Tammy contacts her friend to see if her friend would have any feelings about her dating the ex-boyfriend.
immoral_action: Tammy contacts her friend's ex-boyfriend, and they start dating and run into Tammy's friend while out one night.

norm: You should not talk freely about sensitive subjects.
situation: Jackie is at a work party.
intention: Jackie wants to converse with her coworkers.
moral_action: Jackie talks to the coworkers about a vacation she took.
immoral_action: Jackie tells the coworkers all about her and her husband's sex life.

norm: It's not okay to let something get itself trapped.
situation: Dan works in a home office and has a pet cat Ginger.
intention: Dan wants to have his pet around for company while he works.
moral_action: Dan leaves the door open a crack so ginger can come and go as she pleases.
immoral_action: Dan closes the room door when she enters and wont let her out.

norm: It's not okay to make a mess for others.
situation: Jill makes a mess all over the room while she's playing with her toys.
intention: Jill wants to decide what to do next.
moral_action: Jill cleans up the mess herself before going to do another acctivity.
immoral_action: Jill puts her toys away but leaves the mess; without her toys it appears as though one of her siblings was responsible.

norm: It's not okay to do things that are unhygienic.
situation: Gloria just finished planting some flowers in her garden with her bare hands when her husband lets her know that he made her a sandwich for lunch.
intention: Gloria wants to eat the sandwich for lunch.
moral_action: Gloria goes to the bathroom and washes up before sitting down to eat her sandwich.
immoral_action: Gloria goes into the kitchen and immediately starts eating the sandwich with her hands without washing up first.

norm: Pretending to have things you don't is not okay.
situation: As a member of the PTA at her son's exclusive private school Joan is expected to help plan a fundraiser.
intention: Joan wants to impress her peers.
moral_action: Joan contributes a great deal of her time and energy to make sure the event goes off without a hitch.
immoral_action: Joan says she can arrange a celebrity appearance, without having the means to do so.

norm: It's not okay to talk excessively about your problems.
situation: Linda and several colleagues are having lunch at work and chatting, and Linda just went through a breakup.
intention: Linda wants to participate in the conversation.
moral_action: Linda briefly brings up her situation and asks for advice from her colleagues.
immoral_action: Linda monopolizes the conversation, rehashing her recent breakup in intimate, excrutiating detail.

norm: It's not okay to be a bully.
situation: Sam is at school, has had chronic low-self esteem this week, and it's the middle of the day.
intention: Sam wants to feel powerful during the day.
moral_action: Sam goes to the school gym and lifts weights, and feels confident.
immoral_action: Sam picks on a student and push him around, and feels strong.

norm: It's not okay to do things that hurt another person.
situation: Jimmy and Jeffrey are kids playing on a school playground, and Jimmy steals Jeffrey's lollipop.
intention: Jeffrey wants his lollipop back.
moral_action: Jeffrey knows he can just take the lollipop back, but goes to a nearby teacher and asks them to get his lollipop back from Jimmy instead.
immoral_action: Jeffrey takes a swing at Jimmy, who drops the lollipop and backs off.

norm: It is not okay to laugh at others.
situation: Samantha spilled her drink all over her new dress at the cafeteria beside her friend Tina.
intention: Tina wants to try to make Samantha feel better.
moral_action: Tina offers to help Samantha clean the dress up and to borrow her extra change of clothes.
immoral_action: Tina tries to tell Samantha a joke to cheer her up about how it looks like she rolled in the mud, and laughs heartily at it.

norm: It's not okay to get overly worked up about things.
situation: Tom is running late for work but stops for coffee anyway, which is taking a lot longer than he expected.
intention: Tom wants to speed the process of getting his coffee along.
moral_action: Tom asks the Barista if there is anything he can do to get the coffee more quickly, and explains that he needs to get to work right away.
immoral_action: Tom tells the Barista that if he gets into trouble at work over the wait, he will be back to get the young man fired from the coffee shop.

norm: It's not okay to not give someone personal space.
situation: Kevin is at a library to study and there is one other student seated at a table.
intention: Kevin wants to find a place to sit.
moral_action: Kevin finds an open seat at a table that is unoccupied.
immoral_action: Kevin sits very close to the other person at the library.

norm: It's not okay to not want to help others.
situation: Bobby is playing a video game when Jennifer calls and asks for help because her car broke down.
intention: Bobby wants to play his video game.
moral_action: Bobby drives out to help Jennifer and then goes back to his video game afterward.
immoral_action: Bobby tells Jennifer he can't and goes back to playing his video game.

norm: It's not okay to make someone feel uncomfortable.
situation: Maggie is making dinner and invited her children to come over and eat.
intention: Maggie wants to have a family meal.
moral_action: Maggie's son shows up with his girlfriend and Maggie adds a plate to the table for her to enjoy the meal.
immoral_action: Maggie's son also brought his girlfriend to eat, which Maggie doesn't like, so Maggie acts in a rude manner to her.

norm: It is not acceptable to bully
situation: John shares a house with Mindy and Eric and doesn't want any tv on after 11pm.
intention: John wants everyone in the house to listen to him.
moral_action: John asks Eric and Mindy if they might put their tvs a bit lower after 11pm because he has trouble sleeping.
immoral_action: John raises his voice and uses bad language as he informs Eric and Mindy to shut the tv off now.

norm: It's not okay to stalk somebody else.
situation: Yoshi met a new girl at his high school and has developed a crush on her.
intention: Yoshi wants to let the girl know that he likes her.
moral_action: Yoshi buys some flowers and gives them to the girl telling her that he likes her.
immoral_action: Yoshi starts following the girl around town constantly trailing behind just at the edge of her vision.

norm: It is not okay to tell other people's secrets.
situation: Hank is informed by a co-worker that the workers are planning a surprise party for their boss, who is planning a vacation soon.
intention: Hank wants the boss to be around for the surprise party.
moral_action: "Hank asks for ""help on an important project"" that just happens to be the same day as the surprise party so the boss will be there."
immoral_action: Hank tells their boss that they're planning a party for him and to make sure to be there.

norm: Putting others' lives in danger is not okay.
situation: Ken just bought a new convertible, and he wants to show his friend, Tom, how cool his new car is.
intention: Ken wants to take Tom for a drive.
moral_action: Ken points out the cars cool features to Tom and then safely drives him around with the convertible top down.
immoral_action: Ken shows off to Tom by speeding, weaving in and out of traffic and almost losing control of the car.

norm: It's not okay to pressure people into things.
situation: Tom and Jan went over to Tom's place after watching a movie, and Tom wants to convince her to have sex.
intention: Tom wants to have sex with Jan.
moral_action: Tom tells Jan that he wants to have sex only if she's okay with it.
immoral_action: Tom asks Jan why she would come to his place if she didn't want to have sex.

norm: It's not okay to bully people.
situation: Milton is at school and does not have money for lunch.
intention: Milton wants to get money for lunch.
moral_action: Milton asks the principal if he can borrow money for lunch.
immoral_action: Milton tells another student to give them money, or they will be hit.

norm: It's not okay to handle things that aren't yours.
situation: Octavian notices that his brother's car is blocking the entrance to the driveway.
intention: Octavian wants to move his brother's car.
moral_action: Octavian knocks on his brother's door informing him about his car.
immoral_action: Octavian attempts to back his brother's car out of the driveway.

norm: Making a scene shows a lack of self-control.
situation: Terra is with her boyfriend at the store when he made a rude comment which really upsets her.
intention: Terra wants to set her boyfriend straight.
moral_action: Terra waits until they get back home before discussing what he said earlier.
immoral_action: Terra brings up the issue immediately while they are still at the store.

norm: It's not okay to be overly paranoid about things.
situation: Henry is surfing the Internet when he sees a website about planes spraying chemicals in the air to shorten people's lifespans.
intention: Henry wants to protect himself.
moral_action: Henry stays inside a bit more and does more research to figure out what the chemicals are and how to avoid them.
immoral_action: Henry wears a chemical warfare mask whenever he goes outside to prevent inhaling the chemicals.

norm: It's not okay to want to show off or brag.
situation: Courtney is a wealthy girl who attends a school with kids from varying socioeconomic backgrounds, and her dad recently bought her a designer backpack.
intention: Courtney wants to wear her new backpack to school.
moral_action: Courtney takes her backpack to school without mentioning it to anyone.
immoral_action: Courtney points out her new backpack to all of her classmates, being sure to mention the designer and price tag.

norm: It's not okay to show off and be vain.
situation: Tammy is the head coach of a soccer team who just won their first regional tournament, and she's been called up to the podium to receive the trophy.
intention: Tammy wants to give an acceptance speech.
moral_action: Tammy invites the whole team up to the podium and thanks all the team members for their hard work and perseverance that earned them the trophy.
immoral_action: Tammy spends the entirety of her time at the podium talking about her skills and how well she coached the team.

norm: Overreacting to a joke is not okay.
situation: Gerry is talking to his boss in the breakroom, and his boss makes a mildly funny joke.
intention: Gerry wants to kiss up to his boss.
moral_action: Gerry giggles slightly and tells his boss that it was a pretty good joke.
immoral_action: Gerry doubles himself over with over-the-top fake laughter and acts like it's the funniest thing he's ever heard.

norm: It's not okay to be careless with things.
situation: Brett, who has trouble keeping track of things, just got an expensive new phone and is outside at the park playing with it.
intention: Brett wants to take a quick walk.
moral_action: Brett puts the phone in his pocket and walks around the park, then sits back down.
immoral_action: Brett puts his phone down on a bench and takes a quick lap around the park for exercise.

norm: It's not okay to not sympathize with peoples feelings.
situation: Kyle lives in a neighborhood where a crime boss just died and meets a procession of people who are mourning him.
intention: Kyle wants to decide if he should join the procession.
moral_action: Kyle avoids the procession and goes another way to avoid getting tangled up with them.
immoral_action: Kyle joins the procession and is given a sign to hold that laments the crime boss' death.

norm: It's not normal to put your life in danger
situation: Carey is driving on the highway at night, and gets stuck behind two trucks side by side in each lane.
intention: Carey wants to get past the trucks.
moral_action: Carey flashes her headlights to let them know she wants to pass, then waits for an opening.
immoral_action: Carey drives between the trucks, scraping along each side of her car.

norm: It's not okay to do things that hurt a friendship.
situation: Jenny is in love with her best friend Sue's ex-boyfriend.
intention: She wants to be in a relationship with him.
moral_action: Jenny asks Sue to talk and tells her she would like to date Sue's ex.
immoral_action: Jenny sneaks behind Sue's back and starts secretly dating her ex.

norm: It's not okay to throw a temper tantrum.
situation: Neil is at the mall quietly window shopping when he's slammed into by Matt who's clearly drunk.
intention: Neil wants to react angrily towards Matt.
moral_action: Neil tells Matt that he's a drunk idiot and walks away before Matt can respond.
immoral_action: Neil throws his arms in the air and in a loud voice, so everyone can hear tells Matt he's going to beat him up.

norm: It's not okay to not have friends.
situation: Sam had to move to a new country for his job, and he doesn't know anyone there.
intention: Sam has to decide whether he wants to make friends.
moral_action: Sam goes to a bar and watches sports with others in the country.
immoral_action: Sam decides to spend more time by himself and doesn't try to make friends.

norm: It's not okay to let yourself be taken advantage of.
situation: Jim, who is very intelligent, goes to high school and is asked by many people for answers to their homework.
intention: Jim wants to be helpful to others.
moral_action: Jim offers to tutor anyone who asks for answers, charging them a set amount of money per hour for the privilege.
immoral_action: Jim gives the homework answers to whoever asks him without demanding anything in return.

norm: It's not okay to crush someone's hopes.
situation: Mark is a guidance counselor and a student, Brad, who is doing badly in school says he wants to be an engineer.
intention: Mark wants to respond to the student, Brad.
moral_action: Mark tells Brad that he needs to improve his grades first then he can become an engineer.
immoral_action: Mark tells Brad that being an engineer is too difficult for him, and he is only qualified for low skill jobs.

norm: It's not okay to not make yourself look presentable.
situation: Ginny, a real estate agent, is out for a jog when she gets a call from a client.
intention: Ginny wants to take the client to see a house they are interested in.
moral_action: Ginny ends her jog early and goes home to take a shower before meeting with her clients.
immoral_action: Ginny goes straight from her jog to meet the new clients even though she looks sweaty and disheveled.

norm: It's not okay to leave someone when they need you.
situation: Lars has been happy with his girlfriend Maria for three years but recently Maria got very sick and is hospitalized.
intention: Lars wants to only have happy times with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Lars sticks with Maria and comforts her and finds the joy in helping her and loving her.
immoral_action: Lars tells Maria it's over and looks to date other girls.

norm: It's not okay to make someone dependent on you.
situation: Brad has been dating his girlfriend Marla for the past two months.
intention: Brad wants to help Marla pay her bills.
moral_action: Brad offers to help Marla pay for part of her car note.
immoral_action: Brad makes Marla quit her job and pays her bills himself, making her dependent on him.

norm: It's not okay to hurt people physically.
situation: Jack sees a fight break out between people at the park and stops to see what is happening.
intention: Jack wants to prevent anyone from getting injured.
moral_action: Jack steps between the people fighting and suggests they talk it out.
immoral_action: Jack pulls one person off the other and punches of the people in the face.

norm: It's not okay to spy on others.
situation: Jack is taking a shower in the gym locker room after a hard workout.
intention: Jack wants to compare his body to another man's body.
moral_action: Jack strike up a conversation with another bodybuilder and asks him if they could compare each other's physiques.
immoral_action: Jack turns on his cell phone camera and records other men in the shower without them knowing.

norm: It's not okay to hurt an animal.
situation: Sara has a cat that will not stop scratching the very expensive furniture.
intention: Sara wants to discourage the cat's behavior.
moral_action: Sara finds natural scents that discourage the cat from being interested in the furniture.
immoral_action: Sara hits her cat whenever he scratches the furniture.

norm: It's not okay to vandalize someone's personal possessions.
situation: Sharon and Jared have a huge fight which results in them breaking up, and Sharon is still angry when she sees Jared's car.
intention: Sharon wants to release her frustrations on something.
moral_action: Sharon punches the boxing sandbag in her backyard.
immoral_action: Sharon damages the tires with a sharp knife.

norm: It is not okay to threaten someone.
situation: Steve is at the bar when another person starts crowding his space.
intention: Steve wants to have his personal space back.
moral_action: Steve moves to the other side of the bar away from the person.
immoral_action: Steve gets in the other person's face and threatens to punch them.

norm: It is not acceptable to starve yourself.
situation: Anna has gained weight after a trip to Canada.
intention: Anna wants to lose weight.
moral_action: Anna exercises every day for 60 minutes and eats healthy meals.
immoral_action: Anna eats only one meal per day even though she is hungry.

norm: It's not okay to trap or set up another person.
situation: Brian is staying at Kai's house when Kai sleepwalks into a bathroom.
intention: Brian wants to experiment with Kai's sleepwalking.
moral_action: Brian talks to Kai through the bathroom door, trying to get him to answer questions.
immoral_action: Brian holds the door shut so Kai can't get out easily.

norm: It's not okay to cause damage to a property.
situation: Megan walked out of her room after fighting with Jack.
intention: Megan wants to vent her anger.
moral_action: Megan writes down her feelings in a private blog posts.
immoral_action: Megan spills water on Jack's tablet pc.

norm: It's not okay to steal something from someone.
situation: Amy needs a graphing calculator for an upcoming test and knows that her brother Mark has one.
intention: Amy wants to use Mark's graphing calculator for her test.
moral_action: Amy asks Mark if she can borrow his graphing calculator.
immoral_action: While Mark is downstairs with friends, Amy goes into his room and takes his graphing calculator.

norm: It's not okay to betray your friends.
situation: Jake and Earl made a pact many years ago not to date each other's exes.
intention: Earl has a crush on Jake's ex-girlfriend and wants to ask her out.
moral_action: Earl tells Jake about his feelings and asks to renegotiate their agreement.
immoral_action: Earl goes behind Jake's back and start's dating his ex-girlfriend secretly.

norm: It's not okay to invade someone else's privacy.
situation: Monica was sitting at her desk at work when she noticed her coworkers phone on the floor.
intention: Monica wants to pick up the phone.
moral_action: Monica takes the phone to the person who it belonged to.
immoral_action: Monica takes the phone and reads all the texts that were on it.

norm: Taking someone else's belongings is not okay.
situation: Joe usually rides the bus to work while his roommate Frank drives to his own job at the same time.
intention: Joe wants to get to work.
moral_action: Joe walks to the bus stop and takes his regular bus to work.
immoral_action: Joe takes Frank's car without asking and drives to work.

norm: It is not okay to exclude people.
situation: Sara is playing volleyball at the beach when a girl from school, Misty, shows up asking to play too.
intention: Sara wants to respond to Misty's request.
moral_action: Sara tells Misty she would enjoy having her play.
immoral_action: Sara tells Misty there are already enough players and maybe some other time.

norm: It's not okay to physically harm an infant.
situation: Carrie is at her neighbor's house babysitting when their infant begins to cry.
intention: Carrie wants to quiet the baby.
moral_action: Carrie rocks the baby in her arms as she sings to it.
immoral_action: Carrie picks the baby up out of its crib and begins to quickly shake it.

norm: It's not okay to mock people.
situation: Jason is watching his office coworkers play a softball game against another team when one of the opposing players, Bill falls and hurts himself while running.
intention: Jason wants to react to Bill's fall and injury.
moral_action: "Jason calls out ""someone get him some first aid"" and tells Bill that he'll be alright and not to worry."
immoral_action: Jason begins to  laugh and point at Bill calling him a clumsy loser and saying only pansies get injured in softball.

norm: It's not okay to be dangerous with tools.
situation: Dad brings his young son into the garage where he has set up a work space for them with wood and power tools, so they can build a bird house.
intention: Dad wants to introduce his son to woodworking and carpentry.
moral_action: Dad shows his son how to properly and safely use a jigsaw and watches him make practice cuts on scrap wood before cutting the pieces for the bird house.
immoral_action: Dad hands him a jigsaw with the safety disabled and tells him to cut along the line.

norm: It's not right to steal.
situation: Jenna's parents barely make ends meet, and she can't get an afterschool job because she's their childcare.
intention: Jenna wants a new dress to wear to prom.
moral_action: Jenna borrows money from a friend to buy a new dress and Macy's and carefully keeps the tags on.
immoral_action: Jenna goes to Macy's and walks out wearing a sparkly minidress under her sweater and jeans.

norm: It's not okay to let your opinions cloud your judgement.
situation: Daisy has a huge crush on Italian men.
intention: Daisy wants to have an Italian boyfriend.
moral_action: Daisy goes on a few dates with Italian guys.
immoral_action: Daisy gets into a relationship with the first Italian guy she meets.

norm: It's not okay to invade someone's personal space.
situation: Ricky's friend Hal has a new phone.
intention: Ricky wants to see the phone.
moral_action: Ricky asks Hal if he can get a closer look at the phone.
immoral_action: Ricky gets really close Hal while he's holding the phone.

norm: It's not okay to threaten people in life.
situation: Charles is a poor, muscular man who needs to buy food for himself.
intention: Charles wants money to buy food.
moral_action: Charles takes up a job at a shipping dock that requires lots of muscle.
immoral_action: Charles hides in an alley and robs people at knife point as they pass by.

norm: It's not okay to bother your customers.
situation: Jake is the manager of a shoe store and Eric is a customer that has been at the store browsing for quite a while.
intention: Jake wants to make a comment to Eric.
moral_action: Jake tells Eric that he looks like he might need help and if he does, that he's just over there if Eric needs him.
immoral_action: Jake tells Eric that he's been in the store so long that he must be up to something.

norm: It's not okay to pry into other peoples lives.
situation: Joel is talking to his friend Jim when Jim accidentally mentions something about their spouse which may be embarrassing.
intention: Joel wants to respond to the potentially embarrassing information.
moral_action: Joel acknowledges what Jim said and moves the conversation to a different topic.
immoral_action: Joel asks numerous questions about their Jim's spouse looking to get information.

norm: It's not okay to go through peoples personal things.
situation: Jane's phone has gone missing, and she suspects that Leo has it in his bag.
intention: Jane wants to find her phone.
moral_action: Jane asks Leo if he has seen her phone lately.
immoral_action: Jane looks in Leo's bag while his back is turned.

norm: It's not okay to throw someone's things outside.
situation: Ben keeps putting his dirty clothes into Louis' hamper and Louis is tired of it.
intention: Louis wants to keep Ben's clothes separate from his.
moral_action: Louis buys Ben his own hamper and tells Ben to use that instead.
immoral_action: Louis decides to throw out Ben's clothes that were in his hamper into the lawn.

norm: It's not okay to cheat on others.
situation: Frank is in a monotonous relationship with a longtime partner and has fallen out of love with her.
intention: Frank wants to feel passion again.
moral_action: Frank talks with his partner and decides to end the relationship with her.
immoral_action: Frank ends up seeing another woman outside of his relationship.

norm: You should not purchase attention.
situation: Alyssa is a new Instagram model who is looking to build her brand and her online presence.
intention: Alyssa wants to get more followers.
moral_action: Alyssa studies other models and influencers to find an unfilled niche and develops new content to fill that niche.
immoral_action: Alyssa buys a couple thousand followers from a website to boost her profile.

norm: It's not okay to steal from othes.
situation: Frank sees Ken riding around on a new bike he got while he is still using the one he got 10 years ago.
intention: Frank wants a newer bike.
moral_action: Frank decides to ask his parents for a new bike since his old one is now far too small for him.
immoral_action: Frank pushes over Ken and takes his bike and rides away on it.

norm: It is not acceptable to stare at others.
situation: Frank is at a local bar when he sees an attractive woman at a table across the room.
intention: Frank wants to attract the woman's attention.
moral_action: Frank approaches the woman and asks if he can buy her a drink.
immoral_action: Frank stares directly at the attractive woman until she notices him.

norm: It's not okay to disrespect peoples choices.
situation: Bob buys a car in a weird puke green color and shows it off to is friend Dan.
intention: Dan wants to comment on Bob's new car.
moral_action: Dan says the color's not his favorite, but that the car looks really nice and that he made a good choice.
immoral_action: Dan makes several jokes about the car's color and questions why Dan would buy a car with such a color.

norm: It's not okay to spend your time loitering in public.
situation: Hilda was wandering around a park all day long and someone asks her why.
intention: Hilda needs to decide what to say when someone walks up to her.
moral_action: Hilda tells them she's been lost all day and asks how to get out of the park.
immoral_action: Hilda tells them she's just wasting time until she needs to go to work.

norm: It's not okay to harm yourself.
situation: Rachel's father abused her physically, and she now lives in fear and emotional torment daily.
intention: Rachel wants to escape the pain.
moral_action: Rachel talks with a counselor about her issues and begins a long-term therapy plan with her.
immoral_action: Rachel begins to cut her arms in an attempt to distract herself from the mental pain.

norm: It's not okay to deceive others.
situation: Phil is out shopping when a customer stops him and asks if a $100 bill they found on the floor belongs to Phil, which it doesn't.
intention: Phil needs to decide how to respond.
moral_action: Phil says the bill is not his and offers to help find the person it belongs to.
immoral_action: Phil thanks the customer for finding his lost money and pockets it.

norm: It's not okay to brag to others.
situation: Don is a basketball player, and he's talking to a player on a team he just beat.
intention: Don wants to say something to the player.
moral_action: Don tells the player that it was really hard to beat them.
immoral_action: Don tells the player that his team was so much better than his.

norm: It's not okay to spy on others or be sneaky.
situation: AJ is worried that his girlfriend Susan is cheating on him.
intention: AJ wants to find if Susan is cheating.
moral_action: AJ asks Susan directly if she has been cheating on him.
immoral_action: AJ spies on Susan whenever she goes out in public.

norm: You shouldn't resort to violence
situation: Jeff is walking down the sidewalk to work and a stranger is blocking him up ahead.
intention: Jeff needs to get by the stranger and continue walking to work.
moral_action: Jeff asks the stranger to stand aside.
immoral_action: Jeff shoves the stranger out of the way.

norm: You shouldn't be intolerant of people.
situation: Gwen is attending a Seder at her Jewish friend's home.
intention: Gwen wants to participate during the religious ceremony.
moral_action: Gwen asks appropriate questions as to why the host opened the back door.
immoral_action: Gwen makes inappropriate comments when the host opens the back door.

norm: You shouldn't expose yourself to strangers.
situation: John was out in town and had been drinking soda all day.
intention: John wanted to use the restroom and relieve himself.
moral_action: John found a restroom in a shop where he was browsing.
immoral_action: John pulled his pants down and urinated in the middle of the park.

norm: You shouldn't fake things to others.
situation: Henry and Jake are walking to the park together.
intention: Jake wants Henry to be impressed by him.
moral_action: Jake tells Henry that he'll always be there for him, and they'll be good friends.
immoral_action: Jake tells Henry that he can rust faster than most olympic runners.

norm: You should not partake in illegal activities.
situation: Adam is at a gas station and sees an aisle full of candy.
intention: Adam wants candy.
moral_action: Adam chooses a candy bar and pays for it at the cash register.
immoral_action: Adam hides a candy bar under his shirt when the cashier is not looking and leaves.

norm: You shouldn't be cold-hearted toward people.
situation: A bunch of coworkers go out drinking after learning some of them have been laid off.
intention: Jake wants to network to ensure his job security before the next downsizing.
moral_action: Jake listens empathetically to a coworker's frustrations about being fired.
immoral_action: Jake turns his back to a former coworker and talks to everyone else.

norm: You should not try to humiliate other people.
situation: Ron has a really embarrassing story about Billy.
intention: Ron wants to make his friends laugh.
moral_action: Ron decides not to tell his friends the story, and instead makes a joke.
immoral_action: Ron tells all of his friends about what Billy did.

norm: You shouldn't harass others.
situation: Alex is sitting outside his work.
intention: Alex wants to get the attention of a cute girl walking by.
moral_action: Alex smiles and waves at the cute girl and says hello.
immoral_action: Alex cat calls the pretty girl.

norm: You should not engage in illegal behavior.
situation: Paul is walking through the big box store.
intention: Paul wants to get some new headphones.
moral_action: Paul takes a pair of headphones to the cashier and pays for them.
immoral_action: Paul takes some headphones and hides them in his pants and walks out of the store.

norm: You shouldn't intentionally break rules.
situation: Corey has moved to a new town and is looking at books in the library, despite not having a library card.
intention: Corey wants to bring a book about programming home with him.
moral_action: Corey fills out the paperwork for a library card and checks the book out.
immoral_action: Corey walks to a back corner of the library and puts the book in his backpack.

norm: You shouldn't turn against people.
situation: Selma used to be friends with one her coworkers but now sees that their boss doesn't like the coworker much at all.
intention: Selma wants her boss to think highly of her.
moral_action: Selma stays friend with her coworker and convinces her boss that the coworker is actually great.
immoral_action: Selma stops hanging out with her coworker and starts being cold and distant with her.

norm: You shouldn't invade other's privacy.
situation: Samantha is borrowing her friend's computer and sees her financial software has been left open.
intention: Samantha wants to do some research on the internet.
moral_action: Samantha minimizes the financial software window and continues with her research.
immoral_action: Samantha looks to see how much money her friend has in the bank before she continues with her research.

norm: You shouldn't do things against other people's wishes.
situation: Dave is at home with his wife Judy, and he's flipping through the channels and Judy asks him to pick anything but sports.
intention: Dave wants to choose a channel to settle on.
moral_action: Dave flips through the channels and finds a Conway Twitty concert from the 70's and decides to put that channel on.
immoral_action: Dave flips through the channels and notices that a hockey game is on, which he likes, so he puts that channel on.

norm: You shouldn't use derogatory language toward people.
situation: Tom is at school when he see's his friend across the playground.
intention: Tom wants to get his friends attention.
moral_action: Tom yells his friends name as loud as he can in order to get his attention.
immoral_action: Tom yells at his friend saying a bunch of derogatory terms in order to get his attention.

norm: You shouldn't act upon urges that you know are bad.
situation: Tony hasn't had fulfilling sex in a very long time and is feeling stronger and stronger urges.
intention: Tony wants to have a healthy sex life.
moral_action: Tony works on improving himself and starts looking for a girlfriend.
immoral_action: Tony makes an arrangement with a sex worker.

norm: You shouldn't force people to do things.
situation: Devon's house has created a mess in the kitchen.
intention: Devon wants the dishes cleaned.
moral_action: Devon has a house meeting on how everyone can clean the dishes.
immoral_action: Devon berates his roomate Steve into doing the dishes alone.

norm: People shouldn't put others on the spot with their problems.
situation: Kelly is having relationship problems with Ryan.
intention: Kelly wants to vent her frustrations and get help.
moral_action: Kelly gets counseling about the relationship and Ryan agrees to go too.
immoral_action: Kelly complains daily to her coworkers about Ryan and often asks them to get involved.

norm: You shouldn't say mean things to people.
situation: A girl in Janet's class has lost a little weight and asks Janet how she looks.
intention: Janet wants to answer the girl.
moral_action: Janet tells the girl that she looks great and congratulates her on her weight loss.
immoral_action: Janet tells the girl that she is such a fat pig that the little weight she lost barely makes a difference.

norm: You shouldn't manipulate people.
situation: Lily knows lots of personal secrets about Merlin and needs to get some work done on her car.
intention: Lily wants Merlin to fix her car.
moral_action: Lily offers to pay Merlin to work on her car.
immoral_action: Lily tells Merlin to work on her car or else she'll expose his secrets.

norm: You shouldn't associate with mean people.
situation: Maggie is alone at a large party, and she feels somewhat lonely.
intention: Maggie wants to form new friendships.
moral_action: Maggie goes outside and asks to dance with people she recognizes from work.
immoral_action: Maggie starts up a conversation with an ambitious woman known for bullying others.

norm: You shouldn't do things that endanger the public.
situation: James is starting a new YouTube channel and knows it's a very competitive environment.
intention: James wants to gain lots of followers.
moral_action: James practices guitar until he can write genuinely appealing new songs.
immoral_action: James models dangerous behavior for his underage followers, like playing chicken on the railroad tracks.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone hurtful things.
situation: Jaime often hears other high-school kids making fun of her friend, Destiny, behind her back, but bottles it up.
intention: Jaime wants to finally say something about the bullying.
moral_action: Jaime tells the bullies they are wrong for making fun of Destiny.
immoral_action: Jaime tells Destiny that kids often make fun of her.

norm: You shouldn't do things that get you banned.
situation: Fred, who has a concealed carry permit and a gun, goes to a nightclub, where a drunk person picks a fight with Fred.
intention: Fred wants to deal with the drunk person.
moral_action: Fred goes to the bartender and asks for help dealing with the drunk person.
immoral_action: Fred pulls his gun on the drunk person and tells him to back off immediately.

norm: You should not bother your friends excessively.
situation: Jeff's friend owes him $20.
intention: Jeff wants his friend to pay him back.
moral_action: Jeff reminds his friend about the money the day before they are scheduled to get together.
immoral_action: Jeff sends his friend multiple texts every day about the money.

norm: You shouldn't intentionally spill things on people.
situation: James is a waiter in a fancy restaurant and one of his customers is being very rude.
intention: James wants to avoid dealing with the rude customer.
moral_action: James asks the manager to speak to the rude patron and ask him to change his behavior.
immoral_action: James intentionally drops a plate of beef ragout on the man's expensive suit.

norm: You should not try to suffocate yourself.
situation: Trish just got broken up with by her boyfriend and is feeling overwhelmed by her emotions.
intention: Trish wants her emotions to stop happening.
moral_action: Trish has a few drinks of alcohol and goes up to her bed to fall asleep.
immoral_action: Trish grabs a plastic trash bag and puts it over her head, duct taping it around her neck and securing her hands in a pair of handcuffs.

norm: You shouldn't criticize people with accents.
situation: John is at a restaurant when his waiter asks to take his order, and the waiter has a foreign accent.
intention: John wants to respond to the waiter's accent.
moral_action: Dave points out to the man that he notices his accent and asks him what part of the world he comes from.
immoral_action: John tells the waiter that he's hard to understand tells him he should learn to speak better English.

norm: You shouldn't force someone to do something they don't want.
situation: Eleanor has a daughter.
intention: Eleanor wants her daughter to do an extracurricular activity.
moral_action: Eleanor asks her daughter what activity she wants to do and signs her up for that.
immoral_action: Eleanor signs her daughter up for dance classes even though her daughter dislikes dance.

norm: You shouldn't be sneaky around people.
situation: George is a jokester who likes to make his friends laugh when they come over for dinner.
intention: George wants to prank his friends while they eat dinner.
moral_action: George puts fart bags on everyone's seat at the dinner table.
immoral_action: George hides underneath the dinner table then jumps out wearing a clown mask.

norm: You shouldn't let people steal from you.
situation: Jill runs a store, and she was looking into proper loss prevention measures.
intention: Jill wants to make a decision.
moral_action: Jill signs up with a security system to protect her assets from theft.
immoral_action: Jill decides that the stuff stolen from her is cheaper than what the security bill would be.

norm: You should not force people into situations they don't like.
situation: Marie's daughter Kayla is a shy girl who is afraid of public speaking but enjoys writing poetry and painting.
intention: Marie wants her daughter to make more friends.
moral_action: Marie signs Kayla up for a small art class that teaches painting.
immoral_action: Marie signs Kayla up for the school play, so she can meet people.

norm: You shouldn't say hurtful things to others.
situation: Rebecca just got a new haircut, and she's asking her friend Ellen what she thinks of it.
intention: Ellen wants to give Rebecca her opinion.
moral_action: Ellen tells Rebecca that while she doesn't like it as much as her old haircut, she still pulls it off well.
immoral_action: Ellen tells Rebecca that the haircut looks really bad and that she should get it fixed.

norm: You shouldn't let others change a contract.
situation: Fred has a contract with his brother George about who does what chores that is being discussed.
intention: Fred wants to finish the discussion.
moral_action: Fred doesn't allow George to change the contract, insisting they need to stick by it.
immoral_action: Fred lets George change the contract as long as they both agree to the changes.

norm: You shouldn't act salty toward others.
situation: While playing an online game Jake gets thoroughly beaten by another player in a PVP battle.
intention: Jake wants to communicate with the other player.
moral_action: Jake congratulates the other player and asks for any tips they might have.
immoral_action: Jake sends messages to the other player saying that they cant have possibly won by playing fair.

norm: You shouldn't call people idiots
situation: Louis and his friend Mick are studying math problems and Mick gets a problem wrong.
intention: Louis wants to respond to Mick getting the problem wrong.
moral_action: Louis tells Mick how to solve the problem correctly.
immoral_action: Louis calls Mick an idiot for getting the problem wrong.

norm: You shouldn't let people trick you.
situation: "Steve bet Bob $1 he couldn't answer this question: ""Is the following true or false: My name is Steve, or I am a human""."
intention: Bob wants to answer the question.
moral_action: "Bob asks if the word ""or"" is inclusive or exclusive in the context of the riddle."
immoral_action: Bob takes a guess at the riddle thinking he'll be right half the time.

norm: You shouldn't do anything that will make an argument worse.
situation: Mark was having an argument with his wife over finances.
intention: Mark doesn't want to keep arguing.
moral_action: Mark walks away so that they can agree to disagree.
immoral_action: Mark tells his wife that she shouldn't tell him what to do with his own money.

norm: You shouldn't let people fall if you can prevent it.
situation: James is hired to be a bodyguard at a stage show with a high stage.
intention: James wants to work the entire night for the show.
moral_action: James works the entire night by watching to see if anyone falls off the stage.
immoral_action: James works the night but doesn't pay attention if people are about to fall off the stage.

norm: You shouldn't keep your self harm a secret.
situation: Jackie's mom just died and Jackie has been cutting herself from depression.
intention: Jackie wants to be self-reliant.
moral_action: Jackie calls an ambulance for help on her own and pays for therapy too.
immoral_action: Jackie cuts herself to pieces alone in her room.

norm: You shouldn't use racial slurs.
situation: Alex is a comedian doing a comedy set in a club.
intention: Alex wants to tell some jokes.
moral_action: Alex tells jokes about his involving his everyday life and family.
immoral_action: Alex tells a joke involving several racial stereotypes and slurs.

norm: You should not risk other people's safety.
situation: The fourth of July is coming up and Rachel plans to have a backyard cookout with friends.
intention: Rachel wants to light off fireworks during the cookout.
moral_action: Rachel lights fireworks at the far end of her backyard after asking her guests to stay back.
immoral_action: Rachel lights off fireworks from her top deck.

norm: You shouldn't ridicule others.
situation: Brad is at his desk at work when Ralph comes in wearing really bright yellow pants.
intention: Brad wants to state his surprise at the brightness of Ralph's pants.
moral_action: Brad tells Ralph that he wasn't expecting to see pants that bright but that they make the office pop with good energy.
immoral_action: Brad tells Ralph that the pants are shockingly bright and blinding and that he looks like a moronic clown wearing those to work.

norm: You shouldn't provoke others.
situation: Angie and Tracy are having a big fight while Roland looks on.
intention: Roland wants to react to the fighting.
moral_action: Roland tries to back the two away from each other and calm them down.
immoral_action: Roland tells Tracy to keep going and that Angie has been telling everyone that Tracys mom is fat.

norm: You should not do things to put yourself in danger.
situation: Ian, who lives in a big and fairly dangerous city, just finished up with work and is leaving his office.
intention: Ian wants to get to his house.
moral_action: Ian takes the long way home through a pretty safe neighborhood that he's very familiar with.
immoral_action: Ian decides to take a shortcut home through a dangerous neighborhood with a very high crime rate.

norm: You should not hurt people
situation: Ronald and his friend see a trans person walking down the road, and they don't pass very well.
intention: Ronald wants to make his friend laugh.
moral_action: Ronald tells his friend this joke that he read on the internet.
immoral_action: Ronald waits for the trans person to walk by and then makes fun of their looks.

norm: You shouldn't let others pressure you to do things.
situation: Kiran is feeling tired from a weekend of going out to bars with his friends, but they are trying to persuade him to go out again.
intention: Kiran wants to avoid disappointing his friends.
moral_action: Kiran tells his friends that he needs to take a night off but makes plans to go out with them later that week.
immoral_action: Kiran agrees to go out with his friends, and they go out and drink a fair amount including some shots of whiskey.

norm: You should not try to make a friend uncomfortable.
situation: Kalyn's invited their friend Rachel over but now it's getting late and Rachel shows no sign of leaving.
intention: Kalyn wants Rachel to leave soon.
moral_action: Kalyn tells Rachel that she is tired and would love to catch up with Rachel again some other time.
immoral_action: Kalyn begins asking Rachel about her recent infertility issues to try and make Rachel uncomfortable, so she will leave.

norm: You shouldn't beat someone up.
situation: Bob is at a bar when a drunk customer begins making trouble in the bar, threatening people with a bottle.
intention: Bob wants to protect the customers.
moral_action: Bob lunges at the customer, takes away the bottle, and pins the customer to the ground.
immoral_action: Bob charges the drunk customer, disarms him, and punches him repeatedly.

norm: You shouldn't hide injuries from people.
situation: Finnegan just got home from soccer practice during which he injured his knee, when his parents ask him how his day was.
intention: Finnegan wants to respond to his parents.
moral_action: Finnegan tells his parents about his day in detail, including the injury he sustained during soccer practice.
immoral_action: Finnegan tells his parents that he had a great and uneventful day, purposefully not mentioning his injury so that he doesn't worry them.

norm: You shouldn't be unkind to people.
situation: Mack is driving through heavy traffic on the highway when he sees a fast-moving car quickly approaching behind him.
intention: Mack wants to maintain his place in traffic.
moral_action: Mack pulls over quickly, lets the car by, and jumps right back into his lane.
immoral_action: Mack refuses to pull over for the car and boxes him in so the car must follow him.

norm: You shouldn't use the word retarded as an insult.
situation: Barry watches his friend clown around with his other friends, and he laughs hysterically.
intention: Barry wants to say something in the spirit of the moment.
moral_action: Barry tells his friend that he loves it when they all get together and laugh like that, it's his favorite part of life.
immoral_action: Barry jokingly calls his friend retarded for acting in such a silly manner.

norm: You shouldn't mock people.
situation: Abby said something annoying.
intention: John wants to respond to her to show how he feels.
moral_action: John takes Abby aside and tells her how what she has said is bothering him.
immoral_action: John looked at Abby and starting repeating what she said in a high pitched voice.

norm: You shouldn't call people weird.
situation: Claire asks Donald what he thinks about her making art with macaroni.
intention: Donald wants to give his opinion to Claire.
moral_action: Donald says that Claire is a good macaroni artist with talent.
immoral_action: Donald says he thinks it's weird to make art with macaroni.

norm: You shouldn't live a life that is a lie.
situation: Vanessa wants more people to follow her on Instagram, but she thinks that people would be not interested in her boring life.
intention: Vanessa wants more followers.
moral_action: Vanessa follows people interacting with their posts while uploading pictures of herself taken from different angles.
immoral_action: Vanessa edits her pictures creating a fake life for herself on the platform.

norm: You shouldn't impose your views on others.
situation: Victoria, an experienced mother of four, is asked for parenting advice from Natalie about her misbehaving children.
intention: Victoria wants to help Natalie.
moral_action: Victoria gives Natalie the url to a parenting forum while giving her tips tailored towards Natalie's children.
immoral_action: Victoria stresses her experience as a mother pressuring Natalie into adopting her views on parenting.

norm: You should not overwhelm others with your problems.
situation: Olivia is meeting up with her friends and has had some problems in her home life lately.
intention: Olivia wants to tell her friends about her problems.
moral_action: Olivia briefly mentions her problems at home, but asks others how they are doing.
immoral_action: Olivia goes on and on about all her problems at home and won't let anyone else talk.

norm: You shouldn't intentionally annoy a friend.
situation: Meo is a bit bored while hanging out with Mea in the house.
intention: Meo wants to get out some energy.
moral_action: Meo turns on music and starts dancing.
immoral_action: Meo starts kicking around a foam soccer ball.

norm: You shouldn't dump your problems on other people.
situation: Leah is dealing with a toxic relationship with a guy her friend doesn't like and is having problems deciding what to do.
intention: Leah wants to get some advice on her issue.
moral_action: Leah goes on the internet to find discussions and articles of similar problems to draw from.
immoral_action: Leah approaches her friend about the situation sparing no details.

norm: You shouldn't act oddly around others.
situation: Seth was in the grocery store looking at some products on the shelf.
intention: Seth wants to pick up a can of corn.
moral_action: Seth picks up a can of corn and puts it into the cart.
immoral_action: Seth picks up cans of corn from the shelves and starts to make a tower with them.

norm: You shouldn't burden others with your responsibilities.
situation: Rodger is at work and has a lot of projects piling up.
intention: Rodger wants to make sure the projects get done.
moral_action: Rodger works overtime to make sure he finishes all the projects that have piled up.
immoral_action: Rodger calls in some favors with other coworkers and requests that they do the projects for him.

norm: You shouldn't break things on purpose.
situation: James' wife bought a lamp in the shape of a fishnet-covered leg that he found very offensive.
intention: James doesn't want to have to look at the lamp.
moral_action: James asks his wife if she can move the lamp from their living room to her home office.
immoral_action: James knocks the lamp over and tells his husband that he accidentally smashed it.

norm: You shouldn't say things that offended people
situation: Blake is at the grocery store looking for apples, but they're all spoiled.
intention: Blake wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: Blake takes a breath and asks a worker if he has any fresh apples.
immoral_action: Blake says in a raised voice that the workers in the store can't do their jobs in front of a worker.

norm: People shouldn't abuse their positions of power.
situation: Jim is an auditor with the IRS and his friend John gets a tax bill that has him worried.
intention: Jim wants to soothe John.
moral_action: Jim tells John not to worry that he can get all his answers from the IRS guides available to the public and to just breathe.
immoral_action: Jim tells John not to worry about it, he'll go into work Monday and erase the problem from Jim's file.

norm: You shouldn't purposely annoy people.
situation: Hugh is a huge Trump fan but knows his neighbor Sally hates Trump and what Trump stands for.
intention: Hugh wants to show his support for Trump at his house.
moral_action: Hugh puts one small Trump supporter sign in his yard and let's his neighbor Sally know beforehand he has nothing against her.
immoral_action: Hugh purchases 40 Trump supporter signs and puts them in his yard facing Sally's house.

norm: You shouldn't take your frustrations out on others.
situation: Bret's favorite baseball team just lost, and his wife wants him to take out the garbage.
intention: Bret wants to be less angry.
moral_action: Bret takes out the garbage and smokes a cigarette while outside.
immoral_action: Bret tells his wife that he's tired of doing everything for her.

norm: You shouldn't give people mean looks.
situation: Tom is driving on the highway when a nearby car changes lanes and cuts him off.
intention: Tom wants to show the driver cut him off that he's upset.
moral_action: Tom honks his horn at the driver who cut him off to let him know that he was there.
immoral_action: Tom pulls up along side the driver who cut him off and stares him down.

norm: You should not want to shoot people.
situation: Jake is walking down the street when Clark, who is walking past him accidentally steps on his foot.
intention: Jake wants to react to the pain he's in.
moral_action: Jake whimpers in pain and glances at Clark to illicit sympathy.
immoral_action: Jake pulls out a pistol and points it at Clark demanding Clark apologizes.

norm: You shouldn't take inappropriate photos of people.
situation: Bill is at a crowded beach with his family taking photos.
intention: Bill wants to enjoy his day off with his faimly.
moral_action: Bill takes photos of his wife and children while they play in the water.
immoral_action: Bill notices a woman undressing and takes photos of her.

norm: You shouldn't spread rumors about others.
situation: Sarah hears a rumor that her friend is secretly gay and afraid to come out.
intention: Sarah wants to know her friend's sexuality.
moral_action: Sarah approaches her friend and tells him directly that she is an ally and open to talking without judgment.
immoral_action: Sarah approaches her friend's sister and tells her about the rumor and asks if it might be true.

norm: You shouldn't get involved in forbidden relationships.
situation: Corey just discovered the fact that one of the girls he has been texting is underage.
intention: Corey wants to feel less lonely.
moral_action: Corey pursues one of the women he knows who is an adult.
immoral_action: Corey pursues the underage girl, despite knowing that it is illegal.

norm: You shouldn't pry into others' romantic affairs.
situation: John sees his friend Bill kissing another woman that is clearly not Bill's wife, Susan.
intention: John wants to tell someone what he just saw.
moral_action: John calls his own wife and tells her that an anonymous friend is having an affair and tells her he wants it off his chest.
immoral_action: John calls Susan and tells her that he just saw her husband being a little too friendly with another woman.

norm: You shouldn't post awkward pictures of people.
situation: James recently took a picture of his friend throwing up on James' shoes at a party.
intention: James wants to get back at his friend for puking on James' shoes.
moral_action: James calls his friend Barfy McLightweight every time they talk privately for the next two weeks.
immoral_action: James posts the picture of his drunk, vomiting friend on every social media account.

norm: You shouldn't pry into someone's sex life.
situation: Joe and Joanna are coworkers eating lunch together at a restaurant.
intention: Joe wants to have a conversation over lunch with Joanna.
moral_action: Joe asks Joanna if she has any books she'd recommend to him?
immoral_action: Joe asks Joanna how many people she's slept with so far.

norm: You shouldn't swear at others.
situation: Sam's coworker Tom makes a big error on a group work project.
intention: Sam wants to inform his coworker Tom about the mistake.
moral_action: Sam informs Tom of the error he made and offers to help him fix it.
immoral_action: Sam angrily berates and swears at Tom about the error he made.

norm: People shouldn't tell offensive jokes when it makes other's uncomfortable.
situation: Arthur is at a party where a bunch of friends are drinking beers and telling jokes.
intention: Arthur wants to make his friends laugh at his jokes.
moral_action: Arthur tells a bunch of jokes about dumb stuff his cat does.
immoral_action: Arthur tells a bunch of jokes about dumb stuff certain ethnic groups do.

norm: You shouldn't get involved with toxic people.
situation: Marry is alone at a crowded party.
intention: Mary wants to make friends.
moral_action: Mary decides to dance with some people she's seen at work.
immoral_action: Mary talks to some people with a reputation for backstabbing their friends.

norm: You shouldn't get involved in criminal activities.
situation: Jamie is out with her group of friends on a hot day when they suggest breaking into a rooftop pool to cool off.
intention: Jamie wants to cool off with her friends.
moral_action: Jamie tells her friends that isn't a good idea, and suggests going to the lake instead.
immoral_action: Jamie agrees and goes off with her friends to break into the pool.

norm: You should not enjoy hurting living things.
situation: Sally has just noticed that a bee has gotten into her house.
intention: Sally wants to remove the bee.
moral_action: Sally traps the bee in a container and releases it outside.
immoral_action: Sally smashes the hornet with a shoe and cheers victoriously.

norm: You shouldn't pull pranks that could harm someone.
situation: Dwight's coworker is always messing with people at work and recently finds that a line has been crossed.
intention: Dwight wants to teach his coworker a lesson.
moral_action: Dwight tapes his coworker's desk making it impossible to open without investing time removing all the tape.
immoral_action: Dwight spikes his coworker's lunch with an incredibly spicy hot sauce.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at things that aren't funny.
situation: John watches a classmate trip and injure herself.
intention: John wants to respond to the incident.
moral_action: John responds with a serious expression and offers assistance to the girl.
immoral_action: John laughs at the girl that fell over.

norm: You shouldn't scream at elders.
situation: Andrew is visiting his grandfather and is mad about his grandfather's old-fashioned views.
intention: Andrew wants to tell his grandfather why he's wrong.
moral_action: Andrew listens to his grandfather's point of view, and explains his own.
immoral_action: Andrew yells at his grandfather that he's ignorant.

norm: You shouldn't spit in someone's face.
situation: Maggie is fighting with Shauna, and Shauna tosses water at Maggie.
intention: Maggie wants to express her frustration.
moral_action: Maggie explains her feelings and the source of her anger to Shauna.
immoral_action: Maggie steps forwards and spits on Shauna's cheek.

norm: You shouldn't throw things at people that have special needs.
situation: Amanda is on the school bus and is trying to make her friends laugh about things on the school bus.
intention: Amanda wants her friends to think she's funny.
moral_action: Amanda makes a joke about how ugly the school bus seats are.
immoral_action: Amanda throws a piece of chewed gum at the hair of a child with multiple disabilities.

norm: You shouldn't trick someone into doing your chores.
situation: Paula told her roommate she would clean the house today but her friend just called her and asked her if she wants to go get drinks with her.
intention: Paula wants to go hang out with her friend.
moral_action: Paula tells her roommate she was invited for drinks and asks him to help her clean the house, so she can go out as soon as possible.
immoral_action: Paula tells her roommate she is not feeling well and can't do the cleaning today, then quietly leaves the house while her roommate is doing the cleaning.

norm: You shouldn't pry into someone's private life.
situation: Samantha is hanging out in her friend Ashley's bedroom while Ashley uses bathroom.
intention: Samantha wants to explore Ashley's bedroom.
moral_action: Samantha gets up to look at all of Ashley's paintings and awards.
immoral_action: Samantha finds Ashley's diary and opens it up to read it.

norm: You shouldn't laugh when someone gets hurt.
situation: Susan is riding bikes with her boyfriend Tom, when she falls into a cactus.
intention: Tom wants to react to Susan's fall.
moral_action: Tom feels bad that Susan got hurt and rushes to help her up and pull out the thorns.
immoral_action: Tom feels bad that Susan got hurt but finds the situation amusing, so he bursts into laughter.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at someone's singing.
situation: James and his friends are out at a karaoke bar, and James' friend Linda is singing terribly off-key.
intention: James wants to spend more time listening to the good singers in his group.
moral_action: James keeps suggesting songs to the best singers in the group.
immoral_action: James makes a joke about Linda's singing and gets his whole group of friends laughing at her.

norm: You shouldn't yell at people in their face.
situation: Mark has noticed errors on one his employee's work documents.
intention: Mark wants to address the errors with his employee.
moral_action: Mark discusses the errors while sitting down with his employee.
immoral_action: Mark gets very close to his employee and raises his voice.

norm: You shouldn't keep pestering someone with calls and texts.
situation: Margaret's husband was at work, and she called him non-stop all day.
intention: Margaret wants to know when her husband will get off.
moral_action: Margaret calls her husband once and leaves a message on his voice mail.
immoral_action: Margaret calls her husband every five minutes until he answers the phone.

norm: You shouldn't punch things when you're anger.
situation: Abby and Cory are dating and just had an argument over bills which made Cory angry.
intention: Cory wants to make himself feel better.
moral_action: Cory decides to take deep breaths before reacting.
immoral_action: Cory punches a hole in the wall in an expression of anger to make him feel better.

norm: You shouldn't deceive someone for your own benefit.
situation: Jake has a friend, Shane, who is trying to choose between two video games to buy.
intention: Jake wants Shane to get the game he also owns, so they can play together.
moral_action: Jake gets Shane a copy of the game that he has, so they can play together.
immoral_action: Jake tells Shane that the other game is not well made despite not having played it.

norm: You shouldn't send perverted messages to people.
situation: Cory has taken an interest in a girl and finds her to be quite attractive.
intention: Cory wants to flirt with the girl.
moral_action: Cory waits until they get to know each other more and acts suggestively with her in person.
immoral_action: Cory starts to send her intimate messages about what he wants to do with her.

norm: You shouldn't send hate messages to people.
situation: John is upset that his black friend Tom didn't call him back right away.
intention: John wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: John calls Tom and asks him why he didn't call him back.
immoral_action: John sends Tom some very racist text messages.

norm: You shouldn't pull pranks on people.
situation: Tony is visiting a friend and feels bored one afternoon while his friend is out buying something to eat.
intention: Tony wants to put some excitement in his life.
moral_action: Tony turns on one of his friend's movies really loud and acts it out while in the living room.
immoral_action: Tony gets some wires and hooks up the front door knob to the house's 110V AC current.

norm: People shouldn't try to pigeonhole others into convenient holes.
situation: Bill has known Tom for many years but now Tom wants to start hanging out more with Bill, and Bill isn't sure they are very good friends.
intention: Bill wants to decide if Tom is a good enough friend to hang out with.
moral_action: Bill doesn't label Tom in any particular way and hangs out with him when he is not busy.
immoral_action: Bill decides that Tom is an acquaintance, not really a friend, and declines to hang out with him.

norm: You shouldn't keep secrets from potential significant others.
situation: Zack is dating Kelly, but he has a significant amount of debt.
intention: Zack wants to propose to Kelly.
moral_action: Zack proposes to Kelly and mentions his debt.
immoral_action: Zack proposes to Kelly but does not mention his debt.

norm: You shouldn't use swear words against others.
situation: Gabe is talking to his mother when they get into a heated discussion.
intention: Gabe wants to get his point across.
moral_action: Gabe starts talking in depth about the points that he is trying to make.
immoral_action: Gabe starts to accentuate his point with a variety of curse words.

norm: You shouldn't pry into someone's relationship.
situation: Kelly and her husband Marc are having personal problems that she's been secretive about, and her friend Sue is curious as to why.
intention: Sue wants to ask Kelly about her and Marc's issues.
moral_action: When Sue asks Kelly what's wrong, she says she doesn't want to discuss it right now, so Sue leaves it at that until Kelly's ready to talk about it.
immoral_action: When Sue asks Kelly what the problem is, she says it's personal, but Sue keeps pressing her about it.

norm: People shouldn't misuse devices for purposes they weren't intended.
situation: Faye finds an old iron that has been sitting in the closet for a while.
intention: Faye wants to test out the iron.
moral_action: Faye uses the iron to press wrinkles out of some of her shirts.
immoral_action: Faye uses the iron to make a grilled cheese sandwich.

norm: You shouldn't send naked photos of yourself to others.
situation: Chris is sending messages to Francine to convey his desire to hook up with her.
intention: Chris wants to send Francine a message to get her in the mood.
moral_action: Chris sends a short romantic poem that he wrote to Francine.
immoral_action: Chris sends Francine a picture of himself without any clothes on his body.

norm: You should not damage other peoples things for a prank.
situation: Vince is part of a fraternity and his frat brother Ben has a birthday coming up.
intention: Vince wants to pull a prank on Ben's car.
moral_action: Vince gets some window chalk and writes a lot of funny messages on Ben's car windows.
immoral_action: Vince jacks up the car, puts a hole in the tires, and fills each tire with cement, then lowers the car.

norm: You shouldn't tell jokes that others may be offended over.
situation: Gary is on a date with a Jewish girl named Lisa and needs to say something funny to win her over.
intention: Gary wants to make Lisa laugh.
moral_action: Gary tells Lisa a funny joke about a famous celebrity.
immoral_action: Gary tells Lisa a series of derogatory jokes about Jewish people.

norm: You shouldn't keep pestering people that won't listen.
situation: Greg has an overweight coworker who has no interest in anything health-related that Greg tells him.
intention: Greg wants his coworker to get healthier.
moral_action: Greg asks his coworker if he wants to go out walking or for some physical activity whenever the chance arises.
immoral_action: Greg continues to tell his coworker about ways to improve his health and gives him books about it.

norm: You shouldn't secretly take pictures of people in public.
situation: John, an amateur photographer, is walking through the city and notices a lady in a beautifully unique outfit.
intention: John wants to capture a stunning picture to submit in a photography contest.
moral_action: John approaches the lady and asks her if she wouldn't mind posing for some photos.
immoral_action: John follows the lady discreetly, taking pictures of her from afar as she goes about her business.

norm: You shouldn't rip people off.
situation: Marina is living through a global pandemic.
intention: Marina wants to make money by selling masks during a global pandemic.
moral_action: Marina makes money by buying cheap masks from China and raising the price just a little before selling thousands of them on Amazon.
immoral_action: Marina makes money by buying cheap masks from China and raising the price ten fold before selling hundreds of them on Amazon.

norm: You shouldn't rob people.
situation: John has been laid off from his job.
intention: John wants to find a new source of money.
moral_action: John goes into a local store and fills out a job application.
immoral_action: John goes into a local store and robs the clerk at gunpoint.

norm: You shouldn't commit fraud.
situation: Amy just started a new business and wanted to attract more investors.
intention: Amy wanted more money to help run her business.
moral_action: Amy persuades new investors to invest in her new business by being truthful.
immoral_action: Amy misrepresents her company's financials to persuade investors to give her their money.

norm: You shouldn't do illegal things.
situation: John, a postal worker who is very passionate about his political party, is sorting through some mail and notices a bag of ballots for the opposing party.
intention: John wants his political party to win the next election, which is forecast to be a very close race.
moral_action: John now realizes the opposing political party has a lot of support, so he organizes a rally to gather more support for his own party.
immoral_action: John throws the bag of ballots in the trash.

norm: You shouldn't cheat.
situation: Robert and his wife Susan are playing board games with their friends, Jim and Sue.
intention: Robert really wants to beat Jim and Sue at scrabble.
moral_action: Robert consults with Sue about words they could use in scrabble and end up playing a good game.
immoral_action: Robert excuses himself and goes to the bathroom then uses his phone to find a high scoring word to insert in scrabble.

norm: You shouldn't break a confidence.
situation: Jen tells her friend Billy that she's secretly in love with her best friend Frank who Billy works with.
intention: Billy wants to spend an entertaining day at work with Frank.
moral_action: Billy decides to pass the time at work telling Frank about the game he watched on TV.
immoral_action: Billy decides to pass the time telling Frank all the details about how Jen feels about Frank.

norm: You shouldn't forbid music.
situation: Lisa is studying for her impending exam in a couple days while her brother, John, plays music loudly.
intention: Lisa wants to focus on her studies without interruption.
moral_action: Lisa asks her brother, John, to listen to the music with headphones instead.
immoral_action: Lisa shouts at her brother, John, for playing music loudly forcing him to shut it off.

norm: You shouldn't disobey codes.
situation: Andy is a nurse in a hospital.
intention: Andy wants to do well at his next performance review.
moral_action: Andy asks what he can do to improve his work at the hospital.
immoral_action: Andy hacks into the computer system to say he's working more hours than he is and violates the employee computer rules.

norm: You shouldn't lie in articles.
situation: Janice is writing a research article.
intention: Janice wants more respect.
moral_action: Janice carefully researches her article and makes sure it is truthful.
