immoral_action: Janice invents parts of the article to make it seem more impressive.

norm: You should not be wasteful.
situation: Michelle is cleaning out her garage.
intention: Michelle wants to get rid of some things.
moral_action: Michelle put her items on the curb and makes an ad on Craigslist under the Free section so people can come and take the items to use.
immoral_action: Michelle sets her unwanted items out for the garbage truck to pick up.

norm: You shouldn't throw tantrums.
situation: Stan is shopping in the toy store with his mother for his birthday present.
intention: Stan wants to get a good toy.
moral_action: Stan requests a new game for his Playstation.
immoral_action: Stan pitches a fit when his mother won't buy him a really expensive new video game system.

norm: You shouldn't exaggerate things.
situation: John is applying for a job at a new company.
intention: He wants his job interview to go well.
moral_action: John is honest and upfront about his past job history.
immoral_action: John over-exaggerates his roles in his past company and is not entirely honest about his past duties.

norm: You shouldn't kill yourself.
situation: Mary is saddened by her breakup with her boyfriend recently.
intention: Mary wants to overcome her sad feeling.
moral_action: Mary signs up for a yoga class to improve both her physical and mental health.
immoral_action: Mary commits suicide to end her problem.

norm: You shouldn't be noisy in public.
situation: Dave is sunbathing in a beach.
intention: Dave wants to listen to music.
moral_action: Dave uses headphones to listen to the music.
immoral_action: Dave turns on his cellphone very loud to play his music.

norm: You shouldn't harm yourself.
situation: Dave comes home to his crying wife, Ann who tells him that Dave's mother has passed away.
intention: Dave wants to distract himself to make the pain go away.
moral_action: Dave goes downstairs to the basement and begins playing his drum set loudly.
immoral_action: Dave goes to the kitchen and grabs a knife and begins to cut himself.

norm: You shouldn't spoil a surprise.
situation: Kyle's mother is planning a surprise party for his brother.
intention: Kyle wants to go to the party.
moral_action: Kyle invites his best friend to go to the surprise party with him.
immoral_action: Kyle invites his brother to go to the surprise party with him.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on anyone.
situation: Carla is on a girls weekend out of town and meets George at a bar who buys her drinks and dances with her.
intention: Carla wants to have a carefree weekend.
moral_action: Carla thanks George for the drink and dances with him, but tells him she has a boyfriend.
immoral_action: Carla decides since it is a girls weekend she can do what she wants and takes George back to her hotel room that night.

norm: You shouldn't damage the environment.
situation: Jim is out sailing his yacht on the ocean and is drinking a six pack of soda he just opened.
intention: Jim wants to dispose of the plastic that holds the six-pack together.
moral_action: Jim disposes of the plastic trash in the proper trash receptacle.
immoral_action: Jim hurls the plastic trash overboard and into the ocean.

norm: You shouldn't purposely ignore people.
situation: Sam's mother asks him to clean his room because it is messy.
intention: Sam wants to not have to clean his room right now.
moral_action: Sam asks his mother if it is okay for him to clean his room later.
immoral_action: Sam pretends that he doesn't hear his mother and plays video games instead.

norm: You shouldn't use a fake ID.
situation: Tom's older friend Bill invites him out for a night on the town.
intention: Tom wants to have a fun evening hanging out with his friend Bill.
moral_action: Tom suggests that they go bowling instead of going to a bar.
immoral_action: Tom uses a fake ID to try and get into a bar with Bill.

norm: You shouldn't break the law.
situation: Joe is walking past a convenience store when he notices the only employee is away from the cash register.
intention: Joe is thirsty and wants something to drink.
moral_action: Joe waits for the store's employee to return to the cash register and buys a drink using his debit card.
immoral_action: Joe takes advantage of the situation and shoplifts a bottle of soda from the store.

norm: You shouldn't abandon people.
situation: Madison is shopping with her friend Jill, when a good looking guy, Ken asks her if she wants to grab a bite to eat.
intention: Madison wants to go eat with Ken.
moral_action: Madison tells Ken she would love to grab a bite to eat as long as Jill can come too.
immoral_action: Madison just walks away with Ken to get food, leaving Jill behind.

norm: You shouldn't disobey others.
situation: Neal's parents have tried to teach him to have responsible sex.
intention: Neal wants to have lots of sex.
moral_action: Neal always wears a condom before he has sex.
immoral_action: Neal has a lot of unprotected sex.

norm: You shouldn't be pushy about things.
situation: Cora is trying to buy a necklace at the farmer's market and notices that it has a small imperfection.
intention: Cora wants a discount on the necklace.
moral_action: Cora approaches the vendor and kindly asks if the price can be discounted because of the blemish.
immoral_action: Cora shows the vendor the blemish on the necklace and insists on a discount using degrading language.

norm: You shouldn't treat someone poorly.
situation: Cameron is very busy working on his laptop and his wife Lana asks him to help with dinner.
intention: Cameron wants to respond to Lana's request.
moral_action: Cameron explains to Lana he is very busy finishing some work and asks if she can wait until he's done.
immoral_action: Cameron turns around and snaps at Lana for interrupting him.

norm: You shouldn't lie on forms.
situation: Rob is applying to an engineering job, but he's concerned that his resume doesn't quite stack up with the other candidates.
intention: Rob wants to be hired for the job.
moral_action: Rob works hard to make his resume as impressive and professional as possible while still being honest and accurate.
immoral_action: Rob inflates his credentials to make himself look better throughout his resume.

norm: You shouldn't cheat on people.
situation: Karina and Roland have been a serious couple for years, but recently Karina was asked out on a date by her coworker.
intention: Karina wants to respond to her coworker's invitation.
moral_action: Karina tells her coworker she is flattered, but is very much in love with Roland and must decline.
immoral_action: Karina agrees to the date with her coworker.

norm: You shouldn't abuse your privileges.
situation: Jim is a business executive who is looking to hire a new secretary.
intention: Jim wants to hire a loyal secretary.
moral_action: Jim looks for applicants that have been with their last job for multiple years.
immoral_action: Jim promises his applicants that they'll get the job if they're willing to have a relationship with him.

norm: You shouldn't pirate software.
situation: Josh wants the new Sims game, and he can't afford it.
intention: Josh wants to play the game.
moral_action: Josh sells some of his things to get money to buy the game.
immoral_action: Josh downloads the game off of a torrent website.

norm: You shouldn't give inappropriate gifts.
situation: It's Xmas time and Phil wants to give all of his friends gifts.
intention: Phil wants to give his friends great gifts.
moral_action: Phil goes through carefully and picks out a special gift for each friend.
immoral_action: Phil buys all of his friends expensive gift cards to the same restruant.

norm: You shouldn't ignore people.
situation: Gary is replacing the starter on his car with the help of Timothy, who has much more experience, and is advising him on how to tighten the bolts.
intention: Gary wants to replace the starter.
moral_action: Gary follows Timothy's advice and torques the bolts to the specifications.
immoral_action: Gary ignores Timothy's advice and just cranks down on the bolts.

norm: People shouldn't wear out their welcome.
situation: Molly plans to vacation upstate for a weekend in the same town that her friend Leslie lives in.
intention: Molly wants to save money on a hotel by staying with Leslie during her vacation.
moral_action: Molly completes her upstate vacation and thanks Leslie for her hospitality at the end of the weekend.
immoral_action: Molly has had so much fun during her weekend away, that she decides to extend her vacation for another week.

norm: You shouldn't wear inappropriate clothes.
situation: Rosa loves the bikini she got from her boyfriend, so she now wants to wear it everywhere.
intention: Rosa wants to wear clothes she likes.
moral_action: Rosa realizes that the same clothes at a beach and at a store might mean different things to many people.
immoral_action: Rosa wears her new bikini everywhere she goes such as the grocery store and work.

norm: You shouldn't make a mess.
situation: Jim's wife is out, and he's hungry and wants to have an elaborate dinner.
intention: Jim wants to cook dinner.
moral_action: Jim is careful to put everything away and clean as he is preparing dinner so that the kitchen stays clean.
immoral_action: As Jim makes dinner he leaves all sorts of stuff out and doesn't bother to clean anything so that the kitchen is soon very dirty.

norm: You shouldn't overreact in situations.
situation: Lawrence is cooking bacon on the stove top in his kitchen when the bacon catches fire.
intention: Lawrence wants to respond to the fire.
moral_action: Lawrence removes the pan from the stove top and contains it.
immoral_action: Lawrence runs out of the kitchen and says the house will burn down.

norm: You shouldn't be violent.
situation: Neil is in the park just walking when some guys playing football accidentally hit him with the ball.
intention: Neil wants to react to being hit with the ball.
moral_action: Neil throws the ball back and tells the guys to be more careful in the future.
immoral_action: Neil runs after the guys who threw the ball and tries to kick and punch at them.

norm: You shouldn't ruin your belongings.
situation: Adam has some friends over at his house playing video games when one of his friends says something to make him angry.
intention: Adam wants to silence his friend.
moral_action: Adam challenges his friend to a contest in the game and the loser needs to be quiet for half an hour.
immoral_action: Adam picks up the game system and throws it at his friend, which then hits the wall and shatters.

norm: You shouldn't tear people to pieces.
situation: Barry suffers from strong urges to hurt a woman who lives next to him.
intention: Barry wants to get relief from his urges.
moral_action: Barry goes to therapy and talks about his issues and works to improve his outlook.
immoral_action: Barry abducts the woman and kills her and cuts her up into chunks.

norm: You shouldn't overstay your welcome.
situation: Wendy and her partner own a home together and are going through a rough patch, so she's been staying at her friends house.
intention: Wendy wants to avoid going back to her house.
moral_action: Wendy decides to leave her friend's place and stay with her parents for awhile.
immoral_action: Wendy continues staying with her friend even though it's been a long time already.

norm: You should not insult others.
situation: Wally is stuck on the crowded sidewalk behind a person in a wheelchair and is aggravated that it is taking him so long to get home.
intention: Wally wants to get home as soon as he can.
moral_action: Wally offers to clear a path for the person in the wheelchair, so they can both move more quickly through the crowd.
immoral_action: Wally makes fun of the person in the wheelchair, tells him to get out of the way and the two of them get into a loud conversation on the sidewalk.

norm: You shouldn't reject gifts.
situation: Felix's parents, Cindy and Matt, bought him a toy train that they are hoping he likes, but he really wanted a toy airplane.
intention: Felix wants to react to the present.
moral_action: Felix opens the gift and when he sees it's not exactly what he wanted, he is appreciative and hugs his parents.
immoral_action: Felix opens the box and when he sees the train, he throws it and says he doesn't want it.

norm: You shouldn't be vengeful.
situation: Victor's boss, who is normally a nice guy, did something that Victor didn't like, making Victor angry.
intention: Victor wants to be free of his angry feelings.
moral_action: Victor thinks of the good things that his boss does and figures that the event was a one-time thing.
immoral_action: Victor takes revenge by urinating into his boss's coffee in the morning and feels better.

norm: You shouldn't waste water
situation: Skip got lost on a hike on a hot day and is trying to find his way back to civilization carrying nothing but a canteen.
intention: Skip wants to cool off.
moral_action: Skip finds a large tree that provides shade from the sun and sits under it for a while.
immoral_action: Skip pours the water in his canteen all over his face and body and feels refreshed.

norm: You shouldn't offend people.
situation: It is amateur comedy night at a local night club.
intention: Jo wants to win the audience members over with her jokes.
moral_action: Jo made a joke mocking ableist attitudes towards those with disabilities.
immoral_action: Jo told a joke mocking disabled people's struggles.

norm: You shouldn't do things incorrectly.
situation: Zelda was trying to install a game from a set of floppy disks.
intention: Zelda wants to quickly insert the last disk.
moral_action: Zelda makes sure to use all of the disks in the correct order.
immoral_action: Zelda accidently inserts disk 24 instead of disk 42 because she didn't double check.

norm: You shouldn't download things illegally.
situation: Marvin is excited about the release of a new game he wants to play.
intention: Marvin wants to get the game.
moral_action: Marvin purchases the game from a games website.
immoral_action: Marvin downloads a cracked version of the game from a website for free.

norm: You shouldn't post inappropriate things.
situation: Carla is angry at the Republican party for supporting a bill she opposes and wants to complain about it on social media.
intention: Carla wants to vent her frustrations.
moral_action: Carla tweets to the Republican party's Twitter account that she isn't happy with the party's vote.
immoral_action: In the heat of the moment, Carla goes on Twitter to call all Republican's fascists.

norm: You shouldn't make messes.
situation: Eric has just cooked dinner for himself, dishes everywhere and his roommate John just got home.
intention: Eric wants to go to sleep early.
moral_action: Eric quickly washes his dishes and heads upstairs to eat and sleep.
immoral_action: Eric goes upstairs to his room with his food without washing anything and eats and goes to bed.

norm: You shouldn't steal things.
situation: Randy is at work at the office and sees some office supplies which remind him of what he needs for his home office.
intention: Randy wants to have a stapler to use at home.
moral_action: Randy stops buy an office supply store on his way home from work.
immoral_action: Randy takes home one of the staplers from his work office.

norm: You should not interrupt other people.
situation: Winston is listening to Hillary tell a story about her day when he gets a text saying he has won a prestigious competition.
intention: Winston wants to share his good news.
moral_action: Winston waits for Hillary to finish her story before sharing his exciting news.
immoral_action: Winston cuts Hillary off in the middle of her sentence to share his win.

norm: You shouldn't try to harm yourself.
situation: Jessica's parents just died in a plane crash and Jessica feels totally numb.
intention: Jessica wants to stop feeling numb.
moral_action: Jessica calls a therapy hotline and talks about her pain with a caring therapist.
immoral_action: Jessica takes a razor and cuts herself all over, and she bleeds.

norm: You shouldn't have offensive opinions.
situation: "Dan is in high school and checks out Hitler's autobiography, ""Mein Kempf"", from the library and reads it."
intention: Dan wants to incorporate parts of Hitler's philosophy into his life.
moral_action: Dan adopts Hitler's desire to succeed and works harder in his classes, ignoring Hitler's prejudice.
immoral_action: Dan begins looking at non-white people as inferior and starts a group dedicated to white power.

norm: You should not make false promises.
situation: Gary wants his girlfriend Amber to come with him to his brother's wedding, but Amber has plans to leave for vacation with her own family on the wedding date.
intention: Amber wants to go on vacation with her family.
moral_action: Amber tells Gary that she is not able to go to his brother's wedding because she is leaving for a family vacation on the same day.
immoral_action: Amber agrees to go to Gary's brother's wedding in order to make Gary happy, even though she doesn't plan to go.

norm: You shouldn't disrupt other people.
situation: Larry is in the library when someone calls him on his cell phone.
intention: Larry wants to answer the phone.
moral_action: Larry whispers as he answers the phone and continues the conversation outside.
immoral_action: Larry answers the phone and continues to talk while the people in the library are reading.

norm: You shouldn't cheat at games.
situation: Chad is playing a competitive game of golf with two of his friends.
intention: Chad wants to win the match.
moral_action: Chad focuses as hard as he can on playing well during the round.
immoral_action: Chad alters his scorecard to make his final score appear better than he actually performed.

norm: You shouldn't ditch people.
situation: Fred was driving to work, and he was supposed to pick pup Susan on the way there.
intention: Fred wants to arrive at work.
moral_action: Fred stops to pick up Susan like he's supposed to on the way to work.
immoral_action: Fred decides to go right to work and leave Susan there.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage a project.
situation: Frank has been put into a group project at school with kids he doesn't like.
intention: Frank wants to show his displeasure for his team.
moral_action: Frank tells the team they weren't his ideal choice, but he will do the work.
immoral_action: Frank does not do his part of the project.

norm: You should not misrepresent yourself.
situation: Noah is being interviewed for a technical job, and he does not have the qualifications needed for the job.
intention: Noah wants to get hired.
moral_action: Noah asks if another position is open in the company that better reflects his personal strengths.
immoral_action: Noah tells the interviewer that he is an expert with five years of experience.

norm: You should not starve yourself.
situation: Donna was looking in the mirror and started to think that she was fat.
intention: Donna wanted to lose weight.
moral_action: Donna starts to eat more fruit and vegetables for her snacks.
immoral_action: Donna starts to skip meals and only drinks water all day.

norm: You shouldn't intrude on people.
situation: Helen lives in a shared apartment with a roommate who is currently in their bedroom with the door closed.
intention: Helen has a question she wants to ask her roommate.
moral_action: Helen sends her question to her roommate in a text message.
immoral_action: Helen opens her roommates door without knocking to ask her question.

norm: You shouldn't get into trouble.
situation: Katy is a huge fan of a rock group that will be coming to town for a show over the next weekend.
intention: Katy wants to meet the guitarist for the band and get his autograph.
moral_action: Katy contacts the band's media representative and finds out they will be signing autographs and meeting fans before the concert.
immoral_action: Katy stakes out the hotel where the band is playing and breaks into the guitarist's room while he's out, to wait for him.

norm: You shouldn't ruin people.
situation: Jerry is a powerful owner of a football team and one of his players Dion has been acting egotistical and crazy lately.
intention: Jerry wants to sever ties with Dion.
moral_action: Jerry tells Dion that he's being released and that he's free to sign with someone else.
immoral_action: Jerry tells Dion that he's being released and that he's called the other teams and made sure he'll never play football again.

norm: You shouldn't lie about things to people.
situation: While Marry and Shelly are shopping for dresses, Shelly picks an ill-fitting dress commenting how much she loves it.
intention: Marry wants to respond to Shelly.
moral_action: Marry tells Shelly the dress doesn't suit her suggesting something else instead.
immoral_action: Marry tells Shelly that the dress is fine.

norm: You shouldn't lie to people about your true feelings.
situation: George is hanging out with his friend Lily and Lily confesses that she has romantic feelings toward him, but he doesn't feel the same way.
intention: George wants to let Lily down gently.
moral_action: George tells Lily that he values her friendship, but isn't interested in a romantic relationship.
immoral_action: George tells Lily that he's only uninterested in her romantically because he is gay, which he isnt.

norm: You shouldn't curse at others.
situation: Jeff is trying to merge onto the highway when another car cuts him off.
intention: Jake wants to convey his displeasure at the other driver.
moral_action: Jake bites his tongue and instead honks his horn at the driver who cut him off.
immoral_action: Jake hurls profanities at the other driver, who stops when he hears them and squeezes his 7ft frame out of the car.

norm: You should not mislead others about who you really are.
situation: George who is unemployed meets Elaine for the first time and Elaine asks George what he does for a living.
intention: George wants to respond to Elaine's question.
moral_action: George tells Elaine that he is currently between jobs and living at home with his parents Estelle and Frank.
immoral_action: George tells Elaine that he is an Architect at the firm Vandelay industries who mostly deal with importing latex.

norm: You shouldn't be defensive when you are doing something wrong.
situation: John is washing dishes when his wife Kathy points out that the ones in the rack that are drying actually still have food on them.
intention: John wants to respond to Kathy's statement.
moral_action: John apologizes for the mistake telling Kathy he accidentally overlooked it and offers to rewash them.
immoral_action: John tells Kathy that he's doing a good enough job and if she wants it done to her higher standards that she can do them herself.

norm: You shouldn't put weird things in your mouth.
situation: James is riding the subway with a friend when the friend spots a lost retainer on the next bench and dares James to put it in his mouth.
intention: James wants to avoid his friends calling him a chicken.
moral_action: James tells his friend HE should put the retainer in his mouth or else he's a chicken.
immoral_action: James succumbs to peer pressure and puts the retainer in his mouth.

norm: You shouldn't spoil things for others.
situation: Trevor just saw an exciting new movie at his local cinema.
intention: Trevor wants to talk about the movie he just saw.
moral_action: Trevor refrains from talking about the movie to his friend who hasn't seen it and talks about it with a person who has seen it instead.
immoral_action: Trevor tells a friend who has not seen the movie all about it.

norm: You should not insult the abilities of others.
situation: Mary is working on a group project with other students, she doesn't like some of the work one of the other students has done.
intention: Mary wants to turn in the group project and get an A.
moral_action: Mary talks with the student about their work and makes some suggestions to improve it.
immoral_action: Mary tells one of the students they are doing a bad job and to let her do it.

norm: You shouldn't start up bad habits again.
situation: Jon is having dinner with his family and friends to celebrate his year of sobriety.
intention: Jon wants to have a good time.
moral_action: Jon orders a fancy dessert as a treat for himself.
immoral_action: Jon decides to have just a little sip of wine with his dinner.

norm: You should not call people rude names.
situation: Lina often chats with her coworker, Terry, who has been complaining about her toddler's recent tantrums.
intention: Lina wants to give Terry advice regarding her child.
moral_action: "Lina tells Terry she just needs to reveal the ""angel"" within her child by speaking with a child therapist."
immoral_action: "Lina calls Terry's toddler an ""out of control animal"" and tells her she should seek a child therapist."

norm: You shouldn't be greedy when fishing.
situation: Zach runs a crab fishing boat and has been out catching crab on the ocean for days, and the crab in the boat are not healthy.
intention: Zach wants to catch more crab.
moral_action: Zach catches crab for a few more hours, then decides that he needs to drop off his load.
immoral_action: Zach catches crab for a few more days, ignoring the sick ones.

norm: You should not intentionally hurt others.
situation: James was throwing a baseball in the park with his friends when he spotted a kid who called him a moron in gym.
intention: James wants to make the kid regret insulting him.
moral_action: "James and his friends start following three feet behind the kid chanting, ""I'm not touching you""."
immoral_action: James throws the baseball as hard as he can at the kid's head.

norm: You shouldn't disassociate yourself from reality.
situation: Frank comes home tired from work when he receives an important text from his mother Sarah.
intention: Frank wants to relax.
moral_action: Frank calls Sarah while listening to relaxing music in the background.
immoral_action: Frank spends the evening playing video games.

norm: You shouldn't make people cry.
situation: Jill just lost a swim competition to a girl from another high school.
intention: Jill wants to feel better about losing.
moral_action: Jill privately tells her friends that she bets the winner takes steroids.
immoral_action: Jill tells the winner that she looks fat and ugly in her swimsuit and the girl starts crying.

norm: You shouldn't call someone the wrong name.
situation: James, who comes from a very conservative family, has a class with a transgender student who changed their name from Joe to Joanna.
intention: James wants to share his conservative political views.
moral_action: James uses Joanna's name while talking about his beliefs about the importance of a traditional family .
immoral_action: James insists all calling Joanna by her old name, which clearly bothers her.

norm: You shouldn't laugh at a negative event.
situation: Fred is at the skate park when he watches a fellow skater take a tumble.
intention: Fred wants to react to the skaters fall.
moral_action: Fred rushes over to see if the skater needs help.
immoral_action: Fred laughs at the skaters misfortune.

norm: You shouldn't eat things that are bad for you.
situation: Bobby hash extremely high blood pressure and the doctor has warned him to eliminate fats and cholesterol from his diet.
intention: Bobby wants to have a breakfast that tastes good.
moral_action: Bobby decides to change his diet and has a breakfast of toast and some of his favorite fruit.
immoral_action: Bobby does not listen to his doctor and makes a breakfast consisting of four eggs, four pieces of bacon and two pieces of toast to eat.

norm: You shouldn't wish harm on others
situation: Cal was mad at his father for punishing him on the weekend.
intention: Cal wants his father to know how he feels.
moral_action: Cal talks to his father when he is feeling more calm about the situation.
immoral_action: Cal yells at his father that he hopes he breaks his neck as he slams the door.

norm: You shouldn't make people feel guilty.
situation: Peg needs her coworker Beth to cover her shift at work, so that she may care for her sick son.
intention: Peg wants to use her son as an excuse.
moral_action: Peg tells Beth her son is sick and that she needs the extra time to take care of him.
immoral_action: Peg tells Beth her son is sick and that Beth is the only one that can help to cover her shift.

norm: You shouldn't lie about yourself.
situation: Greg is using a dating app to find a girlfriend.
intention: Greg wants to make himself look good to girls.
moral_action: Greg emphasizes his good qualities on his profiles.
immoral_action: Greg pretends to be a doctor in an effort to impress girls.

norm: You should not insult someone's choices.
situation: Sally asks Joe about his opinion on the dress shes wearing, which Joe believes to be a bad fit for Sally.
intention: Joe wants to be honest with Sally.
moral_action: Joe tactfully tells Sally that the the dress doesn't look as good as he thought it would on the hanger.
immoral_action: Joe tells Sally that the dress looks hideous and questions her taste for even choosing it.

norm: You shouldn't cry if you can't find something.
situation: Jerry notices he's missing his key, and he can't take his friend to the movie.
intention: Jerry wants to express emotion over his missing key.
moral_action: Jerry calmly tells his friend that he lost his keys, without crying.
immoral_action: Jerry cries to his friend, with tears streaming down his eyes.

norm: You shouldn't betray your friends confidence in you to others.
situation: Lisa's friend Robin is pregnant and has asked Lisa to keep it a secret because she is planning to get an abortion.
intention: Lisa wants to help Robin.
moral_action: Lisa looks up organizations that can help Robin through the process of getting a safe abortion.
immoral_action: Lisa tells Robin's parents that Robin is pregnant and doesn't plan to keep the baby.

norm: You should not want to hurt yourself.
situation: Jane failed a test at school.
intention: Jane wants to release her frustration.
moral_action: Jane puts on boxing gloves and hits a punching bag.
immoral_action: Jane bangs her head against the wall.

norm: You shouldn't break the rules of an establishment.
situation: Valerie, a smoker, is in a restaurant with a no-smoking policy and suddenly has the urge to smoke.
intention: Valerie wants to smoke a cigarette.
moral_action: Valerie goes outside to smoke at a designated smoking area.
immoral_action: Valerie lights up a cigarette at the table and smokes.

norm: You shouldn't mislead people.
situation: Chris is an investment professional and is trying to get some clients to invest in a high risk fund.
intention: Chris wants to make a recommendation to his clients.
moral_action: Chris divulges the full risk and reward profile of the fund in his recommendation.
immoral_action: Chris hides the risk of the fund and gets his clients to invest in a high risk fund.

norm: You shouldn't make someone who is positive cry.
situation: Bart's friend Kip is very excited about a video game that is coming out.
intention: Bart wants to comment on Kip liking the video game.
moral_action: Bart says he can't wait to play the game with Kip.
immoral_action: Bart says that video games are for babies and dumb people.

norm: You shouldn't make others sick.
situation: Alice is in the kitchen making chicken and salad for dinner for her hungry kids.
intention: Alice wants to hurry up and feed her children.
moral_action: Alice throws a salad together and tells the kids to start with that while she finished the chicken.
immoral_action: Alice is rushing and doesn't cook the chicken all the way.

norm: You shouldn't disrespect other's cultures.
situation: Kate invited her Asian neighbors to her house for a barbecue, and they took their shoes off inside.
intention: Kate wants to get them to put their shoes on.
moral_action: Kate tells the couple that they don't have to take their shoes off in her house.
immoral_action: Kate tells the couple to put their shoes on to get their germs off her floor.

norm: You shouldn't break company rules.
situation: Robert is at the office and is about to go on lunch break.
intention: Robert wants to have something to eat.
moral_action: Robert clocks out for his lunch break and grabs some food.
immoral_action: Robert knows that he's supposed to clock out for his break, but he ignores the rule and gets something to eat.

norm: You shouldn't get so discouraged about things.
situation: Carl is working on a complex project at home, and a part he is working on has broken.
intention: Carl wants to address the part breaking.
moral_action: Carl starts looking for a replacement for the part, and gets back to work.
immoral_action: Carl gives up on the project, abandoning months of work.

norm: You shouldn't make people angry.
situation: Tom, a racist man, is driving with some friends when he sees a car with some ethnic minorities in it.
intention: Tom wants the ethnic minorities to stay away from him.
moral_action: Tom intentionally slows down to let the other car speed ahead of him.
immoral_action: Tom rolls down his window and tells the people not to come near his car or else he'll get out and fight them.

norm: You shouldn't intentionally hurt someone's feelings.
situation: Chris is a teacher and his student has been consistently late for school for a year.
intention: Chris wants to teach his student a lesson for being late.
moral_action: Chris has the student do character building exercises in a kind way.
immoral_action: Chris decides to shout at his student to lower his self-esteem, so he isn't late anymore.

norm: You shouldn't make your partner cry.
situation: Jack is having trouble teaching his wife Sofia how to play the piano.
intention: Jack wants to tell his wife what she's doing wrong.
moral_action: Jack tells Sofia that she needs to pay closer attention to the keys she hits.
immoral_action: Jack raises his voice at Sofia and tells her that she's not smart enough to hit the right keys.

norm: You shouldn't lie about stupid things.
situation: Chad is talking about TikTok with his friend, and his friend asked him how many followers he has.
intention: Chad wants to impress his friend.
moral_action: Chad says that he only has 150 followers, but he just started using the app one week ago.
immoral_action: Chad tells his friend that he has 300,000 followers on TikTok.

norm: You should not insult the weight of others.
situation: Kate is at the gym working out with a friend of her's who wants to lose weight.
intention: Kate wants to motivate her friend to push harder.
moral_action: Kate focuses on health related goals in order to motivate her friend.
immoral_action: Kate brings up how heavy her friend is in order to get her pumped up.

norm: You shouldn't make false accusations about someone.
situation: Robert is a high school student who isn't too fond of his math teacher, Mrs. Greene.
intention: Robert wants to go to school without having to see Mrs. Greene.
moral_action: Robert speaks with his guidance counselor, telling him that he won't succeed if he has to continue on in Mrs.Greene's class.
immoral_action: Robert files an anonymous report to the school saying that Mrs.Greene hits her students, although she never has.

norm: You shouldn't let your emotions hurt others.
situation: Matt has had a very bad day and has just arrived at home when his children mob him and demand that he play with them.
intention: Matt wants to relieve his stress.
moral_action: Matt asks for a few minutes of rest before playing with the children.
immoral_action: Matt yells at the children and tells them to leave him alone, so he can have peace and quiet.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage your relationships.
situation: Mitch is not getting along well with his girlfriend and wants the relationship to end.
intention: Mitch needs to decide how to proceed in bringing his relationship to a close.
moral_action: Mitch talks with his girlfriend and explains his position to her, after which the couple parts ways.
immoral_action: Mitch starts behaving in a way that is sure to start arguments and cause his girlfriend to leave.

norm: You shouldn't sabotage people's goals.
situation: Dale wants to build a 50 foot guard tower in his neighborhood and that annoys Bill.
intention: Bill wants to do something about the tower.
moral_action: Bill tells Dale how he feels about the tower directly.
immoral_action: Bill tells the city that Dale shouldn't be allowed to build the guard tower.

norm: You should not violate other people's trust.
situation: Jane is at a neighborhood party.
intention: Jane wants everyone to pay attention to her.
moral_action: Jane tells a funny story about her childhood.
immoral_action: Jane tells everyone Anna's secret.

norm: You shouldn't make people around you miserable
situation: Kent and Andrew live together and have a policy that they won't talk politics with each other since Andrew hates it.
intention: Kent wants to talk to Andrew.
moral_action: Kent asks Andrew whether anything interesting happened to him that day.
immoral_action: Kent tells Andrew what he thinks of the current political situation and why he should vote for Kent's preferred Presidential candidate.

norm: You shouldn't wish negative consequences on others.
situation: Lyle is at the mall when a clumsy man, Rick comes stumbling into him and bumps him pretty hard.
intention: Lyle wants to bring attention to his pain.
moral_action: Lyle tells Rick that he hurt him pretty bad and that he needs to watch where he's going.
immoral_action: Lyle yelps in pain and looks at Rick and tells him that he hopes someone does the same to him to be even.

norm: It's wrong to encourage cheating
situation: Henry is on a racing team and is in a meeting with the driver.
intention: Henry wants the team to win.
moral_action: Henry offers to improve his pit crew time to help get the car out faster.
immoral_action: Henry advises putting some illegal fuel additive to make the car go faster.

norm: Its wrong to feel like you cheated.
situation: Louise is playing a card game with her brother.
intention: Louise wants to win.
moral_action: Louise plays the game fairly and wins the game.
immoral_action: Louise hides some of her cards under the table while her brother isn't looking and wins the game.

norm: It's wrong to be jealous.
situation: John is at the bar when Bill shows him a photo of his hot new girlfriend.
intention: John wants to give his opinion of the picture.
moral_action: John tells his friend that she is very pretty, and he's proud of him for having the courage to ask her out.
immoral_action: John tells Bill that she's not that hot and looks kind of trashy in fact, and he shouldn't be so proud.

norm: It is wrong to film inappropriate things.
situation: Bob is taking a videography class and has a gay roommate, who has a boyfriend.
intention: Bob wants to film his roommate and his boyfriend for his class.
moral_action: Bob films his roommate and his boyfriend having a date.
immoral_action: Bob films his roommate and his boyfriend having sex.

norm: It's wrong to be obsessed with something.
situation: Jared, a man with a limited budget, adores his favorite television show, and a new line of figures modeled after the characters are coming out soon.
intention: Jared wants to engage with anything related to his favorite television show.
moral_action: Jared rewatches his two episodes of his favorite show a night before going to bed.
immoral_action: Jared spends most of his upcoming paycheck on figures of all the characters.

norm: It is wrong to be elitist.
situation: James is having a political discussion about abortion while out to lunch with his friend.
intention: James wants to discuss his pro-life beliefs.
moral_action: James expresses his views and then asks his friend to elaborate on the opposing view.
immoral_action: James explains to his friend that all pro-choice people are murderous idiots that have no morals.

norm: It is wrong to be paranoid.
situation: Jasmine is having a sleepover and thinks her friends are talking badly about her because they were whispering in a huddle.
intention: Jasmine wants to know the topic of her friends conversation.
moral_action: Jasmine laughs and smiles as she asks her friends what they big secret was, and she wanted in on it.
immoral_action: Jasmine angrily storms into the room and screams at her friends and demands they tell her what they were whispering about together.

norm: It is wrong to be possessive.
situation: Yves' girlfriend meets a new group of friends and starts to spend a lot of time with them and less with him.
intention: Yves wants to spend more time with his girlfriend.
moral_action: Yves asks if he can tag along with his girlfriend and meet her new friends.
immoral_action: Yves tells his girlfriend that she has to choose between him or her new group of friends.

norm: It's wrong to be misogynistic.
situation: Josh has narrowed down the applicants for his new engineering position down to a highly qualified girl and a friendly boy.
intention: Josh wants to hire someone.
moral_action: Josh reaches out to another person in the industry for advice on how to judge the final applications.
immoral_action: Josh hires the boy based on stereotypical views that women dislike engineering.

norm: It's wrong to be promiscuous.
situation: Denise is chatting with a man who wants to hook up with her.
intention: Denise wants to make the man happy.
moral_action: Denise buys the man a drink and asks him out on a date.
immoral_action: Denise and the man make love at the hotel.

norm: It's wrong to be homophoic.
situation: Jerry is in a debate class, and they are about to debate the merits of gay marraige to an audience.
intention: Jerry wants to express his opinion on gay marriage.
moral_action: Jerry explains that he thinks that gay marriage is ok as long as the couple love each other.
immoral_action: Jerry explains he thinks that gay people shouldn't get married because they are gay.

norm: It's wrong to be lazy
situation: Patty has a big test tomorrow, but is feeling kind of tired.
intention: Patty wants to take a nap.
moral_action: Patty sets her alarm and takes a short nap before studying.
immoral_action: Patty takes a long nap and wakes up late at night.

norm: It's wrong to be selfish.
situation: Elaine was eating her lunch in the park when she saw a homeless man who looked hungry.
intention: Elaine wants to eat her lunch.
moral_action: Elaine offered half of her sandwich to the homeless man in the park.
immoral_action: Elaine ate all of her food while staring down the homeless man.

norm: It's wrong to do things out of retibution.
situation: Tina is about to head out when she notices her neighbor ride his bike right into her parked car which results in a dent.
intention: Tina wants to react to the accident that just occured.
moral_action: Tina runs up to the neighbor and asks him if he's OK and needs any assistance.
immoral_action: Tina runs up to the neighbor and picks up his bike only to throw it back down on the ground in an attempt to damage it.

norm: It's wrong to bother people relentlessly.
situation: Derrick loaned his friend some money, and his friend promised to pay him back.
intention: Derrick wants to be repaid.
moral_action: Derrick waits a few weeks before bringing up the loan again.
immoral_action: Derrick asks his friend every day if he has the money.

norm: It's wrong to be too needy.
situation: Cathy and Andy have been dating for a while and spend a lot of time together.
intention: Cathy wants to be with Andy.
moral_action: Cathy talks to Andy about her problems, but works through them herself.
immoral_action: Cathy is constantly calling Andy and complaining about her problems and asking for favors.

norm: It's wrong to constantly mess up.
situation: When James started his new job as an fMRI technician, he was supposed to read a long technical manual.
intention: James wants to have lots of free time after work.
moral_action: James reads the manual in short chunks over his lunch break.
immoral_action: James doesn't bother reading the manual or learning the safety procedures.

norm: It's wrong to be hypocritical.
situation: Jerry is angry because his friend has made the same mistake that he did in the past.
intention: Jerry wants to get through to his friend and push them to change.
moral_action: Jerry empathizes with his friend and talks to him from experience.
immoral_action: Jerry gets on his friend's case about making such a careless mistake.

norm: It's wrong to call people losers.
situation: Benny is at work when his manager Glenn fires another employee, Jordan.
intention: Benny wants to say something to Jordan.
moral_action: Benny tells Jordan to hang in there and that he'll find another job soon.
immoral_action: Benny tells Jordan that only losers get fired, and he is therefore a total loser.

norm: It's wrong to be a lazy bum.
situation: Kevin has been laying around the house and doing nothing for weeks, when he suddenly sees that he has a missed call from a prospective employer.
intention: Kevin has to decide whether to call the prospect back.
moral_action: Kevin calls the prospective employer back as soon as he sees the missed call and sets up an interview time.
immoral_action: Kevin needs to work but has been enjoying the time off, so he decides not to call the prospective employer back right away.

norm: It's wrong to be a sore loser.
situation: Tad is running for president, but lost his parties primary.
intention: Tad wants to keep working on a campaign.
moral_action: Tad decides to campaign for the primary winner, instead of continuing to run.
immoral_action: Tad decides to run as a third party, against the primary winner, out of spite.

norm: It's wrong to want something for the wrong reasons.
situation: Tim is in a competition for a lucrative work contract with a friend of his.
intention: Tim wants to motivate himself to work hard and get the contract.
moral_action: Tim decides to get the contract, so he can develop his skills, gets the contract, and learns a new technique to accomplish it.
immoral_action: Tim decides to get it, so he can show others how good he is, earns the contract, and brags about it to his friend.

norm: It is wrong to be self depreciating.
situation: Kyle is upset that he has been gaining weight and looks in the mirror to make an assessment of how he looks.
intention: Kyle wants to form an opinion of his personal appearance.
moral_action: Kyle gives himself a pep talk in the mirror, where he verbally expresses that he needs to do a little gym work but that he is worth the effort.
immoral_action: Kyle does not feel anything good about his appearance and forms the opinion that nobody could ever be attracted to him.

norm: It's wrong for someone to make impossible demands.
situation: Jeff solicited the services of a professional tax firm and notices a small mistake by the tax firm.
intention: Jeff wants to demand reparations.
moral_action: Jeff contacts the tax firm about the mistake and waits for a response.
immoral_action: Jeff demands the tax firm pay him millions of dollars for the small mistake.

norm: It's wrong to think you're a failure.
situation: Lyle made a bad grade on his test, and he is walking home from school.
intention: Lyle wants to think about the future.
moral_action: Lyle realizes that he can get better grades if he studies more.
immoral_action: Lyle thinks that the bad grade on the test means that he is a total failure.

norm: It is wrong to be sexist.
situation: Don is hosting a beauty pageant on live tv.
intention: Don wants to be with many women and appear confident.
moral_action: Don makes respectful complimentary remarks about the contestants on the show.
immoral_action: Don makes sexist jokes about the contestants and says he can get any woman he wants.

norm: It is wrong to be emotionally manipulative.
situation: Tara has been dating Willy and sees a really nice necklace in a store.
intention: Tara wants Willy to get her the necklace.
moral_action: Tara tells Willy the necklace would make for a nice birthday or anniversary present.
immoral_action: Tara tells Willy he'll get her the necklace if he loves her and doesn't want her to break up with him.

norm: It's wrong to be manipulative.
situation: Bob is assigned a new client by his company, in hopes that he will improve their sales relationship.
intention: Bob wants to make a big sale to the company.
moral_action: Bob gives a strong presentation about what he has to offer and asks directly for more of the company's business.
immoral_action: Bob tells his new client that he can save them some money if they buy in quantity, but only for one day, which is not true.

norm: It's wrong to make a huge mess.
situation: Keith had told his wife that she didn't have to worry about dinner tonight.
intention: Keith wants to cook dinner for his girlfriend.
moral_action: Keith cleans up the dishes as he goes about cooking dinner.
immoral_action: Keith cooks the food while leaving food wrappers and pots and pans all over the counter.

norm: It's wrong to be impatient.
situation: Steve was in a hurry waiting for Jill to finish.
intention: Steve wanted to finish quickly.
moral_action: Steve waits just a bit longer for Jill to finish before leaving.
immoral_action: Steve leaves Jill behind and hurries off by himself.

norm: It is wrong to overeat.
situation: Victor had gone to an all you can eat buffet for lunch.
intention: Victor wants to get his money's worth.
moral_action: Victor eats a steak, mashed potatoes, a salad, and a dessert for lunch.
immoral_action: Victor stacks four plates of food high and eats all the food.

norm: It's wrong to love cheating.
situation: Dave is playing poker with friends when he gets caught dealing an ace to himself from the bottom of the deck, and they demand an explanation.
intention: Dave wants to give his reasons for cheating.
moral_action: Dave tells the group that he's in desperate need of money and that he's sorry he crossed the line.
immoral_action: Dave tells the group that he just loves the thrill of getting away with such things, and they should try it sometime.

norm: It is wrong to call yourself a loser.
situation: Janice is doing poorly in a diving competition and is preparing for her next dive.
intention: Janice wants to say something to herself before her next dive.
moral_action: Janice tells herself that she's capable of making a great dive and has done it successfuly hundreds of times before.
immoral_action: Janice tells herself that she's a loser for doing so poorly and that she's going to blow her next dive.

norm: It is wrong to be immature.
situation: Bethany, a teenage girl, glares at her parents after they grounded her for making bad grades.
intention: Bethany wants to express her feelings.
moral_action: Bethany writes down her feelings in her diary before looking at her textbook.
immoral_action: Bethany stamps her feet and whines about how her parents are being mean and unfair.

norm: It's wrong to be too demanding.
situation: Sandra owns a consulting company and is the boss of several employees.
intention: Sandra wants to give work to do to her employees.
moral_action: Sandra gives her employees a typical amount of work.
immoral_action: Sandra gives her employees double the amount of work than is typical for the industry.

norm: It's wrong to make a problem worse.
situation: Joe's friend Timmy is failing his classes and might not be able to graduate.
intention: Joe wants Timmy to get a high grade on his upcoming math test.
moral_action: Joe asks his friend Timmy to study with him for the big test.
immoral_action: Joe convinces his friend Timmy to write secret notes on his arm for the test.

norm: It's wrong to make someone suffer.
situation: On an especially hot Summer day, Frank asks Rob if he could borrow his cast iron skillet for supper.
intention: Rob wants to get the cooking tools.
moral_action: Rob invites Frank inside the house while he searches for the skillet.
immoral_action: Rob forces Frank to wait outside in the heat while he searches for the skillet in his kitchen.

norm: It's wrong to ignore people.
situation: Bob hears a knock at the door while trying to cook lunch.
intention: Bob wants to finish cooking lunch.
moral_action: Bob lets the person in and asks him to wait while he finishes cooking.
immoral_action: Bob ignores the knock and continues to cook.

norm: It's wrong to be dishonest.
situation: David is an unhappily married man and is attracted to a woman named Karen.
intention: David wants to be intimate with Karen.
moral_action: David talks to his wife, where they mutually decide to divorce, and he starts a relationship with Karen once single.
immoral_action: David becomes very friendly with Karen, telling her he is single, and they begin a sexual relationship.

norm: It's wrong to destroy things.
situation: While playing tennis with a borrowed racquet, Boj has become angry and frustrated after losing a big point.
intention: Boj needs to vent his emotions.
moral_action: Boj sets down the racquet then practices deep breathing.
immoral_action: Boj smashes the racquet on the ground to vent.

norm: It's wrong to kill things.
situation: Mary sees a mouse run across her kitchen and is very frightened.
intention: Mary wants to get the mouse out of her house.
moral_action: Mary traps the mouse with a container and transfers it outside.
immoral_action: Mary kills the mouse before removing it.

norm: It's wrong to abuse others.
situation: Joseph is fostering two of his sister's children who are playing loudly in the other room.
intention: Joseph wants to be able to relax after work.
moral_action: Joseph asks the kids to quiet down and provides them some quieter activities to do.
immoral_action: Joseph approaches the children and gives them each a sedative to make them go to sleep, so he can get some quiet.

norm: It's wrong to be bitter.
situation: Xander is at a party where he runs into Kevin, who used to steal his lunch money when they were in grade school.
intention: Xander wants to respond to Kevin.
moral_action: Xander says hello to Kevin and the two of them have a nice conversation where Kevin ends up apologizing for past behavior.
immoral_action: Xander angrily confronts Kevin about how he was picked on as a kid and the two of them get into a fist fight.

norm: It's wrong to hurt yourself.
situation: Jack walks out of the room after getting into a fight with Marry.
intention: Jack wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: Jack talks to another one of his friends on the phone about his problems.
immoral_action: Jack smashes his fist against a hard surface on purpose breaking his finger.

norm: It's wrong to skip detention.
situation: Billy threw a rock at a classmate during recess and was given detention after school as a punishment.
intention: Billy wants watch his favorite baseball team after school.
moral_action: Billy goes to detention and asks if the teacher could provide updates on the score of his favorite baseball team.
immoral_action: Billy skips detention and goes home to watch his favorite baseball team on television.

norm: It's wrong to have a bad temper.
situation: It is a hot summer day and Susan's son Tommy keeps pestering her to buy him an ice cream cone.
intention: Susan wants Tommy to stop bothering her.
moral_action: Susan takes Tommy to the local ice cream store and buys him a cone of his favorite flavor.
immoral_action: Susan's temper gets the best of her, and she blows up at Tommy, yelling at him to shut his mouth.

norm: Its wrong to cheat.
situation: Greg has an important math test the next day in school that he isn't well prepared for.
intention: Greg wants to get a good grade on the test.
moral_action: Greg studies hard late into the evening and goes into the test well prepared.
immoral_action: Greg writes unauthorized crib notes on a small sheet of paper which he uses during the test.

norm: It's wrong to abuse someone.
situation: Carlos has just realized that his girlfriend scratched his car when she borrowed it.
intention: Carlos wants to make sure his girlfriend doesn't scratch his car again.
moral_action: Carlos talks to his girlfriend about the importance of paying attention while driving.
immoral_action: Carlos beats his girlfriend after he notices the scratches on his car.

norm: It's wrong to starve yourself.
situation: Bob wanted to lose weight so that he wouldn't have to buy new clothes to fit him.
intention: Bob wants to lose weight.
moral_action: Bob decides to work out more often to try and burn fat.
immoral_action: Bob decides not to eat any food so that he'll lose weight quickly.

norm: It is wrong to end yourself.
situation: Ted has been depressed for a long time and his mother is worried about him.
intention: Ted wants to stop experiencing the sadness he's feeling.
moral_action: Ted goes to see a psychiatrist and gets a prescription for antidepressants.
immoral_action: Ted gets a gun, puts it in his mouth, and shoots himself.

norm: It's wrong to do things that are disgusting.
situation: Billy is a guest at a birthday party for his friend Ursula, and they are having cake.
intention: Billy wants to get Ursula's attention.
moral_action: Billy walks over to Ursula and says that her dress looks nice.
immoral_action: Billy spits his half-eaten cake out onto Ursula's plate.

norm: It's wrong to steal.
situation: Liam is at an antiques store, browsing through the aisles when he notices a beautiful brooch.
intention: Liam wants to get his girlfriend a present.
moral_action: Liam takes the brooch to the cash register and asks for it to be gift wrapped.
immoral_action: Liam discreetly puts the brooch in his pocket and walks out of the store.

norm: It's wrong to ignore your instructor.
situation: Mike is in history class.
intention: Mike wants to get a good grade.
moral_action: Mike takes notes during the teacher's lecture.
immoral_action: Mike finds the teacher boring and decides to read up on the subject himself.

norm: It's wrong to lie.
situation: Red is standing before Al, his dad, and KEvin, the family pet, and a broken lamp lying on the floor.
intention: Red wants to explain why the lamp is broken.
moral_action: Red takes responsibility for breaking the lamp.
immoral_action: Red tells an untruth indicating Kevin broke the lamp.

norm: It's wrong to spite someone.
situation: James is a school counselor, and his least favorite student just gave him a scholarship application to submit.
intention: James wants to teach the student some humilty.
moral_action: James submits the scholarship application and subjects the student to an hour-long lecture about humility.
immoral_action: James deliberately sends in the application late so the student doesn't get the scholarship.

norm: It's wrong to kill yourself
situation: Kim has been enduring extreme bullying by some of her peers at school.
intention: Kim wants to no longer be bullied.
moral_action: Kim shares her burden with her parents and school officials.
immoral_action: Kim decides to take her own life in order to escape her tormentors.

norm: It's wrong for someone to be cruel or racest.
situation: Elon was posting on Twitter when a black Twitter user made fun of him in his replies.
intention: Elon wants to get the user to leave him alone.
moral_action: Elon tells a joke about the user's profile and then blocks the user.
immoral_action: Elon calls the user a racial slur in a public tweet.

norm: It's wrong to abuse the system.
situation: Greg is currently a recipient of welfare, and he has just been hired to a new job.
intention: Greg wants to save up money to get a new place.
moral_action: Greg makes a strict budget and sticks to it in order to build up his savings.
immoral_action: Greg continues to collect his welfare benefits even though he no longer qualifies for them.

norm: It's wrong to do things to harm yourself.
situation: Ray is sore after pushing himself to the limit weightlifting, but he doesn't want to leave the gym.
intention: Ray wants to continue exercising.
moral_action: Ray does some light cardio before doing some streches.
immoral_action: Ray continues lifting heavy weights ignoring his body.

norm: It's wrong to be sadistic and brutal.
situation: John just lost his job and is very upset when he gets home to his wife Mindy.
intention: John wants to vent his anger.
moral_action: John takes a deep breath, tells his wife he lost his job and asks if she wants to talk.
immoral_action: John raises his voice, tells Mindy to take her clothes off and hits her hard.

norm: It's wrong to want to do yourself harm.
situation: Tammy has a difficult home life and is awkward at school with not a lot of friends.
intention: Tammy wants to express her frustration about her life.
moral_action: Tammy talks to a school guidance counselor about her feelings.
immoral_action: Tammy takes a knife and cuts her arms to express her frustration.

norm: It's wrong to bully someone.
situation: Terrence is in the school cafeteria and doesn't have money to buy lunch, but see's that his classmate Jeremy has a whole tray.
intention: Terrence wants to eat Jeremy's food.
moral_action: Terrence asks Jeremy if he would mind sharing some food with him, so he gives him half.
immoral_action: Terrence walks up to Jeremy and says he will beat him up unless he gives up his food, so Jeremy hands it over.

norm: It's wrong to cut yourself.
situation: Mike has failed a big test at school and is frustrated with himself.
intention: Mike wants to release his frustrations through a physical action.
moral_action: Mike goes to a boxing gym and hits the heavy bag.
immoral_action: Mike takes a blade and cuts his arms.

norm: It's wrong to be abusive.
situation: Mark's wife is cooking breakfast when she burns the pancakes.
intention: Mark wants to respond to the burned pancakes.
moral_action: Mark tells his wife that they can eat something else.
immoral_action: Mark walks over to his wife and slaps her in the face.

norm: It's wrong to lose your temper.
situation: Mr. Nelson is an English teacher who has trouble being patient and is teaching a rowdy group of students.
intention: Mr. Nelson wants the students to behave.
moral_action: Mr. Nelson switches to an activity-based teaching style to channel his students' energy and engage them.
immoral_action: Mr. Nelson loses his temper and loudly tells the students to be quiet, lamenting how undisciplined they are.

norm: It is wrong to wish for destruction.
situation: Steve was about to be thrown out by rising rents but the pandemic pushed rents back down to where he could afford it.
intention: Steve wants his life to improve.
moral_action: Steve hope that things get better for everyone over time.
immoral_action: Steve hopes the pandemic keeps ruining the economy so that his rent will stay low.

norm: Its wrong to be violent.
situation: Amelia asks a classmate if she could use the watercolors for her art project, and her classmate declines her request.
intention: Amelia wants to create art.
moral_action: Amelia walks over to the pottery station, and she makes a brightly colored vase.
immoral_action: Amelia shoves her classmate out of the way and grabs the watercolors from her hands.

norm: It's wrong to doubt yourself.
situation: Jacob, who has low self esteem, listens to his boss offer him a promotion, but the promotion has demands above his skill level.
intention: Jacob wants to make money.
moral_action: Jacob takes classes to sharpen his skills, and asks his coworkers to help him out in his new job.
immoral_action: Jacob refuses the job choosing to stay at his current position.

norm: It's bad to use the N word.
situation: Jeremy and Liam are in the car listening to music together.
intention: Jeremy wants to have a good time with Liam while they drive.
moral_action: Jeremy omits any slurs from his rap while he drives.
immoral_action: Jeremy raps the song word-for-word including the N word.

norm: It's bad to exploit others.
situation: It is almost the end of the semester and it is time for Jack to choose groups for the year end project.
intention: Jack wants to get an A and pass the class.
moral_action: Jack works with his friend, and they try hard together.
immoral_action: Jack partners with someone he does not like just because they are smart, and he wants to pass.

norm: It is bad to discriminate.
situation: John is giving a job interview to Darrell who is black when Darrell asks what his prospects for being hired are.
intention: John wants to tell Darrell that he won't be getting hired.
moral_action: John tells Darrell that while he has some good qualities on his resume, he just doesn't have the right kind of experience for the position.
immoral_action: John tells Darrell that since he's black, he's incompatible with the company as they only hire whites.

norm: It's bad to throw things.
situation: John is on his balcony on the 4th floor when his friend James comes over and asks John to let him in the building.
intention: John wants to get James into the building.
moral_action: John tells Bill to hang on and runs downstairs and opens the door from the inside so Bill can get in.
immoral_action: "John grabs the building lobby keys out of his pocket and throws them at James below yelling ""catch!""."

norm: It's bad to molest someone.
situation: Bill at a frat party.
intention: Bill wants to hook up with someone.
moral_action: Bill sees a girl he thinks is attractive and starts a conversation with her.
immoral_action: Bill finds a girl that passed out drunk and fondles her.

norm: It is bad to slack.
situation: Zack is hanging out at home.
intention: Zack wants to find something to do.
moral_action: Zack organizes and pays all of his bills.
immoral_action: Zack spends the day watching reruns of tv shows he has already seen.

norm: It's bad to waste energy.
situation: Jen lives in Arizona.
intention: Jen wants to keep cool during summer.
moral_action: Jen gets several tower fans and uses them in whichever room she's in, and drinks a lot of ice water.
immoral_action: Jen keeps the AC kept at 55 all night and day.

norm: It's bad to be toxic.
situation: Ray and Cindy are divorced and share custody with the children, and Ray wants to have the children for an extra day during one weekend.
intention: Cindy wants to get equal time with the children.
moral_action: Cindy works with Ray to find a compromise where she gets an extra day.
immoral_action: Cindy refuses Ray's request and completely refuses to negotiate with him about it.

norm: It's bad to break things.
situation: Al is cleaning the kitchen after his family has finished their dinner together.
intention: Al wants to put away the clean dishes.
moral_action: Al carefully places the glasses back in the cabinet after he cleans them.
immoral_action: Al grabs a big stack of china and drops some on the way to the cabinet.

norm: It's bad to be narcissistic.
situation: A project led by Peter recently won in a competition.
intention: Peter wants people to admire his success.
moral_action: Peter talks a lot about how the project was a group effort and how he was lucky to lead such a great team, which won that great award.
immoral_action: Peter keeps on telling everyone how the project won because of how brilliant his own ideas were.

norm: It's bad to make a mess.
situation: Mark is cooking dinner at his friend's house and dishes are piling up.
intention: Mark wants to get dinner done on time.
moral_action: Mark cleans as he goes so when he is done, there are no dishes to do.
immoral_action: Mark does not do any dishes, and leaves them laying around.

norm: It is bad to be greedy.
situation: Joe loves seafood and is excited to go to an all you can eat seafood buffet with his friends.
intention: Joe wants to eat as much as he can.
moral_action: Joe eats heartily but stops when he is filled.
immoral_action: Joe eats multiple servings of seafood, continuing to eat even when he is full.

norm: It's bad to be obsessive over someone.
situation: Jenna's boyfriend asked her to break up because she was too clingy.
intention: Jenna wants to try her best to convince her boyfriend to reunite with her.
moral_action: Jenna started dating a handsome coworker to make her boyfriend jealous.
immoral_action: Jenna bombarded her boyfriend with calls, texts, and visits to his house and work.

norm: It is bad to have distractions.
situation: Lily is studying for a test and looks up videos on YouTube to help her learn the topic.
intention: Lily wants to watch a video to help her learn about the subject.
moral_action: Lily watches the video about the subject she needs to learn, takes notes, and reviews her notes and practice exams.
immoral_action: Lily watches the video about her subject but is then distracted by other videos on her suggested playlist.

norm: It is bad to seek conflict
situation: Joe was sitting at bar watching two young men argue loudly.
intention: Joe wanted to get involved and stop the men from arguing.
moral_action: Joe to ask the bar manager to address the two men arguing.
immoral_action: Joe walks over to the men and slaps both of them in the face.

norm: It's bad to have affairs.
situation: Chuck and his wife are going through a difficult time in their relationship and Chuck feels unloved.
intention: Chuck wants to feel loved.
moral_action: Chuck makes efforts to treat his wife kindly and to love her.
immoral_action: Chuck finds another woman and has an affair with her.

norm: It is bad to curse a lot.
situation: Dave is walking to the park when he meets a religious book salesman on the street.
intention: Dave wants to talk to the book salesman.
moral_action: Dave tells stories of his life and edits out the more offensive parts.
immoral_action: Dave tells stories of his life while cursing and swearing like a sailor.

norm: It's bad to be obsessed with attention.
situation: Casey is a youtuber, and her new video is getting less views than others.
intention: Casey wants to gain more exposure.
moral_action: Casey goes on a walk and posts pictures of herself having fun in nature with a promise of new content soon.
immoral_action: Casey gets onto twitter posting an emotional message begging people to watch her video with a bunch of popular hashtags.

norm: It's bad to be immature.
situation: Tim goes to the park and sees a girl he likes.
intention: Tim wants to interact with the girl.
moral_action: Tim interacts with the girl in a normal and mature manner, making small talk.
immoral_action: Tim acts in a silly and childish way with the girl, making jokes suited more to small children.

norm: Gluttony is considered a sin.
situation: Eric and Jenny are at home and decide to order from the pizza restaurant and Eric is asked by the operator what he would like.
intention: Eric wants to answer the operator's question.
moral_action: Eric tells the operator that they will have one medium pizza and two small sides.
immoral_action: Eric tells the operator they would like the 5 pizza special with 5 sides and 5 bottles of Pepsi.

norm: It's bad to scam someone.
situation: James was faced with $20,000 of medical debt after surviving a car crash.
intention: James wants to get rid of all his debt.
moral_action: James declares bankruptcy and asks the court for mercy given his bad luck.
immoral_action: James starts calling people and telling them they can pay him a $200 processing fee to receive their next stimulus check early.

norm: It's bad to be wasteful.
situation: James went to a buffet with hundreds of different foods from dozens of cuisines.
intention: James wants to try dozens of new foods.
moral_action: James takes a small spoonful of everything he wants to try and only gets full portions of what he likes.
immoral_action: James takes ample servings of many different foods and leaves each plate three-quarters full.

norm: It's bad to think only in stereotypes.
situation: Carl walks down the street and sees a group of young men, who appear to be of an ethnic minority, standing on the front porch of an apartment building.
intention: Carl wants to know if this group of people will harass him as he passes them by.
moral_action: Carl greets the young men from a distance, and they return his greeting in a casual way.
immoral_action: Carl eyes the group carefully to determine if they are an ethnic minority that he is afraid of, and crosses the street to avoid them.

norm: It is bad to make excuses.
situation: Grant made an error while writing code and his boss has come to ask him about it.
intention: Grant wants to explain the error to his boss.
moral_action: Grant tells his boss that he made the error, and he will fix it.
immoral_action: Grant says the error comes from the application that is used to write the code.

norm: It's bad to be a glutton.
situation: Karen is at a buffet selecting food to eat.
intention: Karen wants a satisfying meal that tastes good.
moral_action: Karen eats sensible portions of food.
immoral_action: Karen loads several plates with more food than it takes to make a person full because it's the same price.

norm: It's bad to obsesses over someone.
situation: Ivan coudn't stop thinking about how he was going to defeat Miles in the science fair.
intention: Ivan wants to enter the science fair.
moral_action: Ivan focuses on his actual project for the fair rather than his rival.
immoral_action: Ivan obsesses over how he's going to win that he doesn't spend time on his project.

norm: It's wrong to be a glutton.
situation: Matthew comes home from work and feels hunger pangs in his stomach.
intention: Matthew wants to choose something to eat.
moral_action: Matthew makes a meal that consists of vegetables, protein, and carbohydrates.
immoral_action: Matthew orders a bucket of fried chicken and a pizza and eats all of it.

norm: It's bad to want to experience mania.
situation: Amber is suffering from drug addiction and is sitting around her home bored and sober.
intention: Amber wants to feel better.
moral_action: Amber calls a close friend and confesses her state of addiction and asks for help.
immoral_action: Amber misses the feeling of when she first did uppers, so she takes twice as much as normal.

norm: It's bad to be addicted.
situation: Meg has kids, but she has been going through a lot of stress lately due to her parents passing away.
intention: Meg wants to get rid of her pain.
moral_action: Meg starts working out and eating vegetables to get her body right.
immoral_action: Meg starts using crystal meth because she likes the feeling that it gives her.

norm: It's bad to get an unfair advantage.
situation: Sara works at a company where her boyfriend holds an executive position.
intention: Sara wants to advance in her career.
moral_action: Sara puts in the work, earning a promotion with her results and persistence.
immoral_action: Sara gets her boyfriend to pull some strings and get her a promotion.

norm: It's bad to damage things.
situation: Jill was angry with Amanda as they were arguing with each other.
intention: Jill wants to release her anger.
moral_action: Jill decides to punch a punching bag and pound a pillow and hit other things that won't break.
immoral_action: Jill starts grabbing nearby things and smashing them on the floor.

norm: It's bad to be addicted to something illicit.
situation: Ron is working a long shift at the office and is beginning to get bored and sleepy around mid afternoon.
intention: Ron wants to feel more energetic.
moral_action: Ron goes to the office break room and makes himself a cup of coffee.
immoral_action: Ron pulls a small bag out of his pocket and does a couple lines of cocaine off of his desk.

norm: It's bad to cheat.
situation: Tom is struggling in school and his parents offered him money if he gets his grade up to an A.
intention: Tom wants to do well on an upcoming test.
moral_action: Tom puts a lot of time into reviewing the material that will be tested.
immoral_action: Tom writes down the answers to the test questions on a small paper which he uses during the test.

norm: It's bad to speak disrespectfully.
situation: Mike is in a meeting with his boss and coworkers one day.
intention: Mike wants to let the boss know that he disagrees with him.
moral_action: Mike explains to his boss from his point of view.
immoral_action: Mike tells his boss that he is a stupid idiot and tells him that he is completely wrong.

norm: It's bad to interuppt others.
situation: Arnie was talking about something with his friends.
intention: Arnie wants to keep talking.
moral_action: One of Arnie's friends wants to comment and Arnie lets him finish, then replies, then continues.
immoral_action: One of Arnie's friends wants to comment and Arnie interrupts him.

norm: It is bad to have debts.
situation: Hank needs a car, has $10,000 of cash on hand, and is at a car lot deciding on what kind of car he should buy.
intention: Hank wants to pick and buy a car.
moral_action: Hank chooses a gently used car that costs less than $10,000 and pays cash for it.
immoral_action: Hank picks a new car, puts the $10,000 as a down payment, and takes a loan out for the rest.

norm: It's bad to pollute.
situation: Roger has a lot of empty bottles that he needs to get out of his car to make free space.
intention: Roger wants to get rid of the empty bottles.
moral_action: Roger drives to the nearest recycling bin and puts the bottles in it.
immoral_action: Roger throws the empty bottles out of his window while he is driving.

norm: It is bad to lie on things.
situation: Jake is at a sleepover trying to sleep and misplaced his phone, but it is dark, and he can't seem to find the phone.
intention: Jake wants to get rest tonight.
moral_action: Jake crawls on his hands and knees searching the floor in the dark until he finally locates his phone, then goes back to sleep.
immoral_action: Jake searches for a minute or two, then gives up, rolls over, and goes to sleep.

norm: It's bad to deliver the wrong order.
situation: Sharon is a waitress who is serving her last table of the night when she realizes that one of the dishes is wrong.
intention: Sharon wants to clock out for the night.
moral_action: Sharon got the right dish for the customer, served the food, and then clocked out.
immoral_action: Sharon decided to serve the dish to the customer anyway and then clocked out.

norm: It's bad to grope someone.
situation: Ray sees a woman that he is attracted to on the bus.
intention: Ray wants to get the woman's attention.
moral_action: Ray introduces himself to the woman and strikes up a conversation.
immoral_action: Ray grabs the woman on her butt and introduces himself to her.

norm: It's bad to gossip.
situation: Jill was at school talking to her friends during a break from classes.
intention: Jill wanted to make herself look good in front of her friends.
moral_action: Jill decides to talk about her singing in the after school club and some of the other girls decides to Join.
immoral_action: Jill started saying roomers she had heard about a boy from school.

norm: It's bad to embellish your stories.
situation: Henry is with his friends at one of their homes and is telling a story to his friends about his skiing trip.
intention: Henry wants to his story to be interesting to his listeners.
moral_action: Henry digs deep into his vocabulary and turns an otherwise ordinary story into an interesting one by choosing his words carefully.
immoral_action: Henry tells an implausible story involving himself being chased by wolves and bears and barely making it out alive.
