situation: Salvatore is feeling extra depressed on the anniversary of his wife's death 10 years ago.
intention: Salvatore wants to feel better.
moral_action: Salvatore decides to put himself back on the dating market.
immoral_action: Salvatore heavily considers cutting himself, hearing that it helps people feel better.

norm: It's bad to make a bomb threat.
situation: Larry hears his neighbors making noise well into the night, keeping him awake.
intention: Larry wants to tell his neighbor he hates their noise making.
moral_action: Larry tells his neighbors he does not like the noise and asks them to stop.
immoral_action: Larry threatens to explode his neighbors house if they don't tone down the noise.

norm: It is bad to do things to hurt others.
situation: Ron is upset because he doesn't think his family is paying enough attention to him.
intention: Ron wants his family to know how he feels.
moral_action: Ron explains to his parents that he feels left out, and asks if they can do something together.
immoral_action: Ron hits his sister to get his parents' attention, then throws a tantrum and calls them all stupid.

norm: It's bad to violate human rights.
situation: Jeff leans that his son Jim has been playing video games in school.
intention: Jeff wants to punish Jim.
moral_action: Jeff takes Jim's video games away for a month.
immoral_action: Jeff locks Jim in a closet for a month.

norm: It's bad to break things that don't belong to you.
situation: Carl was playing video games at his friend's house, but he was losing.
intention: Carl wants to stop playing the game.
moral_action: Carl puts his video game controller on the floor and walks out of the room.
immoral_action: Carl takes the video game console and throws it on the floor.

norm: It's bad to overstay your welcome.
situation: Miguel had been staying at Mike's house for almost a month.
intention: Miguel wants to go to sleep.
moral_action: Miguel finds his own place to live and brings his things from Mike's place.
immoral_action: Miguel goes to sleep on the couch at Mike's house again.

norm: It is bad to pressure others.
situation: Jim was going to the abandoned mine to play after school.
intention: Jim wants Terry to go with him.
moral_action: Jim tells Terry that he will see him later when Terry declines to join him.
immoral_action: Jim starts calling Terry a chicken when he says that he doesn't want to go to the mine.

norm: It's bad to fall back on bad habits.
situation: Calvin has been sober from alcohol for 2 years, but is going through a stressful divorce.
intention: Calvin wants to relive his anxiety.
moral_action: Calvin thinks about having a drink, but decides instead to meditate.
immoral_action: Calvin decides to have some vodka and orange juice to relax him.

norm: It's bad to make plans to commit a crime.
situation: Joel, who lives with his mother, is low on cash and needs to pay for his prom tuxedo.
intention: Joel wants to get some money.
moral_action: Joel gets a job at a local sandwich shop making sandwiches.
immoral_action: Joel comes up with a plan to rob a local sandwich shop for money.

norm: It is bad to shame others.
situation: Gill's single sister Maria has been gaining weight recently and Gill has noticed.
intention: Gill wants to talk about Maria's weight gain.
moral_action: Gill tells Maria some tips on losing weight.
immoral_action: Gill tells Maria that no one will date her if she is fat.

norm: It is bad to vandalize others.
situation: James is frustrated that his neighbor constantly plays loud music late at night.
intention: James wants to punish his inconsiderate neighbor.
moral_action: James calls the police and files a noise complaint against his neighbor.
immoral_action: James waits until his neighbor is asleep, then spray paints a crudely drawn anus on his garage door.

norm: It's bad to cause inconvenience for others.
situation: Joe is at home without a car and his roommates are running late to the game.
intention: Joe wants to go to the mall.
moral_action: Joe hires a taxi and goes to the mall that way.
immoral_action: Joe begs his roommates to drive him to the mall and says it's an emergency.

norm: It is bad to want to harm others.
situation: Ty walked onto a train when a drunk man started screaming racial slurs at him.
intention: Ty doesn't want to have the man affect him anymore.
moral_action: Ty ignores the man and tells jokes to tease him.
immoral_action: Ty walks over to the man and knocks him out cold.

norm: It is bad to make people feel scared
situation: Ursula is babysitting young children and it is time for them to go to bed.
intention: Ursula wants the kids to stay in their rooms.
moral_action: Ursula reads the children book after book until she sees that they are all sound asleep and tucks them in.
immoral_action: Ursula tells the children a tall tale about mysterious things that happen to children who leave their rooms at night and how they might vanish.

norm: It is bad to neglect relationships.
situation: Arnie was driving home to his family after work and was thinking about what to do.
intention: Arnie wants to plan the rest of his day.
moral_action: Arnie decides to take his whole family out to see a movie they all like to watch together.
immoral_action: Arnie decides to watch TV and read some books before going to bed.

norm: It's bad to partake in illegal activities.
situation: Jess really wants to watch a film, but she has to buy a streaming service to watch it.
intention: Jess wants to watch the movie.
moral_action: Jess buys the new streaming service in order to watch the movie.
immoral_action: Jess downloads the film off of a website from Mexico without paying.

norm: Its bad to let your curiosity lead to danger.
situation: Ted is a boy that finds electric outlets interesting.
intention: Ted wants to find out how electrical outlets work.
moral_action: Ted looks up how electrical outlets work on the internet.
immoral_action: Ted plays with the electrical outlet in his room.

norm: It is bad to rude to others.
situation: Adam is hungry and is in a hurry to go get some food when he encounters a large crowd in his way.
intention: Adam wants to get to the food store.
moral_action: Adam asks people to move as he navigates the crowd.
immoral_action: Adam shoves his way through the crowd calling everyone names.

norm: It's bad to assault others.
situation: Tommy and David are having an argument on their front lawn about where they can park their cars.
intention: Tommy wants to park where he wants.
moral_action: Tommy compromises with David and each take turns parking in the desired spot.
immoral_action: Tommy decides to punch David in the jaw, knocking him over in front of the neighborhood.

norm: It's bad to make a creepy move on someone.
situation: Benjamin is at a party and meets Tina who is exactly his type.
intention: Benjamin wants to show Tina he is interested.
moral_action: Benjamin engages with Tina about her interests and compliments her on her personality.
immoral_action: Benjamin makes some suggestive comments towards Tina and drapes his arm around her.

norm: It is bad to hit others.
situation: Carl is playing at the park when another little boy takes his toy from him.
intention: Carl wants to get the toy back.
moral_action: Carl tells his mother that the boy took his toy from him.
immoral_action: Carl hits the boy and takes the toy back from him.

norm: Causing people to be uncomfortable and fearful is bad.
situation: It is Halloween and Oliver has been invited to a friend's costume party.
intention: Oliver wants to wear a good costume.
moral_action: Oliver dresses up like a ninja by wearing all black and only covering part of his face.
immoral_action: Oliver dresses up as a ninja and covers his face and brings real knives to the party.

norm: It is bad to let grooming become an obsessive behavior.
situation: George is asked to be the best man at his friend's wedding which makes his presence extremely important.
intention: George wants to look good for the wedding.
moral_action: George goes with a hairstyle he likes and has done many times to be early for the wedding procedures.
immoral_action: George tries multiple new hairstyles to on the wedding day to find one he likes most and ends up being very late.

norm: It's bad to scare someone you know is vulnerable.
situation: Dean's older brother Graham has returned home from the military after being diagnosed with PTSD.
intention: Dean wants to play a prank on Graham for April Fool's Day.
moral_action: Dean switches around the contents of his and Graham's cereal boxes.
immoral_action: Dean buys a fake gun and pretends to be a robber breaking into Graham's room.

norm: It is bad to judge things for being weird.
situation: Ana went to India for a vacation with her husband and noticed that people kept pooing outside.
intention: Ana wants to make a remark on Indian people.
moral_action: Ana says that the vacation has really broadened her perspective.
immoral_action: Ana says that Indian people are like a different species.

norm: It's bad to be overly dramatic.
situation: Jill just met Bill at a baseball game and instantly is attracted to him.
intention: Jill wants Bill to pay attention to her.
moral_action: Jill strikes up a conversation with Bill and asks him about himself.
immoral_action: Jill walks up to Bill and tells him that if he doesn't date her she'll kill herself.

norm: It's bad to do things to others that are wrong.
situation: Ted is playing a game with some random people online against a computer opponent.
intention: Ted wants to challenge himself.
moral_action: Ted handicaps himself by not using the most powerful techniques, then still manages to emerge victorious.
immoral_action: Ted helps defeat the computer opponent, then turns against each of his allies and backstabs all of them.

norm: It is bad to want harm on anyone even yourself.
situation: Adam is a high school student who has been feeling very depressed and lonely lately.
intention: Adam wants to feel better.
moral_action: Adam tells his parents how he has been feeling and asks to get medical help.
immoral_action: Adam takes up cutting to relieve his stress after he hears it's used as a release by others in his position.

norm: It's bad to bother other people.
situation: Hayden's sister is studying for her exam in bedroom next to his.
intention: Hayden wants to listen to music.
moral_action: Hayden adjusts his speaker to a quiet level.
immoral_action: Hayden turns his speaker up to full volume.

norm: It's bad to hit someone.
situation: Patrick is at a bar with his girlfriend when a man keeps trying to flirt with her.
intention: Patrick wants to react to the situation.
moral_action: Patrick tells the man to stop flirting with his girlfriend and go find someone else to flirt with.
immoral_action: Patrick hits the man knocking him to the floor and tells him to leave his girlfriend alone.
